text: With health-bestowing drops thine heart I comfort: all-bright again, and undiseased, enjoy them. Drest in like robes let these two drink the mixture, wearing the Asvins' form as an illusion.
meaning: शिवा॒भिष् टे हृ॒दयं तर्पयाम्य् अनमीवो॒ मोदिषीष्ठाः सुव॒र्चाः । सवासि॒नौ पिबतां मन्थ॒म् एत॒म् अश्वि॒नो रूपं॒ परिधा॒य माया॒म् ॥६॥

text: Erst Indra, wounded, made this strengthening portion, eternal food: thine is it, here presented. With this live full of vigour through the autumns. Let not thy strength be drained. Leeches have helped thee.
meaning: इ॒न्द्र एतां॒ ससृजे विद्धो॒ अ॒ग्र ऊर्जां॒ स्वधा॒म् अज॒रां सा॒ त एषा॒ । त॒या त्वं॒ जीव शर॒दः सुव॒र्चा मा॒ त आ॒ सुस्रो॒द् भिष॒जस् ते अक्रन् ॥७॥

text: As the wind shake this Tuft of Grass hither and thither on the ground. So do I stir and shake thy mind, that thou mayst be in love with me, my darling, never to depart.
meaning: य॒थेदं॒ भू॒म्या अ॒धि तृ॒णं वा॒तो मथाय॒ति । एवा॒ मथ्नामि ते म॒नो य॒था मां॒ कामि॒न्य् अ॒सो य॒था म॒न् ना॒पगा अ॒सः ॥१॥

text: Ye, Asvins, lead together, ye unite and bring the loving pair. Now have the fortunes of you twain, now have your vows and spirits met.
meaning: सं॒ चे॒न् न॒याथो अश्विना कामि॒ना सं॒ च व॒क्षथः । सं॒ वां भ॒गासो अग्मत सं॒ चित्ता॒नि स॒म् उ व्रता॒ ॥२॥

text: When eagles, calling out aloud, are screaming in the joy of health, Then to my calling let her come, as to the arrow's neck the shaft.
meaning: य॒त् सुपर्णा॒ विवक्ष॒वो अनमीवा॒ विवक्ष॒वः । त॒त्र मे गछताद् ध॒वं शल्य॒ इव कु॒ल्मलं य॒था ॥३॥

text: Let what is inward turn outside, let what is outward be within: Seize and possess, O Plant, the mind of maidens rich in every charm.
meaning: य॒द् अ॒न्तरं त॒द् बा॒ह्यं य॒द् बा॒ह्यं त॒द् अ॒न्तरम् । कन्या॑नां विश्व॒रूपाणां म॒नो गृभायौषधे ॥४॥

text: Seeking a husband she hath come! and I came longing for a wife: Even as a loudly-neighing steed may fate and fortune have I met.
meaning: ए॒य॒म् अगन् प॒तिकामा ज॒निकामो ऽह॒म् आ॒गमम् । अ॒श्वः क॒निक्रदद् य॒था भ॒गेनाहं॒ सहा॒गमम् ॥५॥

text: With Indra's mighty millstone, that which crushes worms of every sort, I bray and bruise the worms to bits like vetches on the grinding stone.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रस्य या॒ मही॒ दृष॒त् क्रि॒मेर् वि॒श्वस्य त॒र्हणी । त॒या पिनष्मि सं॒ क्रि॒मीन् दृष॒दा ख॒ल्वां इव ॥१॥

text: The Seen and the Invisible, and the Kurūru have I crushed: Alāndus, and all Chhalunas, we bruise to pieces with our spell.
meaning: दृष्ट॒म् अदृ॒ष्टम् अतृहम् अ॒थो कुरू॒रुम् अतृहम् । अल्ग॒ण्डून्त् स॒र्वान् छलु॒नान् क्रि॒मीन् व॒चसा जम्भयामसि ॥२॥

text: I kill Alāndus with a mighty weapon: burnt or not burnt they now have lost their vigour . Left or not left, I with the spell subdue them: let not a single worm remain uninjured.
meaning: अल्ग॒ण्डून् हन्मि महता॒ वधे॒न दूना॒ अ॒दूना अरसा॒ अभूवन् । शिष्टा॒न् अ॒शिष्टान् नि॒ तिरामि वाचा॒ य॒था क्रि॒मीणां न॒किर् उछि॒षातै ॥३॥

text: The worm that lives within the ribs, within the bowels, in the head. Avaskava and Borer, these we bruise to pieces with the spell.
meaning: अ॒न्वान्त्र्यं शी॒र्षण्य॑म् अ॒थो पा॒र्ष्टेयं क्रि॒मीन् । अवस्कवं॒ व्यध्वरं॒ क्रि॒मीन् व॒चसा जम्भयामसि ॥४॥

text: Worms that are found on mountains, in the forests, that live in plants, in cattle, in the waters, Those that have made their way within our bodies,—these I destroy, the worms' whole generation.
meaning: ये॒ क्रि॒मयः प॒र्वतेशु व॒नेष्व् ओ॒षधीषु पशु॒ष्व् अप्स्व् अ॑न्तः॒ । ये॒ अस्मा॒कं तन्व॑म् आविविशुः॒ स॒र्वं त॒द् धन्मि ज॒निम क्रि॒मीणाम् ॥५॥

text: Uprising let the Sun destroy, and when he sinketh, with his beams. The Worms that live within the cow.
meaning: उद्य॒न्न् आदित्यः॒ क्रि॒मीन् हन्तु निम्रो॒चन् हन्तु रश्मि॒भिः । ये॒ अन्तः॒ क्रि॒मयो ग॒वि ॥१॥

text: The four-eyed worm, of every shape, the variegated, and the white I break and crush the creature's ribs, and tear away its head besides.
meaning: विश्व॒रूपं चतुरक्षं॒ क्रि॒मिं सार॒ङ्गम् अ॒र्जुनम् । शृणा॒म्य् अस्य पृष्टी॒र् अ॒पि वृश्चामि य॒च् छि॒रः ॥२॥

text: Like Atri I destroy you, Worms! in Kanva's, Jamadagni's way: I bray and bruise the creeping things to pieces with Agastya's spell.
meaning: अत्रिव॒द् वः क्रिमयो हन्मि कण्वव॒ज् जमदग्निव॒त् । अग॒स्त्यस्य ब्र॒ह्मणा सं॒ पिनष्म्य् अहं॒ क्रि॒मीन् ॥३॥

text: Slain is the sovran of these Worms, yea, their controlling lord is slain: Slain is the Worm, his mother slain, brother and sister both are slain.
meaning: हतो॒ रा॒जा क्रि॒मीणाम् उतै॒षां स्थप॒तिर् हतः॒ । हतो॒ हत॒माता क्रि॒मिर् हत॒भ्राता हत॒स्वसा ॥४॥

text: Slain are his ministers, and slain his followers and retinue: Yes, those that seemed the tiniest things, the Worms have all been put to death.
meaning: हता॒सो अस्य वेश॒सो हता॒सः प॒रिवेशसः । अ॒थो ये॒ क्षुल्लका॒ इव स॒र्वे ते॒ क्रि॒मयो हताः॒ ॥५॥

text: I break in pieces both thy horns wherewith thou pushest here and there: I cleave and rend the bag which holds the venom which is stored in thee.
meaning: प्र॒ ते शृणामि शृ॒ङ्गे या॒भ्यां वितुदाय॒सि । भिना॒द्मि ते कुषु॒म्भं य॒स् ते विषधा॒नः ॥६॥

text: From both thy nostrils, from both eyes, from both thine ears, and from thy chin, Forth from thy brain and tongue I root Consumption seated in thy head.
meaning: अक्षी॒भ्यां ते ना॒सिकाभ्यां क॒र्णाभ्यां छु॒बुकाद् अ॒धि । य॒क्ष्मं शीर्षण्यं॑ मस्ति॒ष्काज् जिह्वा॒या वि॒ वृहामि ते ॥१॥

text: Forth from the neck and from the nape, from dorsal vertebrae and spine. From arms and shoulder-blades I root Consumption seated in thine arms.
meaning: ग्रीवा॒भ्यस् त उष्णि॒हाभ्यः की॒कसाभ्यो अनूक्या॑त् । य॒क्ष्मं दोषण्य॑म् अं॒साभ्यां बाहु॒भ्यां वि॒ वृहामि ते ॥२॥

text: Forth from thy heart and from thy lungs, from thy gall-bladder and thy sides, From kidneys, spleen and liver thy Consumption we eradicate.
meaning: हृ॒दयात् ते प॒रि क्लोम्नो॒ ह॒लीक्ष्णात् पार्श्वा॒भ्याम् । य॒क्ष्मं म॒तस्नाभ्यां प्लीह्नो॒ यक्न॒स् ते वि॒ वृहामसि ॥३॥

text: From bowels and intestines, from the rectum and the belly, I Extirpate thy Consumption, from flanks, navel and mesentery.
meaning: आन्त्रे॒भ्यस् ते गु॒दाभ्यो वनिष्ठो॒र् उद॒राद् अ॒धि । य॒क्ष्मं कुक्षि॒भ्याम् प्लाशे॒र् ना॒भ्या वि॒ वृहामि ते ॥४॥

text: Forth from thy thighs and from thy knees, heels and the fore- parts of thy feet. Forth from thy loins and hips I draw Consumption setted in thy loins.
meaning: ऊरु॒भ्यां ते अष्ठीव॒द्भ्यां पा॒र्ष्णिभ्यां प्र॒पदाभ्याम् । य॒क्ष्मं भसद्यं॑ श्रो॒णिभ्यां भा॒सदं भं॒ससो वि॒ वृहामि ते ॥५॥

text: Forth from thy marrows and thy bones, forth from thy tendons and thy veins I banish thy Consumption, from thy hands, thy fingers, and thy nails.
meaning: अस्थि॒भ्यस् ते मज्ज॒भ्यः स्ना॒वभ्यो धम॒निभ्यः । य॒क्ष्मम् पाणि॒भ्याम् अङ्गु॒लिभ्यो नखे॒भ्यो वि॒ वृहामि ते ॥६॥

text: In every member, every hair, in every joint wherein it lies, We with the exorcising spell of Kasyapa drive far away Con- sumption settled in thy skin.
meaning: अ॒ङ्गेअङ्गे लो॒म्निलोम्नि य॒स् ते प॒र्वणिपर्वणि । य॒क्ष्मं त्वचस्यं॑ ते वयं॒ कश्य॒पस्य वीबर्हे॒ण वि॒ष्वञ्चं वि॒ वृहामसि ॥७॥

text: May this, of all the beasts that Pasupati rules, Lord of animals,. quadruped and biped, Come, purchased, to the sacrificial portion. May growth of wealth attend the sacrificer.
meaning: य॒ ई॒शे पशुप॒तिः पशूना॒म् च॒तुष्पदाम् उत॒ यो॒ द्विप॒दाम् । नि॒ष्क्रीतः स॒ यज्ञि॒यं भाग॒म् एतु राय॒स् पो॒षा य॒जमानं सचन्ताम् ॥१॥

text: Loosing the seed of future-time existence, give good success, O Gods, to him who worships. May what is present, duly brought, the victim, go to the deities' beloved region.
meaning: प्रमुञ्च॒न्तो भु॒वनस्य रे॒तो गातुं॒ धत्त य॒जमानाय देवाः । उपा॒कृतं शशमानं॒ य॒द् अ॒स्थात् प्रिय॒म् देवा॒नाम् अ॒प्य् एतु पा॒थः ॥२॥

text: Those who are looking, deep in meditation, on the bound ani- mal with eye and spirit To them, the first, may Agni, God, give freedom, rejoicing in his creatures, Visvakarman.
meaning: ये॒ बध्य॒मानम् अ॒नु दी॒ध्याना अन्वै॒क्षन्त म॒नसा च॒क्षुषा च । अग्नि॒ष् टा॒न् अ॒ग्रे प्र॒ मुमोक्तु देवो॒ विश्व॒कर्मा प्रज॒या संरराणः॒ ॥३॥

text: Tame animals of every shape, though varied in colour, manifold. alike in nature To them, the first, may Vāyu, God, give freedom, Prajāpati. rejoicing in his creatures.
meaning: ये॒ ग्राम्याः॒ पश॒वो विश्व॒रूपा वि॒रूपाः स॒न्तो बहुधै॒करूपाः । वायु॒ष् टा॒न् अ॒ग्रे प्र॒ मुमोक्तु देवः॒ प्रजा॒पतिः प्रज॒या संरराणः॒ ॥४॥

text: Let those who know receive before all others the vital breath proceeding from the body. Go to the sky. Stay there with all thy members. By paths which Gods have travelled go to Svarga.
meaning: प्रजान॒न्तः प्र॒ति गृह्णन्तु पू॒र्वे प्राण॒म् अ॒ङ्गेभ्यः प॒र्य् आच॒रन्तम् । दि॒वं गछ प्र॒ति तिष्ठा श॒रीरैः स्वर्गं॒ याहि पथि॒भिर् देवया॒नैः ॥५॥

text: We who enjoying it have grown no richer, for whom the sacred altar-fires have sorrowed, We who compounded with deficient worship,—may Visvakarman make our service prosper.
meaning: ये॒ भक्ष॒यन्तो न॒ व॒सून्य् आनृधु॒र् या॒न् अग्न॒यो अन्व॒तप्यन्त धि॒ष्ण्याः । या॒ ते॒षाम् अवया॒ दु॒रिष्टिः स्वि॑ष्टिं नस् तां॒ कृणवद् विश्व॒कर्मा ॥१॥

text: Rishis have called the sacrifice's patron amerced through sin, sorrowing for his offspring. Those drops of meath whereof the missed enjoyment,—may Visvakarman with those drops unite us.
meaning: यज्ञ॒पतिम् ऋ॒षयः ए॒नसाहुर् नि॒र्भक्तं प्रजा॒ अनुतप्य॒मानम् । मथव्या॑न्त् स्तोका॒न् अ॒प या॒न् ररा॒ध सं॒ नष् टे॒भिः सृजतु विश्व॒कर्मा ॥२॥

text: Regarding niggard churls as Soma-drinkers, skilful in sacrifice, weak at the meeting, Whatever sin the captive hath committed, do thou for weal release him, Visvakarman!
meaning: अदान्या॒न्त् सोमपा॒न् म॒न्यमानो यज्ञ॒स्य विद्वा॒न्त् समये॒ न॒ धी॒रः । य॒द् ए॒नश् चकृवा॒न् बद्ध॒ एष॒ तं॒ विश्वकर्मन् प्र॒ मुञ्चा स्वस्त॒ये ॥३॥

text: Awful are Rishis: unto them be homage, and to their eye and truthfulness of spirit! Loud homage to Brihaspati, O mighty! Homage to thee, O Visvakarman! Guard us.
meaning: घोरा॒ ऋ॒षयो न॒मो अस्त्व् एभ्यश् च॒क्षुर् य॒द् एषां म॒नसश् च सत्य॒म् । बृ॒हस्प॒तये महिष द्युम॒न्न् न॒मो वि॒श्वकर्मन् न॒मस् ते पाह्य् अ॑स्मा॒न् ॥४॥

text: The eye of sacrifice, source, and beginning—with voice, ear, spirit unto him I offer. To this our sacrifice wrought by Visvakarman may the Gods come gracious and kindly-hearted.
meaning: यज्ञ॒स्य च॒क्षुः प्र॒भृतिर् मु॒खं च वाचा॒ श्रो॒त्रेण म॒नसा जुहोमि । इमं॒ यज्ञं॒ वि॒ततं विश्व॒कर्मणा॒ देवा॒ यन्तु सुमनस्य॒मानाः ॥५॥

text: To please us may the suitor come, O Agni, seeking this maid and bringing us good fortune. Approved by wooers, lovely in assemblies, may she be soon made happy with a husband.
meaning: आ॒ नो अग्ने सुमतिं॒ संभलो॒ गमेद् इमां॒ कुमारीं॒ सह॒ नो भ॒गेन । जुष्टा॒ वरे॒षु स॒मनेषु वल्गु॒र् ओषं॒ प॒त्या सौ॒भगम् अस्तु अस्यै॒ ॥१॥

text: As bliss beloved by Soma, dear to Prayer, and stored by Arya- man, With the God Dhātar's truthfulness I work the bridal oracle.
meaning: सो॒मजुष्टं ब्र॒ह्मजुष्टम् अर्यम्ना॒ सं॒भृतं भ॒गम् । धातु॒र् देव॒स्य सत्ये॒न कृणो॒मि पतिवे॒दनम् ॥२॥

text: O Agni, may this woman find a husband. Then verily King Soma makes her happy. May she bear sons, chief lady of the household, blessed and bearing rule beside her consort.
meaning: इय॒म् अग्ने ना॒री प॒तिम् विदेष्ट सो॒मो हि॒ रा॒जा सुभ॒गां कृणो॒ति । सु॒वाना पुत्रा॒न् म॒हिषी भवाति गत्वा॒ प॒तिं सुभ॒गा वि॒ राजतु ॥३॥

text: As this lair, Maghavan! that is fair to look on was dear to wild things as a pleasant dwelling, So may this woman here be Bhaga's darling. Loved by her lord and prizing his affection.
meaning: य॒थाखरो॒ मघवंश् चा॒रुर् एष॒ प्रियो॒ मृगा॒णां सुष॒दा बभू॒व । एवा॒ भ॒गस्य जुष्टे॒य॒म् अस्तु ना॒री सं॒प्रिया प॒त्या॒विराधयन्ती ॥४॥

text: Mount up, embark on Bhaga's ship, the full, the inexhaustible, Thereon bring hitherward to us the lover whom thou fain wouldst wed.
meaning: भ॒गस्य ना॒वम् आ॒ रोह पूर्णा॒म् अ॒नुपदस्वतीम् । त॒योपप्र॒तारय यो॒ वरः॒ प्रतिकाम्यः॑ ॥५॥

text: Call out to him, O Lord of Wealth! Make thou the lover well- inclined. Set each on thy right hand who is a lover worthy of her choice.
meaning: आ॒ क्रन्दय धनपते वर॒म् आ॒मनसं कृणु । स॒र्वं प्रदक्षिणं॒ कृणु यो॒ वरः॒ प्रतिकाम्यः॑ ॥६॥

text: Here is the Bdellium and the gold, the Auksha and the bliss are here: These bring thee to the husbands, so to find the man whom thou. wouldst have.
meaning: इदं॒ हि॒रण्यं गु॒ल्गुल्व् अय॒म् औक्षो॒ अथो भ॒गः । एते॒ प॒तिभ्यस् त्वा॒म् अदुः प्रतिकामा॒य वे॒त्तवे ॥७॥

text: May Savitar lead and bring to thee the husband whom thy heart desires. O Plant, be this thy gift to her!
meaning: आ॒ ते नयतु सविता॒ नयतु प॒तिर् यः॒ प्रतिकाम्यः॑ ॥८॥

text: Let the wise Agni go against our foemen, burning against ill-will and imprecation Let him bewilder our opponents' army, Let Jātavedas smite and make them handless.
meaning: अग्नि॒र् नः श॒त्रून् प्र॒त्य् एतु विद्वा॒न् प्रतिद॒हन्न् अभि॒शस्तिम् अ॒रातिम् । स॒ से॒नां मोहयतु प॒रेषां नि॒र्हस्तांश् च कृणवज् जात॒वेदाः ॥१॥

text: Mighty are ye for such a deed, O Maruts. Go forward, overcome them and destroy them. The Vasus slew, and these were left imploring. Wise Agni as our messenger assail them!
meaning: यूय॒म् उग्रा॒ मरुत ईदृ॒शे स्थाभि॒ प्रे॒त मृण॒त स॒हध्वम् । अ॒मीमृणन् व॒सवो नाथिता॒ इमे॒ अग्नि॒र् ह्य् ए॑षां दूतः॒ प्रत्ये॒तु विद्वा॒न् ॥२॥

text: O Maghavan, O Indra, thou who slayest fiends, and, Agni, thou, Burn, both of you, against these men, the foeman's host that threatens us.
meaning: अमित्रसेनां॒ मघवन्न् अस्मा॒न् छत्रूयती॒म् अभि॒ । युवं॒ ता॒म् इन्द्र वृत्रहन्न् अग्नि॒श् च दहतं प्र॒ति ॥३॥

text: Shot down the slope, with thy two tawny coursers, forth go thy bolt, destroying foes, O Indra! Slay those who fly, slay those who stand and follow. On every side fulfil these men's intention.
meaning: प्र॒सूत इन्द्र प्रव॒ता ह॒रिभ्यां प्र॒ ते व॒ज्रः प्रमृण॒न्न् एतु श॒त्रून् । जहि॒ प्रती॒चो अनू॒चः प॒राचो वि॒ष्वक् सत्यं॒ कृणुहि चित्त॒म् एषाम् ॥४॥

text: Indra, bewilder thou the foemen's army. With Agni's, Vāta's furious rush drive them away to every side.
meaning: इ॒न्द्र से॒नां मोहयामि॒त्राणाम् । अग्ने॒र् वा॒तस्य ध्रा॒ज्या ता॒न् वि॒षूचो वि॒ नाशय ॥५॥

text: Let Indra daze their army. Let the Maruts slay it with their might. Let Agni take their eyes away, and let the conquered host retreat.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रः से॒नां मोहयतु मरु॒तो घ्नन्त्व् ओ॒जसा । च॒क्षूंस्य् अग्नि॒र् आ॒ दत्तां पु॒नर् एतु प॒राजिता ॥६॥

text: May Agni, he who knows, our envoy, meet them, burning against ill-will and imprecation. May he bewilder our opponent's senses. May Jātavedas smite and make them handless.
meaning: अग्नि॒र् नो दूतः॒ प्रत्ये॒तु विद्वा॒न् प्रतिद॒हन्न् अभि॒शस्तिम् अ॒रातिम् । स॒ चित्ता॒नि मोहयतु प॒रेषां नि॒र्हस्तांश् च कृणवज् जात॒वेदाः ॥१॥

text: This Agni hath bewildered all the senses that were in your hearts: Now let him blast you from your home, blast you away from every side.
meaning: अय॒म् अग्नि॒र् अमूमुहद् या॒नि चित्ता॒नि वो हृदि॒ । वि॒ वो धमत्व् ओ॒कसः प्र॒ वो धमतु सर्व॒तः ॥२॥

text: Dazing their senses, Indra, come hitherward with the wish and will. With Agni's, Vāta's furious rush drive them to every side away.
meaning: इ॒न्द्र चित्ता॒नि मोह॒यन्न् अर्वा॒ङ् आ॒कूत्या चर । अग्ने॒र् वा॒तस्य ध्रा॒ज्या ता॒न् वि॒षूचो वि॒ नाशय ॥३॥

text: Vanish, ye hopes and plans of theirs, be ye confounded, all their thoughts! Whatever wish is in their heart, do thou expel it utterly.
meaning: व्य् आ॑कूतय एषाम् इता॒थो चित्ता॒नि मुह्यत । अ॒थो य॒द् अद्यै॒षां हृदि॒ त॒द् एषां प॒रि नि॒र् जहि ॥४॥

text: Bewildering the senses of our foemen, seize on their bodies and depart, O Apvā! Go meet them, flame within their hearts and burn them. Smite thou the foes with darkness and amazement.
meaning: अमी॒षां चित्ता॒नि प्रतिमोह॒यन्ती गृहाणा॒ङ्गान्य् अप्वे प॒रेहि । अभि॒ प्रे॒हि नि॒र् दह हृत्सु॒ शो॒कैर् ग्रा॒ह्यामि॒त्रांस् त॒मसा विध्य श॒त्रून् ॥५॥

text: That army of our enemies, O Maruts, that comes against us with' its might, contending— Meet ye and strike it with unwelcome darkness so that not one. of them may know another.
meaning: असौ॒ या॒ से॒ना मरुतः प॒रेषाम् अस्मा॒न् ऐ॒त्य् अभ्य् ओ॒जसा स्प॒र्धमाना । ता॒म् विध्यत त॒मसा॒पव्रतेन य॒थैषाम् अन्यो॒ अन्यं॒ न॒ जाना॒त् ॥६॥

text: Loudly he roared. Here let him labour deftly. Spread, Agni, over spacious earth and heaven. Let Maruts who possesses all treasures yoke thee. Bring him who reverently paid oblations.
meaning: अ॒चिक्रदत् स्वपा॒ इह॒ भुवद् अ॒ग्ने व्य् अ॑चस्व रो॒दसी उरूची॒ । युञ्ज॒न्तु त्वा मरु॒तो विश्व॒वेदस आ॒मुं॒ नय न॒मसा रात॒हव्यम् ॥१॥

text: Though he be far away, let the red horses bring Indra, bring the sage to us and friendship, Since with Sautrāmani Gods for him o'erpower Gāyatri, Brihatī, and hymn of praises.
meaning: दूरे॒ चित् स॒न्तम् अरुषा॒स इ॒न्द्रम् आ॒ च्यावयन्तु सख्या॒य वि॒प्रम् । य॒द् गायत्रीं॒ बृहती॒म् अर्क॒म् अस्मै सौत्रामण्या॒ द॒धृषन्त देवाः॒ ॥२॥

text: King Varuna call thee hither from the waters! From hills and mountains Soma call thee hither! Let Indra call thee hither to these people. Fly hither to these people as a falcon.
meaning: अद्भ्य॒स् त्वा रा॒ज व॒रुणो ह्वयतु सो॒मस् त्वा ह्वयतु प॒र्वतेभ्यः । इ॒न्द्रस् त्वा ह्वयतु विड्भ्य॒ आभ्यः॒ श्येनो॒ भूत्वा॒ वि॒श आ॒ पतेमाः॒ ॥३॥ {४}

text: May the hawk bring the man who must be summoned, from far away, in alien land, an exile. May both the Asvins make thy pathway easy. Come, and unite yourselves with him, ye Kinsmen.
meaning: श्येनो॒ हव्यं॒ नयत्व् आ॒ प॒रस्माद् अन्यक्षेत्रे॒ अ॒परुद्धं च॒रन्तम् । अश्वि॒ना प॒न्थां कृणुतां सुगं॒ त इमं॒ सजाता अभिसं॒विशध्वम् ॥४॥ {५}

text: Let thine opponents call thee back. Thy friends have chosen, thee again. Indra and Agni, all the Gods have kept thy home amid the tribe.
meaning: ह्व॒यन्तु त्वा प्रतिजनाः॒ प्र॒ति मित्रा॒ अवृषत । इन्द्राग्नी॒ वि॒श्वे देवा॒स् ते विशि॒ क्षे॒मम् अदीधरन् ॥५॥ {६}

text: He who disputes our calling thee, be he a stranger or akin. Drive him, O Indra, far away, and do thou bring this man to us.
meaning: य॒स् ते ह॒वं विव॒दत् सजातो॒ य॒श् च नि॒ष्ट्यः । अ॒पाञ्चम् इन्द्र तं॒ कृत्वा॒थेम॒म् इहा॒व गमय ॥६॥ {७}

text: To thee hath come the kingship with its splendour: On! shine as lord, sole ruler of the people. King! let all regions of the heavens invite thee. Here let men wait on thee and bow before thee.
meaning: आ॒ त्वा गन् राष्त्रं॒ सह॒ व॒र्चसो॒द् इहि प्रा॒ङ् विशां॒ प॒तिर् एकरा॒ट् त्वं॒ वि॒ राज । स॒र्वास् त्वा राजन् प्रदि॒शो ह्वयन्तूपस॒द्यो नमस्यो॑ भवेह॒ ॥१॥

text: The tribesmen shall elect thee for the Kingship, these five celestial regions shall elect thee. Rest on the height and top of kingly power: thence as a mighty man award us treasures.
meaning: त्वां॒ वि॒शो वृणतां राज्या॑य त्वा॒म् इमाः॒ प्रदि॒शः प॒ञ्च देवीः॒ । व॒र्ष्मन् राष्ट्र॒स्य ककु॒दि श्रयस्व त॒तो न उग्रो॒ वि॒ भजा व॒सूनि ॥२॥

text: Kinsmen, inviting thee, shall go to meet thee, with thee go Agni as an active herald. Let women and their sons be friendly-minded. Thou mighty one, shalt see abundant tribute.
meaning: अ॒छ त्वा यन्तु हवि॒नः सजाता॒ अग्नि॒र् दूतो॒ अजिरः॒ सं॒ चरातै । जायाः॒ पुत्राः॒ सुम॒नसो भवन्तु बहुं॒ बलिं॒ प्र॒ति पश्यासा उग्रः॒ ॥३॥

text: First shall the Asvins, Varuna and Mitra, the Universal Gods, and Maruts call thee. Then turn thy mind to giving gifts of treasures, thence, mighty one, distribute wealth among us.
meaning: अश्वि॒ना त्वा॒ग्रे मित्रा॒व॒रुणोभा॒ वि॒श्वे॒ देवा॒ मरु॒तस् त्वा॒ ह्वयन्तु । अ॒धा म॒नो वसुदे॒याय कृणुष्व त॒तो न उग्रो॒ वि॒ भजा व॒सूनि ॥४॥

text: Speed to us hither from the farthest distance. Propitious unto thee be Earth and Heaven. Even so hath Varuna this King asserted, he who himself hath called thee: come thou hither.
meaning: आ॒ प्र॒ द्रव परम॒स्याः पराव॒तः शिवे॒ ते द्या॒वापृथिवी॒ उभे॒ स्ताम् । त॒द् अयं॒ रा॒जा व॒रुणस् त॒थाह स॒ त्वाय॒म् अह्वत् स॒ उपेद॒म् ए॒हि ॥५॥

text: Pass to the tribes of men. O Indra, Indra. Thou the Varunas hast been found accordant. To his own place this one hath called thee, saying, Let him adore the Gods and guide the clansmen.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रेन्द्र मनुष्याः॑ प॒रेहि सं॒ ह्य् अ॒ज्ञास्था व॒रुणैः संविदानः॒ । स॒ त्वाय॒म् अह्वत् स्वे॒ सध॒स्थे स॒ देवा॒न् यक्षत् स॒ उ कल्पयद् वि॒शः ॥६॥

text: The Bounteous Paths in sundry forms and places, all in accord, have given thee room and comfort. Let all of these in concert call thee hither. Live thy tenth decade here, a strong kind ruler.
meaning: पथ्या॑ रेव॒तीर् बहुधा॒ वि॒रूपाः स॒र्वाः संग॒त्य व॒रीयस् ते अक्रन् । ता॒स् त्वा स॒र्वाः संविदाना॒ ह्वयन्तु दशमी॒म् उग्रः॒ सुम॒ना वशेह॒ ॥७॥

text: This Parna-Amulet hath come, strong and destroying with its strength my rivals. The power of the Gods, the plants' sweet essence, may it incite me ceaselessly with vigour.
meaning: आ॒य॒म् अगन् पर्णमणि॒र् बली॒ ब॒लेन प्रमृण॒न्त् सप॒त्नान् । ओ॒जो देवा॒नां प॒य ओ॒षधीनां व॒र्चसा मा जिन्वन्त्व् अ॒प्रयावन् ॥१॥

text: O Parna-Amulet, in me set firmly might and opulence. Within the compass of my rule may I be rooted and supreme.
meaning: म॒यि क्षत्रं॒ पर्णमणे म॒यि धारयताद् रयि॒म् । अहं॒ राष्ट्र॒स्याभीवर्गे॒ निजो॒ भूयासम् उत्तमः॒ ॥२॥

text: That dear mysterious Amulet which Gods have set within the tree, May the Gods grant to me to wear together with extended life.
meaning: यं॒ निदधु॒र् व॒नस्प॒तौ गु॒ह्यं देवाः॒ प्रियं॒ मणि॒म् । त॒म् अस्म॒भ्यं सहा॒युषा देवा॒ ददतु भ॒र्तवे ॥३॥

text: As Indra's gift, by Varuna instructed, Parna hath come, the mighty strength of Soma: This would I, brightly shining, love and cherish for long life lasting through a hundred autumns.
meaning: सो॒मस्य पर्णः॒ स॒ह उग्र॒म् आ॒गन्न् इ॒न्द्रेण दत्तो॒ व॒रुणेन शिष्टः॒ । तं॒ प्रियासं बहु॒ रो॒चमानो दीर्घायुत्वा॒य शत॒शारदाय ॥४॥

text: The Parna-Charm hath come to me for great security from ill. That I may be exalted, yea, above the wealth of Aryaman.
meaning: आ॒ मारुक्षत् पर्णमणि॒र् मह्या॒ अरिष्टता॒तये । य॒थाह॒म् उत्तरो॒ ऽसान्य् अर्यम्ण॒ उत॒ संवि॒दः ॥५॥

text: Sagacious builders of the car, cleaver and skilful artisans,— Make all the men on every side, Parna, obedient to my will
meaning: ये॒ धी॒वानो रथकाराः॒ कर्मा॒रा ये॒ मनीषि॒णः । उपस्ती॒न् पर्ण म॒ह्यं त्वं स॒र्वान् कृण्व् अभि॒तो ज॒नान् ॥६॥

text: The kings and makers of the kings, troop-leaders, masters of the horse, Make all the men on every side, Parna, obedient to my will.
meaning: ये॒ रा॒जानो राजकृ॒तः सूता॒ ग्रामण्य॑श् च ये॒ । उपस्ती॒न् पर्ण म॒ह्यं त्वं॒ स॒र्वान् कृण्व् अभि॒तो ज॒नान् ॥७॥

text: Thou, Parna, art my body's guard, man kin my birth to me a man. With splendour of the circling year I bind thee on me, Amulet!
meaning: पर्णो॒ ऽसि तनूपा॒नः स॒योनिर् वीरो॒ वीरे॒ण म॒या । संवत्सर॒स्य ते॒जसा ते॒न बध्नामि त्वा मणे ॥८॥

text: Masculine springs from masculine, Asvattha grows from Kha- dira, May it destroy mine enemies, who hate me and whom I detest.
meaning: पु॒मान् पुंसः॒ प॒रिजातो ऽश्वत्थः॒ खदिरा॒द् अ॒धि । स॒ हन्तु श॒त्रून् मामका॒न् या॒न् अहं॒ द्वे॒ष्मि ये॒ च मा॒म् ॥१॥

text: Crush down my foes, Asvattha! Rend, O Burster, those who storm and rage, With Indra, slayer of the fiends, with Mitra and with Varuna.
meaning: ता॒न् अश्वत्थ निः॒ शृणीहि श॒त्रून् वैबाधदो॒धतः । इ॒न्द्रेण वृत्रघ्ना॒ मेदी॒ मित्रे॒ण व॒रुणेन च ॥२॥

text: As thou hast rent and torn apart, Asvattha! in the mighty sea, So rend asundar all those men who hate me and whom I detest.
meaning: य॒थाश्वत्थ निर॒भनो ऽन्त॒र् महत्य् अ॑र्णवे॒ । एवा॒ ता॒न्त् स॒र्वान् नि॒र् भङ्ग्धि या॒न् अहं॒ द्वे॒ष्मि ये॒ च मा॒म् ॥३॥

text: Thou who like some victorious bull displayest thy surpassing might, With thee, with thee, Asvattha! we would overcome our enemies.
meaning: यः॒ स॒हमानश् च॒रसि सासहान॒ इव ऋषभः॒ । ते॒नाश्वत्थ त्व॒या वयं॒ सप॒त्नान्त् सहिषीमहि ॥४॥

text: Nirriti bind them with the bonds of Death which never may be loosed. Mine enemies, Asvattha! those who hate me and whom I detest.
meaning: सिना॒त्व् एनान् नि॒रृतिर् मृत्योः॒ पा॒शैर् अमोक्यैः॒ । अ॒श्वत्थ श॒त्रून् मामका॒न् या॒न् अहं॒ द्वे॒ष्मि ये॒ च मा॒म् ॥५॥

text: As thou, Asvastha!, mountest on the trees and overthrowest them, So do thou break my foeman's head asunder and o'erpower him.
meaning: य॒थाश्वत्थ वानस्पत्या॒न् आरो॒हन् कृणुषे॒ ऽधरान् । एवा॒ मे श॒त्रोर् मूर्धा॒नं वि॒ष्वग् भिन्द्धि स॒हस्व च ॥६॥

text: Let them drift downward like a boat torn from the rope that fastened it. There is no turning back for those whom He who Cleaves hath driven away.
meaning: ते॒ ऽधरा॒ञ्चः प्र॒ प्लवन्तां छिन्ना॒ नौ॒र् इव ब॒न्धनात् । न॒ वैबाध॒प्रणुत्तानां पु॒नर् अस्ति निव॒र्तनम् ॥७॥

text: With mental power I drive them forth, drive them with intellect and charm. We banish and expel them with the branch of an Asvattha tree.
meaning: प्रै॒णान् नुदे म॒नसा प्र॒ चित्ते॒नोत॒ ब्र॒ह्मणा । प्रै॒णान् वृक्ष॒स्य शा॒खयाश्वत्थ॒स्य नुदामहे ॥८॥

text: The fleet-foot Roebuck wears upon his head a healing remedy. Innate disease he drives away to all directions with his horn.
meaning: हरिण॒स्य रघुष्य॒दो॒ ऽधि शीर्ष॒णि भेषज॒म् । स॒ क्षेत्रियं॒ विषा॒णया विषूची॒नम् अनीनशत् ॥१॥

text: With his four feet the vigorous Buck hath bounded in pursuit of thee. Unbind the chronic sickness, Horn! deeply inwoven in the heart.
meaning: अ॒नु त्वा हरिणो॒ वृ॒षा पद्भि॒श् चतु॒र्भिर् अक्रमीत् । वि॒षाणे वि॒ ष्य गुष्पितं॒ य॒द् अस्य क्षेत्रियं॒ हृदि॒ ॥२॥

text: That which shines younder, like a roof resting on four walls, down on us,— Therewith from out thy body we drive all the chronic malady,
meaning: अदो॒ य॒द् अवरो॒चते च॒तुष्पक्षम् इव छदिः॒ । ते॒ना ते स॒र्वं क्षेत्रिय॒म् अ॒ङ्गेभ्यो नाशयामसि ॥३॥

text: May those twin stars, auspicious, named Releasers, up in yonder sky. Loose of the chronic malady the uppermost and lowest bond.
meaning: अमू॒ ये॒ दिवि॒ सुभ॒गे विचृ॒तौ ना॒म ता॒रके । वि॒ क्षेत्रिय॒स्य मुञ्चताम् अधमं॒ पा॒शम् उत्तम॒म् ॥४॥

text: Water, indeed, hath power to heal, Water drives malady away. May water—for it healeth all—free thee from permanent disease.
meaning: आ॒प इ॒द् वा॒ उ भेषजी॒र् आ॒पो अमीवचा॒तनीः । आ॒पो वि॒श्वस्य भेषजी॒स् ता॒स् त्वा मुञ्चन्तु क्षेत्रिया॒त् ॥५॥

text: Hath some prepared decoction brought inveterate disease on thee, I know the balm that healeth it: we drive the malady away.
meaning: य॒द् आसुतेः॒ क्रिय॒मानायाः क्षेत्रियं॒ त्वा व्यानशे॒ । वे॒दाहं॒ त॒स्य भेषजं॒ क्षेत्रियं॒ नाशयामि त्व॒त् ॥६॥

text: What time the starlight disappears, what time the gleams of Dawn depart, May evil fortune pass from us, the chronic sickness disappear.
meaning: अपवासे॒ न॒क्षत्राणाम् अपवास॒ उष॒साम् उत॒ । अ॒पास्म॒त् स॒र्वं दुर्भूत॒म् अ॒प क्षेत्रिय॒म् उछतु ॥७॥

text: Let Mitra come, arranging, with the Seasons, lulling the Earth to rest with gleams of splendour. And so let Agni, Varuna, and Vāyu make our dominion tran- quil and exalted.
meaning: आ॒ यातु मित्र॒ ऋतु॒भिः क॒ल्पमानः संवेश॒यन् पृथिवी॒म् उस्रि॒याभिः । अ॒थास्म॒भ्यम् व॒रुणो वायु॒र् अग्नि॒र् बृह॒द् राष्ट्रं॒ संवेश्य॑म् दधातु ॥१॥

text: May Indra, Tvashtar hear my word with favour, may Dhātar, Rāti, Savitar accept it. I call the Goddess Aditi, heroes' mother, that I may be the centre of my kinsmen.
meaning: धाता॒ रातिः॒ सविते॒दं॒ जुशन्ताम् इ॒न्द्रस् त्व॒ष्टा प्र॒ति हर्यन्तु मे व॒चः । हुवे॒ देवी॒म् अ॒दितिं शू॒रपुत्रां सजाता॒नां मध्यमेष्ठा॒ य॒था॒सानि ॥२॥

text: Soma I call, and Savitar with homage, and all the Ādityas in the time of contest. Long may this fire send forth its splendour, lighted by kinsmen uttering no word against me.
meaning: हुवे॒ सो॒मं सविता॒रं न॒मोभिर् वि॒श्वान् आदित्यां॒ अह॒म् उत्तरत्वे॒ । अय॒म् अग्नि॒र् दीदायद् दीर्घ॒म् एव॒ सजातै॒र् इद्धो॒ ऽप्रतिब्रुवद्भिः ॥३॥

text: Here, verily, may you stay: go ye no farther. The strong Herd, Lord of Increase, drive you hither! To please this man may all the Gods together come unto you and be as dames who love him.
meaning: इहे॒द् असाथ न॒ परो॒ गमाथे॒र्यो गोपाः॒ पुष्टप॒तिर् व आ॒जत् । अस्मै॒ का॒मायो॒प कामि॒नीर् वि॒श्वे वो देवा॒ उपसं॒यन्तु ॥४॥

text: We bend together all your minds, your vows and purposes we bend. We bend together you who stand apart with hopes opposed to ours.
meaning: सं॒ वो म॒नांसि सं॒ व्रता॒ स॒म् आ॒कूतीर् नमामसि । अमी॒ ये॒ वि॒व्रता स्थ॒न ता॒न् वः सं॒ नमयामसि ॥५॥

text: I with my spirit seize and hold your spirits. Follow with thought and wish my thoughts and wishes. I make your hearts the thralls of my dominion; on me attendant come thy way I guide you.
meaning: अहं॒ गृभ्णामि म॒नसा म॒नांसि म॒म चित्त॒म् अ॒नु चित्ते॒भिर् ए॒त । म॒म व॒शेषु हृ॒दयानि वः कृणोमि म॒म यात॒म् अ॒नुवर्त्मान ए॒त ॥६॥

text: Heaven is the sire, the mother Earth, of Karsapha and Visapha. As ye have brought them hither, Gods! so do ye move therm hence away.
meaning: कर्श॒फस्य विशफ॒स्य द्यौः॒ पिता॒ पृथिवी॒ माता॒ । य॒थाभिचक्र॒ देवा॒स् त॒था॒प कृणुता पु॒नः ॥१॥

text: The bands hold fast without a knot: this is the way that Manu- used. I make Vishkandha impotent as one emasculateth bulls.
meaning: अश्रेष्मा॒णो अधारयन् त॒था त॒न् म॒नुना कृत॒म् । कृणो॒मि व॒ध्रि वि॒ष्कन्धं मुष्काबर्हो॒ ग॒वाम् इव ॥२॥

text: Then to a tawny-coloured string the wise and skilful bind a brush. Let bandages make impotent the strong and active Kābava.
meaning: पिश॒ङ्गे सू॒त्रे खृ॒गलं त॒द् आ॒ बध्नन्ति वेध॒सः । श्रवस्युं॒ शु॒ष्मं काबवं॒ व॒ध्रिं कृण्वन्तु बन्धु॒रः ॥३॥

text: Ye who move active in your strength like Gods with Asuras' magic powers, Even as the monkey scorns the dogs, Bandages! scorn the Kābava.
meaning: ये॒ना श्रवस्यवश् च॒रथ देवा॒ इवासुरमाय॒या । शु॒नां कपि॒र् इव दू॒षणो ब॒न्धुरा काबव॒स्य च ॥४॥

text: Yea, I will chide thee to thy shame, I will disgrace the Kābava. Under our impracations ye, like rapid cars, shall pass away.
meaning: दु॒ष्ट्यै हि॒ त्वा भत्स्या॒मि दूषयिष्या॒मि काबव॒म् । उ॒द् आश॒वो र॒था इव शप॒थेभिः सरिष्यथ ॥५॥

text: One and one hundred over earth are the Vishkandhas spread abroad. Before these have they fetched thee forth. Vishkandha quelling Amulet.
meaning: ए॒कशतं वि॒ष्कन्धानि वि॒ष्ठिता पृथिवी॒म् अ॒नु । ते॒षां त्वा॒म् अ॒ग्रे उ॒ज् जहरुर् मणिं॒ विष्कन्धदू॒षणम् ॥६॥

text: The First hath dawned. With Yama may it be a cow to pour forth milk. May she be rich in milk and stream for us through many a com- ing year.
meaning: प्रथमा॒ ह व्य् उ॑वास सा॒ धेनु॒र् अभवद् यमे॒ । सा॒ नः प॒यस्वती दुहाम् उ॒त्तरामुत्तराम् स॒माम् ॥१॥

text: May she whom Gods accept with joy, Night who approacheth. as a cow, She who is Consort of the Year, bring us abundant happiness
meaning: यां॒ देवाः॒ प्रतिन॒न्दन्ति रा॒त्रिम् धेनु॒म् उपायती॒म् । संवत्सर॒स्य या॒ प॒त्नी सा॒ नो अस्तु सुमङ्गली॒ ॥२॥

text: Thou whom with reverence we approach, O Night, as model of the Year, Vouchsafe. us children long to live; bless us with increase of our wealth.
meaning: संवत्सर॒स्य प्रतिमां॒ यां॒ त्वा रात्र्य् उपा॒स्महे । सा॒ न आ॒युष्मतीं प्रजां॒ राय॒स् पो॒षेण सं॒ सृज ॥३॥

text: This same is she whose light first dawned upon us: she moves established in the midst of others: Great powers and glories are contained within her: a first-born bride, she conquers and bears children.
meaning: इय॒म् एव॒ सा॒ या॒ प्रथमा॒ व्यौ॒छद् आस्व् इ॒तरासु चरति प्र॒विष्टा । महा॒न्तो अस्यां महिमा॒नो अन्त॒र् वधू॒र् जिगाय नवग॒ज् ज॒नित्री ॥४॥

text: Loud was the wooden pass-gear's ring and rattle, as it made annual oblation ready. First Ashtakā! may we be lords of riches, with goodly children and good men about us.
meaning: वानस्पत्या॒ ग्रा॒वाणो घो॒षम् अक्रत हवि॒ष् कृण्व॒न्तः परिवत्सरी॒णम् । ए॒काष्टके सुप्रज॒सः सुवी॒रा वयं॒ स्याम प॒तयो रयीणा॒म् ॥५॥

text: The shrine of Ilā flows with oil and fatness: accept, O Jātavedas, our oblations. Tame animals of varied form and colour—may all the seven abide with me contented.
meaning: इ॒डायास् पदं॒ घृत॒वत् सरीसृपं॒ जा॒तवेदः प्र॒ति हव्या॒ गृभाय । ये॒ ग्राम्याः॒ पश॒वो विश्व॒रूपास् ते॒षां सप्तानां॒ म॒यि र॒न्तिर् अस्तु ॥६॥

text: Come thou to nourish me and make me prosper. Night! may the favour of the Gods attend us. Filled full, O Ladle, fly thou forth. Completely filled fly back again. Serving at every sacrifice bring to us food and energy.
meaning: आ॒ मा पुष्टे॒ च पो॒षे च रा॒त्रि देवा॒नां सुमतौ॒ स्याम । पूर्णा॒ दर्वे प॒रा पत सु॒पूर्णा पु॒नर् आ॒ पत । स॒र्वान् यज्ञा॒न्त् संभुञ्जती॒षम् ऊ॒र्जं न आ॒ भर ॥७॥

text: This Year hath come to us, thy lord and consort, O Ekāshtakā. Vouchsafe us children long to live, bless us with increase of our wealth.
meaning: आ॒य॒म् अगन्त् संवत्सरः॒ प॒तिर् एकाष्टके त॒व । सा॒ न आ॒युष्मतीं प्रजां॒ राय॒स् पो॒षेण सं॒ सृज ॥८॥

text: The Seasons, and the Seasons' Lords I worship, annual parts and groups. Half years, Years, Months, I offer to the Lord of all existing things.
meaning: ऋतू॒न् यज ऋतुप॒तीन् आर्तवा॒न् उत॒ हायना॒न् । स॒माः संवत्सरा॒न् मा॒सान् भूत॒स्य प॒तये यजे ॥९॥

text: I offer to the Seasons, to their several groups, to Months, to Years. Dhātar, Vidhātar, Fortune, to the lord of all existing things.
meaning: ऋतु॒भ्यष् ट्वार्तवे॒भ्यो माद्भ्यः॒ संवत्सरे॒भ्यः । धात्रे॒ विधात्रे॒ समृ॒धे भूत॒स्य प॒तये यजे ॥१०॥

text: With fatness and libation we sacrifice and adore the Gods. Wealthy in kine may we retire to rest us in our modest homes.
meaning: इ॒डया जु॒ह्वतो वयं॒ देवा॒न् घृत॒वता यजे । गृहा॒न् अ॒लुभ्यतो वयं॒ सं विशेमो॒प गो॒मतः ॥११॥

text: Ekāshtakā, burning with zealous fervour, brought forth her babe the great and glorious Indra. With him the Gods subdued their adversaries: the Lord of Might became the Dasyus' slayer.
meaning: एकाष्टका॒ त॒पसा तप्य॒माना जजा॒न ग॒र्भं महिमा॒नम् इ॒न्द्रम् । ते॒न देवा॒ व्य् अ॑सहन्त श॒त्रून् हन्ता॒ द॒स्यूनाम् अभवच् छ॒चीप॒तिः ॥१२॥

text: Indra's and Soma's mother! thou art daughter of Prajāpati. Satisfy thou our hearts' desires. Gladly accept our sacrifice.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रपुत्रे सो॒मपुत्रे दुहिता॒सि प्रजा॒पतेः । का॒मान् अस्मा॒कं पूरय प्र॒ति गृह्णाहि नो हविः॒ ॥१३॥

text: For life I set thee free by this oblation both from unmarked'. decline and from consumption: Or if the grasping demon have possessed him, free him from her,. O Indra, thou and Agni!
meaning: मुञ्चा॒मि त्वा हवि॒षा जी॒वनाय क॒म् अज्ञातयक्ष्मा॒द् उत॒ राजयक्ष्मा॒त् । ग्रा॒हिर् जग्रा॒ह य॒द्य् एत॒द् एनं त॒स्या इन्द्राग्नी प्र॒ मुमुक्तम् एनम् ॥१॥

text: Be his days ended, be he now departed, be he brought very near to death already, Out of Destruction's lap again I bring him, save him for life to last a hundred autumns.
meaning: य॒दि क्षिता॒युर् य॒दि वा प॒रेतो य॒दि मृत्यो॒र् अन्तिकं॒ एव॒ । त॒म् आ॒ हरामि नि॒रृतेर् उप॒स्थाद् अ॒स्पार्शम् एनं शत॒शारदाय ॥२॥

text: With sacrifice thousand-eyed and hundred-powered, bringing a hundred lives, have I restored him, That Indra through the autumns may conduct him safe to the farther shore of all misfortune.
meaning: सहस्राक्षे॒ण शत॒वीर्येण शता॒युषा हवि॒षा॒हार्षम् एनम् । इ॒न्द्रो य॒थैनं शर॒दो न॒यात्य् अ॒ति वि॒श्वस्य दुरित॒स्य पार॒म् ॥३॥

text: Live, waxing in thy strength a hundred autumns, live through a hundred springs, a hundred winters! Indra, Agni, Savitar, Brihaspati give thee a hundred! With hundred-lived oblation have I saved him,
meaning: शतं॒ जीव शर॒दो व॒र्धमानः शतं॒ हेमन्ता॒न् छत॒म् उ वसन्ता॒न् । शतं॒ ते इ॒न्द्रो अग्निः॒ सविता॒ बृ॒हस्प॒तिः शता॒युषा हवि॒षा॒हार्षम् एनम् ॥४॥

text: Breath, Respiration, come to him, as two car-oxen to their stall! Let all the other deaths, whereof men count a hundred, pass away.
meaning: प्र॒ विशतं प्राणापानाव् अनड्वा॒हाव् इव व्रज॒म् । व्य् अ॑न्ये॒ यन्तु मृत्य॒वो या॒न् आहु॒र् इ॒तरान् छत॒म् ॥५॥

text: Breath, Respiration, stay ye here. Go ye not hence away from him, Bring, so that he may reach old age, body and members back again.
meaning: इहै॒व॒ स्तं प्राणापानौ मा॒प गातम् इतो॒ युव॒म् । श॒रीरम् अस्या॒ङ्गानि जर॒से वहतं पु॒नः ॥६॥

text: I give thee over to old age, make thee the subject of old age. Let kindly old age lead thee on. Let all the other deaths, whereof men count a hundred, pass away!
meaning: जरा॒यै त्वा प॒रि ददामि जरा॒यै नि॒ धुवामि त्वा । जरा॒ त्वा भद्रा॒ नेष्ट व्य् अ॑न्ये॒ यन्तु मृत्य॒वो या॒न् आहु॒र् इ॒तरान् छत॒म् ॥७॥

text: Old age hath girt thee with its bonds even as they bind a bull with rope. The death held thee at thy birth bound with a firmly-knotted noose, Therefrom, with both the hands of Truth, Brihaspati hath loose- ned thee.
meaning: अभि॒ त्वा जरिमा॒हित गा॒म् उक्ष॒णम् इव र॒ज्ज्वा । य॒स् त्वा मृत्यु॒र् अभ्य॒धत्त जा॒यमानं सुपाश॒या । तं॒ ते सत्य॒स्य ह॒स्ताभ्याम् उ॒द् अमुञ्चद् बृ॒हस्प॒तिः ॥८॥

text: Here, even here I fix my firm-set dwelling; flowing with fatness may it stand in safety. May we approach thee, House! with all our people, uncharmed and goodly men, and dwell within thee,
meaning: इहै॒व॒ ध्रुवां॒ नि॒ मिनोमि शा॒लां क्षे॒मे तिष्ठाति घृत॒म् उक्ष॒माणा । तां॒ त्वा शाले स॒र्ववीराः सुवी॒रा अ॒रिष्टवीरा उ॒प सं॒ चरेम ॥१॥

text: Even here, O House, stand thou on firm foundation, wealthy in horses, rich in kine and gladness. Wealthy in nourishment. in milk and fatness, rise up for great felicity and fortune.
meaning: इहै॒व॒ ध्रुवा॒ प्र॒ति तिष्ठ शाले॒ ऽश्वावती गो॒मती सूनृ॒तावती । ऊ॒र्जस्वती घृत॒वती प॒यस्वत्य् उ॒च् छ्रयस्व महते॒ सौ॒भगाय ॥२॥

text: A spacious store, O House, art thou, full of clean corn and lofty-roofed. Let the young calf and little boy approach thee, and milch-kine streaming homeward in the evening.
meaning: धरुण्य् अ॑सि शाले बृह॒छन्दाः पू॒तिधान्या । आ॒ त्वा वत्सो॒ गमेद् आ॒ कुमार॒ आ॒ धेन॒वः साय॒म् आस्प॒न्दमानाः ॥३॥

text: This House may Savitar and Vāyu stablish, Brihaspati who knows the way, and Indra. May the moist Maruts sprinkle it with fatness, and may King Bhaga make our corn-land fruitful.
meaning: इमां॒ शा॒लां सविता॒ वायु॒र् इ॒न्द्रो बृ॒हस्प॒तिर् नि॒ मिनोतु प्रजान॒न् । उक्ष॒न्तूद्ना॒ मरु॒तो घृते॒न भ॒गो नो रा॒जा नि॒ कृषिं॒ तनोतु ॥४॥

text: Queen of the home! thou, sheltering, kindly Goddess, wast sta- blished by the Gods in the beginning. Clad in thy robe of grass be friendly-minded, and give us wealth with goodly men about us.
meaning: मा॒नस्य पत्नि शरणा॒ स्योना॒ देवी॒ देवे॒भिर् नि॒मितास्य् अ॒ग्रे । तृ॒णं व॒साना सुम॒ना असस् त्व॒म् अ॒थास्म॒भ्यं सह॒वीरं रयिं॒ दाः ॥५॥

text: Thou Pole, in ordered fashion mount the pillar. Strong, shining forth afar, keep off our foemen. House! let not those who dwell within thee suffer. Live we with all our men, a hundred autumns.
meaning: ऋते॒न स्थू॒णाम् अ॒धि रोह वंशोग्रो॒ विरा॒जन्न् अ॒प वृङ्क्ष्व श॒त्रून् । मा॒ ते रिषन्न् उपसत्ता॒रो गृहा॒णां शाले शतं॒ जीवेम शर॒दः स॒र्ववीराः ॥६॥

text: To this the tender boy hath come, to this the calf with all the beasts, To this crock of foaming drink, hither with jars of curdled milk.
meaning: ए॒मां॒ कुमार॒स् त॒रुण आ॒ वत्सो॒ ज॒गता सह॒ । ए॒मा॒म् परिस्रु॒तः कुम्भ॒ आ॒ दध्नः॒ कल॒शैर् अगुः ॥७॥

text: Bring hitherward, O dame, the well-filled pitcher, the stream of molten butter blent with nectar. Bedew these drinkers with a draught of Amrit. May all our hopes' fulfilment guard this dwelling.
meaning: पूर्णं॒ नारि प्र॒ भर कुम्भ॒म् एतं॒ घृत॒स्य धा॒राम् अमृ॒तेन सं॒भृताम् । इमां॒ पातृ॒̄न् अमृ॒तेन स॒म् अङ्ग्धीष्टापूर्त॒म् अभि॒ रक्षात्य् एनाम् ॥८॥

text: Water that kills Consumption, free from all Consumption, here I bring. With Agni, the immortal one, I enter and possess the house.
meaning: इमा॒ आ॒पः प्र॒ भराम्य् अयक्ष्मा॒ यक्ष्मना॒शनीः । गृहा॒न् उ॒प प्र॒ सीदाम्य् अमृ॒तेन सहा॒ग्नि॒ना ॥९॥

text: As ye, when Ahi had been slain, flowed forth together with a roar, So are ye called the Roaring Ones: this, O ye Rivers, is your name.
meaning: य॒द् अदः॒ संप्रयती॒र् अ॒हाव् अ॒नदता हते॒ । त॒स्माद् आ॒ नद्यो॑ ना॒म स्थ ता॒ वो ना॒मानि सिन्धवः ॥१॥

text: As driven forth by Varuna ye swiftly urged your rolling waves, There Indra reached you as you flowed; hence ye are still the Water-floods.
meaning: य॒त् प्रे॒षिता व॒रुणेना॒च् छी॒भम् सम॒वल्गत । त॒द् आप्नोद् इ॒न्द्रो वो यती॒स् त॒स्माद् आ॒पो अ॒नु ष्ठन ॥२॥

text: Indra restrained you with his might. Goddesses, as ye glided on Not in accordance with his will: hence have ye got the name of Streams.
meaning: अपकामं॒ स्य॒न्दमाना अ॒वीवरत वो हि॒ कम् । इ॒न्द्रो वः श॒क्तिभिर् देवीस् त॒स्माद् वा॒र् ना॒म वो हित॒म् ॥३॥

text: One only God set foot on you flowing according to your will, The mighty ones breathed upward fast: hence; Water is the name they bear.
meaning: ए॒कः वो देवो॒ ऽप्य् अतिष्ठत् स्य॒न्दमाना यथावश॒म् । उ॒द् आनिषुर् मही॒र् इ॒ति त॒स्माद् उदक॒म् उच्यते ॥४॥

text: Water is good, water indeed is fatness. Agni and Soma, truly, both bring water. May the strong rain of those who scatter sweetness come helpful unto me with breath and vigour.
meaning: आ॒पो भद्रा॒ घृत॒म् इ॒द् आ॒प आसन्न् अग्नी॒षो॒मौ बिभ्रत्य् आ॒प इ॒त् ताः॒ । तीव्रो॒ र॒सो मधुपृ॒चाम् अरंगम॒ आ॒ मा प्राणे॒न सह॒ व॒र्चसा गमेत् ॥५॥

text: Then verily, I see, yea, also hear them: their sound approaches me, their voice comes hither. Even then I think I am enjoying Amrit, what time I drink my fill of you, gold coloured!
meaning: आ॒द् इ॒त् पश्याम्य् उत॒ वा शृणोम्य् आ॒ मा घो॒षो गछति वा॒ङ् मासाम् । म॒न्ये भेजानो॒ अमृ॒तस्य त॒र्हि हि॒रण्यवर्णा अ॒तृपं यदा॒ वः ॥६॥

text: Here, O ye Waters, is your heart. Here is your calf, ye holy ones. Flow here, just here, O mighty Streams, whither I now am lead- ing you.
meaning: इदं॒ व आपो हृ॒दयम् अयं॒ वत्स॒ ऋतावरीः । इहे॒त्थ॒म् ए॒त शक्वरीर् य॒त्रेदं॒ वेश॒यामि वः ॥७॥

text: A Pen wherein to dwell at ease, abundance and prosperity, Whate'er is called the birth of day, all this do we bestow on you.
meaning: सं॒ वो गोष्ठे॒न सुष॒दा सं॒ रय्या॒ सं॒ सु॒भूत्या । अ॒हर्जातस्य य॒न् ना॒म ते॒ना वः सं॒ सृजामसि ॥१॥

text: May Aryaman pour gifts on you, and Pūshan, land Brihaspati, And Indra, winner of the prize. Make ye my riches grow with me.
meaning: सं॒ वः सृजत्व् अर्यमा॒ सं॒ पूषा॒ सं॒ बृ॒हस्प॒तिः । स॒म् इ॒न्द्रो यो॒ धनंजयो॒ म॒यि पुष्यत य॒द् व॒सु ॥२॥

text: Moving together, free from fear, with plenteous droppings in this pen, Bearing sweet milk-like Soma-juice, come hither free from all disease.
meaning: संजग्माना॒ अ॒बिभ्युषीर् अस्मि॒न् गोष्ठे॒ करीषि॒णीः । बि॒भ्रतीः सोम्यं॒ म॒ध्व् अनमीवा॒ उपे॒तन ॥३॥

text: Come hither, to this place, O Cows: here thrive as though ye were manured. Even here increase and multiply; let us be friendly, you and me.
meaning: इहै॒व॒ गाव ए॒तनेहो॒ श॒केव पुष्यत । इहै॒वो॒त॒ प्र॒ जायध्वं म॒यि संज्ञा॒नम् अस्तु वः ॥४॥

text: Auspicious be this stall to you. Prosper like cultivated rice. Even here increase and multiply. Myself do we bestow on you.
meaning: शिवो॒ वो गोष्ठो॒ भवतु शारिशा॒केव पुष्यत । इहै॒वो॒त॒ प्र॒ जायध्वं म॒या वः सं॒ सृजामसि ॥५॥

text: Follow me, Cows, as master of the cattle. Here may this Cow- pen make you grow and prosper, Still while we live may we approach you living, ever increasing with the growth of riches.
meaning: म॒या गावो गो॒पतिना सचध्वम् अयं॒ वो गोष्ठ॒ इह॒ पोषयिष्णुः॒ । राय॒स् पो॒षेण बहुला॒ भ॒वन्तीर् जीवा॒ जी॒वन्तीर् उ॒प वः सदेम ॥६॥

text: I stir and animate the merchant Indra; may he approach and be our guide and leader. Chasing ill-will, wild beast, and highway robber, may he who hath the power give me riches.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रम् अहं॒ वणि॒जं चोदयामि स॒ न ऐ॒तु पुरएता॒ नो अस्तु । नुद॒न्न् अ॒रातिं परिपन्थि॒नं मृगं॒ स॒ ई॒शानो धनदा॒ अस्तु म॒ह्यम् ॥१॥

text: The many paths which Gods are wont to travel, the paths which go between the earth and heaven, May they rejoice with me in milk and fatness that I may make rich profit by my purchase.
meaning: ये॒ प॒न्थानो बह॒वो देवया॒ना अन्तरा॒ द्या॒वापृथिवी॒ संच॒रन्ति । ते॒ मा जुषन्तां प॒यसा घृते॒न य॒था क्रीत्वा॒ ध॒नम् आह॒राणि ॥२॥

text: With fuel. Agni! and with butter, longing, mine offering I present for strength and conquest; With prayer, so far as I have strength, adoring—this holy hymn to gain a hundred treasures.
meaning: इध्मे॒नाग्न इछ॒मानो घृते॒न जुहो॒मि हव्यं॒ त॒रसे ब॒लाय । या॒वद् ई॒शे ब्र॒ह्मणा व॒न्दमान इमां॒ धि॒यं शतसे॒याय देवी॒म् ॥३॥

text: Pardon this stubbornness of ours. O Agni, the distant pathway which our feet have trodden. Propitious unto us be sale and barter, may interchange of mer- chandise enrich me. Accept, ye twain, accordant, this libation! Prosperous be our ventures and incomings.
meaning: इमा॒म् अग्ने शर॒णिं मीमृषो नो य॒म् अ॒ध्वानम् अ॒गाम दूर॒म् । शुनं॒ नो अस्तु प्रपणो॒ विक्र॒यश् च प्रतिपणः॒ फलि॒नं मा कृणोतु । इदं॒ हव्यं॒ संविदानौ॒ जुषेथां शुनं॒ नो अस्तु चरित॒म् उ॒त्थितं च ॥४॥

text: The wealth wherewith I carry on my traffic, seeking, ye Gods! wealth with the wealth I offer, May this grow more for me, not less: O Agni, through sacrifice chase those who hinder profit!
meaning: ये॒न ध॒नेन प्रपणं॒ च॒रामि ध॒नेन देवा ध॒नम् इछ॒मानः । त॒न् मे भू॒यो भवतु मा॒ क॒नीयो॒ ऽग्ने सातघ्नो॒ देवा॒न् हवि॒षा नि॒ षेध ॥५॥

text: The wealth wherewith I carry on my traffic, seeking, ye Gods! wealth with the wealth I offer, Herein may Indra, Savitar, and Soma, Prajāpati, and Agni give me splendour.
meaning: ये॒न ध॒नेन प्रपणं॒ च॒रामि ध॒नेन देवा ध॒नम् इछ॒मानः । त॒स्मिन् म इ॒न्द्रो रु॒चिम् आ॒ दधातु प्रजा॒पतिः सविता॒ सो॒मो अग्निः॒ ॥६॥

text: With reverence we sign thy praise, O Hotar-priest Vaisvānara. Over our children keep thou watch, over our bodies, kine, and lives.
meaning: उ॒प त्वा न॒मसा वयं॒ हो॒तर् वैश्वानर स्तुमः॒ । स॒ नः प्रजा॒स्व् आत्म॒सु गो॒षु प्राणे॒षु जागृहि ॥७॥

text: Still to thee ever will we bring oblation, as to a stabled horse, O Jātavedas. Joying in food and in the growth of riches may we thy servants, Agni, never suffer.
meaning: विश्वा॒हा ते स॒दम् इ॒द् भरेमा॒श्वायेव ति॒ष्ठते जातवेदः । राय॒स् पो॒षेण स॒म् इषा॒ म॒दन्तो मा॒ ते अग्ने प्र॒तिवेशा रिषाम ॥८॥

text: Agni at dawn, and Indra we invoke at dawn, and Varuna and Mitra, and the Asvins twain: Bhaga at dawn, Pūshan and Brāhmanaspati, Soma at dawn, and Rudra we invoke at dawn.
meaning: प्रात॒र् अग्निं॒ प्रात॒र् इ॒न्द्रम् हवामहे प्रात॒र् मित्रा॒व॒रुणा प्रात॒र् अश्वि॒ना । प्रात॒र् भ॒गं पूष॒णं ब्र॒ह्मणस् प॒तिं प्रातः॒ सो॒मम् उत॒ रुद्रं॒ हवामहे ॥१॥

text: We all strong Bhaga, conqueror in the morning, the son of Aditi, the great Disposer, Whom each who deems himself poor, strong and mighty, a king, addresses thus, Grant thou my portion!
meaning: प्रातर्जि॒तं भ॒गम् उग्र॒म् हवामहे वयं॒ पुत्र॒म् अ॒दितेर् यो॒ विधर्ता॒ । आध्र॒श् चिद् यं॒ म॒न्यमानस् तुर॒श् चिद् रा॒जा चिद् यं॒ भ॒गं भक्षी॒त्य् आ॒ह ॥२॥

text: Bhaga, our guide, Bhaga whose gifts are faithful, favour this hymn and give us wealth, O Bhaga. Bhaga, augment our store of kine and horses. Bhaga, may we be rich in men and heroes.
meaning: भ॒ग प्र॒णेतर् भ॒ग स॒त्यराधो भ॒गेमां॒ धि॒यम् उ॒द् अवा द॒दन् नः । भ॒ग प्र॒ णो जनय गो॒भिर् अ॒श्वैर् भ॒ग प्र॒ नृ॒भिर् नृव॒न्तः स्याम ॥३॥

text: So may felicity be ours at present, and when the Sun advances, and at noontide; And may we still, O Bounteous One, at sunset be happy in the Gods' protecting favour.
meaning: उते॒दा॒नीं भ॒गवन्तः स्यामोत॒ प्रपित्व॒ उत॒ म॒ध्ये अ॒ह्नाम् । उतो॒दितौ मघवन्त् सू॒र्यस्य वयं॒ देवा॒नां सुमतौ॒ स्याम ॥४॥

text: May Bhaga verily be bliss-bestower, and through him, Gods! may happiness attend us. As such with all my might I call and call thee: as such be thou our leader here, O Bhaga.
meaning: भ॒ग एव॒ भ॒गवां अस्तु देव॒स् ते॒ना वयं॒ भ॒गवन्तः स्याम । तं॒ त्वा भग स॒र्व इ॒ज् जोहवीमि स॒ नो भग पुरएता॒ भवेह॒ ॥५॥

text: To this our sacrifice may the Dawns incline them, and come to the pure place like Dadhikrāvan. As strong steeds draw a chariot may they bring me hitherward Bhaga who discovers treasure.
meaning: स॒म् अध्वरा॒योष॒सो नमन्त दधिक्रा॒वेव शु॒चये पदा॒य । अर्वाचीनं॒ वसुवि॒दं भ॒गं मे र॒थम् इवा॒श्वा वाजि॒न आ॒ वहन्तु ॥६॥

text: May the kind Mornings dawn on us for ever with, wealth of kine, of horses, and of heroes. Streaming with all abundance, pouring fatness, Do ye preserve us evermore with blessings!
meaning: अ॒श्वावतीर् गो॒मतीर् न उषा॒सो वीर॒वतीः स॒दम् उछन्तु भद्राः॒ । घृतं॒ दु॒हाना विश्व॒तः प्र॒पीता यूयं॒ पात स्वस्ति॒भिः स॒दा नः ॥७॥

text: Wise and devoted to the Gods the skilful men bind plough-ropes fast, And lay the yokes on either side.
meaning: सी॒रा युञ्जन्ति कव॒यो युगा॒ वि॒ तन्वते पृ॒थक् । धी॒रा देवे॒षु सुम्नयौ॒ ॥१॥

text: Lay on the yokes and fasten well the traces: formed is the furrow, sow the seed within it. Virāj vouchsafe us hearing fraught with plenty! Let the ripe grain come near and near the sickle.
meaning: युन॒क्त सी॒रा वि॒ युगा॒ तनोत कृते॒ यो॒नौ वपतेह॒ बी॒जम् । विरा॒जः श्नु॒ष्टिः स॒भरा असन् नो ने॒दीय इ॒त् सृण्यः॑ पक्व॒म् आ॒ यवन् ॥२॥

text: The keen-shared plough that bringeth bliss, furnished with traces and with stilts, Shear out for me a cow, a sheep, a rapid drawer of the car, a blooming woman, plump and strong!
meaning: ला॒ङ्गलं पवीर॒वत् सुशी॒मं सोमस॒त्सरु । उ॒द् इ॒द् वपतु गा॒म् अ॒विं प्रस्था॒वद् रथवा॒हनं पी॒बरीं च प्रफर्व्य॑म् ॥३॥

text: May Indra press the furrow down, may Pūshan guard and cherish her. May she, well stored with milk yield milk for us through each succeeding year.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रः सी॒तां नि॒ गृह्णातु तां॒ पूषा॒भि॒ रक्षतु । सा॒ नः प॒यस्वती दुहाम् उ॒त्तरामुत्तरां स॒माम् ॥४॥

text: Happily let the shares turn up the ploughland, the ploughers happily follow the oxen. Pleased with our sacrifice, Suna and Sira! make the plants bring this man abundant produce.
meaning: शुनं॒ सुफाला॒ वि॒ तुदन्तु भू॒मिं शुनं॒ कीना॒शा अ॒नु यन्तु वाहा॒न् । शु॒नासीरा हवि॒षा तो॒शमाना सुपिप्पला॒ ओ॒षधीः कर्तम् अस्मै॒ ॥५॥

text: Happily work our steers and men! May the plough furrow happily, Happily be the traces bound. Happily ply the driving-goad.
meaning: शुनं॒ वाहाः॒ शुनं॒ न॒रः शुनं॒ कृषतु ला॒ङ्गलम् । शुनं॒ वरत्रा॒ बध्यन्तां शुन॒म् अ॒ष्ट्राम् उ॒द् इङ्गय ॥६॥

text: Suna and Sira, welcome ye this laud, and with the milk that ye have made in heaven, Bedew ye both this earth of ours.
meaning: शु॒नासीरेह॒ स्म मे जुषेथाम् । य॒द् दिवि॒ चक्र॒थुः प॒यस् ते॒ने॒मा॒म् उ॒प सिञ्चतम् ॥७॥

text: Auspicious Sitā, come thou near: we venerate and worship thee. That thou mayst bless and prosper us and bring us fruits abundantly.
meaning: सी॒ते व॒न्दामहे त्वार्वा॒ची सुभगे भव । य॒था नः सुम॒ना अ॒सो य॒था नः सुफला॒ भु॒वः ॥८॥

text: Loved by the Visvedevas and the Maruts, let Sitā be bedewed. with oil and honey. Turn thou to us with wealth of milk, O Sitā, in vigorous strength and pouring streams of fatness.
meaning: घृते॒न सी॒ता म॒धुना स॒मक्ता वि॒श्वैर् देवै॒र् अ॒नुमता मरु॒द्भिः । सा॒ नः सीते प॒यसाभ्या॒ववृत्स्वो॒र्जस्वती घृत॒वत् पि॒न्वमाना ॥९॥

text: From out the earth I dig this Plant, and herb of most effectual power, Wherewith one quells the rival wife and gains the husband for one's self.
meaning: इमां॒ खनाम्य् ओ॒षधिं वीरु॒धां ब॒लवत्तमाम् । य॒या सप॒त्नीं बा॒धते य॒या संविन्द॒ते प॒तिम् ॥१॥

text: Auspicious, with expanded leaves, sent by the Gods, victorious Plant, Drive thou, the rival wife away, and make my husband only mine.
meaning: उ॒त्तानपर्णे सु॒भगे दे॒वजूते स॒हस्वति । सप॒त्नीं मे प॒रा णुद प॒तिं मे के॒वलं कृधि ॥२॥

text: Indeed he hath not named her name: thou with this husband dalliest not, Far into distance most remote we drive the rival wife away.
meaning: नहि॒ ते ना॒म जग्रा॒ह नो॒ अस्मि॒न् रमसे प॒तौ । प॒राम् एव॒ पराव॒तं सप॒त्नीं गमयामसि ॥३॥

text: Stronger am I, O stronger one, yea, mightier than the mightier; Beneath me be my rival wife, down, lower than the lowest dames!
meaning: उ॒त्तराह॒म् उत्तर उ॒त्तरे॒द् उ॒त्तराभ्यः । अधः॒ सप॒त्नी या॒ म॒मा॒धरा सा॒धराभ्यः ॥४॥

text: I am the conqueror, and thou, thou also art victorious: As victory attends us both we will subdue my fellowwife.
meaning: अह॒म् अस्मि स॒हमाना॒थो त्व॒म् असि सासहिः॒ । उभे॒ स॒हस्वती भूत्वा॒ सप॒त्नीं मे सहावहै ॥५॥

text: I've girt thee with the conquering Plant, beneath thee laid the mightiest one. As a cow hastens to her calf, so let thy spirit speed to me, hasten like water on its way.
meaning: अभि॒ ते ऽधां स॒हमानाम् उ॒प ते ऽधां स॒हीयसीम् । मा॒म् अ॒नु प्र॒ ते म॒नो वत्सं॒ गौ॒र् इव धावतु पथा॒ वा॒र् इव धावतु ॥६॥

text: Quickened is this my priest rank, quickened is manly strength and force, Quickened be changeless power, whereof I am the conquering President!
meaning: सं॒शितं म इदं॒ ब्र॒ह्म सं॒शितं वीर्यं॑ ब॒लम् । सं॒शितं क्षत्र॒म् अज॒रम् अस्तु जिष्णु॒र् ये॒षाम् अस्मि पुरो॒हितः ॥१॥

text: I quicken these men's princely sway, the might, the manly strength and force; I rend away the foemen's arms with this presented sacrifice.
meaning: स॒म् अह॒म् एषां॒ राष्ट्रं॒ स्यामि स॒म् ओ॒जो वीर्यं॑ ब॒लम् । वृश्चा॒मि श॒त्रूणां बाहू॒न् अने॒न हवि॒षा अह॒म् ॥२॥

text: Down fall the men, low let them lie, who fight against our mighty prince, I ruin foemen with my spell, and raise my friends to high estate.
meaning: नीचैः॒ पद्यन्ताम् अ॒धरे भवन्तु ये॒ नः सूरिं॒ मघ॒वानं पृतन्या॒न् । क्षिणा॒मि ब्र॒ह्मणामि॒त्रान् उ॒न् नयामि स्वा॒न् अह॒म् ॥३॥

text: Keener than is the axe's edge, keener than Agni's self are they, Keener than Indra's bolt are they whose Priest and President am I.
meaning: ती॒क्ष्णीयांसः परशो॒र् अग्ने॒स् तीक्ष्ण॒तरा उत॒ । इ॒न्द्रस्य व॒ज्रात् ती॒क्ष्णीयांसो ये॒षाम् अ॒स्मि पुरो॒हितः ॥४॥

text: The weapons of these men I whet and sharpen, with valiant heroes I increase their kingdom. Victorious be their power and ever ageless! May all the Gods promote their thoughts and wishes.
meaning: एषा॒म् अह॒म् आ॒युधा सं॒ स्याम्य् एषां॒ राष्ट्रं॒ सुवी॒रं वर्धयामि । एषा॒म् क्षत्र॒म् अज॒रम् अस्तु जिष्ण्व् ए॑षां॒ चित्तं॒ वि॒श्वे ऽवन्तु देवाः॒ ॥५॥

text: Let their fierce powers, O Maghavan, be heightened, and upward go the shout of conquering heroes. Apart and clear, let shout and roar and shriek and lamentation rise! Let the Gods led by Indra, let the Maruts with our army go.
meaning: उ॒द् धर्षन्तां मघवन् वा॒जिनान्य् उ॒द् वीरा॒णां ज॒यताम् एतु घो॒षः । पृ॒थग् घो॒षा उलुल॒यः केतुम॒न्त उ॒द् ईरताम् । देवा॒ इ॒न्द्रज्येष्ठा मरु॒तो यन्तु से॒नया ॥६॥

text: Advance and be victorious, men I Exceeding mighty be your arms! Smite with sharp-pointed arrows those whose bows are weak. With your strong arms and weapons smite the feeble foe.
meaning: प्रे॒ता ज॒यता नर उग्रा॒ वः सन्तु बाह॒वः । तीक्ष्णे॒षवो ऽबल॒धन्वनो हतोग्रा॒युधा अबला॒न् उग्र॒बाहवः ॥७॥

text: Loosed from the bowstring fly away, thou Arrow, sharpened by our prayer. Assail the foemen, vanquish them, conquer each bravest man of theirs, and let not one of them escape.
meaning: अ॒वसृष्टा प॒रा पत श॒रव्ये ब्र॒ह्मसंशिते । ज॒य अमि॒त्रान् प्र॒ पद्यस्व जह्य् ए॑षां व॒रंवरं मा॒मी॒षां मोचि क॒श् चन॒ ॥८॥

text: This is thine ordered place of birth whence sprung to life thou shinest forth. Knowing this, Agni, mount on high and cause our riches to increase.
meaning: अयं॒ ते यो॒निर् ऋत्वि॒यो य॒तो जातो॒ अ॒रोचथाः । तं॒ जान॒न्न् अग्न आ॒ रोहा॒धा नो वर्धय रयि॒म् ॥१॥

text: Turn hither, Agni, speak to us, come to us with a friendly mind. Enrich us, Sovran of the Tribes! Thou art the giver of our wealth.
meaning: अ॒ग्ने अ॒छा वदेह॒ नः प्रत्य॒ङ् नः सुम॒ना भव । प्र॒ णो यछ विशां पते धनदा॒ असि नस् त्व॒म् ॥२॥

text: Let Aryaman vouchsafe us, wealth, and Bhaga, and Brihaspati, The Goddesses grant wealth to us, Sūnritā, Goddess, give me wealth!
meaning: प्र॒ णो यछत्व् अर्यमा॒ प्र॒ भ॒गः प्र॒ बृ॒हस्प॒तिः । प्र॒ देवीः॒ प्रो॒त॒ सूनृ॒ता रयिं॒ देवी॒ दधातु मे ॥३॥

text: We call King Soma to our aid, and Agni with our songs and. hymn, The Ādityas, Vishnu, Sūrya, and the Brāhman-priest Brihaspati.
meaning: सो॒मं रा॒जानम् अ॒वसे ऽग्निं॒ गीर्भि॒र् हवामहे । आदित्य॒म् वि॒ष्णुम् सू॒र्यं ब्रह्मा॒णं च बृ॒हस्प॒तिम् ॥४॥

text: Do thou, O Agni, with thy fires strengthen our prayer and. sacrifice. Incite thou us, O God, to give, and send us riches to bestow.
meaning: त्वं॒ नो अग्ने अग्नि॒भिर् ब्र॒ह्म यज्ञं॒ वर्धय । त्वं॒ नो देव दा॒तवे रयिं॒ दा॒नाय चोदय ॥५॥

text: Both Indra here and Vāyu we invoke with an auspicious call, That in assembly all the folk may be benevolent to us, and be inclined to give us gifts.
meaning: इन्द्रवायू॒ उभा॒व् इह॒ सुह॒वेह॒ हवामहे । य॒था नः स॒र्व इ॒ज् ज॒नः सं॒गत्यां सुम॒ना असद् दा॒नकामश् च नो भु॒वत् ॥६॥

text: Urge Aryaman to send us gifts, and Indra, and Brihaspati, Vāta, Vishnu, Sarasvati, and the strong courser Savitar.
meaning: अर्यम॒णं बृ॒हस्प॒तिम् इ॒न्द्रं दा॒नाय चोदय । वा॒तं वि॒ष्णुं स॒रस्वतीं सविता॒रं च वाजि॒नम् ॥७॥

text: Now have we reached the ordering of power, and all these worlds of life are held within it. Let him who knows urge e'en the churl to bounty Give wealth. to us with all good men about us.
meaning: वा॒जस्य नु॒ प्रसवे॒ सं॒ बभूविमेमा॒ च वि॒श्वा भु॒वनानि अन्तः॒ । उता॒दित्सन्तं दापयतु प्रजान॒न् रयिं॒ च नः स॒र्ववीरं नि॒ यछ ॥८॥

text: May heaven's five spacious regions pour their milk for me with all their might. May I obtain each wish and hope formed by my spirit and my heart.
meaning: दुह्रा॒म् मे प॒ञ्च प्रदि॒षो दुह्रा॒म् उर्वी॒र् यथाबल॒म् । प्रा॒पेयं स॒र्वा आ॒कूतीर् म॒नसा हृ॒दयेन च ॥९॥

text: May speech that winneth cows be mine. With splendour mount thou over me. May Vāyu hedge me round about May Pūshan make me pros- perous.
meaning: गोस॒निं वा॒चम् उदेयं व॒र्चसा माभ्यु॒दिहि । आ॒ रुन्धां सर्व॒तो वायु॒स् त्व॒ष्टा पो॒षं दधातु मे ॥१०॥

text: All Fires that are in water and in Vritra, all those that man and stones contain within them, That which hath entered herbs and trees and bushes—to all these Fires be this oblation offered.
meaning: ये॒ अग्न॒यो अप्स्व् अ॑न्त॒र् ये॒ वृत्रे॒ ये॒ पु॒रुषे ये॒ अ॒श्मसु । य॒ आविवे॒शो॒षधीर् यो॒ व॒नस्प॒तींस् ते॒भ्यो अग्नि॒भ्यो हुत॒म् अस्त्व् एत॒त् ॥१॥

text: That which abides in Soma and in cattle, that which lies deep in birds and sylvan creatures, That which hath entered quadrupeds and bipeds—to all these Fires be this oblation offered.
meaning: यः॒ सो॒मे अन्त॒र् यो॒ गो॒ष्व् अन्त॒र् य॒ आ॒विष्टो व॒यःसु यो॒ मृगे॒षु । य॒ आविवे॒श द्विप॒दो य॒स् च॒तुष्पदस् ते॒भ्यो अग्नि॒भ्यो हुत॒म् अस्त्व् एत॒त् ॥२॥

text: The Fire that rideth by the side of Indra, the God Vaisvānara,. yea all-consuming, Whom, as the victor, I invoke in battles—to all these Fires be this oblation offered.
meaning: य॒ इ॒न्द्रेण सर॒थं या॒ति देवो॒ वैश्वानर॒ उत॒ विश्वदाव्यः॑ । यं॒ जो॒हवीमि पृ॒तनासु सासहिं॒ ते॒भ्यो अग्नि॒भ्यो हुत॒म् अस्त्व् एत॒त् ॥३॥

text: The all-devouring God whom men call Kāma, he whom they call the Giver and Receiver, Invincible, pervading, wise, and mighty—to all these Fires be this oblation offered.
meaning: यो॒ देवो॒ विश्वा॒द् य॒म् उ का॒मम् आहु॒र् यं॒ दाता॒रं प्रतिगृह्ण॒न्तम् आहुः॒ । यो॒ धी॒रः शक्रः॒ परिभू॒र् अ॒दाभ्यस् ते॒भ्यो अग्नि॒भ्यो हुत॒म् अस्त्व् एत॒त् ॥४॥

text: To thee, strength-giver, glorious, rich in pleasant strains, whom. in their minds the thirteen creatures of the world, And the five sons of man regard as Hotar-priest—to all these- Fires be this oblation offered.
meaning: यं॒ त्वा हो॒तारं म॒नसाभि॒ संविदु॒स् त्र॒योदश भौवनाः॒ प॒ञ्च मानवाः॒ । वर्चोध॒से यश॒से सूनृ॒तावते ते॒भ्यो अग्नि॒भ्यो हुत॒म् अस्त्व् एत॒त् ॥५॥

text: To him who feeds on ox and cow, sage, bearing Soma on his back, To all Vaisvānara's followers—to these be this oblation paid.
meaning: उक्षा॒न्नाय वशा॒न्नाय सो॒मपृष्ठाय वेध॒से । वैश्वानर॒ज्येष्ठेभ्यस् ते॒भ्यो अग्नि॒भ्यो हुत॒म् अस्त्व् एत॒त् ॥६॥

text: All fiery flames that follow after lightning, flashing o'er earth, through firmament and heaven, All that are in the wind and skyey regions—to all these Fires be this oblation offered.
meaning: दि॒वं पृथिवी॒म् अ॒न्व् अन्त॒रिक्षम् ये॒ विद्यु॒तम् अनुसंच॒रन्ति । ये॒ दिक्ष्व् अ॑न्त॒र् ये॒ वा॒ते अन्त॒स् ते॒भ्यो अग्नि॒भ्यो हुत॒म् अस्त्व् एत॒त् ॥७॥

text: The golden-handed Savitar and Indra, Brihaspati, Varuna, Mitra, and Agni, The Angirases we call, the Visve Devas: let them appease this Agni, Flesh-devourer.
meaning: हि॒रण्यपाणिं सविता॒रम् इ॒न्द्रं बृ॒हस्प॒तिं व॒रुणं मित्र॒म् अग्नि॒म् । वि॒श्वान् देवा॒न् अ॒ङ्गिरसो हवामहे इमं॒ क्रव्या॒दं शमयन्त्व् अग्नि॒म् ॥८॥

text: Flesh-eating Agni is appeased, appeased is he who hurteth men. Now him who burneth every thing, the Flesh-consumer, have I stilled.
meaning: शान्तो॒ अग्निः॒ क्रव्या॒च् छान्तः॒ पुरुषरे॒षणः । अ॒थो यो॒ विश्वदाव्य॑स् तं॒ क्रव्या॒दम् अशीशमम् ॥९॥

text: The mountains where the Soma grows, the waters lying calm and still, Vāta, Parjanya, Agni's self have made the Flesh-consumer rest.
meaning: ये॒ प॒र्वताः सो॒मपृष्ठा आ॒प उत्तानशी॒वरीः । वा॒तः पर्ज॒न्य आ॒द् अग्नि॒स् ते॒ क्रव्या॒दम् अशीशमन् ॥१०॥

text: Famed be the Elephant's strength, the lofty glory, which out of Aditi's body took existence! They all have given me this for my possession, even all the Gods and Aditi accordant.
meaning: हस्तिवर्चसं॒ प्रथतां बृह॒द् य॒शो अ॒दित्या य॒त् तन्वः॑ संबभू॒व । त॒त् सर्वे स॒म् अदुर् म॒ह्यम् एत॒द् वि॒श्वे देवा॒ अ॒दितिः सजो॒षाः ॥१॥

text: On this have Mitra, Varuna, Indra, and Rudra fixed their thought. May those all-fostering deities anoint and balm me with his strength.
meaning: मित्र॒श् च व॒रुणश् चे॒न्द्रो रुद्र॒श् च चेततु । देवा॒सो विश्व॒धायसस् ते॒ माञ्जन्तु व॒र्चसा ॥२॥

text: The strength wherewith the Elephant was dowered, that decks a King among the men, in waters, O Agni, even with that strength make thou me vigorous to-day.
meaning: ये॒न हस्ती॒ व॒र्चसा संबभू॒व ये॒न रा॒जा मनुष्ये॑स्व् अप्स्व् अ॑न्तः॒ । ये॒न देवा॒ देव॒ताम् अ॒ग्र आ॒यन् ते॒न मा॒म् अद्य॒ व॒र्चसा॒ग्ने वर्चस्वि॒नं कृणु ॥३॥

text: The lofty strength which sacrifice brings, Jātavedas! unto thee, What strength the Sun possesses, all strength of the royal Ele- phant—such strength vouchsafe to me the pair of Asvins lotus-garlanded!
meaning: य॒त् ते व॒र्चो जातवेदो बृह॒द् भ॒वत्य् आ॒हुतेः । या॒वत् सू॒र्यस्य व॒र्च आसुर॒स्य च हस्ति॒नः । ता॒वन् मे अश्वि॒ना व॒र्च आ॒ धत्तां पु॒ष्करस्रजा ॥४॥

text: Far as the heaven's four regions spread, far as the eye's most distant ken. So wide, so vast let power be mine, this vigour of the Elephant.
meaning: या॒वच् च॒तस्रः प्रदि॒शश् च॒क्षुर् या॒वत् समश्नुते॒ । ता॒वत् समै॒त्व् इन्द्रियं॒ म॒यि त॒द् धस्तिवर्चस॒म् ॥५॥

text: Now hath the Elephant become chief of all pleasant beasts to ride. With his high fortune and his strength I grace and conscorate myself.
meaning: हस्ती॒ मृगा॒णां सुष॒दाम् अतिष्ठा॒वान् बभू॒व हि॒ । त॒स्य भ॒गेन व॒र्चसाभि॒ षिञ्चामि मा॒म् अह॒म् ॥६॥

text: From thee we banish and expel the cause of thy sterility. This in another place we lay apart from thee and far removed.
meaning: ये॒न वेह॒द् बभू॒विथ नाश॒यामसि त॒त् त्व॒त् । इदं॒ त॒द् अन्य॒त्र त्व॒द् अ॒प दूरे॒ नि॒ दध्मसि ॥१॥

text: As arrow to the quiver, so let a male embryo enter thee. Then from thy side be born a babe, a ten-month child, thy hero son.
meaning: आ॒ ते यो॒निं ग॒र्भ एतु पु॒मान् बा॒ण इवेषुधि॒म् । आ॒ वीरो॒ ऽत्र जायतां पुत्र॒स् ते द॒शमास्यः ॥२॥

text: Bring forth a male, bring forth a son. Another male shall follow him. The mother shalt thou be of sons born and hereafter to be born.
meaning: पु॒मांसं पुत्रं॒ जनय तं॒ पु॒मान् अ॒नु जायताम् । भ॒वासि पुत्रा॒णां माता॒ जाता॒नां जन॒याश् च या॒न् ॥३॥

text: With that auspicious general flow wherewith steers propagate their kind, Do thou obtain thyself a son: be thou a fruitfu! mother-cow.
meaning: या॒नि बद्रा॒णि बी॒जान्य् ऋषभा॒ जन॒यन्ति च । तै॒स् त्वं॒ पुत्रं॒ विन्दस्व सा॒ प्रसू॒र् धे॒नुका भव ॥४॥

text: I give thee power to bear a child: within, thee pass the germ of life! Obtain a son, O woman, who shall be a blessing unto thee. Be thou a blessing unto him.
meaning: कृणो॒मि ते प्राजापत्य॒म् आ॒ यो॒निं ग॒र्भ एतु ते । विन्द॒स्व त्वं॒ पुत्रं॒ नारि य॒स् तु॒भ्यं श॒म् अ॒सच् छ॒म् उ त॒स्मै त्व॒म् भ॒व ॥५॥

text: May those celestial herbs whose sire was Heaven, the Earth their mother, and their root the ocean. May those celestial healing Plants assist thee to obtain a son.
meaning: या॒साम् द्यौः॒ पिता॒ पृथिवी॒ माता॒ समुद्रो॒ मू॒लं वीरु॒धां बभू॒व । ता॒स् त्वा पुत्रवि॒द्याय दै॒वीः प्रा॒वन्त्व् ओ॒षधयः ॥६॥

text: The plants of earth are rich in milk, and rich in milk is this my word, So from the rich in milk I bring thousandfold profit hitherward.
meaning: प॒यस्वतीर् ओ॒षधयः प॒यस्वन् मामकं॒ व॒चः । अ॒थो प॒यस्वतीनाम् आ॒ भरे ऽहं॒ सहस्रशः॒ ॥१॥

text: Him who is rich in milk I know. Abundant hath he made our corn. The God whose name is Gatherer, him we invoke who dwelleth in his house who sacrifices not.
meaning: वे॒दाहं॒ प॒यस्वन्तं चका॒र धान्य॑म् बहु॒ । संभृ॒त्वा ना॒म यो॒ देव॒स् तं॒ वयं॒ हवामहे यो॒यो अ॒यज्वनो गृहे॒ ॥२॥

text: All the five regions of the heavens, all the five races of man- kind, As after rain the stream brings drift, let them bring increase hitherward.
meaning: इमा॒ याः॒ प॒ञ्च प्रदि॒शो मानवीः॒ प॒ञ्च कृष्ट॒यः । वृष्टे॒ शा॒पं नदी॒र् इवेह॒ स्फातिं॒ समा॒वहान् ॥३॥

text: Open the well with hundred streams, exhaustless, with a thousand streams. So cause this corn of ours to be exhaustless, with a thousand streams.
meaning: उ॒द् उ॒त्सं शत॒धारं सह॒स्रधारम् अ॒क्षितम् । एवा॒स्मा॒केदं॒ धान्यं॑ सह॒स्रधारम् अ॒क्षितम् ॥४॥

text: O Hundred-handed, gather up. O Thousand-handed, pour thou forth. Bring hither increase of the corn prepared and yet to be pre- pared.
meaning: श॒तहस्त समा॒हर स॒हस्रहस्त सं॒ किर । कृत॒स्य कार्य॑स्य चेह॒ स्फातिं॒ समा॒वह ॥५॥

text: Three sheaves are the Gandharvas' claim, the lady of the house hath four. We touch thee with the sheaf that is the most abundant of them all.
meaning: तिस्रो॒ मा॒त्रा गन्धर्वा॒णां च॒तस्रो गृह॒पत्न्याः । ता॒सां या॒ स्फातिम॒त्तमा त॒या त्वाभि॒ मृशामसि ॥६॥

text: Adding and Gathering are thy two attendants, O Prajāpati. May they bring hither increase, wealth abundant, inexhaustible.
meaning: उपोह॒श् च समूह॒श् च क्षत्ता॒रौ ते प्रजापते । ता॒व् इहा॒ वहतां स्फातिं॒ बहुं॒ भूमा॒नम् अ॒क्षितम् ॥७॥

text: Let the Impeller goad thee on. Rest not in peace upon thy bed. Terrible is the shaft of Love: therewith I pierce thee to the heart.
meaning: उत्तुद॒स् त्वो॒त् तुदतु मा॒ धृथाः श॒यने स्वे॒ । इ॒षुः का॒मस्य या॒ भीमा॒ त॒या विध्यामि त्वा हृदि॒ ॥१॥

text: That arrow winged with longing thought, its stem Desire, its neck, Resolve, Let Kāma, having truly aimed, shoot forth and pierce thee in the heart.
meaning: आधी॒पर्णां का॒मशल्याम् इ॒षुं संकल्प॒कुल्मलाम् । तां॒ सु॒संनतां कृत्वा॒ का॒मो विध्यतु त्वा हृदि॒ ॥२॥

text: The shaft of Kāma, pointed well, that withers and consumes the spleen. With hasty feathers, all aglow, therewith I pierce thee to the heart.
meaning: या॒ प्लीहा॒नं शोष॒यति का॒मस्ये॒षुः सु॒संनता । प्राची॒नपक्षा व्यो॑षा त॒या विध्यामि त्वा हृदि॒ ॥३॥

text: Pierced through with fiercely-burning heat, steal to me with thy parching lips, Gentle and humble, all mine own, devoted, with sweet words of love.
meaning: शुचा॒ विद्धा॒ व्यो॑षया शु॒ष्कास्याभि॒ सर्प मा । मृदु॒र् नि॒मन्युः के॒वली प्रियवादि॒न्य् अ॒नुव्रता ॥४॥

text: Away Lfrom mother and from sire I drive thee hither with a whip, That thou mayst be at my command and yield to every wish of mine.
meaning: आ॒जामि त्वा॒जन्या प॒रि मातु॒र् अ॒थो पितुः॒ । य॒था म॒म क्र॒ताव् अ॒सो म॒म चित्त॒म् उपा॒यसि ॥५॥

text: Mitra and Varuna, expel all thought and purpose from her heart. Deprive her of her own free will and make her subject unto me.
meaning: व्य् अ॑स्यै मित्रावरुणौ हृद॒श् चित्ता॒न्य् अस्यतम् । अ॒थैनाम् अक्रतुं॒ कृत्वा॒ म॒मैव॒ कृणुतं व॒शे ॥६॥

text: Ye Gods who dwell within this eastward region, entitled Weapons, Agni forms your arrows. Be kind and gracious unto us and bless us. To you be reverence, to you be welcome!
meaning: ये॑ ऽस्यां॒ स्थ॒ प्रा॒च्यां दिशि॒ हेत॒यो ना॒म देवा॒स् ते॒षां वो अग्नि॒र् इषवः । ते॒ नो मृडत ते॒ नो॒ ऽधि ब्रूत ते॒भ्यो वो न॒मस् ते॒भ्यो वः स्वा॒हा ॥१॥

text: Ye Gods who dwell within this southward region, entitled Eager, Kāma forms your arrows. Be kind, etc.
meaning: ये॑ ऽस्यां॒ स्थ॒ द॒क्षिणायां दिश्य् अ॑विष्य॒वो ना॒म देवा॒स् ते॒षां वः का॒म इ॒षवः । ते॒ नो मृडत ते॒ नो॒ ऽधि ब्रूत ते॒भ्यो वो न॒मस् ते॒भ्यो वः स्वा॒हा ॥२॥

text: Ye Gods who dwell within this westward region, whose name is Radiant, Water forms your arrows. Be kind, etc.
meaning: ये॑ ऽस्यां॒ स्थ॒ प्रती॒च्यां दिशि॒ वैराजा॒ ना॒म देवा॒स् ते॒षां व आ॒प इ॒षवः । ते॒ नो मृडत ते॒ नो॒ ऽधि ब्रूत ते॒भ्यो वो न॒मस् ते॒भ्यो वः स्वा॒हा ॥३॥

text: Ye Gods who dwell within this northward region, whose name is Piercers, Vāta forms your arrows. Be kind, etc.
meaning: ये॑ ऽस्यां॒ स्थो॒दीच्यां दिशि॒ प्रवि॒ध्यन्तो ना॒म देवा॒स् ते॒षां वो वा॒त इ॒षवः । ते॒ नो मृडत ते॒ नो॒ ऽधि ब्रूत ते॒भ्यो वो न॒मस् ते॒भ्यो वः स्वा॒हा ॥४॥

text: Ye Gods whose home is in this firm-set region—Nilimpas is your name—Plants are your arrow. Be kind, etc.
meaning: ये॑ ऽस्यां॒ स्थ॒ ध्रुवा॒यां दिशि॒ निलिम्पा॒ ना॒म देवा॒स् ते॒षां व ओ॒षधीर् इ॒षवः । ते॒ नो मृडत ते॒ नो॒ ऽधि ब्रूत ते॒भ्यो वो न॒मस् ते॒भ्यो वः स्वा॒हा ॥५॥

text: Ye Gods whose home is in this upmost region, Yearners by name, Brihaspati forms your arrows. Be kind and gracious unto us and bless us. To you be reverence, to you be welcome!
meaning: ये॑ ऽस्यां॒ स्थो॒र्ध्वा॒यां दिश्य् अ॒वस्वन्तो ना॒म देवा॒स् ते॒षां वो बृ॒हस्प॒तिर् इ॒षवः । ते॒ नो मृडत ते॒ नो॒ ऽधि ब्रूत ते॒भ्यो वो न॒मस् ते॒भ्यो वः स्वा॒हा ॥६॥

text: Agni is regent of the East, its warder is Asita, the Ādityas are the arrows. Worship to these the regents, these the warders, and to the arrows, yea, to these be worship! Within your jaws we lay the man who hateth us and whom we hate.
meaning: प्रा॒ची दि॒ग् अग्नि॒र् अ॒धिपतिर् असितो॒ रक्षिता॒दित्या॒ इ॒षवः । ते॒भ्यो न॒मो॒ ऽधिपतिभ्यो न॒मो रक्षितृ॒भ्यो न॒म इ॒षुभ्यो न॒म एभ्यो अस्तु । यो॑ ऽस्मा॒न् द्वे॒ष्टि यं॒ वयं॒ द्विष्म॒स् तं॒ वो ज॒म्भे दध्मः ॥१॥

text: Indra is regent of the South, its warder Tiraschirāji, and the shafts the Fathers. Worship to these the regents, these the warders, and to the arrows, yea, to these be worship! Within your jaws we lay the man who hateth us and whom we hate.
meaning: द॒क्षिणा दि॒ग् इ॒न्द्रो ऽधिपतिस् ति॒रश्चिराजी रक्षिता॒ पित॒र इ॒षवः । ते॒भ्यो न॒मो ऽधिपतिभ्यो न॒मो रक्षितृ॒भ्यो न॒म इ॒षुभ्यो न॒म एभ्यो अस्तु । यो॑ ऽस्मा॒न् द्वे॒ष्टि यं॒ वयं॒ द्विष्म॒स् तं॒ वो ज॒म्भे दध्मः ॥२॥

text: Of the West region Varuna is ruler, Pridāku warder, Nourish- ment the arrows. Worship, etc.
meaning: प्रती॒ची दि॒ग् व॒रुणो॒ ऽधिपतिः पृ॒दाकू रक्षिता॒न्नम् इ॒षवः । ते॒भ्यो न॒मो ऽधिपतिभ्यो न॒मो रक्षितृ॒भ्यो न॒म इ॒षुभ्यो न॒म एभ्यो अस्तु । यो॑ ऽस्मा॒न् द्वे॒ष्टि यं॒ वयं॒ द्विष्म॒स् तं॒ वो ज॒म्भे दध्मः ॥३॥

text: Soma is ruler of the Northern region, Svaja the warder, lightn- ing's flash the arrows. Worship, etc.
meaning: उ॒दीची दि॒क् सो॒मो॒ ऽधिपतिः स्वजो॒ रक्षिता॒श॒निर् इ॒षवः । ते॒भ्यो न॒मो ऽधिपतिभ्यो न॒मो रक्षितृ॒भ्यो न॒म इ॒षुभ्यो न॒म एभ्यो अस्तु । यो॑ ऽस्मा॒न् द्वे॒ष्टि यं॒ वयं॒ द्विष्म॒स् तं॒ वो ज॒म्भे दध्मः ॥४॥

text: Vishnu is ruler of the firm-set region, Kalmāshagriva warder, Plants the arrows. Worship, etc.
meaning: ध्रुवा॒ दि॒ग् वि॒ष्णुर् अ॒धिपतिः कल्मा॒षग्रीवो रक्षिता॒ वीरु॒ध इ॒षवः । ते॒भ्यो न॒मो ऽधिपतिभ्यो न॒मो रक्षितृ॒भ्यो न॒म इ॒षुभ्यो न॒म एभ्यो अस्तु । यो॑ ऽस्मा॒न् द्वे॒ष्टि यं॒ वय॒म् द्विष्म॒स् तं॒ वो ज॒म्भे दध्मः ॥५॥

text: Brihaspati controls the topmost region, Svitra is warder, and the Rain the arrows. Worship to these the regents, these the warders, and to the arrows, yea, to these be worship,! Within your jaws we lay the man who hateth us and whom we hate.
meaning: ऊर्ध्वा॒ दि॒ग् बृ॒हस्प॒तिर् अ॒धिपतिः श्वित्रो॒ रक्षिता॒ वर्ष॒म् इ॒षवः । ते॒भ्यो न॒मो ऽधिपतिभ्यो न॒मो रक्षितृ॒भ्यो न॒म इ॒षुभ्यो न॒म एभ्यो अस्तु । यो॑ ऽस्मा॒न् द्वे॒ष्टि यं॒ वयं॒ द्विष्म॒स् तं॒ वो ज॒म्भे दध्मः ॥६॥

text: This cow was born to bring forth offspring singly, though they created kine of every colour. When she produces twins in spite of Order, sullen, with groan and grudge she harms the cattle.
meaning: ए॒कैकयैषा॒ सृ॒ष्ट्या सं॒ बभूव य॒त्र गा॒ अ॒सृजन्त भूतकृ॒तो विश्व॒रूपाः । य॒त्र विजा॒यते यमि॒न्य् अपर्तुः॒ सा॒ पशू॒न् क्षिणाति रिफती॒ रु॒शती ॥१॥

text: She brings destruction on the beasts, turned to a flesh-devouring worm. Yes, give her to the Brāhman that she may bring luck and happiness.
meaning: एषा॒ पशू॒न्त् सं॒ क्षिणाति क्रव्या॒द् भूत्वा॒ व्य॒द्वरी । उतै॒नां ब्रह्म॒णे दद्यात् त॒था स्योना॒ शिवा॒ स्यात् ॥२॥

text: Be thou auspicious to our folk, bring luck to horses and to kine. Auspicious unto all this farm, bring luck and happiness to us.
meaning: शिवा॒ भव पु॒रुषेभ्यो गो॒भ्यो अ॒श्वेभ्यः शिवा॒ । शिवा॒स्मै॒ स॒र्वस्मै क्षे॒त्राय शिवा॒ न इहै॒धि ॥३॥

text: Let there be rain and increase here, here be thou most munifi- cient. Mother of twins, prosper our herd.
meaning: इह॒ पु॒ष्टिर् इह॒ र॒स इह॒ सहस्रसा॒तमा भव । पशू॒न् यमिनि पोषय ॥४॥

text: Where, having left all sickness of their bodies, the pious lead, as friends, their lives of gladness Nigh to that world approached the twin calves' mother. Let her not harm our people and our cattle.
meaning: य॒त्रा सुहा॒र्दः सुकृ॒तो म॒दन्ति विहा॒य रो॒गं तन्वः॑ स्वा॒याः । तं॒ लोकं॒ यमि॒न्य् अभिसं॒बभूव सा॒ नो मा॒ हिंसीत् पु॒रुषान् पशूं॒श् च ॥५॥

text: Where lies the world of those dear friends, the pious, those who have brought due sacrifice to Agni Nigh to that world approached the twins calves' mother. Let her not harm our people and our cattle.
meaning: य॒त्रा सुहा॒र्दां सुकृ॒ताम् अग्निहोत्रहु॒ताम् य॒त्र लोकः॒ । तं॒ लोकं॒ यमि॒न्य् अभिसं॒बभूव सा॒ नो मा॒ हिंसीत् पु॒रुषान् पशूं॒श् च ॥६॥

text: When yonder kings who sit beside Yama divide among them- selves the sixteenth part of hopes fulfilled, A ram bestowed as sacrifice, white-footed, frees us from the tax.
meaning: य॒द् रा॒जानो विभ॒जन्त इष्टापूर्त॒स्य षोडश॒म् यम॒स्यामी॒ सभास॒दः । अ॒विस् त॒स्मात् प्र॒ मुञ्चति दत्तः॒ शितिपा॒त् स्वधा॒ ॥१॥

text: He satisfies each hope and want, prevailing, present and pre- pared. The wish-fulfilling ram, bestowed, white-footed is exhaustless still.
meaning: स॒र्वान् का॒मान् पूरयत्य् आभ॒वन् प्रभ॒वन् भ॒वन् । आकूतिप्रो॒ ऽविर् दत्तः॒ शितिपा॒न्न् नो॒प दस्यति ॥२॥

text: He who bestows a white-hooved ram, adequate to the place he holds. Ascends to the celestial height, the heaven where tribute is not paid to one more mighty by the weak.
meaning: यो॒ द॒दाति शितिपा॒दम् अ॒विं लोके॒न सं॒मितम् । स॒ ना॒कम् अभ्या॒रोहति य॒त्र शुल्को॒ न॒ क्रिय॒ते अबले॒न ब॒लीयसे ॥३॥

text: He who bestows a white-hooved ram, adequate to the place he holds. Offered with five cakes, lives on that, unwasting, in the Fathers' world.
meaning: प॒ञ्चापूपं शितिपा॒दम् अ॒विं लोके॒न सं॒मितम् । प्रदातो॒प जीवति पितृ̄णां॒ लोके॒ ऽक्षितम् ॥४॥

text: He who bestows a white-hooved ram, adequate to the place he holds, Offered with five cakes, lives on that, wasteless, while Sun and. Moon endure.
meaning: प॒ञ्चापूपं शितिपा॒दम् अ॒विं लोके॒न सं॒मितम् । प्रदातो॒प जीवति सूर्यामास॒योर् अ॒क्षितम् ॥५॥

text: Like a refreshing draught, like sea, the mighty flood, he faileth not. Like the two Gods whose home is one, the ram white-footed, faileth not.
meaning: इ॒रेव नो॒प दस्यति समुद्र॒ इव प॒यो मह॒त् । देवौ॒ सवासि॒नाव् इव शितिपा॒न् नो॒प दस्यति ॥६॥

text: Whose gift was this, and given to whom? Kāma to Kāma gave the gift. Kāma is giver, Kāma is receiver. Kāma has passed into the sea. Through Kāma do I take thee to myself. O Kāma, this is thine.
meaning: क॒ इदं॒ क॒स्मा अदात् का॒मः का॒मायादात् । का॒मो दाता॒ का॒मः प्रतिग्रहीता॒ का॒मः समुद्र॒म् आ॒ विवेश । का॒मेन त्वा प्र॒ति गृह्नामि का॒मैत॒त् ते ॥७॥

text: May Earth receive thee as her own, and this great interspace of air. Neither in breath and body nor in progeny may this acceptance do me harm.
meaning: भू॒मिष् ट्वा प्र॒ति गृह्णात्व् अन्त॒रिक्षम् इदं॒ मह॒त् । मा॒हं॒ प्राणे॒न मा॒त्म॒ना मा॒ प्रज॒या प्रतिगृ॒ह्य वि॒ राधिषि ॥८॥

text: Freedom from hate I bring to you, concord and unanimity. Love one another as the cow loveth the calf that she hath borne.
meaning: स॒हृदयं सांमनस्य॒म् अ॒विद्वेषं कृणोमि वः । अन्यो॒ अन्य॒म् अभि॒ हर्यत वत्सं॒ जात॒म् इवाघ्न्या॒ ॥१॥

text: One-minded with his mother let the son be loyal to his sire. Let the wife, calm and gentle, speak words sweet as honey to her lord.
meaning: अ॒नुव्रतः पितुः॒ पुत्रो॒ मात्रा॒ भवतु सं॒मनाः । जाया॒ प॒त्ये म॒धुमतीं वा॒चं वदतु शन्तिवा॒म् ॥२॥

text: No brother hate his brother, no sister to sister be unkind. Unanimous, with one intent, speak ye your speech in friend- liness.
meaning: मा॒ भ्रा॒ता भ्रा॒तरं द्विक्षन् मा॒ स्व॒सारम् उत॒ स्व॒सा । सम्य॒ञ्चः स॒व्रता भूत्वा॒ वा॒चं वदत भद्र॒या ॥३॥

text: That spell through which Gods sever not, nor ever bear each other hate, That spell we lay upon your home, a bond of union for the men.
meaning: ये॒न देवा॒ न॒ विय॒न्ति नो॒ च विद्विष॒ते मिथः॒ । त॒त् कृण्मो ब्र॒ह्म वो गृहे॒ संज्ञा॒नं पु॒रुषेभ्यः ॥४॥

text: Intelligent, submissive, rest united, friendly and kind, bearing the yoke together. Come, speaking sweetly each one to the other. I make you one- intentioned and one-minded.
meaning: ज्या॒यस्वन्तश् चित्ति॒नो मा॒ वि॒ यौष्ट संराध॒यन्तः स॒धुराश् च॒रन्तः । अन्यो॒ अन्य॒स्मै वल्गु॒ व॒दन्त ए॒त सध्रीची॒नान् वः सं॒मनसस् क्र्णोमि ॥५॥

text: Let what you drink, your share of food be common together, with one common bond I bid you. Serve Agni, gathered round him like the spokes about the chariot nave.
meaning: समानी॒ प्रपा॒ सह॒ वो ऽन्नभागः॒ समाने॒ यो॒क्त्रे सह॒ वो युनज्मि । सम्य॒ञ्चो ऽग्निं॒ सपर्यतारा॒ ना॒भिम् इवाभि॒तः ॥६॥

text: With binding charm I make you all united, obeying one sole leader and one-minded. Even as the Gods who watch and guard the Amrit, at morn and eve may ye be kindly-hearted.
meaning: सध्रीची॒नान् वः सं॒मनसस् कृणोम्य् ए॒कश्नुष्टीन्त् संव॒ननेन स॒र्वान् । देवा॒ इवामृ॒तं र॒क्षमाणाः सायं॒प्रातः सौमनसो॒ वो अस्तु ॥७॥

text: May Gods release from failing strength, thou Agni, from malignity! I free from every evil, from decline: I compass round with life.
meaning: वि॒ देवा॒ जर॒सावृतन् वि॒ त्व॒म् अग्ने अ॒रात्या । व्य् अ॑हं॒ स॒र्वेण पाप्म॒ना वि॒ य॒क्ष्मेण स॒म् आ॒युषा ॥१॥

text: May Pavamāna free from harm, and Sakra from unrighteous deed. I free from every evil, from decline: I compass round with life.
meaning: व्य् आ॒र्त्या प॒वमानो वि॒ शक्रः॒ पापकृत्य॒या । व्य् अ॑हं॒ स॒र्वेण पाप्म॒ना वि॒ य॒क्ष्मेण स॒म् आ॒युषा ॥२॥

text: Tame beasts have parted from wild beasts, water and thirst have gone apart I free, etc.
meaning: वि॒ ग्राम्याः॒ पश॒व आरण्यै॒र् व्य् आ॒पस् तृ॒ष्णयासरन् । व्य् अ॑हं॒ स॒र्वेण पाप्म॒ना वि॒ य॒क्ष्मेण स॒म् आ॒युषा ॥३॥

text: Parted are heaven and earth, and paths turned to each quarter of the sky. I free, etc.
meaning: वी॑ मे॒ द्या॒वापृथिवी॒ इतो॒ वि॒ प॒न्थानो दि॒शंदिशम् । व्य् अ॑हं॒ स॒र्वेण पाप्म॒ना वि॒ य॒क्ष्मेण स॒म् आ॒युषा ॥४॥

text: Tvashtar prepares the bridal of his daughter; then all this world of life departs and leaves him. I free, etc.
meaning: त्व॒ष्टा दुहित्रे॒ वहतुं॒ युनक्ती॒तीदं॒ वि॒श्वं भु॒वनं वि॒ याति । व्य् अ॑हं॒ स॒र्वेण पाप्म॒ना वि॒ य॒क्ष्मेण स॒म् आ॒युषा ॥५॥

text: Agni combines the vital airs. The moon is closely joined with breath. I free. etc.
meaning: अग्निः॒ प्राणा॒न्त् सं॒ दधाति चन्द्रः॒ प्राणे॒न सं॒हितः । व्य् अ॑हं॒ स॒र्वेण पाप्म॒ना वि॒ य॒क्ष्मेण स॒म् आ॒युषा ॥६॥

text: The Gods have lifted up with breath the Sun whose might is everywhere. I free, etc.
meaning: प्राणे॒न विश्व॒तोवीर्यं देवाः॒ सू॒र्यं स॒म् ऐरयन् । व्य् अ॑हं॒ स॒र्वेण पाप्म॒ना वि॒ य॒क्ष्मेण स॒म् आ॒युषा ॥७॥

text: Die not. Live with the breath of those who make and who enjoy long life. I free, etc.
meaning: आ॒युष्मताम् आयुष्कृ॒तां प्राणे॒न जीव मा॒ मृथाः । व्य् अ॑हं॒ स॒र्वेण पाप्म॒ना वि॒ य॒क्ष्मेण स॒म् आ॒युषा ॥८॥

text: Die not. Stay here. Breathe with the breath of those who draw the vital air. I free, etc.
meaning: प्राणे॒न प्राणतां॒ प्रा॒णेहै॒व॒ भव मा॒ मृथाः । व्य् अ॑हं॒ स॒र्वेण पाप्म॒ना वि॒ य॒क्ष्मेण स॒म् आ॒युषा ॥९॥

text: Rise up with life, conjoined with life. Up, with the sap of growing plants! I free, etc.
meaning: उ॒द् आ॒युषा स॒म् आ॒युषो॒द् ओ॒षधीनां र॒सेन । व्य् अ॑हं॒ स॒र्वेण पाप्म॒ना वि॒ य॒क्ष्मेण स॒म् आ॒युषा ॥१०॥

text: We as immortal beings have arisen with Parjanya's rain, I free from every evil, from decline: I compass round with life.
meaning: आ॒ पर्ज॒न्यस्य वृष्ट्यो॒द् अस्थामामृ॒ता वय॒म् । व्य् अ॑हं॒ स॒र्वेण पाप्म॒ना वि॒ य॒क्ष्मेण स॒म् आ॒युषा ॥११॥

text: Eastward at first the prayer was generated: Vena disclosed bright flashes from the summit, Disclosed his deepest, nearest revelations, womb of the non- existent and existent.
meaning: ब्र॒ह्म जज्ञानं॒ प्रथमं॒ पुर॒स्ताद् वि॒ सीमतः॒ सुरु॒चो वेन॒ आवः । स॒ बुध्न्या॑ उपमा॒ अस्य विष्ठाः॒ सत॒श् च यो॒निम् अ॒सतश् च वि॒ वः ॥१॥

text: Let this Queen come in front, her Father's daughter, found in the worlds for earliest generation. For him they set this radiant vault in motion. Let them prepare warm milk for him who first would drink.
meaning: इयं॒ पि॒त्र्या रा॒ष्ट्र्य् एत्व् अ॒ग्रे प्रथमा॒य जनु॒षे भुवनेष्ठाः॒ । त॒स्मा एतं॒ सुरु॒चं ह्वार॒म् अह्यं घर्मं॒ श्रीणन्तु प्रथमा॒य धास्य॒वे ॥२॥

text: He who was born as his all-knowing kinsman declareth all the deities' generations. He from the midst of prayer his prayer hath taken. On high, below, spread forth his godlike nature.
meaning: प्र॒ यो॒ जज्ञे॒ विद्वा॒न् अस्य ब॒न्धुर् वि॒श्वा देवा॒नां ज॒निमा विवक्ति । ब्र॒ह्म ब्र॒ह्मण उ॒ज् जभार म॒ध्यान् निचै॒र् उच्चैः॒ स्वधा॒ अभि॒ प्र॒ तस्थौ ॥३॥

text: For he, true to the law of Earth and Heaven, established both the mighty worlds securely. Mighty when born, he propped apart the mighty, the sky, our earthly home, and air's mid-region.
meaning: स॒ हि॒ विदः॒ स॒ पृथिव्या॒ ऋतस्था॒ मही॒ क्षे॒मं रो॒दसी अस्कभायत् । महा॒न् मही॒ अ॒स्कभायद् वि॒ जातो॒ द्यां॒ स॒द्म पा॒र्थिवं च र॒जः ॥४॥

text: He from the depth hath been reborn for ever, Brihaspati the world's sole Lord and Ruler. From light was born the Day with all its lustre: through this let sages live endowed with splendour.
meaning: स॒ भुध्न्या॒द् आष्ट्र जनु॒षो ऽभ्य् अ॒ग्रम् बृ॒हस्प॒तिर् देव॒ता त॒स्य सम्रा॒ट् । अ॒हर् य॒च् छुक्रं॒ ज्यो॒तिषो ज॒निष्टा॒थ द्युम॒न्तो वि॒ वसन्तु वि॒प्राः ॥५॥

text: The sage and poet verily advanceth the statute of that mighty God primeval. He was born here with many more beside him: they slumbered when the foremost side was opened.
meaning: नूनं॒ त॒द् अस्य काव्यो॒ हिनोति महो॒ देव॒स्य पूर्व्य॒स्य धा॒म । एष॒ जज्ञे बहु॒भिः साक॒म् इत्था॒ पू॒र्वे अ॒र्धे वि॒षिते सस॒न् नु॒ ॥६॥
