text: The man who seeks the friend of Gods, Atharvan the father, and Brihaspati, with worship, Crying to him, Be thou all things' creator! the wise God, self- dependent, never injures.
meaning: यो॒ ऽथर्वाणं पित॒रं देव॒बन्धुं बृ॒हस्प॒तिं न॒मसा॒व च ग॒छात् । त्वं॒ वि॒श्वेषां जनिता॒ य॒था॒सः कवि॒र् देवो॒ न॒ द॒भायत् स्वधा॒वान् ॥७॥

text: य॒ आत्मदा॒ बलदा॒ य॒स्य वि॒श्व उपा॒सते प्रशि॒षं य॒स्य देवाः॒ । यो॑ ऽस्ये॒शे द्विप॒दो य॒श् च॒तुष्पदः क॒स्मै देवा॒य हवि॒षा विधेम ॥१॥
यः॒ प्राणतो॒ निमिषतो॒ महित्वै॒को रा॒जा ज॒गतो बभू॒व । य॒स्य छाया॒मृ॒तं य॒स्य मृत्युः॒ क॒स्मै देवा॒य हवि॒षा विधेम ॥२॥
यं॒ क्र॒न्दसी अ॒वतश् चस्कभाने॒ भिय॒साने रो॒दसी अ॒ह्वयेथाम् । य॒स्यासौ॒ प॒न्था र॒जसो विमा॒नः क॒स्मै देवा॒य हवि॒षा विधेम ॥३॥
य॒स्य द्यौ॒र् उर्वी॒ पृथिवी॒ च मही॒ य॒स्याद॒ उर्व् अ॑न्त॒रिक्षम् । य॒स्यासौ॒ सू॒रो वि॒ततो महित्वा॒ क॒स्मै देवा॒य हवि॒षा विधेम ॥४॥
य॒स्य वि॒श्वे हिम॒वन्तो महित्वा॒ समुद्रे॒ य॒स्य रसा॒म् इ॒द् आहुः॒ । इमा॒श् च प्रदि॒शो य॒स्य बाहू॒ क॒स्मै देवा॒य हवि॒षा विधेम ॥५॥
आ॒पो अ॒ग्रे वि॒श्वम् आवन् ग॒र्भं द॒धाना अमृ॒ता ऋतज्ञाः॒ । या॒सु देवी॒ष्व् अ॒धि देव॒ आ॒सीत् क॒स्मै देवा॒य हवि॒षा विधेम ॥६॥
हिरण्यगर्भः॒ स॒म् अवर्तता॒ग्रे भूत॒स्य जातः॒ प॒तिर् ए॒क आसीत् । स॒ दाधार पृथिवी॒म् उत॒ द्यां॒ क॒स्मै देवा॒य हवि॒षा विधेम ॥७॥
आ॒पो वत्सं॒ जन॒यन्तीर् ग॒र्भम् अ॒ग्रे स॒म् ऐरयन् । त॒स्योत॒ जा॒यमानस्यो॒ल्ब आसीद् धिरण्य॒यः क॒स्मै देवा॒य हवि॒षा विधेम ॥८॥
Three have gone hence and passed away, the man, the tiger, and the wolf. Down, verily, the rivers flow, down-goeth the celestial Tree,. down let our foemen bend and bow.
meaning: उ॒द् इत॒स् त्र॒यो अक्रमन् व्याघ्रः॒ पु॒रुषो वृ॒कः । हि॒रुग् घि॒ य॒न्ति सि॒न्धवो हि॒रुग् देवो॒ व॒नस्प॒तिर् हि॒रुङ् नमन्तु श॒त्रवः ॥१॥

text: On distant pathway go the wolf, on pathway most remote the thief! On a far road speed forth the rope with teeth, and the malicious man!
meaning: प॒रेणैतु पथा॒ वृ॒कः परमे॒णोत॒ त॒स्करः । प॒रेण दत्व॒ती र॒ज्जुः प॒रेणाघायु॒र् अर्षतु ॥२॥

text: We crush and rend to pieces both thine eyes, O Tiger, and thy jaws and all the twenty claws we break.
meaning: अक्ष्यौ॑ च ते मु॒खं च ते व्या॒घ्र जम्भयामसि । आ॒त् स॒र्वान् विंशतिं॒ नखा॒न् ॥३॥

text: We break and rend the tiger first of creatures that are armed. with teeth; The robber then, and then the snake, the sorcerer, and then the wolf.
meaning: व्याघ्रं॒ दत्व॒तां वयं॒ प्रथमं॒ जम्भयामसि । आ॒द् उ ष्टेन॒म् अ॒थो अ॒हिं यातुधा॒नम् अ॒थो वृ॒कम् ॥४॥

text: The thief who cometh near to-day departeth bruised and crush- ed to bits. By nearest way let him be gone. Let Indra slay him with his bolt.
meaning: यो॒ अद्य॒ स्तेन॒ आ॒यति स॒ सं॒पिष्टो अ॒पायति । पथा॒म् अपध्वंसे॒नैत्व् इ॒न्द्रो व॒ज्रेण हन्तु त॒म् ॥५॥

text: Let the beast's teeth be broken off, shivered and shattered be his ribs! Slack be thy bowstring: downward go the wild beast that pursues the hare!
meaning: मूर्णा॒ मृग॒स्य द॒न्ता अ॒पिशीर्णा उ पृष्ट॒यः । निम्रु॒क् ते गोधा॒ भवतु नीचा॒यच् छशयु॒र् मृगः॒ ॥६॥

text: Open not what thou hast compressed, close not what thou hast not compressed. Indra's and Soma's child, thou art Atharvan's tiger-crushing charm.
meaning: य॒त् संय॒मो न॒ वि॒ यमो वि॒ यमो य॒न् न॒ संय॒मः । इन्द्रजाः॒ सोमजा॒ आथर्वण॒म् असि व्याघ्रज॒म्भनम् ॥७॥

text: We dig thee from the earth, the Plant which strengthens and exalts the nerves, The Plant which the Gandharva dug for Varuna whose power was lost.
meaning: यां॒ त्वा गन्धर्वो॒ अ॒खनद् व॒रुणाय मृत॒भ्रजे । तां॒ त्वा वयं॒ खनामस्य् ओ॒षधिं शेपह॒र्षणीम् ॥१॥

text: Let Ushas and let Sūrya rise, let this the speech I utter rise. Let the strong male Prajāpati arise with manly energy.
meaning: उ॒द् उषा॒ उ॒द् उ सू॒र्य उ॒द् इदं॒ मामकं॒ व॒चः । उ॒द् एजतु प्रजा॒पतिर् वृ॒षा शु॒ष्मेण वाजि॒ना ॥२॥

text: Sicut tui surgentis (membrum virile) tanquam inflammatum palpitat, hoc illud tui ardentius haec herba faciat.
meaning: य॒था स्म ते विरो॒हतो ऽभि॒तप्तम् इवा॒नति । त॒तस् ते शु॒ष्मवत्तरम् इयं॒ कृणोत्व् ओ॒षधिः ॥३॥

text: Sursum (estote) herbarum vires, taurorum vigor. Tu, Indra, corporis potens, virorum masculum robur in hoc homine depone.
meaning: उ॒च् छु॒ष्मौ॒षधीनां सा॒रा ऋषभा॒णाम् । सं॒ पुंसा॒म् इन्द्र वृ॒ष्ण्यम् अस्मि॒न् धेहि तनूवशिन् ॥४॥

text: Ros aquarum primigenitus atque arborum, Somae etiam frater es, vatum sacrorum masculus vigor es.
meaning: अपां॒ र॒सः प्रथमजो॒ ऽथो व॒नस्प॒तीनाम् । उत॒ सो॒मस्य भ्रा॒तास्य् उता॒र्श॒म् असि वृ॒ष्ण्यम् ॥५॥

text: Hodie, Agnis! hodie Savitar! hodie dea Sarasvatis! hodie Brahmanaspatis! hujus fascinum velut arcum extende.
meaning: अद्या॒ग्ने अद्य॒ सवितर् अद्य॒ देवि सरस्वति । अद्या॒स्य॒ ब्रह्मणस् पते ध॒नुर् इवा॒ तानया प॒सः ॥६॥

text: Velut nervum in arcu ego tuum fascinum extendo. Aggredere (mulierem) semper indefessus velut cervus damam.
meaning: आ॒हं॒ तनोमि ते प॒सो अ॒धि ज्या॒म् इव ध॒न्वनि । क्र॒मस्व॒र्श इव रोहि॒तम् अ॒नवग्लायता स॒दा ॥७॥

text: Quae sunt equi vires, muli, capri, arietis, atque tauri, illas, cor- poris potens! in hoc homine depone.
meaning: अ॒श्वस्याश्वतर॒स्याज॒स्य पे॒त्वस्य च । अ॒थ ऋषभ॒स्य ये॒ वा॒जास् ता॒न् अस्मि॒न् धेहि तनूवशिन् ॥८॥

text: The Bull who hath a thousand horns, who rises up from out the sea, By him the strong and mighty one we lull the folk to rest and. sleep.
meaning: सह॒स्रशृङ्गो वृषभो॒ यः॒ समुद्रा॒द् उदा॒चरत् । ते॒ना सहस्ये॑ना वयं॒ नि॒ ज॒नान्त् स्वापयामसि ॥१॥

text: Over the surface of the earth there breathes no wind, there looks. no eye. Lull all the women, lull the dogs to sleep, with Indra as thy friend!
meaning: न॒ भू॒मिं वा॒तो अ॒ति वाति ना॒ति पश्यति क॒श् चन॒ । स्त्रि॒यश् च स॒र्वाः स्वाप॒य शु॒नश् चे॒न्द्रसखा च॒रन् ॥२॥

text: The woman sleeping in the court, lying without, or stretched on beds, The matrons with their odorous sweets—these, one and all, we lull to sleep.
meaning: प्रोष्ठेशया॒स् तल्पेशया॒ ना॒रीर् या॒ वह्यशी॒वरीः । स्त्रि॒यो याः॒ पु॒ण्यगन्धयस् ताः॒ स॒र्वाः स्वापयामसि ॥३॥

text: Each moving thing have I secured, have held and held the eye and breath. Each limb and member have I seized in the deep darkness of the night.
meaning: ए॒जदेजद् अजग्रभं च॒क्षुः प्राण॒म् अजग्रभम् । अ॒ङ्गान्य् अजग्रभं स॒र्वा रा॒त्रीणाम् अतिशर्वरे॒ ॥४॥

text: The man who sits, the man who walks, whoever stands and clearly sees Of these we closely shut the eyes, even as we closely shut this house.
meaning: य॒ आ॒स्ते य॒श् च॒रति य॒श् च ति॒ष्ठन् विप॒श्यति । ते॒षां सं॒ दध्मो अ॒क्षीणि य॒थेदं॒ हर्म्यं॒ त॒था ॥५॥

text: Sleep mother, let the father sleep, sleep dog, and master of the home. Let all her kinsmen sleep, sleep all the people who are round about.
meaning: स्व॒प्तु माता॒ स्व॒प्तु पिता॒ स्व॒प्तु श्वा॒ स्व॒प्तु विश्प॒तिः । स्व॒पन्त्व् अस्यै ज्ञात॒यः स्व॒प्त्व् अय॒म् अभि॒तो ज॒नः ॥६॥

text: With soporific charm, O Sleep, lull thou to slumber all the folk. Let the rest sleep till break of day, I will remain awake till dawn, like Indra free from scath and harm.
meaning: स्व॒प्न स्वप्नाभिक॒रणेन स॒र्वं नि॒ स्वापया ज॒नम् । ओत्सूर्य॒म् अन्या॒न्त् स्वाप॒याव्युषं॒ जागृताद् अह॒म् इ॒न्द्र इवा॒रिष्टो अ॒क्षितः ॥७॥

text: The Brāhman first was brought to life ten-headed and with faces ten. First drinker of the Soma, he made poison ineffectual.
meaning: ब्राह्मणो॒ जज्ञे प्रथमो॒ द॒शशीर्षो द॒शास्यः । स॒ सो॒मं प्रथमः॒ पपौ स॒ चकारारसं॒ विष॒म् ॥१॥

text: Far as the heavens and earth are spread in compass, far as the Seven Rivers are extended, So far my spell, the antidote of poison, have I spoken hence,
meaning: या॒वती द्या॒वापृथिवी॒ वरिम्णा॒ या॒वत् सप्त॒ सि॒न्धवो वितष्ठिरे॒ । वा॒चं विष॒स्य दू॒षणीं ता॒म् इतो॒ नि॒र् अवादिषम् ॥२॥

text: The strong-winged Bird Garutmān first of all, O Poison fed on thee: Thou didst not gripe or make him drunk: aye, thou becamest food for him.
meaning: सुपर्ण॒स् त्वा गरु॒त्मान् वि॒ष प्रथम॒म् आवयत् । ना॒मीमदो ना॒रूरुप उता॒स्मा अभवः पितुः॒ ॥३॥

text: Whoever with five fingers hath discharged thee from the crooked bow, I from the shaft have charmed away the poison of the fastening band.
meaning: य॒स् त आ॒स्यत् प॒ञ्चाङ्गुरिर् वक्रा॒च् चिद् अ॒धि ध॒न्वनः । अपस्कम्भ॒स्य शल्या॒न् नि॒र् अवोचम् अहं॒ विष॒म् ॥४॥

text: The poison have I charmed away from shaft, cement, and feather- ed end; Yea, from the barb, the neck, the horn, the poison have I charmed away.
meaning: शल्या॒द् विषं॒ नि॒र् अवोचम् प्रा॒ञ्जनाद् उत॒ पर्णधेः॒ । अपाष्ठा॒च् छृ॒ङ्गात् कु॒ल्मलान् नि॒र् अवोचम् अह॒म् विष॒म् ॥५॥

text: Feeble, O Arrow, is thy shaft, thy poison, too, hath lost its strength. Made of a worthless tree, thy bow, O feeble one, is impotent.
meaning: अरस॒स् त इषो शल्यो॒ ऽथो ते अरसं॒ विष॒म् । उता॒रस॒स्य वृक्ष॒स्य ध॒नुष् टे अरसारस॒म् ॥६॥

text: The men who brayed it, smeared it on, they who discharged it, sent it forth, All these are made emasculate, emasculate the poison-hill.
meaning: ये॒ अ॒पीषन् ये॒ अ॒दिहन् य॒ आ॒स्यन् ये॒ अवा॒सृजन् । स॒र्वे ते व॒ध्रयः कृता॒ व॒ध्रिर् विषगिरिः॒ कृतः॒ ॥७॥

text: Thy diggers are emasculate, emasculate, O, Plant art thou. The rugged mountain that produced this poison is emasculate.
meaning: व॒ध्रयस् ते खनिता॒रो व॒ध्रिस् त्व॒म् अस्य् ओषधे । व॒ध्रिः स॒ प॒र्वतो गिरि॒र् य॒तो जात॒म् इदं॒ विष॒म् ॥८॥

text: So may this water guard us on the bank of Varanāvati. Therein hath Amrit been infused: with that I ward thy poison off.
meaning: वा॒र् इद॒म् वारयातै वरणा॒वत्याम् अ॒धि । त॒त्रामृ॒तस्या॒सिक्तं ते॒ना ते वारये विष॒म् ॥१॥

text: Weak is the poison of the East, weak is the poison of the North, So too this poison of the South counts as a cake of curds and meal.
meaning: अरसं॒ प्राच्यं॑ विष॒म् अरसं॒ य॒द् उदीच्य॑म् । अ॒थेद॒म् अधराच्यं॑ करम्भे॒ण वि॒ कल्पते ॥२॥

text: When he hath made of thee a cake, broad, steaming, swelling up with fat, And even in hunger eaten thee, then gripe him not, thou hideous one!
meaning: करम्भं॒ कृत्वा॒ तिर्यं॑ पीबस्पाक॒म् उदारथि॒म् । क्षुधा॒ कि॒ल त्वा दुष्टनो जक्षिवा॒न्त् स॒ न॒ रूरुपः ॥३॥

text: Intoxicater! like a shaft we make thy spirit fly away, Like a pot boiling on the fire, we with our word remove thee hence.
meaning: वि॒ ते म॒दं मदावति शर॒म् इव पातयामसि । प्र॒ त्वा चरु॒म् इव ये॒षन्तं व॒चसा स्थापयामसि ॥४॥

text: We set around thee with the spell as 'twere a gathered arma- ment. Stay quiet like a rooted tree. Dug up with mattocks, gripe not thou.
meaning: प॒रि ग्रा॒मम् इवा॒चितं व॒चसा स्थापयामसि । ति॒ष्ठा वृक्ष॒ इव स्था॒म्न्य् अ॒भ्रिखाते न॒ रूरुपः ॥५॥

text: For coverings men have bartered thee, for skins of deer and woven cloths. Thou art a thing of sale, O Plant. Dug up with mattocks, gripe not thou!
meaning: पव॒स्तैस् त्वा प॒र्य् अक्रीणन् दूर्शे॒भिर् अजि॒नैर् उत॒ । प्रक्री॒र् असि त्व॒म् ओषधे॒ ऽभ्रिखाते न॒ रूरुपः ॥६॥

text: None have attained to those of old, those who wrought holy acts for you. Let them not harm our heroes here. Therefore I set before you this.
meaning: अ॒नाप्ता ये॒ वः प्रथमा॒ या॒नि क॒र्माणि चक्रिरे॒ । वीरा॒न् नो अ॒त्र मा॒ दभन् त॒द् व एत॒त् पुरो॒ दधे ॥७॥

text: The Being lays the sap of life in beings: he hath become the sovran Lord of creatures. Death comes to this man's royal consecration: let him as King own and allow this kingdom.
meaning: भूतो॒ भूते॒षु प॒य आ॒ दधाति स॒ भूता॒नाम् अ॒धिपतिर् बभूव । त॒स्य मृत्यु॒श् चरति राजसू॒यं स॒ रा॒जा अ॒नु मन्यताम् इदं॒ ॥१॥

text: Come forward, turn not back in scorn, strong guardian, slayer of the foes. Approach, O gladdener of thy friends. The Gods have blessed and strengthened thee.
meaning: अभि॒ प्रे॒हि मा॒प वेन उग्र॒श् चेत्ता॒ सपत्नहा॒ । आ॒ तिष्ठ मित्रवर्धन तु॒भ्यम् देवा॒ अ॒धि ब्रुवन् ॥२॥

text: All waited on him as he came to meet them. He self-resplendent moves endued with glory. That is the royal hero's lofty nature: he, manifold, hath gained immortal powers.
meaning: आति॒ष्ठन्तं प॒रि वि॒श्वे अभूषं छ्रि॒यं व॒सानश् चरति स्व॒रोचिः । मह॒त् त॒द् वृ॒ष्णो अ॒सुरस्य ना॒मा॒ विश्व॒रूपो अमृ॒तानि तस्थौ ॥३॥

text: Stride forth to heaven's broad regions, thou, a tiger on a tiger's skin. Let all the people long for thee. Let heavenly floods be rich in milk.
meaning: व्याघ्रो॒ अ॒धि वै॒याघ्रे वि॒ क्रमस्व दि॒शो महीः॒ । वि॒शस् त्वा स॒र्वा वाञ्छन्त्व् आ॒पो दिव्याः॒ प॒यस्वतीः ॥४॥

text: Heaven's waters joyous in their milk, the waters of middle air, and those that earth containeth- I with the gathered power and might of all these waters sprinkle thee,
meaning: या॒ आ॒पो दिव्याः॒ प॒यसा म॒दन्त्य् अन्त॒रिक्ष उत॒ वा पृथिव्या॒म् । ता॒सां त्वा स॒र्वासाम् अपा॒म् अभि॒ षिञ्चामि व॒र्चसा ॥५॥

text: The heavenly waters rich in milk have sprinkled thee with power and might. To be the gladdener of thy friends. May Savitar so fashion thee.
meaning: अभि॒ त्वा व॒र्चसासिचन्न् आ॒पो दिव्याः॒ प॒यस्वतीः । य॒था॒सो मित्रव॒र्धनस् त॒था त्वा सविता॒ करत् ॥६॥

text: These, compassing the tiger, rouse the lion to great joy and bliss. As strong floods purify the standing ocean, so men adorn the leopard in the waters
meaning: एना॒ व्याघ्रं॒ परिषस्वजानाः॒ सिंहं॒ हिन्वन्ति महते॒ सौ॒भगाय । समुद्रं॒ न सुभु॒वस् तस्थिवां॒सं मर्मृज्य॒न्ते द्वीपि॒नम् अप्स्व् अ॑न्तः॒ ॥७॥

text: Approach! thou art the mountain's eye, the living thing that saveth us; A gift bestowed by all the Gods, yea, the defence that guardeth life.
meaning: ए॒हि जीवं॒ त्रा॒यमाणं प॒र्वतस्यास्य् अ॒क्ष्यम् । वि॒श्वेभिर् देवै॒र् दत्तं॒ परिधि॒र् जी॒वनाय क॒म् ॥१॥

text: Thou art the safeguard of the men, thou art the safeguard of the kine, Thou standest ready to protect the horses that are fleet of foot.
meaning: परिपा॒णं पु॒रुषाणां परिपा॒णं ग॒वां असि । अ॒श्वानाम् अ॒र्वताम् परिपा॒णाय तस्थिषे ॥२॥

text: Thou, also, Salve! art a defence that rends and crushes sorcerers. Thou knowest, too, of Amrit, thou art the delight of all who live, a jaundice-curing balm art thou.
meaning: उता॒सि परिपा॒णम् यातुज॒म्भनम् आञ्जन । उता॒मृ॒तस्य त्वं॒ वेत्था॒थो असि जीवभो॒जनम् अ॒थो हरितभेषज॒म् ॥३॥

text: Whomso thou creepest over, Salve! member by member, joint by joint, From him, like some strong arbiter of strife, thou banishest decline.
meaning: य॒स्याञ्जन प्रस॒र्पस्य् अ॒ङ्गमङ्गम् प॒रुष्परुः । त॒तो य॒क्ष्मं वि॒ बाधस उग्रो॒ मध्यमशी॒र् इव ॥४॥

text: No imprecation reaches him, no magic, no tormenting fiend, O Salve, Vishkandha seizes not the man who carries thee about.
meaning: नै॒नं प्रा॒प्नोति शप॒थो न॒ कृत्या॒ ना॒भिशो॒चनम् । नै॒नं वि॒ष्कन्धम् अश्नुते य॒स् त्वा बि॒भर्त्य् आञ्जन ॥५॥

text: From lying speech, from evil dream, from wicked act and sinfulness, From hostile and malignant eye,—from these, O Salve, protect us well.
meaning: असन्मन्त्रा॒द् दुष्व॒प्न्याद् दुष्कृता॒च् छ॒मलाद् उत॒ । दुर्हा॒र्दश् च॒क्षुषो घोरा॒त् त॒स्मान् नः पाह्य् आञ्जन ॥६॥

text: I, knowing this, O Salve, will speak the very truth and not a lie: May I obtain both horse and ox, may I obtain thy life, O man.
meaning: इदं॒ विद्वा॒न् आञ्जन सत्यं॒ वक्ष्यामि ना॒नृतम् । सने॒यम् अ॒श्वं गा॒म् अह॒म् आत्मा॒नं त॒व पूरुष ॥७॥

text: Three are the slaves that serve the Salve, Fever, Consumption, and the Snake. Thy father is the loftiest of mountains, named the Triple- peaked.
meaning: त्र॒यो दासा॒ आ॒ञ्जनस्य तक्मा॒ बला॒स आ॒द् अ॒हिः । व॒र्षिष्ठः प॒र्वतानां त्रिककु॒न् ना॒म ते पिता॒ ॥८॥

text: Sprung from the Snowy Mountain's side, this Ointment of the Three-peaked hill. Crushes and rends all sorcerers and every witch and sorceress.
meaning: य॒द् आ॒ञ्जनं त्रैककुद॒म् जातं॒ हिम॒वतस् प॒रि । यातूं॒श् च स॒र्वाञ् जम्भ॒यत् स॒र्वाश् च यातुधान्यः॑ ॥९॥

text: If thou art from the Three-peaked hill or hast thy name from Yamunā, These names are both auspicious: by these two protect thou us, O Salve!
meaning: य॒दि वा॒सि त्रैककुदं॒ य॒दि यामुन॒म् उच्य॒से । उभे॒ ते भद्रे॒ ना॒म्नी ता॒भ्यां नः पाह्य् आञ्जन ॥१०॥

text: Child of the wind firmament, sprung from the lightning and the light, May this the gold-born Shell that bears the pearl preserve us from distress.
meaning: वा॒ताज् जातो॒ अन्त॒रिक्षाद् विद्यु॒तो ज्यो॒तिषस् प॒रि । स॒ नो हिरण्यजाः॒ शङ्खः॒ कृ॒शनः पात्व् अं॒हसः ॥१॥

text: Shell that wast born from out the sea, set at the head of things that shine! With thee we slay the Rākshasas and overcome voracious fiends.
meaning: यो॒ अग्रतो॒ रोचना॒नां समुद्रा॒द् अ॒धि जज्ञिषे॒ । शङ्खे॒न हत्वा॒ र॒क्षांस्य् अत्त्रि॒णो वि॒ षहामहे ॥२॥

text: We stay disease and indigence, and chase Sadānvās with the Shell. May the all-healing Shell that bears the pearl preserve us from distress.
meaning: शङ्खे॒ना॒मीवाम् अ॒मतिं शङ्खे॒नोत॒ सदा॒न्वाः । शङ्खो॒ नो विश्व॒भेषजः कृ॒शनः पात्व् अं॒हसः ॥३॥

text: Born in the heaven, sprung from the sea, brought to us hither from the flood. This gold-born Shell shall be to us an amulet to lengthen life.
meaning: दिवि॒ जातः॒ समुद्रजः॒ सिन्धुत॒स् प॒र्य् आ॒भृतः । स॒ नो हिरण्यजाः॒ शङ्ख॒ आयुष्प्रत॒रणो मणिः॒ ॥४॥

text: From ocean sprang the Amulet, from Vritra sprang the Lord of Day: May this protect us round about from shaft of God and Asura.
meaning: समुद्रा॒ज् जातो॒ मणि॒र् वृत्रा॒ज् जातो॒ दिवाकरः॒ । सो॒ अस्मा॒न्त् सर्व॒तः पातु हेत्या॒ देवासुरे॒भ्यः ॥५॥

text: Peerless 'mid golden ornaments art thou: from Soma wast thou born. Thou gleamest on the quiver, thou art beautiful upon the car: may it prolong our days of life!
meaning: हि॒रण्यानाम् ए॒को ऽसि सो॒मात् त्व॒म् अ॒धि जज्ञिषे । र॒थे त्व॒म् असि दर्शत॒ इषुधौ॒ रोचन॒स् त्वं॒ प्र॒ ण आ॒यूंषि तारिषत् ॥६॥

text: Bone of the Good became the pearl's shell-mother endowed with soul it moveth in the waters. I bind this on thee for life, strength, and vigour, for long life lasting through a hundred autumns. May the pearl's mother keep and guard thee safely!
meaning: देवा॒नाम् अ॒स्थि कृ॒शनं बभूव त॒द् आत्मन्व॒च् चरत्य् अप्स्व् अ॑न्तः॒ । त॒त् ते बध्नाम्य् आ॒युषे व॒र्चसे ब॒लाय दीर्घायुत्वा॒य शत॒शारदाय कार्शन॒स् त्वाभि॒ रक्षतु ॥७॥

text: The Bull supports the wide-spread earth and heaven, the Bull supports the spacious air between them. The Bull supports the sky's six spacious regions: the universal world hath he pervaded.
meaning: अनड्वा॒न् दाधार पृथिवी॒म् उत॒ द्या॒म् अनड्वा॒न् दाधारोर्व् अ॑न्त॒रिक्षम् । अनड्वा॒न् दाधार प्रदि॒शः ष॒ड् उर्वी॒र् अनड्वा॒न् वि॒श्वं भु॒वनम् आ॒ विवेश ॥१॥

text: The Bull is Indra o'er the beasts he watches. He, Sakra measures out three several pathways. He, milking out the worlds, the past, the future, discharges all the Gods' eternal duties.
meaning: अनड्वा॒न् इ॒न्द्रः स॒ पशु॒भ्यो वि॒ चष्टे त्रयां॒ छक्रो॒ वि॒ मिमीते अ॒ध्वनः । भूतं॒ भविष्य॒द् भु॒वना दु॒हानः स॒र्वा देवा॒नाम् चरति व्रता॒नि ॥२॥

text: Being produced among mankind as Indra, the Caldron works heated and brightly glowing. Let him not, with good sons, pass off in vapour who hath not eaten of the Ox with knowledge.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रो जातो॒ मनुष्ये॑ष्व् अन्त॒र् घर्म॒स् तप्त॒श् चरति शो॒शुचानः । सुप्रजाः॒ स॒न्त् स॒ उदारे॒ न॒ सर्षद् यो॒ ना॒श्नीया॒द् अनडु॒हो विजान॒न् ॥३॥

text: The Ox pours milk out in the world of virtue: in earliest time, he, Pavam5na, swells it. Parjanya is the stream, Maruts his udder, sacrifice is the milk, the meed his milking.
meaning: अनड्वा॒न् दुहे सुकृत॒स्य लोक॒ ऐ॒नं प्याययति प॒वमानः पुर॒स्तात् । पर्ज॒न्यो धा॒रा मरु॒त ऊ॒धो अस्य यज्ञः॒ प॒यो द॒क्षिणा दो॒हो अस्य ॥४॥

text: That which not sacrifice nor sacrificer, not giver nor receiver rules and governs, All-winning, all-supporting, all-effecting,—which of all quadru- peds, tell us! is the Caldron?
meaning: य॒स्य नेशे यज्ञ॒पतिर् न॒ यज्ञो॒ ना॒स्य दातेशे न॒ प्रतिग्रहीता॒ । यो॒ विश्वजि॒द् विश्वभृ॒द् विश्व॒कर्मा घर्मं॒ नो ब्रूत यतम॒श् च॒तुष्पात् ॥५॥

text: May we, fame-seekers, reach the world of virtue by service of the Gharma and through fervour, Whereby the Gods went up to heaven, the centre of life eternal, having left the body.
meaning: ये॒न देवाः॒ स्व॑र् आरुरुहु॒र् हित्वा॒ श॒रीरम् अमृ॒तस्य ना॒भिम् । ते॒न गेष्म सुकृत॒स्य लोकं॒ घर्म॒स्य व्रते॒न त॒पसा यशस्य॒वः ॥६॥

text: Prajāpati, supreme and sovran ruler, Indra by form and by his shoulder Agni, Came to Visvānara, came to all men's Bullock: he firmly forti- fied and held securely.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रो रूपे॒णाग्नि॒र् व॒हेन प्रजा॒पतिः परमेष्ठी॒ विरा॒ट् । विश्वा॒नरे अक्रमत वैश्वानरे॒ अक्रमतानदु॒ह्य् अक्रमत । सो॒ ऽदृंहयत सो॒ ऽधारयत ॥७॥

text: The middle of the Bullock's neck, there where the shoulder-bar is placed, Extends as far to east of him as that is settled to the west.
meaning: म॒ध्यम् एत॒द् अनडु॒हो य॒त्रैष॒ व॒ह आ॒हितः । एता॒वद् अस्य प्राची॒नं या॒वान् प्रत्य॒ङ् समा॒हितः ॥८॥

text: He whosoever knows the seven exhaustless pourings of the Ox, Wins himself offspring and the world: the great Seven Rishis know this well.
meaning: यो॒ वे॒दानदु॒हो दो॒हान् सप्ता॒नुपदस्वतः । प्रजां॒ च लोकं॒ चाप्नोति त॒था सप्तऋष॒यो विदुः ॥९॥

text: With feet subduing weariness, with legs extracting freshening draughts, Through toil the plougher and the Ox approach the honeyed beverage.
meaning: पद्भिः॒ सेदि॒म् अवक्रा॒मन्न् इ॒रां ज॒ङ्घाभिर् उत्खिद॒न् । स्र॒मेणानड्वा॒न् कीला॒लं कीना॒शश् चाभि॒ गछतः ॥१०॥

text: Assigned are these twelve nights, they say, as holy to Prajāpati: Whoever knows their proper prayer performs the service of the Ox.
meaning: द्वा॒दश वा॒ एता॒ रा॒त्रीर् व्र॒त्या आहुः प्रजा॒पतेः । त॒त्रो॒प ब्र॒ह्म यो॒ वे॒द त॒द् वा॒ अनडु॒हो व्रत॒म् ॥११॥

text: At evening he is milked, is milked at early morn, is milked at noon. We know that streams of milk that flow from him are in- exhaustible.
meaning: दुहे॒ सायं॒ दुहे॒ प्रात॒र् दुहे॒ मध्यं॒दिनं प॒रि । दो॒हा ये॒ अस्य संय॒न्ति ता॒न् विद्मा॒नुपदस्वतः ॥१२॥

text: Thou art the healer, making whole, the healer of the broken bone: Make thou this whole, Arundhatī!
meaning: रो॒हण्य् असि रो॒हण्य् अस्थ्न॒श् छिन्न॒स्य रो॒हणी । रोह॒येद॒म् अरुन्धति ॥१॥

text: Whatever bone of thine within thy body hath been wrenched or cracked, May Dhātar set it properly and join together limb by limb.
meaning: य॒त् ते रिष्टं॒ य॒त् ते द्युत्त॒म् अ॒स्ति पे॒ष्ट्रं त आत्म॒नि । धाता॒ त॒द् भद्र॒या पु॒नः सं॒ दधत् प॒रुषा प॒रुः ॥२॥

text: With marrow be the marrow joined, thy limb united with the limb. Let what hath fallen of thy flesh, and the bone also grow again.
meaning: सं॒ ते मज्जा॒ मज्ज्ञा॒ भवतु स॒म् उ ते प॒रुषा प॒रुः । सं॒ ते मांस॒स्य वि॒स्रस्तं स॒म् अ॒स्थ्य् अ॒पि रोहतु ॥३॥

text: Let marrow close with marrow, let skin grow united with the skin. Let blood and bone grow strong in thee, flesh grow together with the flesh.
meaning: मज्जा॒ मज्ञा॒ सं॒ धीयतां च॒र्मणा च॒र्म रोहतु । अ॒सृक् ते अ॒स्थि रोहतु मांसं॒ मांसे॒न रोहतु ॥४॥

text: Join thou together hair with hair, join thou together skin with skin. Let blood and bone grow strong in thee. Unite the broken part,. O Plant.
meaning: लो॒म लो॒म्ना सं॒ कल्पया त्वचा॒ सं॒ कल्पया त्व॒चम् । अ॒सृक् ते अ॒स्थि रोहतु छिन्नं॒ सं॒ धेह्य् ओषधे ॥५॥

text: Arise, advance, speed forth; the car hath goodly fellies, naves, and wheels!! Stand up erect upon thy feet.
meaning: स॒ उ॒त् तिष्ठ प्रे॒हि प्र॒ द्रव र॒थः सुचक्रः॒ । सुपविः॒ सुना॒भिः प्र॒ति तिष्ठोर्ध्वः॒ ॥६॥

text: If he be torn and shattered, having fallen into a pit, or a cast stone have struck him, Let the skilled leech join limb with limb, as 'twere the portions of a car.
meaning: य॒दि कर्तं॒ पतित्वा॒ संशश्रे॒ य॒दि वा॒श्मा प्र॒हृतो जघा॒न । ऋभू॒ र॒थस्येवा॒ङ्गानि सं॒ दधत् प॒रुषा प॒रुः ॥७॥

text: Gods, raise again the man whom ye, O Gods, have humbled and brought low. Ye Gods, restore to life again, him, Gods! who hath committed sin.
meaning: उत॒ देवा अ॒वहितं दे॒वा उ॒न् नयथा पु॒नः । उता॒गश् चक्रु॒षं देवा दे॒वा जीव॒यथा पु॒नः ॥१॥

text: Here these two winds are blowing far as Sindhu from a distant land. May one breathe energy to thee, the other blow thy fault away.
meaning: द्वा॒व् इमौ॒ वा॒तौ वात आ॒ सि॒न्धोर् आ॒ पराव॒तः । द॒क्षं ते अन्य॒ आवा॒तु व्य् अ॑न्यो॒ वातु य॒द् र॒पः ॥२॥

text: Hither, O Wind, blow healing balm, blow every fault away, thou Wind! For thou who hast all medicine comest as envoy of the Gods.
meaning: आ॒ वात वाहि भेषजं॒ वि॒ वात वाहि य॒द् र॒पः । त्वं॒ हि॒ विश्वभेषज देवा॒नां दूत॒ ई॒यसे ॥३॥

text: May the Gods keep and save this man, the Maruts' host deliver him. All things that be deliver him that he be freed from his offence.
meaning: त्रा॒यन्ताम् इमं॒ देवा॒स् त्रा॒यन्तां मरु॒तां गणाः॒ । त्रा॒यन्तां वि॒श्वा भूता॒नि य॒थाय॒म् अरपा॒ अ॒सत् ॥४॥

text: I am come nigh to thee with balms to give thee rest and keep thee safe. I bring thee mighty strength, I drive thy wasting malady away.
meaning: आ॒ त्वागमं शं॒तातिभिर् अ॒थो अरिष्ट॒तातिभिः । द॒क्षं त उग्र॒म् आ॒भारिषं प॒रा य॒क्ष्मं सुवामि ते ॥५॥

text: Felicitous is this my hand, yet more felicitous is this. This hand contains all healing balms, and this makes whole with gentle touch.
meaning: अयं॒ मे ह॒स्तो भ॒गवान् अयं॒ मे भ॒गवत्तरः । अयं॒ मे विश्व॒भेषजो ऽयं॒ शिवा॒भिमर्शनः ॥६॥

text: The tongue that leads the voice precedes. Then with our tenfold- branching hands. With these two healers of disease, we stroke thee with a soft caress.
meaning: ह॒स्ताभ्यां द॒शशाखाभ्यां जिह्वा॒ वाचः॒ पुरोगवी॒ । अनामयित्नु॒भ्यां ह॒स्ताभ्यां ता॒भ्यां त्वाभि॒ मृशामसि ॥७॥

text: The Goat was verily produced from Agni. Through sorrow he beheld, at first, his father. Through him at first the Gods attained to godhead, and, meet for sacrifices, were exalted.
meaning: अजो॒ ह्य् अ॑ग्ने॒र् अ॒जनिष्ट शो॒कात् सो॒ अपश्यज् जनिता॒रम् अ॒ग्रे । ते॒न देवा॒ देव॒ताम् अ॒ग्रा आयन् ते॒न रो॒हान् रुरुहुर् मे॒ध्यासः ॥१॥

text: Bearing in hands seethed viands, go with Agni to the cope of heaven. Reaching the sky that touches heaven, mix with the company of Gods.
meaning: क्र॒मध्वम् अग्नि॒ना ना॒कम् उ॒ख्यान् ह॒स्तेषु बि॒भ्रतः । दिव॒स् पृष्ठं॒ स्व॑र् गत्वा॒ मिश्रा॒ देवे॒भिर् आध्वम् ॥२॥

text: From earth's high ridge to middle air I mounted, and from mid- air ascended up to heaven. From the high pitch of heaven's cope I came into the world of light.
meaning: पृष्ठा॒त् पृथिव्या॒ अह॒म् अन्त॒रिक्षम् आ॒रुहम् अन्त॒रिक्षाद् दि॒वम् आ॒रुहम् । दिवो॒ ना॒कस्य पृष्ठा॒त् स्व॑र् ज्यो॒तिर् अगाम् अह॒म् ॥३॥

text: Mounting the sky they look not round; they rise to heaven through both the worlds, Sages who paid the sacrifice that pours its streams on every side.
meaning: स्व॑र् य॒न्तो ना॒पेक्षन्त आ॒ द्यां॒ रोहन्ति रो॒दसी । यज्ञं॒ ये॒ विश्व॒तोधारं सु॒विद्वांसो वितेनिरे॒ ॥४॥

text: First among all the deities, come forward, thou who art eye of Gods and men, O Agni. Imploring, and accordant with the Bhrigus, to heaven in safety go the sacrificers!
meaning: अ॒ग्ने प्रे॒हि प्रथमो॒ देव॒तानां च॒क्षुर् देवा॒नाम् उत॒ मा॒नुषानाम् । इ॒यक्षमाणा भृ॒गुभिः सजो॒षाः स्व॑र् यन्तु य॒जमानाः स्वस्ति॒ ॥५॥

text: With milk and butter I anoint the mighty, celestial Goat, strong- winged, and full of juices. Through him will we attain the world of virtue, ascending to the loftiest cope, to heaven.
meaning: अज॒म् अनज्मि प॒यसा घृते॒न दिव्यं॒ सुपर्नं॒ पयसं॒ बृह॒न्तम् । ते॒न गेष्म सुकृत॒स्य लोकं॒ स्व॑र् आरो॒हन्तो अभि॒ ना॒कम् उत्तम॒म् ॥६॥

text: Set the Goat's head toward the eastern region, and turn his right side to the southern quarter. His hinder part turn to the western quarter, and set his left side to the northern region.
meaning: प॒ञ्चौदनं पञ्च॒भिर् अङ्गु॒लिभिर् द॒र्व्यो॒द्धर पञ्चधै॒त॒म् ओदन॒म् । प्रा॒च्यां दिशि॒ शि॒रो अज॒स्य धेहि द॒क्षिणायां दिशि॒ द॒क्षिणं धेहि पार्श्व॒म् ॥७॥

text: Set the Goat's backbone upmost in the zenith, and lay his belly downward in the nadir; set his midportion in mid-air between them.
meaning: प्रती॒च्यां दिशि॒ भस॒दम् अस्य धेह्य् उ॒त्तरस्यां दिश्य् उ॒त्तरं धेहि पार्श्व॒म् । ऊर्ध्वा॒यां दिश्य् अ॑ज॒स्या॒नूकं धेहि दिशि॒ ध्रुवा॒यां धेहि पाजस्य॑म् अन्त॒रिक्षे मध्यतो॒ म॒ध्यम् अस्य ॥८॥

text: O'er the dressed Goat lay a dressed skin to robe him prepared, in perfect form, with all his members. Rise upward to the loftiest vault of heaven: with thy four feet stand firmly in the regions.
meaning: शृत॒म् अजं॒ शृत॒या प्रो॒र्णुहि त्वचा॒ स॒र्वैर् अ॒ङ्गैः सं॒भृतं विश्व॒रूपम् । स॒ उ॒त् तिस्ठेतो॒ अभि ना॒कम् उत्तमं॒ पद्भि॒श् चतु॒र्भिः प्र॒ति तिष्ठ दिक्षु॒ ॥९॥

text: Let all the misty regions fly together, let all the rain-clouds sped by wind, assemble. Let waters satisfy the earth, the voices of the great mist-enve- loped Bull who roareth.
meaning: समु॒त्पतन्तु प्रदि॒शो न॒भस्वतीः स॒म् अभ्रा॒णि वा॒तजूतानि यन्तु । महऋषभ॒स्य न॒दतो न॒भस्वतो वाश्रा॒ आ॒पः पृथिवीं॒ तर्पयन्तु ॥१॥

text: Let them show forth, the strong, the bounteous Maruts: let plants and shrubs be hung with drops of moisture. Let floods of rain refresh the ground with gladness and herbs spring various with each form and colour.
meaning: स॒म् ईक्षयन्तु तविषाः॒ सुदा॒नवो ऽपां॒ र॒सा ओ॒षधीभिः सचन्ताम् । वर्ष॒स्य स॒र्गा महयन्तु भू॒मिं पृ॒थग् जायन्ताम् ओ॒षधयो विश्व॒रूपाः ॥२॥

text: Cause us who sing to see the gathering vapours: out burst in many a place the rush of waters! Let floods of rain refresh the ground with gladness; and herbs spring various with each form and colour.
meaning: स॒म् ईक्षयस्व गा॒यतो न॒भांस्य् अपा॒म् वे॒गासः पृ॒थग् उ॒द् विजन्ताम् । वर्ष॒स्य स॒र्गा महयन्तु भू॒मिं पृ॒थग् जायन्ताम् वीरु॒धो विश्व॒रूपाः ॥३॥

text: Apart, Parjanya! let the troops of Maruts, roaring, swell the song. Let pouring torrents of the rain that raineth rain upon the earth.
meaning: गणा॒स् त्वो॒प गायन्तु मा॒रुताः पर्जन्य घोषि॒णः पृ॒थक् । स॒र्गा वर्ष॒स्य व॒र्षतो व॒र्षन्तु पृथिवी॒म् अ॒नु ॥४॥

text: Up from the sea lift your dread might, ye Maruts: as light and splendour, send the vapour upward! Let waters satisfy the earth, the voices of the great mist-enve- loped Bull who roareth.
meaning: उ॒द् ईरयत मरुतः समुद्रत॒स् त्वेषो॒ अर्को॒ न॒भ उ॒त् पातयाथ । महऋषभ॒स्य न॒दतो न॒भस्वतो वाश्रा॒ आ॒पः पृथिवीं॒ तर्पयन्तु ॥५॥

text: Roar, thunder, set the sea in agitation, bedew the ground with thy sweet rain, Parjanya! Send plenteous showers on him who seeketh shelter, and let the owner of lean kine go homeward.
meaning: अभि॒ क्रन्द स्तन॒यार्द॒योदधिं॒ भू॒मिं पर्जन्य प॒यसा स॒म् अङ्धि । त्व॒या सृष्टं॒ बहुल॒म् ऐ॒तु वर्ष॒म् आशारैषी॒ कृश॒गुर् एत्व् अ॒स्तम् ॥६॥

text: Let the boon Maruts, let the springs and coiling serpents tend! you well. Urged by the Maruts let the clouds pour down their rain upon. the earth.
meaning: सं॒ वो ऽवन्तु सुदा॒नव उ॒त्सा अजगरा॒ उत॒ । मरु॒द्भिः प्र॒च्युता मेघा॒ व॒र्षन्तु पृथिवी॒म् अ॒नु ॥७॥

text: Let lightning flash on every side: from all the regions blow the winds! Urged by the Maruts let the clouds pour down their rain upon the earth.
meaning: आ॒शामाशां वि॒ द्योततां वा॒ता वान्तु दिशो॒दिशः । मरु॒द्भिः प्र॒च्युता मेघाः॒ सं॒ यन्तु पृथिवी॒म् अ॒नु ॥८॥

text: May waters, lightning, cloud, and rain, boon springs and serpents tend you well. Urged by the Maruts let the clouds pour down their rain upon the earth.
meaning: आ॒पो विद्यु॒द् अभ्रं॒ वर्षं॒ सं॒ वो ऽवन्तु सुदा॒नव उ॒त्सा अजगरा॒ उत॒ । मरु॒द्भिः प्र॒च्युता मेघाः॒ प्रा॒वन्तु पृथिवी॒म् अ॒नु ॥९॥

text: May he who hath become the plants' high regent, suiting our bodies, Agni of the Waters, May Jātavedas send us rain from heaven, Amrit and vital breath to earthly creatures.
meaning: अपा॒म् अग्नि॒स् तनू॒भिः संविदानो॒ य॒ ओ॒षधीनाम् अधिपा॒ बभू॒व । स॒ नो वर्षं॒ वनुतां जात॒वेदाः प्राणं॒ प्रजा॒भ्यो अमृ॒तं दिव॒स् प॒रि ॥१०॥

text: Sending up waters from the flood and ocean Prajapati move the sea to agitation! Forth flow the moisture of the vigorous stallion! With this thy roar of thunder come thou hither,
meaning: प्रजा॒पतिः सलिला॒द् आ॒ समुद्रा॒द् आ॒प ईर॒यन्न् उदधि॒म् अर्दयाति । प्र॒ प्यायतां वृ॒ष्णो अ॒श्वस्य रे॒तो ऽर्वा॒न् एते॒न स्तनयित्नु॒ने॒हि ॥११॥

text: Our father, Lord divine pouring the torrents. Let the streams breathe, O Varuna, of the waters. Pour the floods down: along the brooks and channels let frogs with speckled arms send out their voices.
meaning: अपो॒ निषिञ्च॒न्न् अ॒सुरः पिता॒ नः श्व॒सन्तु ग॒र्गरा अपां॒ वरुणा॒व नी॒चीर् अपः॒ सृज । व॒दन्तु पृ॒श्निबाहवो मण्डू॒का इ॒रिणा॒नु ॥१२॥

text: They who lay quiet for a year, the Brāhmans who fulfil their vows. The frogs, have lifted up their voice, the voice Parjanya hath. inspired.
meaning: संवत्सरं॒ शशयाना॒ ब्राह्मणा॒ व्रतचारि॒णः । वा॒चम् पर्ज॒न्यजिन्वितां प्र॒ मण्दू॒का अवादिषुः ॥१३॥

text: Speak forth a welcome, female frog! Do thou O frog, accost the rain. Stretch thy four feet apart, and swim in the middle of the lake.
meaning: उपप्र॒वद मण्डूकि वर्षं॒ आ॒ वद तादुरि । म॒ध्ये ह्रद॒स्य प्लवस्व विगृ॒ह्य चतु॒रः पदः॒ ॥१४॥

text: Khanvakhā, ho! Khaimakhā, ho! thou in the middle, Taduri! Fathers, enjoy the rain from one who strives to win the Marutes heart.
meaning: खण्वखा॒३इ खैमखा॒३इ म॒ध्ये तदुरि । वर्षं॒ वनुध्वं पितरो मरु॒तां म॒न इछत ॥१५॥

text: Lift up the mighty cask and pour down water; let the wind blow, and lightnings flash around us. Let sacrifice be paid, and, widely scattered, let herbs and plants be full of joy and gladness.
meaning: महा॒न्तं को॒शम् उ॒द् अचाभि॒ षिञ्च सविद्युतं॒ भवतु वा॒तु वा॒तः । तन्व॒तां यज्ञं॒ बहुधा॒ वि॒सृष्टा आनन्दि॒नीर् ओ॒षधयो भवन्तु ॥१६॥

text: The mighty Ruler of these worlds beholds as though from close at hand, The man who thinks he acts by stealth: all this the Gods perceive and know.
meaning: बृह॒न्न् एषाम् अधिष्ठाता॒ अन्तिका॒द् इव पश्यति । य॒ स्ताय॒न् म॒न्यते च॒रन्त् स॒र्वं देवा॒ इदं॒ विदुः ॥१॥

text: If a man stands or walks or moves in secret, goes to his lying- down or his uprising, What two men whisper as they sit together, King Varuna knows: he as the third is present.
meaning: य॒स् ति॒ष्ठति च॒रति य॒श् च वञ्चति यो॒ निला॒यं च॒रति यः॒ प्रत॒ङ्कम् । द्वौ॒ संनिष॒द्य य॒न् मन्त्र॒येते रा॒जा त॒द् वेद व॒रुणस् तृती॒यः ॥२॥

text: This earth, too, is King Varuna's possession, and the high heaven whose ends are far asunder. The loins of Varuna are both the oceans, and this small drop of water, too, contains him.
meaning: उते॒यं॒ भू॒मिर् व॒रुणस्य रा॒ज्ञ उता॒सौ॒ द्यौ॒र् बृहती॒ दूरे॒अन्ता । उतो॒ समुद्रौ॒ व॒रुणस्य कुक्षी॒ उता॒स्मि॒न्न् अ॒ल्प उदके॒ नि॒लीनः ॥३॥

text: If one should flee afar beyond the heaven, King Varuna would still be round about him. Proceeding hither from the sky his envoys look, thousand-eyed, over the earth beneath them.
meaning: उत॒ यो॒ द्या॒म् अतिस॒र्पात् पर॒स्तान् न॒ स॒ मुच्यातै व॒रुणस्य रा॒ज्ञः । दिव॒ स्प॒शः प्र॒ चरन्तीद॒म् अस्य सहस्राक्षा॒ अ॒ति पश्यन्ति भू॒मिम् ॥४॥

text: All this the royal Varuna beholdeth, all between heaven and earth and all beyond them. The twinklings of men's eyelids hath he counted. As one who plays throws dice he settles all things.
meaning: स॒र्वं त॒द् रा॒जा व॒रुणो वि॒ चष्टे य॒द् अन्तरा॒ रो॒दसी य॒त् पर॒स्तात् । सं॒ख्याता अस्य निमि॒षो ज॒नानाम् अक्षा॒न् इव श्वघ्नी॒ नि॒ मिनोति ता॒नि ॥५॥

text: Those fatal snares of thine which stand extended, threefold, O Varuna, seven by seven, May they all catch the man who tells a falsehood, and pass un- harmed the man whose words are truthful.
meaning: ये॒ ते पा॒शा वरुण सप्त॒सप्त त्रेधा॒ ति॒ष्ठन्ति वि॒षिता रु॒षन्तः । छिन॒न्तु स॒र्वे अ॒नृतं व॒दन्तं यः॒ सत्यवाद्य् अ॒ति तं॒ सृजन्तु ॥६॥

text: Varuna, snare him with a hundred nooses! Man's watcher! let not him who lies escape thee. There let the villain sit with hanging belly and bandaged like a cask whose hoops are broken.
meaning: शते॒न पा॒शैर् अभि॒ धेहि वरुणैनं मा॒ ते मोच्य् अनृतवा॒ङ् नृचक्षः । आ॒स्तां जाल्म॒ उद॒रं श्रंशयित्वा॒ को॒श इवाबन्धः॒ परिकृत्य॒मानः ॥७॥

text: Varuna sends, and drives away, diseases: Varuna is both native and a stranger, Varuna is celestial and is human.
meaning: यः॒ समाभ्यो॑ व॒रुणो यो॒ व्याभ्यो॑ यः॒ संदेश्यो॑ व॒रुणो यो॒ विदेश्यो॑ । यो॒ दैवो॒ व॒रुणो य॒श् च मा॒नुषः ॥८॥

text: I bind and hold thee fast with all these nooses, thou son of such a man and such a mother. All these do I assign thee as thy portion.
meaning: तै॒स् त्वा स॒र्वैर् अभि॒ ष्यामि पा॒शैर् असाव् आमुष्यायणामुष्याः पुत्र । ता॒न् उ ते स॒र्वान् अनुसं॒दिशामि ॥९॥

text: We seize and hold thee, Conquering One! the queen of medi- cines that heal. O Plant, I have endowed thee with a hundred powers for every man,
meaning: ई॒शाणां त्वा भेषजा॒नाम् उ॒ज्जेष आ॒ रभामहे । चक्रे॒ सह॒स्रवीर्यम् स॒र्वस्मा ओषधे त्वा ॥१॥

text: Still conquering, banishing the curse, mighty, with thy reverted. bloom. Thee and all Plants have I invoked: Hence let it save us! was my prayer.
meaning: सत्यजि॒तं शपथया॒वनीं स॒हमानां पुनःसरा॒म् । स॒र्वाः स॒म् अह्व्य् ओ॒षधीर् इतो॒ नः पारयाद् इ॒ति ॥२॥

text: She who hath cursed us with a curse, or hath conceived a murderous sin, Or seized our son to take his blood, may she devour the child she bare.
meaning: या॒ शशा॒प श॒पनेन या॒घं॒ मू॒रम् आदधे॒ । या॒ र॒सस्य ह॒रणाय जात॒म् आरेभे॒ तोक॒म् अत्तु सा॒ ॥३॥

text: What magic they have wrought for thee in dish unbaked or burnt dark-red, What they have wrought in flesh undressed,—conquer the sorcerers therewith.
meaning: यां॒ ते चक्रु॒र् आमे॒ पा॒त्रे यां॒ चक्रु॒र् नीललोहिते॒ । आमे॒ मांसे॒ कृत्यां॒ यां॒ चक्रु॒स् त॒या कृत्याकृ॒तो जहि ॥४॥

text: Ill dream and wretchedness of life, Rākshasa, monster, stingy hags, All the she-fiends of evil name and voice, we drive away from us.
meaning: दौ॒ष्वप्न्यं दौ॒र्जीवित्यं र॒क्षो अभ्व॑म् अराय्यः॑ । दुर्णा॒म्नीः स॒र्वा दुर्वा॒चस् ता॒ अस्म॒न् नाशयामसि ॥५॥

text: Death caused by famine, caused by thirst, failure of children,. loss of kine, With thee, O Apāmārga, all this ill we cleanse and wipe away.
meaning: क्षुधामारं॒ तृष्णामार॒म् अगो॒ताम् अनपत्य॒ताम् । अ॒पामार्ग त्व॒या वयं॒ स॒र्वं त॒द् अ॒प मृज्महे ॥६॥

text: Death caused by thirst, death caused by stress of hunger, loss at play with dice, All this, O Apāmārga with thine aid we cleanse and wipe away.
meaning: तृष्णामारं॒ क्षुधामारं॒ अ॒थो अक्षपराजय॒म् । अ॒पामार्ग त्व॒या वयं॒ स॒र्वं त॒द् अ॒प मृज्महे ॥७॥

text: The Apāmārga is alone the sovran of all Plants that grow. With this we wipe away whate'er hath fallen on thee: go in health!
meaning: अपामार्ग॒ ओ॒षधीनां स॒र्वासाम् ए॒क इ॒द् वशी॒ । ते॒न ते मृज्म आ॒स्थितम् अ॒थ त्व॒म् अगद॒श् चर ॥८॥

text: The moonlight equalleth the sun, night is the rival of the day. I make effectual power my help: let magic arts be impotent.
meaning: समं॒ ज्यो॒तिः सू॒र्येणा॒ह्ना रा॒त्री समा॒वती । कृणोमि सत्य॒म् ऊत॒ये ऽरसाः॒ सन्तु कृ॒त्वरीः ॥१॥

text: Gods! if one make and bring a spell on some man's house who knows it not, Close as the calf that sucks the cow may it revert and cling to him.
meaning: यो॒ देवाः कृत्यां॒ कृत्वा॒ ह॒राद् अ॒विदुषो गृह॒म् । वत्सो॒ धारु॒र् इव मात॒रं तं॒ प्रत्य॒ग् उ॒प पद्यताम् ॥२॥

text: When one puts poison in a dish of unbaked clay to kill a man, It cracks when set upon the fire with the sharp sound of many stones.
meaning: अमा॒ कृत्वा॒ पाप्मा॒नं य॒स् ते॒नान्यं॒ जि॒घांसति । अ॒श्मानस् त॒स्यां दग्धा॒यां बहुलाः॒ फ॒ट् करिक्रति ॥३॥

text: Endowed with thousand powers! adjure the bald and those with necks awry. Back to its author turn the spell like a dear damsel to her friend!
meaning: स॒हस्रधामन् वि॒शिखान् वि॒ग्रीवां छायया त्व॒म् । प्र॒ति स्म चक्रु॒षे कृत्यां॒ प्रियां॒ प्रिया॒वते हर ॥४॥

text: I with this Plant have ruined all malignant powers of witchery. The spell which they have laid upon thy field, thy cattle, or thy men.
meaning: अन॒याह॒म् ओ॒षध्या स॒र्वाः कृत्या॒ अदूदुषम् । यां॒ क्षे॒त्रे चक्रु॒र् यां॒ गो॒षु यां॒ वा ते पु॒रुषेषु ॥५॥

text: No power had he who wrought the spell: he hurt his foot, he broke his toe. His act hath brought us happiness and pain and sorrow to him- self.
meaning: य॒श् चका॒र न॒ शशा॒क क॒र्तुं शश्रे॒ पा॒दम् अङ्गु॒रिम् । चका॒र भद्र॒म् अस्म॒भ्यम् आत्म॒ने त॒पनम् तु॒ सः॒ ॥६॥

text: Let Apāmārga sweep away chronic disease and every curse, Sweep sorceresses clean away, and all malignant stingy hags.
meaning: अपामार्गो॒ ऽप मार्ष्टु क्षेत्रियं॒ शप॒थश् च यः॒ । अ॒पा॒ह यातुधानी॒र् अ॒प स॒र्वा अराय्यः॑ ॥७॥

text: Sweep thou away the sorcerers, all stingy fiendish hags away. All this, O Apāmārga, with thine aid we wipe away from us.
meaning: अपमृ॒ज्य यातुधा॒नान् अ॒प स॒र्वा अराय्यः॑ । अ॒पामार्ग त्व॒या वयं॒ स॒र्वं त॒द् अ॒प मृज्महे ॥८॥

text: Thou breakest ties of kith and kin, thou causest, too, relation- ship: So bruise the sorcerer's offspring, like a reed that groweth in the Rains.
meaning: उतो॒ अस्य् अ॒बन्धुकृद् उतो॒ असि नु॒ जामिकृ॒त् । उतो॒ कृत्याकृ॒तः प्रजां॒ नद॒म् इवा॒ छिन्धि वा॒र्षिकम् ॥१॥

text: Thou hast been blessed with blessing by the Brāhman, Kanva Nārshada. Thou fliest like a flashing dart: there is no fear or danger, Plant! within the limit of thy range.
meaning: ब्राह्मणे॒न प॒र्युक्तासि क॒ण्वेन नार्षदे॒न । से॒नेवैषि त्वि॒षीमती न॒ त॒त्र भय॒म् अस्ति य॒त्र प्राप्नो॒ष्य् ओषधे ॥२॥

text: Illumining, as 'twere, with light, thou movest at the head of plants. The saviour of the simple man art thou, and slayer of the fiends.
meaning: अ॒ग्रम् एष्य् ओ॒षधीनां ज्यो॒तिषेवाभिदीप॒यन् । उत॒ त्राता॒सि पा॒कस्या॒थो हन्ता॒सि रक्ष॒सः ॥३॥

text: As once when time began the Gods with thee expelled the Asuras, Even thence, O Plant, wast thou produced as one who wipes and sweeps away.
meaning: य॒द् अदो॒ देवा॒ अ॒सुरांस् त्व॒या॒ग्रे निर॒कुर्वत । त॒तस् त्व॒म् अ॒ध्य् ओषधे ऽपामार्गो॒ अजायथाः ॥४॥

text: Thy father's name was Cleaver. Thou with thousand branches cleavest all. Do thou, turned backward, cleave and rend the man who treateth us as foes.
meaning: विभिन्दती॒ शत॒शाखा विभिन्द॒न् ना॒म ते पिता॒ । प्रत्य॒ग् वि॒ भिन्धि त्वं॒ तं॒ यो॒ अस्मां॒ अभिदा॒सति ॥५॥

text: The evil sprang from earth; it mounts to heaven and spreads to vast extent. Reverted, shaking him with might, thence on its maker let it fall.
meaning: अ॒सद् भू॒म्याः स॒म् अभवत् त॒द् या॒म् एति मह॒द् व्य॒चः । त॒द् वै॒ त॒तो विधूपाय॒त् प्रत्य॒क् कर्ता॒रम् ऋछतु ॥६॥

text: For thou hast grown reverted, and turned backward also is thy fruit. Remove all curses far from me, keep most remote the stroke of death.
meaning: प्रत्य॒ङ् हि॒ संबभू॒विथ प्रतीची॒नफलस् त्व॒म् । स॒र्वान् म॒च् छप॒थाम् अ॒धि व॒रीयो यावया वध॒म् ॥७॥

text: Preserve me with a hundred, yea, protect me with a thousand aids. May mighty Indra, Lord of Plants! give store of strength and. power to thee.
meaning: शते॒न मा प॒रि पाहि सह॒स्रेणाभि॒ रक्षा मा । इ॒न्द्रस् ते वीरुधां पत उग्र॒ ओज्मा॒नम् आ॒ दधत् ॥८॥

text: It sees in front, it sees behind, it sees afar away, it sees The sky, the firmament, and earth: all this, O Goddess, it beholds.
meaning: आ॒ पश्यति प्र॒ति पश्यति प॒रा पश्यति प॒श्यति । दि॒वम् अन्त॒रिक्षम् आ॒द् भू॒मिं स॒र्वं त॒द् देवि पश्यति ॥१॥

text: Through thee, O godlike Plant, may I behold all creatures that exist, Three several heavens, three several earths, and these six regions one by one.
meaning: तिस्रो॒ दि॒वस् तिस्रः॒ पृथिवीः॒ ष॒ट् चेमाः॒ प्रदि॒शाः पृ॒थक् । त्व॒याहं॒ स॒र्वा भूता॒नि प॒श्यानि देव्य् ओषधे ॥२॥

text: The pupil, verily, art thou of that celestial Engle's eye. On earth hast thou alighted as a weary woman seeks her couch.
meaning: दिव्य॒स्य सुपर्ण॒स्य त॒स्य हासि कनी॒निका । सा॒ भू॒मिम् आ॒ रुरोहिथ वह्यं॒ श्रान्ता॒ वधू॒र् इव ॥३॥

text: The God who hath a thousand eyes give me this Plant in my right hand! I look on every one therewith, each Sūdra and each Āryan man.
meaning: तां॒ मे सहस्राक्षो॒ देवो॒ द॒क्षिणे ह॒स्त आ॒ दधत् । त॒याहं॒ स॒र्वं पश्यामि य॒श् च शूद्र॒ उता॒र्यः ॥४॥

text: Make manifest the forms of things; hide not their essences from sight. And, thou who hast a thousand eyes, look the Kimidins in the face.
meaning: आवि॒ष् कृणुष्व रूपा॒नि मा॒त्मा॒नम् अ॒प गूहथाः । अ॒थो सहस्रचक्षो त्वं॒ प्र॒ति पश्याः किमीदि॒नः ॥५॥

text: Make me see Yātudhānas, make thou Yātudhānis visible. Make me see all Pisāchas With this prayer, O Plant, I hold thee fast.
meaning: दर्श॒य मा यातुधा॒नान् दर्श॒य यातुधान्यः॑ । पिशाचा॒न्त् स॒र्वान् दर्शये॒ति त्वा॒ रभ ओषधे ॥६॥

text: Thou art the sight of Kasyapa and of the hound who hath four eyes. Make the Pisācha manifest as Sūrya when he rides at noon.
meaning: कश्य॒पस्य च॒क्षुर् असि शुन्या॒श् च चतुरक्ष्याः॒ । वीध्रे॒ सू॒र्यम् इव स॒र्पन्तं मा॒ पिशाचं॒ तिर॒स् करः ॥७॥

text: Kimidin, Yātudhāna from their hiding-places have I dragged. I look on every one with this, Sūdra and Aryan man alike.
meaning: उ॒द् अग्रभं परिपा॒णाद् यातुधा॒नं किमीदि॒नम् । ते॒नाहं॒ स॒र्वं पश्याम्य् उत॒ शूद्र॒म् उता॒र्यम् ॥८॥

text: Make that Pisācha visible, the fiend who flies in middle air, The fiend who glides across the sky, and him who deems the earth his help.
meaning: यो॒ अन्त॒रिक्षेण प॒तति दि॒वम् य॒श् च अतिस॒र्पति । भू॒मिं यो॒ म॒न्यते नाथं॒ तं॒ पिशाच॒म् प्र॒ दर्शय ॥९॥

text: The kine have come and brought good fortune: let them rest in the cow-pen and be happy near us. Here let them stay prolific, many-coloured, and yield through many morns their milk for Indra.
meaning: आ॒ गा॒वो अग्मन्न् उत॒ भद्र॒म् अक्रन्त् सी॒दन्तु गोष्ठे॒ रण॒यन्त्व् अस्मे॒ । प्रजा॒वतीः पुरुरू॒पा इह॒ स्युर् इ॒न्द्राय पूर्वी॒र् उष॒सो दु॒हानाः ॥१॥

text: Indra aids him who offers sacrifice and praise: he takes not what is his, and gives him more thereto. Increasing ever more and ever more his wealth, he makes the pious dwell within unbroken bounds.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रो य॒ज्वने गृणते॒ च शि॒क्षत उ॒पे॒द् ददाति न॒ स्वं॒ मुषायति । भू॒योभूयो रयि॒म् इ॒द् अस्य वर्ध॒यन्न् अभिन्ने॒ खिल्ये॒ नि॒ दधाति देवयु॒म् ॥२॥

text: These are ne'er lost, no robber ever injures them: no evil-minded foe attempts to harass them. The master of the kine lives a long life with these, the Cows whereby he pours his gifts and serves the Gods.
meaning: न॒ ता॒ नशन्ति न॒ दभाति त॒स्करो ना॒साम् आमित्रो॒ व्यथि॒र् आ॒ दधर्षति । देवां॒श् च या॒भिर् य॒जते द॒दाति च ज्यो॒ग् इ॒त् ता॒भिः सचते गो॒पतिः सह॒ ॥३॥

text: The charger with his dusty brow o'ertakes them not, and never to the shambles do they take their way. These Cows, the cattle of the pious worshipper, roam over wide- spread pasture where no danger is.
meaning: न॒ ता॒ अ॒र्वा रेणु॒ककाटो ऽश्नुते न॒ संस्कृतत्र॒म् उ॒प यन्ति ता॒ अभि॒ । उरुगाय॒म् अ॒भयं त॒स्य ता॒ अ॒नु गा॒वो म॒र्तस्य वि॒ चरन्ति य॒ज्वनः ॥४॥

text: To me the Cows seem Bhaga, they seem Indra, they seem a portion of the first poured Soma. These present Cows, they, O ye men, are Indra. I long for Indra with my heart and spirit.
meaning: गा॒वो भ॒गो गा॒व इ॒न्द्रो म इछाद् गा॒व सो॒मस्य प्रथम॒स्य भक्षः॒ । इमा॒ या॒ गा॒वः स॒ जनास इ॒न्द्र इछा॒मि हृदा॒ म॒नसा चिद् इ॒न्द्रम् ॥५॥

text: O Cows, ye fatten e'en the worn and wasted, and make the unlovely beautiful to look on. Prosper my home, ye with auspicious voices! Your power is magnified in our assemblies.
meaning: यूयं॒ गावो मेदयथ कृशं॒ चिद् अश्रीरं॒ चित् कृणुथा सुप्र॒तीकम् । भद्रं॒ गृहं॒ कृणुथ भद्रवाचो बृह॒द् वो व॒य उच्यते सभा॒सु ॥६॥

text: In goodly pasturage, bright-hued, prolific, drinking pure water at fair drinking-places, Never be thief or sinful man your master, and may the dart of Rudra still avoid you!
meaning: प्रजा॒वतीः सूय॒वसे रुश॒न्तीः शुद्धा॒ अपः॒ सुप्रपाणे॒ पि॒बन्तीः । मा॒ व स्तेन॒ ईशत मा॒घ॒शंसः प॒रि वो रुद्र॒स्य हेति॒र् वृणक्तु ॥७॥

text: Exalt and strengthen this my Prince, O Indra, Make him sole lord and leader of the people. Scatter his foes, deliver all his rivals into his hand in struggles for precedence.
meaning: इम॒म् इन्द्र वर्धय क्षत्रि॒यं मे इमं॒ विशा॒म् एकवृषं॒ कृणु त्व॒म् । नि॒र् अमि॒त्रान् अक्ष्णुह्य् अस्य स॒र्वांस् ता॒न् रन्धयास्मा अहमुत्तरे॒षु ॥१॥

text: Give him a share in village, kine, and horses, and leave his enemy without a portion. Let him as King be head and chief of Princes, Give up to him, O Indra, every foeman.
meaning: ए॒मं॒ भज ग्रा॒मे अ॒श्वेषु गो॒षु नि॒ष् टं॒ भज यो॒ अमि॒त्रो अस्य॒ । व॒र्ष्म क्षत्रा॒णाम् अय॒म् अस्तु रा॒जे॒न्द्र श॒त्रुं रन्धय स॒र्वम् अस्मै॒ ॥२॥

text: Let him be treasure-lord of goodly treasures, let him as King be master of the people. Grant unto him great power and might, O Indra, and strip his enemy of strength and vigour.
meaning: अय॒म् अस्तु ध॒नपतिर् ध॒नानाम् अयं॒ विशां॒ विश्प॒तिर् अस्तु रा॒जा । अस्मि॒न्न् इन्द्र म॒हि व॒र्चांसि धेह्य् अवर्च॒सं कृणुहि श॒त्रुम् अस्य ॥३॥

text: Like milch-kine yielding milk for warm libations, pour, Heaven and Earth! on him full many a blessing. May he as King be Indra's well-beloved, the darling of the kine, the plants, the cattle.
meaning: अस्मै॒ द्यावापृथिवी भू॒रि वामं॒ दुहाथां घर्मदु॒घे इव॒ धेनू॒ । अयं॒ रा॒जा प्रिय॒ इ॒न्द्रस्य भूयात् प्रियो॒ ग॒वाम् ओ॒षधीनां पशूना॒म् ॥४॥

text: I join in league with thee victorious Indra, with whom men conquer and are ne'er defeated. He shall make thee the folk's sole lord and leader, shall make thee highest of all human rulers.
meaning: युन॒ज्मि त उत्तरा॒वन्तम् इ॒न्द्रं ये॒न ज॒यन्ति न॒ पराज॒यन्ते । य॒स् त्वा क॒रद् एकवृषं॒ ज॒नानाम् उत॒ रा॒ज्ञाम् उत्तमं॒ मानवा॒नाम् ॥५॥

text: Supreme art thou, beneath thee are thy rivals, and all, O King, who were thine adversaries. Sole lord and leader and allied with Indra, bring, conqueror, thy foremen's goods and treasures.
meaning: उ॒त्तरस् त्व॒म् अ॒धरे ते सप॒त्ना ये॒ के॒ च राजन् प्र॒तिशत्रवस् ते । एकवृष॒ इ॒न्द्रसखा जिगीवां॒ छत्रूयता॒म् आ॒ भरा भो॒जनानि ॥६॥

text: Consume, with lion aspect, all their hamlets, with tiger aspect, drive away thy foemen. Sole lord and leader and allied with Indra, seize, conqueror, thine enemies' possessions.
meaning: सिंह॒प्रतीको वि॒शो अद्धि स॒र्वा व्याघ्र॒प्रतीको॒ ऽव बाधस्व श॒त्रून् । एकवृष॒ इ॒न्द्रसखा जिगीवां॒ छत्रूयता॒म् आ॒ खिदा भो॒जनानि ॥७॥

text: I fix my heart on wise and ancient Agni, the Five Tribes' Lord, in many a place enkindled. We seek him who hath entered all our houses. May he deliver us from grief and trouble.
meaning: अग्ने॒र् मन्वे प्रथम॒स्य प्र॒चेतसः पा॒ञ्चजन्यस्य बहुधा॒ य॒म् इन्ध॒ते । वि॒शोविशः प्रविशिवां॒सम् ईमहे स॒ नो मुञ्चत्व् अं॒हसः ॥१॥

text: As thou conveyest offerings, Jātavedas! and fashionest the sacri- fice with knowledge, So bear thou to the Gods the prayer we utter. May he deliver us from grief and trouble.
meaning: य॒था हव्यं॒ व॒हसि जातवेदो य॒था यज्ञं॒ कल्प॒यसि प्रजान॒न् । एवा॒ देवे॒भ्यः सुमतिं॒ न आ॒ वह स॒ नो मुञ्चत्व् अं॒हसः ॥२॥

text: I pray to Agni in each act successful, employed in every sacrifice, the strongest, Fiend-slayer, served with fatness, strengthening worship. May he deliver us from grief and trouble.
meaning: या॒मन्यामन्न् उ॒पयुक्तं व॒हिष्ठं क॒र्मङ्कर्मन्न् आ॒भगम् अग्नि॒म् ईडे । रक्षोह॒णं यज्ञवृ॒धं घृता॒हुतं स॒ नो मुञ्चत्व् अं॒हसः ॥३॥

text: We invoke the oblation-bearer, well-born Agni Jātavedas, Him, Vaisvānara, almighty. May he set us free from trouble.
meaning: सु॒जातं जात॒वेदसम् अग्निं॒ वैश्वानरं॒ विभु॒म् । हव्यवा॒हं हवामहे स॒ नो मुञ्चत्व् अं॒हसः ॥४॥

text: With whom as friend the Rishis gave their power new splendour, with whom they kept aloof the Asuras' devices, Agni, with whom Indra subdued the Panis. May he deliver us. from grief and trouble.
meaning: ये॒न ऋ॒षयो बल॒म् अ॒द्योतयन् युजा॒ ये॒ना॒सुराणाम् अ॒युवन्त मायाः॒ । ये॒नाग्नि॒ना पणी॒न् इ॒न्द्रो जिगा॒य स॒ नो मुञ्चत्व् अं॒हसः ॥५॥

text: Through whom the Gods discovered life eternal, through whom they stored the plants with pleasant juices, Through whom they brought to men the light of heaven. May he deliver us from grief and trouble.
meaning: ये॒न देवा॒ अमृ॒तम् अन्व॒विन्दन् ये॒नौ॒षधीर् म॒धुमतीर् अ॒कृण्वन् । ये॒न देवाः॒ स्व॑र् आ॒भरन्त् स॒ नो मुञ्चत्व् अं॒हसः ॥६॥

text: I, suppliant, praise and ever call on Agni, sole Lord of all this world, of all that shineth, Of what exists and shall exist hereafter. May he deliver us from grief and trouble.
meaning: य॒स्येदं॒ प्रदि॒शि य॒द् विरो॒चते य॒ज् जातं॒ जनितव्यं॑ च के॒वलम् । स्तौ॒म्य् अग्निं॒ नाथितो॒ जोहवीमि स॒ नो मुञ्चत्व् अं॒हसः ॥७॥

text: I think of Indra, only him for ever, fiend-slayer, May these lauds of mine come near him. He cometh to the pious offerer's calling. May he deliver us from grief and trouble.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रस्य मन्महे श॒श्वद् इ॒द् अस्य मन्महे वृत्रघ्न॒ स्तो॒मा उ॒प मेम॒ आ॒गुः । यो॒ दाशु॒षः सुकृ॒तो ह॒वम् ए॒ति स॒ नो मुञ्चत्व् अं॒हसः ॥१॥

text: Who with strong arms o'ercame his strong opponents, who broke and crushed the power of the demons, Who won the rivers and the kine in battle. May he deliver us from grief and trouble.
meaning: य॒ उग्री॒णाम् उग्र॒बाहुर् ययु॒र् यो॒ दानवा॒नां ब॒लम् आरुरो॒ज । ये॒न जिताः॒ सि॒न्धवो ये॒न गा॒वः स॒ नो मुञ्चत्व् अं॒हसः ॥२॥

text: Ruler of men, finder of light, the hero: the pressing-stones declare his valour, master. Of sweetest sacrifice with seven Hotars. May he deliver us from grief and trouble.
meaning: य॒श् चर्षणिप्रो॒ वृषभः॒ स्वर्वि॒द् य॒स्मै ग्रा॒वाणः प्रव॒दन्ति नृम्ण॒म् । य॒स्याध्वरः॒ सप्त॒होता म॒दिष्ठः स॒ नो मुञ्चत्व् अं॒हसः ॥३॥

text: The lord of barren cows and bulls and oxen, finder of light for whom the posts are planted, For whom the bright juice flows cleansed by devotion. May he deliver us from grief and trouble.
meaning: य॒स्य वशा॒स ऋषभा॒स उक्ष॒णो य॒स्मै मीय॒न्ते स्व॒रवः स्वर्वि॒दे । य॒स्मै शुक्रः॒ प॒वते ब्र॒ह्मशुम्भितः स॒ नो मुञ्चत्व् अं॒हसः ॥४॥

text: Whose favour those desire who offer Soma, whom, arrow-bearer, men invoke in battle, On whom the hymn depends, in whom is power, May he deliver us from grief and trouble.
meaning: य॒स्य जु॒ष्टिं सोमि॒नः काम॒यन्ते यं॒ ह॒वन्त इ॒षुमन्तं ग॒विष्टौ । य॒स्मिन्न् अर्कः॒ शिश्रिये॒ य॒स्मिन्न् ओ॒जः स॒ नो मुञ्चत्व् अं॒हसः ॥५॥

text: Why was born, first, for active operation, whose valour as the first hath been awakened, Who raised his bolt when he encountered Ahi. May he deliver us from grief and trouble.
meaning: यः॒ प्रथमः॒ कर्मकृ॒त्याय जज्ञे॒ य॒स्य वीर्य॑म् प्रथम॒स्या॒नुबुद्धम् । ये॒नो॒द्यतो व॒ज्रो ऽभ्या॒यता॒हिं स॒ नो मुञ्चत्व् अं॒हसः ॥६॥

text: Strong Lord, who leadeth hosts to meet for battle, who sendeth riches both of earth and heaven, I, suppliant, praise and ever call on Indra. May he deliver us from grief and trouble.
meaning: यः॒ संग्रामा॒न् नयति सं॒ युधे॒ वशी॒ यः॒ पुष्टा॒नि संसृज॒ति द्वया॒नि । स्तौ॒मी॒न्द्रं नाथितो॒ जोहवीमि स॒ नो मुञ्चत्व् अंहसः ॥७॥

text: I think on Vāyu's and Savitar's holy rites, ye twain who penetrate and guard the living world: Ye who have come to be this All's pervaders, deliver us, ye two from grief and trouble.
meaning: वायोः॒ सवितु॒र् विद॒थानि मन्महे या॒व् आत्मन्व॒द् विश॒थो यौ॒ च र॒क्षथः । यौ॒ वि॒श्वस्य परिभू॒ बभूव॒थुस् तौ॒ नो मुञ्चतम् अं॒हसः ॥१॥

text: Ye who have counted up the earth's expanses, and in the sky smoothed out the air's mid-region, Whose going-forth hath ne'er been reached by any, deliver us, ye two, from grief and trouble.
meaning: य॒योः सं॒ख्याता व॒रिमा पा॒र्हिवानि या॒भ्यां र॒जो युपित॒म् अन्त॒रिक्षे । य॒योः प्रायं॒ ना॒न्व् आनशे क॒श् चन॒ तौ॒ नो मुञ्चतम् अं॒हसः ॥२॥

text: Beauteously bright! men rest in thy dominion when thou hast risen up and hastened onward. Ye, Vāyu, Savitar, preserve all creatures. Deliver us, ye, twain, from grief and trouble.
meaning: त॒व व्रते॒ नि॒ विशन्ते ज॒नासस् त्व॒य्य् उ॒दिते प्रे॒रते चित्रभानो । युवं॒ वायो सविता॒ च भु॒वनानि रक्षथस् तौ॒ नो मुञ्चतम् अं॒हसः ॥३॥

text: Hence, Vāyu, Savitar drive evil action, chase Simidā away, drive off the demons. Ye give us store of energy and power. Deliver us, ye twain, from grief and trouble.
meaning: अ॒पेतो॒ वायो सविता॒ च दुष्कृत॒म् अ॒प र॒क्षांसि शि॒मिदां च सेधतम् । सं॒ ह्य् ऊर्ज॒या सृज॒थः सं॒ ब॒लेन तौ॒ नो मुञ्चतम् अं॒हसः ॥४॥

text: Of their own selves let Savitar and Vāyu send favourable strength and wealth and plenty. Here give us perfect freedom from consumption. Deliver us, ye twain, from grief and trouble.
meaning: रयिं॒ मे पो॒षं सवितो॒त॒ वायु॒स् तनू॒ द॒क्षम् आ॒ सुवतां सुशे॒वम् । अयक्ष्म॒तातिं म॒ह इह॒ धत्तं तौ॒ नो मुञ्चतम् अं॒हसः ॥५॥

text: Ye, Savitar and Vāyu, to assist us, enjoy the hymn and the delightful cheerer. Come hither downward from the stream of blessing. Deliver us, ye twain, from grief and trouble.
meaning: प्र॒ सुमतिं॒ सवितर् वाय ऊत॒ये म॒हस्वन्तं मत्सरं॒ मादयाथः । अर्वा॒ग् वाम॒स्य प्रव॒तो नि॒ यछतं तौ॒ नो मुञ्चतम् अं॒हसः ॥६॥

text: Like noblest benisons they have stayed in the God loving man's abode. I glorify bright Savitar and Vāyu. Deliver us, ye twain, from grief and trouble.
meaning: उप॒ श्रे॒ष्ठा न आशि॒षो देव॒योर् धा॒मन्न् अस्थिरन् । स्तौ॒मि देवं॒ सविता॒रं च वायुं॒ तौ॒ नो मुञ्चन्त्व् अं॒हसः ॥७॥

text: O Heaven and Earth, I think on you, wise, givers of abundant gifts, ye who through measureless expanses have spread forth. For ye are seats and homes of goodly treasures. Deliver us, ye twain from grief and trouble.
meaning: मन्वे॒ वां द्यावापृथिवी सुभोजसौ स॒चेतसौ ये॒ अ॒प्रथेथाम् अ॒मिता यो॒जनानि । प्रतिष्ठे॒ ह्य् अ॒भवतं व॒सूनां ते॒ नो मुञ्चतम् अं॒हसः ॥१॥

text: Yea, seats and homes are ye of goodly treasures, grown strong, divine, blessed, and far-extending, To me, O Heaven and Earth, be ye auspicious. Deliver us, ye twain, from grief and trouble.
meaning: प्रतिष्ठे॒ ह्य् अ॒भवतं व॒सूनां प्र॒वृद्धे देवी सुभगे उरूची । द्या॒वापृथिवी भ॒वतं मे स्योने॒ ते॒ नो मुञ्चतम् अं॒हसः ॥२॥

text: I call on you who warm and cause no sorrow, deep, spacious, meet to be adored by poets. To me, O Heaven and Earth, be ye auspicious. Deliver us, ye twain, from grief and trouble.
meaning: असन्तापे॒ सुत॒पसौ हुवे ऽह॒म् उर्वी॒ गम्भीरे॒ कवि॒भिर् नमस्ये॑ । द्या॒वापृथिवी भ॒वतं मे स्योने॒ ते॒ नो मुञ्चतम् अं॒हसः ॥३॥

text: Ye who maintain Amrit and sacrifices, ye who support rivers and human beings, To me, O Heaven and Earth, be ye auspicious, Deliver us, ye twain, from grief and trouble.
meaning: ये॒ अमृ॒तं बिभृथो॒ ये॒ हवीं॒षि ये॒ स्रोत्या॒ बिभृथो॒ ये॒ मनुष्या॑न् । द्या॒वापृथिवी भ॒वतं मे स्योने॒ ते॒ नो मुञ्चतम् अं॒हसः ॥४॥

text: Ye by whom cows and forest trees are cherished within whose range all creatures are included, To me, O Heaven and Earth, be ye auspicious. Deliver us, ye twain, from grief and trouble.
meaning: ये॒ उस्रि॒या बिभृथो॒ ये॒ व॒नस्प॒तीन् य॒योर् वां वि॒श्वा भु॒वनान्य् अन्तः॒ । द्या॒वापृथिवी भ॒वतं मे स्योने॒ ते॒ नो मुञ्चतम् अं॒हसः ॥५॥

text: Ye who delight in nectar and in fatness, ye without whom men have no strength or power, To me, O Heaven and Earth, be ye auspicious. Deliver us, ye twain, from grief and trouble.
meaning: ये॒ कीला॒लेन तर्प॒यथो ये॒ घृते॒न या॒भ्याम् ऋते॒ न॒ किं॒ चन॒ शक्नुव॒न्ति । द्या॒वापृथिवी भ॒वतं मे स्योने॒ ते॒ नो मुञ्चतम् अं॒हसः ॥६॥

text: The grief that pains me here, whoever caused it, not sent by fate, hath sprung from human action. I, suppliant, praise Heaven, Earth, and oft invoke them. Deliver us, ye twain, from grief and trouble.
meaning: य॒न् मे॒द॒म् अभिशो॒चति ये॒नयेन वा कृतं॒ पौ॒रुषेयान् न॒ दै॒वात् । स्तौ॒मि द्या॒वापृथिवी॒ नाथितो॒ जोहवीमि ते॒ नो मुञ्चतम् अं॒हसः ॥७॥

text: I think upon the Maruts: may they bless me, may they assist me to this wealth in battle. I call them like swift well-trained steeds to help us. May they deliver us from grief and trouble.
meaning: मरु॒तां मन्वे अ॒धि मे ब्रुवन्तु प्रे॒मं॒ वा॒जं वा॒जसाते अवन्तु । आशू॒न् इव सुय॒मान् अह्व ऊत॒ये ते॒ नो मुञ्चन्त्व् अं॒हसः ॥१॥

text: Those who surround the never-failing fountain for ever, and bedew the plants with moisture, The Maruts, Prini's sons, I chiefly honour. May they deliver us from grief and trouble.
meaning: उ॒त्सम् अ॒क्षितं व्य॒चन्ति ये॒ स॒दा य॒ आसिञ्च॒न्ति र॒सम् ओ॒षधीषु । पुरो॒ दधे मरु॒तः पृ॒श्निमातृ̄ंस् ते॒ नो मुञ्चन्त्व् अं॒हसः ॥२॥

text: Bards, who invigorate the milk of milch-kine, the sap of growing plants, the speed of coursers To us may the strong Maruts be auspicious. May they deliver us from grief and trouble.
meaning: प॒यो धेनूनां॒ र॒सम् ओ॒षधीनां जव॒म् अ॒र्वतां कवयो य॒ इ॒न्वथ । शग्मा॒ भवन्तु मरु॒तो नः स्योना॒स् ते॒ नो मुञ्चन्त्व् अं॒हसः ॥३॥

text: They who raised water from the sea to heaven and send it from the sky to earth in showers, The Maruts who move mighty with their waters, may they deliver us from grief and trouble.
meaning: अपः॒ समुद्रा॒द् दि॒वम् उ॒द् वहन्ति दिव॒स् पृथिवी॒म् अभि॒ ये॒ सृज॒न्ति । ये॒ अद्भि॒र् ई॒शाना मरु॒तश् चरन्ति ते॒ नो मुञ्चन्त्व् अं॒हसः ॥४॥

text: They who delight in nectar and in fatness, they who bestow upon us health and vigour. The Maruts who rain mighty with their waters, may they deliver us from grief and trouble.
meaning: ये॒ कीला॒लेन तर्प॒यन्ति ये॒ घृते॒न ये॒ वा व॒यो मे॒दसा संसृज॒न्ति । ये॒ अद्भि॒र् ई॒शाना मरु॒तो वर्ष॒यन्ति ते॒ नो मुञ्चन्त्व् अं॒हसः ॥५॥

text: Whether with stormy might the Maruts established this All, or Gods with their celestial power, Ye, kindly Gods, are able to restore it. May they deliver us from grief and trouble.
meaning: य॒दी॒द् इदं॒ मरुतो मा॒रुतेन य॒दि देवा दै॒व्येनेदृ॒ग् आ॒र । यूय॒म् ईशिध्वे वसवस् त॒स्य नि॒ष्कृतेस् ते॒ नो मुञ्चन्त्व् अं॒हसः ॥६॥

text: Potent in battles is the Maruts' army, impetuous train, well- known, exceeding mighty. I, suppliant, praise and oft invoke the Maruts. May they deliver us from grief and trouble.
meaning: तिग्म॒म् अ॒नीकम् विदितं॒ स॒हस्वन् मा॒रुतं श॒र्धः पृ॒तनासूग्र॒म् । स्तौ॒मि मरु॒तो नाथितो॒ जोहवीमि ते॒ नो मुञ्चन्त्व् अं॒हसः ॥७॥

text: I Reverence you—mark this—Bhava and Sarva, ye under whose control is this that shineth. Lords of this world both quadruped and biped. Deliver us, ye twain, from grief and trouble.
meaning: भ॒वाशर्वौ मन्वे॒ वां त॒स्य वित्तं य॒योर् वाम् इदं॒ प्रदि॒शि य॒द् विरो॒चते । या॒व् अस्ये॒शाथे द्विप॒दो यौ॒ च॒तुष्पदस् तौ॒ नो मुञ्चतम् अं॒हसः ॥१॥

text: Lords of all near and even of what is distant, famed as the best and skilfullest of archers, Lords of this world both quadruped and biped, Deliver us, ye twain, from grief and trouble.
meaning: य॒योर् अभ्यभ्व॒ उत॒ य॒द् दूरे॒ चिद् यौ॒ विदिता॒व् इषुभृ॒ताम् अ॒सिष्ठौ । या॒व् अस्ये॒शथे द्विप॒दो यौ॒ च॒तुष्पदस् तौ॒ नो मुञ्चतम् अं॒हसः ॥२॥

text: Thousand-eyed foe-destroyers, I invoke you, still praising you the strong, of wide dominion: Lords of this world both quadruped and biped, Deliver us, ye twain, from grief and trouble.
meaning: सहस्राक्षौ॒ वृत्रह॒ना हुवेहं॒ दूरे॒गव्यूती स्तुव॒न्न् एम्य् उग्रौ॒ । या॒व् अस्ये॒शथे द्विप॒दो यौ॒ च॒तुष्पदस् तौ॒ नो मुञ्चतम् अं॒हसः ॥३॥

text: Ye who of old wrought many a deed in concert, and showed among mankind unhappy omens; Lords of this world both quadruped and biped, Deliver us, ye twain, from grief and trouble.
meaning: या॒व् आरेभा॒थे बहु॒ साक॒म् अ॒ग्रे प्र॒ चे॒द् अ॒स्राष्ट्रम् अभिभां॒ ज॒नेषु । या॒व् अस्ये॒शथे द्विप॒दो यौ॒ च॒तुष्पदस् तौ॒ नो मुञ्चतम् अं॒हसः ॥४॥

text: Ye from the stroke of whose destroying weapon not one among the Gods or men escapeth, Lords of this world both quadruped and biped, Deliver us, ye twain, from grief and trouble.
meaning: य॒योर् वधा॒न् ना॒पप॒द्यते क॒श् चना॒न्त॒र् देवे॒षूत॒ मा॒नुषेषु । या॒व् अस्ये॒शथे द्विप॒दो यौ॒ च॒तुष्पदस् तौ॒ नो मुञ्चतम् अं॒हसः ॥५॥

text: Hurl your bolt, strong Gods, at the Yātudhāna, him who makes ready roots and deals in magic: Lords of this world both quadruped and biped, Deliver us, ye twain, from grief and trouble.
meaning: यः॒ कृत्याकृ॒न् मूलकृ॒द् यातुधा॒नो नि॒ त॒स्मिन् धत्तं व॒ज्रम् उग्रौ॒ । या॒व् अस्ये॒शथे द्विप॒दो यौ॒ च॒तुष्पदस् तौ॒ नो मुञ्चतम् अं॒हसः ॥६॥

text: Comfort and aid us, ye strong Gods, in battles, at each Kimidin send your bolt of thunder. I, suppliant, praise and ever call on Bhav and Sarva. Set us free from grief and trouble.
meaning: अ॒धि नो ब्रूतं पृ॒तनासूग्रौ सं॒ व॒ज्रेण सृजतं यः॒ किमीदी॒ । स्तौ॒मि भवाशर्वौ॒ नाथितो॒ जोहवीमि तौ॒ नो मुञ्चतम् अं॒हसः ॥७॥

text: You twain, O Mitra, Varuna, I honour, Lawstrengtheners, wise, who drive away oppressors. Ye who protect the truthful in his battles, deliver us, ye twain, from grief and trouble.
meaning: मन्वे॒ वां मित्रावरुणाव् ऋतावृधौ स॒चेतसौ द्रु॒ह्वणो यौ॒ नुदे॒थे । प्र॒ सत्या॒वानम् अ॒वथो भ॒रेषु तौ॒ नो मुञ्चतम् अं॒हसः ॥१॥

text: Ye the wise Gods who drive away oppressors, ye who protect the truthful in his battles, Who come, men's guards, to juice pressed forth by Babhru,. deliver us, ye twain, from grief and trouble.
meaning: स॒चेतसौ द्रु॒ह्वणो यौ॒ नुदे॒थे प्र॒ सत्या॒वानम् अ॒वथो भ॒रेषु । यौ॒ ग॒छथो नृच॒क्षसौ बभ्रु॒णा सुतं॒ तौ॒ नो मुञ्चतम् अं॒हसः ॥२॥

text: Mitra and Varuna who help Agasti, Atri, and Angiras, and Jamadagni, Ye who help Kasyapa, who help Vasishtha, deliver us, ye twain, from grief and trouble.
meaning: या॒व् अ॒ङ्गिरसम् अ॒वथो या॒व् अग॒स्तिं मि॒त्रावरुणा जम॒दग्निम् अ॒त्त्रिम् । यौ॒ कश्य॒पम् अ॒वथो यौ॒ व॒सिष्ठं तौ॒ नो मुञ्चतम् अं॒हसः ॥३॥

text: Mitra and Varuna, who help Syāvāsva, Atri, and Purumilha, and Vadhryasva, Ye who help Vimada and Saptavadhri, deliver us, ye twain, from grief and trouble.
meaning: यौ॒ श्यावा॒श्वम् अ॒वथो वाध्र्यश्वं॒ मि॒त्रावरुणा पुरुमीढ॒म् अ॒त्त्रिम् । यौ॒ विमद॒म् अ॒वथो सप्त॒वध्रिं तौ॒ नो मुञ्चतम् अं॒हसः ॥४॥

text: Ye, Varuna, Mitra, who give aid to Kutsa, Gavishthira, Bharadvāja, Visvāmitra, Who help Kakshivan and give aid to Kanva, deliver us, ye twain, from grief and trouble.
meaning: यौ॒ भर॒द्वाजम् अ॒वथो यौ॒ ग॒विष्ठिरं विश्वा॒मित्रं वरुण मित्र कु॒त्सम् । यौ॒ कक्षी॒वन्तम् अ॒वथो प्रो॒त॒ क॒ण्वं तौ॒ नो मुञ्चतम् अं॒हसः ॥५॥

text: Ye, Mitra, Varuna, who help Trisoka, Medhātithi, and Usanā son of Kavi, Ye, Gotama's and Mudgala's protectors, deliver us, ye twain, from grief and trouble.
meaning: यौ॒ मे॒धातिथिम् अ॒वथो यौ॒ त्रिशो॒कं मि॒त्रावरुणाव् उश॒नाम् काव्यं॒ यौ॒ । यौ॒ गो॒तमम् अ॒वथो प्रो॒त॒ मु॒ग्दलं तौ॒ नो मुञ्चतम् अं॒हसः ॥६॥

text: Whose straight-reined car that keeps the track of goodness assails and ruins him who walks perversely I, suppliant, praise with constant invocation Mitra and Varuna. Save us from affliction.
meaning: य॒यो र॒थः सत्य॒वर्त्म र्जु॒रश्मिर् मिथुया॒ च॒रन्तम् अभिया॒ति दूष॒यन् । स्तौ॒मि मित्रा॒व॒रुणौ नाथितो॒ जोहवीमि तौ नो मुञ्चतम् अं॒हसः ॥७॥

text: I travel with the Rudras and the Vasus, with the Ādityas and All-Gods I wander. I hold aloft both Varuna and Mitra, I hold aloft Indra and both the Asvins.
meaning: अहं॒ रुद्रे॒भिर् व॒सुभिश् चराम्य् अह॒म् आदित्यै॒र् उत॒ विश्व॒देवैः । अहं॒ मित्रा॒व॒रुनोभा॒ बिभर्म्य् अह॒म् इन्द्राग्नी॒ अह॒म् अश्वि॒नोभा॒ ॥१॥

text: I am the Queen, the gatherer-up of treasures, most thoughtful, first of those who merit worship. The Gods, making me enter many places, in diverse spots have set mine habitation.
meaning: अहं॒ रा॒ष्ट्री संग॒मनी व॒सूनां चिकितु॒षी प्रथमा॒ यज्ञि॒यानाम् । तां॒ मा देवा॒ व्य् अ॑दधुः पुरुत्रा॒ भू॒रिस्थात्रां भू॒र्य् आवेश॒यन्तः ॥२॥

text: I, verily, myself announce and utter the word that Gods, and men alike shall welcome. I make the man I love exceeding mighty, make him a sage, a Rishi, and a Brāhman.
meaning: अह॒म् एव॒ स्वय॒म् इदं॒ वदामि जु॒ष्टं देवा॒नाम् उत॒ मा॒नुषाणाम् । यं॒ काम॒ये त॒न्तम् उग्रं॒ कृणोमि तं॒ ब्रह्मा॒णं त॒म् ऋ॒षिं तं॒ सुमेधा॒म् ॥३॥

text: Through me alone all eat the food that feeds them, each man who sees, breathes, hears, the word out-spoken. They know it not, but yet they dwell beside me. Hear, one and all, the truth as I declare it.
meaning: म॒या सो॒ ऽन्नम् अत्ति यो॒ विप॒श्यति यः॒ प्राण॒ति य॒ ईम् शृणो॒त्य् उक्त॒म् । अमन्त॒वो मां॒ त॒ उ॒प क्षियन्ति श्रुधि॒ श्रुत श्रुद्धे॒यं ते वदामि ॥४॥

text: I bend the bow for Rudra that his arrow may strike and slay the hater of devotion. I rouse and order battle for the people, and I have penetrated Earth and Heaven.
meaning: अहं॒ रुद्रा॒य ध॒नुर् आ॒ तनोमि ब्रह्मद्वि॒षे श॒रवे ह॒न्तवा॒ उ । अहं॒ ज॒नाय सम॒दं कृणोमि अह॒म् द्या॒वापृथिवी॒ आ॒ विवेश ॥५॥

text: I cherish and sustain high-swelling Soma, and Tvashtar I support, Pashan, and Bhaga. I load with wealth the zealous sacrificer who pours the juice and offers his oblation.
meaning: अहं॒ सो॒मम् आहन॒सं बिभर्म्य् अहं॒ त्व॒ष्टारम् उत॒ पूष॒णं भ॒गम् । अहं॒ दधामि द्र॒विणा हवि॒ष्मते सुप्राव्या॑ य॒जमानाय सुन्वते॒ ॥६॥

text: On the world's summit I bring forth the Father: my home is in the waters, in the ocean. Thence I extend o'er all existing creatures, and touch even yonder heaven with my forehead.
meaning: अहं॒ सुवे पित॒रम् अस्य मूर्ध॒न् म॒म यो॒निर् अप्स्व् अ॑न्तः॒ समुद्रे॒ । त॒तो वि॒ तिष्ठे भु॒वनानि वि॒श्वोता॒मूं॒ द्यां॒ वर्ष्म॒णो॒प स्पृशामि ॥७॥

text: I breathe a strong breath like the wind and tempest, the while I hold together all existence. Beyond this wide earth and beyond the heavens I have become so mighty in my grandeur.
meaning: अह॒म् एव॒ वा॒तैव प्र॒ वाम्य् आर॒भमाणा भु॒वनानि वि॒श्वा । परो॒ दिवा॒ पर॒ एना॒ पृथिव्यै॒ता॒वती महिम्ना॒ सं॒ बभूव ॥८॥

text: Borne on with thee, O Manyu girt by Maruts, let our brave men, impetuous, bursting forward, March on, like flames of fire in form, exulting, with pointed arrows, sharpening their weapons.
meaning: त्व॒या मन्यो सर॒थम् आरुज॒न्तो ह॒र्षमाणा हृषिता॒सो मरुत्वन् । तिग्मे॒षव आ॒युधा संशि॒शाना उ॒प प्र॒ यन्तु न॒रो अग्नि॒रूपाः ॥१॥

text: Flashing like fire, be thou, O conquering Manyu, invoked, O victor, as our army's leader. Slay thou our foes, distribute their possession: show forth thy vigour, scatter those who hate us.
meaning: अग्नि॒र् इव मन्यो त्विषितः॒ सहस्व सेनानी॒र् नः सहुरे हूत॒ एधि । हत्वा॒य श॒त्रून् वि॒ भजस्व वे॒द ओ॒जो मि॒मानो वि॒ मृ॒धो नुदस्व ॥२॥

text: O Manyu, overcome those who assail us. On! breaking, slaying, crushing down the foemen. They have not hindered thine impetuous vigour: mighty! sole born! reduce them to subjection.
meaning: स॒हस्व मन्यो अभि॒मातिम् अस्मै॒ रुज॒न् मृण॒न् प्रमृण॒न् प्रे॒हि श॒त्रून् । उग्रं॒ ते पा॒जो नन्व् आ॒ रुरुध्रे वशी॒ व॒शं नयासा एकज त्व॒म् ॥३॥

text: Alone of many thou art worshipped, Manyu: sharpen the spirit of each clan for combat. With thee to aid, O thou of perfect splendour, we raise the glorious battle-shout for conquest.
meaning: ए॒को बहूना॒म् असि मन्य ईडिता॒ वि॒शंविशम् युद्धा॒य सं॒ शिशाधि । अ॒कृत्तरुक् त्व॒या युजा॒ वयं॒ द्युम॒न्तं घो॒षम् विजया॒य कृण्मसि ॥४॥

text: Unyielding, bringing victory like Indra, O Manyu be thou here our sovran ruler. To thy dear name. O victor, we sing praises: we know the spring from which thou art come hither.
meaning: विजेषकृ॒द् इ॒न्द्र इवानवब्रवो॑ ऽस्मा॒कं मन्यो अधिपा॒ भवेह॒ । प्रियं॒ ते ना॒म सहुरे गृणीमसि विद्मा॒ त॒म् उ॒त्सं य॒त आबभू॒थ ॥५॥

text: Twin-borne with power, destructive bolt of thunder the highest conquering might is thine, subduer! Be friendly to us in thy spirit, Manyu! O much-invoked, in shock of mighty battle!
meaning: आ॒भूत्या सहजा॒ वज्र सायक स॒हो बिभर्षि सहभूत उ॒त्तरम् । क्र॒त्वा नो मन्यो सह॒ मेद्य् ए॑धि महाधन॒स्य पुरुहूत संसृ॒जि ॥६॥

text: For spoil let Varuna and Manyu give us the wealth of both sides gathered and collected; And let our enemies with stricken spirits, o'er-whelmed with. terror, sling away defeated.
meaning: सं॒सृष्टं ध॒नम् उभ॒यं समा॒कृतम् अस्म॒भ्यं धत्तां व॒रुणश् च मन्युः॒ । भि॒यो द॒धाना हृ॒दयेषु श॒त्रवः प॒राजितासो अ॒प नि॒ लयन्ताम् ॥७॥

text: He who hath reverenced thee, Manyu, destructive bolt! breeds. for himself forthwith all conquering energy. Arya and Dāsa will we conquer with thine aid, with thee the conqueror, with conquest conquest-sped.
meaning: य॒स् ते मन्यो॒ ऽविधद् वज्र सायक स॒ह ओ॒जः पुष्यति वि॒श्वम् आनुष॒क् । साह्या॒म दा॒सम् आ॒र्यं त्व॒या युजा॒ वयं॒ स॒हस्कृतेन स॒हसा स॒हस्वता ॥१॥

text: Manyu was Indra, yea, the God was Manyu; Manyu was Hotar Varuna, Jātavedas. The tribes of human lineage worship Manyu. Accordant, with thy fervour, Manyu! guard us.
meaning: मन्यु॒र् इ॒न्द्रो मन्यु॒र् एवा॒स देवो॒ मन्यु॒र् हो॒ता व॒रुणो जात॒वेदाः । मन्युं॒ वि॒श ईडते मा॒नुषीर् याः॒ पहि॒ नो मन्यो त॒पसा सजो॒षाः ॥२॥

text: Come hither, Manyu, mightier than the mighty: smite, with thy fervour, for ally, our foemen. Slayer of foes, of Vritra, and of Dasyu, bring thou to us all kinds of wealth and treasure.
meaning: अभी॒हि मन्यो तव॒सस् त॒वीयान् त॒पसा युजा॒ वि॒ जहि श॒त्रून् । अमित्रहा॒ वृत्रहा॒ दस्युहा॒ च वि॒श्वा व॒सून्य् आ॒ भरा त्वं॒ नः ॥३॥

text: For thou art, Manyu, of surpassing vigour, fierce, queller of the foe, and self-existent, Shared by all men, victorious, subduer: vouchsafe to us superior strength in battles.
meaning: त्वं॒ हि॒ मन्यो अभि॒भूत्योजाः स्वयंभू॒र् भा॒मो अभिमातिषाहः॒ । विश्व॒चर्षणिः स॒हुरिः स॒हीयान् अस्मा॒स्व् ओ॒जः पृ॒तनासु धेहि ॥४॥

text: I have departed still without a portion, wise God! according to thy will, the mighty. I, feeble man, was wroth with thee, O Manyu. Come in thy proper form and give us vigour.
meaning: अभागः॒ स॒न्न् अ॒प प॒रेतो अस्मि त॒व क्र॒त्वा तविष॒स्य प्रचेतः । तं॒ त्वा मन्यो अक्रतु॒र् जिहीडाहं॒ स्वा॒ तनू॒र् बलदा॒वा न ए॒हि ॥५॥

text: Come hither, I am all thine own: advancing, turn thou to me, victorious, all-bestowing. Come to me, Manyu, wielder of the thunder: bethink thee of thy friend, and slay the Dasyus.
meaning: अयं॒ ते अस्म्य् उ॒प न ए॒ह्य् अर्वा॒ङ् प्रतीचीनः॒ सहुरे विश्वदावन् । म॒न्यो वज्रिन्न् अभि॒ न आ॒ ववृत्स्व ह॒नाव द॒स्यूंर् उत॒ बोध्य् आपेः॒ ॥६॥

text: Approach, and on our right hand hold thy station, then let us slay a multitude of foemen. The best of meath I offer to support thee: may we be first to drink thereof in quiet.
meaning: अभि॒ प्रे॒हि दक्षिणतो॒ भवा नो॒ ऽधा वृत्रा॒णि जङ्घनाव भू॒रि । जुहो॒मि ते धरु॒णं म॒ध्वो अ॒ग्रम् उभा॒व् उपांशु॒ प्रथमा॒ पिबाव ॥७॥

text: Chasing our pain with splendid light, O Agni, shine thou wealth on us. His lustre flash our pain away.
meaning: अ॒प नः शो॒शुचद् अघ॒म् अ॒ग्ने शुशुग्ध्य् आ॒ रयि॒म् । अ॒प नः शो॒शुचद् अघ॒म् ॥१॥

text: For goodly fields, for pleasant homes, for wealth we sacrifice to thee. His lustre flash our pain away!
meaning: सुक्षेत्रिया॒ सुगातुया॒ वसूया॒ च यजामहे । अ॒प नः शो॒शुचद् अघ॒म् ॥२॥

text: Best praiser of all these be he, and foremost be our noble chiefs. His lustre flash our pain away!
meaning: प्र॒ य॒द् भ॒न्दिष्ठ एषां प्रा॒स्मा॒कासश् च सूर॒यः । अ॒प नः शो॒शुचद् अघ॒म् ॥३॥

text: So that thy worshipper and we, thine, Agni! in our sons may live. His lustre flash our pain away!
meaning: प्र॒ य॒त् ते अग्ने सूर॒यो जा॒येमहि प्र॒ ते वय॒म् । अ॒प नः शो॒शुचद् अघ॒म् ॥४॥

text: As ever conquering Agni's beams of splendour go to every side, His lustre flash our pain away.
meaning: प्र॒ य॒द् अग्नेः॒ स॒हस्वतो विश्व॒तो य॒न्ति भान॒वः । अ॒प नः शो॒शुचद् अघ॒म् ॥५॥

text: To every side thy face is turned, thou art triumphant everywhere. His lustre flash our pain away!
meaning: त्वं॒ हि॒ विश्वतोमुख विश्व॒तः परिभू॒र् असि । अ॒प नः शो॒शुचद् अघ॒म् ॥६॥

text: O thou whose face looks every way, bear off our foes as in a ship. His lustre flash our pain away!
meaning: द्वि॒षो नो विश्वतोमुखा॒ति नावे॒व पारय । अ॒प नः शो॒शुचद् अघ॒म् ॥७॥

text: As in a ship across the flood, transport us to felicity. His lustre flash our pain away
meaning: स॒ नः सि॒न्धुम् इव नावा॒ति पर्ष स्वस्त॒ये । अ॒प नः शो॒शुचद् अघ॒म् ॥८॥

text: The head of this is prayer, its back the Brihat, Odanas's belly is the Vāmadevya; Its face reality, its sides the metre, Vishtāri sacrifice produced from fervour.
meaning: ब्र॒ह्मास्य शीर्षं॒ बृह॒द् अस्य पृष्ठं॒ वामदेव्य॒म् उद॒रम् ओदन॒स्य । छ॒न्दांसि पक्षौ॒ मु॒खम् अस्य सत्यं॒ विष्टारी॒ जात॒स् त॒पसोऽधि यज्ञः॒ ॥१॥

text: Boneless, cleansed, purified by him who cleanseth, they go res- plendent to the world of splendour. Fire burneth not their organ of enjoyment: much pleasure have they in the world of Svarga.
meaning: अनस्थाः॒ पूताः॒ प॒वनेन शुद्धाः॒ शु॒चयः शु॒चिम् अ॒पि यन्ति लोक॒म् । नै॒षां शिश्नं॒ प्र॒ दहति जात॒वेदाः स्वर्गे॒ लोके॒ बहु॒ स्त्रै॒णम् एषाम् ॥२॥

text: Never doth want or evil fortune visit those who prepare oblation called Vishtāri. He goes unto the Gods, he dwells with Yama, he joys among Gandharvas meet for Soma.
meaning: विष्टारि॒णम् ओदनं॒ ये॒ प॒चन्ति नै॒नान् अ॒वर्तिः सचते कदा॒ चन॒ । आ॒स्ते यम॒ उ॒प याति देवा॒न्त् सं॒ गन्धर्वै॒र् मदते सोम्ये॒भिः ॥३॥

text: Yama robs not of generative vigour the men who dress oblation called Vishtāri. Borne on his car, a charioteer, he travels: endowed with wings he soars beyond the heavens.
meaning: विष्टारि॒णम् ओदन॒म् ये॒ प॒चन्ति नै॒नान् यमः॒ प॒रि मुष्णाति रे॒तः । रथी॒ ह भूत्वा॒ रथया॒न ईयते पक्षी॒ ह भूत्वा॒ति दि॒वः स॒म् एति ॥४॥

text: Strongest is this, performed, of sacrifices: he hath reached heaven who hath prepared Vishtāri. The oval-fruited lotus spreads his fibre: there bloom the nelo- phar and water-lilies. Abundant with their overflow of sweetness, these streams shall reach thee in the world of Svarga, whole lakes with lotus- blossom shall approach thee.
meaning: एष॒ यज्ञा॒नां वि॒ततो व॒हिष्ठो विष्टारि॒णं पक्त्वा॒ दि॒वम् आ॒ विवेश । आण्डी॒कं कु॒मुदं सं॒ तनोति बि॒सं शालू॒कं श॒फको मुलाली॒ । एता॒स् त्वा धा॒रा उ॒प यन्तु स॒र्वाः स्वर्गे॒ लोके॒ म॒धुमत् पि॒न्वमाना उ॒प त्वा तिष्ठन्तु पुष्करि॒णीः स॒मन्ताः ॥५॥

text: Full lakes of butter with their banks of honey, flowing with wine, and milk and curds and water Abundant with their overflow of sweetness, these streams shall reach thee in the world of Svarga, whole lakes with lotus- blossom shall approach thee.
meaning: घृत॒ह्रदा म॒धुकूलाः सु॒रोदकाः क्षीरे॒ण पूर्णा॒ उदके॒न दध्ना॒ । एता॒स् त्वा धा॒रा उ॒प यन्तु स॒र्वाः स्वर्गे॒ लोके॒ म॒धुमत् पि॒न्वमाना उ॒प त्वा तिष्ठन्तु पुष्करि॒णीः स॒मन्ताः ॥६॥

text: I give four pitchers, in four several places, filled to the brim with milk and curds and water. Abundant with their overflow of sweetness, these streams shall reach thee in the world of Svarga, whole lakes with lotus- blossom shall approach thee.
meaning: चतु॒रः कुम्भां॒श् चतुर्धा॒ ददामि क्षीरे॒ण पूर्नां॒ उदके॒न दध्ना॒ । एता॒स् त्वा धा॒रा उ॒प यन्तु स॒र्वाः स्वर्गे॒ लोके॒ म॒धुमत् पि॒न्वमाना उ॒प त्वा तिष्ठन्तु पुष्करि॒णीः स॒मन्ताः ॥७॥

text: I part this Odana among the Brāhmans, Vishtāri, conquering worlds and reaching heaven. Let me not lose it: swelling by its nature, be it my perfect Cow to grant all wishes!
meaning: इम॒म् ओदनं॒ नि॒ दधे ब्राह्मणे॒षु विष्टारि॒णं लोकजि॒तं स्वर्ग॒म् । स॒ मे मा॒ क्षेष्ट स्वध॒या पि॒न्वमानो विश्व॒रूपा धेनुः॒ कामदु॒घा मे अस्तु ॥८॥

text: Odana which Prajāpati, the firstborn of Order, dressed with fervour for the Brāhman, which guards the worlds from breaking atIthe centre,—I with this Odana will conquer Mrityu.
meaning: य॒म् ओदनं॒ प्रथमजा॒ ऋत॒स्य प्रजा॒पतिस् त॒पसा ब्रह्म॒णे॒ ऽपचत् । यो॒ लोका॒नां वि॒धृतिर् ना॒भिरे॒षात् ते॒नौदने॒ना॒ति तराणि मृत्यु॒म् ॥१॥

text: Whereby the World-Creators vanquished Mrityu, that which they found by fervour, toil and trouble, That which prayer first made ready for the Brāhman,—I with this Odana will conquer Mrityu.
meaning: ये॒ना॒तरन् भूतकृ॒तो॒ ऽति मृत्युं॒ य॒म् अन्व॒विन्दन् त॒पसा श्र॒मेण । यं॒ पपा॒च ब्रह्म॒णे ब्र॒ह्म पू॒र्वं ते॒नौदने॒ना॒ति तराणि मृत्यु॒म् ॥२॥

text: That which upholds the Earth, the all-sustainer, that which hath filled air's middle realm with moisture, Which, raised on high in grandeur, stablished heaven,—I with this Odana will conquer Mrityu.
meaning: यो॒ दाधा॒र पृथिवीं॒ विश्व॒भोजसं यो॒ अन्त॒रिक्षम् आ॒पृणाद् र॒सेन । यो॒ अ॒स्तभ्नाद् दि॒वम् ऊर्ध्वो॒ महिम्ना॒ तेनौदने॒ना॒ति तराणि मृत्यु॒म् ॥३॥

text: From which the months with thirty spokes were moulded, from which the twelve-spoked year was formed and fashioned. Which circling day and night have ne'er o'ertaken,—I with this Odana will conquer Mrityu.
meaning: य॒स्मान् मा॒सा नि॒र्मितास् त्रिंश॒दराः संवत्सरो॒ य॒स्मान् नि॒र्मितो द्वा॒दशारः । अहोरात्रा॒ यं॒ परिय॒न्तो ना॒पु॒स् ते॒नौदने॒ना॒ति तराणि मृत्यु॒म् ॥४॥

text: Which hath become breath-giver, life-bestower; to which the worlds flow full of oil and fatness, To whom belong all the refulgent regions,—I with this Odana will conquer Mrityu.
meaning: यः॒ प्राणदः॒ प्राणद॒वान् बभू॒व य॒स्मै लोका॒ घृत॒वन्तः क्ष॒रन्ति । ज्यो॒तिष्मतीः प्रदि॒शो य॒स्य स॒र्वास् ते॒नौदने॒ना॒ति तराणि मृत्यु॒म् ॥५॥

text: From which, matured, sprang Amrit into being, which hath become Gāyatris lord and ruler, In which the perfect Vedas have been treasured,—I with this Odana will conquer Mrityu,
meaning: य॒स्मात् पक्वा॒द् अमृ॒तं संबभू॒व यो॒ गायत्र्या॒ अ॒धिपतिर् बभू॒व । य॒स्मिन् वे॒दा नि॒हिता विश्व॒रूपास् ते॒नौदने॒ना॒ति तराणि मृत्यु॒म् ॥६॥

text: I drive away the hostile God-despiser: far off be those who are mine adversaries, I dress Brahmaudana that winneth all things. May the Gods hear me who believe and trust them.
meaning: अ॒व बाधे द्विष॒न्तं देवपीयुं॒ सप॒त्ना ये॒ मे॒ ऽप ते भवन्तु । ब्रह्मौदनं॒ विश्वजि॒तं पचामि शृण्व॒न्तु मे श्रद्द॒धानस्य देवाः॒ ॥७॥

text: Endowed with true strength, let the Bull, Agni Vaisvānara, burn them up. Him who would pain and injure us, him who would treat us as a foe.
meaning: ता॒न्त् सत्यौ॒जाः प्र॒ दहत्व् अग्नि॒र् वैश्वानरो॒ वृ॒षा । यो॒ नो दुरस्या॒द् दि॒प्साच् चा॒थो यो॒ नो अरातिया॒त् ॥१॥

text: Him who, unharmed, would injure us, and him who, harmed, would do us harm, I lay between the doubled fangs of Agni, of Vaisvānara.
meaning: यो॒ नो दिप्सा॒द् अ॒दिप्सतो दि॒प्सतो य॒श् च दि॒प्सति । वैश्वानर॒स्य दं॒ष्ट्रयोर् अग्ने॒र् अ॒पि दधामि त॒म् ॥२॥

text: Those who, what time the moon is dark, hunt with loud cry and answering shout, Flesh-eaters, others who would harm,—all these I overcome with might.
meaning: य॒ आगरे॒ मृग॒यन्ते प्रतिक्रोशे॒ ऽमावास्ये॑ । क्रव्या॒दो अन्या॒न् दि॒प्सतः स॒र्वांस् ता॒न्त् स॒हसा सहे ॥३॥

text: I conquer the Pisāchas with my power, and take their wealth away. All who would injure us I slay. Let mine intention have success.
meaning: स॒हे पिशाचा॒न्त् स॒हसै॒षां द्र॒विणं ददे । स॒र्वान् दुरस्यतो॒ हन्मि सं॒ म आ॒कूतिर् ऋध्यताम् ॥४॥

text: With Gods who flee with him, and match their rapid motion with the Sun, I with those animals who dwell in rivers and on hills am found.
meaning: ये॒ देवा॒स् ते॒न हा॒सन्ते सू॒र्येण मिमते जव॒म् । नदी॒षु प॒र्वतेषु ये॒ सं॒ तैः॒ पशु॒भिर् विदे ॥५॥

text: I trouble the Pisāchas as the tiger plagues men rich in kine. They, even as dogs when they have seen a lion, find no hiding- place.
meaning: त॒पनो अस्मि पिशाचा॒नां व्याघ्रो॒ गो॒मताम् इव । श्वा॒नः सिंह॒म् इव दृष्ट्वा॒ ते॒ न॒ विन्दन्ते न्य॒ञ्चनम् ॥६॥

text: Naught with Pisāchas can I do, with thieves, with roamers of the wood. Pisāchas flee and vanish from each village as I enter it.
meaning: न॒ पिशाचैः॒ सं॒ शक्नोमि न॒ स्तेनैः॒ न॒ वनर्गु॒भिः । पिशाचा॒स् त॒स्मान् नश्यन्ति य॒म् अहं॒ ग्रा॒मम् आविशे॒ ॥७॥

text: Into whatever village this mine awful power penetrates, Thence the Pisāchas flee away, and plot no further mischief there.
meaning: यं॒ ग्रा॒मम् आविश॒त इद॒म् उग्रं॒ स॒हो म॒म । पिशाचा॒स् त॒स्मान् नश्यन्ति न॒ पाप॒म् उ॒प जानते ॥८॥
