text: Those who enrage me with their prate, as flies torment an elephant, I deem unhappy creatures, like small insects troublesome to man.
meaning: ये॒ मा क्रोध॒यन्ति लपिता॒ हस्ति॒नं मश॒का इव । ता॒न् अहं॒ मन्ये दु॒र्हितान् ज॒ने अ॒ल्पशयून् इव ॥९॥

text: Destruction seize upon the man, as with a cord they hold a horse, The fool who is enraged with me! He is not rescued from the noose.
meaning: अभि॒ तं॒ नि॒रृतिर् धत्ताम् अ॒श्वम् इव अश्वाभिधा॒न्या । मल्वो॒ यो॒ म॒ह्यं क्रु॒ध्यति स॒ उ पा॒शान् न॒ मुच्यते ॥१०॥

text: With thee, O Plant, in olden time Atharvans smote and slew the fiends. Kasyapa smote with thee, with thee did Kanava and Agastya smite.
meaning: त्व॒या पू॒र्वम् अ॒थर्वाणो जघ्नू॒ र॒क्षांस्य् ओषधे । त्व॒या जघान कश्य॒पस् त्व॒या क॒ण्वो अग॒स्त्यः ॥१॥

text: With thee we scare and drive away Gandharvas and Apsarases. O Ajasringi, chase the fiends. Cause all to vanish with thy smell.
meaning: त्व॒या वय॒म् अप्सर॒सो गन्धर्वां॒स् चातयामहे । अ॒जशृङ्ग्य् अ॒ज र॒क्षः स॒र्वान् गन्धे॒न नाशय ॥२॥

text: Let the Apsarases, puffed away, go to the river, to the ford,— Guggulū, Pīlā, Naladi, Aukshagandhi, Pramandini. Ye have become attentive since the Apsarases have past away.
meaning: नदीं॒ यन्त्व् अप्सर॒सो ऽपां॒ तार॒म् अवश्वस॒म् । गुल्गुलूः॒ पी॒ला नलद्य् औ॑क्ष॒गन्धिः प्रमन्दनी॒ । त॒त् प॒रेताप्सरसः प्र॒तिबुद्धा अभूतन ॥३॥

text: Where great trees are, Asvatthas and Nyagrodhas with their leafy crests, There where your swings are green and bright, and lutes and cymbals sound in tune, 'Ye have become attentive since the Apsarases have past away.
meaning: य॒त्राश्वत्था॒ न्यग्रो॒धा महावृक्षाः॒ शिखण्डि॒नः । त॒त् प॒रेताप्सरसः प्र॒तिबुद्धा अभूतन ॥४॥

text: Hither hath come this one, the most effectual of herbs and plants.
meaning: य॒त्र वः प्रेङ्खा॒ ह॒रिता अ॒र्जुना उत॒ य॒त्राघाताः॒ कर्कर्यः॑ संव॒दन्ति । त॒त् प॒रेताप्सरसः प्र॒तिबुद्धा अभूतन ॥५॥

text: Let Ajasringi penetrate, Arā4aki with sharpened horn.
meaning: ए॒य॒म् अगन्न् ओ॒षधीनां वीरु॒धाम् वीर्या॑वती । अजशृङ्ग्य् अ॑राटकी॒ तीक्ष्णशृङ्गी॒ व्यृ॑षतु ॥६॥

text: From the Gandharva, dancing near, the lord of the Apsarases, Wearing the tuft of hair, I take all manhood and virility.
meaning: आनृ॒त्यतः शिखण्डि॒नो गन्धर्व॒स्याप्सरापतेः॒ । भिन॒द्मि मुष्का॒व् अ॒पि यामि शे॒पः ॥७॥

text: With those dread hundred iron spears, the darts of Indra, let it pierce. The Blyxa-fed Gandharvas, those who bring no sacrificial gift.
meaning: भीमा॒ इ॒न्द्रस्य हेत॒यः शतं॒ ऋष्टी॒र् अयस्म॒यीः । ता॒भिर् हविरदा॒न् गन्धर्वा॒न् अवकादा॒न् व्यृ॑षतु ॥८॥

text: With those dread hundred golden spears, the darts of Indra, let it pierce. The Blyxa-fed Gandharvas, those who bring no sacrificial gift.
meaning: भीमा॒ इ॒न्द्रस्य हेत॒यः शतं॒ ऋष्टी॒र् हिरण्य॒यीः । ता॒भिर् हविरदा॒न् गन्धर्वा॒न् अवकादा॒न् व्यृ॑षतु ॥९॥

text: O Plant, be thou victorious, crush the Pisāchas, one and all, Blyxa-fed, shining in the floods, illumining the selfish ones.
meaning: अवकादा॒न् अभिशोचा॒न् अप्सु॒ ज्योतय मामका॒न् । पिशाचा॒न्त् स॒र्वान् ओषधे प्र॒ मृणीहि स॒हस्व च ॥१०॥

text: Youthful, completely decked with hair, one monkey-like, one like a dog,— So the Gandharva, putting on a lovely look, pursues a dame. Him with an efficacious charm we scare and cause to vanish hence.
meaning: श्वे॒वै॒कः कपि॒र् इवै॒कः कुमारः॒ सर्वकेशकः॒ । प्रियो॒ दृश॒ इव भूत्वा॒ गन्धर्वः॒ सचते स्त्रि॒यस् । त॒म् इतो॒ नाशयामसि ब्र॒ह्मणा वीर्या॑वता ॥११॥

text: Your wives are the Apsarases, and ye, Gandharvas, are their lords. Run ye, immortal ones, away: forbear to interfere with men!
meaning: जाया॒ इ॒द् वो अप्सर॒सो ग॒न्धर्वाः प॒तयो युय॒म् । अ॒प धावतामर्त्या म॒र्त्यान् मा॒ सचध्वम् ॥१२॥

text: Hither I call the Apsaras, victorious, who plays with skill, Her who comes freely fort to view, who wins the stakes in games of dice.
meaning: उद्भिन्दतीं॒ संज॒यन्तीम् अप्सरां॒ साधुदेवि॒नीम् । ग्ल॒हे कृता॒नि कृण्वाना॒म् अप्सरां॒ ता॒म् इह॒ हुवे ॥१॥

text: Hither I call that Apsaras who scatters and who gathers up. The Apsaras who plays with skill and takes her winnings in the game.
meaning: विचिन्वती॒म् आकिर॒न्तीम् अप्सरां॒ साधुदेवि॒नीम् । ग्ल॒हे कृता॒नि गृह्णाना॒म् अप्सरां॒ ता॒म् इह॒ हुवे ॥२॥

text: Dancing around us with the dice, winning the wager by her play. May she obtain the stake for us and gain the victory with skill. May she approach us full of strength: let them not win this wealth of ours.
meaning: या॒यैः परिनृ॒त्यत्य् आद॒दाना कृतं॒ ग्ल॒हात् । सा॒ नः कृता॒नि सीषती॒ प्रहा॒म् आप्नोतु माय॒या । सा॒ नः प॒यस्वत्य् ऐ॒तु मा॒ नो जैषुर् इदं॒ ध॒नम् ॥३॥

text: Hither I call that Apsaras, the joyous, the delightful one— Those nymphs who revel in the dice, who suffer grief and yield to wrath.
meaning: या॒ अक्षे॒षु प्रमो॒दन्ते शु॒चं क्रो॒धं च बि॒भ्रती । आनन्दि॒नीं प्रमोदि॒नीम् अप्सरां॒ ता॒म् इह॒ हुवे ॥४॥

text: Who follow in their course the rays of Sūrya, or as a particle of light attend him. Whose leader from afar, with store of riches, compasses quickly all the worlds and guards them. Pleased, may he come to this our burnt oblation, together with the Air, enriched with treasure.
meaning: सू॒र्यस्य रश्मी॒न् अ॒नु याः॒ सञ्च॒रन्ति म॒रीचीर् वा या॒ अनुसञ्च॒रन्ति । या॒साम् ऋषभो॒ दूरतो॒ वाजि॒नीवान्त् सद्यः॒ स॒र्वान् लोका॒न् पर्ये॒ति र॒क्षन् । स॒ न ऐ॒तु हो॒मम् इमं॒ जुसाणो॑ ऽन्त॒रिक्षेण सह॒ वाजि॒नीवान् ॥५॥

text: Together with the Air, O rich in treasure, guard here the white cow and the calf, O mighty! Here are abundant drops for thee, come hither! Here is thy white calf, let thy mind be with us.
meaning: अन्त॒रिक्षेन सह॒ वाजिनीवन् कर्कीं॒ वत्सा॒म् इह॒ रक्ष वाजिन् । इमे॒ ते स्तोका॒ बहुला॒ ए॒ह्य् अर्वा॒ङ् इयं॒ ते कर्की॒ह॒ ते म॒नो ऽस्तु ॥६॥

text: Together with the Air, O rich in treasure, keep the white calf in safety here, O mighty! Here is the grass, here is the stall, here do we bind the calf. We are your masters, name by name. All Hail!
meaning: अन्त॒रिक्षेण सह॒ वाजिनीवन् कर्कीं॒ वत्सा॒म् इह॒ रक्ष वाजिन् । अयं॒ घासो॒ अयं॒ व्रज॒ इह॒ वत्सां॒ नि॒ बध्नीमः । यथानाम॒ व ईश्महे स्वा॒हा ॥७॥

text: Agni no earth kath had mine homage. May he bless me. As I have bowed me down to Agni on the earth, so let the Favouring Graces bow them down to me.
meaning: पृथिव्या॒म् अग्न॒ये स॒म् अनमन्त् स॒ आर्ध्नोत् । य॒था पृथिव्या॒म् अग्न॒ये सम॒नमन्न् एवा॒ म॒ह्यं संन॒मः सं॒ नमन्तु ॥१॥

text: Earth is the Cow, her calf is Agni. May she with her calf Agni yield me food, strength, all my wish, life first of all, and off- spring, plenty, wealth. All Hail!
meaning: पृथिवी॒ धेनु॒स् त॒स्या अग्नि॒र् वत्सः॒ । सा॒ मे ऽग्नि॒ना वत्से॒ने॒षम् ऊ॒र्जं का॒मं दुहाम् । आ॒युः प्रथमं॒ प्रजां॒ पो॒षं रयिं॒ स्वा॒हा ॥२॥

text: Vāyu in air hath had mine homage. May he bless me. As I have bowed me down to Vāyu in the air, so let the Favour- ing Graces bow them down to me.
meaning: अन्त॒रिक्षे वाय॒वे स॒म् अनमन्त् स॒ आर्ध्नोत् । य॒थान्त॒रिक्षे वाय॒वे सम॒नमन्न् एवा॒ म॒ह्यं संन॒मः सं॒ नमन्तु ॥३॥

text: Air is the Cow, her calf is Vāyu. May she with her calf Vāyu yield me food, strength, all my wish, life first of all, and off- spring, plenty, wealth. All Hail!
meaning: अन्त॒रिक्षं धेनु॒स् त॒स्या वत्सः॒ । सा॒ मे वायु॒ना वत्से॒ने॒षम् ऊ॒र्जं का॒मं दुहाम् । आ॒युः प्रथमं॒ प्रजां॒ पो॒षं रयिं॒ स्वा॒हा ॥४॥

text: The Sun in heaven hath had my homage. May he bless me. As I have bowed me down unto the Sun in heaven, so let the Favouring Graces bow them down to me.
meaning: दिव्या॑दित्या॒य स॒म् अनमन्त् स॒ आर्ध्नोत् । य॒था दिव्या॑दित्या॒य सम॒नमन्न् एवा॒ म॒ह्यं संन॒मः सं॒ नमन्तु ॥५॥

text: Heaven is the Cow, her calf Āditya. May she yield with her calf the Sun food, strength, and all my wish, life first of all, and offspring, plenty, wealth. All Hail!
meaning: द्यौ॒र् धेनु॒स् त॒स्या आदित्यो॒ वत्सः॒ । सा॒ म आदित्ये॒न वत्से॒ने॒षम् ऊ॒र्जं का॒मं दुहाम् । आ॒युः प्रथमं॒ प्रजां॒ पो॒षं रयिं॒ स्वा॒हा ॥६॥

text: To Chandra in the quarters have I bowed me. May he bless me. As unto Chandra in the quarters I have bent, so let the Favour- ing Graces bow them down to me.
meaning: दिक्षु॒ चन्द्रा॒य स॒म् अनमन्त् स॒ आर्ध्नोत् । य॒था दिक्षु॒ चन्द्रा॒य सम॒नमन्न् एवा॒ म॒ह्यं संन॒मः सं॒ नमन्तु ॥७॥

text: The quarters are the Cows, their calf is Chandra. May they yield with their calf the Moon food, strength and all my wish, life first of all, and offspring, plenty, wealth. All Hail!
meaning: दि॒शो धेन॒वस् ता॒सां चन्द्रो॒ वत्सः॒ । ता॒ मे चन्द्रे॒ण वत्से॒ने॒षम् ऊ॒र्जं का॒मं दुहाम् आ॒युः प्रथमं॒ प्रजां॒ पो॒सं रयिं॒ स्वा॒हा ॥८॥

text: Agni moves having entered into Agni, the Rishis' son, who guards from imprecations, I offer unto thee with reverent worship. Let me not mar the Gods' appointed service.
meaning: अग्ना॒व् अग्नि॒श् चरति प्र॒विष्ट ऋ॒षीणाम् पुत्रो॒ अभिशस्तिपा॒ उ । नमस्कारे॒ण न॒मसा ते जुहोमि मा॒ देवा॒नां मिथुया॒ कर्म भाग॒म् ॥९॥

text: Skilled in all ways, O God, O Jātavedas, I offer what is cleansed by heart and spirit. To all thy seven mouths, O Jātavedas. Do thou accept with pleasure my libation.
meaning: हृदा॒ पूत॒म् म॒नसा जातवेदो वि॒श्वानि देव वयु॒नानि विद्वा॒न् । सप्ता॒स्या॑नि त॒व जातवेदस् ते॒भ्यो जुहोमि स॒ जुषस्व हव्य॒म् ॥१०॥

text: O Jātavedas, eastward sacrificers, as foes assail us from the eastern quarter. May they, turned back, be pained for harming Agni. I drive them backward with mine incantation.
meaning: ये॒ पुर॒स्ताज् जु॒ह्वति जातवेदः प्रा॒च्या दिशो॒ ऽभिदा॒सन्त्य् अस्मा॒न् । अग्नि॒म् ऋत्वा॒ ते॒ प॒राञ्चो व्यथन्तां प्रत्य॒ग् एनान् प्रतिसरे॒ण हन्मि ॥१॥

text: O Jātavedas, southward sacrificers as foes assail us from the southern quarter. May they, turned back, be pained for harming Yama. I smite them backward with mine incantation.
meaning: ये॒ दक्षिणतो॒ जु॒ह्वति जातवेदो द॒क्षिणाया दिशो॒ ऽभिदा॒सन्त्य् अस्मा॒न् । यमं॒ ऋत्वा॒ ते॒ प॒राञ्चो व्यथन्तां प्रत्य॒ग् एना प्रतिसरे॒ण हन्मि ॥२॥

text: O Jātavedas, westward sacrificers as foes assail us from the western quarter. For harming Varuna be they turned and troubled! I smite them backward with mine incantation.
meaning: ये॒ पश्चा॒ज् जु॒ह्वति जातवेदः प्रती॒च्या दिशो॒ ऽभिदा॒सन्त्य् अस्मा॒न् । व॒रुणम् ऋत्वा॒ ते॒ प॒राञ्चो व्यथन्तां प्रत्य॒ग् एनान् प्रतिसरे॒ण हन्मि ॥३॥

text: Jātavedas, northward sacrificers as foes assail us from the northern quarter. For harming Soma be they turned and troubled! I smite them backward with mine incantation.
meaning: य॒ उत्तरतो॒ जु॒ह्वति जातवेद उ॒दीच्या दिशो॒ ऽभिदा॒सन्त्य् अस्मा॒न् । सो॒मम् ऋत्वा॒ ते॒ प॒राञ्चो व्यथन्तां प्रत्य॒ग् एनान् प्रतिसरे॒ण हन्मि ॥४॥

text: O Jātavedas, nether sacrificers, as foes assail us from the stead- fast quarter. For harming Earth let them be turned and troubled. I smite them backward with mine incantation.
meaning: ये॒ ऽध॒स्ताज् जु॒ह्वति जातवेद उ॒दीच्या दिशो॒ ऽभिदा॒सन्त्य् अस्मा॒न् । भू॒मिम् ऋत्वा॒ ते॒ प॒राञ्चो व्यथन्तां प्रत्य॒ग् एनान् प्रतिसरे॒ण हन्मि ॥५॥

text: Those who pay sacrifice, O Jātavedas, from air assail us from the midway quarter. For harming Vāyu be they turned and troubled! I smite them backward with mine incantation.
meaning: ये॑ ऽन्त॒रिक्षाज् जु॒ह्वति जातवेदो व्यध्वा॒या दिशो॒ ऽभिदा॒सन्त्य् अस्मा॒न् । वायु॒म् ऋत्वा॒ ते॒ प॒राञ्चो व्यथन्तां प्रत्य॒ग् एनान् प्रतिसरे॒ण हन्मि ॥६॥

text: The sacrificers from above assail us, O Jātavedas, from the lofty quarter. For wronging Sūrya be they turned and troubled! I smite them backward with mine incantation.
meaning: य॒ उप॒रिष्टाज् जु॒ह्वति जातवेद ऊर्ध्वा॒या दिशो॒ ऽभिदा॒सन्त्य् अस्मा॒न् । सू॒र्यम् ऋत्वा॒ ते॒ प॒राञ्चो व्यथन्तां प्रत्य॒ग् एनान् प्रतिसरे॒ण हन्मि ॥७॥

text: Those from all points assail us, Jātavedas, who sacrifice from intermediate regions. For wronging Prayer let them be turned and troubled, I smite them backward with mine incantation.
meaning: ये॒ दिशा॒म् अन्तर्देशे॒भ्यो जु॒ह्वति जातवेदः स॒र्वाभ्यो दिग्भ्यो॒ ऽभिदा॒सन्ति अस्मा॒न् । ब्र॒ह्म र्त्वा॒ ते॒ प॒राञ्चो व्यथन्तां प्रत्य॒ग् एनान् प्रतिसरे॒ण हन्मि ॥८॥

text: He who with special plans and deathless spirit, waxing, well- born, hath come unto his birth-place, As he who shines upholds the days, thus Trita, of pure life, bears the Three as their supporter.
meaning: ऋ॒धङ्मन्त्रो यो॒निं य॒ आबभू॒वामृ॒तासुर् व॒र्धमानः सुज॒न्मा । अ॒दब्धासुर् भ्रा॒जमानो॒ ऽहेव त्रितो॒ धर्ता॒ दाधार त्री॒णि ॥१॥

text: He who, the first, approached the holy statutes makes, after, many beauteous forms and figures. Eager to drink, his birth-place first he entered who understands the word when yet unspoken.
meaning: आ॒ यो॒ ध॒र्माणि प्रथमः॒ ससा॒द त॒तो व॒पूंषि कृणुषे पुरू॒णि । धास्यु॒र् यो॒निं प्रथम॒ आ॒ विवेशा॒ यो॒ वा॒चम् अ॒नुदितां चिके॒त ॥२॥

text: He who—the fluid gold, with radiant kinsmen—to fervent glow delivered up thy body, On him both set names, that shall live for ever: to him the regions shall send robes to clothe him,
meaning: य॒स् ते शो॒काय तन्वं॑ रिरे॒च क्ष॒रद् धि॒रण्यं शु॒चयो॒ ऽनु स्वाः॒ । अ॒त्रा दधेते अमृ॒तानि ना॒मास्मे॒ व॒स्त्राणि वि॒श ए॒रयन्ताम् ॥३॥

text: As these have gone to their primeval station, each gaining an imperishable dwelling, May kissing mothers of the bards' beloved bring the pole-draw- ing husband to the sister.
meaning: प्र॒ य॒द् एते॒ प्रतरं॒ पूर्व्यं॒ गुः॒ स॒दःसद आति॒ष्ठन्तो अजुर्य॒म् । कविः॒ शुष॒स्य मात॒रा रिहाणे॒ जाम्यै॒ धु॒र्यं प॒तिम् एरयेथाम् ॥४॥

text: By holy wisdom I a sage, Far-Strider! offer to thee this lofty adoration. This worship both the mighty eddying rivers, coming together to this station, heighten.
meaning: त॒द् ऊ षु॒ ते मह॒त् पृथुज्मन् न॒मः कविः॒ का॒व्येना कृणोमि । य॒त् सम्य॒ञ्चाव् अभिय॒न्ताव् अभि॒ क्षा॒म् अ॒त्रा मही॒ रो॒धचक्रे वावृधे॒ते ॥५॥

text: Seven are the pathways which the wise have fashioned: to one of these may come the troubled mortal. On sure ground where the ways are parted standeth Life's Pillar in the dwelling of the Highest.
meaning: सप्त॒ मर्या॒दाः कव॒यस् ततक्षुस् ता॒साम् इ॒द् ए॒काम् अभ्य् अं॑हुरो॒ गात् । आयो॒र् ह स्कम्भ॒ उपम॒स्य नीडे॒ पथां॒ विसर्गे॒ धरु॒णेषु तस्थौ ॥६॥

text: Working, I go my way with deathless spirit: life, spirit, bodies have gone gladly thither. Aye, Sakra also gives his gift of treasure as when the sacrificer meets with power.
meaning: उता॒मृ॒तासुर् व्र॒त एमि कृन्व॒न्न् अ॒सुर् आत्मा॒ तन्व॑स् त॒त् सुम॒द्गुः । उत॒ वा शक्रो॒ र॒त्नं द॒धात्य् ऊर्ज॒या वा य॒त् स॒चते हविर्दाः॒ ॥७॥

text: Yea, the son asks dominion of his father: this they declared the noblest path to welfare. Varuna, let them see thy revelations: display the wondrous shapes of times to follow.
meaning: उत॒ पुत्रः॒ पित॒रं क्षत्र॒म् ईडे ज्येष्ठं॒ मर्या॒दम् अह्वयन्त् स्वस्त॒ये । द॒र्शन् नु॒ ता॒ वरुण या॒स् ते विष्ठा॒ आव॒र्व्रततः कृणवो व॒पूंषि ॥८॥

text: Halt with the milk, its other half, thou minglest and with that half, strong! unbeguiled! increasest. Let us exalt the gracious friend, the mighty, Varuna son of- Aditi, strength-giver. We have told him the marvels sung by poets. The utterance of Heaven and Earth is truthful.
meaning: अर्ध॒म् अर्धे॒न प॒यसा पृणक्ष्य् अर्धे॒न शुष्म वर्धसे अमुर । अ॒विं वृधाम शग्मि॒यं स॒खायं व॒रुणं पुत्र॒म् अ॒दित्या इषिर॒म् । कविशस्ता॒न्य् अस्मै व॒पूंष्य् अवोचाम रो॒दसी सत्यवा॒चा ॥९॥

text: In all the worlds That was the best and highest whence sprang the Mighty One of splendid valour. As soon as born he overcomes his foemen, when those rejoice in him who bring him succour.
meaning: त॒द् इ॒द् आस भु॒वनेषु ज्ये॒ष्ठम् य॒तो यज्ञ॒ उग्र॒स् त्वेष॒नृम्णः । सद्यो॒ जज्ञानो॒ नि॒ रिणाति श॒त्रून् अ॒नु य॒द् एनं म॒दन्ति वि॒श्व ऊ॒माः ॥१॥

text: Grown mighty in his strength, with ample vigour, he as a foe strikes fear into the Dāsa, Eager to win the breathing and the breathless: All sang thy praise at banquet and oblation.
meaning: ववृधानः॒ श॒वसा भू॒र्योजाः श॒त्रुर् दासा॒य भिय॒सं दधाति । अ॒व्यनच् च व्यन॒च् च स॒स्नि सं॒ ते नवन्त प्र॒भृता म॒देषु ॥२॥

text: All concentrate on thee their mental vigour what time these, twice or thrice, are thine assistants, Blend what is sweeter than the sweet with sweetness win quickly with our meath that meath in battle.
meaning: त्वे॒ क्र॒तुम् अ॒पि पृञ्चन्ति भू॒रि द्वि॒र् य॒द् एते॒ त्रि॒र् भवन्त्य् ऊ॒माः । स्वदोः॒ स्वा॒दीयः स्वादु॒ना सृजा स॒म् अदः॒ सु॒ म॒धु म॒धुनाभि॒ योधीः ॥३॥

text: If verily in every war the sages joy and exult in thee who win- nest treasures, With mightier power, strong God, extend thy firmness: let not malevolent Kaokas harm thee.
meaning: य॒दि चिन् नु॒ त्वा ध॒ना ज॒यन्तं र॒णेरणे अनुम॒दन्ति वि॒प्राः । ओ॒जीयः शुष्मिन्त् स्थिर॒म् आ॒ तनुष्व मा॒ त्वा दभन् दुरे॒वासः कशो॒काः ॥४॥

text: Proudly we put our trust in thee in battles, when we behold great wealth the prize of combat. I with my words impel thy weapons onward, and sharpen with my prayer thy vital vigour.
meaning: त्व॒या वयं॒ शाशद्महे र॒णेषु प्रप॒श्यन्तो युधे॒न्यानि भू॒रि । चोद॒यामि त आ॒युधा व॒चोभिः सं॒ ते शिशामि ब्र॒ह्मणा व॒यांसि ॥५॥

text: Thou in that house, the highest or the lowest, which thy protec- tion guards, bestowest riches. Establish ye the ever-wandering mother, and bring full many deeds to their completion.
meaning: नि॒ त॒द् दधिषे॒ ऽवरे प॒रे च य॒स्मिन्न् आ॒विथा॒वसा दुरोणे॒ । आ॒ स्थापयत मात॒रं जिगत्नु॒म् अ॒त इन्वत क॒र्वराणि भू॒रि ॥६॥

text: Praise in the height Him who hath many pathways, courageous, strongest, Aptya of the Aptyas Through strength he shows himself of ample power: pattern of Prithivī, he fights and conquers.
meaning: स्तुष्व॒ वर्ष्मन् पुरुव॒र्त्मानं स॒म् ऋ॒भ्वाणम् इन॒तमम् आप्त॒म् आप्त्या॒नाम् । आ॒ दर्शति श॒वसा भू॒र्योजाः प्र॒ सक्षति प्रतिमा॒नं पृथिव्याः॒ ॥७॥

text: Brihaddiva, the foremost of light-winners, hath made these holy prayers, this strength for Indra. Free Lord, he rules the mighty fold of cattle, winning, aglow, even all the billowy waters.
meaning: इमा॒ ब्र॒ह्म बृह॒द्दिवः कृणवद् इ॒न्द्राय शूष॒म् अग्रियः॒ स्वर्षाः॒ । महो॒ गोत्र॒स्य क्षयति स्वरा॒जा तु॒रश् चिद् वि॒श्वम् अर्णवत् त॒पस्वान् ॥८॥

text: Thus hath Brihaddiva, the great Atharvan, spoken to Indra as himself in person. Two sisters free from stain, the Mātarivans, with power impel him onward and exalt him.
meaning: एवा॒ महा॒न् बृह॒द्दिवो अ॒थर्वा॒वोचत् स्वां॒ तन्व॑म् इ॒न्द्रम् एव॒ । स्व॒सारौ मातरि॒भ्वरी अरिप्रे॒ हिन्व॒न्ति चैने श॒वसा वर्ध॒यन्ति च ॥९॥

text: Let strength be mine while I invoke thee, Agni! enkindling thee may we support our bodies. May the four regions bend and bow before me: with thee for guardian may we win the combat.
meaning: म॒माग्ने व॒र्चो विहवे॒ष्व् अस्तु वयं॒ त्वे॒न्धानास् तन्व॑म् पुषेम । म॒ह्यं नमन्तां प्रदि॒शश् च॒तस्रस् त्व॒या॒ध्यक्षेण पृ॒तना जयेम ॥१॥

text: Baffling the range of our opponents, Agni! guard us as our protector round about us. Down the steep slope go they who hate us, backward, and let their thought who watch at home be ruined.
meaning: अ॒ग्ने मन्युं॒ प्रतिनुद॒न् प॒रेषां त्वं॒ नो गोपाः॒ प॒रि पाहि विश्व॒तः । अ॒पाञ्चो यन्तु निव॒ता दुरस्य॒वो ऽमै॒षां चित्तं॒ प्रबु॒धां वि॒ नेशत् ॥२॥

text: May all the Gods be on my side in battle, the Maruts led by Indra, Vishnu, Agni. Mine be the middle air's extended region, and may the Wind blow favouring these my wishes.
meaning: म॒म देवा॒ विहवे॒ सन्तु स॒र्व इ॒न्द्रवन्तो मरु॒तो वि॒ष्णुर् अग्निः॒ । म॒मान्त॒रिक्षम् उरु॒लोकम् अस्तु म॒ह्यं वा॒तः पवतां का॒मायास्मै॒ ॥३॥

text: For me let them present all mine oblations, and let my mind's intention be accomplished. May I be guiltless of the least transgression: may all the Gods come hither and protect me.
meaning: म॒ह्यं यजन्तां म॒म या॒नीष्टा॒कूतिः सत्या॒ म॒नसो मे अस्तु । ए॒नो मा॒ नि॒ गां कतम॒च् चनाहं॒ वि॒श्वे देवा॒ अभि॒ रक्षन्तु मेह॒ ॥४॥

text: May the Gods grant me riches, may the blessing and invocation of the Gods assist me. This boon shall the celestial Hotars win us: may we, unwound- ed, have brave heroes round us.
meaning: म॒यि देवा॒ द्र॒विणम् आ॒ यजन्तां म॒यि आशी॒र् अस्तु म॒यि देव॒हूतिः । दैवाः॒ हो॒तारः सनिषन् न एत॒द् अ॒रिष्टाः स्याम तन्वा॑ सुवी॒राः ॥५॥

text: Ye six divine Expanses, give us freedom. Here, all ye Gods, acquit yourselves like heroes. Let not calamity or curse o'ertake us, nor deeds of wickedness that merit hatred.
meaning: दै॒वीः षड् उर्वीर् उरु॒ नः कृणोत वि॒श्वे देवास इह॒ मादयध्वम् । मा॒ नो विदद् अभिभा॒ मो॒ अ॒शस्तिर् मा॒ नो विदद् वृजिना॒ द्वे॒ष्या या॒ ॥६॥

text: Do ye three Goddesses give ample shelter and all success to us ourselves and children. Let us not lose our children or our bodies: let us not benefit the foe, King Soma!
meaning: ति॒स्रो देवीर् म॒हि नः श॒र्म यछत प्रजा॒यै नस् तन्वे॑ य॒च् च पुष्ट॒म् । मा॒ हास्महि प्रज॒या मा॒ तनू॒भिर् मा॒ रधाम द्विषते॒ सोम राजन् ॥७॥

text: Foodful and much-invoked, at this our calling may the far- reaching Bull grant us wide shelter. Lord of bay coursers, Indra, bless our children: harm us not, give us not as prey to others.
meaning: उरुव्य॒चा नो महिषः॒ श॒र्म यछत्व् अस्मि॒न् ह॒वे पुरुहूतः॒ पुरुक्षु॒ । स॒ नः प्रजा॒यै हर्यश्व मृडे॒न्द्र मा॒ नो रीरिषो मा॒ प॒रा दाः ॥८॥

text: Lord of the world, Creator and Disposer, may the God Savitar who quells assailants, May the Ādityas, Rudras, both the Asvins, Gods, guard the sacrificer from destruction.
meaning: धाता॒ विधाता॒ भु॒वनस्य य॒स् प॒तिर् देवः॒ सविता॒भिमातिषाहः॒ । आदित्या॒ रुद्रा॒ अश्वि॒नोभा॒ देवाः॒ पान्तु य॒जमानं निरृथा॒त् ॥९॥

text: Let those who are our foemen stay afar from us: with Indra and with Agni we will drive them off. The Ādityas and the Rudras, over us on high, have made me strong, a thinker, and a sovran lord.
meaning: ये॒ नः सप॒त्ना अ॒प ते॒ भवन्त्व् इन्द्राग्नि॒भ्याम् अ॒व बाधामह एनान् । आदित्या॒ रुद्रा॒ उपरिस्पृ॒शो नो उग्रं॒ चेत्ता॒रम् अधिराज॒म् अक्रत ॥१०॥

text: Yea, we call Indra hitherward, the winner of wealth in battle and of kine and horses. May he mark this our worship when we call him, Lord of bay steeds, thou art our friend and comrade.
meaning: अर्वा॒ञ्चम् इ॒न्द्रम् अमु॒तो हवामहे यो॒ गोजि॒द् धनजि॒द् अश्वजि॒द् यः॒ । इमं॒ नो यज्ञं॒ विहवे॒ शृणोत्व् अस्मा॒कम् अभूर् हर्यश्व मेदी॒ ॥११॥

text: Thou who wast born on mountains, thou most mighty of all plants that grow. Thou Banisher of Fever, come, Kushtha! make Fever pass away.
meaning: यो॒ गिरि॒ष्व् अ॒जायथा वीरु॒धां ब॒लवत्तमः । कु॒ष्ठे॒हि तक्मनाशन तक्मा॒नं नाश॒यन्न् इतः॒ ॥१॥

text: Brought from the Snowy Mountain, born on the high hill where eagles breed, Men seek to buy thee when they hear: for Fever's Banisher they know.
meaning: सुपर्णसु॒वने गिरौ॒ जातं॒ हिम॒वतस् प॒रि । ध॒नैर् अभि॒ श्रुत्वा॒ यन्ति विदु॒र् हि॒ तक्मना॒शनम् ॥२॥

text: In the third heaven above us stands the Asvattha tree, the seat of Gods. There the Gods sought the Kushtha Plant, embodiment of end- less life.
meaning: अश्वत्थो॒ देवस॒दनस् तृती॒यस्याम् इतो॒ दिवि॒ । त॒त्रामृ॒तस्य च॒क्षणं देवाः॒ कु॒ष्ठम् अवन्वत ॥३॥

text: There moved through heaven a golden ship, a ship with cordage wrought of Gold. There the Gods won the Kushtha Plant, the blossom of eternal life.
meaning: हिरण्य॒यी नौ॒र् अचरद् धि॒रण्यबन्धना दिवि॒ । त॒त्रामृ॒तस्य पु॒ष्पं देवाः॒ कु॒ष्ठम् अवन्वत ॥४॥

text: They sailed on pathways paved with gold, the oars they piled were wrought of gold: All golden were the ships wherein they carried Kushtha down to earth.
meaning: हिरण्य॒याः प॒न्थान आसन्न् अ॒रित्राणि हिरण्य॒या । ना॒वो हिरण्य॒यीर् आसन् या॒भिः कु॒ष्ठं निरा॒वहन् ॥५॥

text: O Kushtha, bring thou hitherward this man of mine, restore his health, Yes, free him from disease for me.
meaning: इमं॒ मे कुष्ठ पू॒रुषं त॒म् आ॒ वह तं॒ नि॒ष् कुरु । त॒म् उ मे अगदं॒ कृधि ॥६॥

text: Thou art descended from thee Gods, Soma's benignant friend art thou, Befriend my breath and vital air be gracious unto this mine eye.
meaning: देवे॒भ्यो अ॒धि जातो॒ ऽसि सो॒मस्यासि स॒खा हितः॒ । स॒ प्राणा॒य व्याना॒य च॒क्षुषे मे अस्मै॒ मृड ॥७॥

text: Sprung, northward, from the Snowy Hill thou art conveyed to eastern men. There they deal out among themselves Kushtha's most noble qualities.
meaning: उ॒दङ् जातो॒ हिम॒वतः स॒ प्राच्यां॒ नीयसे ज॒नम् । त॒त्र कु॒ष्ठस्य ना॒मान्य् उत्तमा॒नि वि॒ भेजिरे ॥८॥

text: Most excellent, indeed, art thou, Kushtha! most noble is thy sire. Make all Consumption pass away and render Fever powerless.
meaning: उत्तमो॒ ना॒म कुष्ठस्य् उत्तमो॒ ना॒म ते पिता॒ । य॒क्ष्मं च स॒र्वं नाश॒य तक्मा॒नं चारसं॒ कृधि ॥९॥

text: Malady that affects the head, eye-weakness, bodily defect— All this let Kushtha heal and cure: aye, godlike is the vigorous power.
meaning: शीर्षामय॒म् उपहत्या॒म् अक्ष्यो॒स् तन्वो॑ र॒पः । कु॒ष्ठस् त॒त् स॒र्वं नि॒ष् करद् दै॒वं समह वृ॒ष्ण्यम् ॥१०॥

text: Aryaman is thy grandsire, Night thy mother, and the Cloud thy sire. Thy name is called Silāchi. Thou, thyself, art sister of the Gods.
meaning: रा॒त्री माता॒ न॒भः पिता॒र्यमा॒ ते पितामहः॒ । सिलाची॒ ना॒म वा॒ असि सा॒ देवा॒नाम् असि स्व॒सा ॥१॥

text: Whoever drinketh thee hath life: thou savest and protectest man. As nursing mother of mankind, thou takest all upon thy lap.
meaning: य॒स् त्वा पि॒बति जी॒वति त्रा॒यसे पु॒रुषं त्व॒म् । भर्त्री॒ हि॒ श॒श्वताम् अ॒सि ज॒नानां च न्य॒ञ्चनी ॥२॥

text: Thou clingest close to every tree, as a fond damsel clasps her love. Thy name is called The Conqueror, She who Stands Fast, The Rescuer.
meaning: वृक्षं॒वृक्षम् आ॒ रोहसि वृषण्य॒न्तीव कन्य॒ला । ज॒यन्ती प्रत्याति॒ष्ठन्ती स्प॒रणी ना॒म वा॒ असि ॥३॥

text: Whatever wound the arrow, or the staff, or violence inflicts, Thereof thou art the remedy: as such restore this man to health.
meaning: य॒द् दण्डे॒न य॒द् इ॒ष्वा य॒द् वा॒रुर् ह॒रसा कृत॒म् । त॒स्य त्व॒म् असि नि॒ष्कृतिः से॒मं॒ नि॒ष् कृधि पू॒रुषम् ॥४॥

text: Thou springest from blest Plaxa, or Asvattha, Dhava, Khadira, Parna, or blest Nyagrodha, so come thou to use, Arundhatī!
meaning: भद्रा॒त् प्लक्षा॒न् नि॒स् तिष्ठस्य् अश्वत्था॒त् खदिरा॒द् धवा॒त् । भद्रा॒न् न्यग्रो॒धात् पर्णा॒त् सा॒ न ए॒ह्य् अरुन्धति ॥५॥

text: Gold-coloured, bringing happy fate, most lovely, brilliant as the Sun, Mayst thou, O Healing! come unto the fracture: Healing is thy name.
meaning: हि॒रण्यवर्णे सु॒भगे सू॒र्यवर्णे व॒पुष्टमे । रुतं॒ गछासि निष्कृते नि॒ष्कृतिर् ना॒म वा॒ असि ॥६॥

text: Gold-coloured, bringing happy fate, odorous, hairy-bodied one, The sister of the Waters art thou, Lākshā! and thy soul is Wind.
meaning: हि॒रण्यवर्णे सु॒भगे शु॒ष्मे लो॒मशवक्षने । अपा॒म् असि स्व॒सा लाक्षे वा॒तो हात्मा॒ बभूव ते ॥७॥

text: Silāchi is thy name: thy sire, O goat-brown! is a damsel's son. Thou hast been sprinkled by the mouth of Yama's tawny- coloured horse.
meaning: सिलाची॒ ना॒म कानीनो॒ ऽजबभ्रु पिता॒ त॒व । अ॒श्वो यम॒स्य यः॒ श्याव॒स् त॒स्य हास्ना॒स्य् उक्षिता॒ ॥८॥

text: Issuing from the horse's blood away she glided to the trees. Become a winged water-brook, and come to us, Arundhatī!
meaning: अ॒श्वस्यास्नः॒ सं॒पतिता सा॒ वृक्षां॒ अभि॒ सिष्यदे । सरा॒ पतत्रिणी भूत्वा॒ सा॒ न ए॒ह्य् अरुन्धति ॥९॥

text: Eastward at first the prayer was generated: Vena disclosed bright flashes from the summit, Disclosed his deepest nearest revelations, womb of the non- existent and existent.
meaning: ब्र॒ह्म जज्ञानं॒ प्रथमं॒ पुर॒स्ताद् वि॒ सीमतः॒ सुरु॒चो वेन॒ आवः । स॒ बुध्न्या॑ उपमा॒ अस्य विष्ठाः॒ सत॒श् च यो॒निम् अ॒सतश् च वि॒ वः ॥१॥

text: None have attained to those of old, those who wrought holy acts for you, Let them not harm our heroes here. Therefore I set before you this.
meaning: अ॒नाप्ता ये॒ वः प्रथमा॒ या॒नि क॒र्माणि चक्रिरे॒ । वीरा॒न् नो अ॒त्र मा॒ दभन् त॒द् व एत॒त् पुरो॒ दधे ॥२॥

text: Sweet-tongued, exhaustless, they have sent their voices down together in heaven's vault that pours a thousand streams. His wildly-restless warders never close an eye: in every place the snarers stand to bind men fast.
meaning: सह॒स्रधार एव॒ ते स॒म् अस्वरन् दिवो॒ ना॒के म॒धुजिह्वा असश्च॒तः । त॒स्य स्प॒शो न॒ नि मिषन्ति भू॒र्णयः पदे॒पदे पाशि॒नः सन्ति से॒तवे ॥३॥

text: Speed forward, conquering all foes, to win the spoil, Thou comest on thy haters with a surging sea. Thy name is Fragile. The thirteenth month is Indra's home.
meaning: प॒र्य् ऊ षु॒ प्र॒ धन्वा वा॒जसातये प॒रि वृत्रा॒णि सक्ष॒णिः । द्विष॒स् त॒द् अ॒ध्य् अर्णवे॒नेयसे सनिस्रसो॒ ना॒मासि त्रयोदशो॒ मा॒स इ॒न्द्रस्य गृहः॒ ॥४॥

text: Through this now hast thou sent thy gifts. All hail! With sharpened arms and missiles, kind and friendly, be gracious unto us, Soma and Rudra!
meaning: न्व् ए॑ते॒नारात्सीर् असौ स्वा॒हा । तिग्मा॒युधौ तिग्म॒हेती सुशे॒वौ सो॒मारुद्राव् इह॒ सु॒ मृडतं नः ॥५॥

text: Through this hast thou been left in want. All hail! With sharpened arms and missiles, kind and friendly, be gracious unto us, Soma and Rudra!
meaning: अ॒वैते॒नारात्सीर् असौ स्वा॒हा । तिग्मा॒युधौ तिग्म॒हेती सुशे॒वौ सो॒मारुद्राव् इह॒ सु॒ मृडतं नः ॥६॥

text: Through this hast thou committed faults. All hail! With sharpened arms and missiles, kind and friendly, be gracious unto us, Soma and Rudra!
meaning: अ॒पैते॒नारात्सीर् असौ स्वा॒हा । तिग्मा॒युधौ तिग्म॒हेती सुशे॒वौ सो॒मारुद्राव् इह॒ सु॒ मृडतं नः ॥७॥

text: Free us from trouble, free us from dishonour, accept our wor- ship, give us life immortal.
meaning: मुमुक्त॒म् अस्मा॒न् दुरिता॒द् अवद्या॒ज् जुषे॒थाम् यज्ञ॒म् अमृ॒तम् अस्मा॒सु धत्तम् ॥८॥

text: O missile of the eye, missile of spirit, thou missile of devotion and of fervour! Thou art the weapon shot against the weapon. Let those be weaponless who sin against us.
meaning: च॒क्षुषो हेते म॒नसो हेते ब्र॒ह्मणो हेते त॒पसश् च हेते । मेन्या॒ मेनि॒र् अस्य् अमेन॒यस् ते॒ सन्तु ये॒ ऽस्मां॒ अभ्यघाय॒न्ति ॥९॥

text: Make with thy weapon weaponless, O Agni, all wicked men who deal with us as foemen with eye, with thought, with spirit, or intention.
meaning: यो॑ ऽस्मां॒श् च॒क्षुषा म॒नसा चि॒त्त्या॒कूत्या च यो॒ अघायु॒र् अभिदा॒सात् । त्वं॒ ता॒न् अग्ने मेन्या॒मेनी॒न् कृणु स्वा॒हा ॥१०॥

text: Thou art the house of Indra. I betake me to thee, I enter thee with all my cattle, With all my people and with all my body, with all my soul, with mine entire possessions.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रस्य गृहो॒ ऽसि । तं॒ त्वा प्र॒ पद्ये तं॒ त्वा प्र॒ विशामि स॒र्वगुः स॒र्वपूरुषः स॒र्वात्मा स॒र्वतनूः सह॒ य॒न् मे॒ ऽस्ति ते॒न ॥११॥

text: Thou art the guard of Indra. I betake me to thee, etc.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रस्य श॒र्मासि । तं॒ त्वा प्र॒ पद्ये तं॒ त्वा प्र॒ विशामि स॒र्वगुः स॒र्वपूरुषः स॒र्वात्मा स॒र्वतनूः सह॒ य॒न् मे॒ ऽस्ति ते॒न ॥१२॥

text: Thou art the shield of Indra. I betake me to thee, etc.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रस्य व॒र्मासि । तं॒ त्वा प्र॒ पद्ये तं॒ त्वा प्र॒ विशामि स॒र्वगुः स॒र्वपूरुषः स॒र्वात्मा स॒र्वतनूः सह॒ य॒न् मे॒ ऽस्ति ते॒न ॥१३॥

text: Indra's protection art thou. I betake me to thee, I enter thee with all my cattle. With all my people and with all my body, with all my soul, with mine entire possessions.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रस्य व॒रूथम् असि । तं॒ त्वा प्र॒ पद्ये तं॒ त्वा प्र॒ विशामि स॒र्वगुः स॒र्वपूरुषः स॒र्वात्मा स॒र्वतनूः सह॒ य॒न् मे॒ ऽस्ति ते॒न ॥१४॥

text: Bring thou to us, bar not the way, Arāti! Stay not the guerdon that is being brought us. Homage be paid to Failure, to Misfortune, and Malignity.
meaning: आ॒ नो भर मा॒ प॒रि ष्ठा अराते मा॒ नो रक्षीर् द॒क्षिणां नीय॒मानाम् । न॒मो वीर्त्सा॒या अ॒समृद्धये न॒मो अस्त्व् अ॒रातये ॥१॥

text: The man whom thou preferrest, O Arāti, he who prates to us— This man of thine, we reverence. Baffle not thou my heart's desire,
meaning: य॒म् अराते पुरोधत्से॒ पु॒रुषं परिरापि॒णम् । न॒मस् ते त॒स्मै कृण्मो मा॒ वनिं॒ व्यथयीर् म॒म ॥२॥

text: May our desire which Gods have roused fulfil itself by day and night. We seek to win Arāti: to Arāti be our homage paid.
meaning: प्र॒ णो वनि॒र् देव॒कृता दि॒वा न॒क्तं च कल्पताम् । अ॒रातिम् अनुप्रे॒मो वयं॒ न॒मो अस्त्व् अ॒रातये ॥३॥

text: We, suppliant, call on Bhaga, on Sarasvati, Anumati, Pleasant words have I spoken, sweet as honey is, at invocations of the Gods.
meaning: स॒रस्वतीम् अ॒नुमतिं भ॒गं य॒न्तो हवामहे । वा॒चम् जुष्टां॒ म॒धुमतीम् अवादिषं देवा॒नां देव॒हूतिषु ॥४॥

text: The portion that I crave with speech intelligent and full of power, May faith, presented with the gift of tawny Soma, find to-day.
meaning: यं॒ या॒चाम्य् अहं॒ वाचा॒ स॒रस्वत्या मनोयु॒जा । श्रद्धा॒ त॒म् अद्य॒ विन्दतु दत्ता॒ सो॒मेन बभ्रु॒णा ॥५॥

text: Do not thou make our words or wishes fruitless. Let the twain Indra Agni, bring us treasures. All, fain to-day to give us gifts, welcome Arāti with your love.
meaning: मा॒ वनिं॒ मा॒ वा॒चं नो वी॒र्त्सीर् उभा॒व् इन्द्राग्नी॒ आ॒ भरतां नो व॒सूनि । स॒र्वे नो अद्य॒ दि॒त्सन्तो॒ ऽरातिं प्र॒ति हर्यत ॥६॥

text: Misfortune! go thou far away: we turn thy harmful dart aside. I know thee well, Arāti! as oppressor, one who penetrates.
meaning: परो॒ ऽपेह्य् असमृद्धे वि॒ ते हेतिं॒ नयामसि । वे॒द त्वाहं॒ निमी॒वन्तीं नितुद॒न्तीम् अराते ॥७॥

text: Oft, coming as a naked girl thou hauntest people in their sleep, Baffling the thought, Arāti! and the firm intention of a man.
meaning: उत॒ नग्ना॒ बो॒भुवती स्वप्नया॒ सचसे ज॒नम् । अ॒राते चित्तं॒ वी॒र्त्सन्त्य् आ॒कूतिं पु॒रुषस्य च ॥८॥

text: To her the mighty vast in size, who penetrates all points of space, To her mine homage have I paid, Nirriti with her golden hair.
meaning: या॒ महती॒ महो॒न्माना वि॒श्वा आ॒शा व्यानशे॒ । त॒स्यै हिरण्यकेश्यै॒ नि॒रृत्या अकरं न॒मः ॥९॥

text: Auspicious, with her golden hue, pillowed on gold, the mighty one To this Arāti clad in robes of gold mine homage have I paid.
meaning: हि॒रण्यवर्णा सुभ॒गा हि॒रण्यकशिपुर् मही॒ । त॒स्यै हि॒रण्यद्रापये॒ ऽरात्या अकरं न॒मः ॥१०॥

text: With fuel of Vikankata bring molten butter to the Gods. O Agni, make them joyful here: let them all come unto my call.
meaning: वैकङ्कते॒नेध्मे॒न देवे॒भ्य आ॒ज्यं वह । अ॒ग्ने तां॒ इह॒ मादय स॒र्व आ॒ यन्तु मे ह॒वम् ॥१॥

text: O Indra, come unto my call, This will I do. So hear it thou. Let these exertions for the sake of Indra guide my wish aright. Therewith, O Jātavedas, Lord of Bodies! may we win us strength.
meaning: इन्द्रा॒ याहि मे ह॒वम् इदं॒ करिष्यामि त॒च् छृणु । इम॒ ऐन्द्रा॒ अतिसरा॒ आ॒कूतिं सं॒ नमन्तु मे । ते॒भिः शकेम वीर्यं॑ जा॒तवेदस् त॒नूवशिन् ॥२॥

text: Whatever plot from yonder, O ye Gods, that godless man would frame, Let not the Gods come to his call, nor Agni bear his offering up. Come, ye, come hither to my call.
meaning: य॒द् असा॒व् अमु॒तो देवा अदेवः॒ सं॒श्चि॒कीर्षति । मा॒ त॒स्याग्नि॒र् हव्यं॒ वाक्षीद् ध॒वं देवा॒ अस्य मो॒प गु॒र् म॒मैव॒ ह॒वम् ए॒तन ॥३॥

text: Run, ye Fxertions, farther on By Indra's order smite and slay. As a wolf worrieth a sheep, so let not him escape from you while life remains. Stop fast his breath.
meaning: अ॒ति धावतातिसरा इ॒न्द्रस्य व॒चसा हत । अ॒विं वृ॒क इव मथ्नीत स॒ वो जी॒वन् मा॒ मोचि प्राण॒म् अस्या॒पि नह्यत ॥४॥

text: The Brāhman whom those yonder have appointed priest, for injury, He, Indra! is beneath thy feet. I cast him to the God of Death.
meaning: य॒म् अमी॒ पुरोदधिरे॒ ब्रह्मा॒णम् अ॒पभूतये । इ॒न्द्र स॒ ते अधस्पदं॒ तं॒ प्र॒त्य् अस्यामि मृत्य॒वे ॥५॥

text: If they have issued forth, strongholds of Gods, and made their shield of prayer, Gaining protection for their lives, protection round about, make all their instigation powerless.
meaning: य॒दि प्रेयु॒र् देवपुरा॒ ब्र॒ह्म व॒र्माणि चक्रिरे॒ । तनूपा॒नं परिपा॒णं कृण्वाना॒ य॒द् उपोचिरे॒ स॒र्वं त॒द् अरसं॒ कृधि ॥६॥

text: Exertions which that man hath made, Exertions which he yet will make Turn them, O Indra, back again, O Vritra-slayer, back again on him that they may kill that man.
meaning: या॒न् असा॒व् अतिसरां॒श् चका॒र कृण॒वच् च या॒न् । त्वं॒ ता॒न् इन्द्र वृत्रहन् प्रती॒चः पु॒नर् आ॒ कृधि य॒थामुं॒ तृण॒हां ज॒नम् ॥७॥

text: As Indra, having seized him, set his foot upon Udvāchana, Even so for all the coming years I cast those men beneath my feet.
meaning: य॒थे॒न्द्र उद्वा॒चनं लब्ध्वा॒ चक्रे॒ अधस्पद॒म् । कृण्वे॒ ऽह॒म् अ॒धरान् त॒था अमू॒ञ् छश्वती॒भ्यः स॒माभ्यः ॥८॥

text: Here, Indra Vritra-slayer, in thy strength pierce thou their vital. parts. Here, even here, attack them, O Indra. Thine own dear friend am I. Indra, we closely cling to thee. May we be in thy favouring grace.
meaning: अ॒त्रैनान् इन्द्र वृत्रहन्न् उग्रो॒ म॒र्मणि विध्य । अ॒त्रैवै॒नान् अभि॒ तिष्ठे॒न्द्र मेद्य् अ॑हं॒ त॒व । अ॒नु त्वेन्द्रा॒ रभामहे स्या॒म सुमतौ॒ त॒व ॥९॥

text: All hail to Heaven!
All hail to Earth!
All hail to Air!
meaning: अन्त॒रिक्षाय स्वा॒हा ॥३॥

text: All hail to Air!
meaning: अन्त॒रिक्षाय स्वा॒हा ॥४॥

text: All hail to Heaven!
All hail to Eartht!
Mine eye is Sīirya and my breath is Vāta, Air is my soul and Prithivī my body. I verily who never have been conquered give up my life toe Heaven and Earth for keeping.
meaning: सू॒र्यो मे च॒क्षुर् वा॒तः प्राणो॒ ऽन्त॒रिक्षम् आत्मा॒ पृथिवी॒ श॒रीरम् । अस्तृतो॒ ना॒माह॒म् अय॒म् अस्मि स॒ आत्मा॒नं नि॒ दधे द्या॒वापृथिवी॒भ्यां गोपीथा॒य ॥७॥

text: Exalt my life, my strength, my deed and action; increase my understanding and my vigour. Be ye my powerful keepers, watch and guard me, ye mistresses of life and life's creators! Dwell ye within me, and forbear to harm me.
meaning: उ॒द् आ॒युर् उ॒द् ब॒लम् उ॒त् कृत॒म् उ॒त् कृत्या॒म् उ॒न् मनीषा॒म् उ॒द् इन्द्रिय॒म् । आ॒युष्कृद् आ॒युष्पत्नी स्व॒धावन्तौ गोपा॒ मे स्तं गोपाय॒तं मा । आत्मस॒दौ मे स्तं मा॒ मा हिंसिष्टम् ॥८॥

text: Thou art my wall of stone against the sinner who fights against me from the eastern quarter. May he encounter it!
meaning: अश्मवर्म॒ मे ऽसि यो॒ मा प्रा॒च्या दिशो॒ ऽघायु॒र् अभिदा॒सात् । एत॒त् स॒ ऋछात् ॥१॥

text: Thou art my wall of stone against the sinner who fights against me from the southern quarter. May he encounter it!
meaning: अश्मवर्म॒ मे ऽसि यो॒ मा द॒क्षिणाया दिशो॒ ऽघायु॒र् अभिदा॒सात् । एत॒त् स॒ ऋछात् ॥२॥

text: Thou art my wall of stone against the sinner who fights against me from the western quarter. May he encounter it!
meaning: अश्मवर्म॒ मे ऽसि यो॒ मा प्रती॒च्या दिशो॒ ऽघायु॒र् अभिदा॒सात् । एत॒त् स॒ ऋछात् ॥३॥

text: Thou art my wall of stone against the sinner who fights against me from northern quarter. May he encounter it!
meaning: अश्मवर्म॒ मे ऽसि यो॒ मो॒दीच्या दिशो॒ ऽघायु॒र् अभिदा॒सात् । एत॒त् स॒ ऋछात् ॥४॥

text: Thou art my wall of stone against the sinner who fights against me from the stedfast region. May he encounter it!
meaning: अश्मवर्म॒ मे ऽसि यो॒ मा ध्रुवा॒या दिशो॒ ऽघायु॒र् अभिदा॒सात् । एत॒त् स॒ ऋछात् ॥५॥

text: Thou art my wall of stone against the sinner who fights against Lme from the lofty region! M iy he encounter it!
meaning: अश्मवर्म॒ मे ऽसि यो॒ मोर्ध्वा॒या दिशो॒ ऽघायु॒र् अभिदा॒सात् । एत॒त् स॒ ऋछात् ॥६॥

text: Thou art my wall of stone against the sinner who from points intermediate fights against me. May he encounter it!
meaning: अश्मवर्म॒ मे ऽसि यो॒ मा दिशा॒म् अन्तर्देशे॒भ्यो ऽघायु॒र् अभिदा॒सात् । एत॒त् स॒ ऋछात् ॥७॥

text: With Brihat I invoke the mind, with Mātarisvan both the breaths, The eye from Sūrya, and the ear from Air, the body from the Earth. We, with Sarasvati who suits the mind, call Speech to come to us.
meaning: बृहता॒ म॒न उ॒प ह्वये मातरि॒श्वना प्राणापानौ॒ । सू॒र्याच् च॒क्षुर् अन्त॒रिक्षाच् छ्रो॒त्रं पृथिव्याः॒ श॒रीरम् । स॒रस्वत्या वा॒चम् उ॒प ह्वयामहे मनोयु॒जा ॥८॥

text: How, terrible in might, hast thou here spoken to the great God, how to the gold-hued Father! Thy mind watched, greedy Varuna! to recover the brindled cow thou hadst bestowed as guerdon.
meaning: कथं॒ महे॒ अ॒सुरायाब्रवीर् इह॒ कथं॒ पित्रे॒ ह॒रये त्वेष॒नृम्णः । पृ॒श्निं वरुण द॒क्षिणां ददावा॒न् पु॒नर्मघ त्वं॒ म॒नसाचिकित्सीः ॥१॥

text: Not through desire do I revoke my present: I bring this brind- led cow to contemplate her. Now by what lore, by what inherent nature, knowest thou all things that exist, Atharvan?
meaning: न॒ का॒मेन पु॒नर्मघो भवामि सं॒ चक्षे कं॒ पृ॒श्निम् एता॒म् उ॒पाजे । के॒न नु॒ त्व॒म् अथर्वन् का॒व्येन के॒न जाते॒नासि जात॒वेदाः ॥२॥

text: Truly I am profound in wisdom, truly I know by nature all existing creatures. No Dāsa by his greatness, not an Arya, may violate the law that I will stablish.
meaning: सत्य॒म् अहं॒ गभीरः॒ का॒व्येन सत्यं॒ जाते॒नास्मि जात॒वेदाः । न॒ मे दासो॒ ना॒र्यो महित्वा॒ व्रतं॒ मीमाय य॒द् अहं॒ धरिष्ये॒ ॥३॥

text: None, self-dependent Varuna! existeth wiser than thou or sager by his wisdom. Thou knowest well all these created beings: even the man of wondrous powers fears thee.
meaning: न॒ त्व॒द् अन्यः॒ कवि॒तरो न॒ मेध॒या धी॒रतरो वरुण स्वधावन् । त्वं॒ ता॒ वि॒श्वा भु॒वनानि वेत्थ स॒ चिन् नु॒ त्व॒ज् ज॒नो मायी॒ बिभाय ॥४॥

text: O self-dependent Varuna, wise director, thou knowest verily all generations. What is, unerring one! beyond this region? What more remote than that which is most distant?
meaning: त्वं॒ ह्य् अ॑ङ्ग॒ वरुण स्वधावन् वि॒श्वा वे॒त्थ ज॒निम सुप्रणीते । किं॒ र॒जस एना॒ परो॒ अन्य॒द् अस्त्य् एना॒ किं॒ प॒रेणा॒वरम् अमुर ॥५॥

text: One thing there is beyond this air, and something beyond that one, most hard to reach, remotest. I, Varuna, who know, to thee declare it. Let churls be mighty in the lower regions. Let Dāsas sink into the earth beneath them.
meaning: ए॒कं र॒जस एना॒ परो॒ अन्य॒द् अ॒स्त्य् एना॒ पर॒ ए॒केन दुर्ण॒शं चिद् अर्वा॒क् । त॒त् ते विद्वा॒न् वरुण प्र॒ ब्रवीम्य् अधो॒वचसः पण॒यो भवन्तु नीचै॒र् दासा॒ उ॒प सर्पन्तु भू॒मिम् ॥६॥

text: Many reproaches, Varuna, dost thou utter against the misers. who revoke their presents. Be not thou added to that crowd of niggards: let not men call thee an illiberal giver.
meaning: त्वं॒ ह्य् अ॑ङ्ग॒ वरुण ब्र॒वीषि पु॒नर्मघेष्व् अवद्या॒नि भू॒रि । मो॒ षु॒ पणीं॒र् अभ्य् एता॒वतो भून् मा॒ त्वा वोचन्न् अराध॒सं ज॒नासः ॥७॥

text: Let not men call me an illiberal giver. I give thee back the brindled cow, O singer. Attend in every place where men inhabit, with all thy powers, the hymn that tells my praises.
meaning: मा॒ मा वोचन्न् अराध॒सं ज॒नासः पु॒नस् ते पृ॒श्निं जरितर् ददामि । स्तोत्रं॒ मे वि॒श्वम् आ॒ याहि श॒चीभिर् अन्त॒र् वि॒श्वासु मा॒नुषीषु दिक्षु॒ ॥८॥

text: Let hymns of praise ascend to thee, uplifted in every place of human habitation. But give me now the gift thou hast not given. Thou art my friend for ever firm and faithful.
meaning: आ॒ ते स्तोत्रा॒ण्य् उ॒द्यतानि यन्त्व् अन्त॒र् वि॒श्वासु मा॒नुषीषु दिक्षु॒ । देहि॒ नु॒ मे य॒न् मे अ॒दत्तो अ॒सि यु॒ज्यो मे सप्त॒पदः स॒खासि ॥९॥

text: One origin, Varuna! one bond unites us I know the nature of that common kinship. I give thee now the gift that I retracted. I am thy friend for ever firm and faithful.
meaning: समा॒ नौ ब॒न्धुर् वरुण समा॒ जा॒ वे॒दाहं॒ त॒द् य॒न् नाव् एषा॒ समा॒ जा॒ । द॒दामि त॒द् य॒त् ते अ॒दत्तो अ॒स्मि यु॒ज्यस् ते सप्त॒पदः स॒खास्मि ॥१०॥

text: God, giving life unto the god who lauds me, Sage strengthener of the sage who sings my praises. Thou, self-dependent Varuna! hast begotten the kinsman of the Gods, our sire Atharvan. On him bestow most highly-lauded riches. Thou art our friend, high over all, our kinsman.
meaning: देवो॒ देवा॒य गृणते॒ वयोधा॒ वि॒प्रो वि॒प्राय स्तुवते॒ सुमेधाः॒ । अ॒जीजनो हि॒ वरुण स्वधावन्न् अ॒थर्वाणं पित॒रं देव॒बन्धुम् । त॒स्मा उ रा॒धः कृणुहि सुप्रशस्तं॒ स॒खा नो असि परमं॒ च ब॒न्धुः ॥११॥

text: Thou in the house of man this day enkindled worshippest Gods as God, O Jātavedas. Observant, bright as Mitra, bring them hither. Thou art a sapient and foreknowing envoy.
meaning: स॒मिद्धो अद्य॒ म॒नुषो दुरोणे॒ देवो॒ देवा॒न् यजसि जातवेदः । आ॒ च व॒ह मित्रमहश् चिकित्वा॒न् त्वं॒ दूतः॒ कवि॒र् असि प्र॒चेताः ॥१॥

text: Tanùnapāt, fair-tongued! with sweet meath balming the baths and ways of Order, make them pleasant. Bear to the Gods our sacrifice, exalting with holy thoughts our hymns of praise and worship.
meaning: त॒नूनपात् पथ॒ ऋत॒स्य या॒नान् म॒ध्वा समञ्ज॒न्त् स्वदया सुजिह्व । म॒न्मानि धीभि॒र् उत॒ यज्ञ॒म् ऋन्ध॒न् देवत्रा॒ च कृणुह्य् अध्वर॒म् नः ॥२॥

text: Invoked, deserving prayer and adoration, O Agni, come accor dant with the Vasus. Thou art, O youthful Lord, the Gods' Invoker, so, best of sacri- ficers, bring them quickly.
meaning: आजु॒ह्वान ई॒ड्यो ब॒न्द्यश् चा॒ याह्य् अग्ने व॒सुभिः सजो॒षाः । त्वं॒ देवा॒नाम् असि यह्व हो॒ता स॒ एनान् यक्षीषितो॒ य॒जीयान् ॥३॥

text: By rule the Sacred Grass is scattered eastward, a robe to clothe this earth when dawns are breaking. Widely it spreads around and far extended, fair for the Gods and bringing peace and freedom,
meaning: प्राची॒नं बर्हिः॒ प्रदि॒शा पृथिव्या॒ व॒स्तोर् अस्या॒ वृज्यते अ॒ग्रे अ॒ह्नाम् । व्य् उ॑ प्रथते वितरं॒ व॒रीयो देवे॒भ्यो अ॒दितये स्योन॒म् ॥४॥

text: Let the expansive Doors be widely opened, like wives who deck their beauty for their husbands. Lofty, celestial, all-impelling Portals, admit the Gods and give them easy entrance!
meaning: व्य॒चस्वतीर् उर्विया॒ वि॒ श्रयन्तां प॒तिभ्यो न॒ ज॒नयः शु॒म्भमानाः । दे॒वीर् द्वारो बृहती॒र् विश्वमिन्वा देवे॒भ्यो भवत सुप्रायणाः॒ ॥५॥

text: Pouring sweet dews let holy Night and Morning, each close to each, be seated at their station,— Lofty, celestial Dames with gold to deck them, assuming all their fair and radiant beauty.
meaning: आ॒ सुष्व॒यन्ती यजते॒ उपा॒के उषा॒सान॒क्ता सदतां नि॒ यो॒नौ । दिव्ये॒ यो॒षणे बृहती॒ सुरुक्मे॒ अ॒धि श्रि॒यं शुक्रपि॒शं द॒धाने ॥६॥

text: Come the first two celestial sweet-voiced Hotars, arranging sacrifice for man to worship, As singers who inspire us in assemblies, showing the eastern light with their direction!
meaning: दै॒व्या हो॒तारा प्रथमा॒ सुवा॒चा मि॒माना यज्ञं॒ म॒नुषो य॒जध्यै । प्रचोद॒यन्ता विद॒थेषु कारू॒ प्राची॒नं ज्यो॒तिः प्रदि॒शा दिश॒न्ता ॥७॥

text: Let Bhārati come quickly to our worship and Ilā showing like a human being. So let Sarasvati and both her fellows, deft Goddesses, on this fair grass be seated.
meaning: आ॒ नो यज्ञं॒ भा॒रती तू॒यम् एत्व् इ॒डा मनुष्व॒द् इह॒ चेत॒यन्ती । तिस्रो॒ देवी॒र् बर्हि॒र् ए॒दं॒ स्योनं॒ स॒रस्वतीः स्व॒पसः सदन्ताम् ॥८॥

text: Hotar more skilled in sacrifice, bring hither with speed to-day God Tvashar, thou who knowest, Even him who formed these two, the Earth and Heaven, the Parents, with their forms, and every creature.
meaning: य॒ इमे॒ द्या॒वापृथिवी॒ ज॒नित्री रूपै॒र् अ॒पिंशद् भु॒वनानि वि॒श्वा । त॒म् अद्य॒ होतर् इषितो॒ य॒जीयान् देवं॒ त्व॒ष्टारम् इह॒ यक्षि विद्वा॒न् ॥९॥

text: Bring thou to our oblations which thou balmest the companies of Gods in ordered season. Agni, Vanaspati, the Immolator sweeten our offered gifts with meath and butter!
meaning: उपा॒वसृज त्म॒न्या समञ्ज॒न् देवा॒नां पा॒थ ऋतुथा॒ हवीं॒षि । व॒नस्प॒तिः शमिता॒ देवो॒ अग्निः॒ स्व॒दन्तु हव्यं॒ म॒धुना घृते॒न ॥१०॥

text: Agni as soon as he was born made ready the sacrifice and was the Gods' preceder. May the Gods eat our offering consecrated according to this true Priest's voice and guidance.
meaning: सद्यो॒ जातो॒ व्य् अ॑मिमीत यज्ञ॒म् अग्नि॒र् देवा॒नाम् अभवत् पुरोगाः॒ । अस्य॒ हो॒तुः प्रशि॒ष्य् ऋत॒स्य वाचि॒ स्वा॒हाकृतं हवि॒र् अदन्तु देवाः॒ ॥११॥

text: Varuna, Sage of heaven, hath given me the gift: with spells of mighty power I draw thy poison out. Dug up, not dug, adherent, I have seized it fast: low hath thy venom sunk like water in the sands.
meaning: ददि॒र् हि॒ म॒ह्यं व॒रुणो दिवः॒ कवि॒र् व॒चोभिर् उग्रै॒र् नि॒ रिणामि ते विष॒म् । खात॒म् अ॒खातम् उत॒ सक्त॒म् अग्रभम् इ॒रेव ध॒न्वन् नि॒ जजास ते विष॒म् ॥१॥

text: All the non-fluid portion of thy venom, I receive in these. I take thy middlemost, thy highest, lowest juice: may it be spent and lest by reason of thy fear.
meaning: य॒त् ते अ॒पोदकं विषं॒ त॒त् त एता॒स्व् अग्रभम् । गृह्णा॒मि ते मध्यम॒म् उत्तमं॒ र॒सम् उता॒वम॒म् भिय॒सा नेशद् आ॒द् उ ते ॥२॥

text: Strong is my cry like thunder with the rainy cloud: with power- ful incantation let thy strength be stayed. I, with the men to aid, have seized that juice of his; as light from out the gloom, let Sūrya rise on high
meaning: वृ॒षा मे र॒वो न॒भसा न॒ तन्यतु॒र् उग्रे॒ण ते व॒चसा बाध आ॒द् उ ते । अहं॒ त॒म् अस्य नृ॒भिर् अग्रभम् र॒सं त॒मस इव ज्यो॒तिर् उ॒द् एतु सू॒र्यः ॥३॥

text: I with this eye destroy thine eye, and with this poison conquer thine. Live not, O Snake, but die the death: back go thy venom on thyself.
meaning: च॒क्षुषा ते च॒क्षुर् हन्मि विषे॒ण हन्मि ते विष॒म् । अ॒हे म्रिय॒स्व मा॒ जीवीः प्रत्य॒ग् अभ्य् ए॑तु त्वा विष॒म् ॥४॥

text: Listen to me, Black Snakes and hateful creatures, Lurker-in- Grass, Karait, and Brown, and Spotty, Approach not near the house my friend inhabits: give warning, and rest quiet with your poison.
meaning: कै॒रात पृ॒श्न उ॒पतृण्य ब॒भ्र आ॒ मे शृणुता॒सिता अ॒लीकाः । मा॒ मे स॒ख्युः स्तामा॒नम् अ॒पि ष्ठाताश्राव॒यन्तो नि॒ विषे॒ रमध्वम् ॥५॥

text: Even as the cord that strings the bow, I slacken, as it were, the cars. Of the All-conquering serpent's wrath, of the fierce rage of Black, and Brown, Taimāta, and Apodaka.
meaning: असित॒स्य तैमात॒स्य बभ्रो॒र् अ॒पोदकस्य च । सात्रासाह॒स्याहं॒ मन्यो॒र् अ॒व ज्या॒म् इव ध॒न्वनो वि॒ मुञ्चामि र॒थां इव ॥६॥

text: And Āligi and Viligi, their father and the mother too,— What will ye do? Your venomed sap, we know, is utterly powerless.
meaning: आ॒लिगी च वि॒लिगी च पिता॒ च मता॒ च । विद्म॒ वः सर्व॒तो ब॒न्ध्व् अ॒रसाः किं॒ करिष्यथ ॥७॥

text: Daughter of Urugūlā, she-fiend whom the black, skinned mother bare— All female serpents poison who crept swiftly near is impotent.
meaning: उरुगू॒लाया दुहिता॒ जाता॒ दास्य् अ॒सिक्न्या । प्रत॒ङ्कं दद्रु॒षीणां स॒र्वासाम् अरस॒म् विष॒म् ॥८॥

text: Dwelling beside the mountain's slope, the quick-eared porcupine exclaimed: Of all these she-snakes homed in earth the poison is most powerless.
meaning: कर्णा॒ श्वावि॒त् त॒द् अब्रवीद् गिरे॒र् अवचरन्तिका॒ । याः॒ का॒श् चेमाः॒ खनित्रि॒मास् ता॒साम् अरस॒तमं विष॒म् ॥९॥

text: Tābuva or not Tābuva, thou verily art not Tābuva: poison is killed by Tābuva. Tastuva or not Tastuva, thou verily art not Tastuva: poison is killed by Tastuva.
meaning: ताबु॒वं न॒ ताबु॒वं न॒ घे॒त् त्व॒म् असि ताबु॒वम् । ताबु॒वेनारसं॒ विष॒म् ॥१०॥

text: तस्तु॒वं न॒ तस्तु॒वं न॒ घे॒त् त्व॒म् असि तस्तु॒वम् । तस्तु॒वेनारसं॒ विष॒म् ॥११॥
An eagle found thee: with his snout a wild boar dug thee from the earth. Harm thou, O Plant, the mischievous, and drive the sorcerer away.
meaning: सुपर्ण॒स् त्वा॒न्व् अविन्दत् सूकर॒स् त्वाखनन् नसा॒ । दि॒प्सौषधे त्वं॒ दि॒प्सन्तम् अ॒व कृत्याकृ॒तं जहि ॥१॥

text: Beat thou the Yātudhānas back, drive thou away the sorcerer; And chase afar, O Plant, the man who fain would do us injury.
meaning: अ॒व जहि यातुधा॒नान् अ॒व कृत्याकृ॒तं जहि । अ॒थो यो॒ अस्मा॒न् दि॒प्सति त॒म् उ त्वं॒ जह्य् ओषधे ॥२॥

text: As 'twere a strip cut round from skin of a white-footed an- telope, Bind, like a golden chain, O God, his witchcraft on the sorcerer.
meaning: रि॒श्यस्येव परीशासं॒ परिकृ॒त्य प॒रि त्वचः॒ । कृत्यां॒ कृत्याकृ॒ते देवा निष्क॒म् इव प्र॒ति मुञ्चत ॥३॥

text: Take thou his sorcery by the hand, and to the sorcerer lead it back. Lay it before him, face to face, that it may kill the sorcerer.
meaning: पु॒नः कृत्यां॒ कृत्याकृ॒ते हस्तगृ॒ह्य प॒रा णय । समक्ष॒म् अस्मा आ॒ धेहि य॒था कृत्याकृ॒तम् ह॒नत् ॥४॥

text: Back on the wizard fall his craft, upon the curser light his curse! Let witchcraft, like a well-naved car, roll back upon the sorcerer.
meaning: कृत्याः॒ सन्तु कृत्याकृ॒ते शप॒थः शपथीयते॒ । सुखो॒ र॒थ इव वर्ततां कृत्या॒ कृत्याकृ॒तं पु॒नः ॥५॥

text: Whoso, for other's harm hath dealt-woman or man-in magic arts, To him we lead the sorcery back, even as a courser with a rope.
meaning: य॒दि स्त्री॒ य॒दि वा पु॒मान् कृत्यां॒ चका॒र पाप्म॒ने । ता॒म् उ त॒स्मै नयामस्य् अ॒श्वम् इवाश्वाभिधा॒न्या ॥६॥

text: Now whether thou hast been prepared by Gods or been pre- pared by men, We, with our Indra at our side to aid us, lead thee back again.
meaning: य॒दि वा॒सि देव॒कृता य॒दि वा पु॒रुषैः कृता॒ । तां॒ त्वा पु॒नर् णयामसी॒न्द्रेण सयु॒जा वय॒म् ॥७॥

text: Agni, victorious in fight, subdue the armies of our foes! Back on the sorcerer we cast his sorcery, and beat it home.
meaning: अ॒ग्ने पृतनाषाट् पृ॒तनाः सहस्व । पु॒नः कृत्यां॒ कृत्याकृ॒ते प्रतिह॒रणेन हरामसि ॥८॥

text: Thou who hast piercing weapons, pierce him who hath wrought it; conquer him. We do not sharpen thee to slay the man who hath not practised it.
meaning: कृ॒तव्यधनि वि॒ध्य तं॒ य॒श् चका॒र त॒म् इ॒ज् जहि । न॒ त्वा॒म् अ॒चक्रुषे वयं॒ वधा॒य सं॒ शिशीमहि ॥९॥

text: Go as a son goes to his sire: bite as a trampled viper bites. As one who flies from bonds, go back, O Witchcraft, to the sorcerer.
meaning: पुत्र॒ इव पित॒रं गछ स्वज॒ इवाभि॒ष्ठितो दश । बन्ध॒म् इवावक्रामी॒ गछ कृ॒त्ये कृत्याकृ॒तं पु॒नः ॥१०॥

text: Even as the timid antelope or hind from her assailant flees, So swiftly let the sorcery o'ertake and reach the sorcerer.
meaning: उ॒द् एणी॒व वारण्य् अ॑भिस्क॒न्दं मृगी॒व । कृत्या॒ कर्ता॒रम् ऋछतु ॥११॥

text: Straighter than any arrow let it fly against him, Heaven and Earth. So let that witchcraft seize again the wizard like a beast of chase.
meaning: इ॒ष्वा ऋ॒जीयः पततु द्या॒वापृथिवी तं॒ प्र॒ति । सा॒ तं॒ मृग॒म् इव गृह्णातु कृत्या॒ कृत्याकृ॒तं पु॒नः ॥१२॥

text: Let it go contrary like flame, like water following its course. Let witchcraft, like a well-naved car, roll back upon the sorcerer.
meaning: अग्नि॒र् इवैतु प्रतिकू॒लम् अनुकू॒लम् इवोदक॒म् । सुखो॒ र॒थ इव वर्ततां कृत्या॒ कृत्याकृ॒तं पु॒नः ॥१३॥

text: Plant! I have those who shall avert the threatened danger, ten and one. O sacred Plant, produced aright! make sweetness, sweet thy self, for me.
meaning: ए॒का च मे द॒श च मे ऽपवक्ता॒र ओषधे । ऋ॒तजात ऋ॒तावरि म॒धु मे मधुला॒ करः ॥१॥

text: Twenty and two, O Plant, have I who shall avert the threatened ill. O sacred Plant, produced aright! make sweetness, sweet thyself, for me.
meaning: द्वे॒ च मे विंशति॒श् च मे ऽपवक्ता॒र ओषधे । ऋ॒तजात ऋ॒तावरि म॒धु मे मधुला॒ करः ॥२॥

text: तिस्र॒श् च मे त्रिंश॒च् च मे ऽपवक्ता॒र ओषधे । ऋ॒तजात ऋ॒तावरि म॒धु मे मधुला॒ करः ॥३॥
च॒तस्रश् च मे चत्वारिंश॒च् च मे ऽपवक्ता॒र ओषधे । ऋ॒तजात ऋ॒तावरि म॒धु मे मधुला॒ करः ॥४॥
प॒ञ्च च मे पञ्चाश॒च् च मे ऽपवक्ता॒र ओषधे । ऋ॒तजात ऋ॒तावरि म॒धु मे मधुला॒ करः ॥५॥
ष॒ट् च मे षष्टि॒श् च मे ऽपवक्ता॒र ओषधे । ऋ॒तजात ऋ॒तावरि म॒धु मे मधुला॒ करः ॥६॥
सप्त॒ च मे सप्तति॒श् च मे ऽपवक्ता॒र ओषधे । ऋ॒तजात ऋ॒तावरि म॒धु मे मधुला॒ करः ॥७॥
अष्ट॒ च मे ऽशीति॒श् च मे ऽपवक्ता॒र ओषधे । ऋ॒तजात ऋ॒तावरि म॒धु मे मधुला॒ करः ॥८॥
न॒व च मे नवति॒श् च मे ऽपवक्ता॒र ओषधे । ऋ॒तजात ऋ॒तावरि म॒धु मे मधुला॒ करः ॥९॥
द॒श च मे शतं॒ च मे ऽपवक्ता॒र ओषधे । ऋ॒तजात ऋ॒तावरि म॒धु मे मधुला॒ करः ॥१०॥
शतं॒ च मे सह॒स्रं चापवक्ता॒र ओषधे । ऋ॒तजात ऋ॒तावरि म॒धु मे मधुला॒ करः ॥११॥
Bull! if thou art the single bull, beget. Thou hast no vital sap.
meaning: य॒द्य् एकवृषो॒ ऽसि सृजा॒रसो॒ ऽसि ॥१॥

text: य॒दि द्विवृषो॒ ऽसि सृजा॒रसो॒ ऽसि ॥२॥
य॒दि त्रिवृसो॒ ऽसि सृजा॒रसो॒ ऽसि ॥३॥
य॒दि चतुर्वृषो॒ ऽसि सृजा॒रसो॒ ऽसि ॥४॥
य॒दि पञ्चवृषो॒ ऽसि सृजा॒रसो॒ ऽसि ॥५॥
य॒दि षड्वृषो॒ ऽसि सृजा॒रसो॒ ऽसि ॥६॥
य॒दि सप्तवृषो॒ ऽसि सृजा॒रसो॒ ऽसि ॥७॥
य॒द्य् अष्टवृषो॒ ऽसि सृजा॒रसो॒ ऽसि ॥८॥
य॒दि नववृषो॒ ऽसि सृजा॒रसो॒ ऽसि ॥९॥
य॒दि दशवृषो॒ ऽसि सृजा॒रसो॒ ऽसि ॥१०॥
य॒द्य् एकादशो॒ ऽसि सो॒ ऽपोदको ऽसि ॥११॥
These first, the boundless Sea, and Mātarisvan, fierce glowing Fire, the Strong, the Bliss-bestower, And heavenly Floods, first-born by holy Order, exclaimed against the outrage on a Brāhman.
meaning: ते॒ ऽवद॒न् प्रथमा॒ ब्रह्मकिल्बिषे॒ ऽकूपारः सलिलो॒ मातरि॒श्वा । वीडु॒हरास् त॒प उग्रं॒ मयोभू॒र् आ॒पो देवीः॒ प्रथमजा॒ ऋत॒स्य ॥१॥

text: King Soma first of all, without reluctance, made restitution of the Brāhman's consort. Mitra and Varuna were the inviters: Agni as Hotar took her hand and led her.
meaning: सो॒मो रा॒जा प्रथमो॒ ब्रह्मजायां॒ पु॒नः प्रा॒यछद् अ॒हृणीयमानः । अन्वर्तिता॒ व॒रुणो मित्र॒ आसीद् अग्नि॒र् हो॒ता हस्तगृ॒ह्या॒ निनाय ॥२॥

text: The man, her pledge, must by the hand be taken when he hath cried, She is a Brāhman's consort. She stayed not for a herald to conduct her: thus is the kingdom of a ruler guarded.
meaning: ह॒स्तेनैव॒ ग्राह्य॑ आधि॒र् अस्या ब्रह्मजाये॒ति चे॒द् अ॒वोचत् । न॒ दूता॒य प्रहे॒या तस्थ एषा॒ त॒था राष्ट्रं॒ गुपितं॒ क्षत्रि॒यस्य ॥३॥

text: She whom they call the star with loosened tresses, descending as. misfortune on the village, The Brāhman's consort, she disturbs the kingdom where hath appeared the hare with fiery flashing.
meaning: या॒म् आहु॒स् ता॒रकैषा॒ विकेशी॒ति दुछु॒नां ग्रा॒मम् अवप॒द्यमानाम् । सा॒ ब्रह्मजाया॒ वि॒ दुनोति राष्ट्रं॒ य॒त्र प्रा॒पादि शश॒ उल्कुषी॒मान् ॥४॥

text: Active in duty serves the Brahmachāri: he is a member of the Gods' own body. Through him Brihaspati obtained his consort, as the Gods gained the ladle brought by Soma.
meaning: ब्रह्मचारी॒ चरति वे॒विषद् वि॒षः स॒ देवा॒नां भवत्य् ए॒कम् अ॒ङ्गम् । ते॒न जाया॒म् अ॒न्व् अविन्दद् बृ॒हस्प॒तिः सो॒मेन नीतां॒ जुह्वं॑ न॒ देवाः ॥५॥

text: Thus spake of her those Gods of old, Seven Rishis, who sate them down to their austere devotion: Dire is a Brāhman's wife led home by others: in the supremest heaven she plants confusion.
meaning: देवा॒ वा॒ एत॒स्याम् अवदन्त पू॒र्वे सप्तऋष॒यस् त॒पसा ये॒ निषेदुः॒ । भीमा॒ जाया॒ ब्राह्मण॒स्या॒पनीता दुर्धां॒ दधाति परमे॒ व्यो॑मन् ॥६॥

text: When infants die, untimely born, when herds of cattle waste away, When heroes strike each other dead, the Brāhman's wife destroyeth them.
meaning: ये॒ ग॒र्भा अवप॒द्यन्ते ज॒गद् य॒च् चापलुप्य॒ते । वीरा॒ ये॒ तृह्य॒न्ते मिथो॒ ब्रह्मजाया॒ हिनस्ति ता॒न् ॥७॥

text: Even if ten former husbands—none a Brāhman—had espoused a dame, And then a Brāhman took her hand, he is her husband, only he,
meaning: उत॒ य॒त् प॒तयो द॒श स्त्रियाः॒ पू॒र्वे अ॒ब्राह्मणाः । ब्रह्मा॒ चेद् ध॒स्तम् अ॒ग्रहीत् स॒ एव॒ प॒तिर् एकधा॒ ॥८॥

text: Not Vaisya, not Rājanya, no, the Brāhman is indeed her lord: This Sūrya in his course proclaims to the Five Races of man- kind.
meaning: ब्राह्मण॒ एव॒ प॒तिर् न॒ राजन्यो॑ न॒ वै॒श्यः । त॒त् सू॒र्यः प्रब्रुव॒न्न् एति पञ्च॒भ्यो मानवे॒भ्यः ॥९॥

text: So then the Gods restored her, so men gave the woman back again. Princes who kept their promises restored the Brāhman's wedded wife.
meaning: पु॒नर् वै॒ देवा॒ अददुः पु॒नर् मनुष्या॑ अददुः । रा॒जानः सत्यं॒ गृह्णाना॒ ब्रह्मजायां॒ पु॒नर् ददुः ॥१०॥

text: Having restored the Brāhman's wife, and freed them, with Gods' aid, from sin, They shared the fulness of the earth and worn themselves ex- tended sway.
meaning: पुनर्दा॒य ब्रह्मजायां॒ कृत्वा॒ देवै॒र् निकिल्बिष॒म् । ऊ॒र्जं पृथिव्या॒ भक्त्वो॒रुगाय॒म् उ॒पासते ॥११॥

text: No lovely wife who brings her dower in hundreds rests upon his bed, Within whose kingdom is detained, through want of sense, a Brāhman's dame.
meaning: ना॒स्य जाया॒ शतवाही॒ कल्याणी॒ त॒ल्पम् आ॒ शये । य॒स्मिन् राष्ट्रे॒ निरुध्य॒ते ब्रह्मजाया॒चित्त्या ॥१२॥

text: No broad-browed calf with wide-set ears is ever in his homestead born. Within whose kingdom is detained, through want of sense, a Brāhman's dame.
meaning: न॒ विकर्णः॒ पृथु॒शिरास् त॒स्मिन् वे॒श्मनि जायते । य॒स्मिन् राष्ट्रे॒ निरुध्य॒ते ब्रह्मजाया॒चित्त्या ॥१३॥

text: No steward, golden-necklaced, goes before the meat-trays of the man. Within whose kingdom is detained, through want of sense, a Brāhman's dame.
meaning: ना॒स्य क्षत्ता॒ निष्क॒ग्रीवः सूना॒नाम् एत्य् अग्रतः॒ । य॒स्मिन् राष्ट्रे॒ निरुध्य॒ते ब्रह्मजाया॒चित्त्या ॥१४॥

text: No black-eared courser, white of hue, moves proudly, harnessed to his car, In whose dominion is detained, through want of sense, a Brāhman's dame.
meaning: ना॒स्य श्वेतः॒ कृष्णक॒र्णो धुरि॒ युक्तो॒ महीयते । य॒स्मिन् राष्ट्रे॒ निरुध्य॒ते ब्रह्मजाया॒चित्त्या ॥१५॥

text: No lily grows with oval bulbs, no lotus-pool is in his field, In whose dominion is detained, through senseless love, a Brāhman's dame.
meaning: ना॒स्य क्षे॒त्रे पुष्करि॒णी नाण्डी॒कं जायते बि॒सम् । य॒स्मिन् राष्ट्रे॒ निरुध्य॒ते ब्रह्मजाया॒चित्त्या ॥१६॥

text: The men whose task it is to milk drain not the brindled cow for him, In whose dominion is detained, through senseless love, a Brāhman's dame.
meaning: ना॒स्मै पृ॒श्निं वि॒ दुहन्ति ये॒ ऽस्या दो॒हम् उपा॒सते । य॒स्मिन् राष्ट्रे॒ निरुध्य॒ते ब्रह्मजाया॒चित्त्या ॥१७॥

text: His milch-cow doth not profit one, his draught-ox masters not the yoke, Wherever, severed from his wife, a Brāhman spends the mourn- ful night.
meaning: ना॒स्य धेनुः॒ कल्याणी॒ ना॒नड्वा॒न्त् सहते धु॒रम् । वि॒जानिर् य॒त्र ब्रह्मणो॒ रा॒त्रिं व॒सति पाप॒या ॥१८॥

text: The Gods, O Prince, have not bestowed this cow on thee to eat thereof. Seek not, Rājanya, to devour the Brāhman's cow which none may eat.
meaning: नै॒तां॒ ते देवा॒ अददुस् तु॒भ्यं नृपते अ॒त्तवे । मा॒ ब्राह्मण॒स्य राजन्य गां॒ जिघत्सो अनाद्या॒म् ॥१॥

text: A base Rājanya, spoiled at dice, and ruined by himself, may eat. The Brāhman's cow and think, To-day and not tomorrow, let me live!
meaning: अक्ष॒द्रुग्धो राजन्यः॑ पाप॒ आत्मपराजितः॒ । स॒ ब्राह्मण॒स्य गा॒म् अद्याद् अद्य॒ जीवा॒नि मा॒ श्वः॒ ॥२॥

text: The Brāhman's cow is like a snake, charged with due poison, clothed with skin. Rājanya! bitter to the taste is she, and none may eat of her.
meaning: आ॒विष्टिताघ॒विषा पृदाकू॒र् इव च॒र्मणा । सा॒ ब्राह्मण॒स्य राजन्य तृष्टै॒षा॒ गौ॒र् अनाद्या॒ ॥३॥

text: She takes away his strength, she mars his splendour, she ruins everything like fire enkindled. That man drinks poison of the deadly serpent who counts the Brāhman as mere food to feed him.
meaning: नि॒र् वै॒ क्षत्रं॒ न॒यति हन्ति व॒र्चो ऽग्नि॒र् इवा॒रब्धो वि॒ दुनोति स॒र्वम् । यो॒ ब्राह्मणं॒ म॒न्यते अ॒न्नम् एव॒ स॒ विष॒स्य पिबति तैमात॒स्य ॥४॥

text: Whoever smites him, deeming him a weakling-blasphemer, coveting his wealth through folly Indra sets fire alight within his bosom. He who acts thus is loathed by Earth and Heaven.
meaning: य॒ एनं ह॒न्ति मृदुं॒ म॒न्यमानो देवपीयु॒र् ध॒नकामो न॒ चित्ता॒त् । सं॒ त॒स्ये॒न्द्रो हृ॒दये ऽग्नि॒म् इन्धे उभे॒ एनं द्विष्टो न॒भसी च॒रन्तम् ॥५॥

text: No Brāhman must be injured, safe as fire from him who loves himself. For Soma is akin to him and Indra guards him from the curse.
meaning: न॒ ब्राह्मणो॒ हिंसितव्यो॑ ऽग्निः॒ प्रिय॒तनोर् इव । सो॒मो ह्य् अ॑स्य दायाद॒ इ॒न्द्रो अस्याभिशस्तिपाः॒ ॥६॥

text: The fool who eats the Brāhmans' food and thinks it pleasant to the taste, Eats, but can ne'er digest, the cow that bristles with a hundred barbs,
meaning: शता॒पाष्ठां नि॒ गिरति तां॒ न॒ शक्नोति निःखि॒दम् । अ॒न्नं यो॒ ब्रह्म॒णाम् मल्वः॒ स्वाद्व् अ॑द्मी॒ति म॒न्यते ॥७॥

text: His voice an arrow's neck, his tongue a bowstring, his windpipes fire-enveloped heads of arrows, With these the Brāhman pierces through blasphemers, with God-sped bows that quell the hearts within them.
meaning: जिह्वा॒ ज्या॒ भ॒वति कु॒ल्मलं वा॒ङ् नाडीका॒ द॒न्तास् त॒पसाभि॒दिग्धाः । ते॒भिर् ब्रह्मा॒ विध्यति देवपीयू॒न् हृद्बलै॒र् ध॒नुर्भिर् देव॒जूतैः ॥८॥

text: Keen arrows have the Brāhmans, armed with missiles: the shaft, when they discharge it, never faileth. Pursuing him with fiery zeal and anger, they pierce the foeman even from a distance.
meaning: तीक्ष्णे॒षवो ब्राह्मणा॒ हेतिम॒न्तो या॒म् अ॒स्यन्ति शरव्यां॑ न॒ सा॒ मृ॒षा । अनुहा॒य त॒पसा मन्यु॒ना चोत॒ दुरा॒द् अ॒व भिन्दन्त्य् एनम् ॥९॥

text: They who, themselves ten hundred, were the rulers of a thousand men, The Vaitahavyas, were destroyed for that they ate a Brāhman's cow.
meaning: ये॒ सह॒स्रम् अ॒राजन्न् आ॒सन् दशशता॒ उत॒ । ते॒ ब्राह्मण॒स्य गां॒ जग्ध्वा॒ वैतहव्याः॒ प॒राभवन् ॥१०॥

text: The cow, indeed, when she was slain o'erthrew those Vaitahavyas, who Cooked the last she-goat that remained of Kesaraprābandhā's flock.
meaning: गौ॒र् एव॒ ता॒न् हन्य॒माना वैतहव्यां॒ अ॒वातिरत् । ये॒ के॒सरप्राबन्धायाश् चरमा॒जाम् अ॒पेचिरन् ॥११॥

text: One and a hundred were the folk, those whom the earth shook off from her: When they had wronged the Brāhman race they perished incon- ceivably.
meaning: ए॒कशतं ता॒ जन॒ता या॒ भू॒मिर् व्य॑धूनुत । प्रजां॒ हिंसित्वा॒ ब्रा॒ह्मणीम् असंभव्यं॒ प॒राभवन् ॥१२॥

text: Among mankind the Gods' despiser moveth: he hath drunk poison, naught but bone is left him. Who wrongs the kinsman of the Gods, the Brāhman, gains not the sphere to which the Fathers travelled.
meaning: देवपीयु॒श् चरति म॒र्त्येषु गरगीर्णो॒ भवत्य् अ॒स्थिभूयान् । यो॒ ब्राह्मणं॒ देव॒बन्धुं हिन॒स्ति न॒ स॒ पितृया॒णम् अ॒प्य् एति लोक॒म् ॥१३॥

text: Agni, in sooth, is called our guide, Soma is called our next of kin. Indra quells him who curses us. Sages know well that this is so.
meaning: अग्नि॒र् वै॒ नः पदवायः॒ सो॒मो दायाद॒ उच्यते । हन्ता॒भि॒शस्ते॒न्द्रस् त॒था त॒द् वेध॒सो विदुः ॥१४॥

text: Prince! like a poisoned arrow, like a deadly snake, O lord of kine! Dire is the Brāhman's arrow: he pierces his enemies therewith.
meaning: इ॒षुर् इव दिग्धा॒ नृपते पृदाकू॒र् इव गोपते । सा॒ ब्राह्मण॒स्ये॒षुर् घोरा॒ त॒या विध्यति पी॒यतः ॥१५॥

text: The sons of Vitahavya, the Srinjayas, waxed exceeding strong. They well-nigh touched the heavens, but they wronged Bhrigu and were overthrown.
meaning: अतिमात्र॒म् अवर्धन्त नो॒द् इव दि॒वम् अस्पृशन् । भृ॒गुं हिंसित्वा॒ सृ॒ञ्जया वैतहव्याः॒ प॒राभवन् ॥१॥

text: When men pierced Brihatsāman through, the Brāhman, son of Angiras, The ram with teeth in both his jaws, the sheep, devoured their progeny.
meaning: ये॒ बृह॒त्सामानम् आङ्गिरस॒म् आ॒र्पयन् ब्राह्मणं॒ ज॒नाः । पे॒त्वस् ते॒षाम् उभया॒दम् अ॒विस् तोका॒न्य् आवयत् ॥२॥

text: If men have spat upon, or shot their rheum upon a Brāhman, they. Sit in the middle of a stream running with blood, devouring hair.
meaning: ये॒ ब्राह्मणं॒ प्रत्य॒ष्ठीवन् ये॒ वास्मिञ् छुल्क॒म् ईषिरे॒ । अस्न॒स् ते म॒ध्ये कुल्या॒याः के॒शान् खा॒दन्त आसते ॥३॥

text: While yet the Brāhman's cow which men are dressing quivers in her throe: She mars the kingdom's splendour: there no vigorous hero springs to life.
meaning: ब्रह्मगवी॒ पच्य॒माना या॒वत् सा॒भि॒ विज॒ङ्गहे । ते॒जो राष्ट्र॒स्य नि॒र् हन्ति न॒ वीरो॒ जायते वृ॒षा ॥४॥

text: Terrible is her cutting-up: her bitter flesh is cast away, And it is counted sin among the Fathers if her milk is drunk.
meaning: क्रूर॒म् अस्या आश॒सनं तृष्टं॒ पिशित॒म् अस्यते । क्षीरं॒ य॒द् अस्याः पीय॒ते त॒द् वै॒ पितृ॒षु कि॒ल्बिषम् ॥५॥

text: If any King who deems himself mighty would eat a Brāhman up, Rent and disrupted is that realm wherein a Brāhman is oppres- sed.
meaning: उग्रो॒ रा॒जा म॒न्यमानो ब्राह्मणं॒ यो॒ जि॒घत्सति । प॒रा त॒त् सिच्यते राष्ट्रं॒ ब्राह्मणो॒ य॒त्र जीय॒ते ॥६॥

text: She grows eight-footed, and four-eyed, four-eared, four-jawed, two-faced, two-tongued, And shatters down the kingdom of the man who doth the Brāhman wrong.
meaning: अष्टा॒पदी चतुरक्षी॒ च॒तुःश्रोत्रा च॒तुर्हनुः । द्व्या॑स्या द्वि॒जिह्वा भूत्वा॒ सा॒ राष्ट्र॒म् अ॒व धूनुते ब्रह्मज्य॒स्य ॥७॥

text: As water swamps a leaky ship so ruin overflows that realm. Misfortune smites the realm wherein a Brāhman suffers scath and harm.
meaning: त॒द् वै॒ राष्ट्र॒म् आ॒ स्रवति ना॒वं भिन्ना॒म् इवोदक॒म् । ब्रह्मा॒णं य॒त्र हिं॒सन्ति त॒द् राष्ट्रं॒ हन्ति दुछु॒ना ॥८॥

text: The very trees repel the man, and drive him from their sheltering shade, Whoever claims, O Nārada, the treasure that a Brāhman owns.
meaning: तं॒ वृक्षा॒ अ॒प सेधन्ति छायां॒ नो मो॒प गा इ॒ति । यो॒ ब्राह्मण॒स्य स॒द् ध॒नम् अभि॒ नारद म॒न्यते ॥९॥

text: That wealth, King Varuna hath said, is poison by the Gods prepared. None hath kept watch to guard his realm who hath devoured a Brāhman's cow.
meaning: विष॒म् एत॒द् देव॒कृतं रा॒जा व॒रुणो ऽब्रवीत् । न॒ ब्राह्मण॒स्य गां॒ जग्ध्वा॒ रास्त्रे॒ जागार क॒श् चन॒ ॥१०॥

text: Those nine-and-ninety people whom Earth shook and cast away from her, When they had wronged the Brāhman race were ruined incon- ceivably.
meaning: न॒वैव॒ ता॒ नवत॒यो या॒ भू॒मिर् व्य॑धूनुत । प्रजां॒ हिंसित्वा॒ ब्रा॒ह्मणीम् असंभव्यं॒ प॒राभवन् ॥११॥

text: Oppressor of the Brāhmans! thus the Gods have spoken and declared, The step-effacing wisp they bind upon the dead shall be thy couch.
meaning: या॒म् मृता॒यानुबध्न॒न्ति कूद्यं॑ पदयो॒पनीम् । त॒द् वै॒ ब्रह्मज्य ते देवा॒ उपस्त॒रणम् अब्रुवन् ॥१२॥

text: Oppressor of the Brāhmans! tears wept by the man who suffers wrong, These are the share of water which the Gods have destined to be thine.
meaning: अ॒श्रूणि कृ॒पमानस्य या॒नि जीत॒स्य वावृतुः॒ । तं॒ वै॒ ब्रह्मज्य ते देवा॒ अपां॒ भाग॒म् अधारयन् ॥१३॥

text: The share of water which the Gods have destined to be thine, is that, Oppressor of the priest! wherewith men lave the corpse and wet the beard.
meaning: ये॒न मृतं॒ स्नप॒यन्ति श्म॒श्रूणि ये॒नोन्द॒ते । तं॒ वै॒ ब्रह्मज्य ते देवा॒ अपां॒ भाग॒म् अधारयन् ॥१४॥

text: The rain of Mitra-Varuna falls not on him who wrongs the priest. To him no counsel brings success: he wins, no friend to do his will.
meaning: न॒ वर्षं॒ मैत्रावरुणं॒ ब्रह्मज्य॒म् अभि॒ वर्षति । ना॒स्मै स॒मितिः कल्पते न॒ मित्रं॒ नयते व॒शम् ॥१५॥

text: Formed out of wood, compact with straps of leather, loud is the: War-drum as he plays the hero. Whetting thy voice and vanquishing opponents, roar at them like a lion fain to conquer!
meaning: उच्चै॒र्घोषो दुन्दुभिः॒ सत्वनाय॒न् वानस्पत्यः॒ सं॒भृत उसृइ॒याभिः । वा॒चं क्षुणुवानो॒ दम॒यन्त् सप॒त्नान्त् सिंह॒ इव जेष्य॒न्न् अभि॒ तंस्तनीहि ॥१॥

text: The fastened frame hath roared as 'twere a lion, like a bull bel- lowing to meet the heifer. Thou art a bull, thine enemies are weaklings: thine is the foe- subduing strength of Indra.
meaning: सिंह॒ इवास्तानीद् द्रुव॒यो वि॒बद्धो ऽभिक्र॒न्दन्न् ऋषभो॒ वासिता॒म् इव । वृ॒षा त्वं॒ व॒ध्रयस् ते सप॒त्ना ऐन्द्र॒स् ते शु॒ष्मो अभिमातिषाहः॒ ॥२॥

text: Like a bull marked by strength among the cattle, roar seeking kine and gathering up the booty. Pierce through our adversaries' heart with sorrow, and let our routed foes desert their hamlets.
meaning: वृ॒षेव यूथे॒ स॒हसा विदानो॒ गव्य॒न्न् अभि॒ रुव संधनाजित् । शुचा॒ विध्य हृ॒दयं प॒रेषां हित्वा॒ ग्रा॒मान् प्र॒च्युता यन्तु श॒त्रवः ॥३॥

text: Victorious in the battle, loudly roaring, seizing what may be seized, look all around thee. Utter, O Drum, thy heavenly voice with triumph. Bring, as a priest, our enemies' possessions.
meaning: संज॒यन् पृ॒तना ऊर्ध्व॒मायुर् गृ॒ह्या गृह्णानो॒ बहुधा॒ वि॒ चक्ष्व । दै॒वीं वा॒चं दुन्दुभ आ॒ गुरस्व वेधाः॒ श॒त्रूणाम् उ॒प भरस्व वे॒दः ॥४॥

text: Hearing the Drum's far-reaching voice resounding, let the foe's dame, waked by the roar, afflicted, Grasping her son, run forward in her terror amid the conflict of the deadly weapons.
meaning: दुन्दुभे॒र् वा॒चं प्र॒यतां व॒दन्तीम् आशृण्वती॒ नाथिता॒ घो॒षबुद्धा । ना॒री पुत्रं॒ धावतु हस्तगृ॒ह्यामित्री॒ भीता॒ समरे॒ वधा॒नाम् ॥५॥

text: Thou, first of all, O Drum, thy voice shalt utter: over the ridge of earth speak forth exultant. Crunching with might the army of the foemen, declare thy message pleasantly and clearly.
meaning: पू॒र्वो दुन्दुभे प्र॒ वदासि वा॒चं भू॒म्याः पृष्ठे॒ वद रो॒चमानः । अमित्रसेना॒म् अभिज॒ञ्जभानो द्युम॒द् वद दुन्दुभे सूनृ॒तावत् ॥६॥

text: Loud be thy roar between the earth and heaven. Swift let thy sounds go forth in all directions. Neigh at them, thunder, set in opposition, song-maker, good ally that friends may conquer.
meaning: अन्तरे॒मे॒ न॒भसी घो॒षो अस्तु पृ॒थक् ते ध्वन॒यो यन्तु शी॒भम् । अभि॒ क्रन्द स्तन॒योत्पि॒पानः श्लोककृ॒न् मित्रतू॒र्याय स्वर्धी॒ ॥७॥

text: He shall send forth his voice whom art hath fashioned. Make thou the weapons of our warriors bristle. With Indra for ally call out our heroes, and with thy friends scatter and chase the foemen
meaning: धीभिः॒ कृतः॒ प्र॒ वदाति वा॒चम् उ॒द् धर्षय स॒त्वनाम् आ॒युधानि । इ॒न्द्रमेदी स॒त्वनो नि॒ ह्वयस्व मित्रै॒र् अमि॒त्रां अ॒व जङ्घनीहि ॥८॥

text: Resonant, roaring, with thy powerful weapons, warning, and heard by troops in many places, Knowing all rules and winning us advantage, deal fame to many where two kings are fighting.
meaning: संक्र॒न्दनः प्रवदो॒ धृष्णु॒षेणः प्रवेदकृ॒द् बहुधा॒ ग्रामघोषी॒ । श्रि॒यो वन्वनो॒ वयु॒नानि विद्वा॒न् कीर्ति॒म् बहु॒भ्यो वि॒ हर द्विराजे॒ ॥९॥

text: Bent on advantage, mightier, gaining treasures, victor in war, the spell hath made thee keener. As, in the press, the stone to stalks of Soma, thus, Drum! go dancing to our foes' possessions.
meaning: श्रे॒यःकेतो वसुजि॒त् स॒हीयान्त् संग्रामजि॒त् सं॒शितो ब्र॒ह्मणासि । अंशू॒न् इव ग्रा॒वाधिष॒वणे अ॒द्रिर् गव्य॒न् दुन्दुभे॒ऽधि नृत्य वे॒दः ॥१०॥

text: Foe-conqueror, victor, vanquishing opponents, seeker of booty, mastering, destroying. Speak out as a skilled speaker tells his counsel, speak strength to us that we may win the battle.
meaning: श॒त्रूषाण् नीषा॒द् अभिमातिषाहो॒ गवे॒षणः स॒हमान उद्भि॒त् । वाग्वी॒व म॒न्त्रं प्र॒ भरस्व वा॒चम् सां॒ग्रामजित्याये॒षम् उ॒द् वदेह॒ ॥११॥

text: Shaker of things unshaken, readiest corner to battles; conquer- ing foes, resistless leader, Guarded by Indra, watching our assemblies, go quickly, breaker of their hearts who hate us.
meaning: अच्युतच्यु॒त् सम॒दो ग॒मिष्ठो मृ॒धो जे॒ता पुरएता॒योध्यः॒ । इ॒न्द्रेण गुप्तो॒ विद॒था निचिक्यद् धृद्द्यो॒तनो द्विषतां॒ याहि शी॒भम् ॥१२॥

text: Speak to our enemies, O Drum, discouragement and wild dismay. We bring upon our foemen fear and discord and discomfiture. Drum! drive these enemies away.
meaning: वि॒हृदयं वैमनस्यं॒ व॒दामि॒त्रेषु दुन्दुभे । विद्वेषं॒ क॒श्मशं भय॒म् अमि॒त्रेषु नि॒ दध्मस्य् अ॒व एनान् दुन्दुभे जहि ॥१॥

text: When sacrificial butter hath been offered, let our foemen flee. Through consternation, terrified, trembling in mind and eye and heart.
meaning: उद्वे॒पमाना म॒नसा च॒क्षुषा हृ॒दयेन च । धा॒वन्तु बि॒भ्यतो ऽमि॒त्राः प्रत्रासे॒ना॒ज्ये हुते॒ ॥२॥

text: Wrought out of wood, compact with straps of leather, dear to all the clan, Bedewed with sacrificial oil, speak terror to our enemies.
meaning: वानस्पत्यः॒ सं॒भृत उस्रि॒याभिर् विश्व॒गोत्र्यः । प्रत्रास॒म् अमि॒त्रेभ्यो वदा॒ज्येनाभि॒घारितः ॥३॥

text: As the wild creatures of the wood flee in their terror from a man, Even so do thou, O Drum, roar out against our foes to frighten them, and then bewilder thou their thoughts.
meaning: य॒था मृगाः॒ संविज॒न्त आरण्याः॒ पु॒रुषाद् अ॒धि । एव॒ त्वं॒ दुन्दुभे ऽमि॒त्रान् अभि॒ क्रन्द प्र॒ त्रासया॒थो चित्ता॒नि मोहय ॥४॥

text: As, when the wolf approaches, goats and sheep run sorely terrified, Even so do thou, O Drum, roar out against our foes to frighten them, and then bewilder thou their thoughts.
meaning: य॒था वृ॒काद् अजाव॒यो धा॒वन्ति बहु॒ बि॒भ्यतीः । एव॒ त्वं॒ दुन्दुभे ऽमि॒त्रान् अभि॒ क्रन्द प्र॒ त्रासया॒थो चित्ता॒नि मोहय ॥५॥

text: As birds of air, day after day, fly in wild terror from the hawk, as from a roaring lion's voice, Even so do thou, O Drum, roar out against our foes to frighten them, and then bewilder thou their thoughts.
meaning: य॒था श्येना॒त् पतत्रि॒णः संविज॒न्ते अ॒हर्दिवि सिंह॒स्य स्तन॒थोर् य॒था । एव॒ त्वं॒ दुन्दुभे ऽमि॒त्रान् अभि॒ क्रन्द प्र॒ त्रासया॒थो चित्ता॒नि मोहय ॥६॥

text: May all the deities whose might controls the fortune of the fray Frighten away our enemies with Drum and skin of antelope.
meaning: प॒रामि॒त्रान् दुन्दुभि॒ना हरिण॒स्याजि॒नेन च । स॒र्वे देवा॒ अतित्रसन् ये॒ संग्राम॒स्ये॒षते ॥७॥

text: Let those our enemies who go yonder in their battalions shake. In fear at shadows and the sounds of feet which Indra sporteth with.
meaning: यै॒र् इ॒न्द्रः प्रक्री॒डते पद्घोषै॒श् छाय॒या सह॒ । तै॒र् अमि॒त्रास् त्रसन्तु नो ऽमी॒ ये॒ य॒न्त्य् अनीकशः॒ ॥८॥

text: To all the quarters of the sky let clang of bowstrings and our Drums. Cry out to hosts of foes that go discomfited in serried ranks.
meaning: ज्याघोषा॒ दुन्दुभ॒यो ऽभि॒ क्रोशन्तु या॒ दि॒शः । से॒नाः प॒राजिता यती॒र् अमि॒त्राणाम् अनीकशः॒ ॥९॥

text: Āditya, take their sight away! Follow them close, ye motes of light. Let them cleave fast to foot-bound hosts when strength of arm hath past away.
meaning: आ॒दित्य च॒क्षुर् आ॒ दत्स्व म॒रीचयो॒ ऽनु धावत । पत्सङ्गि॒नीर् आ॒ सजन्तु वि॒गते बाहुवीर्ये॑ ॥१०॥

text: Do ye, O mighty Maruts, sons of Prisni, crush down, with Indra for ally, our foemen. King Soma. Varuna, great God and sovran, Indra too, aye, Death,—
meaning: यूय॒म् उग्रा॒ मरुतः पृश्निमातर इ॒न्द्रेण युजा॒ प्र॒ मृनीत श॒त्रून् । सो॒मो रा॒जा व॒रुणो रा॒जा महादेव॒ उत॒ मृत्यु॒र् इ॒न्द्रः ॥११॥

text: May these embattled Gods, brilliant as Sūrya—All hail!—one- minded conquer those who hate us.
meaning: एता॒ देवसेनाः॒ सू॒र्यकेतवः स॒चेतसः । अमि॒त्रान् नो जयन्तु स्वा॒हा ॥१२॥

text: Hence, filled with holy strength let Agni, Soma, and Varuna, the Press-stone, and the Altar. And Grass, and glowing Fuel banish Fever. Let hateful things stay at a distance yonder.
meaning: अग्नि॒स् तक्मा॒नम् अ॒प बाधताम् इतः॒ सो॒मो ग्रा॒वा व॒रुणः पूत॒दक्षाः । वे॒दिर् बर्हिः॒ समि॒धः शो॒शुचाना अ॒प द्वे॒षांस्य् अमुया॒ भवन्तु ॥१॥

text: And thou thyself who makest all men yellow, consuming them with burning heat like Agni, Thou, Fever! then be weak and ineffective. Pass hence into the realms below or vanish.
meaning: अयं॒ यो॒ वि॒श्वान् ह॒रितान् कृणो॒ष्य् उच्छोच॒यन्न् अग्नि॒र् इवाभिदुन्व॒न् । अ॒धा हि॒ तक्मन्न् अरसो॒ हि॒ भूया॒ अ॒धा न्य॑ङ्ङ् अधरा॒न् वा प॒रेहि ॥२॥

text: Endowed with universal power! send Fever down-ward, far away, The spotty, like red-coloured dust, sprung from a spotty ancestor.
meaning: यः॒ परुषः॒ पारुषेयो॒ ऽवध्वंस॒ इवारुणः॒ । तक्मा॒नं विश्वधावीर्याधरा॒ञ्चं प॒रा सुवा ॥३॥

text: When I have paid obeisance to Fever I send him downward forth. So let Sakambhara's boxer go again to the Mahāvrishas.
meaning: अधरा॒ञ्चम् प्र॒ हिणोमि॒ न॒मः कृत्वा॒ तक्म॒ने । शकम्भर॒स्य मुष्टिहा॒ पु॒नर् एतु महावृषा॒न् ॥४॥

text: His mansions are the Mūjavans, and the Mahāvrishas his home, Thou, Fever, ever since thy birth hast lived among the Bahlikas.
meaning: ओ॒को अस्य मू॒जवन्त ओ॒को अस्य महावृषाः॒ । या॒वज् जात॒स् तक्मंस् ता॒वान् असि ब॒ल्हिकेषु न्योचरः॒ ॥५॥

text: Fever, snake, limbless one, speak out! Keep thyself far away fi om us. Seek thou a wanton Dāst girl and strike her with thy thunder- bolt.
meaning: त॒क्मन् व्या॑ल वि॒ गद व्य॑ङ्ग भू॒रि यावय । दासीं॒ निष्ट॒क्वरीम् इछ ता॒म् व॒ज्रेण स॒म् अर्पय ॥६॥

text: Go, Fever, to the Mūjavans, or, farther, to the Bahlikas. Seek a lascivious Sara girl and seem to shake her through and through.
meaning: त॒क्मन् मू॒जवतो गछ ब॒ल्हिकान् वा परस्तरा॒म् । शूद्रा॒म् इछ प्रफर्व्यं॑ तां॒ तक्मन् वी॒व धूनुहि ॥७॥

text: Go hence and eat thy kinsmen the Mahāvrishas and Mūjavans. These or those foreign regions we proclaim to Fever for his home.
meaning: महावृषा॒न् मू॒जवतो ब॒न्ध्व् अद्धि परे॒त्य । प्रै॒ता॒नि तक्म॒ने ब्रूमो अन्यक्षेत्रा॒णि वा॒ इमा॒ ॥८॥

text: In a strange land thou joyest not; subdued, thou wilt be kind to us. Fever is eager to depart, and to the Bahlikas will go,
meaning: अन्यक्षेत्रे॒ न॒ रमसे वशी॒ स॒न् मृडयासि नः । अ॒भूद् उ प्रा॒र्थस् तक्मा॒ स॒ गमिष्यति ब॒ल्हिकान् ॥९॥

text: Since thou now cold, now burning hot, with cough besides, hast made us shake, Terrible, Fever, are thy darts: forbear to injure us with these.
meaning: य॒त् त्वं॒ शीतो॒ ऽथो रूरः॒ सह॒ कासा॒वेपयः । भीमा॒स् ते तक्मन् हेत॒यस् ता॒भिः स्म प॒रि वृङ्ग्धि नः ॥१०॥

text: Take none of these to be thy friends, Cough, or Consumption or Decline: Never come thence again to us! O Fever, thus I counsel thee.
meaning: मा॒ स्मैता॒न्त् स॒खीन् कुरुथा बला॒सं कास॒म् उद्युग॒म् । मा॒ स्मा॒तोऽर्वा॒ङ् ऐः॒ पु॒नस् त॒त् त्वा तक्मन्न् उ॒प ब्रुवे ॥११॥

text: Go, Fever, with Consumption, thy brother, and with thy sister, Cough. And with thy nephew Herpes, go away unto that alien folk.
meaning: त॒क्मन् भ्रा॒त्रा बला॒सेन स्व॒स्रा का॒सिकया सह॒ । पाप्मा॒ भ्रा॒तृव्येण सह॒ ग॒छामु॒म् अ॒रणं ज॒नम् ॥१२॥

text: Chase Fever whether cold or hot, brought by the summer or the rains, Tertian, intermittent, or autumnal, or continual.
meaning: तृ॒तीयकं वितृतीयं॒ सदन्दि॒म् उत॒ शारद॒म् । तक्मा॒नं शीतं॒ रूरं॒ ग्रै॒ष्मं नाशय वा॒र्षिकम् ॥१३॥

text: We to Gandhāris, Mūjavans, to Angas and to Magadhas. Hand over Fever as it were a servant and a thing of price.
meaning: गन्धा॒रिभ्यो मू॒जवद्भ्यो॒ ऽङ्गेभ्यो मग॒धेभ्यः । प्रैष्य॒न् ज॒नम् इव शेवधिं॒ तक्मा॒नं प॒रि दद्मसि ॥१४॥

text: I have called Heaven and Earth to aid, have called divine Sarasvati, Indra and Agni have I called: Let these destroy the worm, I prayed.
meaning: ओ॒ते मे द्या॒वापृथिवी॒ ओ॒ता देवी॒ स॒रस्वती । ओ॒तौ म इ॒न्द्रश् चाग्नि॒श् च क्रि॒मिं जम्भयताम् इ॒ति ॥१॥

text: O Indra, Lord of Treasures, kill the worms that prey upon this boy. All the malignant spirits have been smitten by my potent spell. We utterly destroy the worm, the worm that creeps around the eyes. The worm that crawls about the nose, the worm that gets bet- ween the teeth.
meaning: अस्ये॒न्द्र कुमार॒स्य क्रि॒मीन् धनपते जहि । हता॒ वि॒श्वा अ॒रातय उग्रे॒ण व॒चसा म॒म ॥२॥

text: Two of like colour, two unlike, two coloured black, two coloured red. The tawny and the tawny-eared, Vulture and Wolf, all these are killed.
meaning: यो॒ अक्ष्यौ॑ परिस॒र्पति यो॒ ना॒से परिस॒र्पति । दतां॒ यो॒ म॒ध्यं ग॒छति तं॒ क्रि॒मिं जम्भयामसि ॥३॥

text: Worms that are white about the sides, those that are black with black-hued arms, All that show various tints and hues, these worms we utterly destroy.
meaning: स॒रूपौ द्वौ॒ वि॒रूपौ द्वौ॒ कृष्णौ॒ द्वौ॒ रो॒हितौ द्वौ॒ । बभ्रु॒श् च बभ्रु॒कर्णश् च गृ॒ध्रः को॒कश् च ते॒ हताः॒ ॥४॥

text: Eastward the Sun is mounting, seen of all, destroying thing unseen, Crushing and killing all the worms invisible and visible.
meaning: ये॒ क्रि॒मयः शितिक॒क्षा ये॒ कृष्णाः॒ शितिबा॒हवः । ये॒ के॒ च विश्व॒रूपास् ता॒न् क्रि॒मीन् जम्भयामसि ॥५॥

text: Let the Yevāshas, Kaskashas, Ejatkas, Sipavitnukas, Let both the worm that we can see, and that we see not, be destroyed.
meaning: उ॒त् पुर॒स्तात् सू॒र्य एति विश्व॒दृष्टो अदृष्टहा॒ । दृष्टां॒श् च घ्न॒न्न् अदृ॒ष्टांश् च स॒र्वांश् च प्रमृण॒न् क्रि॒मीन् ॥६॥

text: Slain the Yevāsha of the worms, slain too is the Nadaniman. I have reduced them all to dust like vetches with the pounding- stone.
meaning: ये॒वाषासः क॒ष्कषास एजत्काः॒ शिपवित्नुकाः॒ । दृष्ट॒श् च हन्य॒तां क्रि॒मिर् उता॒दृ॒ष्टश् च हन्यताम् ॥७॥

text: The worm Sāranga, white of hue, three-headed, with a triple hump, I split and tear his ribs away, I wrench off every head he has.
meaning: हतो॒ ये॒वाषः क्रि॒मीणां हतो॒ नदनिमो॒त॒ । स॒र्वान् नि॒ मष्मषा॒करं दृष॒दा ख॒ल्वां इव ॥८॥

text: I kill you, worms, as Atri, as Kanva and Jamadagni killed. I crush the worms to pieces with a spell that erst Agastya used.
meaning: त्रिशीर्षा॒णं त्रिककु॒दं क्रि॒मिं सार॒ङ्गम् अ॒र्जुनम् । शृणा॒म्य् अस्य पृष्टी॒र् अ॒पि वृश्चामि य॒च् छि॒रः ॥९॥

text: The King of worms hath been destroyed, he who was lord of these is slain. Slain is the worm whose mother, whose brother and sister have been slain.
