text: That collar round thy neck, not to be loosened, which Nirriti the Goddess bound and fastened, I loose for thy long life and strength and vigour. Eat, liberated, food that brings no sorrow.
meaning: य॒त् ते देवी॒ नि॒रृतिर् आबब॒न्ध दा॒म ग्रीवा॒स्व् अविमोक्यं॒ य॒त् । त॒त् ते वि॒ ष्याम्य् आ॒युषे व॒र्चसे ब॒लायादोमद॒म् अ॒न्नम् अद्धि प्र॒सूतः ॥१॥

text: To thee, sharp-pointed Nirriti, be homage! Loose thou the binding fetters wrought of iron. To me, in truth, again doth Yama give thee. To him, to Yama, yea, to Death, be homage!
meaning: न॒मो ऽस्तु ते निरृते तिग्मतेजो ऽयस्म॒यान् वि॒ चृता बन्धपाशा॒न् । यमो॒ म॒ह्यम् पु॒नर् इ॒त् त्वा॒म् ददाति त॒स्मै यमा॒य न॒मो अस्तु मृत्य॒वे ॥२॥

text: Compassed by death which comes in thousand manners, here art thou fastened to the iron pillar. Unanimous with Yama and the Fathers, make this man rise and reach the loftiest heaven.
meaning: अयस्म॒ये द्रुपदे॒ बेधिष इहा॒भि॒हितो मृत्यु॒भिर् ये॒ सह॒स्रम् । यमे॒न त्वं॒ पितृ॒भिः संविदान॒ उत्तमं॒ ना॒कम् अ॒धि रोहयेम॒म् ॥३॥

text: Thou, mighty Agni, good and true, gatherest up all precious things. Bring us all treasures as thou art enkindled at libation's place.
meaning: सं॒सम् इ॒द् युवसे वृषन्न् अ॒ग्ने वि॒श्वान्य् अर्य॒ आ॒ । इड॒स् पदे॒ स॒म् इध्यसे स॒ नो व॒सून्य् आ॒ भर ॥४॥

text: Agree and be united: let your minds be all of one accord, Even as the Gods of ancient days, unanimous, await their share.
meaning: सं॒ जानीध्वं सं॒ पृच्यध्वं सं॒ वो म॒नांसि जानताम् । देवा॒ भागं॒ य॒था पू॒र्वे सम्जानाना॒ उपा॒सते ॥१॥

text: The rede is common, common the assembly, common the law, so be their thoughts united. I offer up your general oblation: together entertain one common purpose.
meaning: समानो॒ म॒न्त्रः स॒मितिः समानी॒ समानं॒ व्रतं॒ सह॒ चित्त॒म् एषाम् । समाने॒न वो हवि॒षा जुहोमि समानं॒ चे॒तो अभिसं॒विशध्वम् ॥२॥

text: One and the same be your resolve, be all your hearts in har- mony: One and the same be all your minds that all may happily con- sent.
meaning: समानी॒ व आ॒कूतिः समाना॒ हृ॒दयानि वः । समान॒म् अस्तु वो म॒नः य॒था वः सु॒सहा॒सति ॥३॥

text: The angry spirit hath relaxed: loose are the arms that act with mind. Do thou, destroyer, overcome and drive these foemen's might away, and then bring opulence to us.
meaning: अ॒व मन्यु॒र् अ॒वा॒यता॒व बाहू॒ मनोयु॒जा । प॒राशर त्वं॒ ते॒षाम् प॒राञ्चं शु॒ष्मम् अर्दया॒धा नो रयि॒म् आ॒ कृधि ॥१॥

text: The shaft for handless fiends which, Gods! ye cast against the handless ones, With this, in shape of sacrifice, I rend the arms of enemies.
meaning: नि॒र्हस्तेभ्यो नैर्हस्त॒म् यं॒ देवाः श॒रुम् अ॒स्यथ । वृश्चा॒मि श॒त्रूणां बाहू॒न् अने॒न हवि॒षा ऽह॒म् ॥२॥

text: Indra made first for Asuras the shaft designed for handless foes: Victorious shall my heroes be with Indra as their constant friend.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रश् चकार प्रथमं॒ नैर्हस्त॒म् अ॒सुरेभ्यः । ज॒यन्तु स॒त्वानो म॒म स्थिरे॒णे॒न्द्रेण मेदि॒ना ॥३॥

text: Handless be every foeman who assaileth, they who with missiles come to fight against us! Dash them together with great slaughter, Indra! and let their robber chief run pierced with arrows.
meaning: नि॒र्हस्तः श॒त्रुर् अभिदा॒सन्न् अस्तु ये॒ से॒नाभिर् यु॒धम् आय॒न्त्य् अस्मा॒न् । स॒म् अर्पयेन्द्र महता॒ वधे॒न द्रा॒त्व् एषाम् अघहारो॒ वि॒विद्धः ॥१॥

text: Ye who run hither bending bows, brandishing swords and cast- ing darts. Handless be ye, O enemies! Let Indra mangle you to-day.
meaning: आतन्वाना॒ आय॒छन्तो॒ ऽस्यन्तो ये॒ च धा॒वथ । नि॒र्हस्ताः शत्रवः स्थने॒न्द्रो वो ऽद्य॒ प॒राशरीत् ॥२॥

text: Handless be these our enemies! We enervate their languid limbs. So let us part among ourselves, in hundreds, Indra! all their wealth.
meaning: नि॒र्हस्ताः सन्तु श॒त्रवो॒ ऽङ्गैषां म्लापयामसि । अ॒थैषाम् इन्द्र वे॒दांसि शतशो॒ वि॒ भजामहै ॥३॥

text: Indra and Pūshan have gone forth along the ways on every side. To-day those hosts of enemies must flee bewildered far away.
meaning: प॒रि व॒र्त्मानि सर्व॒त इ॒न्द्रः पूषा॒ च सस्रतुः । मु॒ह्यन्त्व् अद्या॒मूः॒ से॒ना अमित्राणां परस्तरा॒म् ॥१॥

text: Ye foes, come hitherward dismayed like serpents when their heads are gone. Let Indra slay each bravest one of you whom Agni hath con- fused.
meaning: मूढा॒ अमि॒त्राश् चरताशीर्षा॒ण इवा॒हयः । ते॒षां वो अग्नि॒मूढानाम् इ॒न्द्रो हन्तु व॒रंवरम् ॥२॥

text: Gird thou a bullock's hide on these, make those as timid as the deer. Let the foe flee away, and let his kine come hither-ward to us.
meaning: ऐ॒षु नह्य वृ॒षाजि॒नं हरिण॒स्य भि॒यं कृधि । प॒राङ् अमि॒त्र ए॒षत्व् अर्वा॒ची गौ॒र् उ॒पेषतु ॥३॥

text: Savitar hath come hither with the razor: come thou, O Vāyu, with the heated water. One-minded let Ādityas, Rudras, Vasus moisten the hair: shave ye who know King Soma.
meaning: आ॒य॒म् अगन्त् सविता॒ क्षुरे॒णोष्णे॒न वाय उदके॒ने॒हि । आदित्या॒ रुद्रा॒ व॒सव उन्दन्तु स॒चेतसः सो॒मस्य रा॒ज्ञो वपत प्र॒चेतसः ॥१॥

text: Let Aditi shave the beard, and let the Waters bathe it with their strength: Prajāpati restore his health for sight and days of lengthened life!
meaning: अ॒दितिः श्म॒श्रु वपत्व् आ॒प उन्दन्तु व॒र्चसा । चि॒कित्सतु प्रजा॒पतिर् दीर्घायुत्वा॒य च॒क्षसे ॥२॥

text: The razor used by Savitar, for shaving, who knoweth Varuna and royal Soma, Even with this shave ye this man, O Brāhman. Let him be rich in horses, kine, and children.
meaning: ये॒ना॒वपत् सविता॒ क्षुरे॒ण सो॒मस्य रा॒ज्ञो व॒रुणस्य विद्वा॒न् । ते॒न ब्रह्माणो वपतेद॒म् अस्य॒ गो॒मान् अ॒श्ववान् अय॒म् अस्तु प्रजा॒वान् ॥३॥

text: Mine be the glory in the hill, in vales, in cattle, and in gold, Mine be the sweetness that is found in nectar and in flowing wine!
meaning: गिरा॒व् अरग॒राटेषु हि॒रन्ये गो॒षु य॒द् य॒शः । सु॒रायां सिच्य॒मानायां कीला॒ले म॒धु त॒न् म॒यि ॥१॥

text: With your delicious honey balm me, Asvins, Lords of splendid light! That clear and resonant may be the voice I utter to mankind.
meaning: अ॒श्विना सारघे॒ण मा म॒धुनाङ्क्तं शुभस् पती । य॒था भ॒र्गस्वतीं वा॒चम् आव॒दानि ज॒नां अ॒नु ॥२॥

text: In me be strength, in me be fame, in me the power of sacrifice: Prajāpati establish this in me as firm as light in heaven!
meaning: म॒यि व॒र्चो अ॒थो य॒शो॒ ऽथो यज्ञ॒स्य य॒त् प॒यः । त॒न् म॒यि प्रजा॒पतिर् दिवि॒ द्या॒म् इव दृंहतु ॥३॥

text: As wine associates with flesh, as dice attend the gaming-board, As an enamoured man's desire is firmly set upon a dame, So let thy heart and soul, O Cow, be firmly set upou thy calf.
meaning: य॒था मांस॒म् य॒था सु॒रा य॒थाक्षा॒ अधिदे॒वने । य॒था पुंसो॒ वृषण्यत॒ स्त्रियां॒ निहन्य॒ते म॒नः । एवा॒ ते अघ्न्ये म॒नो॒ ऽधि वत्से॒ नि॒ हन्यताम् ॥१॥

text: As the male elephant pursues with eager step his female's track, As an enamoured man's desire is firmly set upon a dame, So let thy heart and soul, O Cow, be firmly set upon the calf.
meaning: य॒था हस्ती॒ हस्तिन्याः॒ पदे॒न पद॒म् उद्युजे॒ । य॒था पुंसो॒ वृषण्यत॒ स्त्रियां॒ निहन्य॒ते म॒नः । एवा॒ ते अघ्न्ये म॒नो॒ ऽधि वत्से॒ नि॒ हन्यताम् ॥२॥

text: Close as the felly and the spoke, fixt as the wheel-rim on the nave, As an enamoured man's desire is firmly set upon a dame, So let thy heart and soul, O Cow, be firmly set upon thy calf.
meaning: य॒था प्रधि॒र् य॒थोपधि॒र् य॒था न॒भ्यं प्रधा॒व् अ॒धि । य॒था पुंसो॒ वृषण्यत॒ स्त्रियां॒ निहन्य॒ते म॒नः । एवा॒ ते अघ्न्ये म॒नो॒ ऽधि वत्से॒ नि॒ हन्यताम् ॥३॥

text: What food I eat of varied form and nature, food whether gold, or horse, sheep, goat, or bullock, Whatever gift I have received, may Agni the Hotar make it sacrifice well-offered.
meaning: य॒द् अ॒न्नम् अ॒द्मि बहुधा॒ वि॒रूपं हि॒रण्यम् अ॒श्वम् उत॒ गा॒म् अजा॒म् अ॒विम् । य॒द् एव॒ किं॒ च प्रतिजग्र॒हाह॒म् अग्नि॒ष् ट॒द् धो॒ता सु॒हुतं कृनोतु ॥१॥

text: Whatever, sacrificed or not, hath reached me, bestowed by men and sanctioned by the Fathers, Whereby my heart seems to leap up, may Agni the Hotar make that sacrifice well-offered.
meaning: य॒न् मा हुत॒म् अ॒हुतम् आजगा॒म दत्तं॒ पितृ॒भिर् अ॒नुमतं मनुष्यैः॒ । य॒स्मान् मे म॒न उ॒द् इव रा॒रजीत्य् अग्नि॒ष् ट॒द् धो॒ता सु॒हुतं कृणोतु ॥२॥

text: What food I eat unjustly, Gods! or, doubtful between bestow- ing and refusing, swallow, Through greatness of Vaisvānara the mighty may that same food be sweet to me and blessed!
meaning: य॒द् अ॒न्नम् अ॒द्म्य् अ॒नृतेन देवा दास्य॒न्न् अ॒दास्यन्न् उत॒ संगृणा॒मि । वैश्वानर॒स्य महतो॒ महिम्ना॒ शिवं॒ म॒ह्यं म॒धुमद् अस्त्व् अ॒न्नम् ॥३॥

text: Sicut anguis niger ad voluntatem se extendit, Asurarum arte magica formas novas efficiens, sic fascinum tuum, partem cum parte, conjunctum, hic hymnus efficiat.
meaning: य॒थासितः॒ प्रथ॒यते व॒शाम् अ॒नु व॒पूंषि कृण्व॒न्न् अ॒सुरस्य माय॒या । एवा॒ ते शे॒पः स॒हसाय॒म् अर्को॒ ऽङ्गेना॒ङ्गं सं॒समकं कृणोतु ॥१॥

text: Velut penis (tayadarus quem ventus permagnum fecit, quantus. est onagri penis, tantus penis tuus increscat.
meaning: य॒था प॒सस् तायादरं॒ वा॒तेन स्थूलभं॒ कृत॒म् । या॒वत् प॒रस्वतः प॒सस् ता॒वत् ते वर्धतां प॒सः ॥२॥

text: Quantum estonagri membrum masculinum, elephanti, asinique, quantum est fortis equi, tantus penis tuus increscat.
meaning: यावदङ्गी॒नं पा॒रस्वतं हा॒स्तिनं गा॒र्दभम् च य॒त् । या॒वद् अ॒श्वस्य वाजि॒नस् ता॒वत् ते वर्धतां प॒सः ॥३॥

text: Let Varuna come hither, Soma, Agni, Brihaspati come hither with the Vasus! Unanimous, ye kinsmen, come united, come to the glory of this mighty guardian.
meaning: ए॒ह॒ यातु व॒रुणः सो॒मो अग्नि॒र् बृ॒हस्प॒तिर् व॒सुभिर् ए॒ह॒ यातु । अस्य॒ श्रि॒यम् उपसं॒यात स॒र्व उग्र॒स्य चेत्तुः॒ सं॒मनसः सजाताः ॥१॥

text: The inclination which your hearts have harboured, the purpose which hath occupied your spirits, This I annul with sacrifice and butter. In me be your sweet resting-place, O kinsmen.
meaning: यो॒ वः शु॒ष्मो हृ॒दयेष्व् अन्त॒र् आ॒कूतिर् या॒ वो म॒नसि प्र॒विष्टा । ता॒न्त् सीवयामि हवि॒षा घृते॒न म॒यि सजाता रम॒तिर् वो अस्तु ॥२॥

text: Stand even here; forsake me not. Before us may Pūshan make your path unfit to travel. Vāstoshpati incessantly recall you! In me be your sweet resting- place, O kinsmen!
meaning: इहै॒व॒ स्त मा॒प याता॒ध्य् अस्म॒त् पूषा॒ पर॒स्ताद् अ॒पथम् वः कृणोतु । वा॒स्तोष् प॒तिर् अ॒नु वो जोहवीतु म॒यि सजाता रम॒तिः वो अस्तु ॥३॥

text: Close gathered be your bodies: be your minds and vows in. unison! Here present Brāhmanaspati and Bhaga have assembled you.
meaning: सं॒ वः पृच्यन्तां तन्वः॑ सं॒ म॒नांसि स॒म् उ व्रता॒ । स॒म् वो ऽय॒म् ब्र॒ह्मणस् प॒तिर् भ॒गः सं॒ वो अजीगमत् ॥१॥

text: Let there be union of your minds, let there be union of your hearts: All that is troubled in your lot with this I mend and harmonize.
meaning: सम्ज्ञ॒पनं वो म॒नसो॒ ऽथो सम्ज्ञ॒पनम् हृदः॒ । अ॒थो भ॒गस्य य॒च् छ्रान्तं॒ ते॒न सं॒ज्ञपयामि वः ॥२॥

text: As, free from jealousy, the strong Ādityas have been the Vasus' and the Rudras' fellows. So free from jealousy, Lord of Three Titles! cause thou these people here to be one-minded.
meaning: य॒थादित्या॒ व॒सुभिः सम्बभूवु॒र् मरु॒द्भिर् उग्रा॒ अ॒हृणीयमानाः । एवा॒ त्रिणामन्न् अ॒हृणीयमान इमा॒न् ज॒नान्त् सं॒मनसस् कृधीह॒ ॥३॥

text: Forth from his dwelling drive that man, the foeman who assaileth us: Through the Expellent sacrifice hath Indra rent and mangled him.
meaning: नि॒र् अमुं॒ नुद ओ॒कसः सप॒त्नो यः॒ पृतन्य॒ति । नैर्बाध्ये॑न हवि॒षे॒न्द्र एनं प॒राशरीत् ॥१॥

text: Indra, Foe-Slayer, drive him forth into the distance most remote, Whence never more shall be return in all the years that are to come.
meaning: परमां॒ तं॒ पराव॒तम् इ॒न्द्रो नुदतु वृत्रहा॒ । य॒तो न॒ पु॒नर् आ॒यति शश्वती॒भ्यः स॒माभ्यः ॥२॥

text: To the three distances, beyond mankind's Five Races, let him go, Beyond the three skies let him go, whence he shall never come- again In all the years that are to be, long as the Sun is in the heaven.
meaning: ए॒तु तिस्रः॒ पराव॒त ए॒तु प॒ञ्च ज॒नां अ॒ति । ए॒तु तिस्रो॒ ऽति रोचना॒ य॒तो न॒ पु॒नर् आ॒यति । शश्वती॒भ्यः स॒माभ्यो या॒वत् सू॒र्यो अ॒सद् दिवि॒ ॥३॥

text: Those who are sitting round this babe prepare him to be looked upon. Let Agni thoroughly inflamed with all his tongues rise from his- heart.
meaning: य॒ एनं परिषी॒दन्ति समाद॒धति च॒क्षसे । संप्रे॒द्धो अग्नि॒र् जिह्वा॒भिर् उ॒द् एतु हृ॒दयाद् अ॒धि ॥१॥

text: For length of life I use the name of Agni the Consuming God, Whose smoke the sage who knows the truth beholds proceeding. from his mouth.
meaning: अग्नेः॒ साम्तपन॒स्याह॒म् आ॒युषे पद॒म् आ॒ रभे । अद्धाति॒र् य॒स्य प॒श्यति धूम॒म् उद्य॒न्तम् आस्यतः॒ ॥२॥

text: The man who knows his fuel laid in order by the Kshatriya Sets not his foot upon the steep declivity that leads to Death.
meaning: यो॒ अस्य समि॒धं वे॒द क्षत्रि॒येण समा॒हिताम् । ना॒भिह्वारे॒ पदं॒ नि॒ दधाति स॒ मृत्य॒वे ॥३॥

text: Those who encompass slay him not: he goes not near his lurk— ing foes The Kshatriya who, knowing well, takes Agni's name for length of life.
meaning: नै॒नं घ्नन्ति पर्यायि॒णो न॒ सन्नां॒ अ॒व गछति । अग्ने॒र् यः॒ क्षत्रि॒यो विद्वा॒न् ना॒म गृह्ना॒ति आ॒युषे ॥४॥

text: Firm stands the heaven, firm stands the earth, firm stands this universal world, Firm stand the rooted mountains. I have put the horses in the stall.
meaning: अ॒स्थाद् द्यौ॒र् अ॒स्थात् पृथिव्य् अ॒स्थाद् वि॒श्वम् इदं॒ ज॒गत् । आस्था॒ने प॒र्वता अस्थु स्था॒म्न्य् अ॒श्वां अतिष्ठिपम् ॥१॥

text: I call the Herdsman, him who knows the way to drive the cattle forth, Who knows the way to drive them home, to drive them back and drive them in.
meaning: य॒ उदा॒नत् परा॒यणं य॒ उदा॒नण् न्या॒यनम् । आव॒र्तनम् निव॒र्तनं यो॒ गोपा॒ अ॒पि तं॒ हुवे ॥२॥

text: O Jātavedas turn them back: a hundred homeward ways be thine! Thou hast a thousand avenues: by these restore our kine to us.
meaning: जा॒तवेदो नि॒ वर्तय शतं॒ ते सन्त्व् आवृ॒तः । सह॒स्रं त उपावृ॒तस् ता॒भिर् नः पु॒नर् आ॒ कृधि ॥३॥

text: Let this man be again bedewed with this presented sacrifice. And comfort with the sap of life the bride whom they have brought to him.
meaning: ते॒न भूते॒न हवि॒षाय॒म् आ॒ प्यायतां पु॒नः । जाया॒म् या॒म् अस्मा आ॒वाक्षुस् ता॒म् र॒सेनाभि॒ वर्धताम् ॥१॥

text: With life's sap let him comfort her, and raise her high with princely sway. In wealth that hath a thousand powers, this pair be inexhausti- ble!
meaning: अभि॒ वर्धतां प॒यसाभि राष्ट्रे॒ण वर्धताम् । रय्या॒ सह॒स्रवर्चसेमौ॒ स्ताम् अ॒नुपक्षितौ ॥२॥

text: Tvashtar formed her to be thy dame, Tvashtar made thee to be her lord. Long life let Tvashtar give you both. Let Tvashtar give a thousand lives.
meaning: त्व॒ष्टा जाया॒म् अजनयत् त्व॒ष्टास्यै त्वां॒ प॒तिम् । त्व॒ष्टा सह॒स्रम् आ॒युंषि दीर्घ॒म् आ॒युः कृणोतु वाम् ॥३॥

text: May this our Lord of Cloudy Sky, bedewed with liquid drops preserve unequalled riches in our homes.
meaning: अयं॒ नो न॒भसस् प॒तिः संस्फा॒नो अभि॒ रक्षतु । अ॒समातिम् गृहे॒षु नः ॥१॥

text: Lord of the Cloudy Sky, bestow vigour and strength on our abodes. Let wealth and treasure come to us.
meaning: त्वं॒ नो न॒भसस् पते ऊ॒र्जं गृहे॒सु धारय । आ॒ पुष्ट॒म् एत्व् आ॒ व॒सु ॥२॥

text: Thou, God bedewed with drops, art Lord of infinite prosperity. Grant us thereof, give us thereof: may we enjoy this boon of thine.
meaning: दे॒व संस्फा॒न सहस्रापोष॒स्येशिषे । त॒स्य नो रास्व त॒स्य नो धेहि त॒स्य ते भक्तिवा॒म्सः स्याम ॥३॥

text: He flieth in the firmament observing all the things that be: We with this offering will adore the greatness of the Heavenly Hound.
meaning: अन्त॒रिक्षेण पतति वि॒श्वा भूता॒वचा॒कशत् । शु॒नो दिव्य॒स्य य॒न् म॒हस् ते॒ना ते हवि॒षा विधेम ॥१॥

text: The three, the Kālakānjas, set aloft in heaven as they were Gods All these I call to be our help and keep this man secure from harm.
meaning: ये॒ त्र॒यः कालकाञ्जा॒ दिवि॒ देवा॒ इव श्रिताः॒ । ता॒न्त् स॒र्वान् अह्व ऊत॒ये ऽस्मा॒ अरिष्ट॒तातये ॥२॥

text: In waters is thy birth, in heaven thy station, thy majesty on earth and in the ocean. We with this offering will adore the greatness of the Heavenly Hound.
meaning: अप्सु॒ ते ज॒न्म दिवि॒ ते सध॒स्थं समुद्रे॒ अन्त॒र् महिमा॒ ते पृथिव्या॒म् । शु॒नो दिव्य॒स्य य॒न् म॒हस् ते॒ना ते हवि॒षा विधेम ॥३॥

text: Thou art a grasper, holding fast both hands: drivest fiends away. A holder both of progeny and riches hath this Ring become.
meaning: यन्ता॒सि य॒छसे ह॒स्ताव् अ॒प र॒क्षांसि सेधसि । प्रजां॒ ध॒नं च गृह्णानः॒ परिहस्तो॒ अभूद् अय॒म् ॥१॥

text: Prepare accordantly, O Ring, the mother for the infant's birth. On the right way bring forth the boy. Make him come hither. I am here.
meaning: प॒रिहस्त वि॒ धारय यो॒निं ग॒र्भाय धा॒तवे । म॒र्यादे पुत्र॒म् आ॒ धेहि तं॒ त्व॒म् आ॒ गमयागमे ॥२॥

text: The Amulet which Aditi wore when desirous of a son, Tvashtar hath bound upon this dame and said, Be mother of a boy.
meaning: यं॒ परिहस्त॒म् अ॒बिभर् अ॒दितिः पुत्रकाम्या॒ । त्व॒ष्टा त॒म् अस्या आ॒ बध्नाद् य॒था पुत्रं॒ ज॒नाद् ॥३॥

text: I call the name of him who comes, hath come, and still draws- nigh to us. Foe-slaying Indra's name I love, the Vasus' friend with hundred powers.
meaning: आग॒छत आ॒गतस्य ना॒म गृह्णाम्य् आयतः॒ । इ॒न्द्रस्य वृत्रघ्नो॒ वन्वे वासव॒स्य शत॒क्रतोः ॥१॥

text: Thus Bhaga spake to me: Let him bring thee a consort by the path. Whereon the Asvins brought the bride Sūryā the child of Savitar.
meaning: ये॒न सूर्यां॒ सावित्री॒म् अश्वि॒नोह॒तुः पथा॒ । ते॒न मा॒म् अब्रवीद् भ॒गो जया॒म् आ॒ वहताद् इ॒ति ॥२॥

text: Great, Indra. is that hook of thine, bestowing treasure, wrought of gold: Therewith, O Lord of Might, bestow a wife on me who long to wed.
meaning: य॒स् ते ऽङ्कुशो॒ वसुदा॒नो बृह॒न्न् इन्द्र हिरण्य॒यः । ते॒ना जनियते॒ जायां॒ म॒ह्यं धेहि शचीपते ॥३॥

text: Hence, Sores and Pustules, fly away even as the eagle from his home. Let Sūrya bring a remedy, the Moon shine forth and banish you.
meaning: अ॒पचितः प्र॒ पतत सुपर्णो॒ वसते॒र् इव । सू॒र्यः कृणो॒तु भेषजं॒ चन्द्र॒मा वो॒ ऽपोछतु ॥१॥

text: One bright with variegated tints, one white, one black, a couple red:— The'names of all have I declared. Begone, and injure not our men.
meaning: ए॒न्य् ए॒का श्ये॒न्य् ए॒का कृष्णै॒का रो॒हिणी द्वे॒ । स॒र्वासाम् अ॒ग्रभं ना॒मा॒वीरघ्नीर् अ॒पेतन ॥२॥

text: Hence, childless, shall the Pustule flee, grand-daughter of the dusky one. The Boil shall fly away from us, the morbid growth shall vanish hence. Taste, happy in thy mind, thine own oblation, as I with Svāhā with my heart present it.
meaning: असू॒तिका रामायण्य् अ॑पचि॒त् प्र॒ पतिष्यति । ग्लौ॒र् इतः॒ प्र॒ पतिष्यति स॒ गलुन्तो॒ नशिष्यति ॥३॥

text: वीहि॒ स्वा॒म् आ॒हुतिं जुषानो॒ म॒नसा स्वा॒हा म॒नसा य॒द् इदं॒ जुहो॒मि ॥४॥
Thou in whose dread mouth I present oblation, that these bound victims may obtain their freedom, The people deem that thou art Earth: I know thee thoroughly, and I say thou art Destruction.
meaning: य॒स्यास् त आस॒नि घोरे॒ जुहो॒म्य् एषां॒ बद्धा॒नाम् अवस॒र्जनाय क॒म् । भू॒मिर् इ॒ति त्वाभिप्र॒मन्वते ज॒ना नि॒रृतिर् इ॒ति त्वाहं॒ प॒रि वेद सर्व॒तः ॥१॥

text: Be thou enriched, O Welfare, with oblations, here among us is thine allotted portion. Free—Hail to thee!—from sin those here and yonder.
meaning: भू॒ते हवि॒ष्मती भवैष॒ ते भागो॒ यो॒ अस्मा॒सु । मुञ्चे॒मा॒न् अमू॒न् ए॒नसः स्वा॒हा ॥२॥

text: Do thou, Destruction, thus, without a rival, release us from the iron bonds that hind us. To me doth Yama verily restore thee. To him, to Yama, yea, to Death be worship!
meaning: एवो॒ ष्व् अ॑स्म॒न् निरृते ऽनेहा॒ त्व॒म् अयस्म॒यान् वि॒ चृता बन्धपाशा॒न् । यमो॒ म॒ह्यं पु॒नर् इ॒त् त्वां॒ ददाति त॒स्मै यमा॒य न॒मो अस्तु मृत्य॒वे ॥३॥

text: Thou hast been fastened to an iron pillar, here compassed with a thousand deaths around thee. In full accord with Yama and the Fathers, send this man up- ward to the loftiest heaven.
meaning: अयस्म॒ये द्रुपदे॒ बेधिष इहा॒भि॒हितो मृत्यु॒भिर् ये॒ सह॒स्रम् । यमे॒न त्वं॒ पितृ॒भिः संविदान॒ उत्तमं॒ ना॒कम् अ॒धि रोहयेम॒म् ॥४॥

text: Let Varana the heavenly tree here present keep disease away. The Gods have driven off Decline that entered and possessed this man.
meaning: वरणो॒ वारयाता अयं॒ देवो॒ व॒नस्प॒तिः । य॒क्ष्मो यो॒ अस्मि॒न्न् आ॒विष्टस् त॒म् उ देवा॒ अवीवरन् ॥१॥

text: We with the speech of Indra and of Mitra and of Varuna. We with the speech of all the Gods will drive Decline away from thee.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रस्य व॒चसा वयं॒ मित्र॒स्य व॒रुणस्य च । देवा॒नां स॒र्वेषां वाचा॒ य॒क्ष्मं ते वारयामहे ॥२॥

text: Even as Vritra checked and stayed these waters flowing every way, With Agni, God of all mankind. I check and banish thy Decline.
meaning: य॒था वृत्र॒ इमा॒ आ॒पस् तस्त॒म्भ विश्व॒धा यतीः॒ । एवा॒ ते अग्नि॒ना य॒क्ष्मं वैश्वानरे॒ण वारये ॥३॥

text: This is the Lord of Indra, this the Lord of Heaven, the Lord of Earth, The Lord of all existing things: the one and only Lord be thou,
meaning: वृ॒षे॒न्द्रस्य वृ॒षा दिवो॒ वृ॒सा पृथिव्या॒ अय॒म् । वृ॒षा वि॒श्वस्य भूत॒स्य त्व॒म् एकवृषो॒ भव ॥१॥

text: The Sea is regent of the floods, Agni is ruler of the land, The Moon is regent of the stars: the one and only Lord be thou.
meaning: समुद्र॒ ईशे स्रव॒ताम् अग्निः॒ पृथिव्या॒ वशी॒ । चन्द्र॒मा न॒क्षत्राणाम् ईशे त्व॒म् एकवृषो॒ भव ॥२॥

text: Thou art the King of Asuras, the crown and summit of man- kind: Thou art the partner of the Gods: the one and only Lord be thou.
meaning: सम्रा॒ड् अस्य् अ॒सुराणां ककु॒न् मनुष्या॑नाम् । देवा॒नाम् अर्धभा॒ग् असि त्व॒म् एकवृषो॒ भव ॥३॥

text: Here art thou: I have chosen thee. Stand stedfast and immov- able. Let all the clans desire thee: let not thy kingdom fall away.
meaning: आ॒ त्वाहार्षम् अन्त॒र् अभूर् ध्रुव॒स् तिष्ठा॒विचाचलत् । वि॒शस् त्वा स॒र्वा वाञ्छन्तु मा॒ त्व॒द् राष्ट्र॒म् अ॒धि भ्रशत् ॥१॥

text: Be even here: fall not away: be like a mountain unremoved. Stand stedfast here like Indra's self, and hold the kingship in the grasp.
meaning: इहै॒वै॒धि मा॒प च्योष्ठाः प॒र्वत इवा॒विचाचलत् । इ॒न्द्र इवेह॒ ध्रुव॒स् तिष्ठेह॒ राष्ट्र॒म् उ धारय ॥२॥

text: This man hath Indra stablished, made secure by constant sacri- fice. Soma, and Brāhmanaspati here present bless and comfort him!
meaning: इ॒न्द्र एत॒म् अदीधरत् ध्रुवं॒ ध्रुवे॒ण हवि॒षा । त॒स्मै सो॒मो अ॒धि ब्रवद् अयं॒ च ब्र॒ह्मणस् प॒तिः ॥३॥

text: Firm is the sky, firm is the earth, and firm is all this living world; Firm are these mountains on their base, and stedfast is this King of men.
meaning: ध्रुवा॒ द्यौ॒र् ध्रुवा॒ पृथिवी॒ ध्रुवं॒ वि॒श्वम् इदं॒ ज॒गत् । ध्रुवा॒सः प॒र्वता इमे॒ ध्रुवो॒ रा॒जा विशा॒म् अय॒म् ॥१॥

text: Stedfast may Varuna the King, stedfast the God Brihaspati, Stedfast may Indra stedfast, too, may Agni keep thy stedfast reign.
meaning: ध्रुवं॒ ते रा॒जा व॒रुणो ध्रुव॒म् देवो॒ बृ॒हस्प॒तिः । ध्रुवं॒ त इ॒न्द्रश् चा॒ग्नि॒श् च राष्ट्रं॒ धारयतां ध्रुव॒म् ॥२॥

text: Firm, never to be shaken, crush thy foemen, under thy feet lay those who strive against thee. One-minded, true to thee be all the regions: faithful to thee, the firm, be this assembly!
meaning: ध्रुवो॒ ऽच्युतः प्र॒ मृणीहि श॒त्रून् छत्रूयतो॒ ऽधरान् पादयस्व । स॒र्वा दि॒शः सं॒मनसः सध्री॒चीर् ध्रुवा॒य ते स॒मितिः कल्पताम् इह॒ ॥३॥

text: This strength that Soma hath bestowed, the head of her who gladdeneth,— With that which thence hath been produced we make thy spirit sorrowful.
meaning: इदं॒ य॒त् प्रेण्यः॒ शि॒रो दत्तं॒ सो॒मेन वृ॒ष्ण्यम् । त॒तः प॒रि प्र॒जातेन हा॒र्दिं ते शोचयामसि ॥१॥

text: We make thy spirit sorrowful, we fill thy mind with pain and grief. As smoke accompanies the wind, so let thy fancy follow me.
meaning: शोच॒यामसि ते हा॒र्दिं शोच॒यामसि ते म॒नः । वा॒तं धूम॒ इव सध्र्य॑ङ् मा॒म् एवा॒न्व् एतु ये म॒नः ॥२॥

text: May Varuna and Mitra, may Sarasvati the Goddess, May the centre of the earth, and both her limits bring thee close to me.
meaning: म॒ह्यं त्वा मित्रा॒व॒रुणौ म॒ह्यं देवी॒ स॒रस्वती । म॒ह्यं त्वा म॒ध्यं भू॒म्या उभा॒व् अ॒न्तौ स॒म् अस्यताम् ॥३॥

text: The shaft that Rudra hath shot forth against thy members and thy heart, Here do we draw from thee to-day, and turn it hence to every side.
meaning: यां॒ ते रुद्र॒ इ॒षुम् आ॒स्यद् अ॒ङ्गेभ्यो हृ॒दयाय च । इदं॒ ता॒म् अद्य॒ त्व॒द् वयं॒ वि॒षूचीं वि॒ वृहामसि ॥१॥

text: From all the hundred vessels spread throughout the members of thy frame. From all those vessels and canals we call the poisonous matter forth.
meaning: या॒स् ते शतं॒ धम॒नयो॒ ऽङ्गान्य् अ॒नु वि॒ष्ठिताः । ता॒सां ते स॒र्वासाम् वयं॒ नि॒र् विषा॒णि ह्वयामसि ॥२॥

text: Worship to thee, the archer, and O Rudra, to thy levelled shaft! Yea, worship to thine arrow when it left the bow, and when it fell!
meaning: न॒मस् ते रुद्रा॒स्यते न॒मः प्र॒तिहितायै । न॒मो विसृज्य॒मानायै न॒मो नि॒पतितायै ॥३॥

text: They made this barley ready with a team of eight, a team of six. With this I drive to westward, far away, thy bodily disease.
meaning: इमं॒ य॒वम् अष्टायोगैः॒ षद्योगे॒भिर् अचर्कृषुः । ते॒ना ते तन्वो॑ र॒पो ऽपाची॒नम् अ॒प व्यये ॥१॥

text: Vita breathes downward from above, and downward Sūrya sends his heat: Downward is drawn the milch-cow's milk: so downward go thy malady!
meaning: न्य॑ग् वा॒तो वाति न्य॑क् तपति सू॒र्यः । नीची॒नम् अघ्न्या॒ दुहे न्य॑ग् भवतु ते र॒पः ॥२॥

text: The Waters verily bring health, the Waters drive disease away. The Waters cure all malady: may they bring medicine for thee.
meaning: आ॒प इ॒द् वा॒ उ भेषजी॒र् आ॒पो अमीवचा॒तनीः । आ॒पो वि॒श्वस्य भेषजी॒स् ता॒स् ते कृण्वन्तु भेषज॒म् ॥३॥

text: Be fleet as wind, Strong Steed, when thou art harnessed; go forth as swift as thought at lndra's sending. Let the possessors of all wealth, the Maruts, yoke thee, and Tvashtar in thy feet lay swiftness.
meaning: वा॒तरंहा भव वाजिन् युज॒मान इ॒न्द्रस्य याहि प्रसवे॒ म॒नोजवाः । युञ्ज॒न्तु त्वा मरु॒तो विश्व॒वेदस आ॒ ते त्व॒स्ता पत्सु॒ जवं॒ दधातु ॥१॥

text: That speed, that lies concealed in thee, O Charger, speed granted to the hawk or wind that wandered, Therewith, Strong Steed, saving in shock of battle endowed with might by might win thou the contest.
meaning: जव॒स् ते अर्वन् नि॒हितो गु॒हा यः॒ श्येने॒ वा॒ते उत॒ यो॒ ऽचरत् प॒रीत्तः । ते॒न त्वं॒ वाजिन् ब॒लवान् ब॒लेनाजिं॒ जय स॒मने परयिष्णुः॒ ॥२॥

text: Bearing thy body, Charger, may thy body run blessing us and winning thee protection. May he, unswerving, to uphold the mighty, stablish his lustre as a God in heaven.
meaning: तनू॒ष् टे वाजिन् तन्वं॑ न॒यन्ती वाम॒म् अस्म॒भ्यं धा॒वतु श॒र्म तु॒भ्यम् । अ॒ह्रुतो महो॒ धरु॒णाय देवो॒ दिवी॒व ज्यो॒तिः स्व॒म् आ॒ मिमीयात् ॥३॥

text: Yama, Death direly fatal, the Destroyer, with his black crest, Sarva the tawny archer, And all the Gods uprisen with their army, may these on every side avoid our heroes.
meaning: यमो॒ मृत्यु॒र् अघमारो॒ निरृथो॒ बभ्रुः॒ शर्वो॒ ऽस्ता नी॒लशिखण्डः । देवजनाः॒ से॒नयोत्तस्थिवां॒सस् ते॒ अस्मा॒कं प॒रि वृञ्जन्तु वीरा॒न् ॥१॥

text: With mind, burnt offerings, butter, and libation, to royal Bhava and the archer Sarva, To these the worshipful I pay my worship: may they turn else- where things with deadly venom.
meaning: म॒नसा हो॒मैर् ह॒रसा घृते॒न शर्वा॒या॒स्त्र उत॒ रा॒ज्ञे भवा॒य । नमस्ये॑भ्यो न॒म एभ्यः कृणोम्य् अन्य॒त्रास्म॒द् अघ॒विषा नयन्तु ॥२॥

text: Save us, All-Gods and all-possessing Maruts, from murderous stroke and things that slay with poison. Pure is the might of Varuna, Agni, Soma. May Vāta's and Parjanya's favour bless us.
meaning: त्रा॒यध्वं नो अघ॒विषाभ्यो वधा॒द् वि॒श्वे देवा मरुतो विश्ववेदसः । अग्नी॒षो॒मा व॒रुणः पूत॒दक्षा वातापर्जन्य॒योः सुमतौ॒ स्याम ॥३॥

text: We bend your minds in union, bend in harmony your hopes and plans: You there, who turn to sundered ways, we bend and bow in unison.
meaning: सं॒ वो म॒नांसि सं॒ व्रता॒ स॒म् आ॒कूतीर् नमामसि । अमी॒ ये॒ वि॒व्रता स्थ॒न ता॒न् वः सं॒ नमयामसि ॥१॥

text: I with my spirit make your spirits captive: these with their thoughts follow my thought and wishes. I make your hearts submissive to mine order closely attending go where I precede you.
meaning: अहं॒ गृभ्णामि म॒नसा म॒नांसि म॒म चित्त॒म् अ॒नु चित्ते॒भिर् ए॒त । म॒म व॒शेषु हृ॒दयानि वः कृणोमि म॒म यात॒म् अ॒नुवर्त्मान ए॒त ॥२॥

text: I have invoked both Heaven and Earth, invoked divine Sarasvati, Indra and Agni have I called: Sarasvati, so may we thrive!
meaning: ओ॒ते मे द्या॒वापृथिवी॒ ओ॒ता देवी॒ स॒रस्वती । ओ॒तौ म इ॒न्द्रश् चाग्नि॒श् च र्ध्या॒स्मेदं॒ सरस्वति ॥३॥

text: In the third heaven above us stands the Asvattha tree, the seat of Gods. There the Gods gained the Kushtha plant, embodiment of end- less life.
meaning: अश्वत्थो॒ देवस॒दनस् तृती॒यस्याम् इतो॒ दिवि॒ । त॒त्रामृ॒तस्य च॒क्षणम् देवाः॒ कु॒ष्ठम् अवन्वत ॥१॥

text: There moved through heaven a golden ship, a ship with cordage wrought of gold. There Gods obtained the Kushtha plant, the flower of immor- tality.
meaning: हिरण्य॒यी नौ॒र् अचरद् धि॒रण्यबन्धना दिवि॒ । त॒त्रामृ॒तस्य पु॒ष्पं देवाः॒ कु॒ष्ठम् अवन्वत ॥२॥

text: Thou art the infant of the plants, the infant of the Snowy Hills: The germ of every thing that is: free this my friend from his disease.
meaning: ग॒र्भो अस्य् ओ॒षधीनां ग॒र्भो हिम॒वताम् उत॒ । ग॒र्भो वि॒श्वस्य भूत॒स्येमं॒ मे अगदं॒ कृधि ॥३॥

text: The many plants of hundred shapes and forms that Soma rules as King, Commanded by Brihaspati, deliver us from grief and woe!
meaning: या॒ ओ॒षधयः सो॒मराज्ञीर् बह्वीः॒ शत॒विचक्षणाः । बृ॒हस्प॒तिप्रसूतास् ता॒ नो मुञ्चन्त्व् अं॒हसः ॥१॥

text: Let them release me from the curse and from the noose of Varupa, Free me from Yama's fetter, and from every sin against the Gods!
meaning: मुञ्च॒न्तु मा शपथ्या॑द् अ॒थो वरुण्या॑द् उत॒ । अ॒थो यम॒स्य प॒ड्वीशाद् वि॒श्वस्माद् देवकिल्बिषा॒त् ॥२॥

text: From every fault in look, in word, in spirit that we, awake or sleeping, have committed, May Soma, with his godlike nature, cleanse us.
meaning: य॒च् च॒क्षुषा म॒नसा य॒च् च वाचो॒पारिम॒ जा॒ग्रतो य॒त् स्वप॒न्तः । सो॒मस् ता॒नि स्वध॒या नः पुनातु ॥३॥

text: The sacrifice is victor, Agni victor, victorious is Soma, Indra conquers: So will we bring oblation unto Agni, this sacrifice that I may win all battles.
meaning: अभिभू॒र् यज्ञो॒ अभिभू॒र् अग्नि॒र् अभिभूः॒ सो॒मो अभिभू॒र् इ॒न्द्रः । अभ्य् अ॑हं॒ विश्वाः पृ॒तना य॒था॒सान्य् एवा॒ विधेमाग्नि॒होत्रा इदं॒ हविः॒ ॥१॥

text: Praise to you, Mitra-Varupa, hymn-singers! Here swell with meath dominion blest with children. Far into distant regions drive Destruction, and even from committed sin absolve us.
meaning: स्वधा॒स्तु मित्रावरुणा विपश्चिता प्रजा॒वत् क्षत्रं॒ म॒धुनेह॒ पिन्वतम् । बा॒धेथां दूरं॒ नि॒रृतिं पराचैः॒ कृतं॒ चिद् ए॒नः प्र॒ मुमुक्तम् अस्म॒त् ॥२॥

text: In this strong hero be ye glad and joyful: cleave ye to him even as ye cleave to Indra. Victorious, kine-winner, thunder-wielder, who quells a host and with his might destroys it.
meaning: इमं॒ वीर॒म् अ॒नु हर्षध्वम् उग्र॒म् इ॒न्द्रं सखायो अ॒नु सं॒ रभध्वम् । ग्रामजि॒तं गोजि॒तं व॒ज्रबाहुं ज॒यन्तम् अ॒ज्म प्रमृण॒न्तम् ओ॒जसा ॥३॥

text: Indra be victor, never to be vanquished, to reign among the Kings as sovran ruler! Here be thou meet for praise and supplication, to be revered and waited on and worshipped.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रो जयाति न॒ प॒रा जयाता अधिराजो॒ रा॒जसु राजयातै । चर्कृ॒त्य ई॒ड्यो व॒न्द्यश् चोपस॒द्यो नमस्य्श् भवेह॒ ॥१॥

text: Thou fain for glory, an imperial ruler, hast won dominion over men, O Indra, Of these celestial tribes be thou the sovran: long-lasting be thy sway and undecaying!
meaning: त्व॒म् इन्द्राधिराजः॒ श्रवस्यु॒स् त्वं॒ भूर् अभि॒भूतिर् ज॒नानाम् । त्वं॒ दै॒वीर् विश इमा॒ वि॒ राजा॒युष्मत् क्षत्र॒म् अज॒रं ते अस्तु ॥२॥

text: Thou governest the north and eastern regions, Indra! fiend- slayer! thou destroycst foemen. Thou hast won all, far as the rivers wander. Bull, called to help, on our right hand thou goest.
meaning: प्रा॒च्या दिश॒स् त्व॒म् इन्द्रासि रा॒जोतो॒दीच्या दिशो॒ वृत्रहन् छत्रुहो॒ ऽसि । य॒त्र य॒न्ति स्रोत्या॒स् त॒ज् जितं॒ ते दक्षिणतो॒ वृषभ॒ एषि ह॒व्यः ॥३॥

text: Indra, before affliction comes, I call thee from the wide expanse. The mighty guardian, born alone, wearer of many names, I call.
meaning: अभि॒ त्वेन्द्र व॒रिमतः पुरा॒ त्वांहूरणा॒द् धुवे । ह्व॒याम्य् उग्रं॒ चेत्ता॒रं पुरु॒णामानम् एकज॒म् ॥१॥

text: Whatever deadly missile launched to-day flies forth to slaughter us. We take both arms of Indra to encompass us on every side.
meaning: यो॒ अद्य॒ से॒न्यो वधो॒ जि॒घांसन् न उदी॒रते । इ॒न्द्रस्य त॒त्र बाहू॒ समन्तं॒ प॒रि दद्मः ॥२॥

text: We draw about us both the arms of Indra, our deliverer. May they protect us thoroughly. O Savitar, thou God, O royal Soma, make thou me pious- minded for my welfare.
meaning: प॒रि दद्म इ॒न्द्रस्य बाहू॒ समन्तं॒ त्रातु॒स् त्रा॒यतां नः । दे॒व सवितः सो॒म राजन्त् सुम॒नसं मा कृणु स्वस्त॒ये ॥३॥

text: The Gods and Sūrya gave the gift, the Earth and Heaven best- owed the boon. The three Sarasvatis in full accord bestowed the antidote.
meaning: देवा॒ अदुः सू॒र्यो द्यौ॒र् अदात् पृथिव्य् अ॑दात् । तिस्रः॒ स॒रस्वतिर् अदुः स॒चित्ता विषदू॒षणम् ॥१॥

text: That water, Upajīkās! which Gods poured for you on thirsty land, With that same water sent by Gods, drive ye away this poison here.
meaning: य॒द् वो देवा॒ उपजीका आ॒सिञ्चन् ध॒न्वन्य् उदक॒म् । ते॒न देव॒प्रसूतेनेदं॒ दूषयता विष॒म् ॥२॥

text: The daughter of the Asuras art thou, and sister of the Gods. Thou who hast sprung from heaven and earth hast robbed the poison of its power.
meaning: अ॒सुराणां दुहिता॒सि सा॒ देवा॒नाम् असि स्व॒सा । दिव॒स् पृथिव्याः॒ सं॒भूता सा॒ चकर्थारसं॒ विष॒म् ॥३॥

text: Taurum age, palpita, incresce et teipsum extende: per totum membrum increscat penis: hoc tu caede feminam.
meaning: आ॒ वृषायस्व श्वसिहि व॒र्धस्व प्रथ॒यस्व च । यथाङ्गं॒ वर्धतां शे॒पस् ते॒न योषि॒तम् इ॒ज् जहि ॥१॥

text: Quo debilem stimulant, quo aegrum excitant (homines), hoc, O Brahmanaspatis, hujus penem in arcus modum extende.
meaning: ये॒न कृषं॒ वाज॒यन्ति ये॒न हिन्व॒न्त्य् आ॒तुरम् । ते॒नास्य॒ ब्रह्मणस् पते ध॒नुर् इवा॒ तानया प॒सः ॥२॥

text: Velut nervum in arcu ego tuum fascinum extendo. Aggredere (mulierem) semper indefessus velut cervus damam.
meaning: आ॒हं॒ तनोमि ते प॒सो अ॒धि ज्या॒म् इव ध॒न्वनि । क्र॒मस्व ऋ॒ष इव रोहि॒तम् अ॒नवग्लायता स॒दा ॥३॥

text: Even as this ox, O Asvins, steps and turns together with his mate, So let thy fancy turn itself, come nearer, and unite with me.
meaning: य॒थायं॒ वाहो॒ अश्विना समै॒ति सं॒ च व॒र्तते । एवा॒ मा॒म् अभि॒ ते म॒नः समै॒तु सं॒ च वर्तताम् ॥१॥

text: I, as the shaft-horse draws the mare beside him, draw thee to myself. Like grass that storm and wind have rent, so be thy mind at- tached to me!
meaning: आ॒हं॒ खिदामि ते म॒नो राजाश्वः॒ पृष्ट्या॒म् इव । रेष्म॒छिन्नम् य॒था तृ॒णं म॒यि ते वेष्टतां म॒नः ॥२॥

text: Swiftly from Bhaga's hands I bear away a love-compelling charm Of ointment and of sugar-cane, of Spikenard and the Kushtha plant.
meaning: आ॒ञ्जनस्य मदु॒घस्य कु॒ष्ठस्य न॒लदस्य च । तुरो॒ भ॒गस्य ह॒स्ताभ्याम् अनुरो॒धनम् उ॒द् भरे ॥३॥

text: Brihaspati and Savitar prepare a rope to bind you fast! Let Bhaga, Mitra, Aryaman, and both the Asvins make the bond.
meaning: संदा॒नं वो बृ॒हस्प॒तिः संदा॒नं सविता॒ करत् । संदा॒नं मित्रो॒ अर्यमा॒ संदा॒नं भ॒गो अश्वि॒ना ॥१॥

text: I bind together all of them, the first, the last, the middlemost. Indra hath girded these with cord: bind them together, Agni, thou!
meaning: स॒म् परमा॒न्त् स॒म् अवमा॒न् अ॒थो सं॒ द्यामि मध्यमा॒न् । इ॒न्द्रस् ता॒न् प॒र्य् अहार् दा॒म्ना ता॒न् अग्ने सं॒ द्या त्व॒म् ॥२॥

text: Those yonder who approach to fight, with banners raised along their ranks, Indra hath girded these with cord: bind them together, Agni, thou!
meaning: अमी॒ ये॒ यु॒धम् आय॒न्ति केतू॒न् कृत्वा॒नीकशः॒ । इ॒न्द्रस् ता॒न् प॒र्य् अहार् दा॒म्न ता॒न् अग्ने सं॒ द्या त्व॒म् ॥३॥

text: We bind our foemen with a bond that binds them close and holds them fast. Their breath and respiration I dissever, and their lives from life.
meaning: आदा॒नेन संदा॒नेनामि॒त्रान् आ॒ द्यामसि । अपाना॒ ये॒ चैषां प्राणा॒ अ॒सुना॒सून्त् स॒म् अछिदन् ॥१॥

text: This bond, made keen by Indra, I have formed with heat of holy zeal. Securely bind our enemies, O Agni, who are standing here.
meaning: इद॒म् आदा॒नम् अकरं त॒पसे॒न्द्रेण सं॒शितम् । अमि॒त्रा ये॒ ऽत्र नः स॒न्ति ता॒न् अग्न आ॒ द्या त्व॒म् ॥२॥

text: Indra and Agni bind them fast, Soma the King, and both the Friends! May Indra, girt by Maruts, make a bond to bind our enemies.
meaning: ऐ॒नान् द्यताम् इन्द्राग्नी॒ सो॒मो रा॒जा च मेदि॒नौ । इ॒न्द्रो मरु॒त्वान् आदा॒नम् अमि॒त्रेभ्यः कृणोतु नः ॥३॥

text: Rapidly as the fancy flies forth with conceptions of the mind. So following the fancy's flight, O Cough, flee rapidly away.
meaning: य॒था म॒नो मनस्केतैः॒ पराप॒तत्य् आशुम॒त् । एवा॒ त्वं॒ कासे प्र॒ पत म॒नसो॒ ऽनु प्रवाय्य॑म् ॥१॥

text: Rapidly as an arrow flies away with keenly-sharpened point, So swiftly flee away, O Cough, over the region of the earth!
meaning: य॒था बा॒णः सु॒संशितः पराप॒तत्य् आशुम॒त् । एवा॒ त्वं॒ कासे प्र॒ पत पृथिव्या॒ अ॒नु संव॒तम् ॥२॥

text: Rapidly as the beams of light, the rays of Sūrya, fly away, So, Cough! fly rapidly away over the current of the sea!
meaning: य॒था सू॒र्यस्य रश्म॒यः पराप॒तन्त्य् आशुम॒त् । एवा॒ त्वं॒ कासे प्र॒ पत समुद्र॒स्या॒नु विक्षर॒म् ॥३॥

text: Let flowery Dūrvā grass grow up about thine exit and approach. There let a spring of water rise, or lake with blooming lotuses.
meaning: आ॒यने ते परा॒यने दू॒र्वा रोहन्तु पुष्पि॒णीः । उ॒त्सो वा त॒त्र जा॒यताम् ह्रदो॒ वा पुण्ड॒रीकवान् ॥१॥

text: This is the place where waters meet, here is the gathering of the flood. Our home is set amid the lake: turn thou thy jaws away from it.
meaning: अपा॒म् इदं॒ न्य॒यनं समुद्र॒स्य निवे॒शनम् । म॒ध्ये ह्रद॒स्य नो गृहाः॒ पराची॒ना मु॒खा कृधि ॥२॥

text: O House, we compass thee about with coolness to envelop thee. Cool as a lake be thou to us. Let Agni bring us healing balm!
meaning: हिम॒स्य त्वा जरा॒युणा शा॒ले प॒रि व्ययामसि । शीत॒ह्रदा हि॒ नो भु॒वो ऽग्नि॒ष् कृणोतु भेषज॒म् ॥३॥

text: Entrust me, Visvajit, to Trāyamānā. Guard, Trāyamānā, all our men, guard all our wealth of quadrupeds.
meaning: वि॒श्वजित् त्रायमाणा॒यै मा प॒रि देहि । त्रा॒यमाणे द्विपा॒च् च स॒र्वं नो र॒क्ष च॒तुष्पाड् य॒च् च नः स्व॒म् ॥१॥

text: To Visvajit entrust me, Trāyamānā. O Visvajit, guard all our men, etc.
meaning: त्रा॒यमाणे विश्वजि॒ते मा प॒रि देहि । वि॒श्वजिद् द्विपा॒च् च स॒र्वं नो र॒क्ष च॒तुष्पाड् य॒च् च नः स्व॒म् ॥२॥

text: To Visvajit entrust me, O Kalyāni. Guard, O Kalyāni, all our men, etc.
meaning: वि॒श्वजित् कल्याण्यै॒ मा प॒रि देहि । क॒ल्याणि द्विपा॒च् च स॒र्वं नो र॒क्ष च॒तुष्पाड् य॒च् च नः स्व॒म् ॥३॥

text: To Sarvavid entrust me, O Kalyāni. O Sarvavid, guard all our men, guard all our wealth of quadrupeds.
meaning: क॒ल्याणि सर्ववि॒दे मा प॒रि देहि । स॒र्वविद् द्विपा॒च् च स॒र्वं नो र॒क्ष च॒तुष्पाड् य॒च् च नः स्व॒म् ॥४॥

text: Intelligence, come first to us with store of horses and of kine! Thou with the rays of Sūrya art our worshipful and holy one.
meaning: त्वं॒ नो मेधे प्रथमा॒ गो॒भिर् अ॒श्वेभिर् आ॒ गहि । त्वं॒ सू॒र्यस्य रश्मि॒भिस् त्व॒म् नो असि यज्ञिया ॥१॥

text: The first, devout Intelligence, lauded by sages, sped by prayer, Drunk by Brahmachāris, for the favour of the Gods I call.
meaning: मेधा॒म् अहं॒ प्रथमां॒ ब्र॒ह्मण्वतीं ब्र॒ह्मजूताम् ऋ॒षिष्टुताम् । प्र॒पीतां ब्रह्मचारि॒भिर् देवा॒नाम् अ॒वसे हुवे ॥२॥

text: That excellent Intelligence which Ribhus know, and Asuras, Intelligence which sages know, we cause to enter into me.
meaning: यां॒ मेधा॒म् ऋभ॒वो विदु॒र् यां॒ मेधा॒म् अ॒सुरा विदुः॒ । ऋ॒षयो भद्रां॒ मेधां॒ यां॒ विदु॒स् तां॒ म॒य्य् आ॒ वेशयामसि ॥३॥

text: Do thou, O Agni, make me wise this day with that Intelligence. Which the creative ishis, which the men endowed with wisdom knew.
meaning: या॒म् ऋ॒षयो भूतकृ॒तो मेधां॒ मेधावि॒नो विदुः॒ । त॒या मा॒म् अद्य॒ मेध॒या॒ग्ने मेधावि॒नं कृणु ॥४॥

text: Intelligence at eve, at morn, Intelligence at noon of day, With the Sun's beams, and by our speech we plant in us Intelligence.
meaning: मेधां॒ सायं॒ मेधां॒ प्रात॒र् मेधां॒ मध्य॒न्दिनं प॒रि । मेधां॒ सू॒र्यस्य रश्मि॒भिर् व॒चसा॒ वेशयामहे ॥५॥

text: The Berry heals the missile's rent, it heals the deeply-piercing wound. The Gods prepared and fashioned it. This hath sufficient power for life.
meaning: पिप्पली॒ क्षिप्तभेषज्य् उ॑ता॒तिविद्धभेषजी॒ । तां॒ देवाः॒ स॒म् अकल्पयन्न् इयं॒ जी॒वितवा॒ अ॒लम् ॥१॥

text: When from their origin they came, the Berries spake among themselves: The man whom we shall find alive shall never suffer injury.
meaning: पिप्पल्यः॑ स॒म् अवदन्तायती॒र् ज॒ननाद् अ॒धि । यं॒ जीव॒म् अश्न॒वामहै न॒ स॒ रिष्याति पू॒रुषः ॥२॥

text: Asuras buried thee in earth: the Gods again uplifted thee. Healer of sickness caused by wounds and healer of the missile's rent.
meaning: अ॒सुरास् त्वा न्य् अ॑खनन् देवा॒स् त्वो॒द् अवपन् पु॒नः । वाती॒कृतस्य भेषजी॒म् अ॒थो क्षिप्त॒स्य भेषजी॒म् ॥३॥

text: Yea, ancient, meet for praise at sacrifices, ever and now thou sittest down as Hotar. And now, O Agni, make thy person friendly, and win felicity for us by worship.
meaning: प्रत्नो॒ हि॒ क॒म् ई॒ड्यो अध्वरे॒षु सना॒च् च हो॒ता न॒व्यश् च स॒त्सि । स्वा॒म् चाग्ने तन्वं॑ पिप्रा॒यस्वास्म॒भ्यं च सौ॒भगम् आ॒ यजस्व ॥१॥

text: Neath Jyaishthaghni and Yama's Two Releasers this child was born: preserve him from uprooting. He shall conduct him safe past all misfortunes to lengthened life that lasts a hundred autumns.
meaning: ज्येष्ठघ्न्यां॒ जातो॒ विचृ॒तोर् यम॒स्य मूलब॒र्हणात् प॒रि पाह्य् एनम् । अ॒त्य् एनम् नेषद् दुरिता॒नि वि॒श्वा दीर्घायुत्वा॒य शत॒शारदाय ॥२॥

text: Born on the Tiger's day was he, a hero, the Constellations' child, born brave and manly. Let him not wound, when grown in strength, his father, nor disregard his mother, her who bare him.
meaning: व्याघ्रे॒ ऽह्न्य् अजनिष्ट वीरो॒ नक्षत्रजा॒ जा॒यमानः सुवी॒रः । स॒ मा॒ वधीत् पित॒रं व॒र्धमानो मा॒ मात॒रं प्र॒ मिनीज् ज॒नित्रीम् ॥३॥

text: Unbind and loose for me this man, O Agni, who bound and well restrained is chattering folly. Afterward he will offer thee thy portion when he hath been delivered from his madness.
meaning: इम॒म् मे अग्ने पु॒रुषम् मुमुग्ध्य् अयं॒ यो॒ बद्धः॒ सु॒यतो ला॒लपीति । अ॒तो॒ ऽधि ते कृणवद् भागधे॒यं यदा॒नुन्मदितो॒ ऽसति ॥१॥

text: Let Agni gently soothe thy mind when fierce excitement troubles it. Well-skilled I make a medicine that thou no larger mayst be mad.
meaning: अग्नि॒ष् टे नि॒ शमयतु य॒दि ते म॒न उ॒द्युतम् । कृणोमि विद्वा॒न् भेषजं॒ य॒था॒नुन्मदितो॒ ऽससि ॥२॥

text: Insane through sin against the Gods, or maddened by a demon's power— Well-skilled I make a medicine to free thee from insanity.
meaning: देवैनसा॒द् उ॒न्मदितम् उ॒न्मत्तम् र॒क्षसस् प॒रि । कृणोमि विद्वा॒न् भेषजं॒ यदा॒नुन्मदितो॒ ऽसति ॥३॥

text: May the Apsarases release, Indra and Bhaga let thee go. May all the Gods deliver thee that thou no longer mayst be mad.
meaning: पु॒नस् त्वा दुर् अप्सर॒सः पु॒नर् इ॒न्द्रः पु॒नर् भ॒गः । पु॒नस् त्वा दुर् वि॒श्वे देवा॒ य॒थानुन्मदितो॒ ऽससि ॥४॥

text: Let not this one, O Agni, wound the highest of these: preserve thou him from utter ruin. Knowing the way do thou untie the nooses of the she-fiend: let all the Gods approve thee.
meaning: मा॒ ज्येष्ठं॒ वधीद् अय॒म् अग्न एषा॒म् मूलब॒र्हणात् प॒रि पाह्य् एनम् । स॒ ग्रा॒ह्याः पा॒शान् वि॒ चृत प्रजान॒न् तु॒भ्यं देवा॒ अ॒नु जानन्तु वि॒श्वे ॥१॥

text: Rend thou the; bonds of these asunder, Agni! the, threefold noose whereby the three were fastened. Knowing the way untie the she-fiend's nooses: free all, the son, the father, and the mother.
meaning: उ॒न् मुञ्च पा॒शांस् त्व॒म् अग्न एषां॒ त्र॒यस् त्रिभि॒र् उ॒त्सिता ये॒भिर् आ॒सन् । स॒ ग्रा॒ह्याः पा॒शान् वि॒ चृत प्रजान॒न् पितापुत्रौ॒ मात॒रं मुञ्च स॒र्वान् ॥२॥

text: The elder brother's bonds, still left unwedded, fettered in every limb and bound securely, Loose these, for they are bonds for loosing: Pūshan, turn woes away upon the babe-destroyer.
meaning: ये॒भिः पा॒शैः प॒रिवित्तो वि॒बद्धो॒ ऽङ्गेअङ्ग आ॒र्पित उ॒त्सितश् च । वि॒ ते॒ मुच्यन्तं विमु॒चो हि॒ स॒न्ति भ्रूणघ्नि॒ पूषन् दुरिता॒नि मृक्ष्व ॥३॥

text: This sin the Gods wiped off and laid on Trita, and Trita wiped it off on human beings. Thence if the female fiend hath made thee captive, the Gods by prayer shall banish her and free thee.
meaning: त्रिते॒ देवा॒ अमृजतैत॒द् ए॒नस् त्रित॒ एनन् मनुष्ये॑षु ममृजे । त॒तो य॒दि त्वा ग्रा॒हिर् आनशे॒ तां॒ ते देवा॒ ब्र॒ह्मणा नाशयन्तु ॥१॥

text: Enter the particles of light and vapours, go to the rising fogs or mists, O Evil! Hence! vanish in the foams of rivers. Pūshan, wipe woes away upon the babe-destroyer!
meaning: म॒रीचीर् धूमा॒न् प्र॒ विशा॒नु पाप्मन्न् उदारा॒न् गछोत॒ वा नीहारा॒न् । नदी॒नं फे॒नां अ॒नु ता॒न् वि॒ नश्य भ्रूणघ्नि॒ पूषन् दुरिता॒नि मृक्ष्व ॥२॥

text: Stored in twelve separate places lies what Trita hath wiped away, the sins of human beings. Thence if the female fiend hath made thee captive, the Gods by prayer shall banish her and free thee.
meaning: द्वादशधा॒ नि॒हितं त्रित॒स्या॒पमृष्टम् मनुष्यैनसा॒नि । त॒तो य॒दि त्वा ग्रा॒हिर् आनशे॒ तां॒ ते देवा॒ ब्र॒ह्मणा नाशयन्तु ॥३॥

text: Whatever God-provoking wrong we priests have done, O Deities. Therefrom do ye deliver us, Ādityas! by the right of Law.
meaning: य॒द् देवा देवहे॒डनं दे॒वासश् चकृम वय॒म् । आ॒दित्यास् त॒स्मान् नो युय॒म् ऋत॒स्य ऋते॒न मुञ्चत ॥१॥

text: Here set us free, O holy ones, Ādityas, by the right of Law. When striving, bringing sacrifice, we failed to offer it aright.
meaning: ऋत॒स्य ऋते॒नादित्या य॒जत्रा मुञ्च॒तेह॒ नः । यज्ञं॒ य॒द् यज्ञवाहसः शिक्षन्तो नो॒पशेकिम॒ ॥२॥

text: With ladle full of fatness we, worshippers, pouring holy oil, Striving, have failed, O all ye Gods, against our will, to offer it.
meaning: मे॒दस्वता य॒जमानाः स्रुचा॒ज्यानि जु॒ह्वतः । अकामा॒ विश्वे वो देवाः शि॒क्षन्तो नो॒प शेकिम ॥३॥

text: Whatever wrong we wittingly or in our ignorance have done, Do ye deliver us therefrom, O all ye Gods, of one accord.
meaning: य॒द् विद्वां॒सो य॒द् अ॒विद्वांस ए॒नांसि चकृमा॒ वय॒म् । यूयं॒ नस् त॒स्मान् मुञ्चत वि॒श्वे देवाः सजोषसः ॥१॥

text: If I, a sinner, when awake or sleeping have committed sin, Free me therefrom as from a stake, from present and from future guilt.
meaning: य॒दि जा॒ग्रद् य॒दि स्व॒पन्न् ए॒न एनस्यो॒ ऽकरम् । भूतं॒ मा त॒स्माद् भ॒व्यं च द्रुपदा॒द् इव मुञ्चताम् ॥२॥

text: As one unfastened from a stake, or cleansed by bathing after toil, As butter which the sieve hath cleansed, so all shall purge me from the sin.
meaning: द्रुपदा॒द् इव मुमुचानः॒ स्विन्नः॒ स्नात्वा॒ म॒लाद् इव । पूतं॒ पवि॒त्रेणेवा॒ज्यं वि॒श्वे शुम्भन्तु मै॒नसः ॥३॥

text: The wealth which husbandmen aforetime, digging, like men who find their food with knowledge, buried, This to the King, Vivasvān's son, I offer, Sweet be our food and fit for sacrificing!
meaning: य॒द् यामं॒ चक्रु॒र् निख॒नन्तो अ॒ग्रे का॒र्षीवणा अन्नवि॒दो न॒ विद्य॒या । वैवस्वते॒ रा॒जनि त॒ज् जुहोम्य् अ॒थ यज्ञि॒यं म॒धुमद् अस्तु नो॒ ऽन्नम् ॥१॥

text: May he, Vaivasvata, prepare our portion; May he whose share is mead with mead besprinkle. Our sin in hasty mood against our mother, or guilt whereby a sire is wronged and angered.
meaning: वैवस्वतः॒ कृणवद् भागधे॒यं म॒धुभागो म॒धुना सं॒ सृजाति । मातु॒र् य॒द् ए॒न इषितं॒ न आ॒गन् य॒द् वा पिता॒ ऽपराद्धो जिहीदे॒ ॥२॥

text: Whether this sin into our heart hath entered regarding mother, father, son or brother, Auspicious be to us the zeal and spirit of all the fathers who are here among us.
meaning: य॒दीदं॒ मातु॒र् य॒दि पितु॒र् नः प॒रि भ्रा॒तुः पुत्रा॒च् चे॒तस ए॒न आ॒गन् । या॒वन्तो अस्मा॒न् पित॒रः स॒चन्ते ते॒षां स॒र्वेषां शिवो॒ अस्तु मन्युः॒ ॥३॥

text: That which I eat, a debt which still is owing, the tribute due to Yama, which supports me, Thereby may I be free from debt, O Agni. Thou knowest how to rend all bonds asunder.
meaning: अपमि॒त्यम् अ॒प्रतीत्तं य॒द् अ॒स्मि यम॒स्य ये॒न बलि॒ना च॒रामि । इदं॒ त॒द् अग्ने अनृणो॒ भवामि त्वं॒ पा॒शान् विचृ॒तं वेत्थ स॒र्वान् ॥१॥

text: Still dwelling here we give again this present; we send it forth, the living from the living. Throwing away the grain whence I have eaten, thereby shall I be free from debt, O Agni.
meaning: इहै॒व॒ स॒न्तः प्र॒ति दद्म एनज् जीवा॒ जीवे॒भ्यो नि॒ हराम एनत् । अपमि॒त्य धान्यं॑ य॒ज् जघ॒साह॒म् इदं॒ त॒द् अग्ने अनृणो॒ भवामि ॥२॥

text: May we be free in this world and that yonder, in the third world may we be unindebted. May we, debt-free, abide in all the pathways, in all the worlds which Gods and Fathers visit.
meaning: अनृणा॒ अस्मि॒न्न् अनृणाः॒ प॒रस्मिन् तृती॒ये लोके॒ अनृणाः॒ स्याम । ये॒ देवया॒नाः पितृया॒णश् च लोकाः॒ स॒र्वान् पथो॒ अनृणा॒ आ॒ क्षियेम ॥३॥

text: If we have sinned with both our hands, desiring to take the host of dice for our possession, May both Apsarases to-day forgive us that debt, the fiercely- conquering, fiercely-looking.
meaning: य॒द् ध॒स्ताभ्यां चकृम॒ कि॒ल्बिषाण्य् अक्षा॒णां गत्नु॒म् उपलि॒प्समानाः । उग्रंपश्ये॒ उग्रजि॒तौ त॒द् अद्या॒प्सर॒साव् अ॒नु दत्ताम् ऋणं॒ नः ॥१॥

text: Stern viewers of their sins who rule the people, forgive us what hash happened as we gambled. Not urging us to pay the debt we owed him, he with a cord hath gone to Yama's kingdom.
meaning: उ॒ग्रंपश्ये रा॒ष्ट्रभृत् कि॒ल्बिषाणि य॒द् अक्ष॒वृत्तम् अ॒नु दत्तम् न एत॒त् । ऋणा॒न् नो न॒ ऋण॒म् ए॒र्त्समानो यम॒स्य लोके॒ अ॒धिरज्जुर् आ॒यत् ॥२॥

text: My creditor, the man whose wife I visit, he, Gods! whom I approach with supplication, Let not these men dominate me in speaking. Mind this, ye two Apsarases, Gods' Consorts!
meaning: य॒स्मा ऋणं॒ य॒स्य जाया॒म् उपै॒मि यं॒ या॒चमानो अभ्यै॒मि देवाः । ते॒ वा॒चं वादिषुर् मो॒त्तरां म॒द् दे॒वपत्नी अ॒प्सरसाव् अ॒धीतम् ॥३॥

text: The debt which I incur, not gaming, Agni! and, not intending to repay, acknowledge, That may Vaisvānara, the best, our sovran, carry away into the world of virtue.
meaning: य॒द् अ॒दीव्यन्न् ऋण॒म् अहं॒ कृणो॒म्य् अ॒दास्यन्न् अग्ने उत॒ संगृणा॒मि । वैश्वानरो॒ नो अधिपा॒ व॒सिष्ठ उ॒द् इ॒न् नयाति सुकृत॒स्य लोक॒म् ॥१॥

text: I cause Vaisvānara to know, confessing the debt whose payment to the Gods is promised. He knows to tear asunder all these nooses: so may we dwell with him the gentle-minded.
meaning: वैश्वानरा॒य प्र॒ति वेदयामि य॒दि ऋणं॒ संगरो॒ देव॒तासु । स॒ एता॒न् पा॒शान् विचृ॒तम् वेद स॒र्वान् अ॒थ पक्वे॒न सह॒ सं॒ भवेम ॥२॥

text: Vaisvānara the Purifier purge me when I oppose their hope and break my promise, Unknowing in my heart. With supplication, whatever guilt there is in that, I banish.
meaning: वैश्वानरः॒ पविता॒ मा पुनातु य॒त् संगर॒म् अभिधा॒वाम्य् आशा॒म् । अ॒नाजानन् म॒नसा या॒चमानो य॒त् त॒त्रै॒नो अ॒प त॒त् सुवामि ॥३॥

text: If we have injured Air, or Earth, or Heaven, if we have wronged our Mother or our Father, May Agni Gārhapatya here absolve us, and bear us up into the world of virtue.
meaning: य॒द् अन्त॒रिक्षं पृथिवी॒म् उत॒ द्या॒म् य॒न् मात॒रं पित॒रं वा जिहिंसिम॒ । अयं॒ त॒स्माद् गा॒र्हपत्यो नो अग्नि॒र् उ॒द् इ॒न् नयाति सुकृत॒स्य लोक॒म् ॥१॥

text: Earth is our Mother, Aditi our birth-place: our brother Air save us from imprecation! Dyaus, Father, save us, from the world of Fathers! My world not lost, may I approach my kindred.
meaning: भू॒मिर् माता॒दितिर् नो जनि॒त्रं भ्रा॒तान्त॒रिक्षम् अभि॒शस्त्या नः । द्यौ॒र् नः पिता॒ पि॒त्र्याच् छं॒ भवाति जामि॒म् ऋत्वा॒ मा॒व पत्सि लोका॒त् ॥२॥

text: There where our virtuous friends, who left behind them their bodily infirmities, are happy, Free from distortion of the limbs and lameness, may we behold, in heaven, our sons and parents.
meaning: य॒त्रा सुहा॒र्दः सुकृ॒तो म॒दन्ति विहा॒य रो॒गं तन्वः॑ स्वा॒याः । अ॒श्लोना अ॒ङ्गैर् अ॒ह्रुताः स्वर्गे॒ त॒त्र पश्येम पित॒रौ च पुत्रा॒न् ॥३॥

text: Spreading them out, untie the snares that hold us, Varuna's bonds, the upper and the lower. Drive from us evil dream, drive off misfortune; then let us go in- to the world of virtue.
meaning: विषा॒णा पा॒शान् वि॒ ष्या॒ध्य् अस्म॒द् य॒ उत्तमा॒ अधमा॒ वारुणा॒ ये॒ । दुष्व॒प्न्यं दुरितं॒ नि॒ ष्वास्म॒द् अ॒थ गछेम सुकृत॒स्य लोक॒म् ॥१॥

text: If thou art bound with cord or tied to timber, fixt in the earth, or by a word imprisoned, Our Agni Gārhapatya here shall free thee, and lead thee up into the world of virtue.
meaning: य॒द् दा॒रुणि बध्य॒से य॒च् च र॒ज्ज्वां य॒द् भू॒म्यां बध्य॒से य॒च् च वाचा॒ । अयं॒ त॒स्माद् गा॒र्हपत्यो नो अग्नि॒र् उ॒द् इ॒न् नयाति सुकृत॒स्य लोक॒म् ॥२॥

text: The two auspicious stars whose name is called Releasers have gone up. Send Amrit hither, let it come freeing the captive from his bonds!
meaning: उ॒द् अगातां भ॒गवती विचृ॒तौ ना॒म ता॒रके । प्रे॒हा॒मृ॒तस्य यछतां प्रै॒तु बद्धकमो॒चनम् ॥३॥

text: Open thyself, make room: from bonds thou shalt release the prisoner. Freed, like an infant newly born, dwell in all pathways where thou wilt.
meaning: वि॒ जिहीष्व लोक॒म् कृणु बन्धा॒न् मुञ्चासि ब॒द्धकम् । यो॒न्या इव प्र॒च्युतो ग॒र्भः पथः॒ स॒र्वां अ॒नु क्षिय ॥४॥

text: This portion I who understand deliver to Visvakarman first-born son of Order. So may we follow to the end, unbroken, beyond old age, the thread which we have given.
meaning: एतं॒ भागं॒ प॒रि ददामि विद्वा॒न् वि॒श्वकर्मन् प्रथमजा॒ ऋत॒स्य । अस्मा॒भिर् दत्तं॒ जर॒सः पर॒स्ताद् अ॒छिन्नं त॒न्तुम् अ॒नु सं॒ तरेम ॥१॥

text: This long-drawn thread some follow who have offered in order- ed course oblation to the Fathers: Some, offering and giving to the friendless, if they can give: herein they find their heaven. 3, Stand on my side and range yourselves in order, ye two! The faithful reach this world of Svarga. When your dressed food hath been bestowed on Agni, to guard it, wife and husband, come together!
meaning: ततं॒ त॒न्तुम् अ॒न्व् ए॒के तरन्ति ये॒षां दत्तं॒ पि॒त्र्यम् आ॒यनेन । अबन्ध्व् ए॒के द॒दतः प्रय॒छन्तो दा॒तुं चे॒च् छि॒क्षान्त् स॒ स्वर्ग॒ एव॒ ॥२॥

text: अन्वा॒रभेथाम् अनुसं॒रभेथाम् एतं॒ लोकं॒ श्रद्द॒धानाः सचन्ते । य॒द् वां पक्वं॒ प॒रिविष्टम् अग्नौ॒ त॒स्य गु॒प्तये दम्पती सं॒ श्रयेथाम् ॥३॥
Dwelling with zeal I mount in spirit after the lofty sacrifice as it departeth. Agni, may we, beyond decay, invited, in the third heaven, feast and enjoy the banquet.
meaning: यज्ञ॒म् य॒न्तं म॒नसा बृह॒न्तम् अन्वा॒रोहामि त॒पसा स॒योनिः । उ॒पहूता अग्ने जर॒सः पर॒स्तात् तृती॒ये ना॒के सधमा॒दं मदेम ॥४॥

text: These women here, cleansed, purified, and holy, I place at rest singly, in hands of Brāhmans. May Indra, Marut-girt, grant me the blessing I long for as I pour you this libation.
meaning: शुद्धाः॒ पूता॒ योषि॒तो यज्ञि॒या इमा॒ ब्रह्म॒णां ह॒स्तेषु प्रपृथ॒क् सादयामि । य॒त्काम इदं॒ अभिषिञ्चा॒मि वो ऽहं॒ इ॒न्द्रो मरु॒त्वान्त् स॒ ददातु त॒न् मे ॥५॥

text: Ye who are present, unto you I offer this treasure brought to us by Jātavedas Happily will the sacrificer follow: do ye acknowledge him in highest heaven.
meaning: एतं॒ सधस्थाः प॒रि वो ददामि यं॒ शेवधि॒म् आव॒हाज् जात॒वेदः । अन्वागन्ता॒ य॒जमानः स्वस्ति॒ तं॒ स्म जानीत परमे॒ व्यो॑मन् ॥१॥

text: Do ye acknowledge him in highest heaven: ye know the world here present in assembly. In peace will he who sacrifices follow: show him the joy which comes from pious actions.
meaning: जानीत॒ स्मैनं परमे॒ व्यो॑मन् दे॒वाः स॒धस्था विद॒ लोक॒म् अ॒त्र । अन्वागन्ता॒ य॒जमानः स्वस्ती॒ष्टापूर्तं॒ स्म कृणुतावि॒र् अस्मै ॥२॥

text: Gods are the Fathers, and the Fathers Gods. I am the very man I am.
meaning: दे॒वाः पि॒तरः पि॒तरो दे॒वाः । यो॒ अ॒स्मि सो॒ अस्मि ॥३॥

text: I cook, I give, I offer up oblation. From what I gave let me not be disparted.
meaning: स॒ पचामि स॒ ददामि । स॒ यजे स॒ दत्ता॒न् मा॒ यूषम् ॥४॥

text: O King, take thou thy stand in heaven, there also let that gift be placed. Recognize, King, the gift which we have given, and be gracious, God!
meaning: ना॒के राजन् प्र॒ति तिष्ठ त॒त्रैत॒त् प्र॒ति तिष्ठतु । विद्धि॒ पूर्त॒स्य नो राजन्त् स॒ देव सुम॒ना भव ॥५॥

text: From the high firmament, yea, out of heaven a water-drop with dew on me hath fallen. I, Agni! share the merit of the pious, with vigour, milk, and hymns and sacrifices.
meaning: दिवो॒ नु॒ मा॒म् बृहतो॒ अन्त॒रिक्षाद् अपां॒ स्तोको॒ अभ्य् अ॑पप्तद् र॒सेन । स॒म् इन्द्रिये॒न प॒यसाह॒म् अग्ने छ॒न्दोभिर् यज्ञैः॒ सुकृ॒तां कृते॒न ॥१॥

text: If from a tree that fruit hath fallen downward if, aught from air that is vāyu. Where it hath touched my body or my garment, thence may the Waters drive Destruction backward.
meaning: य॒दि वृक्षा॒द् अभ्य॒पप्तत् फ॒लं त॒द् य॒द्य् अन्त॒रिक्षात् स॒ उ वायु॒र् एव॒ । य॒त्रा॒स्पृक्षत् तन्वो॑ य॒च् च वा॒सस आ॒पो नुदन्तु नि॒रृतिं पराचैः॒ ॥२॥

text: It is a fragrant ointment, happy fortune, sheen all of gold, yea, purified from blemish. Spread over us are all purifications. Death and Malignity shall not subdue us.
meaning: अभ्य॒ञ्जनं सुरभि॒ सा॒ स॒मृद्धिर् हि॒रण्यं व॒र्चस् त॒द् उ पूत्रि॒मम् एव॒ । स॒र्वा पवि॒त्रा वि॒तता॒ध्य् अस्म॒त् त॒न् मा॒ तारीन् नि॒रृतिर् मो॒ अ॒रातिः ॥३॥

text: Mayst thou, O Tree, be firm indeed in body, our friend that furthers us, a goodly hero. Put forth thy strength, compact with thongs of leather, and let thy rider win all spoils of battle.
meaning: व॒नस्पते वीड्व॑ङ्गो हि॒ भूया॒ अस्म॒त्सखा प्रत॒रणः सुवी॒रः । गो॒भिः सं॒नद्धो असि वीड॒यस्वास्थाता॒ ते जयतु जे॒त्वानि ॥१॥

text: Its mighty strength was borrowed from the heaven and earth: its conquering force was brought from sovrans of the wood. Honour with sacrifice the Car like Indra's bolt, the Car girt round with straps, the vigour of the floods.
meaning: दिव॒स् पृथिव्याः॒ प॒र्य् ओ॒ज उ॒द्भृतं व॒नस्प॒तिभ्यः प॒र्य् आ॒भृतं स॒हः । अपा॒म् ओज्मा॒नं प॒रि गो॒भिर् आ॒वृतम् इन्द्रस्य व॒ज्रं हविषा र॒थं यज ॥२॥

text: Thou bolt of Indra, vanguard of the Maruts, close knit to Varuna and child of Mitra, As such, accepting gifts which here we offer, receive, O godlike Chariot, these oblations.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रस्यौ॒जो मरु॒ताम् अ॒नीकं मित्र॒स्य ग॒र्भो व॒रुणस्य ना॒भिः । स॒ इमां॒ नो हव्य॒दातिं जुषाणो॒ दे॒व रथ प्र॒ति हव्या॒ गृभाय ॥३॥

text: Send forth thy voice aloud through earth and heaven, and let the world in all its breadth regard thee. O Drum, accordant with the Gods and Indra, drive thou afar, yea, very far, our foemen.
meaning: उ॒प श्वासय पृथिवी॒म् उत॒ द्यं॒ पुरुत्रा॒ ते वन्वतां वि॒ष्ठितम् ज॒गत् । स॒ दुन्दुभे सजू॒र् इ॒न्द्रेण देवै॒र् दूरा॒द् द॒वीयो अ॒प सेध श॒त्रून् ॥१॥

text: Thunder out strength and fill us full of vigour, yea, thunder forth and drive away misfortunes. Drive hence, O Drum, drive thou away mischances. Thou art the fist of Indra, show thy firmness.
meaning: आ॒ क्रन्दय ब॒लम् ओ॒जो न आ॒ धा अभि॒ ष्टन दुरिता॒ बा॒धमानः । अ॒प सेध दुन्दुभे दुछु॒नाम् इत॒ इ॒न्द्रस्य मुष्टि॒र् असि वीड॒यस्व ॥२॥

text: Conquer those yonder and let these be victors. Let the Drum speak aloud as battle's signal. Let our men, winged with horses, fly together. Let our car- warriors, Indra! be triumphant.
meaning: प्रा॒मूं॒ जयाभी॒मे॒ जयन्तु केतुम॒द् दुन्दुभि॒र् वावदीतु । स॒म् अ॒श्वपर्णाः पतन्तु नो न॒रो ऽस्मा॒कम् इन्द्र रथि॒नो जयन्तु ॥३॥

text: Of abscess, of decline, of inflammation of the eyes. O Plant, Of penetrating pain, thou Herb, let not a particle remain.
meaning: विद्रध॒स्य बला॒सस्य लो॒हितस्य वनस्पते । विस॒ल्पकस्यौषधे मो॒च् छिषः पिशितं॒ चन॒ ॥१॥

text: Those nerves of thine, Consumption! which stand closely hidden in thy groin I know the balm for that disease: the magic cure is Sipudru.
meaning: यौ॒ ते बलास ति॒ष्ठतः क॒क्षे मुष्का॒व् अ॒पश्रितौ । वे॒दाहं॒ त॒स्य भेषजं॒ चीपु॒द्रुर् अभिच॒क्षणम् ॥२॥

text: We draw from thee piercing pain that penetrates and racks thy limbs, That pierces ears, that pierces eyes, the abscess, and the heart's disease. Downward and far away from thee we banish that unknown. decline.
meaning: यो॒ अ॒ङ्ग्यो यः॒ क॒र्ण्यो यो॒ अक्ष्यो॒र् विस॒ल्पकः । वि॒ वृहामो विस॒ल्पकं विद्रधं॒ हृदयामय॒म् । प॒रा त॒म् अ॒ज्ञातम् य॒क्ष्मम् अधरा॒ञ्चं सुवामसि ॥३॥

text: What time the heavenly bodies chose the Weather Prophet as their King, They brought him favouring weather, and, Let this be his do- main, they said.
meaning: शकधू॒मं न॒क्षत्राणि य॒द् रा॒जानम् अ॒कुर्वत । भद्राह॒म् अस्मै प्रा॒यछन् इदं॒ राष्ट्र॒म् अ॒साद् इ॒ति ॥१॥

text: May we have weather fair at noon, May we have weather fair at eve, Fair weather when the morning breaks, fair weather when the night is come.
meaning: भद्राहं॒ नो मध्यं॒दिने भद्राहं॒ साय॒म् अस्तु नः । भद्राहं॒ नो अ॒ह्नां प्राता॒ रा॒त्री भद्राह॒म् अस्तु नः ॥२॥

text: Fair weather to the day and night, and to the stars and sun and moon. Give favourable weather thou, King, Weather Prophet, unto us.
meaning: अहोरात्रा॒भ्यां न॒क्षत्रेभ्यः सुर्याचन्द्रम॒साभ्याम् । भद्राह॒म् अस्म॒भ्यं राजन् छ॒कधूम त्वं॒ कृधि ॥३॥

text: Be worship ever paid to thee, O Weather Prophet, King of Star s, Who gavest us oo weather in the evening and by night and day!
meaning: यो॒ नो भद्राह॒म् अ॒करः सायं॒ न॒क्तम् अथो दि॒वा । त॒स्मै ते नक्षत्रराज श॒कधूम स॒दा न॒मः ॥४॥

text: With fortune of the Sisu tree—with Indra as my friend to aid I give myself a happy fate. Fly and begone, Malignities!
meaning: भ॒गेन मा शांशपे॒न साक॒म् इ॒न्द्रेण मेदि॒ना । कृणो॒मि भगि॒नं मा॒प द्रान्त्व् अ॒रातयः ॥१॥

text: That splendour and felicity wherewith thou hast excelled the trees Give me therewith a happy fate. Fly and begone, Malignities
meaning: ये॒न वृक्षां॒ अभ्य॒भवो भ॒गेन व॒र्चसा सह॒ । ते॒न मा भगि॒नं कृण्व् अ॒प द्रान्त्व् अ॒रातयः ॥२॥

text: Blind fortune, with reverted leaves that is deposited in trees— Give me therewith a happy fate. Fly and begone, Malignities.
meaning: यो॒ अन्धो॒ यः॒ पुनःसरो॒ भ॒गो वृक्षे॒ष्व् आ॒हितः । ते॒न मा भगि॒नं कृण्व् अ॒प द्रान्त्व् अ॒रातयः ॥३॥

text: This is the Apsarases' love-spell, the conquering, resistless ones'. Send the spell forth, ye Deities! Let him consume with love of me.
meaning: रथजि॒तां राथजितेयी॒नाम् अप्सर॒साम् अयं॒ स्मरः॒ । दे॒वाः प्र॒ हिणुत स्मर॒म् असौ॒ मा॒म् अ॒नु शोचतु ॥१॥

text: I pray, may he remember me, think of me, loving and beloved. Send forth the spell, ye Deities! Let him consume with love of me.
meaning: असौ॒ मे स्मरताद् इ॒ति प्रियो॒ मे स्मरताद् इ॒ति । दे॒वाः प्र॒ हिणुत स्मर॒म् असौ॒ मा॒म् अ॒नु शोचतु ॥२॥

text: That he may think of me, that I may never, never think of him,. Send forth the spell, ye Deities! Let him consume with love of me.
meaning: य॒था म॒म स्म॒राद् असौ॒ ना॒मु॒ष्याहं॒ कदा॒ चन॒ । दे॒वाः प्र॒ हिणुत स्मर॒म् असौ॒ मा॒म् अ॒नु शोचतु ॥३॥

text: Madden him, Maruts, madden him. Madden him, madden him, O Air. Madden him, Agni, madden him. Let him consume with love of me.
meaning: उ॒न् मादयत मरुत उ॒द् अन्तरिक्ष मादय । अ॒ग्न उ॒न् मादया त्व॒म् असौ॒ मा॒म् अ॒नु शोचतु ॥४॥

text: Down upon thee, from head to foot, I draw the pangs of long- ing love. Send forth the charm, ye Deities! Let him consume with love of me.
meaning: नि॒ शीर्षतो॒ नि॒ पत्तत॒ आध्यो॑ नि॒ तिरामि ते । दे॒वाः प्र॒ हिणुत स्मर॒म् असौ॒ मा॒म् अ॒नु शोचतु ॥१॥

text: Assent to this, O Heavenly Grace! Celestial Purpose, guide it well! Send forth the charm, ye Deities! Let him consume with love of me.
meaning: अ॒नुमते ऽन्व् इदं॒ मन्यस्वा॒कुते स॒म् इदं॒ न॒मः । दे॒वाः प्र॒ हिणुत स्मर॒म् असौ॒ मा॒म् अ॒नु शोचतु ॥२॥

text: If thou shouldst run three leagues away, five leagues, a horse's daily stage, Thence thou shalt come to me again and be the father of our sons.
meaning: य॒द् धा॒वसि त्रियोजनं॒ पञ्चयोजन॒म् आ॒श्विनम् । त॒तस् त्वं॒ पु॒नर् आ॒यसि पुत्रा॒णां नो असः पिता॒ ॥३॥

text: The Philter, burning with the pangs of yearning love, which Gods have poured within the bosom of the floods, That spell for thee I heat by Varuna's decree.
meaning: यं॒ देवाः॒ स्मर॒म् अ॒सिञ्चन्न् अप्स्व् अ॑न्तः॒ शो॒शुचानं सहा॒ध्या॒ । तं॒ ते तपामि व॒रुणस्य ध॒र्मणा ॥१॥

text: The charm which, burning with the pangs of love, the General Gods have poured within the bosom of the floods, That spell for thee I heat by Varuna's decree.
meaning: यं॒ वि॒श्वे देवाः॒ स्मर॒म् अ॒सिञ्चन्न् अप्स्व् अ॑न्तः॒ शो॒शुचानं सहा॒ध्या॒ । तं॒ ते तपामि व॒रुणस्य ध॒र्मणा ॥२॥

text: The Philter, burning with the pangs of longing, which Indrāni hath effused within the waters' depth, That spell for thee I heat by Varuna's decree.
meaning: य॒म् इन्द्राणी॒ स्मर॒म् अ॒सिञ्चद् अप्स्व् अ॑न्तः॒ शो॒शुचानं सहा॒ध्या॒ । तं॒ ते तपामि व॒रुणस्य ध॒र्मणा ॥३॥

text: The charm, aglow with longing, which Indra and Agni have effused within the bosom of the floods, That spell for thee I heat by Varuna's decree.
meaning: य॒म् इन्द्राग्नी॒ स्मर॒म् अ॒सिञ्चताम् अप्स्व् अ॑न्तः॒ शो॒शुचानं सहा॒ध्या॒ । तं॒ ते तपामि व॒रुणस्य ध॒र्मणा ॥४॥

text: The charm aglow with longing which Mitra and Varuna have poured within the bosom of the floods, That spell for thee I heat by Varuna's decree.
meaning: य॒म् मित्रा॒व॒रुणौ स्मर॒म् अ॒सिञ्चताम् अप्स्व् अ॑न्तः॒ शो॒शुचानं सहा॒ध्या॒ । तं॒ ते तपामि व॒रुणस्य ध॒र्मणा ॥५॥

text: By the direction of that God we journey, he will seek means to save and he will free us; The God who hath engirt us with this Girdle, he who hath fast- ened it, and made us ready.
meaning: य॒ इमां॒ देवो॒ मे॒खलाम् आबब॒न्ध यः॒ संनना॒ह य॒ उ नो युयो॒ज । य॒स्य देव॒स्य प्रशि॒षा च॒रामः स॒ पार॒म् इछात् स॒ उ नो वि॒ मुञ्चात् ॥१॥

text: Thou, weapon of the Rishis, art adored and served with sacrifice. First tasting of the votive milk, Zone, be a hero-slayer thou!
meaning: आ॒हुतास्य् अभि॒हुत ऋ॒षीणाम् अस्य् आ॒युधम् । पू॒र्वा व्रत॒स्य प्राश्नती॒ वीरघ्नी॒ भव मेखले ॥२॥

text: As I am now Death's Brahmachāri claiming out of the living world a man for Yama, So with Austerity and Prayer and Fervour I bind this Girdle round the man before me.
meaning: मृत्यो॒र् अहं॒ ब्रह्मचारी॒ य॒द् अ॒स्मि निर्या॒चन् भूता॒त् पु॒रुषं यमा॒य । त॒म् अहं॒ ब्र॒ह्मणा त॒पसा श्र॒मेणान॒यैनं मे॒खलया सिनामि ॥३॥

text: She hath become, Faith's daughter, sprung from Fervour, the sister of the world-creating Rishis; As such, O Girdle, give us thought and wisdom, give us religious zeal and mental vigour.
meaning: श्रद्धा॒या दुहिता॒ त॒पसो॒ ऽधि जाता॒ स्व॒सा ऋ॒षीणां भूतकृ॒तां बभू॒व । सा॒ नो मेखले मति॒म् आ॒ धेहि मेधा॒म् अ॒थो नो धेहि त॒प इन्द्रियं॒ च ॥४॥

text: Thou whom primeval Rishis girt about them, they who made the world, As such do thou encircle me, O Girdle, for long days of life.
meaning: यां॒ त्वा पू॒र्वे भूतकृ॒त ऋ॒षयः परिबेधिरे॒ । सा॒ त्वं॒ प॒रि ष्वजस्व मां॒ दीर्घायुत्वा॒य मेखले ॥५॥

text: This Thunderbolt shall take its fill of Order, scare life away and overthrow the kingdom. Tear necks in pieces. rend napes asunder, even as the Lord of Might the neck of Vritra.
meaning: अयं॒ व॒ज्रस् तर्पयताम् ऋत॒स्यावास्य राष्ट्र॒म् अ॒प हन्तु जीवित॒म् । शृणा॒तु ग्रीवाः॒ प्र॒ शृणातूष्णि॒हा वृत्र॒स्येव श॒चीप॒तिः ॥१॥

text: Down, down beneath the conquerors, let him not rise, concealed in earth, but lie down-smitten with the bolt.
meaning: अ॒धरोऽधर उ॒त्तरेभ्यो गूढः॒ पृथिव्या॒ मो॒त् सृपत् । व॒ज्रेणा॒वहतः शयाम् ॥२॥

text: Seek out the fierce oppressor, yea, strike only the oppressor dead. Down on the fierce oppressor's head strike at full length, O Thunderbolt!
meaning: यो॒ जिना॒ति त॒म् अ॒न्विछ यो॒ जिना॒ति त॒म् इ॒ज् जहि । जिनतो॒ वज्र त्वं॒ सीम॒न्तम् अन्व॒ञ्चम् अ॒नु पातय ॥३॥

text: Whate'er I eat I turn to strength, and thus I grasp the Thunder- bolt, Rending the shoulders of that man as Indra shattered Vritra's neck.
meaning: य॒द् अश्ना॒मि ब॒लं कुर्व इत्थं॒ व॒ज्रम् आ॒ ददे । स्कन्धा॒न् अमु॒ष्य शात॒यन् वृत्र॒स्येव श॒चीप॒तिः ॥१॥

text: I drink together what I drink, even as the sea that swallows all. Drinking the life-breath of that man, we drink that man and swallow him.
meaning: य॒त् पि॒बामि सं॒ पिबामि समुद्र॒ इव संपिबः॒ । प्राणा॒न् अमु॒ष्य संपा॒य सं॒ पिबामो अमुं॒ वय॒म् ॥२॥

text: Whate'er I eat I swallow up, even as the sea that swallows all. Swallowing that man's vital breath, we swallow him completely up.
meaning: य॒द् गि॒रामि सं॒ गि॒रामि समुद्र॒ इव संगिरः॒ । प्राणा॒न् अमु॒ष्य संगी॒र्य सं॒ गिरामो अमु॒म् वय॒म् ॥३॥

text: Born from the bosom of wide Earth the Goddess, godlike Plant, art thou: So we, Nitatnī! dig thee up to strengthen and fix fast the hair.
meaning: देवी॒ देव्या॒म् अ॒धि जाता॒ पृथिव्या॒म् अस्य् ओषधे । तां॒ त्वा नितत्नि के॒शेभ्यो दृं॒हणाय खनामसि ॥१॥

text: Make the old firm, make new hair spring, lengthen what has already grown.
meaning: दृं॒ह प्रत्ना॒न् जन॒या॒जातान् जाता॒न् उ व॒र्षीयसस् कृधि ॥२॥

text: Thy hair where it is falling off, and with the roots is torn away, I wet and sprinkle with the Plant, the remedy for all disease.
meaning: य॒स् ते के॒शो ऽवप॒द्यते स॒मूलो य॒श् च वृश्च॒ते । इदं॒ तं॒ विश्व॒भेषज्याभि॒ षिञ्चामि वीरु॒धा ॥३॥

text: The Plant which Jamadagni dug to make his daughter's locks. grow long, This same hath Vitahavya brought to us from Asita's abode.
meaning: यां॒ जम॒दग्निर् अ॒खनद् दुहित्रे॒ केशव॒र्धनीम् । तां॒ वीत॒हव्य आ॒भरद् अ॒सितस्य गृहे॒भ्यः ॥१॥

text: They might be measured with a rein, meted with both extended arms. Let the black locks spring thick and strong and grow like reeds upon thy head.
meaning: अभी॒शुना मे॒या आसन् व्यामे॒नानुमे॒याः । के॒शा नडा॒ इव वर्धन्तां शीर्ष्ण॒स् ते असिताः॒ प॒रि ॥२॥

text: Strengthen the roots, prolong the points, lengthen the middle part, O Plant. Let the black locks spring thick and strong and grow like reeds upon thy head.
meaning: दृं॒ह मू॒लम् आ॒ग्रं यछ वि॒ म॒ध्यं यामयौषधे । के॒शा नडा॒ इव वर्धन्ताम् शीर्ष्ण॒स् ते असिताः॒ प॒रि ॥३॥

text: O Plant, thy fame is spread abroad as best of all the herbs that grow. Unman for me to-day this man that he may wear the horn of hair.
meaning: त्वं॒ वीरु॒धां श्रे॒ष्ठतमाभिश्रुता॒स्य् ओषधे । इमं॒ मे अद्य॒ पु॒रुषं क्लीब॒म् ओपशि॒नं कृधि ॥१॥

text: Make him a eunuch with a horn, set thou the crest upon his- head. Let Indra with two pressing-stones deprive him of his manly strength.
meaning: क्लीबं॒ कृध्य् ओपशि॒नम् अ॒थो कुरीरि॒णं कृधि । अ॒थास्ये॒न्द्रो ग्रा॒वभ्याम् उभे॒ भिनत्त्व् आण्ड्यौ॑ ॥२॥

text: I have unmanned thee, eunuch! yea, impotent! made thee- impotent, and robbed thee, weakling! of thy strength. Upon his head we set the horn, we set the branching ornament.
meaning: क्ली॒ब क्लीबं॒ त्वाकरं व॒ध्रे व॒ध्रिं त्वाकरम् अ॒रसारसं॒ त्वाकरम् । कुरी॒रम् अस्य शीर्ष॒णि कु॒म्बं चाधिनि॒दध्मसि ॥३॥

text: Duas tuas venas, a Diis factas, in quibus stat vigor virilis, paxillo ligneo in testiculis ob istam mulierem tibi findo.
meaning: ये॒ ते नाद्यौ॑ देव॒कृते य॒योस् ति॒ष्ठति वृ॒ष्ण्यम् । ते॒ ते भिनद्मि श॒म्ययामु॒ष्या अ॒धि मुष्क॒योः ॥४॥

text: Ut mulieres mattam (tegetem) facturae arundinem lapide findunt, sic fascinum tuum cum testiculis ob istam mulierem findo.
meaning: य॒था नड॒म् कशि॒पुने स्त्रि॒यो भिन्द॒न्त्य् अ॒श्मना । एवा॒ भिनद्मि ते शे॒पो ऽमु॒ष्या अ॒धि मुष्क॒योः ॥५॥

text: Thou hast grown up, a source of joy to bless me with pros- perity. A hundred are thy tendrils, three-and-thirty thy descending shoots. With this that bears a thousand leaves I dry thy heart and wither it.
meaning: न्यस्तिका॒ रुरोहिथ सुभगंक॒रणी म॒म । शतं॒ त॒व प्रताना॒स् त्र॒यस्त्रिंशन् नितानाः॒ ॥ त॒या सहस्रपर्ण्या॒ हृ॒दयं शोषयामि ते ॥१॥

text: Let thy heart wither for my love and let thy month be dry for me. Parch and dry up with longing, go with lips that love of me hath dried.
meaning: शु॒ष्यतु म॒यि ते हृ॒दयम् अ॒थो शुष्यत्व् आस्य॑म् । अ॒थो नि॒ शुष्य मां॒ का॒मेना॒थो शु॒ष्कास्या चर ॥२॥

text: Drive us together, tawny! fair! a go-between who wakens love. Drive us together, him and me, and give us both one heart and mind.
meaning: संव॒ननी समुष्पला॒ ब॒भ्रु क॒ल्याणि सं॒ नुद । अमूं॒ च मां॒ च सं॒ नुद समानं॒ हृ॒दयं कृधि ॥३॥

text: Even as his mouth is parched who finds no water for his burn- ing thirst, So parch and burn with longing, go with lips that love of me hath dried.
meaning: य॒थोदक॒म् अ॒पपुषो ऽपशु॒ष्यत्य् आस्य॑म् । एवा॒ नि॒ शुष्य मां॒ का॒मेना॒थो शु॒ष्कास्या चर ॥४॥

text: Even as the Mungoose bites and rends and then restores the wounded snake, So do thou, Mighty one, restore the fracture of our severed love.
meaning: य॒था नकुलो॒ विछि॒द्य संद॒धात्य् अ॒हिं पु॒नः । एवा॒ का॒मस्य वि॒छिन्नं सं॒ धेहि वीर्यावति ॥५॥

text: Two tigers have grown up who long to eat the mother and the sire: Soothe, Brāhmanaspati, and thou, O Jātavedas, both these teeth.
meaning: यौ॒ व्याघ्रा॒व् अ॒वरूधौ जि॒घत्सतः पित॒रं मात॒रं च । तौ॒ द॒न्तं ब्रह्मणस् पते शिवौ॒ कृणु जातवेदः ॥१॥

text: Let rice and barley be your food, eat also beans and sesamum. This is the share allotted you, to be your portion, ye two Teeth. Harm not your mother and your sire.
meaning: व्रीहि॒म् अत्तं य॒वम् अत्तम् अ॒थो मा॒षम् अ॒थो ति॒लम् । एष॒ वां भागो॒ नि॒हितो रत्नधे॒याय दन्तौ मा॒ हिंसिष्टं पित॒रम् मात॒रं च ॥२॥

text: Both fellow teeth have been invoked, gentle and bringing happi- ness. Else whither let the fierceness of your nature turn away, O Teeth! Harm not your mother or your sire.
meaning: उ॒पहूतौ सयु॒जौ स्योनौ॒ द॒न्तौ सुमङ्ग॒लौ । अन्य॒त्र वां घोरं॒ तन्वः॑ प॒रैतु दन्तौ मा॒ हिंसिष्टं पित॒रं मात॒रं च ॥३॥

text: Vayu collected these: to find their sustenance be Tvashtar's care: May Indra bless and comfort them, and Rudra look that they increase.
meaning: वायु॒र् एनाः समा॒करत् त्व॒ष्टा पो॒षाय ध्रियताम् । इ॒न्द्र आभ्यो अ॒धि ब्रवद् रुद्रो॒ भूम्ने॒ चिकित्सतु ॥१॥

text: Take thou the iron axe and make a pair by marks upon their ears. This sign the Asvins have impressed: let these increase and multiply.
meaning: लो॒हितेन स्व॒धितिना मिथुनं॒ क॒र्णयोः कृधि । अ॒कर्ताम् अश्विना ल॒क्ष्म त॒द् अस्तु प्रज॒या बहु॒ ॥२॥

text: Even as Gods and Asuras, even as mortal men have done, Do ye, that these may multiply in thousands, Asvins! make the mark.
meaning: य॒था चक्रु॒र् देवासुरा॒ य॒था मनुष्या॑ उत॒ । एवा॒ सहस्रपोषा॒य कृणुतं॒ ल॒क्ष्माश्विना ॥३॥

text: Spring high, O Barley, and become much through thine own magnificence: Burst all the vessels; let the bolt from heaven forbear to strike thee down.
meaning: उ॒च् छ्रयस्व बहु॒र् भव स्वे॒न म॒हसा यव । मृणीहि॒ वि॒श्वा पा॒त्राणि मा॒ त्वा दिव्या॒श॒निर् वधीत् ॥१॥

text: As we invite and call to thee, Barley, a God who heareth us, Raise thyself up like heaven on high and be exhaustless as the sea.
meaning: आशृण्व॒न्तं य॒वं देवं॒ य॒त्र त्वाछाव॒दामसि । त॒द् उ॒च् छ्रयस्व द्यौ॒र् इव समुद्र॒ इवैध्य् अ॒क्षितः ॥२॥

text: Exhaustless let thine out-turns be, exhaustless be thy gathered heaps, Exhaustless be thy givers, and exhaustless those who eat of thee.
meaning: अ॒क्षितास् त उपस॒दो॒ ऽक्षिताः सन्तु राश॒यः । पृण॒न्तो अ॒क्षिताः सन्त्व् अत्ता॒रः सन्त्व् अ॒क्षिताः ॥३॥

text: They who by thought have guided all that Speech hath best, or they who with their heart have uttered words of truth, Made stronger by the strength which the third prayer bestows, have by the fourth prayer learned the nature of the Cow.
meaning: धीती॒ वा ये॒ अ॒नयन् वाचो॒ अ॒ग्रं म॒नसा वा ये॒ ऽवदन्न् ऋता॒नि । तृती॒येन ब्र॒ह्मणा वावृधाना॒स् तुरी॒येणामन्वत ना॒म धेनोः॒ ॥१॥

text: Well knows this son his sire, he knows his mother well: he hath been son, and he hath been illiberal. He hath encompassed heaven, and air's mid-realm, and sky; he hath become this All; he hath come nigh to us.
meaning: स॒ वेद पुत्रः॒ पित॒रं स॒ मात॒रं स॒ सूनु॒र् भुवत् स॒ भुवत् पु॒नर्मघः । स॒ द्या॒म् और्णोद् अन्त॒रिक्षं स्वः॑ स॒ इदं॒ वि॒श्वम् अभवत् स॒ आ॒भरत् ॥२॥

text: Invoke for us, proclaim in sundry places, the kinsman of the Gods, our sire Atharvan, His mother's germ, his father's breath, the youthful, who with his mind hath noticed this oblation.
meaning: अ॒थर्वाणं पित॒रं देव॒बन्धुं मातु॒र् ग॒र्भं पितु॒र् अ॒सुं यु॒वानम् । य॒ इमं॒ यज्ञ॒म् म॒नसा चिके॒त प्र॒ णो वोचस् त॒म् इहे॒ह॒ ब्रवः ॥१॥

text: He, in this manner showing forth his exploits—for he, bright God, is our broad way for choosing— Rose up to meet his stay, the mead’s best portion: of his own self he sent his body forward.
meaning: अया॒ विष्ठा॒ जन॒यन् क॒र्वराणि स॒ हि॒ घृ॒णिर् उरु॒र् व॒राय गातुः॒ । स॒ प्रत्यु॒दैद् धरु॒णं म॒ध्वो अ॒ग्रं स्व॒या तन्वा॑ तन्व॑म् ऐरयत ॥१॥

text: With thine eleven teams, to aid our wishes, yea, with thy two- and-twenty teams, O Vāyu, With all thy three-and-thirty teams for drawing, here loose these teams, thou who art prompt to listen!
meaning: ए॒कया च दश॒भिश् च सुहुते द्वा॒भ्याम् इष्ट॒ये विंशत्या॒ च । तिसृ॒भिश् च व॒हसे त्रिंश॒ता च वियु॒ग्भिर् वाय इह॒ ता॒ वि॒ मुञ्च ॥१॥

text: The Gods adored the Sacrifice with worship: these were the statutes of primeval ages. Those mighty ones attained the cope of heaven, there where the Sādhyas, Gods of old, are dwelling.
meaning: यज्ञे॒न यज्ञ॒म् अयजन्त देवा॒स् ता॒नि ध॒र्माणि प्रथमा॒न्य् आसन् । ते॒ ह ना॒कं महिमा॒नः सचन्त य॒त्र पू॒र्वे साध्याः॒ स॒न्ति देवाः॒ ॥१॥

text: Sacrifice was, was manifest among us: it sprang to life and then in time grew stronger. Then it became thedeities' lord and ruler: may it bestow on us abundant riches.
meaning: यज्ञो॒ बभूव स॒ आ॒ बभूव स॒ प्र॒ जज्ञे स॒ उ वावृधे पु॒नः । स॒ देवा॒नाम् अ॒धिपतिर् बभूव सो॒ अस्मा॒सु द्र॒विणम् आ॒ दधातु ॥२॥

text: Where the Gods worshipped Gods with their oblation, worship- ped immortals with immortal spirit, There in the loftiest heaven may we be happy, and look upon that light when Sūrya rises.
meaning: य॒द् देवा॒ देवा॒न् हवि॒षा ऽयजन्ता॒मर्त्यान् म॒नसा॒ मर्त्येन । म॒देम त॒त्र परमे॒ व्यो॑मन् प॒श्येम त॒द् उ॒दितौ सू॒र्यस्य ॥३॥

text: With their oblation, Purusha, the Gods performed a sacrifice. A sacrifice more potent still they paid with the invoking hymn.
meaning: य॒त् पु॒रुषेण हवि॒षा यज्ञं॒ देवा॒ अ॒तन्वत । अस्ति नु॒ त॒स्माद् ओ॒जीयो य॒द् विह॒व्येनेजिरे॒ ॥४॥

text: With dog the Gods, perplexed, have paid oblation, and with cow's limbs in sundry sacrifices. Invoke for us, in many a place declare him who with his mind. hath noticed this our worship.
meaning: मुग्धा॒ देवा॒ उत॒ शु॒ना॒ ऽयजन्तोत॒ गो॒र् अ॒ङ्गैः पुरुधा॒ ऽयजन्त । य॒ इमं॒ यज्ञं॒ म॒नसा चिके॒त प्र॒ णो वोचस् त॒म् इहे॒ह॒ ब्रवः ॥५॥

text: Aditi is sky, and air's mid-region, Aditi is the father, son, and mother, Aditi all the Gods and the Five Nations, Aditi what is now and what is future.
meaning: अ॒दितिर् द्यौ॒र् अ॒दितिर् अन्त॒रिक्षम् अ॒दितिर् माता॒ स॒ पिता॒ स॒ पुत्रः॒ । वि॒श्वे देवा॒ अ॒दितिर् प॒ञ्च ज॒ना अ॒दितिर् जात॒म् अ॒दितिर् ज॒नित्वम् ॥१॥

text: We call for help the Queen of Law and Order, great mother of all those whose ways are righteous, Far-spread, unwasting strong in her dominion, Aditi wisely lead- ing, well protecting.
meaning: मही॒म् ऊ षु॒ मात॒रं सुव्रता॒नाम् ऋत॒स्य प॒त्नीम् अ॒वसे हवामहे । तुविक्षत्रा॒म् अज॒रन्तीम् उरूचीं॒ सुश॒र्माणम् अ॒दितिं सुप्र॒णीतिम् ॥२॥

text: Sinless may we ascend, for weal, the vessel, rowed with good oars, divine, that never leaketh, Earth, our strong guard, incomparable Heaven, Aditi wisely lead- ing, well protecting.
meaning: सुत्रा॒माणं पृथिवीं॒ द्या॒म् अनेह॒सं सुश॒र्माणम् अ॒दितिं सुप्र॒णीतिम् । दै॒वीं ना॒वं स्वरित्रा॒म् अ॒नागसो अ॒स्रवन्तीम् आ॒ रुहेमा स्वस्त॒ये ॥१॥

text: Let us bring hither, in pursuit of riches, Aditi with our word, the mighty mother, Her in whose lap the spacious air is lying: may she afford us triply-guarding shelter!
meaning: वा॒जस्य नु॒ प्रसवे॒ मात॒रं मही॒म् अ॒दितिं ना॒म व॒चसा करामहे । य॒स्या उप॒स्थ उर्व् अ॑न्त॒रिक्षं सा॒ नः श॒र्म त्रिव॒रूथं नि॒ यछात् ॥२॥

text: I have sung praise to Diti's sons and Aditi's, those very lofty and invulnerable Gods. For far within the depths of ocean is their home and in the wor- ship paid them none excelleth these.
meaning: दि॒तेः पुत्रा॒णाम् अ॒दितेर् अकारिषम् अ॒व देवा॒नां बृहता॒म् अनर्म॒णाम् । ते॒षां हि॒ धा॒म गभिष॒क् समुद्रि॒यं नै॒नान् न॒मसा परो॒ अस्ति क॒श्चन॒ ॥१॥

text: Go forward on thy way from good to better: Brihaspati pre- cede thy steps and guide thee! Place this man here, within this earth's enclosure, afar from foes with all his men about him.
meaning: भद्रा॒द् अ॒धि श्रे॒यः प्रे॒हि बृ॒हस्प॒तिः पुरएता॒ ते अस्तु । अ॒थेम॒म् अस्या॒ व॒र आ॒ पृथिव्या॒ आरे॒शत्रुं कृणुहि स॒र्ववीरम् ॥१॥

text: Pūshan was born to move on distant pathways, on roads remote from earth, remote from heaven. To both most lovely places of assembly he travels and returns with perfect knowledge.
meaning: प्र॒पथे पथा॒म् अजनिष्ट पूषा॒ प्र॒पथे दिवः॒ प्र॒पथे पृथिव्याः॒ । उभे॒ अभि॒ प्रिय॒तमे सध॒स्थे आ॒ च प॒रा च चरति प्रजान॒न् ॥१॥

text: Pūshan knows all these realms: may he conduct us by ways that are most free from fear and danger. Giver of blessings, glowing, all heroic, may he the wise and watchful go before us.
meaning: पूषे॒मा॒ आ॒शा अ॒नु वेद स॒र्वाः सो॒ अस्मां॒ अ॒भयतमेन नेषत् । स्वस्तिदा॒ आ॒घृणिः स॒र्ववीरो॒ ऽप्रयुछन् पुर॒ एतु प्रजान॒न् ॥२॥

text: We are thy praisers here, O Pūshan: never let us be injured under thy protection.
meaning: पू॒षन् त॒व व्रते॒ वयं॒ न॒ रिष्येम कदा॒ चन॒ । स्तोता॒रस् त इह॒ स्मसि ॥३॥

text: From out the distance, far and wide, may Pūshan stretch his right hand forth. Let him drive back our lost to us, let us return with what is lost.
meaning: प॒रि पूषा॒ पर॒स्ताद् ध॒स्तं दधातु द॒क्षिणम् । पु॒नर् नो नष्ट॒म् आ॒जतु सं॒ नष्टे॒न गमेमहि ॥४॥

text: That breast of thine, exhaustless and delightful, good to invoke, beneficent, free giver. Wherewith thou feedest all things that are choicest, bring that, Sarasvati, that we may drain it.
meaning: य॒स् ते स्त॒नः शशयु॒र् यो॒ मयोभू॒र् यः॒ सुम्नयुः॒ सुह॒वो यः॒ सुद॒त्रः । ये॒न वि॒श्वा पु॒ष्यसि वा॒र्याणि स॒रस्वति त॒म् इह॒ धा॒तवे कः ॥१॥

text: That far-spread thunder, sent from thee, which cometh on all this world, a high celestial signal Strike not, O God, our growing corn with lightning, not kill it with the burning rays of Sūrya.
meaning: य॒स् ते पृथु॒ स्तनयित्नु॒र् य॒ ऋष्वो॒ दै॒वः केतु॒र् वि॒श्वम् आभू॒षतीद॒म् । मा॒ नो वधीर् विद्यु॒ता देव सस्यं॒ मो॒त॒ वधी रश्मि॒भिः सू॒र्यस्य ॥१॥

text: In concord may Prajapati's two daughters, Gathering and As- sembly, both protect me. May every man I meet respect and aid me. Fair be my words, O Fathers, at the meetings.
meaning: सभा॒ च मा स॒मितिश् चावतां प्रजा॒पतेर् दुहित॒रौ संविदाने॒ । ये॒ना संग॒छा उ॒प मा स॒ शिक्षाच् चा॒रु वदानि पितरः सं॒गतेषु ॥१॥

text: We know thy name, O Conference: thy name is interchange of talk. Let all the company who join the Conference agree with me.
meaning: विद्म॒ ते सभे ना॒म नरि॒ष्टा ना॒म वा॒ असि । ये॒ ते के॒ च सभास॒दस् ते मे सन्तु स॒वाचसः ॥२॥

text: Of these men seated here I make the splendour and the lore mine own. Indra, make me conspicuous in all this gathered company.
meaning: एषा॒म् अहं॒ समा॒सीनानां व॒र्चो विज्ञा॒नम् आ॒ ददे । अस्याः॒ स॒र्वस्याः संस॒दो मा॒म् इन्द्र भगि॒नं कृणु ॥३॥

text: Whether your thoughts are turned away, or bound and fastened here or there, We draw them hitherward again: let your mind firmly rest on me.
meaning: य॒द् वो म॒नः प॒रागतं य॒द् बद्ध॒म् इह॒ वेह॒ वा । त॒द् व आ॒ वर्तयामसि म॒यि वो रमतां म॒नः ॥४॥
