text: As the Sun, rising, taketh to himself the brightness of the stars,. So I assume the glory of women and men mine enemies. All ye amang my rivals who behold me as I come to you, I seize the glory of my foes as the Sun, rising, theirs who sleep.
meaning: य॒था सू॒र्यो न॒क्षत्राणाम् उद्यं॒स् ते॒जांस्य् आददे॒ । एवा॒ स्त्रीणां॒ च पुंसां॒ च द्विषतां॒ व॒र्च आ॒ ददे ॥१॥

text: या॒वन्तो मा सप॒त्नानाम् आय॒न्तं प्रतिप॒श्यथ । उद्य॒न्त् सू॒र्य इव सुप्ता॒नां द्विषता॒म् व॒र्च आ॒ ददे ॥२॥
I praise this God, parent of heaven and earth, exceeding wiser possessed of real energy, giver of treasure, thinker dear to all,.
meaning: अभि॒ त्यं॒ देवं॒ सविता॒रम् ओण्योः॑ कवि॒क्रतुम् । अ॒र्चामि सत्य॒सवं रत्नधा॒म् अभि॒ प्रियं॒ मति॒म् ॥१॥

text: Whose splendour is sublime, whose light shone brilliant in crea- tion, who, wise, and golden-handed, in his beauty made the sky.
meaning: उर्ध्वा॒ य॒स्याम॒तिर् भा॒ अ॒दिद्युतत् स॒वीमनि । हि॒रण्यपाणिर् अमिमीत सुक्र॒तुः कृपा॒त् स्वः॑ ॥२॥

text: As thou, God! quickening, for our ancient father, sentest him height above and room about him, So unto us, O Savitar, send treasures, abundant, day by day, in shape of cattle.
meaning: सा॒वीर् हि॒ देव प्रथमा॒य पित्रे॒ वर्ष्मा॒णम् अस्मै वरिमा॒णम् अस्मै । अ॒थास्म॒भ्यं सवितर् वा॒र्याणि दिवो॒दिव आ॒ सुवा भू॒रि पश्वः॒ ॥३॥

text: Savitar, God, our household friend, most precious, hath sent our fathers life and power and riches. Let him drink Soma and rejoice when worshipped. Under his law even the Wanderer travels.
meaning: द॒मूना देवः॒ सविता॒ व॒रेण्यो द॒धद् र॒त्नं पितृ॒भ्य आ॒यूंषि । पि॒बात् सो॒मं मम॒दद् एनम् इष्टे॒ प॒रिज्मा चित् क्रमते अस्य ध॒र्मणि ॥४॥

text: I choose, O Savitar, that glorious favour, with fruitful energy and every blessing, Even this one's teeming cow, erst milked by Kanva, thousand- streamed, milked for happiness by the mighty.
meaning: तां॒ सवितः सत्य॒सवां सुचित्रा॒म् आ॒हं॒ वृणे सुमतिं॒ विश्व॒वाराम् । या॒म् अस्य क॒ण्वो अ॒दुहत् प्र॒पीनां सह॒स्रधारां महिषो॒ भ॒गाय ॥१॥

text: Increase this man Brihaspati! Illume him, O Savitar, for high and happy fortune. Sharpen him thoroughly though already sharpened: with glad acclaim let all the Gods receive him.
meaning: बृ॒हस्पते स॒वितर् वर्ध॒यैनं ज्योत॒यैनं महते॒ सौ॒भगाय । सं॒शितं चित् संतरं॒ सं॒ शिशाधि वि॒श्व एनम् अ॒नु मदन्तु देवाः॒ ॥१॥

text: May the Ordainer give us wealth, Lord, ruler of the world of life: with full hand may he give to us.
meaning: धाता॒ दधातु नो रयि॒म् ई॒शानो ज॒गतस् प॒तिः । स॒ नः पूर्णे॒न यछतु ॥१॥

text: May Dhātar grant the worshipper henceforth imperishable life. May we obtain the favour of the God who giveth every boon.
meaning: धाता॒ दधातु दाशु॒षे प्रा॒चीं जीवा॒तुम् अ॒क्षिताम् । वय॒म् देव॒स्य धीमहि सुमतिं॒ विश्व॒राधसः ॥२॥

text: To him may Dhātar grant all kinds of blessings who, craving children, serves him in his dwelling. Him may the Gods invest with life eternal, yea, all the Gods and Aditi accordant.
meaning: धाता॒ वि॒श्वा वा॒र्या दधातु प्रजा॒कामाय दाशु॒षे दुरोणे॒ । त॒स्मै देवा॒ अमृ॒तं सं॒ व्ययन्तु वि॒श्वे देवा॒ अ॒दितिः सजो॒षाः ॥३॥

text: May this our gift please Savitar, Rāti, Dhātar, Prajāpati, and Agni Lord of Treasures. May Tvashtar, Vishnu, blessing him with children, give store ot riches to the sacrificer.
meaning: धाता॒ रातिः॒ सविते॒दं॒ जुषन्तां प्रजा॒पतिर् निधि॒पतिर् नो अग्निः॒ । त्व॒ष्टा वि॒ष्णुः प्रज॒या संरराणो॒ य॒जमानाय द्र॒विणं दधातु ॥४॥

text: Burst open, Prithvi, and cleave asunder this celestial cloud. Untie, O Dhātar—for thou canst—the bottle of the breast of heaven.
meaning: प्र॒ नभस्व पृथिवि भिन्द्धी॑दं॒ दिव्यं॒ न॒भः । उद्नो॒ दिव्य॒स्य नो धातर् ई॒शानो वि॒ ष्या दृ॒तिम् ॥१॥

text: Let not the Sun's heat burn, nor cold destroy her. Let Earth with all her quickening drops burst open. Even for her the waters flow, and fatness: where Soma is even there is bliss for ever.
meaning: न॒ घ्रं॒स् तताप न॒ हिमो॒ जघान प्र॒ नभतां पृथिवी॒ जीर॒दानुः । आ॒पश् चिद् अस्मै घृत॒म् इ॒त् क्षरन्ति य॒त्र सो॒मः स॒दम् इ॒त् त॒त्र भद्र॒म् ॥२॥

text: Prajapati engenders earthly creatures: may the benevolent Ordainer form them, Having one common womb, and mind, and spirit. He who is. Lord of Plenty give me plenty!
meaning: प्रजा॒पतिर् जनयति प्रजा॒ इमा॒ धाता॒ दधातु सुमनस्य॒मानः । संजानानाः॒ सं॒मनसः स॒योनयो म॒यि पुष्टं॒ पुष्टप॒तिर् दधातु ॥१॥

text: Anumati approve to-day our sacrifice among the Gods! May Agni bear mine offerings away for me the worshipper.
meaning: अ॒न्व् अद्य॒ नो॒ ऽनुमतिर् यज्ञं॒ देवे॒षु मन्यताम् । अग्नि॒श् च हव्यवा॒हनो भ॒वतां दाशु॒षे म॒म ॥१॥

text: Do thou, Anumati! approve, and grant us health and happiness. Accept the offered sacrifice, and, Goddess, give us progeny.
meaning: अ॒न्व् इ॒द् अनुमते त्वं॒ मं॒ससे शं॒ च नस् कृधि । जु॒ष॒स्व हव्य॒म् आ॒हुतं प्रजां॒ देवि ररास्व नः ॥२॥

text: May he approving in return accord us wealth inexhaustible with store of children. Never may we be subject to his anger, but rest in his benevo- lence and mercy.
meaning: अ॒नु मन्यताम् अनुम॒न्यमानः प्रजा॒वन्तं रयि॒म् अ॒क्षीयमाणम् । त॒स्य वयं॒ हे॒डसि मा॒पि भूम सुमृडीके॒ अस्य सुमतौ॒ स्याम ॥३॥

text: Thy name is easy to invoke, good leader! approved, Anumati and rich in bounty. Source of all bonds! fill up therewith our worship, and, Blest One! grant us wealth with goodly heroes.
meaning: य॒त् ते ना॒म सुह॒वं सुप्रणीते॒ ऽनुमते अ॒नुमतं सुदा॒नु । ते॒ना नो यज्ञं॒ पिपृहि विश्ववारे रयिं॒ नो धेहि सुभगे सुवी॒रम् ॥४॥

text: Anumati hath come to this our worship well-formed to give good lands and valiant heroes: For her kind care hath blessed us. God-protected, may she assist the sacrifice we offer.
meaning: ए॒मं॒ यज्ञ॒म् अ॒नुमतिर् जगाम सुक्षेत्र॒तायै सुवीर॒तायै सु॒जातम् । भद्रा॒ ह्य् अ॑स्याः प्र॒मतिर् बभू॒व से॒म॒म् यज्ञ॒म् अवतु देव॒गोपा ॥५॥

text: Anumati became this All, whatever standeth or walketh, every- thing that moveth. May we enjoy thy gracious love, O Goddess. Regard us, O Anu- mati, with favour.
meaning: अ॒नुमतिः स॒र्वम् इदं॒ बभूव य॒त् ति॒ष्ठति च॒रति य॒द् उ च वि॒श्वम् ए॒जति । त॒स्यास् ते देवि सुमतौ॒ स्यामा॒नुमते अ॒नु हि॒ मं॒ससे नः ॥६॥

text: With prayer come all together to the Lord of Heaven: he is the peerless one, far-reaching, guest of men. He, God of ancient time, hath gained a recent thrall; to him alone is turned the path which all must tread.
meaning: समे॒त वि॒श्वे व॒चसा प॒तिं दिव॒ ए॒को विभू॒र् अ॒तिथिर् ज॒नानाम् । स॒ पूर्व्यो॒ नू॒तनम् आवि॒वासत् तं॒ वर्तनि॒र् अ॒नु वावृत ए॒कम् इ॒त् पुरु॒ ॥१॥

text: Unto a thousand sages he hath given sight: thought, light is he in ranging all.
meaning: अयं॒ सह॒स्रम् आ॒ नो दृशे॒ कवीनां॒ मति॒र् ज्यो॒तिर् वि॒धर्मणि ॥१॥

text: The Bright One hath sent forth the Dawns, a closely gathered band, Immaculate, unanimous, brightly refulgent in their homes.
meaning: ब्रध्नः॒ समी॒चीर् उष॒सः स॒म् ऐरयन् । अरेप॒सः स॒चेतसः स्व॒सरे मन्युम॒त्तमाश् चिते॒ गोः॒ ॥२॥

text: The fearful dream, and indigence, the monster, the malignant hags. All female fiends of evil name and wicked tongue we drive afar.
meaning: दौ॒ष्वप्न्यम् दौ॒र्जीवित्यं र॒क्षो अभ्व॑म् अराय्यः॑ । दुर्णा॒म्नीः स॒र्वा दुर्वा॒चस् ता॒ अस्म॒न् नाशयामसि ॥१॥

text: What treasure hath been dug for us by Indra, by Agni, Visve- devas, tuneful Maruts, On us may Savitar whose laws are faithful, Prajāpati, and Heavenly Grace bestow it.
meaning: य॒न् न इ॒न्द्रो अ॒खनद् य॒द् अग्नि॒र् वि॒श्वे देवा॒ मरु॒तो य॒त् स्वर्काः॒ । त॒द् अस्म॒भ्यं सविता॒ सत्य॒धर्मा प्रजा॒पतिर् अ॒नुमतिर् नि॒ यछात् ॥१॥

text: The early morning prayer hath come to Vishnu and Varuna, Lords through might, whom none hath equalled, Gods by whose power the realms of air were stablished, strongest and most heroic in their vigour.
meaning: य॒योर् ओ॒जसा स्कभिता॒ र॒जांसि यौ॒ वीर्यै॒र् वीर॒तमा श॒विष्ठा । यौ॒ प॒त्येते अ॒प्रतीतौ स॒होभिर् वि॒ष्णुम् अगन् व॒रुणं पूर्व॒हूतिः ॥१॥

text: The early prayer hath ever come to Vishnu and Varuna by that God's high power and statute. In whose control is all this world that shineth, all that hath powers to see and all that breatheth.
meaning: य॒स्येदं॒ प्रदि॒शि य॒द् विरो॒चते प्र॒ चा॒नति वि॒ च च॒ष्टे श॒चीभिः । पुरा॒ देव॒स्य ध॒र्मणा स॒होभिर् वि॒ष्णुम् अगन् व॒रुणं पूर्व॒हूतिः ॥२॥

text: I will declare the mighty deeds of Vishnu, of him who measured out the earthly regions, Who propped the highest place of congregation, thrice setting down his footstep, widely striding.
meaning: वि॒ष्णोर् नु॒ कं प्रा॒ वोचं वीर्या॑णि यः॒ पा॒र्थिवानि विममे॒ र॒जांसि । यो॒ अ॒स्कभायद् उ॒त्तरं सध॒स्थं विचक्रमाण॒स् त्रेधो॒रुगायः॒ ॥१॥

text: Loud boast doth Vishnu make of this achievement, like some wild beast, dread, prowling, mountain-roaming. May he approach us from the farthest distance.
meaning: प्र॒ त॒द् वि॒ष्णु स्तवते वीर्या॑णि मृगो॒ न॒ भीमः॒ कुचरो॒ गिरिष्ठाः॒ । पराव॒त आ॒ जगम्यात् प॒रस्याः ॥२॥

text: Thou within whose three wide-extended paces all worlds and creatures have their habitation, Drink oil, thou homed in oil! promote the sacrificer more and more.
meaning: य॒स्योरु॒षु त्रिषु॒ विक्र॒मनेष्व् अधिक्षिय॒न्ति भु॒वनानि वि॒श्वा । उरु॒ विष्णो वि॒ क्रमस्वोरु॒ क्ष॒याय नस् कृधि । घृत॒म् घृतयोने पिब प्र॒प्र यज्ञ॒पतिं तिर ॥३॥

text: Through all this world strode Vishnu: thrice his foot he planted, and the whole Was gathered in his footstep's dust.
meaning: इदं॒ वि॒ष्णुर् वि॒ चक्रमे त्रेधा॒ नि॒ दधे पदा॒ । स॒मूढम् अस्य पंसुरे॒ ॥४॥

text: Vishnu the guardian, he whom none deceiveth, made three steps, thenceforth. Establishing these high decrees.
meaning: त्री॒णि पदा॒ वि॒ चक्रमे वि॒ष्णुर् गोपा॒ अ॒दाभ्यः । इतो॒ ध॒र्माणि धार॒यन् ॥५॥

text: Look ye on Vishnu's works, whereby the friend of Indra, close- allied, Hath let his holy ways be seen.
meaning: वि॒ष्णोः क॒र्माणि पश्यत य॒तो व्रता॒नि पस्पशे॒ । इ॒न्द्रस्य यु॒ज्यः स॒खा ॥६॥

text: The princes evermore behold that loftiest place where Vishnu is, Like an extended eye in heaven,
meaning: त॒द् वि॒ष्णोः परमं॒ पदं॒ स॒दा पश्यन्ति सूर॒यः । दिवी॒व च॒क्षुर् आ॒ततम् ॥७॥

text: From heaven, O Vishnu, or from earth, O Vishnu, or from the great far-spreading air's mid-region, Fill both thy hands full of abundant treasures, and from the right and left bestow them freely.
meaning: दिवो॒ विष्ण उत॒ पृथिव्या॒ महो॒ विष्ण उरो॒र् अन्त॒रिक्षात् । ह॒स्तौ पृणस्व बहु॒भिर् वसव्यै॒र् आप्र॒यछ द॒क्षिणाद् ओ॒त॒ सव्या॒त् ॥८॥

text: May Idā with her statute dwell beside us, she in whose place the pious purge and cleanse them. She, mighty, Soma-decked, whose foot drops fatness, meet for All-Gods, hath come to aid our worship.
meaning: इ॒डैवा॒स्मां॒ अ॒नु वस्तां व्रते॒न य॒स्याः पदे॒ पुन॒ते देवय॒न्तः । घृत॒पदी श॒क्वरी सो॒मपृष्ठो॒प यज्ञ॒म् अस्थित वैश्वदेवी॒ ॥१॥

text: Blest be the Broom, may the Mace bring a blessing, and may the Altar and the Hatchet bless us. Worshipful Gods, may they accept this worship, lovers of sacri- fice, and sacrificers.
meaning: वेदः॒ स्वस्ति॒र् द्रुघणः॒ स्वस्तिः॒ परशु॒र् वे॒दिः परशु॒र् नः स्वस्ति॒ । हविष्कृ॒तो यज्ञिया यज्ञ॒कामास् ते देवा॒सो यज्ञ॒म् इमं॒ जुषन्ताम् ॥१॥

text: This is your glorious might, Agni and Vishnu! Ye drink the essence of the mystic butter. Placing in every home seven costly treasures. Let your tongue stretch to take the offered fatness.
meaning: अ॒ग्नाविष्णू म॒हि त॒द् वां महित्व॒म् पाथो॒ घृत॒स्य गु॒ह्यस्य ना॒म । द॒मेदमे सप्त॒ र॒त्ना द॒धानौ प्र॒ति वां जिह्वा॒ घृत॒म् आ॒ चरण्यात् ॥१॥

text: Ye love the great law, Agni Vishnu! joying, ye feast on mystic essences of butter, Exalted in each house with fair laudation. Let your tongue stretch to take the offered fatness.
meaning: अ॒ग्नाविष्णू म॒हि धा॒म प्रिय॒म् वां वीथो॒ घृत॒स्य गु॒ह्या जुषाणौ॒ । द॒मेदमे सुष्टुत्या॒ वावृधानौ॒ प्र॒ति वां जिह्वा॒ घृत॒म् उ॒च् चरण्यात् ॥२॥

text: Heaven, Earth, and Mitra here have caused mine eyes to be- anointed well, Savitar, Brāhmanaspati take care that they be duly balmed!
meaning: स्वा॒क्तं मे द्या॒वापृथिवी॒ स्वा॒क्तं मित्रो॒ अकर् अय॒म् । स्वा॒क्तं मे ब्र॒ह्मणस् प॒तिः स्वा॒क्तं सविता॒ करत् ॥१॥

text: Rouse us to-day O Indra, Maghavan, hero, with thy best pos- sible and varied succours, May he who hateth us fall low beneath us, and him whom we detest let life abandon.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रोति॒भिर् बहुला॒भिर् नो अद्य॒ यावच्छ्रेष्ठा॒भिर् मघवन् छूर जिन्व । यो॒ नो द्वे॒ष्ट्य् अ॒धर स॒स् पदीष्ट य॒म् उ द्विष्म॒स् त॒म् उ प्राणो॒ जहातु ॥१॥

text: We bringing homage have approached the friend who seeks our wondering praise, Young, strengthener of the sacrifice. May he bestow long life on me.
meaning: उ॒प प्रियं॒ प॒निप्नतम् यु॒वानम् आहुतीवृ॒धम् । अ॒गन्म बि॒भ्रतो न॒मो दीर्घ॒म् आ॒युः कृणोतु मे ॥१॥

text: Let Pūshan, let the Maruts, let Brihaspati pour forth on me; This present Agni pour on me children and riches in a stream! May he bestow long life on me.
meaning: सं॒ मा सिञ्चन्तु मरु॒तः सं॒ पूषा॒ सं॒ बृ॒हस्प॒तिः । सं॒ माय॒म् अग्निः॒ सिञ्चतु प्रज॒या च ध॒नेन च दीर्घ॒म् आ॒युः कृणोतु मे ॥१॥

text: Agni, drive off my rivals born and living, repel those yet unborn, O Jātavedas. Cast down beneath my feet mine adversaries. In Aditi's regard may we be sinless.
meaning: अ॒ग्ने जाता॒न् प्र॒ णुदा मे सप॒त्नान् प्र॒त्य् अ॒जातान् जातवेदो नुदस्व । अधस्पदं॒ कृणुष्व ये॒ पृतन्य॒वो॒ ऽनागसस् ते॒ वय॒म् अ॒दितये स्याम ॥१॥

text: Subdue with conquering might his other rivals, those yet unborn repel, O Jātavedas. For great felicity protect this kingdom, and in this man let all the Gods be joyful.
meaning: प्रा॒न्या॒न्त् सप॒त्नान्त् स॒हसा स॒हस्व प्र॒त्य् अ॒जातान् जातवेदो नुदस्व । इदं॒ राष्ट्रं॒ पिपृहि सौ॒भगाय वि॒श्व एनम् अ॒नु मदन्तु देवाः॒ ॥१॥

text: Hae quot tibi sunt venae atque arteriae harum omnium os tibi lapide occlusi.
meaning: इमा॒ या॒स् ते शतं॒ हिराः॒ सह॒स्रं धम॒नीर् उत॒ । ता॒सां ते स॒र्वासाम् अह॒म् अ॒श्मना बि॒लम् अ॒प्य् अधाम् ॥२॥

text: Uteri tui summam partem inferam facio: ne tibi soboles neque filius eveniat. Sterilem et infecundam te facio: lapidem tuum, operimentum facio.
meaning: प॒रं यो॒नेर् अ॒वरं ते कृणोमि मा॒ त्वा प्रजा॒भि॒ भून् मो॒त॒ सू॒तुः । अस्वं॑ त्वा॒प्रजसं कृणोम्य् अ॒श्मानं ते अपिधा॒नम् कृणोमि ॥३॥

text: Sweet are the glances of our eyes, our faces are as smooth as balm, Within thy bosom harbour me; one spirit dwell in both of us!
meaning: अक्ष्यौ॑ नौ म॒धुसंकाशे अ॒नीकम् नौ सम॒ञ्जनम् । अन्तः॒ कृष्णुष्व मां॒ हृदि॒ म॒न इ॒न् नौ सहा॒सति ॥१॥

text: With this my robe, inherited from Manu, I envelop thee, So that thou mayst be all mine own and give no thought to other dames.
meaning: अभि॒ त्वा म॒नुजातेन द॒धामि म॒म वा॒ससा । या॒था॒ ऽसो म॒म के॒वलो ना॒न्या॒सां कीर्त॒याश् चन॒ ॥१॥

text: I dig this Healing Herb that makes my lover look on me and weep; That bids the parting friend return and kindly greets him as he comes.
meaning: इद॒म् खनामि भेषजं॒ मांपश्य॒म् अभिरोरुद॒म् । परायतो॒ निव॒र्तनम् आयतः॒ प्रतिन॒न्दनम् ॥१॥

text: This Herb wherewith the Asuri drew Indra downward from the Gods, With this same Herb I draw thee close that I may be most dear to thee.
meaning: ये॒ना निचक्र॒ आसुरी॒न्द्रं देवे॒भ्यस् प॒रि । ते॒ना नि॒ कुर्वे त्वा॒म् अहं॒ य॒था ते॒ ऽसानि सु॒प्रिया ॥२॥

text: Thou art the peer of Soma, yea, thou art the equal of the Sun, The peer of all the Gods art thou: therefore we call thee hither— ward.
meaning: प्रती॒ची सो॒मम् असि प्रती॒ची उत॒ सू॒र्यम् । प्रती॒ची वि॒श्वान् देवा॒न् तां॒ त्वाछा॒वदामसि ॥३॥

text: I am the speaker here, not thou: speak thou where the assembly meets. Thou shalt be mine and only mine, and never mention other dames.
meaning: अहं॒ वदामि ने॒त् त्वं॒ सभा॒याम् अ॒ह त्वं॒ व॒द । म॒मे॒द् अ॒सस् त्वं॒ के॒वलो ना॒न्या॒सां कीर्त॒याश् चन॒ ॥४॥

text: If thou art far away beyond the rivers, far away from men, This Herb shall seem to bind thee fast and bring thee back my prisoner.
meaning: य॒दि वा॒सि तिरोजनं॒ य॒दि वा नद्य॑स् तिरः॒इ । इयं॒ ह म॒ह्यं त्वा॒म् ओ॒षधिर् बद्ध्वे॒व न्या॒नयत् ॥५॥

text: May he establish in our home the master of riches, gladdening with rain in season, Mighty, strong-winged, celestial, dropping moisture, Bull of the plants and embryo of waters.
meaning: दिव्यं॒ सुपर्णं॒ पयसं॒ बृह॒न्तम् अपां॒ ग॒र्भं वृषभ॒म् ओ॒षधीनाम् । अभीपतो॒ वृष्ट्या॒ तर्प॒यन्तम् आ॒ नो गोष्ठे॒ रयिष्ठां॒ स्थापयाति ॥१॥

text: We call Sarasvān, under whose protection all cattle wander, to preserve and aid us, Him in whose ordinance abide the waters, to whose command the Lord of Plenty listens.
meaning: य॒स्य व्रतं॒ पश॒वो य॒न्ति स॒र्वे य॒स्य व्रत॒ उपतिष्ठन्त आ॒पः । य॒स्य व्रते॒ पुष्टप॒तिर् नि॒विष्टस् तं॒ स॒रस्वन्तम् अ॒वसे हवामहे ॥१॥

text: Abiding here let us invoke Sarasvān, the seat of riches, glorious, wealth-increaser, Him who inclines and gives to him who worships, the rich pos- sessor and the Lord of Fulness.
meaning: आ॒ प्रत्य॒ञ्चं दाशु॒षे दाश्वं॒सं स॒रस्वन्तं पुष्टप॒तिं रयिष्ठा॒म् । राय॒स् पो॒षं श्रवस्युं॒ व॒साना इह॒ स॒दनं रयीणा॒म् ॥२॥

text: Observing men, and viewing home, the Falcon hath cleft his swift way over wastes and waters. May he, with Indra for a friend, auspicious, traversing all air's lower realms, come hither.
meaning: अ॒ति ध॒न्वान्य् अ॒त्य् अप॒स् ततर्द श्येनो॒ नृच॒क्षा अवसानदर्शः॒ । त॒रन् वि॒श्वान्य् अ॒वरा र॒जंसी॒न्द्रेण स॒ख्या शिव॒ आ॒ जगम्यात् ॥१॥

text: The heavenly Falcon, viewing men, well-pinioned, strength-giver, hundred-footed, hundred-nested, Shall give us treasure which was taken from us. May it be rich in food among our Fathers.
meaning: श्येनो॒ नृच॒क्षा दिव्यः॒ सुपर्णः॒ सह॒स्रपाच् छत॒योनिर् वयोधाः॒ । स॒ नो नि॒ यछाद् व॒सु य॒त् प॒राभृतम् अस्मा॒कम् अस्तु पितृ॒षु स्वधा॒वत् ॥२॥

text: Scatter and drive away, Soma and Rudra, the sickness that hath come within our dwelling, Afar into the distance chase Destruction, and even from commit- ted sin release us.
meaning: सो॒मारुद्रा वि॒ वृहतं विषूचीम् अ॒मीवा या॒ नो ग॒यम् आविवे॒श । बा॒धेथां दूरं॒ नि॒रृतिम् पराचैः॒ कृतं॒ चिद् ए॒नः प्र॒ मुमुक्तम् अस्म॒त् ॥१॥

text: Lay on our bodies, O ye twain, O Soma and Rudra, all those balms that heal diseases. Set free and draw away the sin committed, which we have still inherent in our persons.
meaning: सो॒मारुद्रा युव॒म् एता॒न्य् अस्म॒द् वि॒श्वा तनू॒षु भेषजा॒नि धत्तम् । अ॒व स्यतं मुञ्च॒तं य॒न् नो अ॒सत् तनू॒षु बद्धं॒ कृत॒म् ए॒नो अस्म॒त् ॥२॥

text: Some of thy words bode weal and some misfortune: thou scat- terest them all with friendly feeling. Deep within this three words are laid: among them one hath flown off even as the sound was uttered.
meaning: शिवा॒स् त ए॒का अ॒शिवास् त ए॒काः स॒र्वा बिभर्षि सुमनस्य॒मानः । तिस्रो॒ वा॒चो नि॒हिता अन्त॒र् अस्मि॒न् ता॒साम् ए॒का वि॒ पपाता॒नु घो॒षम् ॥१॥

text: Ye twain have conquered, and have not been vanquished: not either of the pair hath been defeated. Ye, Indra Vishnu, when ye fought your battle; produced this infinite with three divisions.
meaning: उभा॒ जिग्यथुर् न॒ प॒रा जयेथे न॒ प॒रा जिग्ये कतर॒श् चनै॒नयोः । इ॒न्द्रश् च विष्णो य॒द् अ॒पस्पृधेथां त्रेधा॒ सह॒स्रं वि॒ त॒द् ऐरयेथाम् ॥१॥

text: Brought hitherward from Sindhu, from a folk of every mingled race, Fetched from afar, thou art I deem, a balm that cureth. jealousy.
meaning: ज॒नाद् विश्वजनी॒नात् सिन्धुत॒स् प॒र्य् आ॒भृतम् । दूरा॒त् त्वा मन्य उ॒द्भृतम् ईर्ष्या॒या ना॒म भेषज॒म् ॥१॥

text: As one with water quencheth fire, so calm this lover's jealousy, Like heat of fire that burneth here, or flame that rageth through the wood.
meaning: अग्ने॒र् इवास्य द॒हतो दाव॒स्य द॒हतः पृ॒थक् । एता॒म् एत॒स्येर्ष्या॒म् उद्रा॒ग्नि॒म् इव शमय ॥१॥

text: O broad-tressed Sinivāli, thou who art the sister of the Gods, Accept the offered sacrifice, and, Goddess, grant us progeny.
meaning: सि॒नीवालि पृ॒थुष्टुके या॒ देवा॒नाम् अ॒सि स्व॒सा । जुष॒स्व हव्य॒म् आ॒हुतं प्रजां॒ देवि दिदिड्ढि नः ॥१॥

text: Present the sacrifice to her, to Sinivāli, Queen of men, Beauti- ful-fingered, lovely-armed, prolific, bearing many a child.
meaning: या॒ सुबाहुः॒ स्वङ्गुरिः॒ सुषू॒मा बहुसू॒वरी । त॒स्यै विश्प॒त्न्यै हविः॒ सिनीवाल्यै॒ जुहोतन ॥२॥

text: Thou who as Queen of men art Indra's equal, a Goddess coming with a thousand tresses, To thee our sacrifices are performed, O Consort of Vishnu Goddess, urge thy Lord to bounty!
meaning: या॒ विश्प॒त्नी॒न्द्रम् अ॒सि प्रती॒ची सह॒स्रस्तुकाभिय॒न्ती देवी॒ । वि॒ष्णोः पत्नि तु॒भ्यं राता॒ हवीं॒षि प॒तिं देवि रा॒धसे चोदयस्व ॥३॥

text: Oft in this sacrifice with favoured cry I call Kuhū, beneficent Goddess, skilled in all her works. May she vouchsafe us wealth with every boon, and give a, hero meet for praise who gives a hundred gifts.
meaning: कुहूं॒ देवीं॒ सुकृ॒तं विद्मना॒पसम् अस्मि॒न् यज्ञे॒ सुह॒वा जोहवीमि । सा॒ नो रयिं॒ विश्व॒वारं नि॒ यछाद् द॒दातु वीर॒म् शत॒दायम् उक्थ्य॑म् ॥१॥

text: Kuhl), the Queen of Gods and immortality, called to assist, enjoy this sacrifice of' ours! Let her, desirous of our worship, hear to-day: may she, intelligent, give increase of our wealth.
meaning: कुहू॒र् देवा॒नाम् अमृ॒तस्य प॒त्नी ह॒व्या नो अस्य हवि॒षो जुषेत । शृनोतु यज्ञ॒म् उशती॒ नो अद्य॒ राय॒स् पो॒षं चिकितु॒षी दधातु ॥२॥

text: I call on Rākā with hair laud and reverent cry: may she, auspicious, hear us and herself observe. With never-breaking needle may she sew her work, and send a glorious man who gives a hundred gifts.
meaning: राका॒म् अहं॒ सुह॒वा सुष्टुती॒ हुवे शृणो॒तु नः सुभ॒गा बो॒धतु त्म॒ना । सी॒व्यत्व् अ॒पः सूच्या॒छिद्यमानया द॒दातु वीरं॒ शत॒दायम् उक्थ्य॑म् ॥१॥

text: All thy kind favours, Rākā! lovely in their form, wherewith thou grantest treasures to the man who gives, With these come thou to us this day benevolent, O blessed one, bestowing wealth of thousand sorts.
meaning: या॒स् ते राके सुमत॒यः सुपे॒शसो या॒भिर् द॒दासि दाशु॒षे व॒सूनि । ता॒भिर् नो अद्य॒ सुम॒ना उपा॒गहि सहस्रापोष॒म् सुभगे र॒राणा ॥२॥

text: May the Gods' Consorts aid us of their own free will, help us to offspring and the winning of the spoil. May Goddesses who quickly listen shelter us, both those on earth and they within the waters' realm.
meaning: देवा॒नां प॒त्नीर् उशती॒र् अवन्तु नः प्रा॒वन्तु नस् तुज॒ये वा॒जसातये । याः॒ पा॒र्थिवासो या॒ अपा॒म् अ॒पि व्रते॒ ता॒ नो देवीः सुह॒वाः श॒र्म यछन्तु ॥१॥

text: May the Dames, wives of Gods, enjoy our presents, Rāt, Asvini Indrāni and Agnāyi; May Rodasi and Varunāni hear us, and Goddesses come at the matrons' season.
meaning: उत॒ ग्ना॒ व्यन्तु देव॒पत्नीर् इन्द्राण्य् अ॑ग्ना॒य्य् अश्वि॒नी रा॒ट् । आ॒ रो॒दसी वरुनानी॒ शृणोतु व्य॒न्तु देवी॒र् य॒ ऋतु॒र् ज॒नीनाम् ॥२॥

text: As evermore the lightning flash strikes, irresistible, the tree, So, irresistible, may I conquer the gamblers with the dice.
meaning: य॒था वृक्ष॒म् अश॒निर् विश्वा॒हा ह॒न्त्य् अप्रति॒ । एवा॒ह॒म् अद्य॒ कितवा॒न् अक्षै॒र् बध्यासम् अप्रति॒ ॥१॥

text: From every side, from hale and sick, impotent to defend them- selves, May all the fortune of the folk as winnings pass into my hands.
meaning: तुरा॒णाम् अ॒तुराणां विशा॒म् अ॒वर्जुषीणाम् । समै॒तु विश्व॒तो भ॒गो अन्तर्हस्तं॒ कृतं॒ म॒म ॥२॥

text: I pray to Agni, him who guards his treasure: here, won by homage, may he pile our winnings. As 'twere with racing cars I bring my presents: duly with reverence, let me laud the Maruts.
meaning: ई॒डे अग्निं॒ स्वा॒वसुं न॒मोभिर् इह॒ प्रसक्तो॒ वि॒ चयत् कृतं॒ नः । र॒थैर् इव प्र॒ भरे वाज॒यद्भिः प्रदक्षिणं॒ मरु॒तां स्तो॒मम् ऋध्याम् ॥३॥

text: With thee to aid us may we win the treasure: do thou assist our side in every battle. Give us wide room and easy way, O Indra; break down, O Maghavan, the foemen's valour.
meaning: वयं॒ जयेम त्व॒या युजा॒ वृ॒तम् अस्मा॒कम् अं॒शम् उ॒द् अव भ॒रेभरे । अस्म॒भ्यम् इन्द्र व॒रीयः सुगं॒ कृधि प्र॒ श॒त्रूणां मघवन् वृ॒ष्ण्या रुज ॥४॥

text: I have completely cleaned thee out, won from thee what thou keptest back. As a wolf tears and rends a sheep, so do I tear thy stake away.
meaning: अ॒जैषं त्वा सं॒लिखितम् अ॒जैषम् उत॒ संरु॒धम् । अ॒विं वृ॒को य॒था म॒थद् एवा॒ मथ्नामि ते कृत॒म् ॥५॥

text: Yea, by superior play one gains advantage: in time he piles his spoil as doth a gambler. He overwhelms with wealth's inherent powers the devotee who keeps not back his riches.
meaning: उत॒ प्रहा॒म् अ॒तिदीवा जयति कृत॒म् इव श्वघ्नी॒ वि॒ चिनोति काले॒ । यो॒ देव॒कामो न॒ ध॒नम् रुण॒द्धि स॒म् इ॒त् तं॒ रायः॒ सृजति स्वधा॒भिः ॥६॥

text: May we all, much-invoked! repel with cattle want that brings sin, hunger with store of barley. May we uninjured, first among the princes, obtain possessions by our own exertions.
meaning: गो॒भिष् टरेमा॒मतिं दुरे॒वां य॒वेन वा क्षु॒धं पुरुहूत वि॒श्वे । वयं॒ रा॒जसु प्रथमा॒ ध॒नान्य् अ॒रिष्टासो वृजनी॒भिर् जयेम ॥७॥

text: My right hand holds my winnings fast, and in my left is victory. I would that I were winner of cattle and horses, wealth and gold.
meaning: कृतं॒ मे द॒क्षिणे ह॒स्ते जयो॒ मे सव्य॒ आ॒हितः । गोजि॒द् भूयासम् अश्वजि॒द् धनंजयो॒ हिरण्यजि॒त् ॥८॥

text: Dice, give me play that bringeth fruit as 'twere a cow with flowing milk! And, as the bowstring binds, the bow, unite me with a stream of gains.
meaning: अ॒क्षाः फ॒लवतीम् द्यु॒वं दत्त॒ गां॒ क्षीरि॒णीम् इव । सं॒ मा कृत॒स्य धा॒रया ध॒नुः स्ना॒व्नेव नह्यत ॥९॥

text: Brihaspati protect us from the sinner, from rearward, from above, and from below us! May Indra from the front and from the centre, as friend to friends, vouchsafe us room and freedom.
meaning: बृ॒हस्प॒तिर् नः प॒रि पातु पश्चा॒द् उतो॒त्तरस्माद् अ॒धराद् अघयोः॒ । इ॒न्द्रः पुर॒स्ताद् उत॒ मध्यतो॒ नः स॒खा स॒खिभ्यो व॒रीयः कृणोतु ॥१॥

text: Give us agreement with our own, with strangers give us unity: Do ye, O Asvins, in this place join us in sympathy and love.
meaning: संज्ञा॒नं नः स्वे॒भिः संज्ञा॒नम् अ॒रणेभिः । संज्ञा॒नम् अश्विना युव॒म् इहा॒स्मा॒सु नि॒ यछतम् ॥१॥

text: May we agree in mind, agree in purpose: let us not fight against the heavenly spirit. Around us rise no din of frequent slaughter, nor Indra's arrow fly, for day is present!
meaning: सं॒ जानामहै म॒नसा सं॒ चिकित्वा॒ मा॒ युष्महि म॒नसा दै॒व्येन । मा॒ घो॒षा उ॒त् स्थुर् बहुले॒ विनि॒र्हते मे॒षुः पप्तद् इ॒न्द्रस्या॒हन्य् आ॒गते ॥२॥

text: As thou, Brihaspati, from the curse hast saved us, from dwel- ling yonder in the realm of Yama, The Asvins, leeches of the Gods, O Agni, have chased Death far from us with mighty powers.
meaning: अमुत्रभू॒याद् अ॒धि य॒द् यम॒स्य बृ॒हस्पते अभि॒शस्तेर् अ॒मुञ्चः । प्र॒त्य् औहताम् अश्वि॒ना मृत्यु॒म् अस्म॒द् देवा॒नाम् अग्ने भिष॒जा श॒चीभिः ॥१॥

text: Move both together; do not leave the body. Let both the breathings stay for thee united. Waxing in strength live thou a hundred autumns. Thy noblest guardian and thy lord is Agni.
meaning: सं॒ क्रामतं मा॒ जहीतं श॒रीरं प्राणापानौ॒ ते सयु॒जाव् इह॒ स्ताम् । शतं॒ जीव शर॒दो व॒र्धमानो ऽग्नि॒ष् टे गोपा॒ अधिपा॒ व॒सिष्ठः ॥२॥

text: Return, thy life now vanished into distance! Return, the breath thou drawest and exhalest! Agni hath snatched it from Destruction's bosom: into thyself again I introduce it.
meaning: आ॒युर् य॒त् ते अ॒तिहितं पराचै॒र् अपानः॒ प्राणः॒ पु॒नर् आ॒ ता॒व् इताम् । अग्नि॒ष् ट॒द् आ॒हार् नि॒रृतेर् उप॒स्थात् त॒द् आत्म॒नि पु॒नर् आ॒ वेशयामि ते ॥३॥

text: Let not the vital breath he draws forsake him, let not his expiration part and leave him. I give him over to the Seven Rishis: let them conduct him to old age in safety.
meaning: मे॒मं॒ प्राणो॒ हासीन् मो॒ अपानो॒ ऽवहा॒य प॒रा गात् । सप्तर्षि॒भ्य एनं प॒रि ददामि ते॒ एनं स्वस्ति॒ जर॒से वहन्तु ॥४॥

text: Enter him, both ye breaths, like two draught-oxen entering their stall. Let him, the treasure of old age, still wax in strength, uninjured,. here.
meaning: प्र॒ विषतं प्राणापानाव् अनड्वा॒हाव् इव व्रज॒म् । अयं॒ जरिम्नः॒ शेवधि॒र् अ॒रिष्ट इह॒ वर्धताम् ॥५॥

text: I send thee back thy vital breath; I drive Consumption far from thee, May Agni here, most excellent, sustain our life on every side.
meaning: आ॒ ते प्राणं॒ सुवामसि प॒रा य॒क्ष्मं सुवामि ते । आ॒युर् नो विश्व॒तो दधद् अय॒म् अग्नि॒र् व॒रेण्यः ॥६॥

text: From out the depth of darkness, we, ascending to the highest heaven, Have come to the sublimest light, to Sūrya, God among the. Gods.
meaning: उ॒द् वयं॒ त॒मसस् प॒रि रो॒हन्तो ना॒कम् उत्तम॒म् । देवं॒ देवत्रा॒ सू॒र्यम् अ॒गन्म ज्यो॒तिर् उत्तम॒म् ॥७॥

text: We worship holy Verse and Song, by which they carry out their acts, Shining in order's seat these twain present the sacrifice to Gods.
meaning: ऋ॒चं सा॒म यजामहे या॒भ्यां क॒र्माणि कुर्व॒ते । एते॒ स॒दसि राजतो यज्ञं॒ देवे॒षु यछतः ॥१॥

text: As I have asked about Verse, Song, Sacrifice, strength, force,. Yajus-text, So never let this lore that I have sought forsake me, Lord of Might!
meaning: ऋ॒चं सा॒म य॒द् अ॒प्राक्षं हवि॒र् ओ॒जो य॒जुर् ब॒लम् । एष॒ मा त॒स्मान् मा॒ हिंसीद् वे॒दः पृष्टः॒ शचीपते ॥१॥

text: Thy downward paths from heaven, whereby thou hast raised all the world to life, Give us in gracious love, good Lord!
meaning: ये॒ ते प॒न्थानो ऽव दिवो॒ ये॒भिर् वि॒श्वम् ऐ॒रयः । ते॒भिः सुम्नया॒ धेहि नो वसो ॥२॥

text: Whether it came from viper, from black snake or snake with transverse stripes, Or Kankaparvan's bite, this herb hath made the poison power- less.
meaning: ति॒रश्चिराजेर् असिता॒त् पृ॒दाकोः प॒रि सं॒भृतम् । त॒त् कङ्क॒पर्वणो विष॒म् इयं॒ वीरु॒द् अनीनशत् ॥१॥

text: Honey-born, honey-dropping, rich in honey, honeysweet, this herb, Is medicine that heals the wound and kills the gnat that bites and stings.
meaning: इयं॒ वीरु॒न् म॒धुजाता मधुश्चु॒न् मधुला॒ मधूः॒ । सा॒ वि॒ह्रुतस्य भेषज्य् अ॒थो मशकज॒म्भनी ॥२॥

text: Whatever bit, or sucked thy blood, we summon thence away from thee The ineffectual poison of the little sharply-stinging gnat.
meaning: य॒तो दष्टं॒ य॒तो धीतं॒ त॒तस् ते नि॒र् ह्वयामसि । अर्भ॒स्य तृप्रदंशि॒नो मश॒कस्यारसं॒ विष॒म् ॥३॥

text: Thou here who crookest wicked jaws, thou tortuous, jointless, limbless thing, These jaws thou, Brāhmanaspati! shalt bend together like a reed.
meaning: अयं॒ यो॒ वक्रो॒ वि॒परुर् व्य॑ङ्गो मु॒खानि वक्रा॒ वृजिना॒ कृणो॒षि । ता॒नि त्वं॒ ब्रह्मणस् पते इषी॒काम् इव सं॒ नमः ॥४॥

text: This scorpion here that creeps along, low on the ground and powerless— I have removed his poison and then utterly demolished him.
meaning: अरस॒स्य शर्को॒टस्य नीची॒नस्योपस॒र्पतः । विषं॒ ह्य् अ॑स्या॒दिष्य् अ॒थो एनम् अजीजभम् ॥५॥

text: No strength in thy two arms hast thou, nor in thy head, nor in thy waist: Then what is that small thing thou so viciously bearest in thy tail?
meaning: न॒ ते बाह्वो॒र् ब॒लम् अस्ति न॒ शीर्षे॒ नो॒त॒ मध्यतः॒ । अ॒थ किं॒ पाप॒या ऽमुया॒ पु॒छे बिभर्ष्य् अर्भक॒म् ॥६॥

text: The emmets make a meal of thee and peahens tear and mangle thee: All ye are crying out, In sooth the scorpion's poison hath no strength.
meaning: अद॒न्ति त्वा पिपी॒लिका वि॒ वृश्चन्ति मयूर्यः॑ । स॒र्वे भल ब्रवाथ शा॒र्कोटम् अरसं॒ विष॒म् ॥७॥

text: Thou creature who inflictest wounds both with thy mouth and with thy tail, No poison in thy mouth hast thou: what at thy tail's root will there be?
meaning: य॒ उभा॒भ्यां प्रह॒रसि पु॒छेन चास्ये॑न च । आस्ये॑ न॒ ते विषं॒ कि॒म् उ ते पुछधा॒व् असत् ॥८॥

text: Whatever trouble hath disturbed and shaken me—I speak with hope, I move, imploring, 'mid the folk What harm my body in myself hath suffered, now let Sarasvati relieve with fatness.
meaning: य॒द् आश॒सा व॒दतो मे विचुक्षुभे॒ य॒द् या॒चमानस्य च॒रतो ज॒नां अ॒नु । य॒द् आत्म॒नि तन्वो॑ मे वि॒रिष्टं स॒रस्वती त॒द् आ॒ पृणद् घृते॒न ॥१॥

text: Seven flow for him, the youth on whom the Maruts wait: the sons have taught the Father everlasting laws. Both worlds are his: both shine belonging unto him. Both move together: both, as his possession thrive.
meaning: सप्त॒ क्षरन्ति सि॒शवे मरु॒त्वते पित्रे॒ पुत्रा॒सो अ॒प्य् अवीवृतन्न् ऋता॒नि । उभे॒ इ॒द् अस्योभे॒ अस्य राजत उभे॒ यतेते उभे॒ अस्य पुष्यतः ॥२॥

text: True to laws, Indra Varuna, drinkers of the juice, quaff this pressed Soma which shall give you rapturous joy! Let sacrifice, your car, to entertain the Gods, approach its rest- ing-place that they may drink thereof.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रावरुणा सुतपाव् इमं॒ सुतं॒ सो॒मं पिबतं म॒द्यं धृतव्रतौ । युवो॒ र॒थो अध्वरो॒ देव॒वीतये प्र॒ति स्व॒सरम् उ॒प यातु पीत॒ये ॥१॥

text: O Indra Varuna, drink your fill, ye heroes, of this effectual and sweetest Soma. This juice was shed by us that ye might quaff it. On this trimmed grass be seated and rejoice you.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रावरुणा मधुमत्तमस्य वृ॒ष्णः सो॒मस्य वृषणा॒ वृषेथाम् । इदं॒ वाम् अ॒न्धः प॒रिषिक्तम् आस॒द्यास्मि॒न् बर्हि॒षि मादयेथाम् ॥२॥

text: Like a tree struck by lightning may the man be withered from the root. Who curseth us who curse not him, or, when we curse him. curseth us.
meaning: यो॒ नः शपाद् अ॒शपतः श॒पतो य॒श् च नः श॒पात् । वृक्ष॒ इव विद्यु॒ता हत॒ आ॒ मू॒लाद् अ॒नु शुष्यतु ॥१॥

text: I, prudent, bringing power, a treasure-winner, with amicable eye that strikes no terror, Come, praising and kind-thoughted, to these houses: be not afraid of me, be glad and joyful.
meaning: ऊ॒र्जं बि॒भ्रद् वसुव॒निः सुमेधा॒ अ॒घोरेण च॒क्षुषा मित्रि॒येण । गृहा॒न् ऐ॒मि सुम॒ना व॒न्दमानो र॒मध्वम् मा॒ बिभीत म॒त् ॥१॥

text: Let these delightful Houses that are rich in power and store of milk, Replete with wealth and standing firm, become aware of our approach.
meaning: इमे॒ गृहा॒ मयोभु॒व ऊ॒र्जस्वन्तः प॒यस्वन्तः । पूर्णा॒ वामे॒न ति॒ष्ठन्तस् ते॒ नो जानन्त्व् आयतः॒ ॥२॥

text: These Houses we invoke, whereon the distant exile sets his thought, Wherein dwells many a friendly heart: let them beware of our approach.
meaning: ये॒षाम् अध्ये॒ति प्रव॒सन् ये॒षु सौमनसो॒ बहुः॒ । गृहा॒न् उ॒प ह्वयामहे ते॒ नो जानन्त्व् आयतः॒ ॥३॥

text: Thus greeted, ye of ample wealth, friends who enjoy delightful sweets. Be ever free from hunger, free from thirst! Ye Houses, fear us not.
meaning: उ॒पहूता भू॒रिधनाः स॒खायः स्वादु॒संमुदः । अक्षुध्या॒ अतृष्या॒ स्त गृ॒हा मा॒स्म॒द् बिभीतन ॥४॥

text: Kind greeting to the cattle here, kind greeting to the goats and sheep! Then, of the food within our homes, kind greeting to the plea- sant drink!
meaning: उ॒पहूता इह॒ गा॒व उ॒पहूता अजाव॒यः । अ॒थो अ॒न्नस्य कीला॒ल उ॒पहूतो गृहे॒षु ॥५॥

text: Full of refreshment, full of charms, of laughter and felicity, Be ever free from hunger, free from thirst! Ye Houses, fear us not. Stay here, and come not after me: prosper in every form and shape. With happy fortune will I come! Grow more abundant still through me!
meaning: सूनृ॒तावन्तः सुभ॒गा इ॒रावन्तो हसामुदाः॒ । अतृष्या॒ अक्षुध्या॒ स्त गृ॒हा मा॒स्म॒द् बिभीतन ॥६॥

text: इहै॒व स्त मा॒नु गात वि॒श्वा रूपा॒णि पुष्यत । ऐ॒ष्यामि भद्रे॒णा सह॒ भू॒यांसो भवता म॒या ॥७॥
Since, Agni, with our fervent zeal we undergo austerity, May we be dear to Sacred Lore, may we be wise and live long lives.
meaning: य॒द् अग्ने त॒पसा त॒प उपतप्या॒महे त॒पः । प्रियाः॒ श्रुत॒स्य भूयास्मा॒युष्मन्तः सुमेध॒सः ॥१॥

text: Agni, we practise acts austere, we undergo austerity. So listening to Holy Lore may we grow wise and full of days.
meaning: अ॒ग्ने त॒पस् तप्यामह उ॒प तप्यामहे त॒पः । श्रुता॒नि शृण्व॒न्तः वय॒म् आ॒युष्मन्तः सुमेध॒सः ॥२॥

text: Like a car-warrior, Agni here, grown mighty, Lord of the brave, Chief Priest, hath conquered footmen. Laid on earth's centre he hath flashed and glittered. Low may he lay our enemies beneath us.
meaning: अय॒म् अग्निः॒ स॒त्पतिर् वृद्ध॒वृष्णो रथी॒व पत्ती॒न् अजयत् पुरो॒हितः । ना॒भा पृथिव्यां॒ नि॒हितो द॒विद्युतद् अधस्पदं॒ कृणुतां ये॒ पृतन्य॒वः ॥१॥

text: We call with lauds from his most lofty dwelling victorious Agni, conqueror in battles. May he conveyus over all distresses, may the God Agni bear us past our troubles.
meaning: पृतनाजि॒तं स॒हमानम् अग्नि॒म् उक्थ्यै॒र् हवामहे परमा॒त् सध॒स्थात् । स॒ नः पर्षद् अ॒ति दुर्गा॒णि वि॒श्वा क्षा॒मद् देवो॒ ऽति दुरिता॒न्य् अग्निः॒ ॥१॥

text: From all that woe and trouble may the Waters save and rescue me, Whate'er the Raven, black of hue, flying out hither ward, hath dropped.
meaning: इदं॒ य॒त् कृष्णः॒ शकु॒निर् अभिनिष्प॒तन्न् अ॒पीपतत् । आ॒पो मा त॒स्मात् स॒र्वस्माद् दुरिता॒त् पान्त्व् अं॒हसः ॥१॥

text: May Agni Gārhapatya save and set me free from all this guilt. Which the black Raven with thy mouth, O Nirriti, hath wiped away.
meaning: इदं॒ य॒त् कृष्णः॒ शकु॒निर् अवा॒मृक्षन् निरृते ते मु॒खेन । अग्नि॒र् मा त॒स्माद् ए॒नसो गा॒र्हपत्यः प्र॒ मुञ्चतु ॥२॥

text: With retroverted fruit hast thou, O Apāmārga, sprung and grown. Hence into distance most remote drive every curse away from, me.
meaning: प्रतीची॒नफलो हि॒ त्व॒म् अ॒पामार्ग रुरो॒हिथ । स॒र्वान् म॒च् छप॒थाम् अ॒धि व॒रीयो यवया इतः॒ ॥१॥

text: Whatever evil we have done, whatever vile or sinful act, With thee, O Apāmārga, who lookest all ways, we wipe it off.
meaning: य॒द् दुष्कृतं॒ य॒च् छ॒मलं य॒द् वा चेरिम पाप॒या । त्व॒या त॒द् विश्वतोमुखा॒पामार्गा॒प मृज्महे ॥२॥

text: If with the cripple we have lived, whose teeth are black and nails deformed, With thee, O Apāmārga, we wipe all that ill away from us.
meaning: श्याव॒दता कुनखि॒ना बण्डे॒न य॒त् सहा॒सिम॒ । अ॒पामार्ग त्व॒या वयं॒ स॒र्वं त॒द् अ॒प मृज्महे ॥३॥

text: If it was in the wind or air's mid-region, if it was in the trees or in the bushes, To meet whose utterance forth streamed the cattle, may that. Celestial Power again approach us.
meaning: य॒द्य् अन्त॒रिक्षे य॒दि वा॒त आ॒स य॒दि वृक्षे॒षु य॒दि वो॒लपेषु । य॒द् अ॒श्रवन् पश॒व उद्य॒मानं त॒द् ब्रा॒ह्मणं पु॒नर् अस्मा॒न् उपै॒तु ॥१॥

text: May sense return to me again, and spirit, return my Sacred Power and my possessions! Again let fires, aflame on lesser altars, each duly stationed, here succeed and prosper.
meaning: पु॒नर् मैत्व् इन्द्रियं॒ पु॒नर् आत्मा॒ द्र॒विणं ब्रा॒ह्मणं च । पु॒नर् अग्न॒यो धि॒ष्ण्या यथास्थाम॒ कल्पयन्ताम् इहै॒व॒ ॥१॥

text: Sarasvati, in thy decrees, Goddess, in thy celestial laws, Accept the offered sacrifice, and, Goddess, grant us progeny.
meaning: स॒रस्वति व्रते॒षु ते दिव्ये॒षु देवि धा॒मसु । जुष॒स्व हव्य॒म् आ॒हुतं प्रजा॒म् देवि ररास्व नः ॥१॥

text: Here is, Sarasvati, thy fat libation, this sacrifice passing to the mouth of Fathers. These most auspicious offerings have ascended to thee: through, these may we be full of sweetness.
meaning: इदं॒ ते हव्यं॒ घृत॒वत् सरस्वतीदं॒ पितृ̄णां॒ हवि॒र् आस्यं॑ य॒त् । इमा॒नि त उदिता॒ श॒म्तमानि ते॒भिर् वयं॒ म॒धुमन्तः स्याम ॥२॥

text: Be kind and most auspicious, be gracious to us, Sarasvati, May we be ever in thy sight.
meaning: शिवा॒ नः शं॒तमा भव सुमृडीका॒ सरस्वति । मा॒ ते युयोम संदृ॒शः ॥१॥

text: May the wind kindly breathe on us, may the Sun warm us. pleasantly. May days pass happily for us, may night draw near delightfully, may dawn break joyfully for us!
meaning: शं॒ नो वा॒तो वातु शं॒ नस् तपतु सू॒र्यः । अ॒हानि शं॒ भवन्तु नः शं॒ रा॒त्री प्र॒ति धीयतां । शं॒ उषा॒ नो व्य् उ॑छतु ॥१॥

text: Whatever sacrifice that man performeth with voice, mind, sacred formula, oblation, May, in accord with Death, Destruction ruin his offering before it gain fulfilment.
meaning: य॒त् किं॒ चासौ॒ म॒नसा य॒च् च वाचा॒ यज्ञै॒र् जुहो॒ति हवि॒षा य॒जुषा । त॒न् मृत्यु॒ना नि॒रृतिः संविदाना॒ पुरा॒ सत्या॒द् आ॒हुतिं हन्त्व् अस्य ॥१॥

text: For him may sorcerers, Destruction, demons strike and prevent fulfilment through their falsehood. Let Gods, by Indra sent, destroy his butter, and let his sacrifice be ineffective.
meaning: यातुधा॒ना नि॒रृतिर् आ॒द् उ र॒क्षस् ते॒ अस्य घ्नन्त्व् अ॒नृतेन सत्य॒म् । इ॒न्द्रेषिता देवा॒ आ॒जम् अस्य मथ्नन्तु मा॒ त॒त् सं॒ पादि य॒द् असौ॒ जुहो॒ति ॥२॥

text: Let the two Sovrans, swift to come, like falcons swooping on their prey, Destroy the butter of the foe whoever plots to injure us.
meaning: अजिराधिराजौ॒ श्येनौ॒ संपाति॒नाव् इव । आ॒ज्यं पृतन्यतो॒ हतां यो॒ नः क॒श्चाभ्यघाय॒ति ॥३॥

text: I seize thine arms and draw them back, I bind a bandage on thy mouth. I with the anger of the God Agni have killed thy sacrifice.
meaning: अ॒पाञ्चौ त उभौ॒ बाहू॒ अ॒पि नह्याम्य् आस्य॑म् । अग्ने॒र् देव॒स्य मन्यु॒ना ते॒न ते ऽवधिषं हविः॒ ॥४॥

text: Behind thy back I tie thine arms, I bind a bandage on thy mouth: With the terrific Agni's wrath have I destroyed thy sacrifice.
meaning: अ॒पि नह्यामि ते बाहू॒ अ॒पि नह्याम्य् आस्य॑म् । अग्ने॒र् घोर॒स्य मन्यु॒ना ते॒न ऽवधिषं हविः॒ ॥५॥

text: We set thee round us as a fort, victorious Agni! thee a sage, Bold in thy colour day by day, destroyer of the treacherous foe.
meaning: प॒रि त्वाग्ने पु॒रं वयं॒ वि॒प्रं सहस्य धीमहि । धृष॒द्वर्णं दिवे॒दिवे हन्ता॒रं भङ्गुरा॒वतः ॥१॥

text: Rise up and look upon the share of Indra fixt by ritual use. Whether ye poured libation dressed or took delight in it un- cooked.
meaning: उ॒त् तिष्ठता॒व पश्यते॒न्द्रस्य भाग॒म् ऋत्वि॒यम् । य॒दि श्रात॒म् जुहो॒तन य॒द्य् अ॒श्रातं मम॒त्तन ॥१॥

text: Libation is prepared. Come to us, Indra: the Sun hath travelled over half his journey. Friends with their treasures sit around thee, waiting like heads of houses for their wandering chieftain.
meaning: श्रात॒म् हवि॒र् ओ॒ ष्व् इ॑न्द्र प्र॒ याहि जगा॒म सू॒रो अ॒ध्वनो वि॒ म॒ध्यम् । प॒रि त्वासते निधि॒भिः स॒खायः कुलपा॒ न॒ व्राजपति॒म् च॒रन्तम् ॥२॥

text: Dressed in the udder and on fire, I fancy; well dressed, I fancy, is this new oblation. Quaff thickened milk of noon's libation, Indra, well pleased, O Thunderer, famed for many an exploit!
meaning: श्रातं॒ मन्य ऊ॒धनि श्रात॒म् अग्नौ॒ सु॒शृतं मन्ये त॒द् ऋतं॒ न॒वीयः । मा॒ध्यन्दिनस्य स॒वनस्य दध्नः॒ पि॒बेन्द्र वज्रिन् पुरुकृ॒ज् जुषाणः॒ ॥१॥

text: Inflamed is Agni, Heroes! charioteer of heaven. The caldron boils: the meath is drained to be your food. For we, O Asvins, singers sprung from many a house, invite you to be present at our banquetings.
meaning: स॒मिद्धो अग्नि॒र् वृषणा रथी॒ दिव॒स् तप्तो॒ घर्मो॒ दुह्यते वाम् इषे॒ म॒धु । वयं॒ हि॒ वां पुरुद॒मासो अश्विना हवामहे सधमा॒देषु कार॒वः ॥१॥

text: Asvins, the fire is all aglow: your caldron hath been heated;. come! Here, even now, O Heroes, are the milch-kine milked. The priests, ye mighty ones! rejoice.
meaning: स॒मिद्धो अग्नि॒र् अश्विना तप्तो॒ वां घर्म॒ आ॒ गतम् । दुह्य॒न्ते नूनं॒ वृषणेह॒ धेन॒वो द॒स्रा म॒दन्ति वेध॒सः ॥२॥

text: Pure with the Gods is sacrifice with cry of Hail! That is the Asvins' cup whence Gods are wont to drink. Yea, the Immortal Ones accept it, one and all, and come to kiss that cup with the Gandharva's mouth.
meaning: इवा॒हाकृतः शु॒चिर् देवे॒षु यज्ञो॒ यो॒ अश्वि॒नोश् चमसो॒ देवपा॒नः । त॒म् उ वि॒श्वे अमृ॒तासो जुषाणा॒ गन्धर्व॒स्य प्र॒त्य् आस्ना॒ रिहन्ति ॥३॥

text: Milk, molten butter offered when the mornings break,—this is your portion, Asvins! Come ye hitherward. Lords of the brave, balm-lovers, guards of sacrifice, drink ye the warm libation in the light of heaven.
meaning: य॒द् उस्रि॒यास्व् आ॒हुतं घृतं॒ प॒यो ऽयं॒ स॒ वाम् अश्विना भाग॒ आ॒ गतम् । मा॒ध्वी धर्तारा विदथस्य सत्पती तप्तं॒ घर्मं॒ पिबतम् दिवः॒ ॥४॥

text: Let the warm drink approach you with its Hotar-priest: let the Adhvaryu come to you with store of milk. Come, O ye Asvins, taste the meath that hath been drained, drink of the milk provided by this radiant cow.
meaning: तप्तो॒ वां घर्मो॒ नक्षतु स्व॒होता प्र॒ वाम् अध्वर्यु॒श् चरतु प॒यस्वान् । म॒धोर् दुग्ध॒स्याश्विना तना॒या वीतं॒ पातं॒ प॒यस उस्रियायाः ॥५॥

text: Come hither, quickly come, thou milker of the kine; into the caldron pour milk of the radiant cow. Most precious Savitar hath looked upon the heaven. After Dawn's going-forth he sends his light abroad.
meaning: उ॒प द्रव प॒यसा गोधुग् ओष॒म् आ॒ घर्मे॒ सिञ्च प॒य उस्रि॒यायाः । वि॒ ना॒कम् अख्यत् सविता॒ व॒रेण्यो ऽनुप्रया॒णम् उष॒सो वि॒ राजति ॥६॥

text: I invocate this milch-cow good for milking, so that the milker, deft of hand, may milk her. May Savitar give goodliest stimulation. The caldron hath been warmed. Let him proclaim it.
meaning: उ॒प ह्वये सुदु॒घां धेनु॒म् एतां॒ सुह॒स्तो गोधु॒ग् उत॒ दोहद् एनाम् । श्रे॒ष्ठं सवं॒ सविता॒ साविषन् नो ऽभी॒द्धो घर्म॒स् त॒द् उ षु॒ प्र॒ वोचत् ॥७॥

text: She, sovran of all treasures, is come hither yearning in spirit for her calf, and lowing. May this cow yield her milk for both the Asvins, and may she prosper to our great advantage.
meaning: हिङ्कृण्वती॒ वसुप॒त्नी व॒सूनां वत्स॒म् इछ॒न्ती म॒नसा न्या॒गन् । दुहा॒म् अश्वि॒भ्यां प॒यो अघ्न्ये॒यं॒ सा॒ वर्धतां महते॒ सौ॒भगाय ॥८॥

text: As dear house-friend, guest welcome in the dwelling, to this our sacrifice come thou who knowest. And, Agni, having scattered all assailants, bring to us the posses- sions of our foemen.
meaning: जु॒ष्टो द॒मूना अ॒तिथिर् दुरोण॒ इमं॒ नो यज्ञ॒म् उ॒प याहि विद्वा॒न् । वि॒श्वा अग्ने अभियु॒जो विह॒त्य शत्रूयता॒म् आ॒ भरा भो॒जनानि ॥९॥

text: Show thyself strong for mighty bliss, O Agni! Most excellent be thine effulgent splendours! Make easy to maintain our household lordship, and overcome the might of those who hate us.
meaning: अ॒ग्ने श॒र्ध महते॒ सौ॒भगाय त॒व द्युम्ना॒न्य् उत्तमा॒नि सन्तु । सं॒ जास्पत्यं॒ सुय॒मम् आ॒ कृणुष्व शत्रूयता॒म् अभि॒ तिष्ठा म॒हांसि ॥१०॥

text: Fortunate mayst thou be with goodly pasture, and may we also be exceeding wealthy. Feed on the grass, O Cow, at every season, and, coming hither, drink the limpid water.
meaning: सूयवसा॒द् भ॒गवती हि॒ भूया॒ अ॒धा वयं॒ भ॒गवन्तः स्याम । अद्धि॒ तृ॒णम् अघ्न्ये विश्वदा॒नीं पिब शुद्ध॒म् उदक॒म् आच॒रन्ती ॥११॥

text: Black is the mother, we have heard, from whom the red-hued Pustules sprang. With the divine ascetic's root I pierce and penetrate them all.
meaning: अपचि॒तां लो॒हिनीनां कृष्णा॒ माते॒ति शुश्रुम । मु॒नेर् देव॒स्य मू॒लेन स॒र्वा विध्यामि ता॒ अह॒म् ॥१॥

text: I pierce the foremost one of these, I perforate the middlemost, And here I cut the hindermost asunder like a lock of hair.
meaning: वि॒ध्याम्य् आसां प्रथमां॒ विध्यामि उत॒ मध्यमा॒म् । इदं॒ जघन्या॑म् आसाम् आ॒ छिनद्मि स्तु॒काम् इव ॥२॥

text: With spell that Tvashtar sent to us I have dispelled thy jealousy. We mitigate and pacify the anger that thou feltest, Lord!
meaning: त्वाष्ट्रे॒णाहं॒ व॒चसा वि॒ त ईर्ष्या॒म् अमीमदम् । अ॒थो यो॒ मन्यु॒ष् टे पते त॒म् उ ते शमयामसि ॥३॥

text: Lord of religious rites, by law, anointed, shine thou forth here for ever friendly-minded. So may we all with children, Jātavedas! worship and humbly wait on thee enkindled.
meaning: व्रते॒न त्वं॒ व्रतपते स॒मक्तो विश्वा॒हा सुम॒ना दीदिहीह॒ । तं॒ त्वा वयं॒ जातवेदः स॒मिद्धं प्रजा॒वन्त उ॒प सदेम स॒र्वे ॥४॥

text: Let not a thief or wicked man possess you: let not the dart of Rudra come anear you, Prolific, shining in the goodly pasture, drinking at pleasant pools the limpid water.
meaning: प्रजा॒वतीः सूय॒वसे रुश॒न्तीः शुद्धा॒ अपः॒ सुप्रपाणे॒ पि॒बन्तीः । मा॒ व स्तेन॒ ईशत मा॒घ॒शंसः प॒रि वो रुद्र॒स्य हेति॒र् वृणक्तु ॥१॥

text: Ye know the place and rest content, close-gathered, called by many a name. Come to me, Goddesses, with Gods Bedew with streams of fatness us, this cattle-pen, and all this place.
meaning: पदज्ञा॒ स्थ र॒मतयः सं॒हिता विश्व॒नाम्नीः । उ॒प मा देवीर् देवे॒भिर् ए॒त । इमं॒ गोष्ठ॒म् इदं॒ स॒दो घृते॒नास्मा॒न्त् स॒म् उक्षत ॥२॥

text: Rapidly dropping, quick to drop, more evil than the evil ones, More sapless than a dried-up bone, swifter than salt to melt away.
meaning: आ॒ सुस्र॒सः सुस्र॒सो अ॒सतीभ्यो अ॒सत्तराः । से॒होर् अरस॒तरा हवणा॒द् वि॒क्लेदीयसीः ॥१॥

text: Pustules that rise upon the neck, Pustules upon the shoulder- joints, Pustules that, falling of themselves, spring up on every twofold limb:
meaning: या॒ ग्रै॒व्या अपचि॒तो॒ ऽथो या॒ उपपक्ष्याः॑ । विजा॒म्नि या॒ अपचि॒तः स्वयंस्र॒सः ॥२॥

text: I have expelled and banished all Scrofula harboured in the head, And that which bores the breast-bone through, and that which settles in the sole.
meaning: यः॒ की॒कसाः प्रशृणा॒ति तलीद्य॑म् अवति॒ष्ठति । नि॒र् हास् तं॒ स॒र्वं जाया॒न्यम् यः॒ क॒श् च ककु॒दि श्रितः॒ ॥३॥

text: Scrofula flies borne on by wings: it penerates and holds the man. Here is the cure of either kind, the chronic and the transient.
meaning: पक्षी॒ जाया॒न्यः पतति स॒ आ॒ विशति पू॒रुषम् । त॒द् अ॒क्षितस्य भेषज॒म् उभ॒योः सु॒क्षतस्य च ॥४॥

text: We know thine origin, Scrofula! know whence thou, Scrofula, art born. How hast thou then struck this man here, him in whose house we sacrifice?
meaning: विद्म॒ वै॒ ते जायान्य जा॒नं य॒तो जायान्य जा॒यसे । कथं॒ ह त॒त्र त्व॒म् हनो य॒स्य कृण्मो॒ हवि॒र् गृहे॒ ॥१॥

text: Boldly drink Soma from the beaker, Indra! hero in war for treasure! Vritra-slayer. Fill thyself full at the mid-day libation: thyself possessing riches grant us riches.
meaning: धृष॒त् पिब कल॒शे सो॒मम् इन्द्र वृत्रहा॒ शूर समरे॒ व॒सूनाम् । मा॒ध्यन्दिने स॒वन आ॒ वृषस्व रयिष्ठा॒नो रयि॒म् अस्मा॒सु धेहि ॥२॥

text: Ye Maruts, full of fiery heat, accept this offering brought for you To help us, ye who slay the foe.
meaning: सां॒तपना इदं॒ हवि॒र् म॒रुतस् त॒ज् जुजुष्टन । अस्मा॒कोती॒ रिशादसः ॥१॥

text: Maruts, the man who filled with rage against us beyond our thoughts would harm us, O ye Vasus, May he be tangled in the toils of Mischief: smite ye him down with your most flaming weapon.
meaning: यो॒ नो म॒र्तो मरुतो दुर्हृणायु॒स् तिर॒श् चित्ता॒नि वसवो जि॒घांसति । द्रुहः॒ पा॒शान् प्र॒ति मुञ्चतां स॒स् त॒पिष्ठेन त॒पसा हन्तना त॒म् ॥२॥

text: Each year come, friends to man, the tuneful Maruts, dwelling in spacious mansions, trooped together. Exhilarating, gladdening full of fiery heat, may they deliver us from binding bonds of sin.
meaning: सम्वत्सरी॒णा मरु॒तः स्वर्का॒ उरु॒क्षयाः स॒गणा मा॒नुषासः । ते॒ अस्म॒त् पा॒शान् प्र॒ मुञ्चन्त्व् ए॒नसस् सांतपना॒ मत्सरा॒ मादयिष्ण॒वः ॥३॥

text: I free thee from the cord, I loose the bond, I loose the fastening. Even here, perpetual, Agni, wax thou strong.
meaning: वि॒ ते मुञ्चामि रशनां॒ वि॒ यो॒क्त्रं वि॒ नियो॒जनम् । इहै॒व॒ त्व॒म् अ॒जस्र एध्य् अग्ने ॥१॥

text: I with celestial prayer appoint thee, Agni, maintainer of this man in princely powers. Here brightly shine for us with wealth: declare thou to Gods this favoured giver of oblations.
meaning: अस्मै॒ क्षत्रा॒णि धार॒यन्तम् अग्ने युन॒ज्मि त्वा ब्र॒ह्मणा दै॒व्येन । दीदिह्य् अ॑स्म॒भ्यं द्र॒विणेह॒ भद्रं॒ प्रे॒मं॒ वोचो हविर्दा॒म् देव॒तासु ॥२॥

text: Night of the New-born Moon, whatever fortune the Gods who dwell with greatness have assigned thee, Therewith fulfil our sacrifice, all-baunteous! Blessed One, grant us wealth with manly offspring.
meaning: य॒त् ते देवा॒ अ॒कृण्वन् भागधे॒यम् अ॒मावास्ये संव॒सन्तो महित्वा॒ । ते॒ना नो यज्ञं॒ पिपृहि विश्ववारे रयिं॒ नो धेहि सुभगे सुवी॒रम् ॥१॥

text: I am the New Moon's Night, the good and pious are my in- habitants, these dwell within me. In me have Gods of both the spheres, and Sādhyas, with Indra as their chief, all met together.
meaning: अह॒म् एवा॒स्म्य् अमावास्या॑ मा॒म् आ॒ वसन्ति सुकृ॒तो म॒यीमे॒ । म॒यि देवा॒ उभ॒ये साद्या॒श् चे॒न्द्रज्येष्ठाः स॒म् अगछन्त स॒र्वे ॥२॥

text: The Night hath come, the gatherer of treasures, bestowing strength, prosperity, and riches. To New Moon's Night let us present oblation: pouring out strength, with milk hath she come hither.
meaning: आ॒गन् रा॒त्री सङ्ग॒मनी व॒सूनाम् ऊ॒र्जं पुष्टं॒ व॒स्व् आवेश॒यन्ती । अमावास्या॑यै हवि॒ष विधेमो॒र्जं दु॒हाना प॒यसा न आ॒गन् ॥३॥

text: Night of New Moon! ne'er hath been born another than thou embracing all these forms and natures, May we have what we longed for when we brought thee obla- tions: may we be the lords of riches.
meaning: अ॒मावास्ये न॒ त्व॒द् एता॒न्य् अन्यो॒ वि॒श्वा रूपा॒णि परिभू॒र् जजान । य॒त्कामास् ते जुहुम॒स् त॒न् नो अस्तु वयं॒ स्याम प॒तयो रयिणा॒म् ॥४॥

text: Full in the front, full rearward, from the middle the Full Moon's Night hath conquered in the battle. In her: may we, dwelling with Gods and greatness, feast in the height of heaven, on strengthening viands.
meaning: पौर्णमासी॒ जिगाय । त॒स्यां देवैः॒ संव॒सन्तो महित्वा॒ ना॒कस्य पृष्ठे॒ स॒म् इषा॒ मदेम ॥१॥

text: To him, the Full Moon's mighty Bull, we pay our solemn sacri- fice. May he bestow upon us wealth unwasting, inexhaustible.
meaning: वृषभं॒ वाजि॒नं वयं॒ पौर्णमासं॒ यजामहे । स॒ नो ददात्व् अ॒क्षितां रयि॒म् अ॒नुपदस्वतीम् ॥२॥

text: No one but thou, Prajāpati, none beside thee, pervading, gave to all these forms their being. Grant us our hearts' desire when we invoke thee: may we have store of riches in possession.
meaning: प्र॒जापते न॒ त्व॒द् एता॒न्य् अन्यो॒ वि॒श्वा रूपा॒णि परिभू॒र् जजान । य॒त्कामास् ते जुहुम॒स् त॒न् नो अस्तु वयं॒ स्याम प॒तयो रयीणा॒म् ॥३॥

text: First was the Full Moon meet for adoration among the days and in the nights' deep darkness. Into thy heaven, O Holy One, have entered those pious men who honour thee with worship.
meaning: पौर्णमासी॒ प्रथमा॒ यज्ञि॒यासीद् अ॒ह्नां रा॒त्रीणाम् अतिशर्वरे॒षु । ये॒ त्वा॒म् यज्ञै॒र् यज्ञिये अर्ध॒यन्त्य् अमी॒ ते ना॒के सुकृ॒तः प्र॒विष्टाः ॥४॥

text: Forward and backward by their wondrous power move these two youths, disporting, round the ocean. One views all living things, and thou, the other, art born again arranging times and seasons.
meaning: पूर्वापरं॒ चरतो मय॒यैतौ॒ शि॒शू क्री॒डन्तौ प॒रि यातो ऽर्णव॒म् । वि॒श्वान्यो॒ भु॒वना विच॒ष्ट ऋतूं॒र् अन्यो॒ विद॒धज् जायसे न॒वः ॥१॥

text: Thou art re-born for ever new: thou marchest, ensign of days, in forefront of the mornings. Marching thou dealest to the Gods their portion. Thou lengthe- nest, Moon! the days of man's existence.
meaning: न॒वोनवो भवसि जा॒यमानो॒ ऽह्नां केतु॒र् उष॒साम् एष्य् अ॒ग्रम् । भागं॒ देवे॒भ्यो वि॒ दधास्य् आय॒न् प्र॒ चन्द्रमस् तिरसे धीर्घ॒म् आ॒युः ॥२॥

text: O spray of Soma, Lord of Wars! all-perfect verily art thou. Make me all-perfect, Beauteous One! in riches and in progeny.
meaning: सो॒मस्याम्शो युधां पते॒ ऽनूनो ना॒म वा॒ असि । अ॒नूनम् दर्श मा कृधि प्रज॒या च ध॒नेन च ॥३॥

text: Thou art the New Moon, fair to see, thou art complete in every part. May I be perfect, fully blest in every way in steeds and kine, in children, cattle, home, and wealth.
meaning: दर्शो॒ ऽसि दर्शतो॒ ऽसि स॒मग्रो ऽसि स॒मन्तः । स॒मग्रः स॒मन्तो भूयासं गो॒भिर् अ॒श्वैः प्रज॒या पशु॒भिर् गृहै॒र् ध॒नेन ॥४॥

text: Inflate thee with his vital breath who hathes us and whom we detest. May we grow rich in steeds and kine, in children, cattle, houses, wealth.
meaning: यो॑ ऽस्मा॒न् द्वे॒ष्टि यं॒ वयं॒ द्विष्म॒स् त॒स्य त्वं॒ प्राणे॒ना॒ प्यायस्व । आ॒ वयं॒ प्यासिषीमहि गो॒भिर् अ॒श्वैः प्रज॒या पशु॒भिर् गृहै॒र् ध॒नेन ॥५॥

text: With that unwasting stalk which Gods, unwasting Gods, in- crease and eat, May Varuna, Brihaspati, and Indra, the Lords and Guardians of the world, increase us.
meaning: यं॒ देवा॒ अंशु॒म् आप्याय॒यन्ति य॒म् अ॒क्षितम् अ॒क्षिता भक्ष॒यन्ति । ते॒नास्मा॒न् इ॒न्द्रो व॒रुणो बृ॒हस्प॒तिर् आ॒ प्याययन्तु भु॒वनस्य गोपाः॒ ॥६॥

text: Sing with fair laud the combat for the cattle. Bestow upon us excellent possessions. Lead to the Gods the sacrifice we offer: let streams of oil flow pure and full of sweetness.
meaning: अभ्य् अ॑र्चत सुष्टुतिं॒ ग॒व्यम् आजि॒म् अस्मा॒सु भद्रा॒ द्र॒विणानि धत्त । इमं॒ यज्ञं॒ नयत देव॒ता नो घृत॒स्य धा॒रा म॒धुमत् पवन्ताम् ॥१॥

text: Agni I first appropriate with power, with splendour, and with might. I give myself children and lengthened life, with Hail! take Agni to myself.
meaning: म॒य्य् अ॒ग्रे अग्निं॒ गृह्णामि सह॒ क्षत्रे॒ण व॒र्चसा ब॒लेन । म॒यि प्रजां॒ म॒य्य् आ॒युर् दधामि स्वा॒हा म॒य्य् अग्नि॒म् ॥२॥

text: Even here do thou, O Agni, stablish wealth: let not oppressors injure thee by thinking of thee first. Light be thy task of ruling, Agni, with, thy power: may he who worships thee wax strong, invincible.
meaning: इहै॒वा॒ग्ने अ॒ध्य् धारया रयि॒म् मा॒ त्वा नि॒ क्रन् पू॒र्वचित्ता निकारि॒णः । क्षत्रे॒णाग्ने सुय॒मम् अस्तु तु॒भ्यम् उपसत्ता॒ वर्धतां ते अ॒निष्टृतः ॥३॥

text: Agni hath looked upon the spring of Morning, looked on the days, the earliest Jātavedas. So, following the gleams of Morning, Sūrya hath entered heaven and earth as his possession.
meaning: अ॒न्व् अग्नि॒र् उष॒साम् अ॒ग्रम् अख्यद् अ॒न्व् अ॒हानि प्रथमो॒ जात॒वेदाः । अ॒नु सू॒र्य उष॒सो अ॒नु रश्मी॒न् अ॒नु द्या॒वापृथिवी॒ आ॒ विवेश ॥४॥

text: Agni hath looked upon the spring of Mornings, looked on the days, the earliest Jātavedas. So he in countless places hath extended, full against heaven and earth, the beams of Sūrya.
meaning: प्र॒त्य् अग्नि॒र् उष॒साम् अ॒ग्रम् अख्यत् प्र॒ति अ॒हानि प्रथमो॒ जात॒वेदाः । प्र॒ति सू॒र्यस्य पुरुधा॒ च रश्मी॒न् प्र॒ति द्या॒वापृथिवी॒ आ॒ ततान ॥५॥

text: Butter to thee in heaven thy home, O Agni! Manu this day hath kindled thee with butter. Let the Celestial Daughters bring thee butter: Let cows pour butter forth for thee, O Agni.
meaning: घृतं॒ ते अग्ने दिव्ये॒ सध॒स्थे घृते॒न त्वां॒ म॒नुर् अद्या॒ स॒म् इन्धे । घृतं॒ ते देवी॒र् नप्त्य॑ आ॒ वहन्तु घृतं॒ तु॒भ्यं दुह्रतां गा॒वो अग्ने ॥६॥

text: Stablished amid the waters is, King Varuna, thy golden home. Thence let the Sovran who maintains the statutes loose all bind- ing cords.
meaning: अप्सु॒ ते राजन् वरुण गृहो॒ हिरण्य॒यो मितः॒ । त॒तो धृत॒व्रतो रा॒जा स॒र्वा धा॒मानि मुञ्चतु ॥१॥

text: Hence free thou us, King Varuna, from each successive bond and tie. As we have cried, O Varuna! have said, The Waters, they are kine, thence set us free, O Varuna.
meaning: दा॒म्नोदाम्नो राजन्न् इतो॒ वरुण मुञ्च नः । य॒द् आ॒पो अघ्न्या॒ इ॒ति व॒रुणे॒ति य॒द् ऊचिम॒ त॒तो वरुण मुञ्च नः ॥२॥

text: Loosen the bonds, O Varuna, that hold us, loosen the bond. above, between, and under. So before Aditi may we be sinless under thy favouring auspices, Āditya!
meaning: उ॒द् उत्तमं॒ वरुण पा॒शम् अस्म॒द् अ॒वाधमं॒ वि॒ मध्यमं॒ श्रथाय । अ॒धा वय॒म् आदित्य व्रते॒ तवा॒नागसो अ॒दितये स्याम ॥३॥

text: Varuna, free us from all snares that bind us, Varuna's bonds, the upper and the lower. Drive from us evil dream, drive off misfortune: then let us pass into the world of virtue.
meaning: प्रा॒स्म॒त् पा॒शान् वरुण मुञ्च स॒र्वान् य॒ उत्तमा॒ अधमा॒ वारुणा॒ ये॒ । दुष्व॒प्न्यं दुरितं॒ नि॒ ष्वास्म॒द् अ॒थ गछेम सुकृत॒स्य लोक॒म् ॥४॥

text: Holder of sway, shine here refulgent, Agni! invincible immortal Jātavedas. With succours friendly to mankind, auspicious, driving away all maladies, guard our dwelling.
meaning: अनाधृष्यो॒ जात॒वेदा अ॒मर्त्यो विरा॒ड् अग्ने क्षत्रभृ॒द् दीदिहीह॒ । वि॒श्वा अ॒मीवाः प्रमुञ्च॒न् मा॒नुषीभिः शिवा॒भिर् अद्य॒ प॒रि पाहि नो ग॒यम् ॥१॥

text: Thou, Indra, lord and leader of the people, wast born for lovely strength and high dominion. Thou dravest off the folk who were unfriendly, and madest for the Gods wide room and freedom.
meaning: इ॒न्द्र क्षत्र॒म् अभि॒ वाम॒म् ओ॒जो॒ ऽजायथा वृषभ चर्षणीना॒म् । अ॒पानुदो ज॒नम् अमित्रय॒न्तम् उरुं॒ देवे॒भ्यो अकृणोर् उ लोक॒म् ॥२॥

text: Like a dread wild beast roaming on the mountain, may he. approach us from the farthest distance. Whetting thy bolt and thy sharp blade, O Indra, crush down our foes and scatter those who hate us.
meaning: मृगो॒ न भीमः॒ कुचरो॒ गिरिष्ठाः॒ पराव॒त आ॒ जगम्यात् प॒रस्याः । सृकं॒ संशा॒य पवि॒म् इन्द्र तिग्मं॒ वि॒ श॒त्रून् ताढि वि॒ मृ॒धो नुदस्व ॥३॥

text: This very mighty one whom Gods urge onward, the conqueror of cars, ever triumphant, Swift, fleet to battle, with uninjured fellies, even Tārkshya for our weal will we call hither.
meaning: त्य॒म् ऊ षु॒ वाजि॒नं देव॒जूतं स॒होवानं तरुता॒रं र॒थानाम् । अ॒रिष्टनेमिं पृतनाजि॒म् आशुं॒ स्वस्त॒ये ता॒र्क्ष्यम् इहा॒ हुवेम ॥१॥

text: Indra the rescuer, Indra the helper, Indra the brave who hears each invocation, Sakra I call, Indra invoked of many. May Indra Maghavan pros- per and bless us.
meaning: त्राता॒रम् इ॒न्द्रम् अविता॒रम् इ॒न्द्रं ह॒वेहवे सुह॒वं शू॒रम् इ॒न्द्रम् । हुवे॒ नु शक्रं॒ पुरुहूत॒म् इ॒न्द्रं स्वस्ति॒ न इ॒न्द्रो मघ॒वान् कृणोतु ॥१॥

text: To Rudra in the fire, to him who dwells in floods, to Rudra who hath entered into herbs and plants, To him who formed and fashioned all these worlds, to him this Rudra, yea, to Agni, reverence be paid!
meaning: यो॒ अग्नौ॒ रुद्रो॒ यो॒ अप्स्व् अ॑न्त॒र् य॒ ओ॒षधीर् वीरु॒ध आविवे॒श । य॒ इमा॒वि॒श्वा भु॒वनानि चाक्ल्̥पे॒ त॒स्मै रुद्रा॒य न॒मो अस्त्व् अग्न॒ये ॥१॥

text: Depart! thou art a foe, a foe. Poison with poison hast thou mixt, yea, verily poison hast thou mixt. Go to the serpent: strike him dead.
meaning: अ॒पेह्य् अ॒रिर् अस्य् अ॒रिर् वा॒ असि विषे॒ विष॒म् अपृक्था विष॒म् इ॒द् वा॒ अपृक्थाः । अ॒हिम् एवा॒भ्य॒पेहि तं॒ जहि ॥१॥

text: The heavenly Waters have I ranged: we have been sated with their dew. Here, Agni, bearing milk, am I. Endow me with the gift of strength.
meaning: अपो॒ दिव्या॒ अचायिषम् र॒सेन स॒म् अपृक्ष्महि । प॒यस्वान् अग्न आ॒गमं त॒म् मा सं॒ सृज व॒र्चसा ॥१॥

text: Endow me with the gift of strength, with children, and a length- ened life. May the Gods mark this prayer of mine, may Indra with the Rishis mark.
meaning: सं॒ माग्ने व॒र्चसा सृज सं॒ प्रज॒या स॒म् आ॒युषा । विद्यु॒र् मे अस्य॒ देवा॒ इ॒न्द्रो विद्यात् सह॒ ऋ॒षिभिः ॥२॥

text: Ye Waters, wash away this stain and whatsoever taint be here, Each sinful wrong that I have done and every harmless curse of mine.
meaning: इद॒म् आपः प्र॒ वहतावद्यं॒ च म॒लं च य॒त् । य॒च् चाभिदुद्रो॒हा॒नृतं य॒च् च शेपे॒ अभी॒रुणम् ॥३॥

text: Thou art the wood, may I succeed! fuel, may I be glorified! splendour, give splendour unto me.
meaning: ए॒धो ऽस्य् एधिषीय॒ समि॒द् असि स॒म् एधिषीय । ते॒जो ऽसि ते॒जो म॒यि धेहि ॥४॥

text: Tear thou asunder, as of old, like tangles of a creeping plant. Demolish thou the Dāsa's might.
meaning: अ॒पि वृश्च पुराणव॒द् व्रत॒तेर् इव गुष्पित॒म् । ओ॒जो दास॒स्य दम्भय ॥१॥

text: May we with Indra's help divide the gathered treasure of the foe. I, by the law of Varuna, bring down thy pride and wantonness.
meaning: वयं॒ त॒द् अस्य स॒म्भृतं व॒स्व् इ॒न्द्रेन वि॒ भजामहै । म्लाप॒यामि भ्रजः॒ शिभ्रं॒ व॒रुणस्य व्रते॒न ते ॥२॥

text: Ut virga abeat et feminis innocua fiat, (virga) membri humidi, membri quod verberat penetratque, id quod tentum est laxa, id quod sursum tentum est deorsum tende.
meaning: य॒था शे॒पो अपा॒यातै स्त्रीषु॒ चा॒सद् अ॒नावयाः । अवस्थ॒स्य क्नदी॒वतः शाङ्कुर॒स्य नितोदि॒नः । य॒द् आ॒ततम् अ॒व त॒त् तनु य॒द् उ॒त्ततं नि॒ त॒त् तनु ॥३॥

text: May Indra with his help, Lord of all treasures, be unto us a careful protector. Drive off our foes and give us peace and safety. May we be lords of goodly store of heroes.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रः सुत्रा॒मा स्व॒वां अ॒वोभिः सुमृडीको॒ भवतु विश्व॒वेदाः । बा॒धतां द्वे॒षो अ॒भयं नः कृणोतु सुवी॒र्यस्य प॒तयः स्याम ॥१॥

text: May this rich Indra as our good protector keep even far away the men who hate us. May we enjoy his favour, his the holy: may we enjoy his blessed loving-kindness.
meaning: स॒ सुत्रा॒मा स्व॒वां इ॒न्द्रो अस्म॒द् आरा॒च् चिद् द्वे॒षः सनुत॒र् युयोतु । त॒स्य वयं॒ सुमतौ॒ यज्ञि॒यस्या॒पि भद्रे॒ सौमनसे॒ स्याम ॥१॥

text: With Indra's and with Manyu's aid may we subdue our enemies, resistlessly destroying foes.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रेण मन्यु॒ना वय॒म् अभि॒ ष्याम पृतन्यतः॒ । घ्न॒न्तो वृत्रा॒ण्य् अप्रति॒ ॥१॥

text: We laid the constant Soma on with constant sacrificial gift, That Indra may make all the tribes unanimous and only ours.
meaning: ध्रुवं॒ ध्रुवे॒ण हवि॒षा॒व सो॒मं नयामसि । य॒था न इ॒न्द्रः के॒वलीर् वि॒शः सं॒मनसस् क॒रत् ॥१॥

text: To heaven, as 'twere, have soared this man's two vultures, staggering, dusky hued. The Parcher and the Drier-up, the pair who parch and dry his heart.
meaning: उ॒द् अस्य श्यावौ॒ विथुरौ॒ गृ॒ध्रौ द्या॒म् इव पेततुः । उच्छोचनप्रशोचन॒व् अस्यो॒च्छो॒चनौ हृदः॒ ॥१॥

text: I verily have stirred them up like oxen resting after toil. Like two loud-snarling curs, or like two wolves who watch to make their spring:
meaning: अह॒म् एनाव् उ॒द् अतिष्ठिपं गा॒वौ श्रान्तस॒दाव् इव । कुर्कुरा॒व् इव कू॒जन्ताव् उद॒वन्तौ वृ॒काव् इव ॥२॥

text: Like two that thrust, like two that pierce, like two that strike with mutual blows. I bind the conduit of the man or dame who hence hath taken aught.
meaning: आतोदि॒नौ नितोदि॒नाव् अ॒थो संतोदि॒नाव् उत॒ । अ॒पि नह्याम्य् अस्य मे॒ढ्रं य॒ इतः॒ स्त्री॒ पु॒मान् जभा॒र ॥३॥

text: The kine are resting in the stall, home to her nest hath flown the bird, The hills are firmly rooted: I have fixed the kidneys in their place.
meaning: अ॒सदन् गा॒वः स॒दने॒ ऽपप्तद् वसतिं॒ व॒यः । आस्था॒ने प॒र्वता अस्थुः स्था॒म्नि वृक्का॒व् अतिष्ठिपम् ॥१॥

text: As we have here elected thee, skilled Hotar! to-day as this our sacrifice proceedeth, Come to the firm place, mightiest! yea, come firmly. Knowing the sacrifice, approach the Soma.
meaning: य॒द् अद्य॒ त्वा प्रयति॒ यज्ञे॒ अस्मि॒न् हो॒तश् चिकित्वन्न् अ॒वृणीमहीह॒ । ध्रुव॒म् अयो ध्रुव॒म् उता॒ शविष्ठैप्रविद्वा॒न् यज्ञ॒म् उ॒प याहि सो॒मम् ॥१॥

text: With kine connect us, and with spirit, Indra! Lord of Bay Steeds, with princes and with favour, With the God-destined portion of the Brāhmans, and the good-will of Gods who merit worship.
meaning: स॒म् इन्द्र नो म॒नसा नेष गो॒भिः सं॒ सूरि॒भिर् हरिवन्त् सं॒ स्वस्त्या॒ । सं॒ ब्र॒ह्मणा देव॒हितं य॒द् अ॒स्ति सं॒ देवा॒नां सुमतौ॒ यज्ञि॒यानाम् ॥२॥

text: The willing Gods whom, God, thou hast brought hither, send thou to their own dwelling-place, O Agni. When ye have eaten and have drunk sweet juices, endow this man with precious wealth, ye Vasus.
meaning: या॒न् आ॒वह उशतो॒ देव देवां॒स् ता॒न् प्रे॒रय स्वे॒ अग्ने सध॒स्थे । जक्षिवां॒सः पपिवां॒सो म॒धून्य् अस्मै॒ धत्त वसवो व॒सूनि ॥३॥

text: Gods, we have made your seats of easy access, who, pleased with me, have come to my libation. Bearing and bringing hitherward your treasures, after the rich warm beverage mount to heaven.
meaning: सुगा॒ वो देवाः स॒दना अकर्म य॒ आजग्म॒ स॒वने मा जुषाणाः॒ । व॒हमाना भ॒रमाणाः स्वा॒ व॒सूनि व॒सुं घर्मं॒ दि॒वम् आ॒ रोहता॒नु ॥४॥

text: Go to the sacrifiee, go to its master, Sacrifice! To thy birth- place go with Svāhā.
meaning: य॒ज्ञ यज्ञं॒ गछ यज्ञ॒पतिं गछ । स्वां॒ यो॒निं गछ स्वा॒हा ॥५॥

text: This is thy sacrifice with hole hymnal, Lord of the Rite, Svāhā! and fraught with vigour.
meaning: एष॒ ते यज्ञो॒ यज्ञपते सह॒सूक्तवाकः । सुवी॒र्यः स्वा॒हा ॥६॥

text: Vashat to paid and yet unpaid oblations! Ye Gods who know the way, find and pursue it!
meaning: व॒षड् धुते॒भ्यो व॒षड् अ॒हुतेभ्यः । दे॒वा गातुविदो गातुं॒ वित्त्वा॒ गातु॒म् इत ॥७॥

text: Lord of the Mind, lay this our sacrifice in heaven among the Gods. Svāhā in heaven! Svāhā on earth! Svāhā in air! In wind have I paid offerings. Hail!
meaning: म॒नसस् पत इमं॒ नो दिवि॒ देवे॒षु यज्ञ॒म् । स्वा॒हा दिवि॒ स्वा॒हा पृथिव्यां॒ स्वा॒हान्त॒रिक्षे स्वा॒हा वा॒ते धां स्वा॒हा ॥८॥

text: Balmed is the Grass with butter and libation, with Indra. gracious Lord, and with the Maruts. Hail! let the sacrifice go forth anointed to Indra with the Gods and Visve Devas.
meaning: सं॒ बर्हि॒र् अक्तं॒ हवि॒षा घृते॒न स॒म् इ॒न्द्रेण व॒सुना सं॒ मरु॒द्भिः । सं॒ देवै॒र् विश्व॒देवेभिर् अक्त॒म् इ॒न्द्रं गछतु हविः॒ स्वा॒हा ॥१॥

text: Strew thou the Grass, and spread it on the Altar: rob not the sister who is lying yonder. The Hotar's seat is green and golden: these are gold necklets. in the plaee of him who worships.
meaning: प॒रि स्तृणीहि प॒रि धेहि वे॒दिं मा॒ जामिं॒ मोषीर् अमुया॒ श॒यानाम् । होतृष॒दनम् ह॒रितं हिरण्य॒यं निष्का॒ एते॒ य॒जमानस्य लोके॒ ॥१॥

text: I turn away from evil dream, from dream of sin, from indigence. I make the prayer mine inmost friend. Hence! torturing. dreamy phantasies!
meaning: पर्या॒वर्ते दुष्व॒प्न्यात् पापा॒त् स्व॒प्न्याद् अ॒भूत्याः । ब्र॒ह्माह॒म् अ॒न्तरं कृण्वे प॒रा स्व॒प्नमुखाः शु॒चः ॥१॥

text: The food that in a dream I eat is not perceived at early morn. May all that food be blest to me because it is not seen by day.
meaning: य॒त् स्व॒प्ने अ॒न्नम् अश्ना॒मि न॒ प्रात॒र् अधिगम्य॒ते । स॒र्वं त॒द् अस्तु मे शिवं॒ नहि॒ त॒द् दृष्य॒ते दि॒वा ॥१॥

text: When I have worshipped Heaven and Earth, reverenced Firma- ment and Death, I will make water standing up. Let not the Sovrans injure me.
meaning: नमस्कृ॒त्य द्या॒वापृथिवी॒भ्याम् अन्त॒रिक्षाय मृत्य॒वे । मेक्षा॒म्य् ऊर्ध्व॒स् ति॒ष्ठन् मा॒ मा हिंसिषुर् ईश्वराः॒ ॥१॥

text: What princely warrior, seeking higher fortune, will free us from this shameful fiend of mischief? What friend of sacrifice? What guerdon-lover? Who winneth: 'mid the Gods a long existence?
meaning: को॒ अस्या॒ नो द्रुहो॒ ऽवद्य॒वत्या उ॒न् नेष्यति क्षत्रि॒यो व॒स्य इछ॒न् । को॒ यज्ञ॒कामः क॒ उ पू॒र्तिकामः को॒ देवे॒षु वनुते दीर्घ॒म् आ॒युः ॥१॥

text: Who will prepare the dappled Cow, good milker, ne'er without calf, whom Varuna gave Atharvan, And, joying in Brihaspati's alliance, arrange according to his will her body?
meaning: कः॒ पृ॒श्निं धेनुं॒ व॒रुणेन दत्ता॒म् अ॒थर्वने सुदु॒घां नि॒त्यवत्साम् । बृ॒हस्प॒तिना सख्यं॑ जुषणो॒ यथावशं॒ तन्वः॑ कल्पयाति ॥१॥

text: Leaving humanity behind, making the heavenly word thy choice, With all thy friends address thyself to furthering and guiding men.
meaning: अपक्रा॒मन् पौ॒रुषेयाद् वृणानो॒ दै॒व्यं व॒चः । प्र॒णीतीर् अभ्या॒वर्तस्व वि॒श्वेभिः स॒खिभिः सह॒ ॥१॥

text: Each thoughtless ill that we have done, O Agni, all error in our conduct, Jātavedas! Therefrom do thou, O sapient God, preserve us. May we thy friends, for bliss, have life eternal.
meaning: य॒द् अ॒स्मृति चकृम॒ किं॒ चिद् अग्न उपारिम॒ च॒रणे जातवेदः । त॒तः पाहि त्वं॒ नः प्रचेतः शुभे॒ स॒खिभ्यो अमृतत्व॒म् अस्तु नः ॥१॥

text: The seven bright beams of Surya bring the waters downward from the sky, The streams of ocean: these have made the sting that pained thee drop away.
meaning: अ॒व दिव॒स् तारयन्ति सप्त॒ सू॒र्यस्य रश्म॒यः । आ॒पः समुद्रि॒या धा॒रास् ता॒स् शल्य॒म् असिस्रसन् ॥१॥

text: Whoso by stealth or openly would harm us, a friend who knows us, or a stranger, Agni! May the strange she-fiend armed with teeth attack them: O Agni, theirs be neither home nor children!
meaning: यो॒ न स्ताय॒द् दि॒प्सति यो॒ न आविः॒ स्वो॒ विद्वा॒न् अ॒रणो वा नो अग्ने । प्रती॒च्य् एत्व् अ॒रणी दत्व॒ती ता॒न् मै॒षाम् अग्ने वा॒स्तु भून् मो॒ अ॒पत्यम् ॥१॥

text: Whoso oppresseth us O Jātavedas, asleep or waking, standing still or moving. Accordant with Vaisvānara thy comrade, O Jātavedas, meet them and consume them.
meaning: यो॒ नः सुप्ता॒न् जा॒ग्रतो वाभिदा॒सात् ति॒ष्ठतो वा च॒रतो जातवेदः । वैश्वानरे॒ण सयु॒जा सजो॒षास् ता॒न् प्रती॒चो नि॒र् दह जातवेदः ॥२॥

text: My homage to the strong, the brown, the sovran lord among the dice! Butter on Kali I bestow: may he be kind to one like me.
meaning: इद॒म् उग्रा॒य बभ्र॒वे न॒मो यो॒ अक्षे॒षु तनूवशी॒ । घृते॒न क॒लिं शिक्षामि स॒ नो मृडातीदृ॒शे ॥१॥

text: Bear butter to the Apsarases, O Agni, and to the Dice bear dust and sand and water. The Gods delight in both oblations, joying in sacrificial gifts apportioned duly.
meaning: घृत॒म् अप्सरा॒भ्यो वह त्व॒म् अग्ने पांसू॒न् अक्षे॒भ्यः सि॒कता अप॒श् च । यथाभगं॒ हव्य॒दातिं जुषाणा॒ म॒दन्ति देवा॒ उभ॒यानि हव्या॒ ॥२॥

text: The Apsarases take pleasure in the banquet between the Sun and. the libation-holder. With butter let them fill my hands, and give me, to be my prey, the man who plays against me.
meaning: अप्सर॒सः सधमा॒दं मदन्ति हविर्धा॒नम् अन्तरा॒ सू॒र्यं च । ता॒ मे ह॒स्तौ सं॒ सृजन्तु घृते॒न सप॒त्नं मे कितव॒म् रन्धयन्तु ॥३॥

text: Evil be mine opponent's luck! Sprinkle thou butter over us. Strike, as a tree with lightning flash, mine adversary in the game.
meaning: आदिनवं॒ प्रतिदी॒व्ने घृते॒नास्मां॒ अभि॒ क्षर । वृक्ष॒म् इवाश॒न्या जहि यो॒ अस्मा॒न् प्रतिदी॒व्यति ॥४॥

text: The God who found for us this wealth for gambling, to cast the dice and count the winning number, May he accept the sacrifice we offer, and with Gandharvas revel in the banquet.
meaning: यो॒ नो द्युवे॒ ध॒नम् इदं॒ चका॒र यो॒ अक्षा॒णां ग्ल॒हनं शे॒षणं च । स॒ नो देवो॒ हवि॒र् इदं॒ जुषाणो॒ गन्धर्वे॒भिः सधमा॒दं मदेम ॥५॥

text: Fellow-inhabitants, such is your title, for Dice with looks of power support dominion. As such with offerings may we serve you, Indus! May we have riches in our own possession.
meaning: सं॒वसव इ॒ति वो नामधे॒यम् उग्रंपश्या॒ राष्ट्रभृ॒तो ह्य् अ॑क्षाः॒ । ते॒भ्यो व इन्दवो हवि॒षा विधेम वयं॒ स्याम प॒तयो रयीणा॒म् ॥६॥

text: As I invoke the Gods at need, as I have lived in chastity, May these, when I have grasped the Dice, the brown, be kind to one like me.
meaning: देवा॒न् य॒न् नाथितो॒ हुवे॒ ब्रह्मच॒र्यं य॒द् ऊषिम॒ । अक्षा॒न् य॒द् बभ्रू॒न् आल॒भे ते॒ नो मृडन्त्व् ईदृ॒शे ॥७॥

text: Resistless, Agni, Indra, smite his foemen for the worshipper, For best foe-slayers are ye both.
meaning: अ॒ग्न इ॒न्द्रश् च दाशु॒षे हतो॒ वृत्रा॒ण्य् अप्रति॒ । उभा॒ हि॒ वृत्रह॒न्तमा ॥१॥

text: Agni I call, and Indra, foe-destroyers, swift moving, heroes, Gods who wield the thunder, Through whom they won the light in the beginning, these who have made all worlds their habitation.
meaning: या॒भ्याम् अ॒जयन्त् स्व॑र् अ॒ग्र एव॒ या॒व् आतस्थ॒तुर् भु॒वनानि वि॒श्वा । प्र॒ चर्षणी॒वृ॒षणा व॒ज्रबाहू अग्नि॒म् इ॒न्द्रम् वृत्रह॒णा हुवे ऽह॒म् ॥२॥

text: The God Brihaspati hath won thy friendly favour with the cup. With hymns, O Indra, enter us for the juice-pouring worshipper.
meaning: उ॒प त्वा देवो॒ अग्रमीच् चमसे॒न बृ॒हस्प॒तिः । इ॒न्द्र गीर्भि॒र् न आ॒ विश य॒जमानाय सुन्वते॒ ॥३॥

text: Belly of Indra art thou, Soma-holder! the very soul of Gods and human beings. Here be the sire of offspring, thine here present! Here be they glad in thee who now are elsewhere.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रस्य कुक्षि॒र् असि सोमधा॒न आत्मा॒ देवा॒नाम् उत॒ मा॒नुषाणाम् । इह॒ प्रजा॒ जनय या॒स् त आसु॒ या॒ अन्य॒त्रेह॒ ता॒स् ते रमन्ताम् ॥१॥

text: Radiant with light are Heaven and Earth, whose grace is nigh, whose sway is vast. Seven Goddesses have flowed to us: may they deliver us from woe;
meaning: शु॒म्भनी द्या॒वापृथिवी॒ अ॒न्तिसुम्ने म॒हिव्रते । आ॒पः सप्त॒ सुस्रुवुर् देवी॒स् ता॒ नो मुञ्चन्त्व् अं॒हसः ॥१॥

text: Release me from the curse's bond and plague that comes from Varuna; Free me from Yama's fetter and from every sin against the Gods.
meaning: मुञ्च॒न्तु मा शपथ्या॑द् अ॒थो वरुण्या॑द् उत॒ । अ॒थो यम॒स्य प॒ड्वीशाद् वि॒श्वस्माद् देवकिल्बिषा॒त् ॥२॥

text: Rough Plant, thou rough rude parasite, cut thou that man, O Rough and Rude, That thou mayst hinder from his act that man in all his manly strength.
meaning: तृ॒ष्टिके तृ॒ष्टवन्दन उ॒द् अमूं॒ छिन्धि तृष्टिके । य॒था कृत॒द्विष्टा॒सो ऽमु॒ष्मै शेप्या॒वते ॥१॥

text: Thou, rugged Plant, art rude and rough, Vishā, Vishātaki art thou. That thou mayest be cast off by him, as by a bull a barren cow.
meaning: तृष्टा॒सि तृष्टिका॒ विषा॒ विषातक्य् अ॑सि । प॒रिवृक्ता य॒था॒सस्य् ऋषभ॒स्य वशे॒व ॥२॥

text: I have extracted from thy sides, I have extracted from thy heart, I have extracted from thy face the strength and splendour that were thine.
meaning: आ॒ ते ददे वक्ष॒णाभ्य आ॒ ते ऽहं॒ हृ॒दयाद् ददे । आ॒ ते मु॒खस्य स॒ङ्काशात् स॒र्वं ते व॒र्च आ॒ ददे ॥१॥

text: Let pain and suffering pass away, let cares and curses vanish. hence. Let Agni slay the fiendish hags, Soma kill bags who trouble us.
meaning: प्रे॒तो॒ यन्तु व्या॑ध्यः प्रा॒नुध्याः॒ प्रो॒ अ॒शस्तयः । अग्नी॒ रक्षस्वि॒नीर् हन्तु सो॒मो हन्तु दुरस्यतीः॒ ॥२॥

text: Hence. Evil Fortune! fly away, vanish from this place and from that. We fix thee with an iron hook unto the man who hateth us.
meaning: प्र॒ पतेतः॒ पापि लक्ष्मि न॒श्येतः॒ प्रा॒मु॒तः पत । अयस्म॒येनाङ्के॒न द्विषते॒ त्वा॒ सजामसि ॥१॥

text: Granting us riches, Savitar! golden-banded, send thou away from us to other regions That Fortune who, flying, abominable, hath, as a creeper climbs a tree, assailed me.
meaning: या॒ मा लक्ष्मीः॒ पतयालू॒र् अ॒जुष्टाभिचस्क॒न्द व॒न्दनेव वृक्ष॒म् । अन्य॒त्रास्म॒त् सवितस् ता॒म् इतो॒ धा हि॒रण्यहस्तो व॒सु नो र॒राणः ॥२॥

text: One and a hundred Fortunes all together are at his birth born with a mortal's body. Of these we send away the most unlucky: keep lucky ones for us, O Jātavedas.
meaning: ए॒कशतं लक्ष्म्यो॑ म॒र्त्यस्य साकं॒ तन्वा॑ जनु॒षो॒ ऽधि जाताः॒ । ता॒सां पा॒पिष्ठा नि॒र् इतः॒ प्र॒ हिण्मः शिवा॒ अस्म॒भ्यं जातवेदो नि॒यछ ॥३॥

text: I have disparted these and those like cows who stray on common land. Here let auspicious Fortunes stay: hence have I banished evil ones.
meaning: एता॒ एना व्या॒करं खिले॒ गा॒ वि॒ष्ठिता इव । र॒मन्तां पु॒ण्या लक्ष्मी॒र् याः॒ पापी॒स् ता॒ अनीनशम् ॥४॥

text: Homage to him the burning one, shaker, exciter, violent! Homage to him the cold who acts according to his ancient will!
meaning: न॒मो रूरा॒य च्य॒वनाय नो॒दनाय धृष्ण॒वे । न॒मः शीता॒य पूर्वकामकृ॒त्वने ॥१॥

text: May he, the lawless one, who comes alternate or two following days, pass over and possess the frog.
meaning: यो॒ अन्येद्यु॒र् उभयद्यु॒र् अभ्ये॒तीमं॒ मण्डू॒कम् । अभ्य् ए॑त्व् अव्रतः॒ ॥२॥

text: Come hither, Indra, with bay steeds, joyous, with tails like pea- cock plumes. Let none impede thy way as fowlers stay the bird: pass o'er them as o'er desert lands.
meaning: आ॒ मन्द्रै॒र् इन्द्र ह॒रिभिर् याहि॒ मयू॒ररोमभिः । मा॒ त्वा के॒ चिद् वि॒ यमन् विं॒ न॒ पाशि॒नो ऽति ध॒न्वेव तां॒ इहि ॥१॥

text: Thy vital parts I cover with thine armour: with immortality King Soma clothe thee! Varuna give thee what is more than ample, and in thy triumph let the Gods be joyful.
meaning: म॒र्माणि ते व॒र्मणा छादयामि सो॒मस् त्वा रा॒जामृ॒तेना॒नु वस्ताम् । उरो॒र् व॒रीयो व॒रुणस् ते कृणोतु ज॒यन्तं त्वा॒नु देवा॒ मदन्तु ॥१॥

text: Homage to Death the Ender! May thy breathings, inward and outward, still remain within thee. Here stay this man united with his spirit in the Sun's realm, the world of life eternal!
meaning: अ॒न्तकाय मृत्य॒वे न॒मः प्राना॒ अपाना॒ इह॒ ते रमन्ताम् । इहा॒य॒म् अस्तु पु॒रुषः सहा॒सुना सू॒र्यस्य भागे॒ अमृ॒तस्य लोके॒ ॥१॥

text: Bhaga hath lifted up this man, and Soma with his filaments, Indra and Agni, and the Gods the Maruts, raised him up to health.
meaning: उ॒द् एनं भ॒गो अग्रभीद् उ॒द् एनं सो॒मो अंशुमा॒न् । उ॒द् एनं मरु॒तो देवा॒ उ॒द् इन्द्राग्नी॒ स्वस्त॒ये ॥२॥

text: Here is thy spirit, here thy breath, here is thy life, here is thy soul: By a celestial utterance we raise thee from Destruction's bonds.
meaning: इह॒ ते॒ ऽसुर् इह॒ प्राण॒ इहा॒युर् इह॒ ते म॒नः । उ॒त् त्वा नि॒रृत्याः पा॒शेभ्यो दै॒व्या वचा॒ भरामसि ॥३॥

text: Up from this place, O man, rise! sink not downward, casting away the bonds of Death that hold thee. Be not thou parted from this world, from sight of Agni and the Sun.
meaning: उ॒त् क्रामा॒तः पुरुष मा॒व पत्था मृत्योः॒ प॒ड्वीषम् अवमुञ्च॒मानः । मा॒ छित्था अस्मा॒ल् लोका॒द् अग्नेः॒ सू॒र्यस्य संदृ॒शः ॥४॥

text: Purely for thee breathe Wind and Mātarisvan, and let the Waters rain on thee their nectar. The Sun shall shine with healing on thy body; Death shall have mercy on thee: do not leave us!
meaning: तु॒भ्यं वा॒तः पवतां मातरि॒श्वा तु॒भ्यं वर्षन्त्व् अमृ॒तान्य् आ॒पः । सू॒र्यस् ते तन्वे॑ शं॒ तपाति त्वा॒म् मृत्यु॒र् दयतां मा॒ प्र॒ मेष्ठाः ॥५॥

text: Upward must be thy way, O man, not downward: with life and mental vigour I endow thee. Ascend this car eternal, lightly rolling; then full of years shalt thou address the meeting.
meaning: उद्या॒नं ते पुरुष ना॒वया॒नं जीवा॒तुं ते द॒क्षतातिं कृनोमि । आ॒ हि॒ रो॒हेम॒म् अमृ॒तं सुखं॒ र॒थम् अ॒थ जि॒र्विर् विद॒थम् आ॒ वदासि ॥६॥

text: Let not thy soul go thither, nor be lost to us: slight not the living, go not where the Fathers are. Let all the Gods retain thee here in safety.
meaning: मा॒ ते म॒नस् त॒त्र गान् मा॒ तिरो॒ भून् मा॒ जीवे॒भ्यः प्र॒ मदो मा॒नु गाः पितृ॒̄न् । वि॒श्वे देवा॒ अभि॒ रक्षन्तु त्वेह॒ ॥७॥

text: Yearn not for the departed ones, for those who lead men far away. Rise up from darkness into light: come, both thy hands we clasp in ours.
meaning: मा॒ गता॒नाम् आ॒ दीधीथा ये॒ न॒यन्ति पराव॒तम् । आ॒ रोह त॒मसो ज्यो॒तिर् ए॒ह्य् आ॒ ते ह॒स्तौ रभामहे ॥८॥

text: Let not the black dog and the brindled seize thee, two warders of the way sent forth by Yama. Come hither; do not hesitate: with mind averted stay not there.
meaning: श्याम॒श् च त्वा मा॒ शब॒लश् च प्रे॒षितौ यम॒स्य यौ॒ पथिर॒क्षी श्वा॒नौ । अर्वा॒ङ् ए॒हि मा॒ वि॒ दीध्यो मा॒त्र तिष्ठः प॒राङ्मनाः ॥९॥

text: Forbear to tread this path, for it is awful: that path I speak of which thou hast not travelled. Enter it not, O man; this way is darkness: forward is danger, hitherward is safety.
meaning: मै॒तं॒ प॒न्थाम् अ॒नु गा भीम॒ एष॒ ये॒न पू॒र्वं ने॒य॒थ तं॒ ब्रवीमि । त॒म एत॒त् पुरुष मा॒ प्र॒ पत्था भयं॒ पर॒स्ताद् अ॒भयं ते अर्वा॒क् ॥१०॥ {१}

text: Thy guardians be the Fires within the Waters, thy guardian be the Fire which men enkindle. Thy guardian be Vaisvānara Jātavedas; let not celestial Fire with lightning burn thee.
meaning: र॒क्षन्तु त्वाग्न॒यो ये॒ अप्स्व् अ॑न्ता॒ र॒क्षतु त्वा मनुष्या॑ य॒म् इन्ध॒ते । वैश्वानरो॒ रक्षतु जात॒वेदा दिव्य॒स् त्वा मा॒ प्र॒ धाग् विद्यु॒ता सह॒ ॥११॥

text: Let not the Flesh-Consumer plot against thee: depart thou far away from the Destroyer. Be Heaven and Earth and Sun and Moon thy keepers, and from the dart of Gods may Air protect thee.
meaning: मा॒ त्वा क्रव्या॒द् अभि॒ मंस्तारा॒त् सं॒कसुकाच् चर र॒क्षतु त्वा द्यौ॒ र॒क्षतु । पृथिवी॒ सू॒र्यश् च त्वा र॒क्षतां चन्द्र॒माश् च । अन्त॒रिक्षं रक्षतु देवहेत्याः॒ ॥१२॥

text: May Vigilance and Watchfulness protect thee, Sleepless and Slumberless keep guard above thee! Let Guardian and let Wakeful be thy warders.
meaning: बोध॒श् च त्वा प्रतिबोध॒श् च रक्षताम् अस्वप्न॒श् च त्वानवद्राण॒श् च रक्षताम् । गोपायं॒श् च त्वा जा॒गृविश् च रक्षताम् ॥१३॥

text: Let these be thy preservers, these thy keepers. All hail to these, to these be lowly worship!
meaning: ते॒ त्वा रक्षन्तु ते॒ त्वा गोपायन्तु ते॒भ्यो न॒मस् ते॒भ्यः स्वा॒हा ॥१४॥

text: May saving Savitar, Vāyu, Indra, Dhātar restore thee to com- munion with the living. Let not thy vigour or thy breath forsake thee: we recall thy life.
meaning: जीवे॒भ्यस् त्वा समु॒दे वायु॒र् इ॒न्द्रो धाता॒ दधातु सविता॒ त्रा॒यमाणः । मा॒ त्वा प्राणो॒ ब॒लं हासीद् अ॒सुं ते॒ ऽनु ह्वयामसि ॥१५॥

text: Let not the fiend with snapping jaws, nor darkness find thee: tongue, holy grass: how shouldst thou perish? May the Ādityas and the Vasus, Indra and Agni raise thee and to health restore thee.
meaning: मा॒ त्वा जम्भः॒ सं॒हनुर् मा॒ त॒मो विदन् मा॒ जिह्वा॒ बर्हि॒स् प्रमयुः॒ कथा॒ स्याः । उ॒त् त्वादित्या॒ व॒सवो भरन्तू॒द् इन्द्राग्नी॒ स्वस्त॒ये ॥१६॥

text: The Sky hath raised thee, and the Earth, Prajāpati hath raised thee up. The Plants and Herbs with Soma as their King have rescued thee from Death.
meaning: उ॒त् त्वा द्यौ॒र् उ॒त् पृथिव्य् उ॒त् प्रजा॒पतिर् अग्रभीत् । उ॒त् त्वा मृत्यो॒र् ओ॒षधयः सो॒मराज्ञीर् अपीपरन् ॥१७॥

text: Here let this man, O Gods, remain: let him not go to yonder world. We rescue him from Mrityu with a charm that hath a thousand powers.
