meaning: अयं॒ देवा इहै॒वा॒स्त्व् अयं॒ मा॒मु॒त्र गाद् इतः॒ । इमं॒ सह॒स्रवीर्येण मृत्यो॒र् उ॒त् पारयामसि ॥१८॥

text: I have delivered thee from Death. Strength-givers smelt and fashion thee! Let not she-fiends with wild loose locks, or fearful howlers yell at thee.
meaning: उ॒त् त्वा मृत्यो॒र् अपीपरं सं॒ धमन्तु वयोध॒सः । मा॒ त्वा व्यस्तकेश्यो॑ मा॒ त्वाघरु॒दो रुदन् ॥१९॥

text: I have attained and captured thee: thou hast returned restored to youth. Perfect in body: so have I found all thy sight and all thy life.
meaning: आ॒हार्षम् अ॒विदं त्वा पु॒नर् आ॒गाः पु॒नर्णवः । स॒र्वाङ्ग स॒र्वं ते च॒क्षुः स॒र्वम् आ॒युश् च ते ऽविदम् ॥२०॥

text: Life hath breathed on thee; light hath come: darkness hath past away from thee. Far from thee we have buried Death, buried Destruction and: Decline.
meaning: व्य् अ॑वात् ते ज्यो॒तिर् अभूद् अ॒प त्व॒त् त॒मो अक्रमीत् । अ॒प त्व॒न् मृत्युं॒ नि॒रृतिम् अ॒प य॒क्ष्मं नि॒ दध्मसि ॥२१॥ {२}

text: Seize to thyself this trust of life for ever: thine be longevity which nothing shortens. Thy spirit and thy life again I bring thee: die not, nor vanish into mist and darkness.
meaning: आ॒ रभस्वेमा॒म् अमृ॒तस्य श्नु॒ष्टिम् अ॒छिद्यमाना जर॒दष्टिर् अस्तु ते । अ॒सुं त आ॒युः पु॒नर् आ॒ भरामि र॒जस् त॒मो मो॒प गा मा॒ प्र॒ मेष्ठाः ॥१॥

text: Come to the light of living men, come hither: I draw thee to a life of hundred autumns. Loosing the bonds of Death, the curse that holds thee, I give thee age of very long duration.
meaning: जी॒वतां ज्यो॒तिर् अभ्ये॒ह्य् अर्वा॒ङ् आ॒ त्वा हरामि शत॒शारदाय । अवमुञ्च॒न् मृत्युपाशा॒न् अ॒शस्तिं द्रा॒घीय आ॒युः प्रतरं॒ ते दधामि ॥२॥

text: Thy breath have I recovered from the Wind, thy vision from the Sun. Thy mind I stablish and secure within thee: feel in thy members,. use thy tongue, conversing.
meaning: वा॒तात् ते प्रान॒म् अविदं सू॒र्याच् च॒क्षुर् अहं॒ त॒व । य॒त् ते म॒नस् त्व॒यि त॒द् धारयामि सं॒ वित्स्वा॒ङ्गैर् व॒द जिह्व॒या॒लपन् ॥३॥

text: I blow upon thee with the breath of bipeds and quadrupeds, as on a fire new-kindled. To thee, O Death, and to thy sight and breath have I paid reverence.
meaning: प्राणे॒न त्वा द्विप॒दां च॒तुष्पदाम् अग्नि॒म् इव जात॒म् अभि॒ सं॒ धमामि । न॒मस् ते मृत्यो च॒क्षुषे न॒मः प्राणा॒य ते ऽकरम् ॥४॥

text: Let this man live, let him not die: we raise him, we recover him. I make for him a healing balm. O Death, forbear to slay this man.
meaning: अयं॒ जीवतु मा॒ मृतेमं॒ स॒म् ईरयामसि । कृणो॒म्य् अस्मै भेषजं॒ मृ॒त्यो मा॒ पु॒रुषं वधीः ॥५॥

text: Here for sound health I invocate a living animating plant, Preserving, queller of disease, victorious, full of power and might.
meaning: जीवलां॒ नघारिषां॒ जीवन्ती॒म् ओ॒षधीम् अह॒म् । त्रायमाणां॒ स॒हमानां स॒हस्वतीम् इह॒ हुवे ऽस्मा॒ अरिष्ट॒तातये ॥६॥

text: Seize him not, but encourage and release him: here let him stay, though thine, in all his vigour. Bhava and Sarva, pity and protect him: give him full life and drive away misfortunes.
meaning: अ॒धि ब्रूहि मा॒ रभथाः सृजे॒मं॒ त॒वैव॒ स॒न्त् स॒र्वहायाः इहा॒स्तु । भ॒वाशर्वौ मृड॒तं श॒र्म यछतम् अपसि॒ध्य दुरितं॒ धत्तम् आ॒युः ॥७॥

text: Comfort him, Death, and pity him: let him arise and pass away, Unharmed, with all his members, hearing well, with old, may he through hundred years win profit with his soul.
meaning: अस्मै॒ मृत्यो अ॒धि ब्रूहीमं॒ दयस्वो॒द् इतो॒ ऽय॒म् एतु । अ॒रिष्टः स॒र्वाङ्गः सुश्रु॒ज् जर॒सा शत॒हायन आत्म॒ना भु॒जम् अश्नुताम् ॥८॥

text: May the Gods' missile pass thee by. I bring thee safe from the mist: from death have I preserved thee. Far have I banished flesh-consuming Agni: I place a rampart for thy life's protection.
meaning: देवा॒नां हेतिः॒ प॒रि त्वा वृणक्तु पार॒यामि त्वा र॒जस उ॒त् त्वा मृत्यो॒र् अपीपरम् । आरा॒द् अग्निं॒ क्रव्या॒दं निरू॒हं जीवा॒तवे ते परिधिं॒ दधामि ॥९॥

text: Saving him from that misty path of thine which cannot be defined. From that descent of thine, O Death, we make for him a shield of prayer.
meaning: य॒त् ते निया॒नं रजसं॒ मृ॒त्यो अनवधर्ष्य॑म् । पथ॒ इमं॒ त॒स्माद् र॒क्षन्तो ब्र॒ह्मास्मै व॒र्म कृण्मसि ॥१०॥ {३}

text: I give thee both the acts of breath, health, lengthened life, and death by age. All Yama's messengers who roam around, sent by Vaivasvata, I chase away.
meaning: कृणो॒मि ते प्राणापानौ॒ जरां॒ मृत्युं॒ दीर्घ॒म् आ॒युः स्वस्ति॒ । वैवस्वते॒न प्र॒हितान् यमदूतां॒श् चरतो॒ ऽप सेधामि स॒र्वान् ॥११॥

text: Far off we drive Malignity, Destruction, Pisāchas banqueters on flesh, and Grāhi. And all the demon kind, the brood of sin, like darkness, we dispel.
meaning: आरा॒द् अ॒रातिं नि॒रृतिं परो॒ ग्रा॒हिं क्रव्या॒दः पिशाचा॒न् । र॒क्षो य॒त् स॒र्वं दुर्भूतं॒ त॒त् त॒म इवा॒प हन्मसि ॥१२॥

text: I win thy life from Agni, from the living everlasting Jātavedas. This I procure for thee, that thou, undying, mayst not suffer harm, that thou mayst be content, that all be well with thee.
meaning: अग्ने॒ष् ट प्रान॒म् अमृ॒ताद् आ॒युष्मतो वन्वे जात॒वेदसः । य॒था न॒ रि॒ष्या अमृ॒तः सजू॒र् अ॒सस् त॒त् ते कृणोमि त॒द् उ ते स॒म् ऋध्यताम् ॥१३॥

text: Gracious to thee be Heaven and Earth, bringing no grief, and drawing nigh! Pleasantly shine the Sun for thee, the Wind blow sweetly to thy heart! Let the celestial Waters full of milk flow happily for thee.
meaning: शिवे॒ ते स्तां द्या॒वापृथिवी॒ असंतापे॒ अभिश्रि॒यौ । शं॒ ते सू॒र्य आ॒ तपतु शं॒ वा॒तो वातु ते हृदे॒ । शिवा॒ अभि॒ क्षरन्तु त्वा॒पो दिव्याः॒ प॒यस्वतीः ॥१४॥

text: Auspicious be the Plants to thee! I have upraised thee, borne thee from the lower to the upper earth: Let the two Sons of Aditi, the Sun and Moon, protect thee there.
meaning: शिवा॒स् ते सन्त्व् ओ॒षधय उ॒त् त्वाहार्षम् अ॒धरस्या उ॒त्तरां पृथिवी॒म् अभि॒ । त॒त्र त्वादित्यौ॒ रक्षतां सूर्याचन्द्रम॒साव् उभा॒ ॥१५॥

text: Whatever robe to cover thee or zone thou makest for thyself, We make it pleasant to thy frame: may it be soft and smooth to touch.
meaning: य॒त् ते वा॒सः परिधा॒नं यां॒ नीविं॒ कृणुषे॒ त्व॒म् । शिवं॒ ते तन्वे॑ त॒त् कृण्मः संस्पर्शे॒ ऽद्रूक्ष्णम् अस्तु ते ॥१६॥

text: When, with a very keen and cleasing razor, our hair and beards thou shavest as a barber, Smoothing our face steal not our vital forces.
meaning: य॒त् क्षुरे॒ण मर्च॒यता सुतेज॒सा व॒प्ता व॒पसि केशश्मश्रु॒ । शु॒भं मु॒खं मा॒ न आ॒युः प्र॒ मोषीः ॥१७॥

text: Auspicious unto thee be rice and barley, causing no painful sick- ness or consumption, these deliver from calamity.
meaning: शिवौ॒ ते स्तां व्रीहियवा॒व् अबलासा॒व् अदोमधौ॒ । एतौ॒ य॒क्ष्मं वि॒ बाधेते एतौ॒ मुञ्चतो अं॒हसः ॥१८॥

text: Thy food, thy drink, whate'er they be corn grown by cultivation, milk, Food eatable, uneatable, I make all poisonless for thee.
meaning: य॒द् अश्ना॒सि य॒त् पिबसि धान्यं॑ कृष्याः॒ प॒यः । य॒द् आद्यं॑ य॒द् अनाद्यं॒ स॒र्वं ते अ॒न्नम् अविषं॒ कृणोमि ॥१९॥

text: We give thee over as a charge to Day and Night, in trust to both. Keep him for me from stingy fiends, from those who fain would feed on him.
meaning: अ॒ह्ने च त्वा रा॒त्रये चोभा॒भ्यां प॒रि दद्मसि । अरा॒येभ्यो जिघत्सु॒भ्य इमं॒ मे प॒रि रक्षत ॥२०॥ {४}

text: A hundred, yea, ten thousand years we give thee, ages two, three, four. May Indra, Agni, all the Gods, with willing favour look on thee.
meaning: शतं॒ ते ऽयु॒तं हायना॒न् द्वे॒ युगे॒ त्री॒णि चत्वा॒रि कृण्मः । इन्द्राग्नी॒ वि॒श्वे देवा॒स् ते॒ ऽनु मन्यन्ताम् अ॒हृणीयमानाः ॥२१॥

text: To Autumn we deliver thee, to Winter, Spring and Summer's care. We trust thee with auspicious years wherein the plants and herbs grow up.
meaning: शर॒दे त्वा हेमन्ता॒य वसन्ता॒य ग्रीष्मा॒य प॒रि दद्मसि । वर्षा॒णि तु॒भ्यं स्योना॒नि ये॒षु व॒र्धन्त ओ॒षधीः ॥२२॥

text: Death is the lord of bipeds, Death is sovran lord of quadrupeds. Away I bear thee from that: Death the ruler: be not thou afraid.
meaning: मृत्यु॒र् ईशे द्विप॒दां मृत्यु॒र् ईशे च॒तुष्पदाम् । त॒स्मात् त्वां॒ मृत्यो॒र् गो॒पतेर् उ॒द् भरामि स॒ मा॒ बिभेः ॥२३॥

text: Thou, still uninjured, shalt not die: be not afraid; thou shalt not die. Here where I am men do not die or go to lowest depths of gloom.
meaning: सो॒ ऽरिष्ट न॒ मरिष्यसि न॒ मरिष्यसि मा॒ बिभेः । न॒ वै॒ त॒त्र म्रियन्ते नो॒ यन्ति अधमं॒ त॒मः ॥२४॥

text: Here verily all creatures live, the cow, the horse, the man, the beast, Here where this holy prayer is used, a rampart that protecteth life. Let it preserve thee from thy peers, from incantation, from thy friends.
meaning: स॒र्वो वै॒ त॒त्र जीवति गौ॒र् अ॒श्वः पु॒रुषः पशुः॒ । य॒त्रेदं॒ ब्र॒ह्म क्रिय॒ते परिधि॒र् जी॒वनाय क॒म् ॥२५॥

text: Live very long, be healthy, be immortal: let not the vital breath forsake thy body.
meaning: प॒रि त्वा पातु समाने॒भ्यो ऽभिचारा॒त् स॒बन्धुभ्यः । अ॒मम्रिर् भवामृ॒तो ऽतिजीवो॒ मा॒ ते हासिषुर् अ॒सवः श॒रीरम् ॥२६॥

text: One and a hundred modes of death, dangers that may be over- come, May Gods deliver thee from this when Agni, dear to all men, bids.
meaning: ये॒ मृत्य॒व ए॒कशतं या॒ नाष्ट्रा॒ अतितार्याः॑ । मुञ्च॒न्तु त॒स्मात् त्वां॒ देवा॒ अग्ने॒र् वैश्वानरा॒द् अ॒धि ॥२७॥

text: Body of Agni prompt to save, slayer of fiends and foes art thou, Yea, banisher of malady, the healing balm called Pūtudru.
meaning: अग्नेः॒ श॒रीरम् असि पारयिष्णु॒ रक्षोहा॒सि सपत्नहा॒ । अ॒थो अमीवचा॒तनः पूतु॒द्रुर् ना॒म भेषज॒म् ॥२८॥ {५}

text: I balm with oil the mighty demon-slayer, to the most famous friend I come for shelter. Enkindled, sharpened by our rites, may Agni protect us in the day and night from evil.
meaning: रक्षोह॒णं वाजि॒नम् आ॒ जिघर्मि मित्रं॒ प्र॒थिष्ठम् उ॒प यामि श॒र्म । शि॒शानो अग्निः॒ क्र॒तुभिः स॒मिद्धः स॒ नो दि॒वा स॒ रिषः॒ पातु न॒क्तम् ॥१॥

text: O Jātavedas, armed with teeth of iron, enkindled with thy flame, attack the demons. Seize with thy tongue the foolish gods' adorers: rend, put with- in thy mouth the raw-flesh-eaters.
meaning: अ॒योदंष्ट्रो अर्चि॒षा यातुधा॒नान् उ॒प स्पृश जातवेदः स॒मिद्धः । आ॒ जिह्व॒या मू॒रदेवान् रभस्व क्रव्या॒दो वृष्ट्वा॒पि धत्स्वास॒न् ॥२॥

text: Apply thy teeth, the upper and the lower, thou who hast both, enkindled and destroying. Roam also in the air, O King, around us, and with thy jaws assail the wicked spirits.
meaning: उभो॒भयाविन्न् उ॒प धेहि दं॒ष्ट्रौ हिंस्रः॒ शि॒शानो॒ ऽवरं प॒रं च । उता॒न्त॒रिक्षे प॒रि याह्य् अग्ने ज॒म्भैः सं॒ धेह्य् अभि॒ यातुधा॒नान् ॥३॥

text: Pierce through the Yātudhāna's skin, O Agni; let the destroying dart with fire consume him. Rend his joints, Jātavedas! let the eater of raw flesh, seeking flesh, tear and destroy him.
meaning: अ॒ग्ने त्व॒चं यातुधा॒नस्य भिन्धि हिंस्रा॒श॒निर् ह॒रसा हन्त्व् एनम् । प्र॒ प॒र्वाणि जातवेदः शृणीहि क्रव्या॒त् क्रविष्णु॒र् वि॒ चिनोत्व् एनम् ॥४॥

text: Where now thou seest, Agni Jātavedas! a Yātudhāna, standing still or roaming. Or one that flieth through the air's mid-region, kindled to fury as an archer pierce him.
meaning: य॒त्रेदा॒नीं प॒श्यसि जातवेदस् ति॒ष्ठन्तम् अग्न उत॒ वा च॒रन्तम् । उता॒न्त॒रिक्षे प॒तन्तं यातुधा॒नं त॒म् अ॒स्ता विध्य श॒र्वा शि॒शानः ॥५॥

text: Bending thy shafts through sacrifices, Agni! dipping thine arrows in the hymn to point them, Pierce to the heart therewith the Yātudhānas, and break their arms uplifted to attack thee.
meaning: यज्ञै॒र् इ॒षूः संन॒ममानो अग्ने इवाचा॒ शल्यां॒ अश॒निभिर् दिहानः॒ । ता॒भिर् विध्य हृ॒दये यातुधा॒नान् प्रतीचो॒ बाहू॒न् प्र॒ति भङ्ग्ध्य् एषाम् ॥६॥

text: Rescue the captives also, Jātavedas! yea, those whom Yātudhā- nas' spears have captured. Strike down that fiend, blazing before him, Agni! Let spotted carrion-eating kites devour him.
meaning: उता॒रब्धान्त् स्पृनुहि जातवेद उता॒रेभाणां॒ ऋष्टि॒भिर् यातुधा॒नान् । अ॒ग्ने पू॒र्वो नि॒ जहि शो॒शुचान आमा॒दः क्ष्वि॒ङ्कास् त॒म् अदन्त्व् ए॒नीः ॥७॥

text: Here tell this forth, O Agni: whosoever is, he himself, or acteth as, a demon, Grasp him, O thou most youthful, with thy fuel: to the Man- Seer's eye give him as booty.
meaning: इह॒ प्र॒ ब्रूहि यतमः॒ सो॒ अग्ने यातुधा॒नो य॒ इदं॒ कृणोति । त॒म् आ॒ रभस्व समि॒धा यविष्ठ नृच॒क्षसश् च॒क्षुषे रन्धयैनम् ॥८॥

text: With keen glance guard the sacrifice, O Agni: thou Sage, con- duct it onward to the Vasus. Let not the fiends, O Man-Beholder, harm thee burning against the Rākshasas to slay them.
meaning: तीक्ष्णे॒नाग्ने च॒क्षुषा रक्ष यज्ञं॒ प्रा॒ञ्चं व॒सुभ्यः प्र॒ णय प्रचेतः । हिंस्रं॒ र॒क्षांस्य् अभि॒ शो॒शुचानं मा॒ त्वा दभन् यातुधा॒ना नृचक्षः ॥९॥

text: Look on the fiend, 'mid men, as Man-Beholder: rend thou his three extremities in pieces. Demolish with thy flame his ribs, O Agni: the Yātudhāna's root destroy thou triply.
meaning: नृच॒क्षा र॒क्षः प॒रि पश्य विक्षु॒ त॒स्य त्री॒णि प्र॒ति शृणीह्य् अ॒ग्रा । त॒स्याग्ने पृष्टी॒र् ह॒रसा शृणीहि त्रेधा॒ मू॒लं यातुधा॒नस्य वृश्च ॥१०॥ {६}

text: Thrice, Agni, let thy noose surround the demon who with his falsehood injures holy Order. Loud roaring with thy flame, Jātavedas, fetter him in the pre- sense of the singer.
meaning: त्रि॒र् यातुधा॒नः प्र॒सितिं त एत्व् ऋतं॒ यो॒ अग्ने अ॒नृतेन ह॒न्ति । त॒म् अर्चि॒षा स्फूर्ज॒यन् जातवेदः समक्ष॒म् एनम् गृणते॒ नि॒ युङ्ग्धि ॥११॥

text: Agni, what curse the pair this day may utter, what rude rough word the worshippers have spoken, Each arrowy taunt sped from the angry spirit,—pierce to the heart therewith the Yātudhānas.
meaning: य॒द् अग्ने अद्य॒ मिथुना॒ श॒पातो य॒द् वाच॒स् तृष्टं॒ जन॒यन्त रेभाः॒ । मन्यो॒र् म॒नसः शरव्या॑ जा॒यते या॒ त॒या विध्य हृ॒दये यातुधा॒नान् ॥१२॥

text: With fervent heat exterminate the demons: destroy the fiends with glow and flame, O Agni. Destroy with fire the foolish gods' adorers: destroy the insatiate fiercely-burning creatures.
meaning: प॒रा शृणीहि त॒पसा यातुधा॒नान् प॒राग्ने र॒क्षो ह॒रसा शृणीहि । प॒रार्चि॒षा मू॒रदेवान् छृणीहि प॒रासुतृ॒पः शो॒शुचतः शृणीहि ॥१३॥

text: May Gods destroy to-day the evil-doer: may uttered curses turn again and strike him. Let arrows pierce the liar in his vitals, and Visva's net enclose the Yātudhāna.
meaning: प॒राद्य॒ देवा॒ वृजिनं॒ शृणन्तु प्रत्य॒ग् एनं शप॒था यन्तु सृष्टाः॒ । वाचा॒स्तेनं श॒रव ऋछन्तु म॒र्मन् वि॒श्वस्यैतु प्र॒सितिं यातुधा॒नः ॥१४॥

text: The fiend who smears himself with flesh of cattle, with flesh of horses and of human bodies, Who steals the milch-cow's milk away, O Agni,—tear off the heads of such with fiery fury.
meaning: यः॒ पौ॒रुषेयेण क्रवि॒षा समङ्क्ते॒ यो॒ अ॒श्व्येन पशु॒ना यातुधा॒नः । यो॒ अघ्न्या॒या भ॒रति क्षीर॒म् अग्ने ते॒षां शीर्षा॒णि ह॒रसा॒पि वृश्च ॥१५॥

text: Let the fiends steal the poison of the cattle: may Aditi cast off the evil-doers. May the God Savitar give them up to ruin, and be their share of herbs and plants denied them.
meaning: विषं॒ ग॒वां यातुधा॒ना भरन्ताम् आ॒ वृश्चन्ताम् अ॒दितये दुरे॒वाः । प॒रैणान् देवः॒ सविता॒ ददातु प॒रा भाग॒म् ओ॒षधीनां जयन्ताम् ॥१६॥

text: The cow gives milk each year, O Man-Beholder: let not the Yātudhāna ever taste it. Agni, if one should glut him with the biestings, pierce with thy flame his vitals as he meets thee.
meaning: संवत्सरी॒णं प॒य उस्रि॒यायास् त॒स्य मा॒शीद् यातुधा॒नो नृचक्षः । पीयू॒षम् अग्ने यतम॒स् ति॒तृप्सात् तं॒ प्रत्य॒ञ्चम् अर्चि॒षा विध्य म॒र्मणि ॥१७॥

text: Agni, from days of old thou slayest demons: never have Rākshasas in fight o'ercome thee. Burn up the foolish ones, the flesh-devourers: let none of them escape thy heavenly arrow.
meaning: सना॒द् अग्ने मृणसि यातुधा॒नान् न॒ त्वा र॒क्षांसि पृ॒तनासु जिग्युः । सह॒मूरान् अ॒नु दह क्रव्या॒दो मा॒ ते हेत्या॒ मुक्षत दै॒व्यायाः ॥१८॥

text: Guard us, O Agni, from above and under, protect us from be- hind and from before us; And may thy flames, most fierce and never wasting, glowing with fervent heat, consume the sinner.
meaning: त्वं॒ नो अग्ने अधरा॒द् उदक्त॒स् त्वं॒ पश्चा॒द् उत॒ रक्षा पुर॒स्तात् । प्र॒ति त्ये॒ ते अज॒रासस् त॒पिष्ठा अघ॒शंसं शो॒शुचतो दहन्तु ॥१९॥

text: From rear, from front, from under, from above us, Agni, pro- tect us as a sage with wisdom. Guard to old age thy friend as friend eternal: O Agni, as im- mortal, guard us mortals.
meaning: पश्चा॒त् पुर॒स्ताद् अधरा॒द् उतो॒त्तरा॒त् कविः॒ का॒व्येन प॒रि पाह्य् अग्ने । स॒खा स॒खायम् अज॒रो जरिम्ने॒ अ॒ग्ने म॒र्तां अ॒मर्त्यस् त्वं॒ नः ॥२०॥ {७}

text: Lend thou the worshipper that eye, O Agni, where with thou lookest on the hoof-armed demons. With light celestial in Atharvan's manner burn up the fool who ruins truth with falsehood.
meaning: त॒द् अग्ने च॒क्षुः प्र॒ति धेहि रेभे॒ शफारु॒जो ये॒न प॒श्यसि यातुधा॒नान् । अथर्वव॒ज् ज्यो॒तिषा दै॒व्येन सत्यं॒ धू॒र्वन्तम् अचि॒तं न्यो॑ष ॥२१॥

text: We set thee round us as a fort, victorious Agni! thee, a sage, In conquering colour day by day, destroyer of the treacherous foe.
meaning: प॒रि त्वाग्ने पु॒रं वयं॒ वि॒प्रं सहस्य धीमहि । धृष॒द्वर्णं दिवे॒दिवे हन्ता॒रं भङ्गुरा॒वतः ॥२२॥

text: With deadly poison strike thou back the treacherous brood of Rākshasas, O Agni, with thy sharpened glow, with rays that flash with points of flame.
meaning: विषे॒ण भङ्गुरा॒वतः प्र॒ति स्म रक्ष॒सो जहि । अ॒ग्ने तिग्मे॒न शोचि॒षा त॒पुरग्राभिर् अर्चि॒भिः ॥२३॥

text: Agni shines far and wide with lofty splendour, and by his great- ness makes all things apparent. He conquers godless and malign enchantments, and sharpens both his horns to gore the ogres.
meaning: वि॒ ज्यो॒तिषा बृहता॒ भात्य् अग्नि॒र् आवि॒र् वि॒श्वानि कृणुते महित्वा॒ । प्रा॒देवीर् मायाः॒ सहते दुरे॒वाः शि॒शीते शृ॒ङ्गे र॒क्षोभ्यो विनि॒क्षे ॥२४॥

text: Thy two unwasting horns, O Jātavedas, keen-pointed weapons, sharpened by devotion With these transfix the wicked-souled Kimidin, with fierce flame, Jātavedas! when he meets thee.
meaning: ये॒ ते शृ॒ङ्गे अज॒रे जातवेदस् तिग्म॒हेती ब्र॒ह्मसंशिते । ता॒भ्यां दुर्हा॒र्दम् अभिदा॒सन्तं किमीदि॒नं । प्रत्य॒ञ्चम् अर्चि॒षा जातवेदो वि॒ निक्ष्व ॥२५॥

text: Bright, radiant, meet to be adored, immortal with refulgent glow, Agni drives Rākshasas away.
meaning: अग्नी॒ र॒क्षांसि सेधति शुक्र॒शोचिर् अ॒मर्त्यः । शु॒चिः पावक॒ ई॒ड्यः ॥२६॥ {८}

text: Indra and Soma, burn, destroy the demon foe! Send downward, O ye Bulls, those who add gloom to gloom. Annihilate the fools, slay them and burn them up: chase them away from us, pierce the voracious fiends.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रासोमा त॒पतं र॒क्ष उब्ज॒तं न्य् अ॑र्पयतं वृषणा तमोवृ॒धः । प॒रा शृणीतम् अचि॒तो न्य् ओ॑षतं हतं॒ नुदे॒थां नि॒ शिशीतम् अत्त्रि॒णः ॥१॥

text: Let sin, Indra and Soma! round the wicked boil, like as a cald- ron set amid the flames of fire. Against the foe of prayer, eater of gory flesh, the fearful-eyed Kimidin, keep perpetual hate.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रासोमा स॒म् अघ॒शंसम् अभ्य् अ॑घं॒ त॒पुर् ययस्तु चरु॒र् अग्निमां॒ इव । ब्रह्मद्वि॒षे क्रव्या॒दे घोर॒चक्षसे द्वे॒षो धत्तम् अनवायं॒ किमीदिने ॥२॥

text: Indra and Soma, plunge the wicked in the depth, yea, cast them into darkness that hath no support, So that not one of them may ever thence return: so may your wrathful might prevail and conquer them.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रासोमा दुष्कृ॒तो वव्रे॒ अन्त॒र् अनारम्भणे॒ त॒मसि प्र॒ विध्यतम् । य॒तो नै॒षां पु॒नर् ए॒कश् चनो॒द॒यत् त॒द् वाम् अस्तु स॒हसे मन्युम॒च् छ॒वः ॥३॥

text: Indra and Soma, hurl your deadly crushing bolt down on the wicked fiend from heaven and from the earth. Yea, fashion from the big clouds your celestial dart wherewith ye burn to death the waxing demon race.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रासोमा वर्त॒यतं दिवो॒ वधं॒ सं॒ पृथिव्या॒ अघ॒शंसाय त॒र्हणम् । उ॒त् तक्षतं स्वर्यं॑१ प॒र्वतेभ्यो ये॒न र॒क्षो वावृधानं॒ निजू॒र्वथः ॥४॥

text: Indra and Soma, cast ye downward from the sky your deadly bolts of stone burning with fiery flame, Eternal, scorching darts. Plunge the voracious fiends within the depth, and let them pass without a sound.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रासोमा वर्त॒यतं दिव॒स् प॒र्य् अग्नितप्ते॒भिर् युव॒म् अ॒श्महन्मभिः । त॒पुर्वधेभिर् अज॒रेभिर् अत्त्रि॒णो नि॒ प॒र्शाने विध्यतं य॒न्तु निस्वर॒म् ॥५॥

text: Indra and Soma, let this hymn control you both, even as the girth encompasses two vigorous steeds The song of praise which I with wisdom offer you. Do ye, as Lords of men, animate these my prayers.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रासोमा प॒रि वां भूतु विश्व॒त इयं॒ मतिः॒ कक्ष्या॒श्वेव वाजिना । यां॒ वां हो॒त्रां परिहिनो॒मि मेध॒येमा॒ ब्र॒ह्माणि नृप॒ती इव जिन्वतम् ॥६॥

text: In your impetuous manner think ye both thereon: destroy those evil spirits, kill the treacherous fiends. Indra and Soma, let the wicked have no bliss whoso at any time- attacks and injures us.
meaning: प्र॒ति स्मरेथां तुज॒यद्भिर् ए॒वैर् हतं॒ द्रुहो॒ रक्ष॒सो भङ्गुरा॒वतः । इ॒न्द्रासोमा दुष्कृ॒ते मा॒ सुगं॒ भूद् यो॒ मा कदा॒ चिद् अभिदा॒सति द्रुहुः॒ ॥७॥

text: Whoso accuses me with words of falsehood when I pursue my way with guileless spirit, May he, the speaker of untruth, be, Indra! like water which the hollowed hand compresses.
meaning: यो॒ मा पा॒केन म॒नसा च॒रन्तम् अभिच॒ष्टे अ॒नृतेभिर् व॒चोभिः । आ॒प इव काशिना स॒म्गृभीता अ॒सन्न् अस्त्व् अ॒सतः इन्द्र वक्ता॒ ॥८॥

text: Those who destroy, as is their wont, the simple, and with their evil natures harm the righteous, May Soma give them over to the serpent, or to the lap of Nirriti consign them.
meaning: ये॒ पाकशंसं॒ विह॒रन्त ए॒वैर् ये॒ वा भद्रं॒ दूष॒यन्ति स्वधा॒भिः । अ॒हये वा ता॒न् प्रद॒दातु सो॒म आ॒ वा दधातु नि॒रृतेर् उप॒ष्ठे ॥९॥

text: O Agni, whosoever seeks to injure the essence of our food, kine, steeds, or bodies, May he, the adversary, thief, and robber, sink to destruction,. both himself and offspring.
meaning: यो॒ नो र॒सं दि॒प्सति पित्वो॒ अग्ने अ॒श्वानां ग॒वां य॒स् तनू॒नाम् । रिपु॒ स्तेन॒ स्तेयकृ॒द् दभ्र॒म् एतु नि॒ ष॒ हीयतां तन्वा॑ त॒ना च ॥१०॥ {९}

text: May he be swept away, himself and children; may all the three earths press him down beneath them. May his fair glory, O ye Gods, be blighted, who in the day or night would fain destroy us.
meaning: परः॒ सो॒ अस्तु तन्वा॑ त॒ना च तिस्रः॒ पृथिवी॒र् अधो॒ अस्तु वि॒श्वाः । प्र॒ति शुष्यतु य॒शो अस्य देवा यो॒ मा दि॒वा दि॒प्सति य॒श् च न॒क्तम् ॥११॥

text: The prudent finds it easy to distinguish the true and false: their words oppose each other. Of these two that which is the true and honest Soma protects, and brings the false to nothing.
meaning: सुविज्ञानं॒ चिकितु॒षे ज॒नाय स॒च् चा॒सच् च व॒चसी पस्पृधाते । त॒स्योर् य॒त् सत्यं॒ यतर॒द् ऋ॒जीयस् त॒द् इ॒त् सो॒मो ऽवति ह॒न्त्य् अ॒सत् ॥१२॥

text: Never doth Soma aid and guide the wicked or him who falsely claims the Warrior's title. He slays the fiend and him who speaks untruly: both lie entan- gled in the noose of Indra.
meaning: न॒ वा॒ उ सो॒मो वृजिनं॒ हिनोति न॒ क्षत्रि॒यम् मिथुया॒ धार॒यन्तम् । ह॒न्ति र॒क्षो ह॒न्त्य् आ॒सद् व॒दन्तम् उभा॒व् इ॒न्द्रस्य प्र॒सितौ शयाते ॥१३॥

text: As if I worshipped deities of falsehood, or thought vain thoughts about the Gods, O Agni! Why art thou angry with us, Jātavedas? Destruction fall on those who lie against thee!
meaning: य॒दि वाह॒म् अ॒नृतदेवो अ॒स्मि मो॒घं वा देवां॒ अप्यूहे॒ अग्ने । कि॒म् अस्म॒भ्यं जातवेदो हृणीषे द्रोघवा॒चस् ते निरृथं॒ सचन्ताम् ॥१४॥

text: So may I die this day if I have harassed any man's life, or if I be a demon. Yea, may he lose all his ten sons together who with false tongue hath called me Yātudhāna.
meaning: अद्या॒ मुरीय य॒दि यातुधा॒नो अ॒स्मि य॒दि वा॒युस् तत॒प पु॒रुषस्य । अ॒धा स॒ वीरै॒र् दश॒भिर् वि॒ यूया यो॒ मा मो॒घं या॒तुधाने॒त्य् आ॒ह ॥१५॥

text: May Indra slay him with a mighty weapon, and let the vilest of all creatures perish, The fiend who says that he is pure, who calls me a demon though devoid of demon nature.
meaning: यो॒ मा॒यातुं या॒तुधानेत्य् आ॒ह यो॒ वा रक्षाः॒ शि॒चिर् अस्मी॒त्य् आ॒ह । इ॒न्द्रस् तं॒ हन्तु महता॒ वधे॒न वि॒श्वस्य जन्तो॒र् अधम॒स् पदीष्ट ॥१६॥

text: She too who wanders like an owl at night-time, hiding her body in her guile and malice, May she fall downward into endless caverns. May press-stones with loud ring destroy the demons.
meaning: प्र॒ या॒ जि॒गाति खर्ग॒लेव न॒क्तम् अ॒प द्रुहु॒स् तन्वं॑१ गू॒हमाना । वव्र॒म् अनन्त॒म् अ॒व सा॒ पदीष्टिअ ग्रा॒वाणो घ्नन्तु रक्ष॒स उपब्दैः॒ ॥१७॥

text: Spread out, ye Maruts, search among the people: seize ye and grind the Rākshasas to pieces, Who fly abroad, transformed to birds, at night-time, and sully and pollute our holy worship.
meaning: वि॒ तिष्ठध्वम् मरुतो विक्ष्व् इ॑छ॒त गृभाय॒त रक्ष॒सः सं॒ पिनष्टन् । व॒यो ये॒ भूत्वा॒ पत॒यन्ति नक्त॒भिर् ये॒ वा रि॒पो दधिरे॒ देवे॒ अध्वरे॒ ॥१८॥

text: Hurl down from heaven thy bolt of stone, O Indra: sharpen it, Maghavan, made keen by Soma. Forward, behind, and from above and under, smite down the demons with thy rocky weapon.
meaning: प्र॒ वर्तय दिवो॒ ऽश्मानम् इन्द्र सो॒मशितं मघवन्त् सं॒ शिशाधि । प्राक्तो॒ अपाक्तो॒ अधरा॒द् उदक्तो॒ ऽभि॒ जहि रक्ष॒सः प॒र्वतेन ॥१९॥

text: They fly, the demon dogs, and, bent on mischief, fain would they harm indomitable Indra. Sakra makes sharp his weapon for the wicked: now let him cast his bolt at fiendish wizards.
meaning: एत॒ उ त्ये॒ पतयन्ति श्व॒यातव इ॒न्द्रं दिप्सन्ति दिप्स॒वो॒ ऽदाभ्यम् । शि॒शीते शक्रः॒ पि॒शुनेभ्यो वधं॒ नुनं॒ सृजद् अश॒निं यातुम॒द्भ्यः ॥२०॥ {१०}

text: Indra hath ever been the fiends' destroyer who spoil oblations of the Gods' invokers. Yea, Sakra, like an axe that splits the timber, assails and sma- shes them like earthen vessels.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रो यातूना॒म् अभवत् पराशरो॒ हविर्म॒थीनाम् अभ्य् आ॑वि॒वासताम् । अभी॒द् उ शक्रः॒ परशु॒र् य॒था व॒नं पा॒त्रेव भिन्द॒न्त् सत॒ एतु रक्ष॒सः ॥२१॥

text: Destroy the fiend shaped like an owl or owlet, destroy him in. the form of dog or cuckoo. Destroy him shaped as eagle or as vulture: as with a stone, O Indra, crush the demon.
meaning: उ॒लूकयातुं शुशुलू॒कयातुं जहि॒ श्व॒यातुम् उत॒ को॒कयातुम् । सुपर्ण॒यातुम् उत॒ गृ॒ध्रयातुं दृष॒देव प्र॒ मृण र॒क्ष इन्द्र ॥२२॥

text: Let not the fiend of witchcraft-workers reach us: may Dawn. drive off the couples of Kimidins. Earth keep us safe from earthly woe and trouble! From grief that comes from heaven Mid-air preserve us!
meaning: मा॒ नो र॒क्षो अभि॒ नड् यातुमा॒वद् अ॒पोछन्तु मिथुना॒ ये॒ किमीदि॒नः । पृथिवी॒ नः पा॒र्थिवात् पात्व् अं॒हसो ऽन्त॒रिक्षं दिव्या॒त् पात्व् अस्मा॒न् ॥२३॥

text: Indra destroy the demon, male and female, joying and triumph- ing in arts of magic! Let the fools' gods with bent necks fall and perish, and see no. more the Sun when he arises.
meaning: इ॒न्द्र जहि॒ पु॒मांसं यातुधा॒नम् उत॒ स्त्रि॒यं माय॒या शा॒शदानाम् । वि॒ग्रीवासो मू॒रदेवा ऋदन्तु मा॒ ते॒ दृशन्त् सू॒र्यम् उच्च॒रन्तम् ॥२४॥

text: Look, each one, hither, look around. Indra and Soma, watch ye well. Cast forth your weapon at the fiends: against the sorcerers hurl your bolt.
meaning: प्र॒ति चक्ष्व वि॒ चक्ष्वे॒न्द्रश् च सोम जागृतम् । र॒क्षोभ्यो वध॒म् अस्यतम् अश॒निं यातुम॒द्भ्यः ॥२५॥ {११}

text: Upon the strong is bound the strong, this magic cord, this Amu- let, Potent, foe-slayer, served by valiant heroes, happy and fortu- nate defence.
meaning: अयं॒ प्रतिसरो॒ मणि॒र् वीरो॒ वीरा॒य बध्यते । वीर्य॑वान्त् सपत्नहा॒ शू॒रवीरः परिपा॒णः सुमङ्ग॒लः ॥१॥

text: This Charm, foe-slayer, served by many heroes, strong, power- ful, victorious, and mighty, goes bravely forth to meet and ruin witchcraft.
meaning: अयं॒ मणिः॒ सपत्नहा॒ सुवी॒रः स॒हस्वान् वाजी॒ स॒हमान उग्रः॒ । प्रत्य॒क् कृत्या॒ दूष॒यन्न् एति वीरः॒ ॥२॥

text: With this same Amulet wise Indra routed the Asuras, with this he slaughtered Vritra, With this he won this pair, both Earth and Heaven, and made the sky's four regions his possession.
meaning: अने॒ने॒न्द्रो मणि॒ना वृत्र॒म् अहन्न् अने॒ना॒सुरान् प॒राभावयन् मनीषी॒ । अने॒नाजयद् द्या॒वापृथिवी॒ उभे॒ इमे॒ अने॒नाजयत् प्रदि॒शश् च॒तस्रः ॥३॥

text: May this encircling magic cord, this Amulet of Srāktya wood, Mighty, subduing enemies, keep us secure on every side.
meaning: अयं॒ स्राक्त्यो॒ मणिः॒ प्रतीवर्तः॒ प्रतिसरः॒ । ओ॒जस्वान् विमृधो॒ वशी॒ सो॒ अस्मा॒न् पातु सर्व॒तः ॥४॥

text: This Agni hath declared, Soma declared it, Brihaspati, and Savitar, and Indra. So may these Gods whom I have set before me oppose with saving charms and banish witchcraft.
meaning: त॒द् अग्नि॒र् आह त॒द् उ सो॒म आह बृ॒हस्प॒तिः सविता॒ त॒द् इ॒न्द्रः । ते॒ मे देवाः॒ पुरो॒हिताः प्रती॒चीः कृत्याः॒ प्रतिसरै॒र् अजन्तु ॥५॥

text: I have obscured the heaven and earth, yea, and the daylight and the sun. So may these Gods whom I have set before me oppose with saving charms and banish witchcraft.
meaning: अन्त॒र् दधे द्या॒वापृथिवी॒ उता॒हर् उत॒ सू॒र्यम् । ते॒ मे देवाः॒ पुरो॒हिताः प्रती॒चीः कृत्याः॒ प्रतिसरै॒र् अजन्तु ॥६॥

text: Whoever for his armour takes an amulet of the Srāktya tree, Like the Sun risen up to heaven, quells witchcraft with superior might.
meaning: ये॒ स्राक्त्यं॒ मणिं॒ ज॒ना व॒र्माणि कृण्व॒ते । सू॒र्य इव दि॒वम् आरु॒ह्य वि॒ कृत्या॒ बाधते वशी॒ ॥७॥

text: With Amulet of Srāktya wood, as with a thoughtful Rishi's aid, In every fight have I prevailed; I smite the foes and Rākshasas.
meaning: स्राक्त्ये॒न मणि॒ना ऋ॒षिणेव मनीषि॒णा । अ॒जैषं स॒र्वाः पृ॒तना वि॒ मृ॒धो हन्मि रक्ष॒सः ॥८॥

text: All witchcraft of Angirases,"all witchcraft wrought by Asuras, All witchcraft self-originate, and all that others have prepared, May these depart to both remotest spaces, past ninety ample water-floods.
meaning: याः॒ कृत्या॒ आङ्गिरसी॒र् याः॒ कृत्या॒ आसुरी॒र् याः॒ । कृत्याः॒ स्वयं॒कृता या॒ उ चान्ये॒भिर् आ॒भृताः । उभ॒यीस् ताः॒ प॒रा यन्तु पराव॒तो नवतिं॒ नाव्या॑ अ॒ति ॥९॥

text: May the Gods bind the Charm on him for armour, Indra, and Vishnu, Savitar Rudra, Agni, Prajāpati, sublimest Parameshlhin, Virāj, Vaisvānara, and all the Rishis.
meaning: अस्मै॒ मणिं॒ व॒र्म बध्नन्तु देवा॒ इ॒न्द्रो वि॒ष्णुः सविता॒ रुद्रो॒ अग्निः॒ । प्रजा॒पतिः परमेष्ठी॒ विरा॒ड् वैश्वानर॒ ऋ॒षयश् च स॒र्वे ॥१०॥ {१२}

text: Thou art the chief of all the plants, even as a bull among the beasts. A tiger of the beasts of prey. Him whom we sought for have we found, him lying near in wait for us.
meaning: उत्तमो॒ अस्य् ओ॒षधीनाम् अनड्वा॒न् ज॒गताम् इव व्याघ्रः॒ श्व॒पदाम् इव । य॒म् ऐ॒छामा॒विदाम तं॒ प्रतिस्पा॒शनम् अ॒न्तितम् ॥११॥

text: A tiger verily is he, he is a lion, and a bull, Subduer of his foes is he, the man who wears this Amulet.
meaning: स॒ इ॒द् व्याघ्रो॒ भवत्य् अ॒थो सिंहो॒ अ॒थो वृ॒षा । अ॒थो सपत्नक॒र्शनो यो॒ बि॒भर्तीमं॒ मणि॒म् ॥१२॥

text: No mortal beings slay him, no Gāndharvas, no Apsarases; O'er all the regions he is king, the man who wears this Amulet.
meaning: नै॒नं घ्नन्त्य् अप्सर॒सो न॒ गन्धर्वा॒ न॒ म॒र्त्याः । स॒र्वा दि॒शो वि॒ राजति यो॒ बि॒भर्तीमं॒ मणि॒म् ॥१३॥

text: Kasyapa formed and fashioned thee, Kasyapa raised and sent thee forth. Indra wore thee, and, wearing thee, won in the wrestling-match with man. The Amulet of boundless might the Gods have made a coat of mail.
meaning: कश्य॒पस् त्वा॒म् असृजत कश्य॒पस् त्वा स॒म् ऐरयत् । अ॒बिभस् त्वे॒न्द्रो मा॒नुषे बि॒भ्रत् संश्रेषिणे॒ ऽजयत् । मणिं॒ सह॒स्रवीर्यं व॒र्म देवा॒ अकृण्वत ॥१४॥

text: Whoever would destroy thee with Dikshā-rites, sacrifices, spells, Meet him and smite him, Indra! with thy hundred-knotted thunderbolt.
meaning: य॒स् त्वा कृत्या॒भिर् य॒स् त्वा दीक्षा॒भिर् यज्ञै॒र् य॒स् त्वा जि॒घांसति । प्रत्य॒क् त्व॒म् इन्द्र तं॒ जहि व॒ज्रेण शत॒पर्वणा ॥१५॥

text: Verily let this Amulet, circular, potent, conquering, Happy and fortunate defence, preserve thy children and thy wealth.
meaning: अय॒म् इ॒द् वै॒ प्रतीवर्त॒ ओ॒जस्वान् संजयो॒ मणिः॒ । प्रजां॒ ध॒नं च रक्षतु परिपा॒णः सुमङ्ग॒लः ॥१६॥

text: Brave Indra, set before us light, peace and security from below, Peace and security from above, peace and security from behind.
meaning: असपत्नं॒ नो अधरा॒द् असपत्नं॒ न उत्तरा॒त् । इ॒न्द्रासपत्नं॒ नः पश्चा॒ज् ज्यो॒तिः शूर पुर॒स् कृधि ॥१७॥

text: My coat of mail is Heaven and Earth, my coat of mail is Day and Sun: A coat of mail may Indra and Agni and Dhātar grant to me.
meaning: व॒र्म मे द्या॒वापृथिवी॒ व॒र्मा॒हर् व॒र्म सू॒र्यः । व॒र्म म इ॒न्द्रश् चाग्नि॒श् च व॒र्म धाता॒ दधातु मे ॥१८॥

text: Not all the Gods may pierce, all leagued together, the vast strong shield which Indra gives, and Agni. May that great shield on all sides guard my body, that to full old my life may be extended.
meaning: ऐन्द्राग्नं॒ व॒र्म बहुलं॒ य॒द् उग्रं॒ वि॒श्वे देवा॒ ना॒तिवि॒ध्यन्ति स॒र्वे । त॒न् मे तन्वं॑ त्रायतां सर्व॒तो बृह॒द् आ॒युष्मां जर॒दष्टिर् य॒था॒सानि ॥१९॥

text: Let the Gods' Charm be bound on me to keep me safe from every ill. Come ye and enter all within this pillar, the safe-guard of the body, thrice-defended.
meaning: आ॒ मारुक्षद् देवमणि॒र् मह्या॒ अरिष्ट॒तातये । इमं॒ मेथि॒म् अभिसं॒विशध्वं तनूपा॒नं त्रिव॒रूथम् ओ॒जसे ॥२०॥

text: In this let Indra lay a store of valour: approach ye Gods, and enter it together, For his long life, to last a hundred autumns, that to full age his days may be extended.
meaning: अस्मि॒न्न् इ॒न्द्रो नि॒ दधातु नृम्ण॒म् इमं॒ देवासो अभिसं॒विशध्वम् । दीर्घायुत्वा॒य शत॒शारदाया॒युष्मान् जर॒दष्टिर् य॒था॒सत् ॥२१॥

text: Lord of the clan who brings, us bliss, fiend-slayer, queller of the foe, May he, the conqueror, ne'er subdued, may Indra bind the Charm on thee, Bull, Soma-drinker, he who gives us peace. May he protect thee round about, by night and day on every, side.
meaning: स्वस्तिदा॒ विशां॒ प॒तिर् वृत्रहा॒ विमृधो॒ वशी॒ । इ॒न्द्रो बध्नातु ते मणिं॒ जिगीवां॒ अ॒पराजितः । सोमपा॒ अभयङ्करो॒ वृ॒षा ।

text: Let neither fiend of evil name, Alinsa, Vatsapa, desire Thy pair of husband-wooers which thy mother cleansed when, thou wast born.
meaning: यौ॒ ते मातो॒न्ममा॒र्ज जाता॒याः पतिवे॒दनौ । दुर्णा॒मा त॒त्र मा॒ गृधद् अलिं॒श उत॒ वत्स॒पः ॥१॥

text: Palala, Anupalala, Sarku, Koka, Malimlucha, Palijaka Vavri- vāsas and Asresha, Rikshagriva and Pramilin.
meaning: पलालानुपलालौ॒ श॒र्कुं को॒कं मलिम्लुचं॒ पली॒जकम् । आश्रे॒षं वव्रि॒वाससम् ऋ॒क्षग्रीवं प्रमीलि॒नम् ॥२॥

text: Approach not, come not hitherward: creep not thou in-between her thighs. I set, to guard her, Baja, that which chases him of evil name.
meaning: मा॒ सं॒ वृतो मो॒प सृप ऊरू॒ मा॒व सृपो ऽन्तरा॒ । कृणो॒म्य् अस्यै भेषजं॒ बजं॒ दुर्णामचा॒तनम् ॥३॥

text: Durnāmā and Sunāmā both are eager to converse with her. We drive away Arāyas: let Sunāmā seek the women-folk,
meaning: दुर्णा॒मा च सुना॒मा चोभा॒ सम्वृ॒तम् इछतः । अरा॒यान् अ॒प हन्मः सुना॒मा स्त्रै॒णम् इछताम् ॥४॥

text: The black and hairy Asura, and Stambaja and Tundika, Arāyas from this girl we drive, from bosom, waist, and parts below.
meaning: यः॒ कृष्णः॒ केश्य् अ॒सुर स्तम्बज॒ उत॒ तु॒ण्डिकः । अरा॒यान् अस्या मुष्का॒भ्यां भं॒ससो॒ ऽप हन्मसि ॥५॥

text: Sniffer, and Feeler, him who eats raw flesh, and him who licks his lips, Arāyas with the tails of dogs, the yellow Baja hath destroyed.
meaning: अनुजिघ्रं॒ प्रमृश॒न्तं क्रव्या॒दम् उत॒ रेरिह॒म् । अरा॒यां छ्वकिष्कि॒णो बजः॒ पिङ्गो॒ अनीनशत् ॥६॥

text: Whoever, in thy brother's shape or father's comes to thee in sleep, Let Baja rout and chase them like eunuchs with woman's head- dress on.
meaning: य॒स् त्वा स्व॒प्ने निप॒द्यते भ्रा॒ता भूत्वा॒ पिते॒व च । बज॒स् ता॒न्त् सहताम् इतः॒ क्लीब॒रूपांस् तिरीटि॒नः ॥७॥

text: Whoever steals to thee asleep or thinks to harm thee when awake,— These hath it banished, as the Sun travelling round drives shade away.
meaning: य॒स् त्वा स्वप॒न्तीं त्स॒रति य॒स् त्वा दि॒प्सति जा॒ग्रतीम् । छाया॒म् इव प्र॒ ता॒न्त् सू॒र्यः परिक्रा॒मन्न् अनीनशत् ॥८॥

text: Whoever causeth her to lose her child or bear untimely fruit,— Destroy him, O thou Plant, destroy the slippery fiend who lusts for her.
meaning: यः॒ कृणो॒ति मृत॒वत्साम् अ॒वतोकाम् इमां॒ स्त्रि॒यम् । त॒म् ओषधे त्वं॒ नाशयास्याः॒ कम॒लम् अञ्जिव॒म् ॥९॥

text: Those who at evening, with the bray of asses, dance around the house, Kukshilas, and Kusfilas, and Kakubhas, Srimas, Karumas, These with thine odour, O thou Plant, drive far away to every side.
meaning: ये॒ शा॒लाः परिनृ॒त्यन्ति सायं॒ गर्दभनादि॒नः । कुसू॒ला ये॒ च कुक्षिलाः॒ ककुभाः॒ करु॒माः स्रि॒माः । ता॒न् ओषधे त्वं॒ गन्धे॒न विषूची॒नान् वि॒ नाशय ॥१०॥ {१४}

text: Kukundhas and Kukūrabhas who dress themselves in hides and skins, Who dance about like eunuchs, who raise a wild clamour in the wood, all these we banish far away.
meaning: ये॒ कुकु॒न्धाः कुकि॒रभाः कृ॒त्तीर् दूर्शा॒नि बि॒भ्रति । क्लीबा॒ इव प्रनृ॒त्यन्तो व॒ने ये॒ कुर्व॒ते घो॒षं ता॒न् इतो॒ नाशयामसि ॥११॥

text: All those who cannot bear the Sun who warms us yonder from the sky, Arāyas with the smell of goats, malodorous, with bloody mouths, the Makakas we drive afar.
meaning: ये॒ सू॒र्यं न॒ ति॒तिक्षन्त आत॒पन्तम् अमुं॒ दिवः॒ । अरा॒यान् बस्तवासि॒नो दुर्ग॒न्धींल् लो॒हितास्यान् म॒ककान् नाशयामसि ॥१२॥

text: All those who on their shoulders bear a head of monstrous magnitude, Who pierce the women's loins with pain,—those demons, Indra drive away!
meaning: य॒ आत्मा॒नम् अतिमात्र॒म् अं॒स आधा॒य बि॒भ्रति । स्त्रीणां॒ श्रोणिप्रतोदि॒न इ॒न्द्र र॒क्षांसि नाशय ॥१३॥

text: Those, bearing horns upon their hands, who first of all approach the brides; Standing in ovens, laughing loud, those who in bushes flash forth light, all these we banish hence away.
meaning: ये॒ पू॒र्वे बध्वो॑ य॒न्ति ह॒स्ते शृ॒ङ्गानि बि॒भ्रतः । आपाकेस्थाः॒ प्रहासि॒न स्तम्बे॒ ये॒ कुर्व॒ते ज्यो॒तिस् ता॒न् इतो॒ नाशयामसि ॥१४॥

text: Those who have retroverted toes, and heels and faces in the front, Khalajas, Sakadhūmajas, Urundas, all the Matmatas, impotent Kumbhamushkas, these, Drive thou, O Brāhmanaspati, far from this girl with vigilance.
meaning: ये॒षाम् पश्चा॒त् प्र॒पदानि पुरः॒ पा॒र्ष्णीः पुरो॒ मु॒खा । खलजाः॒ शकधूमजा॒ उ॒रुण्डा ये॒ च मट्मटाः॒ कुम्भ॒मुष्का अयाश॒वः । ता॒न् अस्या॒ ब्रह्मणस् पते प्रतीबोधे॒न नाशय ॥१५॥

text: Sightless and with distorted eyes, impotent. woman less be they. O Healing Plant, cast each away who, not her husband, would approach this woman wedded to her lord.
meaning: पर्यस्ताक्षा॒ अ॒प्रचङ्कशा अस्त्रैणाः॒ सन्तु प॒ण्डगाः । अ॒व भेषज पादय य॒ इमां॒ संवि॒वृत्सत्य् अ॒पतिः स्वपतिं॒ स्त्रि॒यम् ॥१६॥

text: The Bristly-haired, the Maniac-haired, the Biter, and the Groper-fiend, The Creeper-near, the Copper-hued, the Snouty, and the Saluda, With foot and heel kick over, as a hasty cow her milking-pan.
meaning: उद्धर्षि॒णं मु॒निकेशं जम्भ॒यन्तं मरीमृ॒श॒म् । उपे॒षन्तम् उदुम्ब॒लं तुण्डे॒लम् उत॒ शा॒लुडम् । पदा॒ प्र॒ विध्य पा॒र्ष्ण्या स्थालीं॒ गौ॒र् इव स्पन्दना॒ ॥१७॥

text: If one should touch thy coming babe or kill thine infant newly born, The yellow Plant with mighty bow shall pierce him even to the heart.
meaning: य॒स् ते ग॒र्भं प्रतिमृशा॒ज् जातं॒ वा मार॒याति ते । पिङ्ग॒स् त॒म् उग्र॒धन्वा कृणो॒तु हृदयावि॒धम् ॥१८॥

text: Those who kill infants unawares, and near the new-made mothers lie, Let Pinga chase the amorous Gandharvas as wind chases cloud.
meaning: ये॒ अम्नो॒ जता॒न् मार॒यन्ति सू॒तिका अनुशे॒रते । स्त्री॒भागान् पिङ्गो॒ गन्धर्वा॒न् वा॒तो अभ्र॒म् इवाजतु ॥१९॥

text: Let it maintain the genial seed: let the laid embryo rest secure. Let both strong Healers, to be worn within the girdle, guard the babe.
meaning: प॒रिसृष्टं धरयतु य॒द् धितं॒ मा॒व पादि त॒त् । ग॒र्भं त उग्रौ॒ रक्षताम् भेषजौ॒ नीविभार्यौ॑ ॥२०॥ {१५}

text: From the Kimīdin, for thy lord and children, Pinga shield thee well, From Sāyaka, and Nagnaka, Tangalva, and Pavīnasa.
meaning: पवीनसा॒त् तङ्गल्वा॑च् छा॒यकाद् उत॒ न॒ग्नकात् । प्रजा॒यै प॒त्ये त्वा पिङ्गः॒ प॒रि पातु किमीदि॒नः ॥२१॥

text: From the five-footed, fingerless, from the four-eyed, the double- faced, From the Close-creeper, from the Worm, from the Quick-roller guard her well.
meaning: द्व्या॑स्याच् चतुरक्षा॒त् प॒ञ्चपदाद् अनङ्गुरेः॒ । वृ॒न्ताद् अभि॒ प्रस॒र्पतः प॒रि पाहि वरीवृता॒त् ॥२२॥

text: Those who eat flesh uncooked, and those who eat the bleeding flesh of men, Feeders on babes unborn, long-haired, far from this place we banish these.
meaning: य॒ आमं॒ मां॒सम् अदन्ति पौ॒रुषेयं च ये॒ क्रविः॒ । ग॒र्भान् खा॒दन्ति केशवा॒स् ता॒न् इतो॒ नाशयामसि ॥२३॥

text: Shy slinkers from the Sun, as slinks a woman from her husband's sire, Deep down into the heart of these let Baja and let Pinga pierce.
meaning: ये॒ सू॒र्यात् परिस॒र्पन्ति स्नुषे॒व श्व॒शुराद् अ॒धि । बज॒श् च ते॒षां पिङ्ग॒श् च हृ॒दये॒ ऽधि नि॒ विध्यताम् ॥२४॥

text: Pinga, preserve the babe at birth, make not the boy a female child. Let not Egg-eaters mar the germs: drive the Kimidins far away.
meaning: पि॒ङ्ग र॒क्ष जा॒यमानं मा॒ पु॒मांसं स्त्रि॒यं क्रन् । आण्डा॒दो ग॒र्भान् मा॒ दभन् बा॒धस्वेतः॒ किमीदि॒नः ॥२५॥

text: Sterility, and infants' death, and weeping that announceth woe, Dear! lay them on the fiend as thou wouldst pluck a garland from a tree.
meaning: अप्रजा॒स्त्वं मा॒र्तवत्सम् आ॒द् रो॒दम् अघ॒म् आवय॒म् । वृक्षा॒द् इव स्र॒जम् कृत्वा॒प्रिये प्र॒ति मुञ्च त॒त् ॥२६॥ {१६}

text: The tawny-coloured, and the pale, the variegated and the red, The dusky-tinted, and the black,—all Plants we summon hither- ward.
meaning: या॒ बभ्र॒वो या॒श् च शुक्रा॒ रो॒हिणीर् उत॒ पृ॒श्नयः । अ॒सिक्नीः कृष्णा॒ ओ॒षधीः स॒र्वा अछा॒वदामसि ॥१॥

text: This man let them deliver from Consumption which the Gods have sent. The father of these Herbs was Heaven, their mother Earth, the Sea their root.
meaning: त्रा॒यन्ताम् इमं॒ पु॒रुसं य॒क्ष्माद् देवे॒षिताद् अ॒धि । या॒साम् द्यौः॒ पिता॒ पृथिवी॒ माता॒ समुद्रो॒ मू॒लं वीरु॒धां बभू॒व ॥२॥

text: The Waters are the best, and heavenly Plants. From every limb of thine have they removed Consumption caused by sin.
meaning: आ॒पो अ॒ग्रं दिव्या॒ ओ॒षधयः । ता॒स् ते य॒क्ष्मम् एनस्य॑म् अ॒ङ्गादङ्गाद् अनीनशन् ॥३॥

text: I speak to Healing Herbs spreading, and bushy, to creepers, and to those whose sheath is single, I call for thee the fibrous and the reed-like, and branching. Plants, dear to the Visve Devas, powerful, giving life to men.
meaning: प्रस्तृणती॒ स्तम्बि॒नीर् ए॒कशुङ्गाः प्रतन्वती॒र् ओ॒षधीर् आ॒ वदामि । अंशुम॒तीः कण्डि॒नीर् या॒ वि॒शाखा ह्व॒यामि ते वीरु॒धो वैश्वदेवी॒र् उग्राः॒ पुरुषजी॒वनीः ॥४॥

text: The conquering strength, the power and might which ye, victo- rious Plants, possess, Therewith deliver this man here from this Consumption, O ye Plants: so I prepare the remedy.
meaning: य॒द् वः स॒हः सहमाना वीर्यं॑१ य॒च् च वो ब॒लम् । ते॒नेम॒म् अस्मा॒द् य॒क्ष्मात् पु॒रुषं मुञ्चतौषधीर् अ॒थो कृणोमि भेषज॒म् ॥५॥

text: The living Plant that giveth life, that driveth malady away, Arundhatr, the rescuer, strengthening, rich a sweets I call, to free this man from scath and harm.
meaning: जीवलां॒ नघारिषां॒ जीवन्ती॒म् ओ॒षधीम् अह॒म् । अरुन्धती॒म् उन्न॒यन्तीं पुष्पा॒म् म॒धुमतीम् इह॒ हुवे ऽस्मा॒ अरिष्ट॒तातये ॥६॥

text: Hitherward let the sapient come, the friendly sharers o f my speech. That we may give this man relief and raise him from his evil plight.
meaning: इहा॒ यन्तु प्र॒चेतसो मेदि॒नीर् व॒चसो म॒म । य॒थेमं॒ पार॒यामसि पु॒रुषं दुरिता॒द् अ॒धि ॥७॥

text: Germ of the Waters, Agni's food, Plants ever growing fresh and new, Sure, healing, bearing thousand names, let them be all collected here.
meaning: अग्ने॒र् घासो॒ अपां॒ ग॒र्भो या॒ रो॒हन्ति पु॒नर्णवाः । ध्रुवाः॒ सह॒स्रनाम्नी॒र् भेषजीः॒ सन्त्व् आ॒भृताः ॥८॥

text: Let Plants whose soul is water, girt with Avakās, piercing with their sharp horns expel the malady.
meaning: अव॒कोल्बा उद॒कात्मान ओ॒षधयः । व्यृ॑षन्तु दुरितं॒ तीक्ष्णशृङ्ग्यः॑ ॥९॥

text: Strong, antidotes of poison, those releasers, free from Varuna, And those that drive away Catarrh, and those that frustrate magic arts, let all those Plants come hitherward.
meaning: उन्मुञ्च॒न्तीर् विवरुणा॒ उग्रा॒ या॒ विषदू॒षनीः । अ॒थो बलासना॒शनीः कृत्यादू॒षणीश् च या॒स् ता॒ इहा॒ यन्त्व् ओ॒षधीः ॥१०॥ {१७}

text: Let purchased Plants of mightier power, Plants that are praised for excellence. Here in this village safely keep cattle and horses, man and beast.
meaning: अपक्रीताः॒ स॒हीयसीर् वीरु॒धो या॒ अभि॒ष्टुताः । त्रा॒यन्ताम् अस्मि॒न् ग्रा॒मे गा॒म् अ॒श्वं पु॒रुषं पशु॒म् ॥११॥

text: Sweet is their root, sweet are these Plants' top branches, sweet also is their intermediate portion; Sweet is their foliage, and sweet their blossom, combined with sweetness is their taste of Amrit: food, fatness let them yield, with kine preceding.
meaning: म॒धुमन् मू॒लं म॒धुमद् अ॒ग्रम् आसाम् म॒धुमन् म॒ध्यं वीरु॒धां बभूव । म॒धुमत् पर्णं॒ म॒धुमत् पु॒ष्पम् आसां म॒धोः स॒म्भक्ता अमृ॒तस्य भक्षो॒ घृत॒म् अ॒न्नं दुह्रतां गो॒पुरोगवम् ॥१२॥

text: These Plants that grow upon the earth, whate'er their number and their size, Let these with all their thousand leaves free me from Death and misery.
meaning: या॒वतीः कि॒यतीश् चेमाः॒ पृथिव्या॒म् अ॒ध्य् ओ॒षधीः । ता॒ मा सहस्रपर्ण्यो॑ मृत्यो॒र् मुञ्चन्त्व् अं॒हसः ॥१३॥

text: May the Plants' Tiger-amulet, protective, guardian from the curse, Beat off the brood of demons, drive all maladies afar from us.
meaning: वै॒याघ्रो मणि॒र् वीरु॒धां त्रा॒यमानो ऽभिशस्तिपाः॒ । अ॒मीवाः स॒र्वा र॒क्षांस्य् अ॒प हन्त्व् अ॒धि दूर॒म् अस्म॒त् ॥१४॥

text: Before the gathered Plants they fly and scatter, as though a lion's roar or fire dismayed them. Expelled by Plants, let men's and kine's Consumption pass from us to the navigable rivers.
meaning: सिं॒हस्येव स्तन॒थोः सं॒ विजन्ते ऽग्ने॒र् इव विजन्ते आ॒भृताभ्यः । ग॒वां य॒क्ष्मः पु॒रुषाणां वीरु॒द्भिर् अ॒तिनुत्तो नाव्या॑ एतु स्रोत्याः॒ ॥१५॥

text: Emancipated from the sway of Agni, of Vaisvānara, go, covering the earth, ye Plants whose ruler is Vanaspati.
meaning: मुमुचाना॒ ओ॒षधयो ऽग्ने॒र् वैश्वानरा॒द् अ॒धि । भू॒मिं संतन्वती॒र् इत या॒सां रा॒जा व॒नस्प॒तिः ॥१६॥

text: May these be pleasant to our heart, auspicious, rich in store of milk, These Plants of the Angirases which grow on mountains and on plains.
meaning: या॒ रो॒हन्त्य् आङ्गिरसीः॒ प॒र्वतेषु समे॒षु च । ता॒ नः प॒यस्वतीः शिवा॒ ओ॒षधीः सन्तु शं॒ हृदे॒ ॥१७॥

text: The Plants I know myself, the plants that with mine eye I look upon, Plants yet unknown, and those we know, wherein we find that power is stored,
meaning: या॒श् चाहं॒ वे॒द वीरु॒धो या॒श् च प॒श्यामि च॒क्षुषा । अ॒ज्ञाता जानीम॒श् च या॒ या॒सु विद्म॒ च सं॒भृतम् ॥१८॥

text: Let all the congregated Plants attend and mark mine utterance, That we may rescue this man here and save him from severe distress.
meaning: स॒र्वाः समग्रा॒ ओ॒षधीर् बो॒धन्तु व॒चसो म॒म । य॒थेमं॒ पार॒यामसि पु॒रुषम् दुरिता॒द् अ॒धि ॥१९॥

text: Asvattha, Darbha, King of Plants, is Soma, deathless sacrifice Barley and Rice are healing balms, the sons of Heaven who never die.
meaning: अश्वत्थो॒ दर्भो॒ वीरु॒धां सो॒मो रा॒जामृ॒तं हविः॒ । व्रीहि॒र् य॒वश् च भेषजौ॒ दिव॒सि पुत्रा॒व् अ॒मर्त्यौ ॥२०॥ {१८}

text: Lift yourselves up, ye Healing Plants, loud is the thunder's crash and roar. When with full flow Parjanya, ye Children of Prisni! blesseth; you.
meaning: उ॒ज् जिहीध्वे स्तन॒यत्य् अभिक्र॒न्दत्य् ओषधीः । यदा॒ वः पृश्निमातरः पर्ज॒न्यो रे॒तसा॒वति ॥२१॥

text: We give the essence of that stream of nectar of this man to drink: So I prepare a remedy that he may live a hundred years.
meaning: त॒स्यामृ॒तस्येमं॒ ब॒लं पु॒रुषं पययामसि । अ॒थो कृणोमि भेषजं॒ य॒था॒सच् छत॒हायनः ॥२२॥

text: Well doth the wild boar know a Plant, the mungoose knows the Healing Herb. I call, to aid this man, the Plants which Serpents and Gandhar- vas know.
meaning: वराहो॒ वेद वीरु॒धं नकुलो॒ वेद भेषजी॒म् । सर्पा॒ गन्धर्वा॒ या॒ विदु॒स् ता॒ अस्मा॒ अ॒वसे हुवे ॥२३॥

text: Plants of Angirases which hawks, celestial Plants which eagles. know; Plants known to swans and lesser fowl, Plants known to all the birds that fly. Plants that are known to sylvan beasts,—I call them all to aid this man.
meaning: याः॒ सुपर्णा॒ आङ्गिरसी॒र् दिव्या॒ या॒ रघ॒तो विदुः॒ । व॒यांसि हंसा॒ या॒ विदु॒र् या॒स् च स॒र्वे पतत्रि॒णः । मृगा॒ या॒ विदु॒र् ओ॒षधीस् ता॒ अस्मा॒ अ॒वसे हुवे ॥२४॥

text: The multitude of herbs whereon the Cows whom none may slaughter feed, all that are food for goats and sheep, So many Plants, brought hitherward, give shelter and defence to thee!
meaning: या॒वतीनाम् ओ॒षधीनां गा॒वः प्राश्न॒न्त्य् अघ्न्या॒ य॒वतीनाम् अजाव॒यः । ता॒वतीस् तु॒भ्यम् ओ॒षधीः श॒र्म य॒छन्त्व् आ॒भृताः ॥२५॥

text: Hitherward unto thee I bring the Plants that cure all maladies, All Plants wherein physicians have discovered health-bestowing power.
meaning: या॒वतीषु मनुष्या॑ भेषजं॒ भिष॒जो विदुः॒ । ता॒वतीर् विश्व॒भेषजीर् आ॒ भरामि त्वा॒म् अभि॒ ॥२६॥

text: Let Plants with flower and Plants with bud, the fruitful and the fruitless, all, Like children of one mother, yield their stores for this man's perfeet health.
meaning: पु॒ष्पवतीः प्रसू॒मतीः फलि॒नीर् अफला॒ उत॒ । संमात॒र इव दुह्राम् अस्मा॒ अरिष्ट॒तातये ॥२७॥

text: From the Five-arrowed, from the Ten-arrowed have I delivered thee, Freed thee from Yama's fetter and from all offence against the Gods,
meaning: उ॒त् त्वाहार्षं प॒ञ्चशलाद् अ॒थो द॒शशलाद् उत॒ । अ॒थो य॒मस्य प॒ड्वीशाद् वि॒श्वस्माद् देवकिल्बिषा॒त् ॥२८॥ {१९}

text: Indra the Shaker shake them up, brave, hero, fortdemolisher, That into thousand fragments we may strike the armies of our foes!
meaning: इ॒न्द्रो मन्थतु म॒न्थिता शक्रः॒ शू॒रः पुरंदरः॒ । य॒था ह॒नाम से॒ना अमि॒त्राणां सहस्रशः॒ ॥१॥

text: Let Pūtirajju with her breath corrupt and putrefy that host, And terror smite our foemen's heart when fire and smoke are seen afar.
meaning: पूतिरज्जु॒र् उपध्मा॒नी पू॒तिं से॒नां कृणोत्व् अमू॒म् । धूम॒म् अग्नि॒म् परादृ॒श्या ऽमि॒त्रा हृत्स्व् आ॒ दधतां भय॒म् ॥२॥

text: Asvattha, rend those men; do thou devour them quickly, Khadira! Like reeds let them be broken through, down-smitten by a lifted rush.
meaning: अमू॒न् अश्वत्थ निः॒ शृणीहि खा॒दामू॒न् खदिराजिर॒म् । ताज॒द्भ॒ङ्ग इव भजन्तां ह॒न्त्व् एनान् व॒धको वधैः॒ ॥३॥

text: Let Parushāhva make them reeds, and let the bulrush strike them down: Bound in a mighty net let them break quickly like an arrow's shaft.
meaning: परुषा॒न् अमू॒न् परुषाह्वः॒ कृणोतु ह॒न्त्व् एनान् व॒धको वधैः॒ । क्षिप्रं॒ शर॒ इव भजन्तां बृहज्जाले॒न सं॒दिताः ॥४॥

text: Air was the net; the poles thereof were the great quarters of the sky: Sakra therewith enveloped and cast on the ground the Dasyus' host.
meaning: अन्त॒रिक्षं जा॒लम् आसीज् जालदण्डा॒ दि॒शो महीः॒ । ते॒नाभिधा॒य द॒स्यूनां शक्रः॒ से॒नाम् अ॒पावपत् ॥५॥

text: Verily mighty is the net of mighty Sakra rich in wealth: Therewith press all the foemen down so that not one of them escape!
meaning: बृह॒द् धि॒ जा॒लं बृहतः॒ शक्र॒स्य वाजि॒नीवतः । ते॒न श॒त्रून् अभि॒ स॒र्वान् न्य् उ॑ब्ज य॒था न॒ मु॒च्यातै कतम॒श् चनै॒षाम् ॥६॥

text: Great is thy net, brave Indra, thine the mighty match for a thousand, Lord of Hundred Powers! Holding them, with his host, therewith hath Indra slaughtered Dasyus a hundred, thousand, myriad, hundred millions.
meaning: बृह॒त् ते जा॒लं बृहत॒ इन्द्र शूर सहस्रार्घ॒स्य शत॒वीर्यस्य । ते॒न शतं॒ सह॒स्रम् अयु॒तं न्य॑र्बुदं जघा॒न शक्रो॒ द॒स्यूनाम् अभिधा॒य से॒नया ॥७॥

text: This world so mighty was the net of Sakra, of the Mighty One: With this, the net of Indra, I envelop all those men with gloom.
meaning: अयं॒ लोको॒ जा॒लम् आसीच् छक्र॒स्य महतो॒ महा॒न् । ते॒नाह॒म् इन्द्रजाले॒नामूं॒स् त॒मसाभि॒ दधामि स॒र्वान् ॥८॥

text: Great weakness and misfortune, pain which words can never charm away, Languor, fatigue, bewilderment, with these I compass all the foes.
meaning: सेदि॒र् उग्रा॒ व्यृ॑द्धिर् आ॒र्तिश् चानपवाचना॒ । श्र॒मस् तन्द्री॒श् च मो॒हश् च तै॒र् अमू॒न् अभि॒ दधामि स॒र्वान् ॥९॥

text: I give those foemen up to Death: bound in the bonds of Death are they. I bind and carry them away to meet Death's wicked messengers.
meaning: मृत्य॒वे ऽमू॒न् प्र॒ यछामि मृत्युपाशै॒र् अमी॒ सिताः॒ । मृत्यो॒र् ये॒ अघला॒ दूता॒स् ते॒भ्य एनान् प्र॒ति नयामि बद्ध्वा॒ ॥१०॥ {२०}

text: Bear them away, Death's messengers! envoys of Yama! bind them fast. More than a thousand be their slain: the club of Bhava pierce them through!
meaning: न॒यतामू॒न् मृत्युदूता य॒मदूता अ॒पोम्भत । परःसहस्रा॒ हन्यन्तां तृणे॒ढ्व् एनान् मत्यं॑ भव॒स्य ॥११॥

text: Forth go the Sādhyas in their might bearing one netpole raised aloft. One pole the Rudras carry, one the Vasus, and the Ādityas one.
meaning: साध्या॒ ए॒कं जालदण्ड॒म् उद्य॒त्य यन्त्य् ओ॒जसा । रुद्रा॒ ए॒कं व॒सव ए॒कम् आदित्यै॒र् ए॒क उ॒द्यतः ॥१२॥

text: The Visve Devas from above shall come depressing it with might, And in the midst the Angirases, slaying the mighty host, shall go.
meaning: वि॒श्वे देवाः॒ उप॒रिष्टाद् उब्ज॒न्तो यन्त्व् ओ॒जसा । म॒ध्येन घ्न॒न्तो यन्तु से॒नाम् अ॒ङ्गिरसो मही॒म् ॥१३॥

text: Trees of the forest, trees that bear flower and fruit, and herbs and plants, Quadruped, biped send I forth that they may strike this army dead,
meaning: व॒नस्प॒तीन् वानस्पत्या॒न् ओ॒षधीर् उत॒ वीरु॒धः । द्विपा॒च् च॒तुष्पाद् इष्णामि य॒था से॒नाम् अमूं॒ ह॒नन् ॥१४॥

text: Gandharvas, and Apsarases, Gods, Serpents, Fathers, Holy Men, Seen and unseen, I send them forth that they may strike this army dead.
meaning: गन्धर्वाप्सर॒सः सर्पा॒न् देवा॒न् पुण्यजना॒न् पितृ॒̄न् । दृष्टा॒न् अदृ॒ष्टान् इष्णामि य॒था से॒नाम् अमूं॒ ह॒नन् ॥१५॥

text: Here spread are snares of Death wherefrom thou, once within them, ne'er art freed: Full many a thousand of the host yonder this horn shall smite and slay.
meaning: इम॒ उप्ता॒ मृत्युपाशा॒ या॒न् आक्र॒म्य न॒ मुच्य॒से । अमु॒ष्या हन्तु से॒नाया इदं॒ कू॒टं सहस्रशः॒ ॥१६॥

text: The Gharma hath been warmed with fire: this Homa slays a thousand men. Let Bhava, Prisnibāhu, and Sarva destroy that armament.
meaning: घर्मः॒ स॒मिद्धो अग्नि॒नायं॒ हो॒मः सहस्रहः॒ । भव॒श् च पृ॒श्निबाहुश् च श॒र्व से॒नाम् अमूं॒ हतम् ॥१७॥

text: Their portion be the fire of Death, hunger, exhaustion, slaughter, fear. With your entangling snares and nets, Sarva and Indra! slay that host.
meaning: मृत्यो॒र् आ॒षम् आ॒ पद्यन्तां क्षु॒धं सेदिं॒ वध॒म् भय॒म् । इ॒न्द्रश् चाक्षुजाला॒भ्यां श॒र्व से॒नाम् अमूं॒ हतम् ॥१८॥

text: Fly, conquered, in alarm, ye foes, run driven by the spell away! Let not one man escape of those when routed by Brihaspati.
meaning: प॒राजिताः प्र॒ त्रसतामित्रा नुत्ता॒ धावत ब्र॒ह्मणा । बृ॒हस्प॒तिप्रनुत्तानां मा॒मी॒षां मोचि क॒श् चन॒ ॥१९॥

text: Down fall their weapons on the ground: no strength be theirs to point a shaft: Then in their dreadful terror let their arrows wound their vital parts.
meaning: अ॒व पद्यन्ताम् एषाम् आ॒युधानि मा॒ शकन् प्रतिधा॒म् इ॒षुम् । अ॒थैषां बहु॒ बि॒भ्यताम् इ॒षवः घ्नन्तु म॒र्मणि ॥२०॥

text: Let Heaven and Earth roar out in wrath against them, and Air with all the Deities in concert, Let them not find a surety or a refuge, but torn away go down to Death together.
meaning: सं॒ क्रोशताम् एनान् द्या॒वापृथिवी॒ स॒म् अन्त॒रिक्षं सह॒ देव॒ताभिः । मा॒ ज्ञाता॒रं मा॒ प्रतिष्ठां॒ विदन्त मिथो॒ विघ्नाना॒ उ॒प यन्तु मृत्यु॒म् ॥२१॥

text: The mules of the Gods' car are heaven's four quarters; their hooves are sacred cakes, the air its body. Its sides are Heaven and Earth, its reins the Seasons, Voice is its hood, its grooms are sky's mid-regions.
meaning: दि॒शश् च॒तस्रो ऽश्वतर्यो॑ देवरथ॒स्य पुरोदा॒शाः शफा॒ अन्त॒रिक्षम् उद्धिः॒ । द्या॒वापृथिवी॒ प॒क्षसी ऋत॒वो ऽभी॒शवो ऽन्तर्देशाः॒ किम्करा॒ वा॒क् प॒रिरथ्यम् ॥२२॥

text: Year is the car, Full Year the seat for driving, Virāj the pole, the chariot's front is Agni, Indra the warrior, and the Moon the driver.
meaning: संवत्सरो॒ र॒थः परिवत्सरो॒ रथोपस्थो॒ विरा॒ड् ईषा॒ग्नी॒ रथमुख॒म् । इ॒न्द्रः सव्यष्ठा॒श् चन्द्र॒माः सा॒रथिः ॥२३॥

text: Hence conquer, conquer, Hail! be thou the victor! Let these be conquerors and those be conquered. Good luck to these, ill luck to those men yonder! With the dark-blue-and-red our foes I cover.
meaning: इतो॒ जयेतो॒ वि॒ जय सं॒ जय ज॒य स्वा॒हा । इमे॒ जयन्तु प॒रामी॒ जयन्तां स्वा॒हैभ्यो॒ दुरा॒हामी॒भ्यः । नीललोहिते॒नामू॒न् अभ्य॒वतनोमि ॥२४॥ {२१}

text: Whence were these two produced? which was that region?' From what world, from which earth had they their being? Calves of Virāj, these two arose from water. I ask thee of these twain, who was their milker.
meaning: कु॒तस् तौ॒ जातौ॒ कतमः॒ सो॒ अ॒र्धः क॒स्माल् लोका॒त् कतम॒स्याः पृथिव्याः॒ । वत्सौ॒ विरा॒जः सलिला॒द् उ॒द् ऐतां तौ॒ त्वा पृछामि कतरे॒ण दुग्धा॒ ॥१॥

text: He who prepared a threefold home, and lying there made the water bellow through his greatness, Calf of Virāj, giving each wish fulfilment, made bodies for him- self far off, in secret.
meaning: यो॒ अ॒क्रन्दयत् सलिलं॒ महित्वा॒ यो॒निं कृत्वा॒ त्रिभु॒जं श॒यानः । वत्सः॒ कामदु॒घो विरा॒जः स॒ गु॒हा चक्रे तन्वः॑ पराचैः॒ ॥२॥

text: Which are the three, the mighty three, whereof the fourth divides the voice, This may the Brāhman know by prayer and fervour, whereto belongs the one, whereto the other.
meaning: या॒नि त्री॒णि बृह॒न्ति ये॒षां चतुर्थं॒ वियुन॒क्ति वा॒चम् । ब्रह्मै॒नद् विद्यात् त॒पसा विपश्चि॒द् य॒स्मिन्न् ए॒कं युज्य॒ते य॒स्मिन्न् ए॒कम् ॥३॥

text: Out of the Brihat as the sixth five Salmons have been fashioned forth: From Brihatī was Brihat formed: whence was the Brihatī com- posed?
meaning: बृहतः॒ प॒रि सा॒मानि षष्ठा॒त् प॒ञ्चा॒धि नि॒र्मिता । बृह॒द् बृहत्या॒ नि॒र्मितं कु॒तो॒ ऽधि बृहती॒ मिता॒ ॥४॥

text: On measure Brihatī is based, and measure on the measurer: From magic might came magic might, from magic might came Mātali.
meaning: बृहती॒ प॒रि मा॒त्राया मातु॒र् मा॒त्रा॒धि नि॒र्मिता । माया॒ ह जज्ञे माया॒या माया॒या मा॒तली प॒रि ॥५॥

text: Vaisvānara's image is the sky above us, so far as Agni forced both spheres asunder. Thence from that region as the sixth come praise-songs, and every sixth day hence again go upward.
meaning: वैश्वानर॒स्य प्रतिमो॒प॒रि द्यौ॒र् या॒वद् रो॒दसी विबबाधे॒ अग्निः॒ । त॒तः षष्ठा॒द् आ॒मु॒तो यन्ति स्तो॒मा उ॒द् इतो॒ यन्त्य् अभि॒ षष्ठ॒म् अ॒ह्नः ॥६॥

text: We, Kagyapa! six present Rishis, ask thee—for thou hast prov- ed things tried and meet for trial They call Virāj the Father of Devotion: tell her to us thy friends in all her figures.
meaning: ष॒ट् त्वा पृछाम ऋ॒षयः कश्यपेमे॒ त्वं॒ हि॒ युक्तं॒ युयुक्षे॒ यो॒ग्यं च । विरा॒जम् आहुर् ब्र॒ह्मणः पित॒रं तां॒ नो वि॒ धेहि यतिधा॒ स॒खिभ्यः ॥७॥

text: She whom, advancing, sacrifices follow, and when she takes her station stand beside her, By whose control and hest the spirit moveth, she is Virāj, in highest heaven, O Rishis.
meaning: यां॒ प्र॒च्युताम् अ॒नु यज्ञाः॒ प्रच्य॒वन्त उपति॒ष्ठन्त उपति॒ष्ठमानाम् । य॒स्या व्रते॒ प्रसवे॒ यक्ष॒म् ए॒जति सा॒ विरा॒ट् ऋषयः परमे॒ व्यो॑मन् ॥८॥

text: Breathless, she moves by breath of living creatures, Svarāj pre- cedes, Virāj comes closely after. Some men behold her not, and some behold her, Virāj meet- shaped, who thinks of all existence.
meaning: अप्राणै॒ति प्राणे॒न प्राणती॒नां विरा॒ट् स्वरा॒जम् अभ्य् ए॑ति पश्चा॒त् । वि॒श्वं मृश॒न्तीम् अभि॒रूपां विरा॒जं प॒श्यन्ति त्वे॒ न त्वे॒ पश्यन्त्य् एनाम् ॥९॥

text: Who hath perceived Virāj's duplication, perceived her seasons and her rule and practice? Who knows her steps, how oft, how far extended, who knows her home and number of her dawnings?
meaning: को॒ विरा॒जो मिथुनत्वं॒ प्र॒ वेद क॒ ऋतू॒न् क॒ उ क॒ल्पम् अस्याः । क्र॒मान् को॒ अस्याः कतिधा॒ वि॒दुग्धान् को॒ अस्या धा॒म कतिधा॒ व्यु॑ष्टीः ॥१०॥ {२२}

text: She here who first of all sent forth her lustre moves onward resting on these lower creatures. Exalted power and might are stored within her: the woman hath prevailed, the new-come mother.
meaning: इय॒म् एव॒ सा॒ या॒ प्रथमा॒ व्यौ॒छद् आस्व् इ॒तरासु चरति प्र॒विष्टा । महा॒न्तो अस्यां महिमा॒नो अन्त॒र् वधू॒र् जिगाय नवग॒ज् ज॒नित्री ॥११॥

text: Both Dawns on wings of song, with rich adornment, move on together to their common dwelling. Sūrya's two wives, unwasting, most prolific, knowing their way, move, rich in light, together.
meaning: छ॒न्दःपक्षे उष॒सा पे॒पिशाने समानं॒ यो॒निम् अ॒नु सं॒ चरेमे । सू॒र्यपत्नी सं॒ चरतः प्रजानती॒ केतुम॒ती अज॒रे भू॒रिरेतसा ॥१२॥

text: The three have passed along the path of Order—three warm libations have regarded offspring One quickens progeny, one strengthens vigour, and one protects the kingdom of the pious.
meaning: ऋत॒स्य प॒न्थाम् अ॒नु तिस्र॒ आ॒गुस् त्र॒यो घर्मा॒ अ॒नु रे॒त आ॒गुः । प्रजा॒म् ए॒का जि॒न्वत्य् ऊ॒र्जम् ए॒का राष्ट्र॒म् ए॒का रक्षति देवयूना॒म् ॥१३॥

text: She who was fourth was made by Agni, Soma, and Rishis as. they formed both halves of worship, Gāyatrī, Trishtup, Jagatī, Anushtup, Brihadarki lightening the sacrificer.
meaning: अग्नी॒षो॒माव् अदधुर् या॒ तुरी॒या॒सीद् यज्ञ॒स्य पक्षा॒व् ऋ॒षयः कल्प॒यन्तः । गायत्रीं॒ त्रिष्टु॒भं ज॒गतीम् अनुष्टु॒भं बृहदर्कीं॒ य॒जमानाय स्व॑र् आभ॒रन्तीम् ॥१४॥

text: Five milkings answer to the fivefold dawning, five seasons to the cow who bears five titles. The five sky-regions made fifteen in number, one head have these to one sole world directed.
meaning: प॒ञ्च व्यु॑ष्टीर् अ॒नु प॒ञ्च दो॒हा गां॒ प॒ञ्चनाम्नीम् ऋत॒वो॒ ऽनु प॒ञ्च । प॒ञ्च दि॒शः पञ्चदशे॒न क्ल्̥प्ता॒स् ता॒ ए॒कमूर्ध्नीर् अभि॒ लोक॒म् ए॒कम् ॥१५॥

text: Six Elements arose, first-born of Order: the six-day time is carried by six Sāmans. Six-yoked the plough is, as each trace is numbered: they call both broad ones six; six, Earth and Heaven.
meaning: ष॒ट् जाता॒ भूता॒ प्रथमजा॒ ऋत॒स्य ष॒ट् उ सा॒मानि षटहं॒ वहन्ति । षट्योगं॒ सी॒रम् अ॒नु सा॒मसाम ष॒ट् आहुर् द्या॒वापृथिवीः॒ ष॒ट् उर्वीः॒ ॥१६॥

text: They call the cold months six, and six the hot ones. Which, tell us, of the seasons is redundant? Seven sages, eagles, have sat down together: seven metres match the seven Consecrations.
meaning: ष॒ड् आहुः शीता॒न् ष॒ड् उ मास॒ उष्णा॒न् ऋतुं॒ नो ब्रू॒त यतमो॒ ऽतिरिक्तः । सप्त॒ सुपर्णाः॒ कव॒यो नि॒ षेदुः सप्त॒ छ॒न्दांस्य् अ॒नु सप्त॒ दीक्षाः॒ ॥१७॥

text: Seven are the Homas, seven the logs for burning, seven are the streams of mead, and seven the seasons. Into the world have come seven streams of butter; those we have heard of as the Seven Vultures.
meaning: सप्त॒ हो॒माः समि॒धो ह सप्त॒ म॒धूनि सप्त॒ ऋत॒वो ह सप्त॒ । सप्ता॒ज्यानि प॒रि भूत॒म् आयन् ताः॒ सप्तगृध्रा॒ इ॒ति शुश्रुमा वय॒म् ॥१८॥

text: Seven metres, by four syllables increasing, each of the seven founded upon another How are the hymns of praise on these supported, and how are these imposed upon the praise-songs?
meaning: सप्त॒ छ॒न्दांसि चतुरुत्तरा॒ण्य् अन्यो॒ अन्य॒स्मिन्न् अ॒ध्य् आ॒र्पितानि । कथं॒ स्तो॒माः प्र॒ति तिष्ठन्ति ते॒षु ता॒नि स्तो॒मेषु कथ॒म् आ॒र्पितानि ॥१९॥

text: How hath the Gāyatri filled out three triads? On the fifteen how is the Trishtup moulded, Jagatī fashioned on the three-and-thirty? How is Anushtup formed? how Ekavinsa?
meaning: कथं॒ गायत्री॒ त्रिवृ॒तं व्य् आ॑प कथं॒ त्रिष्टु॒प् पञ्चदशे॒न कल्पते । त्रयस्त्रिंशे॒न ज॒गती कथ॒म् अनुष्टु॒प् कथ॒म् एकविंशः॒ ॥२०॥ {२३}

text: Eight Elements sprang up, first born of Order: the Priests divine are eight in number, Indra! Eight are the wombs of Aditi, eight her children; for the eighth night is the libation destined.
meaning: अष्ट॒ जाता॒ भूता॒ प्रथमजा॒ ऋत॒स्याष्टे॒न्द्र ऋत्वि॒जो दै॒व्या ये॒ । अष्ट॒योनिर् अ॒दितिर् अष्ट॒पुत्रास्तमीं॒ रा॒त्रिम् अभि॒ हव्य॒म् एति ॥२१॥

text: So planning bliss for you have I come hither to win your friendship: kind am I, and gracious. Born from one source, propitious is your wisdom: knowing full well to all of you it cometh.
meaning: इत्थं॒ श्रे॒यो म॒न्यमानेद॒म् आ॒गमं युष्मा॒कं सख्ये॒ अह॒म् अस्मि शे॒वा । समान॒जन्मा क्र॒तुर् अस्ति वः॒ शिवः॒ स॒ वः स॒र्वाः सं॒ चरति प्रजान॒न् ॥२२॥

text: To Indra eight, to Yama six, seven to the Rishis, seven to each: The number five accompanies waters and men and healing herbs.
meaning: अष्टे॒न्द्रस्य ष॒ड् यम॒स्य ऋ॒षीणां सप्त॒ सप्तधा॒ । अपो॒ मनुष्या॑न् ओ॒षधीस् तां॒ उ प॒ञ्चा॒नु सेचिरे ॥२३॥

text: The Heifer, all his own, poured forth for Indra control and milk at her first time of milking; And he then satisfied the four divisions, the Gods and men and Asuras and Rishis.
meaning: के॒वली॒न्द्राय दुदुहे॒ हि॒ गृष्टि॒र् व॒शम् पीयू॒षं प्रथमं॒ दु॒हाना । अ॒थातर्पयच् चतु॒रश् चतुर्धा॒ देवा॒न् मनुष्यां॑ अ॒सुरान् उत॒ ऋ॒षीन् ॥२४॥

text: Who is the Cow? Who is the Single Rishi? What is the law, what are the benedictions? What on the earth is the one only Spirit? Which of the number is the Single Season?
meaning: को॒ नु॒ गौः॒ क॒ एकऋषिः॒ कि॒म् उ धा॒म का॒ आशि॒षः । यक्ष॒म् पृथिव्या॒म् एकवृ॒द् एकर्तुः॒ कतमो॒ नु॒ सः॒ ॥२५॥

text: One is the Cow, one is the Single Spirit, one is the law, single are benedictions. The Spirit dwelling on the earth is single: the Single Season never is transcended.
meaning: एको॒ गौ॒र् ए॒क एकऋषि॒र् ए॒कं धा॒मैकधा॒शि॒षः । यक्षं॒ पृथिव्या॒म् एकवृ॒द् एकर्तु॒र् ना॒ति रिच्यते ॥२६॥ {२४}

text: Viraj at first was This. At birth all feared her; the thought, She will become this All, struck terror.
meaning: विरा॒ड् वा॒ इद॒म् अ॒ग्र आसीत् त॒स्या जाता॒याः स॒र्वम् अबिभेद् इय॒म् एवे॒दं॒ भविष्य॒ती॒ति ॥१॥

text: She rose, the Gārhapatya fire she entered. He who knows this becomes lord of a household, performer of domestic sacri- fices.
meaning: सो॒द् अक्रामत् सा॒ गा॒र्हपत्ये न्य् अ॑क्रामत् । गृहमेधी॒ गृह॒पतिर् भवति य॒ एवं॒ वे॒द ॥२॥

text: She mounted up, the Eastward fire she entered. He who knows this becomes the Gods' beloved, and to his call they come when she invokes them.
meaning: सो॒द् अक्रामत् सा॒हवनी॒ये न्य् अ॑क्रामत् । य॒न्त्य् अस्य देवा॒ देव॒हूतिं प्रियो॒ देवा॒नां भवति य॒ एवं॒ वे॒द ॥३॥

text: She mounted up, the Southward fire she entered. He who knows this becomes a fit performer of sacrifice, meet for honour, shelter-giver.
meaning: सो॒द् अक्रामत् सा॒ दक्षिणाग्नौ॒ न्य् अ॑क्रामत् । यज्ञ॒र्तो दक्षिणी॒यो वा॒सतेयो भवति य॒ एवं॒ वे॒द ॥४॥

text: She mounted up, she entered the Assembly. He who knows this becomes polite and courtly, and people come as guests to his assembly.
meaning: सो॒द् अक्रामत् सा॒ सभा॒यां न्य् अ॑क्रामत् । य॒न्त्य् अस्य सभां॒ स॒भ्यो भवति य॒ एवं॒ वे॒द ॥५॥

text: She mounted up, she passed within the meeting. He who knows this becomes fit for the meeting, and to his hall of meeting come the people.
meaning: सो॒द् अक्रामत् सा॒ स॒मितौ न्य् अ॑क्रामत् । य॒न्त्य् अस्य स॒मितिं सामित्यो॒ भवति य॒ एवं॒ वे॒द ॥६॥

text: She mounted up, she entered Consultation. Whoso knows this is fit to be consulted, and to his consultation come the people.
meaning: सो॒द् अक्रामत् सा॒म॒न्त्रणे न्य् अ॑क्रामत् । य॒न्त्य् अस्याम॒न्त्रणम् आमन्त्रणी॒यो भवति य॒ एवं॒ वे॒द ॥७॥ {२५}

text: She mounted up, and, into four divided, she took her station in the air's mid-region.
meaning: सो॒द् अक्रामत् सा॒न्त॒रिक्षे चतुर्धा॒ वि॒क्रान्तातिष्ठत् ॥८॥

text: Of her the Gods and men said, This she knoweth. That we may both have life let us invoke her.
meaning: तां॒ देवमनुष्या॑ अब्रुवन्न् इय॒म् एव॒ त॒द् वेद य॒द् उभ॒य उपजी॒वेमेमा॒म् उ॒प ह्वयामहा इ॒ति ॥९॥

text: Thus did they cry to her:
meaning: ता॒म् उ॒पाह्वयन्त ॥१०॥

text: Come, Strength! come, Food! come, Charmer! come, Free- giver!
meaning: ऊ॒र्ज ए॒हि स्व॒ध एहि सू॒नृत ए॒ही॒रावत्य् ए॒ही॒ति ॥११॥

text: Her calf, her well-beloved calf, was Indra: Gāyatri was her rope, the cloud her udder.
meaning: त॒स्या इ॒न्द्रो वत्स॒ आ॒सीद् गायत्र्य् अ॑भिधा॒न्य् अभ्र॒म् ऊ॒धः ॥१२॥

text: Two teats she had, Rathantara and Brihat, two, Yajnāyajniya and Vāmadevya.
meaning: बृह॒च् च रथंतरं॒ च द्वौ॒ स्त॒नाव् आ॒स्तां यज्ञायज्ञि॒यं च वामदेव्यं॒ च द्वौ॒ ॥१३॥

text: With the Rathantara the Gods milked from her the Plants, and all the wide expanse with Brihat.
meaning: ओ॒षधीर् एव॒ रथंतरे॒ण देवा॒ अदुह्रन् व्य॒चो बृह॒ता ॥१४॥

text: They drew the Waters forth with Vāmadevya, with Yajnayaj- niya they milked out worship.
meaning: अपो॒ वामदेव्ये॒न यज्ञं॒ यज्ञायज्ञि॒येन ॥१५॥

text: For him who knoweth this, Rathantara poureth out Plants, and Brihat yieldeth wide expansion.
meaning: ओ॒षधीर् एवा॒स्मै रथंतरं॒ दुहे व्य॒चो बृह॒त् ॥१६॥

text: Waters from Vāmdevya come, from Yajnāyajniya sacrifice.
meaning: अपो॒ वामदेव्यं॒ यज्ञं॒ यज्ञायज्ञि॒यं य॒ वे॒द ॥१७॥ {२६}

text: She rose, she came unto the tress: they killed her. A year went by and she again existed. Hence in a year the wounds of trees heal over. He who knows this sees his loathed rival wounded.
meaning: सो॒द् अक्रामत् सा॒ व॒नस्प॒तीन् आ॒गछत् तां॒ व॒नस्प॒तयो ऽघ्नत सा॒ संवत्सरे॒ स॒म् अभवत् । त॒स्माद् व॒नस्प॒तीनां संवत्सरे॒ वृक्ण॒म् अ॒पि रोहति वृश्च॒ते ऽस्या॒प्रियो भ्रा॒तृव्यो य॒ एवं॒ वे॒द ॥१८॥

text: She mounted up, she came unto the Fathers: they killed her: in a month she re-existed. Hence men give monthly offerings to the Fathers: who knows this, knows the path which they have trodden.
meaning: सो॒द् अक्रामत् सा॒ पितृ॒̄न् आ॒गछत् तां॒ पित॒रो ऽघ्नत सा॒ मासि॒ स॒म् अभवत् । त॒स्मात् पितृ॒भ्यो मास्य् उ॒पमास्यं ददति प्र॒ पितृया॒णं प॒न्थां जानाति य॒ एवं॒ वे॒द ॥१९॥

text: She rose, she came unto the Gods: they killed her: but in a fortnight she again was living. Fortnightly, hence, men serve the Gods with Vasat! Who knows this knows the way which Gods pass over.
meaning: सो॒द् अक्रामत् सा॒ देवा॒न् आ॒गछत् तां॒ देवा॒ अघ्नत सा॒र्धमासे॒ स॒म् अभवत् । त॒स्माद् देवे॒भ्यो ऽर्धमासे॒ व॒षट् कुर्वन्ति प्र॒ देवया॒नं प॒न्थां जानाति य॒ एवं॒ वे॒द ॥२०॥

text: She mounted up, she came to men: they killed her Presently she regained her life and being. Hence on both days to men they bring and offer—who knows this—near-seated in the dwelling.
meaning: सो॒द् अक्रामत् सा॒ मनुष्या॑न् आ॒गछत् तां॒ मनुष्या॑ अघ्नत सा॒ सद्यः॒ स॒म् अभवत् । त॒स्मान् मनुष्ये॑भ्य उभयद्यु॒र् उ॒प हरन्त्य् उ॒पास्य गृहे॒ हरन्ति य॒ एवं॒ वे॒द ॥२१॥ {२७}

text: She rose, approached the Asuras: they called her: their cry was, Come, O Māyā, come thou hither. Her dear calf was Virochana Prāhrādi: her milking vessel was a. pan of iron. Dvimūrdhā Ārtvya milked her, yea, this Māyā, The Asuras depend for life on Māyā. He who knows this becomes a fit supporter.
meaning: सो॒द् अक्रामत् सा॒सुरान् आ॒गछत् ता॒म् अ॒सुरा उ॒पाह्वयन्त मा॒य ए॒ही॒ति । त॒स्या विरो॒चनः प्रा॒ह्रादिर् वत्स॒ आ॒सीद् अयस्पात्रं॒ पा॒त्रम् । तां॒ द्वि॒मूर्धार्त्व्यो॑ ऽधोक् तां॒ माया॒म् एवा॒धोक् ॥ तां॒ माया॒म् अ॒सुरा उ॒प जीवन्त्य् उपजीवनी॒यो भवति य॒ एवं॒ वे॒द ॥२२॥

text: She mounted up, she came unto the Fathers. The Fathers called. to her, O Food, come hither. King Yama was her calf, her pail was silvern. Antaka, Mrityu's. son, milked her, this Svadhā. This Food the Fathers make their lives' sustainer. He who knows this becomes a meet supporter.
meaning: सो॒द् अक्रामत् सा॒ पितृ॒̄न् आ॒गछत् तां॒ पित॒र उ॒पाह्वयन्त स्व॒ध ए॒ही॒ति । त॒स्या यमो॒ रा॒जा वत्स॒ आ॒सीद् रजतपात्रं॒ पा॒त्रम् । ता॒म् अ॒न्तको मार्त्यवो॒ ऽधोक् तां॒ स्वधा॒म् एवा॒धोक् । तां॒ स्वधां॒ पित॒र उ॒प जीवन्त्य् उपजीवनी॒यो भवति य॒ एवं॒ वे॒द ॥२३॥

text: She mounted up, she came to men. They called her, Come unto- us, come hither thou Free-giver! Earth was her milking-pail, the calf beside her Manu Vaivasvata, Vivasvān's offspring. Prithi the son of Vena was her milker: he milked forth hus- bandry and grain for sowing. These men depend for life on corn and tillage. He who knows this becomes a meet supporter, successful in the culture of his_ corn-land.
meaning: सो॒द् अक्रामत् सा॒ मनुष्या॑न् आ॒गछत् तां॒ मनुष्या॑ उ॒पाह्वयन्ते॒रावत्य् ए॒ही॒ति । त॒स्या म॒नुर् वैवस्वतो॒ वत्स॒ आ॒सीत् पृथिवी॒ पा॒त्रम् । तां॒ पृ॒थी वैन्यो॑ ऽधोक् तां॒ कृषिं॒ च सस्यं॒ चाधोक् । ते॒ स्वधां॒ कृषिं॒ च सस्यं॒ च मनुष्या॑ उ॒प जीवन्ति कृष्ट॒राधिर् उपजीवनी॒यो भवति य॒ एवं॒ वे॒द ॥२४॥

text: She rose, she came unto the Seven Rishis. They called her,. Come, Rich in Devotion! hither. King Soma was her calf. the Moon her milk-pail. Brihaspati. Āngirasa, her milker, Drew from her udder Prayer and Holy Fervour. Fervour and Prayer maintain the Seven Rishis. He who knows this becomes a meet supporter, a priest illustri- ous for his sacred knowledge.
meaning: सो॒द् अक्रामत् सा॒ सप्तऋषी॒न् आ॒गछत् तां॒ सप्तऋष॒य उ॒पाह्वयन्त ब्र॒ह्मण्वत्य् ए॒ही॒ति । त॒स्याः सो॒मो रा॒जा वत्स॒ आ॒सीच् छ॒न्दः पा॒त्रम् । तां॒ बृ॒हस्प॒तिर् आङ्गिरसो॒ ऽधोक् तां॒ ब्र॒ह्म च त॒पश् चाधोक् । त॒द् ब्र॒ह्म च त॒पश् च सप्तऋष॒य उ॒प जीवन्ति ब्रह्मवर्चस्य् उ॑पजीवनी॒यो भवति य॒ एवं॒ वे॒द ॥२५॥ {२८}

text: She rose, she came unto the Gods. They called her, crying, O Vigour, come to us, come hither! God Savitar milked her, he milked forth Vigour. The Gods depend for life upon that Vigour. He who knows this becomes a meet supporter.
meaning: सो॒द् अक्रामत् सा॒ देवा॒न् आ॒गछत् तां॒ देवा॒ उ॒पाह्वयन्तो॒र्ज ए॒ही॒ति । त॒स्या इ॒न्द्रो वत्स॒ आ॒सीच् चमसः॒ पा॒त्रम् । तां॒ देवः॒ सविता॒धोक् ता॒म् ऊर्जा॒म् एवा॒धोक् । तां॒ ऊर्जां॒ देवा॒ उ॒प जीवन्त्य् उपजीवनी॒यो भवति य॒ एवं॒ वे॒द ॥२६॥

text: She rose approached the Apsarases and Gandharvas. They called her, Come to us, O Fragrant-scented! The son of Sūryavarchas, Chitraratha, was her dear calf, her pail. a lotus-petal. The son of Sūryavarchas, Vasuruchi, milked and drew from her most delightful fragrance. That scent supports Apsarases and Gandharvas. He who knows this becomes a meet supporter, and round him ever breathes delicious odour.
meaning: सो॒द् अक्रामत् सा॒ गन्धर्वाप्सर॒स आ॒गछत् तां॒ गन्धर्वाप्सर॒स उ॒पाह्वयन्त पु॒ण्यगन्ध ए॒ही॒ति । त॒स्याश् चित्र॒रथः सौर्यवर्चसो॒ वत्स॒ आ॒सीत् पुष्करपर्णं॒ पा॒त्रम् । तां॒ व॒सुरुचिः सौर्यवर्चसो॒ ऽधोक् तां॒ पु॒ण्यम् एव॒ गन्ध॒म् अधोक् । तं॒ पु॒ण्यं गन्धं॒ गन्धर्वाप्सर॒स उ॒प जीवन्ति पु॒ण्यगन्धिर् उपजीवनी॒यो भवति य॒ एवं॒ वे॒द ॥२७॥

text: She mounted up, she came to Other People. They called her, crying, Come, Concealment! hither. Her dear calf was Vaisravana Kubera, a vessel never tempered was her milk-pail. Rajatanābhi, offspring of Kubera, milked her, and from her udder drew concealment. By that concealment live the Other People. He who knows this becomes a meet supporter, and makes all evil disappear and vanish.
meaning: सो॒द् अक्रामत् से॒तरजना॒न् आ॒गछत् ता॒म् इतरजना॒ उ॒पाह्वयन्त ति॒रोध ए॒ही॒ति । त॒स्याः कु॒बेरो वैश्रवणो॒ वत्स॒ आ॒सीद् आमपात्रं॒ पा॒त्रम् । तां॒ रजत॒नाभिः कबेरको॒ ऽधोक् तां॒ तिरोधा॒म् एवा॒धोक् । तां॒ तिरोधा॒म् अतिरजना॒ पित॒र उ॒प जीवन्ति तिरो॒ धत्ते

text: She mounted up, she came unto the Serpents. The Serpents called her, Venomous! come hither. Her calf was Takshaka, Visāla's offspring: a bottlegourd suppli- ed a milking-vessel. Irāvān's offspring, Dhritarāshtra milked her, and from her udder drew forth only poison. That poison quickens and supports the Serpents: He who knows this becomes a meet supporter.
meaning: सो॒द् अक्रामत् सा॒ सर्पा॒न् आ॒गछत् तां॒ सर्पा॒ उ॒पाह्वयन्त वि॒षवत्य् ए॒ही॒ति । त॒स्यास् तक्षको॒ वैशलेयो॒ वत्स॒ आ॒सीद् अलाबुपात्रं॒ पा॒त्रं । तां॒ धृत॒राष्ट्र ऐरावतो॒ ऽधोक् तां॒ विष॒म् एवा॒धोक् । त॒द् विषं॒ सर्वा॒ उ॒प जीवन्त्य् उपजीवनी॒यो भवति य॒ एवं॒ वे॒द ॥२९॥ {२९}

text: One would ward off, for him who hath this knowledge, if with a bottle-gourd he sprinkled water.
meaning: त॒द् य॒स्मा एवं॒ विदु॒षे ऽला॒बुनाभिषिञ्चे॒त् प्रत्या॒हन्यात् ॥३०॥

text: And did he not repel, if in his spirit he said, I drive thee back, he would repel it.
meaning: न॒ च प्रत्याहन्या॒न् म॒नसा त्वा॒ प्रत्या॒हन्मी॒ति प्रत्या॒हन्यात् ॥३१॥

text: The poison that it drives away, that poison verily repels.
meaning: य॒त् प्रत्याह॒न्ति विष॒म् एव॒ त॒त् प्रत्या॒हन्ति ॥३२॥

text: The man who hath this knowledge pours its venom on his hated foe.
meaning: विष॒म् एवा॒स्या॒प्रियं भ्रा॒तृव्यम् अनुवि॒षिच्यते य॒ एवं॒ वे॒द ॥३३॥ {३०}

text: The Asvins' Honey-whip was born from heaven and earth, from middle air, and ocean, and from fire and wind. All living creatures welcome it with joyful hearts, fraught with the store of Amrit it hath gathered up.
meaning: दिव॒स् पृथिव्या॒ अन्त॒रिक्षात् समुद्रा॒द् अग्ने॒र् वा॒तान् मधुकशा॒ हि॒ जज्ञे॒ । तां॒ चायित्वा॒मृ॒तं व॒सानां हृद्भिः॒ प्रजाः॒ प्र॒ति नन्दन्ति स॒र्वाः ॥१॥

text: They call thee earth's great strength in every form, they call thee too the ocean's genial seed. Whence comes the Honey-whip bestowing bounty, there Vital Spirit is, and Amrit treasured.
meaning: मह॒त् प॒यो विश्व॒रूपम् अस्याः समुद्र॒स्य त्वोत॒ रे॒त आहुः । य॒त ऐ॒ति मधुकशा॒ र॒राणा त॒त् प्राण॒स् त॒द् अमृ॒तं नि॒विष्टम् ॥२॥

text: In sundry spots, repeatedly reflecting, men view upon the earth: her course and action; For she, the first-born daughter of the Maruts, derives her origin from Wind and Agni.
meaning: प॒श्यन्त्य् अस्याश् चरितं॒ पृथिव्यां॒ पृ॒थङ् न॒रो बहुधा॒ मी॒मांसमानाः । अग्ने॒र् वा॒तान् मधुकशा॒ हि॒ जज्ञे॒ मरु॒ताम् उग्रा॒ नप्तिः॒ ॥३॥

text: Daughter of Vasus, mother of Ādityas, centre of Amrit breath of living creatures. The Honey-whip, gold-coloured, dropping fatness, moves as a mighty embryo 'mid mortals.
meaning: माता॒दित्या॒नां दुहिता॒ व॒सूनां प्राणः॒ प्रजा॒नाम् अमृ॒तस्य ना॒भिः । हि॒रण्यवर्णा मधुकशा॒ घृता॒ची महा॒न् भ॒र्गश् चरति म॒र्त्येषु ॥४॥

text: The deities begat the Whip of Honey: her embryo assumed all forms and fashions. The mother nourishes that tender infant which at its birth looks on all worlds and beings.
meaning: म॒धोः क॒शाम् अजनयन्त देवा॒स् त॒स्या ग॒र्भो अभवद् विश्व॒रूपः । तं॒ जातं॒ त॒रुणं पिपर्ति माता॒ स॒ जातो॒ वि॒श्वा भु॒वना वि॒ चष्टे ॥५॥

text: Who understandeth well, who hath perceived it, her heart's un- injured Soma-holding beaker? Let the wise Brāhman priest therein be joyful.
meaning: क॒स् तं॒ प्र॒ वेद क॒ उ तं॒ चिकेत यो॒ अस्या हृदः॒ कल॒शः सोमधा॒नो अ॒क्षितः । ब्रह्मा॒ सुमेधाः॒ सो॒ अस्मिन् मदेत ॥६॥

text: He understandeth them, he hath perceived them, her breasts that pour a thousand streams, uninjured. They unreluctantly yield strength and vigour.
meaning: स॒ तौ॒ प्र॒ वेद स॒ उ तौ॒ चिकेत या॒व् अस्याः स्त॒नौ सह॒स्रधाराव् अ॒क्षितौ । ऊ॒र्जं दुहाते अ॒नपस्फुरन्तौ ॥७॥

text: She who with voice upraised in constant clamour, mighty, life- giving, goes unto her function, Bellowing to the heated three libations, suckles with streams of milk, and still is lowing.
meaning: हिङ्क॒रिक्रती बृहती॒ वयोधा॒ उच्चै॒र्घोषाभ्ये॒ति या॒ व्रत॒म् । त्री॒न् घर्मा॒न् अभि॒ वावशाना॒ मि॒माति मायुं॒ प॒यते प॒योभिः ॥८॥

text: On whom, well-fed, the Waters wait in worship, and steers and self-refulgent bulls attend her. For thee, for one like thee down pour the Waters, and cause desire and strength to rain upon thee.
meaning: या॒म् आ॒पीनाम् उपसी॒दन्त्य् आ॒पः शाक्वरा॒ वृषभा॒ ये॒ स्वरा॒जः । ते॒ वर्षन्ति ते॒ वर्षयन्ति तद्वि॒दे का॒मम् ऊ॒र्जम् आ॒पः ॥९॥

text: The thunder is thy voice, O Lord of Creatures: a Bull, thou castest on the earth thy vigour. The Honey-whip, the Manus' first-born daughter, derives her origin from Wind and Agni.
meaning: स्तनयित्नु॒स् ते वा॒क् प्रजापते वृ॒षा शु॒ष्मं क्षिपसि भू॒म्याम् अ॒धि । अग्ने॒र् वा॒तान् मधुकशा॒ हि॒ जज्ञे॒ मरु॒ताम् उग्रा॒ नप्तिः॒ ॥१०॥ {१}

text: As at the morning sacrifice the Asvins twain love Soma well, Even so may both the Asvins lay splendour and strength within my soul.
meaning: य॒था सो॒मः प्रातःसवने॒ अश्वि॒नोर् भवति प्रियः॒ । एवा॒ मे अश्विना व॒र्च आत्म॒नि ध्रियताम् ॥११॥

text: As at the second sacrifice Indra and Agni love him well, Let the pair, Indra Agni, lay splendour and strength within my soul.
meaning: य॒था सो॒मो द्विती॒ये स॒वन इन्द्राग्न्यो॒र् भवति प्रियः॒ । एवा॒ म इन्द्राग्नी व॒र्च आत्म॒नि ध्रियताम् ॥१२॥

text: As at third sacrifice Soma is the Ribhus' well-beloved one, Even so may they, the Ribhus, store splendour and strength within my soul.
meaning: य॒था सो॒मस् तृती॒ये स॒वन ऋभूणां॒ भवति प्रियः॒ । एवा॒ म ऋभवो व॒र्च आत्म॒नि ध्रियताम् ॥१३॥

text: Fain would I bring forth sweetness, fain would make it mine. Bringing milk, Agni! have I come: splendour and strength bestow on me!
meaning: म॒धु जनिषीय म॒धु वंसिषीय । प॒यस्वान् अग्न आ॒गमं तं॒ मा सं॒ सृज व॒र्चसा ॥१४॥

text: Grant me, O Agni, splendid strength, and progeny, and length- ened life. May the Gods know me as I am, may Indra with the Rishis know.
meaning: सं॒ माग्ने व॒र्चसा सृज सं॒ प्रज॒या स॒म् आ॒युषा । विद्यु॒र् मे अस्य॒ देवा॒ इ॒न्द्रो विद्यात् सह॒ ऋ॒षिभिः ॥१५॥

text: As honey-bees collect and add fresh honey to their honey store, Even so may both the Asvins lay splendour and strength within my soul.
meaning: य॒था म॒धु मधुकृ॒तः संभ॒रन्ति म॒धाव् अ॒धि । एवा॒ मे अश्विना व॒र्च आत्म॒नि ध्रियताम् ॥१६॥

text: As over honey flies besmear this honey which the bees have made, So may both Asvins lay in me splendour and strength and power and might.
meaning: य॒था म॒क्षाः इदं॒ म॒धु न्यञ्ज॒न्ति म॒धाव् अ॒धि । एवा॒ मे अश्विना व॒र्चस् ते॒जो ब॒लम् ओ॒जश् च ध्रियताम् ॥१७॥

text: May all the sweetness that is found in hills and mountains, steeds and kine, And wine that floweth from the cup,—may all that sweetness be in me.
meaning: य॒द् गिरि॒षु प॒र्वतेषु गो॒ष्व् अ॒श्वेषु य॒न् म॒धु । सु॒रायां सिच्य॒मानायां य॒त् त॒त्र म॒धु त॒न् म॒यि ॥१८॥

text: May both the Asvins, Lords of Light, balm me with honey of the bees, That I may speak among the folk words full of splendour and of strength.
meaning: अ॒श्विना सारघे॒ण मा म॒धुनाङ्क्तं शुभस् पती । य॒था व॒र्चस्वतीं वा॒चम् आव॒दानि ज॒नां अ॒नु ॥१९॥

text: The thunder is thy voice, O Lord of Creatures: a Bull, thou castest strength on earth and heaven. To that all cattle look for their existence: with this she nourishes their force and vigour.
meaning: स्तनयित्नु॒स् ते वा॒क् प्रजापते वृ॒षा शु॒ष्मं क्षिपसि भू॒म्यां दिवि॒ । तां॒ पश॒व उ॒प जीवन्ति स॒र्वे ते॒नो से॒षम् ऊ॒र्जं पिपर्ति ॥२०॥

text: The Whip itself is Heaven, Earth is the handle, the point of juncture is the Air's mid-region. The lash is lightning, and the tip is golden.
meaning: पृथिवी॒ दण्डो॒ ऽन्त॒रिक्षं ग॒र्भो द्यौः॒ क॒शा विद्यु॒त् प्रकशो॒ हिरण्य॒यो बिन्दुः॒ ॥२१॥

text: Whoever knows the Whip's seven kinds of honey, becomes himself a man endowed with sweetness. Brāhman and King, the draught-ox and the milch-cow, barley and rice, and honey is the seventh.
meaning: यो॒ वै॒ क॒शायाः सप्त॒ म॒धूनि वे॒द म॒धुमान् भवति । ब्राह्मण॒श् च रा॒जा च धेनु॒श् चानड्वां॒श् च व्रीहि॒श् च य॒वश् च म॒धु सप्तम॒म् ॥२२॥

text: Sweet is the man, sweet are his goods and chattels: he who knows this conquers the worlds of sweetness.
meaning: म॒धुमान् भवति म॒धुमद् अस्याहार्यं॑ भवति । म॒धुमतो लोका॒न् जयति य॒ एवं॒ वे॒द ॥२३॥

text: The thundering of Prajāpati in heaven is verily manifest to living creatures. Therefore I stand from right to left invested, and, O Prajāpati, I cry, regard me! The man who hath this knowledge is regarded by living beings and the Lord of Creatures.
meaning: य॒द् वीध्रे॒ स्तन॒यति प्रजा॒पतिर् एव॒ त॒त् प्रजा॒भ्यः प्रादु॒र् भवति । त॒स्मात् प्राचीनोपवीत॒स् तिष्ठे प्र॒जापते॒ ऽनु मा बुध्यस्वे॒ति । अ॒न्व् एनं प्रजा॒ अ॒नु प्रजा॒पतिर् बुध्यते य॒ एवं॒ वे॒द ॥२४॥ {२}

text: Kāma the Bull, slayer of foes, I worship with molten butter, sacrifice, oblation. Beneath my feet cast down mine adversaries with thy great manly power, when I have praised thee.
meaning: सपत्नह॒नम् ऋषभं॒ घृते॒न का॒मं शिक्षामि हवि॒षा॒ज्येन । नीचैः॒ सप॒त्नान् म॒म पदय त्व॒म् अभि॒ष्टुतो महता॒ वीर्ये॑ण ॥१॥
