text: That which is hateful to mine eye and spirit, that harasses and robs me of enjoyment, The evil dream I loose upon my foemen. May I rend him when I have lauded Kāma.
meaning: य॒न् मे म॒नसो न॒ प्रियं॒ च॒क्षुषो य॒न् मे ब॒भस्ति ना॒भिन॒न्दति । त॒द् दुष्व॒प्न्यं प्र॒ति मुञ्चामि सप॒त्ने का॒मं स्तुत्वो॒द् अहं॒ भिदेयम् ॥२॥

text: Kāma, do thou, a mighty Lord and Ruler, let loose ill dream, misfortune, want of children, Homelessness, Kāma! utter destitution, upon the sinner who designs my ruin.
meaning: दुष्व॒प्न्यं काम दुरितं॒ च कमाप्रज॒स्ताम् अस्वग॒ताम् अ॒वर्तिम् । उग्र॒ ई॒शानः प्र॒ति मुञ्च त॒स्मिन् यो॒ अस्म॒भ्यम् अंहूरणा॒ चि॒कित्सात् ॥३॥

text: Drive them away, drive them afar, O Kāma; indigence fall on those who are my foemen! When they have been cast down to deepest darkness, consume their dwellings with thy fire, O Agni.
meaning: नुद॒स्व काम प्र॒ णुदस्व कामा॒वर्तिं यन्तु म॒म ये॒ सप॒त्नाः । ते॒षां नुत्ता॒नाम् अधमा॒ त॒मांस्य् अ॒ग्ने वा॒स्तूनि नि॒र् दह त्व॒म् ॥४॥

text: She, Kāma! she is called the Cow, thy daughter, she who is named Vāk and Virāj by sages. By her drive thou my foemen to a distance. May cattle, vital breath, and life forsake them.
meaning: सा॒ ते काम दुहिता॒ धेनु॒र् उच्यते या॒म् आहु॒र् वा॒चं कव॒यो विरा॒जम् । त॒या सप॒त्नान् प॒रि वृङ्ग्धि ये॒ म॒म प॒र्य् एनान् प्राणः॒ पश॒वो जी॒वनं वृणक्तु ॥५॥

text: By Kāma's might, King Varuna's and Indra's, by Vishnu's strength, and Savitar's instigation, I chase my foes with sacrifice to Agni, as a deft steersman drives his boat through waters.
meaning: का॒मस्ये॒न्द्रस्य व॒रुणस्य रा॒ज्ञो वि॒ष्णोर् ब॒लेन सवितुः॒ सवे॒न । अग्ने॒र् होत्रे॒ण प्र॒ णुदे सप॒त्नां छम्बी॒व ना॒वम् उदके॒षु धी॒रः ॥६॥

text: May Kāma, mighty one, my potent warder, give me full free- dom from mine adversaries. May all the Deities be my protection, all Gods come nigh to this mine invocation.
meaning: अ॒ध्यक्षो वाजी॒ म॒म का॒म उग्रः॒ कृणो॒तु म॒ह्यम् असपत्न॒म् एव॒ । वि॒श्वे देवा॒ म॒म नाथं॒ भवन्तु स॒र्वे देवा॒ ह॒वम् आ॒ यन्तु म इम॒म् ॥७॥

text: Accepting this oblation rich with fatness, be joyful here, ye Gods whose chief is Kāma, Giving me freedom from mine adversaries.
meaning: इद॒म् आ॒ज्यं घृत॒वज् जुषाणाः॒ का॒मज्येष्ठा इह॒ मादयध्वम् । कृण्व॒न्तो म॒ह्यम् असपत्न॒म् एव॒ ॥८॥

text: Ye, Indra, Agni, Kāma! come together and cast mine adver- saries down beneath me. When they have sunk into the deepest darkness, O Agni, with thy fire consume their dwellings.
meaning: इन्द्राग्नी॒ काम सर॒थं हि॒ भूत्वा॒ नीचैः॒ सप॒त्नान् म॒म पादयाथः । ते॒षां पन्ना॒नाम् अधमा॒ त॒मांस्य् अ॒ग्ने वा॒स्तून्य् अनुनि॒र्दह त्व॒म् ॥९॥

text: Slay those who are mine enemies, O Kāma: headlong to depth of blinding darkness hurl them. Reft be they all of manly strength and vigour! Let them not have a single day's existence.
meaning: जहि॒ त्व॒म् काम म॒म ये॒ सप॒त्ना अन्धा॒ त॒मांस्य् अ॒व पादयैनान् । नि॒रिन्द्रिया अरसाः॒ सन्तु स॒र्वे मा॒ ते॒ जीविषुः कतम॒च् चना॒हः ॥१०॥ {३}

text: Kāma hath slain those who were mine opponents, and given me ample room to grow and prosper. Let the four regions bow them down before me, and let the six expanses bring me fatness.
meaning: अ॒वधीत् का॒मो म॒म ये॒ सप॒त्ना उरुं॒ लोक॒म् अकरन् म॒ह्यम् एधतु॒म् । म॒ह्यं नमन्तां प्रदि॒शश् च॒तस्रो म॒ह्यं ष॒ड् उर्वी॒र् घृत॒म् आ॒ वहन्तु ॥११॥

text: Let them drift downward like a boat torn from the rope that held it fast. There is no turning back for those whom our keen arrows have repelled.
meaning: ते॒ ऽधरा॒ञ्चः प्र॒ प्लवन्तां छिन्ना॒ नौ॒र् इव ब॒न्धनात् । न॒ सा॒यकप्रणुत्तानां पु॒नर् अस्ति निव॒र्तनम् ॥१२॥

text: Agni averts, Indra averts, and Soma: may the averting Gods avert this foeman.
meaning: अग्नि॒र् य॒व इ॒न्द्रो य॒वः सो॒मो य॒वः । यवया॒वानो देवा॒ यवयन्त्व् एनम् ॥१३॥

text: To be avoided by his friends, detested, repelled, with few men round him, let him wander. Yea, on the earth descend the lightning-flashes: may the strong God destroy your adversaries.
meaning: अ॒सर्ववीरश् चरतु प्र॒णुत्तो द्वे॒ष्यो मित्रा॒नां परिवर्ग्यः॑ स्वा॒नाम् । उत॒ पृथिव्या॒म् अ॒व स्यन्ति विद्यु॒त उग्रो॒ वो देवः॒ प्र॒ मृणत् सप॒त्नान् ॥१४॥

text: This potent lightning nourishes things shaken, and things un- shaken yet, and all the thunders. May the Sun, rising with his wealth and splendour, drive in victorious might my foemen downward.
meaning: च्युता॒ चेयं॒ बृहत्य् अ॒च्युता च विद्यु॒द् बिभर्ति स्तनयित्नूं॒श् च स॒र्वान् । उद्य॒न्न् आदित्यो॒ द्र॒विणेन ते॒जसा नीचैः॒ सप॒त्नान् नुदतां मे स॒हस्वान् ॥१५॥

text: Thy firm and triply-barred protection, Kāma! thy spell, made weapon-proof extended armour With that drive thou my foemen to a distance. May cattle, vital breath, and life forsake them.
meaning: य॒त् ते काम श॒र्म त्रिव॒रूथम् उद्भु॒ ब्र॒ह्म व॒र्म वि॒ततम् अनतिव्याध्यं॑ कृत॒म् । ते॒न सप॒त्नान् प॒रि वृङ्ग्धि ये॒ म॒म प॒र्य् एनान् प्राणः॒ पश॒वो जी॒वनं वृणक्तु ॥१६॥

text: Far from the world wherein we live, O Kāma, drive thou my foemen with that selfsame weapon Wherewith the Gods repelled the fiends, and Indra cast down the Dasyus into deepest darkness.
meaning: ये॒न देवा॒ अ॒सुरान् प्रा॒णुदन्त ये॒ने॒न्द्रो द॒स्यून् अधमं॒ त॒मो निना॒य । ते॒न त्वं॒ काम म॒म ये॒ सप॒त्नास् ता॒न् अस्मा॒ल् लोका॒त् प्र॒ णुदस्व दूर॒म् ॥१७॥

text: As Gods repelled the Asuras, and Indra down to the lowest darkness drove the demons, So, Kāma, from this world, to distant places, drive thou the men who are mine adversaries.
meaning: य॒था देवा॒ अ॒सुरान् प्रा॒णुदन्त य॒थे॒न्द्रो द॒स्यून् अधमं॒ त॒मो बबाधे॒ । त॒था त्वं॒ काम म॒म ये॒ सप॒त्नास् ता॒न् अस्मा॒ल् लोका॒त् प्र॒ णुदस्व दूर॒म् ॥१८॥

text: First before all sprang Kāma into being. Gods, Fathers, mortal men have never matched him. Stronger than these art thou, and great for ever. Kāma, to thee, to thee I offer worship.
meaning: का॒मो जज्ञे प्रथमो॒ नै॒नं देवा॒ आपुः पित॒रो न॒ म॒र्त्याः । त॒तस् त्व॒म् असि ज्या॒यान् विश्व॒हा महां॒स् त॒स्मै ते काम न॒म इ॒त् कृनोमि ॥१९॥

text: Wide as the space which heaven and earth encompass, far as the flow of waters, far as Agni, Stronger than these art thou, and great for ever. Kāma, to thee, to thee I offer worship.
meaning: या॒वती द्या॒वापृथिवी॒ वरिम्णा॒ या॒वद् आ॒पः सिष्यदु॒र् या॒वद् अग्निः॒ । त॒तस् त्व॒म् असि ज्या॒यान् विश्व॒हा महां॒स् त॒स्मै ते काम न॒म इ॒त् कृणोमि ॥२०॥ {४}

text: Vast as the quarters of the sky and regions that lie between them spread in all directions, vast as celestial tracts and views of heaven, Stronger than these art thou, and great for ever. Kāma, to thee, to thee I offer worship.
meaning: या॒वतीर् दि॒शः प्रदि॒शो वि॒षूचीर् या॒वतीर् आ॒शा अभिच॒क्षणा दिवः॒ । त॒तस् त्व॒म् असि ज्या॒यान् विश्व॒हा महां॒स् त॒स्मै ते काम न॒म इ॒त् कृणोमि ॥२१॥

text: Many as are the bees, and bats, and reptiles, and female serpents of the trees, and beetles, Stronger art thou than these, and great for ever. Kāma, to thee, to thee I offer worship.
meaning: या॒वतीर् भृ॒ङ्गा जत्वः॑ कुरू॒रवो या॒वतीर् व॒घा वृक्षसर्प्यो॑ बभूवुः॒ । त॒तस् त्व॒म् असि ज्या॒यान् विश्व॒हा महां॒स् त॒स्मै ते काम न॒म इ॒त् कृणोमि ॥२२॥

text: Stronger art thou than aught that stands or twinkles, stronger art thou than ocean, Kāma! Manyu! Stronger than these art thou, and great for ever. Kāma, to thee, to thee I offer worship.
meaning: ज्या॒यान् निमिषतो॒ ऽसि ति॒ष्ठतो ज्या॒यान्त् समुद्रा॒द् असि काम मन्यो । त॒तस् त्व॒म् असि ज्या॒यान् विश्व॒हा महां॒स् त॒स्मै ते काम न॒म इ॒त् कृनोमि ॥२३॥

text: Not even Vāta is the peer of Kāma, not Agni, Chandramas the Moon, nor Sūrya. Stronger than these art thou, and great for ever. Kāma, to thee, to thee I offer worship.
meaning: न॒ वै॒ वा॒तश् चन॒ का॒मम् आप्नोति ना॒ग्निः॒ सू॒र्यो नो॒त॒ चन्द्र॒माः । त॒तस् त्व॒म् असि ज्या॒यान् विश्व॒हा महां॒स् त॒स्मै ते काम न॒म इ॒त् कृणोमि ॥२४॥

text: Thy lovely and auspicious forms, O Kāma, whereby the thing thou wilt becometh real, With these come thou and make thy home among us, and make malignant thoughts inhabit elsewhere.
meaning: या॒स् ते शिवा॒स् तन्वः॑ काम भद्रा॒ या॒भिः सत्यं॒ भ॒वति य॒द् वृणिषे॒ । ता॒भिष् ट्व॒म् अस्मां॒ अभिसं॒विशस्वान्य॒त्र पापी॒र् अ॒प वेशया धि॒यः ॥२५॥ {५}

text: We loose the ties and fastenings of the house that holds all precious things, The bands of pillars and of stays, the ties of beams that form the roof.
meaning: उपमि॒तां प्रतिमि॒ताम् अ॒थो परिमि॒ताम् उत॒ । शा॒लाया विश्व॒वाराया नद्धा॒नि वि॒ चृतामसि ॥१॥

text: All-wealthy House! each knot and band, each cord that is attached to thee I with my spell untie, as erst Brihaspati disclosed the cave.
meaning: य॒त् ते नद्धं॒ विश्ववारे पा॒शो ग्रन्थि॒श् च यः॒ कृतः॒ । बृ॒हस्प॒तिर् इवाहं॒ बलं॒ वाचा॒ वि॒ स्रंसयामि त॒त् ॥२॥

text: He drew them close, he pressed them fast, he made thy knotted. bands secure: With Indra's help we loose them as a skilful Slaughterer severs joints.
meaning: आ॒ ययाम सं॒ बबर्ह ग्रन्थीं॒श् चकार ते दृढा॒न् । प॒रूंषि विद्वां॒ छ॒स्तेवे॒न्द्रेण वि॒ चृतामसि ॥३॥

text: We loose the bands of thy bamboos, of bolts, of fastening, of thatch, We loose the ties of thy side-posts, O House that holdest all we prize.
meaning: वंशा॒नां ते न॒हनानां प्राणाह॒स्य तृ॒णस्य च । पक्षा॒णां विश्ववारे ते नद्धा॒नि वि॒ चृतामसि ॥४॥

text: We loosen here the ties and bands of straw in bundles, and of clamps, Of all that compasses and binds the Lady Genius of the Home.
meaning: संदंशा॒नां पलदा॒नां प॒रिष्वञ्जल्यस्य च । इदं॒ मा॒नस्य प॒त्न्या नद्धा॒नि वि॒ चृतामसि ॥५॥

text: We loose the loops which men have bound within thee, loops to tie and hold. Be gracious, when erected, to our bodies, Lady of the Home.
meaning: या॒नि ते ऽन्तः॒ शिक्या॑न्य् आबेधू॒ रण्या॑य क॒म् । प्र॒ ते ता॒नि चृतामसि शिवा॒ मानस्य पत्नि न उ॒द्धिता तन्वे॑ भव ॥६॥

text: Store-house of Soma, Agni's hall, the ladies' bower, the resi- dence, The seat of Gods art thou, O Goddess House.
meaning: हविर्धा॒नम् अग्निशा॒लं प॒त्नीनां स॒दनं स॒दः । स॒दो देवा॒नाम् असि देवि शाले ॥७॥

text: We with our incantation loose the net that hath a thousand. eyes. The diadem, securely tied and laid upon the central beam.
meaning: अ॒क्षुम् ओ॒पशं॒ वि॒ततं सहस्राक्षं॒ विषूव॒ति । अ॒वनद्धम् अभि॒हितं ब्र॒ह्मणा वि॒ चृतामसि ॥८॥

text: The man who takes thee as his own, and he who was thy builder,. House! Both these, O Lady of the Home, shall live to long-extended' years.
meaning: य॒स् त्वा शाले प्रतिगृह्णा॒ति ये॒न चा॒सि मिता॒ त्व॒म् । उभौ॒ मानस्य पत्नि तौ॒ जी॒वतां जर॒दष्टी ॥९॥

text: There let her come to meet this man. Firm, strongly fastened,. and prepared Art thou whose several limbs and joints we part and loosen one by one.
meaning: अमु॒त्रैनम् आ॒ गछताद् दृढा॒ नद्धा॒ प॒रिष्कृता । य॒स्यास् ते विचृता॒मस्य् अ॒ङ्गमङ्गं प॒रुष्परुः ॥१०॥ {६}

text: He who collected timber for the work and built thee up, O House, Made thee for coming progeny, Prajāpati, the Lord Supreme.
meaning: य॒स् त्वा शाले निमिमा॒य संजभा॒र व॒नस्प॒तीन् । प्रजा॒यै चक्रे त्वा शाले परमेष्ठी॒ प्रजा॒पतिः ॥११॥

text: Homage to him! We worship too the giver and the Mansion's lord: Homage to Agni! to the man who serves at holy rites for thee.
meaning: न॒मस् त॒स्मै न॒मो दात्रे॒ शा॒लापतये च कृण्मः । न॒मो ऽग्न॒ये प्रच॒रते पु॒रुषाय च ते न॒मः ॥१२॥

text: Homage to kine and steeds! to all that shall be born within the house We loose the bonds that fasten thee, mother of multitudes to come!
meaning: गो॒भ्यो अ॒श्वेभ्यो न॒मो य॒च् छा॒लायां विजा॒यते । वि॒जावति प्र॒जावति वि॒ ते पा॒शांश् चृतामसि ॥१३॥

text: Agni thou shelterest within, and people with domestic beasts. We loose the bonds that fasten thee, mother of multitudes to come!
meaning: अग्नि॒म् अन्त॒श् छादयसि पु॒रुषान् पशु॒भिः सह॒ । वि॒जावति प्र॒जावति वि॒ ते पा॒शांश् चृतामसि ॥१४॥

text: All space that lies between the earth and heaven, therewith I take this house for thy possession, And all that measures out the air's mid-region I make a hollow to contain thy treasures. Therewith I take the house for his possession.
meaning: अन्तरा॒ द्यां॒ च पृथिवीं॒ च य॒द् व्य॒चस् ते॒न शा॒लां प्र॒ति गृह्णामि त इमा॒म् । य॒द् अन्त॒रिक्षं र॒जसो विमा॒नं त॒त् कृण्वे ऽह॒म् उद॒रं शेवधि॒भ्यः । ते॒न शा॒लां प्र॒ति गृह्णामि त॒स्मै ॥१५॥

text: Rich in prosperity, rich in milk, founded and built upon the earth, Injure not thy receivers, House who holdest food of every sort!'
meaning: ऊ॒र्जस्वती प॒यस्वती पृथिव्यां॒ नि॒मिता मिता॒ । विश्वान्नं॒ बि॒भ्रती शाले मा॒ हिंसीः प्रतिगृह्णतः॒ ॥१६॥

text: Grass-covered, clad with straw, the house, like Night, gives rest to man and beast. Thou standest, built upon the earth, like a she-elephant, borne on feet.
meaning: तृ॒णैर् आ॒वृता पलदा॒न् व॒साना रा॒त्रीव शा॒ला ज॒गतो निवे॒शनी । मिता॒ पृथिव्यां॒ तिष्ठसि हस्ति॒नीव पद्व॒ती ॥१७॥

text: I loosen and remove from thee thy covering formed by mats of reed. What Varuna hath firmly closed Mitra shall ope at early morn.
meaning: इ॒टस्य ते वि॒ चृताम्य् अ॒पिनद्धम् अपोर्णुव॒न् । व॒रुणेन स॒मुब्जितां मित्रः॒ प्रात॒र् व्य् उ॑ब्जतु ॥१८॥

text: May Indra, Agni, deathless Gods, protect the house where Soma dwells, House that was founded with the prayer, built and erected by the wise.
meaning: ब्र॒ह्मणा शा॒लां नि॒मितां कवि॒भिर् नि॒मितां मिता॒म् । इन्द्राग्नी॒ रक्षतां शा॒लाम् अमृ॒तौ सोम्यं॒ स॒दः ॥१९॥

text: Nest upon nest hath been imposed, compartment on compart- ment laid: There man shall propagate his kind, and there shall everything born.
meaning: कुला॒ये॒ ऽधि कुला॒यं को॒शे को॒शः स॒मुब्जितः । त॒त्र म॒र्तो वि॒ जायते य॒स्माद् वि॒श्वं प्रजा॒यते ॥२०॥ {७}

text: Within the house constructed with two side-posts, or with four, or six. Built with eight side-posts, or with ten, lies Agni like a babe unborn.
meaning: या॒ द्वि॒पक्षा च॒तुष्पक्षा ष॒ट्पक्षा या॒ निमीय॒ते । अष्टा॒पक्षां द॒शपक्षां शा॒लां मा॒नस्य प॒त्नीम् अग्नि॒र् ग॒र्भ इवा॒ शये ॥२१॥

text: Turned to thee, House! I come to thee, innocent, turned to welcome me: For Fire and Water are within, the first chief door of sacrifice.
meaning: प्रती॒चीं त्वा प्रतीची॒नः शा॒ले प्रै॒म्य् अ॒हिंसतीम् । अग्नि॒र् ह्य् अ॑न्त॒र् आ॒पश् च ऋत॒स्य प्रथमा॒ द्वाः॒ ॥२२॥

text: Water that kills Consumption, free from all Consumption, here I bring. With Agni, the immortal one, I enter and possess the house.
meaning: इमा॒ आ॒पः प्र॒ भराम्य् अयक्ष्मा॒ यक्ष्मना॒शनीः । गृहा॒न् उ॒प प्र॒ सीदाम्य् अमृ॒तेन सहा॒ग्नि॒ना ॥२३॥

text: Lay thou no cord or noose on us: a weighty burthen, still be light! Withersoever be our will, O House, we bear thee like a bride.
meaning: मा॒ नः पा॒शं प्र॒ति मुचो गुरु॒र् भारो॒ लघु॒र् भव । वधू॒म् इव त्वा शाले यत्रका॒मं भरामसि ॥२४॥

text: Now from the east side of the house to the Great Power be homage paid! Hail to the Gods whose due is Hail!
meaning: प्रा॒च्या दिशः॒ शा॒लाया न॒मो महिम्ने॒ स्वा॒हा देवे॒भ्यः स्वाह्ये॑भ्यः ॥२५॥

text: Now from the south side of the house, etc.
meaning: द॒क्षिणाया दिशः॒ शा॒लाया न॒मो महिम्ने॒ स्वा॒हा देवे॒भ्यः स्वाह्ये॑भ्यः ॥२६॥

text: Now from the west side of the house, etc.
meaning: प्रती॒च्या दिशः॒ शा॒लाया न॒मो महिम्ने॒ स्वा॒हा देवे॒भ्यः स्वाह्ये॑भ्यः ॥२७॥

text: Now from the north side of the house, etc.
meaning: उ॒दीच्या दिशः॒ शा॒लाया न॒मो महिम्ने॒ स्वा॒हा देवे॒भ्यः स्वाह्ये॑भ्यः ॥२८॥

text: So from the mansion's every side to the Great Power be homage paid! Hail to the Gods whose due is Hail!
meaning: ध्रुवा॒या दिशः॒ शा॒लाया न॒मो महिम्ने॒ स्वा॒हा देवे॒भ्यः स्वाह्ये॑भ्यः ॥२९॥

text: ऊर्ध्वा॒या दिशः॒ शा॒लाया न॒मो महिम्ने॒ स्वा॒हा देवे॒भ्यः स्वाह्ये॑भ्यः ॥३०॥
दिशो॒दिशः शा॒लाया न॒मो महिम्ने॒ स्वा॒हा देवे॒भ्यः स्वाह्ये॑भ्यः ॥३१॥ {८}

The Bull, fierce, thousandfold, filled full of vigour, bearing within his flanks all forms and natures, Brihaspati's Steer, hath stretched the thread, bestowing bliss on the worshipper, the liberal giver.
meaning: साहस्र॒स् त्वेष॒ ऋषभः॒ प॒यस्वान् वि॒श्वा रूपा॒णि वक्ष॒णासु बि॒भ्रत् । भद्रं॒ दात्रे॒ य॒जमानाय शीक्षन् बार्हस्पत्य॒ उस्रि॒यस् त॒न्तुम् आ॒तान् ॥१॥

text: He who at first became the Waters' model, a match for everyone, like Earth the Goddess; The husband of the cows, the young calves' father, may be secure us thousandfold abundance.
meaning: अपां॒ यो॒ अ॒ग्ने प्रतिमा॒ बभू॒व प्रभूः॒ स॒र्वस्मै पृथिवी॒व देवी॒ । पिता॒ वत्सा॒नां प॒तिर् अघ्न्या॒नां साहस्रे॒ पो॒षे अ॒पि नः कृणोतु ॥२॥

text: Masculine, prégnant, stedfast. full of vigour, the Bull sustains a trunk of goodly treasure. May Agni Jātavedas bear him offered, on pathways traversed by the Gods, to Indra.
meaning: पु॒मान् अन्त॒र्वान्त् स्थ॒विरः प॒यस्वान् व॒सोः क॒बन्धं ऋषभो॒ बिभर्ति । त॒म् इ॒न्द्राय पथि॒भिर् देवया॒नैर् हुत॒म् अग्नि॒र् वहतु जात॒वेदाः ॥३॥

text: The husband of the cows, the young calves' father, father is he of mighty water-eddies. Calf, after-birth, new milk drawn hot, and biestings, curds, butter, that is his best genial humour.
meaning: पिता॒ वत्सा॒नां प॒तिर् अघ्न्या॒नां अ॒थो पिता॒ महतां॒ ग॒र्गराणाम् । वत्सो॒ जरा॒यु प्रतिधु॒क् पीयू॒ष आमि॒क्षा घृतं॒ त॒द् व् अस्य रे॒तः ॥४॥

text: He is the Gods' allotted share and bundle, essence of waters, and of plants, and butter. Sakra elected him, the draught of Soma. What was his body was a lofty mountain.
meaning: देवा॒नां भाग॒ उपनाह॒ एषो॒ ऽपां॒ र॒स ओ॒षधीनां घृत॒स्य । सो॒मस्य भक्ष॒म् अवृणीत शक्रो॒ बृह॒न्न् अ॒द्रिर् अभवद् य॒च् छ॒रीरम् ॥५॥

text: A beaker filled with Soma juice thou bearest. framer of forms, begetter of the cattle. Kindly to us be these thy wombs here present, and stay for us, O Axe, those that are yonder.
meaning: सो॒मेन पूर्णं॒ कल॒शं बिभर्षि त्व॒स्ता रुपा॒णां जनिता॒ पशूना॒म् । शिवा॒स् ते सन्तु प्रजन्व॑ इह॒ या॒ इमा॒ न्य् अ॑स्म॒भ्यं स्वधिते यछ या॒ अमूः॒ ॥६॥

text: He bears oblation, and his seed is butter. Thousand-fold plenty; sacrifice they call him. May he, the Bull, wearing the shape of Indra, come unto us, O Gods, bestowed, with blessing.
meaning: आ॒जं बिभर्ति घृत॒म् अस्य रे॒तः साहस्रः॒ पो॒षस् त॒म् उ यज्ञ॒म् आहुः । इ॒न्द्रस्य रूप॒म् ऋषभो॒ व॒सानः सो॒ अस्मा॒न् देवाः शिव॒ ऐ॒तु दत्तः॒ ॥७॥

text: Both arms of Varuna, and Indra's vigour, the Maruts' hump is he, the Asvins' shoulders. They who are sages, bards endowed with wisdom, call him Brihaspati compact and heightened.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रस्यौ॒जो व॒रुणस्य बाहू॒ अश्वि॒नोर् अं॒सौ मरु॒ताम् इयं॒ ककु॒त् । बृ॒हस्प॒तिं सं॒भृतम् एत॒म् आहुर् ये॒ धी॒रासः कव॒यो ये॒ मनीषि॒णः ॥८॥

text: Thou, vigorous, reachest to the tribes of heaven. Thee they call Indra, thee they call Sarasvān. Turned to one aim, that Brāhman gives a thousand who offers up the Bull as his oblation.
meaning: दै॒वीर् वि॒शः प॒यस्वान् आ॒ तनोषि त्वा॒म् इ॒न्द्रं त्वां॒ स॒रस्वन्तम् आहुः । सह॒स्रं स॒ ए॒कमुखा ददाति यो॒ ब्राह्मण॒ ऋषभ॒म् आजुहो॒ति ॥९॥

text: Brihaspati, Savitar gave thee vital vigour: thy breath was brought from Tvashtar and from Vāyu. In thought I offer thee in air's mid-region. Thy sacrificial grass be Earth and Heaven!
meaning: बृ॒हस्प॒तिः सविता॒ ते व॒यो दधौ त्व॒ष्टुर् वायोः॒ प॒र्य् आत्मा॒ त आ॒भृतः । अन्त॒रिक्षे म॒नसा त्वा जुहोमि बर्हि॒ष् टे द्या॒वापृथिवी॒ उभे॒ स्ताम् ॥१०॥ {९}

text: Let the priest joyfully extol the limbs and members of the Bull Who moved and roared among the kine as Indra moves among the Gods.
meaning: य॒ इ॒न्द्र इव देवे॒षु गो॒ष्व् एति विवा॒वदत् । त॒स्य ऋषभ॒स्या॒ङ्गानि ब्रह्मा॒ सं॒ स्तौतु भद्र॒या ॥११॥

text: The sides must be Anumati's, and both rib-pieces Bhaga's share, Of the knee-bones hath Mitra said, Both these are mine, and only mine.
meaning: पार्श्वे॒ आस्ताम् अ॒नुमत्या भ॒गस्यास्ताम् अनूवृ॒जौ । अष्ठीव॒न्ताव् अब्रवीन् मित्रो॒ म॒मैतौ॒ के॒वलाव् इ॒ति ॥१२॥

text: The Ādityas claim the hinder parts, the loins must be Brihas- pati's. Vāta, the God, receives the tail: he stirs the plants and herbs therewith,
meaning: भस॒द् आसीद् आदित्या॒नां श्रो॒णी आस्तां बृ॒हस्प॒तेः । पु॒छं वा॒तस्य देव॒स्य ते॒न धूनोत्य् ओ॒षधीः ॥१३॥

text: To Sūryā they assigned the skin, to Sinivāli inward parts. The Slaughterer hath the feet, they said, when they distributed the Bull.
meaning: गु॒दा आसन्त् सिनीवाल्याः॒ सूर्या॒यास् त्व॒चम् अब्रुवन् । उत्थातु॒र् अब्रुवन् पद॒ ऋषभं॒ य॒द् अ॒कल्पयन् ॥१४॥

text: They made a jest of kindred's curse: a jar of Soma juice was set, What time the deities, convened, assigned the Bull's divided parts.
meaning: क्रोड॒ आसीज् जामिशंस॒स्य सो॒मस्य क्ल॒शो धृतः॒ । देवाः॒ संग॒त्य य॒त् स॒र्व ऋषभं॒ व्य॒कल्पयन् ॥१५॥

text: They gave the hooves to tortoises, to Saramā scraps of the feet: His undigested food they gave to worms and things that creep and crawl.
meaning: ते॒ कु॒ष्ठिकाः सर॒मायै कुर्मे॒भ्यो अदधुः शफा॒न् । ऊ॒बध्यम् अस्य कीते॒भ्यः श्ववर्ते॒भ्यो अधारयन् ॥१६॥

text: That Bull, the husband of the kine, pierces the demons with his horns, Banishes famine with his eye, and hears good tidings with his ears.
meaning: शृ॒ङ्गाभ्यां र॒क्ष ऋषत्य् अ॒वर्तिम् हन्ति च॒क्षुषा । शृणो॒ति भद्रं॒ क॒र्णाभ्यां ग॒वां यः॒ प॒तिर् अघ्न्यः॒ ॥१७॥

text: With hundred sacrifices he worships: the fires consume him not: All Gods promote the Braman who offers the Bull in sacrifice.
meaning: शतया॒जं स॒ यजते नै॒नं दुन्वन्त्य् अग्न॒यः । जि॒न्वन्ति वि॒श्वे तं॒ देवा॒ यो॒ ब्राह्मण॒ ऋषभ॒म् आजुहो॒ति ॥१८॥

text: He who hath given away the Bull to Brāhmans frees and cheers his soul. In his own cattle-pen he sees the growth and increase of his cows.
meaning: ब्राह्मणे॒भ्य ऋषभं॒ दत्त्वा॒ व॒रीयः कृणुते म॒नः । पु॒ष्टिं सो॒ अघ्न्या॒नां स्वे॒ गोष्ठे॒ ऽव पश्यते ॥१९॥

text: Let there be cattle, let there be bodily strength and progeny: All this may the Gods kindly grant to him who gives away the Bull.
meaning: गा॒वः सन्तु प्रजाः॒ सन्त्व् अ॒थो अस्तु तनूबल॒म् । त॒त् स॒र्वम् अ॒नु मन्यन्तां देवा॒ ऋषभदायि॒ने ॥२०॥

text: Indra here verily hath rejoiced: let him bestow conspicuous wealth. May he draw forth at will from yonder side of heaven a deft cow, good to milk, whose calf is never wanting.
meaning: अयं॒ पिपान इ॒न्द्र इ॒द् रयिं॒ दधातु चेतनी॒म् । अयं॒ धेनुं॒ सुदु॒घां नि॒त्यवत्सां व॒शं दुहां विपश्चि॒तं परो॒ दिवः॒ ॥२१॥

text: With close connexion mingle with the cows in this our cattle- pen: Mingle, the Bull's prolific flow, and, Indra! thine heroic strength!
meaning: पिश॒ङ्गरूपो नभसो॒ वयोधा॒ ऐन्द्रः॒ शु॒ष्मो विश्व॒रूपो न आ॒गन् । आ॒युर् अस्म॒भ्यं द॒धत् प्रजां॒ च राय॒श् च पो॒षैर् अभि॒ नः सचताम् ॥२२॥

text: Here we restore this Bull, your youthful leader: sporting with him, go, wander at your pleasure. Ne'er, wealthy ones! may he be reft of offspring; and do ye favour us with growth of riches.
meaning: उ॒पेहो॒पपर्चनास्मि॒न् गोष्ठ॒ उ॒प पृञ्च नः । उ॒प ऋषभ॒स्य य॒द् रे॒त उ॒पेन्द्र त॒व वीर्य॑म् ॥२३॥

text: एतं॒ वो यु॒वानं प्र॒ति दध्मो अ॒त्र ते॒न क्री॒डन्तीश् चरत व॒शां अ॒नु । मा॒ नो हासिष्ट जनु॒षा सुभागा राय॒श् च पो॒षैर् अभि॒ नः सचध्वम् ॥२४॥ {१०}
Seize him and bring him hither. Let him travel. foreknowing, to the regions of the pious. Crossing in many a place the mighty darkness, let the Goat mount to the third heaven above us.
meaning: आ॒ नयैत॒म् आ॒ रभस्व सुकृ॒तां लोक॒म् अ॒पि गछतु प्रजान॒न् । तीर्त्वा॒ त॒मांसि बहुधा॒ महा॒न्त्य् अजो॒ ना॒कम् आ॒ क्रमतां तृती॒यम् ॥१॥

text: I bring thee hither as a share for Indra; prince, at this sacrifice,. for him who worships. Grasp firmly from behind all those who hate us: so let the sacri- ficer's men be sinless.
meaning: इ॒न्द्राय भागं॒ प॒रि त्वा नयाम्य् अस्मि॒न् यज्ञे॒ य॒जमानाय सूरि॒म् । ये॒ नो द्विष॒न्त्य् अ॒नु ता॒न् रभस्वा॒नागसो य॒जमानस्य वीराः॒ ॥२॥

text: Wash from his feet all trace of evil-doing: foreknowing, with cleansed hooves let him go upward. Gazing on many a spot, crossing the darkness, let the Goat mount to the third heaven above us.
meaning: प्र॒ पदो॒ ऽव नेनिग्धि दु॒श्चरितं य॒च् चचा॒र शुद्धैः॒ शफै॒र् आ॒ क्रमतां प्रजान॒न् । तीर्त्वा॒ त॒मांसि बहुधा॒ विप॒श्यन्न् अजो॒ ना॒कम् आ॒ क्रमतां तृती॒यम् ॥३॥

text: Cut up this skin with the grey knife, Dissector! dividing joint from joint, and mangle nothing Do him no injury: limb by limb arrange him, and send him up to the third cope of heaven.
meaning: अ॒नुछ्य श्यामे॒न त्व॒चम् एतां॒ विशस्तर् यथापर्व् अ॑सि॒ना मा॒भि॒ मंस्थाः । मा॒भि॒ द्रुहः परुशः॒ कल्पयैनं तृती॒ये ना॒के अ॒धि वि॒ श्रयैनम् ॥४॥

text: With verse upon the fire I set the caldron: pour in the water; lay him down within it! Encompass him with fire, ye Immolators. Cooked, let him reach the world where dwell the righteous.
meaning: ऋचा॒ कुम्भी॒म् अ॒ध्य् अग्नौ॒ श्रयाम्य् आ॒ सिञ्चोदक॒म् अ॒व धेह्य् एनम् । पर्या॒धत्ताग्नि॒ना शमितारः शृतो॒ गछतु सुकृ॒तां य॒त्र लोकः॒ ॥५॥

text: Hence come thou forth, vexed by no pain or torment. Mount to the third heaven from the heated vessel. As fire out of the fire hast thou arisen. Conquer and win this lucid world of splendour.
meaning: उ॒त् क्रामा॒तः प॒रि चेद् अ॒तप्तस् तप्ता॒च् चरो॒र् अ॒धि ना॒कं तृती॒यम् । अग्ने॒र् अग्नि॒र् अ॒धि सं॒ बभूविथ ज्यो॒तिष्मन्तम् अभि॒ लोकं॒ जयैत॒म् ॥६॥

text: The Goat is Agni: light they call him, saying that living man must give him to the Brāhman. Given in this world by a devout believer, the Goat dispels and drives afar the darkness.
meaning: अजो॒ अग्नि॒र् अज॒म् उ ज्यो॒तिर् आहुर् अजं॒ जी॒वता ब्रह्म॒णे दे॒यम् आहुः । अज॒स् त॒मांस्य् अ॒प हन्ति दूर॒म् अस्मिं॒ल् लोके॒ श्रद्द॒धानेन दत्तः॒ ॥७॥

text: Let the Panchaudana Goat, about to visit the three lights, pass away in five divisions. Go midst the pious who have paid their worship, and parted, dwell on the third cope of heaven.
meaning: प॒ञ्चौदनः पञ्चधा॒ वि॒ क्रमताम् आक्रंस्य॒मानस् त्री॒णि ज्यो॒तींषि । ईजाना॒नां सुकृ॒तां प्रे॒हि म॒ध्यं तृती॒ये ना॒के अ॒धि वि॒ श्रयस्व ॥८॥

text: Rise to that world, O Goat, where dwell the righteous: pass, like a Sarabha veiled, all difficult places. The Goat Panchaudana, given to a Brāhman, shall with all ful- ness satisfy the giver.
meaning: अ॒जा॒ रोह सुकृ॒तां य॒त्र लोकः॒ शरभो॒ न॒ चत्तो॒ ऽति दुर्गा॒न्य् एषः । प॒ञ्चौदनो ब्रह्म॒णे दीय॒मानः स॒ दाता॒रं तृ॒प्त्या तर्पयाति ॥९॥

text: The Goat Panchaudana, given to a Brāhman, sets the bestower on the pitch of heaven, In the third vault, third sky, third ridge. One only Cow omni- form art thou, that yields all wishes.
meaning: अज॒स् त्रिनाके॒ त्रिदिवे॒ त्रिपृष्ठे॒ ना॒कस्य पृष्ठे॒ ददिवां॒सं दधाति । प॒ञ्चौदनो ब्रह्म॒णे दीय॒मानो विश्व॒रूपा धेनुः॒ कामदु॒घास्य् ए॒का ॥१०॥ {११}

text: That is the third light that is yours, ye Fathers. He gives the Goat Panchaudana to the Brāhman. Given in this world by the devout believer, the Goat dispels and drives afar the darkness.
meaning: एत॒द् वो ज्यो॒तिः पितरस् तृती॒यं प॒ञ्चौदनं ब्रह्म॒णे ऽजं॒ ददाति । अज॒स् त॒मांस्य् अ॒प हन्ति दूर॒म् अस्मिं॒ल् लोके॒ श्रद्द॒धानेन दत्तः॒ ॥११॥

text: Seeking the world of good men who have worshipped, he gives the Goat Panchaudana to the Brāhman. Win thou this world as thy complete possession. Auspicious unto us be he, accepted!
meaning: ईजाना॒नां सुकृ॒तां लोक॒म् ई॒प्सन् प॒ञ्चौदनं ब्रह्म॒णे ऽजं॒ ददाति । स॒ व्या॑प्तिम् अभि॒ लोकं॒ जयैतं॒ शिवो॑ ऽस्म॒भ्यं प्र॒तिगृहीतो अस्तु ॥१२॥

text: Truly the Goat sprang from the glow of Agni, inspired as sage with all a sage's power. Sacrifice, filled, filled full, offered with Vashat—this let the Gods arrange.at proper seasons.
meaning: अजो॒ ह्य् अ॑ग्ने॒र् अ॒जनिष्ट शो॒काद् वि॒प्रो वि॒प्रस्य स॒हसो विपश्चि॒त् । इष्टं॒ पूर्त॒म् अभि॒पूर्तं व॒षट्कृतं त॒द् देवा॒ ऋतुशः॒ कल्पयन्तु ॥१३॥

text: Home-woven raiment let him give, and gold as guerdon to the priests. So he obtains completely all celestial and terrestrial worlds.
meaning: अमोतं॒ वा॒सो दद्याद् धि॒रण्यम् अ॒पि द॒क्षिणाम् । त॒था लोका॒न्त् स॒म् आप्नोति ये॒ दिव्या॒ ये॒ च पा॒र्थिवाः ॥१४॥

text: Near to thee, Goat! approach these streams of Soma, divine, distilling meath, bedecked with butter! Stay thou the earth and sky and fix them firmly up on the seven- rayed pitch and height of heaven.
meaning: एता॒स् त्वाजो॒प यन्तु धा॒राः सोम्या॒ देवी॒र् घृत॒पृष्ठा मधुश्चु॒तः । स्तभान् पृथिवी॒म् उत॒ द्यां॒ ना॒कस्य पृष्ठे॒ ऽधि सप्त॒रश्मौ ॥१५॥

text: Unborn art thou, O Goat: to heaven thou goest. Though thee Angirases knew that radiant region. So may I know that holy world.
meaning: अजो॒ ऽस्य् अ॒ज स्वर्गो॒ ऽसि त्व॒या लोक॒म् अ॒ङ्गिरसः प्रा॒जानन् । तं॒ लोकं॒ पु॒ण्यं प्र॒ ज्ञेषम् ॥१६॥

text: Convey our sacrifice to heaven, that it may reach the Gods, with that Whereby thou, Agni, bearest wealth in thousands, and all pre- cious things.
meaning: ये॒ना सह॒स्रं व॒हसि ये॒नाग्ने सर्ववेदस॒म् । ते॒नेमं॒ यज्ञं॒ नो वह स्व॑र् देवे॒षु ग॒न्तवे ॥१७॥

text: The Goat Panchaudana, when cooked, transporteth, repelling Nirriti, to the world of Svarga. By him may we win worlds which Sūrya brightens.
meaning: अजः॒ पक्वः॒ स्वर्गे॒ लोके॒ दधाति प॒ञ्चौदनो नि॒रृतिं बा॒धमानः । ते॒न लोका॒न्त् सू॒र्यवतो जयेम ॥१८॥

text: The droppings of the Odanas attending the Goat which I have lodged with priest or people May all this know us in the world of virtue, O Agni, at the meeting of the pathways.
meaning: यं॒ ब्राह्मणे॒ निदधे॒ यं॒ च विक्षु॒ या॒ विप्रु॒ष ओदना॒नाम् अज॒स्य । स॒र्वं त॒द् अग्ने सुकृत॒स्य लोके॒ जानीता॒न् नः संग॒मने पथीना॒म् ॥१९॥

text: This Unborn cleft apart in the beginning: his breast became the earth, his back was heaven. His middle was the air, his sides the regions; the hollows of his belly formed both oceans.
meaning: अजो॒ वा॒ इद॒म् अग्ने व्य् अ॑क्रमत त॒स्यो॒र इय॒म् अभवद् द्यौः॒ पृष्टिह॒म् । अन्त॒रिक्षं म॒ध्यम् दि॒शः पार्श्वे॒ समुद्रौ॒ कुक्षी॒ ॥२०॥ {१२}

text: His eyes were Truth and Right. The whole together was Truth: Virāj his head and Faith his breathing. This Goat Panchaudana was indeed a sacrifice unlimited.
meaning: सत्यं॒ च र्तं॒ च च॒क्षुषी वि॒श्वं सत्यं॒ श्रद्धा॒ प्राणो॒ विरा॒ट् शि॒रः । एष॒ वा॒ अ॒परिमितो यज्ञो॒ य॒द् अजः॒ प॒ञ्चौदनः ॥२१॥

text: A boundless sacrifice he performs, he wins himself a boundless world: Who gives the Goat Panchaudana illumined with a priestly fee.
meaning: अ॒परिमितम् एव॒ यज्ञ॒म् आप्नो॒त्य् अ॒परिमितं लोक॒म् अ॒व रुन्द्धे । यो॑ ऽजं॒ प॒ञ्चौदनं द॒क्षिणाज्योतिषं द॒दाति ॥२२॥

text: Let him not break the victim's bones, let him not suck the marrow out. Let the man, taking him entire, here, even here deposit him.
meaning: ना॒स्या॒स्थीनि भिन्द्यान् न॒ मज्ज्ञो॒ नि॒र् धयेत् । स॒र्वम् एनं समादा॒येद॒मिदं प्र॒ वेशयेत् ॥२३॥

text: This, even this is his true form: the man uniteth him therewith. Food, greatness, strength he bringeth him who giveth the Goat Panchaudana illumed with guerdon.
meaning: इद॒मिदम् एवा॒स्य रूपं॒ भवति ते॒नैनं सं॒ गमयति । इ॒षं म॒ह ऊ॒र्जम् अस्मै दुहे यो॑ ऽजं॒ प॒ञ्चौदनम् द॒क्षिणाज्योतिषं द॒दाति ॥२४॥

text: The five gold pieces, and the five new garments, and the five milch-kine yield him all his wishes. Who gives the Goat Panchaudana illumined with a priestly fee.
meaning: प॒ञ्च रुक्मा॒ प॒ञ्च न॒वानि व॒स्त्रा प॒ञ्चास्मै धेन॒वः कामदु॒घा भवन्ति । यो॑ ऽजं॒ प॒ञ्चौदनं द॒क्षिणाज्योतिषं द॒दाति ॥२५॥

text: The five gold pieces, area light to light him, robes become armour to defend his body; He winneth Svarga as his home who giveth the Goat Panchaud- ana illumed with bountry.
meaning: प॒ञ्च रुक्मा॒ ज्यो॒तिर् अस्मै भवन्ति व॒र्म वा॒सांसि तन्वे॑ भवन्ति । स्वर्गं॒ लोक॒म् अश्नुते यो॑ ऽजं॒ प॒ञ्चौदनं द॒क्षिणाज्योतिषम् द॒दाति ॥२६॥

text: When she who hath been wedded finds a second husband after- ward, The twain shall not be parted if they give the Goat Panchaud- ana.
meaning: या॒ पू॒र्वं प॒तिं वित्त्वा॒ ऽथान्यं॒ विन्द॒ते॒ ऽपरम् । प॒ञ्चौदनं च ता॒व् अजं॒ द॒दातो न॒ वि॒ योषतः ॥२७॥

text: One world with the re-wedded wife becomes the second hus- band's home. Who gives the Goat Panchaudana illumined with the priestly fee.
meaning: समान॒लोको भवति पुनर्भु॒वा॒परः प॒तिः । यो॑ ऽजं॒ प॒ञ्चौदनम् द॒क्षिणाज्योतिषं द॒दाति ॥२८॥

text: They who have given a cow who drops a calf each season, or an ox, A coverlet, a robe, or gold, go to the loftiest sphere of heaven.
meaning: अनुपूर्व॒वत्सां धेनु॒म् अनड्वा॒हम् उपब॒र्हणम् । वा॒सो हि॒रण्यं दत्त्वा॒ ते॒ यन्ति दि॒वम् उत्तमा॒म् ॥२९॥

text: Himself, the father and the son, the grandson, and the father's sire, Mother, wife, her who bore his babes, all the beloved ones I call.
meaning: आत्मा॒नं पित॒रं पुत्रं॒ पौ॒त्रं पितामह॒म् । जायां॒ ज॒नित्रीं मात॒रं ये॒ प्रिया॒स् ता॒न् उ॒प ह्वये ॥३०॥ {१३}

text: The man who knows the season named the Scorching—the Goat Pafichaudana is this scorching season He lives himself, he verily burns up his hated rival's fame, Who gives the Goat Panchaudana illumined with the priestly fee.
meaning: यो॒ वै॒ नै॒दाघं ना॒म र्तुं॒ वे॒द । एष॒ वै॒ नै॒दाघो ना॒म र्तु॒र् य॒द् अजः॒ प॒ञ्चौदनः । नि॒र् एवा॒प्रियस्य भ्रा॒तृव्यस्य श्रि॒यं दहति भ॒वत्य् आत्म॒ना ।

text: The man who knows the season called the Working takes to himself the active fame, his hated rival's active fame. The Goat Panchaudana is this Working season. He lives himself, etc.
meaning: यो॒ वै॒ कुर्व॒न्तं ना॒म र्तुं॒ वे॒द । कुर्वतीं॒कुर्वतीम् एवा॒प्रियस्य भ्रा॒तृव्यस्य श्रि॒यं आ॒ दत्ते । एष॒ वै॒ कुर्व॒न् ना॒म र्तु॒र् य॒द् अजः॒ प॒ञ्चौदनः ।

text: The man who knows the season called the Meeting takes to him- self the gathering fame, his hated rival's gathering fame. The Goat Panchaudana is this Meeting season.
meaning: यो॒ वै॒ संय॒न्तं ना॒म र्तुं॒ वे॒द । संयतीं॒संयतीम् एवा॒प्रियस्य भ्रा॒तृव्यस्य श्रि॒यं आ॒ दत्ते । एष॒ वै॒ संय॒न् ना॒म र्तु॒र् य॒द् अजः॒ प॒ञ्चौदनः ।

text: The man who knows the called the Swelling takes to himself the swelling fame, his hated rival's swelling fame. The Goat Panchaudana is this Swelling season. He lives himself, etc.
meaning: यो॒ वै॒ पिन्व॒न्तं ना॒म र्तु॒म् वे॒द । पिन्वतीं॒पिन्वतीम् एवा॒प्रियस्य भ्रा॒तृव्यस्य श्रि॒यं आ॒ दत्ते । एष॒ वै॒ पिन्व॒न् ना॒म र्तु॒र् य॒द् अजः॒ प॒ञ्चौदनः ।

text: The man who knows the season called the Rising takes to him- self the rising fame, his hated rival's rising fame. The Goat Panchaudana in this Rising season.
meaning: यो॒ वा॒ उद्य॒न्तं ना॒म र्तुं॒ वे॒द । उद्यतीं॒उद्यतीम् एवा॒प्रियस्य भ्रा॒तृव्यस्य श्रि॒यं आ॒ दत्ते । एष॒ वा॒ उद्य॒न्न् ना॒म र्तु॒र् य॒द् अजः॒ प॒ञ्चौदनः ।

text: The man who knows the season called Surpassing takes to him- self thé conquering fame, his hated rival's conquering fame. The Goat Panchaudana is this Conquering season. He lives himself, he verily burns up his hated rival's fame Who gives the Goat Panchaudana illumined with a priestly fee.
meaning: यो॒ वा॒ अभिभु॒वं ना॒म र्तुं॒ वे॒द । अभिभ॒वन्तीमभिभवन्तीम् एवा॒प्रियस्य भ्रा॒तृव्यस्य श्रि॒यं आ॒ दत्ते । एष॒ वा॒ अभिभू॒र् ना॒म र्तु॒र् य॒द् अजः॒ प॒ञ्चौदनः ।

text: He cooks the Goat and the five boiled rice messes. May the uni- ted Quarters, all accordant, and intermediate points, accept him from thee.
meaning: अजं॒ च प॒चत प॒ञ्च चौदना॒न् । स॒र्वा दि॒शः सं॒मनसः सध्री॒चीः सा॒न्तर्देशाः प्र॒ति गृह्न॒न्तु त एत॒म् ॥३७॥

text: May these preserve him for thee. Here I offer t o these the molten butter as oblation.
meaning: ता॒स् ते रक्षन्तु त॒व तु॒भ्यम् एतं॒ ताभ्य आ॒ज्यं हवि॒र् इदं॒ जुहोमि ॥३८॥ {१४}

text: Whoso will know Prayer with immediate knowledge, whose mem- bers are the stuff, whose spine the verses:
meaning: यो॒ विद्या॒द् ब्र॒ह्म प्रत्य॒क्षं प॒रूंषि य॒स्य संभारा॒ ऋ॒चो य॒स्यानूक्य॑म् ॥१॥

text: Whose hairs are psalms, whose heart is called the Yajus, whose coverlet is verily oblation—
meaning: सा॒मानि य॒स्य लो॒मानि य॒जुर् हृ॒दयम् उच्य॒ते परिस्त॒रणम् इ॒द् धविः॒ ॥२॥

text: Verily when a host looks at his guests he looks at the place of sacrifice to the Gods.
meaning: य॒द् वा॒ अ॒तिथिपतिर् अ॒तिथीन् प्रतिप॒श्यति देवय॒जनं प्रे॒क्षते ॥३॥

text: When he salutes them reverently he undergoes preparation for a religious ceremony: when he calls for water, he solemnly brings sacrificial water.
meaning: य॒द् अभिव॒दति दीक्षा॒म् उ॒पैति य॒द् उदकं॒ या॒चत्य् अपः॒ प्र॒ णयति ॥४॥

text: The water that is solemnly brought at a sacrifice is this same water.
meaning: या॒ एव॒ यज्ञ॒ आ॒पः प्रणीय॒न्ते ता॒ एव॒ ताः॒ ॥५॥

text: The libation which they bring; the sacrificial victim dedicated to Agni and Soma which is tied to the post, that, verily, is this man.
meaning: य॒त् त॒र्पणम् आह॒रन्ति य॒ एवा॒ग्नीषोमी॒यः पशु॒र् बध्य॒ते स॒ एव॒ सः॒ ॥६॥

text: When they arrange dwelling-rooms they arrange the sacred chamber and the shed for housing the Soma cars.
meaning: य॒द् आवसथा॒न् कल्प॒यन्ति सदोहविर्धाना॒न्य् एव॒ त॒त् कल्पयन्ति ॥७॥

text: What they spread upon the floor is just Sacrificial Grass.
meaning: य॒द् उपस्तृण॒न्ति बर्हि॒र् एव॒ त॒त् ॥८॥

text: With the couch that the men bring, he wins for himself the world of Svarga.
meaning: य॒द् उपरिशयन॒म् आह॒रन्ति स्वर्ग॒म् एव॒ ते॒न लोक॒म् अ॒व रुन्द्धे ॥९॥

text: The pillow-coverings that they bring are the green sticks that surround the sacrificial altar.
meaning: य॒त् कशिपूपबर्हण॒म् आह॒रन्ति परिध॒य एव॒ ते॒ ॥१०॥

text: The ointment that they bring for injunction is just clarified liquid butter.
meaning: य॒द् आञ्जनाभ्यञ्जन॒म् आह॒रन्त्य् आ॒ज्यम् एव॒ त॒त् ॥११॥

text: The food they bring before the general distribution represents the two sacrificial cakes of rice meal.
meaning: य॒त् पुरा॒ परिवेषा॒त् स्वाद॒म् आह॒रन्ति पुरोदा॒शाव् एव॒ तौ॒ ॥१२॥

text: When they call the man who prepares food they summon the preparer of oblation.
meaning: य॒द् अशनकृ॒तं ह्व॒यन्ति हविष्कृ॒तम् एव॒ त॒द् ध्वयन्ति ॥१३॥

text: The grains of rice and barley that are selected are just filaments of the Soma plant.
meaning: ये॒ व्रीह॒यो य॒वा निरुप्य॒न्ते ऽंश॒व एव॒ ते॒ ॥१४॥

text: The pestle and mortar are really the stones of the Soma press.
meaning: या॒न्य् उलूखलमुसला॒नि ग्रा॒वाण एव॒ ते॒ ॥१५॥

text: The winnowing-basket is the filter, the chaff the Soma dregs, the water, the pressing-gear.
meaning: शू॒र्पं पवि॒त्रं तु॒षा ऋजीषा॒भिष॒वणीर् आ॒पः ॥१६॥

text: Spoon, ladle, fork, stirring-prong are the wooden Soma tubs; the earthen cooking-pots are the mortar-shaped Soma vessels; this earth is just the black-antelope's skin.
meaning: स्रु॒ग् द॒र्विर् ने॒क्षणम् आय॒वनं द्रोणकलशाः॒ कुम्भ्यो॑ वायव्या॑नि पा॒त्राणीय॒म् एव॒ कृष्णाजिन॒म् ॥१७॥ {१५}

text: Or the host acts in this way to a Yajamāna's Brāhman: when he looks at the furniture and utensils he says, More here t yet more here.
meaning: यजमानब्राह्मणं॒ वा॒ एत॒द् अ॒तिथिपतिः कुरुते य॒द् आहार्या॑णि प्रे॒क्षत इदं॒ भू॒या३ इदा॒३म् इ॒ति ॥१८॥

text: When he says, Bring out more, he lengthens his life thereby.
meaning: य॒द् आ॒ह भू॒य उ॒द् धरे॒ति प्राण॒म् एव॒ ते॒न व॒र्षीयांसं कुरुते ॥१९॥

text: He brings oblations: he makes the men sit down.
meaning: उ॒प हरति हवीं॒ष्य् आ॒ सादयति ॥२०॥

text: As the guest of the seated company he himself offers up sacrifice.
meaning: ते॒षाम् आ॒सन्नानाम् अ॒तिथिर् आत्म॒न् जुहोति ॥२१॥

text: With ladle, with hand, in life, at the sacrificial post, with cry of Ladle! with exclamation of Vashat!
meaning: स्रुचा॒ ह॒स्तेन प्राणे॒ यू॒पे स्रुक्कारे॒ण वषट्कारे॒ण ॥२२॥

text: Now these guests, as priests beloved or not beloved, bring one to the world of Svarga.
meaning: एते॒ वै॒ प्रिया॒श् चा॒प्रियाश् च र्त्वि॒जः स्वर्गं॒ लोकं॒ गमयन्ति य॒द् अ॒तिथयः ॥२३॥

text: He who hath this knowledge should not eat hating, should not eat the food of one who hates him, nor of one who is doubt- ful, nor of one who is undecided.
meaning: स॒ य॒ एवं॒ विद्वा॒न् न॒ द्विष॒न्न् अश्नीयान् न॒ द्विषतो॒ ऽन्नम् अश्नीयान् न॒ मीमांसित॒स्य न॒ मीमांस॒मानस्य ॥२४॥

text: This man whose food they eat hath all his wickedness blotted out.
meaning: स॒र्वो वा॒ एष॒ जग्ध॒पाप्मा य॒स्या॒न्नम् अश्न॒न्ति ॥२५॥

text: All that man's sin whose food they do not eat remains unblot- ted out.
meaning: स॒र्वो वा॒ एसो॒ ऽजग्ध॒पाप्मा य॒स्या॒न्नम् ना॒श्न॒न्ति ॥२६॥

text: The man who supplies food hath always pressing stones adjusted, a wet Soma filter, well prepared religious rites, and mental power to complete the arranged sacrifice.
meaning: सर्वदा॒ वा॒ एष॒ युक्त॒ग्रावार्द्र॒पवित्रो वि॒तताध्वर आ॒हृतयज्ञक्रतुर् य॒ उपह॒रति ॥२७॥

text: The arranged sacrifice of the man who offers food is a sacrifice to Prajāpati.
meaning: प्राजापत्यो॒ वा॒ एत॒स्य यज्ञो॒ वि॒ततो य॒ उपह॒रति ॥२८॥

text: The man who offers food follows the steps of Prajāpati.
meaning: प्रजा॒पतेर् वा॒ एष॒ विक्रमा॒न् अनुवि॒क्रमते य॒ उपह॒रति ॥२९॥

text: The fire of the guests is the Āhavaniya, the fire in the dwelling is the Gārhapatya, that whereon they cook food is the South- ern Sacrificial Fire.
meaning: यो॒ ऽतिथीनां स॒ आहवनी॒यो यो॒ वे॒श्मनि स॒ गा॒र्हपत्यो य॒स्मिन् प॒चन्ति स॒ दक्षिणाग्निः॒ ॥३०॥ {१६}

text: Now that man who eats before the guest eats up the sacrifice and the merit of the house.
meaning: इष्टं॒ च वा॒ एष॒ पूर्तं॒ च गृहा॒णाम् अश्नाति यः॒ पू॒र्वो॒ ऽतिथेर् अश्ना॒ति ॥३१॥

text: He devours the milk and the sap:
meaning: प॒यश् च वा॒ एष॒ र॒सं च गृहा॒णाम् अश्नाति यः॒ पू॒र्वो॒ ऽतिथेर् अश्ना॒ति ॥३२॥

text: And the vigour and prosperity.
meaning: ऊर्जां॒ च वा॒ एष॒ स्फातिं॒ च गृहा॒णाम् अश्नाति यः॒ पू॒र्वो॒ ऽतिथेर् अश्ना॒ति ॥३३॥

text: And the progeny and the cattle:
meaning: प्रजां॒ वा॒ एष॒ पशूं॒श् च गृहा॒णाम् अश्नाति यः॒ पू॒र्वो॒ ऽतिथेर् अश्ना॒ति ॥३४॥

text: And the fame and reputation.
meaning: कीर्तिं॒ वा॒ एष॒ य॒शश् च गृहा॒णाम् अश्नाति यः॒ पू॒र्वो॒ ऽतिथेर् अश्ना॒ति ॥३५॥

text: The man who eats before the guest eats up the glory and the understanding of the house.
meaning: श्रि॒यं वा॒ एष॒ संवि॒दं च गृहा॒णाम् अश्नाति यः॒ पू॒र्वो॒ ऽतिथेर् अश्ना॒ति ॥३६॥

text: The man should not eat before the guest who is a Brāhman versed in holy lore.
meaning: एष॒ वा॒ अ॒तिथिर् य॒च् छ्रो॒त्रियस् त॒स्मात् पू॒र्वो ना॒श्नीयात् ॥३७॥

text: When the guest hath eaten he should eat. This is the rule for the animation of the sacrifice and the preservation of its continuity.
meaning: अशिता॒वत्य् अ॒तिथाव् अश्नीयाद् यज्ञ॒स्य सात्मत्वा॒य यज्ञ॒स्या॒विछेदाय त॒द् व्रत॒म् ॥३८॥

text: Now the sweetest portion, the produce of the cow, milk, or flesh, that verily he should not eat.
meaning: एत॒द् वा॒ उ स्वा॒दीयो य॒द् अधिगवं॒ क्षीरं॒ वा॒ मांसं॒ वा॒ त॒द् एव॒ ना॒श्नीयात् ॥३९॥ {१७}

text: The man who having this knowledge pours out milk and offers it wins for himself as much thereby as he gains by the perfor- mance of a very successful Agnishtoma sacrifice.
meaning: स॒ य॒ एवं॒ विद्वा॒न् क्षीर॒म् उपसि॒च्योपह॒रति । या॒वद् अग्निष्टोमे॒नेष्ट्वा॒ सु॒समृद्धेनावरुन्द्धे॒ ता॒वद् एनेना॒व रुन्द्धे ॥४०॥

text: The man who having this knowledge pours out clarified butter and offers it wins for himself thereby as much as he gains by the performance of a very successful Atirātra sacrifice.
meaning: स॒ य॒ एवं॒ विद्वा॒न्त् सर्पि॒र् उपसि॒च्योपह॒रति । या॒वद् अतिरात्रे॒णेष्ट्वा॒ सु॒समृद्धेनावरुन्द्धे॒ ता॒वद् एनेना॒व रुन्द्धे ॥४१॥

text: He who pours out mead and offers it wins for himself thereby as much as he gains by the performance of a very successful Sattrasadya sacrifice.
meaning: स॒ य॒ एवं॒ विद्वा॒न् म॒धूपसि॒च्योपह॒रति । या॒वद् सत्त्रस॒द्येनेष्ट्वा॒ सु॒समृद्धेनावरुन्द्धे॒ ता॒वद् एनेना॒व रुन्द्धे ॥४२॥

text: He who having this knowledge besprinkles flesh and offers it wins for himself thereby as much as he gains by the perfor- mance of a very successful Twelve-Day sacrifice.
meaning: स॒ य॒ एवं॒ विद्वा॒न् मांस॒म् उपसि॒च्योपह॒रति । या॒वद् द्वादशाहे॒नेष्ट्वा॒ सु॒समृद्धेनावरुन्द्धे॒ ता॒वद् एनेना॒व रुन्द्धे ॥४३॥

text: The man who having this knowledge pours out water and offers it obtains a resting-place for the procreation of living beings and becomes dear to living beings, even the man who having this knowledge pours out water and offers it.
meaning: स॒ य॒ एवं॒ विद्वा॒न् उदक॒म् उपसि॒च्योपह॒रति । प्रजा॒नां प्रज॒ननाय गछति प्रतिष्ठां॒ प्रियः॒ प्रजा॒नां भवति य॒ एवं॒ विद्वा॒न् उपसि॒च्योपह॒रति ॥४४॥ {१८}

text: For him Dawn murmurs, and Savitar sings the prelude; Brihas- pati chants with vigour, and Tvashtar joins in with increase; the Visve Devāh take up conclusion. He who hath this know- ledge is the abiding-place of welfare, of progeny, and of cattle.
meaning: त॒स्मा उषा॒ हि॒ङ् कृणोति सविता॒ प्र॒ स्तौति । बृ॒हस्प॒तिर् ऊर्ज॒यो॒द् गायति त्व॒ष्टा पु॒ष्ट्या प्र॒ति हरति वि॒श्वे देवा॒ निध॒नम् ॥२॥ निध॒नं भू॒त्याः प्रजा॒याः पशूनां॒ भवति य॒ एवं॒ वे॒द ॥४५॥

text: For him the rising Sun murmurs, and Early Morning sings the prelude; Noon chants the psalm, Afternoon joins in; the setting Sun takes up the conclusion. He who hath this know- ledge is the abiding place of welfare, of progeny, and of cattle.
meaning: त॒स्मा उद्य॒न्त् सू॒र्यो हि॒ङ् कृणोति संगवः॒ प्र॒ स्तौति । मध्य॒न्दिन उ॒द् गायत्य् अपराह्णः॒ प्र॒ति हरत्य् अस्तंय॒न् निध॒नम् । निध॒नं भू॒त्याः प्रजा॒याः पशूनां॒ भवति य॒ एवं॒ वे॒द ॥४६॥

text: For him the Rain-cloud murmurs when present, sings the pre- lude when thundering, joins in when lightening, chants the psalm when raining, and takes up the conclusion when it stays the downpour. He who hath this knowledge is the abiding- place of welfare, of progeny, and of cattle.
meaning: त॒स्मा अभ्रो॒ भ॒वन् हि॒ङ् कृणोति स्तन॒यन् प्र॒ स्तौति । विद्यो॒तमानः प्र॒ति हरति व॒र्षन्न् उ॒द् गायत्य् उद्गृह्ण॒न् निध॒नम् । निध॒नं भू॒त्याः प्रजा॒याः पशूनां॒ भवति य॒ एवं॒ वे॒द ॥४७॥

text: He looks at the guests, he utters a gentle sound; he speaks, he signs the prelude; he calls for water, he chants the psalm; he offers the residue of the sacrifice, he takes up the conclusion.
meaning: अ॒तिथीन् प्र॒ति पश्यति हिङ् कृणोत्य् अभि॒ वदति प्र॒ स्तौ॒त्य् उदक॒म् याचत्य् उ॒द् गायति । उ॒प हरति प्र॒ति हरत्य् उ॒च्छिष्टं निध॒नम् । निध॒नं भू॒त्याः प्रजा॒याः पशूनां॒ भवति य॒ एव॒म् वे॒द ॥४८॥ {१९}

text: When he summons the door-keeper he gives instruction.
meaning: य॒त् क्षत्ता॒रं ह्व॒यत्य् आ॒ श्रावयत्य् एव॒ त॒त् ॥४९॥

text: He (the door-keeper) pronounces the sacrificial formula in his answer to what he hears.
meaning: य॒त् प्रतिशृणो॒ति प्रत्या॒श्रावयत्य् एव॒ त॒त् ॥५०॥

text: When the attendants with vessels in their hands, foremost and hindmost, come in, they are just the priests who manage the Soma cups.
meaning: य॒त् परिवेष्टा॒रः पा॒त्रहस्ताः पू॒र्वे चा॒परे च प्रप॒द्यन्ते चमसा॒ध्वर्यव एव॒ ते॒ ॥५१॥

text: Not one of them is incompetent to sacrifice.
Or if the host, having offered food to his guest, goes up to the house, he virtually enters the bath of purification.
meaning: य॒द् वा॒ अ॒तिथिपतिर् अ॒तिथीन् परिवि॒ष्य गृहा॒न् उपोदै॒त्य् अवभृ॒थम् एव॒ त॒द् उपा॒वैति ॥५३॥

text: When he distributes food he distributes priestly fees; what he performs he asks as favour.
meaning: य॒त् सभाग॒यति द॒क्षिणाः सभागयति य॒द् अनुति॒ष्ठत उद॒वस्यत्य् एव॒ त॒त् ॥५४॥

text: He having been invited on earth, regales, invited in that, which wears all various forms on earth.
meaning: स॒ उ॒पहूतः पृथिव्यां॒ भक्षयत्य् उ॒पहूतस् त॒स्मिन् य॒त् पृथिव्यां॒ विश्व॒रूपम् ॥५५॥

text: He, having been invited in air, regales, invited, in that which wears all various forms in air.
meaning: स॒ उ॒पहूतो ऽन्त॒रिक्षे भक्षयत्य् उ॒पहूतस् त॒स्मिन् य॒द् दिवि॒ विश्व॒रूपम् ॥५६॥

text: He having been invited in the sky, regales, invited, in that which wears all various forms in the sky.
meaning: स॒ उ॒पहूतो दिवि॒ भक्षयत्य् उ॒पहूतस् त॒स्मिन् य॒द् दिवि॒ विश्व॒रूपम् ॥५७॥

text: He, having been invited among the gods, regales, invited in that which wears all various forms among the Gods.
meaning: स॒ उ॒पहूतो देवे॒षु भक्षयत्य् उ॒पहूतस् त॒स्मिन् य॒द् दिवि॒ विश्व॒रूपम् ॥५८॥

text: He, having been invited in the worlds, regales, invited, in that which wears all various forms in the worlds.
meaning: स॒ उ॒पहूतो लोके॒षु भक्षयत्य् उ॒पहूतस् त॒स्मिन् य॒द् दिवि॒ वि॒श्व॒रूपम् ॥५९॥

text: He, having been invited hath been invited.
meaning: स॒ उ॒पहूत उ॒पहूतः ॥६०॥

text: He gains this world and the world yonder.
meaning: आप्नो॒तीमं॒ लोक॒म् आप्नो॒त्य् अमु॒म् ॥६१॥

text: He who hath this knowledge wins the luminous spheres.
meaning: ज्यो॒तिष्मतो लोका॒न् जयति य॒ एवं॒ वे॒द ॥६२॥ {२०}

text: Prajapati and Parameshthin are the two horns, Indra is the head, Agni the forehead, Yama the joint of the neck.
meaning: प्रजा॒पतिश् च परमेष्ठी॒ च शृ॒ङ्गे इ॒न्द्रः शि॒रो अग्नि॒र् लला॒टं यमः॒ कृ॒काटम् ॥१॥

text: King Soma is the brain, Sky is the upper jaw, Earth is the lower jaw.
meaning: सो॒मो रा॒जा मस्ति॒ष्को द्यौ॒र् उत्तरहनुः॒ पृथिव्य् अ॑धरहनुः॒ ॥२॥

text: Lightning is the tongue, the Maruts are the teeth, Revati is the neck, the Krittikās are the shoulders, the Gharma s the shoulder-bar.
meaning: विद्यु॒ज् जिह्वा॒ मरु॒तो द॒न्ता रेव॒तिर् ग्रीवाः॒ कृ॒त्तिका स्कन्धा॒ घर्मो॒ व॒हः ॥३॥

text: His universe is Vāyu, Svarga is his world, Krishpadram is the tendons and Vertebrae.
meaning: वि॒श्वं वायुः॒ स्वर्गो॒ लोकः॒ कृष्णद्रं॒ विध॒रणी निवेष्यः॒ ॥४॥

text: The Syena ceremony is the breast, Air is the region of the belly,. Brihaspati is the hump, Brihatī the breast-bone and cartilages of the ribs.
meaning: श्येनः॒ क्रोतो॒ ऽन्त॒रिक्षं पाजस्यं॑ बृ॒हस्प॒तिः ककु॒द् बृहतीः॒ की॒कसाः ॥५॥

text: The consorts of the Gods are the ribs, the attendants are ribs.
meaning: देवा॒नां प॒त्नीः पृष्ट॒य उपस॒दः प॒र्शवः ॥६॥

text: Mitra and Varuna are the shoulder-blades. Tvashtar and Arya- man the fore-arms, Mahādeva is the arms.
meaning: मित्र॒श् च व॒रुणश् चां॒सौ त्व॒ष्टा चार्यमा॒ च दोष॒णी महादेवो॒ बाहू॒ ॥७॥

text: Indrāni is the hinder parts, Vāyu the tail, Pavamāna the hair.
meaning: इन्द्राणी॒ भस॒द् वायुः॒ पु॒छं प॒वमानो बा॒लाः ॥८॥

text: Priestly rank and princely power are the hips, and strength is. the thigh.
meaning: ब्र॒ह्म च क्षत्रं॒ च श्रो॒णी ब॒लम् ऊरू॒ ॥९॥

text: Dhātar and Savitar are the two knee-bones, the Gandharvas are the legs the Apsarases are bits of the feet, Aditi is the hooves.
meaning: धाता॒ च सविता॒ चाष्ठीव॒न्तौ ज॒ङ्घा गन्धर्वा॒ अप्सर॒सः कु॒ष्ठिका अ॒दितिः शफाः॒ ॥१०॥

text: Thought is the heart, intelligence is the liver, law the pericar- dium.
meaning: चे॒तो हृ॒दयं य॒कृन् मेधा॒ व्रतं॒ पुरीत॒त् ॥११॥

text: Hunger is the belly, refreshing drink is the rectum, mountains. are the inward parts.
meaning: क्षु॒त् कुक्षि॒र् इ॒रा वनिष्ठुः॒ प॒र्वताः प्लाश॒यः ॥१२॥

text: Wrath is the kidneys, anger the testes, offspring the generative organ.
meaning: क्रो॒धो वृक्कौ॒ मन्यु॒र् आण्डौ॒ प्रजा॒ शे॒पः ॥१३॥

text: The river is the womb, the Lords of the Rain are the breasts,. the thunder is the udder.
meaning: नदी॒ सूत्री॒ वर्ष॒स्य प॒तय स्त॒ना स्तनयित्नु॒र् ऊ॒धः ॥१४॥

text: The All-embracing (Aditi) is the hide, the herbs are her hair,. and the Lunar Mansions her form.
meaning: विश्व॒व्यचास् च॒र्मौ॒षधयो लो॒मानि न॒क्षत्राणि रूप॒म् ॥१५॥

text: The hosts of Gods are her entrails, man are her bowels, and demons her abdomen.
meaning: देवजना॒ गु॒दा मनुष्या॑ आन्त्रा॒ण्य् अत्रा॒ उद॒रम् ॥१६॥

text: Rākshasas are the blood, the Other Folk are the contents of the Stomach.
meaning: र॒क्षांसि लो॒हितम् इतरजना॒ ऊ॒बध्यम् ॥१७॥

text: The rain-cloud is her fat, her resting-place her marrow.
meaning: अभ्रं॒ पी॒बो मज्जा॒ निध॒नम् ॥१८॥

text: Sitting he is Agni, when he hath stood up he is the Asvins.
meaning: अग्नि॒र् आ॒सीन उ॒त्थितो ऽश्वि॒ना ॥१९॥

text: Standing east-wards he is Indra, standing southwards, Yama.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रः प्रा॒ङ् ति॒ष्ठन् दक्षिणा॒ ति॒ष्ठन् यमः॒ ॥२०॥

text: Standing westwards he is Dhātar, standing northwards Savitar.
meaning: प्रत्य॒ङ् ति॒ष्ठन् धातो॒दङ् ति॒ष्ठन्त् सविता॒ ॥२१॥

text: When he hath got his grass he is King Soma.
He is Mitra when he looks about him, and when he hath turned round he is joy.
meaning: मित्र॒ ई॒क्षमाण आ॒वृत्त आनन्दः॒ ॥२३॥

text: When he is yoking he belongs to the All-Gods, when yoked he is Prajāpati, when unyoked he is All.
meaning: युज्य॒मानो वैश्वदेवो॒ युक्तः॒ प्रजा॒पतिर् वि॒मुक्तः स॒र्वम् ॥२४॥

text: This verily is omniform, wearing all forms, bovine-formed.
meaning: एत॒द् वै॒ विश्व॒रूपं स॒र्वरूपं गोरूप॒म् ॥२५॥

text: Upon him wait omniform beasts, wearing every shape, each one who hath this knowledge.
meaning: उ॒पैनं विश्व॒रूपाः स॒र्वरूपाः पश॒वस् तिष्ठन्ति य॒ एवं॒ वे॒द ॥२६॥ {२१}

text: Each pain and ache that racks the head, earache, and erysipelas,. All malady that wrings thy brow we charm away with this our spell.
meaning: शीर्षक्तिं॒ शीर्षामयं॒ कर्णशूलं॒ विलोहित॒म् । स॒र्वं शीर्षन्यं॑ ते रो॒गं बहि॒र् नि॒र् मन्त्रयामहे ॥१॥

text: From both thine ears, from parts thereof, thine earache, and the throbbing pain, All malady that wrings thy brow we charm away with this our spell.
meaning: क॒र्णाभ्यां ते क॒ङ्कूषेभ्यः कर्णशूलं॒ विस॒ल्पकम् । स॒र्वं शीर्षन्यं॑ ते रो॒गं बहि॒र् नि॒र् मन्त्रयामहे ॥२॥

text: So that Consumption may depart forth from thine ears and from. thy mouth, All malady that wrings thy brow we charm away with this our spell.
meaning: य॒स्य हेतोः॒ प्रच्य॒वते य॒क्ष्मः कर्णतो॒ आस्यतः॒ । स॒र्वं शीर्षन्यं॑ ते रो॒गं बहि॒र् नि॒र् मन्त्रयामहे ॥३॥

text: The malady that makes one deaf, the malady that makes one blind, All malady that wrings thy brow we charm away with this our spell.
meaning: यः॒ कृणो॒ति प्रमो॒तम् अन्धं॒ कृणो॒ति पू॒रुषम् । स॒र्वं शीर्षन्यं॑ ते रो॒गं बहि॒र् नि॒र् मन्त्रयामहे ॥४॥

text: The throbbing pain in all thy limbs that rends thy frame with fever-throes, All malady that wrings thy brow we charm away with this our spell.
meaning: अङ्गभेद॒म् अङ्गज्वर॒म् विश्वाङ्ग्यं॑ विस॒ल्पकम् । स॒र्वं शीर्षन्यं॑ ते रो॒गं बहि॒र् नि॒र् मन्त्रयामहे ॥५॥

text: The malady whose awful look makes a man quiver with alarm, Fever whom every Autumn brings we charm away with this our spell.
meaning: य॒स्य भीमः॒ प्रतीकाश॒ उद्वेप॒यति पू॒रुषम् । तक्मा॒नं विश्व॒शारदं बहि॒र् नि॒र् मन्त्रयामहे ॥६॥

text: Disease that creeps about the thighs and, after, reaches both the groins, Consumption from thine inward parts we charm away with this our spell.
meaning: य॒ ऊरू॒ अनुस॒र्पत्य् अ॒थो ए॒ति गवी॒निके । य॒क्ष्मं ते अन्त॒र् अ॒ङ्गेभ्यो बहि॒र् नि॒र् मन्त्रयामहे ॥७॥

text: If the disease originates from love, from hatred, from the heart, Forth from the heart and from the limbs we charm the wasting malady.
meaning: य॒दि का॒माद् अपकामा॒द् धृ॒दयाज् जा॒यते प॒रि । हृदो॒ बला॒सम् अ॒ङ्गेभ्यो बहि॒र् नि॒र् मन्त्रयामहे ॥८॥

text: The yellow Jaundice from thy limbs, and Colic from the parts within, And Phthisis from thine inward soul we charm away with this our spell.
meaning: हरिमा॒णं ते अ॒ङ्गेभ्यो ऽप्वा॒म् अन्तरो॒द॒रात् । यक्ष्मोधा॒म् अन्त॒र् आत्म॒नो बहि॒र् नि॒र् मन्त्रयामहे ॥९॥

text: Let wasting malady turn to dust, become the water of disease. I have evoked the poison-taint of all Consumptions out of thee.
meaning: आ॒सो बला॒सो भ॒वतु मू॒त्रं भवत्व् आम॒यत् । य॒क्ष्माणां स॒र्वेषां विषं॒ नि॒र् अवोचम् अहं॒ त्व॒त् ॥१०॥ {२२}

text: Forth from the hollow let it run, and rumbling sounds from thine inside. I have evoked the poison-taint of all Consumptions out of thee.
meaning: बहि॒र् बि॒लं नि॒र् द्रवतु का॒हाबाहं त॒वोद॒रात् । य॒क्ष्माणां स॒र्वेषां विषं॒ नि॒र् अवोचम् अहं॒ त्व॒त् ॥११॥

text: Forth from thy belly and thy lungs, forth from thy navel and thy heart. I have evoked the poison taint of all Consumptions out of thee.
meaning: उद॒रात् ते क्लोम्नो॒ ना॒भ्या हृ॒दयाद् अ॒धि । य॒क्ष्माणां स॒र्वेषां विषं॒ नि॒र् अवोचम् अहं॒ त्व॒त् ॥१२॥

text: The penetrating stabs of pain which rend asunder crown and head, Let them depart and pass away, free from disease and harming not.
meaning: याः॒ सीमा॒नं विरुज॒न्ति मूर्धा॒नं प्र॒त्य् अर्षनीः॒ । अ॒हिंसन्तीर् अनामया॒ नि॒र् द्रवन्तु बहि॒र् बि॒लम् ॥१३॥

text: The pangs that stab the heart and reach the breast-bone and connected parts, Let them depart and pass away, free from disease and harming not.
meaning: या॒ हृ॒दयम् उपर्ष॒न्त्य् अनुतन्व॒न्ति की॒कसाः । अ॒हिंसन्तीर् अनामया॒ नि॒र् द्रवन्तु बहि॒र् बि॒लम् ॥१४॥

text: The stabs that penetrate the sides and pierce their way along the ribs, Let them depart and pass away, free from disease and harming not.
meaning: याः॒ पार्श्वे॒ उपर्ष॒न्त्य् अनुनि॒क्षन्ति पृष्टीः॒ । अ॒हिंसन्तीर् अनामया॒ नि॒र् द्रवन्तु बहि॒र् बि॒लम् ॥१५॥

text: The penetrating pangs that pierce thy stomach as they shoot across, Let them depart and pass away, free from disease and harming not.
meaning: या॒स् तिर॒श्चीः उपर्ष॒न्त्य् अर्षणी॒र् वक्ष॒णासु ते । अ॒हिंसन्तीर् अनामया॒ नि॒र् द्रवन्तु बहि॒र् बि॒लम् ॥१६॥

text: The pains that through the bowels creep, disordering the inward parts, Let them depart and pass away, free from disease and harming not.
meaning: या॒ गु॒दा अनुस॒र्पन्त्य् आन्त्रा॒णि मोह॒यन्ति च । अ॒हिंसन्तीर् अनामया॒ नि॒र् द्रवन्तु बहि॒र् बि॒लम् ॥१७॥

text: The pains that suck the marrow out, and rend and tear the bones apart, May they speed forth and pass away, free from disease and harming not.
meaning: या॒ मज्ज्ञो॒ निर्ध॒यन्ति प॒रूंषि विरुज॒न्ति च । अ॒हिंसन्तीर् अनामया॒ नि॒र् द्रवन्तु बहि॒र् बि॒लम् ॥१८॥

text: Consumptions with their Colic pains which make thy limbs insensible I have evoked the poison-taint of all Consumptions out of thee.
meaning: ये॒ अ॒ङ्गानि मद॒यन्ति य॒क्ष्मासो रोपणा॒स् त॒व । य॒क्ष्माणां स॒र्वेषां विषं॒ नि॒र् अवोचम् अहं॒ त्व॒त् ॥१९॥

text: Of piercing pain, of abscesses, rheumatic ache, ophthalmia— I have evoked the poison-taint of all Consumptions out of thee.
meaning: विसल्प॒स्य विद्रध॒स्य वातीकार॒स्य वालजेः॒ । य॒क्ष्माणां स॒र्वेषां विषं॒ नि॒र् अवोचम् अहं॒ त्व॒त् ॥२०॥

text: I have dispelled the piercing pains from feet, knees, hips, and hinder parts, And spine, and from the neck and nape the malady that racked the head.
meaning: पा॒दाभ्यां ते जा॒नुभ्यां श्रो॒णिभ्यां प॒रि भं॒ससः । अ॒नूकाद् अर्षणी॒र् उष्णि॒हाभ्यः शीर्ष्णो॒ रो॒गम् अनीनशम् ॥२१॥

text: Sound are the skull-bones of thy head and thy heart's beat is regular. Thou, Sun, arising with thy beams hast chased away the head's disease, hast stilled the pain that racked the limbs.
meaning: सं॒ ते शीर्ष्णः॒ कपा॒लानि हृ॒दयस्य च यो॒ विधुः॒ । उद्य॒न्न् आदित्य रश्मि॒भिः शीर्ष्णो॒ रो॒गम् अनीनशो ऽङ्गभेद॒म् अशीशमः ॥२२॥ {२३}

text: The second brother of this lovely Hotar, hoary with eld, is the voracious Lightning. The third is he whose back is balmed with butter. Here have I seen the King with seven male children.
meaning: अस्य॒ वाम॒स्य पलित॒स्य हो॒तुस् त॒स्य भ्रा॒ता मध्यमो॒ अस्त्य् अ॒श्नः । तृती॒यो भ्रा॒ता घृत॒पृष्ठो अस्या॒त्रापश्यं विश्प॒तिं सप्त॒पुत्रम् ॥१॥

text: The seven make the one-wheeled chariot ready: bearing seven names the single Courser draws it. The wheel, three-naved, is sound and undecaying: thereon these worlds of life are all dependent.
meaning: सप्त॒ युञ्जन्ति र॒थम् ए॒कचक्रम् ए॒को अ॒श्वो वहति सप्त॒नामा । त्रिना॒भि चक्र॒म् अज॒रम् अनर्वं॒ य॒त्रेमा॒ वि॒श्वा भु॒वना॒धि तस्थुः॒ ॥२॥

text: The seven who on this seven-wheeled car are mounted have horses, seven in tale, who draw them onward. Seven sisters utter songs of praise together, in whom the Cows' seven names are held and treasured.
meaning: इमं॒ र॒थम् अ॒धि ये॒ सप्त॒ तस्थुः॒ सप्त॒चक्रं सप्त॒ वहन्त्य् अ॒श्वाः । सप्त॒ स्व॒सारो अभि॒ सं॒ नवन्त य॒त्र ग॒वाम् नि॒हिता सप्त॒ ना॒म ॥३॥

text: Who hath beheld at birth the Primal Being, when She who hath no bone supports the bony? Where is the blood of earth, the life, the spirit? Who may ap- proach the man who knows, to ask it?
meaning: को॒ ददर्श प्रथमं॒ जा॒यमानम् अस्थन्व॒न्तं य॒द् अनस्था॒ बि॒भर्ति । भू॒म्या अ॒सुर् अ॒सृग् आत्मा॒ क्व॑ स्वित् को॒ विद्वां॒सम् उ॒प गात् प्र॒ष्टुम् एत॒त् ॥४॥

text: Let him who knoweth presently declare it, this lovely Bird's securely-founded station. Forth from his head the Cows draw milk, and wearing his ves- ture with their foot have drunk the water.
meaning: इह॒ ब्रवीतु य॒ ईम् अङ्ग॒ वे॒दास्य॒ वाम॒स्य नि॒हितं पदं॒ वेः॒ । शीर्ष्णः॒ क्षीरं॒ दुह्रते गा॒वो अस्य वव्रिं॒ व॒साना उदकं॒ पदा॒ ऽपुः ॥५॥

text: Unripe in mind, in spirit undiscerning, I ask of these the Gods' established places. High up above the yearling Calf the sages, to form a web, their own seven threads have woven.
meaning: पा॒कः पृछामि म॒नसा॒ ऽविजानन् देवा॒नाम् एना॒ नि॒हिता पदा॒नि । वत्से॒ बष्क॒ये॒ ऽधि सप्त॒ त॒न्तून् वि॒ तत्निरे कव॒य ओ॒तवा॒ उ ॥६॥

text: Here, ignorant, I ask the wise who know it, as one who knows not, for the sake of knowledge, What is That One, who in the Unborn's image hath stablished and fixed firm this world's six regions.
meaning: अ॒चिकित्वांस् चिकितु॒षश् चिद् अ॒त्र कवी॒न् पृछामि विद्व॒नो न॒ विद्वा॒न् । वि॒ य॒स् तस्त॒म्भ ष॒ट् इमा॒ र॒जांस्य् अज॒स्य रूपे॒ किं॒ अ॒पि स्विद् ए॒कम् ॥७॥

text: The Mother gave the Sire his share of Order. With thought at first she wedded him in spirit. She, coyly loth, was filled with dew prolific. With adoration men approached to praise her.
meaning: माता॒ पित॒रम् ऋत॒ आ॒ बभाज ऽधीत्य् अ॒ग्रे म॒नसा सं॒ हि॒ जग्मे॒ । सा॒ बीभत्सु॒र् ग॒र्भरसा नि॒विद्धा न॒मस्वन्त इ॒द् उपवाक॒म् ईयुः ॥८॥

text: Yoked was the Mother to the boon Cow's car-pole; in humid folds of cloud the infant rested. Then the Calf lowed and looked upon the Mother, the Cow who wears all shapes in three directions.
meaning: युक्ता॒ माता॒सिद् धुरि॒ द॒क्षिणाया अ॒तिष्ठद् ग॒र्भो वृजनी॒ष्व् अन्तः॒ । अ॒मीमेद् वत्सो॒ अ॒नु गा॒म् अपश्यद् विश्वरूप्यं॑ त्रिषु॒ यो॒गनेषु ॥९॥

text: Bearing three mothers and three fathers, single he stood erect: they never made him weary. On yonder heaven's high ridge they speak together in speech not known to all, themselves all-knowing.
meaning: तिस्रो॒ मतृ॒̄स् त्री॒न् पितृ॒̄न् बि॒भ्रद् ए॒क उर्ध्व॒स् तस्थौ ने॒म् अ॒व ग्लापयन्त । मन्त्र॒यन्ते दिवो॒ अमु॒ष्य पृष्ठे॒ विश्ववि॒दो वा॒चम् अ॒विश्वविन्नाम् ॥१०॥ {२४}

text: Upon the five-spoked wheel revolving ever, whereon all crea- tures rest and are dependent, The axle, heavy-laden, is not heated: the nave from ancient time remains unheated.
meaning: प॒ञ्चारे चक्रे॒ परिव॒र्तमाने य॒स्मिन्न् आतस्थु॒र् भु॒वनानि वि॒श्वा । त॒स्य ना॒क्षस् तप्यते भू॒रिभारः सना॒द् एव॒ न॒ छिद्यते स॒नाभिः ॥११॥

text: They call him in the farther half of heaven the Sire five-footed, of twelve forms, wealthy in watery store. These others, later still, say that he takes his stand upon a seven- wheeled car, six-spoked, whose sight is clear.
meaning: प॒ञ्चपादं पित॒रं द्वा॒दशाकृतिं दिव॒ आहुः प॒रे अ॒र्धे पुरीषि॒णम् । अ॒थेमे॒ अन्य॒ उ॒परे विचक्षणे॒ सप्त॒चक्रे ष॒डर आहुर् अ॒र्पितम् ॥१२॥

text: Formed with twelve spokes, too strong for age to weaken, this wheel of during Order rolls round heaven. Herein established, joined in pairs together, seven hundred sons and twenty stand, O Agni.
meaning: द्वा॒दशारं नहि॒ त॒ज् ज॒राय व॒र्वर्ति चक्रं॒ प॒रि द्या॒म् ऋत॒स्य । आ॒ पुत्रा॒ अग्ने मिथुना॒सो अ॒त्र सप्त॒ शता॒नि विंशति॒श् च तस्थुः ॥१३॥

text: The wheel revolves, unwasting, with its felly: ten draw it, yoked to the far-stretching car-pole. Girt by the region moves the eye of Sūrya, on whom dependent rest all living creatures.
meaning: स॒नेमि चक्र॒म् अज॒रं वि॒ ववृत उत्ताना॒यां द॒श युक्ता॒ वहन्ति । सू॒र्यस्य च॒क्षू र॒जसैत्य् आ॒वृतं य॒स्मिन्न् आतस्थु॒र् भु॒वनानि वि॒श्वा ॥१४॥

text: They told me these were males, though truly females. He who hath eyes sees this, the blind discerns not. The son who is a sage hath comprehended: who knows this rightly is his father's father.
meaning: स्त्रि॒यः सती॒स् ता॒म् उ मे पुंसः॒ आहुः प॒श्यद् अक्षण्वा॒न्न् वि॒ चेतद् अन्धः॒ । कवि॒र् यः॒ पुत्रः॒ स॒ ईम् आ॒ चिकेत य॒स् ता॒ विजाना॒त् स॒ पितु॒ष् पिता॒सत् ॥१५॥

text: Of the co-born they call the seventh single-born: the six twin, pairs are called the Rishis, sons of Gods. Their good gifts sought of men are ranged in order due, and, various, form by form, move for their guiding Lord.
meaning: साकंजा॒नां सप्त॒थम् आहुर् एकजं॒ ष॒ड् इ॒द् यमा॒ ऋ॒षयो देवजा॒ इ॒ति । ते॒षाम् इष्टा॒नि वि॒हितानि धामश॒ स्थात्रे॒ रेजन्ते वि॒कृतानि रूपशः॒ ॥१६॥

text: Beneath the upper realm, above this lower, bearing her Calf at foot, the Cow hath risen. Whitherward, to what place hath she departed? Where doth she calve? Not in this herd of cattle.
meaning: अवः॒ प॒रेण पर॒ एना॒ अ॒वरेण पदा॒ वत्सं॒ बि॒भ्रती गौ॒र् उ॒द् अस्थात् । सा॒ कद्री॒ची कं॒ स्विद् अ॒र्धं प॒रागात् क्व॑ स्वित् सूते नहि॒ यूथे॒ अस्मि॒न् ॥१७॥

text: Who, that the father of this Calf discerneth beneath the upper realm, above the lower, Showing himself a sage, may here declare him? Whence hath the godlike spirit had its rising?
meaning: अवः॒ प॒रेण पित॒रं यो॒ अस्य वे॒दावः॒ प॒रेण पर॒ एना॒वरेण । कवीय॒मानः क॒ इह॒ प्र॒ वोचद् देवं॒ म॒नः कु॒तो अ॒धि प्र॒जातम् ॥१८॥

text: Those that come hitherward they call departing, those that depart they call directed hither. Whatever ye have made, Indra and Soma! steeds draw, as' twere, yoked to the region's car-pole.
meaning: ये॒ अर्वा॒ञ्चस् ता॒म् उ प॒राच आहुर् ये॒ प॒राञ्चस् तां॒ उ अर्वा॒च आहुः । इ॒न्द्रश् च या॒ चक्र॒थुः सोम ता॒नि धुरा॒ न॒ युक्ता॒ र॒जसो वहन्ति ॥१९॥

text: Two Birds with fair wings, knit with bonds of friendship, in the same sheltering tree have found a refuge, One of the twain eats the sweet Fig-tree's berry: the other, eat- ing not, regardeth only.
meaning: द्वा॒ सुपर्णा॒ सयु॒जा स॒खाया समानं॒ वृक्षं॒ प॒रि षस्वजाते । त॒योर् अन्यः॒ पि॒प्पलं स्वाद्व् अ॒त्त्य् अ॒नश्नन्न् अन्यो॒ अभि॒ चाकशीति ॥२०॥

text: The tree whereon the fine Birds eat the sweetness, where they all rest and procreate their offspring Upon the top, they say the fruit is luscious: none gaineth it who knoweth not the Father.
meaning: य॒स्मिन् वृक्षे॒ मध्व॒दः सुपर्णा॒ निविश॒न्ते सु॒वते चा॒धि वि॒श्वे । त॒स्य य॒द् आहुः॒ पि॒प्पलं स्वाद्व् अ॒ग्रे त॒न् नो॒न् नशद् यः॒ पित॒रं न॒ वे॒द ॥२१॥

text: Where the fine birds hymn ceaselessly their portion of life eter- nal, and the sacred synods. There is the Universe's Guard and Keeper who, wise hath entered into me the simple.
meaning: य॒त्रा सुपर्णा॒ अमृ॒तस्य भक्ष॒म् अ॒निमेषं विद॒थाभिस्व॒रन्ति । एना॒ वि॒श्वस्य भु॒वनस्य गोपाः॒ स॒ मा धी॒रः पा॒कम् अ॒त्रा॒ विवेश ॥२२॥ {२५}

text: How on the Gāyatri the Gāyatri was based; how from the Trishtup they fashioned the Trishtup forth: How on the Jagatī was based the Jagatī—they who know this have won themselves immortal life.
meaning: य॒द् गायत्रे॒ अ॒धि गायत्र॒म् आ॒हितं त्रै॒ष्टुभं वा त्रै॒ष्टुभान् निर॒तक्षत । य॒द् वा ज॒गज् ज॒गत्य् आ॒हितं पदं॒ य॒ इ॒त् त॒द् विदु॒स् ते॒ अमृतत्व॒म् आनुशुः ॥१॥

text: With Gāyatri he measures out the praise-song, Sāman with praise-song, triplet with the Trishtup, The triplet with the two or four-foot measure, and with the syllable they form seven metres.
meaning: गायत्रे॒ण प्र॒ति मिमीते अर्क॒म् अर्के॒ण सा॒म त्रै॒ष्टुभेन वाक॒म् । वाके॒न वाकं॒ द्विप॒दा च॒तुष्पदाक्ष॒रेण मिमते सप्त॒ वा॒णीः ॥२॥

text: With Jagatī the flood in heaven he stablished, and saw the Sun in the Rathantara Sāman. Gāyatri hath, they say, three logs for burning: hence it excels in majesty and vigour.
meaning: ज॒गता सि॒न्धुं दिव्य् अ॑स्कभायद् रथंतरे॒ सू॒र्यं प॒र्य् अपश्यत् । गायत्र॒स्य समि॒धस् तिस्र॒ आहुस् त॒तो मह्ना॒ प्र॒ रिरिचे महित्वा॒ ॥३॥

text: I invocate this Milch-cow good at milking, so that the Milker, deft of hand, may milk her. May "Savitar give goodliest stimulation. The caldron is made hot: he will proclaim it.
meaning: उ॒प ह्वये सुदु॒घां धेनु॒म् एतां॒ सुह॒स्तो गोधु॒ग् उत॒ दोहद् एनाम् । श्रे॒ष्ठं सवं॒ सविता॒ साविषन् नो ऽभी॒द्धो घर्म॒स् त॒द् उ षु॒ प्र॒ वोचत् ॥४॥

text: She, Lady of all treasures, hath come hither, yearning in spirit for her calf, and lowing. May this Cow yield her milk for both the Asvins, and may she prosper to our high advantage.
meaning: हिङ्कृण्वती॒ वसुप॒त्नी व॒सूनां वत्स॒म् इछ॒न्ती म॒नसाभ्या॒गात् । दुहा॒म् अश्वि॒भ्यां प॒यो अघ्न्ये॒यं॒ सा॒ वर्धतां महते॒ सौ॒भगाय ॥५॥

text: The Cow hath lowed after her blinking youngling: she licks his forehead as she lows, to form it. His mouth she fondly calls to her warm udder, and suckles him with milk while gently lowing.
meaning: गौ॒र् अमीमेद् अभि॒ वत्सं॒ मिष॒न्तं मूर्धा॒नं हि॒ङ्ङ् अकृणोन् मातवा॒ उ । सृ॒क्वाणं घर्म॒म् अभि॒ वावशाना॒ मि॒माति मायुं॒ प॒यते प॒योभिः ॥६॥

text: He also snorts, by whom encompassed round the Cow lows as she closely clings to him who sheds the rain. She with her shrilling cries hath humbled mortal men, and turn- ed to lightning, hath stripped off her covering robe.
meaning: अयं॒ स॒ शिङ्क्ते ये॒न गौ॒र् अभि॒वृता मि॒माति मयुं॒ ध्वस॒नाव् अ॒धि श्रिता॒ । सा॒ चित्ति॒भिर् नि॒ हि॒ चका॒र म॒र्त्यान् विद्यु॒द् भ॒वन्ती प्र॒ति वव्रि॒म् औहत ॥७॥

text: That which hath breath and life and speed and motion lies firmly stablished in the midst of houses. The living moves by powers of the departed: the immortal is the brother of the mortal.
meaning: अन॒च् छये तुर॒गातु जीव॒म् ए॒जद् ध्रुवं॒ म॒ध्य आ॒ पस्त्या॑नाम् । जीवो॒ मृत॒स्य चरति स्वधा॒भिर् अ॒मर्त्यो म॒र्त्येना स॒योनिः ॥८॥

text: The old hath waked the young Moon from his slumber, who runs his circling course with many round him. Behold the God's high wisdom in its greatness: he who died yesterday to-day is living.
meaning: विधुं॒ दद्राणं॒ सलिल॒स्य पृष्ठे॒ यु॒वानं स॒न्तं पलितो॒ जगार । देव॒स्य पश्य का॒व्यं महित्वा॒द्य॒ ममा॒र स॒ ह्यः॒ स॒म् आन ॥९॥

text: He who hath made him doth not comprehend him: from him who saw him surely he is hidden. He, yet enveloped in his mother's bosom, source of much life, hath sunk into destruction.
meaning: य॒ ईं चका॒र न॒ सो॒ अस्य॒ वेद य॒ ईं दद॒र्श हि॒रुग् इ॒न् नु॒ त॒स्मात् । स॒ मातु॒र् यो॒ना प॒रिवीतो अन्त॒र् बहुप्रजा॒ नि॒रृतिर् आ॒ विवेश ॥१०॥ {२६}

text: I saw the Herdsman, him who never stumbles, approaching by his pathways and departing. He clothed with gathered and diffusive splendours, within the worlds continually travels.
meaning: अ॒पश्यं गोपा॒म् अनिप॒द्यमानम् आ॒ च प॒रा च पथि॒भिश् च॒रन्तम् । स॒ सध्री॒चीः स॒ वि॒षूचीर् व॒सान आ॒ वरीवर्ति भु॒वनेष्व् अन्तः॒ ॥११॥

text: Dyaus is our father, our begetter: kinship is here. This great Earth is our kin and mother. Between the wide-spread world-halves is the birth-place. The Father laid the Daughter's germ within it.
meaning: द्यौ॒र् नः पिता॒ जनिता॒ ना॒भिर् अ॒त्र ब॒न्धुर् नो माता॒ पृथिवी॒ मही॒य॒म् । उत्तान॒योश् चम्वो॑र् यो॒निर् अन्त॒र् अ॒त्रा पिता॒ दुहितु॒र् ग॒र्भम् आ॒धात् ॥१२॥

text: I bid thee tell me earth's extremest limit, about the Stallion's genial flow I ask thee; I ask about the universe's centre, and touching highest heaven where Speech abideth.
meaning: पृछा॒मि त्वा प॒रम् अ॒न्तं पृथिव्याः॒ पृछा॒मि वृ॒ष्णो अ॒श्वस्य रे॒तः । पृछा॒मि वि॒श्वस्य भु॒वनस्य ना॒भिं पृछा॒मि वाचः॒ परमं॒ व्यो॑म ॥१३॥

text: The earth's most distant limit is this altar: this Soma is the Stallion's genial humour; This sacrifice the universe's centre: this Brāhman highest heaven where Speech abideth.
meaning: इयं॒ वे॒दिः प॒रो अ॒न्तः पृथिव्या॒ अयं॒ सो॒मो वृ॒ष्णो अ॒श्वस्य रे॒तः । अयं॒ यज्ञो॒ वि॒श्वस्य भु॒वनस्य ना॒भिर् ब्रह्मा॒यं॒ वाचः॒ परमं॒ व्यो॑म ॥१४॥

text: What thing I truly am I know not clearly: mysterious, fettered in my mind I wander. When the first-born of holy Law approached me, then of this Speech I first obtain a portion.
meaning: न॒ वि॒ जानामि य॒द् इवेद॒म् अ॒स्मि निण्यः॒ सं॒नद्धो म॒नसा चरामि । यदा॒ मा॒गन् प्रथमजा॒ ऋत॒स्या॒द् इ॒द् वाचो॒ अश्नुवे भाग॒म् अस्याः॒ ॥१५॥

text: Back, forward goes he, grasped by power inherent, immortal born the brother of the mortal. Ceaseless they move in opposite directions: men mark the one and fail to mark the other.
meaning: अ॒पाङ् प्रा॒ङ् एति स्वध॒या गृभीतो॒ ऽमर्त्यो म॒र्त्येना स॒योनिः । ता॒ श॒श्वन्ता विषूची॒ना विय॒न्ता न्य् अ॑न्यं॒ चिक्यु॒र् न॒ नि॒ चिक्युर् अन्य॒म् ॥१६॥

text: Seven germs unripened yet are Heaven's prolific seed: their functions they maintain by Vishnu's ordinance. Endued with wisdom through intelligence and thought, present on every side they compass us about.
meaning: सप्ता॒र्धगर्भा॒ भु॒वनस्य रे॒तो वि॒ष्णोस् तिष्ठन्ति प्रदि॒शा वि॒धर्मणि । ते॒ धीति॒भिर् म॒नसा ते॒ विपश्चि॒तः परिभु॒वः प॒रि भवन्ति विश्व॒तः ॥१७॥

text: Upon what syllable of holy praise-hymn, as 'twere their highest heaven, the Gods repose them Who knows not this, what will he do with praise-hymn? But they who know it well sit here assembled.
meaning: ऋचो॒ अक्ष॒रे परमे॒ व्यो॑मन् य॒स्मिन् देवा॒ अ॒धि वि॒श्वे निषेदुः॒ । य॒स् त॒न् न॒ वे॒द कि॒म् ऋचा॒ करिष्यति य॒ इ॒त् त॒द् विदु॒स् ते अमी॒ स॒म् आसते ॥१८॥

text: They, ordering the verse's foot by measure, with the half-verse arranged each thing that moveth. Prayer was diffused in many forms three-footed thereby the world's four regions have their being
meaning: ऋचः॒ पदं॒ मा॒त्रया कल्प॒यन्तो ऽर्धर्चे॒न चक्ल्̥पुर् वि॒श्वम् ए॒जत् । त्रिपा॒द् ब्र॒ह्म पुरुरू॒पं वि॒ तष्ठे ते॒न जीवन्ति प्रदि॒शश् च॒तस्रः ॥१९॥

text: Fortunate mayst thou be with goodly pasture, and may we also be exceeding wealthy. Feed on the grass, O Cow, through all the seasons, and coming hitherward drink limpid water.
meaning: सूयवसा॒द् भ॒गवती हि॒ भूया॒ अ॒धा वयं॒ भ॒गवन्तः स्याम । अद्धि॒ तृ॒णम् अघ्न्ये विश्वदा॒नीं पि॒ब शुद्ध॒म् उदक॒म् आच॒रन्ती ॥२०॥ {२७}

text: Forming the water-floods the Cow herself hath lowed, one-foot- ed or two-footed or four-footed, she, Who hath become eight-footed or acquired nine feet, the uni- verse's thousand-syllabled Pankti. From her descend in streams the seas of water.
meaning: गौ॒र् इ॒न् मिमाय सलिला॒नि त॒क्षती ए॒कपदी द्विप॒दी सा॒ च॒तुष्पदी । अष्टा॒पदी न॒वपदी बभूवु॒षी सह॒स्राक्षरा भु॒वनस्य पङ्क्ति॒स् त॒स्याः समुद्रा॒ अ॒धि वि॒ क्षरन्ति ॥२१॥

text: Dark the descent: the birds are golden-coloured. Robed in the floods they fly aloft to heaven. Again from Order's seat have they descended, and inundated all the earth with fatness.
meaning: कृष्णं॒ निया॒नं ह॒रयः सुपर्णा॒ अपो॒ व॒साना दि॒वम् उ॒त् पतन्ति । तं॒ आ॒ववृत्रन्त् स॒दनाद् ऋत॒स्या॒द् इ॒द् घृते॒न पृथिवीं॒ व्य् ऊ॑दुः ॥२२॥

text: The footless Maid precedeth footed creatures. Who marketh, Mitra Varuna! this your doing? The Babe unborn supporteth this world's burthen, supporteth Right and watcheth Wrong and Falsehood.
meaning: अपा॒द् एति प्रथमा॒ पद्व॒तीनां क॒स् त॒द् वां मित्रावरुणा॒ चिकेत । ग॒र्भो भारं॒ भरत्य् आ॒ चिद् अस्या ऋतं॒ पि॒पर्ति अ॒नृतं नि॒ पाति ॥२३॥

text: Virāj is Speech, and Earth, and Air's mid-region. He is Praja- pati, and he is Mrityu. He is the Lord Imperial of the Sādhyas. He rules what is and what shall be hereafter. May he make me lord of what is and shall be.
meaning: विरा॒ड् वा॒ग् विरा॒ट् पृथिवी॒ विरा॒ड् अन्त॒रिक्षं विरा॒ट् प्रजा॒पतिः । विरा॒ण् मृत्युः॒ साध्या॒नाम् अधिराजो॒ बभूव त॒स्य भूतं॒ भ॒व्यं व॒शे स॒ मे भूतं॒ भ॒व्यं व॒शे कृणोतु ॥२४॥

text: 1 saw from far away the smoke of fuel with spires that rose on high o'er that beneath it. The heroes cooked and dressed the spotted bullock. These were the customs in the days aforetime.
meaning: शकम॒यं धूम॒म् आरा॒द् अपश्यं विषूव॒ता पर॒ एना॒वरेण । उक्षा॒णं पृ॒श्निम् अपचन्त वीरा॒स् ता॒नि ध॒र्माणि प्रथमा॒न्य् आसन् ॥२५॥

text: Three with long tresses show in ordered season. One of them sheareth when the year is ended. One with his powers the universe regardeth. Of one the sweep is seen, but not the figure.
meaning: त्र॒यः केशि॒न ऋतुथा॒ वि॒ चक्षते संवत्सरे॒ वपत ए॒क एषाम् । वि॒श्वम् अन्यो॒ अभिच॒ष्टे श॒चीभिर् ध्रा॒जिर् ए॒कस्य ददृशे न॒ रूप॒म् ॥२६॥

text: Speech hath been measured out in four divisions: the Brāhmans who have wisdom comprehend them. Three, kept in close concealment, cause no motion. Of Speech men speak the fourth division only.
meaning: चत्वा॒रि वा॒क् प॒रिमिता पदा॒नि ता॒नि विदुर् ब्राह्मणा॒ ये॒ मनीषि॒णः । गु॒हा त्री॒णि नि॒हिता ने॒ङ्गयन्ति तुरी॒यं वाचो॒ मनुष्या॑ वदन्ति ॥२७॥

text: They call him Indra, Mitra, Varuna, Agni; and he is heavenly nobly-winged Garutmān. That which is One bards call by many a title: they call It Agni, Yama, Mātariswan.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रं मित्रं॒ व॒रुणम् अग्नि॒म् आहुर् अ॒थो दिव्यः॒ स॒ सुपर्णो॒ गरु॒त्मान् । एकं॒ स॒द् वि॒प्रा बहुधा॒ वदन्त्य् अग्निं॒ यमं॒ मातरिश्वानम् आहुः ॥२८॥ {२८}

text: Afar let her depart: away we drive her whom, made with hands, all-beautiful, Skilled men prepare and fashion like a bride amid her nuptial train.
meaning: यां॒ कल्प॒यन्ति वहतौ॒ वधू॒म् इव विश्व॒रूपां ह॒स्तकृतां चिकित्स॒वः । सा॒रा॒द् एत्व् अ॒प नुदाम एनाम् ॥१॥

text: Complete, with head and nose and ears, all-beauteous, wrought with magic skill Afar let her depart: away we drive her.
meaning: शीर्षण्व॒ती नस्व॒ती कर्णि॒णी कृत्याकृ॒ता सं॒भृता विश्व॒रूपा । सा॒रा॒द् एत्व् अ॒प नुदाम एनाम् ॥२॥

text: Made by a Sidra or a Prince, by priests or women let her go. Back to her maker as her kin, like a dame banished by her lord.
meaning: शूद्र॒कृता रा॒जकृता स्त्री॒कृता ब्रह्म॒भिः कृता॒ । जाया॒ प॒त्या नुत्ते॒व कर्ता॒रं ब॒न्ध्व् ऋछतु ॥३॥

text: I with this salutary herb have ruined all their magic arts, The spell which they have cast upon thy field, thy cattle, or thy men.
meaning: अन॒याह॒म् ओ॒षध्या स॒र्वाः कृत्या॒ अदूदुषम् । यां॒ क्षे॒त्रे चक्रु॒र् यां॒ गो॒षु यां॒ वा ते पु॒रुषेषु ॥४॥

text: Ill fall on him who doeth ill, on him who curseth fall the curse! We drive her back that she may slay the man who wrought the witchery.
meaning: अघ॒म् अस्त्व् अघकृ॒ते शप॒थः शपथीयते॒ । प्रत्य॒क् प्रतिप्र॒हिण्मो य॒था कृत्याकृ॒तं ह॒नत् ॥५॥

text: Against her comes the Angirasa, the Priest whose eye is over us. Turn back all witcheries and slay those practisers of magic arts.
meaning: प्रतीची॒न आङ्गिरसो॒ ऽध्यक्षो नः पुरो॒हितः । प्रती॒चीः कृत्या॒ आकृ॒त्यामू॒न् कृत्याकृ॒तो जहि ॥६॥

text: Whoever said to thee, Go forth against the foeman up the stream, To him, O Krityā, go thou back. Pursue not us, the sinless ones.
meaning: य॒स् त्वोवा॒च प॒रेही॒ति प्रतिकू॒लम् उदाय्य॑म् । तं॒ कृत्ये ऽभिनि॒वर्तस्व मा॒स्मा॒न् इछो अनाग॒सः ॥७॥

text: He who composed thy limbs with thought as a deft joiner builds a car, Go to him: thither lies thy way. This man is all unknown to thee.
meaning: य॒स् ते प॒रूंषि संदधौ॒ र॒थस्येव र्भु॒र् धिया॒ । तं॒ गछ त॒त्र ते॒ ऽयनम् अ॒ज्ञातस् ते ऽयं॒ ज॒नः ॥८॥

text: The cunning men, the sorcerers who fashioned thee and held thee fast,— This cures and mars their witchery, this, repellent, drives it back the way it came. With this we make thee swim.
meaning: ये॒ त्वा कृत्वा॒लेभिरे॒ विद्वला॒ अभिचारि॒णः । शंभ्व् इ॑दं॒ कृत्यादू॒षणं प्रतिवर्त्म॒ पुनःसरं॒ ते॒न त्वा स्नपयामसि ॥९॥

text: When we have found her ducked and drenched, a hapless cow whose calf hath died, Let all my woe depart and let abundant riches come to me.
meaning: य॒द् दुर्भ॒गां प्र॒स्नपितां मृत॒वत्साम् उपेयिम॒ । अ॒पैतु स॒र्वं म॒त् पापं॒ द्र॒विणं मो॒प तिष्ठतु ॥१०॥ {१}

text: If, as they gave thy parents aught, they named thee, or at sacri- fice, From all their purposed evil let these healing herbs deliver thee.
meaning: य॒त् ते पितृ॒भ्यो द॒दतो यज्ञे॒ वा ना॒म जगृहुः॒ । संदेश्या॑त् स॒र्वस्मात् पापा॒द् इमा॒ मुञ्चन्तु त्वौ॒षधीः ॥११॥

text: From mention of thy name, from sin against the Fathers or the Gods, These herbs of healing shall by prayer release thee, by power, by holy texts, the milk of .Rishis.
meaning: देवैनसा॒त् पि॒त्र्यान् नामग्राहा॒त् संदेश्या॑द् अभिनि॒ष्कृतात् । मुञ्च॒न्तु त्वा वीरु॒धो वीर्येण ब्र॒ह्मणा ऋग्भिः॒ प॒यसा ऋ॒षीणाम् ॥१२॥

text: As the wind stirs the dust from earth and drives the rain cloud from the sky, So, chased and banished by the spell, all misery departs from me.
meaning: य॒था वा॒तश् च्याव॒यति भू॒म्या रेणु॒म् अन्त॒रिक्षाच् चाभ्र॒म् । एवा॒ म॒त् स॒र्वं दुर्भूतं॒ ब्र॒ह्मनुत्तम् अ॒पायति ॥१३॥

text: Go with a resonant cry, depart, like a she-ass whose cords are loosed. Go to thy makers: hence! away! Go driven by the potent spell.
meaning: अ॒प क्राम ना॒नदती वि॒नद्धा गर्दभी॒व । कर्तृ॒̄न् नक्षस्वेतो॒ नुत्ता॒ ब्र॒ह्मणा वीर्या॑वता ॥१४॥

text: This, Krityā, is thy path, we say, and guide thee. We drive thee back who hast been sent against us. Go by this pathway, breaking loose for onslaught even as a host complete with cars and horses.
meaning: अयं॒ प॒न्थाः कृत्ये॒ति त्वा नयामो ऽभिप्र॒हितां प्र॒ति त्वा प्र॒ हिण्मः । ते॒नाभि॒ याहि भञ्जत्य् अ॒नस्वतीव वाहि॒नी विश्व॒रूपा कुरूति॒नी ॥१५॥

text: No path leads hitherward for thee to travel. Turn thee from us: far off, thy light is yonder. Fly hence across the ninety floods, the rivers most hard to pass. Begone, and be not wounded.
meaning: प॒राक् ते ज्यो॒तिर् अ॒पथं ते अर्वा॒ग् अन्य॒त्रास्म॒द् अ॒यना कृणुष्व । प॒रेणेहि नवतिं॒ नाव्या॑ अ॒ति दुर्गाः॒ स्रोत्या॒ मा॒ क्षणिष्ठाः प॒रेहि ॥१६॥

text: As wind the trees, so smite and overthrow them: leave not cow, horse, or man of them surviving Return, O Krityā, unto those who made thee. Wake them from sleep to find that they are childless.
meaning: वा॒त इव वृक्षा॒न् नि॒ मृणीहि पाद॒य मा॒ गा॒म् अ॒श्वं पु॒रुषम् उ॒च् छिष एषाम् । कर्तृ॒̄न् निवृ॒त्येतः॒ कृत्ये ऽप्रजास्त्वा॒य बोधय ॥१७॥

text: The charm or secret power which they have buried for thee in sacred grass, field, cemetery, Or spell in household fire which men more cunning have wrought against thee innocent and simple,—
meaning: यां॒ ते बर्हि॒षि यां॒ श्मशाने॒ क्षे॒त्रे कृत्यां॒ वलगं॒ वा निचख्नुः॒ । अग्नौ॒ वा त्वा गा॒र्हपत्ये ऽभिचेरुः॒ पा॒कं स॒न्तं धी॒रतरा अनाग॒सम् ॥१८॥

text: That tool of hatred, understood, made ready, stealthy and buried deep, have we discovered, Let that go back to whence it came, turn thither like a horse and kill the children of the sorcerer.
meaning: उपा॒हृतम् अ॒नुबुद्धं नि॒खातं वै॒रं त्सार्य् अ॒न्व् अविदाम क॒र्त्रम् । त॒द् एतु य॒त आ॒भृतं त॒त्रा॒श्व इव वि॒ वर्ततां ह॒न्तु कृत्याकृ॒तः प्रजा॒म् ॥१९॥

text: Within our house are swords of goodly iron. Krityā, we know thy joints and all their places. Arise this instant and begone! What, stranger! art thou seek- ing here?
meaning: स्वायसा॒ अस॒यः सन्ति नो गृहे॒ विद्मा॒ ते कृत्ये यतिधा॒ प॒रूंषि । उ॒त् तिष्ठैव॒ प॒रेहीतो॒ ऽज्ञाते कि॒म् इहे॒छसि ॥२०॥ {२}

text: O Krityā, I will cut thy throat and hew thy feet off. Run, be- gone! Indra and Agni, Guardian Lords of living creatures, shield us well!
meaning: ग्रीवा॒स् ते कृत्ये पा॒दौ चा॒पि कर्त्स्यामि नि॒र् द्रव । इन्द्राग्नी॒ अस्मा॒न् रक्षतां यौ॒ प्रजा॒नां प्रजा॒वती ॥२१॥

text: May Soma, gracious friend, imperial Sovran, and the world's Masters look on us with favour.
meaning: सो॒मो रा॒जाधिपा॒ मृडिता॒ च भूत॒स्य नः प॒तयो मृडयन्तु ॥२२॥

text: Bhava and Sarva cast the flash of lightning, the weapon of the Gods, against the sinner who made the evil thing, who deals in witchcraft!
meaning: भवाशर्वा॒व् अस्यतां पापकृ॒ते कृत्याकृ॒ते । दुष्कृ॒ते विद्यु॒तं देवहेति॒म् ॥२३॥
