meaning: प्रथमे॒न प्रमारे॒ण त्रेधा॒ वि॒ष्वङ् वि॒ गछति । अद॒ ए॒केन ग॒छत्य् अद॒ ए॒केन गछतीहै॒केन नि॒ षेवते ॥३३॥

text: In the primeval waters cold the body is deposited. In this there is the power of growth: from this is power of growth declared.
meaning: अप्सु॒ स्तीमा॒सु वृद्धा॒सु श॒रीरम् अन्तरा॒ हित॒म् । त॒स्मिं छ॒वो॒ ऽध्य् अन्तरा॒ त॒स्माच् छ॒वो॒ ऽध्य् उच्यते ॥३४॥ {२४}

text: All arms and every arrow, all the power and might that bows possess, The warlike weapon, axes, swords, the plan and purpose in the heart, All this, O Arbudi, make thou visible to our enemies, and let them look on mist and fog.
meaning: ये॒ बाह॒वो या॒ इ॒षवो ध॒न्वनां वीर्या॑णि च । असी॒न् परशू॒न् आ॒युधं चित्ताकूतं॒ च य॒द् धृदि॒ । स॒र्वं त॒द् अर्बुदे त्व॒म् अमि॒त्रेभ्यो दृशे॒ कुरूदारां॒श् च प्र॒ दर्शय ॥१॥

text: Arise ye and prepare yourselves: ye, the celestial hosts, are friends. Let your mysterious natures be seen by our friends O Arbudi.
meaning: उ॒त् तिष्ठत सं॒ नह्यध्वं मि॒त्रा दे॒वजना यूय॒म् । सं॒दृष्टा गुप्ता॒ वः सन्तु या॒ नो मित्रा॒ण्य् अर्बुदे ॥२॥

text: Rise both of you: begin your work with fettering and binding. fast, Assail, both of you, Arbudi, the armies of our enemies.
meaning: उ॒त् तिष्ठतम् आ॒ रभेताम् आदानसंदाना॒भ्याम् । अमि॒त्राणां से॒ना अभि॒ धत्तम् अर्बुदे ॥३॥

text: The God whose name is Arbudi, and Nyarbudi the Mighty One, The two by whom the air and this great earth are compassed and possessed, With these two friends of Indra I go forth to conquer with the host.
meaning: अ॒र्बुदिर् ना॒म यो॒ देव॒ ई॒शानश् च न्य॑र्बुदिः । या॒भ्याम् अन्त॒रिक्षम् आ॒वृतम् इयं॒ च पृथिवी॒ मही॒ । ता॒भ्याम् इ॒न्द्रमेदिभ्याम् अहं॒ जित॒म् अ॒न्व् एमि से॒नया ॥४॥

text: Rise with our army stand thou up. O Godlike Being, Arbudi. Breaking the hosts of enemies, surround them with thy winding coils.
meaning: उ॒त् तिष्ठ त्वं॒ देवजना॒र्बुदे से॒नया सह॒ । भञ्ज॒न्न् अमि॒त्राणां से॒नां भोगे॒भिः प॒रि वारय ॥५॥

text: Exhibiting, O Arbudi, seven children of the mist and fog, When butter hath been offered, rise with all of these and with the host.
meaning: सप्त॒ जाता॒न् न्य॑र्बुद उदारा॒णां समीक्ष॒यन् । ते॒भिष् ट्व॒म् आ॒ज्ये हुते॒ स॒र्वैर् उ॒त् तिष्ठ से॒नया ॥६॥

text: Beating her breast, with tearful face, let the short-earned, the wild-haired hag. Shriek loudly when a man is slain, pierced through by thee, O Arbudi;
meaning: प्रतिघ्नाना॒श्रुमुखी॒ कृधुकर्णी॒ च क्रोशतु । विकेशी॒ पु॒रुषे हते॒ रदिते॒ अर्बुदे त॒व ॥७॥

text: Snatching away the vertebra, while with her thought she seeks her son, Her husband, brother, kin, when one, Arbudi! hath been pierc- ed by thee.
meaning: संक॒र्षन्ती करू॒करं म॒नसा पुत्र॒म् इछ॒न्ती । प॒तिं भ्रा॒तरम् आ॒त् स्वा॒न् रदिते॒ अर्बुदे त॒व ॥८॥

text: Let vultures, ravens, kites, and crows, and every carrion-eating bird. Feast on our foes, and show where one, Arbudi! hath been pierced by thee.
meaning: अलि॒क्लवा जाष्कमदा॒ गृ॒ध्राः श्येनाः॒ पतत्रि॒णः । ध्वा॒ङ्क्षाः शकु॒नयस् तृप्यन्त्व् अमि॒त्रेषु समीक्ष॒यन् रदिते॒ अर्बुदे त॒व ॥९॥

text: Then let each greedy beast of prey, and fly and worm regale itself Upon the human corpse where one, Arbudi, hath been pierced by thee.
meaning: अ॒थो स॒र्वं श्वा॒पदं म॒क्षिका तृप्यतु क्रि॒मिः । पौ॒रुषेये॒ ऽधि कु॒णपे रदिते॒ अर्बुदे त॒व ॥१०॥ {२५}

text: Attack them, both of you; bear off their vital breath O Nyar- budi. Let mingled shouts and echoing cries of woe amid our foemen show where thou, O Arbudi, hast pierced
meaning: आ॒ गृह्णीतं सं॒ बृहतं प्राणापाना॒न् न्यर्बुदे । निवाशा॒ घो॒षाः सं॒ यन्त्व् अमि॒त्रेषु समीक्ष॒यन् रदिते॒ अर्बुदे त॒व ॥११॥

text: Shake them, and let them sink with fear: e'erwhelm our enemies with dread. With widely-grasping bends of arm, O Arbudi, crush down our foes.
meaning: उ॒द् वेपय सं॒ विजन्तां भिया॒मि॒त्रान्त् सं॒ सृज । उरुग्राहै॒र् बाह्वङ्कै॒र् वि॒ध्यामि॒त्रान् न्यर्बुदे ॥१२॥

text: Let those mens' arms grow faint and weak, dull be the purpose of their heart; And let not aught of them be left when thou, O Arbudi, hast pierced.
meaning: मु॒ह्यन्त्व् एषां बाह॒वश् चित्ताकूतं॒ च य॒द् धृदि॒ । मै॒षाम् उ॒च् छेषि किं॒ चन॒ रदिते॒ अर्बुदे त॒व ॥१३॥

text: Self-smiting, beating breast and thigh, careless of unguent, with their hair dishevelled, weeping, hags shall run together, when a man is slain, when thou, O Arbudi, hast pierced.
meaning: प्रतिघ्नानाः॒ सं॒ धावन्तू॒रः पटौरा॒व् आघ्नानाः॒ । अघारि॒णीर् विकेश्यो॑ रुदत्यः॑ पु॒रुषे हते॒ रदिते॒ अर्बुदे त॒व ॥१४॥

text: Apsarases with dog-like mates, and Rūpakās, O Arbudi, And her who licks the cup inside, and seeks to wound in ill- kept place, All these, O Arbudi, do thou make visible to our enemies and let them look on mists and fog.
meaning: श्व॑न्वतीर् अप्सर॒सो रू॒पका उता॒र्बुदे । अन्तःपात्रे॒ रे॒रिहतीं रिशां॒ दुर्णिहितैषि॒णीम् । स॒र्वास् ता॒ अर्बुदे त्व॒म् अमि॒त्रेभ्यो दृशे॒ कुरूदारां॒श् च प्र॒ दर्शय ॥१५॥

text: The fiend who creeps upon the sword, maimed, dwelling where Lthe wounded lie, The misty shapes that lurk concealed, Gandharvas and Apsara- ses, demons, and snakes and Other Folk;
meaning: खडू॒रे ऽधिचङ्क्रमां॒ ख॒र्विकां खर्ववासि॒नीम् । य॒ उदारा॒ अन्त॒र्हिता गन्धर्वाप्सर॒सश् च ये॒ । सर्पा॒ इतरजना॒ र॒क्षांसि ॥१६॥

text: Armed with four fangs and yellow teeth, deformed, with faces smeared with blood, the terrible and fearless ones,
meaning: च॒तुर्दंष्ट्रां छ्याव॒दतः कुम्भ॒मुष्कां अ॒सृङ्मुखान् । स्वभ्यसा॒ ये॒ चोद्भ्यसाः॒ ॥१७॥

text: Make thou, O Arbudi, those wings of hostile armies quake with dread. Let Conqueror and Victor, friends of Indra, overcome our foes.
meaning: उ॒द् वेपय त्व॒म् अर्बुदे ऽमि॒त्राणाम् अमूः॒ सि॒चः । ज॒यंश् च जिष्णु॒श् चामि॒त्रां ज॒यताम् इ॒न्द्रमेदिनौ ॥१८॥

text: Stifled and crushed, O Nyarbudi, low let the smitten foeman lie. With tongue of fire and crest of smoke go conquering maidens with our host!
meaning: प्र॒ब्लीनो मृदितः॒ शयां हतो॑ ऽमि॒त्रो न्यर्बुदे । अग्निजिह्वा॒ धूमशिखा॒ ज॒यन्तीर् यन्तु से॒नया ॥१९॥

text: May Indra, Lord of Might, strike down each bravest warrior of the foes, Whom this our band hath put to flight: let not one man of those escape.
meaning: त॒यार्बुदे प्र॒णुत्तानाम् इ॒न्द्रो हन्तु व॒रंवरम् । अमि॒त्राणां श॒चीप॒तिर् मा॒मी॒षां मोचि क॒श् चन॒ ॥२०॥ {२६}

text: Let their hearts burst asunder, let their breath fly up and pass away. Let dryness of the mouth o'ertake our foemen, not the friendly ones.
meaning: उ॒त् कसन्तु हृ॒दयान्य् ऊर्ध्वः॒ प्राण॒ उ॒द् ईषतु । शौष्कास्य॒म् अ॒नु वर्तताम् अमि॒त्रान् मो॒त॒ मित्रि॒णः ॥२१॥

text: The clever and the foolish ones, those who are twisted round, the deaf, The dusky-hued, the hornless goats and those whose voice is like the buck's, All these, O Arbudi, do thou make visible to our enemies: cause them to look on mists and fog.
meaning: ये॒ च धी॒रा ये॒ चा॒धीराः प॒राञ्चो बधिरा॒श् च ये॒ । तमसा॒ ये॒ च तूपरा॒ अ॒थो बस्ताभिवासि॒नः । स॒र्वांस् तां॒ अर्बुदे त्व॒म् अमि॒त्रेभ्यो दृशे॒ कुरूदारां॒श् च प्र॒ दर्शय ॥२२॥

text: Arbudi and Trishandhi fall upon our foes and scatter them, So that, O Indra, Lord of Might, Slayer of Vritra, we may kill thousands of these our enemies!
meaning: अ॒र्बुदिश् च त्रि॒षन्धिश् चामि॒त्रान् नो वि॒ विध्यताम् । य॒थैषाम् इन्द्र वृत्रहन् ह॒नाम शचीपते ऽमि॒त्राणां सहस्रशः॒ ॥२३॥

text: Tall trees, and those who live in woods, the herbs and creeping plants of Earth, Gandharvas, and Apsarases, Snakes, [] Beings, Fathers, Gods, All these do thou, O Arbudi, make visible to our enemies: cause them to look on mists and fog.
meaning: व॒नस्प॒तीन् वानस्पत्या॒न् ओ॒षधीर् उत॒ वीरु॒धः । गन्धर्वाप्सर॒सः सर्पा॒न् देवा॒न् पुण्यजना॒न् पितृ॒̄न् । स॒र्वांस् तां॒ अर्बुदे त्व॒म् अमि॒त्रेभ्यो दृशे॒ कुरूदारां॒श् च प्र॒ दर्शय ॥२४॥

text: High sway have Maruts, and the God Āditya, Brāhmanaspati, High sway have Indra, Agni, and Dilator, Mitra, Prajāpati, High sway have Rishis given to you, showing upon our enemies where thou, O Arbudi, hast pierced.
meaning: ईशां॒ वो मरु॒तो देव॒ आदित्यो॒ ब्र॒ह्मणस्प॒तिः । ईशां॒ व इ॒न्द्रश् चाग्नि॒श् च धाता॒ मित्रः॒ प्रजा॒पतिः । ईशां॒ व ऋ॒षयश् चक्रुर् अमि॒त्रेषु समीक्ष॒यन् रदिते॒ अर्बुदे त॒व ॥२५॥

text: With full dominion over these, rise, stand ye up, prepare your- selves, Ye are our friends, celestial hosts. When ye have won this battle, go, each to his several sphere, apart.
meaning: ते॒षां स॒र्वेषाम् ई॒शाना उ॒त् तिष्ठत सं॒ नह्यध्वम् । मि॒त्रा दे॒वजना यूय॒म् इमं॒ संग्रामं॒ संजि॒त्य यथालोकं॒ वि॒ तिष्ठध्वम् ॥२६॥ {२७}

text: Rise up, with all your banners rise; prepare your strength, ye vapoury Forms! Serpents and fiends and Other Folk, charge and pursue our enemies!
meaning: उ॒त् तिष्ठत सं॒ नह्यध्वम् उ॒दाराः केतु॒भिः सह॒ । स॒र्पा इ॒तरजना र॒क्षांस्य् अमि॒त्रान् अ॒नु धावत ॥१॥

text: Let those who bear an evil name, in air, in heaven on earth, and men, After Trishandhi's will, revere your power, the sway that Know- ledge gives, together with your ruddy flags.
meaning: ईशां॒ वो वेद रा॒ज्यं त्रि॒षन्धे अरुणैः॒ केतु॒भिः सह॒ । ये॒ अन्त॒रिक्षे ये॒ दिवि॒ पृथिव्यां॒ ये॒ च मानवाः॒ । त्रि॒षन्धेस् ते॒ चे॒तसि दुर्णा॒मान उ॒पासताम् ॥२॥

text: Let those with iron faces, with faces like needles or like combs, Flesh-eaters, rapid as the wind, cling closely to our foemen with Trishandhi for their thunderbolt.
meaning: अ॒योमुखाः सूची॒मुखा अ॒थो विकङ्कती॒मुखाः । क्रव्या॒दो वा॒तरंहस आ॒ सजन्त्व् अमि॒त्रान् व॒ज्रेण त्रि॒षन्धिना ॥३॥

text: Omniscient Āditya, make full many a corpse to disappear. Let this devoted army of Trishandhi be in my control.
meaning: अन्त॒र् धेहि जातवेद आ॒दित्य कु॒णपं बहु॒ । त्रि॒षन्धेर् इयं॒ से॒ना सु॒हितास्तु मे व॒शे ॥४॥

text: Rise up, O Godlike Being, rise, Arbudi, with thine army: this, Tribute is sacrificed to thee, Trishandhi's welcome offering
meaning: उ॒त् तिष्ठ त्वं॒ देवजना॒र्बुदे से॒नया सह॒ । अयं॒ बलि॒र् व आ॒हुतस् त्रि॒षन्धेर् आ॒हुतिः प्रिया॒ ॥५॥

text: May this four-footed White-foot, may this arrow brace and bind thee fast: Together with Trishandhi's host, be thou, O Witchcraft, meant for foes.
meaning: शितिपदी॒ सं॒ द्यतु शरव्ये॑यं॒ च॒तुष्पदी । कृ॒त्ये ऽमि॒त्रेभ्यो भव त्रि॒षन्धेः सह॒ से॒नया ॥६॥

text: Down let the dim-eyed demon fly, and let her shorteared sister shriek: Red be the banners when the host of Arbudi hath won the day.
meaning: धूमाक्षी॒ सं॒ पततु कृधुकर्णी॒ च क्रोशतु । त्रि॒षन्धेः से॒नया जिते॒ अरुणाः॒ सन्तु केत॒वः ॥७॥

text: Let all the birds that move on wings come downward, all fowls that roam the heavens and air's midregion. Let beasts of prey and flies attacks, and vultures that eat raw flesh mangle and gnaw the carcase.
meaning: अ॒वायन्तां पक्षि॒णो ये॒ व॒यांस्य् अन्त॒रिक्षे दिवि॒ ये॒ च॒रन्ति । श्वा॒पदो म॒क्षिकाः सं॒ रभन्ताम् आमा॒दो गृ॒ध्राः कु॒णपे रदन्ताम् ॥८॥

text: By that same binding treaty which thou madest, Brihaspati! with Indra! and with Brahma, By Indra's pledge I bid the Gods come hither. Conquer on this side, not on their side yonder.
meaning: या॒म् इ॒न्द्रेण संधां॒ सम॒धत्था ब्र॒ह्मणा च बृहस्पते । त॒याह॒म् इन्द्रसंध॒या स॒र्वान् देवा॒न् इह॒ हुव इतो॒ जयत मा॒मु॒तः ॥९॥

text: Brihaspati Angirasa, Rishis made strong and keen by prayer, Have set Trishandhi in the heaven, dire weapon that destroys the fiends.
meaning: बृ॒हस्प॒तिर् आङ्गिरस॒ ऋ॒षयो ब्र॒ह्मसंशिताः । असुरक्ष॒यणं वधं॒ त्रि॒षन्धिं दिव्य् आ॒श्रयन् ॥१०॥ {२८}

text: The Gods enjoyed Trishandhi for the sake of energy and power, Him under whose protection, both, Indra and yon Āditya stand.
meaning: ये॒नासौ॒ गुप्त॒ आदित्य॒ उभा॒व् इ॒न्द्रश् च ति॒ष्ठतः । त्रि॒षन्धिं देवा॒ अभजन्तौ॒जसे च ब॒लाय च ॥११॥

text: The Gods, victorious, won themselves all worlds by this oblation, which Brihaspati Angirasa effused, a very thunderbolt, a weapon to destory the friends.
meaning: स॒र्वांल् लोका॒न्त् स॒म् अजयन् देवा॒ आ॒हुत्यान॒या । बृ॒हस्प॒तिर् आङ्गिरसो॒ व॒ज्रं य॒म् अ॒सिञ्चतासुरक्ष॒यणं वध॒म् ॥१२॥

text: That fiend-destroying weapon which Brihaspati Angirasa poured out and made a thunderbolt. Even therewith, Brihaspati, I brush that hostile armament, and strike the foemen down with might.
meaning: बृ॒हस्प॒तिर् आङ्गिरसो॒ व॒ज्रं य॒म् अ॒सिञ्चतासुरक्ष॒यणं वध॒म् । ते॒नाह॒म् अमूं॒ से॒नां नि॒ लिम्पामि बृहस्पते ऽमि॒त्रान् हन्म्य् ओ॒जसा ॥१३॥

text: Over to us come all the Gods who eat the hallowed sacrifice With this oblation be ye pleased: conquer on this side, not on that.
meaning: स॒र्वे देवा॒ अत्या॒यन्ति ये॒ अश्न॒न्ति व॒षट्कृतम् । इमां॒ जुषध्वम् आ॒हुतिम् इतो॒ जयत मा॒मु॒तः ॥१४॥

text: Over,to us let all Gods come: dear is Trishandhi's offering. Keen the great pledge through which, of old, the Asuras were overthrown.
meaning: स॒र्वे देवा॒ अत्या॒यन्तु त्रि॒षन्धेर् आ॒हुतिः प्रिया॒ । संधां॒ महतीं॒ रक्षत य॒या॒ग्रे अ॒सुरा जिताः॒ ॥१५॥

text: Let Vāyu bend the arrow-points of those who are our enemies. Let Indra break their arms away: no power to lay the shaft be theirs! Āditya utterly destroy their missile! Chandramās bar the path of him who lingers!
meaning: वायु॒र् अमि॒त्राणाम् इष्वग्रा॒ण्य् आ॒ञ्चतु । इ॒न्द्र एषां बाहू॒न् प्र॒ति भनक्तु मा॒ शकन् प्रतिधा॒म् इ॒षुम् । आदित्य॒ एषाम् अस्त्रं॒ वि॒ नाशयतु चन्द्र॒मा युताम् अ॒गतस्य प॒न्थाम् ॥१६॥

text: If they have issued forth strongholds of Gods, and made their shields of prayer, Gaining protection for their lives, protection round about, make all their instigation powerless
meaning: य॒दि प्रेयु॒र् देवपुरा॒ ब्र॒ह्म व॒र्माणि चक्रिरे॒ । तनूपा॒नं परिपा॒णं कृण्वाना॒ य॒द् उपोचिरे॒ स॒र्वं त॒द् अरसं॒ कृधि ॥१७॥

text: With the Flesh-eater and with Death, following the Purohita, On! forward with Trishandhi's host! conquering enemies advance!
meaning: क्रव्या॒दानुवर्त॒यन् मृत्यु॒ना च पुरो॒हितम् । त्रि॒षन्धे प्रे॒हि से॒नया ज॒यामि॒त्रान् प्र॒ पद्यस्व ॥१८॥

text: Do thou, Trishandhi, with the gloom of darkness compass round our foes; Let none escape of them expelled with speckled butter mixt with curds.
meaning: त्रि॒षन्धे त॒मसा त्व॒म् अमि॒त्रान् प॒रि वारय । पृषदाज्य॒प्रणुत्तानां मा॒मी॒षां मोचि क॒श् चन॒ ॥१९॥

text: Let White-foot fall upon those wings of our opponents' arma- ment; Mazed and bewildered be those hands of foes this day, O Nyar- budi.
meaning: शितिपदी॒ सं॒ पतत्व् अमि॒त्राणाम् अमूः॒ सि॒चः । मु॒ह्यन्त्व् अद्या॒मूः॒ से॒ना अमि॒त्राणां न्यर्बुदे ॥२०॥ {२९}

text: Mazed are the foemen, Nyarbudi! Slay thou each bravest man of them: with this our army slaughter them.
meaning: मूढा॒ अमि॒त्रा न्यर्बुदे जह्य् ए॑षां व॒रंवरम् । अन॒या जहि से॒नया ॥२१॥

text: Low lie the warrior, mailed, unmailed, each foeman in the rush of war. Down-smitten with the strings of bows, the fastenings of mail, the charge!
meaning: य॒श् च कवची॒ य॒श् चाकवचो॑ ऽमि॒त्रो य॒श् चा॒ज्मनि । ज्यापाशैः॒ कवचपाशै॒र् अ॒ज्मनाभि॒हतः शयाम् ॥२२॥

text: The armour-clad, the armourless, enemies clothed with coats of mail, All these struck down, O Arbudi, let dogs devour upon the earth.
meaning: ये॒ वर्मि॒णो ये॑ ऽवर्मा॒णो अमि॒त्रा ये॒ च वर्मि॒णः । स॒र्वांस् तां॒ अर्बुदे हतां॒ छ्वा॒नो ऽदन्तु भू॒म्याम् ॥२३॥

text: Car-borne and carless fighting men, riders and those who go on foot, All these, struck down, let vultures, kites, and all, the birds of air devour.
meaning: ये॒ रथि॒नो ये॒ अरथा॒ असादा॒ ये॒ च सादि॒नः । स॒र्वान् अदन्तु ता॒न् हता॒न् गृ॒ध्राः श्येनाः॒ पतत्रि॒णः ॥२४॥

text: Low let the hostile army lie, thousands of corpses, on the ground, Pierced through and rent to pieces where the deadly weapons clash in fight.
meaning: सह॒स्रकुणपा शेताम् आमित्री॒ से॒ना समरे॒ वधा॒नाम् । वि॒विद्धा ककजा॒कृता ॥२५॥

text: With eagles let them eat the evil-hearted, pierced in the vitals, lying crushed and howling. The foe whoe'er will fight against this our protecting sacrifice.
meaning: मर्मावि॒धं रो॒रुवतं सुपर्णै॒र् अद॒न्तु दुश्चि॒तं मृदितं॒ श॒यानम् । य॒ इमां॒ प्रती॒चीम् आ॒हुतिम् अमि॒त्रो नो यु॒युत्सति ॥२६॥

text: With this which Gods attend, with this which never fails to gain its end, Let Indra, Vritra-slayer, smite, and with Trishandhi as a bolt.
meaning: यां॒ देवा॒ अनुति॒ष्ठन्ति य॒स्या ना॒स्ति विरा॒धनम् । त॒ये॒न्द्रो हन्तु वृत्रहा॒ व॒ज्रेण त्रि॒षन्धिना ॥२७॥ {३०}

text: Truth, high and potent Law, the Consecrating Rite, Fervour, Brahma, and Sacrifice uphold the Earth. May she, the Queen of all that is and is to be, may Prithivī make ample space and room for us.
meaning: सत्यं॒ बृह॒द् ऋत॒म् उग्रं॒ दीक्षा॒ त॒पो ब्र॒ह्म यज्ञः॒ पृथिवीं॒ धारयन्ति । सा॒ नो भूत॒स्य भ॒व्यस्य प॒त्न्य् उरुं॒ लोकं॒ पृथिवी॒ नः कृणोतु ॥१॥

text: Not over awded by the crowd of Manu's sons, she who hath many heights and floods and level plains; She who bears plants endowed with many varied powers, may Prithivī for us spread wide and favour us.
meaning: असंबाधं॒ मध्यतो॒ मानवा॒नां य॒स्या उद्व॒तः प्रव॒तः समं॒ बहु॒ । ना॒नावीर्या ओ॒षधीर् या॒ बि॒भर्ति पृथिवी॒ नः प्रथतां रा॒ध्यतां नः ॥२॥

text: In whom the sea, and Sindhu, and the waters, in whom our food and corn-lands had their being, In whom this all that breathes and moves is active, this Earth. assign us foremost rank and station!
meaning: य॒स्यां समुद्र॒ उत॒ सि॒न्धुर् आ॒पो य॒स्याम् अ॒न्नं कृष्ट॒यः संबभूवुः॒ । य॒स्याम् इदं॒ जि॒न्वति प्राण॒द् ए॒जत् सा॒ नो भू॒मिः पूर्वपे॒ये दधातु ॥३॥

text: She who is Lady of the earth's four regions, in whom our food and corn-lands had their being, Nurse in each place of breathing, moving creatures, this Earth. vouchsafe us kine with milk that fails not!
meaning: य॒स्याश् च॒तस्रः प्रदि॒शः पृथिव्या॒ य॒स्याम् अ॒न्नम् कृष्ट॒यः संबभूवुः॒ । या॒ बि॒भर्ति बहुधा॒ प्राण॒द् ए॒जत् सा॒ नो भू॒मिर् गो॒ष्व् अ॒प्य् अ॒न्ने दधातु ॥४॥

text: On whom the men of old before us battled, on whom the Gods attacked the hostile demons, The varied home of bird, and kine and horses, this Prithivī vouchsafe us luck and splendour!
meaning: य॒स्यां पू॒र्वे पूर्वजना॒ विचक्रिरे॒ य॒स्यां देवा॒ अ॒सुरान् अभ्य॒वर्तयन् । ग॒वाम् अ॒श्वानां व॒यसश् च विष्ठा॒ भ॒गं व॒र्चः पृथिवी॒ नो दधातु ॥५॥

text: Firm standing-place, all-bearing, store of treasures, gold-breasted, harbourer of all that moveth. May Earth who bears Agni Vaisvānara, Consort of mighty Indra, give us great possessions
meaning: विश्वंभरा॒ वसुधा॒नी प्रतिष्ठा॒ हि॒रण्यवक्षा ज॒गतो निवे॒शनी । वैश्वानरं॒ बि॒भ्रती भू॒मिर् अग्नि॒म् इ॒न्द्रऋषभा द्र॒विणे नो दधातु ॥६॥

text: May Earth, may Prithivī, always protected with ceaseless care by Gods who never slumber, May she pour out for us delicious nectar, may she bedew us with a flood of splendour.
meaning: यां॒ र॒क्षन्त्य् अस्वप्ना॒ विश्वदा॒नीं देवा॒ भू॒मिं पृथिवी॒म् अ॒प्रमादम् । सा॒ नो म॒धु प्रियं॒ दुहाम् अ॒थो उक्षतु व॒र्चसा ॥७॥

text: She who at first was water in the ocean, whom with their wond- rous powers the sages followed, May she whose heart is in the highest heaven, compassed about wit h truth, and everlasting, May she, this Earth, bestow upon us lustre, and grant us power in loftiest dominion.
meaning: या॒र्णवे॒ ऽधि सलिल॒म् अ॒ग्र आ॒सीत् यां॒ माया॒भिर् अन्व॒चरन् मनीषि॒णः । य॒स्या हृ॒दयं परमे॒ व्यो॑मन्त् सत्ये॒ना॒वृतम् अमृ॒तं पृथिव्याः॒ । सा॒ नो भू॒मिस् त्वि॒षिं ब॒लं राष्ट्रे॒ दधातूत्तमे॒ ॥८॥

text: On whom the running universal waters flow day and night with never-ceasing motion, May she with many streams pour milk to feed us, may she bedew us with a flood of splendour.
meaning: य॒स्याम् आ॒पः परिचराः॒ समानी॒र् अहोरात्रे॒ अ॒प्रमादं क्ष॒रन्ति । सा॒ नो भू॒मिर् भू॒रिधारा प॒यो दुहाम् अ॒थो उक्षतु व॒र्चसा ॥९॥

text: She whom the Asvins measured out, o'er whom the foot of Vishnu strode, Whom Indra, Lord of Power and Might, freed from all foemen for himself, May Earth pour out her milk for us, a mother unto me her son.
meaning: या॒म् अश्वि॒नाव् अ॒मिमातां वि॒ष्णुर् य॒स्यां विचक्रमे॒ । इ॒न्द्रो यां॒ चक्र॒ आत्म॒ने ऽनमित्रां॒ श॒चीप॒तिः । सा॒ नो भू॒मिर् वि॒ सृजतां माता॒ पुत्रा॒य मे प॒यः ॥१०॥ {१}

text: O Prithivī, auspicious be thy woodlands, auspicious be thy hills and snow-clad mountains. Unslain, unwounded, unsubdued, I have set foot upon the Earth, On earth brown, black, ruddy and every-coloured, on the firm earth that Indra guards from danger.
meaning: गिर॒यस् ते प॒र्वता हिम॒वन्तो॒ ऽरण्यं ते पृथिवि स्योन॒म् अस्तु । बभ्रुं॒ कृष्णां॒ रो॒हिणीं विश्व॒रूपां ध्रुवां॒ भू॒मिं पृथिवी॒म् इ॒न्द्रगुप्ताम् । अ॒जीतो॒ ऽहतो अ॒क्षतो॒ ऽध्य् अष्ठाम् पृथिवी॒म् अ॒हम् ॥११॥

text: O Prithivī, thy centre and thy navel, all forces that have issued from thy body Set us amid those forces; breathe upon us. I am the son of Earth, Earth is my Mother. Parjanya is my Sire; may he promote me.
meaning: य॒त् ते म॒ध्यं पृथिवि य॒च् च न॒भ्यं या॒स् त ऊ॒र्जस् तन्वः॑ संबभूवुः॒ । ता॒सु नो धेह्य् अभि॒ नः पवस्व माता॒ भू॒मिः पुत्रो॒ अहं॒ पृथिव्याः॒ पर्ज॒न्यः पिता॒ स॒ उ नः पिपर्तु ॥१२॥

text: Earth on whose surface they enclose the altar, and all-performers spin the thread of worship; In whom the stakes of sacrifice, resplendent, are fixed and raised on high before the oblation, may she, this Earth, prospering, make us prosper.
meaning: य॒स्यां वे॒दिं परिगृह्ण॒न्ति भू॒म्यां य॒स्यां यज्ञं॒ तन्व॒ते विश्व॒कर्माणः । य॒स्यां मीय॒न्ते स्व॒रवः पृथिव्या॒म् ऊर्ध्वाः॒ शुक्रा॒ आ॒हुत्याः पुर॒स्तात् । सा॒ नो भू॒मिर् वर्धयद् व॒र्धमाना ॥१३॥

text: The man who hates us, Earth! who fights against us, who threaten us with thought or deadly weapon, make him our thrall as thou hast done aforetime.
meaning: यो॒ नो द्वे॒षत् पृथिवि यः॒ पृतन्या॒द् यो॒ ऽभिदा॒सान् म॒नसा यो॒ वधे॒न । तं॒ नो भूमे रन्धय पूर्वकृत्वरि ॥१४॥

text: Produced from thee, on thee move mortal creatures: thou bearest them, both quadruped and biped. Thine, Prithivī, are these Five human Races, for whom, though mortal, Sūrya as he rises spreads with his rays the light that is immortal.
meaning: त्व॒ज् जाता॒स् त्व॒यि चरन्ति म॒र्त्यास् त्वं॒ बिभर्षि द्विप॒दस् त्वं॒ च॒तुष्पदः । त॒वेमे॒ पृथिवि प॒ञ्च मानवा॒ ये॒भ्यो ज्यो॒तिर् अमृ॒तं म॒र्त्येभ्य उद्य॒न्त् सू॒र्यो रश्मि॒भिर् आतनो॒ति ॥१५॥

text: In concert may these creatures yield us blessings. With honey of discourse, O Earth, endow me.
meaning: ता॒ नः प्रजाः॒ सं॒ दुह्रतां समग्रा॒ वाचो॒ म॒धु पृथिवि धेहि म॒ह्यम् ॥१६॥

text: Kind, ever gracious be the Earth we tread on, the firm Earth, Prithivī, borne up by Order, mother of plants and herbs, the all-producer.
meaning: विश्वस्वं॑ मात॒रम् ओ॒षधीनां ध्रुवां॒ भू॒मिं पृथिवीं॒ ध॒र्मणा धृता॒म् । शिवां॒ स्योना॒म् अ॒नु चरेम विश्व॒हा ॥१७॥

text: A vast abode hast thou become, the Mighty. Great stress is on thee, press and agitation, but with unceasing care great Indra guards thee. So make us shine, O Earth, us with the splendour of gold. Let no man look on us with hatred.
meaning: मह॒त् सध॒स्थं महती॒ बभू॒विथ महा॒न् वे॒ग एज॒थुर् वेप॒थुष् टे । महां॒स् त्वे॒न्द्रो रक्षत्य् अ॒प्रमादम् । सा॒ नो भूमे प्र॒ रोचय हि॒रण्यस्येव संदृ॒शि मा॒ नो द्विक्षत क॒श् चन॒ ॥१८॥

text: Agni is in the earth, in plants; the waters hold Agni in them, in the stones is Agni. Agni abideth deep in men: Agnis abide in cows and steeds.
meaning: अग्नि॒र् भू॒म्याम् ओ॒षधीष्व् अग्नि॒म् आ॒पो बिभ्रत्य् अग्नि॒र् अ॒श्मसु । अग्नि॒र् अन्तः॒ पु॒रुषेषु गो॒ष्व् अ॒श्वेष्व् अग्न॒यः ॥१९॥

text: Agni gives shine and heat in heaven: the spacious air is his, the God's Lover of fatness, bearer of oblation, men enkindle him.
meaning: अग्नि॒र् दिव॒ आ॒ तपत्य् अग्ने॒र् देव॒स्योर्व् अ॑न्त॒रिक्षम् । अग्निं॒ म॒र्तास इन्धते हव्यवा॒हं घृतप्रि॒यम् ॥२०॥ {२}

text: Dark-kneed, invested with a fiery mantle, Prithivī sharpen me and give me splendour!
meaning: अग्नि॒वासाः पृथिव्य् अ॑सितज्ञू॒स् त्वि॒षीमन्तं सं॒शितं मा कृणोतु ॥२१॥

text: On earth they offer sacrifice and dressed oblation to the Gods. Men, mortals, live upon the earth by food in their accustomed way. May that Earth grant us breath and vital power. Prithivī give me life of long duration!
meaning: भू॒म्यां देवे॒भ्यो ददति यज्ञं॒ हव्य॒म् अ॒रंकृतम् । भू॒म्यां मनुष्या॑ जीवन्ति स्वध॒या॒न्नेन म॒र्त्याः । सा॒ नो भू॒मिः प्राण॒म् आ॒युर् दधातु जर॒दष्टिं मा पृथिवी॒ कृणोतु ॥२२॥

text: Scent that hath risen from thee, O Earth, the fragrance which. growing herbs and plants and waters carry, Shared by Apsarases, shared by Gandharvas therewith make thou me sweet: let no man hate me.
meaning: य॒स् ते गन्धः॒ पृथिवि संबभू॒व यं॒ बि॒भ्रत्य् ओ॒षधयो य॒म् आ॒पः । यं॒ गन्धर्वा॒ अप्सर॒सश् च भेजिरे॒ ते॒न मा सुरभिं॒ कृणु मा॒ नो द्विक्षत क॒श् चन॒ ॥२३॥

text: Thy scent which entered and possessed the lotus, the scent which they prepared at Sūryā's bridal, Scent which Immortals Earth! of old collected, therewith make thou me sweet: let no man hate me.
meaning: य॒स् ते गन्धः॒ पु॒ष्करम् आविवे॒श यं॒ संजभ्रुः॒ सूर्या॒या विवाहे॒ । अ॒मर्त्याः पृथिवि गन्ध॒म् अ॒ग्रे ते॒न मा॒ सुरभिं॒ कृणु मा॒ नो द्विक्षत क॒श् चन॒ ॥२४॥

text: Thy scent in women and in men, the luck and light that is in. males, That is in heroes and in steeds in sylvan beasts and elephants, The splendid energy of maids, therewith do thou unite us,. Earth! Let no man look on us with hate.
meaning: य॒स् ते गन्धः॒ पु॒रुषेषु स्त्रीषु॒ पुंसु॒ भ॒गो रु॒चिः । यो॒ अ॒श्वेषु वीरे॒षु यो॒ मृगे॒षूत॒ हस्ति॒षु । कन्या॑यां व॒र्चो य॒द् भूमे ते॒नास्मां॒ अ॒पि सं॒ सृज मा॒ नो द्विक्षत क॒श् चन॒ ॥२५॥

text: Rock earth, and stone, and dust, this Earth is held together,. firmly bound. To this gold-breasted Prithivī mine adoration have I paid.
meaning: शिला॒ भू॒मिर् अ॒श्मा पांसुः॒ सा॒ भू॒मिः सं॒धृता धृता॒ । त॒स्यै हि॒रण्यवक्षसे पृथिव्या॒ अकरं न॒मः ॥२६॥

text: Hither we call the firmly held, the all-supporting Prithivī, On whom the trees, lords of the wood, stand evermore immov- able.
meaning: य॒स्यां वृक्षा॒ वानस्पत्या॒ ध्रुवा॒स् ति॒ष्ठन्ति विश्व॒हा । पृथिवीं॒ विश्व॒धायसं धृता॒म् अछा॒वदामसि ॥२७॥

text: Sitting at ease or rising up, standing or going on our way. With our right foot and with our left we will not reel upon the earth.
meaning: उदी॒राणा उता॒सीनास् ति॒ष्ठन्तः प्रक्रा॒मन्तः । पद्भ्यां॒ दक्षिणसव्या॒भ्यां मा॒ व्यथिष्महि भू॒म्याम् ॥२८॥

text: I speak to Prithivī the purifier, to patient Earth who groweth strong through Brahma. O Earth, may we recline on thee who bearest strength, increase, portioned share of food, and fatness.
meaning: विमृ॒ग्वरीं पृथिवी॒म् आ॒ वदामि क्षमां॒ भू॒मिं ब्र॒ह्मणा वावृधाना॒म् । ऊ॒र्जं पुष्टं॒ बि॒भ्रतीम् अन्नभागं॒ घृतं॒ त्वाभि नि॒ षीदेम भूमे ॥२९॥

text: Purified for our bodies flow the waters: we bring distress on him who would attack us. I cleanse myself, O Earth, with that which cleanseth.
meaning: शुद्धा॒ न आ॒पस् तन्वे॑ क्षरन्तु यो॒ नः से॒दुर् अ॒प्रिये तं॒ नि॒ दध्मः । पवि॒त्रेण पृथिवि मो॒त् पुनामि ॥३०॥ {३}

text: Earth, be thine eastern and thy northern regions, those lying southward and those lying westward. Propitious unto me in all my movements. Long as I tread the ground let me not stumble.
meaning: या॒स् ते प्रा॒चीः प्रदि॒शो या॒ उ॒दीचीर् या॒स् ते भूमे अधरा॒द् या॒श् च पश्चा॒त् । स्योना॒स् ता॒ म॒ह्यं च॒रते भवन्तु मा॒ नि॒ पप्तं भु॒वने शिश्रियाणः॒ ॥३१॥

text: Drive us not from the west or east, drive us not from the north or south, Be gracious unto us, O Earth: let not the robbers find us; keep the deadly weapon far away.
meaning: मा॒ नः पश्चा॒न् मा॒ पुर॒स्तान् नुदिष्ठा मो॒त्तरा॒द् अधरा॒द् उत॒ । स्वस्ति॒ भूमे नो भव मा॒ विदन् परिपन्थि॒नो व॒रीयो यावया वध॒म् ॥३२॥

text: Long as, on thee, I look around, possessing Sūrya as a friend, So long, through each succeeding year, let not my power of vision fail.
meaning: या॒वत् ते ऽभि॒ विप॒श्यामि भू॒मे सू॒र्येण मेदि॒ना । ता॒वन् मे च॒क्षुर् मा॒ मेष्टो॒त्तरामुत्तरां स॒माम् ॥३३॥

text: When, as I lie, O Earth, I turn upon my right side and my left, When stretched at all our length we lay our ribs on thee who meetest us. Do us no injury there, O Earth who furnishest a bed for all.
meaning: य॒च् छ॒यानः पर्या॒वर्ते द॒क्षिणं सख्य॒म् अभि॒ भूमे पार्श्व॒म् उत्ताना॒स् त्वा प्रती॒चीं य॒त् पृष्टी॒भिर् अधिशे॒महे । मा॒ हिंसीस् त॒त्र नो भूमे स॒र्वस्य प्रतिशीवरि ॥३४॥

text: Let what I dig from thee, O Earth, rapidly spring and grow again. O Purifier, let me not pierce through thy vitals or thy heart.
meaning: य॒त् ते भूमे विख॒नामि क्षिप्रं॒ त॒द् अ॒पि रोहतु । मा॒ ते म॒र्म विमृग्वरि मा॒ ते हृ॒दयम् अर्पिपम् ॥३५॥

text: Earth, may thy summer, and thy rains, and autumn, thy winter, and thy dewy frosts, and spring-time. May thy years, Prithivī! and ordered seasons, and day and night pour out for us abundance.
meaning: ग्रीष्म॒स् ते भूमे वर्षा॒णि शर॒द् धेमन्तः॒ शि॒शिरो वसन्तः॒ । ऋत॒वस् ते वि॒हिता हायनी॒र् अहोरात्रे॒ पृथिवि नो दुहाताम् ॥३६॥

text: The purifier, shrinking from the Serpent, she who held fires that lie within the waters, Who gives as prey the God-blaspheming Dasyus, Earth choosing Indra for her Lord, not Vritra, hath clung to Sakra, to the Strong and Mighty.
meaning: या॒प सर्पं॒ विज॒माना विमृ॒ग्वरी य॒स्याम् आ॒सन्न् अग्न॒यो ये॒ अप्स्व् अ॑न्तः॒ । प॒रा द॒स्यून् द॒दती देवपीयू॒न् इ॒न्द्रं वृणाना॒ पृथिवी॒ न॒ वृत्र॒म् शक्रा॒य दध्रे वृषभा॒य वृ॒ष्णे ॥३७॥

text: Base of the seat and sheds, on whom the sacrificial stake is reared, On whom the Yajus-knowing priests recite their hymns and chant their psalms, And ministers are busied that Indra may drink the Soma juice;
meaning: य॒स्यां सदोहविर्धाने॒ यू॒पो य॒स्यां निमीय॒ते । ब्रह्मा॒णो य॒स्याम् अ॒र्चन्त्य् ऋग्भिः॒ सा॒म्ना यजुर्वि॒दः युज्य॒न्ते य॒स्याम् ऋत्वि॒जः सो॒मम् इ॒न्द्राय पा॒तवे ॥३८॥

text: On whom the ancient Rishis, they who made the world, sang forth the cows, Seven worshippers, by session, with their fervent zeal and sacrifice;
meaning: य॒स्यां पू॒र्वे भूतकृ॒त ऋ॒षयो गा॒ उ॒दानृचुः॒ । सप्त॒ सत्रे॒ण वेध॒सो यज्ञे॒न त॒पसा सह॒ ॥३९॥

text: May she, the Earth, assign to us the opulence for which we yearn, May Bhaga share and aid the task and Indra come to lead the way.
meaning: सा॒ नो भू॒मिर् आ॒ दिशतु य॒द् ध॒नं काम॒यामहे । भ॒गो अनुप्र॒युङ्क्ताम् इ॒न्द्र एतु पुरोगवः॒ ॥४०॥ {४}

text: May she, the Earth, whereon men sing and dance with varied shout and noise, Whereon men meet in battle, and the war-cry and the drum resound, May she drive off our foemen, may Prithivī rid me of my foes.
meaning: य॒स्यां गा॒यन्ति नृ॒त्यन्ति भू॒म्यां म॒र्त्या व्यै॑लबाः । युध्य॒न्ते य॒स्याम् आक्रन्दो॒ य॒स्याम् व॒दति दुन्दुभिः॒ । सा॒ नो भू॒मिः प्र॒ णुदतां सप॒त्नान् असपत्नं॒ मा पृथिवी॒ कृणोतु ॥४१॥

text: On whom is food, barley and rice, to whom these Races Five belong, Homage to her, P arjanya's wife, to her whose marrow is the rain!
meaning: य॒स्याम् अ॒न्नं व्रीहियवौ॒ य॒स्या इमाः॒ प॒ञ्च कृष्ट॒यः । भू॒म्यै पर्ज॒न्यपत्न्यै न॒मो ऽस्तु वर्ष॒मेदसे ॥४२॥

text: Whose castles are the work of Gods, and men wage war upon her plain The Lord of Life make Prithivī, who beareth all things in her womb, pleasant to us on every side!
meaning: य॒स्याः पु॒रो देव॒कृताः क्षे॒त्रे य॒स्या विकुर्व॒ते । प्रजा॒पतिः पृथिवीं॒ विश्व॒गर्भाम् आ॒शामाशां र॒ण्यां नः कृणोतु ॥४३॥

text: May Earth the Goddess, she who bears her treasure stored up in many a place, gold, gems, and riches, Giver of opulence, grant great possessions to us bestowing them with love and favour.
meaning: निधिं॒ बि॒भ्रती बहुधा॒ गु॒हा व॒सु मणिं॒ हि॒रण्यं पृथिवी॒ ददातु मे । व॒सूनि नो वसुदा॒ रा॒समाना देवी॒ दधातु सुमनस्य॒माना ॥४४॥

text: Earth, bearing folk of many a varied language with divers rites as suits their dwelling-places, Pour, like a constant cow that never faileth, a thousand streams of treasure to enrich me!
meaning: ज॒नं बि॒भ्रती बहुधा॒ वि॒वाचसं ना॒नाधर्माणं पृथिवी॒ यथौकस॒म् । सह॒स्रं धा॒रा द्र॒विणस्य मे दुहां ध्रुवे॒व धेनु॒र् अ॒नपस्फुरन्ती ॥४५॥

text: Thy snake, thy sharply stinging scorpion, lying concealed, be- wildered, chilled with cold of winter, The worm, O Prithivī, each thing that in the Rains revives and stirs, Creeping, forbear to creep on us! With all things gracious bless thou us.
meaning: य॒स् ते सर्पो॒ वृ॒श्चिकस् तृष्ट॒दंश्मा हेमन्त॒जब्धो भृमलो॒ गु॒हा श॒ये । क्रि॒मिर् जि॒न्वत् पृथिवि य॒द्यद् ए॒जति प्रावृ॒षि त॒न् नः स॒र्पन् मो॒प सृपद् य॒च् छिवं॒ ते॒न नो मृड ॥४६॥

text: Thy many ways on which the people travel, the road for car and wain to journey over, Thereon meet both the good and bad, that pathway may we attain without a foe or robber. With all things gracious bless thou us.
meaning: ये॒ ते प॒न्थानो बह॒वो जना॒यना र॒थस्य व॒र्त्मा॒नसश् च या॒तवे । यैः॒ संच॒रन्त्य् उभ॒ये भद्रपापा॒स् तं॒ प॒न्थानं जयेमानमित्र॒म् अतस्करं॒ य॒च् छिवं॒ ते॒न नो मृड ॥४७॥

text: Supporting both the foolish and the weighty she bears the death both of the good and evil. In friendly concord with the boar, Earth opens herself for the wild swine that roams the forest.
meaning: मल्वं॒ बि॒भ्रती गुरुभृ॒द् भद्रपाप॒स्य निध॒नं तितिक्षुः॒ । वराहे॒ण पृथिवी॒ संविदाना॒ सूकरा॒य वि॒ जिहीते मृगा॒य ॥४८॥

text: All sylvan beasts of thine that love the woodlands, man-eaters,. forest-haunting, lions, tigers, Hyena, wolf, Misfortune, evil spirit, drive from us, chase the demons to a distance.
meaning: ये॒ त आरण्याः॒ पश॒वो मृगा॒ व॒ने हिताः॒ सिंहा॒ व्याघ्राः॒ पुरुषा॒दश् च॒रन्ति । उलं॒ वृ॒कं पृथिवि दुछु॒नाम् इत॒ ऋक्षी॒कां र॒क्षो अ॒प बाधयास्म॒त् ॥४९॥

text: Gandharvas and Apsarases, Kimīdins, and malignant sprites, Pisāchas all, and Rākshasas, these keep thou, Earth! afar from us.
meaning: ये॒ गन्धर्वा॒ अप्सर॒सो ये॒ चारा॒याः किमीदि॒नः । पिशाचा॒न्त् स॒र्वा र॒क्षांसि ता॒न् अस्म॒द् भूमे यावय ॥५०॥ {५}

text: To whom the winged bipeds fly together, birds of each various kind, the swans, the eagles; On whom the Wind comes rushing, Mātarisvan, rousing the dust and causing trees to tremble, and flame pursues the blast. hither and thither;
meaning: यां॒ द्विपा॒दः पक्षि॒णः संप॒तन्ति हंसाः॒ सुपर्णाः॒ शकुना॒ व॒यांसि । य॒स्यां वा॒तो मातरि॒श्वे॒यते र॒जांसि कृण्वं॒श् च्याव॒यंश् च वृक्षा॒न् । वा॒तस्य प्रवा॒म् उपवा॒म् अ॒नु वात्य् अर्चिः॒ ॥५१॥

text: Earth, upon whom are settled, joined together, the night and day, the dusky and the ruddy, Prithivī compassed by the rain about her, Happily may she stablish us in each delightful dwelling place.
meaning: य॒स्यां कृष्ण॒म् अरुणं॒ च सं॒हिते अहोरात्रे॒ वि॒हिते भू॒म्याम् अ॒धि । वर्षे॒ण भू॒मिः पृथिवी॒ वृता॒वृता सा॒ नो दधातु भद्र॒या प्रिये॒ धा॒मनिधामनि ॥५२॥

text: Heaven, Earth, the realm of Middle Air have granted me this ample room, Agni, Sun, Waters, all the Gods have joined to give me mental power.
meaning: द्यौ॒श् च म इदं॒ पृथिवी॒ चान्त॒रिक्षं च मे व्य॒चः । अग्निः॒ सू॒र्य आ॒पो मेधां॒ वि॒श्वे देवा॒श् च सं॒ ददुः ॥५३॥

text: I am victorious, I am called the lord superior on earth, Triumphant, all-o'erpowering the conqueror on every side
meaning: अह॒म् अस्मि स॒हमान उ॒त्तरो ना॒म भू॒म्याम् । अभीषा॒ड् अस्मि विश्वाषा॒ड् आ॒शामाशां विषासहिः॒ ॥५४॥

text: There, when the Gods, O Goddess, named thee, spreading thy wide expanse as thou wast broadening eastward, Then into thee passed many a charm and glory: thou madest for thyself the world's four regions.
meaning: अदो॒ य॒द् देवि प्र॒थमाना पुर॒स्ताद् देवै॒र् उक्ता॒ व्य॒सर्पो महित्व॒म् । आ॒ त्वा सुभूत॒म् अविशत् तदा॒नीम् अ॒कल्पयथाः प्रदि॒शश् च॒तस्रः ॥५५॥

text: In hamlets and in woodland, and in all assemblages on earth, In gatherings, meeting of the folk, we will speak glorious things of thee.
meaning: ये॒ ग्रा॒मा य॒द् अ॒रण्यं याः॒ सभा॒ अ॒धि भू॒म्याम् । ये॒ संग्रामाः॒ स॒मितयस् ते॒षु चा॒रु वदेम ते ॥५६॥

text: As the horse scattereth the dust, the people who dwelt upon the land, at birth, she scattered, Leader and head of all the world, delightful, the trees' protectress and the plants' upholder.
meaning: अ॒श्व इव र॒जो दुधुवे वि॒ ता॒न् ज॒नान् य॒ आ॒क्षियन् पृथिवीं॒ या॒द् अ॒जायत । मन्द्रा॒ग्रे॒त्वरी भु॒वनस्य गोपा॒ व॒नस्प॒तीनां गृ॒भिर् ओ॒षधीनाम् ॥५७॥

text: Whate'er I say I speak with honey-sweetness, whatever I behold for that they love me. Dazzling, impetuous am I: others who fiercely stir I slay.
meaning: य॒द् व॒दामि म॒धुमत् त॒द् वदामि य॒द् ई॒क्षे त॒द् वनन्ति मा । त्वि॒षीमान् अस्मि जूतिमा॒न् अ॒वान्या॒न् हन्मि दो॒धतः ॥५८॥

text: Mild, gracious, sweetly odorous, milky, with nectar in her breast, May Earth, may Prithivī bestow her benison, with milk, on me.
meaning: शन्तिवा॒ सुरभिः॒ स्योना॒ कीला॒लोध्नी प॒यस्वती । भू॒मिर् अ॒धि ब्रवीतु मे पृथिवी॒ प॒यसा सह॒ ॥५९॥

text: Whom Visvakarman with oblation followed, when she was set in mid-air's billowy ocean A useful vessel, hid, when, for enjoyment, she was made mani- fest to those with mothers.
meaning: या॒म् अन्वै॒छद् धवि॒षा विश्व॒कर्मान्त॒र् अर्णवे॒ र॒जसि प्र॒विष्टाम् । भुजिष्यं॑ पा॒त्रं नि॒हितं गु॒हा य॒द् आवि॒र् भो॒गे अभवन् मातृम॒द्भ्यः ॥६०॥

text: Thou art the vessel that containeth people, Aditi, granter of the wish, far-spreading. Prajāpati, the first-born Son of Order, supplieth thee with what- soe'er thou lackest.
meaning: त्व॒म् अस्य् आव॒पनी ज॒नानाम् अ॒दितिः कामदु॒घा पप्रथाना॒ । य॒त् त ऊनं॒ त॒त् त आ॒ पूरयाति प्रजा॒पतिः प्रथमजा॒ ऋत॒स्य ॥६१॥

text: Let thy breasts, frec from sickness and Consumption, be. Prithivī, produced for our advantage. Through long-extended life wakeful and watching still may we be thy tributary servants.
meaning: उपस्था॒स् ते अनमीवा॒ अयक्ष्मा॒ अस्म॒भ्यं सन्तु पृथिवि प्र॒सूताः । दीर्घं॒ न आ॒युः प्रतिबु॒ध्यमाना वयं॒ तु॒भ्यं बलिहृ॒तः स्याम ॥६२॥

text: O Earth, my Mother, set thou me happily in a place secure. Of one accord with Heaven, O Sage, set me in glory and in wealth.
meaning: भू॒मे मातर् नि॒ धेहि मा भद्र॒या सु॒प्रतिष्ठितम् । संविदाना॒ दिवा॒ कवे श्रियां॒ मा धेहि भू॒त्याम् ॥६३॥ {६}

text: This is no place to hold thee; mount the Nāda: this lead is thine appointed share. Come hither. Together with Consumption in the cattle, Consumption in our men, go henee, go southward.
meaning: नड॒म् आ॒ रोह न॒ ते अ॒त्र लोक॒ इदं॒ सी॒सं भागधे॒यं त ए॒हि । यो॒ गो॒षु य॒क्ष्मः पु॒रुषेषु य॒क्ष्मस् ते॒न त्वं॒ साक॒म् अधरा॒ङ् प॒रेहि ॥१॥

text: With this we chase and banish all consumptive malady and Death, With sinner andamalicious man, with helper and with minister,
meaning: अघशंसदुःशंसा॒भ्यां करे॒णानुकरे॒ण च । य॒क्ष्मं च स॒र्वं ते॒नेतो॒ मृत्युं॒ च नि॒र् अजामसि ॥२॥

text: Death and Misfortune we expel, Malignity we drive away. O Agni, thou who eatest not the corpse, eat him who hateth us: him whom we hate we send to thee.
meaning: नि॒र् इतो॒ मृत्युं॒ नि॒रृतिं नि॒र् अ॒रातिम् अजामसि । यो॒ नो द्वे॒ष्टि त॒म् अद्ध्य् अग्ने अक्रव्याद् य॒म् उ द्विष्म॒स् त॒म् उ ते प्र॒ सुवामसि ॥३॥

text: If the corpse-eating Agni, or a tiger leaving his lair, hath entered this our homestead, With beans prepared in butter I expel him: far let him go to fires that lie in waters.
meaning: य॒द्य् अग्निः॒ क्रव्या॒द् य॒दि वा॒ व्याघ्र॒ इमं॒ गोष्ठं॒ प्रविवे॒शा॒न्योकाः । तं॒ मा॒षाज्यं कृत्वा॒ प्र॒ हिणोमि दूरं॒ स॒ गछत्व् अप्सुष॒दो॒ ऽप्य् अग्नी॒न् ॥४॥

text: When, angered that a man hath died, we in our wrath have banished thee, That deed is easily set right through thee: we kindle thee again.
meaning: य॒त् त्वा क्रुद्धाः॒ प्रचक्रु॒र् मन्यु॒ना पु॒रुषे मृते॒ । सुक॒ल्पम् अग्ने त॒त् त्व॒या पु॒नस् त्वो॒द् दीपयामसि ॥५॥

text: Again have the Ādityas, Rudras, Vasus, the Brāhman, bringer of good things, O Agni, Again hath Brāhmanaspati disposed thee for long life lasting through a hundred autumns.
meaning: पु॒नस् त्वादित्या॒ रुद्रा॒ व॒सवः पु॒नर् ब्रह्मा॒ व॒सुनीतिर् अग्ने । पु॒नस् त्वा ब्र॒ह्मणस् प॒तिर् आ॒धाद् दीर्घायुत्वा॒य शत॒शारदाय ॥६॥

text: I sweep afar, for sacrifice to Fathers, corpse-eating Agni who hath come among us, Although he saw this other, Jātavedas: in loftiest space let him inflame the caldron.
meaning: यो॒ अग्निः॒ क्रव्या॒त् प्रविवे॒श नो गृह॒म् इमं॒ प॒श्यन्न् इ॒तरं जात॒वेदसम् । तं॒ हरामि पितृयज्ञा॒य दूरं॒ स॒ घर्म॒म् इन्धां परमे॒ सध॒स्थे ॥७॥

text: I drive corpse-eating Agni to a distance: sin-laden let him go to Yamas vassals. Here let this other, Jātavedas, carry oblation to the Deities, fore- knowing.
meaning: क्रव्या॒दम् अग्निं॒ प्र॒ हिणोमि दूर॒म् यम॒राज्ञो गछतु रिप्रवाहः॒ । इहा॒य॒म् इ॒तरो जात॒वेदा देवो॒ देवे॒भ्यो हव्यं॒ वहतु प्रजान॒न् ॥८॥

text: I quickly sweep away corpse-eating Agni, Death, with his bolt potdepriving men of motion. From household fire, well-knowing, I divide him: so in the world of Fathers be his portion.
meaning: क्रव्या॒दम् अग्नि॒म् इषितो॒ हरामि ज॒नान् दृंह॒न्तं व॒ज्रेण मृत्यु॒म् । नि॒ तं॒ शास्मि गा॒र्हपत्येन विद्वा॒न् पितृ̄णां॒ लोके॒ ऽपि भागो॒ अस्तु ॥९॥

text: Corpse-eating Agni, toil-worn, meet for praises, I send away bypaths used by the Fathers. Stay there; keep watch among the Fathers: come not again to us by ways whereon Gods travel.
meaning: क्रव्या॒दम् अग्निं॒ शशमान॒म् उक्थ्यं॑ प्र॒ हिणोमि पथि॒भिः पितृया॒णैः । मा॒ देवया॒नैः पु॒नर् आ॒ गा अ॒त्रैवै॒धि पितृ॒षु जागृहि त्व॒म् ॥१०॥ {७}

text: They being cleansed and bright, the purifiers, kindle Sankasuka for our well-being. Impurity leaveth us and sin departeth: lighted by the good cleanser Agni cleanseth.
meaning: स॒म् इन्धते सं॒कसुकं स्वस्त॒ये शुद्धा॒ भ॒वन्तः शु॒चयः पावकाः॒ । ज॒हाति रिप्र॒म् अ॒त्य् ए॒न एति स॒मिद्धो अग्निः॒ सुपु॒ना पुनाति ॥११॥

text: Agni the God, the Breaker-up, hath mounted to the heights of heaven. Released from all transgression, he hath from the curse delivered us.
meaning: देवो॒ अग्निः॒ सं॒कसुको दिव॒स् पृष्ठा॒न्य् आ॒रुहत् । मुच्य॒मानो नि॒र् ए॒णसो॒ ऽमोग् अस्मां॒ अ॒शस्त्याः ॥१२॥

text: On Agni here, the Breaker-up, we wipe impurities away. Cleansed, fit for sacrifice have we become: may he prolong our lives.
meaning: अस्मि॒न् वयं॒ सं॒कसुके अग्नौ॒ रिप्रा॒णि मृज्महे । अ॒भूम यज्ञि॒याः शुद्धाः॒ प्र॒ ण आ॒यूंषि तारिषत् ॥१३॥

text: The Breaker-up, the Burster, the Destroyer, and the Silent One, These have expelled Consumption far, far off from thee ānd all thou hast,
meaning: सं॒कसुको वि॒कसुको निरृथो॒ य॒श् च निस्वरः॒ । ते॒ ते य॒क्ष्मं स॒वेदसो दूरा॒द् दूर॒म् अनीनशन् ॥१४॥

text: Corpse-eating Agni we expel, the Agni who bewilders men, Him who is in our horses, in our heroes, cows, and goats, and sheep:
meaning: यो॒ नो अ॒श्वेषु वीरे॒षु यो॒ नो गो॒ष्व् अजावि॒षु । क्रव्या॒दं नि॒र् णुदामसि यो॒ अग्नि॒र् जनयो॒पनः ॥१५॥

text: We drive thee forth to other folk, to alien cattle, alien steeds, Thee the corpse-eating Agni, thee the Agni who bewilders men,
meaning: अ॒न्येभ्यस् त्वा पु॒रुषेभ्यो गो॒भ्यो अ॒श्वेभ्यस् त्वा । निः॒ क्रव्या॒दं नुदामसि यो॒ अग्नि॒र् जीवितयो॒पनः ॥१६॥

text: Whereon the Deities, whereon men too have purified themselves, Exalting fatness, cleanse thyself, Agni, therein and mount to heaven.
meaning: य॒स्मिन् देवा॒ अ॒मृजत य॒स्मिन् मनुष्या॑ उत॒ । त॒स्मिन् घृतस्ता॒वो मृष्ट्वा॒ त्व॒म् अग्ने दि॒वं रुह ॥१७॥

text: O Agni, kindled and adored, turn not away to visit us. Shine brightly even there in heaven, so that we long may see the Sun.
meaning: स॒मिद्धो अग्न आहुत स॒ नो मा॒भ्य॒पक्रमीः । अ॒त्रैव॒ दीदिहि द्य॒वि ज्यो॒क् च सू॒र्यं दृशे॒ ॥१८॥

text: Wipe all away on lead and reed, on Agni, him who breaketh up, Then on a black-hued sheep, and on a cushion pain that racks. the head,
meaning: सी॒से मृड्ढ्वं नडे॒ मृड्ढ्वम् अग्नौ॒ सं॒कसुके च य॒त् । अ॒थो अ॒व्यां रामा॒यां शीर्षक्ति॒म् उपब॒र्हणे ॥१९॥

text: Wipe off pollution, lay it in the lead and in the black-hued sheep, And headache in the cushion; then be cleansed and fit to sacri- fice.
meaning: सी॒से म॒लं सादयित्वा॒ शीर्षक्ति॒म् उपब॒र्हणे । अ॒व्याम् अ॒सिक्न्यां मृष्ट्वा॒ शुद्धा॒ भवत यज्ञि॒याः ॥२०॥ {८}

text: Go onward, Death, pursue thy special pathway apart from that which Gods are wont to travel. To thee I say it who hast eyes and hearest: great grow the number of these men around us!
meaning: प॒रं मृत्यो अ॒नु प॒रेहि प॒न्थां य॒स् त एष॒ इ॒तरो देवया॒नात् । च॒क्षुष्मते शृण्वते॒ ते ब्रवीमीहे॒मे॒ वीरा॒ बह॒वो भवन्तु ॥२१॥

text: Divided from the dead are these, the living: now is our calling on the Gods successful. We have gone forth for dancing and for laughter: may we with brave sons speak to the assembly.
meaning: इमे॒ जीवा॒ वि॒ मृतै॒र् आ॒ववृत्रन्न् अ॒भूद् भद्रा॒ देव॒हुतिर् नो अद्य॒ । प्रा॒ञ्चो अगाम नृत॒ये ह॒साय सुवी॒रासो विद॒थम् आ॒ वदेम ॥२२॥

text: Here I erect this rampart for the living: let none of these, none other, reach this limit. May they survive a hundred lengthened autumns, and may they bury Death beneath this mountain.
meaning: इमं॒ जीवे॒भ्यः परिधिं॒ दधामि मै॒षां नु॒ गाद् अ॒परो अ॒र्थम् एत॒म् । शतं॒ जी॒वन्तः शर॒दः पुरूची॒स् तिरो॒ मृत्युं॒ दधताम् प॒र्वतेन ॥२३॥

text: Live your full lives and find age delightful, all of you striving, one behind the other. May Tvashtar, maker of fair things, be gracious, and lead your whole lives on to full existence.
meaning: आ॒ रोहता॒युर् जर॒सं वृणाना॒ अनुपूर्वं॒ य॒तमाना य॒ति स्थ॒ । ता॒न् वस् त्व॒ष्टा सुज॒निमा सजो॒षाः स॒र्वम् आ॒युर् नयतु जी॒वनाय ॥२४॥

text: As the days follow days in close succession, as with the seasons duly come the seasons. As each successor fails not his foregoer, so constitute the lives of these, Ordainer!
meaning: य॒था॒हान्य् अनुपूर्वं॒ भवन्ति य॒थ र्त॒व ऋतु॒भिर् य॒न्ति साक॒म् । य॒था न पू॒र्वम् अ॒परो ज॒हात्य् एवा॒ धातर् आ॒यूंषि कल्पयैषा॒म् ॥२५॥

text: Gather your strength, my friends; the stream flows stony: acquit yourselves as men, and cross the river. Abandon here the powers that were malignant, and let us cross to powers exempt from sickness.
meaning: अ॒श्मन्वती रीयते सं॒ रभध्वं वीर॒यध्वं प्र॒ तरता सखायः । अ॒त्रा जहीत ये॒ अ॒सन् दुरे॒वा अनमीवा॒न् उ॒त् तरेमाभि वा॒जान् ॥२६॥

text: Rise up erect, cross over, my companions: the stream is stony that flows here before us. Abandon here the powers that were ungracious, and let us cross to powers benign and friendly.
meaning: उ॒त् तिष्ठता प्र॒ तरता सखायो॒ ऽश्मन्वती नदी॒ स्यन्दत इय॒म् । अ॒त्रा जहीत ये॒ अ॒सन्न् अ॒शिवाः शिवा॒न्त् स्योना॒न् उ॒त् तरेमाभि॒ वा॒जान् ॥२७॥

text: Becoming pure and bright and purifying begin the Vaisvadevi strain for splendour.. May we rejoice, o'erpassing troublous places, with all our heroes through a hundred winters.
meaning: वैश्वदेवीं॒ व॒र्चसा आ॒ रभध्वं शुद्धा॒ भ॒वन्तः शु॒चयः पावकाः॒ । अतिक्रा॒मन्तो दुरिता॒ पदा॒नि शतं॒ हि॒माः स॒र्ववीरा मदेम ॥२८॥

text: On pathways swept by wind, directed upward, passing beyond the lower, on the higher, Thrice seven times have the Rishis, the Departed, forced Mrityu backward with the fastened fetter.
meaning: उदीची॒नैः पथि॒भिर् वायुम॒द्भिर् अतिक्रा॒मन्तो॒ ऽवरान् प॒रेभिः । त्रिः॒ सप्त॒ कृ॒त्व ऋ॒षयः प॒रेता मृत्युं॒ प्र॒त्य् औहन् पदयो॒पनेन ॥२९॥

text: Effecting Mrityu's footstep ye came hither, to further times pro- longing your existence, Seated, drive Mrityu to his proper dwelling: then may we, living, speak to the assembly.
meaning: मृत्योः॒ पदं॒ योप॒यन्त ए॒त द्रा॒घीय आ॒युः प्रतरं॒ द॒धानाः । आ॒सीना मृत्युं॒ नुदता सध॒स्थे॒ ऽथ जीवा॒सो विद॒थम् आ॒ वदेम ॥३०॥ {९}

text: Let these unwidowed dames with goodly husbands adorn them- selves with fragrant balm and unguent, Decked with fair jewels, tearless, sound and healthy, first let the dames go up to where he lieth.
meaning: इमा॒ ना॒रीर् अविधवाः॒ सुप॒त्नीर् आ॒ञ्जनेन सर्पि॒षा सं॒ स्पृशन्ताम् । अनश्र॒वो अनमीवाः॒ सुर॒त्ना आ॒ रोहन्तु ज॒नयो यो॒निम् अ॒ग्रे ॥३१॥

text: I with oblation separate both classes, and with my prayer dis- part their several portions. I offer food that wastes not to the Fathers, a nd to these men give life of long duration.
meaning: व्या॒करोमि हवि॒षाह॒म् एतौ॒ तौ॒ ब्र॒ह्मणा व्य् अ॑हं॒ कल्पयामि । स्वधां॒ पितृ॒भ्यो अज॒रां कृणोमि दीर्घे॒णा॒युषा स॒म् इमा॒न्त् सृजामि ॥३२॥

text: That Agni, Fathers! who, himself immortal, hath entered and possessed our mortal bosoms, Even him I grasp and hold the God with me, Let him not hate us, may we never hate him.
meaning: यो॒ नो अग्निः॒ पितरो हृत्स्व् अ॑न्त॒र् आविवे॒शामृ॒तो म॒र्त्येषु । म॒य्य् अहं॒ तं प॒रि गृह्णामि देवं॒ मा॒ सो॒ अस्मा॒न् द्विक्षत मा॒ वयं॒ त॒म् ॥३३॥

text: When ye have left the household fire, with the Corpse-eater southward go. Do that which is delightful to the Fathers, Brāhmans, and your- selves.
meaning: अपावृ॒त्य गा॒र्हपत्यात् क्रव्या॒दा प्रे॒त दक्षिणा॒ । प्रियं॒ पितृ॒भ्य आत्म॒ने ब्रह्म॒भ्यः कृणुता प्रिय॒म् ॥३४॥

text: Agni, the banqueter on flesh, not banished, for the eldest son Taketh a double share of wealth and spoileth it with poverty.
meaning: द्विभागधन॒म् आदा॒य प्र॒ क्षिणात्य् अ॒वर्त्या । अग्निः॒ पुत्र॒स्य ज्येष्ठ॒स्य यः॒ क्रव्या॒द् अ॒निराहितः ॥३५॥

text: What man acquires by plough, by war, all that he wins by toil of hand, He loses all if Agni the Carnivorous be not set aside,
meaning: य॒त् कृष॒ते य॒द् वनुते य॒च् च वस्ने॒न विन्द॒ते । स॒र्वं म॒र्त्यस्य त॒न् ना॒स्ति क्रव्या॒च् चे॒द् अ॒निराहितः ॥३६॥

text: Unholy, splendour-reft is he, his sacrifice unfit to eat. Krayād deprives of tilth of cow, of riches him whom he pursues,
meaning: अयज्ञियो॒ हत॒वर्चा भवति नै॒नेन हवि॒र् अ॒त्तवे । छिन॒त्ति कृष्या॒ गो॒र् ध॒नाद् यं॒ क्रव्या॒द् अनुव॒र्तते ॥३७॥

text: Oft as a greedy beggar speaks the mortal who has brought distress, Those whom Carnivorous Agni close at hand runs after and detects.
meaning: मु॒हुर् गृ॒ध्यैः प्र॒ वदत्य् आ॒र्तिम् म॒र्त्यो नी॒त्य । क्रव्या॒द् या॒न् अग्नि॒र् अन्तिका॒द् अनुविद्वा॒न् विता॒वति ॥३८॥

text: When a dame's husband dies the house is tangled fast in Grāhi's net. A learned Brāhman must be sought to drive Carnivorous Agni, forth.
meaning: ग्रा॒ह्या गृहाः॒ सं॒ सृज्यन्ते स्त्रिया॒ य॒न् म्रिय॒ते प॒तिः । ब्रह्मै॒व॒ विद्वा॒न् एष्यो॑ यः॒ क्रव्या॒दं निराद॒धत् ॥३९॥

text: From any evil we have done, act of impurity or sin, Let waters purge me and from all that comes from Agni Breaker-up.
meaning: य॒द् रिप्रं॒ श॒मलं चकृम॒ य॒च् च दुष्कृत॒म् । आ॒पो मा त॒स्माच् छुम्भन्त्व् अग्नेः॒ सं॒कसुकाच् च य॒त् ॥४०॥ {१०}

text: By pathways travelled by the Gods these waters, well-knowing, from below have mounted upward. High on the summit of the raining mountain the ancient rivers fresh and new are flowing.
meaning: ता॒ अधरा॒द् उ॒दीचीर् आ॒ववृत्रन् प्रजानैतीः॒ पथि॒भिर् देवया॒नैः । प॒र्वतस्य वृषभ॒स्या॒धि पृष्ठे॒ न॒वाश् चरन्ति सरि॒तः पुराणीः॒ ॥४१॥

text: Drive off Carnivorous Agni, thou Agni who eatest not the flesh;. carry oblation paid to Gods.
meaning: अ॒ग्ने अक्रव्यान् निः॒ क्रव्या॒दं नुदा॒ देवय॒जनं वह ॥४२॥

text: The Flesh-eater hath entered him: he hath pursued the Flesh- eater. Making two tigers different-wise, I bear away the ungracious one.
meaning: इमं॒ क्रव्या॒द् आ॒ विवेशायं॒ क्रव्या॒दम् अ॒न्व् अगात् । व्याघ्रौ॒ कृत्वा॒ नानानं॒ तं॒ हरामि शिवापर॒म् ॥४३॥

text: He who holds Gods within himself, the rampart and defence of men, Agni, the sacred household fire, hath come and stands between them both.
meaning: अन्तर्धि॒र् देवा॒नां परिधि॒र् मनुष्या॑णाम् अग्नि॒र् गार्हपत्य उभ॒यान् अन्तरा॒ श्रितः॒ ॥४४॥

text: Prolong the lives of those who live, O Agni, Let the dead go unto world of Fathers. As goodly household fire burn up Arāti; give this man dawn brighter than all the mornings.
meaning: जीवा॒नाम् आ॒युः प्र॒ तिर त्व॒म् अग्ने पितृ̄णां॒ लोक॒म् अ॒पि गछन्तु ये॒ मृताः॒ । सुगार्हपत्यो॒ वित॒पन्न् अ॒रातिम् उषा॒मुषां श्रे॒यसीं धेह्य् अस्मै॒ ॥४५॥

text: Subduing all our adversaries, Agni, give us their food, their strength and their possessions.
meaning: स॒र्वान् अग्ने स॒हमानः सप॒त्नान् ऐ॒षाम् ऊ॒र्जं रयि॒म् अस्मा॒सु धेहि ॥४६॥

text: Grasp ye this Indra, furtherer, satisfier: he will release you from disgrace and trouble. With him drive back the shaft that flies against you, with him. ward off the missile shot by Rudra.
meaning: इम॒म् इ॒न्द्रं व॒ह्निं प॒प्रिम् अन्वा॒रभध्वं स॒ वो नि॒र् वक्षद् दुरिता॒द् अवद्या॒त् । ते॒ना॒प हत श॒रुम् आप॒तन्तं ते॒न रुद्र॒स्य प॒रि पातास्ता॒म् ॥४७॥

text: Seize with firm hold the Ox who boundeth forward: he will uplift you from disgrace and trouble. Enter this ship of Savitar; let us flee from poverty over all the six expenses.
meaning: अनड्वा॒हं प्लव॒म् अन्वा॒रभध्वं स॒ वो नि॒र् वक्षद् दुरिता॒द् अवद्या॒त् । आ॒ रोहत सवितु॒र् ना॒वम् एतां॒ षड्भि॒र् उर्वी॒भिर् अ॒मतिं तरेम ॥४८॥

text: Thou followest the day and night, supporting, standing, at peace, promoting, rich in heroes. Long bearing undiseased and happy sleepers, be ours, O Bed, with smell of man about thee,
meaning: अहोरात्रे॒ अ॒न्व् एषि बि॒भ्रत् क्षेम्य॒स् ति॒ष्ठन् प्रत॒रणः सुवी॒रः । अ॒नातुरान्त् सुम॒नसस् तल्प बि॒भ्रज् ज्यो॒ग् एव॒ नः पु॒रुषगन्धिर् एधि ॥४९॥

text: They sever from the Gods, they live in sin and misery evermore, Those whom from very near at hand Carnivorous Agni casteth down as a horse tramples down the reeds.
meaning: ते॒ देवे॒भ्य आ॒ वृश्चन्ते पापं॒ जीवन्ति सर्वदा॒ । क्रव्या॒द् या॒न् अग्नि॒र् अन्तिका॒द् अ॒श्व इवानुव॒पते नड॒म् ॥५०॥ {११}

text: The faithless, who from lust of wealth abide with him who feeds on flesh, For ever set upon the fire an alien caldron, not their own.
meaning: ये॒ ऽश्रद्धा॒ धनकाम्या॒ क्रव्या॒दा समा॒सते । ते॒ वा॒ अन्ये॒षां कुम्भीं॒ पर्या॒दधति सर्वदा॒ ॥५१॥

text: Forward in spirit would he fly, and often turns he back again, Whomso Carnivorous Agni from anear discovers and torments.
meaning: प्रे॒व पिपतिषति म॒नसा मु॒हुर् आ॒ वर्तते पु॒नः । क्रव्या॒द् या॒न् अग्नि॒र् अन्तिका॒द् अनुविद्वा॒न् विता॒वति ॥५२॥

text: Among tame beasts the black ewe is thy portion, and the bright lead is thine, they say, Flesh-eater! Mashed beans have been assigned thee for oblation go seek the dark wood and the wildernesses.
meaning: अ॒विः कृष्णा॒ भागधे॒यं पशूनां॒ सी॒सं क्रव्या॒द् अ॒पि चन्द्रं॒ त आहुः । मा॒षाः पिष्टा॒ भागधे॒यं ते हव्य॒म् अरण्यान्या॒ ग॒ह्वरं सचस्व ॥५३॥

text: I sought the rustling sugar-cane, white Seasamum, and cane and reed. I made this Indra's fuel, and the Fire of Yama I removed.
meaning: इषी॒कां ज॒रतीम् इष्ट्वा॒ तिल्पि॒ञ्जं द॒ण्डनं नड॒म् । त॒म् इ॒न्द्र इध्म॒म् कृत्वा॒ यम॒स्याग्निं॒ निरा॒दधौ ॥५४॥

text: Against the sinking western Sun I set them; each sundered path, knowing my way, I entered. I have warned off the ghosts of the Departed: to these I give the boon of long existence.
meaning: प्रत्य॒ञ्चम् अर्कं॒ प्रत्यर्पयित्वा॒ प्रविद्वा॒न् प॒न्थां वि॒ ह्य् आ॑विवे॒श । प॒रामी॒षाम् अ॒सून् दिदे॒श दीर्घे॒णा॒युषा स॒म् इमा॒न्त् सृजामि ॥५५॥ {१२}

text: Mount, male from male, the skin. Go thither: summon those whom thou lovest, one and all, to meet thee, Strong as ye were when first ye met each other, still be your strength the same in Yama's kingdom.
meaning: पु॒मान् पुंसो॒ ऽधि तिष्ठ च॒र्मेहि त॒त्र ह्वयस्व यतमा॒ प्रिया॒ ते । या॒वन्ताव् अ॒ग्रे प्रथमं॒ समेय॒थुस् त॒द् वां व॒यो यमरा॒ज्ये समान॒म् ॥१॥

text: So strong your sight, so many be your powers, so great your force, your energies so many, When fire attends the body as its fuel, then may, ye gain full chargers, O ye couple.
meaning: ता॒वद् वां च॒क्षुस् त॒ति वीर्या॑णि ता॒वत् ते॒जस् ततिधा॒ वा॒जिनानि । अग्निः॒ श॒रीरं सचते यदै॒धो ऽधा पक्वा॒न् मिथुना सं॒ भवाथः ॥२॥

text: Together in this world, in God-ward pathway, together be ye in the realms of Yama. Invite, made pure with means of purifying, whatever seed of yours hath been developed.
meaning: स॒म् अस्मिंल् लोके॒ स॒म् उ देवया॒ने सं॒ स्मा समे॒तं यमरा॒ज्येषु । पूतौ॒ पवि॒त्रैर् उ॒प त॒द् ध्वयेथां य॒द्यद् रे॒तो अ॒धि वां संबभू॒व ॥३॥

text: Do ye, O sons, unite you with the waters, meeting this living man, ye life-sustainers, Allot to them the Odana your mother is making ready, which they call immortal.
meaning: आ॒पस् पुत्रासो अभि॒ सं॒ विशध्वम् इमं॒ जीवं॒ जीवधन्याः समे॒त्य । ता॒सां भजध्वम् अमृ॒तं य॒म् आहु॒र् ओदनं॒ प॒चति वां ज॒नित्री ॥४॥

text: That which your mother and your sire, to banish sin and un- cleanness from their lips, are cooking. That Odana with hundred streams, sky-reaching, hath in its might prevaded earth and heaven.
meaning: यं॒ वां पिता॒ प॒चति यं॒ च माता॒ रिप्रा॒न् नि॒र्मुक्त्यै श॒मलाच् च वाचः॒ । स॒ ओदनः॒ शत॒धारः स्वर्ग॒ उभे॒ व्य् आ॑प न॒भसी महित्वा॒ ॥५॥

text: Live with your sons, when life on earth is ended, live in the sphere most rich in light and sweetness. In skies that have been won by sacrificers make both the worlds, earth, heaven, your habitation.
meaning: उभे॒ न॒भसी उभ॒यांश् च लोका॒न् ये॒ य॒ज्वनाम् अभि॒जिताः स्वर्गाः॒ । ते॒षां ज्यो॒तिष्मान् म॒धुमान् यो॒ अ॒ग्रे त॒स्मिन् पुत्रै॒र् जर॒सि सं॒ श्रयेथाम् ॥६॥

text: Approach the eastern, yea: the eastern region, this is the sphere to which the faithful turn them, Your cooked oblation that in fire was offered, together, wife and husband, meet to guard it.
meaning: प्रा॒चींप्राचीं प्रदि॒शम् आ॒ रभेथाम् एतं॒ लोकं॒ श्रद्द॒धानाः सचन्ते । य॒द् वां पक्वं॒ प॒रिविष्टम् अग्नौ॒ त॒स्य गु॒प्तये दंपती सं॒ श्रयेथाम् ॥७॥

text: Now, as your steps approach the southern quarter, move in. your circling course about this vessel. Herein, accordant with the Fathers, Yama shall mightily protect your cooked oblation.
meaning: द॒क्षिणां दि॒शम् अभि॒ न॒क्षमाणौ पर्या॒वर्तेथाम् अभि॒ पा॒त्रम् एत॒त् । त॒स्मिन् वां यमः॒ पितृ॒भिः संविदानः॒ पक्वा॒य श॒र्म बहुलं॒ नि॒ यछात् ॥८॥

text: Best of the regions is indeed this western wherein the King and gracious Lord is Soma. Thither resort for rest, follow the pious. Then gain the laden chargers, O ye couple.
meaning: प्रती॒ची दिशा॒म् इय॒म् इ॒द् व॒रं य॒स्यां सो॒मो अधिपा॒ मृडिता॒ च । त॒स्यां श्रयेथां सुकृ॒तः सचेथाम् अ॒धा पक्वा॒न् मिथुना सं॒ भवाथः ॥९॥

text: Ever victorious is the northern region: may the east quarter set us first and foremost. The Man became the five-divisioned metre. May we abide wit . all our members perfect.
meaning: उ॒त्तरं राष्ट्रं॒ प्रज॒योत्तरा॒वद् दिशा॒म् उ॒दीची कृणवन् नो अ॒ग्रम् । पा॒ङ्क्तं छ॒न्दः पु॒रुषो बभूव वि॒श्वैर् विश्वाङ्गैः॒ सह॒ सं॒ भवेम ॥१०॥ {१३}

text: This stedfast realm is Queen. To her be homage! To me and to my sons may she be gracious. Guard thou, O Goddess Aditi, all-bounteous, our cooked oblation as an active warder.
meaning: ध्रुवे॒यं॒ विरा॒ण् न॒मो अस्त्व् अस्यै॒ शिवा॒ पुत्रे॒भ्य उत॒ म॒ह्यम् अस्तु । सा॒ नो देव्य् अदिते विश्ववार इ॒र्य इव गोपा॒ अभि॒ रक्ष पक्व॒म् ॥११॥

text: Embrace us as a father clasps his children. Here on the Earth let kindly breezes fan us. Let the rice-mess these two cook here, O Goddess, know this our truthfulness and zealous fervour.
meaning: पिते॒व पुत्रा॒न् अभि॒ सं॒ स्वजस्व नः शिवा॒ नो वा॒ता इह॒ वान्तु भू॒मौ । य॒म् ओदनं॒ प॒चतो देव॒ते इह॒ तं॒ नस् त॒प उत॒ सत्यं॒ च वेत्तु ॥१२॥

text: If the dark bird hath come to us and, stealing the hanging. . morsel, settled in his dwelling, Or if the slave-girl hath, wet-handed, smearing the pestle and the mortar, cleansed the waters,
meaning: य॒द्यद् कृष्णः॒ शकुन॒ ए॒ह॒ गत्वा॒ त्स॒रन् वि॒षक्तं बि॒ल आससा॒द । य॒द् वा दास्य् आ॑र्द्र॒हस्ता समङ्क्त॒ उलू॒खलं मु॒सलं शुम्भतापः ॥१३॥

text: This pressing-stone, broad-based and strength-bestowing, made pure by cleansing means, shall chase the demon. Mount on the skin: afford us great protection, Let not the sons' sin fall on wife and husband.
meaning: अयं॒ ग्रा॒वा पृथु॒बुध्नो वयोधाः॒ पूतः॒ पवि॒त्रैर् अ॒प हन्तु र॒क्षः । आ॒ रोह च॒र्म म॒हि श॒र्म यछ मा॒ दं॒पती पौ॒त्रम् अघं॒ नि॒ गाताम् ॥१४॥

text: Together with the Gods, banning Pis5chas and demons, hath Vanaspati come hither. He shall rise up and send his voice out loudly. May we win all the worlds with him to help us.
meaning: व॒नस्प॒तिः सह॒ देवै॒र् न आ॒गन् र॒क्षः पिशाचां॒ अपबा॒धमानः । स॒ उ॒च् छ्रयातै प्र॒ वदाति वा॒चं ते॒न लोकां॒ अभि॒ स॒र्वान् जयेम ॥१५॥

text: Seven victims held the sacrificial essence, the bright one and the one that hath grown feeble. The three-and-thirty Deities attend them. As such, conduct us io the world of Svarga.
meaning: सप्त॒ मे॒धान् पश॒वः प॒र्य् अगृह्णन् य॒ एषां ज्यो॒तिष्मां उत॒ य॒श् चक॒र्श । त्र॒यस्त्रिंशद् देव॒तास् ता॒न्त् सचन्ते स॒ नः स्वर्ग॒म् अभि॒ नेष लोक॒म् ॥१६॥

text: Unto the world of Svarga shalt thou lead us: there may we dwell beside our wife and children. I take thy hand Let not Destruction, let not Malignity come hither and subdue us.
meaning: स्वर्गं॒ लोक॒म् अभि॒ नो नयासि सं॒ जाय॒या सह॒ पुत्रैः॒ स्याम । गृह्णा॒मि ह॒स्तम् अ॒नु मै॒त्व् अ॒त्र मा॒ नस् तारीन् नि॒रृतिर् मो॒ अ॒रातिः ॥१७॥

text: We have subdued that sinful-hearted Grāhi. Thou shalt speak sweetly having chased the darkness. Let not the wooden gear made ready fail us, nor harm the grain of rice that pays due worship.
meaning: ग्रा॒हिं पाप्मा॒नम् अ॒ति तां॒ अयाम त॒मो व्य् अ॑स्य प्र॒ वदासि वल्गु॒ । वानस्पत्य॒ उ॒द्यतो मा॒ जिहिंसीर् मा॒ तण्डुलं॒ वि॒ शरीर् देवय॒न्तम् ॥१८॥

text: Soon to be, decked with butter, all-embracing, come to this world wherewith birth unites thee. Seize thou the winnowing-fan which rains have nourished, and let this separate the chaff and refuse.
meaning: विश्व॒व्यचा घृत॒पृष्ठो भविष्य॒न्त् स॒योनिर् लोक॒म् उ॒प याह्य् एत॒म् । वर्ष॒वृद्धम् उ॒प यछ शू॒र्पं तु॒षं पला॒वान् अ॒प त॒द् विनक्तु ॥१९॥

text: Three worlds hath Power Divine marked out and measured, Fheaven yonder, and the earth, and airs mid-region. Grasp ye the stalks and in your hands retain them: let them be watered and again be winnowed.
meaning: त्र॒यो लोकाः॒ सं॒मिता ब्रा॒ह्मणेन द्यौ॒र् एवा॒सौ॒ पृथिव्य् अ॑न्त॒रिक्षम् । अंशू॒न् गृभीत्वा॒न्वा॒रभेथाम् आ॒ प्यायन्तां पु॒नर् आ॒ यन्तु शू॒र्पम् ॥२०॥ {१४}

text: Manifold, various are the shapes of victims. Thou growest uni- form by great abundance. Push thou away this skin of ruddy colour: the stone will cleanse as one who cleanses raiment.
meaning: पृ॒थग् रूपा॒णि बहुधा॒ पशूना॒म् ए॒करूपो भवसि सं॒ स॒मृद्ध्या । एतां॒ त्व॒चं लो॒हिनीं तां॒ नुदस्व ग्रा॒वा शुम्भाति मलग॒ इव व॒स्त्रा ॥२१॥

text: Earth upon earth l set thee. This thy body is con-substantial,. but in form it differs. Whate'er hath been worn off or scratched in fixing, leak not thereat: I spread a charm to mend it.
meaning: पृथिवीं॒ त्वा पृथिव्या॒म् आ॒ वेशयामि तनूः॒ समानी॒ वि॒कृता त एषा॒ । य॒द्यद् द्युत्तं॒ लिखित॒म् अ॒र्पणेन ते॒न मा॒ सुस्रोर् ब्र॒ह्मणा॒पि त॒द् वपामि ॥२२॥

text: Thou for thy son shalt yearn as yearns a mother. I lay thee down and with the earth unite thee. Conjoined with sacrificial gear and butter may pot and jar stand firmly on the altar.
meaning: ज॒नित्रीव प्र॒ति हर्यासि सूनुं॒ सं॒ त्वा दधामि पृथिवीं॒ पृथिव्या॒ । उखा॒ कुम्भी॒ वे॒द्यां मा॒ व्यथिष्ठा यज्ञायुधै॒र् आ॒ज्येना॒तिषक्ता ॥२३॥

text: Eastward may Agni as he cooks preserve thee. Southward may Indra, grit by Maruts, guard thee, Varuna strengthen and support thee westward, and Soma on the north hold thee together.
meaning: अग्निः॒ प॒चन् रक्षतु त्वा पुर॒स्ताद् इ॒न्द्रो रक्षतु दक्षिणतो॒ मरु॒त्वान् । व॒रुणस् त्वा दृंहाद् धरु॒णे प्रती॒च्या उत्तरा॒त् त्वा सो॒मः सं॒ ददातै ॥२४॥

text: Drops flow, made pure by filters, from the rain-cloud: to heaven and earth and to the worlds they travel, May Indra light them up, poured in the vessel, lively and sted- fast, quickening living creatures.
meaning: पूताः॒ पवि॒त्रैः पवन्ते अभ्रा॒द् दि॒वं च य॒न्ति पृथिवीं॒ च लोका॒न् । ता॒ जीवला॒ जीव॒धन्याः प्रतिष्ठाः॒ पा॒त्र आ॒सिक्ताः प॒र्य् अग्नि॒र् इन्धाम् ॥२५॥

text: From heaven they come, they visit earth, and rising from earth unite themselves with air's mid-region, Purified, excellent, they with shine in beauty. Thus may they lead us to the world of Svarga.
meaning: आ॒ यन्ति दिवः॒ पृथिवीं॒ सचन्ते भू॒म्याः सचन्ते अ॒ध्य् अन्त॒रिक्षम् । शुद्धाः॒ सती॒स् ता॒ उ शुम्भन्त एव॒ ता॒ नः स्वर्ग॒म् अभि॒ लोकं॒ नयन्तु ॥२६॥

text: Yea, and supreme, alike in conformation, and brilliant and refulgent and immortal, As such, enjoined, well-guarding, water-givers, dress ye the Odana for wife and husband.
meaning: उते॒व प्रभ्वी॒र् उत॒ सं॒मितास उत॒ शुक्राः॒ शु॒चयश् चामृ॒तासः । ता॒ ओदनं॒ दं॒पतिभ्यां प्र॒शिष्टा आ॒पः शि॒क्षन्तीः पचता सुनाथाः ॥२७॥

text: Numbered, they visit earth, these drops of moisture, commensu- rate with plants and vital breathings, Unnumbered, scattered, beautiful in colour, the bright, ones have pervaded all refulgence.
meaning: सं॒ख्याता स्तोकाः॒ पृथिवीं॒ सचन्ते प्राणापानैः॒ सं॒मिता ओ॒षधीभिः । अ॒संख्याता ओप्य॒मानाः सुव॒र्णाः स॒र्वं व्या॑पुः शु॒चयः शुचित्व॒म् ॥२८॥

text: Heated, they rage and boil in agitation, they cast about their foam and countless bubbles Like a fond woman when she sees her husband—what time ye waters and these rice-grains mingle,
meaning: उ॒द् योधन्त्य् अभि॒ वल्गन्ति तप्ताः॒ फे॒नम् अस्यन्ति बहुलां॒श् च बिन्दू॒न् । यो॒षेव दृष्ट्वा॒ प॒तिम् ऋ॒त्वियायैतै॒स् तण्डुलै॒र् भवता स॒म् आपः ॥२९॥

text: Take up these rice-grains lying at the bottom: led them be blent and mingled with the waters. This water I have measured in the vessel, if as mid-points the rice-grains have been meted.
meaning: उ॒त् थापय सी॒दतो बुध्न॒ एनान् अद्भि॒र् आत्मा॒नम् अभि॒ सं॒ स्पृशन्ताम् । अ॒मासि पा॒त्रैर् उदकं॒ य॒द् एत॒न् मिता॒स् तण्डुलाः॒ प्रदि॒शो य॒दीमाः॒ ॥३०॥ {१५}

text: Present the sickle: quickly bring it hither. Let them out plants and joints with hands that harm not. So may the plants be free from wrath against us, they o'er whose realm Soma hath won dominion.
meaning: प्र॒ यछ प॒र्शुं त्वर॒या॒ हरौस॒म् अ॒हिंसन्त ओ॒षधीर् दान्तु प॒र्वन् । वा॒सां सो॒मः प॒रि राज्यं॑ बभू॒वा॒मन्युता नो वीरु॒धो भवन्तु ॥३१॥

text: Strew ye fresh grass for the boiled rice to rest on: fair let it be, sweet to the eye and spirit. Hither come Goddesses with Gods, and sitting here taste in proper season this oblation.
meaning: न॒वं बर्हि॒र् ओदना॒य स्तृणीत प्रियं॒ हृद॒श् च॒क्षुषो वल्ग्व् अ॑स्तु । त॒स्मिन् देवाः॒ सह॒ दैवी॒र् विशन्त्व् इमं॒ प्रा॒श्नन्त्व् ऋतु॒भिर् निष॒द्य ॥३२॥

text: On the strewn grass. Vanaspati, be seated; commensurate with Gods and Agnishtomas. Let thy fair form, wrought as by Tvashtar's hatchet, mark these that yearn for thee within the vessel.
meaning: व॒नस्पते स्तीर्ण॒म् आ॒ सीद बर्हि॒र् अग्निष्टोभैः॒ सं॒मितो देव॒ताभिः । त्व॒ष्ट्रेव रूपं॒ सु॒कृतं स्व॒धित्यैना॒ एहाः॒ प॒रि पा॒त्रे ददृश्राम् ॥३३॥

text: In sixty autumns may the Treasure-Guardian seek to gain heavenly light by cooked oblation. On this may sons and fathers live dependent. Send thou this mess to Fire that leads to heaven.
meaning: षष्ट्यां॒ शर॒त्सु निधिपा॒ अभी॒छात् स्वः॑ पक्वे॒नाभ्य् अ॑श्नवातै । उ॒पैनं जीवान् पित॒रश् च पुत्रा॒ एतं॒ स्वर्गं॒ गमया॒न्तम् अग्नेः॒ ॥३४॥

text: On the earth's breast stand firmly as supporter: may Deities stir thee who ne'er hast shaken. So living man and wife with living children remove thee from the hearth of circling Agni.
meaning: धर्ता॒ ध्रियस्व धरु॒णे पृथिव्या॒ अ॒च्युतं त्वा॒ देव॒ताश् च्यावयन्तु । तं॒ त्वा दं॒पती जी॒वन्तौ जीव॒पुत्राव् उ॒द् वासयातः प॒र्य् अग्निधा॒नात् ॥३५॥

text: All wishes that have blessed those with fulfilment, having won all the worlds have met together. Let them plunge in both stirring-spoon and ladle: raise this and set it in a single vessel.
meaning: स॒र्वान्त् समा॒गा अभिजि॒त्य लोका॒न् या॒वन्तः का॒माः स॒म् अतीतृपस् ता॒न् । वि॒ गाहेथाम् आय॒वनं च द॒र्विर् ए॒कस्मिन् पा॒त्रे अ॒ध्य् उ॒द् धरैनम् ॥३६॥

text: Pour out the covering butter, spread it eastward: sprinkle this vessel over with the fatness. Greet this, ye Deities, with gentle murmur, as lowing cows wel- come their tender suckling.
meaning: उ॒प स्तृणीहि प्रथ॒य पुर॒स्ताद् घृते॒न पा॒त्रम् अभि॒ घारयैत॒त् । वाश्रे॒वोस्रा॒ त॒रुणं स्तनस्यु॒म् इमं॒ देवासो अभिहि॒ङ्कृणोत ॥३७॥

text: Thou hast poured oil and made the worlds: let heaven, unequal- led, be spread out in wide extension. Herein be cooked the buffalo, strong-pinioned: the Gods shall give the Deities this oblation.
meaning: उ॒पास्तरीर् अ॒करो लोक॒म् एत॒म् उरुः॒ प्रथताम् अ॒समः स्वर्गः॒ । त॒स्मिं छ्रयातै महिषः॒ सुपर्णो॒ देवा॒ एनं देव॒ताभ्यः प्र॒ यछान् ॥३८॥

text: Whate'er thy wife, away from thee, makes ready, or what, O wife, apart from thee, thy husband, Combine it all: let it be yours in common while ye produce one world with joint endeavour.
meaning: य॒द्यज् जाया॒ प॒चति त्व॒त् प॒रःपरः प॒तिर् वा जाये त्व॒त् तिरः॒ । सं॒ त॒त् सृजेथां सह॒ वां त॒द् अस्तु संपाद॒यन्तौ सह॒ लोक॒म् ए॒कम् ॥३९॥

text: All these now dwelling on the earth, mine offspring, these whom, this woman here, my wife, hath borne me, Invite them all unto the vessel: knowing their kinship have the children met together.
meaning: या॒वन्तो अस्याः॒ पृथिवीं॒ स॒चन्ते अस्म॒त् पुत्राः॒ प॒रि ये॒ संबभूवुः॒ । स॒र्वांस् तां॒ उ॒प पा॒त्रे ह्वयेथां ना॒भिं जानानाः॒ शि॒शवः समा॒यान् ॥४०॥ {१६}

text: Swollen with savoury meath, the stream of treasures, sources of immortality blent with fatness Soma retains all these; in sixty autumns the Guardian Lord of Treasures may desire them.
meaning: व॒सोर् या॒ धा॒रा म॒धुना प्र॒पीना घृते॒न मिश्रा॒ अमृ॒तस्य ना॒भयः । स॒र्वास् ता॒ अ॒व रुन्धे स्वर्गः॒ षष्ट्यां॒ शर॒त्सु निधिपा॒ अभी॒छात् ॥४१॥

text: The Lord of Treasures may desire this treasure: lordless on. every side be all the others. Our mess, presented seeking heaven, hath mounted in three divisions all three realms of Svarga.
meaning: निधिं॒ निधिपा॒ अभ्य् ए॑नम् इछाद् अ॒नीश्वरा अभि॒तः सन्तु ये॒ ऽन्ये॒ । अस्मा॒भिर् दत्तो॒ नि॒हितः स्वर्ग॒स् त्रिभिः॒ का॒ण्डैस् त्री॒न्त् स्वर्गा॒न् अरुक्षत् ॥४२॥

text: May Agni burn the God-denying demon: let no carnivorous. Pis icha drink here. We drive him off, we keep him at a distance. Ādityas and Angirases pursue him!
meaning: अग्नी॒ र॒क्षस् तपतु य॒द् वि॒देवं क्रव्या॒द् पिशाच॒ इह॒ मा॒ प्र॒ पास्त । नुदा॒म एनम् अ॒प रुध्मो अस्म॒द् आदित्या॒ एनम् अ॒ङ्गिरसः सचन्ताम् ॥४३॥

text: This meath do I announce, mingled with butter, to the Angi- rases and the Ādityas. With pure hands ne'er laid roughly on a Brahman go, pious. couple, to the world of Svarga.
meaning: आदित्ये॒भ्यो अ॒ङ्गिरोभ्यो म॒ध्व् इदं॒ घृते॒न मिश्रं॒ प्र॒ति वेदयामि । शुद्ध॒हस्तौ ब्राह्मणस्या॒निहत्यैतं॒ स्वर्गं॒ सुकृताव् अ॒पीतम् ॥४४॥

text: Of this have I obtained the noblest portion from that same world whence Parmeshthin gained it. Pour forth, besprinkle butter rich in fatness: the share of Angiras is here before us.
meaning: इदं॒ प्रा॒पम् उत्तमं॒ का॒ण्डम् अस्य य॒स्माल् लोका॒त् परमेष्ठी॒ समा॒प । आ॒ सिञ्च सर्पि॒र् घृत॒वत् स॒म् अङ्ग्ध्य् एष॒ भागो॒ अ॒ङ्गिरसो नो अ॒त्र ॥४५॥

text: To Deities, to Truth, to holy Fervour this treasure we consign,. this rich deposit, At play, in meeting led it not desert us, never give out to anyone besides me.
meaning: सत्या॒य च त॒पसे देव॒ताभ्यो निधिं॒ शेवधिं॒ प॒रि दद्म एत॒म् । मा॒ नो द्यूते॒ ऽव गान् मा॒ स॒मित्यां मा॒ स्मान्य॒स्मा उ॒त् सृजता पुरा॒ म॒त् ॥४६॥

text: I cook the offering, I present oblation: only my wife attends the holy service. A youthful world, a son hath been begotten. Begin a life that brings success and triumph.
meaning: अहं॒ पचाम्य् अहं॒ ददामि म॒मेद् उ क॒र्मन् करु॒णे॒ ऽधि जाया॒ । कौ॒मारो लोको॒ अजनिष्ट पुत्रो॑ ऽन्वा॒रभेथां व॒य उत्तरा॒वत् ॥४७॥

text: There is no fault in this, no reservation, none when it goes with friends in close alliance. We have laid down this vessel in perfection: the cooked mess shall re-enter him who cooked it.
meaning: न॒ कि॒ल्बिषम् अ॒त्र ना॒धारो॒ अ॒स्ति न॒ य॒न् मित्रैः॒ सम॒ममान ए॒ति । अ॒नूनं पा॒त्रं नि॒हितं न एत॒त् पक्ता॒रं पक्वः॒ पु॒नर् आ॒ विशाति ॥४८॥

text: To those we love may we do acts that please them. Away to darkness go all those who hate us! Cow, ox, and strength of every kind approach us! Thus let them banish death of human beings.
meaning: प्रियं॒ प्रिया॒णां कृणवाम त॒मस् ते॒ यन्तु यतमे॒ द्विष॒न्ति । धेनु॒र् अनड्वा॒न् व॒योवय आय॒द् एव॒ पौ॒रुषेयम् अ॒प मृत्युं॒ नुदन्तु ॥४९॥

text: Perfectly do the Agnis know each other, one visitor of plants and one of rivers, And all the Gods who shine and glow in heaven. Gold is the light of him who cooks oblation.
meaning: स॒म् अग्न॒यः विदुर् अन्यो॒ अन्यं॒ य॒ ओ॒षधीः स॒चते य॒श् च सि॒न्धून् । या॒वन्तो देवा॒ दिव्य् आ॑त॒पन्ति हि॒रण्यं ज्यो॒तिः प॒चतो बभूव ॥५०॥ {१७}

text: Man hath received this skin of his from nature: of other animals not one is naked. Ye make him clothe himself with might for raiment. Odana's mouth is a home-woven vesture.
meaning: एषा॒ त्वचां॒ पु॒रुषे सं॒ बभूवा॒नग्नाः स॒र्वे पश॒वो ये॒ अन्ये॒ । क्षत्रे॒णात्मा॒नं प॒रि धापयाथो ऽमोतं॒ वा॒सो मु॒खम् ओदन॒स्य ॥५१॥

text: Whatever thou may say at dice, in meeting, whatever falsehood through desire of riches, Ye two, about one common warp uniting, deposit all impurity within it.
meaning: य॒द् अक्षे॒षु व॒दा य॒त् स॒मित्यां य॒द् वा व॒दा अ॒नृतं वित्तकाम्या॒ । समानं॒ त॒न्तुम् अभि॒ सम्व॒सानौ त॒स्मिन्त् स॒र्वं श॒मलं सादयाथः ॥५२॥

text: Win thou the rain: approach the Gods. Around thee thou from the skin shalt make the smoke rise upward. Soon to be, decked with butter, all-embracing, come to this world wherewith one birth unites thee.
meaning: वर्षं॒ वनुष्वा॒पि गछ देवां॒स् त्वचो॒ धूमं॒ प॒र्य् उ॒त् पातयासि । विश्व॒व्यचा घृत॒पृष्ठो भविष्य॒न्त् स॒योनिर् लोक॒म् उ॒प याह्य् एत॒म् ॥५३॥

text: In many a shape hath heaven transformed its body, as in itself is known, of varied eolour. Cleansing the bright, the dark form hath it banished: the red form in the fire to thee I offer.
meaning: तन्वं॑ स्वर्गो॒ बहुधा॒ वि॒ चक्रे य॒था विद॒ आत्म॒न्न् अन्य॒वर्णाम् । अ॒पाजैत् कृष्णां॒ रु॒शतीं पुनानो॒ या॒ लो॒हिनी तां॒ ते अग्नौ॒ जुहोमि ॥५४॥

text: To the eastern region, to Agni the Regent, to Asita the Protector, Āditya the Archer, we present thee, this offering of ours. Do ye preserve it from aggression To full old age may Destiny conduct us; may full old age deliver us to Mrityu. Then may we be with our prepared oblation.
meaning: प्रा॒च्यै त्वा दिशे॑ ऽग्न॒ये॒ ऽधिपतये ऽसिता॒य रक्षित्र॒ आदित्या॒ये॒षुमते । एतं॒ प॒रि दद्मस् तं॒ नो गोपायता॒स्मा॒कम् ऐ॒तोः । दिष्टं॒ नो अ॒त्र जर॒से नि॒ नेषज् जरा॒ मृत्य॒वे प॒रि णो ददात्व् अ॒थ पक्वे॒न सह॒ सं॒ भवेम ॥५५॥

text: To the southern region, to Indra the Regent, to Tiraschirāji the Protector, to Yama the Archer, we present, etc. (as in stanza 55)
meaning: द॒क्षिणायै त्वा दिश॒ इ॒न्द्राया॒धिपतये ति॒रश्चिराजये रक्षित्रे॒ यमा॒ये॒षुमते । एतं॒ प॒रि दद्मस् तं॒ नो गोपायता॒स्मा॒कम् ऐ॒तोः । दिष्टं॒ नो अ॒त्र जर॒से नि॒ नेषज् जरा॒ मृत्य॒वे प॒रि णो ददात्व् अ॒थ पक्वे॒न सह॒ सं॒ भवेम ॥५६॥

text: To the western region, to Varuna the Regent, to Pridāku the Protector, to Food the Archer, we present, etc.
meaning: प्रती॒च्यै त्वा दिशे॒ व॒रुणाया॒धिपतये पृ॒दाकवे रक्षित्रे॒ ऽन्नाये॒षुमते । एतं॒ प॒रि दद्मस् तं॒ नो गोपायता॒स्मा॒कम् ऐ॒तोः । दिष्टं॒ नो अ॒त्र जर॒से नि॒ नेषज् जरा॒ मृत्य॒वे प॒रि णो ददात्व् अ॒थ पक्वे॒न सह॒ सं॒ भवेम ॥५७॥

text: To the northern region, to Soma the Regent, to Svaja the Protec- tor, to Thunderbolt the Archer, we present, etc.
meaning: उ॒दीच्यै त्वा दिशे॒ सो॒माया॒धिपतये स्वजा॒य रक्षित्रे॒ ऽश॒न्या इ॒षुमत्यै । एतं॒ प॒रि दद्मस् तं॒ नो गोपायता॒स्मा॒कम् ऐ॒तोः । दिष्टं॒ नो अ॒त्र जर॒से नि॒ नेषज् जरा॒ मृत्य॒वे प॒रि णो ददात्व् अ॒थ पक्वे॒न सह॒ सं॒ भवेम ॥५८॥

text: To the stedfast region, to Vishnu the Regent, to Kalmāshagriva the Protector, to Plants the Archers, we present, etc.
meaning: ध्रुवा॒यै त्वा दिशे॒ वि॒ष्णवे॒ ऽधिपतये कल्मा॒षग्रीवाय रक्षित्र॒ ओ॒षधीभ्य इ॒षुमतीभ्यः । एतं॒ प॒रि दद्मस् तं॒ नो गोपायता॒स्मा॒कम् ऐ॒तोः । दिष्टं॒ नो अ॒त्र जर॒से नि॒ नेषज् जरा॒ मृत्य॒वे प॒रि णो ददात्व् अ॒थ पक्वे॒न सह॒ सं॒ भवेम ॥५९॥

text: To the upper region, to Brihaspati the Regent, to Svitra the Protector, to Rain the Archer, we present thee, this offering of ours. Do ye preserve it from aggression. To full old age may Destiny conduct us, may full old age deliver us to Mrityu. Then may we be with our prepared oblation.
meaning: ऊर्ध्वा॒यै त्वा दिशे॒ बृ॒हस्प॒तये॒ ऽधिपतये श्वित्रा॒य रक्षित्रे॒ वर्षा॒ये॒षुमते । एतं॒ प॒रि दद्मस् तं॒ नो गोपायता॒स्मा॒कम् ऐ॒तोः । दिष्टं॒ नो अ॒त्र जर॒से नि॒ नेषज् जरा॒ मृत्य॒वे प॒रि णो ददात्व् अ॒थ पक्वे॒न सह॒ सं॒ भवेम ॥६०॥ {१८}

text: Give the gift, shall be his word: and straightway they have bound the Cow For Brāhman priests who beg the boon. That bringeth sons and progeny.
meaning: द॒दामी॒त्य् एव॒ ब्रूयाद् अ॒नु चैनाम् अ॒भुत्सत । वशां॒ ब्रह्म॒भ्यो या॒चद्भ्यस् त॒त् प्रजा॒वद् अ॒पत्यवत् ॥१॥

text: He trades and traffics with his sons, and in his cattle suffers loss. Who will not give the Cow of Gods to Rishis children when they beg.
meaning: प्रज॒या स॒ वि॒ क्रीणीते पशु॒भिश् चो॒प दस्यति । य॒ आर्षेये॒भ्यो या॒चद्भ्यो देवा॒नां गां॒ न॒ दि॒त्सति ॥२॥

text: They perish through a hornless cow, a lame cow sinks them in a pit. Through a maimed cow his house is burnt: a one-eyed cow destroys his wealth.
meaning: कूट॒यास्य सं॒ शीर्यन्ते श्लोण॒या काट॒म् अर्दति । बण्ड॒या दह्यन्ते गृहाः॒ काण॒या दीयते स्व॒म् ॥३॥

text: Fierce fever where her droppings fall attacks the master of the kine. So have they named her Vasa, for thou art called uncontrollable.
meaning: विलोहितो॒ अधिष्ठा॒नाच् छक्नो॒ विन्दति गो॒पतिम् । त॒था वशा॒याः सं॒विद्यं दुरदभ्ना॒ ह्य् उ॑च्य॒से ॥४॥

text: The malady Viklindu springs on him from ground whereon she stands, And suddenly, from fell disease, perish the men on whom she sniffs.
meaning: पदो॒र् अस्या अधिष्ठा॒नाद् विक्लि॒न्दुर् ना॒म विन्दति । अनामना॒त् सं॒ शीर्यन्ते या॒ मु॒खेनोपजि॒घ्रति ॥५॥

text: Whoever twitches up her ears is separated from the Gods. He deems he makes a mark, but he diminishes his wealth thereby.
meaning: यो॒ अस्याः क॒र्णाव् आस्कुनो॒त्य् आ॒ स॒ देवे॒षु वृश्चते । ल॒क्ष्म कुर्व इ॒ति म॒न्यते क॒नीयः कृणुते स्व॒म् ॥६॥

text: If to his own advantage one applies the long hair of her tail, His colts, in consequence thereof. die, and the wolf destroys his calves.
meaning: य॒द् अस्याः क॒स्मै चिद् भो॒गाय बा॒लान् क॒श् चित् प्रकृन्त॒ति । त॒तः किशोरा॒ म्रियन्ते वत्सां॒श् च घा॒तुको वृ॒कः ॥७॥

text: If, while her master owneth her, a carrion crow hath harmed her hair, His young boys die thereof, Decline o'ertakes them after fell disease.
meaning: य॒द् अस्या गो॒पतौ सत्या॒ लो॒म ध्वा॒ङ्क्षो अ॒जीहिडत् । त॒तः कुमारा॒ म्रियन्ते य॒क्ष्मो विन्दत्य् अनामना॒त् ॥८॥

text: What time the Dāsi woman throws lye on the droppings of the Cow, Misshapen birth arises thence, inseparable from that sin.
meaning: य॒द् अस्याः प॒ल्पूलनं श॒कृद् दासी॒ सम॒स्यति । त॒तो॒ ऽपरूपं जायते त॒स्माद् अ॒व्येष्यद् ए॒नसः ॥९॥

text: For Gods and Brāhmans is the Cow produced when first she springs to life, Hence to the priests must she be given: this they call guarding private wealth.
meaning: जा॒यमानाभि॒ जायते देवा॒न्त् स॒ब्राह्मणान् वशा॒ । त॒स्माद् ब्रह्म॒भ्यो दे॒यैषा॒ त॒द् आहुः स्व॒स्य गो॒पनम् ॥१०॥ {१९}

text: The God-created Cow belongs to those who come to ask for her. They call it outrage on the priests when one retains her as his own.
meaning: य॒ एनां वनि॒म् आय॒न्ति ते॒षां देव॒कृता वशा॒ । ब्रह्मज्ये॒यं त॒द् अब्रुवन् य॒ एनां निप्रियाय॒ते ॥११॥

text: He who withholds the Cow of Gods from Rishis' sons who ask the gift Is made an alien to the Gods, and subject to the Brāhmans' wrath:
meaning: य॒ आर्षेये॒भ्यो या॒चद्भ्यो देवा॒नां गां॒ न॒ दि॒त्सति । आ॒ स॒ देवे॒षु वृश्चते ब्राह्मणा॒नां च मन्य॒वे ॥१२॥

text: Then let him seek another Cow, whate'er his profit be in this. The Cow, not given, harms a man when he denies her at their prayer.
meaning: यो॒ अस्य स्या॒द् वशाभोगो॒ अन्या॒म् इछेत त॒र्हि सः॒ । हिं॒स्ते अ॒दत्ता पु॒रुषं याचितां॒ च न॒ दि॒त्सति ॥१३॥

text: Like a rich treasure stored away in safety is the Brāhmans' Cow. Therefore men come to visit her, with whomsoever she is born.
meaning: य॒था शेवधि॒र् नि॒हितो ब्राह्मणा॒नां त॒था वशा॒ । ता॒म् एत॒द् अछा॒यन्ति य॒स्मिन् क॒स्मिंश् च जा॒यते ॥१४॥

text: So when the Brāhmans come unto the Cow they come unto their own. For this is her withholding, to oppress these in another life.
meaning: स्व॒म् एत॒द् अछायन्ति य॒द् वशां॒ ब्राह्मणा॒ अभि॒ । य॒थैनान् अन्य॒स्मिन् जिनीया॒द् एवा॒स्या निरो॒धनम् ॥१५॥

text: Thus after three years may she go, speaking what is not under- stood. He, Nārads! would know the Cow, then Brāhmans must be sought unto.
meaning: च॒रेद् एवा॒ त्रैहायणा॒द् अ॒विज्ञातगदा सती॒ । वशां॒ च विद्या॒न् नारद ब्राह्मणा॒स् त॒र्ह्य् एष्याः॑ ॥१६॥

text: Whoso calls her a worthless Cow, the stored-up treasure of the Gods, Bhava and Sarva, both of them, move round and shoot a shaft at him.
meaning: य॒ एनाम् अ॒वशाम् आ॒ह देवा॒नां नि॒हितं निधि॒म् । उभौ॒ त॒स्मै भवाशर्वौ॒ परिक्र॒म्ये॒षुम् अस्यतः ॥१७॥

text: The man who hath no knowledge of her udder and the teats thereof, She yields him milk with these, if he hath purposed to bestow the Cow.
meaning: यो॒ अस्या ऊ॒धो न॒ वेदा॒थो अस्या स्त॒नान् उत॒ । उभ॒येनैवा॒स्मै दुहे दा॒तुं चे॒द् अ॒शकद् वशा॒म् ॥१८॥

text: If he withholds the Cow they beg, she lies rebellious in his stall. Vain are the wishes and the hopes which he, withholding her, would gain.
meaning: दुरदभ्नै॒नम् आ॒ शये याचितां॒ च न॒ दि॒त्सति । ना॒स्मै का॒माः स॒म् ऋध्यन्ते या॒म् अ॒दत्त्वा चि॒कीर्षति ॥१९॥

text: The Deities have begged the Cow, using the Brāhman as their mouth: The man who gives her not incurs the enmity of all the Gods.
meaning: देवा॒ वशा॒म् अयाचन् मु॒खं कृत्वा॒ ब्रा॒ह्मणम् । ते॒षां स॒र्वेषाम् अ॒ददद् धे॒डं न्य् ए॑ति मा॒नुषः ॥२०॥ {२०}

text: Withholding her from Brāhmans, he incurs the anger of the beasts, When mortal man appropriates the destined portion of the Gods.
meaning: हे॒डं पशूनां॒ न्य् ए॑ति ब्राह्मणे॒भ्यो॒ ऽददद् वशा॒म् । देवा॒नां नि॒हितं भागं॒ म॒र्त्यश् चे॒न् निप्रियाय॒ते ॥२१॥

text: If hundred other Brāhmans beg the Cow of him who owneth her, The Gods have said, She, verily, belongs to him who knows the truth.
meaning: य॒द् अन्ये॒ शतं॒ या॒चेयुर् ब्राह्मणा॒ गो॒पतिं वशा॒म् । अ॒थैनां देवा॒ अब्रुवन्न् एवं॒ ह विदु॒षो वशा॒ ॥२२॥

text: Whoso to others, not to him who hath this knowledge, gives the Cow, Earth, with the Deities, is hard for him to win and rest upon.
meaning: य॒ एवं॒ विदु॒षे ऽदत्त्वा॒थान्ये॒भ्यो द॒दद् वशा॒म् । दुर्गा॒ त॒स्मा अधिष्ठा॒ने पृथिवी॒ सह॒देवता ॥२३॥

text: The Deities begged the Cow from him with whom at first she was produced: Her, this one, Nārada would know: with Deities he drove her forth.
meaning: देवा॒ वशा॒म् अयाचन् य॒स्मिन्न् अ॒ग्रे अ॒जायत । ता॒म् एतां॒ विद्यान् ना॒रदः सह॒ देवै॒र् उ॒द् आजत ॥२४॥

text: The Cow deprives of progeny and makes him poor in cattle who Retains in his possession her whom Brāhmans have solicited.
meaning: अनपत्य॒म् अ॒ल्पपशुं वशा॒ कृणोति पू॒रुषम् । ब्राह्मणै॒श् च याचिता॒म् अ॒थैनां निप्रियाय॒ते ॥२५॥

text: For Agni and for Soma, for Kāma, Mitra and Varuna, For these the Brāhmans ask: from these is he who giveth not estranged.
meaning: अग्नी॒षोमाभ्यां का॒माय मित्रा॒य व॒रुणाय च । ते॒भ्यो याचन्ति ब्राह्मणा॒स् ते॒ष्व् आ॒ वृश्चते॒ ऽददत् ॥२६॥
