text: Long as her owner hath not heard, himself, the verses, let her move Among his kine: when he hath heard, let her not make her home with him;
meaning: या॒वद् अस्या गो॒पतिर् नो॒पशृणुया॒द् ऋ॒चः स्वय॒म् । च॒रेद् अस्य ता॒वद् गो॒षु ना॒स्य श्रुत्वा॒ गृहे॒ वसेत् ॥२७॥

text: He who hath heard her verses and still makes her roam among his kine. The Gods in anger rend away his life and his prosperity
meaning: यो॒ अस्या ऋ॒च उपश्रु॒त्या॒थ गो॒ष्व् अ॒चीचरत् । आ॒युश् च त॒स्य भू॒तिं च देवा॒ वृश्चन्ति हीडिताः॒ ॥२८॥

text: Roaming in many a place the Cow is the stored treasure of the Gods, Make manifest thy shape and form when she would seek her dwelling-place.
meaning: वशा॒ च॒रन्ती बहुधा॒ देवा॒नां नि॒हितो निधिः॒ । आवि॒ष् कृणुष्व रूपा॒णि यदा॒ स्था॒म जि॒घांसति ॥२९॥

text: Her shape and form she manifests when she would seek her dwelling-place; Then verily the Cow attends to Brāhman priests and their request.
meaning: आवि॒र् आत्मा॒नं कृणुते यदा॒ स्था॒म जि॒घांसति । अ॒थो ह ब्रह्म॒भ्यो वशा॒ याञ्च्या॒य कृणुते म॒नः ॥३०॥ {२१}

text: This thought he settles in his mind. This safely goeth to the Gods. Then verily the Brāhman priests approach that they may beg the Cow
meaning: म॒नसा सं॒ कल्पयति त॒द् देवां॒ अ॒पि गछति । त॒तो ह ब्रह्मा॒णो वशा॒म् उपप्र॒यन्ति या॒चितुम् ॥३१॥

text: By Svadhā to the Fathers, by sacrifice to the Deities, By giving them the Cow, the Prince doth not incur the mother's. wrath.
meaning: स्वधाकारे॒ण पितृ॒भ्यो यज्ञे॒न देव॒ताभ्यः । दा॒नेन राजन्यो॑ वशा॒या मातु॒र् हे॒डम् न॒ गछति ॥३२॥

text: The Prince's mother is the Cow: so was it ordered from of old. She, when bestowed upon the priests, cannot be given back, they say.
meaning: वशा॒ माता॒ राजन्य॑स्य त॒था सं॒भूतम् अग्रशः॒ । त॒स्या आहुर् अ॒नर्पणं य॒द् ब्रह्म॒भ्यः प्रदीय॒ते ॥३३॥

text: As molten butter, held at length, drops down to Agni from the scoop, So falls away from Agni he who gives no Cow to Brāhman priests.
meaning: य॒था॒ज्यं प्र॒गृहीतम् आलुम्पे॒त् स्रुचो॒ अग्न॒ये । एवा॒ ह ब्रह्म॒भ्यो वशा॒म् अग्न॒य आ॒ वृश्चते॒ ऽददत् ॥३४॥

text: Good milker, with rice-cake as calf, she in the world comes nigh to him, To him who gave her as a gift the Cow grants every hope and. wish.
meaning: पुरोडा॒शवत्सा सुदु॒घा लोके॒ ऽस्मा उ॒प तिष्ठति । सा॒स्मै स॒र्वान् का॒मान् वशा॒ प्रददु॒षे दुहे ॥३५॥

text: In Yama's realm the Cow fulfils each wish for him who gave her up; But hell, they say, is for the man who, when they beg, bestow her not.
meaning: स॒र्वान् का॒मान् यमरा॒ज्ये वशा॒ प्रददु॒षे दुहे । अ॒थाहुर् ना॒रकं लोकं॒ निरुन्धान॒स्य याचिता॒म् ॥३६॥

text: Enraged against her owner roams the Cow when she hath been impregned. He deemed me fruitless is her thought; let him be bound in, snares of Death!
meaning: प्रवीय॒माना चरति क्रुद्धा॒ गो॒पतये वशा॒ । वेह॒तं मा म॒न्यमानो मृत्योः॒ पा॒शेषु बध्यताम् ॥३७॥

text: Whoever looking on the Cow as fruitless, cooks her flesh at home, Brihaspati compels his sons and children of his sons to beg.
meaning: यो॒ वेह॒तं म॒न्यमानो ऽमा॒ च प॒चते वशा॒म् । अ॒प्य् अस्य पुत्रा॒न् पौ॒त्रांश् च याच॒यते बृ॒हस्प॒तिः ॥३८॥

text: Downward she sends a mighty heat, though amid kine a Cow she roams. Poison she yields for him who owns and hath not given her away.
meaning: मह॒द् एषा॒व तपति च॒रन्ती गो॒षु गौ॒र् अ॒पि । अ॒थो ह गो॒पतये वशा॒ददुषे विषं॒ दुहे ॥३९॥

text: The animal is happy when it is bestowed upon the priests: But happy is the Cow when she is made a sacrifice to Gods.
meaning: प्रियं॒ पशूनां॒ भवति य॒द् ब्रह्म॒भ्यः प्रदीय॒ते । अ॒थो वशा॒यास् त॒त् प्रियं॒ य॒द् देवत्रा॒ हविः॒ स्या॒त् ॥४०॥ {२२}

text: Nārada chose the terrible Vilipti out of all the cows Which the Gods formed and framed when they had risen up from sacri- fice
meaning: या॒ वशा॒ उद॒कल्पयन् देवा॒ यज्ञा॒द् उदे॒त्य । ता॒सां विलिप्त्यं॒ भीमा॒म् उदा॒कुरुत नारदः॒ ॥४१॥

text: The Gods considered her in doubt whether she were a Cow or not. Mirada spake of her and said, The veriest Cow of cows is she.
meaning: तां॒ देवा॒ अमीमांसन्त वशे॒या॒३म् अ॒वशे॒ति । ता॒म् अब्रवीन् नारद॒ एषा॒ वशा॒नां वश॒तमे॒ति ॥४२॥

text: How many cows, O Nārada, knowest thou, born among man- kind I ask thee who dost know, of which must none who is no Brāhman eat?
meaning: क॒ति नु॒ वशा॒ नारद या॒स् त्वं॒ वेत्थ मनुष्यजाः॒ । ता॒स् त्वा पृछामि विद्वां॒सं क॒स्या ना॒श्नीयाद् अ॒ब्राह्मणः ॥४३॥

text: Vilipti, cow, and she who drops no second calf, Brihaspati! Of these none not a Brāhmana should eat if he hope for emi- nence.
meaning: विलिप्त्या॒ बृहस्पते या॒ च सूत॒वशा वशा॒ । त॒स्या ना॒श्नीयाद् अ॒ब्राह्मणो य॒ आशं॒सेत भू॒त्याम् ॥४४॥

text: Homage, O Nārada, to thee who hast quick knowledge of the cows. Which of these is the direst, whose withholding bringeth death to man?
meaning: न॒मस् ते अस्तु नारदानुष्ठु॒ विदु॒षे वशा॒ । कतमा॒सां भीम॒तमा या॒म् अ॒दत्त्वा पराभ॒वेत् ॥४५॥

text: Vilipti, O Brihaspati, cow, mother of no second calf—Of these none not a Brāhman should eat if he hope for eminence.
meaning: विलिप्ती॒ या॒ बृहस्पते॒ ऽथो सूत॒वशा वशा॒ । त॒स्या ना॒श्नीयाद् अ॒ब्राह्मणो य॒ आशं॒सेत भू॒त्याम् ॥४६॥

text: Threefold are kine, Vilipti, cow, the mother of no seeond calf: These one should give to priests, and he will not offend Prajā- pati.
meaning: त्री॒णि वै॒ वशाजाता॒नि विलिप्ती॒ सूत॒वशा वशा॒ । ताः॒ प्र॒ यछेद् ब्रह्म॒भ्यः सो॒ ऽनाव्रस्कः॒ प्रजा॒पतौ ॥४७॥

text: This Brāhmans! is your sacrifice: thus should one think when he is asked, What time they beg from him the Cow fearful in the with- holder's house.
meaning: एत॒द् वो ब्राह्मणा हवि॒र् इ॒ति मन्वीत याचितः॒ । वशां॒ चे॒द् एनं या॒चेयुर् या॒ भीमा॒ददुषो गृहे॒ ॥४८॥

text: He gave her not to us, so spake the Gods, in anger, of the Cow. With these same verses they addressed Bheda: this brought him to his death.
meaning: देवा॒ वशां॒ प॒र्य् अवदन् न॒ नो ऽदाद् इ॒ति हीडिताः॒ । एता॒भिर् ऋग्भि॒र् भेदं॒ त॒स्माद् वै॒ स॒ प॒राभवत् ॥४९॥

text: Solicited by Indra, still Bheda refused to give this Cow. In strife for victory the Gods destroyed him for that sin of his.
meaning: उतै॒नां भेदो॒ ना॒ददाद् वशा॒म् इ॒न्द्रेण याचितः॒ । त॒स्मात् तं॒ देवा॒ आ॒गसो॒ ऽवृश्चन्न् अहमुत्तरे॒ ॥५०॥

text: The men of evil counsel who advise refusal of the Cow, Miscreants, through their foolishness, are subjected to Indra's wrath.
meaning: ये॒ वशा॒या अ॒दानाय व॒दन्ति परिरापि॒णः । इ॒न्द्रस्य मन्य॒वे जाल्मा॒ आ॒ वृश्चन्ते अ॒चित्त्या ॥५१॥

text: They who seduce the owner of the Cow and say, Bestow her not. Encounter through their want of sense the missile shot by Rudra's hand.
meaning: ये॒ गो॒पतिं पराणी॒याथाहु॒र् मा॒ ददा इ॒ति । रुद्र॒स्यास्तां ते हेतीं॒ प॒रि यन्त्य् अ॒चित्त्या ॥५२॥

text: If in his home one cooks the Cow, sacrificed or not sacrificed. Wronger of Gods and Brāhmans' he departs, dishonest, from the world.
meaning: य॒दि हुतं॒ य॒द्य् अ॒हुताम् अमा॒ च प॒चते वशा॒म् । देवा॒न्त् स॒ब्राह्मणान् ऋत्वा॒ जिह्मो॒ लोका॒न् नि॒र् ऋछति ॥५३॥ {२३}

text: Created by toil and holy fervour, found by devotion, resting in right;
meaning: श्र॒मेण त॒पसा सृष्टा॒ ब्र॒ह्मणा वित्ता॒ र्ते॒ श्रिता॒ ॥१॥

text: Invested with truth, surrounded with honour, compassed about with glory;
meaning: सत्ये॒ना॒वृता श्रिया॒ प्रा॒वृता य॒शसा प॒रीवृता ॥२॥

text: Girt round with inherent power, fortified with faith, protected, by consecration, installed at sacrifice, the world her resting- place;
meaning: स्वध॒या प॒रिहिता श्रद्ध॒या प॒र्यूढा दीक्ष॒या गुप्ता॒ यज्ञे॒ प्र॒तिष्ठिता लोको॒ निध॒नम् ॥३॥

text: Brahma her guide, the Brāhman her lord and ruler;
meaning: ब्र॒ह्म पदवायं॒ ब्राह्मणो॒ ऽधिपतिः ॥४॥

text: Of the Kshatriya who taketh to himself this Brāhman's cow and oppresseth the Brāhman.
meaning: ता॒म् आद॒दानस्य ब्रह्मगवीं॒ जिनतो॒ ब्राह्मणं॒ क्षत्रि॒यस्य ॥५॥

text: The glory, the heroism, and the favouring fortune depart.
meaning: अ॒प क्रामति सूनृ॒ता वीर्यं॑ पु॒न्या लक्ष्मीः॒ ॥६॥ {२४}

text: The energy and vigour, the power and might the speech and mental strength, the glory and duty;
meaning: ओ॒जश् च ते॒जश् च स॒हश् च ब॒लं च वा॒क् चेन्द्रियं॒ च श्री॒श् च ध॒र्मश् च ॥७॥

text: Devotion and princely sway, kingship and people, brilliance and honour, and splendour and wealth;
meaning: ब्र॒ह्म च क्षत्रं॒ च राष्ट्रं॒ च वि॒शश् च त्वि॒षिश् च य॒शश् च व॒र्चश् च द्र॒विणं च ॥८॥

text: Long life and goodly form, and name and fame, inbreathing and expiration, and sight, and hearing;
meaning: आ॒युश् च रूपं॒ च ना॒म च कीर्ति॒श् च प्राण॒श् चापान॒श् च च॒क्षुश् च श्रो॒त्रं च ॥९॥

text: Milk and flavour, and food and nourishment, and right and truth, and action and fulfilment, and children and cattle;
meaning: प॒यश् च र॒सश् चा॒न्नं चान्ना॒द्यं च र्तं॒ च सत्यं॒ चेष्टं॒ च पूर्तं॒ च प्रजा॒ च पश॒वश् च ॥१०॥

text: All these blessings of a Kshatriya depart from him when he oppresseth the Brāhman and taketh to himself the hhman's cow.
meaning: ता॒नि स॒र्वाण्य् अ॒प क्रामन्ति ब्रह्मगवी॒म् आद॒दानस्य जिनतो॒ ब्राह्मणं॒ क्षत्रि॒यस्य ॥११॥ {२५}

text: Terrible is she this Brāhman's cow, and fearfully venomous, visibly witchcraft.
meaning: सै॒षा॒ भीमा॒ ब्रह्मगव्य् अ॑घ॒विषा साक्षा॒त् कृत्या॒ कू॒ल्बजम् आ॒वृता ॥१२॥

text: In her are all horrors and all death.
meaning: स॒र्वाण्य् अस्यां घोरा॒णि स॒र्वे च मृत्य॒वः ॥१३॥

text: In her are all dreadful, deeds, all slaughters of mankind.
meaning: स॒र्वाण्य् अस्यां क्रूरा॒णि स॒र्वे पुरुषवधाः॒ ॥१४॥

text: This, the Brāhman's cow, being appropriated, holdeth bound in the fetter of Death the oppressor of the Brāhman, the blas- phemer of the Gods.
meaning: सा॒ ब्रह्मज्यं॒ देवपीयुं॒ ब्रह्मगव्य् आ॑दीय॒माना मृत्योः॒ प॒द्वीष आ॒ द्यति ॥१५॥

text: A hundred-killing bolt is she: she slays the Brāhman's injurer.
meaning: मेनिः॒ शत॒वधा हि॒ सा॒ ब्रह्मज्य॒स्य क्षि॒तिर् हि॒ सा॒ ॥१६॥

text: Therefore the Brāhmans' cow is held inviolable by the wise.
meaning: त॒स्माद् वै॒ ब्राह्मणा॒नां गौ॒र् दुराध॒र्षा विजानता॒ ॥१७॥

text: Running she is a thunderbolt, when driven away she is Vaisvā- nara;
meaning: व॒ज्रो धा॒वन्ती वैश्वानर॒ उ॒द्वीता ॥१८॥

text: An arrow when she draweth up her hooves, and Mahādeva when she looketh around;
meaning: हेतिः॒ शफा॒न् उत्खिद॒न्ती महादेवो॑ ऽपे॒क्षमाणा ॥१९॥

text: Sharp as a razor when she beholdeth, she thundereth when she belloweth.
meaning: क्षुर॒पविर् ई॒क्षमाणा वा॒श्यमानाभि॒ स्फूर्जति ॥२०॥

text: Death is she when she loweth, and a fierce God when she whis- keth her tail;
meaning: मृत्यु॒र् हिङ्कृण्वत्य् उ॑ग्रो॒ देवः॒ पु॒छं पर्य॒स्यन्ती ॥२१॥

text: Utter destruction when she moveth her ears this way and that, Consumption when she droppeth water;
meaning: सर्वज्यानिः॒ क॒र्णौ वरीवर्ज॒यन्ती राजयक्ष्मो॒ मे॒हन्ती ॥२२॥

text: A missile when milking, pain in the head when milked;
meaning: मेनि॒र् दुह्य॒माना शीर्षक्ति॒र् दुग्धा॒ ॥२३॥

text: The taking away of strength when she approacheth, a hand-to- hand fighter when roughly touched;
meaning: सेदि॒र् उपति॒ष्ठन्ती मिथोयोधः॒ प॒रामृष्टा ॥२४॥

text: Wounding like an arrow when she is fastened by her mouth, contention when she is beaten;
meaning: शरव्या॑ मु॒खे ऽपिनह्य॒मान ऋ॒तिर् हन्य॒माना ॥२५॥

text: Fearfully venomous when falling, darkness when she hath fallen down.
meaning: अघ॒विषा निप॒तन्ती त॒मो नि॒पतिता ॥२६॥

text: Following him, the Brāhman's cow extinguisheth the vital breath of the injurer of the Brāhman.
meaning: अनुग॒छन्ती प्राणा॒न् उ॒प दासयति ब्रह्मगवी॒ ब्रह्मज्य॒स्य ॥२७॥ {२६}

text: Hostility when being cut to pieces, woe to children when the portions are distributed,
meaning: वै॒रं विकृत्य॒माना पौ॒त्राद्यं विभाज्य॒माना ॥२८॥

text: A destructive missile of Gods when she is being seized, misfortune when carried away;
meaning: देवहेति॒र् ह्रिय॒माणा व्यृ॑द्धि॒र् हृता॒ ॥२९॥

text: Misery while being additionally acquired, contumely and abuse while being put in the stall;
meaning: पाप्मा॒धिधीय॒माना पा॒रुष्यम् अवधीय॒माना ॥३०॥

text: Poison when in agitation, fever when seasoned with condi- ments;
meaning: विषं॒ प्रय॒स्यन्ती तक्मा॒ प्र॒यस्ता ॥३१॥

text: Sin while she is cooking, evil dream when she is cooked;
meaning: अघं॒ प्रच्य॒माना दुष्व॒प्न्यं पक्वा॒ ॥३२॥

text: Uprooting when she is being turned round, destruction when she hath been turned round;
meaning: मूलब॒र्हणी पर्याक्रिय॒माणा क्षि॒तिः पर्या॒कृता ॥३३॥

text: Discord by her smell, grief when she is being eviscerated: ser- pent with poison in its fang when drawn;
meaning: अ॒संज्ञा गन्धे॒न शु॒ग् उद्ध्रिय॒माणाशीविष॒ उ॒द्धृता ॥३४॥

text: Loss of power while sacrificially presented, humiliation when she hath been offered;
meaning: अ॒भूतिर् उपह्रिय॒माणा प॒राभूतिर् उ॒पहृता ॥३५॥

text: Wrathful Sarva while being carved. Simidā when cut up:
meaning: शर्वः॒ क्रुद्धः॒ पिश्य॒माना शि॒मिदा पिशिता॒ ॥३६॥

text: Poverty while she is being eaten. Destruction when eaten.
meaning: अ॒वर्तिर् अश्य॒माना नि॒रृतिर् अशिता॒ ॥३७॥

text: The Brāhman's cow when eaten cuts off the injurer of Brāhmans both from this world and from the world yonder.
meaning: अशिता॒ लोका॒च् छिनत्ति ब्रह्मगवी॒ ब्रह्मज्य॒म् अस्मा॒च् चामु॒ष्माच् च ॥३८॥ {२७}

text: Her slaughter is the sin of witchcraft, her cutting-up is a thunder- bolt, her undigested grass is a secret spell.
meaning: त॒स्या आह॒ननं कृत्या॒ मेनि॒र् आश॒सनं वलग॒ ऊ॒बध्यम् ॥३९॥

text: Homelessness is she when denied her rights.
meaning: अस्वग॒ता प॒रिह्णुता ॥४०॥

text: Having become Flesh-eating Agni the Brāhman's cow entereth into and devoureth the oppressor of Brāhmans.
meaning: अग्निः॒ क्रव्या॒द् भूत्वा॒ ब्रह्मगवी॒ ब्रह्मज्यं॒ प्रवि॒श्यात्ति ॥४१॥

text: She sunders all his members, joints, and roots.
meaning: स॒र्वास्या॒ङ्गा प॒र्वा मू॒लानि वृश्चति ॥४२॥

text: She cuts off relationship on the father's side and destroys mater- nal kinship.
meaning: छिन॒त्त्य् अस्य पितृबन्धु॒ प॒रा भावयति मातृबन्धु॒ ॥४३॥

text: The Brāhman's cow, not restored by a Kshatriya, ruins the marriages and all the kinsmen of the Brāhman's oppressor.
meaning: विवाहां॒ ज्ञाती॒न्त् स॒र्वान् अ॒पि क्षापयति ब्रह्मगवी॒ ब्रह्मज्य॒स्य क्षत्रि॒येणा॒पुनर्दीयमाना ॥४४॥

text: She makes him houseless, homeless, childless: he is extinguished without posterity to succeed him.
meaning: अवास्तु॒म् एनम् अ॒स्वगम् अ॒प्रजसं करोत्य् अपरापरणो॒ भवति क्षीय॒ते ॥४५॥

text: So shall it be with the Kshatriya who takes to himself the cow of the Braman who hath this knowledge.
meaning: य॒ एवं॒ विदु॒षो ब्राह्मण॒स्य क्षत्रि॒यो गा॒म् आदत्ते॒ ॥४६॥ {२८}

text: Quickly, when he is smitten down by death, the clamorous vul- tures cry:
meaning: क्षिप्रं॒ वै॒ त॒स्याह॒नने गृ॒ध्राः कुर्वत ऐलब॒म् ॥४७॥

text: Quickly around his funeral fire dance women with dishevelled locks, Striking the hand upon the breast and uttering their evil shriek.
meaning: क्षिप्रं॒ वै॒ त॒स्याद॒हनं प॒रि नृत्यन्ति केशि॒नीर् आघ्नानाः॒ पाणि॒नो॒रसि कुर्वाणाः॒ पाप॒म् ऐलब॒म् ॥४८॥

text: Quickly the wolves are howling in the habitation where he lived:
meaning: क्षिप्रं॒ वै॒ त॒स्य वा॒स्तुषु वृ॒काः कुर्वत ऐलब॒म् ॥४९॥

text: Quickly they ask about him, What is this? What thing hath happened here?
meaning: क्षिप्रं॒ वै॒ त॒स्य पृछन्ति य॒त् त॒द् आ॒सी३द् इदं॒ नु॒ ता॒३द् इ॒ति ॥५०॥

text: Rend, rend to pieces, rend away, destroy, destroy him utterly.
meaning: छिन्ध्य् आ॒ छिन्धि प्र॒ छिन्ध्य् अ॒पि क्षापय क्षाप॒य ॥५१॥

text: Destroy Angirasi! the wretch who robs and wrongs the Brah- mans, born.
meaning: आद॒दानम् आङ्गिरसि ब्रह्मज्य॒म् उ॒प दासय ॥५२॥

text: Of evil womb, thou witchcraft hid, for Vaisvadevi is thy name,
meaning: वैश्वदेवी॒ ह्य् उ॑च्य॒से कृत्या॒ कू॒ल्बजम् आ॒वृता ॥५३॥

text: Consuming, burning all things up, the thunderbolt of spell and charm.
meaning: ओ॒षन्ती समो॒षन्ती ब्र॒ह्मणो व॒ज्रः ॥५४॥

text: Go thou, becoming Mrityu sharp as razor's edge pursue thy course:
meaning: क्षुर॒पविर् मृत्यु॒र् भूत्वा॒ वि॒ धाव त्व॒म् ॥५५॥

text: Thou bearest off the tyrants' strength, their store of merit, and their prayers.
meaning: आ॒ दत्से जिनतां॒ व॒र्च इष्टं॒ पूर्तं॒ चाशि॒षः ॥५६॥

text: Bearing off wrong, thou givest in that world to him who hath been wronged.
meaning: आदा॒य जीतं॒ जीता॒य लोके॑ ऽमु॒ष्मिन् प्र॒ यछसि ॥५७॥

text: O Cow, become a tracker through the curse the Brāhman hath pronounced,
meaning: अ॒घ्न्ये पदवी॒र् भव ब्राह्मण॒स्याभि॒शस्त्या ॥५८॥

text: Become a bolt, an arrow through his sin, be terribly venomous.
meaning: मेनिः॒ शरव्या॑ भवाघा॒द् अघ॒विषा भव ॥५९॥

text: O Cow, break thou the head of him who wrongs the Brāhmans, criminal, niggard, blasphemer of the Gods.
meaning: अ॒घ्न्ये प्र॒ शि॒रो जहि ब्रह्मज्य॒स्य कृता॒गसो देवपीयो॒र् अराध॒सः ॥६०॥

text: Let Agni burn the spiteful wretch when crushed to death and slain by thee.
meaning: त्व॒या प्र॒मूर्णं मृदित॒म् अग्नि॒र् दहतु दुश्चि॒तम् ॥६१॥ {२९}

text: Rend, rend to bits, rend through and through, scorch and con- sume and burn to dust,
meaning: वृश्च॒ प्र॒ वृश्च सं॒ वृश्च द॒ह प्र॒ दह सं॒ दह ॥६२॥

text: Consume thou, even from the root, the Brāhmans' tyrant, god- like Cow!
meaning: ब्रह्मज्यं॒ देव्य् अघ्न्य आ॒ मू॒लाद् अनुसं॒दह ॥६३॥

text: That he may go from Yama's home afar into the worlds of sin. its
meaning: य॒था॒याद् यमसादना॒त् पापलोका॒न् पराव॒तः ॥६४॥

text: So, Goddess Cow, do thou from him, the Brāhmans' tyrant, criminal, niggard, blasphemer of the Gods,
meaning: एवा॒ त्वं॒ देव्य् अघ्न्ये ब्रह्मज्य॒स्य कृता॒गसो देवपीयो॒र् अराध॒सः ॥६५॥

text: With hundred-knotted thunderbolt, sharpened and edged with razor-blades,
meaning: व॒ज्रेण शत॒पर्वणा तीक्ष्णे॒न क्षुर॒भृष्टिना ॥६६॥

text: Strike off the shoulders and the head.
meaning: प्र॒ स्कन्धा॒न् प्र॒ शि॒रो जहि ॥६७॥

text: Snatch thou the hair from off his head, and from his body strip the skin:
meaning: लो॒मान्य् अस्य सं॒ छिन्धि त्व॒चम् अस्य वि॒ वेष्टय ॥६८॥

text: Tear out his sinews, cause his flesh to fall in pieces from his frame.
meaning: मांसा॒न्य् अस्य शातय स्ना॒वान्य् अस्य सं॒ वृह ॥६९॥

text: Crush thou his bones together, strike and beat the marrow out of him.
meaning: अ॒स्थीन्य् अस्य पीडय मज्जा॒नम् अस्य नि॒र् जहि ॥७०॥

text: Dislocate all his limbs and joints.
meaning: स॒र्वास्या॒ङ्गा प॒र्वाणि वि॒ श्रथय ॥७१॥

text: From earth let the Carnivorous Agni drive him, let Vayu burn. him from mid-air's broad region.
meaning: अग्नि॒र् एनं क्रव्या॒त् पृथिव्या॒ नुदताम् उ॒द् ओषतु वायु॒र् अन्त॒रिक्षान् महतो॒ वरिम्णः॒ ॥७२॥

text: From heaven let Sūrya drive him and consume him.
meaning: सू॒र्य एनं दिवः॒ प्र॒ णुदतां न्य् ओ॑षतु ॥७३॥ {३०}

text: Rise, Mighty One, who liest in the waters, and enter this thy fair and glorious kingdom. Let Rohita who made this All uphold thee carefully nurtured for supreme dominion.
meaning: उदे॒हि वाजिन् यो॒ अप्स्व् अ॑न्त॒र् इदं॒ राष्ट्रं॒ प्र॒ विश सूनृ॒तावत् । यो॒ रो॒हितो वि॒श्वम् इदं॒ जजा॒न स॒ त्वा राष्ट्रा॒य सु॒भृतं बिभर्तु ॥१॥

text: The strength that was in waters hath ascended. Mount o'er the tribes which thou hast generated. Creating Soma, waters, plants and cattle, bring hitherward both quadrupeds and bipeds.
meaning: उ॒द् वा॒ज आ॒ गन् यो॒ अप्स्व् अ॑न्त॒र् वि॒श आ॒ रोह त्व॒द्योनयो याः॒ । सो॒मं द॒धानो ऽप॒ ओ॒षधीर् गा॒श् च॒तुष्पदो द्विप॒द आ॒ वेशयेह॒ ॥२॥

text: Ye Maruts, strong and mighty, sons of Prisni, with Indra for ally crush down our foemen. Let Rohita, ye bounteous givers, hear you, thrice-seven Maruts who delight in sweetness!
meaning: यूय॒म् उग्रा॒ मरुतः पृश्निमातर इ॒न्द्रेण युजा॒ प्र॒ मृणीत श॒त्रून् । आ॒ वो रो॒हितः शृणवत् सुदानवस् त्रिषप्ता॒सो मरुतः स्वादुसंमुदः ॥३॥

text: Up to the lap of births, to lofty places, hath Rohita, the germ of Dames, ascended. Conjoined with these he found the six realms: seeing his way in front here he received the kingship.
meaning: रु॒हो रुरोह रो॒हित आ॒ रुरोह ग॒र्भो ज॒नीनां जनु॒षाम् उप॒स्थम् । ता॒भिः सं॒रब्धम् अ॒न्व् अविन्दन् ष॒ड् उर्वी॒र् गातुं॒ प्रप॒श्यन्न् इह॒ राष्ट्र॒म् आ॒हाः ॥४॥

text: For thee hath Rohita obtained dominion, scattered thine ene- mies, become thy safeguard. So by the potent Sakvaris let Heaven and Earth be milked to- yield thee all thy wishes.
meaning: आ॒ ते राष्ट्र॒म् इह॒ रो॒हितो ऽहार्षीद् व्य् आ॑स्थन् मृ॒धो अ॒भयं ते अभूत् । त॒स्मै ते द्यावापृथिवी॒ रेव॒तीभिः का॒मं दुहाताम् इह॒ श॒क्वरीभिः ॥५॥

text: Rohita gave the Earth and Heavens their being. There Para- meshthin held the cord extended. Thereon reposeth Aja Ekapāda. He with his might hath stab- lished Earth and Heaven.
meaning: रो॒हितो द्या॒वापृथिवी॒ जजान त॒त्र त॒न्तुं परमेष्ठी॒ ततान । त॒त्र शिश्रिये ऽज॒ ए॒कपादो॒ ऽदृंहद् द्या॒वापृथिवी॒ ब॒लेन ॥६॥

text: Rohita firmly stablished Earth and Heaven: by him was ether fixt by him the welkin. He measured out mid air and all the regions: by him the Gods found life that lasts for ever.
meaning: रो॒हितो द्या॒वापृथिवी॒ अदृंहत् ते॒न स्व॑ स्तभितं॒ ते॒न ना॒कः । ते॒नान्त॒रिक्षं वि॒मिता र॒जांसि ते॒न देवा॒ अमृ॒तम् अ॒न्व् अविन्दन् ॥७॥

text: Arranging shoots, springs, Rohita considered this Universe in all its forms and phases. May he, gone up to heaven with mighty glory, anoint thy sov- ranty with milk and fatness.
meaning: वि॒ रो॒हितो अमृशद् विश्व॒रूपं समाकुर्वाणः॒ प्ररु॒हो रु॒हश् च । दि॒वं रूढ्वा॒ महता॒ महिम्ना॒ सं॒ ते राष्ट्र॒म् अनक्तु प॒यसा घृते॒न ॥८॥

text: Thy risings up, thy mountings and ascensions wherewith thou fillest heaven and air's mid-region— By prayer for these, by milk of these, increasing, in Rohita's kingdom watch, among his people.
meaning: या॒स् ते रु॒हः प्ररु॒हो या॒स् त आरु॒हो या॒भिर् आपृणा॒सि दि॒वम् अन्त॒रिक्षम् । ता॒सां ब्र॒ह्मणा प॒यसा ववृधानो॒ विशि॒ राष्ट्रे॒ जागृहि रो॒हितस्य ॥९॥

text: The tribes thy heat produced have followed hither the Calf and Gāyatri, the strain that lauds him. With friendly heart let them approach to serve thee, and the Calf Rohita come with his mother.
meaning: य॒स् ते वि॒शस् त॒पसः संबभूवु॒र् वत्सं॒ गायत्री॒म् अ॒नु ता॒ इहा॒गुः । ता॒स् त्वा विशन्तु म॒नसा शिवे॒न सं॒माता वत्सो॒ अभ्य् ए॑तु रो॒हितः ॥१०॥ {१}

text: Erected, Rohita hath reached the welkin, wise, young, creating every form and figure. Agni, refulgent with his heightened lustre, in the third realm hath brought us joy and gladness.
meaning: ऊर्ध्वो॒ रो॒हितो अ॒धि ना॒के अस्थाद् वि॒श्वा रूपा॒णि जन॒यन् यु॒वा कविः॒ । तिग्मे॒नाग्नि॒र् ज्यो॒तिषा वि॒ भाति तृती॒ये चक्रे र॒जसि प्रिया॒णि ॥११॥

text: Thousand-horned Bull, may Jātavedas, worshipped with butter, balmed with Soma, rich in heroes, Besought, ne'er quit me; may I ne'er forsake thee. Give me abundant men and herds of cattle.
meaning: सह॒स्रशृङ्गो वृषभो॒ जात॒वेदा घृता॒हुतः सो॒मपृष्ठः सुवी॒रः । मा॒ मा हासीन् नाथितो॒ ने॒त् त्वा ज॒हानि गोपोषं॒ च मे वीरपोषं॒ च धेहि ॥१२॥

text: Rohita is the sire and mouth of worship: to him with voice, ear, heart I pay oblation. To Rohita come Gods with joyful spirit. May he by risings raise me till I join him.
meaning: रो॒हितो यज्ञ॒स्य जनिता॒ मु॒खं च रो॒हिताय वाचा॒ श्रो॒त्रेण म॒नसा जुहोमि । रो॒हितं देवा॒ यन्ति सुमनस्य॒मानाः स॒ मा रो॒हैः सामित्यै॒ रोहयतु ॥१३॥

text: Rohita ordered sacrifice for Visvakarman: thence have I obta- ined this strength and energy. May I proclaim thee as my kin over the greatness of the world.
meaning: रो॒हितो यज्ञं॒ व्य् अ॑दधाद् विश्व॒कर्मणे त॒स्मात् ते॒जांस्य् उ॒प मेमा॒न्य् आ॒गुः । वोचे॒यं ते ना॒भिं भु॒वनस्या॒धि मज्म॒नि ॥१४॥

text: On thee have mounted Brihatī and Pankti. and Kakup with great splendour, Jātavedas! The cry of Vashat with the voice uplifted and Rohita with seed on thee have mounted.
meaning: आ॒ त्वा रुरोह बृहत्य् उ॑त॒ पङ्क्ति॒र् आ॒ ककु॒ब् व॒र्चसा जातवेदः । आ॒ त्वा रुरोहोष्णिहाक्षरो॒ वषट्कार॒ आ॒ त्वा रुरोह रो॒हितो रे॒तसा सह॒ ॥१५॥

text: He goes into the womb of earth, he robes himself in heaven and air. He on the Bright One's station hath reached heavenly light and all the worlds.
meaning: अयं॒ वस्ते ग॒र्भं पृथिव्या॒ दि॒वं वस्ते ऽय॒म् अन्त॒रिक्षम् । अयं॒ ब्रध्न॒स्य विष्ट॒पि स्व॑र् लोका॒न् व्य् आ॑नशे ॥१६॥

text: To us, Vāchaspati, may Earth be pleasant, pleasant our dwelling, pleasant be our couches. Even here may Prāna be our friend: may Agni, O Parameshthin give thee life and splendour.
meaning: वा॒चस् पते पृथिवी॒ नः स्योना॒ स्योना॒ यो॒निस् त॒ल्पा नः सुशे॒वा । इहै॒व॒ प्राणः॒ सख्ये॒ नो अस्तु तं॒ त्वा परमेष्ठिन् प॒र्य् अग्नि॒र् आ॒युषा व॒र्चसा दधातु ॥१७॥

text: And those, Vāchaspati, our own five seasons, sacred to Visva- karman their creator. Even here our friend be Prāna: Parameshthin, may Rohita vouchsafe the life and splendour.
meaning: वा॒चस् पत ऋत॒वः प॒ञ्च ये॒ नौ वैश्वकर्मणाः॒ प॒रि ये॒ संबभूवुः॒ । इहै॒व॒ प्राणः॒ सख्ये॒ नो अस्तु तं॒ त्वा परमेष्ठिन् प॒रि रो॒हित आ॒युषा व॒र्चसा दधातु ॥१८॥

text: Breed, O Vāchaspati, joy and understanding, kine i n our stall and children in our consorts. Even here may Prāna be our friend: may Agni, O Parameshthin, give thee life and splendour.
meaning: वा॒चस् पते सौमनसं॒ म॒नश् च गोष्ठे॒ नो गा॒ जन॒य यो॒निषु प्रजाः॒ । इहै॒व॒ प्राणः॒ सख्ये॒ नो अस्तु तं॒ त्वा परमेष्ठिन् प॒र्य् अह॒म् आ॒युषा व॒र्चसा दधातु ॥१९॥

text: With splendour let God Savitar, and Agni, with splendour Mitra, Varuna invest thee. Treading down all Malignities, come hither. Pleasant and' glorious hast thou made this kingdom.
meaning: प॒रि त्वा धात् सविता॒ देवो॒ अग्नि॒र् व॒र्चसा मित्रा॒व॒रुणाव् अभि॒ त्वा । स॒र्वा अ॒रातीर् अवक्रा॒मन्न् ए॒हीदं॒ राष्ट्र॒म् अकरः सुनृ॒तावत् ॥२०॥ {२}

text: Rohita, car-borne by a speckled leader, thou, pouring water,. goest on in triumph.
meaning: यं॒ त्वा पृ॒षती र॒थे प्र॒ष्टिर् व॒हति रोहित । शुभा॒ यासि रिण॒न्न् अपः॒ ॥२१॥

text: Golden, refulgent, lofty is the Lady, Rohinī, Rohita's devoted Consort. Through her may we win various spoil and booty, through her be conquerors in every battle.
meaning: अ॒नुव्रता रो॒हिणी रो॒हितस्य सूरिः॒ सुव॒र्णा बृहती॒ सुव॒र्चाः । त॒या वा॒जान् विश्व॒रूपां जयेम त॒या वि॒श्वाः पृ॒तना अभि॒ ष्याम ॥२२॥

text: Rohita's seat is Rohinī before us: that is the path the speckled Mare pursueth. Kasyapas and Gandharvas lead her upward, and heavenly sages ever watch and guard her,
meaning: इदं॒ स॒दो रो॒हिणी रो॒हितस्यासौ॒ प॒न्थाः पृ॒षती ये॒न या॒ति । तां॒ गन्धर्वाः॒ कश्य॒पा उ॒न् नयन्ति तां॒ रक्षन्ति कव॒यो॒ ऽप्रमादम् ॥२३॥

text: Sūrya's bay steeds refulgent and immortal draw the light-rolling. chariot on for ever. Drinker of fatness, Rohita, resplendent, hath entered into various-coloured heaven,
meaning: सू॒र्यस्या॒श्वा ह॒रयः केतुम॒न्तः स॒दा वहन्त्य् अमृ॒ताः सुखं॒ र॒थम् । घृतपा॒वा रो॒हितो भ्रा॒जमानो दि॒वं देवः॒ पृ॒षतीम् आ॒ विवेश ॥२४॥

text: Rohita, Bull whose horns are sharply pointed, superior of Agni and of Sūrya, He who supports the sundered earth and heaven,—from him the Gods effect their own creations.
meaning: यो॒ रो॒हितो वृषभ॒स् तिग्म॒शृङ्गः प॒र्य् अग्निं॒ प॒रि सू॒र्यं बभू॒व । यो॒ विष्टभ्ना॒ति पृथिवीं॒ दि॒वं च त॒स्माद् देवा॒ अ॒धि सृ॒ष्टीः सृजन्ते ॥२५॥

text: Rohita rose to heaven from mighty ocean, Rohita rose and clomb all steeps and rises.
meaning: रो॒हितो दि॒वम् आ॒रुहन् महतः॒ प॒र्य् अर्णवा॒त् । स॒र्वो रुरोह रो॒हितो रु॒हः ॥२६॥

text: Prepare the Milky One who teems with fatness: she is the Gods' never-reluctant milch-cow. Indra drink Soma: ours be peace and safety. Let Agni lead the laud, and chase our foemen.
meaning: वि॒ मिमीष्व प॒यस्वतीं घृता॒चीं देवा॒नां धेनु॒र् अ॒नपस्पृग् एषा॒ । इ॒न्द्रः सो॒मं पिबतु क्षे॒मो अस्त्व् अग्निः॒ प्र॒ स्तौतु वि॒ मृ॒धो नुदस्व ॥२७॥

text: Both kindling and inflamed, adored with butter and enhanced thereby. May conquering Agni, conqueror of all, destroy mine enemies.
meaning: स॒मिद्धो अग्निः॒ समिधानो॒ घृत॒वृद्धो घृता॒हुतः । अभीषा॒ट् विश्वाषा॒ड् अग्निः॒ सप॒त्नान् हन्तु ये॒ म॒म ॥२८॥

text: Let him smite down in death and burn the foeman who attacketh me. Our adversaries we consume through Agni the Carnivorous.
meaning: ह॒न्त्व् एनान् प्र॒ दहत्व् अ॒रिर् यो॒ नः पृतन्य॒ति । क्रव्या॒दाग्नि॒ना वयं॒ सप॒त्नान् प्र॒ दहामसि ॥२९॥

text: Beat them down, Indra, with thy bolt, beat them down, mighty with thine arm. I through the energy and force of Agni have secured my foes.
meaning: अवाची॒नान् अ॒व जही॒न्द्र व॒ज्रेण बाहुमा॒न् । अ॒धा सप॒त्नान् मामका॒न् अग्ने॒स् ते॒जोभिर् आ॒दिषि ॥३०॥ {३}

text: Cast down our foes beneath our feet, O Agni. Brihaspati, oppress our rebel kinsman. Low let them fall, O Indra-Agni. Mitra-Varuna, powerless to show their anger.
meaning: अ॒ग्ने सप॒त्नान् अ॒धरान् पादयास्म॒द् व्यथ॒या सजात॒म् उत्पि॒पानं बृहस्पते । इ॒न्द्राग्नी मि॒त्रावरुणाव् अ॒धरे पद्यन्ताम् अ॒प्रतिमन्यूयमानाः ॥३१॥

text: Ascending up on high, O God. O Sūrya, drive my foes away. Yea, beat them backward with the stone: to deepest darkness let them go.
meaning: उद्यं॒स् त्वं॒ देव सूर्य सप॒त्नान् अ॒व मे जहि । अ॒वैनान् अ॒श्मना जहि ते॒ यन्त्व् अधमं॒ त॒मः ॥३२॥

text: Calf of Virāj, the Bull of prayers and worship, whitebacked, he hath gone up to air's mid-region. Singing, they hymn the Calf, with gifts of butter: him who is Brahma they exalt with Brahma.
meaning: वत्सो॒ विरा॒जो वृषभो॒ मतीना॒म् आ॒ रुरोह शुक्र॒पृष्ठो ऽन्त॒रिक्षम् । घृते॒नार्क॒म् अभ्य् अ॑र्चन्ति वत्सं॒ ब्र॒ह्म स॒न्तं ब्र॒ह्मणा वर्धयन्ति ॥३३॥

text: Rise up to earth, rise up to heaven above it; rise up to opulence, rise up to kingship. Rise up to offspring, rise to life immortal; rise, and with Rohita unite thy body.
meaning: दि॒वं च रो॒ह पृथिवीं॒ च रोह राष्ट्रं॒ च रो॒ह द्र॒विणं च रोह । प्रजां॒ च रो॒हामृ॒तं च रोह रो॒हितेन तन्वं॑ सं॒ स्पृषस्व ॥३४॥

text: With all the Gods who circle round the Sun, upholding royal sway, With all of these may Rohita accordant, give sovranty to thee with friendly spirit.
meaning: ये॒ देवा॒ राष्ट्रभृ॒तो ऽभि॒तो य॒न्ति सू॒र्यम् । तै॒ष् टे रो॒हितः सम्विदानो॒ राष्ट्रं॒ दधातु सुमनस्य॒मानः ॥३५॥

text: Cleansed by prayer, sacrifices bear thee upward: bay coursers, ever travelling, convey thee. Thy light shines over sea and billowy ocean.
meaning: उ॒त् त्वा यज्ञा॒ ब्र॒ह्मपूता वहन्त्य् अध्वग॒तो ह॒रयस् त्वा वहन्ति । तिरः॒ समुद्र॒म् अ॒ति रोचसे ऽर्णव॒म् ॥३६॥

text: Rohita, conqueror of cows and riches and gathered spoil, is heaven's and earth's upholder. Over earth's greatness would I tell my kinship with thee who hast a thousand births and seven.
meaning: रो॒हिते द्या॒वापृथिवी॒ अ॒धि श्रिते॒ वसुजि॒ति गोजि॒ति संधनाजि॒ति । सह॒स्रं य॒स्य ज॒निमानि सप्त॒ च वोचे॒यं ते ना॒भिं भु॒वनस्या॒धि मज्म॒नि ॥३७॥

text: A glorious sight to beasts and men, thou goest glorious to the regions and mid-regions. On earth's, on Aditi's bosom, bright with glory. Fain would I equal Savitar in beauty.
meaning: यशा॒ यासि प्रदि॒शो दि॒शश् च यशाः॒ पशूना॒म् उत॒ चर्षणीना॒म् । यशाः॒ पृथिव्या॒ अ॒दित्या उप॒स्थे ऽहं॒ भूयासं सविते॒व चा॒रुः ॥३८॥

text: Thou, yonder, knowest all things here, when here thou knowest what is there. From here men see the sphere of light, Sūrya profoundly wise in heaven.
meaning: अमु॒त्र स॒न्न् इह॒ वेत्थेतः॒ सं॒स् ता॒नि पश्यसि । इतः॒ पश्यन्ति रोचनं॒ दिवि॒ सू॒र्यं विपश्चि॒तम् ॥३९॥

text: A God, thou injurest the Gods: thou movest in the ocean's depth. Men kindle common Agni: him only the higher sages know.
meaning: देवो॒ देवा॒न् मर्चयस्य् अन्त॒श् चरस्य् अर्णवे॒ । समान॒म् अग्नि॒म् इन्धते तं॒ विदुः कव॒यः प॒रे ॥४०॥ {४}

text: Beneath the upper realm, above this lower, bearing her Calf at foot, the Cow hath risen Whitherward, to what place hath she departed? Where doth she calve? Not in this herd of cattle.
meaning: अवः॒ प॒रेण पर॒ एना॒वरेण पदा॒ वत्सं॒ बि॒ब्रती गौ॒र् उ॒द् अस्थात् । सा॒ कद्री॒ची कं॒ स्विद् अ॒र्धं प॒रागात् क्व॑ स्वित् सूते नहि॒ यूथे॒ अस्मि॒न् ॥४१॥

text: She hath become one-footed or two-footed, four-footed, or eight-footed or nine-footed, This universe's thousand-syllabled Pankti Oceans flow forth from her in all directions.
meaning: ए॒कपदी द्विप॒दी सा॒ च॒तुष्पद्य् अष्टा॒पदी न॒वपदी बभूवु॒षी । सह॒स्राक्षरा भु॒वनस्य पङ्क्ति॒स् त॒स्याः समुद्रा॒ अ॒धि वि॒ क्षरन्ति ॥४२॥

text: Rising to heaven, immortal, hear my calling. Cleansed by prayer, sacrifices bear thee upward. Bay coursers, ever on the road, convey thee.
meaning: आरो॒हन् द्या॒म् अमृ॒तः प्रा॒व मे व॒चः । उ॒त् त्वा यज्ञा॒ ब्र॒ह्मपूता वहन्त्य् अध्वग॒तो ह॒रयस् त्वा वहन्ति ॥४३॥

text: This, O Immortal One, I know of thee, thy progress to the sky thy dwelling-place in loftiest heaven.
meaning: वे॒द त॒त् ते अमर्त्य य॒त् त आक्र॒मणं दिवि॒ । य॒त् ते सध॒स्थं परमे॒ व्यो॑मन् ॥४४॥

text: Beyond the sky, beyond the Earth looks Sūrya, and beyond the floods. The single eye of all that is; to mighty heaven hath he arisen.
meaning: सू॒र्यो द्यां॒ सू॒र्यः पृठिवीं॒ सू॒र्य आ॒पो॒ऽति पश्यति । सू॒र्यो भूत॒स्यै॒कं च॒क्षुर् आ॒ रुरोह दि॒वं मही॒म् ॥४५॥

text: The earth was made his altar, and the wide expanses were the fence. There Rohita established both these Agnis, fervent heat and cold.
meaning: उर्वी॒र् आसन् परिध॒यो वे॒दिर् भू॒मिर् अकल्पत । त॒त्रैता॒व् अग्नी॒ आ॒धत्त हिमं॒ घ्रंसं॒ च रो॒हितः ॥४६॥

text: He stablished heat and cold, he made the mountains sacrificial posts. Then both the Agnis, Rohita's who found celestial light, with rain for molten butter, sacrificed.
meaning: हिमं॒ घ्रंसं॒ चाधा॒य यू॒पान् कृत्वा॒ प॒र्वतान् । वर्षा॒ज्याव् अग्नी॒ ईजाते रो॒हितस्य स्वर्वि॒दः ॥४७॥

text: Rohita's Agni-his who found heaven's light-is kindled with the prayer. From him the heat, from him the cold, from him the sacrifice was born.
meaning: स्वर्वि॒दो रो॒हितस्य ब्र॒ह्मणाग्निः॒ स॒म् इध्यते । त॒स्माद् घ्रंस॒स् त॒स्माद् धिम॒स् त॒स्माद् यज्ञो॒ ऽजायत ॥४८॥

text: Both Agins-Rohita's who found the light of heaven—made strong by prayer, Waxing by prayer, adored with prayer, by prayer enkindled, sacrificed.
meaning: ब्र॒ह्मणाग्नी॒ वावृधानौ॒ ब्र॒ह्मवृद्धौ ब्र॒ह्माहुतौ । ब्र॒ह्मेद्धाव् अग्नी॒ ईजाते रो॒हितस्य स्वर्वि॒दः ॥४९॥

text: One is deposited in Truth, one kindled in the waters: both Agnis of Rohita who found the light are set aflame with prayer.
meaning: सत्ये॒ अन्यः॒ समा॒हितो ऽप्स्व् अ॑न्यः॒ स॒म् इध्यते । ब्र॒ह्मेद्धाव् अग्नी॒ ईजाते रो॒हितस्य स्वर्वि॒दः ॥५०॥ {५}

text: That decked by Wind, and that prepared by Indra Brāhman- aspati, Agnis of Rohita who found light, prayer-enkindled, sacrificed.
meaning: यं॒ वा॒तः परिशु॒म्भति यं॒ वे॒न्द्रो ब्र॒ह्मणस्प॒तिः । ब्र॒ह्मेद्धावग्नी॒ ईजाते रो॒हितस्य स्वर्वि॒दः ॥५१॥

text: Rohita made the earth to be his altar, heaven his Dakshinā. Then heat he took for Agni, and with rain for molten butter he created every living thing.
meaning: वे॒दिं भू॒मिं कल्पयित्वा॒ दि॒वं कृत्वा॒ द॒क्षिणाम् । घ्रंसं॒ त॒द् अग्निं॒ कृत्वा॒ चका॒र वि॒श्वम् आत्मन्व॒द् वर्षे॒णा॒ज्येन रो॒हितः ॥५२॥

text: The earth became an altar, heat was Agni, and the butter rain. There Agni made, by song and hymn, these mountains rise and stand erect.
meaning: वर्ष॒म् आ॒जम् घ्रंसो॒ अग्नि॒र् वे॒दिर् भू॒मिर् अकल्पत । त॒त्रैता॒न् प॒र्वतान् अग्नि॒र् गीर्भि॒र् ऊर्ध्वां॒ अकल्पयत् ॥५३॥

text: Then, having made the hills stand up, Rohita spake to Earth, and said: In thee let every thing be born, what is and what is yet to be.
meaning: गीर्भि॒र् ऊर्ध्वा॒न् कल्पयित्वा॒ रो॒हितो भू॒मिम् अब्रवीत् । त्व॒यीदं॒ स॒र्वं जायतां य॒द् भूतं॒ य॒च् च भाव्य॑म् ॥५४॥

text: This sacrifice, the first of all, the past, the present, had its birth. From that arose this universe, yea, all this world of brightness, brought by Rohita the heavenly Sage.
meaning: स॒ यज्ञः॒ प्रथमो॒ भूतो॒ भ॒व्यो अजायत । त॒स्माद् ध जज्ञ इदं॒ स॒र्वं य॒त् किं॒ चेदं॒ विरो॒चते रो॒हितेन ऋ॒षिणा॒भृतम् ॥५५॥

text: If thou should kick a cow, or by indecent act offend the Sun, Thy root I sever; nevermore mayst thou cast shadow on the ground.
meaning: य॒श् च गां॒ पदा॒ स्फुर॒ति प्रत्य॒ङ् सू॒र्यं च मे॒हति । त॒स्य वृश्चामि ते मू॒लं न॒ छायां॒ करवो॒ ऽपरम् ॥५६॥

text: Thou who, between the fire and me, passest across the line of shade. Thy root I sever: nevermore mayst thou cast shadow on the ground.
meaning: यो॒ माभिछाय॒म् अत्ये॒षि मां॒ चाग्निं॒ चान्तरा॒ । त॒स्य वृश्चामि ते मू॒लं न॒ छायां॒ करवो॒ ऽपरम् ॥५७॥

text: Whoe'er he be who, Sūrya, God! comes between thee and me to-day, On him we wipe away ill-dream, and troubles, and impurity.
meaning: यो॒ अद्य॒ देव सूर्य त्वां॒ च मां॒ चान्तरा॒यति । दुष्व॒प्न्यं त॒स्मिं छ॒मलं दुरिता॒नि च मृज्महे ॥५८॥

text: Let us not, Indra, leave the path, the Soma-presser's sacrifice. Let not malignities dwell with us.
meaning: मा॒ प्र॒ गाम पथो॒ वयं॒ मा॒ यज्ञा॒द् इन्द्र सोमि॒नः । मा॒न्त॒ स्थुर् नो अ॒रातयः ॥५९॥

text: May we obtain, completely wrought, the thread spun out tc reach the Gods, That perfecteth our sacrifice.
meaning: यो॒ यज्ञ॒स्य प्रसा॒धनस् त॒न्तुर् देवे॒ष्व् आ॒ततः । त॒म् आ॒हुतम् अशीमहि ॥६०॥ {६}

text: Radiant, refulgent in the sky are reared the banners of his light, Āditya's, who beholdeth man, mighty in act and bountiful.
meaning: उ॒द् अस्य केत॒वो दिवि॒ शुक्रा॒ भ्रा॒जन्त ईरते । आदित्य॒स्य नृच॒क्षसो म॒हिव्रतस्य मीढु॒षः ॥१॥

text: Let us laud him, the whole world's Herdsman, Sūrya, who with his rays illumines all the regions, Mark of the quarters, brightening them with lustre, swift, mighty-pinioned, flying in the ocean.
meaning: दिशां॒ प्रज्ञा॒नां स्वर॒यन्तम् अर्चि॒षा सुपक्ष॒म् आशुं॒ पत॒यन्तम् अर्णवे॒ । स्त॒वाम सू॒र्यं भु॒वनस्य गोपां॒ यो॒ रश्मि॒भिर् दि॒श आभा॒ति स॒र्वाः ॥२॥

text: From west to east thou speedest freely, making by magic day and night of diverse colours. This is Āditya, thy transcendent glory, that thou alone art born through all creation.
meaning: य॒त् प्रा॒ङ् प्रत्य॒ङ् स्वध॒या या॒सि शी॒भं ना॒नारूपे अ॒हनी क॒र्षि माय॒या । त॒द् आदित्य म॒हि त॒त् ते म॒हि श्र॒वो य॒द् ए॒को वि॒श्वं प॒रि भू॒म जा॒यसे ॥३॥

text: Victorious, inspired, and brightly shining, whom seven strong tawny-coloured coursers carry, Whom Atri lifted from the flood to heaven, thus men behold thee as thy course thou runnest.
meaning: विपश्चि॒तं तर॒णिं भ्रा॒जमानं व॒हन्ति यं॒ हरि॒तः सप्त॒ बह्वीः॒ । स्रुता॒द् य॒म् अ॒त्त्रिर् दि॒वम् उन्निना॒य तं॒ त्वा पश्यन्ति परिया॒न्तम् आजि॒म् ॥४॥

text: Let them not snare thee speeding on thy journey: pass safely, swiftly places hard to traverse, While measuring out the day and night thou movest—O Sūrya, even Heaven and Earth the Goddess.
meaning: मा॒ त्वा दभन् परिया॒न्तम् आजिं॒ स्वस्ति॒ दुर्गां॒ अ॒ति याहि शी॒भम् । दि॒वं च सूर्य पृथिवीं॒ च देवी॒म् अहोरात्रे॒ विमि॒मानो य॒द् ए॒षि ॥५॥

text: Hail to thy rapid car whereon, O Sūrya, thou circlest in a moment both the limits, Whirled by thy bay steeds, best of all at drawing, thy hundred horses or seven goodly coursers!
meaning: स्वस्ति॒ ते सूर्य चर॒से र॒थाय ये॒नोभा॒व् अ॒न्तौ परिया॒सि सद्यः॒ । यं॒ ते व॒हन्ति हरि॒तो व॒हिष्ठाः शत॒म् अ॒श्वा य॒दि वा सप्त॒ बह्वीः॒ ॥६॥

text: Mount thy strong car, O Sūrya, lightly rolling, drawn by good steeds, propitious, brightly gleaming, Whirled by thy bays, most excellent at drawing, thy hundred horses or seven goodly coursers.
meaning: सुखं॒ सूर्य र॒थम् अंशुम॒न्तं स्योनं॒ सुव॒ह्निम् अ॒धि तिष्ठ वाजि॒नम् । यं॒ ते व॒हन्ति हरि॒तो व॒हिष्ठाः शत॒म् अ॒श्वा य॒दि वा सप्त॒ बह्वीः॒ ॥७॥

text: Sūrya hath harnessed to his car to draw him seven stately bay steeds gay with wolden housings. The Bright One started from the distant region: dispelling gloom the God hath climbed the heavens.
meaning: सप्त॒ सू॒र्यो हरि॒तो या॒तवे र॒थे हि॒रण्यत्वचसो बृहती॒र् अयुक्त । अ॒मोचि शुक्रो॒ र॒जसः पर॒स्ताद् विधू॒य देव॒स् त॒मो दि॒वम् आ॒रुहत् ॥८॥

text: With lofty banner hath the God gone upward, and introduced the light, expelling darkness. He hath looked round on all the worlds, the Hero, the son of Aditi, Celestial Eagle.
meaning: उ॒त् केतु॒ना बृहता॒ देव॒ आ॒गन्न् अ॒पावृक् त॒मो ऽभि॒ ज्यो॒तिर् अश्रैत् । दिव्यः॒ सुपर्णः॒ स॒ वीरो॒ व्य् अ॑ख्यद् अ॒दितेः पुत्रो॒ भु॒वनानि वि॒श्वा ॥९॥

text: Rising, thou spreadest out thy rays, thou nourishest all shapes and forms. Thou with thy power illumest both the oceans, encompassing all spheres with thy refulgence.
meaning: उद्य॒न् रश्मी॒न् आ॒ तनुषे वि॒श्वा रुपा॒णि पुष्यसि । उभा॒ समुद्रौ॒ क्र॒तुना वि॒ भासि स॒र्वांल् लोका॒न् परिभू॒र् भ्रा॒जमानः ॥१०॥ {७}

text: Moving by magic power to east and westward, these two young creatures, sporting, circle ocean. One of the pair beholds all living creatures: with wheels of gold the bay steeds bear the other.
meaning: पूर्वापरं॒ चरतो माय॒यैतौ॒ शि॒शू क्री॒डन्तौ प॒रि यातो ऽर्णव॒म् । वि॒श्वान्यो॒ भु॒वना विच॒ष्टे हैरण्यै॒र् अन्यं॒ हरि॒तो वहन्ति ॥११॥

text: Atri established thee in heaven. O Surya, to create the month. So on thou goest, firmly held, heating, beholding all that is.
meaning: दिवि॒ त्वा॒त्त्रिर् अधारयत् सू॒र्या मा॒साय क॒र्तवे । स॒ एषि सु॒धृतस् त॒पन् वि॒श्वा भूता॒वचा॒कशत् ॥१२॥

text: As the Calf both his parents so thou joinest both the distant bounds, Surely the Gods up yonder knew this sacred mystery long ago.
meaning: उभा॒व् अ॒न्तौ स॒म् अर्षसि वत्सः॒ संमात॒राव् इव । नन्व् ए॑त॒द् इतः॒ पुरा॒ ब्र॒ह्म देवा॒ अमी॒ विदुः ॥१३॥

text: Sūrya is eager to obtain all wealth that lies along the sea, Great is the course spread out for him, his eastward and his westward path.
meaning: य॒त् समुद्र॒म् अ॒नु श्रितं॒ त॒त् सिषासति सू॒र्यः । अ॒ध्वास्य वि॒ततो महा॒न् पू॒र्वश् चा॒परश् च यः॒ ॥१४॥

text: He finishes his race with speed and never turns his thought aside, Thereby he keeps not from the Gods enjoyment of the Drink of Life.
meaning: तं॒ स॒म् आप्नोति जूति॒भिस् त॒तो ना॒प चिकित्सति । ते॒नामृ॒तस्य भक्षं॒ देवा॒नां ना॒व रुन्धते ॥१५॥

text: His heralds bear him up aloft, the God who knoweth all that live, Sūrya, that all may look on him.
meaning: उ॒द् उ त्यं॒ जात॒वेदसं देवं॒ वहन्ति केत॒वः । दृ॒शे॒ वि॒श्वाय सू॒र्यम् ॥१६॥

text: The Constellations pass away, like thieves, departing in the night. Before the all-beholding Sun.
meaning: अ॒प त्ये॒ ताय॒वो यथा न॒क्षत्रा यन्त्य् अक्तु॒भिः । सू॒राय विश्व॒चक्षसे ॥१७॥

text: His herald rays are seen afar refulgent o'er the world of men, Like flames of fire that burn and blaze.
meaning: अ॒दृश्रन्न् अस्य केत॒वो वि॒ रश्म॒यो ज॒नां अ॒नु । भ्रा॒जन्तो अग्न॒यो यथा ॥१८॥

text: Swift and all-beautiful art thou, O Sūrya, maker of the light, Illuming all the radiant realm.
meaning: तर॒णिर् विश्व॒दर्शतो ज्योतिष्कृ॒द् असि सूर्य । वि॒श्वम् आ॒ भासि रोचन ॥१९॥

text: Thou goest to the hosts of Gods, thou comest hither to mankind, Hither, all light to behold.
meaning: प्रत्य॒ङ् देवा॒नां वि॒शः प्रत्य॒ङ्ङ् उ॒द् एषि मा॒नुषीः । प्रत्य॒ङ् वि॒श्वं स्व॑र् दृशे॒ ॥२०॥ {८}

text: With that same eye of thine wherewith thou seest, brilliant Varuna. The active one among mankind,
meaning: ये॒ना पावक च॒क्षसा भुरण्य॒न्तं ज॒नां अ॒नु । त्वं॒ वरुण प॒श्यसि ॥२१॥

text: Traversing sky and wide mid-air, thou metest with thy beams our days, Sun, seeing all things that have life.
meaning: वि॒ द्या॒म् एषि र॒जस् पृथ्व् अ॒हर् मि॒मानो अक्तु॒भिः । प॒श्यन् ज॒न्मानि सूर्य ॥२२॥

text: Seven bay steeds harnessed to thy car bear thee, O thou far- seeing One, God, Sūrya, with the radiant hair.
meaning: सप्त॒ त्वा हरि॒तो र॒थे व॒हन्ति देव सूर्य । शोचि॒ष्केशं विचक्षण॒म् ॥२३॥

text: Sūrya, hath yoked the pure bright seven, the daughters of the car, with these, His own dear team, he travelleth.
meaning: अ॒युक्त सप्त॒ शुन्ध्यु॒वः सू॒रो र॒थस्य नप्त्यः॑ । ता॒भिर् याति स्व॒युक्तिभिः ॥२४॥

text: Devout, aflame with fervent heat, Rohita hath gone up to heaven. He is re-born, returning to his birthplace, and hath become the Gods' imperial ruler.
meaning: रो॒हितो दिवम् आ॒रुहत् त॒पसा तपस्वी॒ । स॒ यो॒निम् ऐ॒ति स॒ उ जायते पु॒नः स॒ देवा॒नाम् अ॒धिपतिर् बभूव ॥२५॥

text: Dear unto all men, facing all directions, with hands and palms on every side extended, He, the sole God, engendering earth and heaven, beareth them with his wings and arms together.
meaning: यो॒ विश्व॒चर्षणिर् उत॒ विश्व॒तोमुखो यो॒ विश्व॒तस्पाणिर् उत॒ विश्व॒तस्पृथः । सं॒ बाहु॒भ्यां भरति सं॒ प॒तत्रैर् द्या॒वापृथिवी॒ जन॒यन् देव॒ ए॒कः ॥२६॥

text: The single-footed hath outstepped the biped, the biped overtakes the triple-footed. The biped hath outstridden the six-footed: these sit around the single-footed's body.
meaning: ए॒कपाद् द्वि॒पदो भू॒यो वि॒ चक्रमे॒ द्वि॒पात् त्रि॒पादम् अभ्य् ए॑ति पश्चा॒त् । द्वि॒पाद् ध ष॒ट्पदो भू॒यो वि॒ चक्रमे त॒ ए॒कपदस् तन्वं॑ स॒म् आसते ॥२७॥

text: When he, unwearied, fain to go, hath mounted his bays, he makes two colours, brightly shining. Rising with banners, conquering the regions, thou sendest light through all the floods, Āditya.
meaning: अ॒तन्द्रो यास्य॒न् हरि॒तो य॒द् आ॒स्थाद् द्वे॒ रूपे॒ कृणुते रो॒चमानः । केतुमा॒न् उद्य॒न्त् स॒हमानो र॒जांसि वि॒श्वा आदित्य प्रव॒तो वि॒ भासि ॥२८॥

text: Verily, Sūrya, thou art great: truly, Āditya, thou art great. Great is thy grandeur, Mighty One: thou, O Āditya, thou art great.
meaning: ब॒ण् महां॒ असि सूर्य ब॒ड् आदित्य महां॒ असि । महां॒स् ते महतो॒ महिमा॒ त्व॒म् आदित्य महां॒ असि ॥२९॥

text: In heaven, O Bird, and in mid-air thou shinest: thou shinest on the earth and in the waters. Thou hast pervaded both the seas with splendour: a God art thou, O God, light-winner, mighty.
meaning: रो॒चसे दिवि॒ रो॒चसे अन्त॒रिक्षे प॒तङ्ग पृथिव्यां॒ रोचसे रो॒चसे अप्स्व् अ॑न्तः॒ । उभा॒ समुद्रौ॒ रु॒च्या व्य् आ॑पिथ देवो॒ देवासि महिषः॒ स्वर्जि॒त् ॥३०॥ {९}

text: Soaring in mid-course hither from the distance, fleet and ins- pired, the Bird that flies above us, With might advancing Vishnu manifested, he conquers all that moves with radiant banner:
meaning: अर्वा॒ङ् पर॒स्तात् प्र॒यतो व्यध्व॒ आशु॒र् विपश्चि॒त् पत॒यन् पतङ्गः॒ । वि॒ष्णुर् वि॒चित्तः श॒वसाधिति॒ष्ठन् प्र॒ केतु॒ना सहते वि॒श्वम् ए॒जत् ॥३१॥

text: Brilliant, observant, mighty Lord, an Eagle illuming both the spheres and air between them. Day and the Night, clad in the robes of Sūrya, spread forth more widely all his hero powers.
meaning: चित्रा॒श् चिकित्वा॒न् महिषः॒ सुपर्ण॒ आरोच॒यन् रो॒दसी अन्त॒रिक्षम् । अहोरात्रे॒ प॒रि सू॒र्यं व॒साने प्रा॒स्य वि॒श्वा तिरतो वीर्या॑णि ॥३२॥

text: Flaming and radiant, strengthening his body, bestowing floods that promptly come to meet us, He, luminous, winged, mighty, strength-bestower, hath mounted all the regions as he forms them.
meaning: तिग्मो॒ विभ्रा॒जन् तन्वं॑ शि॒शानो ऽरंगमा॒सः प्रव॒तो र॒राणः । ज्यो॒तिष्मान् पक्षी॒ महिषो॒ वयोधा॒ वि॒श्वा आ॒स्थात् प्रदि॒शः क॒ल्पमानः ॥३३॥

text: Bright presence of the Gods, the luminous herald Sūrya hath mounted the celestial regions. Day's maker, he hath shone away the darkness, and radiant, passed o'er places hard to traverse.
meaning: चित्रं॒ देवा॒नाम् केतु॒र् अ॒नीकं ज्यो॒तिष्मान् प्रदि॒शः सू॒र्य उद्य॒न् । दिवाकरो॒ ऽति द्युम्नै॒स् त॒मांसि वि॒श्वातारीद् दुरिता॒नि शुक्रः॒ ॥३४॥

text: He hath gone up on high, the Gods' bright presence, the eye of Mitra, Varuna and Agni. The soul of all that moveth not or moveth, Sūrya hath filled the earth and air and heaven,
meaning: चित्रं॒ देवा॒नाम् उ॒द् अगाद् अ॒नीकं च॒क्षुर् मित्र॒स्य व॒रुणस्याग्नेः॒ । आ॒प्राद् द्या॒वापृथिवी॒ अन्त॒रिक्षं सू॒र्य आत्मा॒ ज॒गतस् तस्थु॒षश् च ॥३५॥

text: High in the midst of heaven may we behold thee whom men call Savitar, the bright red Eagle, Soaring and speeding on thy way, refulgent, unwasting light which Atri erst discovered.
meaning: उच्चा॒ प॒तन्तम् अरुणं॒ सुपर्णं॒ म॒ध्ये दिव॒स् तर॒णिं भ्रा॒जमानम् । प॒श्यम त्वा सविता॒रं य॒म् आहु॒र् अ॒जस्रं ज्यो॒तिर् य॒द् अविन्दद् अ॒त्त्रिः ॥३६॥

text: Him, Son of Aditi, an Eagle hasting along heaven's height, I supplicate in terror, As such prolong our lengthened life, O Sūrya: may we, unha- rmed, enjoy thy gracious favour.
meaning: दिव॒स् पृष्ठे॒ धा॒वमानं सुपर्ण॒म् अ॒दित्याः पुत्रं॒ नाथ॒काम उ॒प यामि भीतः॒ । स॒ नः सूर्य प्र॒ तिर दीर्घ॒म् आ॒युर् मा॒ रिषाम सुमतौ॒ ते स्याम ॥३७॥

text: This gold-hued Hansa's wings, soaring to heaven, spread o'er a thousand days' continued journey Supporting all the Gods upon his bosom, he goes his way behold- ing every creature.
meaning: सहस्राह्ण्यं॒ वि॒यताव् अस्य पक्षौ॒ ह॒रेर् हंस॒स्य प॒ततः स्वर्ग॒म् । स॒ देवा॒न्त् स॒र्वान् उ॒रस्य् उपद॒द्य संप॒श्यन् याति भु॒वनानि वि॒श्वा ॥३८॥

text: Rohita, in primeval days Prajāpati, was, after, Time, Mouth of all sacrifices, he, Rohita, brought celestial light.
meaning: रो॒हितः कालो॒ अभवद् रो॒हितो॒ ऽग्रे प्रजा॒पतिः । रो॒हितो यज्ञा॒नां मु॒खं रो॒हितः स्व॑र् आ॒भरत् ॥३९॥

text: He, Rohita, became the world: Rohita gave the heaven its heat. Rohita with his beams of light travelled along the earth and sea.
meaning: रो॒हितो लोको॒ अभवद् रो॒हितो॒ ऽत्य् अतपद् दि॒वम् । रो॒हितो रश्मि॒भिर् भू॒मिं समुद्र॒म् अ॒नु सं॒ चरत् ॥४०॥ {१०}

text: To all the regions Rohita came, the imperial Lord of heaven. He watches over ocean, heaven, and earth and all existing things.
meaning: स॒र्वा दि॒शः स॒म् अचरद् रो॒हितो॒ ऽधिपतिर् दिवः॒ । दि॒वं समुद्र॒म् आ॒द् भू॒मिं स॒र्वं भूतं॒ वि॒ रक्षति ॥४१॥

text: Mounting the lofty ones, he, bright, unwearied, splendidly shining, makes two separate colours, While through all worlds that are he sends his lustre, radiant, observant, mighty, wind-approacher.
meaning: आरो॒हन् छुक्रो॒ बृहती॒र् अ॒तन्द्रो द्वे॒ रूपे॒ कृणुते रो॒चमानः । चित्र॒श् चिकित्वा॒न् महिषो॒ वा॒तमाया या॒वतो लोका॒न् अभि॒ य॒द् विभा॒ति ॥४२॥

text: One form comes on, the other is reverted: to day and night the Strong One shapes and fits him. With humble prayer for aid we call on Sūrya, who knows the way, whose home is in the region.
meaning: अभ्य् अ॑न्य॒द् एति प॒र्य् अन्य॒द् अस्यते ऽहोरात्रा॒भ्यां महिषः॒ क॒ल्पमानः । सू॒र्यं वयं॒ र॒जसि क्षिय॒न्तं गातुवि॒दं हवामहे ना॒धमानाः ॥४३॥

text: The suppliant's way, filling the earth, the Mighty circleth the world with eye that none deceiveth. May he, all-seeing, well-disposed and holy, give ear and listen to the word I utter.
meaning: पृथिवीप्रो॒ महिषो॒ ना॒धमानस्य गातु॒र् अ॒दब्धचक्षुः प॒रि वि॒श्वं बभूव । वि॒श्वं संप॒श्यन्त् सुविद॒त्रो य॒जत्र इदं॒ शृणोतु य॒द् अहं॒ ब्र॒वीमि ॥४४॥

text: Blazing with light his majesty hath compassed ocean and earth and heaven and air's mid-region. May he, all-seeing, well-disposed and holy, give ear and listen to the word I utter.
meaning: प॒र्य् अस्य महिमा॒ पृथिवीं॒ समुद्रं॒ ज्यो॒तिषा विभ्रा॒जन् प॒रि द्या॒म् अन्त॒रिक्षम् । स॒र्वं संप॒श्यन्त् सुविद॒त्रो य॒जत्र इदं॒ शृणोतु य॒द् अहं॒ ब्र॒वीमि ॥४५॥

text: Agni is weakened by the people's fuel to meet the Dawn who cometh like a milch-cow, Like young trees shooting up on high their branches, his flames are mounting to the vault of heaven.
meaning: अ॒बोध्य् अग्निः॒ समि॒धा ज॒नानां प्र॒ति धेनु॒म् इवायती॒म् उष॒सम् । यह्वा॒ इव प्र॒ वया॒म् उज्जि॒हानाः प्र॒ भान॒वः सिस्रते ना॒कम् अ॒छ ॥४६॥ {११}

text: He who engendered these, the earth and heaven, who made the worlds the mantle that he weareth, In whom abide the six wide-spreading regions through which the Bird's keen vision penetrateth, This God is wroth offended by the sinner who wrongs the Brāhman who hath gained this knowledge Agitate him, O Rohita; destroy him: entangle in thy snares the Brāman's tyrant.
meaning: य॒ इमे॒ द्या॒वापृथिवी॒ जजा॒न यो॒ द्रा॒पिम् कृत्वा॒ भु॒वनानि व॒स्ते । य॒स्मिन् क्षिय॒न्ति प्रदि॒शः ष॒ड् उर्वी॒र् याः॒ पतङ्गो॒ अ॒नु विचा॒कशीति । त॒स्य देव॒स्य क्रुद्ध॒स्यैत॒द् आ॒गो य॒ एवं॒ विद्वां॒सं ब्राह्मणं॒ जिना॒ति ।

text: He from whom winds blow pure in ordered season, from whom the seas flow forth in all directions, This God, etc.
meaning: य॒स्माद् वा॒ता ऋतुथा॒ प॒वन्ते य॒स्मात् समुद्रा॒ अ॒धि विक्ष॒रन्ति । त॒स्य देव॒स्य क्रुद्ध॒स्यैत॒द् आ॒गो य॒ एवं॒ विद्वां॒सं ब्राह्मणं॒ जिना॒ति । उ॒द् वेपय रोहित प्र॒ क्षिणीहि ब्रह्मज्य॒स्य प्र॒ति मुञ्च पा॒शान् ॥२॥

text: He who takes life away, he who bestows it; from whom comes breath to every living creature, This God, etc.
meaning: यो॒ मार॒यति प्राण॒यति य॒स्मात् प्राण॒न्ति भु॒वनानि वि॒श्वा । त॒स्य देव॒स्य क्रुद्ध॒स्यैत॒द् आ॒गो य॒ एवं॒ विद्वां॒सं ब्राह्मणं॒ जिना॒ति । उ॒द् वेपय रोहित प्र॒ क्षिणीहि ब्रह्मज्य॒स्य प्र॒ति मुञ्च पा॒शान् ॥३॥

text: Who with the breath he draws sates earth and heaven, with expiration fills the ocean's belly, This God, etc.
meaning: यः॒ प्रा॒णेन द्या॒वापृथिवी॒ तर्प॒यत्य् अपाने॒न समुद्र॒स्य जठ॒रं यः॒ पि॒पर्ति । त॒स्य देव॒स्य क्रुद्ध॒स्यैत॒द् आ॒गो य॒ एवं॒ विद्वां॒सं ब्राह्मणं॒ जिना॒ति । उ॒द् वेपय रोहित प्र॒ क्षिणीहि ब्रह्मज्य॒स्य प्र॒ति मुञ्च पा॒शान् ॥४॥

text: In whom Virāj, Prajāpati, Parameshthin, Agni Vaisvānara abide with Pankti, He who hath taken to himself the breathing of the Supreme, the vigour of the Highest, This God, etc.
meaning: य॒स्मिन् विरा॒ट् परमेष्ठी॒ प्रजा॒पतिर् अग्नि॒र् वैश्वानरः॒ सह॒ पङ्क्त्या॒ श्रितः॒ । यः॒ प॒रस्य प्राणं॒ परम॒स्य ते॒ज आददे॒ । त॒स्य देव॒स्य क्रुद्ध॒स्यैत॒द् आ॒गो य॒ एवं॒ विद्वां॒सं ब्राह्मणं॒ जिना॒ति ।

text: On whom rest six expenses and five regions, four waters, and three syllables of worship, He who hath looked between both spheres in anger, This God, etc.
meaning: य॒स्मिन् ष॒ड् उर्वीः॒ प॒ञ्च दि॒शो अ॒धिश्रिता॒श् च॒तस्र आ॒पो यज्ञ॒स्य त्र॒यो ऽक्ष॒राः । यो॒ अन्तरा॒ रो॒दसी क्रुद्ध॒श् च॒क्षुषै॒क्षत । त॒स्य देव॒स्य क्रुद्ध॒स्यैत॒द् आ॒गो य॒ एवं॒ विद्वां॒सं ब्राह्मण॒म् जिना॒ति ।

text: He who, consuming food, became its master, the Lord of Prayer, the Regent of Devotion, The world's Lord, present and to be hereafter, This God, etc.
meaning: यो॒ अन्नादो॒ अ॒न्नपतिर् बभू॒व ब्र॒ह्मणस् प॒तिर् उत॒ यः॒ । भूतो॒ भविष्य॒त् भु॒वनस्य य॒स् प॒तिः । त॒स्य देव॒स्य क्रुद्ध॒स्यैत॒द् आ॒गो य॒ एवं॒ विद्वां॒सं ब्राह्मणं॒ जिना॒ति ।

text: He who metes out the thirteenth month, constructed with days and nights, containing thirty members, This God, etc.
meaning: अहोरात्रै॒र् वि॒मितं त्रिंश॒दङ्गं त्रयोदशं॒ मा॒सं यो॒ निर्मि॒मीते । त॒स्य देव॒स्य क्रुद्ध॒स्यैत॒द् आ॒गो य॒ एवं॒ विद्वां॒सं ब्राह्मणं॒ जिना॒ति । उ॒द् वेपय रोहित प्र॒ क्षिणीहि ब्रह्मज्य॒स्य प्र॒ति मुञ्च पा॒शान् ॥८॥

text: Dark the descent; the strong-winged birds are golden: they fly aloft to heaven, enrobed in waters. They have come hither from the seat of Order, This God, etc.
meaning: कृस्णं॒ निया॒नं ह॒रयः सुपर्णा॒ अपो॒ व॒साना दि॒वम् उ॒त् पतन्ति । त॒ आ॒ववृत्रन्त् स॒दनाद् ऋत॒स्य । त॒स्य देव॒स्य क्रुद्ध॒स्यैत॒द् आ॒गो य॒ एवं॒ विद्वां॒सं ब्राह्मणं॒ जिना॒ति ।

text: What silver. Kasyapa, thou hast refulgent, what brightly-shining lotus-flower collected, Wherein are gathered seven Suns together, This God, etc.
meaning: य॒त् ते चन्द्रं॒ कश्यप रोचना॒वद् य॒त् संहितं॒ पुष्कलं॒ चित्र॒भानु य॒स्मिन्त् सू॒र्या आ॒र्पिताः सप्त॒ साक॒म् । त॒स्य देव॒स्य क्रुद्ध॒स्यैत॒द् आ॒गो य॒ एवं॒ विद्वां॒सं ब्राह्मणं॒ जिना॒ति । उ॒द् वेपय रोहित प्र॒ क्षिणीहि ब्रह्मज्य॒स्य प्र॒ति मुञ्च पा॒शान् ॥१०॥ {१२}

text: In front the Brihat-Sāman is his mantle, and from behind Rathantara enfolds him, Ever with care robing themselves in splendour. This God, etc.
meaning: बृह॒द् एनम् अ॒नु वस्ते पुर॒स्ताद् रथंतरं॒ प्र॒ति गृह्णाति पश्चा॒त् । ज्यो॒तिर् व॒साने स॒दम् अ॒प्रमादम् । त॒स्य देव॒स्य क्रुद्ध॒स्यैत॒द् आ॒गो य॒ एवं॒ विद्वां॒सं ब्राह्मणं॒ जिना॒ति ।

text: One of his wings was Brihat, and the other Rathantarr., vigorous with one same purpose, What time the Gods gave Rohita his being. This God, etc.
meaning: बृह॒द् अन्य॒तः पक्ष॒ आ॒सीद् रथंतर॒म् अन्य॒तः स॒बले सध्री॒ची । य॒द् रो॒हितम् अ॒जनयन्त देवाः॒ । त॒स्य देव॒स्य क्रुद्ध॒स्यैत॒द् आ॒गो य॒ एवं॒ विद्वां॒सं ब्राह्मणं॒ जिना॒ति ।

text: At evening he is Varuna and Agni, ascending in the morning he is Mitra. As Savitar, he moves through air's mid region, as Indra warms- the heavens from the centre. This God, etc.
meaning: स॒ व॒रुणः साय॒म् अग्नि॒र् भवति स॒ मित्रो॒ भवति प्रात॒र् उद्य॒न् । स॒ सविता॒ भूत्वा॒न्त॒रिक्षेण याति स॒ इ॒न्द्रो भूत्वा॒ तपति मध्यतो॒ दि॒वम् । त॒स्य देव॒स्य क्रुद्ध॒स्यैत॒द् आ॒गो य॒ एवं॒ विद्वां॒सं ब्राह्मणं॒ जिना॒ति ।

text: This gold-hued Harisa's wings, soaring to heaven spread o'er a thousand days' continued journey. Supporting all the Gods upon his bosom, he goes his way behol- ding every creature. This God, etc.
meaning: सहस्राह्ण्यं॒ वि॒यताव् अस्य पक्षौ॒ ह॒रेर् हंस॒स्य प॒ततः स्वर्ग॒म् । स॒ देवा॒न्त् स॒र्वान् उ॒रस्य् उपद॒द्य संप॒श्यन् याति भु॒वनानि वि॒श्वा । त॒स्य देव॒स्य क्रुद्ध॒स्यैत॒द् आ॒गो य॒ एवं॒ विद्वां॒सं ब्राह्मणं॒ जिना॒ति ।

text: This is the God who dwells-within the waters, the thousand- rooted, many-powered Atri, He who brought all this world into existence. This God; etc.
meaning: अयं॒ स॒ देवो॒ अप्स्व् अ॑न्तः॒ सह॒स्रमूलः परुशा॒को अ॒त्त्रिः । य॒ इदं॒ वि॒श्वं भु॒वनं ज॒जान । त॒स्य देव॒स्य क्रुद्ध॒स्यैत॒द् आ॒गो य॒ एवं॒ विद्वां॒सं ब्राह्मणं॒ जिना॒ति ।

text: With flying feet his tawny coursers carry the bright God through, the sky, aglow with splendour. Whose limbs uplifted fire and heat the heavens: hither he shines- with beams of golden colour. This God, etc.
meaning: शुक्रं॒ वहन्ति ह॒रयो रघुष्य॒दो देवं॒ दिवि॒ व॒र्चसा भ्रा॒जमानम् । य॒स्योर्ध्वा॒ दि॒वं तन्व॑स् त॒पन्त्य् अर्वा॒ङ् सुव॒र्णैः पटरै॒र् वि॒ भा॒ति । त॒स्य देव॒स्य क्रुद्ध॒स्यैत॒द् आ॒गो य॒ एवं॒ विद्वां॒सं ब्राह्मणं॒ जिना॒ति ।

text: He beside whom his bay steeds bear the Ādityas, by whom as sacrifice go many knowing. The sole light shining spread through various places. This God, etc.
meaning: ये॒नादित्या॒न् हरि॒तः सम्व॒हन्ति ये॒न यज्ञे॒न बह॒वो य॒न्ति प्रजान॒न्तः । य॒द् ए॒कं ज्यो॒तिर् बहुधा॒ विभा॒ति । त॒स्य देव॒स्य क्रुद्ध॒स्यैत॒द् आ॒गो य॒ एवं॒ विद्वां॒सं ब्राह्मणं॒ जिना॒ति ।

text: This seven make the one-wheeled chariot ready: bearing seven names the single courser draws it. The wheel, three-naved, is sound and undecaying: thereon these worlds of life are all dependent. This God, etc.
meaning: सप्त॒ युञ्जन्ति र॒थम् ए॒कचक्रम् ए॒को अ॒श्वो वहति सप्त॒नामा । त्रिना॒भि चक्र॒म् अज॒रम् अनर्वं॒ य॒त्रेमा॒ वि॒श्वा भु॒वना॒धि तस्थुः॒ । त॒स्य देव॒स्य क्रुद्ध॒स्यैत॒द् आ॒गो य॒ एवं॒ विद्वां॒सं ब्राह्मणं॒ जिना॒ति ।

text: Eight times attached the potent Courser draws it, Sire of the Gods, father of hymns and praises. So Mātarisvan, measuring in spirit the thread of Order, purifies all regions. This God, etc.
meaning: अष्टधा॒ युक्तो॒ व॒हति व॒ह्निर् उग्रः॒ पिता॒ देवा॒नां जनिता॒ मतीना॒म् । ऋत॒स्य त॒न्तुं म॒नसा मिमा॒नः स॒र्वा दि॒शः पवते मातरि॒श्वा । त॒स्य देव॒स्य क्रुद्ध॒स्यैत॒द् आ॒गो य॒ एवं॒ विद्वां॒सं ब्राह्मणं॒ जिना॒ति ।

text: The thread that goes through all celestial quarters within the Gāyatri, womb of life eternal. This God, etc.
meaning: संय॒ञ्चं त॒न्तुं प्रदि॒शो॒ ऽनु स॒र्वा अन्त॒र् गायत्र्या॒म् अमृ॒तस्य ग॒र्भे । त॒स्य देव॒स्य क्रुद्ध॒स्यैत॒द् आ॒गो य॒ एवं॒ विद्वां॒सं ब्राह्मणं॒ जिना॒ति । उ॒द् वेपय रोहित प्र॒ क्षिणीहि ब्रह्मज्य॒स्य प्र॒ति मुञ्च पा॒शान् ॥२०॥ {१३}

text: There are the settings, three the upward risings, three are the- spaces, yea, and three the heavens. We know thy triple place of birth, O Agni, we know the deities'' triple generations.
meaning: निम्रु॒चस् तिस्रो॒ व्यु॒षो ह तिस्र॒स् त्री॒णि र॒जांसि दि॒वो अङ्ग॒ तिस्रः॒ । विद्मा॒ ते अग्ने त्रेधा॒ जनि॒त्रं त्रेधा॒ देवा॒नां ज॒निमानि विद्म॒ । त॒स्य देव॒स्य क्रुद्ध॒स्यैत॒द् आ॒गो य॒ एवं॒ विद्वां॒सं ब्राह्मणं॒ जिना॒ति ।

text: He who, as soon as born, laid broad earth open, and set the ocean in the air's mid-region, This God, etc.
meaning: वि॒ य॒ औ॒र्णोत् पृथिवीं॒ जा॒यमान आ॒ समुद्र॒म् अ॒दधात् अन्त॒रिक्षे । त॒स्य देव॒स्य क्रुद्ध॒स्यैत॒द् आ॒गो य॒ एवं॒ विद्वां॒सं ब्राह्मणं॒ जिना॒ति । उ॒द् वेपय रोहित प्र॒ क्षिणीहि ब्रह्मज्य॒स्य प्र॒ति मुञ्च पा॒शान् ॥२२॥

text: Thou, Agni, kind with lights and mental powers, hast up in heaven shone as the Sun, enkindled. The Maruts, sons of Prisni, sang his praises what time the Gods gave Rohita his being. This God, etc.
meaning: त्व॒म् अग्ने क्र॒तुभिः केतु॒भिर् हितो॑ ऽर्कः॒ स॒मिद्ध उ॒द् अरोचथा दिवि॒ । कि॒म् अभ्य् आ॑र्चन् मरु॒तः पृ॒श्निमातरो य॒द् रो॒हितम् अ॒जनयन्त देवाः॒ । त॒स्य देव॒स्य क्रुद्ध॒स्यैत॒द् आ॒गो य॒ एवं॒ विद्वां॒सं ब्राह्मणं॒ जिना॒ति ।

text: Giver of breath, giver of strength and vigour, he whose com- mandment all the Gods acknowledge, He who is Lord of this, of man and cattle, This God, etc.
meaning: य॒ आत्मदा॒ बलदा॒ य॒स्य वि॒श्व उपा॒सते प्रशि॒षं य॒स्य देवाः॒ । यो॑ ऽस्ये॒शे द्विप॒दो य॒श् च॒तुष्पदः । त॒स्य देव॒स्य क्रुद्ध॒स्यैत॒द् आ॒गो य॒ एवं॒ विद्वां॒सं ब्राह्मणं॒ जिना॒ति ।

text: The single-footed hath outstepped the biped, the biped overtakes the triple-footed. The quadruped hath wrought when bipeds called him, standing and looking on the five collected. This God is wroth offended by the sinner that wrongs the Brāhman who hath gained this knowledge. Agitate him, O Rohita; destroy him: entangle in thy snares the Brāhman's tyrant.
meaning: ए॒कपाद् द्वि॒पदो भू॒यो वि॒ चक्रमे द्वि॒पात् त्रि॒पादम् अभ्य् ए॑ति पश्चा॒त् । च॒तुष्पाच् चक्रे द्वि॒पदाम् अभिस्वरे॒ संप॒श्यन् पङ्क्ति॒म् उपति॒ष्ठमानः । त॒स्य देव॒स्य क्रुद्ध॒स्यैत॒द् आ॒गो य॒ एवं॒ विद्वां॒सं ब्राह्मणं॒ जिना॒ति ।

text: Born is the darksome Mother's Son, the whitely shining Calf of Night. He, Rohita, ascendeth up to heaven, hath mounted to the heights.
meaning: कृष्णा॒यः पुत्रो॒ अ॒र्जुनो रा॒त्र्या वत्सो॒ ऽजायत । स॒ ह द्या॒म् अ॒धि रोहति रु॒हो रुरोह रो॒हितः ॥२६॥ {१४}

text: Down looking, on the ridge of sky Savitar goes to highest heaven.
meaning: स॒ एति सविता॒ स्व॑र् दिव॒स् पृष्ठे॒ ऽवचा॒कशत् ॥१॥

text: To misty cloud filled with his rays Mahendra goes encompassed round.
meaning: रश्मि॒भिर् न॒भ आ॒भृतं महेन्द्र॒ एत्य् आ॒वृतः ॥२॥

text: Creator and Ordainer, he is Vāyu, he is lifted cloud.
meaning: स॒ धाता॒ स॒ विधर्ता॒ स॒ वायु॒र् न॒भ उ॒च्छ्रितम् ॥३॥

text: Rudra, and Mahādeva, he is Aryaman and Varuna.
meaning: सो॒ ऽर्यमा॒ स॒ व॒रुणः स॒ रुद्रः॒ स॒ महादेवः॒ ॥४॥

text: Agni is he, and Siirya, he is verily Mahāyama.
meaning: सो॒ अग्निः॒ स॒ उ सू॒र्यः स॒ उ एव॒ महायमः॒ ॥५॥

text: Calves, joined, stand close beside him, ten in number, with one single head.
meaning: तं॒ वत्सा॒ उ॒प तिष्ठन्त्य् ए॒कशी॒र्षाणो युता॒ द॒श ॥६॥

text: From west to east they bend their way: when he mounts up he shines afar.
meaning: पश्चा॒त् प्रा॒ञ्च आ॒ तन्वन्ति य॒द् उदे॒ति वि॒ भासति ॥७॥

text: His are these banded Maruts: they move gathered close like porters' thongs.
meaning: त॒स्यैष॒ मा॒रुतो गणः॒ स॒ एति शिक्या॒कृतः ॥८॥

text: To misty cloud filled with his rays Mahendra goes encompassed round,
meaning: रश्मि॒भिर् न॒भ आ॒भृतं महेन्द्र॒ एत्य् आ॒वृतः ॥९॥

text: His are the nine supports, the casks set in nine several places here.
meaning: त॒स्येमे॒ न॒व को॒शा विष्टम्भा॒ नवधा॒ हिताः॒ ॥१०॥

text: He keeppeth watch o'er creatures, all that breatheth and that breatheth not.
meaning: स॒ प्रजा॒भ्यो वि॒ पश्यति य॒च् च प्राण॒ति य॒च् च न॒ ॥११॥

text: This conquering might hath entered him, He is the sole the simple One, the One alone.
meaning: त॒म् इदं॒ नि॒गतं स॒हः स॒ एष॒ ए॒क एकवृ॒द् ए॒क एव॒ ॥१२॥

text: In him these Deities become simple and One
meaning: एते॒ अस्मिन् देवा॒ एकवृ॒तो भवन्ति ॥१३॥ {१५}

text: Renown and glory, and force and cloud, the Brāhman's splendour, and food, and nourishment,
meaning: कीर्ति॒श् च य॒शश् चा॒म्भश् च न॒भश् च ब्राह्मणवर्चसं॒ चा॒न्नं चान्ना॒द्यं च ॥१४॥

text: To him who knoweth this God as simple and one.
meaning: य॒ एतं॒ देव॒म् एकवृ॒तं वे॒द ॥१५॥

text: Neither second, nor third, nor yet fourth is he called;
meaning: न॒ द्विती॒यो न॒ तृती॒यश् चतुर्थो॒ ना॒प्य् उच्यते ॥१६॥

text: He is called neither fifth, nor sixth, nor yet seventh
meaning: न॒ पञ्चमो॒ न॒ षष्ठः॒ सप्तमो॒ ना॒प्य् उच्यते ॥१७॥

text: He is called neither eighth, nor ninth, nor yet tenth.
meaning: ना॒ष्टमो॒ न॒ नवमो॒ दशमो॒ ना॒प्य् उच्यते ॥१८॥

text: He watcheth over creatures, all that breatheth and that breatheth not.
meaning: स॒ स॒र्वस्मै वि॒ पश्यति य॒च् च प्राण॒ति य॒च् च न॒ ॥१९॥

text: This conquering might hath entered him. He is the sole, the simple One, the One alone,
meaning: त॒म् इदं॒ नि॒गतं स॒हः स॒ एष॒ ए॒क एकवृ॒द् ए॒क एव॒ ॥२०॥

text: In him these Deities become simple and One
meaning: स॒र्वे अस्मिन् देवा॒ एकवृ॒तो भवन्ति ॥२१॥ {१६}

text: Devotion and Religious Fervour, and renown and glory, and force and cloud, the Brāhman's splendour, and food and nourishment.
meaning: ब्र॒ह्म च त॒पश् च कीर्ति॒श् च य॒शश् चाम्भश् च न॒भश् च ब्राह्मणवर्चसं॒ चा॒न्नं चान्ना॒द्यं च ॥२॥

text: And past and future, and Faith and lustre, and heaven and sweet oblation,
meaning: भूतं॒ च भ॒व्यं च श्रद्धा॒ च रु॒चिश् च स्वर्ग॒श् च स्वधा॒ च ॥२३॥

text: To him who knoweth this God as simple and One.
meaning: य॒ एतं॒ देव॒म् एकवृ॒तं वे॒द ॥२४॥

text: He, verily, is death, he is immortality, he is the monster, he is the fiend.
meaning: स॒ एव॒ मृत्युः॒ सो॑ ऽमृ॒तं सो॑ ऽभ्वं॑ स॒ र॒क्षः ॥२५॥

text: He is Rudra, winner of wealth in the giving of wealth; in uttering homage he is the sacrificial exclamation Vashat duly employed.
meaning: स॒ रुद्रो॒ वसुव॒निर् वसुदे॒ये नमोवाके॒ वषट्कारो॒ ऽनु सं॒हितः ॥२६॥

text: All sorcerers on earth obey with reverence his high behest.
meaning: त॒स्येमे॒ स॒र्वे यात॒व उ॒प प्रशि॒षम् आसते ॥२७॥

text: All constellations yonder, with the Moon, are subject to his will.
meaning: त॒स्यामू॒ स॒र्वा न॒क्षत्रा व॒शे चन्द्र॒मसा सह॒ ॥२८॥ {१७}

text: He was brought forth from Day: and Day derives his origin. from him.
meaning: स॒ वा॒ अ॒ह्नो ऽजायत त॒स्माद् अ॒हर् अजायत ॥२९॥

text: He was brought forth from Night: and Night derives her origins from him.
meaning: स॒ वै॒ रा॒त्र्या अजायत त॒स्माद् रा॒त्रिर् अजायत ॥३०॥

text: He was produced from Air: and Air derives its origin from him.
meaning: स॒ वा॒ अन्त॒रिक्षाद् अजायत त॒स्माद् अन्त॒रिक्षम् अजायत ॥३१॥

text: He was produced from Wind: and Wind derives his origin from. him.
meaning: स॒ वै॒ वायो॒र् अजायत त॒स्माद् वायु॒र् अजायत ॥३२॥

text: From Heaven was he produced: and Heaven derives his origin from him.
meaning: स॒ वै॒ दिवो॒ ऽजायत त॒स्माद् द्यौ॒र् अ॒धि अजायत ॥३३॥

text: He sprang from regions of the sky: from him the heavenly regions sprang.
meaning: स॒ वै॒ दिग्भ्यो॒ ऽजायत त॒स्माद् दि॒शो ऽजायन्त ॥३४॥

text: He is the offspring of the Earth: Earth hath her origin from him.
meaning: स॒ वै॒ भू॒मेर् अजायत त॒स्माद् भू॒मिर् अजायत ॥३५॥

text: He was produced from fire: and fire derives its origin from him.
meaning: स॒ वा॒ अग्ने॒र् अजायत त॒स्माद् अग्नि॒र् अजायत ॥३६॥

text: He is the waters' offspring: and from him the waters were produced.
meaning: स॒ वा॒ अद्भ्यो॒ ऽजायत त॒स्माद् आ॒पो ऽजायन्त ॥३७॥

text: From holy verses was he born: from him the holy verses sprang.
meaning: स॒ वा॒ ऋग्भ्यो॒ ऽजायत त॒स्माद् ऋ॒चो ऽजायन्त ॥३८॥

text: He is the son of sacrifice: and sacrifice was born from him.
meaning: स॒ वै॒ यज्ञा॒द् अजायत त॒स्माद् यज्ञो॒ ऽजायत ॥३९॥

text: Sacrifice, sacrifice's Lord, he was made head of sacrifice.
meaning: स॒ यज्ञ॒स् त॒स्य यज्ञः॒ स॒ यज्ञ॒स्य शि॒रस् कृत॒म् ॥४०॥

text: He thundereth, he lighteneth, he casteth down the thunder-stone
meaning: स॒ स्तनयति स॒ वि॒ द्योतते स॒ उ अ॒श्मानम् अस्यति ॥४१॥

text: For misery or happiness, for mortal man or Asura.
meaning: पापा॒य वा भद्रा॒य वा पु॒रुषाया॒सुराय वा ॥४२॥

text: Whether thou formest growing plants, or sendest rain for happiness, or hast increased the race of man,
meaning: य॒द् वा कृणो॒ष्य् ओ॒षधीर् य॒द् वा वर्षसि भद्र॒या य॒द् वा जन्य॒म् अ॒वीवृधः ॥४३॥

text: Such is thy greatness, liberal Lord! A hundred bodily forms are thine.
meaning: ता॒वांस् ते मघवन् महिमो॒पो ते तन्वः॑ शत॒म् ॥४४॥

text: Millions are in thy million, or thou art a billion in thyself.
meaning: उ॒पो ते ब॒ध्वे ब॒द्धानि य॒दि वा॒सि न्य॑र्बुदम् ॥४५॥ {१८}

text: Stronger than immortality is Indra: stronger thou than deaths;
meaning: भू॒यान् इ॒न्द्रो नमुरा॒द् भू॒यान् इन्द्रासि मृत्यु॒भ्यः ॥४६॥

text: Yea, stronger than Malignity art thou, O Indra, Lord of Might. Calling thee Master, Sovran Chief, we pay our reverence to thee.
meaning: भू॒यान् अ॒रात्याः श॒च्याः प॒तिस् त्व॒म् इन्द्रासि विभूः॒ प्रभू॒र् इ॒ति त्वो॒पास्महे वय॒म् ॥४७॥

text: Worship to thee whom all behold! Regard me, thou whom all regard,
meaning: न॒मस् ते अस्तु पश्यत प॒श्य मा पश्यत ॥४८॥

text: With food, and fame, and vigour, with the splendour of a Brāhman's rank
meaning: अन्ना॒द्येन य॒शसा ते॒जसा ब्राह्मणवर्चसे॒न ॥४९॥

text: We pay thee reverence calling thee strength, power, and might, and conquering force.
meaning: अ॒म्भो अ॒मो म॒हः स॒ह इ॒ति त्वो॒पास्महे वय॒म् ॥५०॥

text: We pay thee reverence calling thee red power, the silvery expanse.
meaning: अ॒म्भो अरुणं॒ रजतं॒ र॒जः स॒ह इ॒ति त्वो॒पास्महे वय॒म् ॥५१॥ {१९}

text: We pay thee reverence calling thee vast, wide, the good, the universe.
meaning: उरुः॒ पृथुः॒ सुभू॒र् भु॒व इ॒ति त्वो॒पास्महे वय॒म् ॥५२॥

text: We pay thee reverence, calling thee extension, compass, width, and world.
meaning: प्र॒थो व॒रो व्य॒चो लोक॒ इ॒ति त्वो॒पास्महे वय॒म् ॥५३॥

text: We pay thee reverence, calling thee rich, opulent in this and that, with wealth unceasing and secure
meaning: भ॒वद्वसुर् इद॒द्वसुः संय॒द्वसुर् आय॒द्वसुर् इ॒ति त्वो॒पास्महे वय॒म् ॥५४॥

text: Worship to thee whom all behold! Regard me, thou whom all regard.
meaning: न॒मस् ते अस्तु पश्यत प॒श्य मा पश्यत ॥५५॥

text: With food, and fame, and vigour, with the splendour of a Brāhman's rank.
meaning: अन्ना॒द्येन य॒शसा ते॒जसा ब्राह्मणवर्चसे॒न ॥५६॥ {२०}

text: Truth is the base that bears the earth; by Sūrya are the heavens upheld. By Law the Ādityas stand secure, and Soma holds his place in heaven.
meaning: सत्ये॒नो॒त्तभिता भू॒मिः सू॒र्येणो॒त्तभिता द्यौः॒ । ऋते॒नादित्या॒स् तिष्ठन्ति दिवि॒ सो॒मो अ॒धि श्रितः॒ ॥१॥

text: By Soma are the Ādityas strong, by Soma mighty is the earth: Thus Soma in the lap of all these constellations hath his home.
meaning: सो॒मेनादित्या॒ बलि॒नः सो॒मेन पृथिवी॒ मही॒ । अ॒थो न॒क्षत्राणाम् एषा॒म् उप॒स्थे सो॒म आ॒हितः ॥२॥

text: One thinks, when men have brayed the plant, that he hath drunk the Soma's juice. Of him whom Brāhmans truly know as Soma never mortal eats.
meaning: सो॒मं मन्यते पपिवा॒न् य॒त् संपिंष॒न्त्य् ओ॒षधिम् । सो॒मं यं॒ ब्रह्मा॒णो विदु॒र् न॒ त॒स्याश्नाति पा॒र्थिवः ॥३॥

text: When they begin to drink thee, then, O God, thou swellest out again. Vāyu in Soma's sentinel. The month is that which shapes the years.
meaning: य॒त् त्वा सोम प्रपि॒बन्ति त॒त आ॒ प्यायसे पु॒नः । वायुः॒ सो॒मस्य रक्षिता॒ स॒मानां मा॒स आ॒कृतिः ॥४॥

text: Soma, preserved by covering rules, guarded by hymns in Brihatī, Thou standest listening to the stones; none tastes of thee who dwells on earth.
meaning: आछ॒द्विधानैर् गुपितो॒ बा॒र्हतैः सोम रक्षितः॒ । ग्रा॒व्णाम् इ॒च् छृण्व॒न् तिष्ठसि न॒ ते अश्नाति पा॒र्थिवः ॥५॥

text: Thought was her coverlet, the power of sight was unguent for her eyes: Her treasure-chest was earth and heaven, when Sūryā went unto her lord.
meaning: चि॒त्तिर् आ उपब॒र्हणं च॒क्षुर् आ अभ्य॒ञ्जनम् । द्यौ॒र् भू॒मिः को॒श आ॒सीद् य॒द् अ॒यात् सूर्या॒ प॒तिम् ॥६॥

text: Raibhi was her dear bridal friend, and Nārāsatisi led her home. Lovely to see was Sūryā's robe: by Gāthā beautified she moves
meaning: रै॒भ्य् आसीद् अनुदे॒यी नाराशंसी॒ न्यो॒चनी । सुर्या॒या भद्र॒म् इ॒द् वा॒सो गा॒थयति प॒रिष्कृता ॥७॥

text: Songs were the cross-bars of the pole, Kurira metre docked her head. Both Asvins were the paranymphs: Agni was leader of the train.
meaning: स्तो॒मा आसन् प्रतिध॒यः कुरी॒रं छ॒न्द ओपशः॒ । सूर्या॒या अश्वि॒ना वरा॒ग्नि॒र् आसीत् पुरोगवः॒ ॥८॥

text: Soma was he who wooed the maid: the groomsmen were both. Asvins, when The Sun-God Savitar bestowed his willing Sūryā on her lord.
meaning: सो॒मो वधूयु॒र् अभवद् अश्वि॒नास्ताम् उभा॒ वरा॒ । सूर्यां॒ य॒त् प॒त्ये शं॒सन्तीं म॒नसा सविता॒ददात् ॥९॥

text: Her spirit was the bridal car, the canopy thereof was heaven: Two radiant oxen formed the team when Sūryā came unto her lord.
meaning: म॒नो अस्या अ॒न आसीद् द्यौ॒र् आसीद् उत॒ छदिः॒ । शुक्रा॒व् अनड्वा॒हाव् आस्तां य॒द् अ॒यात् सूर्या॒ प॒तिम् ॥१०॥ {१}

text: Steadily went the steers upheld by holy verse and song of praise, The chariot-wheels were listening ears: thy path was tremulous in the sky.
meaning: ऋक्सामा॒भ्याम् अभि॒हितौ गा॒वौ ते सामना॒व् ऐताम् । श्रो॒त्रे ते चक्रे॒ आस्तां दिवि॒ प॒न्थाश् चराचरः॒ ॥११॥

text: Pure, as thou wentest, were thy wheels, breath was the axle pier- cing them. Sūryā advancing to her lord rode on the chariot of her heart.
meaning: शु॒ची ते चक्रे॒ यात्या॒ व्यानो॒ अक्ष आ॒हतः । अ॒नो मनस्म॒यं सूर्या॒रोहत् प्रयती॒ प॒तिम् ॥१२॥

text: The bridal pomp of Sūryā, which Savitar started, moved along. In Maghā days are oxen slain, in Phalgunis they wed the bride.
meaning: सूर्या॒या वहतुः॒ प्रा॒गात् सविता॒ य॒म् अवा॒सृजत् । मघा॒सु हन्य॒न्ते गा॒वः फ॒ल्गुनीषु व्य् उ॑ह्यते ॥१३॥

text: When on your three-wheeled chariot, O ye Asvins, ye came as suitors unto Sūrya's bridal, Where was one chariot-wheel of yours? Where stood ye for the sire's command?
meaning: य॒द् अश्विना पृछ॒मानाव् अ॒यातं त्रिचक्रे॒ण वहतुं॒ सूर्या॒याः । क्वै॒कं चक्रं॒ वाम् आसीत् क्व॑ देष्ट्रा॒य तस्थथुः ॥१४॥

text: Twin Lords of Lustre, at the time when ye to Sūryā's wooing came, Then all the Gods agreed to your proposal Pūshan as son elected you as father.
meaning: य॒द् अ॒यातं शुभस् पती वरेयं॒ सूर्या॒म् उ॒प । वि॒श्वे देवा॒ अ॒नु त॒द् वाम् अजानन् पुत्रः॒ पित॒रम् अवृणीत पूषा॒ ॥१५॥

text: Two wheels of thine the Brāhmans know, Sūrya! according to their times. That which is hidden only those who know the highest truths have learned.
meaning: द्वे॒ ते चक्रे॒ सू॒र्ये ब्रह्मा॒ण ऋतुथा॒ विदुः । अ॒थै॒कं चक्रं॒ य॒द् गु॒हा त॒द् अद्धात॒य इ॒द् विदुः॒ ॥१६॥

text: Worship we pay to Aryaman, finder of husbands, kindly friend. As from its stalk a cucumber, from here I loose thee, not from there
meaning: अर्यम॒णं यजामहे सुबन्धुं॒ पतिवे॒दनम् । उर्वारुक॒म् इव ब॒न्धनात् प्रे॒तो॒ मुञ्चामि ना॒मु॒तः ॥१७॥

text: Hence and not thence I send her free. I make her softly fettered there. That, bounteous Indra! she may live blest in her fortune and her sons.
meaning: प्रे॒तो॒ मुञ्चामि ना॒मु॒तः सुबद्धा॒म् अमु॒तस् करम् । य॒थेय॒म् इन्द्र मीढ्वः सुपुत्रा॒ सुभ॒गा॒सति ॥१८॥

text: Now from the noose of Varuna I free thee, where with the bless- ed Savitar hath bound thee. May bless be thine together with thy wooer in Order's dwelling, in the world of virtue.
meaning: प्र॒ त्वा मुञ्चामि व॒रुणस्य पा॒शाद् ये॒न त्वा॒बध्नात् सविता॒ सुशे॒वाः । ऋत॒स्य यो॒नौ सुकृत॒स्य लोके॒ स्योनं॒ ते अस्तु सह॒संभलायै ॥१९॥

text: Let Bhaga take thy hand and hence conduct thee: let the two Asvins on their car transport thee. Go to the house to be the household's mistress, and speak as lady to thy gathered people.
meaning: भ॒गस् त्वेतो॒ नयतु हस्तगृ॒ह्याश्वि॒ना त्वा प्र॒ वहतां र॒थेन । गृहा॒न् गछ गृह॒पत्नी य॒था॒सो वशि॒नी त्वं॒ विद॒थम् आ॒ वदासि ॥२०॥ {२}

text: Happy be thou and prosper with thy children here: be vigilant to rule the household in this home. Closely unite thy body with this man thy lord. So shalt thou, full of years, address thy company.
meaning: इह॒ प्रियं॒ प्रजा॒यै ते स॒म् ऋध्यताम् अस्मि॒न् गृहे॒ गा॒र्हपत्याय जागृहि । एना॒ प॒त्या तन्वं॑ सं॒ स्पृशस्वा॒थ जि॒र्विर् विद॒थम् आ॒ वदासि ॥२१॥

text: Be not divided; dwell ye here; reach the full time of human life. With sons and grandsons sport and play, rejoicing in your happy home.
meaning: इहै॒व॒ स्तं मा॒ वि॒ यौष्टं वि॒श्वम् आ॒युर् व्य् अ॑श्नुतम् । क्री॒डन्तौ पुत्रै॒र् न॒प्तृभिर् मो॒दमानौ स्वस्तकौ॒ ॥२२॥

text: Moving by magic power from east to westward, these children twain go sporting round the ocean. The one beholds all creatures: thou, the other, art born anew, duly arranging seasons.
meaning: पूर्वापरं॒ चरतो मायै॒तौ॒ शि॒शू क्री॒डन्तौ प॒रि यातो ऽर्णव॒म् । वि॒श्वान्यो॒ भु॒वना विच॒ष्ट ऋतूं॒र् अन्यो॒ विद॒धज् जायसे न॒वः ॥२३॥

text: Thou, born afresh, art new and new for ever; ensign of days, before the Dawns thou goest. Coming, thou orderest for Gods their portion. Thou lengthenest, Moon, the days of our existence.
meaning: न॒वोनवो भवसि जा॒यमानो॒ ऽह्नां केतु॒र् उष॒साम् एष्य् अ॒ग्रम् । भागं॒ देवे॒भ्यो वि॒ दधास्य् आय॒न् प्र॒ चन्द्रमस् तिरसे दीर्घ॒म् आ॒युः ॥२४॥

text: Give thou the wollen robe away: deal treasure to the Brāhman- priests. This Witchery hath got her feet: the wife attendeth on her lord.
meaning: प॒रा देहि शामुल्यं॑ ब्रह्म॒भ्यो वि॒ भजा व॒सु । कृत्यै॒षा पद्व॒ती भूत्वा॒ जाया॒ विशते प॒तिम् ॥२५॥

text: It turneth dusky-red: the witch who clingeth close is driven off. Well thrive the kinsmen of this bride: the husband is bound fast in bonds.
meaning: नीललोहितं॒ भवति कृत्या॒सक्ति॒र् व्य् अ॑ज्यते । ए॒धन्ते अस्या ज्ञात॒यः प॒तिर् बन्धे॒षु बध्यते ॥२६॥

text: Unlovely is his body when it glistens with that wicked fiend, What time the husband wraps about his limbs the garment of his wife.
meaning: अश्लीला॒ तनू॒र् भवति रु॒शती पाप॒यामुया॒ । प॒तिर् य॒द् वध्वो॑ वा॒ससः स्व॒म् अ॒ङ्गम् अभ्यूर्णुते॒ ॥२७॥

text: The butchering, the cutting-up, the severing of limb and joint— Behold the forms which Sūryā wears: yet these the Brāhman purifies,
meaning: आश॒सनं विश॒सनम् अ॒थो अधिविक॒र्तनम् । सूर्या॒याः पश्य रूपा॒णि ता॒नि ब्रह्मो॒त॒ शुम्भति ॥२८॥

text: Pungent is this, bitter is this, filled as it were with arrow barbs, empoisoned and not fit for use. The Brāhman who knows Sūryā well deserves the garment of the bride.
meaning: तृष्ट॒म् एत॒त् क॒टुकम् अपाष्ठ॒वद् विष॒वन् नै॒त॒द् अ॒त्तवे । सूर्यां॒ यो॒ ब्रह्मा॒ वे॒द स॒ इ॒द् वा॒धूयम् अर्हति ॥२९॥

text: The Brāhman takes away the robe as a fair thing that brings good luck. He knows the expiating rite whereby the wife is kept unharmed.
meaning: स॒ इ॒त् त॒त् स्योनं॒ हरति ब्रह्मा॒ वा॒सः सुमङ्ग॒लम् । प्रा॒यश्चित्तिं यो॒ अध्ये॒ति ये॒न जाया॒ न॒ रि॒ष्यति ॥३०॥ {३}

text: Prepare, ye twain, happy and prosperous fortune, speaking the truth in faithful utterances. Dear unto her, Brihaspati, make the husband, and pleasant be these words the wooer speaketh.
meaning: युवं॒ भ॒गं सं॒ भरतं स॒मृद्धम् ऋतं॒ व॒दन्ताव् ऋतो॒द्येषु । ब्र॒ह्मणस् पते प॒तिम् अस्यै॒ रोचय चा॒रु संभलो॒ वदतु वा॒चम् एता॒म् ॥३१॥

text: Remain ye even here and go no farther: strengthen this man, ye Cows, with plenteous offspring. May Dawns that come for glory, bright with Soma, here may all Gods fix and enchant your spirits.
meaning: इहे॒द् असाथ न॒ परो॒ गमाथेमं॒ गावः प्रज॒या वर्धयाथ । शु॒भं यतीर् उस्रि॒याः सो॒मवर्चसो वि॒श्वे देवाः॒ क्रन्न् इह॒ वो म॒नांसि ॥३२॥

text: Come, O ye Cows, with offspring dwell around him: he doth not stint the Gods' alloted portion. To him, your friend, may Pūshan, all the Maruts, to him may Dhatar, Savitar send vigour.
meaning: इमं॒ गावः प्रज॒या सं॒ विशाथायं॒ देवा॒नां न॒ मिनाति भाग॒म् । अस्मै॒ वः पूषा॒ मरु॒तश् च स॒र्वे अस्मै॒ वो धाता॒ सविता॒ सुवाति ॥३३॥

text: Straight in direction be the paths, and thornless, whereby our fellows travel to the wooing. With Bhaga and with Aryaman Dhātar endue the pair with strength!
meaning: अनृक्षरा॒ ऋज॒वः सन्तु प॒न्थनो ये॒भिः स॒खायो य॒न्ति नो वरेय॒म् । सं॒ भ॒गेन स॒म् अर्यम्णा॒ सं॒ धाता॒ सृजतु व॒र्चसा ॥३४॥

text: Whatever lustre is in dice, whatever lustre is in wine, Whatever lustre is in cows, Asvins, endue this dame therewith.
meaning: य॒च् च व॒र्चो अक्षे॒षु सु॒रायां च य॒द् आ॒हितम् । य॒द् गो॒ष्व् अश्विना व॒र्चस् ते॒नेमां॒ व॒र्चसावतम् ॥३५॥

text: With all the sheen that balmeth wine, or thigh of female para- mour, With all the sheen that balmeth dice, even with this adorn the dame.
meaning: ये॒न महानघ्न्या॒ जघ॒नम् अ॒श्विना ये॒न वा सु॒रा । ये॒नाक्षा॒ अभ्य॒षिच्यन्त ते॒नेमां॒ व॒र्चसावतम् ॥३६॥

text: He who in water shines unfed with fuel, whom sages worship in their sacrifices. May he, the Waters' Child, send us sweet waters those that en- hanced the power of mighty Indra.
meaning: यो॒ अनिध्मो॒ दीद॒यद् अप्स्व् अ॑न्त॒र् यं॒ वि॒प्रास ई॒डते अध्वरे॒षु । अ॒पां नपान् म॒धुमतीर् अपो॒ दा या॒भिर् इ॒न्द्रो वावृधे॒ वीर्या॑वान् ॥३७॥

text: I cast away a handful here, hurtful, injurious to health. I lift another handful up, sparkling and bringing happiness.
meaning: इद॒म् अहं॒ रु॒शन्तं ग्राभं॒ तनूदू॒षिम् अ॒पोहामि । यो॒ भद्रो॒ रोचन॒स् त॒म् उ॒द् अचामि ॥३८॥

text: Hither let Brāhmans bring her bathing water; let them draw such as guards the lives of heroes. Aryaman's fire let her encircle, Pūshan! Fathers-in-law stand, with their sons, expectant.
meaning: आ॒स्यै ब्राह्मणाः॒ स्न॒पनीर् हरन्त्व् अ॒वीरघ्नीर् उ॒द् अजन्त्व् आ॒पः । अर्यम्णो॒ अग्निं॒ प॒र्य् एतु पूषन् प्र॒तीक्षन्ते श्व॒शुरो देव॒रश् च ॥३९॥

text: Blest be the gold to thee, and blest the water, blest the yoke's opening, and blest the pillar. Blest he the waters with their hundred cleansings: blest be thy body's union with thy husband.
meaning: शं॒ ते हि॒रण्यं श॒म् उ सन्त्व् आ॒पः शं॒ मेथि॒र् भवतु शं॒ युग॒स्य त॒र्द्म । शं॒ त आ॒पः शत॒पवित्रा भवन्तु श॒म् उ प॒त्या तन्वं॑ सं॒ स्पृशस्व ॥४०॥ {४}

text: Cleansing Apālā, Indra! thrice, thou gavest sunbright skin to her Drawn, Satakratu! through the hole of car, of wagon, and of yoke.
meaning: खे॒ र॒थस्य खे॒ ऽनसः खे॒ युग॒स्य शतक्रतो । अपाला॒म् इन्द्र त्रि॒ष् पूत्वा॒कृणोः सू॒र्यत्वचम् ॥४१॥

text: Saying thy prayer for cheerfulness, children, prosperity, and wealth, Devoted to thy husband, gird thyself for immortality.
meaning: आशा॒साना सौमनसं॒ प्रजां॒ सौ॒भाग्यं रयि॒म् । प॒त्युर् अ॒नुव्रता भूत्वा॒ सं॒ नह्यस्वामृ॒ताय क॒म् ॥४२॥

text: As vigorous Sindhu won himself imperial lordship of the streams, So be imperial queen when thou hast come within thy husband's home.
meaning: य॒था सि॒न्धुर् नदी॒नां सा॒म्राज्यं सुषुवे॒ वृ॒षा । एवा॒ त्वं सम्रा॒ज्ञ्य् एधि प॒त्युर् अ॒स्तं परे॒त्य ॥४३॥

text: Over thy husband's fathers and his brothers be imperial queen. Over thy husband's sister and, his mother bear supreme control.
meaning: सम्रा॒ज्ञ्य् एधि श्व॒शुरेषु सम्रा॒ज्ञ्य् उत॒ देवृ॒षु । न॒नान्दुः सम्रा॒ज्ञ्य् एधि सम्रा॒ज्ञ्य् उत॒ श्वश्र्वाः॒ ॥४४॥

text: They who have spun, and woven, and extended Goddesses who have drawn the ends together, May they invest thee for full long existence. Heiress of lengthen- ed life, endue this garment,
meaning: या॒ अ॒कृन्तन्न् अ॒वयन् या॒श् च तत्निरे॒ या॒ देवी॒र् अ॒न्तां अभि॒तो॒ ऽददन्त । ता॒स् त्वा जर॒से सं॒ व्ययन्त्व् आ॒युष्मतीदं॒ प॒रि धत्स्व वा॒सः ॥४५॥

text: They mourn the living, they arrange the sacred rite: the men have set their thoughts upon a distant cast: They who have brought the Fathers this delightful gift, when wives allowed their lords the joy of their embrace.
meaning: जीवं॒ रुदन्ति वि॒ नयन्त्य् अध्वरं॒ दीर्घा॒म् अ॒नु प्र॒सितिं दीध्युर् न॒रः । वामं॒ पितृ॒भ्यो य॒ इदं॒ समीरिरे॒ म॒यः प॒तिभ्यो जन॒ये परिष्व॒जे ॥४६॥
