text: With all his fiery fervour this Āditya hath gone up on high, Giving my foes into my hand. Let me not by my foeman's prey. Manifold are thy great deeds, thine, O Vishnu. Sate us with cattle of all varied colours. Set me in happiness, in loftiest heaven.
meaning: उ॒द् अगाद् अय॒म् आदित्यो॒ वि॒श्वेन त॒पसा सह॒ । सप॒त्नान् म॒ह्यं रन्ध॒यन् मा॒ चाहं॒ द्विषते॒ रधं त॒वे॒द् विष्णो बहूधा॒ वीर्या॑णि । त्वं॒ नः पृणीहि पशु॒भिर् विश्व॒रूपैः सुधा॒यां मा धेहि परमे॒ व्यो॑मन् ॥२४॥

text: Thou for our weal, Āditya, hast mounted thy ship with hundred oars. Thou hast transported me to day: so bear me evermore to night.
meaning: आ॒दित्य ना॒वम् आ॒रुक्षः शता॒रित्रां स्वस्त॒ये । अ॒हर् मा॒त्य् अपीपरो रा॒त्रिं सत्रा॒ति पारय ॥२५॥

text: Thou for our weal, O Sūrya, hast mounted thy ship with hundred oars. Thou hast transported me to night: so bear me evermore to day.
meaning: सूर्य नावम् आरुक्षः शता॒रित्रां स्वस्त॒ये । रा॒त्रिं मा॒त्य् अपीपरो॒ ऽहः सत्रा॒ति पारय ॥२६॥

text: Encompassed by Prajāpati's devotion as shield, with Kasyapa's bright light and splendour, Reaching old age, may I made strong and mighty live through a thousand years with happy fortune.
meaning: प्रजा॒पतेर् आ॒वृतो ब्र॒ह्मणा व॒र्मणाहं॒ कश्य॒पस्य ज्यो॒तिषा व॒र्चसा च । जर॒दष्टिः कृत॒वीर्यो वि॒हायाः सह॒स्रायुः सु॒कृतश् चरेयम् ॥२७॥

text: Compassed am I with prayer, my shield and armour; compassed with Kasyapa's bright light and splendour. Let not shafts reach me shot from heaven against me, nor those sent forth by men for my destruction.
meaning: प॒रिवृतो ब्र॒ह्मणा व॒र्मणाह॒म् कश्य॒पस्य ज्यो॒तिषा व॒र्चसा च । मा॒ मा प्रा॒पन्न् इ॒षवो दै॒व्या या॒ मा॒ मा॒नुषीर् अ॒वसृष्टाः वधा॒य ॥२८॥

text: Guarded am I by Order and the Seasons, protected by the past and by the future. Let not distress, yea, let not Death come nigh me: with water of my speech have I o'erwhelmed them.
meaning: ऋते॒न गुप्त॒ ऋतु॒भिश् च स॒र्वैर् भूते॒न गुप्तो॒ भ॒व्येन चाह॒म् । मा॒ मा प्रा॒पत् पाप्मा॒ मो॒त॒ मृत्यु॒र् अन्त॒र् दधे ऽहं॒ सलिले॒न वाचः॒ ॥२९॥

text: On every side let Agni guard and keep me; the rising Sun drive off the snares of Mrityu! Let brightly flushing Mornings, firm-set mountains, and lives a thousand be with me united.
meaning: अग्नि॒र् मा गोप्ता॒ प॒रि पातु विश्व॒तः उद्य॒न्त् सू॒र्यो नुदतां मृत्युपाशा॒न् । व्युछ॒न्तीर् उष॒सः प॒र्वता ध्रुवाः॒ सह॒स्रं प्राणा॒ म॒य्य् आ॒ यतन्ताम् ॥३०॥ {३}

text: Fain would I win my friend to kindly friendship. So may the Sage, come through the air's wide ocean, Remembering the earth and days to follow, obtain a son the issue of his father.
meaning: ओ॒ चित् स॒खायं सख्या॒ ववृत्यां तिरः॒ पुरु॒ चिद् अर्णवं॒ जगन्वा॒न् । पितु॒र् न॒पातम् आ॒ दधीत वेधा॒ अ॒धि क्ष॒मि प्रतरं॒ दी॒ध्यानः ॥१॥

text: Thy friend loves not the friendship which considers her who is near in kindred as a stranger. Sons of the mighty Asura, the heroes, supporters of the heaven, see far around them.
meaning: न॒ ते स॒खा सख्यं॒ वष्ट्य् एत॒त् स॒लक्ष्मा य॒द् वि॒षुरूपा भ॒वति । मह॒स् पुत्रा॒सो अ॒सुरस्य वीरा॒ दिवो॒ धर्ता॒र उर्विया॒ प॒रि ख्यन् ॥२॥

text: Yea, this the Immortals seek of thee with longing, a scion of the only man existing. Then let thy soul and mine be knit together. Embrace thy con- sort as her loving husband.
meaning: उश॒न्ति घा ते॒ अमृ॒तास एत॒द् ए॒कस्य चित् त्यज॒सं म॒र्त्यस्य । नि॒ ते म॒नो म॒नसि धाय्य् अस्मे॒ ज॒न्युः प॒तिस् तन्व॑म् आ॒ विविष्याः ॥३॥

text: Shall we do now what we ne'er did aforetime? we who spoke righteously now talk impurely? Gandharva in the floods, the Dame of Waters—such is our bond, such our most lofty kinship.
meaning: न॒ यत् पुरा॒ चकृमा॒ क॒द् ध नून॒म् ऋतं॒ व॒दन्तो अ॒नृतं र॒पेम । गन्धर्वो॒ अप्स्व् अ॒प्या च यो॒षा सा॒ नौ ना॒भिः परमं॒ जामि॒ त॒न् नौ ॥४॥

text: Even in the womb God Tvashtar, vivifier, shaping all forms, Creator, made us consorts. Ne'er are his holy statutes violated: that we are his the heaven and earth acknowledge.
meaning: ग॒र्भे नु॒ नौ जनिता॒ द॒म्पती कर् देव॒स् त्व॒ष्टा सविता॒ विश्व॒रूपः । न॒किर् अस्य प्र॒ मिनन्ति व्रता॒नि वे॒द नाव् अस्य॒ पृथिवी॒ उत॒ द्यौः॒ ॥५॥

text: Who yokes to-day unto the pole of Order the strong and passio- nate steers of checkless spirit, With shaft-armed mouths, heart-piercing, joy-bestowing? Long shall he live who duly pays them service.
meaning: को॒ अद्य॒ युङ्क्ते धुरि॒ गा॒ ऋत॒स्य शि॒मीवतो भामि॒नो दुर्हृणायू॒न् । आस॒न्निषून् हृत्स्व॒सो मयोभू॒न् य॒ एषां भृत्या॒म् ऋण॒धत् स॒ जीवात् ॥६॥

text: Who knows that earliest day whereof thou speakest, Who hath beheld it? Who can here declare it? Great is the law of Varuna and Mitra. What, wanton, wilt thou say to men to tempt them?
meaning: को॒ अस्य॒ वेद प्रथम॒स्या॒ह्नः क॒ ईं ददर्श क॒ इह॒ प्र॒ वोचत् । बृह॒न् मित्र॒स्य व॒रुणस्य धा॒म क॒द् उ ब्रव आहनो वी॒च्या नृ॒̄न् ॥७॥

text: Yami am possessed by love of Yama, that I may rest on the same couch beside him. I as a wife would yield me to my husband. Like car-wheels let us speed to meet each other.
meaning: यम॒स्य मा यम्यं॑ का॒म आ॒गन्त् समाने॒ यो॒नौ सहशे॒य्याय । जाये॒व प॒त्ये तन्वं॑ रिरिच्यां वि॒ चिद् वृहेव र॒थ्येव चक्रा॒ ॥८॥

text: They stand not still, they never close their eyelids, those senti- nels of Gods who wander round us. Not me—go quickly, wanton, with another, and hasten like a chariot-wheel to meet him.
meaning: न॒ तिष्ठन्ति न॒ नि॒ मिषन्त्य् एते॒ देवा॒नां स्प॒श इह॒ ये॒ चरन्ति । अन्ये॒न म॒द् आहनो याहि तू॒यं ते॒न वि॒ वृह र॒थ्येव चक्रा॒ ॥९॥

text: May Sūrya's eye with days and nights endow him, and ever may his light spread out before him. In heaven and earth the kindred pair commingle. On Yami be the unbrotherly act of Yama.
meaning: रा॒त्रीभिर् अस्मा अ॒हभिर् दशस्येत् सू॒र्यस्य च॒क्षुर् मु॒हुर् उ॒न् मिमीयात् । दिवा॒ पृथिव्या॒ मिथुना॒ स॒बन्धू यमी॒र् यम॒स्य विवृहाद् अ॒जामि ॥१०॥ {१}

text: Sure there will come succeeding times when brothers and sisters will do acts unmeet for kinsfolk. Not me, O fair one—seek another husband, and make thine arm a pillow for thy consort.
meaning: आ॒ घा ता॒ गछान् उ॒त्तरा युगा॒नि य॒त्र जाम॒यः कृण॒वन्न् अ॒जामि । उ॒प बर्बृहि वृषभा॒य बाहु॒म् अन्य॒म् इछस्व सुभगे प॒तिं म॒त् ॥११॥

text: Is he a brother when no help is left her? Is she a sister when Destruction cometh? Forced by my love these many words I utter. Come near, and hold me in thy close embraces,
meaning: किं॒ भ्रा॒तासद् य॒द् अनाथं॒ भ॒वाति कि॒म् उ स्व॒सा य॒न् नि॒रृतिर् निग॒छात् । का॒ममूता बह्व् ए॑त॒द् रपामि तन्वा॑ मे तन्वं॑ सं॒ पिपृग्धि ॥१२॥

text: I am no help for thee, no refuge, Yami, I will not clasp and press thee to my bosom. This is abhorrent to my mind and spirit—a brother on the couch beside a sister.
meaning: न॒ ते नाथं॒ यम्य् अ॒त्राह॒म् अस्मि न॒ ते तनूं॒ तन्वा॑ स॒म् पपृच्याम् । अन्ये॒न म॒त् प्रमु॒दः कल्पयस्व न॒ ते भ्रा॒ता सुभगे वष्ट्य् एत॒त् ॥१३॥

text: I will not fold mine arms about thy body: they call it sin when one comes near a sister. Not me—prepare thy pleasure with another. Thy brother seeks not this from thee, O fair one.
meaning: न॒ वा॒ उ ते तनूं॒ तन्वा॑ सं॒ पिपृच्यां पाप॒म् आहुर् यः॒ स्व॒सारं निग॒छात् । अ॒संयद् एत॒न् म॒नसो हृदो॒ मे भ्रा॒ता स्व॒सुः श॒यने य॒च् छ॒यीय ॥१४॥

text: Alas; thou art indeed a weakling Yama. We find in thee no trace o f heart or spirit. As round a tree the woodbine clings, another will cling about thee girt as with a girdle.
meaning: बतो॒ बतासि यम नै॒व॒ ते म॒नो हृ॒दयं चाविदाम् आ॒ । अन्या॒ कि॒ल त्वां॒ कक्ष्ये॑व युक्तं॒ प॒रि ष्वजातौ लि॒बुजेव वृक्ष॒म् ॥१५॥

text: Embrace another, Yami. Let some other, even as the woodbine rings a tree, enfold thee. Win thou his heart and let him win thy fancy; so make with him a bond of blest alliance.
meaning: अन्य॒म् ऊ षु॒ यम्य् अन्य॒ उ त्वां॒ प॒रि ष्वजातौ लि॒बुजेव वृक्ष॒म् । त॒स्य वा त्वं॒ म॒न इछा स॒ वा त॒वा॒धा कृणुष्व संविदं सु॒भद्राम् ॥१६॥

text: Three hymns the Sages have disposed in order, the many-formed, the fair, the all-beholding. These in one single world are placed and settled—the growing plants, the breezes, and the waters.
meaning: त्री॒णि छ॒न्दांसि कव॒यो वि॒ येतिरे पुरुरू॒पं दर्शतं॒ विश्व॒चक्षणम् । आ॒पो वा॒ता ओ॒षधयस् ता॒न्य् ए॒कस्मिन् भु॒वन आ॒र्पितानि ॥१७॥

text: The Bull hath yielded for the Bull the milk of heaven: inviolable is the Son of Aditi. According to his wisdom Varuna knoweth all: he halloweth, the holy, times for sacrifice.
meaning: वृ॒षा वृ॒ष्णे दुदुहे दो॒हसा दिवः॒ प॒यांसि यह्वो॒ अ॒दितेर् अ॒दाभ्यः । वि॒श्वं स॒ वेद व॒रुणो य॒था धिया॒ स॒ यज्ञि॒यो यजति यज्ञि॒यां ऋतू॒न् ॥१८॥

text: Gandharvi spake. May she, the Lady of the Flood amid the river's roaring leave my heart untouched. May Aditi accomplish all that we desire, and may our eldest Brother tell us this as chief.
meaning: र॒पद् गन्धर्वी॒र् अ॒प्या च यो॒षणा नद॒स्य नादे॒ प॒रि पातु नो म॒नः । इष्ट॒स्य म॒ध्ये अ॒दितिर् नि॒ धातु नो भ्रा॒ता नो ज्येष्ठः॒ प्रथमो॒ वि॒ वोचति ॥१९॥

text: Yea, even this blessed Morning, rich in store of food, splendid, with heavenly lustre, hath shone out for man, Since they as was the wish of yearning Gods, brought forth that yearning Agni for the assembly as the Priest.
meaning: सो॒ चित् नु॒ भद्रा॒ क्षुम॒ती य॒शस्वत्य् उषा॒ उवास म॒नवे स्व॑र्वती । य॒द् ईम् उश॒न्तम् उशता॒म् अ॒नु क्र॒तुम् अग्निं॒ हो॒तारं विद॒थाय जी॒जनन् ॥२०॥ {२}

text: And the fleet Falcon brought for sacrifice from afar this flowing. drop most excellent and passing wise, Then when the Aryan tribes chose as invoking Priest Agni the wonder-worker, and the hymn rose up.
meaning: अ॒ध त्यं॒ द्रप्सं॒ विभ्वं॑ विचक्षनं॒ वि॒र् आ॒भरद् इषिरः॒ श्येनो॒ अध्वरे॒ । य॒दी वि॒शो वृण॒ते दस्म॒म् आ॒र्या अग्निं॒ हो॒तारम् अ॒ध धी॒र् अजायत ॥२१॥

text: Still art thou kind to him who feeds thee as with grass, and. skilled in sacrifice offers thee holy gifts. When thou having received the sage's strengthening food with lauds, after long toil comest with many more.
meaning: स॒दासि रण्वो॒ य॒वसेव पु॒ष्यते हो॒त्राभिर् अग्ने म॒नुषः स्वध्वरः॒ । वि॒प्रस्य वा य॒च् छशमान॒ उक्थ्यो॑ वा॒जं ससवां॒ उपया॒सि भू॒रिभिः ॥२२॥

text: Urge thou thy Parents, as a lover, to delight: the lovely One desires and craves it from his heart. As Priest he calls aloud, as Warrior shows his skill, as Asura tries his strength, and with the hymn is stirred.
meaning: उ॒द् ईरय पित॒रा जार॒ आ॒ भ॒गम् इ॒यक्षति हर्यतो॒ हृत्त॒ इष्यति । वि॒वक्ति व॒ह्निः स्वपस्य॒ते मख॒स् तविष्य॒ते अ॒सुरो वे॒पते मती॒ ॥२३॥

text: Far famed is he, the mortal man, O Agni thou Son of strength, who hath obtained thy favour. He, gathering power, borne onward by his horses, makes his, days lovely in his might and splendour.
meaning: य॒स् ते अग्ने सुमतिं॒ म॒र्तो अ॒ख्यत् स॒हसः सूनो अ॒ति स॒ प्र॒ शृण्वे । इ॒षं द॒धानो व॒हमानो अ॒श्वैर् आ॒ स॒ द्युमां॒ अ॒मवान् भूषति द्यू॒न् ॥२४॥

text: Hear us, O Agni, in the great assembly: harness thy rapid car,. the car of Amrit. Bring Heaven and Earth, the Deities' Parents, hither: stay with us here, nor from the Gods be absent.
meaning: श्रुधी॒ नो अग्ने स॒दने सध॒स्थे युक्ष्वा॒ र॒थम् अमृ॒तस्य द्रवित्नु॒म् । आ॒ नो वह रो॒दसी देव॒पुत्रे मा॒किर् देवा॒नाम् अ॒प भूर् इह॒ स्याः ॥२५॥

text: When, holy Agni, the divine assembly, the holy synod mid the Gods, is gathered, And when thou, godlike One, dealest forth treasures vouchsafe us too our portion of the riches.
meaning: य॒द् अग्न एषा॒ स॒मितिर् भ॒वाति देवी॒ देवे॒षु यजता॒ यजत्र । र॒त्ना च य॒द् विभ॒जासि स्वधावो भागं॒ नो अ॒त्र व॒सुमन्तं वीतात् ॥२६॥

text: Agni hath looked upon the van of Mornings, and on the days. the earliest Jātavedas. After the Dawns, after their rays of brightness, Sūrya hath enter- ed into earth and heaven.
meaning: अ॒न्व् अग्नि॒र् उष॒साम् अ॒ग्रम् अख्यद् अ॒न्व् अ॒हानि प्रथमो॒ जात॒वेदाः । अ॒नु सू॒र्य उष॒सो अ॒नु रश्मी॒न् द्या॒वापृथिवी॒ आ॒ विवेश ॥२७॥

text: Agni hath looked against the van of Mornings, against the days- the earliest Jātavedas; In many a place against the beams of Sūrya, against the heavens and earth hath he extended.
meaning: प्र॒त्य् अग्नि॒र् उष॒साम् अ॒ग्रम् अख्यत् प्र॒त्य् अ॒हानि प्रथमो॒ जात॒वेदाः । प्र॒ति सू॒र्यस्य पुरुधा॒ च रश्मी॒न् प्र॒ति द्या॒वापृथिवी॒ आ॒ ततान ॥२८॥

text: Heaven and Earth, first by everlasting Order, speakers of truth, are near enough to hear us, When the God, urging men to worship, sitteth as Priest, assum- ing all his vital vigour.
meaning: द्या॒वा ह क्षा॒मा प्रथमे॒ ऋते॒नाभिश्रावे॒ भवतः सत्यवा॒चा । देवो॒ य॒न् म॒र्तान् यज॒थाय कृण्व॒न्त् सी॒दद् धो॒ता प्रत्य॒ङ् स्व॒म् अ॒सुं य॒न् ॥२९॥

text: As God comprising Gods by Law eternal, bear, as the chief who knoweth, our oblation, Smoke-bannered with the fuel, radiant, joyous, better to praise and worship, Priest for ever.
meaning: देवो॒ देवा॒न् परिभू॒र् ऋते॒न व॒हा नो हव्यं॒ प्रथम॒श् चिकित्वा॒न् । धूम॒केतुः समि॒धा भा॒ऋजीको मन्द्रो॒ हो॒ता नि॒त्यो वाचा॒ य॒जीयान् ॥३०॥ {३}

text: I praise your work .that ye may make me prosper: hear, Heaven and Earth, twain worlds that drop with fatness! While days and Gods go to the world of spirits, have let the Parents with sweet mead refresh us.
meaning: अ॒र्चामि वां व॒र्धाया॒पो घृतस्नू द्या॒वाभूमी शृणुतं॒ रोदसी मे । अ॒हा य॒द् देवा॒ अ॒सुनीतिम् आ॒यन् म॒ध्वा नो अ॒त्र पित॒रा शिशीताम् ॥३१॥

text: When the Cow's nectar wins the God completely, men here below are heaven's and earth's sustainers All the Gods come to this thy heavenly Yajus which from the motley Pair milked oil and water
meaning: स्वा॒वृग् देव॒स्यामृ॒तं य॒दी गो॒र् अ॒तो जाता॒सो धारयन्त उर्वी॒ । वि॒श्वे देवा॒ अ॒नु त॒त् ते य॒जुर् गुर् दुहे॒ य॒द् ए॒नी दिव्यं॒ घृत॒म् वाः ॥३२॥

text: Hath the King seized us? How have we offended against his holy Ordinance? Who knoweth? For even Mitra mid the Gods is angry. There are both song and wealth for those who come not.
meaning: किं॒ स्विन् नो रा॒जा जगृहे क॒द् अस्या॒ति व्रतं॒ चकृमा को॒ वि॒ वेद । मित्र॒स् चिद् धि॒ ष्मा जुहुराणो॒ देवां॒ छ्लो॒को न॒ याता॒म् अ॒पि वा॒जो अ॒स्ति ॥३३॥

text: Tis hard to understand the Immortal's nature, where she who is akin becomes a stranger. Guard ceaselessly, great Agni, him who ponders Yama's name easy to be comprehended.
meaning: दुर्म॒न्त्व् अ॒त्रामृ॒तस्य ना॒म स॒लक्ष्मा य॒द् वि॒षुरूपा भ॒वाति । यम॒स्य यो॒ मन॒वते सुम॒न्त्व् अग्ने त॒म् ऋष्व पाह्य् अ॒प्रयुछन् ॥३४॥

text: They in the synod where the Gods rejoice them, where they are seated in Vivasvan's dwelling, Have given the Moon his beams, the Sun his splendour: the two unweariedly maintain their brightness.
meaning: य॒स्मिन् देवा॒ विद॒थे माद॒यन्ते विव॒स्वतः स॒दने धार॒यन्ते । सू॒र्ये ज्यो॒तिर् अ॒दधुर् मास्य् अ॑क्तू॒न् प॒रि द्योतनिं॒ चरतो अ॒जस्रा ॥३५॥

text: The counsel which the Gods meet to consider, their secret plan, of that we have no knowledge. There let God Savitar, Aditi, and Mitra proclaim to Varuna that we are sinless.
meaning: य॒स्मिन् देवा॒ म॒न्मनि संच॒रन्त्य् अपीच्ये॑ न॒ वय॒म् अस्य विद्म । मित्रो॒ नो अ॒त्रा॒दितिर् अ॒नागान्त् सविता॒ देवो॒ व॒रुणाय वोचत् ॥३६॥

text: Companions, let us learn a prayer to Indra whom the thunder arms, To glorify your bold and most heroic Friend.
meaning: स॒खाय आ॒ शिषामहे ब्रह्मे॒न्द्राय वज्रि॒णे । स्तुष॒ ऊ षु॒ नृ॒तमाय धृष्ण॒वे ॥३७॥

text: For thou by slaying Vritra art the Vritra-slayer, famed for might. Thou, Hero, in rich gifts surpassest wealthy chiefs.
meaning: श॒वसा ह्य् अ॒सि श्रुतो॒ वृत्रह॒त्येन वृत्रहा॒ । मघै॒र् मघो॒नो अ॒ति शूर दाशसि ॥३८॥

text: O'er the broad land thou goest like a Stega: here on vast earth let breezes blow upon us, Here hath our dear Friend Varuna, united, like Agni in the wood, shot forth his splendour.
meaning: स्तेगो॒ न॒ क्षा॒म् अ॒त्य् एषि पृथिवीं॒ मही॒ नो वा॒ता इह॒ वान्तु भू॒मौ । मित्रो॒ नो अ॒त्र व॒रुणो युज॒मानो अग्नि॒र् व॒ने न॒ व्य् अ॑सृष्ट शो॒कम् ॥३९॥

text: Sing praise to him the chariot-borne, the famous, Sovran of men, the dread and strong destroyer. O Rudra, praised be gracious to the singer; let thy darts spare us and smite down another.
meaning: स्तुहि॒ श्रुतं॒ गर्तस॒दं ज॒नानां रा॒जानं भीम॒म् उपहत्नु॒म् उग्र॒म् । मृडा॒ जरित्रे॒ रुद्र स्त॒वानो अन्य॒म् अस्म॒त् ते नि॒ वपन्तु से॒न्यम् ॥४०॥ {४}

text: The pious call Sarasvati, they worship Sarasvati while sacrifice proceedeth. The virtuous call Sarasvati to hear them. Sarasvati send bliss to him who giveth!
meaning: स॒रस्वतीं देवय॒न्तो हवन्ते स॒रस्वतीम् अध्वरे॒ ताय॒माने । स॒रस्वतीं सुकृ॒तो हवन्ते स॒रस्वती दाशु॒षे वा॒र्यं दात् ॥४१॥

text: Sarasvati is called on by the Fathers who come right forward to our solemn worship. Seated upon this sacred grass rejoice you. Give thou us strengthening food that brings no sickness.
meaning: स॒रस्वतीं पित॒रो हवन्ते दक्षिना॒ यज्ञ॒म् अभिन॒क्षमाणाः । आस॒द्यास्मि॒न् बर्हि॒षि मादयध्वम् अनमीवा॒ इ॒ष आ॒ धेह्य् अस्मे॒ ॥४२॥

text: Sarasvati, who comest with the Fathers, joying in hymns, O Goddess, and oblations, Give plenteous wealth to this the sacrificer, a portion, worth a thousand, of refreshment.
meaning: स॒रस्वति या॒ सर॒थं यया॒थोक्थैः॒ स्वधा॒भिर् देवि पितृ॒भिर् म॒दन्ती । सहस्रार्घ॒म् इडो॒ अ॒त्र भागं॒ राय॒स् पो॒षं य॒जमानाय धेहि ॥४३॥

text: May they ascend, the lowest, highest, midmost, the Fathers, who deserve a share of Soma. May they who have attained to life, the Fathers, righteous and gentle, aid us when we call them.
meaning: उ॒द् ईरताम् अ॒वर उ॒त् प॒रास उ॒न् मध्यमाः॒ पित॒रः सोम्या॒सः । अ॒सुं य॒ ईयु॒र् अवृका॒ ऋतज्ञा॒स् ते॒ नो ऽवन्तु पित॒रो ह॒वेषु ॥४४॥

text: I have attained the gracious-minded Fathers, I have gained son and progeny from Vishnu. They who enjoy pressed juices with oblation, seated on sacred grass, come oftenest hither.
meaning: आ॒हं॒ पितृ॒̄न्त् सुविद॒त्रां अवित्सि न॒पातं च विक्र॒मणं च वि॒ष्णोः । बर्हिष॒दो ये॒ स्वध॒या सुत॒स्य भ॒जन्त पित्व॒स् त इहा॒गमिष्ठाः ॥४५॥

text: Now be this homage offered to the Fathers, to those who passed of old and those who followed, Those who have rested in the earthly region and those who dwell among the happy races.
meaning: इदं॒ पितृ॒भ्यो न॒मो अस्त्व् अद्य॒ ये॒ पू॒र्वासो ये॒ अ॒परास ईयुः॒ । ये॒ पा॒र्थिवे र॒जस्य् आ॒ नि॒षक्ता ये॒ वा नूनं॒ सुवृज॒नासु दिक्षु॒ ॥४६॥

text: Mātali prospers there with Kavyas, Yama with Angiras' sons, Brihaspati with singers. Exalters of the Gods, by Gods exalted, aid us those Fathers in our invocations?
meaning: मा॒तली कव्यै॒र् यमो॒ अ॒ङ्गिरोभिर् बृ॒हस्प॒तिर् ऋ॒क्वभिर् वावृधानः॒ । यां॒श् च देवा॒ वावृधु॒र् ये॒ च देवां॒स् ते॒ नो ऽवन्तु पित॒रो ह॒वेषु ॥४७॥

text: Yes, this is good to taste and full of sweetness, verily it is strong and rich in flavour. No one may conquer Indra in the battle when he hath drunken of the draught we offer.
meaning: स्वादु॒ष् कि॒लायं॒ म॒धुमां उता॒यं॒ तीव्रः॒ कि॒लायं॒ र॒सवां उता॒य॒म् । उतो॒ न्व् अ॑स्य॒ पपिवां॒सम् इ॒न्द्रं न॒ क॒श् चन॒ सहत आहवे॒षु ॥४८॥

text: Honour the King with your oblations, Yama, Vivasvān's son, who gathers men together. Even him who travelled o'er the mighty rivers, who searches out and shows the path to many.
meaning: परेयिवां॒सं प्रव॒तो मही॒र् इ॒ति बहु॒भ्यः प॒न्थाम् अनुपस्पशान॒म् । वैवस्वतं॒ संग॒मनं ज॒नानां यमं॒ रा॒जानं हवि॒षा सपर्यत ॥४९॥

text: Yama first found for us the road to travel: this pasture never can be taken from us. Men born on earth tread their own paths that lead them whither our ancient Fathers have departed.
meaning: यमो॒ नो गातुं॒ प्रथमो॒ विवेद नै॒षा॒ ग॒व्यूतिर् अ॒पभर्तवा॒ उ । य॒त्रा नः पू॒र्वे पित॒रः प॒रेता एना॒ जज्ञानाः॒ पथ्या॑ अ॒नु स्वाः॒ ॥५०॥ {५}

text: Fathers who sit on sacred grass, come, help us: these offsprings have we made for you; accept them. So come to us with most auspicious favour: bestow on us unfailing health and plenty.
meaning: ब॒र्हिषदः पितर ऊत्य् अ॑र्वा॒ग् इमा॒ वो हव्या॒ चकृमा जुष॒ध्वम् । त॒ आ॒ गता॒वसा शं॒तमेना॒धा नः शं॒ यो॒र् अरपो॒ दधात ॥५१॥

text: Bowing their bended knees and seated southward let all accept this sacrifice with favour. Punish us not for any sin, O fathers which we through human frailty have committed.
meaning: आ॒च्या जा॒नु दक्षिणतो॒ निष॒द्येदं॒ नो हवि॒र् अभि॒ गृणन्तु वि॒श्वे । मा॒ हिंसिष्ट पितरः के॒न चिन् नो य॒द् व आ॒गः पुरुष॒ता क॒राम ॥५२॥

text: Tvashtar prepares the bridal for his daughter: therefore the whole of this our world assembles. But Yama's mother, spouse of great Vivasvān, vanished as she was carried to her dwelling.
meaning: त्व॒ष्टा दुहित्रे॒ वहतुं॒ कृणोति ते॒नेदं॒ वि॒श्वं भु॒वनं स॒म् एति । यम॒स्य माता॒ पर्युह्य॒माना महो॒ जाया॒ वि॒वस्वतो ननाश ॥५३॥

text: Go forth, go forth upon the homeward pathways whither our sires of old have gone before us. Then shalt thou look on both the Kings enjoying their sacred food, God Varuna and Yama.
meaning: प्रे॒हि प्रे॒हि पथि॒भिः पूर्या॒णैर् ये॒ना ते पू॒र्वे पित॒रः प॒रेताः । उभा॒ रा॒जानौ स्वध॒या म॒दन्तौ यमं॒ पश्यासि व॒रुणं च देव॒म् ॥५४॥

text: Go hence, depart ye, fly in all directions. This world for him the Fathers have provided. Yama bestow upon this man a dwelling adorned with days and beams of light and waters.
meaning: अ॒पेत वी॒त वि॒ च सर्पता॒तो ऽस्मा॒ एतं॒ पित॒रो लोक॒म् अक्रन् । अ॒होभिर् अद्भि॒र् अक्तु॒भिर् व्य॑क्तं यमो॒ ददात्य् अवसा॒नम् अस्मै ॥५५॥

text: We set thee down with yearning, and with yearning we enkindle thee, Yearning, bring yearning Fathers nigh to eat the food of sacrifice.
meaning: उश॒न्तस् त्वेधीमह्य् उश॒न्तः स॒म् इधीमहि । उश॒न्न् उशत॒ आ॒ वह पितृ॒̄न् हवि॒षे अ॒त्तवे ॥५६॥

text: We, splendid men, deposit thee, we, splendid men, enkindle thee. Splendid, bring splendid Fathers nigh to eat the sacrificial food.
meaning: द्युम॒न्तस् त्वेधीमहि द्युम॒न्तः स॒म् इधीमहि । द्युमा॒न् द्युमत॒ आ॒ वह पितृ॒̄न् हवि॒षे अ॒त्तवे ॥५७॥

text: Our Fathers are Angirases, Navagvas, Atharvans, Bhrigus, who deserve the Soma. May these, the holy, look on us with favour; may we enjoy their gracious loving-kindness.
meaning: अ॒ङ्गिरसो नः पित॒रो न॒वग्वा अ॒थर्वाणो भृ॒गवः सोम्या॒सः । ते॒षां वयं॒ सुमतौ॒ यज्ञि॒यानाम् अ॒पि भद्रे॒ सौमनसे॒ स्याम ॥५८॥

text: Come, Yama, with Angirases, the holy; rejoice thee here with children of Virūpa. Seated on sacred grass at this oblation: I call Vivasvān too, thy father, hither.
meaning: अ॒ङ्गिरोभिर् यज्ञि॒यैर् आ॒ गहीह॒ य॒म वैरूपै॒र् इह॒ मादयस्व । वि॒वस्वन्तं हुवे यः॒ पिता॒ ते ऽस्मि॒न् बर्हि॒ष्य् आ॒ निष॒द्य ॥५९॥

text: Come, seat thee on this bed of grass. O Yama, accordant with Angirases and Fathers. Let texts recited by the sages bring thee. O. King, let this oblation make thee joyful.
meaning: इमं॒ यम प्रस्तर॒म् आ॒ हि॒ रो॒हा॒ङ्गिरोभिः पितृ॒भिः संविदानः॒ । आ॒ त्वा म॒न्त्राः कविशस्ता॒ वहन्त्व् एना॒ राजन् हवि॒षो मादयस्व ॥६०॥

text: He hath gone hence and risen on high mounting heaven's ridges by that path Whereon the sons of Angiras, the conquerors of earth, went up.
meaning: इत॒ एत॒ उदा॒रुहन् दिव॒स् पृष्ठा॒न्व् आ॒रुहन् । प्र॒ भूर्ज॒यो य॒था पथा॒ द्या॒म् अ॒ङ्गिरसो ययुः॒ ॥६१॥ {६}

text: For Yama Soma juice flows clear, to Yama is oblation paid. To Yama sacrifice prepared, and heralded by Agni, goes.
meaning: यमा॒य सो॒मः पवते यमा॒य क्रियते हविः॒ । यमं॒ ह यज्ञो॒ गछत्य् अग्नि॒दूतो अ॒रंकृतः ॥१॥

text: Offer to Yama sacrifice most sweet in savour and draw near. Bow down before the Rishis of the olden time, the ancient ones who made the path.
meaning: यमा॒य म॒धुमत्तमं जुहो॒ता प्र॒ च तिष्ठत । इदं॒ न॒म ऋ॒षिभ्यः पूर्वजे॒भ्यः पू॒र्वेभ्यः पथिकृ॒द्भ्यः ॥२॥

text: Offer to Yama, to the King, butter and milk in sacrifice. So may he grant that we may live long days of life mid living men,
meaning: यमाय घृत॒वत् प॒यो रा॒ज्ञे हवि॒र् जुहोतन । स॒ नो जीवे॒ष्व् आ॒ यमेद् दीर्घ॒म् आ॒युः प्र॒ जीव॒से ॥३॥

text: Burn him not up, nor quite consume him, Agni. Let not his body or his skin be scattered. O Jātavedas, when thou hast matured him, then send him on his way unto the Fathers.
meaning: मै॒नम् अग्ने वि॒ दहो मा॒भि शूशुचो मा॒स्य त्व॒चं चिक्षिपो मा॒ श॒रीरम् । शृतं॒ यदा॒ क॒रसि जातवेदो॒ ऽथेम् एनं प्र॒ हिणुतात् पितृ̄ं॒र् उ॒प ॥४॥

text: When thou hast made him ready, Jātavedas, then do thou give him over to the Fathers. When he attains unto the life that waits him he will obey the Deities' commandment.
meaning: यदा॒ शृतं॒ कृण॒वो जातवेदो॒ ऽथेम॒म् एनं प॒रि दत्तात् पितृ॒भ्यः । यदो॒ ग॒छात्य् अ॒सुनीतिम् एता॒म् अ॒थ देवा॒नां वशनी॒र् भवाति ॥५॥

text: With the three jars Brihat alone makes pure the six wide-spread- ing realms. The Gāyatri, the Trishtup, all metres in Yama are contained.
meaning: त्रि॒कद्रुकेभिः पवते ष॒ड् उर्वी॒र् ए॒कम् इ॒द् बृह॒त् । त्रिष्टु॒ब् गायत्री॒ छ॒न्दांसि स॒र्वा ता॒ यम॒ आ॒र्पिता ॥६॥

text: The Sun receive thine eye, the wind thy spirit; go, as thy merit is, to earth or heaven. Go, if it be thy lot, unto the waters: go, make thy home in plants with all thy members.
meaning: सू॒र्यं च॒क्षुषा गछ वा॒तम् आत्म॒ना दि॒वं च ग॒छ पृथिवीं॒ च ध॒र्मभिः । अपो॒ वा गछ य॒दि त॒त्र ते हित॒म् ओ॒षधीषु प्र॒ति तिष्ठा श॒रीरैः ॥७॥

text: Thy portion is the goat: with heat consume him: let thy fierce flame, thy glowing splendour, burn him. With thine auspicious forms, O Jātavedas, bear this man to the region of the pious.
meaning: अजो॒ भाग॒स् त॒पसस् तं॒ तपस्व तं॒ ते शोचि॒स् तपतु तं॒ ते अर्चिः॒ । या॒स् ते शिवा॒स् तन्वो॑ जातवेदस् ता॒भिर् वहैनं सुकृ॒ताम् उ लोक॒म् ॥८॥

text: Let all thy rapid flames, O Jātavedas, wherewith thou fillest heaven and earth's mid-region, Follow the goat as he goes on, united: then with the others, most auspicious, aid us.
meaning: या॒स् ते शोच॒यो रं॒हयो जातवेदो या॒भिर् आपृणा॒सि दि॒वम् अन्त॒रिक्षम् । अजं॒ य॒न्तम् अ॒नु ताः॒ स॒म् ऋण्वताम् अ॒थे॒तराभिः शिव॒तमाभिः शृतं॒ कृधि ॥९॥

text: Away O Agni, to the Fathers, send him who, offered in thee, goes with our oblations. Wearing new life let him approach his offspring, and splendid, be invested with a body,
meaning: अ॒व सृज पु॒नर् अग्ने पितृ॒भ्यो य॒स् त आ॒हुतश् च॒रति स्वधा॒वान् । आ॒युर् व॒सान उ॒प यातु शे॒षः सं॒ गछतां तन्वा॑ सुव॒र्चाः ॥१०॥ {७}

text: Run and outspeed the two dogs, Sarama's offspring, brindled, four-eyed, upon thy happy pathway. Draw nigh thou to the gracious-minded Fathers who take their pleasure in the feast with Yama.
meaning: अ॒ति द्रव श्वा॒नौ सारमेयौ॒ चतुरक्षौ॒ शब॒लौ साधु॒ना पथा॒ । अ॒धा पितृ॒̄न्त् सुविद॒त्रां अ॒पीहि यमे॒न ये॒ सधमा॒दं म॒दन्ति ॥११॥

text: And those two dogs of thine, Yama, the watchers, four-eyed who look on men and guard the pathway Entrust this man, O King, to their protection, and with prosperity and health endow him.
meaning: यौ॒ ते श्वा॒नौ यम रक्षिता॒रौ चतुरक्षौ॒ पथिष॒दी नृच॒क्षसा । ता॒भ्यां राजन् प॒रि धेह्य् एनं स्वस्त्य् अ॑स्मा अनमीवं॒ च धेहि ॥१२॥

text: Dark-hued, insatiate, with distended nostrils, Yama's two envoys roam among the people. May they restore to us a fair existence here and to-day that we may see the sunlight.
meaning: उरूणसा॒व् असुतृ॒पाव् उदुम्बलौ॒ यम॒स्य दूतौ॒ चरतो ज॒नां अ॒नु । ता॒व् अस्म॒भ्यं दृश॒ये सू॒र्याय पु॒नर् दाताम् अ॒सुम् अद्ये॒ह॒ भद्र॒म् ॥१३॥

text: For some the Soma juice runs clear some sit by sacrificial oil. To those for whom the meath flows forth, even to those let him depart.
meaning: सो॒म ए॒केभ्यः पवते घृत॒म् ए॒क उ॒पासते । ये॒भ्यो म॒धु प्रधा॒वति तां॒श् चिद् एवा॒पि गछतात् ॥१४॥

text: Let him, O Yama, go to those Rishis austere, of Fervour born, First followers of Law, the sons of Law, upholders of the Law.
meaning: ये॒ चित् पू॒र्व ऋत॒साता ऋत॒जाता ऋतावृ॒धः । ऋ॒षीन् त॒पस्वतो यम तपोजां॒ अ॒पि गछतात् ॥१५॥

text: Invincible through Fervour, they who by their Fervour went to heaven. Who practised great austerity,—even to those let him depart.
meaning: त॒पसा ये॒ अनाधृष्या॒स् त॒पसा ये॒ स्व॑र् ययुः॒ । त॒पो ये॒ चक्रिरे॒ म॒हस् तां॒श् चिद् एवा॒पि गछतात् ॥१६॥

text: The heroes who contend in war and boldly cast their lives away. Or who give guerdon thousandfold,—even to those let him depart.
meaning: ये॒ यु॒ध्यन्ते प्रध॒नेषु शू॒रासो ये॒ स्व॑र् तनूत्य॒जः । ये॒ वा सह॒स्रदक्षिणास् तां॒ चिद् एवा॒पि गछतात् ॥१७॥

text: Let him, O Yama, go to those Rishis austere, of Fervour born, Skilled in a thousand ways and means, the sages who protect the Sun.
meaning: सह॒स्रणीथाः कव॒यो ये॒ गोपाय॒न्ति सू॒र्यम् । ऋ॒षीन् त॒पस्वतो यम तपोजां॒ अ॒पि गछतात् ॥१८॥

text: Be pleasant unto him, O Earth, thornless and lulling him to rest. Vouchsafe him shelter broad and sure.
meaning: स्योना॒स्मै भव पृथिव्य् अनृक्षरा॒ निवे॒शनी । य॒छास्मै श॒र्म सप्र॒थाः ॥१९॥

text: In the free amplitude of earth take roomy space to lodge thee in. Let all oblations which in life thou paidest drop thee honey now.
meaning: असंबाधे॒ पृथिव्या॒ उरौ॒ लोके॒ नि॒ धीयस्व । स्वधा॒ या॒श् चकृषे॒ जी॒वन् ता॒स् ते सन्तु मधुश्चु॒तः ॥२०॥ {८}

text: Hither I call thy spirit with my spirit. Come thou; delighted, to these dwelling-places. Unite thee with the Fathers and with Yama: strong and delicious be the winds that fan thee.
meaning: ह्व॒यामि ते म॒नसा म॒न इहे॒मा॒न् गृहा॒म् उ॒प जुजुषाण॒ ए॒हि । सं॒ गछस्व पितृ॒भिः सं॒ यमे॒न स्योना॒स् त्वा वा॒ता उ॒प वान्तु शग्माः॒ ॥२१॥

text: Floating in water, bringing streams, let Maruts carry thee aloft, And causing coolness by their rush sprinkle thee with their fall- ing rain.
meaning: उ॒त् त्वा वहन्तु मरु॒त उदवाहा॒ उदप्रु॒तः । अजे॒न कृण्व॒न्तः शीतं॒ वर्षे॒णोक्षन्तु बा॒ल् इ॒ति ॥२२॥

text: I have recalled thy life to life, to being, power, and energy. Let thy soul go unto its own: so to the Fathers hasten thou.
meaning: उ॒द् अह्वम् आ॒युर् आ॒युषे क्र॒त्वे द॒क्षाय जीव॒से । स्वा॒न् गछतु ते म॒नो अ॒धा पितृ̄ं॒र् उ॒प द्रव ॥२३॥

text: Let not thy soul be left behind: here let not aught of thee remain, Of spirit, body, members, sap.
meaning: मा॒ ते म॒नो मा॒सोर् मा॒ङ्गानां मा॒ र॒सस्य ते । मा॒ ते हास्त तन्वः॑ किं॒ चने॒ह॒ ॥२४॥

text: Let not a tree oppness thee, nor Earth the great Goddess weigh thee down. Among the Fathers find thy home, and thrive mid those whom Yama rules.
meaning: मा॒ त्वा वृक्षः॒ सं॒ बाधिष्ट मा॒ देवी॒ पृथिवी॒ मही॒ । लोकं॒ पितृ॒षु वित्त्वै॒धस्व यम॒राजसु ॥२५॥

text: Each parted member, severed from thy body, thy vital breaths that in the wind have vanished, With all of these, piece after piece, shall Fathers who dwell to- gether meet and reunite thee.
meaning: य॒त् ते अ॒ङ्गम् अ॒तिहितं पराचै॒र् अपानः॒ प्राणो॒ य॒ उ वा ते प॒रेतः । त॒त् ते संग॒त्य पित॒रः स॒नीडा घासा॒द् घासं॒ पु॒नर् आ॒ वेशयन्तु ॥२६॥

text: Him have the living banished from their houses: remove him to a distance from the hamlet. Yama's observant messenger was Mrityu he hath despatched men's lives unto the Fathers.
meaning: अ॒पेमं॒ जीवा॒ अरुधन् गृहे॒भ्यस् तं॒ नि॒र् वहत प॒रि ग्रा॒माद् इतः॒ । मृत्यु॒र् यम॒स्यासीद् दूतः॒ प्र॒चेता अ॒सून् पितृ॒भ्यो गमयां॒ चकार ॥२७॥

text: Those Dasyus who, not eating our oblations, come wilh friends' faces mingled with the Fathers, Those who wear gross those who wear subtile bodies,—from this. our sacrifice let Agni blast them.
meaning: ये॒ द॒स्यवः पितृ॒षु प्र॒विष्टा ज्ञाति॒मुखा अहुता॒दश् च॒रन्ति । परापु॒रो निपु॒रो ये॒ भ॒रन्त्य् अग्नि॒ष् टा॒न् अस्मा॒त् प्र॒ धमाति यज्ञा॒त् ॥२८॥

text: Bringing delight, prolonging our existence, here let our own, the Fathers, dwell together. Coming with sacrifice may we assist them, living long lives through many autumn seasons.
meaning: सं॒ विशन्त्व् इह॒ पित॒रः स्वा॒ नः स्योनं॒ कृण्व॒न्तः प्रतिर॒न्त आ॒युः । ते॒भ्यः शकेम हवि॒षा न॒क्षमाणा ज्यो॒ग् जी॒वन्तः शर॒दः पुरूचीः॒ ॥२९॥

text: Now by this cow I bring thee, by the boiled rice set in milk for thee, Be the supporter of the folk left here without a livelihood.
meaning: यां॒ ते धेनुं॒ निपृणा॒मि य॒म् उ क्षीर॒ ओदन॒म् । ते॒ना ज॒नस्यासो भर्ता॒ यो॒ ऽत्रा॒सद् अ॒जीवनः ॥३०॥ {९}

text: Prolong the pleasant Dawn enriched with horses-or bearing us. anew beyond the darkness. Adjudged to die be he, the man who slew thee: this portion let him find, and not another.
meaning: अ॒श्वावतीं प्र॒ तर या॒ सुशे॒वा र्क्षा॒कं वा प्रतरं॒ न॒वीयः । य॒स् त्वा जघा॒न व॒ध्यः सो॒ अस्तु मा॒ सो॒ अन्य॒द् विदत भागधे॒यम् ॥३१॥

text: Yama is higher and Vivasvān lower: nothing whatever do I see above him. This sacrifice of mine is based on Yama, Vivasvān spread the atmosphere about us.
meaning: यमः॒ प॒रो॒ ऽवरो वि॒वस्वान् त॒तः प॒रं ना॒ति पश्यामि किं॒ चन॒ । यमे॒ अध्वरो॒ अ॒धि मे नि॒विष्टो भु॒वो वि॒वस्वान् अन्वा॒ततान ॥३२॥

text: From mortal men they hid the immortal Lady, made one like her and gave her to Vivasvān. Saranyū brought to him the Asvin brothers, and then deserted both twinned pairs of children.
meaning: अ॒पागूहन्न् अमृ॒तां म॒र्त्येभ्यः कृत्वा॒ स॒वर्णाम् अदधुर् वि॒वस्वते । उता॒श्वि॒नाव् अभरद् य॒त् त॒द् आ॒सीद् अ॒जहाद् उ द्वा॒ मिथुना॒ सरण्यूः॒ ॥३३॥

text: Bring thou the Fathers one and all Agni, to eat the sacrifice. The buried, and the cast away, those burnt with fire, and those exposed.
meaning: ये॒ नि॒खाता ये॒ प॒रोप्ता ये॒ दग्धा॒ ये॒ चो॒द्धिताः । स॒र्वांस् ता॒न् अग्न आ॒ वह पितृ॒̄न् हवि॒षे अ॒त्तवे ॥३४॥

text: Those, whether flames have burnt or not consumed them, who in the midst of heaven enjoy oblations— Let them, when thou dost know them, Jatavedas, accept with sacred food the axe and worship.
meaning: ये॒ अग्निदग्धा॒ ये॒ अ॒नग्निदग्धा म॒ध्ये दिवः॒ स्वध॒या माद॒यन्ते । त्वं॒ ता॒न् वेत्थ य॒दि ते॒ जातवेदः स्वध॒या यज्ञं॒ स्व॒धितिं जुषन्ताम् ॥३५॥

text: Burn gently, Agni, burn not up the body with too fervent heat. Let all thy force and fury be expended on the woods and earth.
meaning: शं॒ तप मा॒ति तपो अ॒ग्ने मा॒ तन्वं॑ त॒पः । व॒णेषु शु॒ष्मो अस्तु ते पृथिव्या॒म् अस्तु य॒द् ध॒रः ॥३६॥

text: I give this place to him who hath come hither and now is mine, to be a home to rest in: This was the thought of Yama when he answered: This man is. mine. Let him come here to riches.
meaning: द॒दाम्य् अस्मा अवसा॒नम् एत॒द् य॒ एष॒ आ॒गन् म॒म चे॒द् अ॒भूद् इह॒ । यम॒श् चिकित्वा॒न् प्र॒त्य् एत॒द् आह म॒मैष॒ राय॒ उ॒प तिष्ठताम् इह॒ ॥३७॥

text: This date we settle once for all, that it may ne'er be fixt again_ A hundred autumns; not before.
meaning: इमां॒ मा॒त्रां मिमीमहे य॒था॒परं न॒ मा॒सातै । शते॒ शर॒त्सु नो पुरा॒ ॥३८॥

text: This date we order, etc.
meaning: प्रे॒मां॒ मा॒त्रां मिमीमहे य॒था॒परं न॒ मा॒सातै । शते॒ शर॒त्सु नो पुरा॒ ॥३९॥

text: This date we limit, etc.
meaning: अ॒पेमां॒ मा॒त्रां मिमीमहे य॒था॒परं न॒ मा॒सातै । शते॒ शर॒त्सु नो पुरा॒ ॥४०॥ {१०}

text: This date we measure, etc.
meaning: वी॒मां॒ मा॒त्रां मिमीमहे य॒था॒परं न॒ मा॒सातै । शते॒ शर॒त्सु नो पुरा॒ ॥४१॥

text: This date we mete out, etc.
meaning: नि॒र् इमां॒ मा॒त्रां मिमीमहे य॒था॒परं न॒ मा॒सातै । शते॒ शर॒त्सु नो पुरा॒ ॥४२॥

text: This date we stablish, etc.
meaning: उ॒द् इमां॒ मा॒त्रां मिमीमहे य॒था॒परं न॒ मा॒सातै । शते॒ शर॒त्सु नो पुरा॒ ॥४३॥

text: This date we mete and measure out, that it may ne'er be fixt. again. A hundred autumns: not before.
meaning: स॒म् इमां॒ मा॒त्रां मिमीमहे य॒था॒परं न॒ मा॒सातै । शते॒ शर॒त्सु नो पुरा॒ ॥४४॥

text: The period I have measured—come to heaven. I would my life were long Not to be measured out again; a hundred autumns, not before.
meaning: अ॒मासि मा॒त्रां स्व॑र् अगाम् आ॒युष्मान् भूयासम् । य॒था॒परं न॒ मा॒सातै शते॒ शर॒त्सु नो पुरा॒ ॥४५॥

text: Inbreath and outbreath, breath diffused, life, sight to look upon the Sun Seek by a straight unwinding path the Fathers whom King Yama rules,
meaning: प्राणो॒ अपानो॒ व्यान॒ आ॒युश् च॒क्षुर् दृश॒ये सू॒र्याय । अ॒परिपरेण पथा॒ यम॒राज्ञः पितृ॒̄न् गछ ॥४६॥

text: Unmarried men who toiled and have departed, the childless, having left their foes behind them, Have found on high the world whereto they mounted, reflecting on the ridge of vaulted heaven.
meaning: ये॒ अ॒ग्रवः शशमानाः॒ परेयु॒र् हित्वा॒ द्वे॒षांस्य् अ॒नपत्यवन्तः । ते॒ द्या॒म् उदि॒त्याविदन्त लोकं॒ ना॒कस्य पृष्ठे॒ अ॒धि दी॒ध्यानाः ॥४७॥

text: The lowest is the Watery heaven, Pilumatī the middlemost; The third and highest, that wherein the Fathers dwell, is called Pradyaus.
meaning: उदन्व॒ती द्यौ॒र् अवमा॒ पीलु॒मती॒ति मध्यमा॒ । तृती॒या ह प्रद्यौ॒र् इ॒ति य॒स्यां पित॒र आ॒सते ॥४८॥

text: The Fathers of our Father, his Grandfathers, those who have entered into air's wide region, Those who inhabit earth or dwell in heaven, these Fathers will we worship with oblation.
meaning: ये॒ न पितुः॒ पित॒रो ये॒ पितामहा॒ य॒ आविविशु॒र् उर्व् अ॑न्त॒रिक्षम् । य॒ आक्षिय॒न्ति पृथिवी॒म् उत॒ द्यां॒ ते॒भ्यः पितृ॒भ्यो न॒मसा विधेम ॥४९॥

text: Thou seest now, and ne'er again shalt look upon, the Sun in heaven. Cover him as a mother draws her skirt about her son, O Earth!
meaning: इद॒म् इ॒द् वा॒ उ ना॒परं दिवि॒ पश्यसि सू॒र्यम् । माता॒ पुत्रं॒ य॒था सिचा॒भ्य् ए॑नं भूम ऊर्णुहि ॥५०॥ {११}

text: This once,,and at no other time hereafter in a lengthened life: Cover him, as a wife, O Earth, covers her husband with her robe!
meaning: इद॒म् इ॒द् वा॒ उ ना॒परं जर॒स्य् अन्य॒द् इतो॒ ऽपरम् । जाया॒ प॒तिम् इव वा॒ससाभ्य् ए॑नं भूम ऊर्णुहि ॥५१॥

text: Round thee auspiciously I wrap the vesture of our Mother Earth: Be bliss among the living mine, oblation mid the Fathers thine!
meaning: अभि॒ त्वोर्णोमि पृथिव्या॒ मातु॒र् व॒स्त्रेण भद्र॒या । जीवे॒षु भद्रं॒ त॒न् म॒यि स्वधा॒ पितृ॒षु सा॒ त्व॒यि ॥५२॥

text: Ye have prepared, pathmakers, Agni-Soma, a fair world for the Gods to be the it treasure. Go to that world and send us Pūshan hither to bear us on the paths the goat hath trodden.
meaning: अ॒ग्नीषोमा प॒थिकृता स्योनं॒ देवे॒भ्यो र॒त्नं दधथुर् वि॒ लोक॒म् । उ॒प प्रे॒ष्यन्तं पूष॒णं यो॒ व॒हात्य् अञ्जोया॒नैः पथि॒भिस् त॒त्र गछतम् ॥५३॥

text: Guard of the world, whose cattle ne'er are injured, may Pūshan bear thee hence, for he hath knowledge. May he consign thee to these Fathers' keeping, and to the gracious Gods let Agni give hee.
meaning: पूषा॒ त्वेत॒श् च्यावयतु प्र॒ विद्वा॒न् अ॒नष्टपशुर् भु॒वनस्य गोपाः॒ । स॒ त्वैते॒भ्यः प॒रि ददत् पितृ॒भ्यो ऽग्नि॒र् देवे॒भ्यः सुविदत्रि॒येभ्यः ॥५४॥

text: Lord of all life, let Ayu guard thee, Pūshan convey thee forward on the distant pathway. May Savitar the God conduct thee thither where dwell the pious who have gone before thee.
meaning: आ॒युर् विश्वा॒युः प॒रि पातु त्वा पूषा॒ त्वा पातु प्र॒पथे पुर॒स्तात् । य॒त्रा॒सते सुकृ॒तो य॒त्र त॒ ईयु॒स् त॒त्र त्वा देवः॒ सविता॒ दधातु ॥५५॥

text: For thee I yoke these carriers twain to bear thee to the spirit. world. Hasten with them to Yama's home and join his gathered. companies.
meaning: इमौ॒ युनज्मि ते व॒ह्नी अ॒सुनीताय वो॒ढवे । ता॒भ्यां यम॒स्य सा॒दनं स॒मितिश् चा॒व गछतात् ॥५६॥

text: This is the robe that first was wrapped about thee: cast off the robe thou worest here among us. Go, knowing, to the meed of virtuous action, thy many gifts. bestowed upon the friendless.
meaning: एत॒त् त्वा वा॒सः प्रथमं॒ न्व् आ॒गन्न् अ॒पैत॒द् ऊह य॒द् इहा॒बिभः पुरा॒ । इष्टापूर्त॒म् अनुसं॒क्राम विद्वा॒न् य॒त्र ते दत्तं॒ बहुधा॒ वि॒बन्धुषु ॥५७॥

text: Mail thee with flesh against the flames of Agni; encompass thee about with fat and marrow; So will the bold One eager to attack thee with fierce glow fail to girdle and consume thee.
meaning: अग्ने॒र् व॒र्म प॒रि गो॒भिर् व्ययस्व सं॒ प्रो॒र्णुष्व मे॒दसा पी॒वसा च । ने॒त् त्वा धृष्णु॒र् ह॒रसा ज॒र्हृषाणो दधृ॒ग् विधक्ष॒न् परीङ्ख॒यातै ॥५८॥

text: From his dead hand I take the staff he carried, together with his lore and strength and splendour. There art thou, there; and here with good men round us may we o'ercome all enemies and foemen.
meaning: दण्डं॒ ह॒स्ताद् आद॒दानो गता॒सोः सह॒ श्रो॒त्रेण व॒र्चसा ब॒लेन । अ॒त्रैव॒ त्व॒म् इह॒ वयं॒ सुवी॒रा वि॒श्वा मृ॒धो अभि॒मातीर् जयेम ॥५९॥

text: From his dead hand I take the bow he carried, together with his. power and strength and splendour. Having collected wealth and ample treasure, come hither to the- world of living beings.
meaning: ध॒नुर् ह॒स्ताद् आद॒दानो मृत॒स्य सह॒ क्षत्रे॒ण व॒र्चसा ब॒लेन । समा॒गृभाय व॒सु भूरि पुष्ट॒म् अर्वा॒ङ् त्व॒म् ए॒ह्य् उ॒प जीवलोक॒म् ॥६०॥ {१२}

text: Choosing her husband's world, O man, this woman lays herself down beside thy lifeless body. Preserving faithfully the ancient custom. Bestow upon here both wealth and offspring.
meaning: इयं॒ ना॒री पतिलोकं॒ वृणाना॒ नि॒ पद्यत उ॒प त्वा मर्त्य प्रे॒तम् । ध॒र्मं पुराण॒म् अनुपाल॒यन्ती त॒स्यै प्रजां॒ द्र॒विणं चेह॒ धेहि ॥१॥

text: Rise, come unto the world of life, O woman: come, he is lifeless by whose side thou liest. Wifehood with this thy husband was thy portion who took thy hand and wooed thee as a lover.
meaning: उ॒द् ईर्ष्व नार्य् अभि॒ जीवलोकं॒ गता॒सुम् एत॒म् उ॒प शेष ए॒हि । हस्तग्राभ॒स्य दधिषो॒स् त॒वेदं॒ प॒त्युर् जनित्व॒म् अभि॒ सं॒ बभूथ ॥२॥

text: I looked and saw the youthful dame escorted, the living to the dead: I saw them, bear her. When she with blinding darkness was enveloped, then did I turn her back and lead her homeward.
meaning: अ॒पश्यं युवतिं॒ नीय॒मानां जीवां॒ मृते॒भ्यः परिणीय॒मानाम् । अन्धे॒न य॒त् त॒मसा प्रा॒वृता॒सीत् प्राक्तो॒ अ॒पाचीम् अनयं त॒द् एनाम् ॥३॥

text: Knowing the world of living beings, Aghnyā! treading the path. of Gods which lies before thee, This is thy husband: joyfully receive him and let him mount into the world of Svarga.
meaning: प्रजानत्य् अ॑घ्न्ये जीवलोकं॒ देवा॒नां प॒न्थाम् अनुसंच॒रन्ती । अयं॒ ते गो॒पतिस् तं॒ जुषस्व स्वर्गं॒ लोक॒म् अ॒धि रोहयैनम् ॥४॥

text: The speed of rivers craving heaven and cane, thou, Agni, art the waters' gall.
meaning: उ॒प द्या॒म् उ॒प वेतस॒म् अ॒वत्तरो नदी॒नाम् । अ॒ग्ने पित्त॒म् अपा॒म् असि ॥५॥

text: Cool, Agni, and again refresh the spot which thou hast scorched and burnt. Here let the water-lily grow, and tender grass and leafy plant.
meaning: यं॒ त्व॒म् अग्ने सम॒दहस् त॒म् उ नि॒र् वापय पु॒नः । क्या॒म्बूर् अ॒त्र रोहतु शाण्डदूर्वा॒ व्य॑ल्कशा ॥६॥

text: Here is one light for thee, another yonder: enter the third and be therewith united. Uniting with a body be thou lovely, dear to the Gods in their sublimest mansion.
meaning: इदं॒ त ए॒कम् पुर॒ ऊ त ए॒कं तृती॒येन ज्यो॒तिषा सं॒ विशस्व । संवे॒शने तन्वा॑ चा॒रुर् एधि प्रियो॒ देवा॒नां परमे॒ सध॒स्थे ॥७॥

text: Rise up, advance, run forward: make thy dwelling in water that shall be thy place to rest in There dwelling in accordance with the Fathers delight thyself with Soma and libations.
meaning: उ॒त् तिष्ठ प्रे॒हि प्र॒ द्रवौ॒कः कृणुष्व सलिले॒ सध॒स्थे । त॒त्र त्वं॒ पितृ॒भिः संविदानः॒ सं॒ सो॒मेन म॒दस्व सं॒ स्वधा॒भिः ॥८॥

text: Prepare thy body: speed thou on thy journey: let not thy limbs,. thy frame be left behind thee. Follow to its repose thy resting spirit: go to whatever spot of earth thou lovest.
meaning: प्र॒ च्यवस्व तन्वं॑ सं॒ भरस्व मा॒ ते गा॒त्रा वि॒ हायि मो॒ श॒रीरम् । म॒नो नि॒विष्टम् अनुसं॒विशस्व य॒त्र भू॒मेर् जुष॒से त॒त्र गछ ॥९॥

text: With splendour may the Fathers, meet for Soma, with mead and. fatness may the Gods anoint me. Lead me on farther to extended vision, and prosper me through life of long duration.
meaning: व॒र्चसा मां॒ पित॒रः सोम्या॒सो अ॒ञ्जन्तु देवा॒ म॒धुना घृते॒न । च॒क्षुषे मा प्रतरं॒ तार॒यन्तो जर॒से मा जर॒दष्टिं वर्धन्तु ॥१०॥ {१३}

text: May Agni balm me thoroughly with splendour; may Vishnu. touch my lips with understanding. May all the Deities vouchsafe me riches, and pleasant Waters purify and cleanse me.
meaning: व॒र्चसा मां॒ स॒म् अनक्त्व् अग्नि॒र् मेधां॒ मे वि॒ष्णुर् न्य् अ॑नक्त्व् आस॒न् । रयिं॒ मे वि॒श्वे नि॒ यछन्तु देवाः॒ स्योना॒ मा॒पः प॒वनैः पुनन्तु ॥११॥

text: Mitra and Varuna have stood about me. Ādityas, Sacirifical Posts exalt me! May Indra balm my hands with strength and splendour. A long, long life may Savitar vouchsafe me.
meaning: मित्रा॒व॒रुणा प॒रि मा॒म् अधाताम् आदित्या॒ मा स्व॒रवो वर्धयन्तु । व॒र्चो म इ॒न्द्रो न्य् अ॑नक्तु ह॒स्तयोर् जर॒दष्टिं मा सविता॒ कृणोतु ॥१२॥

text: Worship with sacrificial gift King Yama, Vivasvān's son who gathers men together, Yama who was the first to die of mortals, the first who travelled to the world before us.
meaning: यो॒ ममा॒र प्रथमो॒ म॒र्त्यानां यः॒ प्रेया॒य प्रथमो॒ लोक॒म् एत॒म् । वैवस्वतं॒ संग॒मनं ज॒नानां यमं॒ रा॒जानं हवि॒षा सपर्यत ॥१३॥

text: Depart, O Fathers, and again come hither; this sacrifice of yours is balmed with sweetness. Enrich us here with gift of great possessions; grant blessed wealth with ample store of heroes.
meaning: प॒रा यात पितर आ॒ च यातायं॒ वो यज्ञो॒ म॒धुना स॒मक्तः । दत्तो॒ अस्म॒भ्यं द्र॒विणेह॒ भद्रं॒ रयिं॒ च नः स॒र्ववीरं दधात ॥१४॥

text: Kanva, Kakshivān, Purumidha, Agastya, Syāvāsva Sobhari, and Archanānas, This Visvāmitra, Jamadagni, Atri, Kasyapa, Vāmadeva be our helpers!
meaning: क॒ण्वः कक्षी॒वान् पुरुमीढो॒ अग॒स्त्यः श्यावा॒श्वः सो॒भर्य् अर्चना॒नाः । विश्वा॒मित्रो ऽयं॒ जम॒दग्निर् अ॒त्रिर् अ॒वन्तु नः कश्य॒पो वाम॒देवः ॥१५॥

text: Vasishtha, Jamadagni, Visvāmitra, Gotama, Vāmadeva, Bhara- dvaja! Atri hath won your favour with homage. Gracious to us be ye praiseworthy Fathers.
meaning: वि॒श्वामित्र ज॒मदग्ने व॒सिष्ठ भ॒रद्वाज गो॒तम वा॒मदेव । शर्दि॒र् नो अ॒त्रिर् अग्रभीन् न॒मोभिः सु॒संशासः पि॒तरो मृड॒ता नः ॥१६॥

text: They, making for themselves a new existence, wash off defilement in the brazen vessel. May we be fragrant in our houses, ever increasing in our children and our riches.
meaning: कस्ये॒ मृजाना अ॒ति यन्ति रिप्र॒म् आ॒युर् द॒धानाः प्रतरं॒ न॒वीयः । आप्या॒यमानाः प्रज॒या ध॒नेना॒ध स्याम सुरभ॒यो गृहे॒षु ॥१७॥

text: They balm him, balm him over, balm him thoroughly, caress the mighty power and balm it with the mead, They seize the flying steer at the stream's breathing-place: cleansing with gold they grasp the animal herein.
meaning: अञ्ज॒ते व्य् अ॑ञ्जते स॒म् अञ्जते क्र॒तुं रिहन्ति म॒धुनाभ्य् अ॑ञ्जते । सि॒न्धोर् उच्छ्वासे॒ पत॒यन्तम् उक्ष॒णं हिरण्यपावाः॒ पशु॒म् आसु गृह्नते ॥१८॥

text: Fathers, be glorious in yourselves, and follow all that is glad in you and meet for Soma. Give ear and listen, swiftly-moving Sages, benevolent, invoked in our assembly.
meaning: य॒द् वो मुद्रं॒ पितरः सोम्यं॒ च ते॒नो सचध्वं स्व॒यशसो हि॒ भूत॒ । ते॒ अर्वाणः कवय आ॒ शृणोत सुविद॒त्रा विद॒थे हुय॒मानाः ॥१९॥

text: Atris, Angirases, Navagvas, givers of liberal gifts, continual sacrificers, Devout and pious, granting guerdon freely, sit on this holy grass and be ye joyful.
meaning: ये॒ अ॒त्रयो अ॒ङ्गिरसो न॒वग्वा इष्टा॒वन्तो रातिषा॒चो द॒धानाः । द॒क्षिणावन्तः सुकृ॒तो य॒ उ स्था॒स॒द्यास्मि॒न् बर्हि॒षि मादयध्वम् ॥२०॥ {१४}

text: As in the days of old our ancient Fathers, speeding the work of sacred worship, Agni! Sought pure light and devotion, singing praises, they cleft the ground and made red Dawns apparent.
meaning: अ॒धा य॒था नः पित॒रः प॒रासः प्रत्ना॒सो अग्न ऋत॒म् आशशानाः॒ । शु॒ची॒द् अयन् दी॒ध्यत उक्थश॒सः क्षा॒मा भिन्द॒न्तो अरुणी॒र् अ॒प व्रन् ॥२१॥

text: Gods, doing holy acts, devout, resplendent, smelting like ore their human generation, Brightening Agni and exalting Indra, they came encompassing the stall of cattle.
meaning: सुक॒र्मानः सुरु॒चो देवय॒न्तो अ॒यो न॒ देवा॒ ज॒निमा ध॒मन्तः । शुच॒न्तो अग्निं॒ वावृध॒न्त इ॒न्द्रम् उर्वी॒म् ग॒व्यां परिष॒दं नो अक्रन् ॥२२॥

text: Strong One! he marked them, and the gods before them, like herds of cattle in a foodful pasture. There man moaned forth their strong desires, to strengthen even the true; the nearest One, the living.
meaning: आ॒ यूथे॒व क्षुम॒ति पश्वो॒ अख्यद् देवा॒नां ज॒निमा॒न्त्य् उग्रः॒ । म॒र्तासश् चिद् उर्व॒शी॒र् अकृप्रन् वृधे॒ चिद् अर्य॒ उ॒परस्यायोः॒ ॥२३॥

text: We have worked for thee, we have toiled and laboured: bright Dawns have shed their light upon our worship. All that the Gods regard with love is blessed. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.
meaning: अ॒कर्म ते स्व॒पसो अभूम ऋत॒म् अवस्रन्न् उष॒सो विभातीः॒ । वि॒श्वं त॒द् भद्रं॒ य॒द् अ॒वन्ति देवा॒ बृह॒द् वदेम विद॒थे सुवी॒राः ॥२४॥

text: From eastward Indra, Lord or Maruts, guard me, as in her arms Earth guards the heaven above us! Those who give room, who made the paths, we worship, you, mid the Gods, who share the gifts we offer.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रो मा मरु॒त्वान् प्रा॒च्या दिशः॒ पातु बाहुच्यु॒ता पृथिवी॒ द्या॒म् इवोप॒रि । लोककृ॒तः पथिकृ॒तो यजामहे ये॒ देवा॒नां हुत॒भागा इह॒ स्थ॒ ॥२५॥

text: Dhātar with Nirriti save me from southward, etc. (as in stanza 25).
meaning: धाता॒ मा नि॒रृत्या द॒क्षिणाया दिशः॒ पातु बाहुच्यु॒ता पृथिवी॒ द्यां इवोप॒रि । लोककृ॒तः पथिकृ॒तो यजामहे ये॒ देवा॒नां हुत॒भागा इह॒ स्थ॒ ॥२६॥

text: From westward Aditi was Ādityas save me! etc.
meaning: अ॒दितिर् मादित्यैः॒ प्रती॒च्या दिशः॒ पातु बाहुच्यु॒ता पृथिवी॒ द्या॒म् इवोप॒रि । लोककृ॒तः पथिकृ॒तो यजामहे ये॒ देवा॒नां हुत॒भागा इह॒ स्थ॒ ॥२७॥

text: From westward with the All-Gods save me Soma! etc.
meaning: सो॒मो मा वि॒श्वैर् देवै॒र् उ॒दीच्या दिशः॒ पातु बाहुच्यु॒ता पृथिवी॒ द्या॒म् इवोप॒रि । लोककृ॒तः पथिकृ॒तो यजामहे ये॒ देवा॒नां हुत॒भागा इह॒ स्थ॒ ॥२८॥

text: May the strong firm Sustainer bear thee upright, as Savitar bears light above the heaven. Those who give room, who made the paths, we worship, you mid the Gods, whe share the gifts we offer.
meaning: धर्ता॒ ह त्वा धरु॒णो धारयाता ऊर्ध्वं॒ भानुं॒ सविता॒ द्या॒म् इवोप॒रि । लोककृ॒तः पथिकृ॒तो यजामहे ये॒ देवा॒नां हुत॒भागा इह॒ स्थ॒ ॥२९॥

text: Toward the eastward region I supply thee before thou goest homeward, with oblation, as in her arms, etc. (as in stanza 25).
meaning: प्रा॒च्यां त्वा दिशि॒ पुरा॒ सम्वृ॒तः स्वधा॒याम् आ॒ दधामि बाहुच्यु॒ता पृथिवी॒ द्या॒म् इवोप॒रि । लोककृ॒तः पथिकृ॒तो यजामहे ये॒ देवा॒नां हुत॒भागा इह॒ स्थ॒ ॥३०॥ {१५}

text: Toward the southern region, etc.
meaning: द॒क्षिणायां त्वा दिशि॒ पुरा॒ सम्वृ॒तः स्वधा॒याम् आ॒ दधामि बाहुच्यु॒ता पृथिवी॒ द्या॒म् इवोप॒रि । लोककृ॒तः पथिकृ॒तो यजामहे ये॒ देवा॒नां हुत॒भागा इह॒ स्थ॒ ॥३१॥

text: Toward the western region, etc.
meaning: प्रती॒च्यां त्वा दिशि॒ पुरा॒ संवृ॒तः स्वधा॒याम् आ॒ दधामि बाहुच्यु॒ता पृथिवी॒ द्या॒म् इवोप॒रि । लोककृ॒तः पथिकृ॒तो यजामहे ये॒ देवा॒नां हुत॒भागा इह॒ स्थ॒ ॥३२॥

text: Toward the northern region, etc.
meaning: उ॒दीच्यां त्वा दिशि॒ पुरा॒ सम्वृ॒तः स्वधा॒याम् आ॒ दधामि बाहुच्यु॒ता पृथिवी॒ द्या॒म् इवोप॒रि । लोककृ॒तः पथिकृ॒तो यजामहे ये॒ देवा॒नां हुत॒भागा इह॒ स्थ॒ ॥३३॥

text: Toward the stedfast region, etc.
meaning: ध्रुवायां त्वा दिशि॒ पुरा॒ संवृ॒तः स्वधा॒याम् आ॒ दधामि बाहुच्यु॒ता पृथिवी॒ द्या॒म् इवोप॒रि । लोककृ॒तः पथिकृ॒तो यजामहे ये॒ देवा॒नां हुत॒भागा इह॒ स्थ॒ ॥३४॥

text: Toward the upmost region I supply thee, before thou goest homeward, with oblation, as in her arms Earth bears the heaven above us. Those who give room, who made the paths, we worship, you, mid the Gods, who share the gifts we offer.
meaning: ऊर्ध्वायां त्वा दिशि॒ पुरा॒ सम्वृ॒तः स्वधा॒याम् आ॒ दधामि बाहुच्यु॒ता पृथिवी॒ द्या॒म् इवोप॒रि । लोककृ॒तः पथिकृ॒तो यजामहे ये॒ देवा॒नां हुत॒भागा इह॒ स्थ॒ ॥३५॥

text: Thou art the Bull, Supporter, and Upholder,
meaning: धर्ता॒सि धरु॒नो ऽसि वं॒सगो ऽसि ॥३६॥

text: Who purifiest wind and mead and water.
meaning: उदपू॒र् असि मधुपू॒र् असि वातपू॒र् असि ॥३७॥

text: From this side and from that let both assist me. As, speeding, ye have come like two twin sisters, Religious-hearted votaries brought you forward. Knowing your several places be ye seated.
meaning: इत॒श् च मामु॒तश् चावतां यमे॒ इव य॒तमाने य॒द् ऐत॒म् । प्र॒ वां भरन् मा॒नुषा देवय॒न्तो आ॒ सीदतां स्व॒म् उ लोकं॒ वि॒दाने ॥३८॥

text: Sit near, sit very near beside our Soma: for you I fit the ancient prayer with homage. The praise-song, like a chieftain on his pathway, spreads far and wide. Let all Immortals hear it.
meaning: स्वासस्थे॒ भवतम् इ॒न्दवे नो युजे॒ वां ब्र॒ह्म पूर्व्यं॒ न॒मोभिः । वि॒ श्लो॒क एति पथ्ये॑व सूरिः॒ शृण्व॒न्तु वि॒श्वे अमृ॒तास एत॒त् ॥३९॥

text: Three paces hath the stake gone up, and followed her, the four- footed, with devout observance. He with the Syllable copies the praise-song; he thoroughly purifies at Order's centre.
meaning: त्री॒णि पदा॒नि रुपो॒ अ॒न्व् अरोहच् च॒तुष्पदीम् अ॒न्व् एतद् व्रते॒न । अक्ष॒रेण प्र॒ति मिमीते अर्क॒म् ऋत॒स्य ना॒भाव् अभि॒ सं॒ पुनाति ॥४०॥ {१६}

text: Chose he then, death for Gods to be their portion? Why chose he not for men a life eternal? Brihaspati span sacrifice, the Rishi; and Yama yielded up his own dear body.
meaning: देवे॒भ्यः क॒म् अवृणीत मृत्युं॒ प्रजा॒यै कि॒म् अमृ॒तं ना॒वृणीत । बृ॒हस्प॒तिर् यज्ञ॒म् अतनुत ऋ॒षिः प्रियां॒ यम॒स् तन्व॑म् आ॒ रिरेच ॥४१॥

text: Thou, Agni Jātavedas, when entreated, didst bear our offerings, having made them fragrant. And give them to the Fathers who consumed them with Svadhā. Eat, thou God, the gifts we bring thee.
meaning: त्व॒म् अग्न ईडितो॒ जातवेदो॒ ऽवाड् ढव्या॒नि सुरभी॒णि कृत्वा॒ । प्रा॒दाः पितृ॒भ्यः स्वध॒या ते॒ अक्षन्न् अद्धि॒ त्वं॒ देव प्र॒यता हवीं॒षि ॥४२॥

text: Lapped in the bosom of the purple Mornings, give riches to the man who brings oblations. Grant to your sons a portion of that treasure, and, present, give them energy, O Fathers.
meaning: आ॒सीनासो अरुणी॒नाम् उप॒स्थे रयिं॒ धत्त दाशु॒षे म॒र्त्याय । पुत्रे॒भ्यः पितरस् त॒स्य व॒स्वः प्र॒ यछत त॒ इहो॒र्जं दधात ॥४३॥

text: Fathers whom Agni's flames have tasted, come ye nigh: in per- fect order take ye each your proper place. Eat sacrificial food presented on the grass: grant riches with a multitude of hero sons.
meaning: अ॒ग्निष्वात्ताः पितर ए॒ह॒ गछत स॒दःसदः सदत सुप्रणीतयः । अत्तो॒ हवीं॒षि प्र॒यतानि बर्हि॒षि रयिं॒ च नः स॒र्ववीरं दधात ॥४४॥

text: May they, the Fathers who deserve the Soma, invited to their favourite oblations. Laid on the sacred grass, come nigh and listen. May they be gracious unto us and bless us.
meaning: उ॒पहूता नः पित॒रः सोम्या॒सो बर्हिष्ये॑षु निधि॒षु प्रिये॒षु । त॒ आ॒ गमन्तु त॒ इह॒ श्रुवन्त्व् अ॒धि ब्रुवन्तु ते॒ ऽवन्त्व् अस्मा॒न् ॥४५॥

text: Our Father's Fathers and their sires before them who came, most noble, to the Soma banquet, With these let Yama, yearning with the yearning, rejoicing eat our offerings at his pleasure.
meaning: ये॒ नः पितुः॒ पित॒रो ये॒ पितामहा॒ अनूजहिरे॒ सोमपीथं॒ व॒सिष्ठाः । ते॒भिर् यमः॒ सम्रराणो॒ हवीं॒ष्य् उश॒न्न् उश॒द्भिः प्रतिकाम॒म् अत्तु ॥४६॥

text: Come to us, Agni, with the gracious Fathers who dwell in glow- ing light, the very Sages, Who thirsted mid the Gods, who hasten hither, oblation-winners, theme of singers' praises.
meaning: ये॒ तातृषु॒र् देवत्रा॒ जे॒हमाना होत्रावि॒दः स्तो॒मतष्टासो अर्कैः॒ । आ॒ग्ने याहि सह॒स्रं देववन्दैः॒ सत्यैः॒ कवि॒भिर् ऋ॒षिभिर् घर्मस॒द्भिः ॥४७॥

text: Come, Agni, come with countless ancient Fathers, dwellers in light, primeval, God-adorers, Eaters and drinkers of oblation, truthful, who travel with the Deities and Indra.
meaning: ये॒ सत्या॒सो हविर॒दो हविष्पा॒ इ॒न्द्रेण देवैः॒ सर॒थं तुरे॒ण । आ॒ग्ने याहि सुविद॒त्रेभिर् अर्वा॒ङ् प॒रैः पू॒र्वैर् ऋ॒षिभिर् घर्मस॒द्भिः ॥४८॥

text: Betake thee to the lap of Earth, our mother, of Earth far-spread- ing, very kind and gracious. May she, wool-soft unto the guerdon-giver, guard thee in front upon the distant pathway.
meaning: उ॒प सर्प मात॒रं भू॒मिम् एता॒म् उरुव्य॒चसं पृथिवीं॒ सुशे॒वाम् । ऊ॒र्णम्रदाः पृथिवी॒ द॒क्षिणावत एषा॒ त्वा पातु प्र॒पथे पुर॒स्तात् ॥४९॥

text: Heave thyself, Earth, nor press him downward heavily: afford him easy access pleasant to approach, Cover him as a mother wraps her skirt about her child, O Earth!
meaning: उ॒च् छ्वञ्चस्व पृथिवि मा॒ नि॒ बाधथाः सूपायना॒स्मै भव सूपसर्पणा॒ । माता॒ पुत्रं॒ य॒था सिचा॒भ्य् ए॑नं भूम ऊर्णुहि ॥५०॥ {१७}

text: Now let the heaving earth be free from motion: yea, let a thousand clods remain above him. Be they to him a home distilling fatness: here let them ever be his place of refuge.
meaning: उ॒च्छ्व॒ञ्चमाना पृथिवी॒ सु॒ तिष्ठतु सह॒स्रं मि॒त उ॒प हि॒ श्र॒यन्ताम् । ते॒ गृहा॒सो घृतश्चु॒तः स्योना॒ विश्वा॒हास्मै शरणाः॒ सन्त्व् अ॒त्र ॥५१॥

text: I stay the earth from thee, while over thee I place this piece of earth. May I be free from injury. The Fathers firmly fix this pillar here for thee; and there let Yama make thee an abiding-place.
meaning: उ॒त् ते स्तभ्नामि पृथिवीं॒ त्व॒त् प॒रीमं॒ लोगं॒ निद॒धन् मो॒ अह॒म् रिषम् । एतां॒ स्थू॒णां पित॒रो धारयन्ति ते त॒त्र यमः॒ सा॒दना ते कृणोतु ॥५२॥

text: Forbear, O Agni, to upset this chalice: the Gods and they who merit Soma love it. This cup, yea this which serves the Gods to drink from,—in this let the Immortals take their pleasure.
meaning: इम॒म् अग्ने चमसं॒ मा॒ वि॒ जिह्व॒रः प्रियो॒ देवा॒नाम् उत॒ सोम्या॒नाम् । अयं॒ य॒श् चमसो॒ देवपा॒नस् त॒स्मिन् देवा॒ अमृ॒ता मादयन्ताम् ॥५३॥

text: The chalice brimming o'er which erst Atharvan offered to Indra, Lord of wealth and treasure, Indu therein sets draught of virtuous action, and ever purifies himself within it.
meaning: अ॒थर्वा पूर्ण॒म् चमस॒म् य॒म् इन्द्राया॒बिभर् वाजि॒नीवते । त॒स्मिन् कृणोति सुकृत॒स्य भक्षं॒ त॒स्मिन् इ॒न्दुः पवते विश्वदा॒नि॒म् ॥५४॥

text: What wound soe'er the dark bird hath inflicted, the emmet, or the serpent, or the jackal, May Agni who devoureth all things heal it, and Soma, who hath passed into the Brāhmans.
meaning: य॒त् ते कृष्णः॒ शकुन॒ आतुतो॒द पिपीलः॒ सर्प॒ उत॒ वा श्वा॒पदः । अग्नि॒ष् ट॒द् विश्वा॒द् अगदं॒ कृणोतु सो॒मश् च यो॒ ब्राह्मणां॒ आविवे॒श ॥५५॥

text: The plants of earth are rich in milk, and rich in milk is this my milk. With all the milky essence of the Waters let them make me clean.
meaning: प॒यस्वतीर् ओ॒षधयः प॒यस्वन् मामकं॒ प॒यः । अपां॒ प॒यसो य॒त् प॒यस् ते॒न मा सह॒ शुम्भतु ॥५६॥

text: Let these unwidowed dames with goodly husbands adorn them- selves with fragrant balm and unguent. Decked with fair jewels, tearless, free, from trouble, first let the dames go up to where he lieth.
meaning: इमा॒ ना॒रीर् अविधवाः॒ सुप॒त्नीर् आ॒ञ्जनेन सर्पि॒षा सं॒ स्पृशन्ताम् । अनश्र॒वो अनमीवाः॒ सुर॒त्ना आ॒ रोहन्तु ज॒नयो यो॒निम् अ॒ग्रे ॥५७॥

text: Meet Yama, meet the Fathers, meet the merit of virtuous action in the loftiest heaven. Leave sin and evil, seek anew thy dwelling: so bright with glory let him join his body.
meaning: सं॒ गछस्व पितृ॒भिः सं॒ यमे॒नेष्टापूर्ते॒न परमे॒ व्यो॑मन् । हित्वा॒वद्यं॒ पु॒नर् अ॒स्तम् ए॒हि सं॒ गछतां तन्वा॑ सुव॒र्चाः ॥५८॥

text: Our Father's Fathers and their sires before them, they who have entered into air's wide region, For them shall self-resplendent Asuniti form bodies now accord- ing to her pleasure.
meaning: ये॒ नः पितुः॒ पित॒रो ये॒ पितामहा॒ य॒ आविविशु॒र् उर्व् अ॑न्त॒रिक्षम् । ते॒भ्यः स्वरा॒द् अ॒सुनीतिर् नो अद्य॒ वथावशं॒ तन्वः॑ कल्पयाति ॥५९॥

text: Let the hoar-frost be sweet to thee. sweetly on thee the rain descend! O full of coolness, thou cool Plant, full of fresh moisture, fresh- ening Herb, Bless us in waters, female Frog: calm and allay this Agni here.
meaning: शं ते नीहारो॒ भवतु शं॒ ते प्रुष्वा॒व शीयताम् । शी॒तिके शी॒तिकावति ह्ला॒दिके ह्ला॒दिकावति । मण्डूक्य् अ॑प्सु॒ शं॒ भुव इमं॒ स्व् अ॑ग्निं॒ शमय ॥६०॥ {१८}

text: Vivasvān make us free from fear and peril, good rescuer, quick- pouring, bounteous giver! Many in number be these present heroes! Increase of wealth be mine in kine and horses!
meaning: विव॒स्वान् नो अ॒भयं कृणोतु यः॒ सुत्रा॒मा जीर॒दानुः सुदा॒नुः । इहे॒मे॒ वीरा॒ बह॒वो भवन्तु गो॒मद् अ॒श्ववन् म॒य्य् अस्तु पुष्ट॒म् ॥६१॥

text: In immortality Vivasvān set us! Go from us Death, come to us life eternal! To good old age may he protect these people: let not their spirits pass away to Yama.
meaning: विव॒स्वान् नो अमृतत्वे॒ दधातु प॒रैतु मृत्यु॒र् अमृ॒तं न ऐ॒तु । इमान् रक्षतु पु॒रुषान् आ॒ जरिम्णो॒ मो॒ स्व् ए॑षाम् अ॒सवो यमं॒ गुः ॥६२॥

text: The Sage of Fathers, guardian of devotions who holds thee up with might in air's mid-region,— Praise him ye Visvāmitras, with oblation. To lengthened life shall be, this Yama, lead us.
meaning: यो॒ दध्रे॒ अन्त॒रिक्षे न॒ मह्ना पितृ̄णां॒ कविः॒ प्र॒मतिर् मतीना॒म् । त॒म् अर्चत विश्व॒मित्रा हवि॒र्भिः स॒ नो यमः॒ प्रतरं॒ जीव॒से धात् ॥६३॥

text: Mount and ascend to highest heaven, O Rishis: be ye not afraid. Soma-drinkers to you is paid this Soma-lover's sacrifice. We have attained the loftiest light.
meaning: आ॒ रोहत दि॒वम् उत्तमा॒म् ऋ॒षयो मा॒ बिभीतन । सो॒मपाः सो॒मपायिन इदं॒ वः क्रियते हवि॒र् अ॒गन्म ज्वो॒तिर् उत्तम॒म् ॥६४॥

text: Agni is shining forth with lofty banner: the Bull is bellowing to earth and heaven. From the sky's limit even hath he stretched near us: the Steer hath waxen in the waters' bosom.
meaning: प्र॒ केतु॒ना बृहता॒ भात्य् अग्नि॒र् आ॒ रो॒दसी वृषभो॒ रोरवीति । दिव॒श् चिद् अ॒न्ताद् उपमा॒म् उ॒द् आनड् अपा॒म् उप॒स्थे महिषो॒ ववर्ध ॥६५॥

text: They gaze on thee with longing in their spirit, as on an eagle that is mounting skyward; On thee with wings of gold, Varuna's envoy, the Bird that hasteth to the home of Yama.
meaning: ना॒के सुपर्ण॒म् उ॒प य॒त् प॒तन्तं ह्र्दा॒ वे॒नन्तो अभ्य॒चक्षत त्वा । हि॒रण्यपक्षं व॒रुणस्य दूतं॒ यम॒स्य यो॒नौ शकुनं॒ भुरन्यु॒म् ॥६६॥

text: O Indra, bring us wisdom as a sire gives wisdom to his sons. Guide us, O much-invoked in this our way: may we still living look upon the Sun.
meaning: इ॒न्द्र क्र॒तुं न आ॒ भर पिता॒ पुत्रे॒भ्यो य॒था । शि॒क्षा णो अस्मि॒न् पुरुहूत या॒मनि जीवा॒ ज्यो॒तिर् अशीमहि ॥६७॥

text: Let these which Gods have held for thee, the beakers covered o'er with cake, Be full of sacred food for thee, distilling fatness, rich in mead.
meaning: अपूपा॒पिहितान् कुम्भा॒न् यां॒स् ते देवा॒ अ॒धारयन् । ते॒ ते सन्तु स्वधा॒वन्तो म॒धुमन्तो घृतश्चु॒तः ॥६८॥

text: Grains which for thee I scatter, mixt with Sesamum, as holy food, May they for thee be excellent and potent: King Yama look on them as thine with favour!
meaning: या॒स् ते धाना॒ अनुकिरा॒मि तिल॒मिश्रा स्वधा॒वतीः । ता॒स् ते सन्तु विभ्वीः॒ प्रभ्वी॒स् ता॒स् ते यमो॒ रा॒जा॒नु मन्यताम् ॥६९॥

text: O Tree, give back again this man who is deposited on thee. That he may dwell in Yama's home addressing the assemblies there.
meaning: पु॒नर् देहि वनस्पते य॒ एष॒ नि॒हितस् त्व॒यि । य॒था यम॒स्य सा॒दन आ॒सातौ विद॒था व॒दन् ॥७०॥

text: Seize hold O Jātavedas; let thy flame be full of fervent heat. Consume his body: to the world of pious ones transport this man.
meaning: आ॒ रभस्व जातवेदस् ते॒जस्वद् ध॒रो अस्तु ते । श॒रीरम् अस्य सं॒ दहा॒थैनं देहि सुकृ॒ताम् उ लोके॒ ॥७१॥

text: To these, thy Fathers who have passed away at first and after- ward, Let the full brook of butter run, o'erflowing with a hundred streams.
meaning: ये॒ ते पू॒र्वे प॒रागता अ॒परे पित॒रश् च ये॒ । ते॒भ्यो घृत॒स्य कुल्यै॒तु शत॒धारा व्युन्दती॒ ॥७२॥

text: Mount to this life, removing all defilement: here thine own kindred shine with lofty splendour. Depart thou; be not left behind: go forward, first of those here, unto the world of Fathers.
meaning: एत॒द् आ॒ रोह व॒य उन्मृजानः॒ स्वा॒ इह॒ बृह॒द् उ दीदयन्ते । अभि॒ प्रे॒हि मध्यतो॒ मा॒प हास्थाः पितृ̄नां॒ लोकं॒ प्रथमो॒ यो॒ अ॒त्र ॥७३॥ {१९}

text: Rise to your mother, flames of Jātavedas! I send you up by paths which Fathers traverse. With headlong speed the Oblation bearer bore our gifts: toil ye, and place the offerer where the righteous dwell.
meaning: आ॒ रोहत ज॒नित्रीं जातवेदसः पितृया॒नैः सं॒ व आ॒ रोहयामि । अ॒वाड् ढव्ये॒षितो॒ हव्यवाह॒ ईजानं॒ युक्ताः॒ सुकृ॒तां धत्त लोके॒ ॥१॥

text: The Seasons, Deities, form and order Worship, butter, cake, ladles, sacrificial weapons. Tread thou God-travelled paths whereby the righteous, payers of sacrifices, go to Svarga.
meaning: देवा॒ यज्ञ॒म् ऋत॒वः कल्पयन्ति हविः॒ पुरोडा॒शं स्रुचो॒ यज्ञायुधा॒नि । ते॒भिर् या॒हि पथि॒भिर् देवया॒नैर् यै॒र् ईजानाः॒ स्वर्गं॒ यन्ति लोक॒म् ॥२॥

text: Carefully look on Sacrifice's pathway whereon the Angirases, the righteous, travel. By those same pathways go thou up to Svarga where the Ādityas take their fill of sweetness, There make thy home in the third vault of heaven,
meaning: ऋत॒स्य प॒न्थाम् अ॒नु पश्य साध्व् अ॒ङ्गिरसः सुकृ॒तो ये॒न य॒न्ति । ते॒भिर् या॒हि पथि॒भिः स्वर्गं॒ य॒त्रादित्या॒ म॒धु भक्ष॒यन्ति तृती॒ये ना॒के अ॒धि वि॒ श्रयस्व ॥३॥

text: Three eagles in the region's roar are standing high on heaven's ridge in their appointed station. The worlds of Svarga shall, filled full of Amrit, yield food and power to him who sacrificeth.
meaning: त्र॒यः सुपर्णा॒ उ॒परस्य मायू॒ ना॒कस्य पृष्ठे॒ अ॒धि विष्ट॒पि श्रिताः॒ । स्वर्गा लोका॒ अमृ॒तेन विष्ठा॒ इ॒षम् ऊ॒र्जं य॒जमानाय दुह्राम् ॥४॥

text: Upabhrit stablished air, Juhū the heaven, Dhruva supported earth securely founded. As meed, the Svarga worlds, o'erspread with fatness shall yield the sacrificer all his wishes.
meaning: जुहू॒र् दाधार द्या॒म् उपभृ॒द् अन्त॒रिक्षं ध्रुवा॒ दाधार पृथिवीं॒ प्रतिष्ठा॒म् । प्र॒तीमां॒ लोका॒ घृत॒पृष्ठाः स्वर्गाः॒ का॒मंकामं य॒जमानाय दुह्राम् ॥५॥

text: Dhruvā, ascend thou earth the all sustainer: go thou, O Upa- bhrit, to air's mid-region. Juhu, go skyward with the sacrificer; go, and with Sruva be thy calf beside thee drain all the swelling unreluctant quarters.
meaning: ध्रु॒व आ॒ रोह पृथिवीं॒ विश्व॒भोजसम् अन्त॒रिक्षम् उपभृ॒द् आ॒ क्रमस्व । जु॒हु द्यां॒ गछ य॒जमानेन साकं॒ स्रुवे॒ण वत्से॒न दि॒शः प्र॒पीनाः स॒र्वा धुक्ष्वा॒हृण्यमानः ॥६॥

text: They ford the mighty rivers by the pathway which they who sacrifice, the righteous, travel. There they gave room unto the sacrificer when they made regions and existing creatures.
meaning: तीर्थै॒स् तरन्ति प्रव॒तो मही॒र् इ॒ति यज्ञकृ॒तः सुकृ॒तो ये॒न य॒न्ति । अ॒त्रादधुर् य॒जमानाय लोकं॒ दि॒शो भूता॒नि य॒द् अ॒कल्पयन्त ॥७॥

text: The Angirases' pathway is the eastern Agni, the Ādityas' path- way is the Gārhapatya: The southward Agni is the way of Southerns. To Agni's greatness whom the prayer divideth go powerful, un- scathed with all thy members.
meaning: अ॒ङ्गिरसाम् अ॒यनं पू॒र्वो अग्नि॒र् आदित्या॒नाम् अ॒यनं गा॒र्हपत्यो द॒क्षिणानाम् अ॒यनं दक्षिणाग्निः॒ । महिमा॒नम् अग्ने॒र् वि॒हितस्य ब्र॒ह्मणा स॒मङ्गः स॒र्व उ॒प याहि शग्मः॒ ॥८॥

text: Eastward let east fire happily consume thee, and westward happily the Gārhapatya. Burn southern fire, thine armour and protection: from air's- mid-region from the north and centre, on all sides, Agni, guard thou him from horror.
meaning: पू॒र्वो अग्नि॒ष् ट्वा तपतु शं॒ पुर॒स्ताच् छं॒ पश्चा॒त् तपतु गा॒र्हपत्यः । दक्षिणाग्नि॒ष् टे तपतु श॒र्म व॒र्मोत्तरतो॒ मध्यतो॒ अन्त॒रिक्षाद् दिशो॒दिशो अग्ने प॒रि पाहि घोरा॒त् ॥९॥

text: Do ye, with your most kindly forms, O Agni, waft, turned to rapid steeds whose ribs bear burthens, The sacrificer to the world of Svarga where with the Gods they banquet and are joyful.
meaning: यूय॒म् अग्ने शंतमाभिस् तनू॒भिर् ईजान॒म् अभि॒ लोकं॒ स्वर्ग॒म् । अ॒श्वा भूत्वा॒ पृष्टिवा॒हो वहाथ य॒त्र देवैः॒ सधमा॒दं म॒दन्ति ॥१०॥ {२०}

text: Happily from the rear burn this man, Agni, happily from before, above, and under. One, triply parted, Jātavedas, place him happily in the world that holds the righteous.
meaning: श॒म् अग्ने पश्चा॒त् तप शं॒ पुर॒स्ताच् छ॒म् उत्तरा॒च् छ॒म् अधरा॒त् तपैनम् । ए॒कस् त्रेधा॒ वि॒हितो जातवेदः सम्य॒ग् एनं धेहि सुकृ॒ताम् उ लोके॒ ॥११॥

text: Happily lit, let fires, each Jātavedas, seize on Prajāpati's appoint- ed victim. Let them not cast it down while here they cook it.
meaning: श॒म् अग्न॒यः स॒मिद्धा आ॒ रभन्तां प्राजापत्यं॒ मे॒ध्यं जात॒वेदसः । शृतं॒ कृण्व॒न्त इह॒ मा॒व चिक्षिपन् ॥१२॥

text: Sacrifice, duly offered, comes preparing the sacrificer for the. world of Svarga, Let all the fires, each Jatavedas, welcome Prajāpati's completely offered victim. Let them not cast it down while here they cook it.
meaning: यज्ञ॒ एति वि॒ततः क॒ल्पमान ईजान॒म् अभि॒ लोकं॒ स्वर्ग॒म् । त॒म् अग्न॒यः स॒र्वहुतं जुषन्तां प्राजापत्यं॒ मे॒ध्यं जात॒वेदसः ॥१३॥

text: Fain to fly up from the sky's ridge to heaven, the worshipper hath mounted visible Agni. Lucid from out the mist to him, the pious, gleams the God- travelled path that leads to Svarga.
meaning: ईजान॒श् चित॒म् आ॒रुक्षद् अग्निं॒ ना॒कस्य पृष्ठा॒द् दि॒वम् उत्पतिष्य॒न् । त॒स्मै प्र॒ भाति न॒भसो ज्यो॒तिषीमान्त् स्वर्गः॒ प॒न्थाः सुकृ॒ते देवया॒नः ॥१४॥

text: On thy right hand let Indra be thy Brāhman, Brihaspati Adh- varyu Agni Hotar. This ordered sacrifice goes offered thither whither presented gifts have gone aforetime.
meaning: अग्नि॒र् हो॒ताध्वर्यु॒ष् टे बृ॒हस्प॒तिर् इ॒न्द्रो ब्रह्मा॒ दक्षिणत॒स् ते अस्तु । हुतो॒ ऽयं॒ सं॒स्थितो यज्ञ॒ एति य॒त्र पू॒र्वम् अ॒यनं हुता॒नाम् ॥१५॥

text: Enriched with cake and milk here let the Charu rest. World-makers, makers of the path we worship you of the Gods who here partake oblations.
meaning: अपूप॒वान् क्षीर॒वांश् चरु॒र् ए॒ह॒ सीदतु । लोककृ॒तः पथिकृ॒तो यजामहे ये॒ देवा॒नां हुत॒भागा इह॒ स्थ॒ ॥१६॥

text: Enriched with cake and curds, etc. (as in stanza 16).
meaning: अपूप॒वान् द॒धिवांश् चरु॒र् ए॒ह॒ सीदतु । लोककृ॒तः पथिकृ॒तो यजामहे ये॒ देवा॒नां हुत॒भागा इह॒ स्थ॒ ॥१७॥

text: Enriched with cake and drops, etc.
meaning: अपूप॒वान् द्रप्स॒वांश् चरु॒र् ए॒ह॒ सीदतु । लोककृ॒तः पथिकृ॒तो यजामहे ये॒ देवा॒नां हुत॒भागा इह॒ स्थ॒ ॥१८॥

text: Enriched with cake and butter, etc.
meaning: अपूप॒वान् घृत॒वांश् चरु॒र् ए॒ह॒ सीदतु । लोककृ॒तः पथिकृ॒तो यजामहे ये॒ देवा॒नां हुत॒भागा इह॒ स्थ॒ ॥१९॥

text: Enriched with cake and flesh, etc.
meaning: अपूप॒वान् मांस॒वांश् चरु॒र् ए॒ह॒ सीदतु । लोककृ॒तः पथिकृ॒तो यजामहे ये॒ देवा॒नां हुत॒भागा इह॒ स्थ॒ ॥२०॥ {२१}

text: Enriched with cake and food, etc.
meaning: अपूप॒वान् अ॒न्नवांश् चरु॒र् ए॒ह॒ सीदतु । लोककृ॒तः पथिकृ॒तो यजामहे ये॒ देवा॒नां हुत॒भागा इह॒ स्थ॒ ॥२१॥

text: Enriched with cake and mead, etc.
meaning: अपूप॒वान् म॒धुमांश् चरु॒र् ए॒ह॒ सीदतु । लोककृ॒तः पथिकृ॒तो यजामहे ये॒ देवा॒नां हुत॒भागा इह॒ स्थ॒ ॥२२॥

text: Enriched with cake and juice, etc.
meaning: अपूप॒वान् र॒सवांश् चरु॒र् ए॒ह॒ सीदतु । लोककृ॒तः पथिकृ॒तो यजामहे ये॒ देवा॒नां हुत॒भागा इह॒ स्थ॒ ॥२३॥

text: Here, mixt with cake and water rest the Charu! World-makers, makers of the path, we worship those Gods of you who here partake oblations.
meaning: अपूप॒वान् अ॒पवांश् चरु॒र् ए॒ह॒ सीदतु । लोककृ॒तः पथिकृ॒तो यजामहे ये॒ देवा॒नां हुत॒भागा इह॒ स्थ॒ ॥२४॥

text: Let these which Gods have held for thee, these beakers covered o'er with cake, Be full of sacred food for thee, distilling fatness, rich in mead.
meaning: अपूपा॒पिहितान् कुम्भा॒न् यां॒स् ते देवा॒ अ॒धारयन् । ते॒ ते सन्तु स्वधा॒वन्तो म॒धुमन्तो घृतश्चु॒तः ॥२५॥

text: Grains which for thee I scatter, mixt with Sesamum, as holy food. May they for thee be excellent and potent. King Yama look on, them as thine with favour!
meaning: या॒स् ते धाना॒ अनुकिरा॒मि तिल॒मिश्राः स्वधा॒वतीः । ता॒स् ते सन्तूद्भ्वीः॒ प्रभ्वी॒स् ता॒स् ते यमो॒ रा॒जा॒नु मन्यताम् ॥२६॥

text: More immortality!
On all the earth, to heaven, the drop descended, on this place and on that which was before it. I offer up, throughout the seven oblations, the drop which still to one same place is moving.
meaning: द्रप्स॒श् चस्कन्द पृथिवी॒म् अ॒नु द्या॒म् इमं॒ च यो॒निम् अ॒नु य॒श् च पू॒र्वः । समानं॒ यो॒निम् अ॒नु सम्च॒रन्तं द्रप्स॒म् जुहोम्य् अ॒नु सप्त॒ हो॒त्राः ॥२८॥

text: Those who observe men look on wealth as Vāyu with countless. streams, and as light-finding Arka; Those drain out Guerdon sprung from seven mothers, who satis- fy and evermore give presents.
meaning: शत॒धारं वायु॒म् अर्कं॒ स्वर्वि॒दं नृच॒क्षसस् ते॒ अभि॒ चक्षते रयि॒म् । ये॒ पृन॒न्ति प्र॒ च य॒छन्ति सर्वदा॒ ते॒ दुह्रते द॒क्षिणां सप्त॒मातरम् ॥२९॥

text: They for their weal drain out the cask, the beaker four-holed,. the milch-cow Idā full of sweetness, Injure not, Agni, in the loftiest heaven Aditi heightening strength among the people.
meaning: को॒शं दुहन्ति कल॒शं च॒तुर्बिलम् इ॒डां धेनुं॒ म॒धुमतीं स्वस्त॒ये । ऊ॒र्जं म॒दन्तीम् अ॒दितिं ज॒नेष्व् अ॒ग्ने मा॒ हिंसीः परमे॒ व्यो॑मन् ॥३०॥ {२२}

text: On thee doth Savitar the God bestow this vesture for thy wear. Clothe thee herein, and find meet robe in Yama's realm to cover thee.
meaning: एत॒त् ते देवः॒ सविता॒ वा॒सो ददाति भ॒र्तवे । त॒त् त्वं यम॒स्य रा॒ज्ये व॒सानस् तार्प्यं॑ चर ॥३१॥

text: The grains of corn have now become a cow, the Sesamum her calf. He in the realm of Yama lives on her the inexhaustible.
meaning: धाना॒ धेनु॒र् अभवद् वत्सो॒ अस्यास् तिलो॒ ऽभवत् । तां॒ वै॒ यम॒स्य रा॒ज्ये अ॒क्षिताम् उ॒प जीवति ॥३२॥

text: Let these become thy milch-kine, man! supplying all thy heart's desires. There, speckled, white, like-hued and various-coloured, with calves of Sesamum let them stand beside thee.
meaning: एता॒स् ते असौ धेन॒वः कामदु॒घा भवन्तु । ए॒नीः श्ये॒नीः स॒रूपा वि॒रूपास् तिल॒वत्सा उ॒प तिष्ठन्तु त्वा॒त्र ॥३३॥

text: Let the green grains become thy white, and speckled, The dusky corns become thy ruddy milch-kine. Let those with calves of Sesamum for ever yield strength to him and never flinch from milking.
meaning: ए॒नीर् धाना॒ ह॒रिणीः श्ये॒नीर् अस्य कृष्णा॒ धाना॒ रो॒हिणीर् धेन॒वस् ते । तिल॒वत्सा ऊ॒र्जम् अस्मै॒ दु॒हाना विश्वा॒हा सन्त्व् अ॒नपस्फुरन्तीः ॥३४॥

text: I offer in Vaisvānara this oblation, thousandfold spring that pours a hundred steamlets. This with a swelling flow supports the Father, supports grand- fathers and their sires before them.
meaning: वैश्वानरे॒ हवि॒र् इदं॒ जुहोमि साहस्रं॒ शत॒धारम् उ॒त्सम् । स॒ बिभर्ति पित॒रं पितामहा॒न् प्रपितामहा॒न् बिभर्ति पि॒न्वमानः ॥३५॥

text: Beside the spring with hundred, thousand currents, expanding on the summit of the water, Exhaustless, yielding strength, never reluctant, the Fathers with their sacred food are seated.
meaning: सह॒स्रधारं शत॒धारम् उ॒त्सम् अ॒क्षितं व्यच्य॒मानं सलिल॒स्य पृष्ठे॒ । ऊ॒र्जं दु॒हानम् अ॒नपस्फुरन्तम् उ॒पासते पित॒रः स्वधा॒भिः ॥३६॥

text: This pile of wood, collected, heaped together, regard it, O ye, kinsmen, and come near it. To immortality this mortal goeth: prepare a home for him, all ye his kindred.
meaning: इदं॒ क॒साम्बु च॒यनेन चितं॒ त॒त् सजाता अ॒व पश्यते॒त । म॒र्त्यो ऽय॒म् अमृतत्व॒म् एति त॒स्मै गृहा॒न् कृणुत यावत्स॒बन्धु ॥३७॥

text: Be here, even here, acquiring wealth, here be thou thoughts here be thou strength. Be stronger here in manly power, life-giver, never beaten back.
meaning: इहै॒वै॒धि धनस॒निर् इह॒चित्त इह॒क्रतुः । इहै॒धि वीर्य॑वत्तरो वयोधा॒ अ॒पराहतः ॥३८॥

text: Giving the son and grandson satisfaction, let these the present Waters full of sweetness, Pouring forth food and Amrit for the Fathers, refresh both these and those, the Goddess Waters.
meaning: पुत्रं॒ पौ॒त्रम् अभितर्प॒यन्तीर् आ॒पो म॒धुमतीर् इमाः॒ । स्वधां॒ पितृ॒भ्यो अमृ॒तं दु॒हाना आ॒पो देवी॒र् उभ॒यांस् तर्पयन्तु ॥३९॥

text: 40. Waters, send Agni forward to the Fathers: let them accept the sacrifice I offer. May they who follow Vigour that abideth there send us down wealth with full store of heroes.
meaning: आ॒पो अग्निं॒ प्र॒ हिणुत पितृ̄ं॒र् उ॒पेमं॒ यज्ञं॒ पित॒रो मे जुषन्ताम् । आ॒सीनाम् ऊ॒र्जम् उ॒प ये॒ स॒चन्ते ते॒ नो रयिं॒ स॒र्ववीरं नि॒ यछान् ॥४०॥ {२३}

text: Lover of butter, deathless, him, Oblation-bearer, they inflame. He knoweth well the treasured stores gone to the Fathers, far away.
meaning: स॒म् इन्धते अ॒मर्त्यं हव्यवा॒हं घृतप्रि॒यम् । स॒ वेद नि॒हितान् निधी॒न् पितृ॒̄न् पराव॒तो गता॒न् ॥४१॥

text: The mingled draught, the mess of rice, the flesh which I present to thee, May these be full of food for thee, distilling fatness, rich in sweets.
meaning: यं॒ ते मन्थं॒ य॒म् ओदननं॒ य॒न् मांसं॒ निपृणा॒मि ते । ते॒ ते सन्तु स्वधा॒वन्तो म॒धुमन्तो घृतश्चु॒तः ॥४२॥

text: Grains which for thee I scatter, mixt with Sesamum as sacred food, May these for thee be excellent and potent. King Yama look on, them, as thine, with favour.
meaning: या॒स् ते धाना॒ अनुकिरा॒मि तिल॒मिश्राः स्वधा॒वतीः । ता॒स् ते सन्तूद्भ्वीः॒ प्रभ्वी॒स् ता॒स् ते यमो॒ रा॒जा॒नु मन्यताम् ॥४३॥

text: This is the ancient, this the recent pathway, by which thy sires of olden time departed. They who first travelled it, and they who followed, convey thee to the world where dwell the righteous.
meaning: इदं॒ पू॒र्वम् अ॒परं निया॒नं ये॒ना ते पू॒र्वे पित॒रः प॒रेताः । पुरोगवा॒ ये॒ अभिसा॒चो अस्य ते॒ त्वा वहन्ति सुकृ॒ताम् उ लोक॒म् ॥४४॥

text: The pious call Sarasvati: they worship Sarasvati while sacrifice proceedeth. The righteous doers of good deeds invoke her: Sarasvati send bliss to him who giveth!
meaning: स॒रस्वतीं देवय॒न्तो हवन्ते स॒रस्वतीम् अध्वरे॒ ताय॒माने । स॒रस्वतीं सुकृ॒तो हवन्ते स॒रस्वती दाशु॒षे वा॒र्यं दात् ॥४५॥

text: Approaching on the south our solemn worship, the Fathers call- Sarasvati to hear them. Sit on this holy grass and be ye joyful: give thou us strengthen- ing food that brings no sickness.
meaning: स॒रस्वतीं पित॒रो हवन्ते दक्षिणा॒ यज्ञ॒म् अभिन॒क्षमाणाः । आस॒द्यास्मि॒न् बर्हि॒षि मादयध्वम् अनमीवा॒ इ॒ष आ॒ धेह्य् अस्मे॒ ॥४६॥

text: Sarasvati, who tamest with them, joying in hymns and food, O Goddess, with the Fathers, Here give the Sacrificer growth of riches, a portion, worth a thousand, of refreshment.
meaning: स॒रस्वति या॒ सर॒थं यया॒थोक्थैः॒ स्वधा॒भिर् देवि पितृ॒भिर् म॒दन्ती । सहस्रार्घ॒म् इडो॒ अ॒त्र भागं॒ राय॒स् पो॒षं य॒जमानाय धेहि ॥४७॥

text: As Prithivī rests on earth, so do I seat thee. May the God Dhātar lengthen our existence. For you may he who parts in turn find treasures, but let the Dead among the Fathers.
meaning: पृथिवीं॒ त्वा पृथिव्या॒म् आ॒ वेशयामि देवो॒ नो धाता॒ प्र॒ तिरात्य् आ॒युः । प॒रापरैता वसुवि॒द् वो अस्त्व् अ॒धा मृताः॒ पितृ॒षु सं॒ भवन्तु ॥४८॥

text: Depart ye two: wipe ye away whatever omens of evil fortune here have told you. Go from this man, both Steers, to him who wills it: ye are my joys here by the giver's Fathers.
meaning: आ॒ प्र॒ च्यवेथाम् अ॒प त॒न् मृजेथां य॒द् वाम् अभिभा॒ अ॒त्रोचुः॒ । अस्मा॒द् ए॒तम् अघ्न्यौ॒ त॒द् व॒शीयो दातुः॒ पितृ॒ष्व् इह॒भोजनौ म॒म ॥४९॥

text: From a good quarter have we gained this guerdon, gift of this man, strength giving, plenteous milker. Bringing in youth old age unto the living, may she bear these together to the Fathers.
meaning: ए॒य॒म् अगन् द॒क्षिणा भद्रतो॒ ना अने॒न दत्ता॒ सुदु॒घा वयोधाः॒ । यौ॒वने जीवा॒न् उपपृञ्चती॒ जरा॒ पितृ॒भ्य उपसंप॒राणयाद् इमा॒न् ॥५०॥ {२४}

text: I bring this clipped grass hither for the Fathers: grass living,. higher, for the Gods I scatter. Mount this, O man, as victim: let the Fathers recognize thee: when thou hast travelled yonder.
meaning: इदं॒ पितृ॒भ्यः प्र॒ भरामि बर्हि॒र् जीवं॒ देवे॒भ्य उ॒त्तरं स्तृणामि । त॒द् आ॒ रोह पुरुष मे॒ध्यो भ॒वन् प्र॒ति त्वा जानन्तु पित॒रः प॒रेतम् ॥५१॥

text: Set on this grass thou hast become a victim. Fathers shall know thee yonder when they meet thee. Gather thy body, limb by limb, together: I by the power of prayer arrange thy members.
meaning: ए॒दं॒ बर्हि॒र् असदो मे॒ध्यो ऽभूः प्र॒ति त्वा जानन्तु पित॒रः प॒रेतम् । यथापरु॒ तन्वं॑ सं॒ भरस्व गात्राणि ते ब्र॒ह्मणा कल्पयामि ॥५२॥

text: The royal Parna is the caldrons' cover: strength have we gained, force, power, and might, and vigour. Bestowing length of life upon the living, for long existence through a hundred autumns.
meaning: पर्णो॒ रा॒जापिधा॒नं चरूणा॒म् ऊर्जो॒ ब॒लं स॒ह ओ॒जो न आ॒गन् । आ॒युर् जीवे॒भ्यो वि॒दधद् दीर्घायुत्वा॒य शत॒शारदाय ॥५३॥

text: The share of vigour which gave this man being, the stone won lordship over foods that nourish. Hymn this with your oblations, Visvāmitras: may he, may Yama, lengthen our existence.
meaning: ऊर्जो॒ भागो॒ य॒ इमं॒ जजा॒ना॒श्मा॒न्नानाम् आ॒धिपत्यं जगा॒म । त॒म् अर्चत विश्व॒मित्रा हवि॒र्भिः स॒ नो यमः॒ प्रतरं॒ जीव॒से धात् ॥५४॥

text: As the Five Races of mankind for Yama set apart a house. Even so I set a house apart that greater numbers may be mine.
meaning: य॒था यमा॒य हर्म्य॒म् अ॒वपन् प॒ञ्च मानवाः॒ । एवा॒ वपामि हर्म्यं॒ य॒था मे भू॒रयो॒ ऽसत ॥५५॥

text: Take thou and wear this piece of gold, the gold thy father used to wear. Wipe tenderly the right hand of thy sire who goes away to heaven.
meaning: इदं॒ हि॒रण्यं बिभृहि य॒त् ते पिता॒बिभः पुरा॒ । स्वर्गं॒ यतः॒ पितु॒र् ह॒स्तं नि॒र् मृड्ढि द॒क्षिणम् ॥५६॥

text: To all, the living and the dead, all that are born, the worshipful. Let the full brook of fatness run, o'erflowing, with stream of mead.
meaning: ये॒ च जीवा॒ ये॒ च मृता॒ ये॒ जाता॒ ये॒ च यज्ञि॒याः । ते॒भ्यो घृत॒स्य कुल्यै॒तु म॒धुधारा व्युन्दती॒ ॥५७॥

text: Far-seeing he flows on, the Bull, the Lord of hymns, promoter of the Sun, of Days, of Dawns, of Heaven. Breath of the rivers he hath roared into the jars, and through his wisdom entered into Indra's heart.
meaning: वृ॒षा मतीनां॒ पवते विचक्षणः॒ सू॒रो अ॒ह्नां प्रत॒रीतोष॒सां दिवः॒ । प्राणः॒ सि॒न्धूनां कल॒शां अचिक्रदद् इ॒न्द्रस्य हा॒र्दिम् आविश॒न् मनीष॒या ॥५८॥

text: Let thy bright smoke envelop thee, spread forth, O Bright One, in the sky. For, Purifier, like the Sun thou shinest with thy radiant glow.
meaning: त्वेष॒स् ते धूम॒ ऊर्णोतु दिवि॒ षं॒ छुक्र॒ आ॒ततः । सू॒रो न॒ हि॒ द्युता॒ त्वं कृपा॒ पावक रो॒चसे ॥५९॥

text: Indu is moving forth to Indra's destined place, and slights not as a friend the promise of his friend. Thou, Soma, comest nigh as bridegroom meets the bride, reach- ing the beaker by a course of hundred paths.
meaning: प्र॒ वा॒ एती॒न्दुर् इ॒न्द्रस्य नि॒ष्कृतिं स॒खा स॒ख्युर् न॒ प्र॒ मिनाति संगिरः॒ । म॒र्य इव यो॒षाः स॒म् अर्षसे सो॒मः कल॒शे शत॒यामना पथा॒ ॥६०॥ {२५}

text: Well have they eaten and rejoiced: their dear ones have they shaken off. Sages, self-luminous, have praised: we who are youngest supplicate.
meaning: अ॒क्षन्न् अ॒मीमदन्त ह्य् अ॒व प्रियां॒ अधूषत । अ॒स्तोषत स्व॒भानवो वि॒प्रा य॒विष्ठा ईमहे ॥६१॥

text: Come hither, Fathers, who deserve the Soma, by the deep path- ways which the Fathers travel. Bestow upon us life and store of children, and favour us with increase of our riches.
meaning: आ॒ यात पितरः सोम्या॒सो गम्भीरैः॒ पथि॒भिः पितृया॒णैः । आ॒युर् अस्म॒भ्यं द॒धतः प्रजां॒ च राय॒श् च पो॒षैर् अभि॒ नः सचध्वम् ॥६२॥

text: Depart, O Fathers, ye who merit Soma, by the deep pathways which the Fathers travel; But in a month, rich in fair sons and heroes, come back into our homes to eat oblation.
meaning: प॒रा यात पितरः सोम्या॒सो गम्भीरैः॒ पथि॒भिः पूर्या॒णैः । अ॒धा मासि पु॒नर् आ॒ यात नो गृहा॒न् हवि॒र् अ॒त्तुं सुप्रज॒सः सुवी॒राः ॥६३॥

text: If Agni Jātavedas, as he bore you hence to the Fathers' world, hath left one single. Limb of your bodies, here do I restore it. Fathers, rejoice in heaven with all your members!
meaning: य॒द् वो अग्नि॒र् अ॒जहाद् ए॒कम् अ॒ङ्गं पितृलोकं॒ गम॒यं जात॒वेदाः । त॒द् व एत॒त् पु॒नर् आ॒ प्याययामि साङ्गाः॒ स्वर्गे॒ पित॒रो मादयध्वम् ॥६४॥

text: Meet for men's praises, Agni Jātavedas was sent as envoy when the day was closing. Thou gavest to the Fathers with oblation. They ate; eat, God, our offered sacrifices.
meaning: अ॒भूद् दूतः॒ प्र॒हितो जात॒वेदाः सायं॒ न्य॒ह्न उपव॒न्द्यो नृ॒भिः । प्रा॒दाः पितृ॒भ्यः स्वध॒या ते॒ अक्षन्न् अद्धि॒ त्वं॒ देव प्र॒यता हवीं॒षि ॥६५॥

text: Here hast thou left thy heart; O man, as sisters leave their little pet. Do thou, O earth, envelop him.
