text: Preserve our breath, O Vital Breath, have mercy on our life, O Life. From snares of Nirriti do thou, O Nirriti, deliver us.
meaning: प्रा॒ण प्राणं॒ त्रायस्वासो अ॒सवे मृड । नि॒रृते नि॒रृत्या नः पा॒शेभ्यो मुञ्च ॥४॥

text: Thou art the babe of Sindhu, thou art lightnings' flower, wind, breath, and Sun: thou art the eye and milk of heaven.
meaning: सि॒न्धोर् ग॒र्भो ऽसि विद्यु॒तां पु॒ष्पम् । वातः प्राणः॒ सू॒र्यश् च॒क्षुर् दिव॒स् प॒यः ॥५॥

text: Gods' Ointment from the Three Peaked Hill, preserve thou me on every side. No plants of earth surpass thee, none from mountain or from cultured ground.
meaning: दे॒वाञ्जन त्रै॒ककुद प॒रि मा पाहि विश्व॒तः । न॒ त्वा तरन्त्य् ओ॒षधयो बा॒ह्याः पर्वती॒या उत॒ ॥६॥

text: Now hath it gently crept within, fiend-slaying, chasing malady. And driving all diseases hence, and evil omens, banished them.
meaning: वी॒दं॒ म॒ध्यम् अ॒वासृपद् रक्षोहा॒मीवचा॒तनः । अ॒मीवाः स॒र्वाश् चात॒यन् नाश॒यद् अभिभा॒ इतः॒ ॥७॥

text: Full many a falsehood, O thou King Varuna, man hath uttered here: Do thou who hast a thousand powers preserve us from that misery.
meaning: बह्व् इ॑दं॒ राजन् वरुणा॒नृतम् आह पू॒रुषः । त॒स्मात् सहस्रवीर्य मुञ्च॒ नः प॒र्य् अं॒हसः ॥८॥

text: If we have cried, O Waters! Cows! if we have cried, O Varuna! For this endowed with thousand powers! deliver us from misery.
meaning: य॒द् आपो अघ्न्या॒ इ॒ति व॒रुणे॒ति य॒द् ऊचिम॒ । त॒स्मात् सहस्रवीर्य मुञ्च॒ नः प॒र्य् अं॒हसः ॥९॥

text: Mitra and Varuna, O Salve have closely followed after thee May they, when they have followed thee afar, restore thee for our use.
meaning: मित्र॒श् च त्वा व॒रुणश् चानुप्रे॒यतुर् आञ्जन । तौ॒ त्वानुग॒त्य दूरं॒ भोगा॒य पु॒नर् ओ॒हतुः ॥१०॥

text: As debt from debt repay and send sorcery to the sorcerer's house. Split, Salve! the cruel villain's ribs whose evil eye bewitches us.
meaning: ऋणा॒द् ऋण॒म् इव सं॒ नय कृत्यां॒ कृत्याकृ॒तो गृह॒म् । च॒क्षुर्मन्त्रस्य दुर्हा॒र्दः पृष्टी॒र् अ॒पि शृणाञ्जन ॥१॥

text: Whatever evil dream we have, what'er befall our kine or home, Be this that is salubrity, the evil-hearted's foe applied.
meaning: य॒द् अस्मा॒सु दुष्व॒प्न्यं य॒द् गो॒षु य॒च् च नो गृहे॒ । अ॒नामगस् तं॒ च दुर्हा॒र्दः प्रियः॒ प्र॒ति मुञ्चताम् ॥२॥

text: Increasing from the Waters' strength and vigour, sprung into life from Agni Jātavedas, Strong as four heroes, mountain born, this Ointment make for thee quarters and mind-points auspicious!
meaning: अपा॒म् ऊर्ज॒ ओ॒जसो वावृधान॒म् अग्ने॒र् जात॒म् अ॒धि जात॒वेदसः । च॒तुर्वीरं पर्वती॒यं य॒द् आ॒ञ्जनं दि॒शः प्रदिशः करद् इ॒च् छिवा॒स् ते ॥३॥

text: On thee is laid the Chaturvira Ointment: let all the regions give thee peace and safety. Secure like precious Savitar thou standest: to thee let all these regions bring their tribute.
meaning: च॒तुर्वीरं बध्यत आ॒ञ्जनं ते स॒र्वा दि॒शो अ॒भयास् ते भवन्तु । ध्रुव॒स् तिष्ठासि सविते॒व चा॒र्य इमा॒ वि॒शो अभि॒ हरन्तु ते बलि॒म् ॥४॥

text: Make one thy salve, thine amulet another, drink one, and with another bathe thy body. So let the Chaturvira keep us guarded from the four bonds of Nirriti and Grāhi.
meaning: आ॒क्ष्वै॒कं मणि॒म् ए॒कं क्र्णुष्व स्नाह्य् ए॒केना॒ पिबै॒कम् एषाम् । च॒तुर्वीरं नैरृते॒भ्यश् चतु॒र्भ्यो ग्रा॒ह्या बन्धे॒भ्यः प॒रि पात्व् अस्मा॒न् ॥५॥

text: May Agni protect me with fire for inspiration and expiration, for strength, for energy, for vigour, for weal and prosperity. All Hail!
meaning: अग्नि॒र् माग्नि॒नावतु प्राणा॒यापाना॒या॒युषे व॒र्चस ओ॒जसे । ते॒जसे स्वस्त॒ये सुभूत॒ये स्वा॒हा ॥६॥

text: May Indra protect me with his Indra-power for inspiration, etc.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रो मेन्द्रिये॒णावतु प्राणा॒यापाना॒या॒युषे व॒र्चस ओ॒जसे । ते॒जसे स्वस्त॒ये सुभूत॒ये स्वा॒हा ॥७॥

text: May Soma protect me with Soma-power, etc.
meaning: सो॒मो मा सौ॒म्येनावतु प्राणा॒यापाना॒या॒युषे व॒र्चस ओ॒जसे । ते॒जसे स्वस्त॒ये सुभूत॒ये स्वा॒हा ॥८॥

text: May Bhaga with good fortune protect me, etc.
meaning: भ॒गो म भ॒गेनावतु प्राणा॒यापाना॒या॒युषे व॒र्चस ओ॒जसे । ते॒जसे स्वस्त॒ये सुभूत॒ये स्वा॒हा ॥९॥

text: May the Maruts protect me with their troops for inspiration and expiration, for strength, for energy, for vigour, for weal and prosperity. All Hail!
meaning: मरु॒तो मा गणै॒र् अवन्तु प्राणा॒यापाना॒युषे व॒र्चस ओ॒जसे ते॒जसे । स्वस्त॒ये सुभूत॒ये स्वा॒हा ॥१०॥

text: For manly strength Prajāpati bound thee on first, invincible. This for long life on thee I bind for splendour, strength, and energy. Invincible, let it guard thee well.
meaning: प्रजा॒पतिष् ट्वा बध्नात् प्रथम॒म् अ॒स्तृतं वीर्या॑य क॒म् । त॒त् ते बध्नाम्य् आ॒युषे व॒र्चस ओ॒जसे च ब॒लाय चा॒स्तृतस् त्वाभि॒ रक्षतु ॥१॥

text: Erect, invincible, be this man's watchful keeper: let not the Panis or the sorcerers harm thee. Shake off thy foes as Indra scattered Dasyus: quell all enemies. Invincible, let it guard thee well.
meaning: ऊर्ध्व॒स् तिष्ठतु र॒क्षन्न् अ॒प्रमादम् अ॒स्तृतेम॒म् मा॒ त्वा दभन् पण॒यो यातुधा॒नाः । इ॒न्द्र इव द॒स्यून् अ॒व धूनुष्व पृतन्यतः॒ स॒र्वां छ॒त्रून् वि॒ षहस्वा॒स्तृतस् त्वाभि॒ रक्षतु ॥२॥

text: Indra hath lent the power of sight, and vital breath and strength to this. Whom even a hundred combatants, striking, have failed to over- come. Invincible, let it guard thee well.
meaning: शतं॒ च न प्रह॒रन्तो निघ्न॒न्तो न॒ तस्तिरे॒ । त॒स्मिन्न् इ॒न्द्रः प॒र्य् अदत्त च॒क्षुः प्राण॒म् अ॒थो ब॒लम् अ॒स्तृतस् त्वाभि॒ रक्षतु ॥३॥

text: Around thy limbs I place the mail of Indra who hath become the Gods' imperial Sovran. Again let all the Deities bring thee hither. Invincible let it guard thee well.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रस्य त्वा व॒र्मणा प॒रि धापयामो यो॒ देवा॒नाम् अधिराजो॒ बभू॒व । पु॒नस् त्वा देवाः॒ प्र॒ णयन्तु स॒र्वे॒ ऽस्तृतस् त्वाभि॒ रक्षतु ॥४॥

text: One and a hundred manly powers, a thousand lives hath this Amulet, unconquered ever. Go forth a tiger, strike down all thy foemen: let him who would oppose fall low beneath thee. Invincible, let it guard thee well.
meaning: अस्मि॒न् मणा॒व् ए॒कशतं वीर्या॑णि सह॒स्रं प्राणा॒ अस्मिन्न् अ॒स्तृते । व्याघ्रः॒ श॒त्रून् अभि॒ तिष्ठ स॒र्वान् य॒स् त्वा पृतन्याद् अ॒धरः सो॒ अस्त्व् अ॒स्तृतस् त्वाभि॒ रक्षतु ॥५॥

text: Drawn forth from butter, rich in milk and sweetness, hundred- lived, thousand-homed, bestowing vigour, Kindly, delightsome, full of sap, and mighty, invincible let it guard thee well.
meaning: घृता॒द् उ॒ल्लुप्तो म॒धुमान् प॒यस्वान्त् सह॒स्रप्राणः शत॒योनिर् वयोधाः॒ । शम्भू॒श् च मयोभू॒श् चो॒र्जस्वांश् च प॒यस्वांश् चा॒स्तृतस् त्वाभि॒ रक्षतु ॥६॥

text: That thou mayst be pre-eminent, slayer of rivals, rivalless, May Savitar cause thee to be chief and controller of thy kin. Invincible, let it guard thee well.
meaning: य॒था त्व॒म् उत्तरो॒ ऽसो असपत्नः॒ सपत्नहा॒ । सजाता॒नाम् असद् वशी॒ त॒था त्वा सविता॒ करद् अ॒स्तृतस् त्वाभि॒ रक्षतु ॥७॥

text: Night! the terrestrial realm hath been filled with the Father's power and might. Thou spreadest forth on high unto the seats of Heaven: dark- ness that strikes with awe comes near.
meaning: आ॒ रात्रि पा॒र्थिवं र॒जः पितु॒र् अप्रायि धा॒मभिः । दिवः॒ स॒दांसि बृहती॒ वि॒ तिष्ठस आ॒ त्वेषं॒ वर्तते त॒मः ॥१॥

text: Each moving thing finds rest in her whose yonder boundary is not seen, nor that which keeps her separate. O spacious, darksome Night, may we uninjured reach the end of thee, reach, O thou blessed One, thine end.
meaning: न॒ य॒स्याः पारं॒ द॒दृशे न॒ यो॒युवद् वि॒श्वम् अस्यां॒ नि॒ विशते य॒द् ए॒जति । अ॒रिष्टासस् त उर्वि तमस्वति रा॒त्रि पार॒म् अशीमहि भ॒द्रे पार॒म् अशीमहि ॥२॥

text: Thy ninety-nine examiners, O Night, who look upon mankind, Eighty-and-eight in number, or seven-and-seventy are they.
meaning: ये॒ ते रात्रि नृच॒क्षसो द्रष्टा॒रो नवति॒र् न॒व । अशीतिः॒ स॒न्त्य् अष्टा॒ उतो॒ ते सप्त॒ सप्ततिः॒ ॥३॥

text: Sixty-and-six, O opulent, fifty-and-five, O happy One, Forty-and-four and thirty-three are they, O thou enriched with spoil.
meaning: षष्टि॒श् च ष॒ट् च रेवति पञ्चाश॒त् प॒ञ्च सुम्नयि । चत्वा॒रश् चत्वारिंश॒च् च त्र॒यस् त्रिंश॒च् च वाजिनि ॥४॥

text: Twenty-and-two hast thou, O Night, eleven, yea, and fewer still. With these protectors guard us well. O Daughter of the Sky, to- day.
meaning: द्वौ॒ च ते विंशति॒श् च ते रा॒त्र्य् ए॒कादशावमाः॒ । ते॒भिर् नो अद्य॒ पायु॒भिर् नु॒ पाहि दुहितर् दिवः ॥५॥

text: Let not a fiends or spiteful man, let no ill-wisher master us. Let not the robber seize our cows, nor the wolf take our sheep today.
meaning: र॒क्षा मा॒किर् नो अघ॒शंस ईशत मा॒ नो दुःशं॒स ईशत । मा॒ नो अद्य॒ ग॒वां स्तेनो॒ मा॒वीनां वृ॒क ईशत ॥६॥

text: Let not the thief, O Blessed, seize our horses, nor she-fiends our men. Let thief and robber run away on pathways most remote from us.
meaning: मा॒श्वानां भद्रे त॒स्करो मा॒ नृणां॒ यातुधान्यः॑ । परमे॒भिः पथि॒भि स्तेनो॒ धावतु त॒स्करः । प॒रेण दत्व॒ती र॒ज्जुः प॒रेणाघायु॒र् अर्षतु ॥७॥

text: Far from us let Rope with Fangs, far from us let the wicked flee. Do thou make blind and headless. Night, the serpent with his pungent breath.
meaning: अ॒ध रात्रि तृष्ट॒धूमम् अशीर्षा॒णम् अ॒हिं कृणु । ह॒नू वृ॒कस्य जम्भ॒या स्तेनं॒ द्रुपदे॒ जहि ॥८॥

text: Crush the wolf's jaws in pieces, strike the robber dead against a post. In thee, O Night, do we abide: we here will sleep. Be watchful thou. Give thou protection to our kine; and to our horses, and our men.
meaning: त्व॒यि रात्रि वसामसि स्वपिष्या॒मसि जागृहि॒ । गो॒भ्यो नः श॒र्म यछा॒श्वेभ्यः पु॒रुषेभ्यः ॥९॥

text: Then all that we accumulate, all that the treasure-chest contains,. All this do we entrust to thee.
meaning: अ॒थो या॒नि च य॒स्मा ह या॒नि चान्तः॒ परीण॒हि । ता॒नि ते प॒रि दद्मसि ॥१॥

text: Entrust thou us to Dawn, O Mother Night. May Dawn entrust us to the Day, and Day to thee, O splendid. One.
meaning: रा॒त्रि मा॒तर् उष॒से नः प॒रि देहि । उषा॒ नो अ॒ह्ने प॒रि ददात्व् अ॒हस् तु॒भ्यं विभावरि ॥२॥

text: Whatever flying thing be here, whatever thing that creeps and. crawls. Whatever fastens on a joint, therefrom do thou protect us, Night.
meaning: य॒त् किं॒ चेदं॒ पत॒यति य॒त् किं॒ चेदं॒ सरीसृप॒म् । य॒त् किं॒ च प॒र्वतायास॒त्वं त॒स्मात् त्वं॒ रात्रि पाहि नः ॥३॥

text: So guard thou us from west and east, protect us from the north and south. O splendid One, preserve us: we, the singers of thy praise, are here.
meaning: सा॒ पश्चा॒त् पाहि सा॒ पुरः॒ सो॒त्तरा॒द् अधरा॒द् उत॒ । गोपाय॒ नो विभावरि स्तोता॒रस् त इह॒ स्मसि ॥४॥

text: They who are followers of Night, and they who watch o'er living things. They who protect all cattle, they keep watch and ward over our lives, over our herds keep watch and ward.
meaning: ये॒ रा॒त्रिम् अनुति॒ष्ठन्ति ये॒ च भूते॒षु जा॒ग्रति । पशू॒न् ये॒ स॒र्वान् र॒क्षन्ति ते॒ न आत्म॒सु जाग्रति ते॒ नः पशु॒षु जाग्रति ॥५॥

text: Verily, Night, I know thy name, Dropper of Fatness art thou called. Thee Bharadvāja knew as such: as such be watchful o'er our wealth.
meaning: वे॒द वै॒ रात्रि ते ना॒म घृता॒ची ना॒म वा॒ असि । तां॒ त्वां॒ भर॒द्वाजो वेद सा॒ नो वित्ते॒ ऽधि जाग्रति ॥६॥

text: Friend of the home, the strong and youthful maiden, Night, dear to Savitar the God, and Bhaga, All-compassing, all-glorious, prompt to listen, hath with her greatness filled the earth and heaven.
meaning: इषिरा॒ यो॒षा युवति॒र् द॒मूना रा॒त्री देव॒स्य सवितु॒र् भ॒गस्य । अश्वक्षभा॒ सुह॒वा सं॒भृतश्रीर् आ॒ पप्रौ द्या॒वापृथिवी॒ महित्वा॒ ॥१॥

text: Over all depths hath she gone up, and mounted, most mighty One, the sky's exalted summit. Over me now the loving Night is spreading with her auspicious. Godlike ways like Mitra.
meaning: अ॒ति वि॒श्वान्य् अरुहद् गम्भिरो॒ व॒र्षिष्ठम् अरुहन्त श्र॒विष्ठाः । उशती॒ रा॒त्र्य् अ॒नु सा॒ भद्राभि॒ तिष्ठते मित्र॒ इव स्वधा॒भिः ॥२॥

text: Excellent, high-born, blissful, meet for worship, Night, thou hast come: stay here with friendly spirit. Guard us, the food for men that we have gotten, and all pro- sperity that comes of cattle.
meaning: व॒र्ये व॒न्दे सु॒भगे सु॒जात आ॒जगन् रा॒त्रि सुम॒ना इह॒ स्याम् । अस्मां॒स् त्रायस्व न॒र्याणि जाता॒ अ॒थो या॒नि ग॒व्यानि पुष्ट्या॒ ॥३॥

text: With eager haste hath Night assumed the vigour of leopard,. tiger, or of tawny lion, The horse's neighing and the wild-man's bellow, Thou takest many a form when thou appearest.
meaning: सिंह॒स्य रा॒त्र्य् उशती॒ पींष॒स्य व्याघ्र॒स्य द्वीपि॒नो व॒र्च आ॒ ददे । अ॒श्वस्य ब्रध्नं॒ पु॒रुषस्य मायुं॒ पुरु॒ रूपा॒णि कृणुषे विभाती॒ ॥४॥

text: Kind through the Night be absence of the sunshine: Mother of Frost, may she be swift to hear us. Take notice of the hymn, thou highly favoured, wherewith I worship thee in all the regions.
meaning: शिवां॒ रा॒त्रिम् अनुसू॒र्यं च हिम॒स्य माता॒ सुह॒वा नो अस्तु । अस्य॒ स्तो॒मस्य सुभगे नि॒ बोध ये॒न त्वा व॒न्दे वि॒श्वासु दिक्षु॒ ॥५॥

text: Even as a King, O splendid Night, thou takest pleasure in our hymn. May we through Mornings as they flush have all our good men, round us, and become possessors of all wealth.
meaning: स्तो॒मस्य नो विभावरि रा॒त्रि रा॒जेव जोषसे । अ॒साम स॒र्ववीरा भ॒वाम स॒र्ववेदसो व्युछ॒न्तीर् अ॒नूष॒सः ॥६॥

text: Yes, Rāmyā is the name thou hast assumed. The men who fain. would spoil. My wealth do thou annoy, O Night, that not one robber may appear, none may a second time appear.
meaning: श॒म्या ह ना॒म दधिषे॒ म॒म दि॒प्सन्ति ये॒ ध॒ना । रा॒त्रीहि॒ ता॒न् असुतपा॒ य॒ स्तेनो॒ न॒ विद्य॒ते य॒त् पु॒नर् न॒ विद्य॒ते ॥७॥

text: Thou like a well-wrought cup, O Night, art lovely: thou, a. young maid, art formed in perfect beauty. Thou lovingly, for me with eyes to se: them, hast bound on thee heaven's stars as thine adornment.
meaning: भद्रा॒सि रात्रि चमसो॒ न॒ विष्टो॒ वि॒ष्वङ् गो॒रूपं युवति॒र् बिभर्षि । च॒क्षुष्मती मे उशती॒ व॒पूम्षि प्र॒ति त्वं॒ दिव्या॒ न॒ क्षाम् अमुक्थाः ॥८॥

text: Whatever robber comes to-day, mischievous mortal enemy. Let Night go forth, encounter him, and smite away his neck and head;
meaning: यो॒ अद्य॒ स्तेन॒ आ॒यत्य् अघायु॒र् म॒र्त्यो रिपुः॒ । रा॒त्री त॒स्य प्रती॒त्य प्र॒ ग्रीवाः॒ प्र॒ शि॒रो हनत् ॥९॥

text: His feet that he may walk no more, his hands that he may do no harm. The robber who comes hitherward goes crushed and mutilated hence, Goes hence, goes far away from us, goes hence and bears no spoil away.
meaning: प्र॒ पादौ न॒ य॒था॒यति प्र॒ ह॒स्तौ न॒ य॒था॒शिषत् । यो॒ मलिम्लु॒र् उपा॒यति स॒ सं॒पिष्टो अ॒पायति । अ॒पायति स्व॒पायति शु॒ष्के स्थाणा॒व् अ॒पायति ॥१०॥

text: Blind him and make him headless, Night! the serpent with the pungent breath. Strike from his head the wolf's two eyes, and dash the thief against a post.
meaning: अ॒ध रात्रि तृष्ट॒धूमम् अशीर्षा॒णम् अ॒हिं कृणु । अक्षौ॒ वृ॒कस्य नि॒र् जह्यास् ते॒न तं॒ द्रुपदे॒ जहि ॥१॥

text: Those oxen that are thine, O Night, with sharpened horns and rapid pace, With those transport us safe to-day o'er difficulties everywhere.
meaning: ये॒ ते रात्र्य् अनड्वा॒हस् तीक्ष्ण॒शृङ्गाः स्वाश॒वः । ते॒भिर् नो अद्य॒ पारया॒ति दुर्गा॒णि विश्व॒हा ॥२॥

text: Uninjured in our bodies may we pass through each succeeding night, And let malignities fail to pass, as men without a boat the depth.
meaning: रा॒त्रिंरात्रिम् अ॒रिष्यन्तस् त॒रेम तन्वा॑ वय॒म् । गम्भीर॒म् अ॒प्लवा इव न॒ तरेयुर् अ॒रातयः ॥३॥

text: As millet hurried through the air before us is beheld no more. So cause the man to vanish, Night, who plans to do us injury.
meaning: य॒था शाम्या॒कः प्रप॒तन्न् अपवा॒न् ना॒नुविद्य॒ते । एवा॒ रात्रि प्र॒ पातय यो॒ अस्मां॒ अभ्यघाय॒ति ॥४॥

text: The thief hast thou kept far away, the robber driver of our kine. Even him who having covered up the horse's head would lead him off.
meaning: अ॒प स्तेनं॒ वा॒सयो गोअज॒म् उत॒ त॒स्करम् । अ॒थो यो॒ अ॒र्वतः शि॒रो ऽभिधा॒य नि॒नीषति ॥५॥

text: If dealing treasure thou hast come to-day, O highly favoured Night. Cause thou us to enjoy it all so that this may not pass away.
meaning: य॒द् अद्य॒ रात्रि सुभगे विभ॒जन्त्य् अ॒यो व॒सु । य॒द् एत॒द् अस्मा॒न् भो॒जय य॒थे॒द् अन्या॒न् उपा॒यसि ॥६॥

text: Do thou entrust us to the Dawn, all of us free from sin, O Night. May Dawn deliver us to Day, and Day to thee, O glorious One.
meaning: उष॒से नः प॒रि देहि स॒र्वान् रात्र्य् अनाग॒सः । उषा॒ नो अ॒ह्ने आ॒ भजाद् अ॒हस् तु॒भ्यं विभावरि ॥७॥

text: Undisturbed am I, undisturbed is my soul, undisturbed mine eye, undisturbed mine ear, undisturbed is mine in-breathing, undisturbed mine out-breathing, undisturbed my diffusive- breath, undisturbed the whole of me.
meaning: अ॒युतो ऽह॒म् अ॒युतो म आत्मा॒युतं मे च॒क्षुर् अ॒युतं मे श्रो॒त्रम् । अ॒युतो मे प्राणो॒ ऽयुतो मे ऽपानो॒ ऽयुतो मे व्यानो॒ ऽयुतो ऽहं॒ स॒र्वः ॥१॥

text: Under the impulse of the God Savitar, sent forth from the arms- of the Asvins and both hands of Pūshan I have taken thee.
meaning: देव॒स्य त्वा सवितुः॒ प्रसवे॒ ऽश्वि॒नोर् बाहु॒भ्यां पूष्णो॒ ह॒स्ताभ्यां प्र॒सूत आ॒ रभे ॥२॥

text: Thereafter rose Desire in the beginning, Desire the primal seed and germ of Spirit. O Kāma dwelling with the lofty Kāma, give growth of riches to the sacrificer.
meaning: का॒मस् त॒द् अ॒ग्रे स॒म् अवर्तत म॒नसो रे॒तः प्रथमं॒ य॒द् आ॒सीत् । स॒ काम का॒मेन बृहता॒ स॒योनी राय॒स् पो॒षं य॒जमानाय धेहि ॥१॥

text: Thou, Kāma, art victorious, famous, potent, splendid, a friend. to him who seeks thy friendship. Mighty and overpowering in battle, give strength and vigour to the sacrificer.
meaning: त्वं॒ काम स॒हसासि प्र॒तिष्ठितो विभु॒र् विभा॒वा सख आ॒ सखीयते॒ । त्व॒म् उग्रः॒ पृ॒तनासु ससहिः॒ स॒ह ओ॒जो य॒जमानाय धेहि ॥२॥

text: They heard his prayers, and they begot, by Kāma, heavenly- light for him. Who from a distance longed for it, a dealer ready to exchange.
meaning: दूरा॒च् चकमाना॒य प्रतिपाणा॒या॒क्षये । आ॒स्मा अशृण्वन्न् आ॒शाः का॒मेनाजनयन्त् स्वः॑ ॥३॥

text: O Kāma, with whatever wish we make this offering to thee, May it be all fulfilled to us. Then taste this sacrifice, All hail!
meaning: का॒मेन मा का॒म आ॒गन् हृ॒दयाद् धृ॒दयं प॒रि । य॒द् अमी॒षाम् अदो॒ म॒नस् त॒द् ऐ॒तू॒प माम् इह॒ ॥४॥

text: य॒त् काम काम॒यमाना इदं॒ कृण्म॒सि ते हविः॒ । त॒न् नः स॒र्वं स॒म् ऋध्यताम् अ॒थैत॒स्य हवि॒षो वीहि स्वा॒हा ॥५॥
Prolific, thousand-eyed, and undecaying, a horse with seven reins Time bears us onward. Sages inspired with holy knowledge mount him: his chariot wheels are all the worlds of creatures.
meaning: कालो॒ अ॒श्वो वहति सप्त॒रश्मिः सहस्राक्षो॒ अज॒रो भू॒रिरेताः । त॒म् आ॒ रोहन्ति कव॒यो विपश्चि॒तस् त॒स्य चक्रा॒ भु॒वनानि वि॒श्वा ॥१॥

text: This Time hath seven rolling wheels and seven naves immorality is the chariot's axle. This Time brings hitherward all worlds about us: as primal Deity is he entreated.
meaning: सप्त॒ चक्रा॒न् वहति काल॒ एष॒ सप्ता॒स्य ना॒भीर् अमृ॒तं न्व् अ॒क्षः । स॒ इमा॒ वि॒श्वा भु॒वनान्य् अञ्जत् कालः॒ स॒ ईयते प्रथमो॒ नु॒ देवः॒ ॥२॥

text: On Time is laid an overflowing beaker: this we behold in many a place appearing. He carries from us all these worlds of creatures. They call him Kāla in the loftiest heaven.
meaning: पूर्णः॒ कुम्भो॒ ऽधि काल॒ आ॒हितस् तं॒ वै॒ प॒श्यामो बहुधा॒ नु॒ स॒न्तम् । स॒ इमा॒ वि॒श्वा भु॒वनानि प्रत्य॒ङ् कालं॒ त॒म् आहुः॒ परमे॒ व्यो॑मन् ॥३॥

text: He only made the worlds of life, he only gathered the worlds of living things together. Their son did he become who was their Father: no other higher power than he existeth.
meaning: स॒ एव॒ सं॒ भु॒वनान्य् आ॒भरत् स॒ एव॒ सं॒ भु॒वनानि प॒र्य् ऐत् । पिता॒ स॒न्न् अभवत् पुत्र॒ एषां त॒स्माद् वै॒ ना॒न्य॒त् प॒रम् अस्ति ते॒जः ॥४॥

text: Kāla created yonder heaven, and Kāla made these realms of earth. By Kāla, stirred to motion, both what is and what shall be expand.
meaning: कालो॒ ऽमूं॒ दि॒वम् अजनयत् काल॒ इमाः॒ पृथिवी॒र् उत॒ । काले॒ ह भूतं॒ भ॒व्यं चेषितं॒ ह वि॒ तिष्ठते ॥५॥

text: Kāla created land; the Sun in Kāla hath his light and heat. In Kāla rest all things that be: in Kāla doth the eye discern.
meaning: कालो॒ भूति॒म् असृजत काले॒ त॒पति सू॒र्यः । काले॒ ह वि॒श्वा भूता॒नि काले॒ च॒क्षुर् वि॒ पश्यति ॥६॥

text: In Kāla mind, in Kāla breath, in Kāla name are fixt and joined. These living creatures, one and all, rejoice when Kāla hath approached.
meaning: काले॒ म॒नः काले॒ प्राणः॒ काले॒ ना॒म समा॒हितम् । काले॒न स॒र्वा नन्दन्त्य् आ॒गतेन प्रजा॒ इमाः॒ ॥७॥

text: Kāla embraces Holy Fire, the Highest, Brahma in himself. Yea, Kāla, who was father of Prajāpati, is Lord of All.
meaning: काले॒ त॒पः काले॒ ज्ये॒ष्ठम् काले॒ ब्र॒ह्म समा॒हितम् । कालो॒ ह स॒र्वस्येश्वरो॒ यः॒ पिता॒सीत् प्रजा॒पतेः ॥८॥

text: He made, he stirred this universe to motion, and on him it rests. He, Kāla, having now become Brahma, holds Parameshthin up.
meaning: ते॒नेषितं॒ ते॒न जातं॒ त॒द् उ त॒स्मिन् प्र॒तिष्ठितम् । कालो॒ ह ब्र॒ह्म भूत्वा॒ बि॒भर्ति परमेष्ठि॒नम् ॥९॥

text: Kāla created living things and, first of all, Prajāpati. From Kāla self-made Kasyapa, from Kāla Holy Fire was born.
meaning: कालः॒ प्रजा॒ असृजत कालो॒ अ॒ग्रे प्रजा॒पतिम् । स्वयंभूः॒ कश्य॒पः काला॒त् त॒पः काला॒द् अजायत ॥१०॥

text: From Kāla sprang the Waters, sprang the regions, Brahma, Holy Fire. The Sun ascends by Kāla, and in Kāla sinks again to rest.
meaning: काला॒द् आ॒पः स॒म् अभवन् काला॒द् ब्र॒ह्म त॒पो दि॒शः । काले॒नो॒द् एति सू॒र्यः काले॒ नि॒ विशते पु॒नः ॥१॥

text: By Kāla freshly blows the wind, mighty through Kāla is the Earth: on Kāla rests the mighty Sky.
meaning: काले॒न वा॒तः पवते काले॒न पृथिवी॒ मही॒ । द्यौ॒र् मही॒ काल॒ आ॒हिता ॥२॥

text: In Kāla erst the text produced what is and what is yet to be. From Kāla sprang the Richas, and from Kāla was the Yajus born.
meaning: कालो॒ ह भूतं॒ भ॒व्यं च पुत्रो॒ अजनयत् पुरा॒ । काला॒द् ऋ॒चः स॒म् अभवन् य॒जुः काला॒द् अजायत ॥३॥

text: They formed in Kāla sacrifice, eternal portion for the Gods. In Kāla the Gandharvas and Apsarasas and worlds abide.
meaning: कालो॒ यज्ञं॒ स॒म् ऐरयद् देवे॒भ्यो भाग॒म् अ॒क्षितम् । काले॒ गन्धर्वाप्सर॒सः काले॒ लोकाः॒ प्र॒तिष्ठिताः ॥४॥

text: Atharvan and this Angiras in Kāla are supreme o'er heaven. Both this world and the world that is most lofty, the pure worlds and pure intermediate spaces,— Yea, having conquered all the worlds by Brahma, Kāla as God Supreme is supplicated.
meaning: काले॒ ऽय॒म् अ॒ङ्गिरा देवो॒ ऽथर्वा चा॒धि तिष्ठतः । इमं॒ च लोकं॒ परमं॒ च लोकं॒ पु॒ण्यांश् च लोका॒न् वि॒धृतीश् च पु॒ण्याः । स॒र्वांल् लोका॒न् अभिजि॒त्य ब्र॒ह्मणा कालः॒ स॒ ईयते परमो॒ नु॒ देवः॒ ॥५॥

text: Bringing, as 'twere, with care unceasing fodder night after night to feed this stabled Courser, Joying in food and in the growth of riches, may we thy neigh- bours, Agni, ne'er be injured.
meaning: रा॒त्रिंरात्रिम् अ॒प्रयातं भ॒रन्तो॒ ऽश्वायेव ति॒ष्ठते घास॒म् अस्मै॒ । राय॒स् पो॒षेण स॒म् इषा॒ म॒दन्तो मा॒ ते अग्ने प्र॒तिवेशा रिषाम ॥१॥

text: Here is thine own desire for wealth: through this be gracious unto us. Joying in food and in the growth of riches, may we thy neigh- bours, Agni, ne'er be injured.
meaning: या॒ ते व॒सोर् वा॒त इ॒षुः सा॒ त एषा॒ त॒या नो मृड । राय॒स् पो॒षेण स॒म् इषा॒ म॒दन्तो मा॒ ते अग्ने प्र॒तिवेशा रिषाम ॥२॥

text: Each eve that comes our household's Lord is Agni, showing his. loving-kindness every morning. Bestow upon us treasure after treasure: enkindling thee may we increase thy body.
meaning: सायं॒सायं गृह॒पतिर् नो अग्निः॒ प्रातः॒प्रातः सौमनस॒स्य दाता॒ । व॒सोर्वसोर् वसुदा॒न एधि वयं॒ त्वे॒न्धानास् तन्वं॑ पुषेम ॥३॥

text: Each morn that comes our household's Lord is Agni, showing. his loving-kindness every evening. Vouchsafe us treasure after treasure: kindling thee may we prosper through a hundred winters.
meaning: प्रातः॒प्रातर् गृह॒पतिर् नो अग्निः॒ सायं॒सायं सौमनस॒स्य दाता॒ । व॒सोर्वसोर् वसुदा॒न एधी॒न्धानास् त्वा शतं॒हिमा ऋधेम ॥४॥

text: Never may I come short of food to feed me. Glory to Agni, Rudra, the consumer and the Lord of food!
meaning: अ॒पश्चा दग्धा॒न्नस्य भूयासम् । अन्नादा॒यान्नपतये रुद्रा॒य न॒मो अग्न॒ये । सभ्यः॒ सभां॒ मे पाहि ये॒ च सभ्याः॒ सभास॒दः ॥५॥

text: Protect my company, protect its courteous members, courteous. God! Only through thee, O much-invoked, may I be ever rich in kine. Only to thee bringing our tribute, Agni, each day as fodder to a stabled courser, Joying in food and in the growth of riches, may we the neigh- bours, Agni ne'er be injured.
meaning: त्वाम् इन्द्रा पुरुहूत वि॒श्वम् आ॒युर् व्य् अ॑श्नवन् । अ॒हरहर् बलि॒म् इ॒त् ते ह॒रन्तो॒ ऽश्वायेव ति॒ष्ठते घास॒म् अग्ने ॥६॥

text: Thou art come hither from the world of Yama: thou, resolute, affectest men with rapture. Thou, Sleep, created in the Asura's dwelling, goest, well-know- ing, with the solitary.
meaning: यम॒स्य लोका॒द् अ॒ध्य् आ॒ बभूविथ प्र॒मदा म॒र्त्यान् प्र॒ युनक्षि धी॒रः । एकाकि॒ना सर॒थं यासि विद्वा॒न्त् स्व॒प्नं मि॒मानो अ॒सुरस्य यो॒नौ ॥१॥

text: At first the all-containing, depth beheld thee, ere Night was born, when only Day existed. Thence hast thou come, thence, Sleep, hast thou come hither, concealing, deep within, all form and figure.
meaning: बन्ध॒स् त्वा॒ग्रे विश्व॒चया अपश्यत् पुरा॒ रा॒त्र्या ज॒नितोर् ए॒के अ॒ह्नि । त॒तः स्वप्नेद॒म् अ॒ध्य् आ॒ बभूविथ भिष॒ग्भ्यो रूप॒म् अपगू॒हमानः ॥२॥

text: Come from the Asuras in lofty, glory, he hath approached the Gods in search of greatness. Winners of heavenly light, the Three-and-Thirty endowed this Sleep with his supreme dominion.
meaning: बृहद्गा॒वा॒सुरेभ्यो॒ ऽधि देवा॒न् उ॒पावर्तत महिमा॒नम् इछ॒न् । त॒स्मै स्व॒प्नाय दधुर् आ॒धिपत्यं त्रयस्त्रिंशा॒सः स्व॑र् आनशानाः॒ ॥३॥

text: Of him nor Fathers nor the Gods have knowledge, the Gods whose gentle talk is still about him. Urged by command of Varuna the Ādityas, Heroes, transported Sleep to Trita Āptya.
meaning: नै॒तां॒ विदुः पित॒रो नो॒त॒ देवा॒ ये॒षां ज॒ल्पिश् च॒रत्य् अन्तरे॒द॒म् । त्रिते॒ स्व॒प्नम् अदधुर् आप्त्ये॒ न॒र आदित्या॒सो व॒रुणेना॒नुशिष्टाः ॥४॥

text: Thou whose severity hath reached ill-doers, and whose reward the good have gained in slumber, Delightest heaven with thy most lofty kinship, born from his spirit who was worn and weary.
meaning: य॒स्य क्रूर॒म् अ॒भजन्त दुष्कृ॒तो ऽस्व॒प्नेन सुकृ॒तः पु॒ण्यम् आ॒युः । स्व॑र् मदसि परमे॒ण बन्धु॒ना तप्य॒मानस्य म॒नसो॒ ऽधि जज्ञिषे ॥५॥

text: Of old we know all places whence thou comest. O Sleep, we know him who is here thy ruler. Protect us here illustrious with glory. Go, from afar, with poisons, into distance.
meaning: विद्म॒ ते स॒र्वाः परिजाः॒ पुर॒स्ताद् विद्म॒ स्वप्न यो॒ अधिपा॒ इहा॒ ते । यशश्वि॒नो नो य॒शसेह॒ पाह्य् आरा॒द् द्विषे॒भिर् अ॒प याहि दूर॒म् ॥६॥

text: As men discharge the utmost debt, collect the eighth and sixteenth part, So to the foeman we transfer together all the evil dream.
meaning: य॒था कलां॒ य॒था शफं॒ य॒था र्णं॒ सम्न॒यन्ति । एवा॒ दुष्व॒प्न्यं स॒र्वम् अ॒प्रिये सं॒ नयामसि ॥१॥

text: Princes came together, debts came together, Kushthas came to- gether, Sixteenths came together. The whole evil dream that hath visited us we send away as a bad dream to the man who hates us.
meaning: सं॒ रा॒जानो अगुः स॒म् ऋणा॒म्य् अगुः सं॒ कुष्ठा॒ अगुः सं॒ कला॒ अगुः । स॒म् अस्मा॒सु य॒द् दुष्व॒प्न्यं नि॒र् द्विषते॒ दुष्व॒प्न्यं सुवाम ॥२॥

text: Child of Gods' Consorts, minister of Yama is the good Dream: that which is my trouble we drive away to the enemy.
meaning: दे॒वानां पत्नीनां गर्भ य॒मस्य कर यो॒ भद्रः॒ स्वप्न । स॒ म॒म यः॒ पाप॒स् त॒द् द्विषते॒ प्र॒ हिण्मः । मा॒ तृष्टा॒नाम् असि कृष्णशकुने॒र् मु॒खम् ॥३॥

text: Thou whose name is Rough art the mouth of the Black Bird. As such we know thee, Dream, as such we know thee well. Like a horse art thou, O Dream. As they bind girth and surcingle on a horse, so bind the alien mischief-maker, the scorner of the Gods.
meaning: तं॒ त्वा स्वप्न त॒था सं॒ विद्म स॒ त्वं॒ स्वप्ना॒श्व इव काय॒म् अ॒श्व इव नीनाह॒म् । अनास्माकं॒ देवपीयुं॒ पि॒यारुं वप य॒द् अस्मा॒सु दुष्व॒प्न्यं य॒द् गो॒षु य॒च् च नो गृहे॒ ॥४॥

text: The evil dream that threatens us, threatens our cattle or our home. That let the scorner of the Gods, the alien mischief-maker bind as a gold jewel round his neck. Having measured off nine cubits' distance from us we give away the whole of the evil dream to the man who hates us.
meaning: अनास्माक॒स् त॒द् देवपीयुः॒ पि॒यारुर् निष्क॒म् इव प्र॒ति मुञ्चताम् । न॒वारत्नी॒न् अ॒पमया अस्मा॒कं त॒तः प॒रि । दुष्व॒प्न्यं स॒र्वं द्विषते॒ नि॒र् दयामसि ॥५॥

text: Still equal be the flow of butter ever causing the Year to prosper with oblation. Still be our hearing, sight, and breath uninjured: let us lose nothing of our life and vigour.
meaning: घृत॒स्य जूतिः॒ स॒मना स॒देवा संवत्सरं॒ हवि॒षा वर्ध॒यन्ती । श्रो॒त्रं च॒क्षुः प्राणो॒ ऽछिन्नो नो अस्त्व् अ॒छिन्ना वय॒म् आ॒युषो व॒र्चसः ॥१॥

text: Let lively breath invite us: we call vital breath to visit us. Earth and air's middle realm have gathered, Soma, Brihaspati and Dhartar gathered vigour.
meaning: उ॒पास्मा॒न् प्राणो॒ ह्वयताम् उ॒प प्राणं॒ हवामहे । व॒र्चो जग्राह पृथिव्य् अ॑न्त॒रिक्षं व॒र्चः सो॒मो बृ॒हस्प॒तिर् विधत्ता॒ ॥२॥

text: The earth and heaven have come to be two gatherers up of vigo- rous might. So let us gather vigour up and closely follow after Earth. With glory come the cows and stand beside the master of the herd. Let us when we have gathered fame and glory closely follow Earth.
meaning: व॒र्चसो द्यावापृथिवी॒ संग्र॒हणी बभूव॒थुर् व॒र्चो गृहीत्वा पृथिवी॒म् अ॒नु सं॒ चरेम । यश॒सम् गा॒वो गो॒पतिम् उ॒प तिष्ठन्त्य् आयती॒र् य॒शो गृहीत्वा॒ पृथिवी॒म् अ॒नु सं॒ चरेम ॥३॥

text: Prepare the cow-stall, for there drink your heroes: stitch ye the coats of armour wide and many. Make iron forts defying all assailants: let not your pitcher leak; stay it securely.
meaning: व्रजं॒ कृणुध्वं स॒ हि॒ वो नृपा॒णो व॒र्मा सीव्यध्वं बहुला॒ पृथू॒नि । पु॒रः कृणुध्वम् आ॒यसीर् अ॒धृष्टा मा॒ वः सुस्रोच् चमसो॒ दृंहत त॒म् ॥४॥

text: The eye of sacrifice, source and beginning with voice, car, spirit unto him I offer. To this our sacrifice, wrought by Visvakarman, may the Gods come gracious and kindly-hearted.
meaning: यज्ञ॒स्य च॒क्षुः प्र॒भृतिर् मु॒खं च वाचा॒ श्रो॒त्रेण म॒नसा जुहोमि । इमं॒ यज्ञं॒ वि॒ततं विश्व॒कर्मणा॒ देवा॒ यन्तु सुमनस्य॒मानाः ॥५॥

text: Let the Gods' Priests and those who merit worship, to whom oblation as their share is offered, Come to this holy service with their Consorts, and all Gods revel in the food we bring them.
meaning: ये॒ देवा॒नाम् ऋत्वि॒जो ये॒ च यज्ञि॒या ये॒भ्यो हव्यं॒ क्रिय॒ते भागधे॒यम् । इमं॒ यज्ञं॒ सह॒ प॒त्नीभिर् ए॒त्य या॒वन्तो देवा॒स् तविषा॒ मादयन्ताम् ॥६॥

text: God among mortals, Agni, thou art guard of holy Law, thou art To be adored in sacred rites.
meaning: त्व॒म् अग्ने व्रतपा॒ असि देव॒ आ॒ म॒र्त्येष्व् आ॒ । त्वं॒ यज्ञे॒ष्व् ई॒ड्यः ॥१॥

text: When, ignorant, we violate the statutes of you, O Deities, with whom is knowledge, Wise Agni shall correct our faults and failings, and Soma who hath entered into Brāhmans.
meaning: य॒द् वो वयं॒ प्रमिना॒म व्रता॒नि विदु॒षां देवा अ॒विदुष्टरासः । अग्नि॒ष् ट॒द् विश्वा॒द् आ॒ पृणातु विद्वा॒न्त् सो॒मस्य यो॒ ब्राह्मणां॒ आविवे॒श ॥२॥

text: To the Gods' pathway have we come desiring to execute what work we may accomplish. Let Agni—for he knows—complete the worship. He is the Priest: let him fix rites and seasons.
meaning: आ॒ देवा॒नाम् अ॒पि प॒न्थाम् अगन्म य॒च् छक्न॒वाम त॒द् अनुप्र॒वोढुम् । अग्नि॒र् विद्वा॒न्त् स॒ यजात् स॒ इ॒द् धो॒ता सो॒ ऽध्वरा॒न्त् स॒ ऋतू॒न् कल्पयाति ॥३॥

text: May I have voice in my mouth, breath in my nostrils, sight in mine eyes, hearing in mine ears, hair that hath not turned gray, teeth free from yellowness, and much strength in mine arms.
meaning: वा॒ङ् म आस॒न् नसोः॒ प्राण॒श् च॒क्षुर् अक्ष्णोः॒ श्रो॒त्रं क॒र्णयोः । अ॒पलिताः के॒शा अ॒शोणा द॒न्ता बहु॒ बाह्वो॒र् ब॒लम् ॥१॥

text: May I have power in my thighs, swiftness in my legs, stedfast- ness in my feet. May all my members be uninjured and my soul unimpaired.
meaning: ऊर्वो॒र् ओ॒जो ज॒ङ्घयोर् जवः॒ पा॒दयोः । प्रतिष्ठा॒ अ॒रिष्टानि मे स॒र्वात्मा॒निभृष्टः ॥२॥

text: May my self remain in my body: may I enjoy the full time of life, Rest thee pleasantly: pour forth abundance, purifying thyself in Svarga.
meaning: तनू॒स् तन्वा॑ मे सहे दतः॒ स॒र्वम् आ॒युर् अशीय । स्योनं॒ मे सीद पुरुः॒ पृणस्व प॒वमानः स्वर्गे॒ ॥१॥

text: Make me beloved among the Gods, beloved among the Princes, make Me dear to everyone who sees, to Sūdra and to Aryan man.
meaning: प्रियं॒ मा कृणु देवे॒षु प्रियं॒ रा॒जसु मा कृणु । प्रियं॒ स॒र्वस्य प॒श्यत उत॒ शूद्र॒ उता॒र्ये ॥१॥

text: Rise up, O Brāhmanaspati; awake the Gods with sacrifice. Strengthen the Sacrificer: aid life, breath, and off-spring, cattle, fame.
meaning: उ॒त् तिष्ठ ब्रह्मणस् पते देवा॒न् यज्ञे॒न बोधय । आ॒युः प्राणं॒ प्रजां॒ पशू॒न् कीर्तिं॒ य॒जमानं च वर्धय ॥१॥

text: For lofty Jātavedas I have brought the fuel hither first. May he who knoweth all bestow faith and intelligence on me.
meaning: अ॒ग्ने समि॒धम् आ॒हार्षं बृहते॒ जात॒वेदसे । स॒ मे श्रद्धां॒ च मेधां॒ च जात॒वेदाः प्र॒ यछतु ॥१॥

text: With fuel and with flaming wood we, Jātavedas, strengthen thee; So do thou strengthen us in turn with children and with store of wealth.
meaning: इध्मे॒न त्वा जातवेदः समि॒धा वर्धयामसि । त॒था त्व॒म् अस्मा॒न् वर्धय प्रज॒या च ध॒नेन च ॥२॥

text: Whatever even be the logs which, Agni, we lay down for thee, propitious be it all to me: accept it, O most youthful God.
meaning: य॒द् अग्ने या॒नि का॒नि चिद् आ॒ ते दा॒रूणि दध्म॒सि । स॒र्वं त॒द् अस्तु मे शिवं॒ त॒ज् जुषस्व यविष्ठ्य ॥३॥

text: Agni, these logs are thine: with these be, fain to burn! a flaming brand. Vouchsafe us length of life and give us hope of immortality.
meaning: एता॒स् ते अग्ने समि॒धस् त्व॒म् इद्धः॒ समि॒द् भव । आ॒युर् अस्मा॒सु धेह्य् अमृतत्व॒म् आचार्या॑य ॥४॥

text: A Golden Eagle thou hast soared with light to heaven. Those who would harm thee as thou fliest skyward. Beat down, O Jātavedas, with thy fury. The strong hath feared: to heaven mount up with light, O Sūrya.
meaning: ह॒रिः सुपर्णो॒ दि॒वम् आ॒रुहो ऽर्चि॒षा ये॒ त्वा दि॒प्सन्ति दि॒वम् उत्प॒तन्तम् । अ॒व तां॒ जहि ह॒रसा जातवेदो॒ ऽबिभ्यद् उग्रो॒ ऽर्चि॒षा दि॒वम् आ॒ रोह सूर्य ॥१॥

text: The Asuras with iron nets, magicians, who roam about with hooks and bonds of iron, With wrath I make thy thralls, O Jātavedas. Come as a bolt foe- quelling, thousand pointed.
meaning: अ॒योजाला अ॒सुरा मायि॒नो ऽयस्म॒यैः पा॒शैर् अङ्कि॒नो ये॒ च॒रन्ति । तां॒स् ते रन्धयामि ह॒रसा जातवेदः सह॒स्रऋष्टिः सप॒त्नान् प्रमृण॒न् पाहि व॒ज्रः ॥१॥

text: A hundred autumns may we see.
meaning: प॒श्येम शर॒दः शत॒म् ॥१॥

text: A hundred autumns may we live.
meaning: जी॒वेम शर॒दः शत॒म् ॥२॥

text: A hundred autumns may we know.
meaning: बु॒ध्येम शर॒दः शत॒म् ॥३॥

text: A hundred autumns may we grow.
meaning: रो॒हेम शर॒दः शत॒म् ॥४॥

text: A hundred autumns may we thrive.
meaning: पू॒षेम शर॒दः शत॒म् ॥५॥

text: A hundred autumns may we be.
meaning: भ॒वेम शर॒दः शत॒म् ॥६॥

text: A hundred autumns may we bide.
meaning: भू॒षेम शर॒दः शत॒म् ॥७॥

text: A hundred, yea, and even more.
meaning: भू॒यसीः शर॒दः शत॒म् ॥८॥

text: Both of broad and narrow I with magic power unclose the mouth. With these when we have raised the bunch of grass we pay the holy rites.
meaning: अ॒व्यसश् च व्य॒चसश् च बि॒लं वि॒ ष्यामि माय॒या । ता॒भ्याम् उद्धृ॒त्य वे॒दम् अ॒थ क॒र्माणि कृण्महे ॥१॥

text: Ye are alive. I fain would live. I fain would live my complete term of life.
meaning: जीवा॒ स्थ जीव्या॒सं स॒र्वम् आ॒युर् जीव्यासम् ॥१॥

text: Ye live dependent. I fain would live dependent. I fain would live my complete term of life.
meaning: उपजीवा॒ स्थो॒प जीव्यासं स॒र्वम् आ॒युर् जीव्यासम् ॥२॥

text: Ye remain alive. I fain would remain alive. I fain would live my complete term of life.
meaning: संजीवा॒ स्थ सं॒ जीव्यासं स॒र्वम् आ॒युर् जीव्यासम् ॥३॥

text: Ye are life-givers. I fain would live. I fain would live my com- plete term of life.
meaning: जीवला॒ स्थ जीव्या॒सं स॒र्वम् आ॒युर् जीव्यासम् ॥४॥

text: Live, Indra. Live Sūrya. Live, ye Gods. I fain would live. Fain would I live my complete term of life.
meaning: इ॒न्द्र जी॒व सू॒र्य जी॒व दे॒वा जी॒वा जीव्या॒सम् अह॒म् । स॒र्वम् आ॒युर् जीव्यासम् ॥१॥

text: Let my libations, giving boons, adoring, further the Twice-born's song that honours Soma. Go ye to Brahma's world having enriched me with life and breath, with children and with cattle, with fame and wealth, and with a Brāhman's lustre.
meaning: स्तुता॒ म॒या वरदा॒ वेदमाता॒ प्र॒ चोदयन्तां पावमानी॒ द्विजा॒नाम् । आ॒युः प्राणं॒ प्रजां॒ पशुं॒ कीर्तिं॒ द्र॒विणं ब्रह्मवर्चस॒म् । म॒ह्यं दत्त्वा॒ व्रजत ब्रह्मलोक॒म् ॥१॥

text: Within the chest whence we before extracted the bunch of grass, this do we now deposit. Wrought is the sacrifice by power of Brahma. Through this assist me here, ye God, with Fervour.
meaning: य॒स्मात् को॒शाद् उद॒भराम वे॒दं त॒स्मिन्न् अन्त॒र् अ॒व दध्म एनम् । कृत॒म् इष्टं॒ ब्र॒ह्मणो वीर्ये॑ण ते॒न मा देवास् त॒पसावतेह॒ ॥१॥

text: Thee, Indra, we invoke, the Bull, what time the Soma hath been pressed. Drink of the sweetly-flavoured juice.
meaning: इ॒न्द्र त्वा वृषभं॒ वयं॒ सुते॒ सो॒मे हवामहे । स॒ पाहि म॒ध्वो अ॒न्धसः ॥१॥

text: The best of guardian hath the man within whose dwelling-place ye drink, O Maruts, giants of the sky.
meaning: म॒रुतो य॒स्य हि॒ क्ष॒ये पाथा॒ दिवो॒ विमहसः । स॒ सुगोपा॒तमो ज॒नः ॥२॥

text: Let us serve Agni with our hyms, Sage who consumeth ox and cow, Who beareth Soma on his back.
meaning: उक्षा॒न्नाय वशा॒न्नाय सो॒मपृष्ठाय वेध॒से । स्तो॒मैर् विधेमाग्न॒ये ॥३॥

text: Let the Maruts drink Trishtups from the Potar's cup, according to the season Soma from heaven.
meaning: मरु॒तः पोत्रा॒त् सुष्टु॒भः स्वर्का॒द् ऋतु॒ना सो॒मं पिबन्तु ॥१॥

text: Let Agni from the Kindler's cup drink Trishtups, according to the season Soma from heaven.
meaning: अग्नि॒र् आ॒ग्नीध्रात् सुष्टु॒भः स्वर्का॒द् ऋतु॒ना सो॒मं पिबतु ॥२॥

text: Let Indra the Brāhman from the Brāhman's cup drink Trishtups, according to the season Soma from heaven.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रो ब्रह्मा॒ ब्रा॒ह्मणात् सुष्टु॒भः स्वर्का॒द् ऋतु॒ना सो॒मं पिबतु ॥३॥

text: Let the God, Granter of Wealth, from the Potar's cup drink Trishtups, according to the season Soma from heaven.
meaning: देवो॒ द्रविणोदाः॒ पोत्रा॒त् सुष्टु॒भः स्वर्का॒द् ऋतु॒ना सो॒मं पिबतु ॥४॥

text: Come, we have pressed the juice for thee: O Indra, drink this Soma here. Seat thee on this my sacred grass.
meaning: आ॒ याहि सुषुमा॒ हि॒ त इ॒न्द्र सो॒मं पि॒बा इम॒म् । ए॒दं॒ बर्हिः॒ सदो म॒म ॥१॥

text: Let both thy bay steeds, yoked by prayer long-maned, O Indra, bring thee nigh.
meaning: आ॒ त्वा ब्रह्मयु॒जा ह॒री व॒हताम् इन्द्र केशि॒ना । उ॒प ब्र॒ह्माणि नः शृणु ॥२॥

text: We Soma-bearing Brāhmans call thee Soma-drinker with thy friend, We, Indra, who have pressed the juice.
meaning: ब्रह्मा॒णस् त्वा वयं॒ युजा॒ सोमपा॒म् इन्द्र सोमि॒नः । सुता॒वन्तो हवामहे ॥३॥

text: Come unto us who poured the juice, come hither to our eulogies. Drink of the juice, O fair of face.
meaning: आ॒ नो याहि सुता॒वतो ऽस्मा॒कं सुष्टुती॒र् उ॒प । पि॒बा सु॒ शिप्रिन्न् अ॒न्धसः ॥१॥

text: I pour it down within thee, so through all thy members let it run. Take with thy tongue the pleasant drink.
meaning: आ॒ ते सिञ्चामि कुक्ष्यो॒र् अ॒नु गा॒त्रा वि॒ धावतु । गृभाय॒ जिह्व॒या म॒धु ॥२॥

text: Sweet to thy body let it be, delicious be the savoury juice. Sweet be the Soma to thy heart.
meaning: स्वादु॒ष् टे अस्तु संसु॒दे म॒धुमान् तन्वे॑ त॒व । सो॒मः श॒म् अस्तु ते हृदे॒ ॥३॥

text: Like women, let this Soma juice invested with its raiment, glide.. Most active Indra, close to thee.
meaning: अय॒म् उ त्वा विचर्षणे ज॒नीर् इवाभि॒ सं॒वृतः । प्र॒ सो॒म इन्द्र सर्पतु ॥१॥

text: Mighty in bulk, strong-necked, stout-armed in the wild rapture. of the juice Doth Indra smite the foemen dead.
meaning: तुविग्री॒वो वपो॒दरः सुबाहु॒र् अ॒न्धसो स॒दे । इ॒न्द्रो वृत्रा॒णि जिघ्नते ॥२॥

text: Indra, advance, go forward thou who by thy might art Lord of all. Slay, Vritra-slayer slay thy foes.
meaning: इ॒न्द्र प्रे॒हि पुर॒स् त्वं॒ वि॒श्वस्ये॒शान ओ॒जसा । वृत्रा॒णि वृत्रहं जहि ॥३॥

text: Long be thy grasping-hook wherewith thou givest treasure unto- him Who pours the juice and worships thee.
meaning: दीर्घ॒स् ते अस्त्व् अङ्कुशो॒ ये॒ना व॒सु प्रय॒छसि । य॒जमानाय सुन्वते॒ ॥४॥

text: Here, Indra, is thy Soma draught, made pure upon the sacred. grass. Run hither, come and drink thereof.
meaning: अयं॒ त इन्द्र सो॒मो नि॒पूतो अ॒धि बर्हि॒षि । ए॒हीम् अस्य॒ द्र॒वा पि॒ब ॥५॥

text: Famed for thy radiance, worshipped well! this juice is shed for thy delight: Thou art invoked, Ākhandala!
meaning: शा॒चिगो शा॒चिपूजनायं॒ र॒णाय ते सुतः॒ । आ॒खण्डल प्र॒ हूयसे ॥६॥

text: To Kundapāyya, grandson's son, grandson of Sringavrish, to thee, To him have I addressed my thought.
meaning: य॒स् ते शृङ्गवृषो नपात् प्र॒णपात् कुण्डपा॒य्यः । न्य् अ॑स्मिन् दध्र आ॒ म॒नः ॥७॥

text: Thee, Indra, we invoke, the Bull, what time the Soma is ex- pressed. So drink thou of the savoury juice.
meaning: इ॒न्द्र त्वा वृषभं॒ वयं॒ सुते॒ सो॒मे हवामहे । स॒ पाहि म॒ध्वो अ॒न्धसः ॥१॥

text: Indra, whom many laud, accept the strength-confering Soma juice. Quaff, pour down drink that satisfies.
meaning: इ॒न्द्र क्रतुवि॒दं सुतं॒ सो॒मं हर्य पुरुष्टुत । पि॒बा॒ वृषस्व ता॒तृपिम् ॥२॥

text: Indra, with all the Gods promote our wealth-bestowing sacrifice, Thou highly-lauded Lord of men.
meaning: इ॒न्द्र प्र॒ णो धिता॒वानं यज्ञं॒ वि॒श्वेभिर् देवे॒भिर् । तिर॒ स्तवान विश्पते ॥३॥

text: Lord of the brave, to thee proceed these drops of Soma juice expressed, The bright drops to thy dwelling-place.
meaning: इ॒न्द्र सो॒माः सुता॒ इमे॒ त॒व प्र॒ यन्ति सत्पते । क्ष॒यं चन्द्रा॒स इ॒न्दवः ॥४॥

text: Within thy belly, Indra take Soma the juice most excellent: The heavenly drops belong to thee.
meaning: दधिष्वा॒ जठ॒रे सुतं॒ सो॒मम् इन्द्र व॒रेण्यम् । त॒व द्युक्षा॒स इ॒न्दवः ॥५॥

text: Drink our libation, Lord of hymns: with streams of meath thou art bedewed: Our glory, Indra, is thy gift.
meaning: गि॒र्वणः पाहि॒ नः सुतं॒ म॒धोर् धा॒राभिर् अज्यसे । इ॒न्द्र त्वा॒दातम् इ॒द् य॒शः ॥६॥

text: To Indra go the treasures of the worshipper which never fail: He drinks the Soma and is strong.
meaning: अभि॒ द्युम्ना॒नि वनि॒न इ॒न्द्रं सचन्ते अ॒क्षिता । पीत्वी॒ सो॒मस्य वावृधे ॥७॥

text: From far away, from near at hand, O Vritra-slayer, come to us: Accept the songs we sing to thee.
meaning: अर्वाव॒तो न आ॒ गहि पराव॒तश् च वृत्रहन् । इमा॒ जुषस्व नो गि॒रः ॥८॥

text: य॒द् अन्तरा॒ पराव॒तम् अर्वाव॒तं च हूय॒से । इ॒न्द्रेह॒ त॒त आ॒ गहि ॥९॥
Sūrya, thou mountest up to meet the Hero famous for his wealth, Who hurls the bolt and works for man:
meaning: उ॒द् घे॒द् अभि॒ श्रुता॒मघं वृषभं॒ न॒र्यापसम् । अ॒स्तारम् एषि सूर्य ॥१॥

text: Him who with might of both his arms brake nine-and ninety castles down, Slew Vritra and smote Ahi dead.
meaning: न॒व यो॒ नवतिं॒ पु॒रो बिभे॒द बाह्वो॑जसा । अ॒हिं च वृत्रहा॒वधीत् ॥२॥

text: This Indra is our gracious Friend. He sends us in a full broad stream Riches in horses, kine, and corn.
meaning: स॒ न इ॒न्द्रः शिवः॒ स॒खा॒श्वावद् गो॒मद् य॒वमत् । उरु॒धारेव दोहते ॥३॥

text: Indra, whom many laud, accept the strength-conferring Soma juice. Quaff, pour down drink that satisfies.
meaning: इ॒न्द्र क्रतुवि॒दं सुतं॒ सो॒मं हर्य पुरुष्टुत । पिबा॒ वृषस्व ता॒तृपिम् ॥४॥

text: Drink as of old, and let the draught delight thee: hear thou my prayer and let our songs exalt thee. Make the Sun visible, make food abundant: slaughter the foes,. pierce through and free the cattle.
meaning: एवा॒ पाहि प्रत्न॒था म॒न्दतु त्वा श्रुधि॒ ब्र॒ह्म वावृध॒स्वोत॒ गीर्भिः॒ । आविः॒ सू॒र्यं कृणुहि॒ पीपिही॒षो जहि॒ श॒त्रूंर् अभि॒ गा॒ इन्द्र तृन्धि ॥१॥

text: Come to us; they have called thee Soma-lover. Here is the pressed juice: drink thereof for rapture. Widely-capacious, pour it down within thee, and invocated hear us like a father.
meaning: अर्वा॒ङ् ए॒हि सो॒मकामं त्वाहुर् अयं॒ सुत॒स् त॒स्य पिबा म॒दाय । उरुव्य॒चा जठ॒र आ॒ वृषस्व पिते॒व नः शृणुहि हूय॒मानः ॥२॥

text: Full is his chalice. Blessing! Like a pourer I have filled up the vessel for his drinking. Presented on the right, dear Soma juices have brought us Indra,. to rejoice him, hither.
meaning: आ॒पूर्णो अस्य कल॒शः स्वा॒हा से॒क्तेव को॒शं सिषिचे पि॒बध्यै । स॒म् उ प्रिया॒ आ॒ववृत्रन् म॒दाय प्रदक्षिणि॒द् अभि॒ सो॒मास इ॒न्द्रम् ॥३॥

text: As cows low to their calves in stalls, so with our songs we glorify This Indra, even your wondrous God who checks attack, who joys in the delicious juice.
meaning: तं॒ वो दस्म॒म् ऋतीष॒हम् व॒सोर् मन्दान॒म् अ॒न्धसः । अभि॒ वत्सं॒ न॒ स्व॒सरेषु धेन॒व इ॒न्द्रं गीर्भि॒र् नवामहे ॥१॥

text: Celestial, bounteous Giver, girt about with might, rich, moun- tain-like, in precious things Him swift we seek for foodful booty rich in kine, brought hundredfold and thousandfold.
meaning: द्युक्षं॒ सुदा॒नुं त॒विषीभिर् आ॒वृतं गिरिं॒ न॒ पुरुभो॒जसम् । क्षुम॒न्तं वा॒जं शति॒नं सहस्रि॒णं मक्षू॒ गो॒मन्तम् ईमहे ॥२॥

text: I crave of thee that hero strength, that thou mayst first regard this prayer, Wherewith thou helpest Bhrigu and the Yatis and Praskanva when the prize was staked.
meaning: त॒त् त्वा यामि सुवी॒र्यं त॒द् ब्र॒ह्म पूर्व॒चित्तये । ये॒ना य॒तिभ्यो भृ॒गवे ध॒ने हिते॒ ये॒न प्र॒स्कण्वम् आ॒विथ ॥३॥

text: Wherewith thou sentest mighty waters to the sea, that, Indra, is. thy hero strength. For ever unattainable is this power of him to whom the worlds. have called aloud.
meaning: ये॒ना समुद्र॒म् अ॒सृजो मही॒र् अप॒स् त॒द् इन्द्र वृ॒ष्णि ते श॒वः । सद्यः॒ सो॒ अस्य महिमा॒ न॒ संन॒शे यं॒ क्षोणी॒र् अनुचक्रदे॒ ॥४॥

text: These songs of ours exceeding sweet, these hymns of praise as- cend to thee, Like ever-conquering chariots that display their strength, gain wealth and give unfailing aid.
meaning: उ॒द् उ ते॒ म॒धुमत्तमा गि॒र स्तो॒मास ईरते । सत्राजि॒तो धनसा॒ अ॒क्षितोतयो वाजय॒न्तो र॒था इव ॥१॥

text: The Bhrigus are like suns, like Kanvas, and have gained all that their thoughts were bent to win. The living men of Priyamedha's race have sung exalting Indra with their lauds.
meaning: क॒ण्वा इव भृ॒गवः सू॒र्या इव वि॒श्वम् इ॒द् धीत॒म् आनशुः । इ॒न्द्रं स्तो॒मेभिर् मह॒यन्त आय॒वः प्रिय॒मेधासो अस्वरन् ॥२॥

text: Fort-render, Lord of Wealth, dispelling foemen, Indra with lightnings hath o'ercome the Dāsa. Impelled by prayer and waxen great in body, he hath filled earth and heaven, the bounteous Giver.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रः पूर्भि॒द् आ॒तिरद् दा॒सम् अर्कै॒र् विद॒द्वसुर् द॒यमानो वि॒ श॒त्रून् । ब्र॒ह्मजूतस् तन्वा॑ वावृधानो॒ भू॒रिदात्र आ॒पृणद् रो॒दसी उभे॒ ॥१॥

text: I stimulate this zeal, the Strong, the Hero, decking my song of praise for thee Immortal. O Indra, thou art equally the leader of heavenly hosts and human generations.
meaning: मख॒स्य ते तविष॒स्य प्र॒ जूति॒म् इ॒यर्मि वा॒चम् अमृ॒ताय भू॒षन् । इ॒न्द्र क्षितीना॒म् असि मा॒नुषीणां विशां॒ दै॒वीनाम् उत॒ पूर्वया॒वा ॥२॥

text: Leading his band Indra encompassed Vritra; weak grew the wily leader enchanters. He who burns fierce in forests slaughtered Vyansa, and made the milch-kine of nights apparent.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रो वृत्र॒म् अवृणोच् छ॒र्धनीतिः प्र॒ मायि॒नाम् अमिनाद् व॒र्पणीतिः । अ॒हन् व्यं॑सम् उश॒धग् व॒नेष्व् आवि॒र् धे॒ना अकृणोद् राम्या॒णाम् ॥३॥

text: Indra, light-winner, days' creator, conquered, as guardian, hostile bands with those who loved him. For man the days' bright ensign he illumined, and found the light for his great joy and gladness.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रः स्वर्षा॒ जन॒यन्न् अ॒हानि जिगा॒योशि॒ग्भिः पृ॒तना अभिष्टिः॒ । प्रा॒रोचयन् म॒नवे केतु॒म् अ॒ह्नाम् अ॒विन्दज् ज्यो॒तिर् बृहते॒ र॒णाय ॥४॥

text: Forward to fiercely falling blows pressed Indra, hero-like doing many hero exploits. Those holy songs he taught the bard who praised him, and widely spread these Dawns' resplendent colour.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रस् तु॒जो बर्ह॒णा आ॒ विवेश नृव॒द् द॒धानो न॒र्या पुरू॒णि । अ॒चेतयद् धि॒य इमा॒ जरित्रे॒ प्रे॒मं॒ व॒र्णम् अतिरच् छुक्र॒म् आसाम् ॥५॥

text: They laud the mighty acts of him the mighty, the many glorious deeds performed by Indra. He in his strength, with all-surpassing prowess, through wond- rous arts crushed the malignant Dasyus.
meaning: महो॒ महा॒नि पनयन्त्य् अस्ये॒न्द्रस्य क॒र्म सु॒कृता पुरू॒णि । वृज॒नेन वृजिना॒न्त् सं॒ पिपेष माया॒भिर् दस्यूं॒र् अभि॒भूत्योजाः ॥६॥

text: Lord of the brave, Indra who rules the people gave freedom to the Gods by might and battle. Wise singers glorify with chanted praises these his achievements in Vivasvān's dwelling.
meaning: युधे॒न्द्रो मह्ना॒ व॒रिवश् चकार देवे॒भ्यः स॒त्पतिश् चर्षणिप्राः॒ । विव॒स्वतः स॒दने अस्य ता॒नि वि॒प्रा उक्थे॒भिः कव॒यो गृणन्ति ॥७॥

text: Excellent, conqueror, the victory-giver, the winner of the light and godlike waters, He who hath won this broad earth and this heaven,—in Indra they rejoice who love devotions.
meaning: सत्रासा॒हं व॒रेण्यं सहोदां॒ ससवां॒सं स्व॑र् अप॒श् च देवीः॒ । ससा॒न यः॒ पृथिवीं॒ द्या॒म् उते॒मा॒म् इ॒न्द्रं मदन्त्य् अ॒नु धी॒रणासः ॥८॥

text: He gained possession of the Sun and horses; Indra obtained the cow who feedeth many. Treasure of gold he won; he smote the Dasyus and gave protec- tion to the race of Aryas.
meaning: ससा॒ना॒त्यां उत॒ सू॒र्यं ससाने॒न्द्रः ससान पुरुभो॒जसं गा॒म् । हिरण्य॒यम् उत॒ भो॒गं ससान हत्वी॒ द॒स्यून् प्रा॒र्यं व॒र्णम् आवत् ॥९॥

text: He took the plants and days for his possession; he gained the forest trees and air's mid-region. Vala he cleft, and chased away opponents: thus was he tamer of the overweening.
meaning: इ॒न्द्र ओ॒षधीर् असनोद् अ॒हानि व॒नस्प॒तींर् असनोद् अन्त॒रिक्षम् । बिभे॒द बलं॒ नुनुदे॒ वि॒वाचो॒ ऽथाभवद् दमिता॒भि॒क्रतूनाम् ॥१०॥

text: Call we on Maghavan, auspicious Indra, best Hero in the fight where spoil is gathered, The Strong, who listens, who gives aid in battles, who slays the Vritras, wins and gathers treasures.
meaning: शुनं॒ हुवेम मघ॒वानम् इ॒न्द्रम् अस्मि॒न् भ॒रे नृ॒तमं वा॒जसातौ । शृण्व॒न्तम् उग्र॒म् ऊत॒ये सम॒त्सु घ्न॒न्तं वृत्रा॒णि संजि॒तं ध॒नानाम् ॥११॥

text: Prayers have been offered up through love of glory: Vasishtha, honour Indra in the battle. He who with might extends through all existence hears words which I, his faithful servant, utter.
meaning: उ॒द् उ ब्र॒ह्माण्य् ऐरत श्रवस्ये॒न्द्रं समर्ये॒ महया वसिष्ठ । आ॒ यो॒ वि॒श्वानि श॒वसा तता॒नोपश्रोता॒ म ई॒वतो व॒चांसि ॥१॥

text: A cry was raised which reached the Gods, O Indra, a cry to them to send us strength in combat. None among men knows his own life's duration: bear us in safety over these our troubles.
meaning: अ॒यामि घो॒ष इन्द्र देव॒जामिर् इरज्य॒न्त य॒च् छुरु॒धो वि॒वाचि । नहि॒ स्व॒म् आ॒युश् चिकिते॒ ज॒नेषु ता॒नी॒द् अं॒हांस्य् अ॒ति पर्ष्य् अस्मा॒न् ॥२॥

text: The Bays, the booty-seeking car I harness: my prayers have reached him who accepts them gladly. Indra, when he had slain resistless Vritras, forced with his might the two world-halves asunder.
meaning: युजे॒ र॒थं गवे॒षणं ह॒रिभ्याम् उ॒प ब्र॒ह्माणि जुजुषाण॒म् अस्थुः । वि॒ बाधिष्ट स्य॒ रो॒दसी महित्वे॒न्द्रो वृत्रा॒ण्य् अप्रती॒ जघन्वा॒न् ॥३॥

text: Like barren cows, moreover, swelled the waters: the singers sought thy holy rite, O Indra. Come unto us as with his team comes Vāyu: thou, through our solemn hymns, bestowest booty.
meaning: आ॒पश् चित् पिप्यु स्तर्यो॑ न॒ गा॒वो न॒क्षन्न् ऋतं॒ जरिता॒रस् त इन्द्र । याहि॒ वायु॒र् न॒ नियु॒तो नो अ॒छा त्वं॒ हि॒ धीभि॒र् द॒यसे वि॒ वा॒जान् ॥४॥

text: So may these gladdening draughts rejoice thee, Indra, the Mighty, very bounteous to the singer. Alone among the Gods thou pitiest mortals: O Hero, make thee glad at this libation.
meaning: ते॒ त्वा म॒दा इन्द्र मादयन्तु शुष्मि॒णं तुविरा॒धसं जरित्रे॒ । ए॒को देवत्रा॒ द॒यसे हि॒ म॒र्तान् अस्मि॒न् छूर स॒वने मादयस्व ॥५॥

text: Thus the Vasishthas glorify with praises Indra, the Mighty One, whose arm wields thunder. Praised, may he guard our wealth in kine and heroes. Ye Gods,. preserve us evermore with blessings.
meaning: एवे॒द् इ॒न्द्रं वृ॒षणं व॒ज्रबाहुं व॒सिष्ठासो अभ्य् अ॑र्चन्त्य् अर्कैः॒ । स॒ न स्तुतो॒ वीर॒वद् धातु गो॒मद् यूयं॒ पात स्वस्ति॒भिः स॒दा नः ॥६॥

text: Impetuous, Thunderer, strong, quelling the mighty, King, potent, Vritra-slayer, Soma-drinker, May he come hither with his yoked bay horses. May Indra glad- den him at noon libation.
meaning: ऋजीषी॒ वज्री॒ वृषभ॒स् तुराषा॒ट् छुष्मी॒ रा॒जा वृत्रहा॒ सोमपा॒वा । युक्त्वा॒ ह॒रिभ्याम् उ॒प यासद् अर्वा॒ङ् मा॒ध्यंदिने स॒वने मत्सद् इ॒न्द्रः ॥७॥

text: Lords of great wealth, Brihaspati and Indra, rejoicing at this sacrifice drink Soma. Let the abundant drops sink deep within you: vouchsafe us riches with full store of heroes.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रश् च सो॒मं पिबतं बृहस्पते ऽस्मि॒न् यज्ञे॒ मन्दसाना॒ वृषण्वसू । आ॒ वां विशन्त्व् इ॒न्दवः स्वाभु॒वो ऽस्मे॒ रयिं॒ स॒र्ववीरं नि॒ यछतम् ॥१॥

text: Let your swift-gliding coursers bear you hitherward with their fleet pinions. Come ye forward with your arms. Sit on the grass; a wide seat hath been made for you: delight yourselves, O Maruts, in the pleasant food.
meaning: आ॒ वो वहन्तु स॒प्तयो रघुष्य॒दो रघुप॒त्वानः प्र॒ जिगात बाहु॒भिः । सीदता बर्हि॒र् उरु॒ वः स॒दस् कृतं॒ माद॒यध्वं मरुतो म॒ध्वो अ॒न्धसः ॥२॥

text: For Jātavedas, worthy of our praise, will we frame with our mind this eulogy as 'twere a car. For good in his assembly is this care of ours. Let us not in thy friendship, Agni, suffer harm.
meaning: इमं॒ स्तो॒मम् अ॒र्हते जात॒वेदसे र॒थम् इव सं॒ महेमा मनीष॒या । भद्रा॒ हि॒ नः प्र॒मतिर् अस्य संस॒द्य् अ॒ग्ने सख्ये॒ मा॒ रिषामा वयं॒ त॒व ॥३॥

text: With these, borne on one car, Agni, approach us; or borne on many, for thy steeds are able. Bring, with their Dames, the Gods, the Three-and-Thirty, after thy Godlike nature, and he joyful.
meaning: ऐ॒भिर् अग्ने सर॒थं याह्य् अर्वा॒ङ् नानारथं॒ वा विभ॒वो ह्य् अ॒श्वाः । प॒त्नीवतस् त्रिंश॒तं त्रीं॒श् च देवा॒न् अनुष्वध॒म् आ॒ वह माद॒यस्व ॥४॥

text: We call on thee, O peerless One. We, seeking help, possessing nothing firm ourselves, Call on thee wonderful in fight.
meaning: वय॒म् उ त्वा॒म् अपूर्व्य स्थूरं॒ न॒ क॒च् चिद् भ॒रन्तो ऽवस्य॒वः । वा॒जे चित्रं॒ हवामहे ॥१॥

text: On thee for aid in sacrifice. This youth of ours, the bold, the mighty, hath gone forth. We, therefore, we thy friends, Indra, have chosen thee, free- giver, as our guardian God.
meaning: उ॒प त्वा क॒र्मन्न् ऊत॒ये स॒ नो यु॒वोग्र॒श् चक्राम यो॒ धृष॒त् । त्वा॒म् इ॒द् ध्य् अ॑विता॒रं ववृम॒हे स॒खाय इन्द्र सानसि॒म् ॥२॥

text: Him who of old hath brought to us this and that blessing, him I magnify for you, Even Indra, O my friends, for help:
meaning: यो॒ न इद॒मिदं पुरा॒ प्र॒ व॒स्य आनिना॒य त॒म् उ व स्तुषे । स॒खाय इ॒न्द्रम् ऊत॒ये ॥३॥

text: Borne by bay steeds, the Lord of heroes, ruling men, for it is he who takes delight. The Bounteous Lord bestows on us his worshippers hundreds of cattle and of steeds.
meaning: ह॒र्यश्वं स॒त्पतिं चर्षणीस॒हं स॒ हि॒ ष्मा यो॒ अ॒मन्दत । आ॒ तु नः स॒ वयति ग॒व्यम् अ॒श्व्यं स्तोतृ॒भ्यो मघ॒वा शत॒म् ॥४॥

text: To him most liberal, lofty Lord of lofty wealth, verily powerful and strong, I bring my hymn, Whose checkless bounty, as of waters down a slope, is spread abroad for all that live, to give them strength.
meaning: प्र॒ मं॒हिष्ठाय बृहते॒ बृह॒द्रये सत्य॒शुष्माय तव॒से मतिं॒ भरे । अपा॒म् इव प्रवणे॒ य॒स्य दुर्ध॒रं रा॒धो विश्वा॒यु श॒वसे अ॒पावृतम् ॥१॥

text: Now all this world, for worship, shall come after thee—the offerer's libations like descending floods, When the well-loved one seems to rest upon the hill, the thun- derbolt of Indra, shatterer wrought of gold.
meaning: अ॒ध ते वि॒श्वम् अ॒नु हासद् इष्ट॒य आ॒पो निम्ने॒व स॒वना हवि॒ष्मतः । य॒त् प॒र्वते न॒ सम॒शीत हर्यत॒ इ॒न्द्रस्य व॒ज्रः श्न॒थिता हिरण्य॒यः ॥२॥

text: To him the terrible, most worthy of high praise, like radiant Dawn, bring gifts with reverence in this rite, Whose being, for renown, yea, Indra-power and light, have been created, like bay steeds, to move with speed.
meaning: अस्मै॒ भीमा॒य न॒मसा स॒म् अध्वर॒ उ॒षो न॒ शुभ्र आ॒ भरा प॒नीयसे । य॒स्य धा॒म श्र॒वसे ना॒मेन्द्रियं॒ ज्यो॒तिर् अ॒कारि हरि॒तो ना॒यसे ॥३॥

text: Thine, Indra, praised by many excellently rich! are we who trusting in thy help draw near to thee. Lover of praise, none else but thou receives our laud: as Earth loves all her creatures, love thou this our hymn.
meaning: इमे॒ त इन्द्र ते॒ वयं॒ पुरुष्टुत ये॒ त्वार॒भ्य च॒रामसि प्रभूवसो । नहि॒ त्व॒द् अन्यो॒ गिर्वणो गि॒रः स॒धत् क्षोणी॒र् इव प्र॒ति नो हर्य त॒द् व॒चः ॥४॥

text: Great is thy power, O Indra, we are thine. Fulfil, O Maghavan, the wish of this thy worshipper. After thee lofty heaven hath measured out its strength to thee and to thy power this earth hath bowed itself.
meaning: भू॒रि त इन्द्र वीर्यं॑ त॒व स्मस्य् अस्य॒ स्तोतु॒र् मघवन् का॒मम् आ॒ पृण । अ॒नु ते द्यौ॒र् बृहती॒ वीर्यं॑ मम इयं॒ च ते पृथिवी॒ नेम ओ॒जसे ॥५॥

text: Thou, who hast thunder for thy weapon, with thy bolt hast shattered into pieces this broad massive cloud. Thou hast sent down obstructed floods that they may flow: thou hast, thine own for ever, all victorious might.
meaning: त्वं॒ त॒म् इन्द्र प॒र्वतं महा॒म् उरुं॒ व॒ज्रेण वज्रिन् पर्वश॒श् चकर्तिथ । अ॒वासृजो नि॒वृताः स॒र्तवा॒ अपः॒ सत्रा॒ वि॒श्वं दधिषे के॒वलं स॒हः ॥६॥

text: Like birds who keep their watch, plashing in water, like the loud voices of the thundering rain-cloud, Like merry streamlets bursting from the mountain thus to Brihaspati our hymns have sounded.
meaning: उदप्रु॒तो न॒ व॒यो र॒क्षमाणा वा॒वदतो अभ्रि॒यस्येव घो॒षाः । गिरिभ्र॒जो नो॒र्म॒यो म॒दन्तो बृ॒हस्प॒तिम् अभ्य् अ॑र्का॒ अनावन् ॥१॥

text: The son of Angiras, meeting the cattle, as Bhaga, brought in Aryaman among us. As Friend of men he decks the wife and husband. As for the race, Brihaspati, nerve our coursers.
meaning: सं॒ गो॒भिर् अङ्गिरसो॒ न॒क्षमाणो भ॒ग इवे॒द् अर्यम॒णं निनाय । ज॒ने मित्रो॒ न॒ द॒म्पती अनक्ति बृ॒हस्पते वाज॒याशूं॒र् इवाजौ॒ ॥२॥

text: Brihaspati, having won them from the mountains, strewed down, like barley out of winnowing-baskets, The vigorous, wandering cows who aid the pious, desired of all, of blameless form, well-coloured.
meaning: साध्वर्या॒ अतिथि॒नीर् इषिरा॒ स्पार्हाः॒ सुव॒र्णा अनवद्य॒रूपाः । बृ॒हस्प॒तिः प॒र्वतेभ्यो वितू॒र्या नि॒र् गा॒ ऊपे य॒वम् इव स्थिवि॒भ्यः ॥३॥

text: As the Sun dews with meath the seat of Order, and casts a flam- ing meteor down from heaven, So from the rock Brihaspati forced the cattle, and cleft the earth's skin as it were with water.
meaning: आप्रुषाय॒न् म॒धुना ऋत॒स्य यो॒निम् अवक्षिप॒न्न् अर्क॒ उल्का॒म् इव द्योः॒ । बृ॒हस्प॒तिर् उद्ध॒रन्न् अ॒श्मनो गा॒ भू॒म्या उद्ने॒व वि॒ त्व॒चं बिभेद ॥४॥

text: Forth from mid-air with light he draye the darkness, as the gale blows a lily from the river. Like the wind grasping at the cloud of Vala, Brihaspati gathered to himself the cattle.
meaning: अ॒प ज्यो॒तिषा त॒मो अन्त॒रिक्षद् उद्नः॒ शी॒पालम् इव वा॒त आजत् । बृ॒हस्प॒तिर् अनुमृ॒श्या वल॒स्याभ्र॒म् इव वा॒त आ॒ चक्र आ॒ गाः॒ ॥५॥

text: Brihaspati, when he with fiery lightnings cleft through the weapon of reviling Vala, Consumed him as tongues eat what teeth have compassed: he threw the prisons of the red cows open.
meaning: यदा॒ वल॒स्य पी॒यतो ज॒सुं भे॒द् बृ॒हस्प॒तिर् अग्नित॒पोभिर् अर्कैः॒ । दद्भि॒र् न॒ जिह्वा॒ प॒रिविष्टम् आ॒दद् आवि॒र् निधीं॒र् अकृणोद् उस्रि॒याणाम् ॥६॥

text: That secret name borne by the lowing cattle within the cave Brihaspati discovered, And draye, himself, the bright kine from the mountain, like a bird's young after the eggs' disclosure.
meaning: बृ॒हस्प॒तिर् अ॒मत हि॒ त्य॒द् आसां ना॒म स्वरी॒णां स॒दने गु॒हा य॒त् । आण्डे॒व भित्वा॒ शकुन॒स्य ग॒र्भम् उ॒द् उस्रि॒याः प॒र्वतस्य त्म॒नाजत् ॥७॥

text: He looked around on rock-imprisoned sweetness as one who eyes a fish in scanty water. Brihaspati, cleaving through with varied clamour, brought it forth like a bowl from out the timber.
meaning: अ॒श्ना॒पिनद्धं म॒धु प॒र्य् अपश्यन् म॒त्स्यं न॒ दीन॒ उद॒नि क्षिय॒न्तम् । नि॒ष् ट॒ज् जभार चमसं॒ न॒ वृक्षा॒द् बृ॒हस्प॒तिर् विरवे॒णा विकृ॒त्य ॥८॥

text: He found the light of heaven, and fire, and Morning: with lucid rays he forced apart the darkness. As from a joint, Brihaspati took the marrow of Vala as he gloried in his cattle.
meaning: सो॒षा॒म् अविन्दत् स॒ स्वः॑ सो॒ अग्निं॒ सो॒ अर्के॒ण वि॒ बबाधे त॒मांसि । बृ॒हस्प॒तिर् गो॒वपुषो वल॒स्य नि॒र् मज्जा॒नं न॒ प॒र्वणो जभार ॥९॥

text: As trees for foliage robbed by winter, Vala mourned for the cows Brihaspati had taken. He did a deed ne'er done, ne'er to be equalled, whereby the sun and moon ascend alternate.
meaning: हिमे॒व पर्णा॒ मुषिता॒ व॒नानि बृ॒हस्प॒तिनाकृपयद् वलो॒ गाः॒ । अनानुकृत्य॒म् अपुन॒श् चकार या॒त् सू॒र्यामा॒सा मिथ॒ उच्च॒रातः ॥१०॥

text: Like a dark steed adorned with pearl, the Fathers have decorat- ed heaven with constellations. They set the light in day, in night the darkness, Brihaspati cleft the rock and found the cattle.
meaning: अभि॒ श्यावं॒ न॒ कृ॒शनेभिर् अ॒श्वं न॒क्षत्रेभिः पित॒रो द्या॒म् अपिंशन् । रा॒त्र्यां त॒मो अ॒दधुर् ज्यो॒तिर् अ॒हन् बृ॒हस्प॒तिर् भिन॒द् अ॒द्रिं विद॒द् गाः॒ ॥११॥

text: This homage have we offered to the Cloud-God who thunders out to many in succession. May this Brihaspati vouchsafe us fulness of life with kine and horses, men, and heroes.
meaning: इद॒म् अकर्म न॒मो अभ्रिया॒य यः॒ पूर्वी॒र् अ॒न्व् आनो॒नवीति । बृ॒हस्प॒तिः स॒ हि॒ गो॒भिः सो॒ अ॒श्वैः स॒ वीरे॒भिः स॒ नृ॒भिर् नो व॒यो धात् ॥१२॥

text: In perfect unison all yearning hymns of mine that find the light of heaven have sung forth Indra's praise. As wives embrace their lord, the comely bridegroom, so they compass Maghavan about that he may help.
meaning: अ॒छा म इ॒न्द्रं मत॒यः स्वर्वि॒दः सध्री॒चीर् वि॒श्वा उशती॒र् अनूषत । प॒रि ष्वजन्ते ज॒नयो य॒था प॒तिं म॒र्यं न॒ शुन्ध्युं॒ मघ॒वानम् ऊत॒ये ॥१॥

text: Directed unto thee my spirit never strays, for I have set my hopes on thee, O much-invoked! Sit, wonderful! as King upon the sacred grass, and let thy drinking-place be by the Soma juice.
meaning: न॒ घा त्वद्रि॒ग् अ॒प वेति मे म॒नस् त्वे॒ इ॒त् का॒मं पुरुहूत शिश्रय । रा॒जेव दस्म नि॒ षदो॒ ऽधि बर्हि॒ष्य् अस्मि॒न्त् सु॒ सो॒मे ऽवपा॒नम् अस्तु ते ॥२॥

text: From indigence and hunger Indra turns away: Maghavan hath dominion over precious wealth. These the Seven Rivers flowing on their downward path increase the vital vigour of the Mighty Steer.
meaning: विषूवृ॒द् इ॒न्द्रो अ॒मुतेर् उत॒ क्षुधः॒ स॒ इ॒द् रायो॒ मघ॒वा व॒स्व ईशते । त॒स्ये॒द् इमे॒ प्रवणे॒ सप्त॒ सि॒न्धवो व॒यो वर्धन्ति वृषभ॒स्य शुष्मि॒णः ॥३॥

text: As on the fair-leafed tree rest birds, to Indra flow the gladden- ing Soma juices that the bowls contain. Their face that glows with splendour through their mighty power hath found the shine of heaven for man, the Aryas' light.
meaning: व॒यो न॒ वृक्षं॒ सुपलाश॒म् आ॒सदन्त् सो॒मास इ॒न्द्रं मन्दि॒नश् चमूष॒दः । प्रै॒षाम् अ॒नीकं श॒वसा द॒विद्युतद् विद॒त् स्व॑र् म॒नवे ज्यो॒तिर् आ॒र्यम् ॥४॥

text: As in the game a gambler piles his winnings, so Maghavan, sweeping all together, gained the Sun. This mighty deed of thine none other could achieve, none, Maghavan, before thee, none in recent time.
meaning: कृतं॒ न॒ श्वघ्नी॒ वि॒ चिनोति दे॒वने संव॒र्गं य॒न् मघ॒वा सू॒र्यं ज॒यत् । न॒ त॒त् ते अन्यो॒ अ॒नु वीर्यं॑ शकन् न॒ पुराणो॒ मघवन् नो॒त॒ नू॒तनः ॥५॥

text: Maghavan came by turns to all the tribes of men: the Steer took notice of the people's songs of praise. The man in whose libations Sakra hath delight by means of potent Somas vanquisheth his foes.
meaning: वि॒शंविशं मघ॒वा प॒र्य् अशायत ज॒नानां धे॒ना अवचा॒कशद् वृ॒षा । य॒स्या॒ह शक्रः॒ स॒वनेषु र॒ण्यति स॒ तीव्रैः॒ सो॒मैः सहते पृतन्यतः॒ ॥६॥

text: As waters flow together to the river, thus Somas to Indra flow, as rivulets to the lake. In place of sacrifice sages exalt his might, as the rain swells the corn by moisture sent from heaven.
meaning: आ॒पो न॒ सि॒न्धुम् अभि॒ य॒त् सम॒क्षरन्त् सो॒मास इ॒न्द्रं कुल्या॒ इव ह्रद॒म् । व॒र्धन्ति वि॒प्रा म॒हो अस्य सा॒दने य॒वं न॒ वृष्टि॒र् दिव्ये॒न दा॒नुना ॥७॥

text: He rushes through the region like a furious bull, he who hath made these floods the dames of worthy lords. This Maghavan hath found light for the man who brings oblation, sheds the juice, and promptly pours his gifts.
meaning: वृ॒षा न॒ क्रुद्धः॒ पतयद् र॒जःस्व् आ॒ यो॒ अर्य॒पत्नीर् अ॒कृणोद् इमा॒ अपः॒ । स॒ सुन्वते॒ मघ॒वा जीर॒दानवे॒ ऽविन्दज् ज्यो॒तिर् म॒नवे हवि॒ष्मते ॥८॥

text: Let the keen axe come forth together with the light: here be, as erst, the teeming cow of sacrifice. Let the Red God shine pure with his refulgent ray, and let the Lord of heroes glow like heaven's clear sheen.
meaning: उ॒ज् जायतां परशु॒ ज्यो॒तिषा सह॒ भूया॒ ऋत॒स्य सुदु॒घा पुराणव॒त् । वि॒ रोचताम् अरुषो॒ भानु॒ना शु॒चिः स्व॑र् न॒ शुक्रं॒ शुशुचीत स॒त्पतिः ॥९॥

text: O much-invoked, may we subdue all famine and evil want with store of grain and cattle. May we allied, as first in rank, with princes, obtain possessions by our own exertion.
meaning: गो॒भिष् टरेमा॒मतिं दुरे॒वां य॒वेन क्षु॒धं पुरुहूत वि॒श्वाम् । वयं॒ रा॒जभिः प्रथमा॒ ध॒नान्य् अस्मा॒केन वृज॒नेना जयेम ॥१०॥

text: Brihaspati protect us from the rearward, and from above, and from below, from sinners. May Indra from the front, and from the centre, as friend to friends, vouchsafe us room and freedom.
meaning: बृ॒हस्प॒तिर् नः प॒रि पातु पश्चा॒द् उतो॒त्तरस्माद् अ॒धराद् अघायोः॒ । इ॒न्द्रः पुर॒स्ताद् उत॒ मध्यतो॒ नः स॒खा स॒खिभ्यः व॒रिवः कृणोतु ॥११॥

text: Ye twain are Lords of wealth in earth and heaven, thou, O Brihaspati, and thou, O Indra. Mean though he be, give wealth to him who lauds you. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
meaning: बृ॒हस्पते युव॒म् इ॒न्द्रश् च व॒स्वो दिव्य॒स्येशाथे उत॒ पा॒र्थिवस्य । धत्तं॒ रयिं॒ स्तुवते॒ कीर॒ये चिद् यूयं॒ पात स्वस्ति॒भिः स॒दा नः ॥१२॥

text: This, even this, O Indra, we implore: as thy devoted friends, The Kanvas praise thee with their hymns.
meaning: वय॒म् उ त्वा तदि॒तर्था इ॒न्द्र त्वाय॒न्तः स॒खायः । क॒ण्वा उक्थे॒भिर् जरन्ते ॥१॥

text: Naught else, O Thunderer, have I praised in the skilled singer's eulogy: On thy laud only have I thought.
meaning: न॒ घेम् अन्य॒द् आ॒ पपन व॒ज्रिन्न् अप॒सो न॒विष्टौ । त॒वे॒द् उ स्तो॒मं चिकेत ॥२॥

text: The Gods seek him who presses out the Soma; they desire not sleep: Incessantly they punish sloth.
meaning: इछ॒न्ति देवाः॒ सुन्व॒न्तं न॒ स्व॒प्नाय स्पृहयन्ति । य॒न्ति प्रमा॒दम् अ॒तन्द्राः ॥३॥

text: Faithful to thee we loudly sing, heroic Indra, songs to thee. Mark, gracious Lord, this act of ours.
meaning: वय॒म् इन्द्र त्वाय॒वो ऽभि॒ प्र॒ णोनुमो वृषन् । विद्धि॒ त्व् अ॑स्य॒ नो वसो ॥४॥

text: Give us not up to man's reproach, to foeman's hateful calumny: In thee alone is all my strength.
meaning: मा॒ नो निदे॒ च व॒क्तवे ऽर्यो॒ रन्धीर् अ॒राव्ने । त्वे॒ अ॒पि क्र॒तुर् म॒म ॥५॥

text: Thou art mine ample coat of mail, my champion, Vritra-slayes, thou. With thee for Friend I brave the foe.
meaning: त्वं॒ व॒र्मासि सप्र॒थः पुरोयोध॒श् च वृत्रहन् । त्व॒या प्र॒ति ब्रुवे युजा॒ ॥६॥

text: O Indra, for the strength that slays the foe and conquers in the fight We turn thee hitherward to us.
meaning: वा॒र्त्रहत्याय श॒वसे पृतनाषा॒ह्याय च । इ॒न्द्र त्वा॒ वर्तयामसि ॥१॥

text: O Indra, Lord of Hundred Powers, may those who praise thee hitherward. Direct thy spirit and thine eye.
meaning: अर्वाची॒नं सु॒ ते म॒न उत॒ च॒क्षुः शतक्रतो । इ॒न्द्र कृण्व॒न्तु वाघ॒तः ॥२॥

text: O Indra, Lord of Hundred Powers, with all our songs we invocate. Thy names for triumph over foes.
meaning: ना॒मानि ते शतक्रतो वि॒श्वाभिर् गीर्भि॒र् ईमहे । इ॒न्द्राभिमातिषा॒ह्ये ॥३॥

text: We strive for glory through the powers immense of him whom many praise, Of Indra who supports mankind.
meaning: पुरुष्टुत॒स्य धा॒मभिः शते॒न महयामसि । इ॒न्द्रस्य चर्षणीधृ॒तः ॥४॥

text: For the foe's slaughter I address Indra whom many invocate, To win us booty in the wars.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रं वृत्रा॒य ह॒न्तवे पुरुहूत॒म् उ॒प ब्रुवे । भ॒रेषु वा॒जसातये ॥५॥

text: In battles be victorious. We seek thee, Lord of Hundred Powers, O Indra, that the foe may fall.
meaning: वा॒जेषु सासहि॒र् भव त्वा॒म् ईमहे शतक्रतो । इ॒न्द्र वृत्रा॒य ह॒न्तवे ॥६॥

text: In splendid combats of the hosts, in glories where the fight is won, Indra, be victor over foes.
meaning: द्युम्ने॒षु पृतना॒ज्ये पृत्सुतू॒र्षु श्र॒वःसु च । इ॒न्द्र सा॒क्ष्वाभि॒मातिषु ॥७॥

text: Drink thou the Soma for our help, bright, vigilant, exceeding strong, O Indra, Lord of Hundred Powers.
meaning: शुष्मि॒न्तमं न ऊत॒ये द्युम्नि॒नं पाहि जा॒गृविम् । इ॒न्द्र सो॒मं शतक्रतो ॥१॥

text: O Satakratu, powers which thou mid the Five Races hast dis- played These, Indra, do I claim of thee.
meaning: इन्द्रिया॒णि शतक्रतो या॒ ते ज॒नेषु पञ्च॒सु । इ॒न्द्र ता॒नि त आ॒ वृणे ॥२॥

text: Indra, great glory hast thou gained. Win splendid fame which none may mar: We make thy might perpetual.
meaning: अ॒गन्न् इन्द्र श्र॒वो बृह॒द् द्युम्नं॒ दधिष्व दुष्ट॒रम् । उ॒त् ते शु॒ष्मं तिरामसि ॥३॥

text: Come to us either from anear, or, Sakra, come from far away. Indra, wherever be thy home, come to us thence, O Thunder- armed.
meaning: अर्वाव॒तो न आ॒ गह्य् अ॒थो शक्र पराव॒तः । उ लोको॒ य॒स् ते अद्रिव इ॒न्द्रेह॒ त॒त आ॒ गहि ॥४॥

text: Verily Indra, conquering all, driveth even mighty fear away; For firm is he and swift to act.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रो अङ्गं॒ मह॒द् भय॒म् अभि॒ ष॒द् अ॒प चुच्यवत् । स॒ हि॒ स्थिरो॒ वि॒चर्षणिः ॥५॥

text: Indra be gracious unto us: sin shall not reach us afterward . And good shall be before us still,
meaning: इ॒न्द्रश् च मृल॒याति नो न॒ नः पश्चा॒द् अघं॒ नशत् । भद्रं॒ भवाति नः पुरः॒ ॥६॥

text: From all the regions of the world let Indra send security. The foe-subduer, swift to act.
meaning: इ॒न्द्र आ॒शाभ्यस् प॒रि स॒र्वाभ्यो अ॒भयं करत् । जे॒ता श॒त्रून् वि॒चर्षणिः ॥७॥

text: We will present fair praise unto the Mighty One, our hymns to Indra in Vivasvān's dwelling-place; For he hath ne'er found wealth in those who seem to sleep; those who give wealth to men accept no paltry praise.
meaning: न्य् ऊ षु॒ वा॒चं प्र॒ महे॒ भरामहे गि॒र इ॒न्द्राय स॒दने विव॒स्वतः । नू॒ चिद् धि॒ र॒त्नं ससता॒म् इवा॒विदन् न॒ दुष्टुति॒र् द्रविणोदे॒षु शस्यते ॥१॥

text: Giver of horses, Indra, giver, thou, of kine, giver of barley, thou art Lord and guard of wealth: Man's helper from of old, not disappointing hope, Friend of our friends, to thee as such we sing this praise.
meaning: दुरो॒ अ॒श्वस्य दुर॒ इन्द्र गो॒र् असि दुरो॒ य॒वस्य व॒सुन इन॒स् प॒तिः । शिक्षानरः॒ प्रदि॒वो अ॒कामकर्शनः स॒खा स॒खिभ्यस् त॒म् इदं॒ गृणीमसि ॥२॥

text: Indra, most splendid, powerful, rich in mighty deeds, this treasure spread around is known to be thine own. Gather therefrom. O Conqueror, and bring to us: fail not the hope of him who loves and sings to thee.
meaning: श॒चीव इन्द्र पुरुकृद् द्युमत्तम त॒वे॒द् इद॒म् अभि॒तश् चेकिते व॒सु । अ॒तः संगृ॒भ्याभिभूत आ॒ भर मा॒ त्वायतो॒ जरितुः॒ का॒मम् ऊनयीः ॥३॥

text: Well-pleased with these bright flames and with these Soma drops, take thou away our poverty with steeds and kine. With Indra scattering the Dasyu through these drops, freed from their hate may we obtain abundant food.
meaning: एभि॒र् द्यु॒भिर् सुम॒ना एभि॒र् इ॒न्दुभिर् निरुन्धानो॒ अ॒मतिं गो॒भिर् अश्वि॒ना । इ॒न्द्रेण द॒स्युं दर॒यन्त इ॒न्दुभिर् युत॒द्वेषसः सम् इषा॒ रभेमहि ॥४॥

text: Let us obtain, O Indra, plenteous wealth and food, with strength exceeding glorious, shining to the sky. May we obtain the Goddess Providence, the strength of heroes, special source of cattle, rich in steeds.
meaning: स॒म् इन्द्र राया॒ स॒म् इषा॒ रभेमहि सं॒ वा॒जेभिः पुरुश्चन्द्रै॒र् अभि॒द्युभिः । सं॒ देव्या॒ प्र॒मत्या वीर॒शुष्मया गो॒अग्रया॒श्वावत्या रभेमहि ॥५॥

text: These our libations, strength inspiring Soma draughts, gladdened thee in the fight with Vritra, Hero-Lord, What time thou slewest for the singer with trimmed grass ten thousand Vritras, thou resistless in thy might.
meaning: ते॒ त्वा म॒दा अमदन् ता॒नि वृ॒ष्ण्या ते सो॒मासो वृत्रह॒त्येषु सत्पते । य॒त् कार॒वे द॒श वृत्रा॒ण्य् अप्रति॒ बर्हि॒ष्मते नि॒ सह॒स्राणि बर्ह॒यः ॥६॥

text: Thou goest on from fight to fight intrepidly, destroying castle after castle here with strength; Thou Indra, with thy friend who makes the foe bow down, slewest from far away the guileful Namuchi.
meaning: युधा॒ यु॒धम् उ॒प घे॒द् एषि धृष्णुया॒ पुरा॒ पु॒रं स॒म् इदं॒ हंस्य् ओ॒जसा । न॒म्या य॒द् इन्द्र स॒ख्या पराव॒ति निबर्ह॒यो न॒मुचिं ना॒म मायि॒नम् ॥७॥

text: Thou hast stuck down in death Karanja, Parnaya, in Atithigva's very glorious going forth: Unyielding, when Rijisvan compassed them with siege, thou hast destroyed the hundred towns of Vangrida.
meaning: त्वं॒ क॒रञ्जम् उत॒ पर्ण॒यं वधीस् ते॒जिष्ठयातिथिग्व॒स्य वर्तनी॒ । त्वं॒ शता॒ व॒ङ्गृदस्याभिनत् पु॒रो ऽनानुदः॒ प॒रिषूता ऋजि॒श्वना ॥८॥

text: With all-outstripping chariot wheel, O Indra, thou far-famed, hast overthrown the twice ten kings of men, With sixty thousand nine-and-ninety followers, who came in arms to fight with friendless Susravas.
meaning: त्व॒म् एतां॒ जनरा॒ज्ञो द्वि॒र् द॒शाबन्धु॒ना सुश्र॒वसोपजग्मु॒षः । षष्टिं॒ सह॒स्रा नवतिं॒ न॒व श्रुतो॒ नि॒ चक्रे॒ण र॒थ्या दुष्प॒दावृणक् ॥९॥

text: Thou hast protected Susravas with succour, and Tūrvayāna with thine aid, O Indra: Thou madest Kutsa, Atithigva, Ayu subject unto this king, the young, the mighty.
meaning: त्व॒म् आविथ सुश्र॒वसं त॒वोति॒भिस् त॒व त्रा॒मभिर् इन्द्र तू॒र्वयाणम् । त्व॒ अस्मै कु॒त्सम् अतिथिग्व॒म् आयुं॒ महे॒ रा॒ज्ञे यू॒ने अरन्धनायः ॥१०॥

text: May we protected by the Gods hereafter remain thy very pro- sperous friends, O Indra. Thee we extol, enjoying through thy favour life-long and joyful and with store of heroes.
meaning: य॒ उदृ॒चीन्द्र देव॒गोपाः स॒खायस् ते शिव॒तमा अ॒साम । त्वां॒ स्तोषाम त्व॒या सुवी॒रा द्रा॒घीय आ॒युः प्रतरं॒ द॒धानाः ॥११॥

text: Hero, the Soma being pressed I pour the juice for thee to drink Sate thee and finish thy carouse.
meaning: अभि॒ त्वा वृषभा सुते॒ सुतं॒ सृजामि पीत॒ये । तृम्पा॒ व्य् अ॑श्नुही म॒दम् ॥१॥

text: Let not the fools, or those who mock, beguile thee when they seek thine aid: Love not the enemies of prayer.
meaning: मा॒ त्वा मूरा॒ अविष्य॒वो मो॒पह॒स्वान आ॒ दभन् । मा॒कीं ब्रह्मद्वि॒षो वनः ॥२॥

text: Here let them with rich milky draught cheer thee to great munificence: Drink as the wild bull drinks the lake.
meaning: इह॒ त्वा गो॒परीणसा महे॒ मन्दन्तु रा॒धसे । स॒रो गौरो॒ य॒था पिब ॥३॥

text: Praise, even as he is known, with song Indra, the guardian of the kine, The Son of Truth, Lord of the brave.
meaning: अभि॒ प्र॒ गो॒पतिं गिरे॒न्द्रम् अर्च य॒था विदे॒ । सूनुं॒ सत्य॒स्य स॒त्पतिम् ॥४॥

text: Hither his bay steeds have been sent, red steeds are on the sacred grass. Where we in concert sing our songs.
meaning: आ॒ ह॒रयः ससृज्रिरे॒ ऽरुषीर् अ॒धि बर्हि॒षि । य॒त्राभि॒ संन॒वामहे ॥५॥

text: For Indra, Thunder-armed, the kine have yielded mingled milk and meath, What time he found them in the vault.
meaning: इ॒न्द्राय गा॒व आशि॒रं दुदुह्रे॒ वज्रि॒णे म॒धु । य॒त् सीम् उपह्वरे॒ विद॒त् ॥६॥

text: Invoked to drink the Soma juice come with thy bay steeds, Thunder-armed! Come, Indra, hitherward, to me.
meaning: आ॒ तू॒ न इन्द्र मद्र्य॑ग् घुवानः॒ सो॒मपीतये । ह॒रिभ्यां याह्य् अद्रिवः ॥१॥

text: Our priest is seated true to time; the grass is regularly strewn; The pressing-stones were set at morn.
meaning: सत्तो॒ हो॒ता न ऋत्वि॒यस् तिस्तिरे॒ बर्हि॒र् आनुष॒क् । अ॒युज्रन् प्रात॒र् अ॒द्रयः ॥२॥

text: These prayers, O thou who bearest prayer, are offered. Seat thee on the grass. Hero, enjoy the offered cake.
meaning: इमा॒ ब्र॒ह्म ब्रह्मवाहः क्रिय॒न्त आ॒ बर्हिः॒ सीद । वीहि॒ शूर पुरोला॒शम् ॥३॥

text: O Vritra-slayer, be thou pleased with these libations, with these hymns, Song-loving Indra, with our lauds.
meaning: रारन्धि॒ स॒वनेषु ण एषु॒ स्तो॒मेषु वृत्रहन् । उक्थे॒ष्व् इन्द्र गिर्वणः ॥४॥

text: Our hymns caress the Lord of Strength, vast, drinker of the Soma's juice, Indra, as mother-cows their calf.
meaning: मत॒यः सोमपा॒म् उरुं॒ रिह॒न्ति श॒वसस् प॒तिम् । इ॒न्द्रं वत्सं॒ न॒ मात॒रः ॥५॥

text: Delight thee with the juice we pour for thine own great munificence: Yield not thy singer to reproach.
meaning: स॒ मन्दस्वा ह्य् अ॒न्धसो रा॒धसे तन्वा॑ महे॒ । न॒ स्तोता॒रं निदे॒ करः ॥६॥

text: We, Indra, dearly loving thee, bearing oblation, sing thee hymns: Thou, Vasu, nearly lovest us.
meaning: वय॒म् इन्द्र त्वाय॒वो हवि॒ष्मन्तो जरामहे । उत॒ त्व॒म् अस्मयु॒र् वसो ॥७॥

text: O thou to whom thy Bays are dear, loose not thy horses far from us: Here glad thee, Indra, Lord Divine.
meaning: मा॒रे॒ अस्म॒द् वि॒ मुमुचो ह॒रिप्रियार्वा॒ङ् याहि । इ॒न्द्र स्वधावो म॒त्स्वेह॒ ॥८॥

text: May long-maned courses, dropping oil, bring thee on swift car hitherward. Indra, to seat thee on the grass.
meaning: अर्वा॒ञ्चं त्वा सुखे॒ र॒थे व॒हताम् इन्द्र केशि॒ना । घृत॒स्नू बर्हि॒र् आस॒दे ॥९॥

text: Come to the juice that we have pressed, to Soma, Indra! blent with milk: Come, favouring us, thy bay-drawn car!
meaning: उ॒प नः सुत॒म् आ॒ गहि सो॒मम् इन्द्र ग॒वाशिरम् । ह॒रिभ्यां य॒स् ते अस्मयुः॒ ॥१॥

text: Come, Indra, to this gladdening drink, placed on the grass, pressed out with stones: Wilt thou not drink thy fill thereof?
meaning: त॒म् इन्द्र म॒दम् आ॒ गहि बर्हिष्ठां॒ ग्रा॒वभिः सुत॒म् । कुवि॒न् न्व् अ॑स्य तृप्ण॒वः ॥२॥

text: To Indra have my songs of praise gone forth, thus rapidly sent hence, To turn him to the Soma-draught.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रम् इत्था॒ गि॒रो म॒मा॒छागुर् इषिता॒ इतः॒ । आवृ॒ते सो॒मपीतये ॥३॥

text: Hither with songs of praise we call Indra to drink the Soma. juice: Will he not come to us by lauds?
meaning: इ॒न्द्रं सो॒मस्य पीत॒ये स्तो॒मैर् इह॒ हवामहे । उक्थे॒भिः कुवि॒द् आग॒मत् ॥४॥

text: Indra, these Somas are expressed, Take them within thy belly, Lord Of Hundred Powers, thou Prince of wealth.
meaning: इ॒न्द्र सो॒माः सुता॒ इमे॒ ता॒न् दधिष्व शतक्रतो । जथ॒रे वाजिनीवसो ॥५॥

text: We know thee winner of the spoil and resolute in battles, Sage! Therefore thy blessing we implore.
meaning: विद्मा॒ हि॒ त्वा धनंजयं॒ वा॒जेषु दधृषं॒ कवे । अ॒धा ते सुम्न॒म् ईमहे ॥६॥

text: Borne hither by thy stallions, drink, Indra, this juice which we have pressed, Mingled with barley and with milk.
meaning: इम॒म् इन्द्र ग॒वाशिरं य॒वाशिरं च नः पिब । आग॒त्या वृ॒षभिः सुत॒म् ॥७॥

text: Indra, for thee in thine own place I urge the Soma for thy draught: Deep in thy heart let it remain.
meaning: तु॒भ्ये॒द् इन्द्र स्व॒ ओक्ये॑ सो॒मं चोदामि पीत॒ये । एष॒ रारन्तु ते हृदि॒ ॥८॥

text: We call on thee, the Ancient One, Indra, to drink the Soma juice, We Kusikas who seek thine aid.
meaning: त्वां॒ सुत॒स्य पीत॒ये प्रत्न॒म् इन्द्र हवामहे । कुशिका॒सो अवस्य॒वः ॥९॥

text: Indra, the mortal man well guarded by thine aid goes foremost in the wealth of horses and of kine. With amplest wealth thou fillest him, as round about the waters clearly seen afar fill Sindhu full.
meaning: अ॒श्वावति प्रथमो॒ गो॒षु गछति सुप्रावी॒र् इन्द्र म॒र्त्यस् त॒वोति॒भिः । त॒म् इ॒त् पृणक्षि व॒सुना भ॒वीयसा सि॒न्धुम् आ॒पो य॒थाभि॒तो वि॒चेतसः ॥१॥

text: The heavenly waters come not nigh the priestly bowl: they but look down and see how far mid-air is spread: The Deities conduct the pious man to them: like suitors they delight in him who loveth prayer.
meaning: आ॒पो न॒ देवी॒र् उ॒प यन्ति होत्रि॒यम् अवः॒ पश्यन्ति वि॒ततं य॒था र॒जः । प्राचै॒र् देवा॒सः प्र॒ णयन्ति देवयुं॒ ब्रह्मप्रि॒यं जोषयन्ते वरा॒ इव ॥२॥

text: Praiseworthy blessing hast thou laid upon the pair who with uplifted ladle serve thee, man and wife. Unchecked he dwells and prospers in thy law: thy power brings blessing to the sacrificer pouring gifts.
meaning: अ॒धि द्व॒योर् अदधा उक्थ्यं॑ व॒चो यत॒स्रुचा मिथुना॒ या॒ सपर्य॒तः । अ॒संयत्तो व्रते॒ ते क्षेति पु॒ष्यति भद्रा॒ शक्ति॒र् य॒जमानाय सुन्वते॒ ॥३॥

text: First the Angirases won themselves vital power, whose fires were kindled through good deeds and sacrifice. The men together found the Pani's hoarded wealth, the cattle, and the wealth in horses and in kine,
meaning: आ॒द् अ॒ङ्गिराः प्रथमं॒ दधिरे व॒य इद्धा॒ग्नयः श॒म्या ये॒ सुकृत्य॒या । स॒र्वं पणेः॒ स॒म् अविन्दन्त भो॒जनम् अ॒श्वावन्तं गो॒मन्तम् आ॒ पशुं॒ न॒रः ॥४॥

text: Atharvan first by sacrifices laid the path; then, guardian of the Law, sprang up the loving Sun. Usanā Kāvya drove the kine hither with him: let us with offer- ings honour Yama's deathless birth.
meaning: यज्ञै॒र् अ॒थर्वा प्रथमः॒ पथ॒स् तते त॒तः सू॒र्यो व्रतपा॒ वेन॒ आ॒जनि । आ॒ गा॒ आजद् उश॒ना काव्यः॒ स॒चा यम॒स्य जात॒म् अमृ॒तं यजामहे ॥५॥

text: When sacred grass is trimmed to aid the auspicious work, or the hymn makes its voice of praise sound to the sky, Where the stone rings as 'twere a singer skilled in laud,—Indra in truth delights when these come near to him.
meaning: बर्हि॒र् वा य॒त् स्वपत्या॒य वृज्य॒ते ऽर्को॒ वा श्लो॒कम् आघो॒षते दिवि॒ । ग्रा॒वा य॒त्र व॒दति करु॒र् उक्थ्य॑स् त॒स्ये॒द् इ॒न्द्रो अभिपित्वे॒षु रण्यति ॥६॥

text: To make thee start, a strong true draught I offer to thee the Bull, O thou whom bay steeds carry. Here take delight. O Indra, in our voices while thou art hymned with power and all our spirit.
meaning: प्रो॒ग्रां॒ पीतिं॒ वृ॒ष्ण इयर्मि सत्यां॒ प्रयै॒ सुत॒स्य हर्यश्व तु॒भ्यम् । इ॒न्द्र धे॒नाभिर् इह॒ मादयस्व धीभि॒र् वि॒श्वाभिः श॒च्या गृणानः॒ ॥७॥

text: In every need, in every fray we call, as friends, to succour us Indra the mightiest of all.
meaning: यो॒गेयोगे तव॒स्तरं वा॒जेवाजे हवामहे । स॒खाय इ॒न्द्रम् ऊत॒ये ॥१॥

text: If he will hear us let him come with succour of a thousand kinds, And all that strengthens, to our call.
meaning: आ॒ घा गमद् य॒दि श्र॒वत् सहस्रि॒णीभिर् ऊति॒भिः । वा॒जेभिर् उ॒प नो ह॒वम् ॥२॥

text: I call him, mighty to resist, the Hero of our ancient home, Thee whom my sire invoked of old.
meaning: अ॒नु प्रत्न॒स्यौ॒कसो हुवे॒ तुविप्रतिं॒ न॒रम् । यं॒ ते पू॒र्वं पिता॒ हुवे॒ ॥३॥

text: They who stand round him as he moves harness the bright, the ruddy steed: The lights are shining in the sky.
meaning: युञ्ज॒न्ति ब्रध्न॒म् अरुषं॒ च॒रन्तं प॒रि तस्थु॒षः । रो॒चन्ते रोचना॒ दिवि॒ ॥४॥

text: On both sides of the car they yoke the two bay coursers dear to him, Bold, tawny, bearers of the thief.
meaning: युञ्ज॒न्ति अस्य का॒म्या ह॒री वि॒पक्षसा र॒थे । शो॒णा धृष्णू॒ नृवा॒हसा ॥५॥

text: Thou, making light where no light was, and form, O Men! where form was not, Wast born together with the Dawns.
meaning: केतुं॒ कृण्व॒न्न् अकेत॒वे पे॒शो मर्या अपेश॒से । स॒म् उष॒द्भिर् अजायथाः ॥६॥

text: If I, O Indra, were, like thee, the single sovran of all wealth. My worshipper should be rich in kine.
meaning: य॒द् इन्द्राहं॒ य॒था त्व॒म् ई॒शीय व॒स्व ए॒क इ॒त् । स्तोता॒ मे गो॒षखा स्यात् ॥१॥
