text: I should be fain, O Lord of Might, to strengthen and enrich the sage, Were I the lord of herds of kine,
meaning: शि॒क्षेयम् अस्मै दि॒त्सेयं श॒चीपते मनीषि॒णे । य॒द् अहं॒ गो॒पतिः स्या॒म् ॥२॥

text: To worshippers who press the juice thy goodness, Indra, is a cow. Yielding in plenty kine and steeds.
meaning: धेनु॒ष् ट इन्द्र सूनृ॒ता य॒जमानाय सुन्वते॒ । गा॒म् अ॒श्वं पिप्यु॒षी दुहे ॥३॥

text: None is there, Indra, God or man, to hinder thy munificence, The wealth which, lauded, thou wilt give.
meaning: न॒ ते वर्ता॒स्ति रा॒धस इ॒न्द्र देवो॒ न॒ म॒र्त्यः । य॒द् दि॒त्ससि स्तुतो॒ मघ॒म् ॥४॥

text: The sacrifice made Indra strong when he unrolled the earth and made Himself a diaden in heaven.
meaning: यज्ञ॒ इ॒न्द्रम् अवर्धयद् य॒द् भू॒मिं व्य् अ॑वर्तयत् । चक्राण॒ ओपशं॒ दिवि॒ ॥५॥

text: Thine aid we claim, O Indra, thine who after thou hast waxen great. Hast won all treasures for thine own.
meaning: वावृधान॒स्य ते वयं॒ वि॒श्वा ध॒नानि जिग्यु॒षः । ऊति॒म् इन्द्रा॒ वृणीमहे ॥६॥

text: In Soma's ecstasy Indra spread the firmament and realms of light. When he cleft Vala limb from limb.
meaning: व्य् अ॑न्त॒रिक्षम् अतिरन् म॒दे सो॒मस्य रोचना॒ । इ॒न्द्रो य॒द् अ॒भिनद् वल॒म् ॥१॥

text: Showing the hidden he draye forth the cows for the Angirases, And Vala he cast headlong down.
meaning: उ॒द् गा॒ आजद् अ॒ङ्गिरोभ्य आवि॒ष् क्र्ण्व॒न् गु॒हा सतीः॒ । अर्वा॒ञ्चं नुनुदे वल॒म् ॥२॥

text: By Indra were the luminous realms of heaven established and secured. Firm and immovable in their place.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रेण रोचना॒ दिवो॒ दृल्हा॒नि दृंहिता॒नि च । स्थिरा॒णि न॒ पराणु॒दे ॥३॥

text: Indra, thy laud moves quickly like a joyous wave of water-floods. Bright shine the drops that gladden thee.
meaning: अपा॒म् ऊर्मि॒र् म॒दन्न् इव स्तो॒म इन्द्राजिरायते । वि॒ ते म॒दा अराजिषुः ॥४॥

text: For thou, O Indra, art the God whom hymns and praises magnify: Thou blessest those who worship thee.
meaning: त्वं॒ हि॒ स्तोमव॒र्धन इ॒न्द्रा॒स्य् उक्थव॒र्धनः । स्तोतृ̄णा॒म् उत॒ भद्रकृ॒त् ॥१॥

text: Bay horses with their long manes bring Indra to drink the Soma juice, The Bountiful to our sacrifice.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रम् इ॒त् केशि॒ना ह॒री सोमपे॒याय वक्षतः । उ॒प यज्ञं॒ सुरा॒धसम् ॥२॥

text: With waters' foam thou torest off, Indra, the head of Namuchi, Subduing all contending hosts.
meaning: अपां॒ फे॒नेन न॒मुचेः शि॒र इन्द्रो॒द् अवर्तयः । वि॒श्वा य॒द् अ॒जय स्पृ॒धः ॥३॥

text: The Dasyus, when they fain would climb by magic arts and mount to heaven, Thou, Indra, castest down to earth.
meaning: माया॒भिर् उत्सि॒सृप्सत इन्द्र द्या॒म् आरु॒रुक्षतः । अ॒व द॒स्यूंर् अधूनुथाः ॥४॥

text: As Soma-drinker conquering all, thou scatteredst to every side Their band who poured no gifts to thee.
meaning: असुन्वा॒म् इन्द्र संस॒दं वि॒षूचीं व्य् अ॑नाशयः । सोमपा॒ उ॒त्तरो भ॒वन् ॥५॥

text: In the great synod will I laud thy two bay steeds: I prize the sweet strong drink of thee the Warrior-God, His who pours lovely oil as'twere with yellow drops. Let my songs enter thee whose form hath golden tints.
meaning: प्र॒ ते महे॒ विद॒थे शंसिषं ह॒री प्र॒ ते वन्वे वनु॒षो हर्यतं॒ म॒दम् । घृतं॒ न॒ यो॒ ह॒रिभिश् चा॒रु से॒चत आ॒ त्वा विशन्तु ह॒रिवर्पसं गि॒रः ॥१॥

text: Ye who—in concert sing unto the gold-hued place, like bay steeds driving onward to the heavenly seat, For Indra laud ye strength allied with tawny steeds, laud him whom cows content as'twere with yellow drops.
meaning: ह॒रिं हि॒ यो॒निम् अभि॒ ये॒ सम॒स्वरन् हिन्व॒न्तो ह॒री दिव्यं॒ य॒था स॒दः । आ॒ यं॒ पृण॒न्ति ह॒रिभिर् न॒ धेन॒व इ॒न्द्राय शूशं॒ ह॒रिवन्तम् अर्चत ॥२॥

text: His is that thunderbolt, of iron, golden-hued, gold-coloured, very dear, and yellow in his arms; Bright with strong teeth, destroying with its tawny rage. In Indra are set fast all forms of golden hue.
meaning: सो॒ अस्य व॒ज्रो ह॒रितो य॒ आयसो॒ ह॒रिर् नि॒कामो ह॒रिर् आ॒ ग॒भस्त्योः । द्युम्नी॒ सुशिप्रो॒ ह॒रिमन्युसायक इ॒न्द्रे नि॒ रूपा॒ ह॒रिता मिमिक्षिरे ॥३॥

text: As if a lovely ray were laid upon the sky, the golden thunder- bolt spread out as in a race. That iron bolt with yellow jaw smote Ahi down. A thousand flames had he who bore the tawny-hued.
meaning: दिवि॒ न॒ केतु॒र् अ॒धि धायि हर्यतो॒ विव्य॒चद् व॒ज्रो ह॒रितो न॒ रं॒ह्या । तुद॒द् अहिं॒ ह॒रिशिप्रो य॒ आयसः॒ सह॒स्रशोका अभवद् धरिम्भरः॒ ॥४॥

text: Thou, thou, when praised by men who sacrificed of old, hadst pleasure in their lauds, O Indra golden-haired. All that befits thy song of praise thou welcomest, the perfect: pleasant gift, O golden-hued from birth.
meaning: त्वं॒त्वम् अहर्यथा उ॒पस्तुतः पू॒र्वेभिर् इन्द्र हरिकेश य॒ज्वभिः । त्वं॒ हर्यसि त॒व वि॒श्वम् उक्थ्य॑म् अ॒सामि रा॒धो हरिजात हर्यत॒म् ॥५॥

text: These two dear Bays bring hither Indra on his car, thunder- armed, joyous, meet for laud, to drink his fill. Many libations flow for him who loveth them: to Indra have: the gold-hued Soma juices run.
meaning: ता॒ वज्रि॒णं मन्दि॒नं स्तो॒म्यं म॒द इ॒न्द्रं र॒थे वहतो हर्यता ह॒री । पुरू॒ण्य् अस्मै स॒वनानि ह॒र्यत इ॒न्द्राय सो॒मा ह॒रयो दधन्विरे ॥१॥

text: The gold-hued drops have flowed to gratify his wish: the yellow. drops have urged the swift Bays to the Strong. He who speeds on with bay steeds even as he lists hath satisfied his longing for the golden drops.
meaning: अ॒रं का॒माय ह॒रयो दधमिरे स्थिरा॒य हिन्वन् ह॒रयो ह॒री तुरा॒ । अ॒र्वद्भिर् यो॒ ह॒रिभिर् जो॒षम् ई॒यते सो॒ अस्य का॒मं ह॒रिवन्तम् आनशे ॥२॥

text: At the swift draught the Soma-drinker waxed in might, the iron. One with yellow beard and golden hair, He, Lord of tawny coursers. Lord of fleet-foot mares, will bear his bay steeds safely over all distress.
meaning: ह॒रिश्मशारुर् ह॒रिकेश आयस॒स् तुरस्पे॒ये यो॒ हरिपा॒ अ॒वर्धत । अ॒र्वद्भिर् यो॒ ह॒रिभिर् वाजि॒नीवसुर् अ॒ति वि॒श्वा दुरिता॒ पा॒रिषद् ध॒री ॥३॥

text: His yellow-coloured jaws, like ladles, move apart, what time,. for strength, he makes the yellow-tinted stir, When. while the bowl stands there, he grooms his tawny steeds, when he hath drunk strong drink, the sweet juice that he: loves.
meaning: श्रु॒वेव यस्य ह॒रिणी विपेत॒तुः शि॒प्रे वा॒जाय ह॒रिणी द॒विध्वतः । प्र॒ य॒त् कृते॒ चमसे॒ म॒र्मृजद् ध॒री पीत्वा॒ म॒दस्य हर्यत॒स्या॒न्धसः ॥४॥

text: Yea, to the dear one's seat in homes of heaven and earth the- bay steeds' Lord hath whinnied like a horse for food. Then the great wish hath seized upon him mightily, and the beloved One hath gained high power of life.
meaning: उत॒ स्म स॒द्न हर्यत॒स्य पस्त्यो॑र् अ॒त्यो न॒ वा॒जं ह॒रिवां अचिक्रदत् । मही॒ चिद् धि॒ धिष॒णा॒हर्यद् ओ॒जसा बृह॒द् व॒यो दधिषे हर्यत॒स् चिद् आ॒ ॥५॥

text: Thou, comprehending with thy might the earth and heaven, acceptest the dear hymn for ever new and new. O Asura, disclose thou and make visible the Cow's beloved home to the bright golden Sun.
meaning: आ॒ रो॒दसी ह॒र्यमाणो महित्वा॒ न॒व्यंनव्यं हर्यसि म॒न्म नु॒ प्रिय॒म् । प्र॒ पस्त्य॑म् असुर हर्यतं॒ गो॒र् आवि॒ष् कृधि ह॒रये सू॒र्याय ॥१॥

text: O Indra, let the eager wishes of the folk bring thee the golden- jawed, delightful, on thy car. That, pleased with sacrifice wherein ten fingers toil, thou mayest at the feast drink of our offered mead.
meaning: आ॒ त्वा हर्य॒न्तं प्रयु॒जो ज॒नानां र॒थे वहन्तु ह॒रिशिप्रम् इन्द्र । पि॒बा य॒था प्र॒तिभृतस्य म॒ध्वो ह॒र्यन् यज्ञं॒ सधमा॒दे द॒शोणिम् ॥२॥

text: Juices aforetime, Lord of Bays, thou drankest, and thine, and only thine, is this libation. Gladden thee, Indra, with the mead-rich Soma: pour it down ever, Mighty One, within thee.
meaning: अ॒पाः पू॒र्वेषां हरिवः सुता॒नाम् अ॒थो इदं॒ स॒वनं के॒वलं ते । ममद्धि॒ सो॒मं म॒धुमन्तम् इन्द्र सत्रा॒ वृषं जथ॒र आ॒ वृषस्व ॥३॥

text: Drink of the juice which men have washed in waters and fill the- full, O Lord of tawny horses. O Indra, hearer of the laud, with Soma which stones have mix- ed for thee enhance thy rapture.
meaning: अप्सु॒ धूत॒स्य हरिवः पि॒बेह॒ नृ॒भिः सुत॒स्य जठ॒रं पृणस्व । मिमिक्षु॒र् य॒म् अ॒द्रय इन्द्र तु॒भ्यं ते॒भिर् वर्धस्व म॒दम् उक्थवाहः ॥१॥

text: To make thee start, a strong true draught I offer to thee the Bull, O thou whom bay steeds carry. Here take delight, O Indra, in our voices while thou art hymned with power and all our spirit.
meaning: प्रो॒ग्रां॒ पीतिं॒ वृ॒ष्ण इयर्मि सत्यां॒ प्रयै॒ सुत॒स्य हर्यश्व तु॒भ्यम् । इ॒न्द्र धे॒नाभिर् इह॒ मादयस्व धीभि॒र् वि॒श्वाभिः श॒च्या गृणानः॒ ॥२॥

text: O mighty Indra, through thine aid, thy prowess, obtaining life, zealous, and skilled in worship. Men in the house who share the sacred banquet stand singing praise that brings them store of children.
meaning: ऊती॒ शचीवस् त॒व वीर्ये॑ण व॒यो द॒धाना उशि॒ज ऋतज्ञाः॒ । प्रजा॒वद् इन्द्र मं॒सो दुरोणे॒ तस्थु॒र् गृण॒न्तः सधमा॒द्यासः ॥३॥

text: He who just born, chief God of lofty spirit, by power and might became the God's protector, Before whose breath, through greatness of his valour, the two worlds trembled, He, O men, is Indra.
meaning: यो॒ जात॒ एव॒ प्रथमो॒ म॒नस्वान् देवो॒ देवा॒न् क्र॒तुना पर्य॒मूषत् । य॒स्य शु॒ष्माद् रो॒दसी अ॒भ्यसेतां नृम्ण॒स्य मह्ना॒ स॒ जनास इ॒न्द्रः ॥१॥

text: He who fixed fast and firm the earth that staggered, and set at rest the agitated mountains, Who measured out air's wider middle region and gave the heaven support, He, O men, is Indra.
meaning: यः॒ पृथिवीं॒ व्य॒थमानाम् अ॒दृंहद् यः॒ प॒र्वतान् प्र॒कुपितां अ॒रम्णात् । यो॒ अन्त॒रिक्षं विममे॒ व॒रीयो यो॒ द्याम् अ॒स्तभ्नात् स॒ जनास इ॒न्द्रः ॥२॥

text: Who slew the Dragon, freed the Seven Rivers, and draye the kine forth from the cave of Vala, Begat the fire between both stones, the spoiler in warrior's battle, He, O men, is Indra.
meaning: यो॒ हत्वा॒हिम् अ॒रिणात् सप्त॒ सि॒न्धून् यो॒ गा॒ उदा॒जद् अपधा॒ वल॒स्य । यो॒ अ॒श्मनोर् अन्त॒र् अग्निं॒ जजान संवृ॒क् सम॒त्सु स॒ जनास इ॒न्द्रः ॥३॥

text: By whom this universe was made to tremble, who chased away the humbled brood of demon, Who, like a gambler gathering his winnings, seized the foe's riches, He, O men, is Indra.
meaning: ये॒नेमा॒ वि॒श्वा च्य॒वना कृता॒नि यो॒ दा॒सं व॒र्णम् अ॒धरं गु॒हा॒कः । श्वघ्नी॒व यो॒ जिगीवां॒ लक्ष॒म् आ॒दद् अर्यः॒ पुष्टा॒नि स॒ जनास इ॒न्द्रः ॥४॥

text: Of whom, the terrible, they ask, Where is He? or verily they say of him, He is not. He wastes the foeman's wealth like stakes of gamblers. Have faith in him for He, O men, is Indra.
meaning: यं॒ स्मा पृछ॒न्ति कु॒ह से॒ति घोर॒म् उते॒म् आहुर् नै॒षो॒ अस्ती॒त्य् एनम् । सो॒ अर्यः॒ पुष्टी॒र् वि॒ज इवा॒ मिनाति श्र॒द् अस्मै धत्त स॒ जनास इ॒न्द्रः ॥५॥

text: Stirrer to action of the poor and lowly, of priest, of suppliant who sings his praises Who, fair-faced, favours him who presseth Soma with stones adjusted, He, O men, is Indra.
meaning: यो॒ रध्र॒स्य चोदिता॒ यः॒ कृश॒स्य यो॒ ब्रह्म॒णो ना॒धमानस्य कीरेः॒ । युक्त॒ग्राव्णो यो॒ ऽविता॒ सुशिप्रः॒ सुत॒सोमस्य स॒ जनास इ॒न्द्रः ॥६॥

text: He under whose supreme control are horses, all chariots, and the hamlets, and the cattle: He who begat the Sun, begat the Morning, leader of waters. He, O men, is Indra.
meaning: य॒स्या॒श्वासः प्रदि॒शि य॒स्य गा॒वो य॒स्य ग्रा॒मा य॒स्य वि॒श्वे र॒थासः । यः॒ सू॒र्यं य॒ उष॒सं जजा॒न यो॒ अपां॒ नेता॒ स॒ जनास इ॒न्द्रः ॥७॥

text: To whom both armies cry in close encounter, foe against foe, the stronger and the weaker; Whom two invoke upon one chariot mounted, each for himself, He, O ye men, is Indra.
meaning: यं॒ क्र॒न्दसी संयती॒ विह्व॒येते प॒रे॒ ऽवरे उभ॒या अमि॒त्राः । समानं॒ चिद् र॒थम् आतस्थिवां॒सा ना॒ना हवेते स॒ जनास इ॒न्द्रः ॥८॥

text: He, without whom men conquer not in battle, whom, warring, they invoke for help and succour; He, all this universe's type and image, who shakes what never shook, He, men, is Indra.
meaning: य॒स्मान् न॒ ऋते॒ विज॒यन्ते ज॒नासो यं॒ यु॒ध्यमाना अ॒वसे ह॒वन्ते । यो॒ वि॒श्वस्य प्रतिमा॒नं बभू॒व यो॒ अच्युतच्यु॒त् स॒ जनास इ॒न्द्रः ॥९॥

text: He who hath smitten, ere they know their danger, with his hurl- ed weapon many grievous sinners: Who pardons not his boldness who provokes him, who slays the Dasyu, He, O men, is Indra.
meaning: यः॒ श॒स्वतो म॒ह्य् एनो द॒धानान् अ॒मन्यमानां छ॒र्वा जघा॒न । यः॒ श॒र्धते ना॒नुद॒दाति शृध्यां॒ यो॒ द॒स्योर् हन्ता॒ स॒ जनास इ॒न्द्रः ॥१०॥

text: He who discovered in the fortieth autumn Sambara dwelling in the midst of mountains: Who slew the Dragon putting forth his vigour, the demon lying there, He, men, is Indra.
meaning: यः॒ श॒म्भरं प॒र्वतेषु क्षिय॒न्तं चत्वारिंश्यां॒ शर॒द्य् अन्व॒विन्दत् । ओजाय॒मानं यो॒ अ॒हिं जघा॒न दा॒नुं श॒यानं स॒ जनास इ॒न्द्रः ॥११॥

text: Who drank the juice poured at the seas of Order, subduing Sambara by superior prowess, Who hoarded food within the mountain's hollow wherein he grew in strength, He, men, is Indra.
meaning: यः॒ शम्भरं पर्य॒तरत् क॒सीभिर् यो॒ ऽचारुकास्ना॒पिबत् सुत॒स्य । अन्त॒र् गिरौ॒ य॒जमानं बहुं॒ ज॒नं य॒स्मिन्न् आ॒मूर्छत् स॒ जनास इ॒न्द्रः ॥१२॥

text: Who, with seven guiding reins, the Bull, the mighty, set the Seven Rivers free to flow at pleasure; Who, thunder-armed, rent Rauhina in pieces when scaling heaven, He, O ye men, is Indra.
meaning: यः॒ सप्त॒रश्मिर् वृषभ॒स् तु॒विष्मान् अवा॒सृजत् स॒र्तवे सप्त॒ सि॒न्धून् । यो॒ रौहिण॒म् अ॒स्फुरद् व॒ज्रबाहुर् द्या॒म् आरो॒हन्तं स॒ जनास इ॒न्द्रः ॥१३॥

text: Heaven, even, and the earth bow down before him, before his very breath the mountains tremble. Known as the Soma-drinker, armed with thunder, the wielder of the bolt, He, men, is Indra.
meaning: द्या॒वा चिद् अस्मै पृथिवी॒ ममेते शु॒ष्माच् चिद् अस्य प॒र्वता भयन्ते । यः॒ सोमपा॒ निचितो॒ व॒ज्रबाहुर् यो॒ व॒ज्रहस्तः स॒ जनास इ॒न्द्रः ॥१४॥

text: Who aids with favour him who pours the Soma, and him who brews it, sacrificer, singer; Whose strength our prayer and offered Soma heighten, and this our gift, He, O ye men, is Indra.
meaning: यः॒ सुन्व॒न्तम् अ॒वति यः॒ प॒चन्तं यः॒ शं॒सन्तं यः॒ शशमान॒म् ऊती॒ । य॒स्य ब्र॒ह्म व॒र्धनं य॒स्य सो॒मो य॒स्येदं॒ रा॒धः स॒ जनास इ॒न्द्रः ॥१५॥

text: Born, manifested in his Parents' bosom, He knoweth as a son the Highest Father. He who with vigorous energy assisted the companies of Gods, He, men, is Indra
meaning: जातो॒ व्य् अ॑ख्यत् पित्रो॒र् उप॒स्थे भु॒वो न॒ वेद जनितुः॒ प॒रस्य । स्तविष्य॒माणो नो॒ यो॒ अस्म॒द् व्रता॒ देवा॒नां स॒ जनास इ॒न्द्रः ॥१६॥

text: Lord of Bay steeds, who loves the flowing Soma, He before whom all living creatures tremble. He who smote Sambara and slaughtered Sushna, He the Sole Hero, He, O men, is Indra.
meaning: यः॒ सो॒मकामो ह॒र्यश्वः सूरि॒र् य॒स्माद् रे॒जन्ते भु॒वनानि वि॒श्वा । यो॒ जघा॒न श॒म्बरं य॒श् च शु॒ष्णं य॒ एकवीरः॒ स॒ जनास इ॒न्द्रः ॥१७॥

text: Thou verily art true strong God who sendest wealth to the man who brews and pours libation. So may we evermore, thy friends, O Indra, address the synod with brave sons about us.
meaning: यः॒ सुन्वते॒ प॒चते दुध्र॒ आ॒ चिद् वा॒जं द॒र्दर्षि स॒ कि॒लासि सत्यः॒ । वयं॒ त इन्द्र विश्व॒ह प्रिया॒सः सुवी॒रासो विद॒थम् आ॒ वदेम ॥१८॥

text: To him, to him swift, strong, and high-exalted, I bring my song of praise as dainty viands; My thought to him resistless, meet for praises, prayers offered most devotedly to Indra.
meaning: अस्मा॒ इ॒द् उ प्र॒ तव॒से तुरा॒य प्र॒यो न॒ हर्मि स्तो॒मं मा॒हिनाय । ऋ॒चीषमाया॒ध्रिगव ओ॒हम् इ॒न्द्राय ब्र॒ह्माणि रात॒तमा ॥१॥

text: To him I offer praise as choice refreshment, bring forth my song, with seemly laud besiege him. For Indra, Lord of olden time, the singers shall deck their hymns with heart and mind and spirit.
meaning: अस्मा॒ इ॒द् उ प्र॒य इव प्र॒ यंसि भ॒राम्य् आन्गूषं॒ बा॒धे सुवृक्ति॒ । इ॒न्द्राय हृदा॒ म॒नसा मनीषा॒ प्रत्ना॒य प॒त्ये धि॒यो मर्जयन्त ॥२॥

text: To him then with my lips my song of praises, excellent, winning heavenly light, I offer, To magnify with hymns of invocation and eulogies the Lord, most bounteous Giver.
meaning: अस्मा॒ इ॒द् उ त्य॒म् उपमं॒ स्वर्षां॒ भ॒राम्य् आङ्गूष॒म् आस्ये॑न । मं॒हिष्ठम् अ॒छोक्तिभिर् मतीनां॒ सुवृक्ति॒भिः सूरिं॒ वावृध॒ध्यै ॥३॥

text: Even for him I frame a laud—so fashions the wright a chariot for the man who needs it Songs for wise Indra hymned with invocation, a song composed with care and all-impelling.
meaning: अस्मा॒ इ॒द् उ स्तो॒मं सं॒ हिनोमि र॒थं न॒ त॒ष्टेव त॒त्सिनाय । गि॒रश् च गि॒र्वाहसे सुवृक्ती॒न्द्राय विश्वमिन्वं॒ मे॒धिराय ॥४॥

text: So with my tongue I deck, to please that Indra, my hymn as't- were a horse, through love of glory, To reverence the Hero, bounteous Giver, famed far and wide, destroyer of the castles.
meaning: अस्मा॒ इ॒द् उ स॒प्तिम् इव श्रवस्ये॒न्द्रायार्कं॒ जुह्वा॑ स॒म् अञ्जे । वीर॒म् दानौ॒कसं वन्द॒ध्यै पुरां॒ गूर्त॒श्रवसं दर्मा॒णम् ॥५॥

text: Even for him hath Tvashtar forged the thunder, most deftly wrought, celestial, for the battle. Wherewith he reached the vital parts of Vritra, striking—the vast, the mighty—with the striker,
meaning: अस्मा॒ इ॒द् उ त्व॒ष्टा तक्षद् व॒ज्रं स्व॒पस्तमं स्वर्यं॑ र॒णाय । वृत्र॒स्य चिद् विद॒द् ये॒न म॒र्म तुज॒न्न् ई॒शानस् तुजता॒ कियेधाः॒ ॥६॥

text: As soon as, at libations of his mother, great Vishnu had drunk up the draught, he plundered. The dainty cates, the cooked mess; but One stronger transfixed the wild boar, shooting through the mountain.
meaning: अस्ये॒द् उ मातुः॒ स॒वनेषु सद्यो॒ महः॒ पितुं॒ पपिवां॒ चा॒र्व् अ॒न्ना । मुषाय॒द् वि॒ष्णुः पचतं॒ स॒हीयान् वि॒ध्यद् वराहं॒ तिरो॒ अ॒द्रिम् अ॒स्ता ॥७॥

text: To him, to Indra when he slew the Dragon, the Dames too, Consorts of the Gods, wove praises. The mighty heaven and earth hath he encompassed: thy great- ness heaven and earth, combined, exceed not.
meaning: अस्मा॒ इ॒द् उ ग्ना॒श् चिद् देव॒पत्नीर् इ॒न्द्रायार्क॒म् अहिह॒त्य ऊवुः । प॒रि द्या॒वापृथिवी॒ जभ्र उर्वी॒ ना॒स्य ते॒ महिमा॒नं प॒रि ष्टः ॥८॥

text: Yea, of a truth, his magnitude surpasseth the magnitude of earth, mid-air and heaven. Indra whom all men praise, the Sovran Ruler, waxed in his home loud-voiced and strong for battle.
meaning: अस्ये॒द् एव॒ प्र॒ रिरिचे महित्वं॒ दिव॒स् पृथिव्याः॒ प॒र्य् अन्त॒रिक्षात् । स्वरा॒ल् इ॒न्द्रो द॒म आ॒ विश्व॒गूर्तः स्वरि॒र् अ॒मत्रो ववक्षे र॒णाय ॥९॥

text: Through his own strength with bolt of thunder Indra smote piece-meal Vritra, drier up of waters. He let the floods go free, like cows imprisoned, for glory, with a heart inclined to bounty.
meaning: अस्ये॒द् एव॒ श॒वसा शुश॒न्तं वि॒ वृश्चद् व॒ज्रेण वृत्र॒म् इ॒न्द्रः । गा॒ न॒ व्राणा॒ अव॒नीर् अमुञ्चद् अभि॒ श्र॒वो दाव॒ने स॒चेताः ॥१०॥

text: Through his resplendent power still stood the rivers when with his bolt on every side he stayed them. With lordly might favouring him who worshipped, he made a ford, victorious, for Turviti.
meaning: अस्ये॒द् उ त्वेष॒सा रन्त सि॒न्धवः प॒रि य॒द् व॒ज्रेण सीम् अ॒यछत् । ईशानकृ॒द् दाशु॒षे दशस्य॒न् तुर्वी॒तये गाधं॒ तुर्व॒णिः कः॒ ॥११॥

text: Vast, with thine ample power, with eager movement against this Vritra cast thy bolt of thunder. Rend thou his joints, as of an ox dissevered, with bolt oblique that floods of rain may follow.
meaning: अस्मा॒ इ॒द् उ प्र॒ भरा तू॒तुजानो वृत्रा॒य व॒ज्रम् ई॒शानः कियेधाः॒ । गो॒र् न॒ प॒र्व वि॒ रदा तिरश्चे॒ष्यन्न् अ॒र्णांस्य् अपां॒ चर॒ध्यै ॥१२॥

text: Sing with new lauds his exploits wrought aforetime, the deeds of him, yea, him who moveth swiftly, When, hurling forth his weapons in the battle, he with impetuous wrath lays low the foemen.
meaning: अस्ये॒द् उ प्र॒ ब्रूहि पूर्व्या॒णि तुर॒स्य क॒र्माणि न॒व्य उक्थैः॒ । युधे॒ य॒द् इष्णान॒ आ॒युधान्य् ऋघाय॒माणो निरिणा॒ति श॒त्रून् ॥१३॥

text: When he, yea, he is born the firm-set mountains and the whole heaven and earth tremble in terror. May Nodhas ever lauding the protection of this dear Friend win straightway strength heroic.
meaning: अस्ये॒द् उ भिया॒ गिर॒यश् च दृल्हा॒ द्या॒वा च भू॒मा जनु॒षस् तुजेते । उ॒पो वेन॒स्य जो॒गुवान ओणिं॒ सद्यो॒ भुवद् वीर्या॑य नोधाः॒ ॥१४॥

text: Now unto him of these things hath been given what he, who rules alone o'er much, electeth. Indra helped Etasa, the Soma presser, contending in the chariot- race with Sūrya.
meaning: अस्मा॒ इ॒द् उ त्य॒द् अ॒नु दाय्य् एषाम् ए॒को य॒द् वव्ने॒ भू॒रेर् ई॒शानः । प्रै॒तशं सू॒र्ये पस्पृधानं॒ सौ॒वश्व्ये सु॒ष्विम् आवद् इ॒न्द्रः ॥१५॥

text: Thus to thee, Indra, yoker of bay coursers, the Gotamas have brought their prayers and praises. Bestow upon them thought, decked with all beauty. May he, enriched with prayer, come soon and early.
meaning: एवा॒ ते हारियोजना सुवृक्ती॒न्द्र ब्र॒ह्माणि गो॒तमासो अक्रन् । ऐ॒षु विश्व॒पेशसं धि॒यं धाः प्रात॒र् मक्षू॒ धिया॒वसुर् जगम्यात् ॥१६॥

text: With these my hymns I glorify that Indra who is alone to be invoked by mortals. The Lord, the Mighty One, of manly vigour, victorious, Hero, true, and full of wisdom.
meaning: य॒ ए॒क इ॒द् ध॒व्यश् चर्षणीना॒म् इ॒न्द्रं तं॒ गीर्भि॒र् अभ्य् अ॑र्च आभिः॒ । यः॒ प॒त्यते वृषभो॒ वृ॒ष्ण्यावान्त् सत्यः॒ स॒त्वा पुरुमायः॒ स॒हस्वान् ॥१॥

text: Our ancient sires, Navagvas, sages seven, while urging him to show his might, extolled him, Dweller on heights, swift smiting down opponents, guileless in word, and in his thoughts most mighty.
meaning: त॒म् उ नः पू॒र्वे पित॒रो न॒वग्वाः सप्त॒ वि॒प्रासो अभि॒ वाज॒यन्तः । नक्षद्दाभं॒ त॒तुरिं पर्वतेष्ठा॒म् अ॒द्रोघवाचं मति॒भिः श॒विष्ठम् ॥२॥

text: We seek that Indra to obtain his riches that yield much food, and men, and store of heroes. O Lord of Bay Steeds, bring to make us joyful, celestial wealth abundant, undecaying.
meaning: त॒म् ईमहे इ॒न्द्रम् अस्य रायः॒ पुरुवी॒रस्य नृव॒तः पुरुक्षोः॒ । यो॒ अ॒ष्कृधोयुर् अज॒रः स्व॑र्वान् त॒म् आ॒ भर हरिवो मादय॒ध्यै ॥३॥

text: Declare to us—if at thy hand aforetime the earlier singers have obtained good fortune What is thy share and portion, strong Subduer, Asura-slayer, rich, invoked of many?
meaning: त॒न् नो वि॒ वोचो य॒दि ते पुरा॒ चिज् जरिता॒र आनशुः॒ सुम्न॒म् इन्द्र । क॒स् ते भागः॒ किं॒ व॒यो दुध्र खिदुः पु॒रुहूत पुरूवसो ऽसुरघ्नः॒ ॥४॥

text: He who for car-borne, thunder-wielding Indra, hath a hymn, craving deeply-piercing, fluent, Who sends a song effectual, firmly-grasping, and strength- bestowing, he comes near the mighty.
meaning: तं॒ पृछ॒न्ती व॒ज्रहस्तं रथेष्ठा॒म् इ॒न्द्रं वे॒पी व॒क्वरी य॒स्य नू॒ गीः॒ । तुविग्राभं॒ तुविकूर्मिं॒ रभोदां॒ गातु॒म् इ॒षे न॒क्षते तु॒म्रम् अ॒छ ॥५॥

text: Strong of thyself! thou with this art hast shattered with thought- swift Parvata, him who waxed against thee; And, Mightiest! rager! boldly rent in pieces things that were firmly fixed and never shaken..
meaning: अया॒ ह त्यं॒ माय॒या वावृधानं॒ मनोजु॒वा स्वतवः प॒र्वतेन । अ॒च्युता चिद् वीलिता॒ स्वोजो रुजो॒ वि॒ दृल्हा॒ धृषता॒ विरप्शिन् ॥६॥

text: Him will we fit for you with new devotion, the strongest, Ancient One, in ancient manner. So way that Indra, boundless, faithful leader, conduct us o'er all places hard to traverse.
meaning: त॒म् वो धिया॒ न॒व्यस्या श॒विष्ठम् प्रत्नं॒ प्रत्नव॒त् परितंसय॒ध्यै । स॒ नो वक्षद् अनिमानः॒ सुव॒ह्ने॒न्द्रो वि॒श्वान्य् अ॒ति दुर्ग॒हाणि ॥७॥

text: Thou for the people who oppress hast kindled the earthly firma- ment and that of heaven. With heat, O Bull, on every side consume them heat earth and flood for him who hates devotion:
meaning: आ॒ ज॒नाय द्रु॒ह्वणे पा॒र्थिवानि दिव्या॒नि दीपयो ऽन्त॒रिक्षा । त॒पा वृषन् विश्व॒तः शोचि॒षा ता॒न् ब्रह्मद्वि॒षे शो॒चय क्षा॒म् अप॒श् च ॥८॥

text: Of all the heavenly folk, of earthly creatures, thou art the King, O God of splendid aspect. In thy right hand, O Indra, grasp the thunder: Eternal! thou destroyest all enchantments.
meaning: भु॒वो ज॒नस्य दिव्य॒स्य रा॒जा पा॒र्थिवस्य ज॒गतस् त्वेषसंदृक् । धिष्व॒ व॒ज्रं द॒क्षिण इन्द्र ह॒स्ते वि॒श्वा अजुर्य दयसे वि॒ मायाः॒ ॥९॥

text: Give us confirmed prosperity, O Indra, vast and exhaustless for the foes' subduing. Strengthen therewith the Arya's hate and Dāsa's; and let the arms of Nahushas be mighty.
meaning: आ॒ संय॒तम् इन्द्र णः स्वस्तिं॒ शत्रुतू॒र्याय बृहती॒म् अ॒मृध्राम् । य॒या दा॒सान्य् आ॒र्याणि वृत्रा॒ क॒रो वज्रिन्त् सुतु॒का ना॒हुषाणि ॥१०॥

text: Come with thy teams which bring all blessings, hither, disposer, much-invoked, exceeding holy! Come to me swiftly with these teams of coursers, these which no fiend, no God may stay or hinder.
meaning: स॒ नो नियु॒द्भिः पुरुहूत वेधो विश्व॒वाराभिर् आ॒ गहि प्रयज्यो । न॒ या॒ अ॒देवो व॒रते न॒ देव॒ आ॒भिर् याहि तू॒यम् आ॒ मद्र्यद्रि॒क् ॥११॥

text: He, like a bull with sharpened horns, terrific, singly excites and agitates all the people. Then givest him who largely pours libation his wealth who pours not, for his own possession.
meaning: य॒स् तिग्म॒शृङ्गो वृषभो॒ न॒ भीमः॒ ए॒कः कृष्टी॒श् च्यव॒यति प्र॒ वि॒श्वाः । यः॒ श॒श्वतो अ॒दाशुषो ग॒यस्य प्रयन्ता॒सि सु॒ष्वितराय वे॒दः ॥१॥

text: Thou verily, Indra, gavest help to Kutsa, willingly lending ear to him in battle. When, aiding Arjunneya, thou subduedst to him both Kuyava and the Dāsa Sushna.
meaning: त्वं॒ ह त्य॒द् इन्द्र कु॒त्सम् आवः शुश्रूषमाणस् तन्वा॑ समर्ये॒ । दा॒सं य॒च् शु॒ष्णम् कु॒यवं न्य् अ॑स्मा अ॒रन्धय आर्जुनेया॒य शि॒क्षन् ॥२॥

text: O Bold One, thou with all thine aids hast boldly helped Sudās whose offerings were accepted, Pūru in winning land and slaying foemen, and Trasadasyu son of Purukutsa.
meaning: त्वं॒ धृष्णो धृषता॒ वीत॒हव्यं प्रा॒वो वि॒श्वाभिर् ऊति॒भिः सुदा॒सम् । प्र॒ पौ॒रुकुत्सिं त्रस॒दस्युम् आवः क्षे॒त्रसाता वृत्रह॒त्येषु पूरु॒म् ॥३॥

text: At the Gods' banquet, Hero-souled! with heroes, Lord of Bay Steeds, thou slewest many Vritras. Thou sentest in swift death to sleep the Dasyu, both Chumuri and Dhuni, for Dabhiti,
meaning: त्वं॒ नृ॒भिर् नृमणो देव॒वीतौ भू॒रीणि वृत्रा॒ हर्यश्व हंसि । त्वं॒ नि॒ द॒स्युं चु॒मुरिं धु॒निं चा॒स्वापयो दभी॒तये सुह॒न्तु ॥४॥

text: These were thy mighty powers that, Thunder-wielder! then swiftly crushedst nine-and ninety castles. Thou capturedst the hundredth in thine onslaught; thou slewest Namuchi, thou slewest Vritra.
meaning: त॒व च्यौत्ना॒नि वज्रहस्त ता॒नि न॒व य॒त् पु॒रो नवतिं॒ च सद्यः॒ । निवे॒शने शततमा॒विवेषीर् अ॒हं च वृत्रं॒ न॒मुचिम् उता॒हन् ॥५॥

text: Old are the blessings, Indra, which thou gavest Sudās the wor- shipperwho brought oblations. For thee, the strong I yoke thy strong bay horses: let them, approach our prayers and wealth, Most Mighty!
meaning: स॒ना ता॒ त इन्द्र भो॒जनानि रात॒हव्याय दाशु॒षे सुदा॒से । वृ॒ष्णे ते ह॒री वृ॒षणा युनज्मि व्य॒न्तु ब्र॒ह्माणि पुरुशाक वा॒जम् ॥६॥

text: Give us not up, Lord of Bay Horses, victor, in this our time of- trouble, to the wicked. Deliver us with true and faithful succour: dear may we be to thee among the princes.
meaning: मा॒ ते अस्यां॒ सहसावन् प॒रिष्टाव् अघा॒य भूम हरिवः परादौ॒ । त्रा॒यस्व नो ऽवृके॒भिर् व॒रूथैस् त॒व प्रिया॒सः सूरि॒षु स्याम ॥७॥

text: May we men, Bounteous Lord, the friends thou lovest, near i thee be joyful under thy protection. Fain to fulfil the wish of Atithigva, bow Turvasa, bow down,. the son of Yadu.
meaning: प्रिया॒स इ॒त् ते मघवन्न् अभि॒ष्टौ न॒रो मदेम शरणे॒ स॒खायः । नि॒ तुर्व॒शं नि॒ या॒द्वं शिशीह्य् अतिथिग्वा॒य शं॒स्यं करिष्य॒न् ॥८॥

text: Swiftly, in truth, O Bounteous Lord, about thee men skilled im hymning sing their songs and praises. Elect us shares of their love and friendship who by their calls on, thee despoiled the niggards.
meaning: सद्य॒श् चिन् नु॒ ते मघवन्न् अभि॒ष्टौ न॒रः शंसन्त्य् उक्थशा॒स उक्था॒ । ये॒ ते ह॒वेभिर् वि॒ पणीं॒र् अ॒दाशन्न् अस्मा॒न् वृणीष्व यु॒ज्याय त॒स्मै ॥९॥

text: Thine are these Lauds, O manliest of heroes, Lauds which revert to us and give us riches. Favour these, Indra, when they strike the foemen, as Friend and Hero and the heroes' helper.
meaning: एते॒ स्तो॒मा नरां॒ नृतम तु॒भ्यम् अस्मद्र्य॑ञ्चो द॒दतो मघा॒नि । ते॒षाम् इन्द्र वृत्रह॒त्ये शिवो॒ भूः स॒खा च शू॒रो ऽविता॒ च नृणा॒म् ॥१०॥

text: Now, lauded for thine aid, heroic Indra, sped by our prayer,, wax mighty in thy body. To us apportion wealth and habitations. Ye Gods, protect us- evermore with blessings.
meaning: नू॒ इन्द्र शूर स्त॒वमान ऊती॒ ब्र॒ह्मजूतस् तन्वा॑ वावृधस्व । उ॒प नो वा॒जान् मिमीह्य् उ॒प स्ती॒न् युयं॒ पात स्वस्ति॒भिः स॒दा नः ॥११॥

text: Come, we have pressed the juice for thee. O Indra, drink the Soma here. Sit thou on this my sacred grass.
meaning: आ॒ याहि सुषुमा॒ हि॒ त इ॒न्द्र सो॒मं पि॒बा इम॒म् । ए॒दं॒ बर्हिः॒ सदो म॒म ॥१॥

text: O Indra, let thy long-maned Bays, yoked by prayer, bring thee hitherward. Give ear and listen to our prayers.
meaning: आ॒ त्वा ब्रह्मयु॒जा ह॒री व॒हताम् इन्द्र केशि॒ना । उ॒प ब्र॒ह्माणि नः शृणु ॥२॥

text: We, Soma-bearing Brāhmans, call thee, Soma-drinker, with thy friend, We, Indra, bringing juice expressed.
meaning: ब्रह्मा॒णस् त्वा वयं॒ युजा॒ सोमपा॒म् इन्द्र सोमि॒नः । सुता॒वन्तो हवामहे ॥३॥

text: Indra the singers with high praise, Indra reciters with their lauds, Indra the choirs have glorified.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रम् इ॒द् गाथि॒नो बृह॒द् इ॒न्द्रम् अर्के॒भिर् अर्कि॒णः । इ॒न्द्रं वा॒णीर् अनूषत ॥४॥

text: Indra hath ever close to him his two bay steeds and word-yoked: car, Indra, the golden, Thunder-armed.
meaning: इ॒न्द्र इ॒द् ध॒र्योः स॒चा सं॒मिश्ल आ॒ वचोयु॒जा । इ॒न्द्रो वज्री॒ हिरण्य॒यः ॥५॥

text: Indra hath raised the Sun aloft in heaven that he may see afar. He burst the mountain for the kine.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रो दीर्घा॒य च॒क्षस आ॒ सू॒र्यं रोहयद् दिवि॒ । वि॒ गो॒भिर् अ॒द्रिम् ऐरयत् ॥६॥

text: For you, from every side, we call Indra away from other men: Ours, and none others', let him be.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रं वो विश्व॒तस् प॒रि ह॒वामहे ज॒नेभ्यः । अस्मा॒कम् अस्तु के॒वलः ॥१॥

text: In Soma's ecstasy Indra spread the firmament and realms of light. When he cleft Vala limb from limb.
meaning: व्य् अ॑न्त॒रिक्षम् अतिरन् म॒दे सो॒मस्य रोचना॒ । इ॒न्द्रो य॒द् अ॒भिनद् वल॒म् ॥२॥

text: Showing the hidden cows he draye them forth for the Angirases, And Vala he cast headlong down.
meaning: उ॒द् गा॒ आजद् अ॒ङ्गिरोभ्य आवि॒ष् कृण्व॒न् गु॒हा सतीः॒ । अर्वा॒ञ्चं नुनुदे वल॒म् ॥३॥

text: By Indra were the luminous realms of heaven established and secured, Firm and immovable from their place.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रेण रोचना॒ दिवो॒ दृल्हा॒नि दृंहिता॒नि च । स्थिरा॒णि न॒ पराणु॒दे ॥४॥

text: Indra, thy laud moves quickly like a joyous wave of waters: bright. Have shone the drops that gladden thee.
meaning: अपा॒म् ऊर्मि॒र् म॒दन्न् इव स्तो॒म इन्द्राजिरायते । वि॒ ते म॒दा अराजिषुः ॥५॥

text: Mayest thou verily be seen coming by fearless Indra's side: Both joyous: equal in your sheen.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रेण सं॒ हि॒ दृ॒क्षसे संजग्मानो॒ अ॒बिभ्युषा॒ । मन्दू॒ समान॒वर्चसा ॥१॥

text: With Indra's well-beloved hosts, the blameless, hastening to heaven, The sacrificer cries aloud.
meaning: अनवद्यै॒र् अभि॒द्युभिर् मखः॒ स॒हस्वद् अर्चति । गणै॒र् इ॒न्द्रस्य का॒म्यैः ॥२॥

text: Thereafter they, as is their wont, threw off the state of babes unborn, Assuming sacrificial name.
meaning: आ॒द् अ॒ह स्वधा॒म् अ॒नु पु॒नर् गर्भत्व॒म् एरिरे॒ । द॒धाना ना॒म यज्ञि॒यम् ॥३॥

text: With bones of Dadhyach for his arms, Indra, resistless in attack, Struck nine-and-ninety Vritras dead,
meaning: इ॒न्द्रो दधीचो॒ अस्थ॒भिर् वृत्रा॒ण्य् अ॒प्रतिष्कुतः । जघा॒न नवती॒र् न॒व ॥१॥

text: He, searching for the horse's head, removed among the moun- tains, found At Saryanāvān what he sought.
meaning: इछ॒न् अ॒श्वस्य य॒च् छि॒रः प॒र्वतेष्व् अ॒पश्रितम् । त॒द् विदच् छर्यणा॒वति ॥२॥

text: Then verily they recognized the essential form of Tvashtar's Bull. Here in the mansion of the Moon.
meaning: अ॒त्रा॒ह गो॒र् अमन्वत ना॒म त्व॒ष्टुर् अपीच्य॑म् । इत्था॒ चन्द्र॒मसो गृहे॒ ॥३॥

text: From Indra have I measured an eight-footed and nine-cornered. song, Delicate, faithful to the Law.
meaning: वा॒चम् अष्टा॒पदीम् अहं॒ न॒वस्रक्तिम् ऋतस्पृ॒शम् । इ॒न्द्रात् प॒रि तन्व॑म् ममे ॥१॥

text: Indra, both worlds complained to thee when uttering thy fearful roar, What time thou smotest Dasyus dead.
meaning: अ॒नु त्वा रो॒दसी उभे॒ क्र॒क्षमाणम् अकृपेताम् । इ॒न्द्र य॒द् दस्युहा॒भवः ॥२॥

text: Arising in thy might thy jaws thou shookest, Indra, having quaffed The Soma poured into the bowls.
meaning: उत्तिष्ठन्न् ओ॒जसा सह॒ पीत्वी॒ शि॒प्रे अवेपयः । सो॒मम् इन्द्र चमू॒ सुत॒म् ॥३॥

text: Drive all our enemies away, smite down the foes who press around, And bring the wealth for which we long;
meaning: भिन्धि॒ वि॒श्वा अ॒प द्वि॒षः बा॒धो जही॒ मृ॒धः । व॒सु स्पार्हं॒ त॒द् आ॒ भर ॥१॥

text: O Indra, that which is concealed in firm strong place precipitous: Bring us the wealth for which we long:
meaning: य॒द् वीला॒व् इन्द्र य॒त् स्थिरे॒ य॒त् प॒र्शाने प॒राभृतम् । व॒सु स्पार्हं॒ त॒द् आ॒ भर ॥२॥

text: Great riches which the world of men shall recognize as sent by thee: Bring us the wealth for which we long,
meaning: य॒स्य ते विश्व॒मानुषो भू॒रेर् दत्त॒स्य वे॒दति । व॒सु स्पार्हं॒ त॒द् आ॒ भर ॥३॥

text: Praise Indra whom our songs must laud, great Sovran of man- kind, the Chief Most liberal who controlleth men.
meaning: प्र॒ सम्रा॒जं चर्षणीना॒म् इ॒न्द्रं स्तोता न॒व्यं गीर्भिः । न॒रं नृषा॒हं मं॒हिष्ठम् ॥१॥

text: In whom the hymns of praise delight, and all the glory-giving songs, Like the flood's longing for the sea.
meaning: य॒स्मिन्न् उक्था॒नि र॒ण्यन्ति वि॒श्वानि च श्रवस्य । अपा॒म् अ॒वो न॒ समुद्रे॒ ॥२॥

text: Him I invite with eulogy, best King, effective in the fight, Strong for the gain of mighty spoil.
meaning: तं॒ सुष्टुत्या॒ विवासे ज्येष्ठरा॒जं भ॒रे कृत्नु॒म् । महो॒ वाजि॒नं सनि॒भ्यः ॥३॥

text: This is thine own. Thou drawest near, as the dove turneth to his mate. Thou carest too for this our prayer.
meaning: अय॒म् उ ते स॒म् अतसि कपो॒त इव गर्भधि॒म् । व॒चस् त॒च् चिन् न ओहसे ॥१॥

text: O Hero, Lord of Bounties, praised in hymns, may power and pleasantness Be his who signs the laud to thee.
meaning: स्तोत्रं॒ राधानां पते गि॒र्वाहो वीर य॒स्य ते । वि॒भूतिर् अस्तु सूनृ॒ता ॥२॥

text: Lord of a Hundred Powers, stand up to lend us succour in this fight: In others too let us agree.
meaning: ऊर्ध्व॒स् तिष्ठा न ऊत॒ये ऽस्मि॒न् वा॒जे शतक्रतो । स॒म् अन्ये॒षु ब्रवावहै ॥३॥

text: Him who advances men to wealth, sends light to lead them in their wars, And quells their foemen in the fray:
meaning: प्रणेता॒रम् व॒स्यो अ॒छा क॒र्तारं ज्यो॒तिः सम॒त्सु । सासह्वां॒सम् युधा॒मि॒त्रान् ॥१॥

text: May he, the saviour much-invoked, may Indra bear us in a ship Safely beyond all enemies.
meaning: स॒ नः प॒प्रिः पारयाति स्वस्ति॒ नावा॒ पुरुहूतः॒ । इ॒न्द्रो वि॒श्वा अ॒ति द्वि॒षः ॥२॥

text: As such, O Indra, honour us with wealth and treasure: further us, And lead us to felicity.
meaning: स॒ त्वं॒ न इन्द्र वा॒जोभिर् दशस्या॒ च गातुया॒ च । अ॒छा च नः सुम्नं॒ नेषि ॥३॥

text: We make this Indra show his strength, to strike the mighty Vritra dead: A vigorous Hero shall he be.
meaning: त॒म् इ॒न्द्रं वाजयामसि महे॒ वृत्रा॒य ह॒न्तवे । स॒ वृ॒षा वृषभो॒ भुवत् ॥१॥

text: Indra was made for giving, most powerful, friendly in carouse, Bright, meet for Soma, famed in song.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रः स॒ दा॒मने कृत॒ ओ॒जिष्ठः स॒ म॒दे हितः॒ । द्युम्नी॒ श्लोकी॒ स॒ सोम्यः॒ ॥२॥

text: By song, as 'twere, the mighty bolt, which none may parry, was prepared: Lofty, invincible he grew.
meaning: गिरा॒ व॒ज्रो न॒ सं॒भृतः स॒बलो अ॒नपच्युतः । ववक्ष॒ ऋष्वो॒ अ॒स्तृतः ॥३॥

text: इ॒न्द्रम् इ॒द् गाथि॒नो बृह॒द् इ॒न्द्रम् अर्के॒भिर् अर्कि॒णः । इ॒न्द्रं वा॒णीर् अनूषत ॥४॥
इ॒न्द्र इ॒द् ध॒र्योः स॒चा सं॒मिश्ल आ॒ वचोयु॒जा । इ॒न्द्रो वज्री॒ हिरण्य॒यः ॥५॥
इ॒न्द्रो दीर्घा॒य च॒क्षस आ॒ सू॒र्यं रोहयद् दिवि॒ । वि॒ गो॒भिर् अ॒द्रिम् ऐरयत् ॥६॥
आ॒ याहि सुषुमा॒ हि॒ त इ॒न्द्र सो॒मं पि॒बा इम॒म् । ए॒दं॒ बर्हिः॒ सदो म॒म ॥७॥
आ॒ त्वा ब्रह्मयु॒जा ह॒री व॒हताम् इन्द्र केशि॒ना । उ॒प ब्र॒ह्माणि नः शृणु ॥८॥
ब्रह्मा॒णस् त्वा वयं॒ युजा॒ सोमपा॒म् इन्द्र सोमि॒नः । सुता॒वन्तो हवामहे ॥९॥
They who stand round him as he moves harness the bright, the ruddy Steed: The lights are shining in the sky.
meaning: युञ्ज॒न्ति ब्रध्न॒म् अरुषं॒ च॒रन्तं प॒रि तस्थु॒षः । रो॒चन्ते रोचना॒ दिवि॒ ॥१०॥

text: They yoke on both sides to the car the two bay coursers dear to him, Bold, tawny, bearers of the Chief.
meaning: युञ्ज॒न्त्य् अस्य का॒म्या ह॒री वि॒पक्षसा र॒थे । शो॒णा धृष्णू॒ नृवा॒हसा ॥११॥

text: Thou, making light where no light was, and form, O Men r where no form was, Wast born together with the Dawns,
meaning: केतुं॒ कृण्व॒न्न् अकेत॒वे पे॒शो मर्या अपेश॒से । स॒म् उष॒द्भिर् अजायथाः ॥१२॥

text: His bright rays bear him up aloft, the God who knoweth all that= is, Sūrya, that every one may see.
meaning: उ॒द् उ त्यं॒ जात॒वेदसं देवं॒ वहन्ति केत॒वः । दृशे॒ वि॒श्वाय सू॒र्यम् ॥१३॥

text: The constellations pass away, like thieves, together with their- beams, Before the all-beholding Sun.
meaning: अ॒प त्ये॒ ताय॒वो यथा न॒क्षत्रा यन्त्य् अक्तु॒भिः । सू॒राय विश्व॒चक्षसे ॥१४॥

text: His herald rays are seen afar refulgent o'er the world of men, Like fiery flames that burn and blaze.
meaning: अ॒दृश्रन्न् अस्य केत॒वो वि॒ रश्म॒यो ज॒नां अ॒नु । भ्रा॒जन्तो अग्न॒यो यथा ॥१५॥

text: Swift and all-beautiful art thou, O Sūrya, maker of the light. Illuming all the radiant realm.
meaning: तर॒णिर् विश्व॒दर्शतो ज्योतिष्कृ॒द् असि सूर्य । वि॒श्वम् आ॒ भासि रोचन ॥१६॥

text: Thou guest to the troops of Gods, thou comest hither to man- kind, Hither, all light for us to see.
meaning: प्रत्य॒ङ् देवा॒नां वि॒शः प्रत्य॒ङ्ङ् उ॒द् एषि मा॒नुषीः । प्रत्य॒ङ् वि॒श्वं स्व॑र् दृशे॒ ॥१७॥

text: Thou with that eye of thine wherewith thou seest, brilliant. Varuna, The active one throughout mankind.
meaning: ये॒ना पावक च॒क्षसा भुरण्य॒न्तं ज॒नां अ॒नु । त्वं॒ वरुण प॒श्यसि ॥१८॥

text: Pervadest heaven and wide mid-air, melting the days out with. thy beams, Sun, seeing all things that have birth.
meaning: वि॒ द्याम् एषि र॒जस् पृथ्व् अ॒हर् मि॒मानो अक्तु॒भिः । प॒श्यं ज॒न्मानि सूर्य ॥१९॥

text: Seven bay steeds, harnessed to thy car, bear thee, O.thou far- seeing One, God, Sūrya, thee with radiant hair.
meaning: सप्त॒ त्वा हरि॒तो र॒थे व॒हन्ति देव सूर्य । शोचि॒ष्केशम् विचक्षण॒म् ॥२०॥

text: Sūrya hath yoked the seven bright mares, the daughters of the car: With these, His own dear team, he travelleth.
meaning: अ॒युक्त सप्त॒ शुन्ध्यु॒वः सू॒रो र॒थस्य नप्त्यः॑ । ता॒भिर् याति स्व॒युक्तिभिः ॥२१॥

text: The swiftly-moving songs of praise pour on thee streams of vital strength As mother cows refresh the calf.
meaning: अभि॒ त्वा व॒र्चसा गि॒रः सिञ्च॒न्त्य् आ॒ चरण्यु॒वः । अभि॒ वत्सं॒ न॒ धेन॒वः ॥१॥

text: Swift move the bright ones while they blend the Milk with vital vigour, as A dame her infant with her heart.
meaning: ता॒ अर्षन्ति शुभ्रि॒यः पृञ्चती॒र् व॒र्चसा प॒यः । जातं॒ ज॒निर् य॒था हृदा॒ ॥२॥

text: Fair hymns bring glory to the Strong, and Indra-vigour; unto, me Fatness and milk and length of days.
meaning: व॒ज्रापवसा॒ध्यः कीर्ति॒र् म्रिय॒माणम् आ॒वहन् । म॒ह्यम् आ॒युर् घृतं॒ प॒यः ॥३॥

text: This brindled Bull hath come and sat before the Mother in the east, Advancing to the Father Heaven.
meaning: आ॒यं॒ गौः॒ पृ॒श्निर् अक्रमीद् अ॒सदन् मात॒रं पुरः॒ । पित॒रं च प्रय॒न्त् स्वः॑ ॥४॥

text: As expiration from breath she moves along the lucid spheres: The Bull shines forth through all the sky.
meaning: अन्त॒श् चरति रोचना॒ अस्य॒ प्राणा॒द् अपानतः॒ । व्य् अ॑ख्यन् महिषः॒ स्वः॑ ॥५॥

text: Song is bestowed upon the Bird. It reigns supreme throughout thirty realms Throughout the days at break of morn.
meaning: त्रिंश॒द् धा॒मा वि॒ राजति वा॒क् पतङ्गो॒ अशिश्रियत् । प्र॒ति व॒स्तोर् अ॒हर् द्यु॒भिः ॥६॥

text: When voices, fain to win mid-air, ascended to the Mighty One, The vigorous God was filled with joy.
meaning: य॒च् छक्रा॒ वा॒चम् आ॒रुहन्न् अन्त॒रिक्षं सिषासथः । सं॒ देवा॒ अमदन् वृ॒षा ॥१॥

text: Praise with the voice the Mighty, praise the awful with the voice: in heaven He, the most bounteous, hath been glad.
meaning: शक्रो॒ वा॒चम् अ॒धृष्टायो॒र् उवाचो अ॒धृष्णुहि । मं॒हिष्ठ आ॒ मदर्दि॒वि ॥२॥

text: Praise with the voice the Mighty: he rules in each realm. In transport he Hath set upon the sacred grass.
meaning: शक्रो॒ वा॒चम् अ॒धृष्णुहि धा॒मधर्मन् वि॒ राजति । वि॒मदन् बर्हि॒र् आ॒सरन् ॥३॥

text: As cows low to their calf in stalls, so with our songs we glorify This Indra, even your wondrous God who checks attack, who joys in the delightful juice.
meaning: तं॒ वो दस्म॒म् ऋतीष॒हं व॒सोर् मन्दान॒म् अ॒न्धसः । अभि॒ वत्सं॒ न॒ स्व॒सरेषु धेन॒व इ॒न्द्रं गीर्भि॒र् नवामहे ॥४॥

text: Celestial, bounteous Giver, God, with power and might, rich, mountain-like, in precious things. Him soon we see for foodful booty rich in kine, brought hundredfold and thousandfold.
meaning: द्युक्षं॒ सुदा॒नुं त॒विषीभिर् आ॒वृतम् गिरिं॒ न॒ पुरुभो॒जसम् । क्षुम॒न्तं वा॒जं शति॒नं सहस्रि॒णं मक्षू॒ गो॒मन्तम् ईमहे ॥५॥

text: I crave of thee that hero strength—that thou mayst first regard this prayer Wherewith thou helpest Bhrigu and the Yatis and Praskanva when the prize was staked.
meaning: त॒त् त्वा यामि सुवी॒र्यं त॒द् ब्र॒ह्म पूर्व॒चित्तये । ये॒ना य॒तिभ्यो भृ॒गवे ध॒ने हिते॒ ये॒न प्र॒स्कण्वम् आ॒विथ ॥६॥

text: Wherewith thou sentest mighty waters to the sea—Indra, that manly strength of thine. For ever unattainable is this power of him to whom the worlds have cried aloud.
meaning: ये॒ना समुद्र॒म् अ॒सृजो मही॒र् अप॒स् त॒द् इन्द्र वृ॒ष्णि ते श॒वः । सद्यः॒ सो॒ अस्य महिमा॒ न॒ संन॒शे यं॒ क्षोणी॒र् अनुचक्रदे॒ ॥७॥

text: What newest of imploring hymns shall, then, the zealous mortal sing? For have not they who laud his might and Indra-power won for themselves the light of heaven?
meaning: क॒न् न॒व्यो अतसी॒नां तुरो॒ गृणीत म॒र्त्यः । नही॒ न्व् अ॑स्य महिमा॒नम् इन्द्रियं॒ स्व॑र् गृण॒न्त आनशुः॒ ॥१॥

text: When shall they keep the Law and praise thee mid the Gods? Who counts as Rishi and as sage? When wilt thou ever, Indra, Bounteous Lord, come nigh to presser's or to praiser's call?
meaning: क॒द् उ स्तुव॒न्त ऋतयन्त देव॒त ऋ॒षिः को॒ वि॒प्र ओहते । कदा॒ ह॒वं मघवन्न् इन्द्र सुन्वतः॒ क॒द् उ स्तुवत॒ आ॒ गमः ॥२॥

text: For you will I sing Indra's praise who gives good gifts as well we know; Praise of the Bounteous Lord who, rich in treasure, aids his singers with wealth thousandfold.
meaning: अभि॒ प्र॒ वः सुरा॒धसम् इ॒न्द्रम् अर्च य॒था विदे॒ । यो॒ जरितृ॒भ्यो मघ॒वा पुरूव॒सुः सह॒स्रेणेव शिक्षति ॥१॥

text: As with a hundred hosts he rushes boldly on, and for the offerer slays his foes. As from a mountain flow the water-brooks, thus flow his gifts who feedeth many a one.
meaning: शता॒नीकेव प्र॒ जिगाति धृष्णुया॒ हन्ति वृत्रा॒णि दाशु॒षे । गिरे॒र् इव प्र॒ र॒सा अस्य पिन्विरे द॒त्राणि पुरुभो॒जसः ॥२॥

text: Sakra I praise, for victory, far-famed, exceeding bountiful. Who gives, as 'twere in thousands, precious wealth to him who sheds the juice and worships him.
meaning: प्र॒ सु॒ श्रुतं॒ सुरा॒धसम् अ॒र्चा शक्र॒म् अभि॒ष्टये । यः॒ सुन्वते॒ स्तुवते॒ का॒म्यं व॒सु सह॒स्रेणेव मं॒हते ॥३॥

text: Arrows with hundred points, unconquerable, are this Indra's mighty arms in war. He streams on liberal worshippers like a hill with springs, when juices poured have gladdened him.
meaning: शता॒नीका हेत॒यो अस्य दुष्ट॒रा इ॒न्द्रस्य समि॒षो महीः॒ । गिरि॒र् न॒ भुज्मा॒ मघ॒त्सु पिन्वते य॒द् ईं सुता॒ अ॒मन्दिषुः ॥४॥

text: We compass thee like waters, we whose grass is trimmed and Soma pressed. Here where the filter pours its stream thy worshipper round thee, O Vritra-slayer, sit.
meaning: वयं॒ घ त्वा सुता॒वन्त आ॒पो न॒ वृक्त॒बर्हिषः । पवि॒त्रस्य प्रस्र॒वणेषु वृत्रहन् प॒रि स्तोता॒र आसते ॥१॥

text: Men, Vasu! by the Soma, with lauds call thee to the foremost place. When comest thou athirst unto the juice as home, O Indra, like a bellowing bull?
meaning: स्व॒रन्ति त्वा सुते॒ न॒रो व॒सो निरेक॒ उक्थि॒नः । कदा॒ सुतं॒ तृषाण॒ ओक आ॒ गम इ॒न्द्र स्वब्दी॒व वं॒सगः ॥२॥

text: क॒ण्वेभिर् धृष्णव् आ॒ धृस॒द् वा॒जं दर्षि सहस्रि॒णम् । पिश॒ङ्गरूपं मघवन् विचर्षणे मक्षू॒ गो॒मन्तम् ईमहे ॥३॥
Who knows what vital power he wins, drinking beside the flowing juice? This is the fair-cheeked God who, joying in the draught, breaks down the castles in his strength.
meaning: क॒ ईं वेद सुते॒ स॒चा पि॒बन्तं क॒द् व॒यो दधे । अयं॒ यः॒ पु॒रो विभिन॒त्त्य् ओ॒जसा मन्दानः॒ शिप्र्य् अ॒न्धसः ॥१॥

text: As a wild elephant rushes on, this way and that way, mad with heat. None may restrain thee; yet come hither to the draught: thou movest mighty in thy power.
meaning: दाना॒ मृगो॒ न॒ वारणः॒ पुरुत्रा॒ चर॒थं दधे । न॒किष् ट्वा नि॒ यमद् आ॒ सुते॒ गमो महा॒श् चरस्य् ओ॒जसा ॥२॥

text: When he, the mighty, ne'er o'erthrown, stedfast, made ready for the fight. When Indra, Bounteous Lord, lists to his praiser's call, he will not stand aloof, but come.
meaning: य॒ उग्रः॒ स॒न्न् अ॒निष्टृत स्थिरो॒ र॒णाय सं॒स्कृतः । य॒दि स्तोतु॒र् मघ॒वा शृण॒वद् ध॒वं ने॒न्द्रो योषत्य् आ॒ गमत् ॥३॥

text: Of one accord they made and formed for kingship Indra, the Hero who in all encounters overcometh, Most eminent for power, destroyer in the conflict, fierce and exceeding strong, stalwart and full of vigour.
meaning: वि॒श्वाः पृ॒तना अभिभू॒तरं न॒रं सजू॒स् ततक्षुर् इ॒न्द्रं जजनु॒श् च राज॒से । क्र॒त्वा व॒रिष्ठं व॒र आमु॒रिम् उतो॒ग्र॒म् ओ॒जिष्ठं तव॒सं तरस्वि॒नम् ॥१॥

text: Bards joined in song to Indra so that he might drink the Soma juice, The Lord of Light, that he whose laws stand fast might aid with power and with help he gives.
meaning: स॒म् ईं रेभा॒सो अस्वरन्न् इ॒न्द्रं सो॒मस्य पीत॒ये । स्व॑र्पतिं य॒द् ईं वृधे॒ धृत॒व्रतो ह्य् ओ॒जसा स॒म् ऊति॒भिः ॥२॥

text: The holy sages form a ring, looking and singing to the Ram. Your very bright inciters, void of all deceit, are with the chan- ters nigh to hear.
meaning: नेमिं॒ नमन्ति च॒क्षसा मेषं॒ वि॒प्रा अभिस्व॒रा । सुदीत॒यो वो अद्रु॒हो ऽपि क॒र्णे तरस्वि॒नः स॒म् ऋ॒क्वभिः ॥३॥

text: Oft, oft I call that Indra, Maghavan the mighty, who evermore possesses power, ever resistless. Holy, most liberal, may he lead us on to riches, and, thunder armed, make all our pathways pleasant for us.
meaning: त॒म् इ॒न्द्रं जोहवीमि मघ॒वानम् उग्रं॒ सत्रा॒ द॒धानम् अ॒प्रतिष्कुतं श॒वांसि । मं॒हिष्ठो गीर्भि॒र् आ॒ च यज्ञि॒यो वव॒र्तद् राये॒ नो वि॒श्वा सुप॒था कृणोतु वज्री॒ ॥१॥

text: Indra, what joys as Lord of Light thou broughtest from the Asuras, Prosper therewith, O Maghavan, him who lauds that deed, and those whose grass is trimmed for thee.
meaning: या॒ इन्द्र भु॒ज आ॒भरः स्व॒र्वां अ॒सुरेभ्यः । स्तोता॒रम् इ॒न् मघवन्न् अस्य वर्धय ये॒ च त्वे॒ वृक्त॒बर्हिषः ॥२॥

text: The wasteless share of steeds and kine which, Indra, thou hast fast secured. Grant to the worshipper who presses Soma and gives guerdon, not unto the churl.
meaning: य॒म् इन्द्र दधिषे॒ त्व॒म् अ॒श्वं गां॒ भाग॒म् अ॒व्ययम् । य॒जमाने सुन्वति॒ द॒क्षिणावति त॒स्मिन् तं॒ धेहि मा॒ पणौ॒ ॥३॥

text: Indra, foe-slayer, hath been raised to joy and power by the men. Him, verily, we invocate in battles whether great or small: be he our aid in fights for spoil.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रो म॒दाय वावृधे श॒वसे वृत्रहा॒ नृ॒भिः । त॒म् इ॒न् मह॒त्स्व् आजि॒षूते॒म् अ॒र्भे हवामहे स॒ वा॒जेषु प्र॒ नो ऽविषत् ॥१॥

text: For, Hero, thou art like a host, art giver of abundant prey. Strengthening even the feeble, thou aidest the sacrificer, thou givest the worshipper ample wealth.
meaning: अ॒सि हि॒ वीर से॒न्यो ऽसि भू॒रि पराददिः॒ । अ॒सि दभ्र॒स्य चिद् वृधो॒ यजमानाय शिक्षसि सुन्वते॒ भू॒रि ते व॒सु ॥२॥

text: When war and battles are on foot, booty is laid before the bold. Yoke thou thy wildly rushing Bays. Whom wilt thou slay and whom enrich? Do thou, O Indra, make us rich,
meaning: य॒द् उदी॒रत आज॒यो धृष्ण॒वे धीयते ध॒ना । युक्ष्वा॒ मदच्यु॒ता ह॒री कं॒ ह॒नः कं॒ व॒सौ दधो ऽस्मां॒ इन्द्र व॒सौ दधः ॥३॥

text: He, righteous-hearted, at each time of rapture gives us herds of kine. Gather in both thy hands for us treasures of many hundred sorts. Sharpen thou us, and bring us wealth.
meaning: म॒देमदे हि॒ नो ददि॒र् यूथा॒ ग॒वाम् ऋजुक्र॒तुः । सं॒ गृभाय पुरु॒ शतो॒भयाहस्त्या॒ व॒सु शिशीहि॒ राय॒ आ॒ भर ॥४॥

text: Refresh thee, Hero, with the juice outpoured for bounty and for strength. We know thee Lord of ample store, to thee have sent our heart's desires: be therefore our protector thou.
meaning: माद॒यस्व सुते॒ स॒चा श॒वसे शूर रा॒धसे । विद्मा॒ हि॒ त्वा पुरूव॒सुम् उ॒प का॒मान्त् ससृज्म॒हे॒ ऽथा नो ऽविता॒ भव ॥५॥

text: These people, Indra, keep for thee all that is worthy of thy choice. Discover thou, as Lord, the wealth of men who offer up no gifts: bring thou to us this wealth of theirs.
meaning: एते॒ त इन्द्र जन्त॒वो विश्वं पुष्यन्ति वा॒र्यम् । अन्त॒र् हि॒ ख्यो॒ ज॒नानाम् अर्यो॒ वे॒दो अ॒दाशुषां ते॒षां नो वे॒द आ॒ भर ॥६॥

text: As a good cow to him who milks, we call the doer of fair deeds. To our assistance day by day.
meaning: सुरूपकृत्नु॒म् ऊत॒ये सुदु॒घाम् इव गोदु॒हे । जुहूम॒सि द्य॒विद्यवि ॥१॥

text: Come thou to our libations, drink of Soma, Soma-drinker thou! The rich One's rapture giveth kine.
meaning: उ॒प नः स॒वना॒ गहि सो॒मस्य सोमपाः पिब । गोदा॒ इ॒द् रेव॒तो म॒दः ॥२॥

text: So may we be acquainted with thine innermost benevolence: Neglect us not, come hitherward.
meaning: अ॒था ते अ॒न्तमानां विद्या॒म सुमतीना॒म् । मा॒ नो अ॒ति ख्य आ॒ गहि ॥३॥

text: Drink for our help the Soma bright, vigilant, and exceeding strong, O Indra, Lord of Hundred Powers.
meaning: शुष्मि॒न्तमं न ऊत॒ये द्युम्नि॒नं पाहि जा॒गृविम् । इ॒न्द्र सो॒मं शतक्रतो ॥४॥

text: O Satakratu, powers which thou mid the Five Races hast dis- played, These, Indra, do I claim of thee.
meaning: इन्द्रिया॒णि शतक्रतो या॒ ते ज॒नेषु पञ्च॒सु । इ॒न्द्र ता॒नि त आ॒ वृणे ॥५॥

text: Indra, great glory hast thou gained. Win splendid fame which none may mar. We make thy might perpetual.
meaning: अ॒गन्न् इन्द्र श्र॒वो बृह॒द् द्युम्नं॒ दधिष्व दुष्ट॒रम् । उ॒त् ते शु॒ष्मं तिरामसि ॥६॥

text: Come to us either from anear, or, Sakra, come from far away. Indra, wherever be thy home, come thence, O Caster of the Stone.
meaning: अर्वाव॒तो न आ॒ गह्य् अ॒थो शक्र पराव॒तः । उ लोको॒ य॒स् ते अद्रिव इ॒न्द्रेह॒ तत आ॒ गहि ॥७॥

text: Verily Indra, conquering all, driveth even mighty fear away. For firm is he and swift to act.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रो अङ्ग॒ मह॒द् भय॒म् अभी॒ ष॒द् अ॒प चुच्यवत् । स॒ हि॒ स्थिरो॒ वि॒चर्षनिः ॥८॥

text: Indra be gracious unto us: sin shall not reach us afterward, And good shall be before us still.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रश् च मृल॒याति नो न॒ नः पश्चा॒द् अघं॒ नशत् । भद्रं॒ भवाति नः पुरः॒ ॥९॥

text: From all the regions of the world let Indra send security. The foe-subduer, swift to act.
meaning: इन्द्र आ॒शाभ्यस् प॒रि स॒र्वाभ्यो अ॒भयं करत् । जे॒ता श॒त्रून् वि॒चर्षणिः ॥१०॥

text: क॒ ईं वेद सुते॒ स॒चा पि॒बन्तं क॒द् व॒यो दधे । अयं॒ यः॒ पु॒रो विभिन॒त्त्य् ओ॒जसा मन्दानः॒ शिप्र्य् अ॒न्धसः ॥११॥
दाना॒ मृगो॒ न॒ वारणः॒ पुरुत्रा॒ चर॒थं दधे । न॒किष् ट्वा नि॒ यमद् आ॒ सुते॒ गमो महां॒श् चरस्य् ओ॒जसा ॥१२॥
य॒ उग्रः॒ स॒न्न् अ॒निष्टृत स्थिरो॒ र॒णाय सं॒स्कृतः । य॒दि स्तोतु॒र् मघ॒वा शृण॒वद् ध॒वं ने॒न्द्रो योषत्य् आ॒ गमत् ॥१३॥
We compass thee like waters, we whose grass in trimmed and Soma pressed. Here where the filter pours its stream thy worshippers round thee, O Vritra-slayer, sit.
meaning: वयं॒ घ त्वा सुता॒वन्त आ॒पो न॒ वृक्त॒बर्हिषः । पवि॒त्रस्य प्रस्र॒वणेषु वृत्रहन् प॒रि स्तोता॒र आसते ॥१४॥

text: Men, Vasu, by the Soma with lauds call thee to the foremost place. When comest thou athirst unto the juice as home, O Indra, like a bellowing bull?
meaning: स्व॒रन्ति त्वा सुते॒ न॒रो व॒सो निरेक॒ उक्थि॒नः । कदा॒ सुतं॒ तृषाण॒ ओ॒क आ॒ गम इ॒न्द्र स्वब्दी॒व वं॒सगः ॥१५॥

text: Boldly, bold Hero, bring us spoil in thousands for the Kanvas' sake. O active Maghavan, with eager prayer we crave the yellow-hued with store of kine.
meaning: क॒ण्वेभिर् धृष्णव् आ॒ धृष॒द् वा॒जं दर्षि सहस्रि॒णम् । पिश॒ङ्गरूपं मघवन् विचर्षणे मक्षू॒ गो॒मन्तम् ईमहे ॥१६॥

text: Turning, as 'twere, to meet the Sun, enjoy from Indra all good things. When he who will be born is born with power we look to treasures as our heritage.
meaning: श्रा॒यन्त इव सू॒र्यं वि॒श्वे॒द् इ॒न्द्रस्य भक्षत । व॒सूनि जाते॒ ज॒नमान ओ॒जसा प्र॒ति भागं॒ न॒ दीधिम ॥१॥

text: Praise him who sends us wealth, whose bounties injure none. Good are the gifts which Indra gives. He is not wroth with one who satisfies his wish: he turns his mind to granting boons.
meaning: अ॒नर्शरातिं वसुदा॒म् उ॒प स्तुहि भद्रा॒ इ॒न्द्रस्य रात॒यः । सो॒ अस्य का॒मं विधतो॒ न॒ रोषति म॒नो दाना॒य चोद॒यन् ॥२॥

text: Verily, Sūrya, thou art great; truly, Āditya, thou art great. As thou art great indeed thy greatness is admired: yea, verily, great art thou, O God.
meaning: ब॒ण् महां॒ असि सूर्य ब॒ड् आदित्य महां॒ असि । मह॒स् ते सतो॒ महिमा॒ पनस्यते ऽद्धा॒ देव महां॒ असि ॥३॥

text: Yea, Sūrya, thou art great in fame: thou evermore, O God, art great. By greatness thou art President of Gods, divine, far-spread, inviolable light.
meaning: ब॒ट् सूर्य श्र॒वसा महां॒ असि सत्रा॒ देव महां॒ असि । मह्ना॒ देवा॒नाम् असुर्यः॑ पुरो॒हितो विभु॒ ज्यो॒तिर् अ॒दाभ्यम् ॥४॥

text: उ॒द् उ त्ये॒ म॒धु मत्तमा॒ गि॒र स्तो॒मास ईरते । सत्राजि॒तो धनसा॒ अ॒क्षितोतयो वाजय॒न्तो र॒था इव ॥१॥
क॒ण्वा इव भृ॒गवः सू॒र्य इव वि॒श्वम् इ॒द् धीत॒म् आनशुः । इ॒न्द्रं स्तो॒मेभिर् मह॒यन्त आय॒वः प्रिय॒मेधासो अस्वरन् ॥२॥
His portion is exceeding great, like a victorious soldier's spoil. Him who is Indra, Lord of Bays, no foes subdue. He gives the Soma-pourer strength.
meaning: उ॒द् इ॒न् न्व् अ॑स्य रिच्यते॒ ऽंशो ध॒नं न॒ जिग्यु॒सः । य॒ इ॒न्द्रो ह॒रिवान् न॒ दभन्ति तं॒ रिपो द॒क्षं दधाति सोमि॒नि ॥३॥

text: Make for the holy Gods a hymn that is not mean, but well arranged and fair in form. Full many snares and bonds subdue not him who dwells with Indra through his sacrifice.
meaning: म॒न्त्रम् अ॒खर्वं सु॒धितं सुपे॒शसं द॒धात यज्ञि॒येष्व् आ॒ । पूर्वी॒श् चन॒ प्र॒सितयस् तरन्ति तं॒ य॒ इ॒न्द्रे क॒र्मणा भु॒वत् ॥४॥

text: For so thou art the hero's Friend, a Warrior too art thou, and strong: So may thy heart be won to us.
meaning: एवा॒ ह्य् अ॒सि वीरयु॒र् एवा॒ शू॒र उत॒ स्थिरः॒ । एवा॒ ते रा॒ध्यं म॒नः ॥१॥

text: So hath the offering; wealthiest Lord, been paid by all the worshippers: So dwell thou, Indra, even with me.
meaning: एवा॒ राति॒स् तुवीमघ वि॒श्वेभिर् धायि धातृ॒भिः । अ॒घा चिद् इन्द्र मे स॒चा ॥२॥

text: Be not thou, like a slothful priest, O Lord of wealth and spoil: rejoice. In the pressed Soma blent with milk.
meaning: मो॒ षु॒ ब्रह्मे॒व तन्द्रयु॒र् भु॒वो वाजानां पते । म॒त्स्वा सुत॒स्य गो॒मतः ॥३॥

text: So also is his excellence, great copious, rich in cattle, like A ripe branch to the worshipper.
meaning: एवा॒ ह्य् अ॑स्य सूनृ॒ता विरप्शी॒ गो॒मती मही॒ । पक्वा॒ शा॒खा न॒ दाशु॒षे ॥४॥

text: For verily thy mighty powers, Indra, are saving helps at once Unto a worshipper like me.
meaning: एवा॒ हि॒ ते वि॒भूतय ऊत॒य इन्द्र मा॒वते । सद्य॒श् चित् स॒न्ति दाशु॒षे ॥५॥

text: So are his lovely gifts: let laud be said and praise to Indra sung. That he may drink the Soma juice.
meaning: एवा॒ ह्य् अ॑स्य का॒म्या स्तो॒म उक्थं॒ च शं॒स्या । इ॒न्द्राय सो॒मपीतये ॥६॥

text: We sing this strong and wild delight of thine which conquers in the fray, Which, Caster of the Stone, gives room and shine like gold.
meaning: तं॒ ते म॒दं गृणीमसि वृ॒षणं पृत्सु॒ सासहि॒म् । उ लोककृत्नु॒म् अद्रिवो हरिश्रि॒यम् ॥१॥

text: Wherewith thou also foundest lights for Āyu and for Manu's sake: Now joying in!!this sacred grass thou beamest forth.
meaning: ये॒न ज्यो॒तीम्ष्य् आय॒वे म॒नवे च विवे॒दिथ । मन्दानो॒ अस्य॒ बर्हि॒षो वि॒ राजसि ॥२॥

text: This day to singers of the hymn praise, as of old, this, might of thine. Win thou the waters, day by day, thralls of the strong.
meaning: त॒द् अद्या॒ चित् त उक्थि॒नो॒ ऽनु ष्टुवन्ति पूर्व॒था । वृ॒षपत्नीर् अपो॒ जया दिवे॒दिवे ॥३॥

text: Sing forth to him whom many men invoke, to him whom many laud: Invite the potent Indra with your songs of praise;
meaning: त॒म् व् अभि॒ प्र॒ गायत पुरुहूतं॒ पुरुष्टुत॒म् । इ॒न्द्रं गीर्भि॒स् तविष॒म् आ॒ विवासत ॥४॥

text: Whose lofty might—for doubly strong is he—supports the heaven and earth. And hills and plains and floods and light with manly power.
meaning: य॒स्य द्विब॒र्हसो बृह॒त् स॒हो दाधा॒र रो॒दसी । गिरीं॒र् अ॒ज्रां अपः॒ स्व॑र् वृषत्वना॒ ॥५॥

text: Such, praised by many! thou art King: alone thou smitest foe- men dead, To gain, O Indra, spoils of war and high renown.
meaning: स॒ राजसि पुरुष्टुतं ए॒को वृत्रा॒णि जिघ्नसे । इ॒न्द्र जै॒त्रा श्रवस्य च य॒न्तवे ॥६॥

text: वय॒म् उ त्वा॒म् अपूर्व्य स्थूरं॒ न॒ क॒च् चिद् भ॒रन्तो ऽवस्य॒वः । वा॒जे चित्रं॒ हवामहे ॥१॥
उ॒प त्वा क॒र्मन्न् ऊत॒ये स॒ नो यु॒वोग्र॒श् चक्राम यो॒ धृषत् । त्वा॒म् इ॒द् ध्य् अ॑विता॒रं ववृम॒हे स॒खाय इन्द्र सानसि॒म् ॥२॥
यो॒ न इद॒मिदं पुरा॒ प्र॒ व॒स्य आनिना॒य त॒म् उ व स्तुषे । स॒खाय इ॒न्द्रम् ऊत॒ये ॥३॥
ह॒र्यश्वं स॒त्पतिं चर्षणीस॒हं स॒ हि॒ ष्मा यो॒ अ॒मन्दत । आ॒ तु॒ नः स॒ वयति ग॒व्यम् अ॒श्व्यं स्तोतृ॒भ्यो मघ॒वा शत॒म् ॥४॥
To Indra sing a Sāman, sing to the high Sage a lofty song, To him who keeps the Law, inspired and fain for praise.
meaning: इ॒न्द्राय सा॒म गायत वि॒प्राय बृहते॒ बृह॒त् । धर्मकृ॒ते विपश्चि॒ते पनस्य॒वे ॥५॥

text: Thou, Indra, art preeminent: thou gavest splendour to the Sun. Maker of all things, thou art mighty and All-God.
meaning: त्व॒म् इन्द्राभिभू॒र् असि त्वं॒ सू॒र्यम् अरोचयः । विश्व॒कर्मा विश्व॒देवो महां॒ असि ॥६॥

text: Radiant with light thou wentest to the sky, the luminous realms: of heaven. The Gods, O Indra, strove to win thee for their friend.
meaning: विभ्रा॒जं ज्यो॒तिषा स्व॑र् अ॒गछो रोचनं॒ दिवः॒ । देवा॒स् त इन्द्र सख्या॒य येमिरे ॥७॥

text: Sing forth to him whom many men invoke, to him whom many laud: Invite the potent Indra with your songs of praise;
meaning: त॒म् व् अभि॒ प्र॒ गायत पुरुहूतं॒ पुरुष्टुत॒म् । इ॒न्द्रं गीर्भिस् तविष॒म् आ॒ विवासत ॥८॥

text: Whose lofty might—for doubly strong is he—supports the heaven and earth, And hills and plains and floods and light with manly power.
meaning: य॒स्य द्विब॒र्हसो बृह॒त् स॒हो दाधा॒र रो॒दसी । गिरीं॒र् अ॒ज्रां अपः॒ स्व॑र् वृषत्वना॒ ॥९॥

text: Such, praised by many! thou art King. Alone thou smitest foe- men dead, To gain, O Indra, spoils of war and high renown.
meaning: स॒ राजसि पुरुष्टुतं ए॒को वृत्रा॒णि जिघ्नसे । इ॒न्द्र जै॒त्र श्रवस्य च य॒न्तवे ॥१०॥

text: We will, with Indra, and all Gods to aid us, bring these existing. worlds into subjection. Our sacrifice, our bodies, and our offspring, let Indra form to- gether with the Ādityas.
meaning: इमा॒ नु॒ कं भु॒वना सीषधामे॒न्द्रश् च वि॒श्वे च देवाः॒ । यज्ञं॒ च नस् तन्वं॑ च प्रजां॒ चादित्यै॒र् इन्द्रः सह॒ चीक्ल्̥पाति ॥१॥

text: With the Ādityas with the band of Maruts, may Indra be pro- tector of our bodies; As when the Gods came, after they had slaughtered the Asuras,. keeping safe their godlike nature,
meaning: आदित्यै॒र् इ॒न्द्रः स॒गणो मरु॒द्भिर् अस्मा॒कं भूत्व् अविता॒ तनू॒नाम् । हत्वा॒य देवा॒ अ॒सुरान् य॒द् आ॒यन् देवा॒ देवत्व॒म् अभिर॒क्षमाणाः ॥२॥

text: Brought the Sun hitherward with mighty powers, and looked! about them on their vigorous God-head. With this may we obtain strength God-appointed, and brave sons gladden us through a hundred winters.
meaning: प्रत्य॒ञ्चम् अर्क॒म् अनयं छ॒चीभिर् आ॒द् इ॒त् स्वधा॒म् इषिरां॒ प॒र्य् अपश्यन् । अया॒ वा॒जं देव॒हितं सनेम म॒देम शत॒हिमाः सुवी॒राः ॥३॥

text: He who alone bestoweth might on mortal man who offereth gifts, The ruler of resistless power, is Indra, sure.
meaning: य॒ ए॒क इ॒द् विद॒यते व॒सु म॒र्ताय दाशु॒षे । ई॒शानो अ॒प्रतिष्कुत इ॒न्द्रो अङ्ग॒ ॥४॥

text: When will he trample like a weed the man who hath no gift for him? When verily will Indra hear our songs of praise?
meaning: कदा॒ म॒र्तम् अराध॒सं पदा॒ क्षु॒म्पम् इव स्फुरत् । कदा॒ नः शुश्रवद् गि॒र इ॒न्द्रो अङ्ग॒ ॥५॥

text: He who with Soma juice prepared among the many harbours. thee, Verily Indra gains thereby tremendous might.
meaning: य॒श् चिद् धि॒ त्वा बहु॒भ्य आ॒ सुता॒वां आवि॒वासति । उग्रं॒ त॒त् पत्यते श॒व इ॒न्द्रो अङ्ग॒ ॥६॥

text: Joy, mightiest Indra, known and marked, sprung most from Soma draughts, wherewith Thou smitest down the greedy fiend, for that we pray.
meaning: य॒ इन्द्र सोमपा॒तमो म॒दः शविष्ठ चे॒तति । ये॒ना हं॒सि न्य् अ॑त्त्रि॒णं त॒म् ईमहे ॥७॥

text: Wherewith thou helpest Adhrigu, the great Dasagva, and the God Who stirs the sunlight, and Sea, for that we pray.
meaning: ये॒ना द॒शग्वम् अ॒ध्रिगुं वेप॒यन्तं स्व॑र्णरम् । ये॒ना समुद्र॒म् आ॒विथा त॒म् ईमहे ॥८॥

text: Wherewith thou dravest forth like cars Sindhu and all the mighty floods. To go the way ordained by Law, for that we pray.
meaning: ये॒न सि॒न्धुं मही॒र् अपो॒ र॒थां इव प्रचोद॒यः । प॒न्थाम् ऋत॒स्य या॒तवे त॒म् ईमहे ॥९॥

text: Come unto us, O Indra, dear, still conquering, unconcealable, Vast as a mountain spread on all sides, Lord of heaven.
meaning: ए॒न्द्र नो गधि प्रियः॒ सत्राजि॒द् अ॒गोह्यः । गिरि॒र् न॒ विश्व॒तस् पृथुः॒ प॒तिर् दिवः॒ ॥१॥

text: O truthful Soma-drinker, thou art mightier than both the worlds. Thou strengthenest him who pours libation, Lord of heaven.
meaning: अभि॒ हि॒ सत्य सोमपा उभे॒ बभू॒थ रो॒दसी । इ॒न्द्रा॒सि सुन्वतो॒ वृधः॒ प॒तिर् दिवः॒ ॥२॥

text: For thou art, he, O Indra, who stormest all castles of the foe, Slayer of Dasyus, man's supporter, Lord of heaven.
meaning: त्वं॒ हि॒ श॒श्वतीनाम् इ॒न्द्र दर्ता॒ पुरा॒म् अ॒सि । हन्ता॒ द॒स्योर् म॒नोर् वृधः॒ प॒तिर् दिवः॒ ॥३॥

text: O ministering priest, pour out of the sweet juice what gladdens most. So is the Hero praised who ever prospers us.
meaning: ए॒द् उ म॒ध्वो मदि॒न्तरं सिञ्च॒ वाध्वर्यो अ॒न्धसः । एवा॒ हि॒ वीर॒ स्त॒वते सदा॒वृधः ॥४॥

text: Indra whom tawny coursers bear, praise such a thine,. preeminent None by his power or by his goodness hath attained
meaning: इ॒न्द्र स्थातर् हरीणां न॒किष् ते पूर्व्य॒स्तुतिम् । उ॒द् आनंश श॒वसा न॒ भन्द॒ना ॥५॥

text: We seeking glory, have invoked this Master of all power and' might. Who must be glorified by constant sacrifice.
meaning: तं॒ वो वा॒जानां प॒तिम् अ॒हूमहि श्रवस्य॒वः । अ॒प्रायुभिर् यज्ञे॒भिर् वावृधे॒न्यम् ॥६॥

text: Come, sing we praise to Indra, friends! the Hero who deserves the laud, Him who with none to aid o'ercomes all tribes of men.
meaning: ए॒तो न्व् इ॒न्द्रं स्त॒वाम स॒खाय स्तो॒म्यं न॒रम् । कुष्टी॒र् यो॒ वि॒श्वा अभ्य् अ॑स्त्य् ए॒क इ॒त् ॥१॥

text: To him who wins the kine, who keeps no cattle back, celestial God, Speak wondrous speech more sweet than butter and than mead.
meaning: अ॒गोरुधाय गवि॒षे द्युक्षा॒य द॒स्म्यं व॒चः । घृता॒त् स्वा॒दीयो म॒धुनश् च वोचत ॥२॥

text: Whose hero powers are measureless, whose bounty ne'er may be surpassed, Whose liberality, like light, is over all.
meaning: य॒स्या॒मितानि वीर्या॑ न॒ रा॒धः प॒र्येतवे । ज्यो॒तिर् न॒ वि॒श्वम् अभ्य् अ॒स्ति द॒क्षिणा ॥३॥

text: As Vyasva did, praise Indra, praise the strong unfluctuating guide. Who gives the foe's possessions to the worshipper.
meaning: स्तुही॒न्द्रं व्यश्वव॒द् अ॒नूर्मिं वाजि॒नं य॒मम् । अर्यो॒ ग॒यं मं॒हमानं वि॒ दाशु॒षे ॥१॥

text: Now, son of Vyasva, praise thou him who to the tenth time still is new. The very wise, whom living men must glorify.
meaning: एवा॒ नून॒म् उ॒प स्तुहि वै॒यश्व दशमं॒ न॒वम् । सु॒विद्वांसं चर्कृ॒त्यं चर॒णीनाम् ॥२॥

text: Thou knowest, Indra, thunder-armed, how to avoid destructive Powers, As one secure from pitfalls each succeeding day.
meaning: वे॒त्था हि॒ नि॒रृतीनां व॒ज्रहस्त परिवृ॒जम् । अ॒हरहः शुन्ध्युः॒ परिप॒दाम् इव ॥३॥

text: The pourer of oblations gains the home of wealth pouring his gift conciliates hostilities, yea, the hostilities of Gods. Pouring he strives, unchecked and strong, to win him riches thousandfold. Indra gives lasting wealth to him who pours forth gifts; yea, wealth he gives that long shall last.
meaning: वनो॒ति हि॒ सुन्व॒न् क्ष॒यं प॒रीणसः सुन्वानो॒ हि॒ ष्मा य॒जत्य् अ॒व द्वि॒षो देवा॒नाम् अ॒व द्वि॒षः । सुन्वान॒ इ॒त् सिषासति सह॒स्रा वाज्य् अ॒वृतः । सुन्वाना॒ये॒न्द्रो ददात्य् आभु॒वं रयिं॒ ददात्य् आभु॒वम् ॥१॥

text: Ne'er may those manly deeds of yours for us grow old, never may your bright glories fall into decay, never before your time decay. What deed of yours, new every age, wondrous, surpassing man,. rings forth, Whatever, Maruts may be difficult to gain grant us whate'er is hard to win.
meaning: मो॒ षु॒ वो अस्म॒द् अभि॒ ता॒नि पौं॒स्या स॒ना भूवन् द्युम्ना॒नि मो॒त॒ जारिषुर् अस्म॒त् पुरो॒त॒ जारिषुः । य॒द् वश् चित्रं॒ युगे॒युगे न॒व्यं घो॒षाद् अ॒मर्त्यम् । अस्मा॒सु त॒न् मरुतो य॒च् च दुष्ट॒रं दिधृता॒ य॒च् च दुष्ट॒रम् ॥२॥

text: I think on Agni, Hotar, the munificent, the gracious Son of strength, who knoweth all that live, as holy Sage who knoweth all. Lord of fair rites, a God with form erected turning to the Gods. He, when the flame hath sprung forth from the holy oil, the offered fatness, longeth for it with his glow.
meaning: अग्निं॒ हो॒तारम् मन्ये दा॒स्वन्तं व॒सुं सूनुं॒ स॒हसो जात॒वेदसं वि॒प्रं न॒ जात॒वेदसम् । य॒ ऊर्ध्व॒या स्वध्वरो॒ देवो॒ देवा॒च्या कृपा॒ । घृत॒स्य वि॒भ्राष्टिम् अ॒नु वष्टि शोचि॒षाजु॒ह्वानस्य सर्पि॒षः ॥३॥

text: Busied with sacrifice, with spotted deer and spears, gleaming. upon your way with ornaments, yea, our friends, Sitting on sacred grass, ye sons of Bharata, drink Soma from the Potar's bowl, O Men of heaven.
meaning: यज्ञैः॒ सं॒मिश्लाः पृ॒षतीभिर् ऋष्टि॒भिर् या॒मं छुभ्रा॒सो अञ्जि॒षु प्रिया॒ उत॒ । आस॒द्या बर्हि॒र् भरतस्य सूनवः पोत्रा॒द् आ॒ सो॒मं पिबता दिवो नरः ॥४॥

text: Bring the Gods hither, Sage, and offer sacrifice. At the three altars seat thee willingly .O Priest. Accept for thy delight the proffered Soma mead: drink from the Kindler's bowl and sate thee with thy share.
meaning: आ॒ वक्षि देवां॒ इह॒ विप्र य॒क्षि चोश॒न् होतर् नि॒ षदा यो॒निषु त्रिषु॒ । प्र॒ति वीहि प्र॒स्थितं सोम्यं॒ म॒धु पि॒बा॒ग्नीध्रात् त॒व भाग॒स्य तृस्णुहि ॥५॥

text: This is the strengthener of thy body's manly might: strength,. victory for all time are laid within thine arms. Pressed for thee, Maghavan, it is offered unto thee: drink from the chalice of this Brāhman, drink thy fill.
meaning: एष॒ स्य॒ ते तन्वो॑ नृम्णव॒र्धनः स॒ह ओ॒जः प्रदि॒वि बाह्वो॒र् हितः॒ । तु॒भ्यं सुतो॒ मघवन् तु॒भ्यम् आ॒भृतस् त्व॒म् अस्य ब्रा॒ह्मणाद् आ॒ तृप॒त् पिब ॥६॥

text: Him whom of old I called on, him I call on now. He is to be invoked: his name is He who Gives. Here brought by priests in Soma mead. Granter of Wealth, drink Soma with the Seasons from the Hotar's Cup.
meaning: य॒म् उ पू॒र्वम् अ॒हुवे त॒म् इदं॒ हुवे से॒द् उ ह॒व्यो ददि॒र् यो॒ ना॒म प॒त्यते । अध्वर्यु॒भिः प्र॒स्थितं सोम्यं॒ म॒धु पोत्रा॒त् सो॒मं द्रविणोदः पि॒ब ऋतु॒भिः ॥७॥

text: सुरूपकृत्नु॒म् ऊत॒ये सुदु॒घाम् इव गोदु॒हे । जुहूम॒सि द्य॒विद्यवि ॥१॥
उ॒प नः स॒वना॒ गहि सो॒मस्य सोमपाः पिब । गोदा॒ इ॒द् रेव॒तो म॒दः ॥२॥
अ॒था ते अ॒न्तमानां विद्या॒म सुमतीना॒म् । मा॒ नो अ॒ति ख्य आ॒ गहि ॥३॥
Go to the wise unconquered One, ask thou of Indra, skilled in song, Him who is better than thy friends.
meaning: प॒रेहि वि॒ग्रम् अ॒स्तृतम् इ॒न्द्रं पृछा विपश्चि॒तम् । य॒स् ते स॒खिभ्य आ॒ व॒रम् ॥४॥

text: Whether the men who mock us say, Depart unto another place, Ye who serve Indra and none else;
meaning: उत॒ ब्रुवन्तु नो नि॒दो नि॒र् अन्य॒तश् चिद् आरत । द॒धाना इ॒न्द्र इ॒द् दु॒वः ॥५॥

text: Or whether, God of wondrous deeds, all our true people call us blest, Still may we dwell in Indra's care.
meaning: उत॒ नः सुभ॒गां अरि॒र् वोचे॒युर् दस्म कृष्ट॒यः । स्या॒मे॒द् इ॒न्द्रस्य श॒र्मणि ॥६॥

text: Unto the swift One bring the swift, man-cheering, grace of sacrifice. That to the Friend gives wings and joy.
meaning: ए॒म् आ॒शु॒म् आश॒वे भर यज्ञश्रि॒यं नृमा॒दनम् । पतय॒न् मन्दय॒त्सखम् ॥७॥

text: Thou, Satakratu, drankest this and wast the Vritras' slayer; thou. Helpest the warrior in the fray.
meaning: अस्य॒ पीत्वा॒ शतक्रतो घनो॒ वृत्रा॒णाम् अभवः । प्रा॒वो वा॒जेषु वाजि॒नम् ॥८॥

text: We strengthen, Satakratu, thee, yea, thee the powerfull in fight, That, Indra, we may win us wealth.
meaning: तं॒ त्वा वा॒जेषु वाजि॒नं वाज॒यामः शतक्रतो । ध॒नानाम् इन्द्र सात॒ये ॥९॥

text: To him the mighty stream of wealth, prompt Friend of him who pours the juice, Yea, to this Indra sing your song.
meaning: यो॒ रायो॑ ऽव॒निर् महा॒न्त् सुपारः॒ सुन्वतः॒ स॒खा । त॒स्मा इ॒न्द्राय गायत ॥१०॥

text: O come ye hither, sit ye down: to Indra sing ye forth your song, Companions, bringing hymns of praise.
meaning: आ॒ त्व् ए॒ता नि॒ षीदते॒न्द्रम् अभि॒ प्र॒ गायत । स॒खाय स्तो॒मवाहसः ॥११॥

text: To him the richest of the rich, the Lord of treasures excellent, Indra, with Soma juice outpoured.
meaning: पुरूत॒मं पुरूणा॒म् ई॒शानं वा॒र्याणाम् । इ॒न्द्रं सो॒मे स॒चा सुते॒ ॥१२॥

text: May he stand by us in our need and in abundance for our wealth: With riches may he come to us;
meaning: स॒ घा नो यो॒ग आ॒ भुवत् स॒ राये॒ स॒ पु॒रंध्याम् । ग॒मद् वा॒जेभिर् आ॒ स॒ नः ॥१॥

text: Whose pair of tawny horses yoked in battles foemen challenge not: To him, to Indra, sing your song.
meaning: य॒स्य संस्थे॒ न॒ वृण्व॒ते ह॒री सम॒त्सु श॒त्रवः । त॒स्मा इ॒न्द्राय गायत ॥२॥

text: Nigh to the Soma-drinker come, for his enjoyment, these bright drops, The Somas mingled with the curd.
meaning: सुतपा॒व्ने सुता॒ इमे॒ शु॒चयो यन्ति वीत॒ये । सो॒मासो द॒ध्याशिरः ॥३॥

text: Thou, grown at once to perfect strength, wast born to drink the Soma juice, strong Indra, for preeminence.
meaning: त्वं॒ सुत॒स्य पीत॒ये सद्यो॒ वृद्धो॒ अजायथाः । इ॒न्द्र ज्यै॒ष्ठ्याय सुक्रतो ॥४॥

text: O Indra, lover of the song, may these quick Somas enter thee: May they bring bliss to thee the Sage.
meaning: आ॒ त्वा विशन्त्व् आश॒वः सो॒मास इन्द्र गिर्वणः । शं॒ ते सन्तु प्र॒चेतसे ॥५॥

text: O Lord of Hundred Powers, our chants of praise and lauds have strengthened thee: So strengthen thee the songs we sing!
meaning: त्वां॒ स्तो॒मा अवीवृधन् त्वा॒म् उक्था॒ शतक्रतो । त्वां॒ वर्धन्तु नो गि॒रः ॥६॥

text: Indra, whose succour never fails, accept this treasure thousand- fold, Wherein all manly powers abide.
meaning: अ॒क्षितोतिः सनेद् इमं॒ वा॒जम् इ॒न्द्रः सहस्रि॒णम् । य॒स्मिन् वि॒श्वानि पौं॒स्या ॥७॥

text: O Indra, thou who lovest song, let no man hurt our bodies, keep. Slaughter far from us, for thou canst.
meaning: मा॒ नो म॒र्ता अभि॒ द्रुहन् तनू॒नाम् इन्द्र गिर्वणः । ई॒शानो यवया वध॒म् ॥८॥

text: युञ्ज॒न्ति ब्रध्न॒म् अरुष॒म् च॒रन्तं प॒रि तस्थु॒षः । रो॒चन्ते रोचना॒ दिवि॒ ॥९॥
युञ्ज॒न्त्य् अस्य का॒म्या ह॒री वि॒पक्षसा र॒थे । शो॒णा धृष्णू॒ नृवा॒हसा ॥१०॥
केतुं॒ कृण्व॒न्न् अकेत॒वे पे॒शो मर्या अपेश॒से । स॒म् उष॒द्भिर् अजायथाः ॥११॥
Thereafter they, as is their wont, threw off the state of babes urborn, Taking their sacrificial name.
meaning: आ॒द् अ॒ह स्वधा॒म् अ॒नु पु॒नर् गर्भत्व॒म् एरिरे॒ । द॒धाना ना॒म यज्ञि॒यम् ॥१२॥

text: Thou, Indra, with the Tempest-Gods, the breakers down of what is firm, Foundest the kine even in the cave.
meaning: वीलु॒ चिद् आरुजत्नु॒भिर् गु॒हा चिद् इन्द्र व॒ह्निभिः । अ॒विन्द उस्रि॒या अ॒नु ॥१॥

text: Worshipping even as they list, singers laud him who findeth wealth, The far-renowned, the mighty One.
meaning: देवय॒न्तो य॒था मति॒म् अ॒छा विद॒द्वसुं गि॒रः । महा॒म् अनूषत श्रुत॒म् ॥२॥

text: Then, faring on by Indra's side, the fearless, let thyself be seen,. Both gracious and in splendour peers.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रेण सं॒ हि॒ दृ॒क्षसे संजग्मानो॒ अ॒बिभ्युषा । मन्दू॒ समान॒वर्चसा ॥३॥

text: With Indra's well-beloved hosts, the blameless, tending heaven- ward, The sacrificer cries aloud.
meaning: अनवद्यै॒र् अभि॒द्युभिर् मखः॒ स॒हस्वद् अर्चति । गणै॒र् इ॒न्द्रस्य का॒म्यैः ॥४॥

text: Come from this place, O wanderer, or downward from the light of heaven! Our songs of praise all yearn for this.
meaning: अ॒तः परिज्मन्न् आ॒ गहि दिवो॒ वा रोचना॒द् अ॒धि । स॒म् अस्मिन्न् ऋञ्जते गि॒रः ॥५॥

text: Or Indra we implore for help from here, from heaven above the earth, Or from the spacious firmament.
meaning: इतो॒ वा साति॒म् ई॒महे दिवो॒ वा पा॒र्थिवाद् अ॒धि । इ॒न्द्रं महो॒ वा र॒जसः ॥६॥

text: Indra the singers with high praise, Indra reciters with their lauds, Indra the choirs have glorified.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रम् इ॒द् गथि॒नो बृह॒द् इ॒न्द्रम् अर्के॒भिर् अर्कि॒णः । इ॒न्द्रं वा॒णीर् अनूषत ॥७॥

text: Indra hath ever close to him his two bay steeds and word-yoked car, Indra the golden, Thunder-armed.
meaning: इ॒न्द्र इ॒द् ध॒र्योः स॒चा सं॒मि॒श्ल आ॒ वचोयु॒जा । इ॒न्द्रो वज्री॒ हिरण्य॒यः ॥८॥

text: Indra hath raisedjthe Sun on high in heaven, that he may see afar: He burst the mountain for the kine.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रो दीर्घा॒य च॒क्षस आ॒ सू॒र्यं रोहयद् दिवि॒ । वि॒ गो॒भिर् इ॒न्द्रम् ऐरयत् ॥९॥

text: Help us, O Indra, in the frays, yea, frays where thousand spoils are gained, With awful aids, O awful One.
meaning: इ॒न्द्र वा॒जेषु नो ऽव सह॒स्रप्रधनेषु च । उग्र॒ उग्रा॒भिर् ऊति॒भिः ॥१०॥

text: In mighty battle we invoke, Indra, Indra in lesser fight, The friend who bends his bolt at fiends.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रं वयं॒ महाधन॒ इ॒न्द्रम् अ॒र्भे हवामहे । यु॒जं वृत्रे॒षु वज्रि॒णम् ॥११॥

text: Unclose, our manly Hero, thou for ever bounteous, yonder cloud, For us, thou irresistible.
meaning: स॒ नो वृषन्न् अमुं॒ चरुं॒ स॒त्रादावन्न् अ॒पा वृधि । अस्म॒भ्यम् अ॒प्रतिष्कुतः ॥१२॥

text: Still higher, at each strain of mine, thunder-armed Indra's, praises rise: I find no laud worthy of him.
meaning: तुञ्जे॒तुञ्जे य॒ उ॒त्तरे स्तो॒मा इ॒न्द्रस्य वज्रि॒णः । न॒ विन्धे अस्य सुष्टुति॒म् ॥१३॥

text: Even as the bull drives on the herds, he drives the people with his might, The ruler irresistible:
meaning: वृ॒षा यूथे॒व वं॒सगः कृष्टी॒र् इयर्त्य् ओ॒जसा । ई॒शानो अ॒प्रतिष्कुतः ॥१४॥

text: Indra who rules with single sway men, riches, and the fivefold race. Of those who dwell upon the earth.
meaning: य॒ ए॒कश् चर्षणीनां॒ व॒सूनाम् इरज्य॒ति । इ॒न्द्रः प॒ञ्च क्षितीना॒म् ॥१५॥

text: For your sake from each side we call Indra away from other men: Ours, and none others', may he be.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रं वो विश्व॒तस् प॒रि ह॒वामहे ज॒नेभ्यः । अस्मा॒कम् अस्तु के॒वलः ॥१६॥

text: Indra, bring wealth that gives delight, the victor's ever-conquer- ing wealth, Most excellent, to be our aid;
meaning: ए॒न्द्र सानसिं॒ रयिं॒ सजि॒त्वानं सदास॒हम् । व॒र्षिष्ठम् ऊत॒ये भर ॥१७॥

text: By means of which we may repel our foes in battle hand to hand. By thee assisted with the car.
meaning: नि॒ ये॒न मुष्टिहत्य॒या नि॒ वृत्रा॒ रुण॒धामहै । त्वो॒तासो न्य् अ॒र्वता ॥१८॥

text: Aided by thee, the Thunder-armed, Indra; may we lit up the bolt, And conquer all our foes in fight.
meaning: इ॒न्द्र त्वो॒तासो आ॒ वयं॒ व॒ज्रं घना॒ ददीमहि । ज॒येम सं॒ युधि॒ स्पृ॒धः ॥१९॥

text: With thee, O Indra, for ally, with missile-darting heroes may We conquer our embattled foes.
meaning: वयं॒ शू॒रेभिर् अ॒स्तृभिर् इ॒न्द्र त्व॒या युजा॒ वय॒म् । सासह्या॒म पृतन्यतः॒ ॥२०॥

text: Mighty is Indra, yea, supreme; greatness becomes the Thunderer! Wide as the heaven extends his power;
meaning: महां॒ इ॒न्द्रः पर॒श् च नु॒ महित्व॒म् अस्तु वज्रि॒णे । द्यौ॒र् न॒ प्रथिना॒ श॒वः ॥१॥

text: Which aideth those to win them sons who come as heroes to the fight, Or singers loving holy thoughts.
meaning: समोहे॒ वा य॒ आ॒शत न॒रस् तोक॒स्य स॒नितौ । वि॒प्रासो वा धियाय॒वः ॥२॥

text: His belly drinking deepest draughts of Soma like an ocean swells, Like wide streams from the cope of heaven.
meaning: यः॒ कुक्षिः॒ सोमपा॒तमः समुद्र॒ इव पि॒न्वते । उर्वी॒र् आ॒पो न॒ काकु॒दः ॥३॥

text: एवा॒ ह्य् अ॑स्य सूनृ॒ता विरप्शी॒ गो॒मती मही॒ । पक्वा॒ शा॒खा न॒ दाशु॒षे ॥४॥
एवा॒ हि॒ ते वि॒भूतय ऊत॒य इन्द्र मा॒वते । सद्य॒श् चित् स॒न्ति दाशु॒षे ॥५॥
एवा॒ ह्य् अ॑स्य का॒म्या स्तो॒म उक्थं॒ च शं॒स्या । इ॒न्द्राय सो॒मपीतये ॥६॥
Come, Indra, and delight thee with the juice at all the Soma feasts, Protector, mighty in thy strength.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रे॒हि म॒त्स्य् अ॒न्धसो वि॒श्वेभिः सोमप॒र्वभिः । महां॒ अभिष्टि॒र् ओ॒जसा ॥७॥

text: To Indra pour ye forth the juice, the active gladdening juice, to him The gladdening omnific God.
meaning: ए॒म् एनं सृजता सुते॒ मन्दि॒म् इ॒न्द्राय मन्दि॒ने । च॒क्रिं वि॒श्वानि च॒क्रये ॥८॥

text: O Lord of all men, fair of cheek, rejoice thee in the gladdening buds, Present at these drink-offerings.
meaning: म॒त्स्वा सुशिप्र मन्दि॒भि स्तो॒मेभिर् विश्वचर्षणे । स॒चैषु॒ स॒वनेष्व् आ॒ ॥९॥

text: Songs have outpoured themselves to thee, Indra, the strong, the guardian Lord. And raised themselves unsatisfied.
meaning: अ॒सृग्रम् इन्द्र ते गि॒रः प्र॒ति त्वा॒म् उ॒द् अहासत । अ॒जोषा वृषभं॒ प॒तिम् ॥१०॥

text: Send to us bounty manifold, O Indra, worthy of our wish, For power supreme is only thine.
meaning: स॒म् चोदय चित्र॒म् अर्वा॒ग् रा॒ध इन्द्र व॒रेण्यम् । अ॒सद् इ॒त् ते विभु॒ प्रभु॒ ॥११॥

text: O Indra, stimulate thereto us emulously fain for wealth. And glorious, O most splendid One.
meaning: अस्मा॒न्त् सु॒ त॒त्र चोदये॒न्द्र राये॒ र॒भस्वतः । तु॒विद्युम्न य॒शस्वतः ॥१२॥

text: Give, Indra, wide and lofty fame, wealthy in cattle and in strength, Lasting our life-time, failing not.
meaning: सं॒ गो॒मद् इन्द्र वा॒जवद् अस्मे॒ पृथु॒ श्र॒वो बृह॒त् । विश्वा॒युर् धेह्य् अ॒क्षितम् ॥१३॥

text: Grant us high fame, O Indra, grant riches bestowing thousands, those Fair fruits of earth borne home in wains.
meaning: अस्मे॒ धेहि श्र॒वो बृह॒द् द्युम्नं॒ सहस्रसा॒तमम् । इ॒न्द्र ता॒ रथि॒नीर् इ॒षः ॥१४॥

text: Praising with songs the praise-worthy who cometh to our aid, we call Indra, the Treasure-Lord of wealth.
meaning: व॒सोर् इ॒न्द्रम् व॒सुपतिं गीर्भि॒र् गृण॒न्त ऋग्मि॒यम् । हो॒म ग॒न्तारम् ऊत॒ये ॥१५॥

text: To lofty Indra, dweller by each libation, the pious man Sings forth aloud a strengthening hymn.
meaning: सुते॒सुते न्यो॑कसे बृह॒द् बृहत॒ ए॒द् अरिः॒ । इ॒न्द्राय शूष॒म् अर्चति ॥१६॥

text: In all libations men with hero spirit urge thee, Universal, One, each seeking several light, each fain to win the light apart. Thee, furthering like a ship, will we set to the chariot pole of strength, As men who win with sacrifices Indra's thought, men who win Indra with their lauds.
meaning: वि॒श्वेषु हि॒ त्वा स॒वनेषु तुञ्ज॒ते समान॒म् ए॒कं वृ॒षमण्यवः पृ॒थक् स्वः॑ सनिष्य॒वः पृ॒थक् । तं॒ त्वा ना॒वं न॒ पर्ष॒णिं शूष॒स्य धुरि॒ धीमहि । इ॒न्द्रं न॒ यज्ञै॒श् चत॒यन्त आय॒व स्तो॒मेभिर् इन्द्रम् आय॒वः ॥१॥

text: Couples desirous of thine aid are storming thee, pouring their presents forth to win a stall of kine, pouring gifts, Indra, seeking thee. When two men seeking spoil or heaven thou bringest face to face in war, Thou showest Indra, then the bolt thy constant friend, the bull that ever waits on thee,
meaning: वि॒ त्वा ततस्रे मिथुना॒ अवस्य॒वो व्रज॒स्य साता॒ ग॒व्यस्य निःसृ॒जः स॒क्षन्त इन्द्र निःसृ॒जः । य॒द् गव्य॒न्ता द्वा॒ ज॒ना स्व॑र् य॒न्ता समू॒हसि । आवि॒ष् क॒रिक्रद् वृ॒षणं सचाभु॒वं व॒ज्रम् इन्द्र सचाभु॒वम् ॥२॥

text: Also this morn may he be well inclined to us, mark at our call our offerings and our song of praise, our call that we may win the light. As thou, O Indra Thunder-armed, wilt, as the Strong One, slay the foe, Listen, thou to the prayer of me a later sage, hear thou a later sage's prayer.
meaning: उतो॒ नो अस्या॒ उष॒सो जुषे॒त ह्य् अ॑र्क॒स्य बोधि हवि॒षो ह॒वीमभिः स्व॑र्षाता ह॒वीमभिः । य॒द् इन्द्र ह॒न्तवे मृ॒घो वृ॒षा वज्रिं चि॒केतसि । आ॒ मे अस्य॒ वेध॒सो न॒वीयसो म॒न्म श्रुधि न॒वीयसः ॥३॥

text: All these libations are for thee, O Hero: to thee I offer these my prayers that strengthen. Ever, in every place, must men invoke thee.
meaning: तु॒भ्ये॒द् इमा॒ स॒वना शूर वि॒श्वा तु॒भ्यं ब्र॒ह्माणि व॒र्धना कृणोमि । त्वं॒ नृ॒भिर् ह॒व्यो विश्व॒धासि ॥१॥

text: Never do men attain, O Wonder-worker, thy greatness, Mighty One who must be lauded, Nor, Indra, thine heroic power and bounty.
meaning: नू॒ चिन् नु॒ ते म॒न्यमानस्य दस्मो॒द् अश्नुवन्ति महिमा॒नम् उग्र । न॒ वीर्य॑म् इन्द्र ते न॒ रा॒धः ॥२॥

text: Bring to the Wise, the Great who waxeth mighty your offerings and make ready your devotion: To many clans he goeth, man's Controller.
meaning: प्र॒ वो महे॒ महिवृ॒धे भरध्वं प्र॒चेतसे प्र॒ सुमतिं॒ कृणुध्वम् । वि॒शः पूर्वीः॒ प्र॒ चरा चर्षणिप्राः॒ ॥३॥

text: When, with the Princes, Maghavan, famed of old, comes nigh the thunderbolt of gold and the Controller's car Which his two tawny coursers draw, then Indra is the Sovran Lord of power whose fame spreads far and wide.
meaning: यदा॒ व॒ज्रं हि॒रण्यम् इ॒द् अ॒था र॒थं ह॒री य॒मस्य व॒हतो वि॒ सूरि॒भिः । आ॒ तिष्ठति मघ॒वा स॒नश्रुत इ॒न्द्रो वा॒जस्य दीर्घ॒श्रवसस् प॒तिः ॥४॥

text: With him too is this rain of his that comes like herds: Indra throws drops of moisture on his yellow beard. When the sweet juice is shed he seeks the pleasant place, and stirs the worshipper as the wind disturbs the wood.
meaning: सो॒ चिन् नु॒ वृष्टि॒र् यूथ्या॑ स्वा॒ स॒चां इ॒न्द्रः श्म॒श्रूणि ह॒रिताभि॒ प्रुष्णुते । अ॒व वेति सुक्ष॒यं सुते॒ म॒धू॒द् इ॒द् धूणोति वा॒तो य॒था व॒नम् ॥५॥

text: We laud and praise his several deeds of valour who, fatherlike,. with power hath made us stronger; Who with his voice slew many thousand wicked ones who spake in varied manner with contemptuous cries.
meaning: यो॒ वाचा॒ वि॒वाचो मृध्र॒वाचः पुरू॒ सह॒स्रा॒शिवा जघा॒न । त॒त्तद् इ॒द् अस्य पौं॒स्यं गृणीमसि पिते॒व य॒स् त॒विषीं वावृधे॒ श॒वः ॥६॥

text: O Soma-drinker, ever true, utterly hopeless though we be, Do thou, O Indra, give us hope of beauteous horses and of kine, In thousands, O most wealthy One.
meaning: य॒च् चिद् धि॒ सत्य सोमपा अनाशस्ता॒ इव स्म॒सि । आ॒ तू॒ न इन्द्र शंसय गो॒ष्व् अ॒श्वेषु शुभ्रि॒षु सह॒स्रेषु तुवीमघ ॥१॥

text: O Lord of strength, whose jaws are strong, great deeds are thine, the powerful: Do thou, O Indra, give us hope of beauteous horses and of kine, In thousands, O most wealthy One.
meaning: शि॒प्रिन् वाजानां पते श॒चीवस् त॒व दंस॒ना । आ॒ तू॒ न इन्द्र शंसय गो॒ष्व् अ॒श्वेषु शुभ्रि॒षु सह॒स्रेषु तुवीमघ ॥२॥

text: Lull thou asleep, to wake no more, the pair who on each other look: Do thou, O Indra, give us hope of beauteous horses and of kine, In thousands, O most wealthy One.
meaning: नि॒ ष्वापया मिथूदृ॒शा सस्ता॒म् अ॒बुध्यमाने । आ॒ तू॒ न इन्द्र शंसय गो॒ष्व् अ॒श्वेषु शुभ्रि॒षु सह॒स्रेषु तुवीमघ ॥३॥

text: Hero, let hostile spirits sleep, and every gentler Genius wake: Do thou, O Indra, give us hope of beauteous horses and of kine, In thousands, O most wealthy One.
meaning: सस॒न्तु त्या॒ अ॒रातयो बो॒धन्तु शूर रात॒यः । आ॒ तू॒ न इन्द्र शंसय गो॒ष्व् अ॒श्वेषु शुभ्रि॒षु सह॒स्रेषु तुवीमघ ॥४॥

text: Destroy this ass, O Indra, who in tones discordant brays to thee: Do thou, O Indra, give us hope of beauteous horses and of kine, In thousands, O most wealthy One.
meaning: स॒म् इन्द्र गर्दभं॒ मृण नुव॒न्तं पप॒यामुया॒ । आ॒ तू॒ न इन्द्र शंसय गो॒ष्व् अ॒श्वेषु शुभ्रि॒षु सह॒स्रेषु तुवीमघ ॥५॥

text: Far distant on the forest fall the tempest in a circling course; Do thou, O Indra, give us hope of beauteous horses and of kine, In thousands, O most wealthy One.
