meaning: प॒ताति कुण्डृणा॒च्या दूरं॒ वा॒तो व॒नाद् अ॒धि । आ॒ तू॒ न इन्द्र शंसय गो॒ष्व् अ॒श्वेषु शुभ्रि॒षु सह॒स्रेषु तुवीमघ ॥६॥

text: Slay each reviler and destroy him who in secret injures us: Do thou, O Indra, give us thope of beauteous horses and of kine, In thousands, O most wealthy One.
meaning: स॒र्वं परिक्रोशं॒ जहि जम्भ॒या कृकदाश्व॑म् । आ॒ तू॒ न इन्द्र शंसय गो॒ष्व् अ॒श्वेषु शुभ्रि॒षु सह॒स्रेषु तुवीमघ ॥७॥

text: Couples desirous of thine aid are storming thee, pouring their presents forth to win a stall of king pouring gifts, Indra, seeking thee. When two men seeking spoil or heaven thou bringest face to face in war, Thou showest, Indra, then the bolt, thy constant friend, the bull that ever waits on thee.
meaning: वि॒ त्वा ततस्रे मिथुना॒ अवस्य॒वो व्रज॒स्य साता॒ ग॒व्यस्य निःसृ॒जः स॒क्षन्त इन्द्र निःसृजः । य॒द् गव्य॒न्त द्वा॒ ज॒ना स्व॑र् य॒न्ता समू॒हसि । आवि॒ष् क॒रिक्रद् वृ॒षणं सचाभु॒वं व॒ज्रम् इन्द्र सचाभु॒वम् ॥१॥

text: This thine heroic power full well the people knew, wherewith thou brakest down, Indra, autumnal forts, brakest them down with conquering might. Thou hast chastised. O Indra, Lord of strength, the man who worships not, And made thine own this great earth and these water-floods, with joyous heart these water-floods.
meaning: विदु॒ष् टे अस्य॒ वीर्य॑स्य पूर॒वः पु॒रो य॒द् इन्द्र शा॒रदीर् अवा॒तिरः सासहानो॒ अवा॒तिरः । शा॒सस् त॒म् इन्द्र म॒र्त्यम् अ॒यजुं शवसस् पते । मही॒म् अमुष्णाः पृथिवी॒म् इमा॒ अपो॒ मन्दसान॒ इमा॒ अपः॒ ॥२॥

text: And they have bruited far this hero might, when thou, O Strong One, in thy joy helpest thy suppliants who sought to win thee for their Friend. Their battle-cry thou madest sound victorious in the shocks of war. One stream after another have they gained from thee, eager for glory have they gained.
meaning: आ॒द् इ॒त् ते अस्य॒ वीर्य॑स्य चर्किरन् म॒देषु वृषन्न् उशि॒जो य॒द् आ॒विथ सखीयतो॒ य॒द् आ॒विथ । चक॒र्थ कार॒म् एभ्यः पृ॒तनासु प्र॒वन्तवे । ते॒ अन्या॒मन्यां नद्यं॑ सनिष्णत श्र॒वस्य॒न्तः सनिष्णत ॥३॥

text: As sits the young bird on the tree rejoicing, ye, swift pair, have been roused by clear laudation, Whose Hoter-priest through many days is Indra, earth's guardian, friend of men, the best of heroes.
meaning: व॒ने न॒ वा यो॒ न्य् अ॑धायि चाक्रं॒ छु॒चिर् वां स्तो॒मो भुरणाव् अजीगः । य॒स्ये॒द् इ॒न्द्रः पुरुदि॒नेषु हो॒ता नृणां॒ न॒र्वो नृ॒तमः क्षपा॒वान् ॥१॥

text: May we, when this Dawn and the next dance hither, be thy best servants, most heroic Hero! Let the victorious car with triple splendour bring hitherward the hundred chiefs with Kutsa.
meaning: प्र॒ ते अस्या॒ उष॒सः प्रा॒परस्या नृतौ॒ स्याम नृ॒तम् अस्य नृणा॒म् । अ॒नु त्रिशो॒कः शत॒म् आ॒वहन् नृ॒̄न् कु॒त्सेन र॒थो यो॒ अ॒सत् ससवा॒न् ॥२॥

text: What was the gladdening draught that pleased thee, Indra? Speed to our doors, our songs, for thou art mighty. Why comest thou to me, what gift attracts thee? Fain would I bring thee food most meet to offer.
meaning: क॒स् ते म॒द इन्द्र र॒न्त्यो भूद् दु॒रो गि॒रो अभ्य् उ॑ग्रो॒ वि॒ धाव । क॒द् वा॒हो अर्वा॒ग् उ॒प मा मनीषा॒ आ॒ त्वा शक्याम् उपम॒म् रा॒धो अ॒न्नैः ॥३॥

text: Indra, what fame hath one like thee mid heroes? With what plan wilt thou act? Why hast thou sought us? As a true friend, Wide-Strider! to sustain us, since food absorbs the thought of each among us.
meaning: क॒द् उ द्युम्न॒म् इन्द्र त्वा॒वतो नृ॒̄न् क॒या धिया॒ करसे क॒न् न आ॒गन् । मित्रो॒ न॒ सत्य॒ उरुगाय भृत्या॒ अ॒न्ने समस्य य॒द् अ॒सन् मनीषाः॒ ॥४॥

text: Speed happily those, as Sūrya ends his journey, who meet his wish as bridegrooms meet their spouses; Men who support, O Indra strong by nature, with food the many songs that tell thy praises.
meaning: प्रे॒रय सू॒रो अ॒र्थं न॒ पारं॒ ये॒ अस्य का॒मं जनिधा॒ इव ग्म॒न् । गि॒रश् च ये॒ ते तुविजात पूर्वी॒र् न॒र इन्द्र प्रतिशि॒क्षन्त्य् अ॒न्नैः ॥५॥

text: Thine are two measures, Indra, wide, well-meted, heaven for thy majesty, earth for thy wisdom. Here for thy choice are Somas mixed with butter: may the sweet meath be pleasant for thy drinking.
meaning: मा॒त्रे नु॒ ते सु॒मिते इन्द्र पूर्वी॒ द्यौ॒र् मज्म॒ना पृथिवी॒ का॒व्येन । व॒राय ते घृत॒वन्तः सुता॒सः स्वा॒द्नन् भवन्तु पीत॒ये म॒धूनि ॥६॥

text: They have poured out a bowl to him, to Indra, full of sweet juice, for faithful is his bounty. O'er earth's expanse hath he grown great by wisdom, the friend of man, and by heroic exploits.
meaning: आ॒ म॒ध्वो अस्मा असिचन्न् अ॒मत्रम् इ॒न्द्राय पूर्णं॒ स॒ हि॒ सत्य॒राधाः । स॒ वावृधे व॒रिमन्न् आ॒ पृथिव्या॒ अभि॒ क्र॒त्वा न॒र्यः पौं॒स्यैश् च ॥७॥

text: Indra hath conquered in his wars the mighty: men strive in multitudes to win his friendship. Ascend thy chariot as it were in battle, which thou shalt drive to us with gracious favour,
meaning: व्य् आ॑नऌ इ॒न्द्रः पृ॒तनाः स्वो॒जा आ॒स्मै यतन्ते सख्या॒य पूर्वीः॒ । आ॒ स्मा र॒थं न॒ पृ॒तनासु तिष्ठ यं॒ भद्र॒या सुमत्या॒ चोद॒यासे ॥८॥

text: Impetuous, true, let Maghavan come hither, and let his tawny coursers speed to reach us. For him have we pressed juice exceeding potent: here, praised with song, let him effect his visit.
meaning: आ॒ सत्यो॒ यातु मघ॒वां ऋजीषी॒ द्र॒वन्त्व् अस्य ह॒रय उ॒प नः । त॒स्मा इ॒द् अ॒न्धः सुषुमा सुद॒क्षम् इहा॒भिपित्वं॒ करते गृणानः॒ ॥१॥

text: Unyoke, as at thy journey's end, O Hero, to gladden thee to-day at this libation. Like Usanā, the priest a laud shall utter, a hymn to thee, the Lord Divine, who markest.
meaning: अ॒व स्य शूरा॒ध्वनो ना॒न्ते ऽस्मि॒न् नो अद्य॒ स॒वने मन्द॒ध्यै । शं॒सात्य् उक्थ॒म् उश॒नेव वेधा॒श् चिकितु॒षे असुर्या॑य म॒न्म ॥२॥

text: When the Bull quaffing praises our libation, as a sage paying holy rites in secret, Seven singers here from heaven hath he begotten, who e'en by day have wrought their works while singing.
meaning: कवि॒र् न॒ निण्यं॒ विद॒थानि सा॒धन् वृ॒षा य॒त् से॒कं विपिपानो॒ अ॒र्चात् । दिव॒ इत्था॒ जीजनत् सप्त॒ कारू॒न् अ॒ह्ना चिच् चक्रुर् वयु॒ना गृण॒न्तः ॥३॥

text: When heaven's fair light by hymns was made apparent. (they made great splendour shine at break of morning), He with his succour, best of heroes, scattered the blinding dark- ness so that men saw clearly.
meaning: स्व॑र् य॒द् वे॒दि सुदृ॒शीकम् अर्कै॒र् म॒हि ज्यो॒ती रुरुचुर् य॒द् ध व॒स्तोः । अन्धा॒ त॒मांसि दु॒धिता विच॒क्षे नृ॒भ्यश् चकार नृ॒तमो अभि॒ष्टौ ॥४॥

text: Indra, impetuous One, hath waxed immensely: he with his vastness hath filled earth and heaven. E'en beyond this his majesty extendeth who hath exceeded all the worlds in greatness,
meaning: ववक्ष॒ इ॒न्द्रो अ॒मितम् ऋजिष्य् उ॑भे॒ आ॒ पप्रौ रो॒दसी महित्वा॒ । अ॒तश् चिद् अस्य महिमा॒ वि॒ रेच्य् अभि॒ यो॒ वि॒श्वा भु॒वना बभू॒व ॥५॥

text: Sakra who knoweth well all human actions hath with his eager friends let loose the waters. They with their songs cleft e'en the mountain open, and willingly disclosed the stall of cattle.
meaning: वि॒श्वानि शक्रो॒ न॒र्याणि विद्वा॒न् अपो॒ रिरेच स॒खिभिर् नि॒कामैः । अ॒श्मानं चिद् ये॒ बिभिदु॒र् व॒चोभिर् व्रज॒म् गो॒मन्तम् उशि॒जो वि॒ वव्रुः ॥६॥

text: He smote away the flood's obstructer Vritra: Earth conscious lent her aid to speed thy thunder. Thou sentest forth the waters of the ocean as Lord through power and might, O daring Hero.
meaning: अपो॒ वृत्रं॒ वव्रिवां॒सं प॒राहन् प्रा॒वत् ते व॒ज्रं पृथिवी॒ स॒चेताः । प्रा॒र्णांसि समुद्रि॒याण्य् ऐनोः प॒तिर् भ॒वं छ॒वसा शूर धृष्णो ॥७॥

text: When, Much-invoked! the waters' rock thou deftest, Saramā showed herself and went before thee. Hymned by Angirases, bursting the cowstalls, thou foundest ample strength for us as leader.
meaning: अपो॒ य॒द् अ॒द्रिं पुरुहूत द॒र्दर् आवि॒र् भुवत् सर॒मा पूर्व्यं॒ ते । स॒ नो नेता॒ वा॒जम् आ॒ दर्षि भू॒रिं गोत्रा॒ रुज॒न्न् अ॒ङ्गिरोभिर् गृणानः॒ ॥८॥

text: Sing this, what time the juice is pressed, to him your Hero much-invoked, To please him as a mighty, Bull.
meaning: त॒द् वो गाय सुते॒ स॒चा पुरुहूता॒य स॒त्वने । शं॒ य॒द् ग॒वे न॒ शाकि॒ने ॥१॥

text: He, excellent, withholdeth not his gift of power and wealth in kine, When he hath listened to our songs.
meaning: न॒ घा व॒सुर् नि॒ यमते दानं॒ वा॒जस्य गो॒मतः । य॒त् सीम् उ॒प श्र॒वद् गि॒रः ॥२॥

text: May he with might disclose for us the cows' stall, whosesoe'er it be, To which the Dasyu-slayer goes.
meaning: कुवि॒त्सस्य प्र॒ हि॒ व्रजं॒ गो॒मन्तं दस्युहा॒ ग॒मत् । श॒चीभिर् अ॒प नो वरत् ॥३॥

text: O Indra, give us wisdom as a sire gives wisdom to his sons. Guide us, O Much-invoked, on this our foray: may we, living, still enjoy the light.
meaning: इ॒न्द्र क्र॒तुं न आ॒ भर पिता॒ पुत्रे॒भ्यो य॒था । शि॒क्षा णो अस्मि॒न् पुरुहूत या॒मनि जीवा॒ ज्यो॒तिर् अशीमहि ॥१॥

text: Grant that no mighty foes, unknown, malevolent, unhallowed, tread us to the ground. With thine assistance, Hero! may we pass through all the waters that are rushing down.
meaning: मा॒ नो अ॒ज्ञाता वृज॒ना दुराध्यो॑ मा॒शिवासो अ॒व क्रमुः । त्व॒या वयं॒ प्रव॒तः श॒श्वतीर् अपो॒ ऽति शूर तरामसि ॥२॥

text: Bring us, O Indra, name and fame, enriching, mightiest, excellent, Wherewith, O wondrous God, fair-cheeked and thunder-armed, thou hast filled full this earth and heaven.
meaning: इ॒न्द्र ज्ये॒ष्ठं न आ॒ भरं ओ॒जिष्ठं प॒पुरि श्र॒वः । ये॒नेमे॒ चित्र वज्रहस्त रो॒दसी ओ॒भे॒ सुशिप्र प्राः॒ ॥१॥

text: We call on thee, O King, mighty among the Gods, ruler of men, to succour us, All that is weak in us, excellent God, make firm: make our foes easy to subdue.
meaning: त्वा॒म् उग्र॒म् अ॒वसे चर्षणीस॒हं रा॒जन् देवे॒षु हूमहे । वि॒श्वा सु॒ नो विथुरा॒ पिब्दना॒ वसो ऽमि॒त्रान् सुष॒हान् कृधि ॥२॥

text: O Indra, if a hundred heavens and if a hundred earths were: thine No, not a hundred suns could match thee at thy birth, not, both, the worlds, O Thunderer.
meaning: य॒द् द्या॒व इन्द्र ते शतं॒ शतं॒ भू॒मिर् उत॒ स्युः॒ । न॒ त्वा वज्रिन्त् सह॒स्रं सू॒र्या अ॒नु न॒ जात॒म् अष्ट रो॒दसी ॥१॥

text: Thou, Hero, hast performed thy hero needs with might, yea, all+ with strength, O Strongest One. Maghavan, help us to a stable full of kine, O Thunderer, with) wondrous aids.
meaning: आ॒ पप्राथ महिना॒ कृ॒ष्ण्या वृषन् वि॒श्वा शविष्ठ श॒वसा । अस्मां॒ अ॒व मघवन् गो॒मति व्रजे॒ व॒ज्रिम् चित्रा॒भिर् ऊति॒भिः ॥२॥

text: If I, O Indra, were the lord of riches ample as thine own, I should support the singer, God who scatterest wealth! and! not abandon him to woe.
meaning: य॒द् इन्द्र या॒वतस् त्व॒म् एता॒वद् अह॒म् ई॒शीय । स्तोता॒रम् इ॒द् दिधिषेय रदावसो न॒ पापत्वा॒य रासीय ॥१॥

text: Each day would I enrich the man who sang my praise, in what- soever place he were. No kinship is there better, Maghavan, than thine: a father even) is no more.
meaning: शि॒क्षेयम् इ॒न् महयते॒ दिवे॒दिवे राय॒ आ॒ कुहचिद्वि॒दे । नहि॒ त्व॒द् अन्य॒न् मघवन् न आ॒प्यं व॒स्यो अ॒स्ति पिता॒ चन॒ ॥२॥

text: O Indra, grant a happy home, a triple refuge, triply strong. Bestow a dwelling-place on the rich lords and me, and keep thy dart afar from these.
meaning: इ॒न्द्र त्रिधा॒तु शरणं॒ त्रिव॒रूथं स्वस्तिम॒त् । छर्दि॒र् यछ मघ॒वद्भ्यश् च म॒ह्यं च याव॒या दिद्यु॒म् एभ्यः ॥१॥

text: They who with minds intent on spoil subdue the foe, boldly attack and smite him down. From these, O Indra, Bounteous Lord who lovest song, be closest guardian of our lives.
meaning: ये॒ गव्यता॒ म॒नसा श॒त्रुम् आदभु॒र् अभिप्रघ्न॒न्ति धृष्णुया॒ । अ॒घ स्मा नो मघवन्न् इन्द्र गिर्वणस् तनूपा॒ अ॒न्तमो भव ॥२॥

text: O Indra marvellously bright, come, these libations long for thee, Thus by fine fingers purified.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रा॒ याहि चित्रभानो सुता॒ इमे॒ त्वाय॒वः । अ॒ण्वीभिस् त॒ना पूता॒सः ॥१॥

text: Urged by the holy singer, sped by song, come, Indra, to the prayers. Of the libation-pouring priest.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रा॒ याहि धिये॒षितो॒ वि॒प्रजुतः सुता॒वतः । उ॒प ब्र॒ह्माणि वाघ॒तः ॥२॥

text: Approach, O Indra, hasting thee, Lord of Bay Horses, to the prayers: Take pleasure in the juice we pour.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रा॒ याहि तू॒तुजान उ॒प ब्र॒ह्माणि हरिवः । सुते॒ दधिष्व नश् च॒नः ॥३॥

text: Glorify naught besides, O friends; so shall no sorrow trouble you. Praise only mighty Indra when the juice is shed, and say your lauds repeatedly:
meaning: मा॒ चिद् अन्य॒द् वि॒ शंसत स॒खायो मा॒ रिषण्यत । इ॒न्द्रम् इ॒त् स्तोता वृ॒षणं स॒चा सुते॒ मु॒हुर् उक्था॒ च शंसत ॥१॥

text: Even him, eternal, like a bull who rushes down, men's con- queror, bounteous like a cow; Him who is cause of both, of enmity and peace, to both sides most munificent.
meaning: अवक्रक्षि॒णं वृषभं॒ यथाजु॒रम् गां॒ न॒ चर्षणीस॒हम् । विद्वे॒षणं संव॒ननोभयंकरं॒ मं॒हिष्ठम् उभयावि॒नम् ॥२॥

text: Although these men in sundry ways invoke thee to obtain thine aid. Be this our prayer, addressed, O Indra, unto thee, thine exalta- tion every day.
meaning: य॒च् चिद् धि॒ त्वा ज॒ना इमे॒ ना॒ना ह॒वन्त ऊत॒ये । अस्मा॒कं ब्र॒ह्मेद॒म् इन्द्र भूतु ते॒ ऽहा वि॒श्वा च व॒र्धनम् ॥३॥

text: Those skilled in song, O Maghavan, among these men o'ercome with might the foeman's songs, Come hither, bring us strength in many a varied form most near that it may succour us.
meaning: वि॒ तर्तूर्यन्ते मघवन् विपश्चि॒तो ऽर्यो॒ वि॒पो ज॒नानाम् । उ॒प क्रमस्व पुरुरू॒पम् आ॒ भर वा॒जं ने॒दिष्ठम् ऊत॒ये ॥४॥

text: Those who are yoked by prayer with prayer I harness, the two. fleet friendly Bays who joy together. Mounting thy firm and easy car, O Indra, wise and all-knowing come thou to the Soma.
meaning: ब्र॒ह्मणा ते ब्रह्मयु॒जा युनज्मि ह॒री स॒खाया सधमा॒द आशू॒ । स्थिरं॒ र॒थं सुख॒म् इन्द्राधिति॒ष्ठन् प्रजान॒न् विद्वां॒ उ॒प याहि सो॒मम् ॥१॥

text: Priests, offer to the Lord of all the people the milked-out stalk of Soma, radiant-coloured. No wild bull knows his drinking-place like Indra who ever seeks him who hath pressed the Soma.
meaning: अ॒ध्वर्यवो ऽरुणं॒ दुग्ध॒म् अंशुं॒ जुहो॒तन वृषभा॒य क्षितीना॒म् । गौरा॒द् वे॒दीयां अवपा॒नम् इ॒न्द्रो विश्वा॒हे॒द् याति सुत॒सोमम् इछ॒न् ॥१॥

text: Thou dost desire to drink, each day that passes, the pleasant food which thou hast had aforetime. O Indra, gratified in heart and spirit, drink eagerly the Soma set before thee.
meaning: य॒द् दधिषे॒ प्रदि॒वि चा॒र्व् अ॒न्नं दिवे॒दिवे पीति॒म् इ॒द् अस्य वक्षि । उत॒ हृदो॒त॒ म॒नसा जुषाण॒ उश॒न्न् इन्द्र प्र॒स्थितान् पाहि सो॒मान् ॥२॥

text: Thou, newly-born, for strength didst drink the Soma; thy mother told thee of thy future greatness. O Indra, thou hast filled mid-air's wide region, and given the Gods by battle room and freedom.
meaning: जज्ञानः॒ सो॒मं स॒हसे पपाथ प्र॒ ते माता॒ महिमा॒नम् उवाच । ए॒न्द्र पप्राथोर्व् अ॑न्त॒रिक्षं युधा॒ देवे॒भ्यो व॒रिवश् चकर्थ ॥३॥

text: When thou hast urged the arrogant to combat, proud in their strength of arm, we will subdue them. Or, Indra, when thou fightest girt by heroes, we in the glorious fray with thee will conquer.
meaning: य॒द् योध॒या महतो॒ म॒न्यमानान् सा॒क्षाम ता॒न् बाहु॒भिः शा॒शदानान् । य॒द् वा नृ॒भिर् वृ॒त इन्द्राभियु॒ध्यास् तं॒ त्व॒याजिं॒ सौश्रवसं॒ जयेम ॥४॥

text: I will declare the earliest deeds of Indra, and recent acts which Maghavan hath accomplished. When he had conquered godless wiles and magic, Soma became his own entire possession.
meaning: प्रे॒न्द्रस्य वोचं प्रथमा॒ कृता॒नि प्र॒ नू॒तना मघ॒वा या॒ चका॒र । यदे॒द् अ॒देवीर् अ॒सहिष्ट माया॒ अ॒थाभवत् के॒वलः सो॒मो अस्य ॥५॥

text: Thine is this world of flocks and herds around thee, which with the eye of Surya thou beholdest. Thou, Indra, art alone the Lord of cattle: may we enjoy the treasure which thou givest.
meaning: त॒वेदं॒ वि॒श्वम् अभि॒तः पशव्यं॑ य॒त् प॒श्यसि च॒क्षसा सू॒र्यस्य । ग॒वाम् असि गो॒पतिर् ए॒क इन्द्र भक्षीम॒हि ते प्र॒यतस्य व॒स्वः ॥६॥

text: Ye twain are Lords of wealth in earth and heaven, thou, O Brihaspati, and thou, O Indra . Mean though he be, give wealth to him who lauds you. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
meaning: बृ॒हस्पते युव॒म् इ॒न्द्रश् च व॒स्वो दिव्य॒स्येशाथे उत॒ पार्थिवस्य । धत्तं॒ रयिं॒ स्तुवते॒ कीर॒ये चिद् यूयं॒ पात स्वस्ति॒भिः स॒दा नः ॥७॥

text: Him who with might hath propped earth's ends, who sitteth in threefold seat, Brihaspati, with thunder, Him of the pleasant tongue have ancient sages, deep thinking,. holy singers, set before them.
meaning: य॒स् तस्त॒म्भ स॒हसा वि॒ ज्मो॒ अ॒न्तान् बृ॒हस्प॒तिस् त्रिषधस्थो॒ र॒वेण । तं॒ प्रत्ना॒स ऋ॒षयो दी॒ध्यानाः पुरो॒ वि॒प्रा दधिरे मन्द्र॒जिह्वम् ॥१॥

text: Wild in their course, in well-marked wise rejoicing were they,. Brihaspati, who pressed around us Preserve, Brihaspati, the stall uninjured,r,this company's raining. ever-moving birth-place.
meaning: धुने॒तयः सुप्रकेतं॒ म॒दन्तो बृ॒हस्पते अभि॒ ये॒ नस् ततस्रे॒ । पृ॒षन्तं सृप्र॒म् अ॒दब्धम् ऊर्वं॒ बृ॒हस्पते र॒क्षताद् अस्य यो॒निम् ॥२॥

text: Brihaspati, from thy remotest distance have they sat down who love the law eternal. For thee were dug wells springing from the mountain, which murmuring round about pour streams of sweetness.
meaning: बृ॒हस्पते या॒ परमा॒ पराव॒द् अ॒त आ॒ ते ऋतस्पृ॒शो नि॒ षेदुः । तु॒भ्यं खाता॒ अवता॒ अ॒द्रिदुग्धा म॒ध्व श्चोतन्त्य् अभि॒तो विरप्श॒म् ॥३॥

text: Brihaspati, when first he had his being from mighty splendour in supremest heaven. Strong, with his sevenfold mouth, with noise of thunder, with his seven rays blew and dispersed the darkness.
meaning: बृ॒हस्प॒तिः प्रथमं॒ जा॒यमानो महो॒ ज्यो॒तिषः परमे॒ व्यो॑मन् । सप्ता॒स्यस् तुविजातो॒ र॒वेण वि॒ सप्त॒रश्मिर् अधमत् त॒मांसि ॥४॥

text: With the loud-shouting band who sang his praises, with thunder, he destroyed malignant Vala. Brihaspati thundering drave forth the cattle, the lowing cows who make oblations ready.
meaning: स॒ सुष्टु॒भा स॒ ऋ॒क्वता गणे॒न वलं॒ रुरोज फलिगं॒ र॒वेन । बृ॒हस्प॒तिर् उस्रि॒या हव्यसू॒दः क॒निक्रदद् वा॒वशतीर् उ॒द् आजत् ॥५॥

text: Serve we with sacrifices, gifts, and homage even thus the Steer of all the Gods, the Father. Brihaspati, may we be lords of riches, with noble progeny and, store of heroes.
meaning: एवा॒ पित्रे॒ विश्व॒देवाय वृ॒ष्णे यज्ञै॒र् विधेम न॒मसा हवि॒र्भिः । बृ॒हस्पते सुप्रजा॒ वीर॒वन्तो वयं॒ स्याम प॒तयो रयीणा॒म् ॥६॥

text: Even as an archer shoots afar his arrow, offer the laud to him with meet adornment. Quell with your voice the wicked's voice, O sages, Singer, make Indra rest beside the Soma.
meaning: अ॒स्तेव सु॒ प्रतरं॒ ला॒यम् अ॒स्यन् भू॒षन्न् इव प्र॒ भरा स्तो॒मम् अस्मै । वाचा॒ विप्रास् तरत वा॒चम् अर्यो॒ नि॒ रामय जरितः सो॒म इ॒न्द्रम् ॥१॥

text: Draw thy Friend to thee like a cow at milking: O singer, wake up Indra as a lover. Make thou the Hero haste to give us riches even as a vessel filled brimful with treasure.
meaning: दो॒हेन गा॒म् उ॒प शिक्षा स॒खायं प्र॒ बोधय जरितर् जार॒म् इ॒न्द्रम् । को॒शं न॒ पूर्णं॒ व॒सुना न्यृ॑ष्टम् आ॒ च्यावय मघदे॒याय शू॒रम् ॥२॥

text: Why, Maghavan, do they call thee bounteous Giver? Quicken me: thou, I hear, art he who quickens. Sakra, let my intelligence be active, and bring us luck that finds great wealth, O Indra.
meaning: कि॒म् अङ्ग॒ त्वा मघवन् भोज॒म् आहुः शिशीहि॒ मा शिशयं॒ त्वा शृणोमि । अ॒प्नस्वती म॒म धी॒र् अस्तु शक्र वसुवि॒दं भ॒गम् इन्द्रा॒ भरा नः ॥३॥

text: Standing, in battle for their rights, together, the people, Indra, in the fray invoke thee. Him who brings gifts the Hero makes his comrade: with him who pours no juice he seeks not friendship.
meaning: त्वां॒ ज॒ना ममसत्ये॒ष्व् इन्द्र संतस्थाना॒ वि॒ ह्वयन्ते समीके॒ । अ॒त्रा यु॒जं कृणुते यो॒ हवि॒ष्मान् नासुन्वता सख्यं॒ वष्टि शू॒रः ॥४॥

text: Whoso with plenteous juice for him expresses strong Somas as much quickly-coming treasure, For him he everthrows in early morning his swift well-weapon- ed foes and slays the tyrant.
meaning: ध॒नं न॒ स्पन्द्रं॒ बहुलं॒ यो॒ अस्मै तीव्रा॒न्त् सो॒मां आसुनो॒ति प्र॒यस्वान् । त॒स्मै श॒त्रून्त् सुतु॒कान् प्रात॒र् अ॒ह्नो नि॒ स्व॒ष्ट्रान् युव॒ति ह॒न्ति वृत्र॒म् ॥५॥

text: He unto whom we offer praises, Indra, Maghavan, who hath joined to ours his wishes Before him even afar the foe must tremble: low before him must bow all human glories.
meaning: य॒स्मिन् वयं॒ दधिमा॒ शं॒सम् इ॒न्द्रे यः॒ शिश्रा॒य मघ॒वा का॒मम् अस्मे॒ । आरा॒च् चित् स॒न् भयताम् अस्य श॒त्रुर् न्य् अ॑स्मै द्युम्ना॒ ज॒न्या नमन्ताम् ॥६॥

text: With thy fierce bolt, O God invoked of many, drive to a distance from afar the foeman. O Indra, give us wealth in corn and cattle, and make the singer's prayer gain strength and riches.
meaning: आरा॒च् छ॒त्रुम् अ॒प बाधस्व दूर॒म् उग्रो॒ यः॒ श॒म्बः पुरुहूत ते॒न । अस्मे॒ धेहि य॒वमद् गो॒मद् इन्द्र कृधी॒ धि॒यं जरित्रे॒ वा॒जरत्नाम् ॥७॥

text: Indra the swallower of strong libations with their thick residue, the potent Somas, He, Maghavan, will not restrict his bounty: he brings much wealth unto the Soma-presser.
meaning: प्र॒ य॒म् अन्त॒र् वृषसवा॒सो अ॒ज्मन् तीव्राः॒ सो॒मा बहुला॒न्तास इ॒न्द्रम् । ना॒ह दामा॒नं मघ॒वा नि॒ यंसन् नि॒ सुन्वते॒ वहति भू॒रि वाम॒म् ॥८॥

text: Yea, by superior play he wins advantage when he, a gambler, piles his gains in season. Celestial-natured, he o'erwhelms with riches the devotee who keeps not back his money.
meaning: उत॒ प्रहा॒म् अ॒तिदीवा जयति कृत॒म् इव श्वघ्नी॒ वि॒ चिनोति काले॒ । यो॒ देव॒कामो न॒ ध॒नं रुण॒द्धि स॒म् इ॒त् तं॒ रायः॒ सृजति स्वधा॒भिः ॥९॥

text: O much-invoked, may we subdue all famine and evil want with store of grain and cattle. May we allied, as first in rank, with princes,:obtain possessions by our own exertion
meaning: गो॒भिष् टरेमा॒मतिं दुरे॒वां य॒वेन वा क्षु॒धं पुरुहूत वि॒श्वे । वयं॒ रा॒जसु प्रथमा॒ ध॒नान्य् अ॒रिष्टासो वृजनी॒भिर् जयेम ॥१०॥

text: Brihaspati protect us from the rearward, and from above and from below, from sinners. May Indra from the front and from the centre, as friend to friends, vouchsafe us room and freedom.
meaning: बृ॒हस्प॒तिर् नः प॒रि पातु पश्चा॒द् उतो॒त्तरस्माद् अ॒धराद् अघयोः॒ । इ॒न्द्रः पुर॒स्ताद् उत॒ मध्यतो॒ नः स॒खा स॒खिभ्यो व॒रीयः कृणोतु ॥११॥

text: Served with oblations, first-born, mountain-render, Angiras' Son, Brihaspati the holy. With twice-firm path, dwelling in light, our Father, roars loudly, as a bull, to earth and heaven.
meaning: यो॒ अद्रिभि॒त् प्रथमजा॒ ऋता॒वा बृ॒हस्प॒तिर् आङ्गिरसो॒ हवि॒ष्मान् । द्विब॒र्हज्मा प्राघर्मस॒त् पिता॒ न आ॒ रो॒दसी वृषभो॒ रोरवीति ॥१॥

text: Brihaspati who made for such a people wide room and verge when Gods were invocated— Slaying his foe he breaketh down their cattles, quelling his enemies and those who hate him.
meaning: ज॒नाय चिद् य॒ ई॒वते उ लोकं॒ बृ॒हस्प॒तिर् देव॒हूतौ चका॒र । घ्न॒न् वृत्रा॒णि वि॒ पु॒रो दर्दरीति ज॒यं छ॒त्रूंर् अमि॒त्रान् पृत्सु॒ सा॒हन् ॥२॥

text: Brihaspati in war hath won rich treasures, hath won, this God, the great stalls filled with cattle. Striving to win waters and light, resistless, Brihaspati with light- ning smites the foeman.
meaning: बृ॒हस्प॒तिः स॒म् अजयद् व॒सूनि महो॒ व्रजा॒न् गो॒मते देव॒ एषः॒ । अपः॒ सि॒षासन्त् स्व॑र् अ॒प्रतीतो बृ॒हस्प॒तिर् ह॒न्त्य् अमि॒त्रम् अर्कैः॒ ॥३॥

text: This holy hymn sublime and seven-headed, sprung from eternal Law, our sire discovered. Ayāsya, friend of all men, hath engendered the fourth hymn as he sang his laud to Indra.
meaning: इमां॒ धि॒यं सप्त॒शीर्ष्णीं पिता॒ न ऋत॒प्रजातां बृहती॒म् अविन्दत् । तुरी॒यं स्विज् जनयद् विश्व॒जन्यो ऽया॒स्य उक्थ॒म् इ॒न्द्राय शं॒सन् ॥१॥

text: Thinking aright, praising eternal Order, the sons of Dyaus the Asura, those heroes, Angirases, holding the rank of sages, first honoured sacrifice's holy statute.
meaning: ऋतं॒ शं॒सन्त ऋजु॒ दी॒ध्याना दिव॒स् पुत्रा॒सो अ॒सुरस्य वीराः॒ । वि॒प्रं पद॒म् अ॒ङ्गिरसो द॒धाना यज्ञ॒स्य धा॒म प्रथमं॒ मनन्त ॥२॥

text: Girt by his friends who cried with swanlike voices, bursting the stoney barriers of the prison, Brihaspati spake in thunder to the cattle, and uttered praise and. song when he had found them.
meaning: हंसै॒र् इव स॒खिभिर् वा॒वदद्भिर् अश्मन्म॒यानि न॒हना व्य॒स्यन् । बृ॒हस्प॒तिर् अभिक॒निक्रदद् गा॒ उत॒ प्रा॒स्तौद् उ॒च् च विद्वां॒ अगायत् ॥३॥

text: Apart from one, away from two above him, he draye the kine that stood in bonds of falsehood. Brihaspati, seeking light amid the darkness, draye forth the bright cows: three he made apparent.
meaning: अवो॒ द्वा॒भ्यां पर॒ ए॒कया गा॒ गु॒हा ति॒ष्ठन्तीर् अ॒नृतस्य से॒तौ । बृ॒हस्प॒तिस् त॒मसि ज्यो॒तिर् इछ॒न् उ॒द् उस्रा॒ आ॒कर् वि॒ हि॒ तिस्र॒ आ॒वः ॥४॥

text: When he had cleft the lairs and western castle, he cut off three from him who held the waters. Brihaspati discovered, while he thundered like Dyaus, the dawn,. the sun, the cow, the lightning.
meaning: विभि॒द्या पु॒रं शय॒थेम् अ॒पाचीं नि॒स् त्री॒णि साक॒म् उदधे॒र् अकृन्तत् । बृ॒हस्प॒तिर् उष॒सं सू॒र्यं गा॒म् अर्कं॒ विवेद स्तन॒यन्न् इव द्यौः॒ ॥५॥

text: As with a hand, so with his roaring Indra cleft Vala through,. the guardian of the cattle. Seeking the milk-draught with sweat-shining comrades he stole: the Pani's kine and left him weeping.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रो वलं॒ रक्षिता॒रं दु॒घानां करे॒णेव वि॒ चकर्ता र॒वेण । स्वे॒दाञ्जिभिर् आशि॒रम् इछ॒मानो॒ ऽरोदयत् पणि॒म् आ॒ गा॒ अमुष्णात् ॥६॥

text: He with bright faithful friends, winners of booty, hath rent the milker of the cows asunder. Brihaspati with wild boars strong and mighty sweating with heat hath gained a rich possession.
meaning: स॒ ईं सत्ये॒भिः स॒खिभिः शुच॒द्भिर् गो॒धायसं वि॒ धनसै॒र् अदर्दः । ब्र॒ह्मणस् प॒तिर् वृ॒षभिर् वरा॒हैर् घर्म॒स्वेदेभिर् द्र॒विणं व्य् आ॑नट् ॥७॥

text: They, longing for the kine, with faithful spirit incited with their hymns the Lord of cattle. Brihaspati freed the radiant cows with comrades self-yoked,. averting shame from one another.
meaning: ते॒ सत्ये॒न म॒नसा गो॒पतिं गा॒ इयाना॒स इषणयन्त धीभिः॒ । बृ॒हस्प॒तिर् मिथो॒अवद्यपेभिर् उ॒द् उस्रि॒या असृजत स्वयु॒ग्भिः ॥८॥

text: In our assembly with auspicious praises exalting him who roareth. like a lion. May we in every fight where heroes conquer rejoice in strong. Brihaspati the victor.
meaning: तं॒ वर्ध॒यन्तो मति॒भिः शिवा॒भिः सिंह॒म् इव ना॒नदतं सध॒स्थे । बृ॒हस्प॒तिं वृ॒षणं शू॒रसातौ भ॒रेभरे अ॒नु मदेम जिष्णु॒म् ॥९॥

text: When he had won him strength of every nature and gone to heaven and its most lofty mansions, Men praised Brihaspati the mighty, bringing the light within their mouths from sundry places.
meaning: यदा॒ वा॒जम् अ॒सनद् विश्व॒रूपम् आ॒ द्या॒म् अरुक्षद् उ॒त्तराणि स॒द्म । बृ॒हस्प॒तिं वृ॒षणं वर्ध॒यन्तो ना॒ना स॒न्तो बि॒भ्रतो ज्यो॒तिर् आसा॒ ॥१०॥

text: Fulfil the prayer that begs for vital vigor: aid in your wonted manner e'en the humble. Let all our foes be turned and driven backward. Hear this, O Heaven and Earth, ye all-producers.
meaning: सत्य॒म् आशि॒षं कृणुता वयोधै॒ कीरिं॒ चिद् ध्य् अ॒वथ स्वे॒भिर् ए॒वैः । पश्चा॒ मृ॒धो अ॒प भवन्तु वि॒श्वास् त॒द् रोदसी शृणुतं विश्वमिन्वे॒ ॥११॥

text: Indra with mighty strength hath cleft asunder the head of Arbuda the watery monster, Slain Ahi, and set free the Seven Rivers. O Heaven and Earth, with all the Gods, protect us.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रो मह्ना॒ महतो॒ अर्णव॒स्य वि॒ मूर्धा॒नम् अभिनद् अर्बुद॒स्य । अ॒हन्न् अ॒हिम् अ॒रिणात् सप्त॒ सि॒न्धून् देवै॒र् द्यावापृथिवी प्रा॒वतं नः ॥१२॥

text: Praise, even as he is known, with song Indra the guardian of the kine, The Son of Truth, Lord of the brave.
meaning: अभि॒ प्र॒ गो॒पतिं गिरे॒न्द्रम् अर्च य॒था विदे॒ । सूतुं॒ सत्य॒स्य स॒त्पतिम् ॥१॥

text: Hither his bay steeds have been sent, red steeds are on the sacred grass. Where we in concert sing our songs.
meaning: आ॒ ह॒रयः ससृज्रिरे॒ ऽरुषीर् अ॒धि बर्हि॒षि । य॒त्राभि॒ संन॒वामहे ॥२॥

text: For Indra thunder-armed the kine have yielded mingled milk and meath. What time he found them in the vault.
meaning: इ॒न्द्राय गा॒व आशि॒रं दुदुह्रे॒ वज्रि॒णे म॒धु । य॒त् सीम् उपह्वरे॒ विद॒त् ॥३॥

text: When I and Indra amount on high up to the bright One's place and home, We, having drunk of meath, will reach his seat whose Friends are three-times-seven.
meaning: उ॒द् य॒द् ब्रध्न॒स्य विष्ट॒पं गृह॒म् इ॒न्द्रश् च ग॒न्वहि । म॒ध्वः पीत्वा॒ सचेवहि त्रिः॒ सप्त॒ स॒ख्युः पदे॒ ॥४॥

text: Sing, sing ye forth your songs of praise, ye Priyamedhas, sing your songs: Yea, let young children sing their lauds: as a strong castle praise ye him.
meaning: अ॒र्चत प्रा॒र्चत प्रि॒यमेधासो अ॒र्चत । अ॒र्चन्तु पुत्रका॒ उत॒ पु॒रं न॒ धृष्ण्व् अ॑र्चत ॥५॥

text: Now loudly let the viol sound, the lute send out its voice with might, Shrill be the music of the string. To Indra is the hymn upraised.
meaning: अ॒व स्वराति ग॒र्गरो गोधा॒ प॒रि सनिष्वणत् । पि॒ङ्गा प॒रि चनिष्कदद् इ॒न्द्राय ब्र॒ह्मो॒द्यतम् ॥६॥

text: When hither speed the dappled cows, unflinching, easy to be milked, Seize quickly, as it bursts away, the Soma juice for Indra's drink.
meaning: आ॒ य॒त् प॒तन्त्य् एन्यः॑ सुदु॒घा अ॒नपस्फुरः । अपस्फु॒रं गृभायत सो॒मम् इ॒न्द्राय पा॒तवे ॥७॥

text: Indra hath drunk; Agni hath drunk all Deities have drunk their fill. Here Varuna shall have his home, to whom the floods have sung aloud as mother-kine unto their calves.
meaning: अ॒पाद् इ॒न्द्रो अ॒पाद् अग्नि॒र् वि॒श्वे देवा॒ अमत्सत । व॒रुण इ॒द् इह॒ क्षयत् त॒म् आ॒पो अभ्य् अ॑नूषत वत्सं॒ संशि॒श्वरीर् इव ॥८॥

text: Thou, Varuna, to whom belong the Seven Streams, art a glorious God. The waters flow into thy throat as'twere a pipe with ample mouth.
meaning: सुदेवो॒ असि वरुण य॒स्य ते सप्त॒ सि॒न्धवः । अनुक्ष॒रन्ति काकु॒दं सूर्यं॑ सुषिरा॒म् इव ॥९॥

text: He who hath made the fleet steeds spring, well-harnessed, to the worshipper, He, the swift guide, is that fair form thot loosed the horses near at hand.
meaning: यो॒ व्य॒तींर् अ॒फाणयत् सु॒युक्तां उ॒प दाशु॒षे । तक्वो॒ नेता॒ त॒द् इ॒द् व॒पुर् उपमा॒ यो॒ अ॒मुच्यत ॥१०॥

text: Indra, the very mighty, holds his enemies in utter scorn. He, far away, and yet a child, cleft the cloud smitten by his voice.
meaning: अ॒ती॒द् उ शक्र॒ ओहत इ॒न्द्रो वि॒श्वा अ॒ति द्वि॒षः । भिन॒त् कनी॒न ओदनं॒ पच्य॒मानं परो॒ गिरा॒ ॥११॥

text: He, yet a boy exceeding small, mounted his newly-fashioned car. He for his Mother and his Sire cooked the wild mighty buffalo.
meaning: अर्भको॒ न॒ कुमारको॒ ऽधि तिष्ठन्न् अ॒वं र॒थम् । स॒ पक्षन् महिषं॒ मृगं॒ पित्रे॒ मात्रे॒ विभुक्र॒तुम् ॥१२॥

text: Lord of the Home, with beauteous cheeks, ascend thy chariot wrought of gold. We will attend the heavenly One; the thousand-footed, red of hue, matchless, who blesses where he goes.
meaning: आ॒ तू॒ सुशिप्र दंपते र॒थं तिष्ठा हिरण्य॒यम् । अ॒ध द्युक्षं॒ सचेवहि सह॒स्रपादम् अरुषं॒ स्वस्तिगा॒म् अनेह॒सम् ॥१३॥

text: With reverence they come hitherward to him as to a sovran lord, That they may bring him near for this man's good success, to prosper and bestow his gifts.
meaning: त॒म् घेम् इत्था॒ नमस्वि॒न उ॒प स्वरा॒जम् आसते । अ॒र्थं चिद् अस्य सु॒धितं य॒द् ए॒तवे आवर्त॒यन्ति दाव॒ने ॥१४॥

text: The Priyamedhas have observed the offering of the men of old, Of ancient custom, while they strewed the sacred grass and spread their sacrificial food.
meaning: अ॒नु प्रत्न॒स्यौ॒कसः प्रिय॒मेधास एषाम् । पू॒र्वाम् अ॒नु प्र॒यतिं वृक्त॒बर्हिषो हित॒प्रयस आशत ॥१५॥

text: He who as sovran Lord of men moves with his chariots unrestrained, The Vritra-slayer, queller of all fighting hosts, preeminent, is praised in song.
meaning: यो॒ रा॒जा चर्षणीनां॒ या॒ता र॒थेभिर् अ॒ध्रिगुः । वि॒श्वासां तरुता॒ पृ॒तनानां ज्ये॒ष्ठो यो॒ वृत्रहा॒ गृणे॒ ॥१६॥

text: Honour that Indra, Puruhanman! for his aid, in whose sustain- ing hand of old. The splendid bolt of thunder was deposited, as the great Sun was set in heaven.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रं तं॒ शुम्भ पुरुहन्मन्न् अ॒वसे य॒स्य द्विता॒ विधर्त॒रि । ह॒स्ताय व॒ज्रः प्र॒ति धायि दर्शतो॒ महो॒ दिवे॒ न॒ सू॒र्यः ॥१७॥

text: No one by deed attains to him who works and strengthens evermore: No, not by sacrifice, to Indra praised of all, resistless, daring, bold in might;
meaning: न॒किष् टं॒ क॒र्मणा नशद् य॒श् चका॒र सदा॒वृधम् । इ॒न्द्रं न॒ यज्ञै॒र् विश्व॒गूर्तम् ऋ॒भ्वसम् अ॒धृष्टं धृष्ण्वो॑जसम् ॥१८॥

text: The potent Conqueror, invincible in war, him at whose birth the mighty ones, The kine who spread afar, sent their loud voices out, heavens, earths sent their loud voices out.
meaning: अ॒षाल्हम् उग्रं॒ पृ॒तनासु सासहिं॒ य॒स्मिन् मही॒र् उरुज्र॒यः । सं॒ धेन॒वो जा॒यमाने अनोनवुर् द्या॒वः क्षा॒मो अनोनवुः ॥१९॥

text: O Indra, if a hundred heavens and if a hundred earths were thine No, not a thousand suns could match thee at thy birth, not both the worlds, O Thunderer.
meaning: य॒द् द्या॒व इन्द्र ते शतं॒ शतं॒ भू॒मीर् उत॒ स्युः॒ । न॒ त्वा वज्रिन्त् सह॒स्रं सू॒र्या अ॒नु न॒ जात॒म् अष्ट रो॒दसी ॥२०॥

text: Thou, Hero, hast performed thy hero deeds with might, yea, all with strength, O Strongest One. Maghavan, help us to a stable full of kine, O Thunderer, with wondrous aids.
meaning: आ॒ पप्राथ महिना॒ वृ॒ष्ण्या वृषन् वि॒श्वा शविष्ठ श॒वसा । अस्मां॒ अव मघवन् गो॒मति व्रजे॒ व॒ज्रिं चित्रा॒भिर् ऊति॒भिः ॥२१॥

text: May our hymns give thee great delight. Display thy bounty, Thunderer. Drive off the enemies of prayer.
meaning: उ॒त् त्वा मन्दन्तु स्तो॒माः कृणुष्व॒ रा॒धो अद्रिवः । अ॒व ब्रह्मद्वि॒षो जहि ॥१॥

text: Crush with thy foot the niggard churls who bring no gifts. Might art thou: There is not one to equal thee.
meaning: पदा॒ पणीं॒र् अराध॒सो नि॒ बाधस्व महां॒ असि । नहि॒ त्वा क॒श् चन॒ प्र॒ति ॥२॥

text: Thou art the Lord of Soma pressed, Soma unpressed is also thine, Thou art the Sovran of the folk.
meaning: त्व॒म् ईशिषे सुता॒नाम् इ॒न्द्र त्व॒म् अ॒सुतानाम् । त्वं॒ रा॒जा ज॒नानाम् ॥३॥

text: Swaying about the active Ones came nigh to Indra at his birth, And shared his great heroic might.
meaning: ईङ्ख॒यन्तीर् अपस्यु॒व इ॒न्द्रं जात॒म् उ॒पासते । भेजाना॒सः सुवी॒र्यम् ॥४॥

text: Based upon strength and victory and power, O Indra is thy birth. Thou, Mighty One, art strong indeed.
meaning: त्व॒म् इन्द्र ब॒लाद् अ॒धि स॒हसो जात॒ ओ॒जसः । त्वं॒ वृषन् वृ॒षे॒द् असि ॥५॥

text: Thou art the Vritra-slayer, thou, Indra, hast spread the firmament: Thou hast with might upheld the heavens.
meaning: त्व॒म् इन्द्रासि वृत्रहा॒ व्य् अ॑न्त॒रिक्षम् अ॒तिरः । उ॒द् द्या॒म् अस्तभ्ना ओ॒जसा ॥६॥

text: Thou, Indra, bearest in thine arms the lightning that accords with thee, Whetting thy thunderbolt with might.
meaning: त्व॒म् इन्द्र सजो॒षसम् अर्कं॒ बिभर्षि बाह्वोः॒ । व॒ज्रं शि॒शान ओ॒जसा ॥७॥

text: Thou, Indra, art pre-eminent over all creatures in thy strength: Thou hast pervaded every place.
meaning: त्व॒म् इन्द्राभिभु॒र् असि वि॒श्वा जाता॒न्य् ओ॒जसा । स॒ वि॒श्वा भु॒व आ॒भवः ॥८॥

text: May Sovran Indra come to the carousal, he who by holy Law is strong and active. The overcomer of all conquering forces with his great bull-like power that hath no limit.
meaning: आ॒ यात्व् इ॒न्द्रः स्व॒पतिर् म॒दाय यो॒ ध॒र्मणा तूतुजान॒स् तु॒विष्मान् । प्रत्वक्षाणो॒ अ॒ति वि॒श्वा स॒हांस्य् अपारे॒ण महता॒ वृ॒ष्ण्येन ॥१॥

text: Firm-seated is thy car, thy steeds are docile: thy hand, O King, holds, firmly grasped, the thunder. On thy fair path, O Lord of men, come quickly: we will increase thy power when thou hast drunken.
meaning: सुष्ठा॒मा र॒थः सुय॒मा ह॒री ते मिम्य॒क्ष व॒ज्रो नृ॒पते ग॒भस्तौ । शी॒भं राजन् सुप॒था॒ याह्य् अर्वा॒ङ् व॒र्धाम ते पपु॒सो वृ॒ष्ण्यानि ॥२॥

text: Let strong and mighty steeds who bear this mighty Indra, the Lord of men, whose arm wields thunder, Bring unto us, as shares of our banquet, the Bull of conquering might, of real vigour.
meaning: ए॒न्द्रवा॒हो नृप॒तिं व॒ज्रबाहुम् उग्र॒म् उग्रा॒सस् तविषा॒स एनम् । प्र॒त्वक्षसं वृषभं॒ सत्य॒शुष्मम् ए॒म् अस्मत्रा॒ सधमा॒दो वहन्तु ॥३॥

text: So like a bull thou rushest to the Lord who loves the trough, the Sage, the prop of vigour, in the vat. Prepare thine energies, collect them in thyself: be for our profit as the Master of the wise.
meaning: एवा॒ प॒तिं द्रोणसा॒चं स॒चेतसम् ऊर्ज॒ स्कम्भं॒ धरु॒ण आ॒ वृषायसे । ओ॒जः कृष्व सं॒ गृभाय त्वे॒ अ॒प्य् अ॒सो य॒था केनिपा॒नाम् इनो॒ वृधे॒ ॥४॥

text: May precious treasures come to us,— so will I pray. Come to the votary's gift offered with beauteous laud. Thou art the Lord, as such sit on this holy grass: thy vessels are inviolate as Law commands.
meaning: ग॒मन्न् अस्मे॒ व॒सून्य् आ॒ हि॒ शं॒सिषं स्वाशि॒षं भ॒रम् आ॒ याहि सोमि॒नः । त्व॒म् ईशिषे सा॒स्मि॒न्न् आ॒ सत्सि बर्हि॒ष्य् अनाधृष्या॒ त॒व पा॒त्राणि ध॒र्मणा ॥५॥

text: Far went our earliest invocations of the Gods, and won us glories that can never be surpassed. They who could not ascend the ship of sacrifice sink down in desolation, trembling with alarm.
meaning: पृ॒थक् प्रा॒यन् प्रथमा॒ देव॒हूतयो॒ ऽकृण्वत श्रवस्या॑नि दुष्ट॒रा । न॒ ये॒ शेकु॒र् यज्ञि॒यां ना॒वम् आरु॒हम् इर्मै॒व॒ ते॒ न्य् अ॑विशन्त के॒पयः ॥६॥

text: So be the others, evil-hearted, far away, whose horses difficult to harness have been yoked. Here in advance man stand anear to offer gifts, by whom full many a work that brings reward is done.
meaning: एवै॒वा॒पाग् अ॒परे सन्तु दूध्यो॒ ऽश्वा ये॒षां दुर्यु॒ग आयुयुज्रे॒ । इत्था॒ ये॒ प्रा॒ग् उ॒परे सन्ति दाव॒ने पुरू॒णि य॒त्र वयु॒नानि भो॒जना ॥७॥

text: He firmly fixed the plains and mountains as they shook. Dyaus thundered forth and made the air's mid-region quake. He stays apart the two confronting bowls; he sings lauds in the potent Soma's joy when he hath drunk.
meaning: गिरीं॒र् अ॒ज्रान् रे॒जमानां अधारयद् द्यौः॒ क्रन्दद् अन्त॒रिक्षाणि कोपयत् । समीचीने॒ धिष॒णे वि॒ ष्कभायति वृ॒ष्णः पीत्वा॒ म॒द उक्था॒नि शंसति ॥८॥

text: I bear this deftly-fashioned goad of thine wherewith thou, Maghavan, shalt break the strikers with the hoof. At the libation mayst thou be well satisfied. Partake the juice, partake the banquet, Bounteous Lord.
meaning: इमं॒ बिभर्मि सु॒कृतं ते अङ्कुशं॒ ये॒नारुजा॒सि मघवं छफारु॒जः । अस्मि॒न्त् सु॒ ते स॒वने अस्त्व् ओक्त्यं॑ सुत॒ इष्टौ॒ मघवन् बोध्य् आ॒भगः ॥९॥

text: O Much-invoked, may we subdue all famine and evil want with store of grain and cattle. May we allied, as first in rank, with princes, obtain possessions by our own exertions.
meaning: गो॒भिष् टरेमा॒मतिं दुरे॒वां य॒वेन क्षु॒धं पुरुहूत वि॒श्वाम् । वयं॒ रा॒जभिः प्रथमा॒ ध॒नान्य् अस्मा॒केन वृज॒नेना जयेम ॥१०॥

text: Brihaspati protect us from the rearward, and from above, and from below, from sinners! May Indra from the front and from the centre, as friend to friends, vouchsafe us room and freedom.
meaning: बृ॒हस्प॒तिर् नः प॒रि पातु पश्चा॒द् उतो॒त्तरस्माद् अ॒धराद् अघयोः॒ । इ॒न्द्रः पुर॒स्ताद् उत॒ मध्यतो॒ नः स॒खा स॒खिभ्यो व॒रिवः कृणोतु ॥११॥

text: From the three jars the Great and Strong hath drunk drink blent with meal. With Vishnu hath he quaffed the flowing Soma juice, all that he would. That hath so heightened him the Great, the Vast, to do his mighty work. So may the God attend the God, true Indu Indra who is true.
meaning: त्रि॒कद्रुकेषु महिषो॒ य॒वाशिरं तुविशु॒ष्मस् तृप॒त् सो॒मम् अपिबद् वि॒ष्णुना सुतं॒ यथा॒वशत् । स॒ ईं ममाद म॒हि क॒र्म क॒र्तवे महा॒म् उरुं॒ सै॒नं सश्चद् देवो॒ देवं॒ सत्य॒म् इ॒न्द्रं सत्य॒ इ॒न्दुः ॥१॥

text: Sing strength to Indra that shall set his chariot in the foremost place. Giver of room in closest fight, slayer of foes in shock of war, be thou our great encourager. Let the weak bowstrings break upon the bows of feeble enemies.
meaning: प्रो॒ ष्व् अ॑स्मै पुरोरथ॒म् इ॒न्द्राय शूष॒म् अर्चत । अभी॒के चिद् उ लोककृ॒त् संगे॒ सम॒त्सु वृत्रहा॒स्मा॒कं

text: Thou didst destroy the Dragon: thou sentest the rivers down to earth. Foeless, O Indra, wast thou born. Thou tendest well each choicest thing. Therefore we draw us close to thee. Let the weak bowstrings break upon the bows of feeble enemies.
meaning: त्वं॒ सि॒न्धूंर् अ॒वासृजो ऽधरा॒चो अ॒हन्न् अ॒हिम् । अशत्रु॒र् इन्द्र जज्ञिषे वि॒श्वं पुष्यसि वा॒र्यं तं॒ त्वा प॒रि

text: Destroyed be all malignities and all our enemy's designs. Thy bolt thou castest at the foe, O Indra, who would smite us dead: thy liberal bounty gives us wealth. Let the weak bow- strings break upon the bows of feeble enemies.
meaning: वि॒ षु॒ वि॒श्वा अ॒रातयो ऽर्यो॒ नशन्त नो धि॒यः । अ॒स्तासि श॒त्रवे वधं॒ यो॒ न इन्द्र जि॒घांसति या॒ ते राति॒र् ददि॒र् व॒सु । न॒भन्ताम् अन्यके॒षां ज्यका॒ अ॒धि ध॒न्वसु ॥४॥

text: Taste this strong draught that gives thee vital vigour: with all thy chariot here unyoke thy coursers. Let not those other sacrificers stay thee, Indra: these juices shed for thee are ready.
meaning: तीव्र॒स्याभि॒वयसो अस्य॒ पाहि सर्वरथा॒ वि॒ ह॒री इह॒ मुञ्च । इ॒न्द्र मा॒ त्वा य॒जमानासो अन्ये॒ नि॒ रीरमन् तु॒भ्यम् इमे॒ सुता॒सः ॥१॥

text: Thine is the juice effused, thine are the juices yet to be pressed: our resonant songs invite thee. O Indra, pleased to-day with this libation, come, thou who knowest all, and drink the Soma.
meaning: तु॒भ्यं सुता॒स् तु॒भ्यम् उ सो॒त्वासस् त्वां॒ गि॒रः श्वा॒त्र्या आ॒ ह्वयन्ति । इ॒न्द्रेद॒म् अद्य॒ स॒वनं जुषाणो॒ वि॒श्वस्य विद्वां॒ इह॒ पाहि सो॒मम् ॥२॥

text: Whoso, devoted to the God, effuses Soma for him with yearning heart and spirit, Never doth Indra give away his cattle: for him he makes the lovely Soma famous.
meaning: य॒ उशता॒ म॒नसा सो॒मम् अस्मै सर्वहृदा॒ देव॒कामः सुनो॒ति । न॒ गा॒ इ॒न्द्रस् त॒स्य प॒रा ददाति प्रशस्त॒म् इ॒च् चा॒रुम् अस्मै कृणोति ॥३॥

text: He looks with loving favour on the mortal who, like a rich man, pours for him the Soma. Maghavan in his bended arm supports him: he slays, unasked, the men who hate devotion.
meaning: अ॒नुस्पष्टो भवत्य् एषो॒ अस्य यो॒ अस्मै रेवा॒न् न॒ सुनो॒ति सो॒मम् । नि॒र् अरत्नौ॒ मघ॒वा तं॒ दधाति ब्रह्मद्वि॒षो हन्त्य् अ॒नानुदिष्टः ॥४॥

text: We call on thee to come to us, desirous of booty, and of cattle, and of horses. For thy new love and favour are we present: let us invoke thee, Indra, as our welfare.
meaning: अश्वाय॒न्तो गव्य॒न्तो वाज॒यन्तो ह॒वामहे त्वो॒पगन्तवा॒ उ । आभू॒षन्तस् ते सुमतौ॒ न॒वायां वय॒म् इन्द्र त्वा शुनं॒ हुवेम ॥५॥

text: For life I set thee free by this oblation from the unknown decline and from consumption; Or, if the grasping demon have possessed him, free him from her, O Indra, thou and Agni.
meaning: मुञ्चा॒मि त्वा हवि॒षा जी॒वनाय क॒म् अज्ञातयक्ष्मा॒द् उत॒ राजयक्ष्मा॒त् । ग्रा॒हिर् जग्रा॒ह य॒द्य् एत॒द् त॒स्या इन्द्राग्नी प्र॒ मुमुक्तम् एनम् ॥६॥

text: Be his days ended, be he how departed, be he brought very near to death already, Out of Destruction's lap again I bring him, save him for life to last a hundred autumns.
meaning: य॒दि क्षिता॒युर् य॒दि वा प॒रेतो य॒दि मृत्यो॒र् अन्तिकं॒ नी॒त एव॒ । त॒म् आ॒ हरामि नि॒रृतेर् उप॒स्थाद् अ॒स्पार्शम् एनं शत॒शारदाय ॥७॥

text: With thousand-eyed oblation, hundred-autumned, bringing a hundred lives, have 1 restored him. That Indra for a hundred years may lead him safe to the farther shore of all misfortune.
meaning: सहस्राक्षे॒ण शत॒वीर्येण शता॒युषा हवि॒षा॒हार्षम् एनम् । इ॒न्द्रो य॒थैनं शर॒दो न॒यात्य् अ॒ति वि॒श्वस्य दुरित॒स्य पार॒म् ॥८॥

text: Live waxing in thy strength a hundred autumns, live through a hundred springs, a hundred winters. Through hundred-lived oblation Indra, Agni, Brihaspati, Savitar yield him for a hundred!
meaning: शतं॒ जीव शर॒दो व॒र्धमानः शतं॒ हेमन्ता॒न् छत॒म् उ वसन्ता॒न् । शतं॒ त इ॒न्द्रो अग्निः॒ सविता॒ बृ॒हस्प॒तिः शता॒युषा हवि॒षा॒हार्षम् एनम् ॥९॥

text: So have I found and rescued thee: thou hast returned with youth renewed. Whole in thy members! I have found whole sight and all thy life for thee.
meaning: आ॒हार्षम् अ॒विदं त्वा पु॒नर् आ॒गाः पु॒नर्णवः । स॒र्वाङ्ग स॒र्वं ते च॒क्षुः स॒र्वम् आ॒युश् च ते ऽविदम् ॥१०॥

text: May Agni yielding to our prayer, the Rakshas-killer, drive away. The malady of evil name that hath beset thy labouring womb.
meaning: ब्र॒ह्मणाग्निः॒ सम्विदानो॒ रक्षोहा॒ बाधताम् इतः॒ । अ॒मीवा य॒स् ते ग॒र्भं दुर्णा॒मा यो॒निम् आश॒ये ॥११॥

text: Agni, concurring in the prayer, drive off the eater of thy flesh, The malady of evil name that hath attacked thy babe and womb.
meaning: य॒स् ते ग॒र्भम् अ॒मीवा दुर्णा॒मा यो॒निम् आश॒ये । अग्नि॒ष् टं॒ ब्र॒ह्मणा सह॒ नि॒ष् क्रव्या॒दम् अनीनशत् ॥१२॥

text: That which destroys the sinking germ, the settled, moving embryo, That which would kill the babe at birth, even this will we drive far away.
meaning: य॒स् ते ह॒न्ति पत॒यन्तं निषत्स्नुं॒ यः॒ सरीसृप॒म् । जातं॒ य॒स् ते जि॒घांसति त॒म् इतो॒ नाशयामसि ॥१३॥

text: That which divides thy legs that it may lie between the married pair, That penetrates and licks thy side, even this will we exterminate.
meaning: य॒स् त ऊरू॒ विह॒रत्य् अन्तरा॒ द॒म्पती श॒ये । यो॒निं यो॒ अन्त॒र् आरे॒ल्हि त॒म् इतो॒ नाशयामसि ॥१४॥

text: What rests by thee in borrowed form of brother, lover, or of lord, And would destroyed the progeny,—even this will we exter- minate.
meaning: य॒स् त्वा भ्रा॒ता प॒तिर् भूत्वा॒ जारो॒ भूत्वा॒ निप॒द्यते । प्रजां॒ य॒स् ते जि॒घांसति त॒म् इतो॒ नाशयामसि ॥१५॥

text: That which through sleep or darkness hath deceived thee and lies down by thee, And will destroy thy progeny,—even this will we exterminate.
meaning: य॒स् त्वा स्व॒प्नेन त॒मसा मोहयित्वा॒ निप॒द्यते । प्रजां॒ य॒स् ते जि॒घांसति त॒म् इतो॒ नाशयामसि ॥१६॥

text: From both thy nostrils, from thine eyes, from both thine ears and from thy chin, Forth from thy head and brain and tongue I drive thy malady away.
meaning: अक्षी॒भ्यां ते ना॒सिकाभ्यां क॒र्णाभ्यां छु॒बुकाद् अ॒धि । य॒क्ष्मं शी॒र्षण्यं॑ मस्ति॒ष्काज् जिह्वा॒या वि॒ वृहामि ते ॥१७॥

text: From the neck-tendons and the neck, from the breast-bones and from the spine, From shoulders, upper, lower arms, I drive thy malady away.
meaning: ग्रीवा॒भ्यस् त उष्णि॒हाभ्यः की॒कसाभ्यो अनूक्या॑त् । य॒क्ष्मं दोषण्य॑म् अं॒साभ्यां बाहु॒भ्यां वि॒ वृहामि ते ॥१८॥

text: From viscera and all within, forth from the rectum, from the heart, From kidneys, liver and from spleen, I drive thy malady away.
meaning: हृ॒दयात् ते प॒रि क्लोम्नो॒ ह॒लीक्ष्णात् पार्श्वा॒भ्याम् । य॒क्ष्मं म॒तस्नाभ्यां प्लीह्नो॒ यक्न॒स् ते वि॒ वृहामसि ॥१९॥

text: From thighs, from knee-caps, and from heels, and from the forepart of the feet, From hips, from stomach, and from groin, I drive thy malady away.
meaning: आन्त्रे॒भ्यस् ते गु॒दाभ्यो वनिष्ठो॒र् उद॒राद् अ॒धि । य॒क्ष्मं कुक्षि॒भ्यां प्लाशे॒र् ना॒भ्या वि॒ वृहामि ते ॥२०॥

text: From what is voided from within, and from thy hair, and from thy nails, From all thyself, from top to toe, I drive thy malady away.
meaning: ऊरु॒भ्यां ते अष्ठीव॒द्भ्यां पा॒र्ष्णिभ्यां प्र॒पदाभ्याम् । य॒क्ष्मं भसद्यं॑ श्रो॒णिभ्यां भा॒सदं भां॒ससो वि॒ वृहामि ते ॥२१॥

text: From every member, every hair, disease that comes in every joint, From all thyself, from top to toe, I drive thy malady away.
meaning: मे॒हनाद् वनंक॒रणाल् लो॒मभ्यस् ते नखे॒भ्यः । य॒क्ष्मं स॒र्वस्माद् आत्म॒नस् त॒म् इदं॒ वि॒ वृहामि ते ॥२२॥

text: अस्थि॒भ्यस् ते मज्ज॒भ्यः स्ना॒वभ्यो धम॒निभ्यः । य॒क्ष्मं पाणि॒भ्याम् अङ्गु॒लिभ्यो नखे॒भ्यो वि॒ वृहामि ते ॥२२॥
Avaunt, thou Master of the Mind, I Depart and vanish far away. Look on Destruction far from us. The live man's mind is manifold.
meaning: अ॒ङ्गेअङ्गे लो॒म्निलोम्नि य॒स् ते प॒र्वणिपर्वणि । य॒क्षं त्वचस्यं॑ ते वयं॒ कश्य॒पस्य वीबर्हे॒ण वि॒ष्वञ्चं वि॒ वृहामसि ॥२३॥

text: अ॒पेहि मनसस् पते॒ ऽप काम पर॒श् चर । परो॒ नि॒रृत्या आ॒ चक्ष्व बहुधा॒ जी॒वतो म॒नः ॥२४॥
Here verily yesterday we let the Thunder-wielder drink his fill. So in like manner, offer him the juice to day. Now range you. by the Glorious One.
meaning: वय॒म् एनम् इदा॒ ह्यो॒पीपेमेह॒ वज्रि॒णम् । त॒स्मा उ अद्य॒ समना॒ सुतं॒ भरा॒ नूनं॒ भूषत श्रुते॒ ॥१॥

text: Even the wolf, the savage beast that rends the sheep, follows the path of his decrees. So, India, graciously accepting this our praise, with wondrous. thought come forth to us.
meaning: वृ॒कश् चिद् अस्य वारण॒ उराम॒थिर् आ॒ वयु॒नेषु भूषति । से॒मं॒ नः स्तो॒मं जुजुषाण॒ आ॒ गही॒न्द्र प्र॒ चित्र॒या धिया॒ ॥२॥

text: What manly deed of vigour now remains that Indra hath not done? Who hath not heard his glorious title and his fame, the Vritra- slayer from his birth?
meaning: क॒द् उ न्व् अ॑स्या॒कृतम् इ॒न्द्रस्यास्ति पौं॒स्यम् । के॒नो नु॒ कं श्रो॒मतेन न॒ शुश्रुवे जनु॒षः प॒रि वृत्रहा॒ ॥३॥

text: That we may win us wealth and spoil we poets verily call on thee. In war men call on thee, Indra, the hero's Lord, in the steed's, race-course call on thee.
meaning: त्वा॒म् इ॒द् धि॒ ह॒वामहे साता॒ वा॒जस्य कार॒वः । त्वां॒ वृत्रे॒ष्व् इन्द्र स॒त्पतिं न॒रस् त्वां का॒ष्ठास्व् अ॒र्वतः ॥१॥

text: As such, O Wonderful whose hand holds thunder, praised as mighty, Caster of the Stone. Pour on us boldly, Indra, kie and chariot-steeds, ever to be the conqueror's strength.
meaning: स॒ त्वं॒ नश् चित्र वज्रहस्त धृष्णुया॒ मह॒ स्तवानो॒ अद्रिवः । गा॒म् अ॒श्वं रथ्य॑म् इन्द्र सं॒ किर सत्रा॒ वा॒जं न॒ जिग्यु॒षे ॥२॥

text: Men with their lauds are urging thee, Indra, to drink the Soma first. The Ribhus in accord have lifted up their voice and Rudras. sung thee as the First.
meaning: अभि॒ त्वा पूर्व॒पीतय इ॒न्द्र स्तो॒मेभिर् आय॒वः । समीचीना॒स ऋभ॒वः स॒म् अस्वरन् रुद्रा॒ गृणन्त पू॒र्व्यम् ॥१॥

text: Indra increased his manly strength at sacrifice, in the wild rapture of this juice; And living men to-day, even as of old, sing forth their praises to his majesty.
meaning: अस्ये॒द् इ॒न्द्रो वावृधे वृ॒ष्ण्यं श॒वो म॒दे सुत॒स्य वि॒ष्णवि । अद्या॒ त॒म् अस्य महिमा॒नम् आय॒वो॒ ऽनु ष्टुवन्ति पूर्व॒था ॥२॥

text: Now have we, Indra, Friend of Song, sent our great wishes forth to thee. Coming like floods that follow floods.
meaning: अ॒धा ही॒न्द्र गिर्वण उ॒प त्वा का॒मान् महः॒ ससृज्म॒हे । उदे॒व य॒न्त उद॒भिः ॥१॥

text: As rivers swell the ocean, so, Hero, our prayers increase thy might, Though of thyself, O Thunderer, waxing day by day.
meaning: वा॒र् ण॒ त्वा यव्या॒भिर् व॒र्धन्ति शूर ब्र॒ह्माणि । वावृध्वां॒सं चिद् अद्रिवो दिवे॒दिवे ॥२॥

text: With holy song they bind to the broad wide-yoked car the bay steeds of the rapid God, Bearers of India, yoked by prayer.
meaning: युञ्ज॒न्ति ह॒री इषिर॒स्य गा॒थयोरौ॒ र॒थ उरु॒युगे । इन्द्रवा॒हा वचोयु॒जा ॥३॥

text: Agni we choose, the messenger, the herald, master of all wealth,. Well skilled in this our sacrifice.
meaning: अग्निं॒ दूतं॒ वृणीमहे हो॒तारं विश्व॒वेदसम् । अस्य॒ यज्ञ॒स्य सुक्र॒तुम् ॥१॥

text: With calls they ever invocate Agni, Agni, Lord of the House, Oblation-bearer, much-beloved.
meaning: अग्नि॒मग्निं ह॒वीमभिः स॒दा हवन्त विश्प॒तिम् । हव्यवा॒हं पुरुप्रिय॒म् ॥२॥

text: Bring the Gods hither, Agni, born for him who strews the sacred grass. Thou art our herald, meet for praise.
meaning: अ॒ग्ने देवां॒ इहा॒ वह जज्ञानो॒ वृक्त॒बर्हिषे । अ॒सि हो॒ता न ई॒ड्यः ॥३॥

text: Meet to be lauded and adored, showing in beauty through the= dark, Agni the Bull is kindled well,
meaning: ईले॒न्यो नमस्य॑स् तिर॒स् त॒मांसि दर्शतः॒ । स॒म् अग्नि॒र् इध्यते वृ॒षा ॥१॥

text: Agni is kindled as a Bull, like a horse bearer of the Gods; Men with oblations worship him.
meaning: वृ॒षो अग्निः॒ स॒म् इध्यते॒ ऽश्वो न॒ देववा॒हनः । तं॒ हवि॒ष्मन्तः ईलते ॥२॥

text: Thee will we kindle as a Bull, we who are bulls ourselves, O Bull, Thee, Agni, shining mightily.
meaning: वृ॒षणं त्वा वयं॒ वृषन् वृ॒षणः स॒म् इधीमहि । अ॒ग्ने दी॒द्यतं बृह॒त् ॥३॥

text: Solicit with your hymns, for aid, Agni the God with piercing flame, For riches famous Agni, Purmilha and ye men, Agni to light our dwelling well.
meaning: अग्नि॒म् ईलिष्वा॒वसे गा॒थाभिः शीर॒शोचिषम् । अग्निं॒ राये॒ पुरुमील्ह श्रुतं॒ न॒रो ऽग्निं॒ सुदीत॒ये छर्दिः॒ ॥१॥

text: Agni, come hither with thy fires: we choose thee as our Hotai- priest. Let the extended ladle full of oil balm thee, best priest, to sit on sacred grass.
meaning: अ॒ग्न आ॒ याह्य् अग्नि॒भिर् हो॒तारं त्वा वृणीमहे । आ॒ त्वा॒म् अनक्तु प्र॒यता हवि॒ष्मती य॒जिष्ठं बर्हि॒र् आस॒दे ॥२॥

text: For unto thee, O Angiras, O Son of Strength, move ladles in the sacrifice, To Agni, Child of Force, whose locks drop oil, we seek, fore- most in sacrificial rites.
meaning: अ॒छ हि॒ त्वा सहसः सूनो अङ्गिरः स्रु॒चश् च॒रन्त्य् अध्वरे॒ । ऊर्जो॒ न॒पातं घृत॒केशम् ईमहे ऽग्निं॒ यज्ञे॒षु पूर्व्य॒म् ॥३॥

text: May these my songs of praise exalt thee, Lord who hast abun- dant wealth. Men skilled in holy hymns, bright with the hues of fire, have sung them with their lauds to thee.
meaning: इमा॒ उ त्वा पुरूवसो गि॒रो वर्धन्तु या॒ म॒म । पावक॒वर्णाः शु॒चयो विपश्चि॒तो ऽभि॒ स्तो॒मैर् अनूषत ॥१॥

text: He with his might enhanced by Rishis thousand-fold, hath like an ocean spread himself. His majesty is praised as true at solemn rites, his power where holy singers rule
meaning: अयं॒ सह॒स्रम् ऋ॒षिभिः स॒हस्कृतः समुद्र॒ इव पप्रथे । सत्यः॒ सो॒ अस्य महिमा॒ गृने श॒वो यज्ञे॒षु विप्ररा॒ज्ये ॥२॥

text: May Indra, who in every fight must be invoked, be near to us. May the most mighty Vritra-slayer, meet for praise, come to libations and to hymns.
meaning: आ॒ नो वि॒श्वासु ह॒व्य इ॒न्द्रः सम॒त्सु भूषतु । उ॒प ब्र॒ह्माणि स॒वनानि वृत्रहा॒ परमज्या॒ ऋ॒चीषमः ॥३॥

text: Thou art the best of all in sending bounteous gifts, true art thou,. lordly in thine act. We claim alliance with the very Glorious One, yea, with the- mighty Son of Strength.
meaning: त्वं॒ दाता॒ प्रथमो॒ रा॒घसाम् अस्य् अ॒सि सत्य॒ ईशानकृ॒त् । तुविद्युम्न॒स्य यु॒ज्या वृणीमहे पुत्र॒स्य श॒वसो महः॒ ॥४॥

text: Thou in the battles, Indra, art subduer of all hostile bands. Father art thou, all-conquering, cancelling the curse, thou victor of the vanquisher.
meaning: त्व॒म् इन्द्र प्र॒तूर्तिष्व् अभि॒ वि॒श्वा असि स्पृ॒धः । अशस्तिहा॒ जनिता॒ विश्वतू॒र् असि त्वं॒ तूर्य तरुष्यतः॒ ॥१॥

text: The earth, and heaven cling close to thy victorious might, as sire and mother to their child. When thou attackest Vritra all the hostile bands shrink and faint, Indra at thy wrath.
meaning: अ॒नु ते शु॒ष्मं तुर॒यन्तम् ईयतुः क्षोणी॒ शि॒शुं न॒ मात॒रा । वि॒श्वास् ते स्पृ॒धः श्नथयन्त मन्य॒वे वृत्रं॒ य॒द् इन्द्र तू॒र्वसि ॥२॥

text: Bring to your aid the Eternal One, who shoots and none may shoot at him, Inciter, swift, victorious, best of charioteers, Tugrya's unvan- quished strengthener;
meaning: इत॒ ऊती॒ वो अज॒रं प्रहेता॒रम् अ॒प्रहितम् । आशुं॒ जे॒तारं हे॒तारं रथी॒तमम् अ॒तूर्तं तुग्र्यावृ॒धम् ॥३॥

text: यो॒ रा॒जा चर्षणीनां॒ या॒ता र॒थेभिर् अ॒ध्रिगुः । वि॒श्वासां तरुता॒ पृ॒तनानां ज्ये॒ष्ठो यो॒ वृत्रहा॒ गृणे॒ ॥४॥
इ॒न्द्रं तं॒ शुम्भ पुरुहन्मन्न् अ॒वसे य॒स्य द्विता॒ विधर्त॒रि । ह॒स्ताय व॒ज्रः प्र॒ति धायि दर्शतो॒ महो॒ दिवे॒ न॒ सू॒र्यः ॥५॥
That lofty energy of thine, thy strength and thine intelligence, Thy thunderbolt for which we long, our wish makes keen.
meaning: त॒व त्य॒द् इन्द्रियं॒ बृह॒त् त॒व शु॒ष्मम् उत॒ क्र॒तुम् । व॒ज्रं शिशाति धिष॒णा व॒रेण्यम् ॥१॥

text: O Indra, heaven and earth augment thy manly power and thy renown, The waters and the mountains stir and urge thee on.
meaning: त॒व द्यौ॒र् इन्द्र पौं॒स्यं पृथिवी॒ वर्धति श्र॒वः । त्वा॒म् आ॒पः प॒र्वतासश् च हिन्विरे ॥२॥

text: Vishnu, the lofty Ruling Power, Varuna, Mitra sing thy praise: In thee the Maruts' company hath great delight.
meaning: त्वां॒ वि॒ष्णुर् बृह॒न् क्ष॒यो मित्रो॒ गृणाति व॒रुणः । त्वां॒ श॒र्धो मदत्य् अ॒नु मा॒रुतम् ॥३॥

text: Before his hot displeasure all the peoples, all the men bow down, As rivers bend them to the sea.
meaning: स॒म् अस्य मन्य॒वे वि॒शो वि॒श्वा नमन्त कुष्ट॒यः । समुद्रा॒येव सि॒न्धवः ॥१॥

text: This power of his shone brightly forth when Indra brought to- gether like A skin the worlds of earth and heaven.
meaning: ओ॒जस् त॒द् अस्य तित्विष उभे॒ य॒त् सम॒वर्तयत् । इ॒न्द्रश् च॒र्मेव रो॒दसी ॥२॥

text: The fiercely-moving Vritra's head he severed with his thunder- bolt, His hundred-knotted thunderbolt.
meaning: वि॒ चिद् वृत्र॒स्य दो॒धतो व॒ज्रेण शत॒पर्वणा । शि॒रो बिभेद् वृष्णि॒ना ॥३॥

text: In all the worlds That was the best and highest whence sprang the mighty God, of splendid valour. As soon as born he overcomes his foemen, he in whom all who lend him aid are joyful.
meaning: त॒द् इ॒द् आस भु॒वनेषु ज्ये॒ष्ठं य॒तो जज्ञ॒ उग्र॒स् त्वेष॒नृम्णः । सद्यो॒ जज्ञानो॒ नि॒ रिणाति श॒त्रून् अ॒नु य॒द् एनं म॒दन्ति वि॒श्व ऊ॒माः ॥४॥

text: Grown mighty in his strength, with ample vigour, he as a foe strikes fear into the Dāsa, Eager to win the breathing and the breathless. All sang thy praise at banquet and oblation.
meaning: वावृधानः॒ श॒वसा भू॒र्योजाः श॒त्रुर् दासा॒य भिय॒सं दधाति । अ॒व्यनच् च व्यन॒च् च स॒स्नि सं॒ ते नवन्त प्र॒भृता म॒देषु ॥५॥

text: All concentrate on thee their mental vigour, what time these, twice or thrice, are thine assistants. Blend what is sweeter than the sweet with sweetness: win quickly with our meath that meath in battle.
meaning: त्वे॒ क्र॒तुम् अ॒पि पृञ्चन्ति भू॒रि द्वि॒र् य॒द् एते॒ त्रि॒र् भवन्त्य् ऊ॒माः । स्वादोः॒ स्वा॒दीयः स्वादु॒ना सृजा स॒म् अदः॒ सु॒ म॒धु म॒धुनाभि॒ योधीः ॥६॥

text: Therefore in thee too, thou who winnest riches, at every banquet are the sages joyful With mighter power, bold God, extend thy firmness: let not malignant Yātudhānas harm thee.
meaning: य॒दि चिन् नु॒ त्वा ध॒ना ज॒यन्तं र॒णेरणे अनुम॒दन्ति वि॒प्राः । ओ॒जीयः शुष्मिन्त् स्थिर॒म् आ॒ तनुष्व मा॒ त्वा दभन् दुरे॒वासः कशो॒काः ॥७॥

text: Proudly we put our trust in thee in battles, when we behold great wealth the prize of combat. I with my words impel thy weapons onward, and sharpen with my prayer thy vital vigour.
meaning: त्व॒या वयं॒ शाशद्महे र॒णेषु प्रप॒श्यन्तो युधे॒न्यानि भू॒रि । चोद॒यामि त आ॒युधा व॒चोभिः सं॒ ते शिशामि ब्र॒ह्मणा व॒यांसि ॥८॥

text: Worthy of praises many-shaped, most skilful, most energetic, Āptya of the Aptyas: He with his might destroys the seven Dānus, subduing many who were deemed his equals.
meaning: नि॒ त॒द् दधिषे॒ ऽवरे प॒रे च य॒स्मिन्न् आ॒विथा॒वसा दुरोणे॒ । आ॒ स्थापयत मात॒रं जिगत्नु॒म् अ॒त इन्वत क॒र्वराणि भू॒रि ॥९॥

text: Thou in that house which thy protection guardedh bestowest- wealth, the higher and the lower. Thou stablishest the two much-wandering Mothers, and bringest many deeds to their completion.
meaning: स्तुष्व॒ वर्ष्मन् पुरुव॒र्त्मानं स॒म् ऋ॒भ्वाणम् इन॒तमम् आप्त॒म् आप्त्या॒नाम् । आ॒ दर्शति श॒वसा भू॒र्योजाः प्र॒ सक्षति प्रतिमा॒नं पृथिव्याः॒ ॥१०॥

text: Brihaddiva, the foremost of light-winners, repeasts these holy prayers, this strength to Indra. He rules the great self-luminous fold of cattle, and all the doors of light hath he thrown open.
meaning: इमा॒ ब्र॒ह्म बृह॒द्दिवः कृणवद् इ॒न्द्राय शूष॒म् अग्नियः॒ स्वर्षाः॒ । महो॒ गोत्र॒स्य क्षयति स्वरा॒जा तु॒रश् चिद् वि॒श्वम् अर्णवत् त॒पस्वान् ॥११॥

text: Thou hath Brihaddiva the great Atharvan, spoken to Indra as himself in person. The Mātarisvarīs, the spotless sisters, with power exalt him and impel him onward.
meaning: एवा॒ महा॒न् बृह॒द्दिवो अ॒थर्वा॒वोचत् स्वां॒ तन्व॑म् इ॒न्द्रम् एव॒ । स्व॒सारौ मातरि॒भ्वरी अरिप्रे॒ हिन्व॒न्ति चैने श॒वसा वर्ध॒यन्ति च ॥१२॥

text: Bright, Presence of the Gods, the luminous herald, Siirya hath mounted the celestial regions. Day's maker, he hath shone away the darkness, and radiant passed o'er places hard to traverse.
meaning: चित्रं॒ देवा॒नां केतु॒र् अ॒नीकं ज्यो॒तिष्मान् प्रदि॒शः सू॒र्य उद्य॒न् । दिवाकरो॒ ऽति द्युम्नै॒स् त॒मांसि वि॒श्वातारीद् दुरिता॒नि शुक्रः॒ ॥१३॥

text: The brilliant Presence of the Gods hath risen, the eye of Mitra, Varuna, and Agni. The soul of all that moveth not or moveth, Sūrya hath filled the earth and air and heaven.
meaning: चित्रं॒ देवा॒नाम् उ॒द् अगाद् अ॒नीकं च॒क्षुर् मित्र॒स्य व॒रुणस्याग्नेः॒ । आ॒प्राद् द्या॒वापृथिवी॒ अन्त॒रिक्षं सू॒र्य आत्मा॒ ज॒गतस् तस्थु॒षश् च ॥१४॥

text: Even as a lover followeth a maiden, so doth the Sun the Dawn, refulgent Goddess: Where pious men extend their generations before the Gracious One for happy fortune.
meaning: सू॒र्यो देवी॒म् उष॒सं रो॒चमानां म॒र्यो न॒ यो॒षाम् अभ्य् ए॑ति पश्चा॒त् । य॒त्रा न॒रो देवय॒न्तो युगा॒नि वितन्वते॒ प्र॒ति भद्रा॒य भद्र॒म् ॥१५॥

text: O Indra, bring great strength to us, bring valour, Satakratu, thou most active, bring. A hero conquering in war.
meaning: त्वं॒ न इन्द्रा॒ भरं ओ॒जो नृम्णं॒ शतक्रतो विचर्षणे । आ॒ वीरं॒ पृतनाष॒हम् ॥१॥

text: For, gracious Satakratu, thou hast ever been a mother and a sire to us, So now for bliss we pray to thee.
meaning: त्वं॒ हि॒ नः पिता॒ वसो त्वं॒ माता॒ शतक्रतो बभू॒विथ । अ॒धा ते सुम्न॒म् ईमहे ॥२॥

text: To thee, Strong, Much-invoked who showest forth thy strength, O Satakratu, do I speak: So grant thou us heroic might.
meaning: त्वां॒ शुष्मिन् पुरुहूत वाजय॒न्तम् उ॒प ब्रुवे शतक्रतो । स॒ नो रास्व सुवी॒र्यम् ॥३॥

text: The juice of Soma thus diffused, sweet to the taste, the bright Cows drink Who for the sake of splendour close to mighty Indra's side rejoice, good in their own supremacy.
meaning: स्वादो॒र् इत्था॒ विषुव॒तो म॒ध्वः पिबन्ति गौर्यः॑ । या॒ इ॒न्द्रेण सया॒वरीर् वृ॒ष्णा म॒दन्ति शोभ॒से व॒स्वीर् अ॒नु स्वरा॒ज्यम् ॥१॥

text: Craving his touch the dappled Kine mingle the Soma with their milk. The milch-kine dear to Indra send forth his death-dealing thun- derbolt, good in their own supremacy.
meaning: ता॒ अस्य पृशनायु॒वः सो॒मं श्रीणन्ति पृ॒श्नयः । प्रिया॒ इ॒न्द्रस्य धेन॒वो व॒ज्रं हिन्वन्ति सा॒यकं व॒स्वीर् अ॒नु स्वरा॒ज्यम् ॥२॥

text: With veneration, passing wise, honouring his victorious might, They follow close his many laws to win them due preeminence, good in their own supremacy.
meaning: ता॒ अस्य न॒मसा स॒हः सपर्य॒न्ति प्र॒चेतसः । व्रता॒न्य् अस्य सश्चिरे पुरू॒णि पूर्व॒चित्तये व॒स्वीर् अ॒नु स्वरा॒ज्यम् ॥३॥

text: For Indra, lover of carouse, loud be our songs about the juice: Let poets sing the hymn of praise.
meaning: इ॒न्द्राय म॒दूने सुतं॒ प॒रि ष्टोभन्तु नो गि॒रः । अर्क॒म् अर्चन्तु कार॒वः ॥१॥

text: We summon Indra to the draught, in whom all glories rest, in whom The seven communities rejoice.
meaning: य॒स्मिन् वि॒श्वा अ॒धि श्रि॒यो र॒णन्ति सप्त॒ संस॒दः । इ॒न्द्रं सुते॒ हवामहे ॥२॥

text: By the three Soma jars the Gods span sacrifice that stirs the mind: Let our songs aid and prosper it.
meaning: त्रि॒कद्रुकेषु चे॒तनं देवा॒सो यज्ञ॒म् अत्नत । त॒म् इ॒द् वर्धन्तु नो गि॒रः ॥३॥

text: If, Indra, thou drink Soma by Vishnu's or Trita Āptya's side, Or with the Maruts take delight in flowing drops;
meaning: य॒त् सो॒मम् इन्द्र वि॒ष्णवि य॒द् वा घ त्रित॒ आप्त्ये॒ । य॒द् वा मरु॒त्सु म॒न्दसे स॒म् इ॒न्दुभिः ॥१॥

text: Or, Sakra, if thou gladden thee afar or in the sea of air, Rejoice thee in this juice of ours, in flowing drops.
meaning: य॒द् वा शक्र पराव॒ति समुद्रे॒ अ॒धि म॒न्दसे । अस्मा॒कम् इ॒त् सुते॒ रणा स॒म् इ॒न्दुभिः ॥२॥

text: Or, Lord of Heroes, if thou aid the worshipper who sheds the juice, Or him whose laud delights thee, and his flowing drops.
meaning: य॒द् वा॒सि सुन्वतो॒ वृधो॒ य॒जमानस्य सत्पते । उक्थे॒ वा य॒स्य र॒ण्यसि स॒म् इ॒न्दुभिः ॥३॥

text: Whatever, Vritra-slayer! thou Sūrya, hast risen upon to-day, That, Indra, all is in thy power.
meaning: य॒द् अद्य॒ क॒च् च वृत्रहन्न् उद॒गा अभि॒ सूर्य । स॒र्वं त॒द् इन्द्र ते व॒शे ॥१॥

text: When, Mighty One, Lord of the Brave, thou thinkest, I shall never die, That thought of thine is true indeed.
meaning: य॒द् वा प्रवृद्ध सत्पते न॒ मरा इ॒ति म॒न्यसे । उतो॒ त॒त् सत्य॒म् इ॒त् त॒व ॥२॥

text: Thou, Indra, goest unto all Soma libations shed for thee, Both far away and near at hand.
meaning: ये॒ सो॒मासः पराव॒ति ये॒ अर्वाव॒ति सुन्विरे॒ । स॒र्वांस् तां॒ इन्द्र गछसि ॥३॥

text: Both boons—may Indra hitherward turned, listen to this, prayer of ours, And, mightiest Maghavan with thought inclined to us come nigh to drink the Soma juice.
meaning: उभ॒यं शृण॒वच् च न इ॒न्द्रो अर्वा॒ग् इदं॒ व॒चः । सत्रा॒च्या मघ॒वा सो॒मपीतये धिया॒ श॒विष्ठ आ॒ गमत् ॥१॥

text: For him, strong independent Ruler, Heaven and Earth have fashioned forth for power and might. Thou seatest thee as first among thy peers in place, for thy soul longs for Soma juice.
meaning: तं॒ हि॒ स्वरा॒जं वृषभं॒ त॒म् ओ॒जसे धिष॒णे निष्टतक्ष॒तुः । उतो॒पमा॒नां प्रथमो॒ नि॒ षीदसि सो॒मकामं हि॒ ते म॒नः ॥२॥

text: O Indra, from all ancient time rivalless ever and companionless art thou: In war thou seekest comradeship.
meaning: अभ्रातृव्यो॒ऽअना॒ त्व॒म् अ॒नापिर् इन्द्र जनु॒षा सना॒द् असि । युधे॒द् आपित्व॒म् इछसे ॥१॥

text: Thou findest not the wealthy man to be thy friend: those scorn thee who are flown with wine. What time thou thunderest and gatherest, then thou, even as a father, art invoked.
meaning: न॒की रेव॒न्तं सख्या॒य विन्दसे पी॒यन्ति ते सुराश्वः॑ । यदा॒ कृणो॒षि नदनुं॒ स॒म् ऊहस्य् आ॒द् इ॒त् पिते॒व हूयसे ॥२॥

text: I from my Father have received deep knowledge of the holy Law: I was born like unto the Sun.
meaning: अह॒म् इ॒द् धि॒ पितु॒ष् प॒रि मेधा॒म् ऋत॒स्य जग्र॒भ । अहं॒ सू॒र्य इवाजनि ॥१॥

text: After the lore of ancient time I make, like Kanva, beauteous songs, And Indra's self gains strength thereby.
meaning: अहं॒ प्रत्ने॒न म॒न्मना गि॒रः शुम्भामि कण्वव॒त् । ये॒ने॒न्द्रः शु॒ष्मम् इ॒द् दधे॒ ॥२॥

text: Whatever Rishis have not praised thee, Indra, or have lauded thee, By me exalted wax thou strong.
meaning: ये॒ त्वा॒म् इन्द्र न॒ तुष्टुवु॒र् ऋ॒षयो ये॒ च तुष्टुवुः॒ । म॒मे॒द् वर्धस्व सु॒ष्टुतः ॥३॥

text: Never may we be cast aside and strangers, as it were to thee. We, Thunder-wielding Indra, count ourselves as trees rejected and unfit to burn.
meaning: मा॒ भूम नि॒ष्ट्या इवे॒न्द्र त्व॒द् अ॒रणा इव । व॒नानि नि॒ प्रजहिता॒न्य् अद्रिवो दुरो॒षासो अमन्महि ॥१॥

text: O Vritra slayer, we were thought slow and unready for the fray: Yet once in thy great bounty may we have delight, O Hero, after praising thee.
meaning: अ॒मन्मही॒द् अनाश॒वो ऽनुग्रा॒सश् च वृत्रहन् । सुकृ॒त् सु॒ ते महता॒ शूर रा॒धसा॒नु स्तो॒मं मुदीमहि ॥२॥

text: Drink Soma, Lord of Bays, and let it cheer thee: Indra, the stone, like a well-guided courser, Directed by the presser's arms hath pressed it.
meaning: पि॒बा सो॒मम् इन्द्र म॒न्दतु त्वा यं॒ ते सुषा॒व हर्यश्वा॒द्रिः । सोतु॒र् बाहु॒भ्यां सु॒यतो ना॒र्वा ॥१॥

text: So let the draught of joy, thy dear companion, by which, O Lord of Bays, thou slayest foemen, Delight thee, Indra, Lord of princely treasures.
meaning: य॒स् ते म॒दो यु॒जस् चा॒रुर् अ॒स्ति ये॒न वृत्रा॒णि हर्यश्व हं॒सि । स॒ त्वा॒म् इन्द्र प्रभूवसो ममत्तु ॥२॥

text: Mark closely, Maghavan; the words I utter, this eulogy recited by Vasishtha: Accept the prayers I offer at thy banquet.
meaning: बो॒धा सु॒ मे मघवन् वा॒चम् ए॒मां॒ यां॒ ते व॒सिष्ठो अ॒र्चति प्र॒शस्तिम् । इमा॒ ब्र॒ह्म सधमा॒दे जुषस्व ॥३॥

text: Indra with all thy saving helps give us assistance, Lord of Power For after thee we follow even as glorious bliss, thee, Hero, finder-out of wealth.
meaning: शग्ध्य् ऊ षु॒ शचीपत इ॒न्द्र वि॒श्वाभिर् ऊति॒भिः । भ॒गं न॒ हि॒ त्वा यश॒सं वसुवि॒दम् अ॒नु शूर च॒रामसि ॥१॥

text: Increaser of our steeds and multiplying kine, a golden well, O God, art thou; For no one may impair the gifts laid up in thee, Bring me what- ever thing I ask.
meaning: पौरो॒ अ॒श्वस्य पुरुकृ॒द् ग॒वाम् अस्य् उ॒त्सो देव हिरण्य॒यः । न॒किर् हि॒ दा॒नं परिम॒र्धिषत् त्वे॒ य॒द्यद् या॒मि त॒द् आ॒ भर ॥२॥

text: Indra for worship of the Gods, Indra while sacrifice proceeds, Indra as warriors in the battle-shock we call, Indra that we may win the spoil.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रम् इ॒द् देव॒तातये इ॒न्द्रं प्रयत्य् अ॑ध्वरे॒ । इ॒न्द्रं समीके॒ वनि॒नो हवामह इ॒न्द्रं ध॒नस्य सात॒ये ॥३॥

text: With might hath Indra spread out heaven and earth, with power hath Indra lighted up the Sun. In Indra are all creatures closely held; in him meet the distilling Soma drops.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रो मह्ना॒ रो॒दसी पप्रथच् छ॒व इ॒न्द्रः सू॒र्यम् अरोचयत् । इ॒न्द्रे ह वि॒श्वा भु॒वनानि येमिर इ॒न्द्रे सुवाना॒स इ॒न्दवः ॥४॥

text: An ancient praise-song hath been sung: to Indra have ye said the prayer. They have sung many a Brihatī of sacrifice, poured forth th, worshipper's many thoughts.
meaning: अ॒स्तावि म॒न्म पूर्व्यं॒ ब्र॒ह्मे॒न्द्राय वोचत । पूर्वी॒र् ऋत॒स्य बृहती॒र् अनूषत स्तोतु॒र् मेघा॒ असृक्षत ॥१॥

text: In zealous haste the singers have sung forth a song distilling oil and rich in sweets. Riches have spread among us, and heroic strength; with us are flowing Soma drops.
meaning: तुरण्य॒वो म॒धुमन्तं घृतश्चु॒तं वि॒प्रासो अर्क॒म् आनृचुः । अस्मे॒ रयिः॒ पप्रथे वृ॒ष्ण्यं श॒वो ऽस्मे॒ सुवाना॒स इ॒न्दवः ॥२॥

text: Though, Indra, thou art called by men eastward and westward, north and south, Thou chiefly art with Anava and Turvasa, brave Champion! urged by men to come.
meaning: य॒द् इन्द्र प्रा॒ग् अ॒पाग् उ॒दङ् न्य॑ग् वा हूय॒से नृ॒भिः । सि॒मा पुरू॒ नृ॒षूतो अस्य् आ॒नवे॒ ऽसि प्रशर्ध तुर्व॒शे ॥१॥

text: Or, Indra, when with Ruma, Rusama, Syāvaka, and Kripa thou rejoicest thee, Still do the Kanvas bring praises, with their prayers, O Indra, draw thee hither: come.
meaning: य॒द् वा रु॒मे रु॒शमे श्या॒वके कृ॒प इ॒न्द्र माद॒यसे स॒चा । क॒ण्वासस् त्वा ब्र॒ह्मभि स्तो॒मवाहस इ॒न्द्रा॒ यछन्त्य् आ॒ गहि ॥२॥

text: Over the three great distances, past the Five Peoples go thy way, O Indra, noticing our voice.
meaning: अभि॒ त्वा शूर नोनुमो॒ ऽदुग्धा इव धेन॒वः । ई॒शानम् अस्य॒ ज॒गतः स्वर्दृ॒शम् ई॒शानम् इन्द्र तस्थु॒षः ॥१॥

text: Send forth thy ray like Sūrya: let my songs attract thee hither- ward. Like waters gathering to the vale.
meaning: न॒ त्वा॒वां अन्यो॒ दिव्यो॒ न॒ पा॒र्थिवो न॒ जातो॒ न॒ जनिष्यते । अश्वाय॒न्तो मघवन्न् इन्द्र वाजि॒नो गव्य॒न्तस् त्वा हवामहे ॥२॥

text: With Indra splendid feasts be ours enriched with ample spoil, wherewith, Wealthy in food, we may rejoice.
meaning: रेव॒तीर् नः सधमा॒द इ॒न्द्रे सन्तु तुवि॒वाजाः । क्षुम॒न्तो या॒भिर् म॒देम ॥१॥

text: Like thee, thyself, the singers' friend, thou movest as it were, besought, Bold One, the axle of the car.
meaning: आ॒ घ त्वा॒वान् त्म॒नाप्त॒ स्तोतृ॒भ्यो धृष्णव् इयानः॒ । ऋणो॒र् अ॒क्षं न॒ चक्रयोः॑ ॥२॥

text: That, Satakratu, thou to grace and please thy praisers, as it were, Stirrest the axle with thy strength.
meaning: आ॒ य॒द् दु॒वः शतक्रतव् आ॒ का॒मं जरितृ̄णा॒म् । ऋणो॒र् अ॒क्षं न॒ श॒चीभिः ॥३॥

text: This is the Godhead, this the might of Sūrya: he hath with- drawn what spread o'er work unfinished. When he hath loosed his horses from their station, straight over all night spreadeth out her garment.
meaning: त॒त् सू॒र्यस्य देवत्वं॒ त॒न् महित्वं॒ मध्या॒ क॒र्तोर् वि॒ततं सं॒ जभार । यदे॒द् अ॒युक्त हरि॒तः सध॒स्थाद् आ॒द् रा॒त्री वा॒सस् तनुते सिम॒स्मै ॥१॥

text: In the sky's lap the Sun this form assumeth for Mitra and for Vāruna to look on. His bay steeds well maintain his power eternal, at one time bright and darksome at another.
meaning: त॒न् मित्र॒स्य व॒रुणस्याभिच॒क्षे सू॒र्यो रूपं॒ कृणुते द्यो॒र् उप॒स्थे । अनन्त॒म् अन्य॒द् रु॒शद् अस्य प्रा॒जः कृष्ण॒म् अन्य॒द् धरि॒तः सं॒ भरन्ति ॥२॥

text: With what help will he come to us, wonderful, ever-waxing Friend, With what most mighty company?
meaning: क॒या नश् चित्र॒ आ॒ भुवद् ऊती॒ सदा॒वृधः स॒खा । क॒या श॒चिष्ठया वृता॒ ॥१॥

text: What genuine and most liberal draught will spirit thee with juice to burst. Open e'en strongly-guarded wealth?
meaning: क॒स् त्वा सत्यो॒ म॒दानां मं॒हिष्ठो मत्सद् अ॒न्धसः । दृल्हा॒ चिद् आरु॒जे व॒सु ॥२॥

text: Do thou who art protector us thy friends who praise thee With hundred aids approach us.
meaning: अभी॒ षु॒ नः स॒खीनाम् अविता॒ जरितृ̄णा॒म् । शतं॒ भवास्य् ऊति॒भिः ॥३॥

text: We will, with Indra and all Gods to help us, bring these existing worlds into subjection. Our sacrifice, our bodies, and our offspring shall Indra form together with the Ādityas.
meaning: इमा॒ नु॒ कं भु॒वना सीषधामे॒न्द्रश् च वि॒श्वे च देवाः॒ । यज्ञं॒ च नस् तन्वं॑ च प्रजां॒ चादित्यै॒र् इ॒न्द्रः सह॒ चीक्ल्̥पाति ॥४॥

text: With the Ādityas, with the band of Maruts, may Indra be pro- tector of our bodies. As when the Gods came after they had slaughtered the Asuras, keeping safe their Godlike nature,
meaning: आदित्यै॒र् इ॒न्द्रः स॒गणो मरु॒द्भिर् अस्मा॒कं भूत्व् अविता॒ तनू॒नाम् । हत्वा॒य देवा॒ अ॒सुरान् य॒द् आ॒यन् देवा॒ देवत्व॒म् अभिर॒क्षमाणाः ॥५॥

text: Brought the Sun hitherward with mighty powers, and looked about them on their vigorous Godhead. With this may we obtain strength God-appointed, and joy with brave sons through a hundred winters.
meaning: प्रत्य॒ञ्चम् अर्क॒म् अनयं छ॒चीभिर् आ॒द् इ॒त् स्वधा॒म् इषिरा॒म् प॒र्य् अपश्यन् । अया॒ वा॒जं देव॒हितं सनेम म॒देम शत॒हिमाः सुवी॒राः ॥६॥

text: Drive all our enemies away, O Indra, the western, mighty Con- queror, and the eastern, Hero, drive off our northern foes and southern, that we in thy wide shelter may be joyful.
meaning: अ॒पेन्द्र प्रा॒चो मघवन्न् अमि॒त्रान् अ॒पा॒पाचो अभिभूते नुदस्व । अ॒पो॒दीचो अ॒प शूराधरा॒च उरौ॒ य॒था त॒व श॒र्मन् म॒देम ॥१॥

text: What then? As men whose fields are full of barley reap the ripe corn removing it in order, So bring the food of those men, bring it hither, who come not to prepare the grass for worship.
meaning: कुवि॒द् अङ्ग॒ य॒वमन्तो य॒वं चिद् य॒था दा॒न्त्य् अनुपूर्वं॒ वियू॒य । इहे॒हैषां कृणुहि भो॒जनानि ये॒ बर्हि॒षो न॒मोवृक्तिं न॒ जग्मुः॒ ॥२॥

text: Men come not with one horse at sacred seasons; thus they obtain no honour in assemblies. Sages desiring herds of kine and horses strengthen the mighty Indra for his friendship.
meaning: नहि॒ स्थू॒र्य् ऋतुथा॒ यात॒म् अस्ति नो॒त॒ श्र॒वो विविदे संगमे॒षु । गव्य॒न्त इ॒न्द्रं सख्या॒य वि॒प्रा अश्वाय॒न्तो वृ॒षणं वाज॒यन्तः ॥३॥

text: Ye, Asvins, Lords of Splendour, drank full draughts of grateful Soma juice, And aided Indra in his work with Namuchi of Asura birth.
meaning: युवं॒ सुरा॒मम् अश्विना न॒मुचाव् आसुरे॒ स॒चा । विपिपाना॒ शुभस् पती इ॒न्द्रं क॒र्मस्व् आवतम् ॥४॥

text: As parents aid a son, both Asvins, Indra, aided thee with their wondrous powers and wisdom When thou, with might, hadst drunk the draught that glad- dens, Sarasvati, O Maghavan refreshed thee.
meaning: पुत्र॒म् इव पित॒राव् अश्वि॒नोभे॒न्द्राव॒थुः का॒व्यैर् दंस॒नाभिः । य॒त् सुरा॒मं व्य् अ॒पिबः श॒चीभिः स॒रस्वती त्वा मघवन्न् अभिष्णक् ॥५॥

text: Indra is strong to save, rich in assistance: may he, possessing all, be kind and gracious. May he disperse our foes and give us safety, and may we be the lords of hero vigour.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रः सुत्रा॒मा स्व॒वां अ॒वोभिः सुमृडीको॒ भवतु विश्व॒वेदाः । बा॒धतां द्वे॒षो अ॒भयं नः कृणोतु सुवी॒र्यस्य प॒तयः स्याम ॥६॥

text: May we enjoy his favour, his the holy: may we enjoy his blessed loving-kindness. May this rich Indra, as our good protector, drive off and keep afar all those who hate us.
meaning: स॒ सुत्रा॒मा स्व॒वां इ॒न्द्रो अस्म॒द् आरा॒च् चिद् द्वे॒षः सनुत॒र् युयोतु । त॒स्य वयं॒ सुमतौ॒ यज्ञि॒यस्या॒पि भद्रे॒ सौमनसे॒ स्याम ॥७॥

text: Men have abstained from pouring juice; nor counted Indra as a God. Where at the votary's store my friend Vrishākapi hath drunk his fill. Supreme is Indra over all.
meaning: वि॒ हि॒ सो॒तोर् अ॒सृक्षत ने॒न्द्रं देव॒म् अमंसत । य॒त्रा॒मदद् वृषा॒कपिर् अर्यः॒ पुष्टे॒षु म॒त्सखा वि॒श्वस्माद् इ॒न्द्र उ॒त्तरः ॥१॥

text: Thou, Indra, heedless passest by the ill Vrishākapi hath wrought; Yet nowhere else thou findest place wherein to drink the Soma juice. Supreme is Indra over all.
meaning: प॒रा ही॒न्द्र धा॒वसि वृषा॒कपेर् अ॒ति व्य॒थिः । नो॒ अ॒ह प्र॒ विन्दस्य् अन्य॒त्र सो॒मपीतये वि॒श्वस्माद् इ॒न्द्र उ॒त्तरः ॥२॥

text: What hath he done to injure thee, this tawny beast Vrishākapi, With whom thou art so angry now? What is the votary's food- ful store? Supreme is Indra over all.
meaning: कि॒म् अयं॒ त्वां वृषा॒कपिश् चका॒र ह॒रितो मृगः॒ । य॒स्मा इरस्य॒सी॒द् उ न्व् अ॑र्यो॒ वा पुष्टिम॒द् व॒सु वि॒श्वस्माद् इ॒न्द्र उ॒त्तरः ॥३॥

text: Soon may the hound who hunts the boar seize him and bite him in the ear, O Indra, that Vrishākapi whom thou protectest as a friend. Supreme is Indra over all.
meaning: य॒म् इमं॒ त्वं॒ वृषा॒कपिं प्रिय॒म् इन्द्राभिर॒क्षसि । श्वा॒ न्व् अ॑स्य जम्भिषद् अ॒पि क॒र्णे वराहयु॒र् वि॒श्वस्माद् इ॒न्द्र उ॒त्तरः ॥४॥

text: Kapi hath marred the beauteous things, all deftly wrought, that were my joy. In pieces will I rend his head; the sinner's portion shall be woe. Supreme is Indra over all.
meaning: प्रिया॒ तष्टा॒नि मे कपि॒र् व्य॑क्ता व्य् अ॑दूदुषत् । शि॒रो न्व् अ॑स्य राविषं न॒ सुगं॒ दुष्कृ॒ते भुवं वि॒श्वस्माद् इ॒न्द्र उ॒त्तरः ॥५॥

text: No dame hath ampler charms than I, or greater wealth of love's delights. None with more ardour offers all her beauty to her lord's embrace. Supreme is Indra over all.
meaning: न॒ म॒त् स्त्री॒ सुभस॒त्तरा न॒ सुया॒शुतरा भुवत् । न॒ म॒त् प्र॒तिच्यवीयसी न॒ स॒क्थ्य् उ॒द्यमीयसी वि॒श्वस्माद् इन्द्र उ॒त्तरः ॥६॥

text: Mother whose love is quickly won,I say what verily will be, My breast, O mother, and my head and both my hips seem quivering Supreme is Indra over all.
meaning: उवे॒ अम्ब सुलाभिके य॒थेवाङ्गं॒ भविष्य॒ति । भस॒न् मे अम्ब स॒क्थि मे शि॒रो मे वी॒व हृष्यति वि॒श्वस्माद् इ॒न्द्र उ॒त्तरः ॥७॥

text: Dame with the lovely hands and arms, with broad hair-plaits and ample hips, Why, O thou hero's wife, art thou angry with our Vrishākapi? Supreme is Indra over all.
meaning: किं॒ सुबाहो स्वङ्गुरे पृ॒थुष्टो पृ॒थुजाघने । किं॒ शूरपत्नि नस् त्व॒म् अभ्य् अ॑मीषि वृषा॒कपिं वि॒श्वस्माद् इ॒न्द्र उ॒त्तरः ॥८॥

text: This noxious creature looks on me as one bereft of hero's love. Yet heroes for my sons have I, the Maruts' friend and Indra's Queen Supreme is Indra over all.
meaning: अवी॒राम् इव मा॒म् अयं॒ शरा॒रुर् अभि॒ मन्यते । उता॒ह॒म् अस्मि वीरि॒णी॒न्द्रपत्नी मरु॒त्सखा वि॒श्वस्माद् इ॒न्द्र उ॒त्तरः ॥९॥

text: From olden time the matron goes to feast and general sacrifice. Mother of heroes, Indra's Queen, the rite's ordainer is extolled. Supreme is Indra over all.
meaning: संहोत्रं॒ स्म पुरा॒ ना॒री स॒मनं वा॒व गछति । वेधा॒ ऋत॒स्य वीरि॒णी॒न्द्रपत्नी महीयते वि॒श्वस्माद् इ॒न्द्र उ॒त्तरः ॥१०॥

text: So have I heard Indrāni called most fortunate among these dames, For never shall her Consort die in future time through length of days. Supreme is Indra over all.
meaning: इन्द्राणी॒म् आसु॒ ना॒रिषु सुभ॒गाम् अह॒म् अश्रवम् । नह्य् अ॑स्या अपरं॒ चन॒ जर॒सा म॒रते प॒तिर् वि॒श्वस्माद् इ॒न्द्र उ॒त्तरः ॥११॥

text: Never, Indrāni have I joyed without my friend Vrishākapi, Whose welcome offering here, made pure with water, goeth to the Gods. Supreme is Indra over all.
meaning: ना॒ह॒म् इन्द्रा॒णि रारण स॒ख्युर् वृषा॒कपेर् ऋते॒ । य॒स्येद॒म् अ॒प्यं हविः॒ प्रियं॒ देवे॒षु ग॒छति वि॒श्वस्माद् इ॒न्द्र उ॒त्तरः ॥१२॥

text: Wealthy Vrishākapāyi, blest with sons and consorts of thy sons, Indra will eat thy bulls, thy dear oblation that effecteth much. Supreme is Indra over all.
meaning: वृ॒साकपायि रे॒वति सु॒पुत्र आ॒द् उ सु॒स्नुषे । घ॒सत् त इ॒न्द्र उक्ष॒णः प्रियं॒ काचित्करं॒ हवि॒र् वि॒श्वस्माद् इ॒न्द्र उ॒त्तरः ॥१३॥

text: Fifteen in number, then, for me a score of bullocks they prepare. And I devour the fat thereof: they fill my belly full with food. Supreme is Indra over all.
meaning: उक्ष्णो॒ हि॒ मे प॒ञ्चदश साकं॒ प॒चन्ति विंसति॒म् । उता॒ह॒म् अद्मि पी॒व इ॒द् उभा॒ कुक्षी॒ पृणन्ति मे वि॒श्वस्माद् इ॒न्द्र उ॒त्तरः ॥१४॥

text: Like as a bull with pointed horn, loud bellowing amid the herds, Sweet to thine heart, O Indra, is the brew which she who tends thee pours. Supreme is Indra over all.
meaning: वृषभो॒ न॒ तिग्म॒शृङ्गो ऽन्त॒र् यूथे॒षु रो॒रुवत् । मन्थ॒स् त इन्द्र शं॒ हृदे॒ यं॒ ते सुनो॒ति भावयु॒र् वि॒श्वस्माद् इ॒न्द्र उ॒त्तरः ॥१५॥

text: Indrāni speaks. Non ille fortis (ad Venerem) est cujus mentula laxe inter femora dependet; fortis vero estille cujus, quum sederit, membrum pilosum se extendit. Super omnia est Indra.
meaning: न॒ से॒शे य॒स्य र॒म्बते ऽन्तरा॒ सक्थ्या॑ क॒पृत् । से॒दीशे य॒स्य रोमशं॒ निषेदु॒षो विजृ॒म्भते वि॒श्वस्माद् इ॒न्द्र उ॒त्तरः ॥१६॥

text: Indra speaks. Non fortis est ille cujus, quum sederit, membrum pilosum se extendit: fortis vero est ille cujus mentula laxe inter femora dependet. Super omnia est Indra.
meaning: न॒ से॒शे य॒स्य रोमशं॒ निषेदु॒षो विजृ॒म्भते । से॒दीशे य॒स्य र॒म्बते ऽन्तरा॒ सक्थ्या॑ क॒पृत् वि॒श्वस्माद् इ॒न्द्र उ॒त्तरः ॥१७॥

text: O Indra, this Vrishākapi hath found a slain wild animal, Dresser, and new-made pan, and knife, and wagon with a load of wood. Supreme is Indra over all.
meaning: अय॒म् इन्द्र वृषा॒कपिः प॒रस्वन्तं हतं॒ विदत् । असिं॒ सूनां॒ न॒वं चरु॒म् आ॒द् एधस्या॒न आ॒चितं वि॒श्वस्माद् इन्द्र उ॒त्तरः ॥१८॥

text: Distinguishing the Dāsa and the Arya, viewing all, I go. I look upon the wise, and drink the simple votary's Soma juice. Supreme is Indra over all.
meaning: अय॒म् एमि विचा॒कशद् विचिन्व॒न् दा॒सम् आ॒र्यम् । पि॒बामि पाकसु॒त्वनो ऽभि॒ धी॒रम् अचाकशं वि॒श्वस्माद् इ॒न्द्र उ॒त्तरः ॥१९॥

text: The desert plains and steep descents, how many leagues in length they spread! Go to the nearest houses, go unto thine home, Vrishākapi. Supreme is Indra over all.
meaning: ध॒न्व च य॒त् कृन्त॒त्रं च क॒ति स्वित् ता॒ वि॒ यो॒जना । ने॒दीयसो वृषाकपे॒ ऽस्तम् ए॒हि गृहां॒ उ॒प वि॒श्वस्माद् इ॒न्द्र उ॒त्तरः ॥२०॥

text: Turn thee again Vrishākapi; we twain will bring thee happiness. Thou goest homeward on thy way along this path which leads to sleep. Supreme is Indra over all.
meaning: पु॒नर् ए॒हि वृषाकपे सुविता॒ कल्पयावहै । य॒ एष॒ स्वप्ननं॒शनो॒ ऽस्तम् ए॒षि पथा॒ पु॒नर् वि॒श्वस्माद् इ॒न्द्र उ॒त्तरः ॥२१॥

text: When, Indra and Vrishākapi, ye travelled upward to your home, Where was that noisome beast, to whom went it, the beast that troubles man? Supreme is Indra over all.
meaning: य॒द् उ॒दञ्चो वृषाकपे गृह॒म् इन्द्रा॒जगन्तन । क्व॑ स्य॒ पुल्वघो॒ मृगः॒ क॒म् अगं जनयो॒पनो वि॒श्वस्माद् इ॒न्द्र उ॒त्तरः ॥२२॥

text: Daughter of Manu, Parsu bare a score of children at a birth. Her portion verily was bliss although her burthen caused her grief.
meaning: प॒र्शुर् ह ना॒म मानवी॒ साकं॒ ससूव विंशति॒म् । भद्रं॒ भल त्य॒स्या अभूद् य॒स्या उद॒रम् आ॒मयद् वि॒श्वस्माद् इ॒न्द्र उ॒त्तरः ॥२३॥

text: Listen to this, ye men, a laud of glorious bounty shall be sung. Thousands sixty, and ninety we, O Kaurama, among the Rusamas have received.
meaning: इदं॒ ज॒ना उ॒प श्रुत न॒राशं॒स स्त॒विष्यते । षष्टिं॒ सह॒स्रा नवतिं॒ च कौरम आ॒ रुश॒मेषु दद्महे ॥१॥

text: Camels twice-ten that draw the car, with females by their side, he gave. Fain would the chariot's top bow down escaping from the stroke of heaven.
meaning: उ॒ष्ट्रा य॒स्य प्रवाह॒णो वधू॒मन्तो द्विर्द॒श । वर्ष्मा॒ र॒थस्य नि॒ जिहीडते दिव॒ ईष॒माणा उपस्पृ॒शः ॥२॥

text: A hundred chains of gold, ten wreaths, upon thee Rishi he bestowed, And thrice-a-hundred mettled steeds, ten-times-a-thousand cows he gave.
meaning: एष॒ इषा॒य मामहे शतं॒ निष्का॒न् द॒श स्र॒जः । त्री॒णि शता॒न्य॒र्वतां सह॒स्रा द॒श गो॒नाम् ॥३॥

text: Glut thee, O Singer, glut thee like a bird on a ripe-fruited tree. Thy lips and tongue move swiftly like the sharp blades of a pair of shears.
meaning: व॒च्यस्व रे॒भ वच्यस्व वृक्षे॒ न पक्वे॒ शकु॒नः । न॒ष्टे जिह्वा॒ चर्चरीति क्षुरो॒ न॒ भुरि॒जोरिव ॥४॥
