text: Quickly and willingly like kine forth come the singers and their hymns: Their little maidens are at home, at home they wait upon the cows.
meaning: प्र॒ रेभा॒सो मनीषा॒ वृ॒षा गा॒व इवेरते । अमोतपु॒त्रका एषा॒ममो॒त गा इ॒वासते ॥५॥

text: O Singer, bring thou forth the hymn that findeth cattle, findeth: wealth. Even as an archer aims his shaft address this prayer unto the Gods.
meaning: प्र॒ रेभ धी॒म् भरस्व गोवि॒दं वसुवि॒दम् । देवत्रे॒मां वा॒चं स्रीणीही॒षुर्ना॒वीरस्ता॒रम् ॥६॥

text: List to Parikshit's eulogy, the sovran whom all people love, The King who ruleth over all, excelling mortals as a God.
meaning: रा॒ज्ञो विश्वज॒नीनस्य यो॒ देवो॒म॒र्त्यां अ॒ति । वैश्वानर॒स्य सु॒ष्टुतिमा॒ सुनो॒ता परिक्षि॒तः ॥७॥

text: Mounting his throne, Parikshit, best of all, hath given us peace and rest,' Saith a Kauravya to his wife as he is ordering his house.
meaning: परिछि॒न्नः क्षे॒मम् अकरोत् त॒म आ॒सनमाच॒रन् । कु॒लायन् कृण्व॒न् कौ॒रव्यः प॒तिर् व॒दति जाय॒या ॥८॥

text: Which shall I set before thee, curds, gruel of milk, or barley- brew?' Thus the wife asks her husband in the realm which King Parikshit rules.
meaning: कतर॒त् त आ॒ हराणि द॒धि म॒न्थां प॒रि श्रु॒तम् । जायाः॒ प॒तिं वि॒ पृछति राष्ट्रे॒ रा॒ज्ञः परिक्षि॒तः ॥९॥

text: Up as it were to heavenly light springs the ripe corn above the cleft. Happily thrive the people in the land where King Parikshit reigns.
meaning: अभी॒व॒स्वः प्र॒ जिहीते य॒वः पक्वः॒ पथो॒ बि॒लम् । ज॒नः स॒ भद्र॒म् ए॒धति राष्ट्रे॒ रा॒ज्ञः परिक्षि॒तः ॥१०॥

text: Indra hath waked the bard and said, Rise, wander singing here and there. Praise me, the strong: each pious man will give thee riches in return,
meaning: इ॒न्द्रः कारु॒म् अबूबुधद् उ॒त्तिष्ठ वि॒ चरा ज॒नम् । म॒मे॒दुग्र॒स्य च॒र्कृधि स॒र्व इ॒त् ते पृणादरिः॒ ॥११॥

text: Here, cows! increase and multiply, here ye, O horses, here, O men. Here, with a thousand rich rewards, doth Pūshan also seat him- self.
meaning: इह॒ गा॒वः प्र॒ जायध्वम् इहा॒श्वा॒ इह॒ पू॒रुषाः । इहो॒ सह॒स्रदक्षिणो॒पि पूषा॒ नि॒ षीदति ॥१२॥

text: O Indra, let these cows be safe, their master free from injury. Let not the hostile-hearted or the robber have control of them.
meaning: ने॒मा॒ इन्द्र गा॒वो रिषन् मो॒ आसां॒ गो॒प रीरिषत् । मा॒साम् अमि॒त्रयु॒र्जन इ॒न्द्र मा॒ स्तेन॒ ईशत ॥१३॥

text: Oft and again we glorify the hero with our hymn of praise, with prayer, with our auspicious prayer. Take pleasure in the songs we sing: let evil never fall on us.
meaning: उ॒प नो न रमसि सू॒क्तेन व॒चसा वयं॒ भद्रे॒ण व॒चसा वय॒म् । व॒नाद् अधिध्वनो॒ गिरो॒ न॒ रिष्येम कदा॒ चन॒ ॥१४॥

text: The worshipper who pours the juice, for gathering and assembly fit, And yonder foe-destroying Sun,—these have the Gods designed of old.
meaning: यः॒ सभे॒यो विदथ्यः॑ सुत्वा॒ यज्वा॒थ पू॒रुषः । सू॒र्यं चा॒मू रिशा॒द॒सस् त॒द् देवाः॒ प्रा॒ग् अकल्पयन् ॥१॥

text: He who defiles a sister, he who willingly would harm a friend, The fool who slights his elder, these, they say, must suffer down. below.
meaning: यो॒ जाम्या॒ अ॒प्रथयस् त॒द् य॒त् स॒खायं दु॒धूर्षति । ज्ये॒ष्ठो य॒द् अप्रचेतास् त॒द् आहुर् अ॒धराग् इ॒ति ॥२॥

text: Whenever any good man's son becometh bold and spirited, Then hath the wise Gandharva said this pleasant upward-point- ing word.
meaning: य॒द् भद्र॒स्य पु॒रुषस्य पुत्रो॒ भवति दाधृषिः॒ । त॒द् विप्रो॒ अ॒ब्रवीद् उ त॒द् गन्धर्वः॒ का॒म्यं व॒चः ॥३॥

text: The most unprofitable churl, the wealthy men who brings no. gift, These, verily, as we have heard, are cast away by all the wise.
meaning: य॒श्च पणि॒ र॒घुजिष्ठ्यो॒ य॒श्च देवां॒ अ॒दाशुरिः । धी॒राणां श॒श्वताम् अहं॒ त॒द् अपाग् इ॒ति शुश्रुम ॥४॥

text: But they who have adored the Gods, and they who have best- owed their gifts, Those liberal lords are filled with wealth like Sūrya risen up to heaven.
meaning: ये॒ च देवा॒ अ॒यजन्ता॒थो ये॒ च पराददिः॒ । सू॒र्यो दि॒वम् इव गत्वा॒य मघ॒वा नो वि॒ रप्शते ॥५॥

text: With unanointed eyes and limbs, wearing no gem or ring of gold. No priest, no Brāhman's son is he: these things are ordered in the rules.
meaning: यो॒ऽनाक्ता॒क्षो अनभ्यक्तो॒ अ॒मणिवो॒ अ॒हिरण्य॒वः । अ॒ब्रह्मा ब्र॒ह्मणः पुत्र॒स्तोता॒ क॒ल्पेषु संमि॒ता ॥६॥

text: With well-anointed limbs and eyes, wearing fair gem and golden, ring, Good priest is he, the Brāhman's son; these things are ordered in the rules.
meaning: य॒ आक्ता॒क्षः सुभ्यक्तः॒ सु॒मणिः सु॒हिरण्य॒वः । सु॒ब्रह्मा ब्र॒ह्मणः पुत्र॒स्तोता॒ क॒ल्पेषु संमि॒ता ॥७॥

text: Pools with no place for drinking, and the wealthy man who. giveth naught, The pretty girl you may not touch, these things are ordered in: the rules.
meaning: अ॒प्रपाणा॒ च वेशन्ता॒ रेवां॒ अ॒प्र॒तिदिश्ययः । अ॒यभ्या कन्या॑ कल्याणी॒ तोता॒ क॒ल्पेषु संमि॒ता ॥८॥

text: Pools with good drinking places, and the wealthy man who freely gives, The pretty girl who may be touched, these things are ordered in the rules.
meaning: सु॒प्रपाणा॒ च वेशन्ता॒ रेवा॒न्त् सु॒प्र॒तिदिश्ययः । सु॒यभ्या कन्या॑ कल्याणी॒ तोता॒ क॒ल्पेषु संमि॒ता ॥९॥

text: The favourite wife neglected, and the man who safely shuns the fight, A sluggish horse whom none may guide, these things are order- ed in the rules.
meaning: प॒रिवृक्ता॒ च म॒हिषी स्वस्त्या॑ च युधिं॒ गमः॒ । अ॒नाशुर॒श्चा॒यामी॒ तोता॒ क॒ल्पेषु संमि॒ता ॥१०॥

text: The favourite wife most dearly loved, the man who safely goes to war, The fleet steed who obeys the rein, these things are ordered in the rules.
meaning: वावाता॒ च म॒हिषी स्वस्त्या॑ च युधिं॒ गमः॒ । श्वाशु॒रश् चायामी॒ तोता॒ क॒ल्पेषु संमि॒ता ॥११॥

text: When, Indra, thou, as no man could, didst plunge into the Ten Kings' fight, That was a guard for every man: for he is formed to stay disease.
meaning: य॒द् इन्द्रादो दाशराज्ञे॒ मा॒नुषं वि॒ गाहथाः । वि॒रूपः स॒र्वस्मा आसीत् सह॒ यक्षा॒य क॒ल्पते ॥१२॥

text: Easily conquering Maghavan, thou, Hero, bentest Raji down, Rentest asunder Rauhina, calvest in pieces Vritra's head.
meaning: त्वं॒ वृषाक्षुं॒ मघवन्न् अ॒म्रं मर्या॒क॒रो र॒विः । त्वं॒ रौहिणं॒ व्या॑स्यो वि॒ वृत्र॒स्या॒भिनच् छि॒रः ॥१३॥

text: Thou who didst separate the clouds and penetrate the water- floods, To thee, great slayer of the foe, be glory, Indra, yea, to thee!
meaning: यः॒ प॒र्वतान् व्य॑दधाद् यो॒ अपो॒ व्यगाहथाः । इ॒न्द्रो यो॒ वृत्रहा॒न्महं॒ त॒स्माद् इन्द्र न॒मो ऽस्तु ते ॥१४॥

text: They said to Auchchaihsravasa running as side-horse of the Bays, Safely to victory, O Steed, bear Indra with the beauteous wreath.
meaning: पृष्ठं॒ धा॒वन्तं हर्यो॒र् औ॒च्चैः श्रवस॒म् अब्रुवन् । स्वस्त्य॒श्व जै॒त्राये॒न्द्रम् आ॒ वह सुस्र॒जम् ॥१५॥

text: They yoke the white mares, on the Bay's right harness Auchchai- hsravasa. He joyeth as he carrieth Indra the foremost of the Gods.
meaning: ये॒ त्वा श्वेता॒ अ॒जैश्रवसो॒ हा॒र्यो युञ्ज॒न्ति द॒क्षिणम् । पू॒र्वा न॒मस्य देवा॒नां बि॒भ्रद् इन्द्र महीयते ॥१६॥

text: These mares come springing
meaning: एता॒ अ॒श्वा आ॒ प्लवन्ते ॥१॥

text: forward to Pratipa Prātisutvana.
meaning: प्रतीपं॒ प्रा॒ति सुत्व॒नम् ॥२॥

text: One of them is Hariknikā. Hariknikā, what seekest thou?
meaning: ता॒साम् ए॒का ह॒रिक्निका ॥३॥

text: Hariknikā, what seekest thou?
meaning: ह॒रिक्निके॒ कि॒म् इछासि ॥४॥

text: The excellent, the golden son:
meaning: साधुं॒ पुत्रं॒ हिरण्य॒यम् ॥५॥

text: where now hast thou abandoned him?
meaning: क्वा॒हतं प॒रास्यः ॥६॥

text: There where around those distant trees,
three Sisus that are standing there,
meaning: प॒रि त्रयः ॥८॥

text: Three adders, breathing angrily,
are blowing loud the threatening horn.
meaning: शृ॒ङ्गं धम॒न्त आसते ॥१०॥

text: Hither hath come a stallion:
meaning: अय॒न्महा॒ ते अर्वाहः॒ ॥११॥

text: he is known by droppings on his way,
meaning: स॒ इ॒छ॒कं स॒घाघते ॥१२॥

text: As by their dung the course of kine.
meaning: स॒घाघते गो॒मीद्या॒ गो॒गतीर् इ॒ति ॥१३॥

text: What wouldst thou in the home of men?
Barley and ripened rice I seek.
meaning: प॒ल्प बद्ध व॒यो इ॒ति ॥१५॥

text: On rice and barley hast thou fed,
meaning: ब॒द्ध वो अ॒घा इ॒ति ॥१६॥

text: As the big serpent feeds on sheep.
Cow's hoof and horse's tail hast thou,
meaning: अ॒श्वस्य वा॒रो गोशपद्यके॒ ॥१८॥

text: Winged with a falcon's pinion
is that harmless swelling of thy tongue.
meaning: अनामयो॒पजिह्वि॒का ॥२०॥

text: Who carried off these stores of milk?
meaning: को॒ अर्य बहुलि॒मा इ॒षूनि ॥१॥

text: Who took the dark cow's milk away?
Who took away the white cow's milk?
Who took the black cow's milk away?
Question this man, Where do I ask?
meaning: एतं॒ पृछ कु॒हं पृछ ॥५॥

text: Where, whom that knoweth do I ask?
meaning: कु॒हाकं पक्वकं॒ पृछ ॥६॥

text: Not to the belly comes the grain.
meaning: य॒वानो यतिष्व॒भिः कुभिः ॥७॥

text: The patient ones are angry now.
meaning: अ॒कुप्यन्तः कु॒पायकुः ॥८॥

text: Undecked with gems, and decked with gems:
meaning: आ॒मणको म॒णत्सकः ॥९॥

text: deity rivalling the Sun.
meaning: दे॒व त्वप्रतिसूर्य ॥१०॥

text: Dapple, Harinikā, and Bay
meaning: ए॒नश्चिपङ्क्तिका॒ हविः॒ ॥११॥

text: ran forward to the liberal gifts.
meaning: प्र॒दु॒द्रुदो म॒घाप्रति ॥१२॥

text: When the horn's blast hath sounded forth
meaning: शृ॒ङ्ग उत्पन्न ॥१३॥

text: let not our friend discover thee.
meaning: मा॒ त्वाभि स॒खा नो विदन् ॥१४॥

text: Hither to the cow's son they come.
meaning: वशा॒याः पुत्र॒म् आ॒ यन्ति ॥१५॥

text: Libation hath rejoiced the God.
meaning: इ॒रावेदुम॒यं दत ॥१६॥

text: Then cried they. Here he is, and, Here;
meaning: अ॒थो इय॒न्नि॒यन्न् इ॒ति ॥१७॥

text: again the cry was, Here is he.
Then not defective be our steeds!
meaning: अ॒थो श्वा॒ अ॒स्थिरो भवन् ॥१९॥

text: A splinter so diminutive!
meaning: उयं॒ यकां॒शलोकका॒ ॥२०॥

text: He minishes, he splits in twain:
meaning: आ॒मिनोनिति॒ भद्यते ॥१॥

text: crush it and let it be destroyed.
meaning: त॒स्य अनु नि॒भञ्जनम् ॥२॥

text: Varuna with the Vasus goes:
meaning: व॒रुणो या॒ति व॒स्वभिः ॥३॥

text: the Wind-God hath a hundred reins.
meaning: शतं॒ वा भा॒रती श॒वः ॥४॥

text: A hundred golden steeds hath he, a hundred chariots wrought of gold.
meaning: शत॒माश्वा॒ हिरण्य॒याः । शतं॒ रथ्या॒ हिरण्य॒याः । शतं॒ कुथा॒ हिरण्य॒याः ।

text: Lover of Kusa grass, Unploughed!
meaning: अ॒हुल कुश वर्त्तक ॥६॥

text: Fat is not reckoned in the hoof.
meaning: शफे॒न इव॒ ओहते ॥७॥

text: The ladle doth not hold apart
meaning: आ॒य वने॒नती ज॒नी ॥८॥

text: the entrails and the clotted blood.
meaning: व॒निष्ठा ना॒व गृह्य॒न्ति ॥९॥

text: This O Mandūrikā, is mine.
Thy trees are standing in a clump.
meaning: ते॒ वृक्षाः॒ सह॒ तिष्ठति ॥११॥

text: The plain domestic sacrifice,
the sacrifice with burning dung.
Asvattha, Dhava, Khadira,
meaning: अ॒श्वत्थ ख॒दिरो धवः॒ ॥१४॥

text: leaf taken from the Aratu.
meaning: अ॒रदुपरम ॥१५॥

text: The man pervaded thoroughly lies
meaning: श॒यो हत॒ इव ॥१६॥

text: on the ground as he were slain.
The biestings only have they milked:
meaning: अ॒दूहमित्यां॒ पू॒षकम् ॥१८॥

text: one-and-a half of the wild ass,
meaning: अ॒त्यर्धर्च॒ परस्व॒तः ॥१९॥

text: And two hides of an elephant.
Then too the single bottle-gourd,
meaning: आ॒द॒लाबुकमे॒ककम् ॥१॥

text: the bottle-gourd dug from the earth,
meaning: अ॒लाबुकम् नि॒खातकम् ॥२॥

text: The lute dug up from out the ground:
meaning: कर्करिको॒ नि॒खातकः ॥३॥

text: this the wind stirs and agitates.
meaning: त॒द् वा॒त उ॒न्मथायति ॥४॥

text: Let him prepare a nest, they say:
meaning: कु॒लायं कृणवादि॒ति ॥५॥

text: he shall obtain it strong and stretched.
meaning: उग्रं॒ वनिष॒दाततम् ॥६॥

text: He shall not gain it unspread out.
meaning: न॒ वनिषद॒नाततम् ॥७॥

text: Who among these will touch the lute?
meaning: क॒ एषां क॒र्करी लिखत् ॥८॥

text: Who among these will beat the drum?
meaning: क॒ एषां दुन्दु॒भिं हनत् ॥९॥

text: How, if he beat it, will he beat?
meaning: य॒दीयं॒ हनत् क॒थं हनत् ॥१०॥

text: Where beating will the Goddess beat
meaning: देवी॒ हनत् कु॒हनत् ॥११॥

text: again again about the house?
Three are the names the camel bears,
meaning: त्री॒ण्युष्ट्र॒स्य ना॒मानि ॥१३॥

text: Golden is one of them, he said.
meaning: हिरण्य॒ इ॒त्ये॒के अब्रवीत् ॥१४॥

text: Glory and power, these are two.
He with black tufts of hair shall strike.
meaning: नी॒लशिखण्डवा॒हनः ॥१६॥

text: Two rays of light are lengthened out, and the man gently touches them with the two beatings on the drum. Maiden, it truly is not so as thou, O maiden, fanciest.
meaning: वि॒ततौ किरणौ द्वौ॒ ता॒वा पिनष्टि पू॒रुषः । न॒ वै कुमारि त॒त् त॒था य॒था कुमारि म॒न्यसे ॥१॥

text: Two are thy mother's rays of light: the skin is guarded from the man.
meaning: मातु॒ष्टे॒ किरणौ द्वौ॒ नि॒वृत्तः पु॒रुषानृते । न॒ वै कुमारि त॒त् त॒था य॒था कुमारि म॒न्यसे ॥२॥

text: नि॒गृह्य क॒र्णकौ द्वौ॒ नि॒रायछसि म॒ध्यमे । न॒ वै कुमारि त॒त् त॒था य॒था कुमारि म॒न्यसे ॥३॥
उत्ताना॒यै शयाना॒यै ति॒ष्ठन्ती वा॒व गूहसि । न॒ वै कुमारि त॒त् त॒था य॒था कुमारि म॒न्यसे ॥४॥
श्ल॒क्ष्णायां श्ल॒क्ष्णिकायां श्ल॒क्ष्णमेवा॒व गूहसि । न॒ वै कुमारि त॒त् त॒था य॒था कुमारि म॒न्यसे ॥५॥
अ॒वश्लक्ष्णमि॒व भ्रंशद् अन्त॒र्लोमम॒ति ह्रदे॒ । न॒ वै कुमारि त॒त् त॒था य॒था कुमारि म॒न्यसे ॥६॥
Here are we sitting east and west and north and south, with waters. Bottle-gourd vessels.
meaning: इहे॒त्थ॒ प्रा॒ग॒पागु॒दगध॒राग् अ॒रालागु॒दभर्त्सथ ॥१॥

text: Here east and west and north and south sit the calves sprinkling Curds and oil.
meaning: इहे॒त्थ॒ प्रा॒ग॒पागु॒दगध॒राग् वत्साः॒ पु॒रुषन्त आसते ॥२॥

text: Here east and west and north and south the offering of rice clings on. The leaf of the Asvattha tree.
meaning: इहे॒त्थ॒ प्रा॒ग॒पागु॒दगध॒राक् स्था॒लीपाको वि॒ लीयते ॥३॥

text: Here east and west and north and south adheres when touched. That water-drop.
meaning: इहे॒त्थ॒ प्रा॒ग॒पागु॒दगध॒राक् स॒ वै पृथु॒ लीयते ॥४॥

text: Here east and west and north and south in iron mayst thou not be caught. The cup.
meaning: इहे॒त्थ॒ प्रा॒ग॒पागु॒दगध॒राग् आ॒स्ते लाहणि ली॒शाथी ॥५॥

text: Here east and west and north and south fain would it clasp what would not clasp. Emmet hole.
meaning: इहे॒त्थ॒ प्रा॒ग॒पागु॒दगध॒राग् अ॒क्ष्लि॒ली पु॒छि॒लीयते ॥६॥

text: Bang! here he is. A dog,
meaning: भु॒ग् इत्य् अभि॒गतः श॒लित्यप॒क्रान्तः फ॒लित्यभि॒ष्ठितः । दुन्दु॒भिम् आहननाभ्यां॒ ज॒रि॒त॒रो॒थामो दैव॒ ॥१॥

text: Swish! it is gone. Falling of leaves.
meaning: कोशबि॒ले रजनि ग्र॒न्थेर् धान॒म् उपा॒न॒हि पाद॒म् । उ॒त्तमां ज॒निमां जन्या॒नु॒त्तमां ज॒नीन् व॒र्त्मन्यात् ॥२॥

text: Crunch! it is trodden on. A cow's hoof.
meaning: अ॒लाबूनि पृषा॒तकान्य॒श्वत्थप॒लाशम् । पि॒पीलिकाव॒तश्व॒सो विद्यु॒त्स्वा॒पर्णशफो॒ गो॒शफो॒ ज॒रि॒तरो॒था॒मो दैव॒ ॥३॥

text: These Gods have gone astray. Do thou, Adhvaryu, quickly do thy work.
meaning: वी॑मे देवा॒ अक्रंसता॒ध्वर्यो॒ क्षिप्रं॒ प्रच॒र । सुसत्य॒म् इ॒द् ग॒वाम् अस्य॒सि प्रखुद॒सि ॥४॥

text: There is good resting for the cows. Take thy delight.
meaning: पत्नी॒ य॒दृश्यते पत्नी॒ य॒क्ष्यमाणा जरितरो॒था॒मो दैव॒ । होता॒ विष्टीमेन॒ जरितर् ओ॒था॒मो दैव॒ ॥५॥

text: O singer, the Ādityas brought rich guerdon to the Angirases. Singer, they went not near to it. Singer, they did not take the gift.
meaning: आ॒दित्या ह जरितर् अ॒ङ्गिरोभ्यो द॒क्षिणाम् अन॒यन् । तां॒ ह जरितः प्र॒त्यायंस् ता॒म् उ॒ ह जरितः प्र॒त्यायन् ॥६॥

text: Singer, they went not near to that; but, singer, they accepted this: That days may not be indistinct, nor sacrifices leaderless.
meaning: तां॒ ह जरितर् नः प्र॒त्यगृभ्णंस् ता॒म् उ॒ ह जरितर् नः प्र॒त्यगृभ्णः । अ॒हानेतरसं न वि॒ चेत॒नानि यज्ञा॒न् ए॒तरसं न पु॒रोग॒वामः ॥७॥

text: And quickly Both he fly away, the White Horse swiftest on his feet, And swiftly fills his measure up.
meaning: उत॒ श्वे॒त आ॒शुपत्वा उतो॒ प॒द्याभिर् य॒विष्ठः । उते॒म् आ॒शु मा॒नं पिपर्ति ॥८॥

text: Ādityas, Rudras, Vasus, all pay worship unto thee. Accept this liberal gift, O Angiras, This bounty excellent and rich, this ample bounty spreading far.
meaning: आ॒दित्या रुद्रा॒ व॒सवस् त्वे॒नु त इदं॒ रा॒धः प्र॒ति गृभ्णीह्य् अङ्गिरः । इदं॒ रा॒धो विभु॒ प्र॒भु इदं॒ रा॒धो बृह॒त् पृ॒थु ॥९॥

text: The Gods shall give the precious boon: let it be pleasant to your hearts. Let it be with you every day: accept our offerings in return.
meaning: दे॒वा ददत्वा॒सुरं त॒द् वो अस्तु सु॒चेतनम् । यु॒ष्मां अस्तु दि॒वेदिवे प्रत्ये॒व गृभायत् ॥१०॥

text: Vouchsafe us shelter, Indra, thou to be invoked from far away. Bring treasure hither to reward the far-famed bard who praises thee.
meaning: त्व॒म् इन्द्र शर्म॒रिणा हव्यं॒ पा॒रावतेभ्यः । वि॒प्राय स्तुवते॒ वसुव॒निं दुरश्रवसे॒ वह ॥११॥

text: Thou, Indra, to the trembling dove whose pinions had been rent and torn. Gayest ripe grain and Pilu fruit, gavest him water when athirst.
meaning: त्व॒म् इन्द्र कपो॒ताय छिन्नपक्षा॒य व॒ञ्चते । श्या॒माकं पक्वं॒ पी॒लु च वा॒रस्मा अ॒कृणोर् बहुः॒ ॥१२॥

text: The ready praiser loudly speaks though fastened triply with a strap. Yea, he commends the freshening draught, deprecates languor of disease.
meaning: अरंगरो॒ वावदीति त्रेधा॒ बद्धो॒ वरत्र॒या । इ॒रामह प्र॒शंसत्य् अ॒निराम् अ॒प सेधति ॥१३॥

text: Si quis in hujus tenui rima praeditae feminae augustias fascinum intromittit, vaccae ungularum et Sakula. rum pisci- um more pudenda ejus agitantur.
meaning: य॒द् अस्या अंहुभे॒द्याः कृधु॒ स्थूल॒म् उपा॒तसत् । मुष्का॒वि॒दस्या एजतो॒ गोशफे॒ शकुला॒व् इव ॥१॥

text: Quum magno pene parvula ejus pudenda vir percutit, huc et illuc ilia increscunt veluti duo asini in solo arenoso.
meaning: य॒दा स्थूले॒न प॒ससाणौ मुष्का॒ उ॒पावधीत् । वि॒ष्वञ्चा वस्या॒ व॒र्धतः सि॒कतास्व् एव ग॒र्दभौ ॥२॥

text: Quum parvum, admodum parvum, Ziziphi Jujubae quasi granum in eam incidit, ventris ejus partes interiores, velut verno tempore arundo, extentae videntur.
meaning: य॒द् अल्पिकास्व॑ल्पिका क॒र्कधूके॒वष॒द्यते । वासन्तिक॒म् इव ते॒जनं य॒न्त्य् अवा॒ताय वि॒त्पति ॥३॥

text: Si Dii mentulae intumescenti faverunt, cum femoribus suis se: ostentat femina tanquam vero testi.
meaning: य॒द् देवा॒सो ललामगुं प्र॒विष्टीमि॒नम् आविषुः । सकुला॒ देदिश्यते ना॒री सत्य॒स्याक्षिभु॒वो य॒था ॥४॥

text: Magnopere delectata est arnica: ut equns solutus adveniens vocem edidit: Vaginam juvenis! pene percute: medium. femur paratum est.
meaning: महानग्न्य॑तृप्नद्वि मो॒क्रदद॒स्थानासरन् । श॒क्तिकान॒ना स्वचम॒शकं सक्तु प॒द्यम ॥५॥

text: Arnica, pilam superans, dixit: Ut tua, Arbor, ! (verbera) pinsunt, sic etiam nunc (hic me permolit).
meaning: महानग्न्यु॑लूखलम् अतिक्रा॒मन्त्य् अब्रवीत् । य॒था त॒व वनस्पते नि॒रघ्नन्ति त॒थैवेति ॥६॥

text: Arnica eum alloquitur: Tum etiam tu defecisti. Ut tua. Arbor! (verbera) Pinsunt, sic etiam nunc (me permole).
meaning: महानग्न्यु॒प ब्रूते भ्रष्टो॒था॒प्यभूभुवः । य॒थैव॒ ते वनस्पते पि॒प्पति त॒थैवेति ॥७॥

text: Arnica eum alloquitur: Tum etiam tu defceisti. Ut silvae ignis. inflammatur, sic ardent mea membra.
meaning: महानग्न्यु॒प ब्रूते भ्रष्टो॒था॒प्यभूभुवः । य॒था वयो वि॒दा॒ह्य स्वर्गे॒ नम॒व॒दह्यते ॥८॥

text: Arnica eum alloquitur: Fauste infixus est penis; arboris fructu celeriter fruamur.
meaning: महानग्न्यु॒प ब्रूते स्वसावे॒शितं प॒सः । इत्थं॒ फ॒लस्य वृ॒क्षस्य शू॒र्पे शूर्पं भ॒जेमहि ॥९॥

text: Arnica cum fuste gallum circumcurrit. Nos nescimus quae bestia pudendum muliebre in capite gerat.
meaning: महानग्नी॒ कृकवाकं श॒म्यया प॒रि धावति । अयं॒ न विद्म॒ यो॒ मृगः॒ शीर्ष्णा॒ हरति धा॒णिकाम् ॥१०॥

text: Arnica post currentem amatorem currit: Has ejus boves custodi tu. Me futue: coctam oryzam ede.
meaning: महानग्नी॒ महानग्नं॒ धा॒वन्तम् अ॒नु धावति । इमा॒स् त॒द् अस्य गा॒ रक्ष य॒भ मा॒म् अद्ध्यौदन॒म् ॥११॥

text: Fortunatus, Arnica, te opprimit. Bona est magni viri fututio, Macrum pinguis. femina obtineat. Futue me, etc.
meaning: सु॒देवस् त्वा महा॒नग्नीर् ब॒बाधते महतः॒ साधु खोद॒नम् । कुसं॒ पी॒वरो॒ नवत् ॥१२॥

text: Sine digito mulcta vacca vanankaram producit, Magna et bona est Aegle Marmelos. Futue me, etc.
meaning: वशा॒ दग्धा॒म् इमाङ्गुरिं॒ प्र॒सृजतोग्र॒तं परे । महा॒न् वै॒ भद्रो॒ य॒भ मा॒म् अद्ध्यौदन॒म् ॥१३॥

text: Infelix, Amice, te opprimit. Bona est magni viri fututio. Flava puollula, opere suo perfecto, procurrit.
meaning: वि॒देवस् त्वा महा॒नग्नीर् वि॒बाधते महतः॒ साधु खोद॒नम् । कुमारिका॒ पिङ्गलिका॒ का॒र्द भ॒स्मा कु धा॒वति ॥१४॥

text: Magna certe et bona est Aegle Marmelos. Bona est magna Ficus Glomerata. Magnus vir ubique opprimit. Bona est magni viri fututio.
meaning: महा॒न् वै भद्रो॒ बिल्वो॒ महा॒न् भद्र उदुम्ब॒रः । महां॒ अभिक्त॒ बाधते महतः॒ साधु खोद॒नम् ॥१५॥

text: Quem macrum factum puella flava pinguisque capiat sicut pollicem ex olei cado fossorem ilium extrahat.
meaning: यः॒ कुमारी॒ पिङ्गलिका॒ व॒सन्तं पीवरी॒ लभेत् । तै॒लकुण्डमि॒माङ्गुष्ठं॒ रो॒दन्तं शुदम् उ॒द्धरेत् ॥१६॥

text: When, foul with secret spot and stain, ye hastened onward to the breast. All Indra's enemies were slain and passed away like froth and foam.
meaning: य॒द् ध प्रा॒चीर् अ॒जगन्तो॒रो मण्डूरधाणिकीः । हता॒ इ॒न्द्रस्य श॒त्रवः स॒र्वे बुद्बुद॒याशवः ॥१॥

text: Indra is he, O men, who gives us happiness: sport, urge the giver of delight to win the spoil. Bring quickly down, O priests, hither to give us aid, to drink the Soma, Indra son of Nishtigri.
meaning: क॒पृन् नरः कपृथ॒म् उ॒द् दधातन चोद॒यत खुद॒त वा॒जसातये । निष्टिग्र्यः॑ पुत्र॒म् आ॒ च्यावयोत॒य इ॒न्द्रं सबा॒ध इह॒ सो॒मपीतये ॥२॥

text: So have I glorified with praise strong Dadhikrāvan, conquering steed. Sweet may he make our mouths; may he prolong the days we have to live.
meaning: दधिक्रा॒व्णो अकारिषं जिष्णो॒र् अ॒श्वस्य वाजि॒नः । सुरभि॒ नो मु॒खा करत् प्र॒ ण आ॒यूंषि तारिषत् ॥३॥

text: The Somas very rich in sweets, for which the sieve is destined, flow, Effused, the source of Indra's joy. May your strong juices reach the Gods.
meaning: सुता॒सो म॒धुमत्तमाः सो॒मा इ॒न्द्राय मन्दि॒नः । पवि॒त्रवन्तो अक्षरन् देवा॒न् गछन्तु वो म॒दाः ॥४॥

text: Indu flows on for Indra's sake—thus have the deities declared. The Lord of Speech exerts himself, ruler of all, because of might.
meaning: इ॒न्दुर् इ॒न्द्राय पवत इ॒ति देवा॒सो अब्रुवन् । वाच॒स् प॒तिर् मखस्यते वि॒श्वस्ये॒शान ओ॒जसा ॥५॥

text: Inciter of the voice of song, with thousand streams the ocean flows, Even Soma, Lord of Opulence, the friend of Indra, day by day.
meaning: सह॒स्रधारः पवते समुद्रो॒ वाचमीङ्खयः॒ । सो॒मः प॒ती रयीणां॒ स॒खे॒न्द्रस्य दिवे॒दिवे ॥६॥

text: The black drop sank in Ansumati's bosom, advancing with ten thousand round about it. Indra with might longed for it as it panted: the hero-hearted laid aside his weapons.
meaning: अ॒व द्रप्सो॒ अंशुम॒तीम् अतिष्ठद् इयानः॒ कृष्णो॒ दश॒भिः सह॒स्रैः । आ॒वत् त॒म् इ॒न्द्रः श॒च्या ध॒मन्तम् अ॒प स्ने॒हितीर् नृम॒णा अधत्त ॥७॥

text: I saw the drop in the far distance moving, on the slope bank of Ansumati's river, Like a black cloud that sank into the water. Heroes. I send you forth. Go, fight in battle.
meaning: द्रप्स॒म् अपश्यं वि॒षुणे च॒रन्तम् उपह्वरे॒ नद्यो॑ अंशुम॒त्याः । न॒भो न॒ कृष्ण॒म् अवतस्थिवां॒सम् इ॒ष्यामि वो वृषणो यु॒ध्यताजौ॒ ॥८॥

text: And then the drop in Ansumati's bosom, splendid with light, assumed its proper body; And Indra with Brihaspati to aid him, conquered the godless tribes that came against him.
meaning: अ॒ध द्रप्सो॒ अंशुम॒त्या उप॒स्थे॒ ऽधारयत् तन्वं॑ तित्विषाणः॒ । वि॒शो अ॒देवीर् अभ्य् आ॑च॒रन्तीर् बृ॒हस्प॒तिना युजे॒न्द्रः ससाहे ॥९॥

text: Then, at thy birth, thou wast the foeman, Indra, of those the seven who ne'er had met a rival. The hidden pair, the heaven and earth, thou foundest, and to the mighty worlds thou gavest pleasure.
meaning: त्वं॒ ह त्य॒त् सप्त॒भ्यो जा॒यमानो ऽशत्रु॒भ्यो अभवः श॒त्रुर् इन्द्र । गूल्हे॒ द्या॒वापृथिवी॒ अ॒न्व् अविन्दो विभुम॒द्भ्यो भु॒वनेभ्यो र॒णं धाः ॥१०॥

text: So, Thunder-armed! thou with thy bolt of thunder didst boldly smite that power which none might equal; With weapons broughtest low the might of Sushna, and, Indra, foundest by thy strength the cattle.
meaning: त्वं॒ ह त्य॒द् अप्रतिमान॒म् ओ॒जो व॒ज्रेण वज्रिन् धृषितो॒ जघन्थ । त्वं॒ शु॒ष्णस्या॒वातिरो व॒धत्रैस् त्वं॒ गा॒ इन्द्र श॒च्ये॒द् अविन्दः ॥११॥

text: We make this Indra very strong to strike the mighty Vritra dead: A vigorous Hero shall he be.
meaning: त॒म् इ॒न्द्रं वाजयामसि महे॒ वृत्रा॒य ह॒न्तवे । स॒ वृ॒षा वृषभो॒ भुवत् ॥१२॥

text: Indra was made for giving, set, most mighty, o'er the joyous draught, Bright, meet for Soma, famed in song.
meaning: इ॒न्द्रः स॒ दा॒मने कृत॒ ओ॒जिष्ठः स॒ म॒दे हितः॒ । द्युम्नी॒ श्लोकी॒ स॒ सोम्यः॒ ॥१३॥

text: By song, as 'twere, the powerful bolt which none may parry was prepared: Lofty, invincible he grew.
meaning: गिरा॒ व॒ज्रो न॒ सं॒भृतः स॒बलो अ॒नपच्युतः । ववक्ष॒ ऋष्वो॒ अ॒स्तृतः ॥१४॥

text: Indra, great in his power and might and, like Parjanya, rich in rain, Is magnified by Vatsa's lauds,
meaning: महां॒ इ॒न्द्रो य॒ ओ॒जसा पर्ज॒न्यो वृष्टिमां॒ इव । स्तो॒मैर् वत्स॒स्य वावृधे ॥१॥

text: When the priests, strengthening the Son of holy Law, present their gifts, Singers with Order's hymn of praise.
meaning: प्रजा॒म् ऋत॒स्य पि॒प्रतः प्र॒ य॒द् भ॒रन्त व॒ह्नयः । वि॒प्रा ऋत॒स्य वा॒हसा ॥२॥

text: Since Kanvas with their lauds have made Indra complete the sacrifice, Words are their own appropriate arms.
meaning: क॒ण्वाः इ॒न्द्रं य॒द् अ॒क्रत स्तो॒मैर् यज्ञ॒स्य सा॒धनम् । जामि॒ ब्रुवत आ॒युधम् ॥३॥

text: To help and favour Vatsa now, O Asvins, come ye hitherward. Bestow on him a dwelling spacious and secure, and keep malig- nites afar.
meaning: आ॒ नून॒म् अश्विना युवं॒ वत्स॒स्य गन्तम् अ॒वसे । प्रा॒स्मै यछतम् अवृक॒म् पृथु॒ छर्दि॒र् युयुतं॒ या॒ अ॒रातयः ॥१॥

text: All manliness that is in heaven, with the Five Tribes, or in mid- air, Bestow, ye Asvins, upon us.
meaning: य॒द् अन्त॒रिक्षे य॒द् दिवि॒ य॒त् प॒ञ्च मा॒नुषां अ॒नु । नृम्नं॒ त॒द् धत्तम् अश्विना ॥२॥

text: Remember Kārnva first of all among the singers,, Asvins, who Have thought upon your wondrous deeds.
meaning: ये॒ वाम् दं॒सांस्य् अश्विना वि॒प्रासः परिमामृशुः॒ । एवे॒त् काण्व॒स्य बोधतम् ॥३॥

text: Asvins, for you with song of praise this hot oblation is effused, This your sweet Soma juice, ye Lords of wealth and spoil, through which ye think upon the foe.
meaning: अयं॒ वां घर्मो॒ अश्विना स्तो॒मेन प॒रि षिच्यते । अयं॒ सो॒मो म॒धुमान् वाजिनीवसू ये॒न वृत्रं॒ चिकेतथः ॥४॥

text: Whatever ye have done in floods, in the tree, Wonder-workers, and in growing plants, Therewith, O Asvins, succour me.
meaning: य॒द् अप्सु॒ य॒द् व॒नस्प॒तौ य॒द् ओ॒षधीषु पुरुदंससा कृत॒म् । ते॒न माविष्टम् अश्विना ॥५॥

text: What force, Nāsatyas, ye exert, whatever, Gods, ye tend and heal, This your own Vatsa gains not by his hymns alone: ye visit him who offers gifts.
meaning: य॒न् नासत्या भुरण्य॒थो य॒द् वा देव भिषज्य॒थः । अयं॒ वां वत्सो॒ मति॒भिर् न॒ विन्धते हवि॒ष्मन्तं हि॒ ग॒छथः ॥१॥

text: Now hath the Rishi splendidly thought out the Asvins' hymn of praise. Let the Atharvan pour the warm oblation forth, and Soma very rich in sweets.
meaning: आ॒ नून॒म् अश्वि॒नोर् ऋ॒षि स्तो॒मं चिकेत वाम॒या । आ॒ सो॒मं म॒धुमत्तमं घर्मं॒ सिञ्चाद् अ॒थर्वणि ॥२॥

text: Ye Asvins, now ascend your car that lightly rolls upon its way. May these my praises make you speed hitherward like a cloud of heaven.
meaning: आ॒ नूनं॒ रघु॒वर्तनिं र॒थं तिष्ठाथो अश्विना । आ॒ वां स्तो॒मा इमे॒ म॒म न॒भो न॒ चुच्यवीरत ॥३॥

text: When, O Nāsatyas, we this day make you speed hither N ith our hymns, Or, Asvins, with our songs of praise, remember Kānva specially.
meaning: य॒द् अद्य॒ वां नासत्योक्थै॒र् आचुच्युवीम॒हि । य॒द् वा वा॒णीभिर् अश्विनेवे॒त् कण्व॒स्य बोधतम् ॥४॥

text: As erst Kakshivān and the Rishi Vyasva, as erst Dirghatamas invoked your presence, Or, in the sacrificial chambers, Vainya Prithī, so be ye mindful of us here, O Asvins.
meaning: य॒द् वां कक्षी॒वां उत॒ य॒द् व्य॑श्व ऋ॒षिर् य॒द् वां दीर्घ॒तमा जुहा॒व । पृ॒थी य॒द् वां वैन्यः॒ सा॒दनेष्व् एवे॒द् अ॒तो अश्विना चेतयेथाम् ॥५॥

text: Come as home-guardians, saving us from foemen, guarding our living creatures and our bodies, Come to the house to give us seed and offspring:
meaning: यातं॒ छर्दिष्पा॒ उत॒ परस्पा॒ भूतं॒ जगत्पा॒ उत॒ नस् तनूपा॒ । वर्ति॒स् तोका॒य त॒नयाय यातम् ॥१॥

text: Whatever with Indra ye be faring, Asvins, or resting in one dwelling-place with Vāyu, In concord with the Ribhus or Ādityas, or standing still in Vishnu's striding-places.
meaning: य॒द् इ॒न्द्रेण सर॒थं याथो॒ अश्विना य॒द् वा वायु॒ना भ॒वथः स॒मोकसा । य॒द् आदित्ये॒भिर् ऋभु॒भिः सजो॒षसा य॒द् वा वि॒ष्णोर् विक्र॒मणेषु ति॒ष्ठथः ॥२॥

text: When I, O Asvins, call on you to-day that I may gather strength, Or as all-conquering might in war, be that the Asvins' noblest grace.
meaning: य॒द् अद्या॒श्वि॒नाव् अहं॒ हुवे॒य वा॒जसातये । य॒त् पृत्सु॒ तुर्व॒णे स॒नस् त॒च् छ्रे॒ष्ठम् अश्वि॒नोर् अ॒वः ॥३॥

text: Now come, ye Asvins, hitherward: here are oblations set for you; These Soma draughts to aid Yadu and Turvasa, these offered you mid Kanva's sons.
meaning: आ॒ नूनं॒ यातम् अश्विनेमा॒ हव्या॒नि वां हिता॒ । इमे॒ सो॒मासो अ॒धि तुर्व॒शे य॒दाव् इमे॒ क॒ण्वेषु वाम् अ॒थ ॥४॥

text: Whatever healing balm is yours, Nāsatyas near or far away, Therewith, great Sages, grant a home to Vatsa and to Vimāda.
meaning: य॒न् नासत्या पराके॒ अर्वाके॒ अ॒स्ति भेषज॒म् । ते॒न नूनं॒ विमदा॒य प्रचेतसा छर्दि॒र् वत्सा॒य यछ॒तम् ॥५॥

text: Together with the Goddess, with the Asvins' Speech have I awoke. Thou, Goddess, hast disclosed the hymn and holy gift from mortal men.
meaning: अ॒भुत्स्य् उ प्र॒ देव्या॒ साकं॒ वाचा॒हम् अश्वि॒नोः । व्य् आ॑वर् देव्य् आ॒ मतिं॒ वि॒ रातिं॒ म॒र्त्येभ्यः ॥१॥

text: Awake the Asvins, Goddess Dawn! Up, mighty Lady of Sweet Strains! Rise straightway, priest of sacrifice! High glory to the glad- dening draught!
meaning: प्र॒ बोधयोषो अश्वि॒ना प्र॒ देवि सूनृते महि । प्र॒ यज्ञहोतर् आनुष॒क् प्र॒ म॒दाय श्र॒वो बृह॒त् ॥२॥

text: Thou, Dawn, approaching with thy light, shinest together with the Sun, And to this man-protecting home the chariot of the Asvins comes.
meaning: य॒द् उषो या॒सि भानु॒ना सं॒ सू॒र्येण रोचसे । आ॒ हाय॒म् अश्वि॒नो र॒थो वर्ति॒र् याति नृपा॒य्यम् ॥३॥

text: When yellow stalks give forth the juice as cows from udders pour their milk, And voices sound the song of praise, the Asvins' worshippers show first.
meaning: य॒द् आ॒पीतासो अंश॒वो गा॒वो न॒ दुह्र॒ ऊ॒धभिः । य॒द् वा वा॒णीर् अ॒नुषत प्र॒ देवय॒न्तो अश्वि॒ना ॥४॥

text: Forward for glory and for strength, protection that shall con- quer men, And power and skill, most sapient Ones!
meaning: प्र॒ द्युम्ना॒य प्र॒ श॒वसे प्र॒ नृषा॒ह्याय श॒र्मणे । प्र॒ द॒क्षाय प्रचेतसा ॥५॥

text: When, Asvins worthy of our lauds, ye seat you in the father's house. With wisdom or the bliss ye bring.
meaning: य॒न् नूनं॒ धीभि॒र् अश्विना पितु॒र् यो॒ना निषी॒दथः । य॒द् वा सुम्ने॒भिर् उक्थ्या ॥६॥

text: We invocate this day your car, far-spreading, O Asvins, even the gathering of the sunlight, Car praised in hymns, most ample, rich in treasure, fitted with seats, the car that beareth Sūryā.
meaning: तं॒ वां र॒थं वय॒म् अद्या॒ हुवेम पृथुज्र॒यम् अश्विना सं॒गतिं गोः॒ । यः॒ सूर्यां॒ व॒हति वन्धुरायु॒र् गि॒र्वाहसं पुरुत॒मं वसूयु॒म् ॥१॥

text: Asvins, ye gained that glory by your Godhead, ye Sons of Heaven, by your own might and power. Food followeth close upon your bright appearing when stately horses in your chariot draw you.
meaning: युवं॒ श्रि॒यम् अश्विना देव॒ता तां॒ दि॒वो नपाता वनथः श॒चीभिः । युवो॒र् व॒पुर् अभि॒ पृ॒क्षः सचन्ते व॒हन्ति य॒त् ककुहा॒सो र॒थे वाम् ॥२॥

text: Who bringeth you to-day for help with offered oblations, or with hymns to drink the juices? Who, for the sacrifice's ancient lover, turneth you hither, Asvins, offering homage?
meaning: को॒ वाम् अद्या॒ करते रात॒हव्य ऊत॒ये वा सुतपे॒याय वार्कैः॒ । ऋत॒स्य वा वनु॒षे पूर्व्या॒य न॒मो येमानो॒ अश्विना॒ ववर्तत् ॥३॥

text: Borne on your golden car, ye omnipresent! come to this sacrifice of ours, Nāsatyas. Drink of the pleasant liquor of the Soma: give riches to the people who adore you.
meaning: हिरण्य॒येन पुरुभू र॒थेनेमं॒ यज्ञं॒ नासत्यो॒प यातम् । पि॒बाथ इ॒न् म॒धुनः सोम्य॒स्य द॒धथो र॒त्नं विधते॒ ज॒नाय ॥४॥

text: Come hitherward to us from earth, from heaven, borne on your golden chariot rolling lightly. Suffer not other worshippers to stay you: here are ye bound by earlier bonds of friendship.
meaning: आ॒ नो यातं दिवो॒ अ॒छ पृथिव्या॒ हिरण्य॒येन सुवृ॒ता र॒थेन । मा॒ वाम् अन्ये॒ नि॒ यमन् देवय॒न्तः सं॒ य॒द् ददे॒ ना॒भिः पूर्व्या॒ वाम् ॥५॥

text: Now for us both, mete out, O Wonder-Workers, riches exceed- ing great with store of heroes, Because the men have sent you praise, O Asvins, and Ajamīlhas come to the laudation.
meaning: नू॒ नो रयिं॒ पुरुवी॒रं बृह॒न्तं द॒स्रा मि॒माथाम् उभ॒येष्व् अस्मे॒ । न॒रो य॒द् वाम् अश्विना स्तो॒मम् आ॒वन्त् सध॒स्तुतिम् आजमील्हा॒सो अग्मन् ॥६॥

text: Whene'er I gratified you here together, your grace was given us, O ye rich in booty. Protect, ye twain, the singer of your praises: to you, Nāsatyas, is my wish directed.
meaning: इहे॒ह य॒द् वां समना॒ पपृक्षे॒ से॒य॒म् अस्मे॒ सुमति॒र् वाजरत्ना । उरुष्य॒तं जरिता॒रं युवं॒ ह श्रितः॒ का॒मो नासत्या युवद्रि॒क् ॥७॥

text: Sweet be the plants for us, the heavens, the waters, and full of sweets for us be air's mid-region! May the Field's Lord for us be full of sweetness, and may we follow after him uninjured.
meaning: म॒धुमतीर् ओ॒षधीर् द्या॒व आ॒पो म॒धुमन् नो भवत्व् अन्त॒रिक्षम् । क्षे॒त्रस्य प॒तिर् म॒धुमान् नो अस्त्व् अ॒रिष्यन्तो अ॒न्व् एनं चरेम ॥८॥

text: Asvins, that work of yours deserves our wonder, the Bull of firmament and earth and heaven; Yes, and your thousand promises in battle. Come near to all these men and drink beside us.
meaning: पना॒य्यं त॒द् अश्विना कृतं॒ वां वृषभो॒ दिवो॒ र॒जसः पृथिव्याः॒ । सह॒स्रं शं॒सा उत॒ ये॒ ग॒विष्टौ स॒र्वां इ॒त् तां॒ उ॒प याता पि॒बध्यै ॥९॥
